story: Last year we surpassed our $10,000 goal. We thought this was impossible. The generosity we received inspired us to work harder, and make more. In the past year, we've toured an evening-length work (for the first time ever!), produced an oversold solo show at The Bushwick Starr, found a home in New Brooklyn Theatre, received the inaugural Harkness Promise Award at the Dance Magazine awards, received the Breakout Award from the Stage Directors and Choreographers Foundation, named the Resident Commissioned Artist at Live Arts, and premiered a commission in the legacy of Agnes de Mille. In just one year! And it wouldn't have happened without you. So now, we�re putting on our fundraising hats again in gearing up for another 24-hour Tele-Gala-Dance-A-Thon and some folks are wondering why...? With the successes of the last 12 months, surely we have enough funding? It�s true, our forward momentum is incredible, but it isn't enough to sustain the company financially. Two months ago we began paying the dancers for rehearsals because we are finally able to afford it, but we are only able to afford it for the next year or two. New Brooklyn Theatre is providing the feath3r theory with a legitimate company model, but the organization does not have significant funding of its own. It's up to us to continue to push forward and build the sustainability that we need to keep making the work for years to come. We hope we can continue to make genre-bending, surreal, and human work you have continued to support. Our goal this year is to raise $15,000 to help support the company�s new works: We May Never Dance Again, a world premiere for The Invisible Dog that will be performed live during the 24-hour event WEDNESDAY, a work slated to premiere at Live Arts in Fall 2020 The McCarthy Era, a work slated to premiere at HERE Arts in Spring 2021 Fantasia, a dream project currently in its infancy The money we raise goes towards artist fees, administrative support and our yearly operating costs! ABOUT THE FEATH3R THEORY the feath3r theory began making work in 2009 and we had our first world premiere in 2013. The mission of the feath3r theory is to challenge its audience (and its creators) to collectively interrogate -and celebrate - its shared relationship to human empathy and personal ethics as expressed in (and distorted by) popular media. By unabashedly appropriating the structures, themes, and aesthetics of reality television, celebrity culture, social media and the internet, the work of TF3T synthesizes dance, visual media and narrative theater into virtuosic, expansive pop-culture phenomena or an �Gesamtkunstwerk� in which artists and audience alike experience their shared humanity. the feath3r theory is a project of New Brooklyn Theatre, a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization. Members of the feath3r theory include Raja Feather Kelly (Artistic Director), Zain Alam (Composer), Emily Auciello (Sound Design), You-Shin Chen (Scenic Design), Kate Enman (Photographer), Erika Foley (Stage Manager), Alexandria Giroux (Performer), Amy Gernux (Performer), Sara Gurevich (Performer), Rebecca Hite (Performer), Kalin Imar (Performer), Rachel Pritzlaff (Performer and Executive Director), Collin Ranf (Performer), Aaron Moses Robin (Performer), Coel Rodriguez (Performer), Laura Snow (Video Editor), Candace Taylor (Performer), Benjamin Wolk (Performer), and Tuce Yasak (Lighting Designer).

It�s A Good Life, Babe podcast is a New Orleans culture show, recording weekly for close to 3 years with over 200 shows published and distributed. Our show strives to be culturally relevant, current, fun, but also document today and the last 40 years in such a way that on occasion we have a show that should go in a time capsule for future anthropologists, or aliens, or cockroaches. We recorded 13 episodes remotely from the Bonnaroo Music & Arts Festival in 2017, and have been invited back for this year�s upcoming festival, June 13- 16. We have never solicited sponsors for the podcast until making some effort to obtain sponsorship to support this Bonnaroo trip. While we have made some inroads with a few brands towards future partnerships, the timing just wasn�t right at the moment for those brands interested in aligning themselves with the show. As a last ditch effort, we have launched this Kickstarter campaign. We are only trying to raise enough funds to recoup our hard costs, which are approximately $3,500. These funds are our hard costs and go towards a Class B RV rental, gas for driving from New Orleans, food & supplies/ gear. Our friends at Bonnaroo are giving us press credentials, a production area trailer in which to record, and a complementary space for our RV. We will travel with all audio recording gear from our New Orleans studio. While we are a New Orleans culture podcast, as evidenced in our 2017 shows from Bonnaroo, we�re able to find plenty of New Orleans related subject matter at one of the biggest and festivals in the world. Guests from Bonnaroo 2017 included Greg Harris, the CEO of the Rock n Roll Hall of Fame; Patrick Clifford who produced the Neville Brothers� Yellow Moon album; and Rick Farman, original founder of Superfly Presents (started in New Orleans) and promoter of Bonnaroo. Bonnaroo, named after the Dr. John album, and is a creole term meaning 'good stuff', is intrinsically tied to New Orleans and the spirit of our show.

WHAT THIS IS PILOT was born out of a desire to provide a platform for choreographers, dancers and directors of the coming generation to create and present their own work and to develop the skills necessary to engage in equitable, sustainable creative practices. We've dreamt up a multifaceted, month-long residency held at Base: Experimental Arts + Space, July 1-27, 2019, providing the Seattle dance community with: Daily movement practices, ranging from all-abilities classes to rigorous professional training. Collaborative creation residencies, culminating in public workshops and informal showings. Community-centric conversations surrounding different themes encompassing sustainable art-making today. Innovative, thoughtful, accessible performances, celebrating Seattle's vibrant creative scene. PILOT 2019, Design by Andrew JS and Emma Wheeler WHY WE'RE HERE PILOT is an opportunity to support, to move, to talk, to document, to include, to see, to share, and to make space for collaboration, exploration, problem solving and conversation. We're here to figure out how, as young movers and makers, we can not only fine tune our artistic voices, but garner skills to find agency, build community, and keep Seattle dance propelling forward. "Due to concerns over money, time, rates, booking and sustainability generally, artists tend to silo themselves and therefore, can lack the capacity to consider and engage with the greater arts community. This program feels radical because it brings artists together to share space, workshops, discussions, and showings. It�s inspiring and I hope it can inspire future program development. This way of working, sharing, and collaborating feels like dance sustainability on a whole new level." -Thomas House WHO WE ARE A group of 6 emerging dance professionals, eager to reunite in Seattle where we began collaboration as YC2, a collective of young dance artists mentored and supported by Studio Kate Wallich. PILOT Creative Team: Laura Carella (Seattle) Dominica Greene (New York/Salt Lake City) Carlin Kramer (Seattle) Emma Lawes (New York/Seattle) Alex Quetell (Los Angeles) Emma Wheeler (Seattle) YC2 in rehearsal, photo by Tom Weinberger In an effort to provide support to makers beyond our collective, we're excited to welcome 3 Resident Artists to the space who are at various stages of their careers, are deeply ingrained in the Seattle dance community and whose work reflects empowerment and inclusivity. Resident artists will have access to the space for new creations and opportunities to share their research through showings and workshops. PILOT Artists in Residence: Thomas House Jody Kuehner Dani Tirrell Thomas House, photo by Jim Coleman Jody Kuehner as Cherdonna, photo by Eric Paguio �Sustainability also happens when we can all come together and be in a shared space with each other, especially when worlds don�t seem to cross... How can we, outside of financial sustainability, how can we sustain each other in community? How can we be open to the fact that [we're] doing different things, and still 100% be there to support each other?" -Dani Tirrell Dani Tirrell, photo by Naomi Ishisaka WHERE YOU COME IN First and foremost, our goal with PILOT is to foster a healthy space for education, training, and research. This largely includes being able to properly compensate the artists involved. From performers to teachers to discussion facilitators to media designers to photographers to costume designers to lighting designers to house managers ... we want these artists to be fully compensated to reflect our ethos of sustainability. It will take a total of $10,000 to pay our well-deserving, highly skilled collaborators, and all funds raised from this campaign will go directly towards that goal. These artists will not only make PILOT what it is, but have proven themselves time and time again as vital, generous contributors to Seattle's creative community. Help us support them! *All donations are TAX-DEDUCTIBLE via our fiscal sponsor: Studio Kate Wallich.* We are over the moon excited to launch this thing. See you in July. -Team Pilot YC2 performing 'A Drama', photo by Tim Summers

I want to bring enthusiastic consent into open conversation to spot what we can all be doing for the #metoo movement. Combining my personal experience with sexual assault with our award-winning crew, I'm here with my droplet of water in the ocean of change engulfing the #metoo movement. My weapon of choice is my latest short film. In 2019, we need more survivor-fronted art than ever. Alex, Stop seeks to pivot the #metoo movement toward our #hellyes movement, emphasizing enthusiastic consent in our sex lives. Inviting viewers to pledge #hellyes! we want to echo sex positivity amidst this global awakening. We're here to question how we treat our intimate lives while taking a detour from the fearful language and conversations that divide us. With a little cup of vulnerability, we're here to break bread over sex positivity. This short will take us into the psychological experience of date rape and call us to question the consent we would like to recognize within us and within our sexual partners.

THE WOLF WHO SWALLOWED THE SUN by Donald Newlove I've read a lot of quirky, unorthodox fiction in my time and I can say in all honesty that I've never come across anything quite like Donald Newlove's The Wolf Who Swallowed the Sun. But, then, what else should I have expected from the author of Sweet Adversity, a masterfully-executed 600-page seriocomic novel about alcoholic Siamese twin wannabe jazz musicians? Subtitled A Jungian Fable of Family and Finance Across the Twentieth Century, Newlove's darkly comic novel, originally written in 1998, is the sweeping saga of one family's greed, extortion, and double-crossing as they strive to acquire a controlling interest in the world's wealth. It is also the story of Billy Baxter, heir to this massive fortune who, with the help of a married couple of Chinese-Swiss Jungian psychoanalysts (one of whom he has fallen in love with), seeks atonement for his family's sins. As an added twist that only a first-rate storyteller like Newlove could credibly pull off, Baxter also happens to be descendent from an ancient clan of humanoid wolves on the brink of extinction. Cover design for the book. Format: Paperback Pages: 252 Dimensions: 8.27" x 5.83" x 0.53" Weight: 0.68 lbs. Praise for Donald Newlove's Earlier Works The Painter Gabriel (1970) "One of the best fictional studies of madness, descent, and purification that any American has written since Ken Kesey's One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest." � Robert Hughes, Time magazine Sweet Adversity (1978) "One of the most desperately funny books we've been given in a long time ... the novel is a convulsion of ghastly laughs and gorgeous writing." � Frederick Busch, The New York Times "A dazzling highwire act ... the sheer inventiveness and strength of his writing turn risk into triumph, drunken monologues into subtle satire, A.A. meetings into riveting dramas, and what in another writer might be bathos into brilliant comedy ... probably the most clear-eyed and moving�and certainly one of the most honest�books ever written about alcoholics." � Lis Harris, The New Yorker "Easily one of the most ambitious American novels of the last fifty years." � Brad Bigelow, The Neglected Books Page Eternal Life (1979) "Sumptuous language, uprushing energy." � Lynn Luria-Sukenick, The Village Voice Those Drinking Days: Myself and Other Writers (1981) "Intoxication does mist and spiral in these pages, but it's the intoxication of language ... writing in all its peacock splendor, writing that crackles and sings." � James Wolcott, Esquire About the Author Donald Newlove was born in Erie, Pennsylvania, in 1928, and currently lives in New York City's Greenwich Village. As a reporter, book reviewer, and short story writer, his work appeared in Esquire, New York Magazine, Evergreen Review, and The Saturday Review. His first novel, The Painter Gabriel (1970), was hailed by Time Magazine as "one of the best fictional studies of madness, descent, and purification that any American has written since Ken Kesey's One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest." Newlove is the author of several other novels, a series of books on the art of writing, and the critically acclaimed memoir, Those Drinking Days: Myself and Other Writers (1981). Newlove with the statue of James Joyce at Joyce�s gravesite in Z�rich, Switzerland, mid-1980s. (Photo by Keith Guenthardt) Where the Money Will Go As with all my previous Kickstarter projects, my goal is simply to break even and get the book out there. For this campaign to be successful, I will need to raise $1,428. In the interest of full disclosure, here's how it all breaks down, assuming 102 U.S. pledges at $14 each: Kickstarter's 10% cut: $142.80 Printer set-up fees: $49.00 ISBN and bar code: $85.00 Cost to have 102 copies printed and shipped to me: $546.34 Cost to package and mail 102 copies domestically ($2.93 each): $298.86 Cost to have 10 copies printed and shipped to the author: $66.00 Royalties to the author for 102 copies ($2.34 each): $238.68 My profit: $1.32 About Tough Poets Press Tough Poets Press is a one-person independent publisher of rediscovered offbeat literary fiction and non-fiction founded in 2015. To date, I've published 11 books thanks to the generous support of the Kickstarter community, including the recent first-ever reissues of Donald Newlove's 1978 novel, Sweet Adversity, and Gil Orlovitz's 1970 experimental novel, Ice Never F.

Kudo Banz was originally created with parents in mind, but teachers use positive reinforcement in their classrooms everyday! After our Shark Tank episode aired, so many awesome Teachers, OTs and Special Needs Educators emailed us and asked us to create a Teacher Kit for their classrooms, so we're here to Kickstart it right to our product line! While we didn't get a deal, teachers and parents were shocked! Our family was bummed that a Shark didn't "pick us up" but we had a ton of fun, learned a lot about our product--- like how teachers love it--- AND best of all the Sharks were really supportive of our product, even though some of them though we were "too new" for an investment. We're here at Kickstarter to help raise the funds to bring Kudo Banz to classrooms! Sticker charts are always, well, stuck! Kudo Banz �unsticks� the sticker chart and puts it right on a child�s wrist where they can always keep their goals in sight and in mind, making positive reinforcement easier and more effective! Because it�s on their wrist kids can remember the things they are working on. Just like adults need "bands" to remember their "Steps� and sticky notes to get things done, kids need visual reminders too! Kudo Banz has been tested and loved by some of the very best in the industry. From Parents to Psychologists, Expert Moms to Industry Experts, we've won ten industry awards! While sticker charts and clip charts are always "stuck" on the wall, Kudo Banz is busy making it easier for kids to reach their goals, while making classroom management easier too! Since Kudo Banz is always right there on their wrists, kids can remember what they are working on whether they are at stations, in the hall or even in music class. This connects the entire school climate and creates a positive reinforcement tool that helps develop social and emotional learning throughout the school. Kudo Banz aligns with today's school initiatives and competencies like PBIS (Positive Behavioral Interventions & Supports), Growth Mindset, and SEL (Social & Emotional Learning). �I watched your episode on Shark Tank and instantly thought of my classroom� -Special Education Teacher, AL �Half the battle is keeping kids goals on top of their mind- this does that and more!� -Pediatric Occupational Therapist, CA "We received our package yesterday and hit the ground running. He enjoyed the story. We made very easy goals. Eat all our meals, clean our toys, and take our bath without fighting us. I immediately shared with his ABA therapist. I personally think this is great as reward charts aren�t tangible. Put a sticker and leave it. The bracelet is a constant reminder of the goals and end result spinning the wheel." -Parent of a 5 year old, NJ "Amazing, this will work wonders in our 2nd grade class!� -Second Grade Teacher, MA "Kudo Banz has been a wonderful tool for reinforcing positive behavior in my children.They are encouraging each other and seeking family time rewards." -Kindergarten Teacher & Mom of 3, CT 1. Read the Drago & George storybook with your class. This introduces the concept of Kudo Banz in a really easy and fun way! At the end of the book there is a spot to set goals. 2. Hand out the Banz to your class. Each child starts with an empty band to fill with kudos for the day. 3. Kids earn Kudos for their goals, like good listening. This keeps kids motivated to continue building good behaviors and turning them into habits. 4. As kids fill their banz and reach their goals, they take off the kudos and add them to the Classroom Jar! They start again the next day. Once the Jar is filled the classroom unlocks the magical reward wheel and earns a classroom reward! + + + Kudo Banz is SUPER flexible. We made it so that it adapts to different classrooms and behaviors. Kudo Banz can be used as a group goal or for individual goals. Teacher can set it up they way it works best for them! Some teachers have kids earn an individual prize once they've filled their band, some teachers fill the classroom jar and then the classroom gets a group prize. Some teachers give out three Kudos, some teachers have kids slide their Kudo from 1 to 2 to 3. Some earn 3 per day, some earn 1 per day and build on it. The best part about Kudo Banz is that it's flexible! Teachers can set it up any way they'd like. (Social & Emotional Learning) Kudo Banz aligns with SEL because Kudo Banz: Builds students up by building their confidence, and focusing on the positive. Through inclusion and goal setting, Kudo Banz can work on specific SEL behaviors like understanding others. Kudo Banz is structured so that kids can feel included and appreciated, all kids wear a band and work toward their goals individually as well in a group. Since kids have a plan, they are more likely to make constructive choices about personal behavior and social interactions. Because Kudo Banz is always on their wrist, students can remember and self-regulate their behavior and emotions, stay mindful of their goals, stay on-task and listen attentively. Models positivity towards others so that students can learn to build others up instead of knocking them down. Builds kids confidence so they feel confident in participating in classroom discussions. Kudo Banz creates opportunities for students to be responsible in the classroom. By being mindful of their goals, kids can stay on-task and make connections between their choices and potential consequences. Because they are working on a group goal, students feel like they are a part of the group and are more open to using the support and feedback from peers to improve to reach the group goal. (Work hard and accept challenges as opportunities to grow) Kudo Banz aligns with Growth Mindset becuase Kudo Banz: Teaches students the feeling of success by setting up small achievable goals. As students feel the success they get hooked- and their confidence grows. Models persistence to reach their goals Creates a sense of community where other's achievements can be celebrated Builds a sense of confidence, which may lead to taking on more challenging tasks Encourages kids to take on challenges and learn from them, therefore increasing their abilities and achievement Through Kudo Banz, positive affirmation is given to students on a consistent basis which makes students feel good and know that their efforts can lead to positive results. (Positive Behavioral Interventions & Supports) Kudo Banz aligns with PBIS becuase Kudo Banz: Sets a clear plan in place; students and teaches set goals together, creating a plan that kids are a part of. Since they had the opportunity to self assess and set up a plan together, students better understand their goals and feel more vested in reaching them. Focuses on the positive behavior, minimizing attention to the negative behavior Creates learning opportunities that emphasize the desired behaviors Is easy and quick to use which helps the teacher maintain instructional time to the remainder of the class. Is flexible, can be used for many different behaviors and on an individual or group goal. Uses inclusion; Kudo Banz can be used as a classroom goal and/or can be set up as an individual plan working on shaping specific behaviors. Can be used in conjunction with PBIS feedback guidelines: Functional, Accurate/Consistent, Specific, Timely. Connecting Home and School Because it�s right there on students wrists, it goes where children go. For tough behaviors, it can be use both at home and at school, creating a strong consistent message between home and school. When used together, Kudo Banz works as a united message because of the connection that is consistent at home and school. After Shark Tank so many awesome Teachers, OTs and Special Needs Educators emailed us and asked us to create a Teacher Kit for their classrooms, so we're here to Kickstart it right to our product line! While we didn't get a deal, teachers and parents were shocked! Our family was bummed that a Shark didn't "pick us up" but we had a ton of fun, learned a lot about our product--- like how teachers love it--- AND best of all the Sharks were really supportive of our product, even though some of them thought we were "too new" for an investment. That's why we're here to help raise the funds to bring Kudo Banz to classrooms! Hi there! I�m Amanda, founder, and mom of 3. When my first little one was three years old, I wanted my little guy to grow up believing in himself, but the old parenting methods like yelling and time-outs just left us both unhappy and sent him the wrong message. I knew something had to change so I read a looooot of books and did a bunch of research. That�s when I turned to the sticker chart method. Problem was, we were always on-the-go, and the sticker chart was always stuck at home. My little guy and I couldn�t remember it! So I invented Kudo Banz, a sticker chart for his wrist! I knew I wanted him to grow up confident and proud of who he was, so I started focusing on the positive instead of the negative. Simple things like leaving the park, trying new foods and cleaning up stopped being such a struggle. His No�s turned into Yes�s and he went from �I can�t� to �I�ll try�. He was excited and proud and the whole family was happier. I went on to use Kudo Banz with my other two little ones, Ayaan who is a year and a half younger than Mickey, and Sofia, my youngest. Kudo Banz taught them to grow up confident too. Sofia learned to try new foods and dress for the weather (she�s a girl who only loves sundresses, even in winter!). I always dreamed of spreading positivity and helping other kids and parents who has the same daily struggles. Then, my husband Hamza encouraged me to follow my dreams and make Kudo Banz a reality! Now our entire family works together to bring the power of positivity to parents and kids everywhere! NOW and WOW are two of our values. It's important to us that we deliver on time and that you're 100% happy when it arrives on your doorstep. As soon as we meet our funding goal we will begin production of the Kudo Banz Classroom Kit. We will need 30-60 days for that, plus some QC time & transit time. We are confident we will have the Kudo Banz Classroom Kit ready for you by July. We are so happy to have you along on this journey. Invest in the supplies needed to create and manufacture the Classroom Kit. This includes tooling, moulds, packaging and labor. We already have an awesome factory that works hard to bring Kudo Banz to families, so we'll utilize their same talents to create the Classroom Pack for classrooms. If we reach our stretch goal of $25,000 we will use the extra Kickstarter funds to write, illustrate & produce a special hardcover, classroom specific storybook! If we reach this goal, we'll include this book in your Classroom Kit for FREE, instead of our general Drago & George storybook. What can I do to help reach the stretch goal? Please share! The more awesome teachers, OTs and therapists know about our new Classroom Kit, the easier it will be to reach our stretch goal! Share This Project! You can share this campaign on Facebook | Instagram | Twitter: @kudobanz or by Email: (link to our campaign) Kickstarter allows new ideas to come to life through community support. Project creators (like Kudo Banz) set a funding goals. If people like the product, they can pledge money to make it happen. Pledging money to a Kickstarter campaign is easy. It's essentially the same as pre-ordering a product. For example, if we reach our funding goal of $3,000, Kudo Banz will be able to initiate our first big production run of the Classroom Kit. The product will be manufactured and sent out to all of our wonderful supporters this summer! If for some reason the campaign does not reach the funding goal, all backers money will be refunded in full. "I think this will become extremely beneficial for schools especially in the Special Education Department. My son is in kindergarten and is on the Autism Spectrum along with other learning disabilities and his SpEd teacher has recently tried to put him onto a rewards plan for staying on task, but its pretty floppy. This, on the other hand, he�ll love!"- Parent of an Autistic Kindergartener "I just wanted to say thank you for inventing this product! I saw you on Shark Tank and immediately I knew I had to try these for my kids. We believe our oldest has high functioning autism and we struggle with a lot of aggressive behaviors and struggle to get her to listen when asked to do things. We just got out started kit today and she loves it! She�s already earned 3 kudos because she�s going out of her way to find ways to help and listen. Thank you for making this!" - Mom of 2, PA

Missed the Campaign? Head to www.shirtsbyshurts.com or contact me at shirtsbyshurts (at) gmail (dot) com If you backed my previous campaigns here's what's different: Polo shirts in Youth Sizes for the little squirts in your life. All shirts in this campaign are offered in Youth Small, Medium & Large in addition to adult sizes. Simplified pricing: $22 for youth shirts and $27 for adult sizes New Rook design and a few new color options on some of the most popular designs. Short and Sweet: No stretch goals and this campaign ends at the same time as school for my kids. New to Shirts by Shurts? Read on. I love board games. I enjoy sitting down with family and friends and playing a game together. Its a great opportunity to catch up with friends. Board games offer me the chance to help my kids learn important life lessons and skills. They give my wife and me a quiet night in after the kids are in bed. I wanted to show off my love of gaming to others. I have picked up a few t-shirts over the years, but nothing I could wear to the office. After not finding what I wanted, I created Shirts by Shurts. A polo shirt that offers a professional look while still showing off my favorite hobby. After 2 successful campaigns and numerous designs and colors, almost 1000 Shirts by Shurts polos are being worn all over the world. I wear one to work at least once a week. And now I'm back because my kids wanted in on the action. They wanted shirts just like Dad has. So now the junior gamers in your life can look just as good as you do. I am offering my shirts in select colors in youth sizes in addition to adult sizes. Each polo shirt features a simple, but easily recognizable, symbol from the world of table top games. A crest design is embroidered in a contrasting or coordinating color on the left chest. I evaluated many suppliers to find a polo shirt that matched my quality standards. I've worn and washed these shirts many times and am very happy with the final product. Tagless: There's no tag scratching your neck Poly/Cotton Blend: The soft touch of cotton, but no shrinking and easy care Pique Texture: For its great look and durability Range of Sizes: Available Youth Sizes Small, Medium and Large and in Men's from S to 6XL and Women's from S to 4XL. Tall sizes are also available for Men's in some colors - noted with a "T" on the graphic. Below are all of the color combinations available for this campaign. These colors are available in Youth, Women's and Men's sizes. Choose from a selection of classic Shirts by Shurts colors and designs or from some of the exciting new options: Youth Sizes are as follows: Small (size 6-8), Medium (10-12) and Large (14-16) I have had a lot of great feedback from my previous Kickstarters. Originally Tom Vasel of the Dice Tower had this to say about my shirts: They look like nice polo shirts and they have these ... logos in them that you at first glance you don't even know it's a board game so that's kind of cool. It kind of gives it a classy look. I received lots of positive feedback from previous backers: "They look and feel great. I love being able to wear a gaming shirt to work. Nicely done." "Once again, I am the best-dressed guy on the block. Thanks for another unqualified success." - Repeat Backer "Wore the first one today - the OG Meeple. Got a few comments from co-workers. I'll try out the Hex tomorrow. Loved the shirt - very comfortable all day long." "I gave my BF his for xmas and he LOVES it. The fit is PERFECT for him! I'll definitely be getting more. Thanks!" I'm keeping the reward levels very simple. Only one option, but feel free to add up to 9 more shirts (10 total) to either level. You'll be able to select the colors and sizes of each shirt after the campaign ends during the survey. Just add $22 for each additional Youth Sized shirt and $27 for each additional Adult sized shirt. For each Extended and Tall sized shirt add these amounts to your pledges now. Once the campaign is over you won't be able to edit your pledge. Any of the shirts marked with a "T" are available in Tall sizes. Only want 1 Adult shirt? Just add $5 to the single shirt pledge level (plus any extra for extended sizes). No stretch goals for this campaign. All of the colors and designs that are being offered are already unlocked. If you were hoping for a design or color from a previous campaign send me a message with the size you are looking for. I have a very limited stock of shirts from the previous campaigns I will offer at a reduced price on a first come, first serve basis. Shipping is already added when you make your pledge. Any additional cost of shipping extra shirts is built into the add-on price of each shirt. Note for International Backers: Shipping outside of the US is NOT customs friendly. Coming from an era full of fads such as using tear catchers to determine the length of mourning, Tussie-Mussie is based on the Victorian fad that assigned meanings to the flowers that friends and lovers exchanged. Famous authors such as William Shakespeare, Jane Austen, Charlotte Bronte, and Emily Bronte all utilized the meaning of flowers in their writings, and now you can experience the language of flowers in this newest wallet game from Wingspan designer Elizabeth Hargrave, artist Beth Sobel, and Button Shy Games. (Also includes a solo expansion by Mike Mullins - see below for more info.) Featuring I-Split-You-Choose drafting, players draw 2 cards and offer one face-up and another face-down to their neighbor. The neighbor takes their choice and the active player receives the other. After everyone has 4 cards, face-down cards are revealed and everyone scores their collection. After 3 rounds the scores are totaled to determine a winner! If you haven't heard of us before, here are a few quick notes about Button Shy: We're a small, family based company, with a few helping hands and a great group of designers and artists. We release a new wallet game every month. This is game #52! Our wallet games are packaged in a small vinyl wallet for maximum portability. Each game is hand assembled and mailed from our little workspace in New Jersey. If you want to know more about anything... games, rules questions, join an already wonderful community at our discord channel: https://discord.gg/pf9DPqs The active player draws two cards and looks at them. They will need to offer both to their neighbor, except one will be face-up and the other will be face down. Their neighbor will choose one card and the active player receives the other, so the decision here is very important. Once they decide which card to reveal, they place them onto the table. It's fun to read the flavor text on the face-up card aloud when offering to your neighbor. "We are happy friends" should help influence their decision, right? The neighbor must choose one to take based upon the information they have available in front of them. This is also a key decision. Will they take the face-up card or go for the unknown in the face-down card? These decisions get harder and harder as the game goes on as players can see what other players are collecting. Once taken, the card's orientation is maintained, but if a face-down card was taken, the owner may now look at it to see what they received. The active player keeps the other card, maintaining its orientation as well. Cards are placed in order of receipt from left to right and must remain in that order for the round. After each player has 4 cards, the round ends and players move into the scoring phase of the game. The Orchid can count as pink, giving a bonus point for the Pink Rose. Face-up cards are considered your Bouquet and remain in place. Face-down cards are considered your Keepsakes. Pull them closer to you, forming a second row but maintaining their order from left to right (and retaining the gaps formed between the Bouquet cards), and reveal them. Cards with abilities trigger in any order that you choose. Using the Snapdragon's ability, I was able to move the Orchid from my bouquet row to my keepsake row. This gives me exactly two cards in the bouquet and an extra 2 points for the Peony. Then score your card abilities from left to right. Each Heart is worth 1 point as well. This example would have been an 8 point round. Not bad! Players then compare total scores. Play to 3 rounds. The winner is the player with the highest combined score from all 3 rounds. You can check out a low color print and play here: https://www.pnparcade.com/collections/new-games/products/tussie-mussie Tussie Mussie impressed us from the start when it won the 2018 Gen Can't design contest. Since then, it's managed to capture hearts of the review community. Here's a taste of it: "Tussie-Mussie creates more thoughtful decisions with its "I cut, you choose" style and 18 cards than some full-blown tabletop games with five-square-foot player boards and 108 miniatures. It does one thing (card drafting) but does it in a way that creates a light, enjoyable stress for both the cutter and chooser. It is a very good game mechanically." - http://www.everythingboardgames.com/2019/05/tussie-mussie-kickstarter-preview.html "In terms of both play and form, Tussie Mussie is New York Slice/Piece o� Cake meets Love Letter. People who enjoy these games will find joy in the language of flowers. Elizabeth Hargrave has another hit on her hands." - https://boardgamesquad.com/tussie-mussie/ "Don�t let the name fool you, there is some serious gaming to be found inside this little wallet of a game." - https://cardboardclash.wordpress.com/2019/05/27/review-for-one-tussie-mussie/ "This game will never make it to my shelf. It will 110% go to my car." - https://meeplegamers.com/tussie-mussie-preview-buttonshy/ "Tussie Mussie is a very quick and thoughtful game with an awesome theme and fantastic art. Definitely worth checking out!" - https://whatsericplaying.com/2019/05/27/tussie-mussie/ "One of Tussie Mussie�s more subtle but delightful features is that it actually has flavor text on the bottom of each card, displaying the meaning behind that flower. For example, the orchid meant �You are beautiful�, the carnation meant �I do not agree� (which I�m sure led to many a passive aggressive end to arguments), and the hyacinth meant �Please forgive me�." - https://boarandarrow.home.blog/2019/05/27/tussie-mussie-review/ "Tussie Mussie is a good, quick, simple game that you can pull out just about anywhere and have a good time with." - https://boardsandbees.wordpress.com/2019/05/24/0860/ "I appreciate its' simplicity because I can see myself, and probably others, being able to introduce it to non-gamer friends and families easily, which is always a bonus." - https://settleroftheboards.weebly.com/home/a-flower-for-your-thoughts "One of the coolest mechanics in board gaming is the �I split, you choose� mechanic, and in Tussie Mussie, it works to perfection." - https://boardgamegumbo.wordpress.com/2019/05/27/beignets-board-games-tussie-mussie-discussion $3 - Print and Play version of Tussie Mussie plus Flower Shoppe solo expansion - delivered via Kickstarter message in August 2019. $10 - Tussie Mussie plus Flower Shoppe solo expansion - delivered to your door in September 2019. Tussie Mussie: Flower Shoppe is a 6-card expansion that brings solo play to Tussie Mussie! Designed by Mike Mullins (Bottom of the 9th, Pentaquark) this expansion is full of the heart of the multiplayer game, but puts some nice new twists on it for the solo player. Turn Cards direct how cards must be dealt and how they must be taken, but it's up to you to decide which card will go to which player. Do you want to gain some information about that face-down card, or leave it and potentially give your opponent the lead? Want to see how it works? Matt Upton made a lovely walkthrough video: We're also offering a reward level that includes a Solo Playmat. This is not required to play, but makes it look really nice. It's 24" wide by 14" tall and helps separate the areas of play as well as keep score. You will need 2 cubes or small tokens to track the scores of yourself and the AI opponent. Elizabeth Hargrave is a game designer living just outside Washington, DC. She designed Tussie Mussie for a Button Shy design contest last summer. It was several months later that her game Wingspan (just nominated for the Kennerspiel des Jahres) burst onto the scene. Beth Sobel is a board game illustrator living in Bellingham, Washington with her husband and two cats. Beth has illustrated our very own Circle The Wagons, along with many other great games such as Viticulture, Wingspan, Arboretum, Between Two Cities and many more. We have an awesome following of repeat customers. As a result, we've built the Board Game of the Month Club. It's a subscription service where you receive unreleased microgames, promo cards, expansion content, and Kickstarter discounts.... every month. Supporters will receive from $1, $2, $5 to $10 off of EVERY WALLET GAME THAT WE MAKE. (See the $1 level, that's where the members back the projects). Our 2019 $5 packages include an episode of Chain Mail, a card and dice driven, asymmetric dungeon crawler for 1-4 players. Each episode comes with a postcard map, dual monster card, and a new quest. It also includes a copy (and a link to print more) of the next Tempus Quest pen and paper game where you use time instead of dice. The crew of the Tempus ship get into a new adventure each month. You can try out the first Episode today right here: https://www.patreon.com/posts/tempus-quest-0-24629368 Our $10 packages include all of the above and something extra. Generally it's a micro-game (up to 9 cards), or some expansion / promo cards for our existing games. Next month is an Anthelion expansion and a 3 card solo game, MechAge. And our $20 package includes all of the above and a copy of the featured wallet game (or the wallet game of your choice). The featured wallet games also come with any expansion material that is given away in the Kickstarter campaigns. If that sounds cool to you, check out the Board Game of the Month Club on Patreon! http://www.patreon.com/buttonshy

Hey there! I'm a 2019 graduate from NYU who's moving to SF and starting a pop-up restaurant for four guests every two weeks in my apartment! This past year has been a crazy ride in terms of cooking for me - I started off taking a food science class in the fall that taught me the fundamentals of cooking. This past semester, I've been hosting 6-8 course tasting menus for four people every two weeks out of my tiny NYC apartment. I've enjoyed the experience a ton and am packing it up to restart it back in San Francisco :) I've prepared dishes ranging from duck/rabbit to caviar/tuna and everything in between and I'm really excited to recreate the menu over this summer for a fall re-launch of the pop-up! A few photos of the dishes that I've been making can be seen below: And a sample menu can be found below as well: This has been a passion project of mine for a while now and I can't wait to start it back up in SF. I'm looking to raise $500 to get this off the ground with new utensils, tools, and plates/bowls as well as experiment with new ingredients over the summer. Anything (even just a dollar) helps and thanks so much for supporting me on this project!

Welcome to my 22nd Enamel Pin Kickstarter Campaign! I am a HUGE dragon fan, so I want to make a HUGE dragon pin! The only problem is, I couldn't decide what color to make it... Based on my previous experience I am pretty confident that Red and Blue are the two most popular colors of dragons (sorry to all you fans of other colors of dragons. It's nothing personal, this is just based on my past projects). Unfortunately the Red/Blue situation is too close to call, so I want to make this design in red AND blue! The Pins Each pin: is Hard Enamel is 2.25 inches tall and 2.25 inches wide has gold colored plating has two post/clutches to hold it securely in place Why are there A-Grade and B-Grade and what is the difference? This refers to the quality grade of the pin. Enamel pins are individually crafted and because of this there is some variation in the quality. A-grade pins have extremely few or no visible flaws. These are the very best of what I have to offer. B-grades have minor flaws that may include over or under filled enamel, small scratches,, wobbly (but secure) back posts, or other similar defects, but they are still beautiful pins! I actually prefer B-grade pins for wearing or putting on my bag, as I don't have to be as concerned about them picking up scratches or getting lost as I go about my day. Some of my KS campaigns, especially smaller ones like this, are really personal projects that I invite others to join me in. This is one of those projects. I want these dragons on my bag, so I am taking a risk on the campaigns success and am having the pins made ahead of a campaign so I can ship quickly. Because of this I have chosen to limit the number of A-grade pins available to make sure that I have enough to quickly fulfill the rewards. About Frost Dragon Designs, LLC My name is Joshua R. Pinkas and I am the creator and owner of Frost Dragon Designs, LLC. After years of working on projects for others through freelance work and private commissions, I decided to start building something for myself and started Frost Dragon Designs, LLC. I am an artist and seasoned pin creator and have designed, had manufactured, and delivered thousands of beautiful enamel pins. All of my designs are my own original creations. I start my creative process with traditional drawings in sketchbooks. Even the simplest of designs will usually go through a dozen or more revisions before I recreate it digitally and prepare the files to send to my manufacturing partners. This is my 22nd Kickstarter campaign! I love launching new projects and designs on Kickstarter because this is where I got my start with my company, and because I have found a wonderfully supportive community here who genuinely care about creatives. Every pin you back helps fund the production of new original designs!

Trip to Fhloston Paradise not included You're a Winner Welcome and thanks for checking us out. We're here with another indie badge for DEF CON this year. You may remember @CromulonB from our Cromulon heads or various SAO holders from years past. We are not associated with DEF CON and this badge won't actually get you into the con but will get you more geek cred once you are on site. We've been a little more industrious over the winter this year and we would humbly like to present the MULTI PASS badge for your consideration and approval. Images not to scale The theme of this years badge is based on one of my favorite movies, The Fifth Element. Of course there is a little DEF CON flare thrown in there but we tried to stay faithful to the original prop. At least as far as we could in PCB form. For instance we were able to read the part number for the LED indicator on the original prop. That component is still in production and you can see we included that on the final badge. The image above is one of the early hand built prototypes so there are a few changes in the final version. Mainly going with a gold process and an added SAO location. The name displayed on the MULTI PASS screen is an option you can change on the badge. Render of final colors When we set out to make this badge one of our main goals was to make a badge that would be useful even after the con. The way we are attempting to make this happen is by making our badge easy to develop for and by being compatible with an existing platform. The badge.team platform supports apps written in python. Python generally has a lower learning curve then most embedded languages. The platform also has a repository with apps written and submitted by others. There is a ton of documentation and example code so getting started is easy. There is even an emulator so you can write apps before you even get the badge. Apps can be installed over USB or downloaded with an included installer while on WiFi. Below is a quick navigation demo. You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00 Specs and Features Features: Capacitive touch controls Low power e-paper display with partial update and Zero power screen persistence Embedded micropython implementation supporting python apps Wireless connectivity for OTA software/app updates, browse repo, or communication Open platform with app repository and several years of app development Light weight LiPO battery lasting over 24 hours, rechargeable over USB Separate power control for badge and bling 2 x SAO V1.69BIS headers (I'm a fan of shitty addons) GPIO Headers for use in custom applications 13 animated LEDs All schematics and code will be released after DEF CON Hardware: 16MB ESP32 WROOM module (dual core 240 MHz, integrated WiFi and Bluetooth) 2.9" e-paper display (296x128) MPR121 I2C Capacitive touch + GPIO controller CP2102 USB UART TP4056 Battery charger Up/Down/Left/Right/Select/Start/A/B capacitive touch buttons for input 1000mAh battery micro SD card reader atmega48 (to make things blink) micro USB 12 pin GPIO Header Tiers and Stretch Goals Korben's Taxi The Water, Fire, and Fifth tiers will include an SAO in the form of Korben Dallas's taxi from the movie. This SAO is of course compatible with any other badge with an SAO header. One point has been removed from your license. Secret SAO If we told you any details it wouldn't be a secret. Just know it's on theme and it'll be cool. Half the fun is the other #BadgeLife nerds trying to spot one in the wild. Stretch Goals $12,000 - Generic lanyard becomes a customized lanyard and DC souvenir. Sell Out - For our sanity and safety of our production timelines we aren't going to make a huge amount of badges. If we sell all the badges listed here (Fifth Element Tier not included) a special gift will be included with all the badges. This is in the works and we will give more details if the goal is reached. FAQs Will this badge get me into DEF CON? Nope. We are not associated with DEF CON in any official way. Can I buy a badge and pick it up at DEF CON? Not this time around. Kickstarter has limitations on selecting shipping and with the limited number of badges keeping everything separate would be a pain. Not to mention airport security is already hard enough for me without 100 LiPo batteries. Will these be available in Vegas? We hope to have a limited number on site to be bought, earned, found, etc. Of course the campaign has be successful for that to happen.

This is a fun side project I decided to embark on. I really don't like the fact that the T-shirts are $20, because I'm not trying to make much profit, but after crunching all the numbers, selling at least 50 of these for $20 is the only way I can make some money for the time I've put into it. My goal with this is just to spread the design of the shirt! If people are into the design that's all I really want. The company I'm going through to make these is 4imprint, and they have great reviews in terms of quality of product so I'm confident the shirts will turn out well. If you'd like to support me in this endeavor, pledging $20 can be thought of as a pre-order for the shirt until they're made and ready to be shipped out. I have to stress this though; you will NOT be eligible for a shirt if you pledge under $20. Any pledges under or over $20 will be assumed as general donations to get this project off the ground. Thank you!

It�s been two years since we launched our first issue of Anxy, an independent bi-annual publication exploring personal narratives and mental health through an artful and creative lens. Two years of sharing our innermost feelings, getting real about our personal struggles, and opening mental health conversations through original, insightful, and creative perspectives. To celebrate our anniversary, we�re producing a limited edition collection box. Our four issues�Masculinity, Anger, Workaholism, and Boundaries�in a beautiful letterpress package designed just for you. If you have been reading us for some time and are missing an issue or two, you can now complete the collection and safe keep it for years to come. For new readers, you can begin your Anxy journey with the whole series right from the start. In this campaign, we are also releasing 140 copies of the issue that kicked it all off. Straight from our archives, we are making �The Anger Issue� temporarily available. It�s been sold out for almost a year, but we know it�s the only one some of you are missing! We are proud of what we have accomplished over the past two years and appreciate all the love and immense support. It has exceeded our dreams and expectations. In a short time, over 30,000 people joined our global community of readers, stockists, and admirers. Anxy was also recognized as one of the top 100 organizations leading cultural change by the Yerba Buena Center for the Arts. We also graciously accepted two Stack Awards in 2017�Launch of the Year and Subscribers� Choice�and two more in 2018 for Art Director of the Year and Best Use of Illustration. Last month, we spent some time with San Francisco Suicide Prevention for their gala event Laughs for Life where we received the Vanguard Award alongside the Born This Way Foundation and Solomon Thomas from the San Francisco 49ers. To top it all off, The Society of Publication Designers recently selected Anxy for two Silver Awards, recognizing Anxy as one of the world's best editorial design, together with The New York Times Magazine, The California Sunday Magazine, WIRED, and more. Anxy has quickly become a favorite among indie magazine lovers around the world, shortlisted with some of the most established publications, and we couldn�t be more honored to be on this journey together with you. Select the full set, or a combination of issues and the box, to complete your collection. No. 1 � The Anger Issue: We all know anger, but it presents itself in unique ways. Maybe it begins as a nagging irritation and develops into a Hulk-like rage; or perhaps it just eats away at you slowly. We wanted to bring the ever-present, shape-shifting nature of anger to the pages of Anxy. Featured Interview: Margaret Atwood. Explore more > No. 2� The Workaholism Issue: Work isn�t just what we do�it�s who we are. But when does hard work stray into something addictive, controlling, and dangerous? We decided to investigate the realities of work in an issue filled with personal experiences, brave interviews, striking photography, and creative work. Featured Interview: Comedian Neal Brennan. Explore more > No. 3 � The Boundaries Issue: How do our inner worlds define the lines we draw and the space we create? Boundaries shape the way we live, love and work�but what do our boundaries say about who we are underneath? Our third issue looks at personal space from the inside out. Featured Interview: Open Mike Eagle & Fabiola Jean-Louis. Explore more > No. 4 �The Masculinity Issue: What does it mean to be masculine? How does masculinity influence our sense of self and the culture around us? Masculinity isn�t just about men. Masculinity is about everyone�our power, our vulnerability, our self-expression, and our state of mind. Featured Interview: Terry Crews & Karamo Brown. Explore more > � Thank you Thank you to the writers and artists who have contributed their words, stories, and art to Anxy. Thank you to the dedicated Anxy staff who have dedicated their time and passion to Anxy, including founder Indhira Rojas; editor-in-chief Bobbie Johnson; editor-at-large Jennifer Maerz; director of photography Michelle Le; guest editors Sarah Rich, Pendarvis Harshaw, editors Madison Kahn, Katie MacBride, and Kati Krause; designers Livia Foldes, Alma Avila, Nicholas Law, and Alexandria Troup; operations team Rachel Gepner, Ian Sivertstol, and Jeannine Ventura; marketing team Sonja Kari Murphy and Megan Fradley-Smith; and mental health advisors Natasha Vianna and Natalie Harvey, LMFT. � Questions? Check out our FAQ section for more information about the project.

INTRODUCTION: This project is about The Four Elements of Thinking Book and a companion Deck of Cards for the Four Elements of Thinking. The Four Elements of Thinking is a book about training your mind to work through problems, decision making, reasoning, spurring creativity, finding insights through synthesis, and learning how to evaluate ideas. You can use the cards as flash cards to learn about the Four Elements of Thinking or to apply the elements of thinking in your everyday life. You will find the cards useful at work and at home. The book associates the Ancient Greek elements of Earth, Air, Water and Fire with the key aspects of thinking: Reasoning, Creativity, Synthesis and Evaluation. This mnemonic gets you to apply the key aspects of thinking frequently. You can find out more by previews of the book (available at Amazon) or by visiting my website: http://cheung.interzone.com. Each of the Four Elements is comprised of four Components (see following picture). Each component has Principles which are mental tools and skills. You can read more about me and my bio on my website or at Amazon. The Four Elements of Thinking book (paperback edition): The Four Elements of Thinking (Paperback ed.) This "elevator pitch" graphic I created summarizes the Four Elements of Thinking: Each of the four elements of thinking has 4 components The Four Elements of Thinking PLAYING CARDS are a "standard" 52-deck of cards (+2 Jokers), that you can use them to play any normal card game, such as Poker, Spades, and Go-Fish. It also serves as a TRAINING/LEARNING DECK to efficiently apply or learn the Four Elements of Thinking. The Cards each describe the Four Elements (Earth thinking, Air thinking, Water thinking, Fire Thinking) and each of their four components. The cards also have some of the component's principles. Because the Four Elements of Thinking book introduced a set of mental tools; you will need practice with these tools. As with any skill, the more you use them the better you get at it. The PLAYING CARDS are meant to be flash cards that allow you to reinforce the skills described in the principles. The cards can be also used to help you learn more about the four elements, they can be used as a refresher, and also can enhance your training as you practice. They can also be used to help you efficiently apply the Four elements of Thinking because the use of the components and principles can be applied at different points throughout the thinking process. One of the two "jokers" in the Deck is a complete summary of the Four Elements of Thinking; and the other joker is the PROBLEM SOLVING Flow using the Four Elements of Thinking (from Chapter 32). The Four Elements of Thinking playing cards IN HAND: I have made a "batch" of The Four Elements of Thinking playing cards. So they are IN-HAND, and READY TO SHIP! These are Custom-printed, premium 300gsm cards with a smooth, air-cushion finish. The Four Elements of Thinking Playing Cards ready to ship PLEDGE LEVELS: The various Pledge Levels let you get the PLAYING CARDS (exclusive to kickstarter) and discounted copies of my book (compared to the retail Amazon price). My book will be autographed by me (unique to kickstarter). By default, books you get from this kickstarter will be autographed by me, and you can also specify what you'd like me to write or you can choose to have no autograph too. Note: that I do ship world-wide, but due to the weight of the book, shipping costs internationally can be pretty high. It is probably less expensive for you to buy the book directly from the international Amazon websites. Contact me and I can assist you.

Synopsis Ev'rything's cool in Chill Town. There's always sumthin' to do, sumthin' new to see, an' all tha opportunities imaginable to be who u wanna be. We follo Lenny an' AFG (that's me) as they train unda Master Jude, to become tha greatest fighters alive. Lenny also has a Girlfriend, an' an Arch-Rival nam'd Axe, who leads around his own lil' gang of punks. Join Lenny an' AFG as they perfeck they fightin' styles, practicin' they moves out on tha good-fo'-nuthin's of Chill Town. Background I'mma filmmaker, mo' specifically a Transmedia Produca, who jus' came out here to L.A. I don' kno a lotta people, an' tha people I git to kno ain' dependable. I've been tryin' to shoot a few of tha shorts I wrote, but I cayn find no crews. Plus, findin' any adults in this business that are willin' to treat a black man wit' respeck is a challenge enuff. I wanna make content, but producin' wit' people who ain' actually passionate 'bout filmmakin' is impossible. So 1 day, I wuz all like, I wanna make a cartoon. What I'm On Creatin' this cartoon gives me tha opportunity to create sumthin' wit' minimal disturbances. Iss tha easiest job eva, all I gotta do is draw all day an' listen to Podcasts. But I don' like bein' tol' what to do, an' I wanna make this Cartoon my way; that's where u come in! Workin' mossly thru Adobe an' tha computas I already own makes this shit easy enuff, but I still needa budget. This is also jus' Season 1, so I might be back here doin' tha same shit fo' tha nex couple o' seasons too. Let's see. I'mma drop it all on YouTube fo' free, no ads, no ad sales, jus' funded by tha crowd.

Heyyyy I wrote a song for gay pride and I want to get it fully produced and on Spotify - I'd love to have your support to make it happen! The song is called "This Love" and it tells my story going from age 12 to now, from wondering if I was gay to sharing life with my partner, and the rainbow love that was there in my heart the whole time, through all the crying and all the joy. Me around 12, omg what a journey ahead of me... the fear of hell, of not being accepted into Heaven because I had this terrible sin that was a deep part of who I was. On top of a mountain in Austria My boyfriend and I in our early years :) Going against all the authority figures in my life, and taking a step into my heart, into this love. Aww so young and serious After so many years of dreaming about it, moving to the west coast together and feeling a bit like Heaven on Earth. SO glad I listened to my heart and not my fears. On our move to LA last year, living our dreams! I sang the song for the first time at church on Sunday and received such a great response and several tears, it was really encouraging and makes me want to share it more widely. This is kinda new territory for me, most of my songs are super esoteric and this one is a bit more relatable I think (especially for gays). First Unitarian of LA on Instagram: "Thanks to @masonofma for sharing an original song at today's special LGBTQ+ Pride Service. #happypride #unitarianuniversalist" A great producer in Nashville reached out, who can work with me remotely and turn it into a nice power pop ballad, and I can record the vocals here with a friend. So I'm all set, just need YOU! Thank you for helping get this song out there!!!

Hello there! It's almost SHOW TIME!    My name is Lauren and I am so happy you have landed on our Fairhaven Summer Repertory Theatre (FSRT) Kickstarter page! I am the 2019 fundraising fairy/thespian/Development Director and I have been asked to help raise $10,000 for this ambitious program produced by Bellingham TheatreWorks. But Lauren, your Kickstarter goal is only $2K? Why is that? I am so glad you asked! To be honest, our team is pretty nervous about this Kickstarter. To be even MORE honest, it's the first Kickstarter I've been in charge of and we wanted to set a goal we believe is obtainable! We hope you will consider supporting our work and maybe with some luck and your help to spread the word this Kickstarter will take off and get us to 10K! So, without further adieu, let's get into those details!  T H E � D E T A I L S  W H A T � A R E � Y O U � F U N D R A I S I N G � F O R ? We need funding to provide: AFFORDABLE THEATRE for all! We want to keep ticket prices low and to be able to provide those who need financial assistance the support they need to see quality productions. PAY ARTISTS involved in our productions! The time, dedication, and quality of our local actors, designers, and crew members is priceless. Our FSRT Creative team is top-notch and we want to be able to honor that. Starving artists should be a thing of the past! RETURN NEXT SUMMER with more quality theatre! W H A T � A R E � Y O U � D O I N G ? We are creating a summer season! Three shows, performing six nights a week for four weeks at the Firehouse Arts and Events Center in Bellingham, WA. We are bringing world class theatre with a local twist to our up-and-coming arts community in Fairhaven! Our shows for 2019. We are going BEYOND the page, BEYOND the stage, and with this 2019 season giving our community an opportunity to discuss the quality of life of patients and their families who face the problems associated with serious or life-threatening illness. The theme of the shows of our 2019 season. To achieve this level of engagement about quality of life we are excited to be partnered with Western Washington University's Palliative Care Institute. Together we are providing a space through the arts where people living with serious illnesses or facing the end of life don�t have to be cured to heal.    S H O W S    Fairhaven Summer Repertory Theatre | Facebook Our Inaugural 2019 Summer Season Includes: WIT by Margaret Edson "Pulitzer Prize-winning play - a sardonic, funny, and heart-wrenching exploration of the puzzle of our irrevocable journey toward death, as seen through the eyes of a feisty 50-year-old professor of English Literature who has been diagnosed with Stage IV ovarian cancer." CAT ON A HOT TIN ROOF by Tennessee Williams "As a family gathers to celebrate Big Daddy's birthday, sins of the past and desperate, clawing hopes for the future spar with one another as the knowledge that Big Daddy is dying slowly makes the rounds in this 1955 Pulitzer Prize winning classic." THE CLEAN HOUSE by Sarah Ruhl. "This Pulitzer nominated romantic comedy is about loss, love, change and redemption, The Clean House is both whimsical and touching. A serious career-oriented doctor, Lane, has hired a quirky Brazilian maid. The only problem is that the maid, Matilde, hates to clean. Instead, she longs to be a comedienne." W H A T ' S � T H E � P L A N ? The show will go on! No matter what happens with the 2K Kickstarter goal, the 10K season goal, theatre will be happening this July. As with all theatre, it is a labor of love and dedication and we have gone into this adventure prepared. We need this funding so we can improve, remain affordable, and grow roots in Fairhaven. WE MADE OUR STRETCH GOAL! With just a few minutes remaining we reached our stretch goal! Your messages and support has been amazing. We're so grateful. We're excited to add a special, signed commemorative launch print to all shipments. Come with us to the forefront of space exploration... ...to rocket launchpads, to intimate interviews with astronauts, scientists and to transformative experiences designed by inspired artists. Join us every step of the way as we document through a stunning short film, an augmented reality book... and take the emotion and story of space directly to communities across the U.S. in our touring show. Physical rewards begin to ship next month and act as a constantly-updating virtual portal while design, filming and post-production finish. We're so honored to be featured by Kickstarter as a "Projects We Love". Read our coverage in Wired, Inverse, Inverse(2), BoingBoing, Digital Trends, and NPR's "Are We There Yet?" Podcast. We place autonomous ultra-high speed video cameras at the launchpads of SpaceX, NASA, and ULA. These are cameras we position well ahead of the liftoff, design to survive the elements and, since no humans can be anywhere near the rockets, trigger without any interaction. The results are stunning. Close to our hearts are the intimate interviews with astronauts, scientists, and the people sending missions to space; as well as artists, musicians and philosophers who are inspired by these events. The art and the pages in this book come to life immediately teleporting you to rocket launch pads and directly to our intimate interviews with astronauts. We fuse art with science blending our love of photography with compelling video to capture the emotion, excitement, and gravity of these events. Hardcover. Foil stamped. Rich in video-enhanced photography. Augmented reality enhanced book mockup Rewards include four mission art cards: SpaceX Falcon Heavy, ULA Delta IV, SpaceX Falcon 9, Orbital twilight events The book and art come to life using augmented reality with a simple and free iOS or Android app (actual demo) "Guidance Internal: Lessons from Astronauts", augmented reality book mock-up We've already begun touring the live show�traveling in our mobile observatory, speaking to communities throughout the United States, reaching groups far from where these events take place. First premiered at NASA Kennedy Space Center, these talks combine our personal journey, interviews, and compelling visuals into an exciting and inspirational presentation. Guidance Internal first premiered at Yuri's Night NASA Kennedy Space Center on April 13th 2019 We love taking you along with us as we travel together full-time in an off-the-grid personal version of Carl Sagan's Ship of the Imagination. Voyager 3 (our version of Carl Sagan's Ship of the Imagination) at the SETI Allen telescope array We are two humans (and a pup) building a movement. The traveling crew: Pup Tuck, Ryan Chylinski, and MaryLiz Bender Ryan and MaryLiz at NASA Kennedy Space Center MaryLiz Bender is a space artist and live show producer who brings together communities of artists, scientists, and philosophers to tell powerful stories and create transformative experiences. She spent several years as a touring musician, learning how impactful it is to meet communities where they are. This inspired her to take the Cosmic Perspective on tour, building a network of people along the way that work to elevate empathy in their own communities. In 2017, she sold her house, her possessions and hit the road full-time in her mobile observatory. Persevering through poverty, addiction, and depression, she knows the importance in pursuing meaningful work, linking positive people together, and the life transformations that can result from focused inner-work. Cosmic Perspective is her mission to help others pursue a meaningful life. MaryLiz interviewing Michelle Thaller at the NASA ICESAT-2 launch Ryan Chylinski is a cinematographer who has spent the past several years working with altered perception photography to tell stories like they�ve never been told before. His mission documenting rocket launches, and the science and people behind them, has been featured on the cover of magazines, news sites, and premiered on networks including the Discovery Channel and A24 studios. SpaceX Falcon Heavy photograph featured on the cover of Ad Astra magazine We filmed exclusively for A24 and Supercluster during the Falcon Heavy Arabsat-6A launch. Timelapse Photography, his best-selling book, has sold over 14,000 copies worldwide and forms the framework for a larger educational platform inspiring creatives, both amateur and pro alike, to explore realms beyond the human eye and tell stories in new and dynamic ways. Ryan placing solar powered high-speed video cameras at Vandenberg Air Force Base We also bring 360 cameras with us to the pads and have developed a physical "robotic finger" to get around the fact that some systems simply are not designed to be triggered via software. Look for more 360 and VR experiences going live during the campaign. During the SpaceX CRS-15 launch Erik Kuna, Tom Cross and Ryan Chylinski executed a planned Sony, Canon, and Nikon shot capturing an orbital sunrise event with Tesla Models S, 3, X arrayed in the foreground. See one of the final images below and watch the extended length collaboration discussion to learn exactly how they pulled it off. The results were stunning. Your support will allow us to dedicate the next year to completing our research on empathy-elevating experiences, conducting additional interviews with astronauts, artists, scientists, and related professionals through the lens of our grand adventure to space. We hadn't met yet, but in 2017, we both sold everything�our homes and possessions�and we took to the road full-time to research a phenomenon. The research tugged us both to NASA Kennedy Space Center where we met just after a rocket launch. We fell madly in love and began our journey together. While traveling together full-time for the last year, we've shared moments of awe that have changed our lives and shaped who we are today. We can't help but share them with the world. Come fly with Leonardo in a whole new way! Building on the success of our first Kickstarter picture book Sleep, Acroterion Books presents our plan for Leonardo Dreams of his Flying Machine! To celebrate the 500th anniversary of the life and creative accomplishments of this great Renaissance master, artist Anne Horjus has created a series of wondrous oil paintings to tell the visual story of the libretto written by Charles Anthony Silvestri for the choral masterpiece of the same name by composer Eric Whitacre. Choirs and audiences all over the world have thrilled to the soaring and ethereal harmonies of Whitacre's setting, and now you can experience Leonardo's daring leap in a whole new way! Here is one of the many fine performances of Whitacre's Leonardo Dreams of his Flying Machine, by the VocalEssence Ensemble Singers and conducted by Eric Whitacre himself. Anne's paintings for the book are based on many original works by Leonardo, adapted to fit the story of the text. His illustrations all fit together in an ingenious series of interlocking compositional layers, worthy of Leonardo's cleverness, with each painting flowing seamlessly into the next, sharing a compositional structure all based on the face of Leonardo as he dreams of flight. We have added new text as well, introducing you to Leonardo himself, his life and work, his methods and techniques, and his musings on the future of flight. Your amazing stretch goal support for our Sleep project enabled Anne to create these remarkable paintings. Now with your help we can raise the funds necessary to print Leonardo Dreams Of His Flying Machine with the same quality and care, and share it with the world! With your support as a generous backer of this campaign you will enable us to print Leonardo at Worzalla Press in Wisconsin, just as we did Sleep, so the same deluxe quality, feel, and weight that folks have loved about Sleep will be duplicated with this book. Your support also enables us to create a full print run of 3000 books, so that Leonardo can take his place alongside his sister, Sleep, at bookstores and on Amazon for years to come. Like Sleep, Leonardo Dreams Of His Flying Machine combines a well-known choral work with a picture book, enabling interdisciplinary learning in Music, Language Arts, and History classrooms. But we suspect that our most enthusiastic backers will be choir geeks like ourselves! If you have sung Leonardo, let us know! We thank you for your consideration, and for your backing yet another exciting project! We look forward to rewarding you for your support, and we won't let you down! (All artwork, music, and video on this page are used with kind permission of the creators.)
