mock-up image of Two Tribes Two Tribes is an allegory for tribalism and political polarization in America today. Set in a land nearby but a time long ago, it tells the epic tale of our left and right-leaning ancestors who must overcome their differences in order to save their shared home. With Dr. Suess style rhymes, beautiful illustrations, and a comical but timely metaphor, Two Tribes is for kids and adults alike. What people are saying... Know someone else that would love Two Tribes? Want to be part of the movement that fixes our polarizing politics? Let your friends know about Two Tribes. About the author Hello! I'm Tyler. Two Tribes is my first book, and was written on a spark of inspiration (more on that later). I currently work in business operations, before that I volunteered full time in Nepal and Louisiana, and before that I worked for a healthcare software company. In case you were wondering, I don't identify with any political party. Where I'm coming from: I grew up in a conservative family, attended liberal schools, and have friends on both sides of the aisle. As someone with ties to people on both sides, I am really worried about the spread of tribalism and political extremism in America. I have watched good people become hateful and divisive, and seen families torn apart by differences in political opinions. I have met intelligent people who have lost faith in truth and reason, and heard normally kind individuals spew hateful insults. I'm guessing you've seen it too. Who is the illustrator? Two Tribes was illustrated by Rachel Beenken. To see more of her amazing work or to get in touch, check out her website: www.rachelbeenken.com Inspiration! The story of Two Tribes was inspired by a conversation I had with my dad. We were talking about a political issue, and after initially agreeing on most things, we started arguing because of a small difference in opinion. He saw things one way and I saw them another. We stopped listening to each other and instead tried to prove we were right. This only made it worse. We fixed nothing and strained our relationship, and we were further apart than when we had started. It seemed to me this was a microcosm of what was happening in politics in general, and I knew we weren't the only people having useless arguments. As a country we are stuck in a tug of war with each other, neither side willing to give an inch to gain a mile. This experience sparked the idea of Two Tribes. I imagined two groups of people, who because of a slight difference between them, struggle to address an issue that threatens them all. Although Two Tribes is a children's book, I hope it will be appreciated by kids and adults of all ages and political backgrounds. Find the reward that's right for you! Why I'm raising money Making and printing a book is surprisingly expensive. I'm raising money to cover the costs of the first print run. Thousands of dollars and hundreds of hours have already gone into the creation of Two Tribes. Without much of a budget left, this Kickstarter will ensure that I can print the first physical copies and make the book available for purchase. 1st print run: $7,500 You mentioned 'political polarization'...what is that? In short, political polarization is when people sort themselves into political groups that become increasing hostile towards one another and more extreme and certain in their opinions or ideology. The Pew Research Center says that "Republicans and Democrats are more divided along ideological lines � and partisan acrimony is deeper and more extensive � than at any point in recent history." Why should you care? In a recent study, over 40% of participants in each political party said they view the other party as "downright evil." This would indicate almost 50 million voters in America believe that people on the other side are inherently evil, not just misinformed or of a different opinion. Additionally, nearly 1 in 5 participants agreed with the question: "Do you ever think we'd be better off as a country if large numbers of the opposing party in the public today just died?" Americans no longer simply disagree with one another. They hate, fear, and are unwilling to work with people they disagree with. This is bad for the country and sets a terrible example for the next generation of voters. Worse, it sets the grounds for politically motivated violence and gives power to the extreme ends of the political spectrum. Polarization is a threat to everyone - left and right leaning alike. Stretch Goals - Help Unlock These Great Goals What's the timeline for Two Tribes? Two Tribes was created with the help of the amazing team at Wise Ink Creative Publishing. Thank you for supporting Two Tribes!

Beach Family's first project, in collaboration with Schmengie, Inc., is a new comedic web series, Annabel! Created by Bonnie Dolan, Annabel brings together goofy, zany comedy with real heart and honest storytelling. It was borne out of a love for classic rom-com movies and half-hour sitcoms, but also a desire for more serious character depth, complexity, and diversity. Annabel features female, LGBTQ+, and POC characters and relationships. Here's a synopsis! Annabel Stevens, Walking Disaster�, is in trouble. Her sister wants her to find love, her mother wants her to find her dreams, her best friends want her to find her humanity - but she just wants to sit, eat a lot of cheese balls and make rent. Can Annabel figure out how to grow up without losing who she is? Here are the faces of some humans involved in the show! Bonnie Dolan as Annabel Stevens Bonnie Dolan is a multi-hyphenate artist based in Los Angeles, CA. She holds a BA in Theatre Performance from Cal State Long Beach, performing regularly with California Repertory Company (Kaliope/She Kills Monsters, Swing/Wonderland, Featured Artist/WOKE! A Revolutionary Cabaret). She has also performed with South Coast Symphony and Knoxville Symphony Orchestra. Bonnie is a founding ensemble member and co-artistic director of Contigo Theatre Company, an LA-based ensemble of actors, writers, and directors committed to telling underrepresented stories. She served as assistant director and collaborator of Dreamers: Aqui y Alla (California Repertory), a devised theatre piece heralded by OC Weekly as the Best Play of 2018. Most recently, she originated the role of Rover in Rover the Bear, a play for young audiences using puppets and movement (Take the Stage Productions). On camera, she can be seen as the title character in the upcoming comedy web series Annabel, as Margot in Jeannie Elise Mai�s sci-fi web series Holly, and as Erin in the short film SISTER. Written works: Waffles, Annabel. You can find her on Instagram @thebonniebelle. Christian B. Schmidt as Jamie Christian B. Schmidt is a Los Angeles-based actor, singer, writer, and CSULB alumni. Schmidt has starred in several stage productions over the years; some of his favorite shows including "Rent," "Into The Woods," and "Little Shop of Horrors." Outside of acting, Schmidt enjoys writing sketch comedy, and has also written music for a myriad of projects. He absolutely loves playing snark-master Jamie on "Annabel" and is fortunate enough to be one of the series writers as well. He hates writing bios, but loves the readers! Barbara Vides as Mandy Barbara Vides is an actor and writer from Hawthorne, CA. She has appeared in several productions including �Wanda�s Visit�, �The Laramie Project�, and �The Pillowman� and also wrote the play �Distortion� which was performed at the 2017 Let�s Create Play Festival. She earned her BA in Theatre Performance from Cal State Long Beach and is a founding member of Contigo Theatre Company. Charles Denton as Ben Charles Denton is a LA based artist known for his acting, writing, and musicianship. He has studied with Steppenwolf Theatre Company, and holds a BA in Theatre Performance from Long Beach State, where he performed for two years with California Repertory. He is a founding ensemble member of Contigo Theatre Company in Long Beach, CA, a company with which he currently writes and acts. On camera, Charles is currently playing Ben in the filming of Annabel, a Comedy Webseries. Recent projects on stage include originating the role of John Chase in a Simon Stephens US premiere (The Funfair), as well as playing an unforgettable dual role of Jesus and Stephen Hawking in End Days. As an activist for social change, Charles has collaborated to devise powerful, ensemble focused works, the most recent of which was named by OC Weekly as the Best Play of 2018. (Dreamers, Aqu� y All�) As a musician, Charles is an experienced clarinetist, a skill of which has often worked in tandem with his acting on stage. (WOKE! A Revolutionary Cabaret and The Funfair) Charles has written multiple complete works for the stage (Show Yourself and 8th and Olive) and is currently developing a piece for Contigo Theatre. The cast, with director/producer Alex Romero and editor/producer Quin McCarthy

Do You Love ASMR? Have you ever become pleasantly zoned out while watching Bob Ross or listening to someone tap their nails? If so, then you've probably experienced ASMR. ASMR (or autonomous sensory meridian response) is a deeply relaxing experience in which certain sounds trigger a tingly feeling in your body. People describe it as chill, blissful, even euphoric�and it can be brought on by something as simple as listening to someone brush their hair, whisper, or crinkle paper. It may sound a little out there, but it's hugely popular. (Perhaps you've read about how Cardi B's a fan or seen the ASMR commercial featuring Zo� Kravitz?) Whether you're a longtime ASMR enthusiast or just curious, we have a first of its kind product that we think you'll love. Experience ASMR Like Never Before It's called SleepPhones�: ASMR Edition, and it's the first headphones to come preloaded with ASMR content. (Eight hours, in fact!) And these aren't just any headphones�they're SleepPhones�, the world's most comfortable headphones for sleeping and relaxing. SleepPhones� feature flat speakers in a soft, stretchy headband. They also contain a thin, flexible module with a button that lets you play, pause, skip tracks, and control the volume. With SleepPhones�: ASMR Edition, there's no external device or cords�just simple headphones that can play for 20 hours from a three-hour charge. You'll love the superior sound quality from the eco-friendly, lead-free speakers. Ditto for the comfortable headband made from our proprietary SheepCloud� fabric. Our headbands are machine washable and come in two fabrics: warm Fleece and moisture-wicking Breeze. You can also choose from three sizes and lots of great colors! Get Ready to Tingle We worked with 16 top ASMRtists from all over the world to create the preloaded recordings for SleepPhones�: ASMR Edition. You'll enjoy everything from rhythmic tapping to light scratching to peaceful Italian whisperings. And you'll enjoy lots of it because these artists have recorded 8 hours of deeply relaxing ASMR content for your listening pleasure! Imagine slipping a soft, pliable headband over your ears. A small button in the back of the headband cues hours of ASMR to start playing. This button also lets you adjust the volume and skip tracks. There are no ads, no blue light from a device, and no scrolling�just a whole lot of incredibly relaxing ASMR ready for you to enjoy. Unwind with These ASMRtists We spent many months gathering just the right mix of ASMRtists for this special project. We're proud to include the following 16 ASMRtists on SleepPhones�: ASMR Edition. Collectively, they have 2.4 million YouTube subscribers! Alana ASMR ASMR Mam� Susurros ASMR Psychetruth ASMRwithAllie Be calm with Becca ASMR Brittany ASMR Christen Noel ASMR DiamondASMR Doncella SusurrosASMR Fairy ASMR Marno ASMR TheOneLilium ASMR QueenOfSerene ASMR Seafoam Kitten's ASMR Tori ASMR WhisperAudios ASMR Your Support Matters With your backing, we will be able to secure our first shipment of SleepPhones�: ASMR Edition. As a self-funded, inventory-based business, we must put forth a substantial level of investment to design, manufacture, ship, and store a new product. Any amount you pledge will help us get one step closer to making SleepPhones�: ASMR Edition a reality! Here's a timeline of what's been done so far�and what you can expect when you back this one-of-a-kind Kickstarter campaign: A Bit More About Us Our company is called AcousticSheep LLC, and we're the inventors of SleepPhones�, the world's first and most comfortable headphones for sleeping. They say necessity is the mother of invention, and that was certainly the case when it came to SleepPhones�. After taking patient phone calls late into the night, Dr. Wei-Shin Lai wanted to listen to relaxing music in bed. But only bulky headphones or uncomfortable earbuds were on the market. So she and her husband decided to design comfortable headband headphones you can wear in bed�even if you sleep on your side. SleepPhones� feature wafer-thin speakers in a super soft headband so anyone can easily and comfortably listen to music, audio books, meditation tracks, and more in bed. Since 2007, our company has sold more than one million SleepPhones� and won many awards for our patented invention. Beyond helping people sleep and relax, SleepPhones� became very popular within the ASMR community. Some of the top ASMR YouTube artists have promoted our products to their millions of followers for years. That got us thinking: Why not marry SleepPhones� award-winning design with great ASMR content? Soon, that will be a reality with SleepPhones�: ASMR Edition. Our 2015 Kickstarter campaign for our SleepPhones� Effortless� exceeded its goal by 656%, and we hope this project will, too. Thank you for supporting SleepPhones�: ASMR Edition!

You may know or you may not but Randy Butterknubs: Awakening is a short film made by the cousins years ago. It is a story with no real plot...all you needed to know was that Randy was coming and Jimmy Crumpet had to stop him. Along the way Jimmy Crumpet (Humphrey) had met many characters. Manticore (Drew), Dances with Squirrels (Gerald), Randy (Alex), and Randy's Evil Henchman (Hunter and Thomas), and even a Cameo from Nana, Kim, Copeland. This project we made was almost forgotten but we have revisited the source material and decided to bring the film back. We are now capable of so much more and want to make a six year old film into a new age. Some Characters can't return, and some others may not. But for the ones who can't return we plan to make this film in a way that would make them happy and make them laugh. The budget for the film that we have set is to cover the costs of the costumes and other expenses, since we plan to take this a bit more serious. I can't afford to make this investment on my own and I am mostly asking family and those involved in the film to contribute. Thank you so much and we hope to be able to create something that would not only be our proudest work, but also something to represent the creative, crazy, and unique nature of our family.

"Some games in my life translate into stories that bring back great memories. Battlestations is one such game." -Tom Vasel "Battlestations is the living manifestation of every spaceship I drew in my middle school notebook instead of listening to my teachers. Its modular design is tremendously influential among game designers, and it's great to see it roar back onto the scene." -Mike Selinker (Designer, Pathfinder Adventure Card Game) To purchase an Add-On, just stay in your pledge tier and add the total cost for the Add-Ons you want. We will have a pledge manager after the campaign ends. Battlestations - 45 miniatures, modular ships and space maps Dirtside - 40+ miniatures, millions of planet combinations, and 180+ page scenario book We need space explorers! Battlestations: You are simultaneously moving your minis around your starship boards (to activate battlestations or fight off boarding pirates)� while ALSO flying your ship mini around on the separate spacemap, dodging asteroids or launching missiles. Many missions can be played fully co-op or solo, but generally a moderator facilitates the game. We need boots on the ground! Dirtside: Each type of terrain has thematic and intuitive rules; hide in buildings or gain cover in trees! The enemies and other threats are all controlled by the game itself, but you can play with a moderator if you want to. Gain experience and abilities between missions! Each mission has a defined goal, and the campaign has an ongoing narrative of mystery, action, and adventure. Each turn you each get to move + take an action - like piloting a ship or vehicle, or operating a weapon or medkit. Battlestations and Dirtside both use the same game system and are fully compatible, so characters and equipment migrate seamlessly. They are also both standalone. Battlestations has received worldwide acclaim. Now it is time for Battlestations: Dirtside. Battlestations takes place on ships. Dirtside takes place on ships AND planets! If you have questions, back any tier and post in the comments. You can change your tier. You won't be charged until June 27th. More info about Battlestations can be found at the bottom of this page, or here. Battlestations: DIRTSIDE is both a board game and a RPG. It can be played - without a game master - up to 8 players, or played solo. It can also be played as a tactical skirmish game (player vs. player). It is a science fiction adventure on the surface of alien worlds. Features dozens of aliens species, multiple factions vying for power, and cloning technology. You don't need Battlestations to play. Your character starts with a special ability, weapons, and an ability for your species. You can gain experience, rank up, purchase equipment between missions, and gain new abilities. The action is fully contained in each mission, but your character growth is unlimited. Simple rules, and a tutorial campaign to learn advanced rules one-at-a-time. I couldn't be more excited for this." -UndeadViking "The opportunities are endless." -Unfiltered Gamer "An incredibly robust system... You can HALO out of a suborbital ship, hijack a jetbike, and overtake a heavy weapon firing from the roof of a tower. Or... Hitch a ride on the outside of a vehicle, and each time the driver makes a maneuver, you'll roll an athletics check to make sure you don�t fall off. Fire from your ship cannon, turning a building into a crater, or just crash the ship onto your target and hope your hull doesn't crack! Launch a satchel charge as a rocket launcher, or lob it as a mortar and re-target the drift based on your combat skill. Use a plasma projector to combo with your Shock Trooper ability to take out 4 grunts hiding behind trees, then see if the trees catch fire! A plasma projector can turn the terrain into a fire or crater! Exists in the established Battlestations universe and is fully compatible with Battlestations: Second Edition and Battlestations: The Starships Hundreds of ability and equipment upgrades, with ongoing character advancement Multiple map boards - your crew can move around inside your starship, launching missiles and teleporter bombs at the surface, or parachute out and move around on the terrain boards on foot or in vehicles Ultra quick turn-actions so players get to take twice as many actions per mission as they would in similar games like Imperial Assault A true sense of camaraderie - nearly all missions are fully cooperative and require every player's unique skills and equipment Unique missions (puzzle solving, combat, natural disasters, etc), with all the threats controlled by the game itself! There's missions for 3 different game modes: Fully Co-Op, 1v1 Skirmish, or Moderated RPG. Journey to dozens of unique planets, or build your own! LANDING PARTY COMES WITH 2 OF EVERY MINI NOW THAT WE HIT ALL THE STRETCH GOALS! Click to view in high resolution. Click to view in higher resolution. The minis from Battlestations are fully compatible and the rules are in the Dirtside book. Those minis are available below, as add-ons, or available as part of the Super-Deluxe tier. Designed from the ground-up to be playable cooperatively (no Game Master), or solo. Some missions can be played as a tactical skirmish game (1v1). Also a fully-compatible extension of Battlestations, which means every mission can also be played as a moderated RPG (using a GM) if your group chooses. Simple flowcharts for calculating enemy actions! Or manually click each link below: Introduction to Dirtside (2 min) Character Actions and Skill Checks (4 min) Personal Movement (4 min) Personal Combat (4 min) Sequence of Play (8 min) Threats (8 min) Mission Difficulty (1 min) Scanning (4 min) Vehicles (5 min) The World of Battlestations (Lore and Mythology) (13 min) Character Actions and Skill Checks (4 min) Example of Play Part 1: Character Actions (9 min) Two obstacles to interstellar flight were solved in the 22nd Century: Hyperdrives to actually get us to other planets, and cloning technology to replace our bodies and brains from backups in the inevitable situation something goes wrong on the trip. You and your friends are a crew of heroes in the far future, landing your starship on mysterious planets, with adventures such as raiding, rescuing, fighting, and escaping. In each mission, you�ll have an objective to cooperatively accomplish, with threats like motor gangs, natural disasters, or planetary bombardment. You can combine your actions to do fun things like ram a jetcar into a building (to turn the building into a crater), or try to put out a fire before it reaches your ship. Your character starts with a special ability, weapons, and an ability for your species. You gain experience over time, rank up, and can purchase equipment between missions, plus gain new abilities. If you own Battlestations, your characters are already fully compatible with Dirtside, and you can transition seamlessly between Battlestations (missions in space) and Dirtside (missions on planets). What will YOU discover, Dirtside? You�ve experienced adventures in space, drifting between planets� now you can explore them. Dirtside is fully compatible with its companion game Battlestations: Second Edition. Characters can migrate freely between the two games, although distance and movement rules are different between the two games. Do I need Battlestations? No, DIRTSIDE is ready to go out of the box. You can play fully cooperatively against the game, or one player can act as the game master for a classic Battlestations RPG experience. Battlestations and Dirtside are cross-compatible, so you can play your characters and minis from one game in the other game! You don�t need to know all the rules before starting a mission for either game, just the basics and the rules for your character and your equipment. You can look up anything else you need later. Dirtside takes place primarily on the surface of planets. Each planet is different. There's several vehicles to drive around in, and they all have different features. Parachute in, or ride in a boarding missile. Dirtside's world exists in 3 dimensions. You'll have to work together to take down a Vraktian Behemoth! The bigger they are, the harder they fall! Cannon Installation - a small pillbox-like building with a ship-cannon sized gun in multimode. Battlestations Second Edition is based on the same game system as Dirtside. Battlestations is a tabletop starship simulator � a multi-map board game that simultaneously features ship-action in space AND the events on board the ships involved in the conflicts. It is also a roleplaying game in which your characters grow throughout campaigns, picking up experience points, upgrades, and new abilities. You are simultaneously moving your minis around your starship boards (to activate battle stations or fight off boarding pirates)� AND flying your ship mini around on the separate space map, dodging asteroids and launching missiles. Ultra simple rules so anyone can join the game - simply move and take an action, or else take an action and then move. Ultra quick turn actions so players get to take twice as many actions per mission as similar games like Imperial Assault True sense of camaraderie as nearly all missions are fully cooperative Unique missions (puzzle solving, combat, navigation hazards, etc), including missions by guest designers We've been building this incredible game nearly 20 years. Now we're taking it to the next level - DIRTSIDE, a brand new standalone game that is fully cooperative, so you don't need a game master. Plus it can be played completely solo, or played 1 vs 1, as a miniatures skirmish game. Packages will ship to most countries from within those countries. Shipping will be totally weight-based, which means we can know very closely in advance how much the shipping will cost. See the chart below to estimate shipping. Shipping will be under $20 USD for most backers We are fulfilling from hubs in the UK (EU and Rest of the World), USA, CANADA, CHINA or HONG KONG (Asia), and AUSTRALIA/NZ. Brick-and-mortar retailers can order cartons of 4 copies - they pay only $15 shipping in the USA or the EU. Shipping Estimates Landing Party (basic game) weighs just under 4.5 kg (10 lbs). ASIA: $26 to China and Hong Kong. REST OF ASIA: $30 AUSTRALIA and NZ: $20-$26 AFRICA: $60+ (message us) Rest of World: $30-$60 (message us) Shipping is the worst part of this whole process. We are sorry. On Battlestations we undercharged shipping by tens of thousands of dollars and the dire financials slowed our ability to create new games. Dirtside is a heavy game and it costs money to ship, but it will be worth it. CHARGES: June 27th - Main pledges charged. BackerKit will be open for 3-5 months to purchase Add-Ons. Shipping and Add-Ons will be charged 1-2 months prior to shipping. That's it! I am ready to deliver a game for you to love for decades. Thanks for reading, and message us if you have any questions! -Jeff Siadek

As promised, the PnP funds (from the last campaign) have now been used to create the manufactured version! This board game involves more than dangerous paths and chance encounters; it also demands a careful use of food and water. No food -- your team can't move. No water -- your team dies. In other words -- logistics, in the form of food, water, and trade goods tokens your team needs to ration until you can find, trade, or steal for more along the way. A perfect 1 - 2 player board game with entertaining escapism. For those seeing this for the first time, here's the introduction to the game (if you've already saw this last time, scroll past it): Somewhere on a mountain top, an airplane crashes. Are there any survivors? No one knows, and very few care. Why? Because there was gold on board that plane. Your mission is to take your team (starting with six members) to the top of the mountain and bring back the gold, and if you come back empty-handed, your backers will make you wish you never did. Sounds easy? Don't even think it! For starters, you may have another team trying to beat you to the treasure. Then, near the top, there's the chance for avalanches that will bury you faster than you can take a breath. And what about that rickety old bridge you may have to cross? Will your steps be the ones that will take it -- and you -- to the bottom of the ravine? And then there are villagers. Friendly you think? Maybe yes; maybe no. Entering a village can result in anything to from celebrations or normal trade to mysterious diseases or even a personal invitation to dinner from a bunch of cannibals! Some paths are easier than others -- maybe. One leads to a vast thicket patch that may take an eternity as you aimlessly cut your way through. Another leads through a desolate mountain path completely devoid of water. Let's say you're lucky. Very lucky. Let's say there's no avalanches, broken bridges, or even bad village encounters. You're not out of danger yet. Not by a long shot. There's the little matter of food and water to consider. Because the journey is strenuous, you need food and lots of it! And water? Well, let's just say you simply can't live without it! You must manage your team's food and water as though your lives depended upon it, because it does. Without food, your team cannot move; without water, your team dies. Will you have enough food and water for the journey to the gold and back? That's up to you, and luck. Along the way, you will run low on both, but you will have opportunities to get both from villages -- if they're friendly and free of disease -- and you'll have ample free water in the snow capped regions of the mountains -- if you get that far. Your team can leave supplies behind along the way for later, but be sure the team picking it up again is your team. Feel free to trade with the competing team, but keep in mind that if your team is smaller than theirs, they can take all they can carry of yours and leave you stranded. So, are you up to the challenge? Can you handle the tedious, but life-sustaining, task of keeping your people supplied while you press on for the gold? Are you willing to accept the inevitable loss of team members and face the disappointment that, one by one, your team gets smaller and smaller? Can you keep your head and not panic when the food and water runs low? Are you willing to sacrifice all for the gold? If so, back this game for a board game that will give you the time of your life! PRODUCT SPECIFICS (comparing the new manufactured to the old PnP ): 1. The printed 5 pages of Rules are now in a convenient booklet: 2. The flimsy paper game board is now a sturdy quad-fold: 3. No more hunting down suitable dice; all properly colored & sized dice included: 4. Thicker pieces make for easier manipulation on the game board, as well as being less likely to get bent: 5. Lastly, uniform pressing of all pieces ensure a smart look and don't have imperfect cuts that might hint at what message is on the opposite side (for Village, Bridge, and Avalanche pieces):

Welcome to Hell! Disclaimer: if you are in anyway offended by fictitious, treacherous, and grotesque creatures from the depths of hell, this Kickstarter is not for you! If you are not offended by these things: I hope you will join me in my efforts to raise this set of 5 miniature demons from the darkest corners of abysmal darkness. Forged from the dungeons of Skeleton Head Toys - these monstrosities are sure to stand out on your gaming table! Each miniature has been hand sculpted in epoxy putty and will be cast in high quality resin. I have already created 2 master castings and the funding from this project will go towards the materials to mold and cast the rest of these miniatures. All profits will go towards future projects from Skeleton Head Toys! There have been some exciting stretch goals unlocked in the campaign. Take a look at what you get: A better look at the miniatures: Varpor The overseer of the netherworld, Varpor watches over the eternal torment of the damned! A 32mm scale miniature, he stands at 60mm from top of base to top of head. $11 Varpor $11 Kralen A terrifying and statuesque entity, Kralen uses it's engulfing "wings" to draw in and demolish all hope from unlucky observers. Kralen stands at 45mm to the top of head. $13 Kralen $13 Evor A violent and dangerous entity trapped in the mutated form of an elephant! Stands at 40mm to the top of head. $13 Evor $13 Klaxis The unstoppable rage filled beast, Klaxis has only one thing on his mind... The tormenting of condemned souls! 60mm to top of horn. $15 Klaxis $15 Gasth Giving birth is never easy and it doesn't get any better in hell! Gasth spends its days painfully producing the demons that populate hell. A 40mm scale miniature on a 50mm round base. $12 Gasth $12 Stretch Goals Some fun stretch goals have been unlocked during the campaign. Reviews Cryptic Brush takes a look at some of the miniatures I have created for this campaign and painted a few up. He does a great job of going over the details of each mini. Check it out: Resin Casts I have spent a great deal of time over the last few years learning to cast miniatures. I make use of high pressure casting to ensure the miniatures come out in the highest quality possible. Addons If would like to add additional items you can choose any one of the tiers and then add the additional funds to that tier for the items you are interested in. Doomed Souls Playset with Varpor for size (not inclued) Shipping Shipping will be calculated after the campaign has ended. Paypal and Venmo are prefered for shipping costs, but I will attempt to accommodate all customer's preferred method. Please feel free to contact me with any questions. Estimated prices are as follows: United States: $5 Canada : $11 Rest of World : $15 Large quantities may affect shipping charges. Some locations may be higher than listed. If you are at all concerned with shipping prices, please contact me.

The Main Stage Kids are headed to New York! Our young performers have been invited to perform at the Triad Theater in New York City on June 30th! They will perform alongside other young artists in training in an off-Broadway youth showcase hosted by New Jersey's Professional Performance Prep. All four of the young performers making the trip have been a prominent part of our Main Stage company over the past 5 years. You've seen them The Secret Garden, Annie, Mary Poppins, Oliver, and this summer, Matilda! Our young performers are serious about their craft, and their training. In addition to performing for the community they take weekly voice and dance lessons, perform with Main Stage's children's company, and several also play instruments. The girls will be performing a tribute their home theater and community. A selection of "Our Favorite Things" - a medley of songs from Main Stage shows past, present, and future. We are passionate about supporting these young artists in taking on this exciting opportunity and further pursuing their artistic goals. Creating opportunities for young performers is a part of the foundation of our organization. Helping these 4 young artists, who have given so much of their time and talents to the Main Stage community, get to New York is no exception! Thank you for support of youth performing arts in Humboldt County!

For my 30th birthday I'm recording an album of my original songs. Help me cover the production costs and I'll send you a physical copy! You can choose between CD, vinyl, or cassette tape. I started writing songs in high school. I would sit with my guitar for hours and hours, painstakingly crafting miserable little pieces of poetry and putting them to music. Nothing has changed since then in that regard, but I did eventually graduate high school and went on to study music theory. When I was 20 I began teaching a songwriting class at Camp Winnarainbow. Kids ages 7 to 14 would come write weird songs in the woods and perform them for their parents after two weeks. The most popular topics kids choose to write songs about are 1) ex-boyfiends, 2) food, and 3) dinosaurs. Check out this classic. This album is all the songs I wrote in my twenties that I still enjoy playing. Some were written a decade ago; some I wrote this year. You'll notice they all have nice major chords and rhyming lyrics. Thanks for your support! -Jordan

If you�re old enough...or hip to awesome cinematic lore, you remember the joy of wandering the blissfully bloody aisles of the horror section of your local video store. We're not talking about the big, brightly-lit stores like Blockbuster, either. We mean the hole-in-the-wall shops, where you could find some deep dive horror movies. Well, welcome to Video Hell. Lunchbox Press proudly presents Graveyard Slaughter. Lunchbox Press invites you back to those video stores of old. This collection of four horror epics is written by Cullen Bunn and Kevin Watkins. The stories are illustrated by a host of amazing talent, including Javier Saltares, Blacky Shepherd, Gary Bedell, and Adam McLaughlin. We are also pleased to have award-winning and best-selling author, Paul Tremblay, providing an introduction to our premiere issue. The stories in this comic harken back to the dark, bloody, subversive horror yarns that sat in clamshell boxes on video stores shelves across the country. They�re gruesome and gory and fun horror tales, and we're all psyched to be part of the book. Once funded...we plan on delivering you the book by Halloween 2019. Be kind. Rewind. Or die. Early Acclaim for Graveyard Slaughter �Video store wonderment, arcades and slasher gore, everything I wanted when I was 9!� -CM Punk (Mixed martial artist, actor (Rabid), comic book writer (Drax), and retired professional wrestler) "Reading this collection felt like stepping back in time to my first reads of Goosebumps, or watching Are you Afraid of the Dark." -The Convention Collective "Their 50-page comic book anthology perfectly embraces the bloody madness and nostalgia of classic '80s VHS gore and those passionately curated horror aisles of the deep-dive video rental stores." -SyFyWire "80s homage that is perfectly brought to life with thrills and chills that will ignite your imagination as you get lost in this world." -Reading With A Flight Ring "Come for the monsters, the gore, and the scares, and stay for the exact same reason. It�s truly an enjoyable read for anyone that loves the camp, gore, and horror that the 1980s did so well." -Monkeys Fighting Robots "It�s hard not to love this book. Graveyard Slaughter #1 embraces the off the wall mania of the VHS horror section." -But Why Tho? "Stories of the lunatic in the woods, the teens drinking and partying, or the game of hide and seek in the graveyard are all tropes that have been used often. It is the execution of these stories and, in some, the ending that keeps you engaged in Graveyard Slaughter." -DIS/MEMBER "Graveyard Slaughter is dripping with '80s nostalgia and covered in blood...all of the stories feel like they were pulled right from my childhood." -Horror DNA Promotional ad by Gary Bedell The Graveyard Slaughter Super Group...from left to right...Javier Saltares, Gary Bedell, Cullen Bunn, Kevin Watkins, Blacky Shepherd, Adam McLaughlin At over 50 pages, the first issue is done. We are so excited to share it with you. There will be three different covers to choose from: Standard Cover by Gary Bedell, Variant Cover by Javier Saltares, and a limited Sketch Cover option by the artist of your choice. Each backer of the physical copy of the book will get an exclusive Graveyard Slaughter Bookmark and a Digital Copy of Survive the Night...The Official Theme of Graveyard Slaughter. Graveyard Slaughter Bookmark Survive the Night: The Official Theme of Graveyard Slaughter Graveyard Slaughter Issue 1 Cover by Gary Bedell Graveyard Slaughter Issue 1 Variant Cover by Javier Saltares Graveyard Slaughter Issue 1 Sketch Cover As you can probably tell, we are so stoked to get you this first issue. We are equally stoked to have the following professional talent involved. Cullen Bunn Cullen Bunn is one of the most prolific writers in comics. He is known for his creator-owned series The Sixth Gun, Shadow Roads, and The Damned for Oni Press; Harrow County and Manor Black for Dark Horse Comics; Bone Parish for Boom! Studios; Pumpkinhead and Vampirella vs ReAnimator for Dynamite; Subspecies for Action Lab; Regression and Unearth for Image; Unholy Grail, Brothers Dracul, and Dark Ark for Aftershock Comics. He also ran successful Kickstarter campaigns for his graphic novels Metro and A Passage in Black. He is also known for his work on Uncanny X-Men, X-Men: Blue, Magneto, and various insanely popular Deadpool miniseries for Marvel Comics. Kevin Watkins Kevin Watkins is the co-owner of Lunchbox Press. He is the writer and co-creator of Listen to the Thunder, and a contributing writer to the graphic novel A Passage in Black. Javier Saltares Javier Saltares is a legend in the comic book industry. He is known for his outstanding 8-year run on Marvel's Ghost Rider. He has also worked for DC, Dark Horse, and IDW. Blacky Shepherd Blacky Shepherd has stormed the professional comic industry with his outstanding work on Voltron: From the Ashes, Pumpkinhead, and Vampirella vs Reanimator for Dynamite Entertainment. Gary Bedell Gary Bedell is an award winning illustrator who has worked for Nickelodeon, Cartoon Network, Fantasy Flight Games, and story board artist for Showtime's movie Above Ground. Adam McLaughlin Adam McLaughlin is co-owner of Lunchbox Press. He is co-creator and artist of Listen to the Thunder, and contributing artist to the graphic novel A Passage in Black. Troy Peteri A Larger World Studios' Troy Peteri lettered the comic. Troy is a Harvey Award nominated letterer who has lettered comics for Top Cow, IDW, Dynamite, Marvel, and DC. Paul Tremblay Paul Tremblay is a Bram Stoker Award winning and best-selling author who has written A Head Full of Ghosts, Disappearance at Devil's Rock, The Cabin at the End of the World, and the forthcoming Growing Things. Stephen King said this about A Head Full of Ghosts, �A Head Full of Ghosts by Paul Tremblay: Scared the living hell out of me, and I�m pretty hard to scare." Stephen King also praised The Cabin at the End of the World, �A tremendous book  thought-provoking and terrifying, with tension that winds up like a chain. The Cabin at the End of the World is Tremblay�s personal best. It�s that good.� Graveyard Slaughter T-Shirt Graveyard Slaughter Issue 1 Sample Page Art by Javier Saltares Graveyard Slaughter Issue 1 Sample Page Art by Gary Bedell Graveyard Slaughter Issue 1 Sample Page Art by Blacky Shepherd Graveyard Slaughter Issue 1 Sample Page Art by Adam McLaughlin Sketch Cover Examples Sketch Cover Examples by artists Adam McLaughlin, Javier Saltares, Gary Bedell, and Blacky Shepherd We have some Super Rad Stretch Goals in store for you SUPER RAD STRETCH GOAL TRACKER...THINGS BEST LEFT BURIED (UNLOCKED), VIDEO HELL MEMBERSHIP CARD (UNLOCKED), AND AN EXCLUSIVE BARBARIC DAYS POSTER BY JAVIER SALTARES (UNLOCKED) Each Super Rad Stretch Goal will be UNLOCKED in levels of $1,000 over Kickstarter Goal Things Best Left Buried: An extra four-page making of special of Graveyard Slaughter (UNLOCKED) Things Best Left Buried: A Behind The Scenes Look At Graveyard Slaughter An exclusive laminated Video Hell Personalized Eternal Membership Card (UNLOCKED) Video Hell Membership Card (Front) Video Hell Membership Card (Back) An exclusive Barbaric Days video game poster (artwork forthcoming) (UNLOCKED) Letter from Alexander Tigh...CEO of Video Games Experiences Blood Splatter option on issue one of Graveyard Slaughter (artwork forthcoming) Graveyard Slaughter Issue One Bloody Splatter Option...Blood Splatter Patterns May Vary. Cover A: Cowgirl Cathy & Schoolgirl Suzie Cover B: Powerhouse Pam The sexiest girls in comics return in a series that launches a universe! In Pussycats: Eat Death, Or Get Naked #1 Cowgirl Cathy and Schoolgirl Suzie think that they're dead. Why wouldn't they? They're on a UFO. Which don't exist. Right? Wrong. Mother Superior chooses space and its silence because her disinformation campaign has done little to turn the odds in her favor. She is still wanted by the U.S. government, her Pussycats are still hunted, and there is nowhere to hide from the men that want them eliminated. This new mini-series will be available in comic shops starting this September � running through December � and you'll see it advertised with the ad slick below featured in the July 2019 PREVIEWS comic shop catalog. NOTE: There are no immediate plans to issue a TP of this series after it concludes. The earliest a TP will be issued will be in fall 2020. However...first stop....Kickstarter! That's right, we're back here first to kick things off like we always do, and this Kickstarter's going to be our biggest to date because we have superstars Tori Duke and Sarah Shellhorn as our cover models throughout the entire series! What that means is get used to seeing these pretty ladies on a lot of our covers and Kickstarter rewards. Oh, yeah, you'll see them in the next 3 Kickstarters we launch after this one, so mark your calendar! Kickstarter #2 for Issue #2: July 7 Kickstarter #3 for Issue #3: August 4 Kickstarter #4 for Issue #4: September 2 Tori and Sarah join a returning Kristy Ann as Powerhouse Pam, plus new models Jen Seidel and Robin Miller will be appearing later as the new Nurse Nancy and Mother Superior! These ladies do us the honor of giving you a series that sets the bar higher on sex, sass, and shotguns! We are now doing interviews and press for this series during this Kickstarter! Courtesy of Todd Mulrooney, here is a YouTube interview that Vince and Tori Duke did on May 30, talking with Chester C Busby III. Learn about the origin of the series, and how the models are an integral part of the Pussycats comic book! PREVIEWSworld has already jumped on this book prior to its release, and their article can be read here. We are also honored to have been featured in an interview by Chris Braly on Bleeding Fool's Indie Showcase! This site is top notch in that they don't bend at the knee for those who are "woke." Check out the interview by clicking on the image below, or by clicking on the link here. For those of you new to Pussycats, in Volumes 1-2 the gun-toting nun Mother Superior has been targeted for elimination in an election year because of her past ties to covert operations during the Cold War. The knowledge that she and her former colleagues possess makes them liabilities. To protect herself, the woman of God goes underground, publishes the names of her former superiors, and recruits the few women she trusts � her �Pussycats� � to help her save members of her former military unit. Her last attempt to cheat death is to leave Earth with the Pussycats in transportation that�s not forged by human hands, or terrestrial technology. Volume 3 reveals how the Pussycats legacy extends to paramilitary lovers Viper and Foxglove. These lesbian lovers try to expose Earth�s zombie plague as an intentional act of genocide by the same people who tried to eliminate the Pussycats. Through classified documents, they learn that decades earlier Mother Superior had tried to stop the plague and other acts of subterfuge from their nation�s leaders, but all of her efforts ended in failure. To see the past 3 storylines at a glance, check out the .pdf previews of the previous trade paperbacks here: Volume 1 TP Volume 2 TP This new series ties together the events shown in Sex, Drugs & The Impossible and The End Of Everything. Present and future events collide in a Eat Death, Or Get Naked, revealing the repercussions of Mother Superior�s unilateral actions. A woman of God is about to feel the wrath of Heaven. The big question is who else becomes collateral damage? Check out some of the new book's interior pages below, and then we'll sum things up, and get to the goodie bags! Check out this preview of issue #1, which is raw meth mixed with adrenaline. Pussycats: Eat Death, Or Get Naked is for Mature Readers, and contains sex, nudity, graphic violence, and foul language. Starting with Eat Death, Or Get Naked #1 each issue of Pussycats now features a gallery of our models in character for sexy stunning photos! Check out Tori Duke and Sarah Shellhorn embracing the love and camaraderie of Cowgirl Cathy and Schoolgirl Suzie! Our goal is to offset the cost of printing this book. That's it. The book is done. It will ship on time. Guaranteed. Anyone who's supported this book in the past can tell you that we always deliver. We're able to do a series a year because Kickstarter keeps us in the black. This time is no different, but because we have new models that went over and beyond for us in this series, check out the volume of new rewards that we have to offer which can suit the tightest of budgets, or for those that want to be in the studio with Tori and Sarah when the cameras took the pictures. To prevent shipping damage, all books come bagged and boarded, and prints and posters ship flat between cardboard. All .PDF files are downloaded. NOTE: Upon request, we can customize your reward tier with additional prints, posters, or comics. Such requests can be sent to us through a Kickstarter message, or you can email us directly at info@pussycatscomics.com. We'll get back to you in 24 hours! *Choose from two covers! Signed editions available, as well as 8x10 prints & 11x17 posters bearing these images. *Choose from two signed covers! Signed editions available, as well as 8x10 prints & 11x17 posters bearing these images. *An 11x17 full-color poster of our trade show banner! *Signed by Sarah Shellhorn! *Our tabloid-sized fan magazine! Available in multiple formats! Signed by Vince! *Featuring 8x10 illustrations ready for framing. All prints signed by Vince! *Re-marked first printings w/exclusive prints signed by Sarah and Tori, plus EDGN #1 signed by Vince!

Read Ch 1 for FREE | Click Here WHAT IS THE ELEMENTAL BALANCE? The Elemental Balance is a story about 4 individuals from around the world who gain the powers of the Elements. They are known as the Elementals. They don�t know how or why they got these powers, but they all diedfrom a natural disaster caused by the Element's energy they harness. The story follows their journey of finding one another in hopes of unraveling the truth behind their powers and its connection to their resurrection. Instead, they discover that they're being hunted by a mysterious force! The story has been written by Zain Shenwari with artwork done by Luke Horsman. This is our 2nd project on Kickstarter and we're really excited to present this to everyone. Project Status: All of the artwork, coloring and lettering have been completed . We'll be ready to mail out the printed comics as soon as the campaign is over. All we need now is your support to help fund the prints for Chapter 4! So...What's the Story Like? If you've enjoyed shows like NBC's "Heroes" and Netflix's show "Sense8" then you would definitely enjoy The Elemental Balance. ELEMENTAL BALANCE CH 4 | FIRED UP They say LOVE is like FIRE because when you're in love the heart ignites. But when the heart breaks, it burns! Chapter 4 of the Elemental Balance takes us to the other side of the world to Chile, South America. A country known for its dense population of volcanoes, surrounding its border by the ring of fire. A suitable birthplace for the Fire Elemental. Adriana and Lucia have been best friends since childhood but they're polar opposites of one another. Adriana prides herself in being good, while Lucia could care less about her image. Growing up, their parents nicked name them "Angelita y Diablita" or translated in English as "little Angel & little Devil". After one of them goes through a heartbreak , the other helps by suggesting going on a hiking trip up a volcano. What could possibly go wrong? Discover the secrets revealed at the pinnacle of a Volcano in Chapter 4, Fired Up. Here are some posts from happy customers from our previous campaign: Paper Action Figures Digital Comics Comics in Print Signed Comic Necklace (From the comic book) Elemental Book Mark Series Bookmark Wristbands Metal Pins | Elemental Symbols Fire Elemental Button Sticker Options Mini Poster (7" x 10.5") Mini Poster (7" x 10.5") Mini Poster (7" x 10.5") ...And more ITEMS to come... CRITIC REVIEWS: CJPendragon from "But Why Tho?". Click here for the full review. "The Elemental Balance is a weirdly awesome mash-up of science, superpowers, and humanity that will leave most readers vying for more. It�s well-written, with just enough suspense to have a thrill for your experience." Steven Leitman from "Reading with a Flight Ring". Click here for the full review. Part of the joy of reviewing books is when people send me their books and I have no idea who they are or what they do. It is that surprise moment when you feel like you�ve discovered something fantastic. This is the kind of book I tell you about and seek folks this out at conventions. Mike from "Chico Comics Page". Click here for the full review. "In comics there are indie publishers, and then there are indie publishers. There was confidence in the writing, the art, and overall design of the book. The art in here is fantastic. Everything feels like a comic I should be reading off the stands." Trever from "Frags and Beer". Click here for the full review. "I enjoyed every panel of this book, and hope to see a lot more from Luke. The pages have a lot of movement and detail. The characters look great against wonderful backgrounds. The pencils are up there with the best that I�ve seen from any company, large or indie. This book is definitely worth checking out." ABOUT ME: Hi, my name is Zain and I�m the writer for The Elemental Balance. I�ve always had a passion for writing stories. In fact, my first story �Game Plan� was written to impress my wife. Spoiler alert, it paid off! I find it rewarding to bring entertainment to people, that�s my niche! My style of storytelling is grounded in reality but, nonetheless, is fiction. Characters are set in unrealistic situations but have very relatable emotions. Imagine if someone could achieve greatness with a determined will, how would they react if they had powers? This is what my stories are rooted in�.emotions! Zain Shenwari - Writer/Creator ABOUT THE ARTIST: Luke Horsman is an extremely talented artist from the UK. He is well versed in many forms of art mediums. In fact, Luke did the pencils, ink, and coloring for the first three chapters. His artwork has truly brought the characters from the script to life. Luke Horsman - Penciler/Inker/Colorist It's been a blast working with him. We mesh really well. I'm particular with scenes and visual symbolism and he's keen on creating eye-catching, bold illustrations. Together we made an excellent team! Check out Luke's website for awesome artwork by clicking here. Other Ways You Can Help Sometimes budgets are tight, and we understand if you can't contribute. But you still can help us out tremendously by getting the word out. Please share links on your social media accounts and feel free to tag us. We could use all the love and support we can get :) Contact Us Need some help? We're always happy to answer any questions. You can contact us through Indiegogo or send us an email at inzanecomics@gmail.com. Or you can visit us on our website www.inzanecomics.com. Or...Visit our Social Media sites: We here at inZane Comics would like to thank you for your support and hope to bring you amazing comics for years to come!

With the rapid change of technology and the need for more time to do the things we all want, Munchez was born. From ride share services, on demand food delivery, dry cleaning, errands, etc. It was only a matter of time before the convenience store became even more convenient. With a fast download from the app store, you can have practically any convenience store items delivered to you. From the concept of what you want from a delivery type service we kept all the good and removed all those annoying things such as "hidden fees" "service fees" "surcharges" and "minimum order requirements" to keep things simple. With a flat rate, affordable delivery fee, no minimum order requirements, and customer service that will make you feel like our best friend, We can promise you will love this service! The goal of this project is to raise the necessary funds to expand into multiple cities, add additional products and services within the Munchez Business, all that has been asked by current and future customers. With over 140 app downloads in the first 30 Days of launch, which included created accounts from 18 Cities in 10 States outside of our current market, We see not only a want but a need that other delivery and on demand services have yet to fill or simply won't.

This is an app that's going to benefit both trainers and personnel looking to get fit! As a trainer, it can be hard to find new leads sometimes, this app will bring them straight to you! both trainers and trainees will get a chance to modify their searches by locations and type of training they're into, whether it's bodybuilding, cross-fit, or simply getting fit. You get to match with the trainer contact them and the best part is: if you've decided to work with that trainer, there will be a clients section for trainers to track their clients progress, send them workout and meal plan on the app instead of writing it on paper! there's a lot more to it. we already found a developer that can make all that possible, right now we're just stuck on the funding part. feel free to ask any questions that you have before backing!

Beam3D has designed an out of the box, easy-to-use solution for resin 3D printing. Currently, solutions for affordable resin printing require either experience or research to get started. Our goal was to make using a resin 3D Printer easy and affordable. The Prism The Prism is the result of thousands of hours of use and development. The Prism removes a number of barriers through a combination of hardware and unique software features, making it approachable for non-super users. Hardware With an easy to remove magnetic bed and a print volume of 120mm x 70mm x 150mm, the Prism is a resin printer with a 2K LCD screen that allows for high resolution prints that look like finished products. Built with an all metal chassis for durability and a dual linear rail motion system for stability, prints can be as fine as 25 micron. The 57 watt parallel LED array drives uniform light distribution across the entire build plate, edge to edge. Hardware Features Auto Leveling Auto leveling in its purest form. The leveling system actions at the beginning of every print and when homing the machine. Instead of chasing your tail around leveling and running test prints to make sure the level is right, let the machine take care of that process. You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00 Dual Linear Rails - Reliable and repeatable Z movement is essential for high quality printing. 2K LCD Screen - The 2K LCD screen allows for high quality printing. All Metal - The all metal frame provides a rigid structure for daily operation. Fully enclosed with convenient flip lid. Parallel LED Array - The 57 Watt Parallel LED Array allows for even light distribution throughout the build area. The 57 Watt Parallel UV Light Array allows for even light distribution throughout the build area Software Regardless of the material, the resin calibration gives a strong start on cure times without guessing. The auto leveling system allows for beginners and experts to just print. On the fly cure time adjustment prevents the need to alter your workflow. Finally, we provide support for all major slicers. Software Features Resin Calibration Print Not sure what cure time to set for new resin? No problem. Avoid guess and check by using the built-in resin calibration print. This print provides a reasonable ballpark on what cure time to set for the resin being used -- getting you from guessing to printing faster. Just choose the column that shows the best results! You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00 On-the-fly Cure Time Adjustment Avoid nuisance around cure time while you are printing. Being able to adjust the cure time on the fly can save a number of pains like needing to reslice the file just to adjust cure time, or fine tune your cure time for a resin. Don't reslice, just print and adjust. You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00 WiFi Support The Prism has a WebUI that functions as a convenient WiFi based delivery device for sliced files. In addition to delivering files, you are able to: start, stop, pause, edit profiles, and adjust printer settings. Current WebUI interface. Naturally, feel free to transfer files via Micro SD card if preferred! Full Control of Machine Settings Anti Aliasing levels (0,2,4,8x), Movement speed, UV Power Intensity Allowing full control over machine settings is useful to power users and casual users alike. Want to cure a layer faster? Increase the power. Want to use a thicker resin? Adjust the Z speed and distance. Want to smooth out that lower resolution model? Enable anti-aliasing. Take advantage of more settings that many printers lock out. Keep the advanced settings from ChiTuBox intact, including Anti-Aliasing and Power Management Software Compatibility The Prism supports all major slicers, and will continue to be updated as the software for SLA printing evolves. We hope that this lets you choose the software YOU like instead of forcing a buggy difficult-to-use slicer with limited features. Currently, it supports files from ChiTuBox, Slic3r, Print Studio, and Creation Workshop. Print Gallery Here is the Prism in action: You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00 You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00 Resin: In addition to the Prism, we also offer a line of 3D printer resins. They are made in America and formulated for LCD based resin printers. Stretch Goals: Timeline and milestones: May 22nd - Beam3d launches Kickstarter campaign June 22nd - Beam3d Kickstarter campaign ends June 28th - Production of units start July 20th - units are ready to ship and start shipping The Beam Team The Beam3D Team is composed of professionals who have been involved in consumer electronics for the majority of our careers. At our core, we are 3D printing guys, each with our own stable of 3D printers. In fact, a number of those printers are pieces that we have either developed or used in professional ventures throughout our careers from homebrew kits, entry level consumer models, and even up to industrial grade machines. We see the need for high quality, low cost resin printers in the community, and we would like to be the ones to deliver on and support that dream. The Iterations The Prism has gone through a number of iterations. Below are some of the different phases that the Prism has gone through. One of our earliest prototypes. If you have any questions about anything regarding this project, or any of our other items, please contact us at freshhotflavors@gmail.com. You can also follow us on Twitter and Instagram and keep an eye on our Updates Page. Thank you everyone!! As of 7/9/19 our Pixel Pride Kickstarter has reached 100% of it's funding goal! We want to thank each and every backer, all the supporters that have shared our campaign, and all our friends that have helped us immensely along the way! We couldn't have done this without you!!!! Introducing Pixel Pride, a collection of LGBTQ+ pride pants and skirts (with pockets!) to fit a variety of different identities and a wide range of body types! Pride month is all about expressing your identity to the world, and clothing is a great way to do that! While there's plenty of great pride gear for your torso, we want to provide something comfortable, functional, and fun for your leggies as well. Our goal with the Pixel Pride line is to create casual clothing that fits more easily into everyday wear than standard flag stripes, while still being a recognizable way to show that you're proud of who you are. June is Pride month, but your identity remains the same year round. We wanted to create a line of clothing to help you show your pride whether you're marching in a parade or shopping for groceries. Humans don't come in only one size, and clothing shouldn't either. So we have a range of sizes available to choose from. All of our clothing has stretchy elastic waistbands, so check out our sizing info to find out the right fit for you! All unlocked designs will be available in all of the sizes shown below. Click the image to go to our detailed size charts with measurements! You can check out our more detailed size charts with measurements, and also see the different sizes on a range of models at this link: Size Charts & Model Gallery Pockets! We know all too well the struggle of wanting to wear something cute and having nowhere to put your phone and wallet. That�s why we include pockets on all of our jogger pants AND skirts! And we don�t skimp on the size, either. Cell phones keep getting bigger, and we make our pockets deep enough to hold them. What is Fresh Hot Flavors? Fresh Hot Flavors is an artist studio run by three queer women (and two fry dragons) living in Dallas, Texas. We all met during college and got our start selling our artistic wares separately at anime, gaming, and otherwise geeky conventions all over the US. In 2017, we decided to join forces to sell our designs on apparel and accessories online and at conventions. You can check out our online store filled with other clothing and accessories we designed at freshhotflavors.com! Goals Our main campaign's goal is to get skirts and pants made for six different identities: gay rainbow, transgender, asexual, bisexual, nonbinary, and pansexual. You can check out these first six designs below! Lesbian will be our very first stretch goal, and there are more to be unlocked after that! Choose Your Pledge Tier! International (non-US) backers - please keep in mind that there may be VAT or custom fees applied to your items that you will be responsible for once it arrives in your country! Stretch Goals Once we meet our main goal, there are other goals to unlock as well! Why is Lesbian a Stretch Goal and not in the main Goal? Please see our FAQ for the answer! <3 Stretch goal #1 @ $13,500: Lesbian Skirt and Pants Design Unlocked Stretch Goal #2 @ $16,000: Free Sticker added to all Physical Reward Tiers - Art is TBD Stretch Goal #3 @ $19,500: ????? Skirt and Pants Design Unlocked Stretch Goal #4 @ $21,000: Free Pin for all Reward Tiers Pin and Above - Art is TBD Stretch Goal #5 @ $24,000: ????? Skirt and Pants Design Unlocked Timeline All the art for the main goals has already been completed. Up until fulfillment, we will be finishing the art for any stretch goals we meet, placing the order with our manufacturer, and then waiting for the product to be finished and shipped to us. July 8th: Kickstarter Ends. July: Surveys sent out & backers respond. End of July: Kickstarter funds deposited. August: Place order with manufacturer. October: Manufacturer ships items to Fresh Hot Flavors' studio. November: Items arrive from manufacturer. The FHF Crew can begin fulfilling rewards!! January: Hopefully all rewards will be on their way to their new homes! Budget Why Kickstarter? We know from experience how difficult it can be to find merchandise for specific identities, and how exciting it is when you find something that represents you. We wanted to put out a line of pants and skirts to accommodate a variety of identities. Producing clothing is a costly process, and we couldn't fund stock of this many different designs without your help! If funded, will these products be exclusive to Kickstarter? Nope! Our goal with this campaign is to fund a line of clothing accessible to as many people as we can. We don't want anyone to miss out, so all of the items that become available through this Kickstarter will be for sale on our online store and at conventions after the campaign is over as well. Getting in at the beginning with our Kickstarter will allow you to be the very first to grab these designs, as well as help us fund even more designs and get some freebies if we unlock stretch goals!

Past Lives EP Cover Art by Sydnie Switzer Origin Story: The Past Lives EP has been in the planning stages for a long time. 3/4 of the songs were written over the past few years and they've been patiently waiting to be released into the world. These four songs form a loose concept EP as described in the video. The use of the words "past life" can be interpreted in whichever way you see fit, whether it relates to your belief in our having lived different lives prior to this one, or whether it makes you reminisce on who you were in the past of this life. Over a year ago I released three singles that I love dearly. This EP would be what I consider as my first multiple-song release. If you have any of the "albums" that I released in high school, I ask that you do us all a favor and destroy them to protect future generations. I live in fear that one day I will sit across from Jimmy Fallon and he will have dredged up some embarrassing artistic venture from my youth, but if you wish to see me embarrassed on national television, that may be extra incentive to help me fund this project! The first memory I have of songwriting occurred when I was around four or five years old. I distinctly remember lying in bed and composing a kitschy "rock & roll" song about a literal rock rolling down a hill. Twenty years later, some things have changed: I've transplanted myself from California to Nashville, I've swapped back and forth between genres, (most recently settling into indie pop), and I've played many more shows. Despite my life changes, I've never stopped having late night songwriting sessions. The title of my autobiography will likely be, "I Should Have Been Sleeping." Past Lives EP Track Listing: 1. Past Lives 2. Good & Well 3. Atlas 4. No Fear Nuts and Bolts: The money raised in this campaign will go to the costs of this EP's high quality production as well as some artistic elements to accompany the songs. Musicians and producers will be paid. Studios will be rented. Band pizza will be bought. Tracking, Mixing, and Mastering engineers will all be compensated. I also plan to film at least one music video with the funds collected in this campaign. Check out my music video for the song "Long Shot" if you would like to see an example of what I envision. "Long Shot" Music Video Independent musicians need help from people like you. The music industry is constantly evolving, but the one thing that has never wavered is supporter involvement. Maybe the way artists interact with supporters has changed, but no matter what technology does to the music industry, the supporters and the artists will always have each other's backs. Your support means the world to me. Please share with all of your friends and any especially wealthy enemies you may possess. I cannot wait for you to hear the finished versions of these songs. I hope they make you dance, sing, laugh, and cry. We're creating something together, here. I hope you realize that. Art is a uniting force. Photography by Matt Blum instagram twitter Facebook

Sweet Enemy Clothing is a brand that brings honor to all of those who aren�t here with us today. Whatever your inspiration, Sweet Enemy is firmly planted in reminding you to never forget your reason. Grammie Rose And Me Sweet Enemy Clothing was founded in 2013, in honor of my Grammie Rose Ventula. The name "SWEET ENEMY" visually and metaphorically symbolizes her name, Rose, and how her passing had a tremendous impact on my life, as well as many others. The "ROSE" is a symbol of balance. The beauty of this flower expresses LOVE, PROMISE, HOPE, and NEW BEGINNINGS. In contrast, the thorns represent the HURT, PAIN, and SUFFERING that one goes through when losing a loved one or when opportunities pass us by. The slogan, �NEVER FORGET THE REASON� exemplifies the true meaning of what inspires us to excel in life, and to never give up. Growing up I admired my Grammie Rose and her impeccable sense of fashion and passion for gardening. In honor of her, I have spent the last few years focusing on my craft and bringing my vision and concept to life: �THE WORLD'S SWEETEST GARDEN" A floral/garden inspired streetwear boutique Front of Store "The Florist" Sweet Enemy Section "The Garden" Thrift/Vintage Section Store View I humbly ask for your support and generosity in helping SWEET ENEMY CLOTHING transform vision into reality and grow �THE WORLD SWEETEST GARDEN," specializing in streetwear and vintage/thrift apparel. Yeah that's right, vintage! I'm excited to share with you the perfect compliment to our concept that allows us to provide you with the nostalgia and high quality of yesterday. The goal is to open our doors to you in August, 2019, exactly 6 years from when Sweet Enemy Clothing was first launched from the back of my car trunk. By opening this store it will allow us the opportunity to host events and do what we do best: Give back to the community. Given this opportunity and this location, I will achieve my biggest dream and be able to serve, share, and inspire. Again, thank you for your support! If you have read this far, I hope that I have sparked some motivation or inspired you in some way. Over the years, I had the privilege to meet such amazing people and I am excited to meet many more. I can't wait to watch the garden grow with all of you. LET'S GO AND LET'S GROW! Kickstarter reward options: * Our 3 logo t-shirt is an exclusive Kickstarter release STICKER OPTIONS T-SHIRT OPTIONS LOGOS DESCRIPTION: Sweet Enemy Original Logo (Black) is a font logo that adds simplicity to the brand's name and meaning. SE Rose (Blue) is the iconic logo for this brand. The S in the design symbolizes the rose flower while the E represents the thorns. Our Hawaii (Red): We capture the aloha spirit with our "H" Diamondhead. The t-shirt design combines the three main logos to create an exclusive release. HAT OPTION #1 HAT OPTION #2 (Red) SLOGAN AND LOGO DESCRIPTION: Never Forget the Reason (black), this is the slogan of the brand. It reminds us of what inspires us in our daily lives. Often, it is due to a loss loved one or an opportunity that passes us by. Halo S (blue), the halo in the" S" represents the angels that have made an impact on our lives. The hat design symbolizes Sweet Enemy's slogan and the true meaning of the brand.

Custom art prints in the style of Dr. Ishihara's color vision tests Dr. Shinobu Ishihara first used his iconic images to test for color vision deficiency in 1917, and more than 100 years later they are still in use worldwide. Besides their practical simplicity, they also evoke a certain beauty. Several years ago, while learning about color vision as a student in optometry school, I thought it would be cool if you could make your own custom Ishihara-style images. My initial attempt at this failed, so I put the idea on hold. But now, after a recent breakthrough, you can order your very own custom IshiPrints! These unique works of art will look gorgeous as part of your home or office decor. They also make great gifts for birthdays, anniversaries, baby or wedding showers, etc. If you don't want to order a hard-copy print, you can order the image just as a digital file (in PNG format). These are great for websites, social media, and other digital design projects. I can make many custom images, but keep in mind that due to the nature of the Ishihara test style (a collage of colored circles) there are limits to the resolution that can be achieved. Fine details and thin lettering will likely be lost when converting to an IshiPrint. (On that note, it bears mentioning that these works of art are NOT approved to actually test if someone viewing them is colorblind.) I'm raising funds to help with the software development (which is mostly completed--still tweaking a few settings) as well as the printer testing, as it can be a challenge to match printed colors exactly with what you see on a high-definition screen. I'm passionate about this project because I love the culture of the eyecare world. People seeing these IshiPrints will instantly recognize the link to the color vision test patterns, and I want to create something that adds beauty to that world. (This image says "WOW!" in case you are red-green color blind and can't see the letters.) Available Backer Rewards To support this creative campaign and bring IshiPrints to life you have a couple options: 1) Order a pre-made IshiPrint from the gallery (see images below); 2) Order a custom IshiPrint made just for you! Here are the steps/guidelines: a. Choose the size you want (11"x17", 18"x24", or 24"x36"), or you can order a digital file download (in PNG format). b. If/when the campaign is successfully funded, backers of custom IshiPrint rewards will be contacted via e-mail to specify exactly what they would like: the colors, the text and/or images, etc. Files can be sent to Jonathan@ishiprints.com. c. Backers of custom orders will receive a digital proof to approve before the IshiPrint is produced and sent to their shipping address. d. RULES for CUSTOM ORDERS: 1. No trademarked logos, such as for pro or college sports teams. (I don't want to get sued!) 2. I reserve the right to reject any custom image creation requests, such as for requests that are overly complex. I'm pretty good, but I can't recreate Van Gogh's "Starry Night" (though I have tried...). 3. Due to the resolution limitations of the IshiPrint style, the image you have in mind for transforming into a custom IshiPrint might not turn out how you envision it. In these cases you will have the option of submitting another image/design. Gallery of Pre-Made IshiPrints Available to Order "EYES" Inspired by Robert Indiana's LOVE sculpture; available in multiple color combinations (Backers will be able to select colors *after* ordering). "EYES" by Jonathan Jacesko (2019); available as 20"x20" print, backers can choose colors for text and background. "Liberty is Not Colorblind" Available as an 11"x17" or 24"x36" IshiPrint. "Liberty is Not Colorblind" by Jonathan Jacesko (2019). Available in 11"x17" or 24"x36". "Stars & Stripes & Ishihara" Available only as a 24"x36" IshiPrint. (Other flags are also available as custom orders.) "Stars & Stripes & Ishihara" by Jonathan Jacesko (2019). Available as a 24"x36" poster. Close-up detail of "Stars & Stripes & Ishihara" (since the circles are hard to see in the full-flag image above). "Ishihara Eiffel Tower" Available as 11"x17" or 24"x36" IshiPrint poster. "Ishihara Eiffel Tower" by Jonathan Jacesko (2019); available in 11"x17" or 24"x36". Custom Baby Name Banner Order an 11"x17" IshiPrint that stands out in any nursery. Backers will be contacted to customize their order by choosing the name, date of birth, optional graphic, and colors for the text/image and the background. Sample Baby Name Banner.
