Hey all! My name is Erin Ptah, I make webcomics, and I promised supporters on Patreon that once there were 50 of them, I would make pins. We're starting with the top 2 designs voted on by readers -- 1 critter from each comic. Read on to find out more about the characters, or keep scrolling to see the pins! The Comics But I'm A Cat Person: Two ordinary graduates adopt a puppy�which turns out to be a magical shapeshifting battle monster. Now one of them is involved in a soul-binding ownership contract, rich and powerful people are lurking around looking to challenge them, and they still can�t find any companies that are hiring. Patrick is our starring shapeshifter. He's nervous, determined, eager to please, and always ready to show off his prowess in a fight! ...much to the distress of his new pacifist millennial Master. Leif & Thorn: Sparkly queer bilingual fantasy comedy. Dragonslaying hero Thorn Estragon and his team of loyal knights are assigned to guard a foreign embassy; Leif works there as a gardener, serving his native S�nheim in order to pay off a mysterious debt. Thorn doesn�t speak Leif�s language too well when they first meet � but he�s about to find a lot of reasons to learn. Tiernan is Thorn's soulbonded therapy cat. She provides emotional support, help recovering from PTSD flashbacks, and general adorableness. Also, she cuddles up to Leif at every opportunity. The Rewards $5: $12: $20: $25: $49: $69, nice: The Budget 31.5% - Tiernan pin 31.5% - Patrick pin 26.9% - Postage & packaging 10.0% - Kickstarter fees What's Next? Even if you pledge early, you won't be charged until the end of the campaign, and only if the funding goal is reached! So if you don't want to miss out on a limited reward tier, pledge early. When the project ends, you'll be sent a Kickstarter survey that asks for your delivery address, and any other information I need. Digital rewards will be sent once Kickstarter transfers the funds, which takes about 2 weeks after the end of the campaign. Physical rewards will be shipped when they arrive, probably within 6-8 weeks. In the meantime, you can stay up-to-date reading But I'm A Cat Person or Leif & Thorn. You can also get the ebooks on Gumroad, and if you miss the original Kickstarter, you'll be able to get pins later by supporting the artist on Patreon. Thanks for reading, and scroll back up to follow the project, or to preorder your pins!

My Journey I started as a maker a few years ago when my sister invited me to a soap making class at a local school. We soon learned how creativity and chemistry could culminate in something amazing. From simple ingredients, something utilitarian and beautiful was created as soap. I slowly started making my own as I learned about colorants, fragrances, butters, oils, and recipes until I was able to produce soaps to gift to friends and family. Once I started receiving requests for certain types of bars, I launched my own business to share my handcrafted clean experience. My company name urban solace comes from the words: �urban- adj: characteristic of city life� and �solace-noun: something that provides comfort or peace�. What's In It? All of my carefully formulated products are created in small batches of 8-10 items each. I try to source everything locally (coffee grounds, teas, botanicals, honey and beeswax) and ensure ingredients are pure and sustainable as I believe you create amazing things from only the best supplies. I enjoy infusing herbs into olive oil as I believe it adds unique richness to each bar. I use skin safe fragrances free from parabens, phthalates or synthetics and essential oils are therapeutic grade. In addition to my natural line, I explore new fragrances and colorants in my artisan soaps. Artisan Soaps I filmed making individual soap batches so others can see how simple and pure the process is: Click Here to see Lavender Soap Making . Recently I expanded my natural products to include a spa line with lotion bars, balms, bath salts as well as candles. Made with Epsom & Sea Salts Growing to new markets My customer base is largely from referrals. I am grateful to have such loyal fans and want to share what they love and launch into new markets. I believe once you understand what is in your products you have a greater love for natural, local & sustainable sourcing. I am looking for support to redesign my branding and expand my presence from online to craft and farmer's markets. Eventually if the support is significant, I will be able to transition to my dream of teaching others how to make their own soap and beauty products from natural ingredients. Your Gifts I am excited to share my work with you! I have a wide selection of fragrances, oils and bars to choose from for each level. Each bar you receive will have a complete list of ingredients for that specific recipe/bar. Following is a list of most commonly used ingredients in our soaps: Olive Oil: Cold Pressed, Coconut Oil: Organic and Ultra Refined, Castor Oil, Shea Butter: Both Refined and Unrefined, Essential Oils, Kaolin Clay, Skin Safe Fragrance & Colorants Thank you for your consideration! Your support will help me expand to markets with: Branding & Advertising: I designed my own packaging and logo in the interest of being cost effective. I am looking for a professional designer to best represent my brand and how fantastic my products are for my customers. Show Display: Come visit my booth! This would include the setup for my products/soaps, an engaging banner with logo, if needed trade show insurance, table cover/table, and recycled logo paper bags. Packaging: I use sustainable, re-usable and recycled when possible to package my products. Labels, glass jars, soap boxes and paper shred help present and protect my work. Packaging Pictures

Want to join me in making a difference? I'm raising money for La Luz (Eats) an emerging blog (laluzeats.com), social media presence, catering endeavor. The ultimate goal is to fund a food truck that will provide nutritious pescatarian (seafood), vegetarian and vegan options to the community. Our hope is to also grant the community service of an annual "meal day," gratis, in a local food desert. Additionally, we'd like to be in a position to offer sustainable employment to at least 2-3 women who are looking for opportunities while transitioning out of homeless or domestic violence shelters; guaranteeing at least 3 months of consecutive work. This is a viable passion that just needs the financial push and any donation will help make impact. I am a high school teacher, a mother, a published author and a life long pescatarian (seafood and veggies only)! Taking out a loan is not a preferred option and there is a truck currently available that meets our organizational needs. Food is a necessity that is vital to our existence as human beings; it impacts our mental clarity and susceptibility to diseases and not all of us are in predicaments that give us this awareness of the effects of quality foods, nor do all of us have access to quality foods. The La Luz Eats Food Truck is my way of serving any and all communities that we can travel to within reason; my goal is to have a positive impact. Thanks in advance for your contribution to this cause that means so much to me! "To Nourish...I Eat From Land And Sea"- Honor

Do you want to go for a WALK??? There's so much excitement when you ask that question! Gear Fur is a project aimed at bringing more of that joy into the world, to make excursions with our dogs safer and more enjoyable. Beta Testers Why Re-Invent the Dog Leash? Gear Fur began with a broken leash. My wife, Avonlea, was leaving the dog park with our two Siberian Huskies, Hoshi and Yuki, when a brand-new leash simply snapped. They all managed to get home safely that day, and it could have been a lot worse, but it made us realize that we needed gear we could actually trust. After years of hard work, and 13 successful Kickstarter projects we steadily acquired all of the tools and know-how needed to make the perfect dog leash, designed and built to a higher standard. The Problem Dogs are family, but many don't see it that way. So most dog gear is designed down to a price, rather than up to any kind of performance expectation. Most leashes have 3 problems in common: Problem 1 - Safety: Most latches can release accidentally. It's especially common when maneuvering in and out of the car, so an "accidental release" is likely to happen in a parking lot, or near a road. Accidental Release Examples Problem 2 - Functionality: Comfort and Ease-of-Use take a back seat to how the leash looks. Most leashes look good, but are awkward to use, often requiring the human to use two hands to attach and release. Problem 3 - Quality: Because manufacturers and retailers are obsessed with reducing cost, inferior materials are often specified for the strap and clasp, and you can't tell just by looking, as we learned ourselves when a name-brand leash simply snapped. The Solution (How it Works) After our close call, I began designing our own dog gear from the ground up, using custom machined hardware and high-quality materials. The goal was to make the best leash possible, whatever the cost. Avonlea and I went through dozens of prototypes before getting it perfect, but this is the result: Feature 1- Redundant Latch Mechanism: The leash is very very unlikely to ever release accidentally, because both latches must be depressed simultaneously. Feature 2 - Hyper Functionality: Push to connect, and squeeze to release: Making the bond between human and beast should be easy and graceful. And if you're as clumsy as my wife, you need all the help you can get. She knows I'm joking... but seriously ;) The hands-free leash belt is also quick-release, and practically connects itself, because it uses the same high-strength, locking magnetic buckle concept that we designed for our "Quicky" Kickstarter project. Feature 3 - Ball Bearing Swivel: When your dog pulls on its leash, most swivels lock up due to the increased friction, causing twists and tangles. Meanwhile, our ball bearing swivel remains smooth-as-butter, even under hundreds of pounds of tension. Feature 4 - Padded Handle: If you have a powerful dog, prone to pulling arms out of sockets, it's a relief to have some soft padding between your hand and their raw pulling force. Feature 5 - Aircraft Grade Materials: Underneath the smooth anodized surface, you'll find CNC machined components, made from heat-treated Aircraft-Grade Aluminum (6061-T6 and 7075-T6). Anodized Aluminum Construction After machining, the parts are polished and anodized to achieve a smooth durable finish, according to Military Specification (MIL-A-8625). Feature 6 - Made in the USA with Quality Materials: All under one roof. From machining, to assembly, to sewing and shipping, we do it all right here. It's not the cheapest way to make a leash, but QUALITY is our priority. The Standard Leash Color Options Include: Sea Glass (top), Black, Blue Camo, Coyote Brown, Navy Blue, Paw Prints, Pink, Blue, Wolf Grey, and Purple The Climbing Rope Leash Does your dog destroy normal leashes? This one will give the furry ball of terror a run for its money. They're constructed with authentic American-made climbing rope (not the stuff you see in your local pet store). Climbing Rope Leash - Blue Color Options Include: Blue (top), Black, Neon Green, Olive Drab, and Burnt Orange The Double-Leash The only thing better than walking one dog is... walking two dogs! The Double-Leash makes it an absolute pleasure. All CNC machined connectors, three of our exclusive ball bearing swivels, and a comfortable padded handle. You'll have the nicest leash in the neighborhood, guaranteed. Double-Leash (rope version) - Black The Double-Leash is made with your choice of standard flat webbing or climbing rope. Color Options: Same as for the Standard and Climbing Rope Leashes The Magnetic Belt Hands-free dog walking is the way of the future! Using our ultra-secure magnetic buckle design, this belt is the perfect companion to any leash. It's super quick to put on and off, and adjusts to any size. And its beefy aluminum construction will endure loads that could easily snap a plastic buckle. Color Options Include: Sea Glass, Black, Blue Camo, Coyote Brown, Navy Blue, Paw Prints, Pink, Blue, Wolf Grey, and Purple Hands Free Leash Belt About Us We're a husband and wife team with a track record of success, fulfilling 13 Kickstarter campaigns to over 5000 backers all around the world. With your support, we are confident we can successfully bring Gear Fur to life for our backers, and for amazing dogs all around the world. Paying it Forward - The Gear Fur Way No funds raised here on Kickstarter will be donated. This Kickstarter project exists simply to bring life to the Gear Fur product line. However, we do have a bold plan to do our part for dogs in need. This isn't limited to this Kickstarter project. It's just an integral part of our business model: When you purchase a Gear Fur leash from us, we will make an extra, and send it to a non-profit organization that can use it to help care for dogs. We're currently working with these incredible organizations, and we hope to work with many more in the future! Game of Thrones: Cartoon Universe Hello! I'll cut right to it. I'm a cartoonist and a Game of Thrones fan. I love big illustrations that depict some of the iconic universes in pop culture as cute cartoon characters. This is what I aim to do with the Game of Thrones universe. I have done this type of illustration before. If you would like to see an example of what you can expect in the final draft, take a look at the 'Punchout' illustration below. I've also done some others which I've uploaded here. You can also check my links and see some of my other work. This will all give you a good idea of the quality level of this Game of Thrones project. I've whipped up some black and white individual sketches of some of the characters to give you an idea of what I'll be doing. You can see them on this page. The final product will be 10" x 36" horizontal full-color illustration. This size is easy to find a cheap frame for. I suggest Walmart's 11.75" x 36" frames. Here is my Tumblr link where you can find a lot of my work. https://bryanharmon.tumblr.com/ Thank you for checking it out and I hope you help me get this done!

We wanted to give the underdogs hope, we wanted to make any warrior - no matter what size, feel like a champion. I named it Commando for this reason: they're lean mean machines! The Commando team took valuable feedback from seasoned boxers and made it our mission to innovate a training experience. WHO WE ARE and our MISSION: We are Rashad Ahmed M.D. (BOP) and Yousaf Chowdhry M.D. (POP) and as newly trained Physiatrists (Physical Medicine & Rehabilitation physicians) we aim to encourage the implementation of preventive medicine at an early age. As stated by the American College of Preventive Medicine, the main goal of this area of medicine is to protect, promote, and maintain a healthy lifestyle in order to prevent disease and disability. In an effort to share this message with children of all ages across the world, we are making songs that are fun to sing and dance to, with visually stimulating videos featuring the characters: Drs. Bop �N Pop. We strongly believe that music is a universal language that crosses all barriers and will help us spread our message around the world. In addition to basic children�s education (including learning about the alphabet, colors, basic math, etc.), the emphasis will include: healthy hygiene practices, personal safety, diet, being physically active, and teaching kids how to practice a smaller ecological footprint, among other important topics and skills. We plan to give parents beneficial tips and creative strategies to promote a healthy lifestyle for their kids as well as themselves. We are very passionate about this project and want our audience to learn with us and of course, to have fun along the way! GOALS: To encourage children of all ages to live healthy lifestyles today so they can fulfill their dreams tomorrow, with the help of music and theatre. Complete a full children's album containing approximately 15 songs professionally produced and mastered, focused on multiple educational subjects as noted above. The music is going to be great, we promise - just take a listen to our samples provided!!!! Create at least three animated music videos featuring the cartoon characters, Drs. Bop �N Pop, as they venture out into the world and discover how to be healthy and ecologically conscious! Establish a Youtube channel free to everyone around the world as Dr. Ahmed and Dr. Chowdhry go into character as Drs. Bop �N Pop and educate kids in a fun and interactive setting.

150 backers stretch goal LOCKED: Coasters! $2400 stretch goal UNLOCKED: Bookmarks! Awesome! Everybody loves bookmarks, right? Especially when they look something like this! Design not final All print backers will receive one of these sturdy beauties to mark their place in the largest book of all time, and everybody from the $3 level and up will receive a high-res download. $2200 stretch goal UNLOCKED: Gustavo Vargas print! All print backers will receive this print in our standard XXL A4 size, and everybody from the $3 level and up will receive a download. Nice! �Mitch Hammer fills that Kurt Russell-Big Trouble in Little China-grand-80s-Action-Comedy-Cheese hole in your heart! Do your eyeballs a favor and pick it up immediately if not sooner!� -Fred Van Lente (Amazing Spider-Man, Archer & Armstrong, Eat Fighter) MITCH HAMMER is a 3-issue mini-series about mustaches, monsters, and the militant wing of the National Blood Clot Association. Written by Chris Lewis, drawn by Fernando Pinto, colored by Kurt Michel Russell, and lettered by Marco Della Verde, this over-the-top comedy was inspired by 80s action flicks and the greatest comic book of all time � Nextwave. After crushing the first Kickstarter campaigns for issues 1-2, we are back to show you how it all ends! (Trust me, it�s with a bang.) We are coming to Kickstarter to raise money for the production costs of issue #3. Clocking in at 24 pages and a whopping XXL 7.5 x 11 format - WAY BIGGER THAN YOUR STANDARD U.S. COMIC SIZE - issue #3 rounds out the story of our lovable lug of a construction worker. As with the first two campaigns, we�ve got digital books that are easy on the wallet, as well as extra goodies that come along with the print version. So have a look at what we have on offer, and please consider joining us for a final trip into the world of Mitch. Mitch Hammer is a construction worker on-site at the local community college, who finds himself squaring off against C.L.O.T., the militant wing of the National Blood Clot Association. To quickly bring you up to speed (spoiler alert), Mitch was at ground zero of a science-gone-wrong �splosion, where got a backhoe bucket arm� Then he met a professor turned caterpillar, er, manerpillar� Punched some living blod clots� Thought about his life choices... Dug some tunnels� And ran into a giant pupa. Do you want to see what�s inside that vile sack? Then maybe the cover will offer you a clue! As you might have noticed in our first two issues, Mitch doesn�t like waiting around. Neither do we. That�s why we�re happy to say this oversized 24-page issue is 100% complete! We�ll be sending it to the printers as soon as the campaign ends, and your books will loudly announce their presence in your mailbox in a timely manner. Until then here�s a taste of what you can expect inside: And here's what people are saying about it: "Mitch Hammer is some strange, alluring combination of Silver Age antics and Coen brothers� characters. I�d call it zany, but zany is a gross understatement for these idiosyncratic hijinks." - Adrian Wassel, Editor-in-Chief @ Vault Comics �If you enjoy lip curling and an explosion of hammer puns, welcome home.� � A Place To Hang Your Cape ��Mitch Hammer� #1 is a book where a man�s mullet and handle-bar mustache sail in the breeze while he stands between tendrils of smoke and flame lapping at his legs and threatens a mutant bug-man.� � Multiversity Comics Over here at MITCH central we don�t do floppy. That�s why MITCH HAMMER #3, just like issues #1-2, is a BIG book. Here it is compared to a standard comic: A hefty book like this needs to be stable, which is why we are printing on heavy paper stock for both the cover and interior pages. And while these books can withstand tons of punishment, we want yours to be in pristine condition when it arrives. That's why we bag and board each issue, and ship using reinforced envelopes, for the absolute sturdiest of packages. All physical backers will receive this BIG A4-size poster from superstar Hus Ozkan. We've been lucky enough to feature Hus' artwork in every campaign, and he absolutely outdid himself this time! We're asking for $2000 to make this happen. That should just cover the costs of printing and shipping the books and other material to all our backers. Anything above and beyond our goal will go towards producing more great stuff for you to enjoy (extra posters, anyone?). Mitch won't make us rich, but he will make you happy. That's what this is all about. Chris Lewis - writer An Oregonian who lives in Germany with his wife and son, Chris is the writer of DRONES (IDW), MIXMANCER, and KARMA POLICE (Vault). You can follow his anagrammed self over on Twitter @relicswish Fernando Pinto - artist From Chile. Graduated The Joe Kubert school in '04 and since then has drawn a ton of Storyboards for commercials you haven't seen, a bunch of Indie comics you may or may not have read, and has taught a few hundred kids how to draw like them pros do. His mom thinks he's pretty cool. You can check him out at fernandopintoart.com K. Michael Russell - colorist K Michael Russell has been working as a professional comic book color artist since 2011. His credits include the critically acclaimed series GLITTERBOMB, HACK/SLASH: SON OF SAMHAIN, JUDGE DREDD, the Eisner and Harvey-nominated IN THE DARK: A HORROR ANTHOLOGY, and many other independent and small press projects. Marco Della Verde - letterer Marco has been writing and lettering comics since 1997. His work has been published by DC Comics, IDW, Image Comics, Heavy Metal Magazine, Comics Experience Publishing, AC Comics, Noise Press and many others. He's also an editor, and co-founder of Mokapop, an Italy based community of storytellers. Dan Hill - editor Dan Hill has produced a number of comic book shorts for a number of projects, including the Eisner nominated 'To End All Wars' and wrote the WW2 set 'Go Home' from Alterna Comics. His editing credits include titles for MonkeyBrain/IDW, ComiXtribe and Black Mask Studios. Dan digs obscure historical facts, running, grimy movies from the 70s and punk rock.

Hello! My name is Jennifer (most refer to me as Jen). I�m a mom to three spectacular boys, Chase 16, Gabe 14, and Jayden 11. In December of 2015, I didn�t have money to purchase Christmas gifts for family. I had recently come out of a domestic violence marriage. I was getting food assistance weekly from a place called Gleaners. During one of my weekly pickups of food I received a bountiful gift of blackberries. Prior to my separation, I was a stay-at-home mom and volunteered the majority of my spare time at the boys� school. I had not been able to volunteer anymore and felt bad. To show my gratefulness and appreciation to the staff, I made them a Blackberry Cheesecake. It was such a big hit that it gave me the idea to make cheesecakes paired with wine for my family for Christmas. I took a picture of the cheesecakes I made and posted them on my personal Facebook page stating, �Cheesecakes made with love by Jen.� Facebook post I had three friends reach out to me and ask if they could pay me to make them a cheesecake for New Years. Let�s just say I was speechless and in utter shock! I remember when I received my first payment I cried. This was when "Cheesecakes By Jen" originated. Now three and half years later I have made over 400 cheesecakes. I have delivered as far North to Vancouver and South to Albany. A friend froze one of my cheesecakes and snuck it in her luggage to Colorado. Stowaway cheesecake My Salted Caramel has gone for $600 at a local charter school auction. I continually hear that my cheesecakes are �the best,� �amazing,� �to die for,�and "orgasmic." I�m honored and humbled every time. Honestly, I don�t know what makes my cheesecakes so special other than I really do make them with my whole heart. I do love feeding souls! Over the last three years, I pursued a degree in Social Work while navigating being a full time single mom, student and a 16 hour per week practicum. In the midst of all that, I also juggled many court trials, depositions, custody evaluations, restraining orders and immediate danger orders, moved twice, houseless for three weeks, countless counseling appointments, mediation, kids attorney, DHS, and the list goes on and on. Cheesecakes became my stability. Making them became a form of therapy for me. My mind would stop racing as I made them and it's still the same to this day. After the above, I graduated with honors from Portland State University last summer 2018. This was a HUGE accomplishment as I am the first-generation college graduate in my family. As school wrapped up the demand for my cheesecakes grew. Not the direction I had envisioned but doors kept opening for me to have my own storefront shop. I found a space downtown Silverton. I will be able to sell cheesecakes wholesale to local restaurants, while still providing cheesecakes to my beloved customers that I have grown to know personally and love. The end goal is to have the shop space be a place for community to gather and for customers to come in and enjoy a scrumptious, decadent dessert. I have two main mottos I live by: �Each day is a gift� and �You only live once.� I've chosen to jump and take this risk of opening up a shop. I don't want to live with regrets. I�ve realized that I can integrate my social work practice within my cheesecake business. My dreams are to grow and expand to where I can hire individuals with barriers or need a hand up. I want the shop to be an opportunity to bless the community. Not just with the deliciousness of cheesecake but as an experience; an environment that cultivates community, warmth, love, joy, empowerment, inspiration, friendship, acceptance, etc. The space did not come with a kitchen. I�m raising funds for the kitchen, to provide an ADA bathroom as well as other renovations. I have been finding used commercial equipment here and there, yet still in need of mixers, ovens, a freezer, POS System and general inventory. I can't thank you enough in advance for any dollar amount gifted. I'm super sentimental which means your name will be placed on a wall in the kitchen called the "Backers" wall. :) Beloved Cheesecakes belongs to a Beloved community of supporters near and far. The boys and I look forward to sharing the rewards with you! With an enormous grateful heart, Jen

IF WE CAN RAISE $250 MORE (FOR A TOTAL OF $3750) EVERYONE WHO IS GETTING A PHYSICAL ITEM (SO PLEDGED $10 OR MORE) WILL ALSO RECEIVE A SKEWERED GUMMY BEAR. LET'S SPREAD THE #GUMMYHORROR! Click here to get a free 22 page preview of the comic! AND for every dollar donated I will destroy 1 gummy bear. Help us spread the #gummyhorror! And share the love! Tag @emptiescomics on any photo of #gummyhorror and I�ll DM you a FREE digital copy of The Empties, Issue #1. NO ADDITIONAL DOMESTIC SHIPPING CHARGES! The Empties - When a housewife contracts a flesh-eating illness, she and her husband try desperately to survive, and in the process, rekindle a love that is literally all-consuming! If you love body horror, this is our love letter to the genre! My obsession with body horror: I was in high school science class when I was first introduced to the movie that would mold my obsession with the body horror genre - and that was David Cronenberg�s The Fly. I remember that friends and I loved that movie so much that we went home and had �The Fly� parties. We watched all the versions of The Fly. But David Cronenberg�s left a lasting impression. Not only is it the story that most inspired The Empties, it is the story that also turned me on to horror. I�ve been a bit obsessed with body mutations since then. I, of course, went on and watched almost all of Cronenberg�s films and I also found punk rock movies like Troma�s Toxic Avenger, Stuart Gordon�s From Beyond (and Re-Animator!) and so many more (Xtro, Hellraiser, Slither, Bad Taste� you know the ones!)! I absolutely love this kind of horror because it is focuses on human beings who go through horrific transformations! That feels more real to me for some reason. We understand that they are not monsters, and we feel for them as they become monsters. But it is not the physical that makes you a monster, it�s the inner self and horrific actions that makes a person a monster. The Empties is a comic book series about humans who turn into gummy like monsters with a taste for flesh and all the while trying to survive this thing called love! The Team The Empties is a horror comic book limited series. We successfully brought Issue #1 and #2 to life, and like any good zombie story, we need to do it again! The good news is that, Issue #3 is complete! So what we really need money for is this: to print Issue #4 and keep our artists from starving to death while they work on Issue #4, 5, and 6 I believe in this project 100%. That is why I put $800 of every paycheck I make into creating this comic book series. And believe me, if I could spare more, I would. Because believe it or not, it does cost more than that (I�m sure you�ll believe me after I break down the budget for you). I pay Eli a rate of $240 per page. Many people do not pay their indie artists as much as I pay Eli, but this is not foolish spending on my part. No! The quality of the art is unlike anything you have ever seen before. Eli is a master at horror and an absolute professional who deserves even more than I can pay, which is why I also offered him a small percentage of the net profits. Next, this comic book series is shaping up exactly how I imagined it. Again, I was worried that luck would not strike three times and that this third issue might be the one where we failed, but we did it! And it wasn't by luck! Eli does such an amazing job time and time again. So, the rate I pay Eli means that we deliver the best quality possible. For Lettering, I pay Marshall $20 per page. This is probably the most insanely reasonable rate anyone of his talent has offered anyone. He is so generous when working with indie authors and he delivers the most impressive letters I have ever seen. You can see for yourself here in this FREE 22 page preview! For the Front Cover - I have worked out a licensing deal with Jeanne where I pay her to create original art, which she still owns, and I give her a 5 cent royalty on every issue we sell. Needless to say, she deals primarily in the fine arts, and to commission a custom work from her would cost anyone well in the thousands of dollars. So you can see what a great deal she is giving me. And last but not least, Zimri is our graphic designer who designed up the titles on the front and back cover and the credits page on the inside of the book. He is insanely talented and puts all the finishing touches on the issue to make sure it is perfect. Zimri gets a varying rate depending on the difficulty of the work. Generally, this budget is $250 for the work he delivers. When you all that all up you get the following: Artist - 22 pages + back cover at $240/ page = $5,520 Letterer - 22 pages + Recap page at $20/ page = $460 Cover Artist - Base + 5 cent royalty Graphic Designer - Various projects - $250 = $250 Grand Total - minimum $6230 per issue of The Empties Wow. That�s a lot of money! And that�s before printing costs. But it is worth every penny, and I wouldn't dream of not paying my artists. So like I said, I put $800 of every paycheck I make into this project, and I will continue to do so until all 6 issues are complete. Now, if we are ever going to: get the 4th issue printed, and get the comics finished in a reasonable time frame Then this indie project needs your help! That�s what this Kickstarter is for. It is so that we can send you a beautiful copy of the third issue AND keep up the quality and the pace for the 4th issue and more. Without your help: It will take longer for the 4th issue to be released. (This would also be sad... BUT IT DOESN'T HAVE TO BE! YAY!) Where is my money going? Great question! Here is a pie chart of the distribution of the funds. It should be a pretty good guide on where your money is going. If we don�t raise that money, this project will take more time to produce. But this is happening. We�re not stopping now. The #gummyhorror will spread! People really loved the first two comics: Women are too often vilified. We turn them into monsters. And if they are not monsters, the women exist only for men. (Think I�m wrong? Ask yourself how many comics and movies pass the Bechdel test?) As a woman, I reject these notions. My woman is fierce and she is flawed, making her equal to the men portrayed in The Empties. She has the courage to try to escape a relationship that has trapped her in traditional roles (even if she loses herself in the process). Helen, a trapped housewife, is the one who makes a firm decision to leave her husband, and she is clear and upfront about it. This is not an easy situation to be in. After all, it is not easy to claim that neglect is abuse. But she has been emotionally abused, and she lashes out. Helen is not a hero or a role model, she is a woman trying to claim her own identity, and the process is impossible because, in this story, she is literally turning into a zombie. It is painful to watch her lose herself. She is rundown, overpowered, and trapped. At first, we think that she is the monster (and that�s before she turns into a zombie). Her flaws are evident. After all, she is the one who cheated on her husband. But as we learn more and more about these people, we learn that her husband, Derrick, is controlling and that Helen is justified in her feelings. She is not a pet or a doll, but she sure is treated like one. We sympathize with each of the characters at different points in the story. But it is Derrick who commits the most monstrous acts. He justifies these acts in the name of love. It is too real, because we have all done desperate and horrible things in the name of love. I see a lot of myself in Derrick; I�ve made similar mistakes. I don�t believe in black and white monsters (only black and white comics, haha). I believe that every person is capable of monstrous things and that every person is equally capable of wonderful things. The Empties shows the monstrous side of people in love. Issue #3 Art! (Spoiler Free!) What can you get for your pledge? Still on the fence? No worries. Click here for a FREE 22 page preview!

We are pleased to present the Nozzle Removal Tool. As it stands now, the procedure to swap nozzles includes, cooling the machine down, removing the existing filament, and then removing the nozzle. This operation requires the use of a combination of 2 tools. The two devices are the crescent wrench to secure the heater block and the socket wrench to remove the nozzle. The current removal procedure is cumbersome and can take up to 20 min. The Nozzle Removal Tool is essentially one tool in which the user will be able to change nozzles. This tool works by allowing the top component to secure to the heater block and using the lower part to remove the nozzle. Our goal is to turn this product into an everyday item Makers can use. This tool would reduce machine downtime and make changing nozzles safer and more accessible. Photos and illustrations below show the functionality and blueprint diagram of the apparatus. Technical Information: The Nozzle Removal consists of 6 components, not including the heater block, nozzle, and 1/4 inch socket. Heater Block Compatibility Dimensions: 48 mm (1.889 in) x 23 mm (0.905 in) x 14 mm (0.55 in) Weight: 233.22 Grams (0.514 lbs) Expanded Length: 3.23 in (82 mm) Compressed Length: 2.57 in (65.27 mm) Overall Diameter: 1.25 in (31.75 mm) Gripping area is composed of Material is 304 Stainless Steel. (shown above is an animation of the ZCatch Universal Tool acting on the heater block) (The above illustration shows the dimensional compatibility of heater block within the Nozzle Removal Tool and the compact size of the tool) (This Video illustrates the current method, which combines a crescent wrench and socket wrench) (Above video illustrates the functionality of The Universal Nozzle Removal Tool) CLICK HERE: 3DPRINING.COM, 3DPRINT.COM, FABBALOO.COM Quality and Distribution: The prototype is currently in the final stages of development. Final testing and material selection are critical before mass distribution. Additionally, we are in the process of looking into adding more functionality to our tool for future versions. A safety mechanism is being researched to prevent the user from over torque of the nozzle; this will cause damage to the heater block. Additional features such as ratcheting will allow for more rapid removal of the nozzle. Manufacturing and distribution are a crucial aspect of the success of meeting your expectations. International Shipping costs for those are a priority. We will ensure product delivery at a reasonable price. If funding is met the distributing our product will follow our set schedule outlined below. Our goal is to grow the Nozzle Removal Tool in this direction using local machine shops as our Manufacturing supplier.

I've been doing my own music for years. Because I've always lacked the funds to truly make it great, I've always settled for putting out music that is lo-fi (a.k.a. lower quality). With my new project, Big Blind, I really want my music to be high quality because it means a lot to me and I want it to sound the way that I imagine it in my head. Jason Lowrie, my good friend and producer on the project, has offered to grace my music with his talents. I am making this Kickstarter so that I can receive aid in paying for his services so that I can put out my first EP, Besa, in a few months time. The money raised will pay for Jason to track my vocals, guitars and do mixing on all of my music. It will also pay for Jared Hirshland to do the mastering on all of the songs. With your help I can make this happen.

I wanted to find a simple application to make lists. I could not find anything that was exactly what I wanted, a simple application with no frills, I just wanted to keep track of things in a list after all. I decided I would have to create one. After weeks of learning how to create an Android application I had done it, I had created the simple list app that I had been searching for. I was going to keep it for myself but my wife urged me to share it with the world through Google Play. It has had a few hundred downloads and very positive feedback. My wife decided she wanted different colors so I added that option just designing a few color options. That was the extent of the frills that I had planned. Simple and Sweet. Now I am seeing a big benefit of being able to share your lists across devices(I have had a few users lose their lists because of getting new phones). Looking into doing this I find that it will be costly, not just the development but storing and accessing the data. I am looking for funding to help get this piece developed and the server supported long enough to get some subscribers. The ultimate goal is still simplicity for the user. Please check the App out for yourself here. https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.aadam_duckett.MasterList&hl=en_US

The Moody Deck The Moody Deck can be used solely for meditation and introspection, but what makes it really special is the option to use it as a tool for goal setting and planning action steps. This deck is highly recommended for creatives, leaders, and entrepreneurs, and can be used by individuals, partners, and small groups. How to use the deck All exercises listed below are included and described in the MAP guidebook (included with every deck). A "spread" is the term used to describe how the cards are physically laid out. SOLO Theme of the day - a simple technique to use for inspiration and self-reflection Creative meditation - use the MAP guidebook as a resource for a variety of meditations: some are visualizations, others include breathing exercises, and a few will call for you to act Goal Setting & Action Planning Spread - focus on a specific goal you'd like to achieve by a certain date WITH A PARTNER Core Values Spread - brainstorm and identify core values in a specific area: business/career, love, personal growth, wellness, parenting, etc. Have-Desire-Require Spread - this check-in spread is helpful for identifying strengths and opportunities for growth Goal Setting & Action Planning Spread - focus on a specific goal you'd like to achieve by a certain date AS A GROUP Collaboration Spread - a great team-building/ice-breaker exercise Dinner Talk Spread - a fun way to spark conversation and get to know one another Core Values Spread - create a creative mission statement There are 54 cards in the deck. Each card is accompanied by a written meditation in the MAP guidebook. Several of the spreads include prompts to identify actionable steps, so it may be helpful to have writing materials close by to record your thoughts as you go. The artwork For The Moody Deck, I wanted to create images that were visually appealing, but also meditative, which is why I committed to simple color palettes and balanced abstract images. I did extensive research on color symbolism and color's effect on mood to create this beautiful deck. All images come from original watercolor paintings I completed over the last six months. About the name...why "moody"? I've often wondered why the word mood, defined as a temporary state of mind or feeling, is neutral, but the word moody is typically given a negative connotation (e.g. crabby, cross, and sulky). Here's the truth as I see it: we are always moody, because we are always in some temporary state of mind or feeling. When we are happy, energized, motivated, adventurous, or inspired, we are experiencing mood! With this deck, I'm embracing the fact that we, as humans, are moody creatures. For goal-setting and action-planning purposes, I've chosen to focus on the moods that uplift and further progression. The goods Each set of The Moody Deck includes: Fifty-four 2.75" x 4.75" high-quality, matte-finish cards printed in color, front and back* 4.25" x 6.875" 68-page Meditation & Action Planning (MAP) guidebook a tuck box to keep your cards fresh and safe *please note the design on the back of the cards is not reversible, as The Moody Deck doesn't require different interpretations for cards drawn in reverse Estimated ship date: September 2019. Production should be completed mid-to-late July, but I prefer to set realistic expectations should there be unforeseen delays. Creating The Moody Deck has been a dream come true, and I am so excited to share it with you! You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00 sneak preview of some of the spreads you'll find in the MAP guidebook How will Kickstarter funds be spent? The breakdown: production of cards, boxes, and guidebooks (250 ct.) shipping & packing materials Kickstarter fees taxes If my goal is surpassed, I will use the extra funding to print more copies of The Moody Deck + MAP guidebook, increase distribution, and further pursue business opportunities for The Moody Deck.

Phobia Toys: My name is Ben Farnam and I am in the early stages of forming my toy company Phobia Toys. I started collecting vinyl toys around 2007 and have had an unhealthy obsession with them ever since. Shortly after becoming a collector I started trying to sculpt my own toys. I haven�t had any formal training so there was a lot of trial and error along with some pretty hideous looking toys! With the dream of making my own toys I continued to practice for many years. Though I am not anywhere near where I want to be, I finally got to a point last year where I thought what I was making was good enough to be made into my first vinyl toy. It�s hard to describe the feeling of sculpting clay for hours and hours on end, sending it off half way around the world, and finally receiving a giant box with a bunch of vinyl toy reproductions, but it is something I hope to experience again and again in the years to come! My first toy has a furry cyclops monster who goes by the name Rowlii. After Rowlii, I helped an incredible Russian artist named Acid Ma turn one of his illustrations into a soft vinyl toy. The result was a maggot infested worm called The Cherv, which was also brought to life through a kickstarter campaign. Most recently I self funded a set of two smaller two piece toys that I am calling The Ugly Twins. Images of all these toys can be found on my Instagram page @binbizii. tV HeAd will be my 4th sculpt to become part of the Phobia Toys line up. In my opinion this sculpt is one of my best to date and with six separate pieces it allows for more possible positions than any other toy I've attempted to create. With the recent investment in the ugly twins I just don't have the funds to bring tV HeAd to life on my own. tV HeAd: tV HeAd prototype tV HeAd prototype turnaround tV head is approximately 4.25" tall with five points of articulation. There will be 4 colors to begin with. This is a pretty basic campaign with the rewards focusing on the toy itself. There will be 3 different options. The first reward is for a single blank vinyl toy. The second level will be for the painted kickstarter exclusive. The last option is a tV HeAd 4-pack which includes one of each color. Thank you: Thank you so much for taking the time to check out my Kickstarter campaign! I hope you that you can find something in your price range to help make this toy come to life. If you have any questions or just want to be a nerd and chat about how much you love toys, please shoot me an email at phobiatoys@gmail.com

Making Rideshare Connections Safe IdentiRide is an AI-powered platform that uses blockchain security to protect rideshare users. It�s smart, highly secure and seamless. No more trying to guess which ride is yours on crowded streets or outside venues. No more approaching or getting into wrong cars. And no more risking�sometimes very serious harm�to you and those you love from someone posing as a rideshare driver. Keeping your connections safe, every time Uber provides 15 million rides per day. Lyft reached 1 billion rides in 2018. That�s a lot of people jumping into strangers� cars. Most times with little thought of the possible dangers. But that�s the world we live in today. But with explosive ride demand and a relentless push to grow, rideshare companies have left a huge hole in rider security. There�s little today to stop someone from pretending to be your ride and do harm. That�s what really worries me. I�ve used rideshare. I have kids that use it. I have relatives, friends, co-workers and others that I care for that use it regularly. We all do. So when I see the news stories popping up with growing regularity of harm coming to people from fake rideshare drivers�it makes me think: Who�s really looking out for the rider in all of this? Posing as a rideshare driver is easy to do and happening now. Take a look: You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00 It�s a serious problem that needs fixing No rideshare company wants to publicly admit it�s a growing problem or bring attention to it. It�s clear their immediate attention is to grab market share as fast as possible before the other guy. We�re convinced it�s time to do better and force this safety problem to be fixed. And your backing can help make a real difference. By kickstarting our project: You�ll help send a message and push the rideshare industry to take this problem much more seriously You�ll help us create a proof-of-concept solution that we can put right in front of them Create a safer, more secure rideshare experience for all riders Securing your ride How do you know�for sure�the rideshare you�re getting into is the one you ordered? Think of a busy street after a concert, outside a nightclub on Saturday night or pretty much anywhere. You can look carefully at the car, check the license plate, and check the driver photo. But how many people are really doing this? And what if the ride has been hacked? Check out that generic car photo provided by the rideshare app. It�s not even the same color of the car you�re looking for half the time. Look out into a crowd of cars that look pretty similar nowadays�which one is yours? Then there�s going to that lone car in the middle of nowhere that you�re convinced must be yours as you walk toward it. Add in rain or snow, a dark night�and it doesn�t get better. It happened to me outside a busy airport in the middle of night One floor of the parking garage was set up just for rideshare and had cones directing them all over the place. There were about 30 rideshare cars moving around in there. Riders where walking back and forth, knocking on windows and trying to find their rides. I found it absurd. And it took me three shots to finally connect with my own ride. I saw just how trusting people really are. Few took the time to do basic security protocols. They usually just asked are you my so-and-so ride?...and then got in It�s pretty hard to change human behavior. We saw the same thing time and again. So we are taking a different approach to security by putting powerful technology behind it. Take a look at what IdentiRide can do: You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00 How did we come up with the idea? It started when George was outside a gated condo complex deep in the night. No one was around. He was just about to call his girlfriend to buzz him in, when he was startled by a knock on his car window. �You my Uber ride?� asked the 20-something young lady. She showed no signs of being drunk, but still had walked right up to a stranger�s car. He quickly sent her on her way. But he kept thinking how could this have happened? It also got him thinking about his daughter who lives in a city and uses rideshare all the time. This rattled around inside his head for quite a while. So he started researching and paying much more attention to the issue. In our meet-ups he told us about it, and we started to pay much more attention ourselves. We became convinced there had to be a better way to protect riders before they get into their rideshares. That�s where our product IdentiRide comes in Rideshare companies provide the basics to help you find your ride when it shows up. But it�s far from exact and security is surprisingly lax�especially when you actually approach and get into the car. IdentiRide is an AI-based platform that includes a blockchain security to assess, identify and secure every aspect your individual ride transaction. No guessing if your ride and driver that show up is legit, and no more fumbling around looking for your ride in a sea of lookalike cars. Or worse, getting into a fake rideshare with a driver intent on harm. And let�s face it, people aren�t always their sharpest after a night of partying when it's time to get home. IdentiRide will offer: Seamless integration with rideshare apps and systems Provides all benefits and features through the rideshare app you are using. IDs and tracks the car before its arrival right to you Guides you right to the exact car using multiple outputs including step-by-step visual, audio and tactile guidance. Alerts you when you head to the wrong car or veer off at any time and gets you back on the correct path to your specific ride. Protects you from fake rideshare drivers and potential harm�before you�re ever in the car Alerts you if anything is amiss Constant verification in real time of correct ride, distance and time to arrival. You�ll be instantly warned when the AI detects any problems outside the verified parameters for your ride and driver along its entire way to you. Driver confirmation is assured Two-way, virtually un-crackable blockchain solution between rider and driver makes sure the driver they send is the driver you see�before getting too close or into the car. Rider safety has to matter more: And we�re going to do it I�ve used rideshare. My kids use it. I�m sure you or someone you care about has or eventually will use it. Which is really our point. Rideshare is pretty much everywhere. Fake rideshare drivers are increasingly taking advantage of people�s trust in the system�and real harm is coming to people. We believe we have a powerful security solution that could make these problems a thing of the past. Who we are We�re a few guys with a game-changing idea. But the beauty is we have the right combination of experience and skills to make this thing happen. You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00 George is the CEO of our fledgling company Enhancc, which we formed to do products like these. And in one sense, he is the father of our first product idea to make it this far: IdentiRide. It�s funny how such a small thing can spin up such a great idea. But that�s how many big changes get started. George has more than 25 years of experience as a Wall Street financial advisor and head equities trader under his belt. So he has seen many ideas come and go. He was convinced this is a winning one that is sorely needed in the rideshare industry, and we agree. Our CTO David is our ace-in-hole. He�s a computer systems and technical guru entrepreneur that brings quite a punch to the table. He founded three IT organizations that support SMBs (Small/Medium Business), government, medical equipment vendors and healthcare providers. He has designed, architected and trained neural networks, and is actively involved in feature engineering, machine learning, machine vision and natural language processing in the AI space. For the last 20 years, David has been involved with Enterprise Information Systems, Cloud based SaaS/PaaS/MBaaS, Ecommerce and Social Web Technologies, Data Visualization and Business Intelligence Toolkits, Mobile Application Development. And to boot, he�s a consultant hired to bring Agile and Lean Six Sigma performance improvement methodologies to companies, so he�s the perfect person to keep this project on point and on task. And our CMO Steve has been in communications for more than 30 years across multiple industries. This includes stints with multi-billion dollar healthcare companies, worldwide Fortune 1,000 worldwide consumer products organization and a rapidly growing hospitality brand. And yea, as you can guess, I'm the guy that wrote this pitch. How we're going to do it We have the provisional patent filed and the plan. Now we need to raise funds to build out an initial prototype. These funds will be used for contract developers to create the proof-of-concept software platform for this, our first step on this crazy-cool journey. We expect the funds to be used follows: What has happened 2017 May: George has a brainstorm; team gets onboard Jun - Dec: Many beers are shared, initial ideas formed, we poke holes and discard many of them over the remainder of the year 2018 Jan: We have it! Mar: Specs and product design May: Now the name...so many good ones were taken, and so many websites unavailable. More beers to spur more creativity. Eureka! IdentiRide is born. June - Dec: Product design continues; web, social and pitch materials developed 2019 Jan: Thoughts of crowdfunding project begin to arise, so we start exploring that direction May: Kickstater campaign launches What's coming 2019 June: Funding campaign a success with your help (fingers crossed)! Q3: Development team contracted; work begins Q4: Alpha version developed; testing begins 2020 Q1: Changes, fixes, bugs eradicated and the like Q1 - Q2: Beta version is ready enough to begin showing; approach companies to secure partnership(s) for testing

Logan Ibarra's very bad day continues on in Not Drunk Enough volume two! Your favorite surly, not-that-bright repairman keeps on the struggle of surviving through the madness that is created by a scientist that truly believes that the life of one outweighs the many. Not Drunk Enough is a horror-comedy that dives into the darkness of our minds, tugging and pulling at the idea of what we can do when we feel a little trapped. It has characters who are more monster than human, and those who just really seem to epitomize being in the wrong place at the wrong time. The Harvey-nominated comic has been running for just over a year now over at notdrunkenough.com where you can catch updates on every Tuesday and Thursday! Not Drunk Enough is an incredibly special project to me, one that I keep very close to my heart. It's the story that helped me navigate some of my darkest depressions, my feelings of being trapped, and it is, in essence, a story that helped me come to understand who I really am. The journeys to finish the second book in particular were a bit difficult, so being able to come here today with it all finished and ready to go means the world to me. Here's a comic about one of the journeys in particular: Thank you for taking the time to check this out and check out samples of the pages below to get a good peek of what's in store! The books are going to collect the entirety of the second volume, along with some sweet inside looks in the back and extra content! Pick up where we left off which was just a lot of screaming in a building full of monsters. 7X9 and in full color! ***No Shipping is being charged during the campaign. We will be utilizing PledgeManager to charge location and weight based shipping closer to when the campaign is being fulfilled!*** Printing, as we all know, costs a heck of a lot, and Not Drunk Enough is what it is today because of all of you! I still cannot thank everyone enough for the support that the comic has received thus far, as well as getting me through the dream of printing the first one. I really hope we can work together and bring the second one to its beautiful physical form to join it's little brother on a bookshelf! Thanks so much for your love and consideration!! Love, Tess!

VR YOGI Virtual Reality Mobile Wellness App Welcome to VR YOGI, the virtual reality mobile wellness app. VR YOGI combines adventure travel with guided meditations to create one-of-a-kind immersive experiences at ancient temples, sacred rivers, and the beauty of the Himalayan Mountains. Immersion into the birthplace of yoga is as easy as pulling out a mobile device. THE VR YOGI PROJECT: The VR YOGI project creates the interactive VR YOGI Virtual Reality Mobile Wellness App in 360-video. The majority of our budget is allocated towards the professional development of the VR YOGI Virtual Reality Mobile Wellness App. This includes: A bulleted user story outlining the ideal VR app experience flow. Script Development Storyboard creation to illustrate the VR experience, including: Splash Screen, Menu UI/UX, App UI Design Elements, and 3D models. Content Creation Voice Over Recording Store Art Creation to include: App Icon, Hero Artwork, Additional Banner and Badge Imagery Technical Execution Quality Assurance Testing Launch Post-Launch Support The VR YOGI Virtual Reality Mobile Wellness App features: A mobile virtual reality app perfect for IOS and Android devices. Over 20 breathtaking destinations, each one a gateway to a wellness goal. Visually captivating and emotionally engaging VR experiences. Guided meditations across several categories including, stress, sleep, focus, anxiety and more. Custom soundtracks to enhance the immersive experience. WHAT MAKES VR YOGI VIRTUAL REALITY MOBILE WELLNESS APP DIFFERENT FROM OTHER WELLNESS APPS? VR YOGI is the only wellness app that immerses you in the birthplace of yoga, the Himalayan Mountains. The VR YOGI immersive experiences, filmed in 360-video on location at annual Making of A Yogi trips to India, are transformational: VR YOGI features the Himalayan wisdom teachings of yoga master, Yogi Amandeep Singh. With a Master's Degree in counseling and in-depth knowledge of Kundalini Yoga, his lessons are unique and highly effective in dealing with stress, depression, anxiety, and emotional trauma. PLEASE BACK THIS PROJECT We need your help to make the VR YOGI Virtual Reality Mobile Wellness App a reality. Don't underestimate the booming wellness market: Yoga has grown massively in popularity over the past few years, with passionate yogis stretching around the world. Thirty-six million Americans practice yoga, and there are thought to be over 300 million yoga practitioners worldwide. Wellness tourism has become a dominant lifestyle value that is profoundly changing consumer behavior and changing the markets. Wellness, defined broadly as the active pursuit of activities that promote physical and mental well-being, is a $639.4 billion industry. Fitness mind/body industry is a $595.4 billion industry. Workplace wellness at $47.5 billion, remains small in comparison to the financial burdens and losses created by unhealthy, overstressed employees. Please back this project now by selecting one of the rewards on the right-hand side of the page. Share this campaign with your friends, family, acquaintances....everyone! BENEFITS OF VR YOGI VIRTUAL REALITY MOBILE WELLNESS APP VR YOGI makes the "Himalayan yoga experience" as easy as donning a headset. Real-life travel to the Himalayan Mountains is both perilous and out of reach for most people. It takes time, money, physical endurance, and good health to trek at high altitude. Ranakpur Jain Temple, Rajasthan, India Believable immersion is therapeutic. VR studies have shown that people who learn and train in VR retain the information much more deeply and for more extended periods than those who use traditional methods. WHY WE CARE ABOUT BRINGING THE VR YOGI VIRTUAL REALITY MOBILE WELLNESS APP TO THE WORLD? VR YOGI wants to keep you sane! Co-Founder, Catherine Kominos, VR YOGI Keynote Presentation at VR Days Europe 2018 According to the World Health Organization, stress is a worldwide epidemic. Prolonged stress exacts a toxic toll on the body, brain, mind, and soul. Research findings published in JAMA Internal Medicine suggest that meditation can help ease the symptoms of stress, anxiety, depression, and pain. There is no way to express the gratitude we feel for your interest in VR YOGI and for your support. Founders, Catherine Kominos and Yogi Amandeep Singh at VR Days Europe 2018 In gratitude.

Celebrating 15 years in comics, Beyond Time presents the 140+ page Black Tiger: Legacy of Fury Graphic Novel, created and written by John Hervey (Troubleman), with pencils by Rod Luper (Star Wars: Outlander) and Diego Bernard (X-Men Gold, Witchblade) covers by Greg Horn (New Avengers, Justice League: The Rise of Arsenal, X-Men Universe), inks by Arne Starr (The Legion of Super-Heroes, Star Trek) and Chuck Drost (Supergirl Plus, Troubleman), colors by Robert Hawkins and Beezzz Studios and letters by Marco Della Verde (Howard Lovecraft and the Undersea Kingdom). Who is the Black Tiger? Los Santos is a city at war between the jockeying gangs, the feared and reviled meta-humans, and the thinly stretched police. In between all of it, one man has served as Los Santos� self-appointed protector for over forty years: Black Tiger, the fist of justice, who uses his meta-human powers and bone-crushing kung fu to protect the innocent and punish the guilty. What no one knows is that the Black Tiger is actually the men of the Fong family, the power passed down from father to son. The Story Pacific "Pac" Fong, the current Black Tiger, has a strained relationship with his children. His daughter, Jenn, is the straight-as-an-arrow Assistant DA whom Pac has inadvertently lost in the shuffle as he focuses his attention on his prodigal son, Eric. Unbeknownst to Jenn, Eric is the heir to the Black Tiger power and an enforcer in the Red Dragon Triad, the most brutal gang in Chinatown. When an assassin�s bullet ends Pac�s life and grants the power to Eric, the family is shattered. Pac's web of secrets drives brother and sister onto separate journeys that collide as the fate of the city and the mantle of the Black Tiger hangs in the balance. The book is mostly finished. The story is complete and 140 pages of production are done. If the Stretch Goals are attained 37 new pages will be produced and 9 pages will be remastered. After production is complete the books will need to be prepared for printing, including the approval of proofs, printed and then shipped. Rewards We have attempted to keep reward tiers simple and limited to help things go as smoothly as possible, but if you have any questions, feel free to message us here on kickstarter or by email at bt@beyondtimecomics.com. If you want a combination of rewards or extra books, simply add the price of the reward to your pledge (no need to include extra shipping on fewer than 5 books), and you can specify what you want in a survey that will be sent out after the campaign ends. U.S. shipping for most tiers = $7 USD Unfortunately International shipping is very expensive; $15 USD in Canada and $20 USD everywhere else (not including duties and taxes that may apply in your country.) Important note for international backers: The intention is to avoid passing on customs fees, VAT taxes and tariffs for as many backers as we can, but it's possible that they may be unavoidable. You may be responsible for these fees. For the tiers including prints, sketches or original art it is expensive to ship those overseas, which is why we are collecting $40 though it actually costs more in the $50-$60 range. How Else Can You Help? You can also greatly help the campaign by: Sharing the Kickstarter campaign on Facebook, Google+, Twitter, Instagram and any other social media site you are a part of. The more people we can attract to our cause, the better chance of a successful campaign, and the more people we can share our graphic novel with once made! For more info, check out www.beyondtimecomics.com! Tell friends, family, everyone you know and everybody you meet! Like and repost our Instagram posts, like and share our Facebook posts and Kickstarter updates and retweet our tweets... or even better, give us a shout out and include...

We�re going to code and design software that a user can copy and paste content in, take a picture and upload into or enter a website address into a portal that will then recognize and translate complicated legal information into simplified common information. Few people outside of legal circles can understand legal information. Economic barriers and social taboos are a couple of obstacles in the way. This legal tool will empower people to demand justice, accountability and effective remedies at all levels The absence of legal culture and resulting legal ignorance main reasons for the large number of cases created. If the accused knew that an act is a crime punishable by law they may not do it. Law is a a complicated language that lights the way to harmony. We just need it #LitDifferent

About the Illustration This pin design is based on a drawing I made a few months ago, where I reinterpreted my favorite Loter�a card illustration. The original card features El Diablito (the Little Devil) looking perfectly spooky and classic. I love a good vintage devil, but I wondered what a softer, more modern version of this character might look like. I ended up drawing the gal below and people seemed to like her! The original Loteria card (left) and my drawing from earlier this year (right) Why an Enamel Pin? I designed my first pin over a year ago and was so happy with the final product, I've wanted to make another for a while now. I love the process of designing a little 3D object and seeing where each pin goes on to live. But getting these things manufactured in big quantities is spendy! So this time, I figured I'd gauge interest and offer a preorder: You can help bring the pin to life, and I can devote more time and money to making cool stuff this Summer�without worrying quite as much about rent. Everyone who pledges will also get one of my new holographic stickers, and shipping is free within the U.S.. Not bad, right? The Details This pin will be 2 inches tall, black dye soft enamel with five colors. A proof of the final design is attached below. I'll be ordering a small batch in the next few days, and will calculate how many more to order as soon as this campaign ends. All the details are sorted out, so this is basically just a preorder! Production Proof

Hi there, my name is Danni, I'm an ice cream making, art directing, designer and cyclist who loves maps! I'm launching my first Kickstarter here to help fund a project I've been thinking about for a few years now, a map of the Delaware Beaches.  Riding the Junction Breakwater Trail. I started going to Lewes and Rehoboth a few years ago and fell in love with it (I even got married there)! You can't throw a stone without hitting an awesome brewery, distillery or meadery ... there's amazing food and the bike trails are top-notch! There's alot of off-beat charm that people may not notice at first glance, but that's what makes the area so special to me. Anyways, this project is my love letter to Slower Lower � I had a blast putting it together and it's finally ready for publication. The campaign finishes in early July, and the printed maps will be available to go to market by the beginning of August. My dream would be to have these available in some of the shops and local businesses featured on the map, so I'm hoping this will help to get the word out! Map features: Folds down to 3.75" x 3.75" so it fits in your back pocket Inset map of the main biking trails from Lewes to Rehoboth 50+ descriptions of things to see and do insider tips for all the top spots for beer and ice cream *Printing by Risolve Studio The goal of launching this campaign is to spread the word, with your support this project can be realized on an even larger scale then I initially intended. Funds raised here will go towards covering part of the cost of printing the map as well as the cost of the pins and prints. The hope is that once this is funded and I distribute the printed map to local shops in the region, the momentum from the digital campaign will propel things forward to greater success. Thanks so much for reading (if you've made it this far). Adventure onward!

"ANNIE HALL MEETS THE BABADOOK" THIS IS AN AMAZING OPPORTUNITY TO BE A PART OF the 2019 Los Angeles premiere of Ali MacLean�s award-winning play, She�s Not There at this year�s SHE NYC/LA ARTS SUMMER THEATER FESTIVAL. This annual festival supports the creation and production of meaningful, powerful works by women playwrights. The She LA Summer Theater Festival will present five new full-length plays. She's Not There - When Rob meets Anna, he thinks she is the one. When Anna meets Rob, she thinks she can finally be happy. But there is a third party in the relationship that may destroy their union. Every night a shadowy form seeps from the walls of Anna's apartment and tries to kill her. She�s Not There is funny and poignant - but also experimental and shocking. This is a tragicomedy that explores how depression and mental illness can hijack a relationship. The play unflinchingly portrays how depression isolates a person and how suicide can devastate the lives around them. The personification of depression is portrayed as a literal monster. THE MISSION We need to talk about depression and suicide. With this play, we want to spark a dialogue within the audience, connect our community through empathy, and spur anyone affected by depression into action. Whether that is on an individual level by reaching out to a friend in need, or on a sociopolitical level by helping to institute change, we hope this promotes understanding of those who have mental illnesses � and eliminates the stigma and confusion that�s too often present. Our mission is to use the timeless medium of live theater to foster empathy and education about a commonly taboo subject. With your donations we hope to achieve that goal. Depression is not just a mental health issue, but a public health issue as well. Too often the emotional impact of depression and suicide is marginalized and discriminated against, and access to help is out of reach to certain social classes. In addition, the stigma of mental illness makes it difficult for many to ask for help. According to statistics from the National Institute of Mental Health, approximately one in five adults in the US experiences mental illness. Only 41% actually receive help. Serious mental illnesses cost Americans around 192 billion dollars in lost earnings and suicide is the 10th leading cause of death. ACCOLADES She�s Not There is the recipient of the 2018 John Gassner award. It was also selected for the Ensemble Studio Theatre Winterfest reading series, workshopped in London at the White Bear Theatre, finalist for the Kitchen Dog Theatre New Works Festival, finalist for the Gary Marshall Theatre New Works Festival, shortlisted for the Dennis and Victoria Ross Foundation Project, semi-finalist in the Screencraft Play competition, and has been selected for the 2019 SHE NY Summer Arts festival. �We so enjoyed its explosively idiosyncratic theatricality and deceptive structure, as well as its deep probing into the world of mental health� - Clubbed Thumb Theater NYC �Exciting and fascinating. The dialogue, pacing and characterization are exceptional. A wonderful and imaginative writer� � Southwest Theatre Festival �This story has amazing dialogue...Every character is interesting and Anna�s plight, experienced by many in a theatre�s audience, is something many can relate to� � Austin Film Festival Ali MacLean and "She's Not There" featured in Broadway World THE FESTIVAL The opportunity to take part in this limited engagement presentation was offered by the She LA / NYC Arts Theater Festival. We are proud to have been chosen out of thousands of submissions -- and to be a part of a festival that promotes women in the arts and one that supports female playwrights and artists. THE VENUE THE ZEPHYR THEATRE 7456 Melrose Avenue Los Angeles, CA 90046 This year the festival takes place at the Zephyr Theatre in Los Angeles, CA. For more than 50 years, the Zephyr has been a mainstay of the Los Angeles theater scene and has hosted writers and performers at every level of achievement, from Oscar and Emmy award winners to new playwrights. THE TEAM ALI MacLEAN - PLAYWRIGHT https://alimaclean.com Ali's plays include She�s Not There, Wolves At The Door, and Tales Of A Bleaknik. Her work has been developed at the HBO Workspace, Comedy Central Stages, and The Ensemble Studio Theatre. She�s Not There has placed in the Screencraft Stageplay competition, The Gary Marshall Theatre New Works, the Dennis and Victoria Ross Foundation Project, and won the John Gassner Playwriting Award. Her play Wolves At The Door was an O�Neill National Playwrights Conference finalist. Ali won the Writers For Writers Fellowship and is a finalist for the Orchard Project fellowship. Ali is a graduate of the Miami University Acting Program, the La Jolla Playhouse Theatre Conservatory and is a member of the Ensemble Studio Theatre Playwrights Unit, The LA Female Playwrights Initiative, and the Dramatist Guild. Ali writes for television. JESSICA ROULSTON - PRODUCER Jessica Roulston is a film and television producer and production manager. Her resume includes films, television, commercials, music videos and documentaries, including �The Curious Case of Benjamin Button� (2008 Academy Award) and Eric Clapton�s �Crossroads Guitar Festival� (2008 Emmy Award). Her most recent work was for �Landmarks Live,� an award-winning Great Performances series for PBS. Jessica has worked with such luminaries as Ridley Scott, David Fincher; and Spike Jonze; has helped curate several high-profile film festivals; produced for the IFP/Independent Spirit Awards; and also freelances for Lincoln Center and HBO. Jessica attended the American Academy of Dramatic Arts and The Juilliard School. NASH DUNNIGAN - POSTER / PROGRAM DESIGNER Nash Dunnigan is an art director and designer with Blue Sky Studios / Disney (formerly Twentieth Century Fox Animation). His projects there include �Robots,� �Horton Hears a Who,� �No Time for Nuts� (nominated for 2007 Academy Award), and the Ice Age franchise. He was the art director for �The Peanuts Movie� and �Ice Age: Continental Drift.� Before his tenure at Blue Sky, he was a designer on various animated television series including �Gotham Girls� and �Venture Brothers.� He has also published several art books, including the award-winning �Out of Picture� and a book detailing the artwork of �The Peanuts Movie.� Nash is a graduate of Virginia Commonwealth University. PRODUCTION COSTS We are keeping our costs as low as possible, but we still need production funds to rent rehearsal space; purchase set-building materials; rent/purchase props and costumes; and pay for poster & program printing...and to pay our talented actors (an ambitious 8-10 cast size).

We live in a time where negativity is more looked at than positivity. Aspire to Inspire is a movement to shine light on the one thing that matters... Love. We�ve created this movement to 1. Inspire each other & 2. Focus on people who spend their lives inspiring others. Come help us and be apart of our movement! We need your support for filming and also production costs, and lastly for the t-shirts. Check us out! You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. Ilina's Invitation is a story about hospitality geared toward children ages 4-12. In our story, Ilina Bonavento experiences what it feels like to be an outsider for the first time. In the midst of her discouragement, Ilina's parents come up with a great idea to help her make friends while including others who have been left out themselves. Ilina learns that her home is a gift, meant to be extended to people who might otherwise feel unwanted. Children will learn that it is important to look for value in others, make them feel welcome, and see them as image-bearers of God.
