My name is Congruence and I am a musician from Massachusetts. I make Pop influenced/melodic Hip hop music and I am raising funds to assist with paying to work with the best engineers and beat makers I can in order to bring the songs I have worked so hard on to life. In February of 2019, I left my job after working in retail for around 8 years. I was doing my best to power through work everyday with constant anxiety and depression but eventually it got to the point where I could no longer ignore it. Since leaving, I have spent the majority of my days working on perfecting my style, building my Instagram account from the ground up, and attempting to lift my mental health. In dealing with these mental illnesses, I use music as a way to turn it into something positive. My goal is to create a final product that can help as many people as possible who are in a similar position to mine. This album is dedicated to and inspired by my close friend Michael who passed away in October of 2018. You can hear my most recent song here:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yEDEn7ckLTs

In a nutshell: the World�s First Roleplaying Game how I�d do it. A hack that does what I always wished the game would do, that changes or discards the bits and pieces that always rubbed me the wrong way, while not overly complicating things and still delivering the same classic dungeon-crawler experience I�ve loved since I was a kid. Don�t get me wrong: I�ve enjoyed the game for over twenty years. I wouldn�t have kept playing it and writing about it if I didn�t. But everyone has their issues with it, everyone cooks up their own homebrew rules whether or not they end up using them at the table, or even bothering to fully flesh them out. I just ended up with enough that I felt collectively it justified a new game. People have described it as a more customizable-yet-simpler take on 5th Edition, something between 3rd and 5th Edition, and even a kind of modernized B/X or Rules Cyclopedia. Pretty much everyone agrees it fits the old-school aesthetic, which is good because it was intended to be a kind of homage to the "easy to master black box" that I grew up on. If you want to check out Black Book, you can snag it over on DriveThruRPG by going here (or get it as an Add-On: see below). You can also check out a quick-start version of the rules and content by clicking here (this incorporates some of the changes that will be going into Red Book). It's a direct Google Drive link, so you'll just need to click and download, no other steps necessary! Here are some other links if you want to dig even deeper: You can find a bunch of blog posts about design and how it's changed over time, as well as countless play reports, here. An interview with the folks from Game School TSR Podcast: Several reviews for Black Book: Mark Craddock (Cross Planes) Jeremy "Frothsof" Smith (Thought Eater) Niklas Skinner (Skinner Games) The RPG Crawler Not an interview or anything, but this guy Will "BilliamBabble Meddis" seems to dig it, too. Red Book takes all of the things that worked in Black Book and Appendix D and GREATLY expands upon and refines them. Black Book was 141 pages, Red Book is nearly 600. It's got more of the stuff that you love: races, classes (and talents for each), alchemical items, magic items, monsters, treasure, tables to speed things up, etc. It's like comparing a Starter Set to something like Rules Cyclopedia. Just to be clear: virtually everything in Black Book (and the Appendix D supplement) is in Red Book. Some mechanics or minor elements might have been scrapped, others changed, but for the most part it's all been ported over to Red Book (it might also be worded differently). This is intended to be a stand-alone RPG that doesn't require Black Book (or Appendix D) at all. Here's a rundown of the big things that help distinguish Dungeons & Delvers from the game(s) that inspired it: Ability scores are just modifiers. You don't have a Strength score of 14, with a modifier of +2. You just have the +2. You can roll stats, which requires you to reference a table, but it uses old-school modifier ranges so an 18 nets you a +3 instead of the +4 you'd get in later editions. There's very little number scaling. Some editions of the World's First Roleplaying Game had a lot of assumed math and wealth progression, especially 3rd and 4th. In Dungeons & Delvers there is some scaling, to the tune of about +1 every five levels. Monsters and task difficulties aren't built around this however, so you can better experiment without fretting much about your stats. Hit Points are split into Wound and Vitality Points. Wound Points (WP) represents more severe injuries, or "meat points". As such it recovers very slowly. Vitality Points (VP) represent fatigue and minor injuries. It replenishes much more quickly, at first with a quick rest, but over the course of the adventuring day it takes longer and longer. Armor provides both an AC bonus and Damage Resistance, so even if an attack connects it can absorb some of the damage. Beware though: some attacks like poisonous gas or a ghost's life-draining touch can penetrate your armor's DR, or even bypass it entirely! You can, for the most part, control how complicated your character gets. Whether you're a fighter or wizard most characters start pretty darn simple, and depending on what you want to do can remain simple. You can also shift gears as you play, choosing more complex stuff later on (and vice versa). Most classes have their own spellcasting mechanics. There's no pseudo-Vancian magic. This wasn't done for it's own sake as a gimmick or anything like that, but rather to make sure the mechanics for certain classes evoke a specific tone and feel (wizard magic is more dangerous and unpredictable, cleric magic is completely safe), that they build on the flavor so it all makes sense "in-game". Simple, Useful, and Robust Crafting: Making something is a snap: make sure you have the relevant crafting skill, make sure you have the item's cost in materials, and make sure you have the time. That's it. No rolling necessary.While there are a bunch of examples in the book, the rules are also open-ended, allowing players to try making their own unique items out of strange materials they discover. Fresh Takes on Classic Monsters: As we stat out monsters, we've been looking at the flavor behind them, deviating from the default where we think it'll make things more interesting. For example, kobolds are based on Germanic spirits (and a core PC race, effectively replacing halflings), and ghouls are demonic creatures with the ability to change their shape and steal the face of a creature they have eaten. Piercers don't just fall on you: they gather in clusters, and spray a paralyzing acid on anything that gets close, before using long proboscis to slurp up the remains. Some monsters look similar enough but have different abilities or flavor surrounding them, like gnolls: they look like classic gnolls but have more in common with the wendigo. Fresh Takes From Classic Monsters: Not every monster hoards treasure, but that's not a big deal since many monsters have useful bits you can harvest from them. These can be sold or traded, or used to make equipment. As it stands almost all of the text is done. There's about...1d4+2% left to go, but the primary purpose of this Kickstarter is so we can more easily set aside the time to finish the staggering amount of art it still demands! People love our art. It's been a defining trait since our Dungeon World class-creating roots. We've gotten better and faster over the years, but it can still take a lot of time and we don't like to skimp. The Black Book edition was 141 pages and boasted an impressive 58 illustrations. Red Book has greatly exceeded the 500-page mark, which will require a substantially greater amount of art. The current ballpark number is 100 new illustrations. Here's some samples of our art, so you can get idea of the style and quality: And while that's all going on we're also going to incrementally share content documents with you, the backers, giving everyone a chance to chime in, provide feedback and suggestions. This way we can better iron out kinks, make the system as airtight as possible so we ideally will never need to do another "edition" down the road. We really want to focus on new settings and adventures, but want a more finalize system before doing all that. The secondary purpose is to pay Chris for editing and proofreading. First things first, backers will not only be able to get their mitts on content sooner than later, they'll also get the PDFs and/or physical copies cheaper that what it'll cost once published, to the tune of about $5-10. Second, as already mentioned, the book is nearing the 600-page count, but that's just for a single-volume, digest-sized book. Sounds impressive, but we know some people prefer letter-sized books (8.5 x 11), and others might prefer to have the digest-sized book divvied up a bit, so we're making it available in three different formats: Not final cover. Page numbers subject to change, especially if stretch goals are met. The two digest-sized books will be divided into a player and GM book. We considered doing three (player, GM, and monsters), but the GM book would have been really small. This way they're more evenly matched in size. The letter-sized book will have a two-column per page layout. I should note that if you pledge for multiple books they can be in different formats. For example, if you want a color and B&W book, the color can be letter-sized, while the B&W can be a pair of digest books. Mix and match them however you like! Everyone that backs at the Wanderer level or higher will get PDFs for every format, in both B&W and in color: you don't need to choose. We're very open to suggestions, and if people want we could also do "art-free" and a version without a background page texture. Your name will also be added to a Kickstarter Backer section at the back of the book. Higher pledge levels (Explorer and up) net you a physical book. You choose what size of a book you want, and if you want a digest-sized book whether you want it in one or two books. Once the books are nearing completion, we'll send out a survey asking you how you want your book, and when they are ready send you a print-on-demand (POD) link. How that works is, once the book is finished and we get a suitable proof back from DriveThruRPG, we send out the POD links. These let you get a book from DriveThruRPG "at cost", as in they bare minimum they charge to print it: we don't receive any money from those, it all goes to DriveThru to pay for the books. If you want additional books, see the Add-Ons section, below. Since DriveThruRPG has print-on-demand facilities in America and Europe, in most cases this should keep shipping and handling costs at a minimum. The Immortal pledge level is different. For that we print the book and mail it out ourselves; since shipping and handling costs can change dramatically we'll have to wait to figure that out later. Just something to keep in mind, especially if you live in another country. If you want additional books, simply increase your pledge as follows for each additional book you want (required pledge levels are mentioned in parenthesis): B&W Softcover (Wanderer or higher) +$15 B&W Hardcover (Adventurer, Veteran, Hero, or Immortal) +$20 Color Softcover (any tier with a color softcover or color hardcover ) +$20 Color Hardcover (any tier with a color hardcover) +$30 There are no limits, just keep in mind that although DriveThru will package them together (up to a point, anyway) S&H might increase. Once the campaign is over we'll send out an email survey asking you which add-ons you want, and how many (as well as sizes in case you want both digest- and letter-sized books, or one big digest book and a pair of smaller ones). One other thing is that for the duration of the campaign, you can also pick up other Dungeons & Delvers products at a discount: Black Book +$4 Appendix D +$4 Krampus Run +$1 Escape From the Flesh Catacombs +$3 Delver #1 +$3 Dungeons & Delvers (Dice Pool/Chibi Version) +$6 Dungeons & Delvers: Red Book GM Screen +$5 One-Page Dungeons +$1 for each (5 in total) Dungeons & Delvers: Red Book Paper Minis +$5 You can get more information about all of those except the GM screen, one-page dungeons, and paper minis (we haven't made them yet) by going here. These prices are for both PDFs and at-cost print-on-demand if you want a physical version, just keep in mind that you'll need to pay the print cost and S&H as well. These will be sent out as soon as the campaign is over, in case you want to try out a more basic version of the game sooner than later. Note that you will not need Black Book or Appendix D to use Red Book: it will be completely stand-alone, and include most, if not all of the content from both books. It's really only if you want to try out the game sooner, and at a discount. If we exceed the initial goal, more loot will be obtained! UNLOCKED! Though the book will already be profusely illustrated, at this amount we'll be adding even more art: most if not all monsters will get illustrated, and we'll fill in most of the blank spaces with smaller bits of art. In addition, every backer will receive the art as individual images (300dpi, multiple formats): you can use them in personal or commercial projects, no limits! UNLOCKED! We were holding back on the wizard due to the sheer number of spell talents it already gets (which in turn were justified by all the bonus talents it also gets), but at this level we'll cram in the Conjurer talents we've cooked up, plus the Conjurer Talent chart! UNLOCKED! As with the Conjurer School, the cleric already had a bunch of talents. Not as many but then it doesn't get any bonus talents. At these level we'll add them to the mix. UNLOCKED! We were thinking of saving the Greek monsters for an issue of Delver, or a Greek campaign setting so everything would be in a single thematic book. At this level we'll at least put the classics in Red Book, and won't reprint them later, instead sticking to the more esoteric stuff, plus a bunch of variants and original stuff we've cooked up. Back in my day, race was your class! You played a dwarf or elf and liked it! At this level we won't replace races with classes, but make it an optional thing you can choose. You'll be able to multiclass between a racial class and a standard class, too, so you can decided just how dwarfy or elfy you want to be! Something we whipped up for the Game Science Podcast interview: players find an odd, seemingly abandoned tower in the wilderness, and quickly learn that a bunch of really nasty shit went down. It's mostly done, and we were going to publish it standalone, but at this level we'll stick it in the back so you'll have an adventure ready to go after whipping up your first batch of characters! David Guyll has been gaming for well over 20 years, cutting his teeth on the Easy-to-Master D&D "black box" (the one with Zanzer Tem's dungeon), before soon moving on to 2nd Edition. He�s maintained the roleplaying game-centric Points of Light blog for over ten years, where he reviews games, posts play reports, talks about games, adventure and game design, and features a bunch of homebrewed content. Melissa Guyll has been playing tabletop RPGs since meeting David one fateful day after being enticed by a plate of bacon and chocolate cake. Her history with RPGs didn't start there. Since she was in elementary school and took hold of a Nintendo controller she found a love for playing video games, RPGs being her go-to genre. When she's not being a nerd or coloring David's amazing art, she's also a mom, chicken herder, and gardener. Starting way back in 2013 they have labored to publish a collection of class powers and magic items for Dungeons & Dragons, as well as several adventures, numerous classes, a half-dozen magic item collections, and an original, unconventional campaign setting for Dungeon World. They've since expanded to publishing their own stand-alone roleplaying games, though still produce the occasional third-party product. They enjoy helping other creators with their work when they can, offering advice and providing inexpensive, sometimes free services and art. Chris started playing RPGs in 1980 and was hooked when after 2 hours of working on first character he died in first encounter (RIP forgotten named elf character). Chris went on to get his revenge with his second character and spent most of his youth with RPGs somewhere in the background. Always tinkering and coming up with house rules, characters, and adventures, from both a player and GM side. After high school Chris went on to join the Navy and became a pirate for God and country, where he learned the skills required for good QA work in a Submarine Engine Room. Afterwards going to art school to be a comic artist and eventually becoming an art/design director for the last twenty years at a promotional design firm. Red Book is his first adventure into being on a RPG team. His sword and pack are ready. Melissa and I delivered the PDF of A Sundered World over a month early. The print copies took longer, as it took us several tries to get the cover looking right but we've gotten better at predicting the results of DriveThru's print-on-demand service. We were also ordering them during the holidays, which probably caused them to take longer to arrive.We didn't bother running a Kickstarter campaign until the book was nearly complete, leaving us with pretty much just the art to worry about. That that's the same deal, here: text is mostly done, it's really a matter of cranking out the art. We also kept in constant contact with the backers, providing them with access to easily digestible Google documents, so they could offer feedback and suggestions while we toiled away on the art. We're also incredibly easy to get in touch with directly if needed.

The Altered Esthetics (Ae) Film Festival has been championing avant-garde and experimental filmmaking since 2014. We showcase and support filmmakers who explore the art of the moving image including works that represent experimental narratives, genre-expanding documentary, contemporary art practices, and avant-garde poetics. We screen short film and video works that stretch the notion of what the moving image is and can be. The 2019 Ae Film Festival will take place August 28th and 29th at Minneapolis' Trylon Cinema. The Trylon is known for showing unique film selections and features newly remodeled, accessible spaces and seating. Still from 2018 Audience Award Winner, Thursday's Child, by Maret Polzine We are entering our 6th season with our new Festival Director, Molly Parker Stuart, at the helm. As an interdisciplinary and film artist, she has been featured in several Ae exhibitions and was awarded a Featured Artist Award at our 2017 Film Festival. Maret Polzine has also joined our team as Assistant Festival Director. They have screened work with Ae previously including at our 2018 festival where they won an Audience Award. Under our new leadership, we look forward to continuing and growing our festival to include partnerships with local artist communities and organizations to foster diverse and inclusive practices within the experimental film community. Still from 2018 Audience Award Winner, The D�rive, by Tanin Torabi Ae puts artists first. We are proud to offer affordable submission fees, waivers, and cash awards to participating filmmakers, performers, and musicians. Each year, approximately 80% of our submissions come through one of our free-to-submit programs which are offered to all Minnesota-based artists as well as any artist facing financial or political difficulties. Our waiver program has assisted filmmakers from the United States, Brazil, Vietnam, and Iran who are facing such barriers. These artists would not be able to participate in the the experimental film community without our support. Last year, we were awarded a Community Arts grant from the Metropolitan Regional Arts Council to produce a series of microcinemas which allowed us to share our artists� work with expanded audiences. These community events screened short films for new viewers including many who had never seen an experimental film program before. This grant also allowed us to pay each of our participating artists. Within the traditional system, filmmakers only get paid through winning awards. We believe that any filmmaker who is showing work should be paid for their labor and we are working to establish this standard. Still from 2018 Creative Vision Award Winner, Float, by Karli Evans We have great plans for the future of the Ae Film Festival but cannot accomplish these goals without your help. Today, we are asking you to help us fund the 2019 Film Festival. Altered Esthetics is a 501(c)3 nonprofit run by a volunteer board of directors. 100% of your tax-deductible gift to Ae goes directly to the festival�s operating costs and paying participating artists. Please consider making a donation of any amount to support the future of experimental film in the Twin Cities and beyond! Here is a breakdown of our $1110 minimum budget: $640 - Theater rental $250 - Cash stipends for the winning filmmakers $170 - Award laurels for the winning filmmakers $50 - Printing programs and promotional materials

Play an early version of the game here in a Chrome browser! We made our goal! Now we are looking towards getting as close as we can to our stretch goal of $4,200. A bigger budget will allow us to: Publish on Steam! Commission higher quality illustrations! Cover our Construct3 license! Port to consoles like PS4 and Switch Thanks for your support! What is Grace? Grace is a short story-based game about two field technicians working in the Sierra Nevada of California. They're tasked with monitoring the nests of the Ruddy Quail but discover that the study design won't work because of human impacts on the ecosystem. They have to decide whether to continue collecting data or to tell the nearby townspeople about the problem. The two protagonists, Grace and Kiran We wanted to make an immersive natural environment with this game.You can use your field guide to identify the flora and fauna that you find throughout the levels. All the trees, flowers, and birds included in this game can be found in the Sierra Nevada (except for the fictional Ruddy Quail, the Ruddy Quail was kindly voiced by the Mountain Quail). Right now we are about 60% of the way done with the development of Grace. Learning how to use Construct 3 (our game development software) was a large part of the last two months. We've also created the first and largest map, animations for the birds and main characters, pixel art of the plants, and dialogue boxes. The soundscape was designed so that birds and objects become louder as you approach them. The mechanics of the field guide are completed. Grace is the first game we've worked on together. Development began in mid-April of 2019, so we'll have been working on this for two months at the time of the kickstarter launch. When the game is completed we'll release it for free on itch.io and--if we meet our stretch goal of $4,200--Steam! We want this game to be accessible to people of all financial backgrounds. The idea for the game came from a short story that Sarah wrote to explore her own feelings about science vs. outreach. We decided to turn the short story into our first game to test our skills and to see if anyone else is interested in environmental games. We have ideas for bigger games that we'd love to make in the future! Why Do We Need Money? Making art takes a lot of time and talent, so we'd like to pay professional artists to draw higher resolution illustrations of the birds and plants for the field guide. We want to pay artists $100-200 per illustration and we have 28 illustrations to commission. Sarah is a decent digital artist, so she could make some of them if necessary. That's why we've set our goal to $2,000 with a stretch goal of $4,200. Any additional money will go toward maintaining our Construct 3 license and buying food. If we do not get funded, we plan to develop the story part of the game and release it on itch.io anyway! The pictures for the birds won't be as pretty and it will probably take longer to finish. If we don't meet our goal and you'd like updates on our progress anyway, please contact us at swampastudio@gmail.com or follow Sarah on twitter. Who Are We? We're a team of two based in Worcester, MA. Jon is a videographer and music composer who works with nonprofits in the area. Sarah is an ecosystem ecologist and is entering a Master's in Geography program in September. She has been involved in projects ranging from bird breeding ecology to tree mortality. We collaborated on every part of the design of Grace. Rough Project Timeline If we meet our goal, we'll immediately start contacting artists and commissioning illustrations. We will provide updates on the timeline for these. In the meantime, we're working on the other maps as well as polishing the demo map, adding dialogue, and making story animations for the game. We hope to finish all this by August 31st, 2019. Our To-Do List Dialogue score Credits music Illustrations we didn't get the funds to commission Integration of illustrations into field guide NPC dialogue portraits BONUS: nest-finding mini-game BONUS: birding mini-game Story animations - DONE as of 7/12 Field site map assets - DONE as of 7/10 Extra dialogue to fill in story exposition - DONE as of 7/6 (we have seven pages of dialogue!) NPCs that appear in the store - DONE as of 7/5 Opening title animation - DONE as of 6/30 Store map assets - DONE as of 6/29 Scene transitions - DONE as of 6/28 The field site map and the store map - DONE as of 6/28 Sound design for the new maps - DONE as of 6/28

Part 2 - Maxfit 3rd Party Review Part 3 - MAXFIT 3rd Party Review Part 4 - MAXFIT 3rd Party Review Part 5 - MAXFIT 3rd Party Review Part 7 - MAXFIT 3rd Party Review Part 8 - MAXFIT 3rd Party Review Part 9 - MAXFIT 3rd Party Review Part 10 - MAXFIT 3rd Party Review Part 11 - MAXFIT 3rd Party Review Part 12 - MAXFIT 3rd Party Review At MaxFit we care about creating innovative health and fitness solutions that improve the well-being of all people through a fun fitness experience. We believe in a holistic fitness experience that encompasses smart fitness, good nutrition, and positive mind health. The MaxFit is a connected fitness platform that connects to a smartphone or tablet and allows people of all ages and all fitness levels, from the elite athlete to the fitness newbie to assess, plan, motivate, improve and reach their fitness goals through built-in professional training programs, powered by sophisticated algorithms, that customize workout plans for each individuals needs. As a company it is important to us not only to provide a great product that our customers will love, and will help them live a healthier lifestyle, but also to create a company that our employees love to be a part of, and a company that helps to improve it's local communities, and to be a general force for good in this world.

The Lost Dwarven Mine LAM Magnetic Dungeon Tiles are like no other LAM Dungeon tiles on the market today. LAM stands for Layer Additive Manufacturing which accounts for a much higher resolution printing than the normal hobby printers on the market. Tomb Guardians has designed a set of 47 plus 28-mm dungeon tiles that no longer require clips to connect the pieces together. All of our dungeon tiles are magnetically connected and use the magnets' polarity to hold the tiles in place. What this means for you is no more shoving tiles together, breaking and replacing tiles and clips, and, most importantly, not hurting or cutting your hands! If you enjoy dungeon adventures, you will love this set of dungeon tiles. Sculpted by renown artist Iain Lovecraft, we have created an amazing dungeon full of special rooms (crystal room, forge room, storage room, blacksmiths room to name a few), LED lighting on some of the special rooms, tons of accessory pieces, and a whole lot of dungeon tiles. Let your imagination run wild and create your own adventure. This entire project is being offered for physical products only. There are no downloads available. Founded in 2002 by Ted Thomas and Frances Ortiz, Thomas/Ortiz Dance is a collection of twelve dancers from culturally diverse backgrounds who present fresh and emotionally engaging performance. The company's repertoire explores a multitude of thought provoking and socially relevant themes. Thomas/Ortiz Dance has four upcoming engagements in which they are seeking support: The company's debut performance in their hometown on New Canaan, CT. Residency and performance at the Newport Dance Festival in Rhode Island. Public performance for diverse audiences this June in Jamaica, Queens. A commission by the Norwalk Symphony Orchestra premiering in November 2019. Our goal is to raise $4,000 for the expenses associated with dancer salaries and costumes. The company is thrilled to have been invited to perform in these engagements, and strives to bring high quality art to the communities and spaces in these various regions. With your support, Thomas/Ortiz Dance will be able to carry out this vision. We believe that this campaign will enable the company to share the professionalism and artistry that is its signature.

"Wars may be fought with weapons, but they are won by men. It is the spirit of men and the one who leads them that earn the victory." -- General George S. Patton This board game 'port' captures the strategy, choices and fun of the beloved video games. Players maneuver units from one of four factions to secure resource points, grow their economy, unlock buildings and purchase and upgrade new units. Player's eventually unleash their team's powerful end game forces to secure enough victory points (victory point mode) or destroy the enemy's base (annihilation mode). The Company of Heroes board game is a stream-lined WW2 board game with tactical maneuvers and economic choices. Featuring innovative game mechanics like multiple fog of war systems, an elegant combat engine, cover systems, building occupation and destruction, as well as beginner and intermediate play modes. The CoH board game is also expandable to be solo, cooperative or competitive up to 8 players. A snapshot of the vehicles coming with the $99 Core Set Applicable stretch goals include all nation specific bonus units and universal components. Includes bonus Monastery map. Not shown but 3 Mortars, 3 MG's and 3 Anti-Tank guns are also included for each faction. Not shown are the 3 Mortars, MG's and Anti-Tank guns included for each faction. *Lead designer's note: "I know everyone wants us to change the soviet infantry model, and we probably will, but he still cracks me up every time i see it. So arrogant lol." Yes, all of the above is included in the 4 Player Core Set! Plus all of the free bonus stretch rewards if you pledge during the campaign :) There are currently six possible Add On's: The Terrain Pack ($26) The Solo / Cooperative Expansion ($26) the Elite Commanders Collection ($46) Oberkommando West Faction Pack. ($42) Eastern Reinforcements Pack ($16) Early Bird Pathfinder Pack ($12) The STUG Assault Pack ($15) The Metal War Chest (tin container to hold everything $22) NONE OF THESE ADD-ONS ARE NECESSARY! These Add Ons represent extra game features and units not essential to the core experience. (The Core Set really does contain everything you need to play Company of Heroes!) You can select a reward tier bundle that includes the add-ons you want, or you can add them individually by simply adding the correct amount to your pledge. The price is the same either way, but choosing a bundle does help with tracking counts and unlocking add-on specific stretch goals. The add-ons you add manually will be confirmed shortly after the KickStarter campaign ends through a short KS survey. Later you will be able to further add expansions or these add-ons through the 3rd Party Pledge Manager that will go live approximately in October and run for 5 months until the game ships. Featuring a unique fog of war and AI reaction system, overcome 10 pre-set scenarios and challenges, or dive into a fully functioning free-play system like the video games' AI multiplayer! Click Here For More Rules and Game-play Examples of the Cooperative Expansion The big boys of the armored divisions! Includes the King Tiger, JagdPanther, IS-3 Heavy Tank, KV-2 Assault Tank, British Comet Tank, Sexton Motorized Artillery, US Pershing Heavy Tank and the US Sherman Calliope. Along with 2 variations of each Commander to unlock new abilities and upgrades. Note: We have also unlocked the Sherman Fireflies!! The Elite Commanders Collection features all of the Commander Packs that will be sold separately at retail for $10-12 a pack. For the KickStarter, we have bundled all 16 commanders and their special doctrinal vehicles into one bundle. Note that we will be confirming these vehicle selections with you, the backers, over the course of the campaign via a series of 8 polls to give you the option to select from this current set or alternate vehicles! This collection includes 2 of each doctrinal vehicle even the giant 3.7" King Tiger. Two US M5 Light Tanks have been added to the Elite Commander's Collection along with a new Mobile Forces Commander! (You may know this tank as the 'Stuart' the British nickname for them.) Leave a comment in the comments section or over at boardgamegeek to put in your vote. Right now the British Sherman Firefly is in the lead (hopefully with a Tulip rockets upgrade). This is a faction pack that allows you to play with a different type of German faction. This faction focuses on mobility and its light vehicles as well as the ability to create bases anywhere on the map. Note that this is not a 5th player expansion. Two PUMAS and the Breakthrough Doctrine Commander unlocked for the Oberkommando West pack! This mobile light vehicle carries a big armor-piercing punch to help dominate the early to mid game. The next Stretch goal is at 1600 OKW Packs (currently 1100) and will be a major addition by adding not only Flak Half-tracks but a whole configurable half-track system allowing you to spawn multiple types of half-tracks (like Flak, troop transport, Anti-tank etc...) (Maybe even that searchlight halftrack :) The ISU-152 is one of our favorite units out of all the Company of Heroes video games and will receive special treatment here. It is one of the only vehicles that can switch between a powerful armor piercing round and an infantry-devastating high explosive shell. With ultra long range and heavy armor, its weakness is its lack of turret and slow turning speed. Note that if your backer number is 4600 or less (i.e. backed before Saturday June 22, 2019 Noon PST) you are receiving this pack already! ALL ADD-ONS CAN BE ADDED BY JUST MANUALLY INCREASING YOUR PLEDGE BY THE CORRECT AMOUNT. A POST KS SURVEY WILL CONFIRM YOUR CHOICES! The early bird Pathfinder Pack now available as an add on for those that missed it! You can add this to your rewards by manually adjusting your pledge up $12. If your backer number is 3051 or less you are already receiving this pack. ALL ADD-ONS CAN BE ADDED BY JUST MANUALLY INCREASING YOUR PLEDGE BY THE CORRECT AMOUNT. A POST KS SURVEY WILL CONFIRM YOUR CHOICES! The Company of Heroes Board Game is an interesting hybrid of strategy, unit tactics and resource management; just like the video games. In our experience, if you like the video games and you like board games you WILL love this game. If you are unfamiliar with the video games, but like strategy board games, tactical miniatures games or war-games, you will PROBABLY like this game, it depends on whether you are looking for a relatively fast, medium complexity WW2 strategy game. I Never Played the Video Games, Will I Still Love It? For those in the second category the important distinction to consider is that this is a cross between tactical skirmish games and economy-based resource management games so it feels and plays differently than most other games out there. While the CoH board game shares some common elements with skirmish games and tabletop miniatures games, (players are maneuvering units around on a map after all), it has such a large focus on securing, collecting and spending resources that the end experience is quite different! Playtesters that never played the video games, said they enjoyed the fun choices and purchases you get to constantly be making in addition to all the tactical maneuvering like occupying buildings, positioning mortars, or flanking to vehicle weak spots; but without getting bogged down by a lot of calculation, dice rolling or waiting between turns. A third of the game revolves around your HQ board and production tiles. This is where you spend resources to unlock buildings, purchase new units and upgrades, as well build up experience and Commander levels. How Does It Stack Up? If you are a fan of of some of our favorite WW2 board games you will probably enjoy the Company of Heroes board game as well. But you should know that it is simpler (and less time consuming) than Squad Leader, Tide of Iron and Bolt Action. It has more tactical depth than titles like Memoir 44'. The unit interactions and abilities approach the degree found in games like Heroes of Normandie and Conflict of Heroes but has a more streamlined (and therefore lighter) combat system. This chart is a very rough comparison, it does not take into account play time. Also, even though complexity is not always the same as tactical depth; this chart combines the two together weighting tactical depth a little higher (otherwise Axis and Allies would be farther to the right.) The CoH board game ranges from 60-90 minutes in standard mode. It contains squad level tactics but also emphasizes capturing resources and many purchase decisions. *Beta Prototype Components Shown in Videos Gameplay Video - Real Time The 2 player live game continues as we extend the victory conditions from a medium game (15 points) to a long game (21) and we switch to Real Time Mode. These victory point levels are similar to playing a 250, 500 or 1000 point match in the video games. (Note that the first round is not an accurate representation in this video because we were using a 2 minute instead of a 3 minute sand timer at first, but later we correct.) *A few changes and improvements to the rules and gameplay have been incorporated since these tutorials. For example, spawn points are the entire back row of that side of the board, allowing faster horizontal movement and a wider range of openers. Click the image above to read or download the draft rulebook from ISSUU.com (Note that this is only an unfinished draft and represents a work in progress.) ALL OF THESE LANGUAGES HAVE UNLOCKED A *FULL LANGUAGE VERSION OF THE CORE SET and the COOPERATIVE EXPANSION! The ECC and OKW Commander Cards will be printed in the back of a language's rulebook for reference. Each version will require a small logistical fee that will be charged during the Pledge Manager (less than $10). These contents may be increased from stretch goals! They are also subject to change and approval by SEGA. These models are also shown with the decals we hope to unlock mid campaign. Note the AT guns, mortars and MG models are still draft versions and will be improved. 1:120 Scale, Solid, Pre-Assembled Models. The vehicle models are in 1:120 (15mm scale) with some greater than 3 inches in length. Pre-assembled with rotating turrets and produced in a base color for each nation. Note that most, but not all model designs have been completed; we will continue to add detail and complexity throughout the line. Infantry and weapon teams shown here represent draft versions. Note that we plan to fudge the scale of the infantry miniatures by approximately 1-2 mm in order to help with detail as well as handling that small size. Heavy Weight ABS Plastic. We will be using a heavier weight plastic than our last game to increase the heft of each miniature. They will be entirely solid as well! (No hollowing.) They will be manufactured with high precision-cut steel molds. US and German scout and light vehicles. Scout vehicles are ones that can capture points, reinforce troops or both. Light vehicles like these M8 Greyhounds and 222 Armored Cars are more offensive. Why 1:120 / 15mm Scale? We did not choose this scale, the scale chose us! There were a lot of considerations and design dependencies that were formed as we wrestled the board game version of Company of Heroes into existence. We wanted it to be accessible to a wide range of players, so the board had to be large but reasonable and able to be placed on a good sized kitchen table or convention table. We needed X amount of hexes in order to create enough space and distance on the maps, and those hexes needed to be of a fairly large size in order to accommodate everything we would be putting into them. The buildings and map features had to be close to the scale of vehicles and infantry and the end result was 1:120 scale. If any changes are made to the scale going forward it will be to increase the size to 1:100 (good news for all the FoW fans out there) but for now plan and back assuming 1:120. What is particularly cool about this scale are the simple conversions: a 23 foot Panzer IV becomes a 2.3 inch model. A 17' Staghound becomes a 1.7" miniature. Simple! Just a reminder that the components shown represent a work in progress and are subject to change. Stay tuned for the updated Churchills! We are deeply indebted to both SEGA and Relic Entertainment for giving us the opportunity to develop the board game version of their wonderful franchise. As devout fans of Company of Heroes, this project is a dream come true for us. This board game only turned out as good as it did because of the years of design and crafting that went into the video games. We promise to be ultra-transparent and communicative from beginning to end. Note that while, our team may use the comments section from time to time; mostly we will be passively reviewing the comments section and replying to questions and comments through the updates, direct messages and by building up the community FAQ. The Gi Backpack Functionally, it's a backpack. Cosmetically, it looks like a gi. Ultimately, it's a fun and unique way to rep your style, your school, and your love for martial arts. At the same time, it provides a new and exciting way to help grow your martial arts program. Look, on his back. It's a backpack. It's a gi. It's a Bushido Bag! Does it come in white? Yes. The factory sample is black, but it will come in white too. Who am I and why did I make this? I'm Erick and I love martial arts. I've spent the last 35 years studying Tae Kwon Do, Karate, Judo, Brazilian Jiu Jitsu, and MMA. From the mats to mitts, from kata to the cage - I love it all! Since you're reading this, you probably love it too. A family that kicks together, sticks together. What do we do with something we love? We share it, we talk about it, we tell our friends about it. How can you share your martial arts journey with your friends? One way is with a backpack that looks like a gi. When people see that you have a Bushido Bags gi backpack, not only will they know that you have impeccable taste in backpacks, but they'll also know that you harbor a love for martial arts. Why should you back us? The vision for Bushido Bags is to bring martial arts into the public eye through creative, fun methods. When you become a backer, you aren't just purchasing an awesome backpack (or backpacks) at a discounted rate. You're making a statement that you are a proud member of a global community of skilled, disciplined athletes and warriors. Did you say a gi backpack can help my dojo get more students? It definitely can. There are 5 easy steps: Place your business cards in the built-in business card holder. Sell the gi backpack and your school patch to your students. Your students carry the backpacks to schools, parks, or shopping centers. Your students refer friends using your card. You sign up the friends. Start the process again with the new students. "Why yes, I do train. It's awesome. Come try a free class. Worst case, you'll get really fit and have a lot of fun." This is a win-win. You sold the backpack and the patch. Your students recruited friends and receive your referral incentive. The friends have joined the amazing world of martial arts (and are paying you). Everyone wins! How can I decorate the gi backpack? However you want. If you're using it for referrals, I recommend that you put your school patch on it. However, at the end of the day, it's a backpack. You could cover it in enamel pins, glitter, rhinestones, or comic book superheroes. I'm sure yours looks better than this. If not, I know a guy. Who is making the bags? Someone big. I looked at a lot of manufacturers, but I ultimately decided on one of the world's largest manufacturers of name-brand backpacks. In fact, you probably already own some products that they made. The quality of this bag is top-notch, which you would expect form an industry leader. What are the specifications? 420D Nylon 12.5L capacity approx. 10.5" x 14.5" x 5" reinforced seams breathable mesh straps elastic bottle pocket

Prosperity. Joy. Ambition. Regret. In a time where family was one�s true north, with the Great Depression looming, a wave of discontent rushed over the city. Ambition can lead to desperation; regret can lead to death. A young girl is ready to leave home for the big city, despite strangling words of caution from a family that can�t, or won�t understand her. With a chance to find a brighter path�she finds him instead � the origin of a heartbreaking legacy that will stain the city of Cleveland for years to come. Why Immersive? Audiences today are choosing personal experiences over the purchase of physical objects. Immersive theatre dives into this mindset - a guest can attend multiple performances and have a completely different experience based on the choices they make throughout the evening. Combining elements from theatre, night clubs, and personal exploration into one evening of fully engaging entertainment, audiences will want to gather afterwards to share their experience and make plans for their next trip. Background Information Shadow of the Run was conceived in December 2015 by Beth McGee and Adam Kern. In January 2016 the project was awarded a $1,000 grant as an audience favorite from Notre Dame College�s SEAChange Program, prior to appearing in the Cleveland Leadership Center�s Accelerate Competition in February of the same year. With the addition of co-creators and partners Ben Needham and Christine Woods, the team began to develop a full scale immersive. With initial support from Joe and Anthony Russo, the team continued development to find the right opportunity to bring Immersive to the city of Cleveland. As implied in the title Chapter 1: WanderLust is the first part of a larger production, aimed for a 2020 opening.

I'm Erin Roseberry and I'm a comics artist and illustrator living in NYC. You may have previously encountered my work in the Magical Art Therapy series, which is an ongoing collection of sigils--or magical images--that use a symbolic visual language inspired by nature, mythology, and occult practices like alchemy and the tarot to address topics related to mental illness, trauma, and surviving in an unkind world. The Magical Art Therapy series has been inspired by my personal experiences as a mentally ill survivor of traumatic events, and I have been beyond humbled at the response from other people that have faced similar difficulties in their lives and found comfort and understanding in my work. Last year, I ran my first Kickstarter campaign which, with the help of my wonderful backers, brought two of the sigils--Sigil for Swift Justice Against Those That Got Away With It and Sigil for Stealing Back What You Can--to life as enamel pins. For this project, our goal is to bring the rest of the Sigils for Trauma and Recovery set into print as enamel pins, including the final stretch goals of reprinting the two designs from the original project for those that missed out the first time. Magical Art Therapy: Sigils for Trauma and Recovery. If we meet all our stretch goals for this campaign, all of the above designs will be made into enamel pins. *INTIAL GOAL: **!UNLOCKED!** AT $544* Sigil for the Retroactive Protection of Your Younger Self shows a ferocious dragon protecting a cracked egg, surrounded by weapons it has broken. Sometimes survivors of traumatic experiences wish someone or something had been able to protect them when they were vulnerable. This sigil represents a fantasy of being able to go back in time and defend yourself from harm, with the dragon being an invulnerable guardian that can stand up to any threat. *FIRST STRETCH GOAL: **!UNLOCKED!** AT $972* Sigil for Safety Against Your Nightmares shows a unicorn illuminating the dark, driving away barely-seen horrors. Some of us who have experienced trauma struggle with lingering fears related to the traumatic event, including that it will reoccur. Besides trauma, many other things, including certain mental illness symptoms, can cause upsetting thoughts and fears we struggle to cope with. This sigil represents the desire to stand against and banish these type of nightmares. *SECOND STRETCH GOAL: **!UNLOCKED!** AT $1,350* Sigil for Mourning Your Lost Futures shows a coyote wearing a crown of crystals crying over a coyote skull wearing a crown of wilted flowers, while the moon passes overhead. This sigil represents an understanding place to grieve the lives you could have lived and things that could have been if you had not been adversely impacted by trauma and mental illness. *THIRD STRETCH GOAL: **!UNLOCKED!** AT $1,720* Sigil for Accepting Dormancy shows a hedgehog holding an acorn hibernating in the roots of an oak tree while life goes on on the surface above. Many if us that have "lost time" to mental and physical illnesses struggle with the feeling that we are behind and have missed out. This sigil represents accepting these fallow periods have happened and are not a complete loss, symbolized by the acorn's promise of new growth. *FOURTH STRETCH GOAL: REPRINT **!UNLOCKED!** AT $2,100* Sigil for Stealing Back What You Can shows a magpie plucking jewels from a dangerous tangle of thorns. It represents recovering after periods of personal instability and difficulty to return to the world. Many of us that have been greatly affected by traumatic experiences or have "lost time" to mental or physical illnesses feel like success is more difficult to achieve for us, especially as traditionally defined. This sigil and its clever magpie project hope and encouragement that you will find a way to achieve what you want, even if the path may be hard or not what you originally envisioned. This is a reprint of a design from the first Kickstarter. *FIFTH AND FINAL STRETCH GOAL: REPRINT UNLOCKS AT $2,400* Sigil for Swift Justice Against Those That Got Away With It shows two wolves flanking the �gishj�lmur or Helm of Awe, an Icelandic magical stave that invokes terror in one's enemies. Freed from the chains that held them, the wolves represent a curse on the people that have hurt you but were shielded from the true consequences of their actions by society, and a wish for them one day to finally face the cosmic justice they deserve. This is a reprint of a design from the first Kickstarter. All unlocked pin designs will be: hard enamel black nickel plated 1.75 inches tall backed with two posts and black rubber backers pinned to custom backing cards with a description of the sigil on the back side packaged in biodegradable clear bags mailed in recycled bubble mailers that can be reused or recycled at services that take plastic grocery bags (note: some orders may be mailed in my older, non-recyclable packaging stock--no solution is perfect, but I am trying to move towards using more eco-friendly packaging material) Below are images of the enamel pins and backing cards from the last Kickstarter, which were made to the same specifications as above, so you can have a clear idea what to expect from the finished product. note that these particular designs are not available as rewards for this Kickstarter unless we reach the stretch goals to reprint them See more information about the Custom Art tier by visiting this update. An add-on is an additional item that you can add to your pledge at any reward tier by pledging more. I wanted to make some of the other Magical Art Therapy products I sell online and at cons available to backers this way! These items will ship in the same package as your pins. How do you add an add-on to your rewards? Simply click the "manage my pledge" button and add the additional money for the add-on products you'd like to your current pledge, when backer surveys go out there will be a place to indicate if you added any add-ons to your pledge and what they were. You can watch a short video going over this process by another creator right here! Magical Art Therapy Zine vol. 1: This zine is 28 pages long collects the first twelve Magical Art Therapy sigils, covering the "Sigils for Trauma and Recovery" and "Sigils for Mental Health" sets. In addition to reproducing the sigils, it contains a detailed guide to the symbolism, meanings, and uses of each one. These zines are hand-made by me and each one has a unique, hand-drawn cover in silver ink on black paper. Add $6 to your pledge to get one! Magical Art Therapy Multi-Sigil Postcards: square 4.72 inch postcards printed on premium card stock with a soft, silky finish that gets a lot of compliments in person. Each postcard showcases six different sigils, choose between the "Sigils for Trauma and Recovery" and the "Sigils for Mental Health" sets. Add $3 to your pledge for one, or $5 for a discount on both! May 31-June 21 the Kickstarter project is live. June 21 project ends and backer surveys go out. End of June the Kickstarter funds and completed backer surveys come in, allowing me to order the pins and other materials July the pins are manufactured. August I receive the pins from the manufacturer and I package and ship them out to backers. Late August-to-September after all backers have received their pins, any extras go up for sale in an online store for people that missed the Kickstarter. If everything goes well, extra pins will also be available to purchase at Flame Con August 17-18. 55% pin manufacturing 25% shipping rewards to backers 10% packaging and shipping materials 10% fees Learn more about the Magical Art Therapy series by visiting my website. Browse other Magical Art Therapy products at my Gumroad and RedBubble stores. Follow me on social media at @fox-teeth on tumblr and @roseberrycomix on twitter. Spread the word about the project by sharing this post on tumblr and this post on twitter. Reblogs and retweets are greatly appreciated!

A Passion for the Planet I�m Geoff Hudson. I�m a composer and for the past two years I�ve been writing A Passion for the Planet, an hour-long work for chorus and orchestra that focuses on the pains and perils of climate change. Two years ago, I was reading an essay in which climate scientists were lamenting their difficulties in capturing the public�s attention. One of them was quoted as saying, �People won�t really respond to the climate crisis until they connect with it on an emotional level.� Geoffrey Hudson, composer of A Passion for the Planet And that made a lightbulb go on in my head. Music is a powerful way to form emotional connections. Perhaps we can harness that power to confront climate change. A Passion for the Planet starts in a place of beauty. The opening movement is a beautiful, spacious celebration of the wonders of creation. It moves from reverence, to gratitude, to revelry, before closing with some resonant �alleluias�. After that, things get darker, as the music looks at what is already happening all around us. That journey into darkness reaches a climax with a musical depiction of the infamous �hockey stick� graphs. Temperatures rise; oceans rise; extinction rates increase� The world flies out of control. What have you done with what was given you? And then a children�s choir stands up and sings words by the Irish poet Theo Dorgan, �What have you done with what was given you? What have you done with the blue, beautiful world?� It�s like an arrow into the listeners� hearts. And that�s a turning point in this piece. I don�t want to leave listeners in that dark place. Over the last two years, when I tell people what I�m working on, a bunch of people have said, �Oh, you�re writing a requiem for the planet.� And I say, �No. It�s not time for that yet. We don�t have much time left � the IPCC report gave us twelve years � but it�s not over yet. We all need to roll up our sleeves and get serious about turning this around.� And A Passion for the Planet is about breaking through the defenses and avoidance mechanisms that people have built up around this horrific threat. conductor Tony Thornton The last three movements of the Passion revolve around hope, beginning with a wonderful thought from David Orr: �Hope is a verb with its sleeves rolled up.� The piece ends with everyone singing; performers and audience members join together to sing a chorale tune. We�re all in this together. It�s bigger any of us as individuals. The only way to succeed is for all of us to roll up our sleeves. baritone Dashon Burton I�m very fortunate in having some wonderful collaborators for the premiere. In June, Tony Thornton will be leading the Illuminati Vocal Arts Ensemble in the first performance of A Passion for the Planet. I�ve been at the early rehearsals; the beauty of their sound just slays me. We have two fabulous soloists, baritone Dashon Burton and soprano Alisa Pearson, and we�ll be joined by a chamber orchestra of 12 players. I�m so excited to hear the first performance. And if you�re in driving distance of western Massachusetts on June 15th, I urge you to join us. soprano Alisa Pearson The reason I�m here on Kickstarter today is to ask for your help in making a recording of this piece. Our goal is to get this music out into the world � to have groups across the US and internationally perform it. Having a good recording will be tremendously helpful in that process � allowing conductors to easily gauge what it is they�re signing up for. Please be generous. Budget Everything we raise towards our goal of $7,650 will go to fund the recording of A Passion for the Planet. The money will go to Hybrid Vigor Music, the Massachusetts-based not-for-profit that has championed A Passion for the Planet, which will use the money to pay the musicians, recording engineers, and Kickstarter. Anything raised beyond our goal will support our campaign to encourage other groups across the United States and internationally to perform A Passion for the Planet. Here�s what that budget looks like. The Timeline We have a recording date scheduled in June 2019. Post-production work will take place over the summer. We should have a finished recording by August 2019.

The 45L Denali Leather Duffel : The Ultimate Leather Travel Bag "And into the forest I go, to lose my mind and find my soul." Since we first started making leather goods, we have been fine tuning every aspect of the production process. From the design of the bag, to the leather and hardware types, we have been working to keep them as authentic as possible, while maintaining the highest level of functionality and performance. As this is our second duffel bag we have launched on Kickstarter, we have had a lot of feedback on features people are looking for in a travel bag, not the least of which was having a size option that was big enough to be used as a carry on for a cross-continental flight, while staying within the carry on size restrictions. We built this bag around the idea of maximizing the usability of a carry on duffel, and making it easy to transport with your luggage, through security and around the airport. Removable Luggage Strap Keeps Duffel Secured to Luggage Handle The idea for this specific type of bag has come after getting frustrated with trying to get through security with my duffel bag and laptop, having to gate check my carry on luggage, and wishing my smaller travel bags were big enough to carry all of my important items that I didn't want going in with my checked bag. These problems, along with a ton of feedback from customers, family and friends, we have come up with a bag that not only makes airline travel easier, but it stays right in line with our Classic + Rugged Kodiak Leather look and feel. Introducing the 45L Denali Leather Duffel. A travel bag that can be used for business, as well as the outdoors. A bag that makes you want to plan that bucket list trip, just so you can take it with you. Core Features: - 45L size (which is within the carry on size requirements for airlines.) 45 Liter Carrying Capacity - Separated, padded laptop compartment on the lower portion of the bag near the base. This makes going through security so much easier!! Just unzip the base compartment and pull out your laptop for security, then place it back in the separated compartment. This pocket is big enough for a 15" laptop as well as a power bank. Padded Laptop Pocket - Fits a 15" laptop or smaller as well as a portable powerbank. - Zippered pocket allows easy access and security for your laptop or tablet. Easily fits a 15" laptop or smaller. - Removable Luggage Strap for easy carry on top of roller suitcase. This will keep your bag secure and keep it from falling off or sliding around on top of your suitcase / luggage. Removable Luggage Strap - Shoe pocket. This pocket is similar to our 60L duffel style, and can be used to separate your dirty clothes, shoes, or give easy access to any other items. Convenient and secure exterior shoe pocket - - 3 exterior zippered pockets. One on each side of the bag near the handles, and one large zippered pocket on the end of the bag. This pocket is perfect for your passport, keys, or wallet. - Large Zippered Compartment - Thick, Top Grain Leather. - YKK Zippers. - Heavy Duty Nylon Liner. - Brass feet. 5 Brass Feet - Removable & Adjustable shoulder strap. - Double layered carrying handle on the front of the bag. YKK Zippers + Double Wrapped Handle Interior || Zippered compartment, phone and pen holders, heavy duty nylon liner, 45L carrying capacity Exterior || Shoe Pocket, adjustable shoulder strap, 2 zippered side pockets, 1 large zippered pocket for phone, keys wallet. Double zipper can be locked. Separate padded laptop compartment on base, making it easy to get through security. Big enough for a powerbank and laptop. Sturdy carry handle. Background We are Kodiak Leather (www.kodiakleather.com), a startup in Lehi, Utah founded by Jared Morse, an outdoorsman who was frustrated by the lack of reasonably priced leather bags that would hold up through all the wear and tear of daily use. This inspired Jared to create Kodiak Leather Co. and our custom leather bags. After finding only the highest quality leather and hardware, we set out to build a bag that would last a lifetime. Fast Forward 4 Years... After having 4 successful Kickstarter campaigns, the Buffalo Leather Satchel, The Classic Weekender Duffel, the Sitka Leather Messenger, and our most recent Kobuk Leather Backpack, we have come full circle on offering a wide variety of travel bags , briefcases (similar to the satchel and the messenger), as well as some smaller, everyday carry items like journals and wallets. We have had countless insights on product design, future product offerings, and functionality suggestions from our 3200+ previous backers. Leather Color Options This bag will be available in Antique Brown and Dark Walnut. Antique Brown - 45L Denali Duffel - Shown in Antique Brown - Dark Walnut Full Product Specs: Dimensions: 21" L x 12" W x 11" H Weight: 4 lbs 14 oz. Padded Laptop Sleeve: Located on the lower portion of the bag, measures 16" W x 10" D x 2.5" H. This pocket will fit up to a 15" laptop, as well as a standard sized power bank. Shoulder Strap Length: Each strap is fully adjustable from 61" to 38" (Clip to Clip). Materials: Thick, Top-Grain Leather Brass Hardware Premium YKK Metal Zippers Heavy Duty Nylon Liner Rewards: 45L Denali Leather Duffel Shown in Antique Brown - Shown in Dark Walnut Denali Traveler's Set Denali Traveler's Set - Shown in Antique Brown - Front of Bag - Antique Brown - Denali Travel Set - Back of Bag - Large Toiletry Bag - Shown in Antique Brown - Passport Cover Interior Timeline: October 2018: Begin design and prototyping of 45L Denali Duffel. November 2018: Complete first prototype. Make end pocket size adjustment. Switch duffel from backpack style to standard shoulder strap style. Add brass feet. Start new sampling. February 2019: Second sample complete. March 2019: Product testing begins. Took duffel on trip to London. Loved everything about the bag, except it kept slipping off my suitcase at the airport. Decided to add the removable luggage strap to secure duffel to suitcase. Begin sampling of revised design. April 2019: Final prototype is finished. Along with other designs for campaign. Final colors selected. May 21: Launch Kickstarter Campaign. July 10: Kicksktarter Campaign Ends. July 24: Receive Funds From Kickstarter / Start Production & Manufacturing of Rewards. October 7: Complete Production of Kickstarter Rewards. October 14: Begin Shipping Rewards. October 31: Remaining Reward Fulfillment Completed. Lifetime Warranty: Every Kodiak Leather bag is made for a lifetime of use. In fact, we believe in our craftsmen, our materials and our designs so much that we warranty them against defects in materials and workmanship. If there is ever a problem with one of our products just send it back and we will either repair or replace it for free. This project is promoted by Jellop, the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarters with 750+ successful Kickstarter projects with over $330MM raised between them.

Kindra is where we celebrate amazing people in your life by creating custom, collaborative books. In just a few clicks, a group of people can share memories, well wishes and pictures. Then Kindra weaves it all together into a legacy book. It's the most meaningful, personalized gift perfect for any special occasion. Birthdays | Weddings | Anniversaries | Graduations | Retirements | Bar & Bat Mitzvahs | Baby Showers | Bridal Showers | Farewells | Mother's Day | Father's Day | Teacher Appreciation | Employee Appreciation | "The quality of your relationships determines the quality of your life." Make sure the special people in your life know their ripple effect in the world with a Kindra book (and get up to $70 off!) Be remembered as a gifting legend! We do the hard part, you get the glory. Help Kindra complete the automation of our design platform. After making so many test books manually, we want our weekends back. ;) Infuse planet earth with love, LoVe, LOVE! We took a collective scrapbooking project that used to take tedious months of content collection, design and printing and condensed it into a few clicks. Select questions for people to answer (or create your own questions). Kindra collects stories, memories and photos from collaborators through Instagram, Facebook or their phone or computer. The questions become the chapters of the book. We design and print the book for you (after your review and approval, of course). Your lucky recipient tells you they have "never felt as loved or as special before." Pure magic. Here's what makes Kindra different than a standard photo book: 1) Kindra is especially designed to honor someone using our unique and signature layouts. The first page of every book is this word cloud composed of the words collected to describe the recipient(s). 2) We don't just collect photos; we also gather stories, sentiments and well wishes. That's why someone said �Kindra is like the storybook of my life written by everyone who loves me." 3) It's not just one person making a book, it's a group of people creating a book. In fact, it�s never been easier to co-author a book before. People from around the world can celebrate milestones from afar. Fair warning: Side effects include immeasurable joy. We're not sure who love us more - gift organizers or the recipients! We have a 97% satisfaction rate from on the first round of test books. Hear more about why people love their Kindra experience: Personalized book co-authored by up to 15 collaborators (fee to add more people) Standard landscape book 8 x 10 in Up to 65 pages Image-wrap cover (you choose hard or soft cover) Boundless love Hiya! I�m Danielle DiMare, the creator of Kindra. For more than 10 years, I've been making these keepsake books for my family because I believe everyone deserves to know how special they are to the world. About 2 years ago, I was inspired to figure out how to digitize this gift-making engine and make it available to world. Prior to pursuing this dream, I spent 15 years helping NYC create citywide arts, technology and enrichment programs for young people. I know a thing or two about bringing big ideas to life. Driven by my lifelong passion for community and creativity, I decided to focus all my energy into creating Kindra - a powerful vehicle for collective kindness. Come join the journey to amplify Love in this unique and memorable way! Big thanks to these incredible humans who help power the journey: Kindra's team, Adi, Maddie, and Lazar, and our outstanding tech partner, Z1! Nicole Poor for her creative direction, encouragement and the epic beta book she made for her father's 70th birthday. Benny Nicks for creating this awesome Kickstarter video and his patience with all my edits. Whitney Theis for our amazing animated explainer vid. Allie Mason for her communications prowess, social strategy and all-around support. My soul fam, Tacklebox Accelerator and WeWork Labs Dumbo for your encouragement and belief in Kindra. Kindra's founding community, the first round of folks to create these meaningful gifts for their favorite people. And an extra special thanks to my three incredible brothers for inspiring the very first Kindra books so many years ago. Mom & Dad, thanks for cultivating so much family loving.

Doughside Donuts' values center on active participation in our community. We utilize primarily small businesses local to Oceanside, California. It is our mission to provide consistently beautiful and delicious gourmet, handmade, artisan doughnuts. We recently won the 2018 San Diego magazine awards for Best High End Doughnut and 3rd place for Best Vegan Doughnut. We have been operating out of a locally owned commercial kitchen since 2017 and have been providing special orders, wholesaling to other local small businesses, and holding pop-up events alongside our esteemed peers in Oceanside�s fabulous restaurant scene. The bottom line is that we have outgrown our space. We have secured a prime location in downtown Oceanside and intend to open in July 2019.Doughside outright owns nearly all of the equipment needed for this location. We are looking to our community for financial help securing build out costs. We will leverage our strong community ties with other local small businesses to continue to grow this already well-functioning business into a multi-faceted, expanding endeavor which will immediately better serve the existing demand of North San Diego county and beyond.

Designed by Andrew Nerger and Jeffrey Chin (creators of Crypt) and illustrated by Ben Ortiz, Afternova is a negotiation game for 3 to 6 players with easy-to-learn rules and highly interactive gameplay. Check out the rulebook to learn more. Plus, its compact size makes it easy to put in your bag and take it anywhere! Watch our Full-Playthrough Video on Facebook Live On your turn you may extract Fragments from a planet by employing Hired Paws whose total skill values meet or exceed the planet�s skill requirement. You may work alone and extract all the Fragments (if you can afford to do so) or, more likely, you may need to negotiate with one or more players to meet the requirement. When working with other players, all teammates must agree on how to split the Fragments. Once all teammates agree, play the Hired Paws and collect the agreed upon Fragments. Or spend your turn acquiring 3 new cards by taking any combination of Hired Paws or Blueprints from the market. Complete Blueprints by discarding the indicated Fragments. Each Blueprint completed gives you a new ability and scores you victory points. The game ends when a player completes their 6th Blueprint.
