Kung Fu Fighting is a fast, hilarious, action-packed card game for 2-6 players in which you are a combatant in a free-for-all martial arts movie fight scene. Unleash a Flying, Flipping, Spinning Kick on your opponents, but be careful to hang onto a Block or two for when they try to do the same to you! As SlugFest's first published game, Kung Fu Fighting has always held a special place in our hearts and the hearts of our longtime fans. This exciting card game hit a really good sweet spot as a quick and light game that still had some interesting choices and lots of silly, over-the-top cinematic Kung Fu moments. A typically over-the-top attack. So after it was out of print we tried to Kickstart a totally new edition: fancy art, overhauled mechanics, higher production value, etc. Response was overwhelmingly meh. Since that failed project, we've thought a lot about this game, and we still get occasional requests for reprints. After the success of our low-key print-on-demand version of En Garde Reforged, we decided we should do the same thing for Kung Fu Fighting. We are very much using the KISS principle for this project: Keep It Simple, SlugFest! Rather than redoing everything (art, mechanics, etc.), we are simply creating a lightly-updated set of cards with the original art and mechanics and sending that off to our friends at DriveThruCards for printing. However, as with the En Garde Reforged campaign, we have one stretch goal. If we pass $30k, we will do a manufacturing print run of the game instead. It will still be the lightly-updated original game, however. (For our previous Kung Fu Fighting campaign we underestimated the amount of love that was out there for the original version!) As with our En Garde Reforged campaign, we can offer you the game right now, in a very functional, if minimalist way. Our colleagues at DriveThruCards do great, reliable work and are ready to publish this game through their print-on-demand services. In essence, your pledge of support is a pre-order for the new print-on-demand version of the game, consisting of: Kung Fu Fighting deck More Kung Fu Fighting expansion, including extra cards for the base game, Archetype cards and cards for Team play 6 mini-player mats 2 large plastic deck boxes (the game is too big for just one!) The rules will be available online and you will need to supply 6 objects to use as Chi Tokens (which conveniently fit in the deck boxes!). If demand for the game is high enough, then instead of offering a minimalist print-on-demand version of the game, we will manufacture a full production run of the game! Allow us to introduce you to our one and only over-funding milestone: the Kung Fu Master Stretch Goal! As you can see, we do not have an all-or-nothing initial funding level. We can create and deliver the print-on-demand version of the game with even just a single backer. What this Kickstarter campaign is all about, however, is whether or not we can get enough folks interested in the game to elevate it to the next level, taking it from print-on-demand to full manufacturing. Therefore, there are no nickel and dime micro-upgrades with dozens of micro-goals like you might expect from traditional board game campaigns. We only need one, all-or-nothing stretch goal: If we can raise $30,000 everyone's rewards upgrade for free, becoming a manufactured version of Kung Fu Fighting with all the bells and whistles, including: Kung Fu Fighting deck More Kung Fu Fighting expansion, including extra cards for the base game, Archetype cards and cards for Team play 6 full-size player mats 6 Chi Markers 1 Game Box with Cover Art Rules This upgrade includes all the usual micro-goals you usually see from other campaigns: improved box, glossy rules, token upgrades, etc. Best of all, even if we don�t hit the Kung Fu Master Stretch Goal, everyone will still be getting a great game (and, as a consolation prize, they'll be getting it way ahead of schedule)! The unique nature of this campaign has some big ramifications on the estimated delivery date for the rewards. If we do not reach the Kung Fu Master Stretch Goal, we will ship rewards as soon as the campaign funds become available. Therefore, we actually have two estimated delivery dates: If we receive <$30,000 of funding, rewards will be shipped out by August 2019. If we receive >$30,000 of funding, rewards will be shipped out by February 2020. Because we can only list one estimated delivery date on the pledge levels we can offer, we opted to use the farthest out date. Backers are required to fulfill all of their regional obligations for import. Unfortunately, there is no region-friendly shipping for this project. In addition, we should note here that we will not be using a pledge manager for this project. Interested in picking up some of our other games? Then head on over to SlugFestGames.com where you can get all of our games right now! Best of all, we are offering free domestic shipping on all orders placed during the campaign!

Hex & Company is a board game cafe, an experiential retail haven for those who enjoy board, card, and tabletop games. For a $10 seating fee, you have access to our library of hundreds of games, from Settlers of Catan to Cards Against Humanity. It's also a place where you can eat, drink, and buy your favorite board games. Hex & Company is currently located on the Upper West Side, but we've set our sights on new territory. We're launching this Kickstarter so you can help us build a brand new store and community on the Upper East Side, at 1462 First Avenue. Family-Friendly. Our space is a place for everyone! In addition to keeping a large number of family-oriented games in our library, we'll also offer family and kid-only programs. We're bringing The Brooklyn Strategist�s wildly successful after school enrichment and summer camp programs to our store, too. The program teaches children to think critically and be confident in their decision-making using a wide range of board games! Events and Programs. We'll build on the existing New York Magic: The Gathering and Tabletop RPG communities by giving the Upper East Side a chance to join in on the fun. We�ll run Magic events weekly and offer new tabletop players the chance to learn how to play games like Dungeons & Dragons and Pathfinder from our experienced game masters. A Great Place to Play. Everything about the new store, from the lighting and the furniture arrangement, will be designed to maximize your play experience. We're working with a sculptor and set designer to make this space the most engaging and fun it can be. Great Food. Alright, this one isn�t about building a community so much, but we�re REALLY excited about our food menu. We�re adding fresh ingredients, house-smoked meats, and grilled pizzas. Great Drink. Our coffee is from Brooklyn Roasting Company, and our tea is from Harney & Sons. Beer and cider enthusiasts have always found a home at our current location, with over 30 options to choose from. We'll be taking all of that with us to the East Side, except we're adding a cocktail menu and milkshakes. Three words: Mini Donut Machine. Starting a business is a lot of work. It's a lot of paperwork: licenses and fees and consultations and permits. Our Upper East Side location is happening no matter what, but after focusing our funds and efforts on all of the above, we need some help to make the space the best it can be. That means filling out our game library, improving upon our space, and adding all the really cool things we've always wanted to add. Yes, that (hopefully) means a Mini Donut Machine. Hex & Co Sticker - We'll send you a sticker with the official Hex & Company logo, compatible with all your favorite surfaces. We'll ship it to anywhere in the U.S., or you can come pick it up in-store. Hex & Co Mug - Get a specialized Hex & Company mug that's perfect for enjoying liquids of all kinds: hot, cold, and even lukewarm. We'll ship anywhere in the U.S., or you can pick it up in-store. Buy Us A Board Game - Is there a game you'd like to see in our store? Tell us about it, and we'll do our best to add it to the collection. Write us a recommendation, and we'll immortalize that and your name inside the box forever. Backer Party Invite - We'll send you an invitation to our exclusive Backer Party, which will take place in our brand new space. Buffet provided with entry. Since there's limited space at our venue, this reward is limited! Backer Bundle - Get all of our merch AND a ticket to the Backer Party! Since there's limited space at our venue, this reward is limited! Hex & Co House Call - Can't make it to New York City, but interested in improving your D&D game? Have a group, but no game master? Get some one-on-one time with a Hex staff member over the Internet! One of our professional game masters will teleconference into your living room for a four-hour session. They can either run a game for you and your friends, or you can use the time to get coaching on how to better run the game yourself (or both)! Our game masters run more than just D&D�Kids On Bikes, Vampire, Blades in the Dark�and can pass any of that knowledge on to you. Kickstarter Membership - Your seating fee will be free for the first 3 months after we open! You'll also get an invite to our party and all of our merchandise. Enrichment Sampler - Perfect for anyone interested in our Enrichment Programs for children grades K-6. You'll get to send your child to two days of one of our summer camps, or a full week (5 days) of our after school enrichment program. Class Trip - Send your child and their entire class to Hex & Co for a few hours of board games, snacks, and fun! This reward is redeemable anytime in the first year that we're open. You can schedule your trip during school hours, for up to 40 kids, up to four hours! Name a Table - Name one of the tables at our new location, and it will be immortalized forever with a plaque. You can name it after yourself, your favorite board game, or that meme that will only be relevant for two more months. (We reserve the right to ask you to try again if your name is inappropriate for the store.) You'll also get the Kickstarter Membership. Private Party for 5 - Experience what Hex & Company is all about! While you're here, a game guru or game master will spend time introducing you to new board games or tabletop RPGs respectively. It comes with a sampler of our food & (non-alcoholic) drink menu. Our member of staff will be available for a maximum of 4 hours with you. Store for a Night - We'll shut down the whole store on a night of your choosing*. We'll work with you to create a menu, find the drinks you like, and deliver a personalized Hex experience just for you! A great option for birthday parties, work outings, or just a gathering of you and your 60 closest friends. *The store will accommodate this reward any Sunday through Thursday, from 8PM to closing, anytime within the first 6 months of the store opening. 10,000 - We're fully funded! This money covers rounding out our board game library, new aesthetic and artistic additions to the space, and all the other finishing touches. For every $1,000 above our initial goal of $10,000, we will use $100 to back board game Kickstarter projects and bring more independently-developed games into our store. 12,000 - We'll buy that mini donut machine we've been talking about. 15,000 - We'll invest in new microphones and cameras to increase the production value of the Hex & Co. House Call service. 20,000 - Free stuff! Everyone who donated $10+ gets a free Hex & Co. pin. Everyone who donated $100+ gets a free Hex & Co. hat. 25,000 - We'll hire a Game Guru for the first year of the new store. The Game Guru is an expert in board gaming who can make sure you get the most out of your Hex experience by recommending and teaching you new games. The Hex & Company team is comprised of: Greg May founded The Uncommons- the first board game cafe in Manhattan- after noticing that tabletop gaming lacked a community home. Originally from small town Iowa, Greg has worked in everything from food journalism to photography to the Silicon Valley startup scene, while living around the world, from Beijing to Honolulu. Board games, coffee, and beer were always passions, and when the former Village Chess Shop space became available, he decided to combine them. The Uncommons has become a neighborhood fixture, and has been featured everywhere from the New York Times to The New Yorker. Mark Miller is nothing if not persistent. Riding the occasional good idea, he has produced new methods for curing and hot smoking salmon, 4 internationally acclaimed CDs of American Roots Music, and over 100 16 and 32 bit video game soundtracks. He has a degree in Comparative Religions and Ethnomusicology from Wesleyan University and an eMBA from Northeastern University. He is greatly looking forward to smoking delicious things for patrons at Hex & Company. Dr. Jon Freeman is the founder of The Brooklyn Strategist. Dr. Jon brings to Hex & Company his proud blend of clinical neuroscience nerdiness and his love and passion of board games (more nerdiness). His acclaimed after school and camp enrichment programs that promote neurodevelopment and social responsibility through game play is a cornerstone feature of Hex & Company�s milieu. For Jon, Hex & Company represents the ultimate community space � a safe environment where people can be themselves, meet new friends and engage wits in a healthy and spirited fashion. Will Horowitz is a consultant on the new Hex & Company menu. He is the chef & co-owner of restaurants Ducks Eatery and Harry & Ida�s meat and supply co. both located in the East Village of NYC. He is the author of �Salt Smoke Time� with Harper-Collins and co-founder of seaweed company Akua. By supporting this Kickstarter, you'll be sending a very clear message about what kinds of spaces you want to see in your neighborhood. We're honored you want to help us build this space, and we can't wait to get it up on its feet. Every donation counts! If you can't donate, talking up this Kickstarter with your friends and on social media will help get the word out. Have you ever thought about what you'd like to be when you grow up? You might find that some jobs aren't always what you'd expect them to be...especially when that job involves delivering mail to monsters! MONSTER MAIL is an illustrated children's book about a lively mail carrier named Juniper and her creature-filled career. Even though it�s not your average everyday job, she�s taken quite a liking to it. With exciting new discoveries (as well as a few occupational hazards), it�s important to take advice from the best! Join Juniper as she guides you through her daily deliveries in a world where monsters apparently �need mail just as much as we do. Juniper and her travel companion, Pocket! This Kickstarter is to fund the making of this book from it's current rough state to a finished product. If you're super eager to get this book in your hands ASAP, no worries! It's been written and all of the illustrations have been drawn out, so a good chunk of the work is already done. With your support, I'll be able to paint, proof, print, and ship 'em out! Below is a rendering of the finished product, as well as examples from the dummy book: Rendering (tentacle not included) Additionally, here are examples of the extra rewards that are included depending on which tier you choose: Prints available in tiers $45 and up! (Included in Monster Bundle) Stickers available in tiers $25 and up! (Included in Monster Bundle) Enamel pins available in tiers $45 and up! (Included in Monster Bundle) The cost breakdown covers all expenses involved in this project. This would include proofing and printing the books, shipping, Kickstarter fees, processing fees, printing rewards, packaging, and the ISBN barcode. This stuff sure adds up fast, but your contribution will play a huge part in what makes producing this book possible! If you are unable to support this project financially, then feel free to share my project with others and follow along with the journey via any of my social media pages HERE! Additionally, after receiving one of their really rad sample packs and searching through a few companies, I've decided I'll be going through Print Ninja to print the books! Feel free to check them out in the link below for more info on their process and products: Since the book is still in-progress, it is of utmost importance that you lovely backers are as informed as possible! Don't worry, I won't spam you all into oblivion with emails, but I do intend on keeping you as involved in my process as possible. Again, I'll be updating my social media pages with insider looks, progress photos, etc. With a little patience from ya'll (and a lot of painting on my end), everything should go according to plan! This timeline is set up in a way that prepares me for any unseen obstacles as this is, in fact, my first rodeo. There is the potential that things could get done quicker than estimated, but for safety's sake, I added an extra bit of breathing room in the schedule. If my project manages to exceed the goal I've set, I will unlock some rad bonus rewards! I'll give more insight into these goals the closer we get to 'em! My name is Angela Cronk, the illustrator and writer of Monster Mail! Most of my work includes fantastic creatures, cute characters, and silly sketches. When I'm not drawing, I'm talking with my buds, going to restaurants too much, dog-watching at parks, and yelling at the TV during any remotely tense scenes. Hangin' with the BUDS. (Haa.) If you'd like to see more of my work and receive updates on my Kickstarter progress, follow the links below: acronkart @ instagram - facebook - tumblr - twitter - - - Credits: Music from https://filmmusic.io: "Pookatori and Friends" by Kevin MacLeod (https://incompetech.com) License: CC BY (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/)

Hello! My name is Will Mason and I am the author/creator of the LGBTQ children's book series, called "The Boy with the Rainbow Heart." This Kickstarter is being used to launch the second book in the series, called "The Invasion of Big Angry Red." Want to learn more? Scroll down and learn about our journey! Front Cover! This is me signing books before speaking at the 10th anniversary of Embrace WNY's Buffalo Brunch! A couple years ago, I created a children's book, called "The Boy with the Rainbow Heart" in an attempt to spread more love to kids who might feel different. I was inspired to write the book because my sister had a really tough time when she came out as a kid - both at home and at school. Jessica and me last summer in LA together to speak about the book. There is a rainbow in this! I hated seeing what she went through so I decided to create the book to help spread more kindness to other children and LGBTQ families. If you want to learn more about our first book, click here: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/2114819346/the-boy-with-the-rainbow-heart-an-lgbtq-childrens?ref=discovery&term=the%20boy%20with%20the%20rainbow%20heart. Now, a couple years later, we are launching the second book in the series, called "The Invasion of Big Angry Red," which is centered on bullying. We are dedicating this book to Jamel Myles, the 9 year old student who sadly killed himself after being bullied when he came out to his classmates this past August. It broke my heart to see that, so we got in touch with his family, and we are dedicating this book to him - as well as donating 5% of all book-sales to GLSEN - which helps spread LGBTQ acceptance in schools across the US. GLSEN is wonderful and you can actually find our first book and K-3 lesson plans on their website, listed here: https://www.glsen.org/article/boy-rainbow-heart-lesson-plans-grades-k-3. Picture of Jamel Myles (from his mother) SO - this June 1st (first day of gay pride month) - we are launching the sequel, in honor of Jamel, and all LGBTQ youth. If you're interested in making a social media post, sharing our book-launch during the month of June, please know how grateful I am. The above picture is from "The Invasion of Big Angry Red" which showcases The Boy defending the Town of Shine against the darkness of the bully, Big Angry Red. In this story, Big Angry Red abrupty enters the Town of Shine, and after teasing the townspeople, and causing fear everywhere - the Boy is left watching and wondering how he can help Red become less angry. Want to find out how the story ends and what happens to Big Angry Red and the Boy? some of the fun rewards - the original book and a plush of the boy! HELP ME BRING THIS TO LIFE BY SHARING ON SOCIAL MEDIA, AND TELLING YOUR FRIENDS AND FAMILY. Let's keep spreading the message of LOVE! Want to learn a bit more? Who is involved? I (Will Mason) am the creator and author of the project, Cody Weiler is responsible for the book formatting/editing/typography and Anna Au is our main illustrator. Cody and Anna are incredibly talented artists/graphic designers and we are fortunate to have them involved with the project! A special thanks to Brianna Blank for creating the Kickstarter video & a special thanks to Ray Ganoe - our lead sponsor from Evergreen Health! Costs/Funding Goal? We need to raise $10,000 to cover the following: illustration costs packaging costs reward fulfillment costs ordering the hardcover print copies of the books! What�s our schedule/timeline? June - Kickstarter Launch July - Kickstarter End July - Order books! August/September - Receive books and begin packaging rewards September/October - Send reward packages & books! What do the books look/feel like? 8.5 by 11 hardcover, full & vibrant colored, 32 page children's book! Rewards: Rainbow Heart T-Shirts Original Hardcover Book Sequel Hardcover Book (photo to come soon!) Rainbow Heart Bracelets Plush Dolls of The Boy and Big Angry Red these were the books I signed for Jamel's school - we donate 19 hardcover books with kind messages for the students. Here are some pictures of the journey thus far! make sure to check out the awesome lesson plans teachers have done with this book! This is me donating 80 copies to every school psychologist at Cleveland Public Schools! :) Listed below are several links to articles, interviews, and videos that have been recorded about the book/project over the last several months. The top couple are #1 from NPR Buffalo/Toronto and #2 - Buffalo News. http://wbfo.drupal.publicbroadcasting.net/post/lgbtq-children-s-book-offers-sensitive-lesson https://buffalonews.com/2018/06/16/rainbow-heart-storybook-inspired-by-familys-rainbow-sheep/ http://www.amherstbee.com/news/2018-01-24/Lifestyles/LGBTQ_childrens_book_offers_ray_of_light.html http://www.syracuse.com/entertainment/index.ssf/2018/01/mason_ganza_ikins_cassanolochman_cny_books_and_authors.html https://canisiusgriffin.wordpress.com/2018/02/09/spreading-rainbow-hearts/ https://www.wkbw.com/news/-the-boy-with-the-rainbow-heart-moves-young-readers-towards-embracing-diversity https://sweetbuffalo716.com/the-boy-with-the-rainbow-heart-childrens-book-supports-lbgt-community/ https://blogs.canisius.edu/the-dome/2017/12/06/mason-authors-first-childrens-book/ https://issuu.com/dailypublic.com/docs/loopdec17web (page 4) https://www.gayswithkids.com/help-make-a-new-lgbtq-childrens-book-happen-2475894050.html http://www.kickstartchildrensbooks.com/how-to-publish-a-childrens-book-blog/learn-from-the-best-how-kickstarter-childrens-book-creator-will-mason-got-his-project-funded-in-24-hours http://spectrumlocalnews.com/nys/rochester/news/2017/08/27/the-boy-with-the-rainbow-heart-lgbtq-youth-self-acceptance-love-differences-kindness-will-mason-author-kids-schools-buffalo a picture of my mom at a gay pride parade - this would have never happened years ago! She is awesome, isn't she?

OUR STORY As boardgames have made a resurgence in the past 15 years, it has become an exciting time to participate in the most wonderful hobby. All around the world board game cafes have sprung up, from Germany to Canada to Massachusetts. When I moved to Boise a couple of years ago, I found a rich community of gamers and truly amazing Friendly Local Game Stores. Surprisingly, there wasn't a board game cafe to be found. After a trip to Portland, visiting Game Knight (if you're in Portland or will be going soon, highly recommended) sparked a desire in me that grew into what has now become Boise's first full-fledged gaming cafe, Room and Boards. After my wife and I formed an LLC last October, the specifics of the cafe began take to take shape. Once we decided on a name, finding a space became our next priority. We were fortunate to work with some outstanding local realtors (Malissa Jackson at Colliers, she's incredible I tell you) we found what would be our future home on the first place we visited. Logic told us to keep looking just to be sure, but when you know a place is right, there's really no other choice. So we started moving in around early April and preparing the space as we envisioned it. The journey of preparing to open a business has been quite an adventure, so many things that were both expected and unexpected! While there has been a slight delay of our intended opening due to permitting/plumbing issues, the calendar still looks good for us to open not longer after we expected (mid to late June now) Our plan has always been to launch a Kickstarter, and the intention of doing so is to make the community part of the cafe. We have the space, we have the games, we have all of our equipment, but what why we're doing a Kickstarter is to push us over the edge (go to 11!); we want to have a wider range of games, food, and experiences available, and this will help us get there at the start. In the meantime, you'll get access to the cafe, some great swag, and help us get to know you (and you us!) We're excited to have you game with us, because at Room and Boards, it's always game night. And it's always your place to come and play. Some of our library below! Library THE CAFE Now you know who we are, here's a bit about WHAT we are: we have a library of over 500 games, ranging from light and fun party games like Codenames, Fluxx, and Geek Out, to complex and intricate games like Twilight Imperium, Terra Mystica, and Food Chain Magnate (yes, a game about owning fast food restaurants is dauntingly complex yet utterly awesome) And we also have the staff and the knowledge to help you pick a game that will perfectly suit you and your group. For those who've not been to a board game cafe, the idea will be pretty similar to others we've had the pleasure of patronizing (Game Haus in Glendale, CA, Meepleville in Las Vegas, and Game Knight in Portland, OR are some of our favorites!) There's a $5 table fee per person, and this allows you full access to the game library to play 1 or 10 games, you're able to sit as long as you'd like to play. There's no minimum of food or drink to buy, but our menu will be available to all who sit. If there's a group who wishes to reserve the space for a special event, or host a specific game, we're always open to discuss this. We are located on Fairview Avenue in Boise (right at the edge of Meridian) in the same complex as Sockeye's Brewery. We will be open Tuesday through Thursday, 4pm - 10pm, and Friday until midnight. Saturday and Sunday we will be open 10:30am - midnight, and we are closed on Mondays. These hours may change as we get closer to our opening, and we will keep everyone informed both here and on our FB page. Our entire library will be available to browse online by the end of May with a online finder we developed for ease of use, and you are absolutely welcome to message us with any questions about any game prior to your visit. In addition to having all the modern, new games, we will also have all the classic games you loved growing up like Clue, Hungry Hungry Hippos, Jenga, and Connect Four. Every game has a place and a time, and we like to think that's where we come in! We also have a robust library of RPG sourcebooks and player guides, from classics like Dungeons and Dragons, Shadowrun, and Call of Cthulhu to new and exciting games like Kids on Bikes, Tales from the Loop, Numenara, and more. We will start having weekly nights to teach both RPG and board games based on interest, and want to provide a place for everyone to have their game night (or day!) so all you have to do is show up. RPGs Along with the games, we have an espresso machine and a full menu of coffee-drinks, such as lattes, cappuccinos, drip coffee, and iced mochas. We will also have a beer (Sockeyes, Boise Brewery), wine (St Chapelle), and cider (Merriwether) available from local sources. We feature a full menu of panini sandwiches, small plates (cheese/meat/fruit plates), a daily soup and other snacks. REWARDS You'll find a list of all of our rewards we've got available on the campaign. From a first free visit, to a 6 month-membership, to a boardgame backpack full of awesome games, there's something for everyone, whether you're local or from out of town. If you wish to gift a pledge to someone, pledges can be given to anyone. Just let us know who and where it should go to once the pledge manager is done. The final art for the t-shirts, dice bags, mugs and glasses will be available shortly after launch, and will be included in some of our first updates. We're also very excited to be partnered with GeekOn, the manufacturer of the boardgaming backpack, and after the campaign is over, we will also be proudly featuring these in our cafe for sale! There's a little something for everyone, and if there are any questions, please don't hesitate to post in the comments or message us. STRETCH GOALS We're aiming for a modest amount, and wish to use this as a means to expand our offerings even further based on feedback we've received from our future customers. For now, we are putting 2 stretch goals, and will add more as the campaign goes along. CONCLUSION We're excited to bring the cafe to life, and even more excited to have everyone be a part of it. Throughout the campaign, we will be sharing updates and pictures of our progress, and hosting events until our opening. The first will be at Phoenix Fire Games on June 1st for International Tabletop Day, and we hope to see you all there! Game on!

Provoked & WillDaBeast: We've both been rapping for 20 years, we met in 2000, and have been doing shows together since 2005. We've tried to collaborate many times since then, but this is our first official release and it's long overdue. In a day and age when marketing and promotion is more than half the battle, we have to figure out new ways to get our music heard. There has been an awesome local response, but we know we have to start taking steps towards international success. However, there's a lot of outside attention on music and art in our desert communities and plenty of local milestones still to be met. In recent years, Golden Voice has chosen a local act to be on each Coachella line up. That should be motivation for all Coachella Valley artists to push the envelope in creating fresh and unique content to catch their attention. I truly believe this amazing desert inspired - hand drawn and digitized cover art by Ivan Canevaro has the ability to do so. For this EP we are pressing a limited run of special edition 12" vinyls with full color jackets, and hi res full color prints & stickers (cover art). All supporters will be notified after we receive test prints and details (will be available for $25 preorder). Between this merch package and the billboard, I know WillDaBeast and I will be much closer to our goals of success in good quality music with awesome art and an uplifting message. I'm eternally grateful for all your support and it will not go unnoticed. Thank you for your time. We hope to reach our goal of $1,000 in 60 days https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/provoked-willdabeast/1461656510

Who is Dollars & Donuts Productions? Dollars & Donuts Productions is a small group of filmmaking friends including Daryl Della, Michael Martin, Ray Revello, and Becker Von Felsburg. the Crew We�ve been making movies together since high school and are always looking to level up in the realm of filmmaking (and red carpet posing). Michael, Ray, Daryl, & Becker at the Intendence Film Festival What's the film about? �Am I See You?� follows Whitney Nelson (Tara Erickson) on her quest to find answers about a mysterious pin left behind by her departed mother. Along with her friend Alana (Sasha Boggs), she gets mixed up with a crazy cult of collectors who will stop at nothing to acquire her special pin. The story was inspired by Daryl's lifelong obsession with Disneyland, his mother's hobby of Disney pin collecting, and an accidental 1-second clip of footage: You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00 Daryl & Tara met up at Disneyland one day, and instead of taking a photo their friend inadvertently hit the record button. Impressed with how the accidental footage turned out, the dream to film a short inside Disneyland was born. "Am I See You?" is our first female-led drama. We tackle the subjects of mother-daughter relationships, friendships, and the longing for connection with loved ones who have passed on, in a mature and realistic way� that is until things go awry in the second act. It wouldn�t be a Dollars & Donuts Production without some elements of genre filmmaking. When our characters enter this bizarre new world we want the audience to be taken on a ride with them. Taking inspiration from classic Disneyland attractions and melding it with our horror/thriller roots, we think we�ve come up with the perfect cocktail of laughs, tears, and thrills. Tara, Michael, Daryl, & Sasha rehearsing at the Disneyland Hotel Directed by Daryl Della Starring Tara Erickson & Sasha Boggs Featuring Ray Revello, Becker Von Felsburg, & Michael Martin Screenplay by Daniel Viau & Daryl Della and Tara Erickson Produced by Michael Martin How do you plan to shoot the film? We�re planning on shooting the film in 4K using our trusty Panasonic GH5 cameras in V-LOG mode. Last year, we shot our first anthology feature that way and were very happy with the results. Sasha, Daryl, Michael, & Tara on location in Disneyland USA The small DSLR body also allowed us to shoot the first half of our film on location in Disneyland USA without any issues. With that completed, the rest of the film primarily takes place in the back storage room of a collectibles shop (which doubles as a meeting place for our Collector Cult). What will your contribution be supporting? With every film we make we like to take on new challenges and grow as filmmakers. This time out, one area we�d like to improve is sound recording. Always a challenge for our small crew, we hope to hire a dedicated audio recordist to capture crystal-clear sound for us. Another area we're focused on improving is set design. We want our cult to have the ultimate creep-factor and thus need an appropriate setting. The plan is to rent a studio warehouse to shoot in, and hire a set designer to create our Collectors� cave of terrors. Inspired by classic Disney, there are also a few musical moments in the film. These songs are written and composed by Robert Ruby and will be performed by our cast members. Here is a basic breakdown of the estimated budget: - Audio Recording - 10% - Set Design - 20% - Location Rental - 10% - Costumes, Props, & Misc Items - 20% - Song Creation & Recording - 20% - Daily Production Costs (transportation, food, etc.) - 10% - Kickstarter Fees and Backer Rewards - 10% On the right you'll see a list of all the great rewards you'll receive by helping us create this movie! You can also check out our website at dollarsanddonuts.com to see some of our previous work and confirm your contribution is going to a quality project. Dollars & Donuts Logo Pin Reward Thank you for your support and remember to check back often for production updates! We�ll be adding new videos and photos to this page every day to track our production progress. Let�s make a movie together! Yeah yeah yeah! Cast & Crew of "Am I See You?" Stretch Goals Since we have surpassed our original goal (thank you everyone who made that happen!), we have decided on some stretch goals for if we can make it to certain amounts. $15,000 If we hit $15,000, our plan is to upgrade the camera that we shoot the rest of the film on. While our Panasonic GH5s have served us very well and will remain as our B-Cams, at $15,000 we will be able to rent a higher end full-frame camera. Whether that will be a RED, a Black Magic, or a Canon C300, we're not sure yet. We've shot on variations of all those cameras before and need to do some more comparison research as to which one will be best suited to our film. $20,000 If we make it to $20,000 our plan is to screen the film in more cities nationwide. We already plan on setting up a number of these screenings, and this extra funding would make for more stops on our tour, posting video updates along the way so you can all be there with us. One place we'd love to screen the film is Walt Disney's hometown of Marceline, Missouri. $25,000 If we can make it all the way to $25,000 we'd like to host a very special screening in San Francisco as a way to say thank you to everyone for their support. The plan is to rent out the Alamo Drafthouse, and not only screen the film but also hire live musicians and comedians, turning it into grand night of entertainment and celebration. Tickets would be free for Kickstarter backers.

THE "WHAT" My name is Jordan Copas & I've been doing music like this since April of 2011... That's 8 years. And I have now what you can call a collection of songs which makes my 8th full length studio recorded album! I've been creating a lot this last year and this year I've been blessed to be working with a post production team who is taking my music and talents to the next level! Here on Kickstarter we are funding the CD Duplication of "The New Untitled Album" and the final touches of making the album finalized. This album has already been mostly produced, recorded, mixed & mastered. So yes I have already put a lot of hard work and time and money into what I do! A lot of hard work!!! So now I would like to invite you to help me kick start this project into completion! Last year you all helped me a ton with the funding of my kickstarter campaign as 24 people backed my project for it to be fully funded! This year I have something a little different going on with my kickstarter campaign. This year, whoever chooses to back this project will be the only people to have this special edition exclusive copy of the album available to them! Meaning; no one else will have these special edition albums! Only people who back the project here on kickstarter! There are better rewards this year and better musical content as well! And I am going to keep the reading section much shorter this year than last year, I'd like for you to take your time looking at all of the great rewards listed this year, as they have significantly changed since last years kickstarter campaign! Another difference is that I don't have any of the artwork done for this exclusive release, so I will update all of the backers with the progress of all artwork and the finalized track listings once we are fully funded and the funds come through. THE "WHY" It's my desire for more people to be blessed and touched by the power of this music. And that's where you come in... As an independent artist I don't have the backing of a label, BUT I do have creative freedom to be able to use platforms such as kickstarter. And that's what I'm doing! Asking for us to collaborate together on this! I know my great supporters will Help me kick start this project! So why should you really pledge and support me? It's easy! You believe in what I do! And it's a great product! Also, I have great rewards available to you! And there will be stretch goals once enough people backs this project up and it's fully funded, all of the people who backed this project will get extra rewards based on how much extra is raised towards the stretch goals! From the new album this is one of the songs called: You Have A Voice THE "WHO" Jordan Copas has a passion for lighting fires through his music that will spark a thousand more. This passion was birthed through pain and hardship in his life, leading him to begin a movement called UN>LIKELY. In 1 Corinthians 1 we are told: "God uses the weak and foolish (unlikely) people of this world to bring to shame the proud." By the end of the chapter we see that God uses those people so that He gets all the glory! How amazing is that?!? The God of the Universe using unlikely people to bring Him glory! It doesn't matter what these people have done in their past, where they are from, or what they look like. God's grace is amazing and real, and Jordan's music brings this reality to life for others. Jordan began writing and recording music in April 2011 after God called him to take a leap of faith into the unknown world of the music industry. Since then, he has traveled the United States, touring, sharing his testimony through music, and watching as the Gospel of Jesus Christ impacts and transforms lives. Since Jordan has been performing music professionally, God has opened many doors that only He could have opened and has done many things through those opportunities that Jordan never would have thought possible. This includes witnessing to and discipling secular music artists, all of whom are now using their musical talents to glorify God! Not only that, Jordan's raw and honest music, his powerful testimony, and his unshakable faith have led countless concert-goers to have radical encounters with Christ's love. And what does Jordan say about this wild n' amazing Kingdom journey he's been on? "God gets the glory." https://jordancopas.com/ https://www.youtube.com/jordancopas https://www.facebook.com/JordanCopas https://www.instagram.com/jordancopasig/ https://twitter.com/jordancopas SOME REWARDS: Signed Tour Banner (Reward Option) 1 available! The movie transcripts My name is Tamar Rothstein I am a spiritual teacher, I am happy to present the book back to the truth. The first of three books I'm about to publish For many years I suffered from anxiety and attention deficit problems, even though I had everything I wanted, a supportive loving partner, I was not happy. I saw that my anxieties permeated and affected my partner, Shimon, really only when he reached the edge, losing his temper and shouting I listen to him One day, in the midst of a bout of self-hatred, I heard a deep voice coming from my soul and asking me why you were getting worse with yourself. I saw there was an aggressive voice in my head that I believed. I asked God not to learn more from suffering. I wanted to learn from love. Life presents difficulties for us to wake up. The challenges are not the problem these are our judicial thoughts about them. The book Back to Truth will give you the tools to develop attentiveness and contact with your inner world. How to be present in the present in the challenge, to be connected and not reactive. If you are currently in crisis, years of treatment and still experiencing mental suffering, or if you are curious to find out how to connect to your natural happiness Back to the truth This is your book, it's a gift you can give yourself, Go inside, support the book, and choose your reward, About My Project My name is Tamar Rothstein I am happy to present to you my book "Back to Truth" Do you feel confused? Dealing with challenging life situations? Are you looking for a deeper inner peace? Do you have a lot of spiritual and conscious knowledge? And still find it difficult to find the center and peace in the moments you need them? Are you looking for answers to questions and a way to connect to your truth and intuition without judgment and fear? My book is back to the truth, giving reminders to reach your inner space at any moment, transform and connect to peace The book points to the possibility of reacting and feeling different from the reactionary patterns that cause suffering The book has a collection of powerful insights that can help bring the light that exists in you in dark and difficult moments To open an opening of possibility and hope in the wall of fear and pain, to help apply spiritual knowledge in everyday life The book is written in Hebrew, ten chapters Each chapter focuses on one of the areas of life: spiritual awakening A connection to your inner truth, love, relationships Reading the book is intuitive, in every page you will fine an answer the question that bothers help and remind you that happiness and peace is already within you The purpose of the book is not to teach a new truth, it is not a philosophical book Three hundred insights from thousands I wrote Collected to 260 pages of the book come to mention teaching how to direct light healer passing through the words Remember that you are the life behind the words. You are the ones who give the power and power to the words You learned and acquired a lot of knowledge but you still have trouble applying this knowledge when needed in real time, the book comes Bridge the gaps between knowledge and implementation in practice and point out the reasons and causes for the difficulty and challenge to find peace And suggests simple ways to connect and anchor presence in the present at this moment "Tamar, your messages are so meaningful and valuable. Particularly in the past year I have been following you closely with your post and past, getting inspiration, insights and insights. Our conversation was so meaningful to me and I feel that it has a significant part in the change I make in the journey of my life. I want to thank you for who you are and for your extraordinary uniqueness. You brought a quiet life, a new look and no less important is a great idea that I apply and works for me great. I wish you would raise all the money needed to bring out your book and that many more people will enjoy the wonderful gifts you bring as you are       --------------------------- Hey Dear Tamar  I wanted to tell you that I have been following you for some time, and especially recently, and find in your words so much strength and consolation. You have no idea how much. You write so amazing and precise, it calms me when the soul hurts and gives me inspiration when I am happy  Thank you from the bottom of my heart --------------------------- I went through tax years a very difficult crisis Since I read your insights something in me has changed for the better The anxiety decreased. My understanding of myself became so strong that in a slow and controlled process I reached a state of significant reduction in anxiety and loss of the way ... You helped me understand myself and let me understand that I did not live by mistake And that's why I'm interested in your book To read and strengthen Right next to the Bible I read --------------------------- I would like to say thank you for all the information you share. It certainly helped and helps me and it can be said that it really changed my perception of my thoughts. Thank you --------------------------- Yesterday I got to your writing In the morning I printed it and put it in my laptop bag. Every time the mobile is in the hand, the words seep Last night, I spent hours sorting out a 17-year-old with a mental illness that caused her to self-injure And today I read what you wrote about the joy And even though and especially when a person dear to us suffers It is important to bring our life energy to it --------------------------- Charming that you are very honored to have a personal dedication I have no doubt that he will star in the contents of my clinic How to support a project Go to the link here Choose one of the gifts, next to each gift there is the amount of your support The book is in the final stages of editing before designing and printing. The budget I want to raise will cover the expense costs In light of the printing and design and editing and shipping to 150 books If you are in the process of spiritual awakening and want to apply the peace and insights in everyday life to make happiness For some of you, if you are dealing with Challenges and difficulties in the areas of life and feel that enough, you suffer enough, you are ready to start a new path, the book "Back To truth "is the gift you give yourself You are not the passing states of life but the living consciousness, the vast light that lies behind the passing states of life Something taken from us allows something new to grow Thank you and love Tamar

Thank you for checking out my Kickstarter! This Kickstarter is for two different projects that work great together but also are completely independent RPG accessories that can be used individually. Different pledge levels will let you get either just one type or get both of them bundled together. Minimalist Creature Dice are 1 inch cubes that can be used instead of miniatures for table top role playing games and the Status & Condition Markers are a great simple way to track the status and condition of different creatures and players. Minimalist Creature Dice When I decided to run a game to introduce D&D to my niece and nephew I realized that I was either going to have to buy $30-$50 worth of my own miniatures or drive over an hour both ways to borrow my brother's collection and then have them back before his next session with his play group. The other solution was to just use what I had around, random lego men, plastic army figures etc. but that always bothered me when a player would say something like, "I attack R2D2" and I have to say, oh so you're attacking the "Lich Lord"? Random figures just take the players out of the game. These Minimalist Creature Dice are the perfect solution. One of these dice can replace 6 standard miniatures. A set of 6 of these dice is the equivalent of having 36 different miniatures at your disposal. 6 Creature Dice = 36 Standard Miniatures They are clearly marked with the name of the creature and minimalist artwork that make them easy to discern at a glance. The creatures represented are GOBLIN, ORC, UNDEAD, KOBOLD, HUMAN & ELF. These were chosen among other reasons because they are creatures that are commonly encountered in a lot of games and often the most likely creatures for early level adventurers to come up against when starting a campaign. Once the funding goal is reached they will be available in three different colors green, red & black with further colors being unlocked at different stretch goals (see below[blue unlocked]). You can get the dice all in one color or a variety of your choice of all unlocked colors. The idea of having multiple colors is to make it easy to tell which creature is which and to differentiate between different types of the same creature (melee, ranged, magic, npc, big boss, etc). Status & Condition Markers One of the biggest challenges when you're playing an encounter in a table top roll playing game with a lot going on is keeping track of everything. Both as a player and as a Game Master it is easy to forget a small detail that may be important such as a particular status or condition you or another creature or player is currently in. I did a lot of searching for a good solution to this but I could never find one. I've seen people use coins, aquarium pebbles and different colored markers but these aren't great solutions because it's easy to forget what color means what and not every player at the table ever really knows what all of the different markers mean. That is why I created my Status & Condition Makers which make it easy for everyone to tell exactly what is going on at a glance. Currently there are two different versions of these markers. Each marker has four different status/conditions on it. The first version is the Universal Status & Condition Marker, it has PRONE, RESTRAINED, STUNNED & BLINDED. These four status/conditions are used in both 4E & 5E Dungeons and Dragons as well as many other RPGs. The second version is the 5E Status & Condition Marker, it has POISONED, CHARMED, GRAPPLED & FRIGHTENED. These four status/conditions are used in other RPGs but specifically I was concentrating on the most recent edition of Dungeons & Dragons. I also have the design done for a 4E Status & Condition Maker that is unlockable [UNLOCKED!] as a Stretch Goal (see below). If this project does well I will also take suggestions for further versions of these markers for D&D and other games. Stretch Goals $7500 = NEW COLOR for Creature Dice [BLUE UNLOCKED!] If the project reaches $7500 we will add one more color for the creature dice. This color will be chosen by the backers. Shortly after hitting $7500 I will send out a survey to everyone who is backing the project to chose what color we will be adding. $10,000 to unlock = 4E Status & Condition Markers [UNLOCKED!] If the project reaches $10,000 we will create a new version of the Status & Condition dice, this version will feature status/conditions that are frequent in the fourth edition of Dungeons and Dragons most likely MARKED, CURSED, DAZED & ONGOING. $12,000 to unlock = NEW COLOR for Creature Dice [PURPLE UNLOCKED!] If the project reaches $12,000 we will add one more color for the creature dice. This color will be chosen by the backers. Shortly after hitting $12,000 I will send out a survey to everyone who is backing the project to chose what color we will be adding. Bonus Goal = NEW COLOR for Creature Dice [YELLOW UNLOCKED!]

A place where book-lovers and tea enthusiasts alike can come to relax, comb through the shelves, and have a nice scone while they read their new favorite. That is what Serendipi*TEA Books aims for- a comfy getaway for anyone near Winter Haven, Florida with a fondness for books and/or tea and scones. We�ve got our eyes set on the perfect building for the job, and we�re hoping to earn the funds to buy it outright. We hope to use the Kickstarter cash to completely pay off the building�s mortgage, so that we can invest more time, funds, and love into setting up the shop. Our team has always had a love for literature, and wish to spread that love around our community. Books hold thousands of different universes, morals, and characters that continually inspire and push us forward, and Serendipi*TEA Books strives to be a center for the wonderful tales that people can tell. Tea has also been a favorite of our collaboraters, with all the fancy table clothes, teapots, and frilly hats that a traditional tea room lets you experience. But we realize that people today are always on their feet- in between work, social life, and chores- so we want to provide people a chance to enjoy the refined taste of tea without the time invested into a boisterous get-together. If the Kickstarter�s goal is reached, we will buy the building and input more time into renovating, decorating, and equipping it. The backer�s money is going straight into paying off the mortgage and funding rewards. Thank you in advance for any and all pledges you make, and if you choose to share this on social media. :) Our founder, Rebecca Fanchette, who is one month away from having her Master�s in Healthcare Administration, is a book lover, a tea connoisseur, and a dreamer. She has always wanted to own her own little bookstore that serves to spread an appreciation for books. Serendipity- noun the occurrence and development of events by chance in a happy or beneficial way. [1] Tea- noun 1. a hot drink made by infusing the dried crushed leaves of the tea plant in boiling water.[1] [1] -via New Oxford Dictionary What do you get if you combine the two? *Reward tiers are progressive, so you get the tier you purchased and all the levels beneath it* REWARDS Pledge $1- Pledge a dollar to get a shoutout on our Facebook! Pledge $5- Receive one of three handmade, custom bookmarks! (*Final designs will vary from mock-up*) Pledge $10- Choose a book cover for the front wall! (*Books with NSFW art or books that send hateful or derogatory messages will not be displayed on the wall*) Pledge $20- Work with one of our collaborators to commission a custom artwork! A larger portfolio of art can be found at @abledust on Instagram. Pledge $50- Work together with the team to customize and name a signature tea blend based on your favorite flavors! Pledge $100- Receive a box of the tea you helped customize and name! (*box shown is just a rough sketch of what a sample custom tea box would look like, final version will most likely be a tin of loose leaf tea*) Pledge $200- �Adopt a Bookshelf� and get your name on a plaque! (*If there is a high demand for this tier, you may end up sharing a shelf with someone.*) Pledge $500- A bundle an exclusive Serendipi*TEA tumbler, t-shirt, and a mystery box of various book-related goodies!(*Final Serendipi*TEA products will vary from this rough mock-up*) Instagram: @serendipi_teabookstore or https://www.instagram.com/serendipitea_bookstore/ Twitter: @tea_serendipi or https://mobile.twitter.com/tea_serendipi Facebook: https://m.facebook.com/rebecca.fanchette.5?ref=bookmarks Backer survey will be sent out at the end of the Kickstarter if funds are raised, so that you can choose your rewards/collaborate with our team.

DEATHROLL is a science-fantasy RPG that invites its players to try-out new ways to play, new ways to write, and new roles to take on. This is because every story told in the apocalyptic world of Arcadia is finite. Meaning, every setting, every character -- even the GM -- are all meant to be experienced just a single time. Illustrated by F-G-P DEATHROLL is a game that empowers its players to take on the role of the GM. It is my belief that most players who never try playing as the GM aren't disinterested in the role, but overwhelmed by it. DEATHROLL aims to change this. Games can be short �one-offs� (referred to as Tales) that can be ready to play in as short as an hour. A small list of 3 primary, PbtA inspired "moves", make running the game incredibly streamlined. Settings (referred to as Adventures or Tales) are created using a step-by-step process called Adventure Creation. Each segment (or Act) of an Adventure is created one at a time, allowing the GM to focus on a smaller portion of the larger story without having to consider the entire arc. Instead of just creating a ruleset of how to play, DEATHROLL also creates a ruleset of how to write. If you have never attempted to run an RPG, learning from a guide can be a daunting feat. Though running a game is complex, it has been meticulously unpacked and demystified to great extents in other games. However, the problem as I see it does not lie in the running of a game, but the writing of the setting. Attempting to both properly design and creatively write a setting for the players to enjoy keeps many from ever touching the role of GM. This is where a process called Adventure Creation comes in. For both GMs who are completely new to the role, as well as those that have been running games for decades; Adventure Creation supplies a new way to think about the very first and most important part of being the GM � designing the setting. Illustrated by F-G-P During Adventure Creation a GM will create: Acts: Individual segments of an Adventure (based on the three-act narrative structure). Major Conflicts: Each Act's individual conflict that must be resolved before players can progress. Villains: The antagonists responsible for an Act's Major Conflict. Encounters: Challenges that involve a specific person(s), obstacle, or event. Grand Scheme: The primary conflict of the entire Adventure and the cause of all the other Major Conflicts. Archvillain: The dastardly mastermind behind the Grand Scheme and the main villain of the setting. Entire Adventures like this are created in segments, only adding additional Acts after prior ones have been completed. This allows the GM to: Focus on the creation of the individual Acts without having to worry about the overall arc of the entire story. Begin new games and create original settings much faster. Develop the next major portion of the story based on the player's choices they made during the prior Act. Through Encounter Creation, the setting you have written will become both playable and challenging. Designing a setting to both be a fun challenge while remaining fair to the players can be difficult, even for veteran GMs. Encounter Creation simplifies this design process by: Centering each Encounter a GM adds around a single Focus: either a specific person(s), obstacle, or event. Asking the GM to determine the types of Threats their Encounters will contain: NPCs, Puzzles, Creatures, Weather, and more. Having the GM establish the Encounter's Difficulty Rating, narrowing down what is key to the Encounter and why. The player characters that you will be controlling are referred to as Survivors, poor souls who have lived through an apocalyptic event known as The Great Downfall. Times are tough now sure, but as the players will discover from creating these Survivors, Arcadia has not been a kind place for some time now. Illustrated by F-G-P Survivors are created rapidly, with familiarity of the creation process allowing the player to create a new character in under 20 minutes. This is made possible due to every Survivor�s background being fleshed out as they are being generated. Assembled through Life Events the player rolls, the Survivor will develop all the way from adolescence to the time of The Great Downfall itself. Survivors in DEATHROLL are class-based, using PbtA inspired class-specific �moves� (referred to as Talents), each of which are linked to one of 46 different Skills. Unlike traditional PbtA systems, each Talent in DEATHROLL can be acquired by any other class, so long as that Survivor has Mastery over the Skill the Talent is linked to. Skills, used in conjunction with Abilities (like in D6 systems) are also class-based, but also accessible by any other class, either by experiencing a particular Life Event during Survivor Creation, or through Skill Progression (our equivalent of leveling). Survivors are also constructed with: Races: Either Human or Azani, race dictates initial benefits and disadvantages, as well as a unique benefit that passively assists the Survivor. Wealth Statuses: Your Survivor�s social class and access to wealth prior to The Great Downfall. Higher Wealth Statuses offer better Gear Packages (an initial reward of useful items) before play begins. Motivators: A strong drive that compels the Survivor to act, often times irrationally. DEATHROLL uses a mishmash of D6 and PbtA systems you may be familiar with, but with an added layer of flexibility. In most cases, both the GM and the player engage with the same system, not two separate ones created specifically for each role. This allows for a much clearer view into what everyone at the table is capable of, allowing for more clarity on how the rules are meant to be used by everyone (including the GM). Action Resolution by Contest: All Actions are resolved through a Contest between two players (a Survivor and the GM). The winner of the Contest resolves the Action to their liking. Contextual Damage: Context-based damage output. If it seems possible to kill with Lethal Damage, simply win a Contest to do so and take out the target with a single strike. Universal Actions: Both the Survivors and the GM take Actions. Meaning, some of the GM�s Actions are contestable by the players, and can be forced to fail if the GM loses a Contest with a player opposing them. Exertion Cards: Used as a hand of playing cards, an additional Pool Modifier of dice can be added to both the GMs or player�s Dice Pools. Cards are played face-down, then revealed at the same time, adding their value in dice as a surprise to the other. Illustrated by F-G-P Gear Packages: Quickly jump into a new game with a full set of useful items without having to crunch numbers deciding what you can and cannot afford to buy. Trust Statuses: A trackable scale of Trust makes it quick and easy to determine how NPCs interact with Survivors or how close they are to becoming friend or foe. Narrative Initiative: An initiative system that can be used at any time by the GM to create turn-based play during which only a certain amount of Actions can be taken (including GM Actions). Threat Guides: Walkthroughs that help the GM create any possible Threat she can imagine: Creatures, Terrain, Weather, Traps, and more. Written & designed by Conor Kennedy Edited by Barbey Plummer Art by Fausto Pontes Character Sheet by Meg Ellison The book is both fully written and edited, with only the layout and art (both of which that are well underway) remaining to be finished. The PDF will be optimized in RGB for screens, with the expected internal linking and bookmarks. The fully edited (but not laid out) draft can be found here. How to get the Book As you pledge to this Kickstarter, you get the PDF copy of the game as well as the "at-cost" POD (print-on-demand) from DriveThru RPG. This means that you will need to pay DriveThru RPG in order to receive a physical copy of the book (if you desire one). In this way, every backer will have the option to buy the printed copy of the game on DriveThru RPG�s marketplace (est. $10 + shipping) in addition to also receiving the PDF version. We make no additional money off the sale of printed copies, this is why the POD is priced �at cost�. The $10 pledge a backer makes is all the revenue I earn. Drive Thru RPG simply needs to cover the cost of printing. If you don�t wish to have a physical copy, or don�t like the idea of spending more than $10 to play the game, simply ignore the POD or give it away to someone else.

I am writing a book as a legacy to lost family members and a promise to a dying sister. The hope is that the book will raise spirits and help others who are battling cancer and other diseases to keep doing what they love and keep their spirits high. This is a funny book, with true stories of my dad as he had the ability that will highlight the humorist ways of a funny man in life.

Since September 29, 2018, The Shabby Tabby Cat Cafe has been able to place over 200 cats and kittens into their forever homes, by opening as Long Island's FIRST Cat Cafe! IG @theshabbytabbyLI Website: theshabbytabbyLI.com The Shabby Tabby- Sayville Location The Shabby Tabby- Sayville Location The Shabby Tabby- Sayville Location Check out our features in the news!!! News 12- Doug Geed & Danielle Campbell We have partnered with Golden Paw Society, a cat rescue based out of Huntington, NY. The mission of Golden Paw Society is to rescue cats from high kill shelters, which we think is just amazing! At The Shabby Tabby Cat Cafe, people are able to meet and socialize with the cats and get to know their true personalities. It is easier to see how the cats really are when they are in the comfort of the cafe than meeting them in a shelter setting where they are often scared. 13 Year Old Bugs Bunny- ADOPTED 4 Year Old Casey- ADOPTED Princess & Coco- BOTH ADOPTED We provide a one hour experience to come in and hang out with our resident cats, who are all adoptable. If you fall in love, you can apply to take them home! Every cat is fully vaccinated and given a clean bill of health before entering the cafe, and our application process is thorough. We want to make sure the home is a purrfect fit for both you and the kitty! Throughout the past year, our Shabby Tabby team has been so successful in reaching our goals, that we have decided to open another location in Huntington Village. By doing this, we will be able to increase the amount of cats we take in, which is MANY, many more cats that can be rescued from euthanasia! The Shabby Tabby Cat Cafe will also be able to continue to bring animal lovers together through our events. We have events like Drag Queen Bingo, Kitten Yoga, TNR classes, private parties, Paint Nights, and other fun various events. These events bring the cat rescue community together while creating more social cats who love the company of humans. We have chosen Huntington Village because it is a vivacious town with plenty to do! We wanted to find a location in which our cats would get the most exposure by having lots of things to do, while also being in the same town as our partner rescue- Golden Paw Society! We have found and secured a location in the heart of the village and we have begun renovations and catifications! We will be partnering up with local bakeries and eateries who will provide our snacks and food for events. We will not be preparing any food in house. Only beverages like coffee, different teas, hot chocolate, and more, which will all be included complimentary in the 1 hour session price. Rewards:

Order now before supplies dry up! The Legend's Cookbook is a culinary adventure between two covers. This is a professionally developed and designed cookbook filled to the brim with good food, charming illustrations and imaginative recipes. This cookbook is for everyone, beginners and pros. Drawing from a litany of inspirations, we capture a sense of adventure, novelty and the wild. These dishes will transport the reader to new worlds, teaching them to cook with a plethora of different techniques, approaches and flavors. From the culinary styles of the French, Spanish, German, and even something out of this world, this cookbook will be your guide to fantastic dining everyday. It will act as a gateway to a diverse dining table and truly take your breath away. This is an original, independent, and unofficial project led and being created by fans of cooking, gaming and making things. You can follow along with the project on our Twitter @LegendsCookbook or our Instagram @legends_cookbook. My name is Peter J. Abreu, I�m chef, pilot and traveler. Originally, I�m from Long Island, NY, but I can�t say I�m from just there. My mother's Italian, and my father's Cuban, so I learned almost everything I know about good food from watching my family cook dinner. Everything else I learned about food came from my time abroad. My parents worked in the airline industry as I was growing up, so I was fortunate enough to be able to embrace my heritage and experience others all across the globe. I spent the summers of high school teaching and cooking in the Castilian region of Spain, and that�s where I realized my dream to help spread what I�d learned all across the globe. I attended flight school, became a pilot, and started my own YouTube cooking show where I embrace my love for cooking, video games and traveling. Speaking of, I�ve met a lot of incredible people on my travels, shared so many memorable meals and learned a lot about what to do in the kitchen. What I love about a good meal is that it brings people together and takes them on a journey. I want to bring that to as many people as possible, and this cookbook will be your invitation to this journey. I�m not alone in this project either; I�m joined with an incredible team of creative professionals and now we want you to be our cooking champion. The Legend�s Cookbook will be produced in digital, paperback and hardcover formats so you can choose-your-own-adventure. Contained in this 8" x 10" cookbook's 150 pages, you'll find over 70 original recipes, hundreds of hand-drawn illustrations and diagrams, plus professional food photography that will inspire you to try every single dish. Not only are there straight-forward directions in this cookbook, but I�m going to be sharing interesting tips and info I�ve learned over the years about everything culinary. Ever wonder why saffron is so expensive? What�s the difference between the different types olive oil? Why do we put salt on everything? Get equipped with all sorts of cooking hints. You�ll be impressed with a lot of the aesthetic attributes as well, such as the delightful field guide style of the cookbook, complete with anatomical sketches of herbs, charcoal sketches and small watercolor pieces tucked away in the corners of pages. It�s fun, adventurous, and stands out, not just in the kitchen but on your bookshelf. Design not final, subject to change. So far, we�ve already composed and tasted every single one of the 70+ recipes being included in this cookbook. I�ve spent a lot of time showing them off and tweaking them on my YouTube cooking channel. We�ve taken these recipes far, even getting some feedback from my grandma (and she�s the best cook I know). The next step is to put them out there into the world. We�ve spent the last year prepping for that. My team and I have spent that time working on photographing the food for the cookbook, designing the layouts and working on all the art we will need to fill the pages. As a result, we are nearly done with an initial print draft of the book. This is where we need your help in the final leg of our publishing journey. As you can see from all the incredible photos and sample pages here, our team has personally invested a lot time and money in this project but we need your support and backing to physically print this cookbook. We've done all the legwork, gotten price quotes and have lined up a fantastic printer, we just need to know how many to order. If you can�t back this project right now, you can help us by simply sharing our project on social media or telling a friend. This is a group effort. As with any incredible undertaking, so many people have been there for us all along and now we just need you. Join us and we can finish this quest so we can start a new one in kitchens all across the globe. Within this cookbook, we are aiming for the highest caliber of flavor while adhering to the themes of nature, simplicity and the wild. To achieve this, we engineered our recipes with a few specifics. Things like not using artificial food dye. Natural coloring should be utilized as often as possible, even if this involves extracting pigments from certain ingredients just to add to later dishes. Blackberry pur�e will always beat out purple food coloring - we want to arm you with the wisdom of the natural alternatives. We also want to utilize fresh ingredients as natural and raw as possible. Don�t get us wrong, we don�t want you to go through the hassle of threshing your own wheat when you can just buy a pound of flour from a store, but if you want something special and a bit wilder, we are going to make you aware of it and more power to you for trying it. Our last tenant is one of simplicity. All of our recipes are straightforward to make. There�s nothing wrong with a baked apple recipe being just baking an apple with some brown sugar and a touch of cinnamon. A simple meal is often the best meal and we want you to have the courage to try it. I've been cooking all my life and sharing those recipes with my friends, and audience on YouTube. I've even gained over 25,000 subscribers and have millions of views. I�m also collaborating with the lead writer and several other team members of the recently released Mother�s Cookbook. You can check out their previous campaign here to get a taste of what we�re hoping to make in this cookbook. We have an incredible team of photographers, writers, chefs and artists. Peter J. Abreu � Lead Chef & Project Leader, Cuban-Italian chef from Long Island that loves to cook and teach people about it. Matt Mannheimer � Producer & PR Manager, a public relations professional with a wealth of expertise in various markets, you might know him from his previous work on Tails� Channel or when his boss was a blue hedgehog. One stormy February night, three Stanford students hatched a simple, but brutally juicy plan to save the world: replace wasteful plastic lip balms with a closed-loop make-up experience. The MUMO experience is a DIY kit that 1. gives you fantastic lip balm, 2. reduces plastic waste, 3. provides complete transparency over the substances you are putting on your face, 4. creates a fun experience to pamper yourself and/or bond with friends. Each kit includes the ingredients and instructions to quickly and effortlessly craft 2 refillable lip balms in a snazzy aluminum container. The containers can be refilled with our refill kit! Understand exactly how your lip balm is made with MUMO. Kick it back with the ladies, gentleman, and people who know better to make something good for you and the environment.
