Cleaning your grill just became easy. Grill Rescue uses steam to clean your grill. Not aggravated forceful brushing. THE PROBLEM: You know the pains of cleaning your grill. So well, that you tell yourself you like the "flavor" it gives when you don't. You know the frustration of attempting to clean your grill with a dirty, rusted, metal bristle grill brush. Is that really the best we can do? I don't think needing a tetanus shot after grilling is satisfactory. Or even good enough.. WARNING - SHOCKING FACT: In a 12 year span, there were an estimated 1,698 grill brush injuries in the United States alone. That's over 130 injuries per year in a single country. Are you next to eat your wire bristles? X-rays of wire bristles getting lodged in people. So, ask yourself: Is my grill brush really worth it? We know you settled for your current grill cleaner. That's Okay. You can say goodbye to eating wire bristles, wood shavings, and stone powder. Do any of these look familiar? Point to the one you have. Now get your filthy fingers off your screen. We have solved all the problems with these grill cleaners and made the grill brush of your dreams. Seriously, this thing rocks. The biggest issue with current grill brushes are that they simply don't work. On top of that, you have to deal with a number of additional problems. They break easily and get stuck in your food. They are not sanitary. They are always dirty (how do you clean your grill with a dirty cleaner?). They leave a nasty residue on your grill or just move the mess around. Why do you deal with this? Because there's no other option! THE SOLUTION: Grill Rescue uses steam to clean your grill. Yes, to actually clean your grill. Using Grill Rescue is so simple to use and will save you loads of time you could spend eating your food. Step 1. Preheat your grill to a minimum of 400 degrees Fahrenheit. For safety, turn off the burners once your grill is hot. Step 2. Dunk your brush, or run it under water. Step 3. Gently wipe away the nasty gunk that's been building up. Grill Rescue gets in all the grooves for a super clean grill. We've designed our brush heads to fit in all grill grates. You might be asking yourself, wouldn't this brush get super dirty after cleaning a really nasty grill? YES! Grill Rescue has to get dirty to get your grill clean. Most grill cleaners just stay dirty. Not Grill Rescue! We've thought of that too. Put your detachable brush head in your dishwasher or washing machine. Now it's clean and ready to clean more BBQ rib gunk. It was made to be reused for up to 100 washes (on average during testing). After that, just grab your 2nd brush head, snap it on your Grill Rescue, and you're good for another 100 cleans! THE PROCESS: Designing the world's best grill brush was very difficult. Wanting something better than what's currently on the market is easy, creating it is hard. It took nearly 2 years to design and create the perfect version of Grill Rescue.Take a look below and get a 30 second view of the last 2 years creating the perfect grill brush. 1st Prototype - Made from the handle of an existing grill brush, wood block, and terrycloth. 2nd Prototype - Made from the handle of an existing grill brush with disconnecting mechanism, mildly absorbent sponge, and high quality terrycloth. 3rd Prototype - Made from a custom designed 3D printed handle, very absorbent heat proof "sponge", and high quality terrycloth. 6th Prototype - Branded with the Grill Rescue logo. Made from a fire retardant custom designed 3D printed handle, very absorbent heat proof foam, wrapped in a high quality heat proof cloth. We created Grill Rescue out of frustration of a dirty grill. No grill cleaner could clean our grills well enough. We soon found there was an even bigger issue. People are swallowing metal bristles that break off the most popular grill cleaners. Thousands of people are being sent to the Emergency Room in excruciating pain and getting immediate surgery to remove these metal pieces from throats, stomachs, and even hearts. This is when we knew we could make a real difference. Hundreds of news videos and thousands of articles and Facebook posts flood the web of people getting severely injured from grill brushes. We are going to put a stop to this for good and get your grill cleaned in the process. Grill Rescue is not only a life saver, it truly is the world's best grill brush! REWARDS: TIMELINE: WHO ARE WE?: Scott is a South Florida Firefighter and the inventor of Grill Rescue. Scott is currently completing his Bachelor's in Business Administration at Florida Atlantic University. He is a full-time Fire Fighter and Paramedic since 2012. Scott is involved with the Technical Rescue Team and also part of The United States Task Force II Team, which helps with many natural disaster missions. In his free time, Scott spends time developing and constantly bettering Grill Rescue. He really enjoys the Florida weather and takes full advantage of scuba diving, fishing, and grilling up all his catches. Anthony is a Business Consultant and co-creator of Grill Rescue. While the majority of Anthony's time is spent on branding and marketing Grill Rescue, he is also responsible for all the events, video, imagery, and design. Anthony spends his free time volunteering as a mentor to aspiring entrepreneurs. Oh yea, and he loves to grill! Due to the beautiful year round Florida weather, Anthony can grill nearly every night of the year. Includes: 1 Grill Rescue, 2 Cleaning Heads, 'MERICA Apron, 1 hat, and a Long Sleeve Shirt - UPF 50+ (Sun Protection) - ENDS ON JULY, 7 2019 @ 11:59PM Includes: 1 Grill Rescue, 2 Cleaning Heads, and a #1 DAD Apron - ENDS ON JUNE, 16 2019 @ 11:59PM This project is promoted by Jellop, the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarters with 650+ successful Kickstarter projects with over $300MM raised between them.

Hi! My name is Stevie and I am a 24 year old independent artist from NYC. This is my second Kickstarter campaign for pins and I am very excited for it! The Powerpuff Girls were my favorite TV show as a kid and actually the first things I've ever drawn, so I'm very excited to be able to create some pins of them! All of these pins will all be hard enamel as well as made with rose gold plating The pins will come with rubber clutches and a backing card. The Blossom pin is first in the initial goal, each additional pin can be unlocked with further funding! June: Kickstarter launch yay! July: Kickstarter ends and survey for selection of pins/stickers are sent out. August: Pin production begins! September/October Pins and stickers are mailed out provided with tracking! Other Notes: Shipping Info  USA: USPS First Class Mail $3  International: First Class Mail $12. Unfortunately sometimes with international packages there are slight delays depending on where you live, usually this isn't too big of a problem though! Funds Breakdown  Pin Production - 70%  Packaging & Shipping - 20%  Kickstarter Fees - 10%

Here is the third big issue in our sf series, Out of This World. The cover may be the most frightening image Ditko has ever produced so we only dare show you a portion in our preview. This issue is another 48-page anthology. The selection of materials is the equal of our two previous issues, perhaps even a little better? Now there are some, many, who would like to know the details of plot, character, theme, and the conclusion of any coming attraction anywhere. Those so interested can tune in to Turner Classic Movies in the evening and listen to the host reveal all of this and more before he begins showing the picture. The Channel Guide provides details of the plot and ending of movies and television programs. Select a tv news channel and you can find someone who will anxiously tell you how the big game will turn out, the contents of the political speech scheduled for the following day or how the election will be decided. Turn to a comic book web site for all of the details about the new comics from Archie, DC, Marvel and others. We have chosen to go our own way. We can�t compete with Archie and the others and would be lost in the mix if we tried to do so. Snyder and Ditko have established some sort of a record from 1988 to date. We have produced 62 different books--from Steve Ditko�s Static in the beginning to Konga no. 25 last year and Postshadowing vol. iv this month. Now comes Out of This World this Summer. Our book is complete, finished, but for the editorial pages. This is where you can shine, where we can add your name to the growing number of subscribers to our publications. Yes, all we have to do is complete work on the text pages and send the book to the printer. We have been working with Morgan Printing for many years and are pleased with their work, efficiency and quick turn-around. We invite you to join us in our new campaign. We can use your help. We do not have the star attractions of Archie, DC, Marvel and the others. Perhaps you can help us to spread the word about this new production. Once we succeed in our campaign we will review the pages one more time before turning the book over to the printer. Thank you,

Tyro badge displaying clear PCB for shine through LEDs You're awesome! Simply visiting our Kickstarter has made us Snoopy dance around the room. Thanks for being awesome and a potential Believer in Hak4Kidz's first Kickstarter! History and Inspiration Hak4Kidz has been around for six years providing kids ages 7 - 17 a fun and safe ethical hacking conferences, much like you enjoy. In 2016, we produced our first digital badge (with lots of help) and the kids loved it! This badge got us invited into the #badgelife DEF CON community. In 2017, we produced the analog cipher-disc badge you may have seen during hacker summer camp. In 2018, we produced another analog badge using a deck of trading cards called Phreaker Life! Tons of puzzles in the cards which 1 person solved for a lifetime badge to CypherCon!! This year, in partnership with MK Factor (the GOON Box badge creators) we present to you our 2019 badge! Tinker, our mascot, is sitting behind a giant cryptex. The cryptex is from the movie The Da Vinci Code which is used to store a secret message. Figure out how to unlock the cryptex and it's secrets are yours! Features and Hardware Additional resources available on Github Three different types of badges are used at Hak4Kidz events, Tyro, Admin, and 1337. The Tyro badge is white for kids and parents, the Admin badge is red for volunteers, and the 1337 is black for event organizers and founders. Using PCB materials that match the badges colors we use was super cool. We wanted the badge to have connectivity options, but didn't want them as separate components on the board. The badge needed to be easy for kids to code on, something familiar and lots of examples like the Arduino IDE, so using the ESP32 made sense. Keeping our primary audience in mind, as much simplicity and fun as possible was a requirement. So, having a lot of blinky lights, micro-USB for flashing, easy soldering add-ons, big LCD, and way cool touch pads were must haves! When the kids pressed the touch pads there would be some response, and 1 challenge for CTF points, but the other badges had those touch options mixed up. For example, on the 1337 badge pressing touch pad 6 revealed the challenge, but not on the other 2 badges. Let's take a look at the components. Components mono-chrome LEDs (2 x red, 6 x white) 8 x RGB LEDs LED driver ON / OFF switch - OFF is USB connection mode micro-USB with auto-flash for ESP32 FTDI FT231XS serial-UART convertor TFT 2.4 inch SPI LCD ILI9341 driver (240px x 320px) 6 x capacitive touch pads 2 x SAO v1.69bis locations Power from USB or 3 x AA batteries (included) ESP32-WROOM-32 MCU ESP32-WROOM-32 Specs Processors: CPU: Xtensa dual-core 32-bit LX6 microprocessor; operating at 160 or 240 MHz and performing at up to 600 DMIPS Ultra low power (ULP) co-processor Memory: 520 KiB SRAM Wireless connectivity: Wi-Fi: 802.11 b/g/n Bluetooth: v4.2 BR/EDR and BLE Peripheral interfaces: 12-bit SAR ADC up to 18 channels 2 � 8-bit DACs 10 � touch sensors (capacitive sensing GPIOs) 4 � SPI 2 � I�S interfaces 2 � I�C interfaces 3 � UART SD/SDIO/CE-ATA/MMC/eMMC host controller SDIO/SPI slave controller Ethernet MAC interface with dedicated DMA and IEEE 1588 Precision Time Protocol support CAN bus 2.0 Infrared remote controller (TX/RX, up to 8 channels) Motor PWM LED PWM (up to 16 channels) Hall effect sensor Ultra low power analog pre-amplifier Security: IEEE 802.11 standard security features all supported, including WFA, WPA/WPA2 and WAPI Secure boot Flash encryption 1024-bit OTP, up to 768-bit for customers Cryptographic hardware acceleration: AES, SHA-2, RSA, elliptic curve cryptography (ECC), random number generator (RNG) Power management: Internal low-dropout regulator Individual power domain for RTC 5A deep sleep current Wake up from GPIO interrupt, timer, ADC measurements, capacitive touch sensor interrupt Source: Wikipedia Your Positive Impact As a Believer, your support covers the cost for 2 badges for the kids. All excess will be used to support future event activities.

For our Kickstarter campaign, CatLadder.com is introducing our newest line of ladders constructed of Baltic Birch. Pricing is exclusive to this campaign and offers backers a 15% discount on regular pricing. Plus, we�re covering the shipping. Our campaign goal is to raise funds to invest in manufacturing and packaging to make our processes more efficient so we can make more ladders more quickly. We�ve sold hundreds of ladders and our customers and their cats love them. Now we need to step up production capabilities to keep up with orders. It�s a good challenge to have! Baltic Birch is a strong, attractive and dimensionally stable wood product that�s been used by European cabinet and furniture makers for decades. It allows us to efficiently produce ladder parts with precision and speed. Thanks to birch�s hard, uniform grain, we can use finishes that dry quickly and evenly. Cat Ladder style is simple and tasteful, to complement any d�cor. It�s not the typical cat climber from the pet store that you wish you could stash away. Cat Ladder is thoughtfully designed to be sturdy, safe and remain stable where you put it, and we've made sure it�s angled and stepped just right for easy climbing. The durable carpet pads let cats grip as they climb, and scratch as they�re naturally inclined to do. Our ladders are crafted like quality furniture and built to last. We sweat the details and take care with the finishing touches including the custom packaging to make sure your Cat Ladder arrives in perfect shape. Cat Ladder is light enough so you can move it from place to place in your home to give your curious cat a fresh view and access to new places to explore. And that will help keep your kitty active and happy! You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00 See how our Baltic Birch ladders are made and packaged. Windowsill, countertop or bookcase � where does your cat want to climb and how high does your ladder need to reach? Choose number of steps based on height required. Standard ladders are lighter and slimmer. Wide ladders offer a more generous perch but are a bit heavier. *You will get to choose your carpet color once our campaign succeeds. Pads are removable. Replacements can be ordered from CatLadder.com. College friends turned business partners 25 years later, Damon Knopf and Joe Koziol were determined to combine their skills and ideas to create something truly unique. In 2014 they formed Kozworks LLC. Cat Ladder is the first product they�ve brought to market, and it has evolved into a full product line with multiple sizes, finishes, carpet choices and more. Enhancements and complementary product ideas are in the hopper, ready to be developed. Damon brings years of experience in fine woodworking to Kozworks. He handcrafts and ships the ladders from the manufacturing shop in Durham, North Carolina. Joe�s background in architectural metalwork and furniture design (as well as his love of cats!) led to the creation of the first Cat Ladder. He handles marketing and customer service near his home in Western New York.

"Another marvelous and whimsical narrative project from one of the most interesting small presses you're likely to encounter." �Kelly Link, author of Get In Trouble Long associated with children's games and acts of divination, paper cootie catchers find new and exciting use in Lianna Fled the Cranberry Bog, a haunting, interactive story by GennaRose Nethercott. Illustrated by artist Bobby DiTrani, the twenty-six fortune tellers unfold to reveal a kaleidoscopic tale of cruel beasts, daring thieves, lost sweethearts, and a family on the run. Each cootie catcher features eight possible endings�but the endings are also beginnings, complications, transformations, jumping-off points for other parts of the tale. Read them alone or with a partner, using any method you like: counting off bolded words and numbers, choosing panels that strike your fancy, or simply laying them flat. From jailbreaks to kissing practice, murders to museum heists, each trip through Lianna Fled the Cranberry Bog reveals new sides of this wild, multifaceted tale of wonder and terror. "I absolutely adore this haunting, dark, strange, glorious work of art.... I have been playing this book/game for hours and I'll never get enough of it." �Edward Carey, author of Little and The Iremonger Trilogy  STRETCH GOAL UNLOCKED  $20,000: An inner sleeve to hold the cootie catcher flats, packed with liner notes, illustrated instructions, and additional art by Bobby DiTrani. Rewards All backers pledging at the $12 level or higher will receive a PDF of the twenty-six cootie catchers. If printed on standard size paper, the sheets will have to be cut square before folding. All backers pledging at the $18 level will receive a physical copy of Lianna Fled the Cranberry Bog at a discount (post-Kickstarter, the retail price will be $20 or more). The cootie catcher flats will be professionally printed and packed in an illustrated sleeve. We are committed to having all parts of the physical edition produced in the US. 24 of the 26 Cootie Catcher Flats Backers pledging at higher levels may claim additional copies of the physical edition, including signed copies. We are also making previous Ninepin Press publications available at some levels. More information about each is available on our website:  Cosmogram, an anthology of tiny horoscope stories  Zodiac B, a chapbook in cards by Travis Smith  The Family Arcana, a story in cards by Jedediah Berry The Celestial Arcana Note: Our stock of The Family Arcana is running low, so for the time being we are making a limited number of copies available only through this Kickstarter campaign. At even higher levels, backers can secure some of the few remaining copies of the uncut sheets (about 26" x 22") of The Family Arcana as part of The Ninepin Press Collection. Finally, you'll find opportunities to claim some of the original Lianna art by Bobby DiTrani. Each piece is about 10" x 10". "It Skulks Beneath the Bog" "Lianna Lived Inside a Belly" "Recipe for Lianna's Cranberry Soup" "When Bail Isn't Enough" "The Definition of Hunger" "What Kind of Thief Are You?" "Ivy & Josephine Learn of the Past" About the Author Photo by Kirk Murphy GennaRose Nethercott�s book The Lumberjack�s Dove (Ecco/HarperCollins) was selected by Louise Gl�ck as a winner of the National Poetry Series for 2017. She is also the lyricist behind the narrative song collection Modern Ballads, and is a Mass Cultural Council Artist Fellow. Her writing has appeared widely in journals and anthologies including BOMB, The Massachusetts Review, The Offing, and PANK, and she has been a writer-in-residence at the Shakespeare & Company bookstore, Art Farm Nebraska, and The Vermont Studio Center, among others. A born Vermonter, she tours nationally and internationally performing from her works and composing poems-to-order for strangers on a 1952 Hermes Rocket typewriter. About the Illustrator Bobby DiTrani's formative years were spent in the small (once smaller) town of North Bend, WA. A graduate of the Aristides Classical Atelier at the Gage Academy of Art in Seattle, he frequently tours with his band, DiTrani Brothers and the Hammer of Spring. About Ninepin Press We are a small publisher of literary objects that blur the lines between fiction, poetry, and games. Our first publication, The Family Arcana: A Story in Cards by Jedediah Berry, was a World Fantasy Award finalist. Other publications include Zodiac B by Travis Smith and Cosmogram, an anthology of tiny horoscope stories by Kelly Link, Victor LaValle, Alexander Chee, Alice Sola Kim, and others. Editors: Jedediah Berry & Emily Houk.

HELLO. sketches is my out-of-print solo album, originally released on cassette tape in 2012. It's been unavailable otherwise in physical and streaming format until now. This was the very first self-produced work I've made. In the time since, I've worked with a multitude of artists and created new musical relationships. Releasing sketches digitally, this will be the first time most people have heard me sing or write. For this release, I've remixed/remastered/fine-tuned (3d) the tracks. Everything remains the same musically except my friend Elliot played drums on "nowhere else." I think it all sounds just a bit better; a lot of sonic problems were addressed. So yeah, printing up a limited run of vinyl with NEW cover art and 3D! recordings. I'm making a few t-shirts and offering an extremely limited run of handwritten lyrics. I'm doing all this because I know the project brings light to many of the people that have heard it, and I just feel like there's no reason to hinder further discovery. Thanks for listening and continuing to support. What Stuff Looks Like: Guitar and Case ($400, 1 available): Kurzweil PC2X, My original Tally Hall Keyboard ($2500, 1 available) (minor damage here from touring)

Hi Kickstarter, we are three companies (and makers) that all got our start here on Kickstarter, and today we wanted to comeback and share a new project we�ve been working on with the community that created us. - Tyler, Patrick, and John STRETCH GOALS UPDATE: We're so excited and happy by the success of the project! We're pumped to announce we've reached three of our stretch goals, we're now offering White glow as a color option, Ebony Wood as a wood option, the Voltage Pendant, a pendant featuring the same fractal design as the Voltage Ring, and a Free UV Light Keychain with every order! - Check them out at the bottom of the page! Meet the Voltage Ring. Inspired by natural bioluminescence, we set out to create a ring that embodied the raw and unbridled energy found in nature. We ended with a ring that captures the excitement of a truly brilliant bolt of lightning. Each voltage ring features a Wooden Band with Fractal Burns that Glow at night thanks to our own proprietary formula. Featured on BackerCity and BackerClub! Each and every Voltage Ring is handmade in America through a collaborative effort between our three companies: Carbon Fi, Carbon 6, and Patrick Adair Designs. Making this (as far as we know) the largest collaboration Kickstarter�s ever seen. The foundation of each Voltage Ring is a luxury wooden band, handcrafted out of your choice of maple, cherry, or walnut. Each band is complimented by a luminescent glow liner. The liners are made using the same material and process as luxury Swiss watches and charged using UV rays that can be found in black lights or natural sunlight. We are also offering the opportunity to replace the luminescent liner with a luxury grade forged carbon fiber or aerospace grade titanium liner! What truly sets the Voltage Ring apart is the fractal burned into each ring. Taking inspiration from lightning, the fractals are created by transmitting over 10,000 volts through the wood using high voltage iron probes. Electricity travels from one probe throughout the wood and back into a second probe. This unique process is what creates the incredible lightning bolt pattern seen on the outside of each ring. Each fractal is completely random meaning that no two rings will ever be identical. While fractal burning is not uncommon in larger art pieces, we are the only team currently able to apply it to jewelry, but the complexity of the Voltage Ring doesn't stop there. Once the fractals are created, they are hand filled with pure strontium aluminate glow crystals. The micro-glow crystals intake energy through uv light or heat energy and slowly emit it back out overtime as visible light. The color of the light that is emitted is dictated by the internal crystal structure which outputs a visible wavelength in the ROYGBV light spectrum The pattern that is left is known as a Lichtenberg figure and it beautifully displays the path electricity takes when flowing through a material. This complex process makes each Voltage Ring completely unique and one of a kind. The Voltage Ring was born from our goal to create a piece of jewelry that could capture the raw beauty seen in arcing electricity. Lightning is represented wonderfully in larger art pieces through the fractal burning process. Our goal was to use our combined expertise in the Jewelry industry to perfect this process and apply it to smaller pieces at scale. We took careful consideration in our design: every choice of material, color, and finish is deliberate and intentional. We love the symbolism of the rings being burned but then rebuilt to be better and brighter than ever before THE TEAM This project required the necessary experience of all three of our companies: Carbon 6's specialty in precision CNC machining allows for the two piece bands to be manufactured quickly and precisely. They�re also the only company able to produce fractal burns precise enough to be added to rings at scale. These rings wouldn't be half as amazing if they didn't have a brilliant glow solution. The Voltage Rings feature a luminescent glow liner on the inside and a glow resin inlay on the outside of the ring. Carbon Fi makes all of this possible by bringing in a proprietary resin solution that has been formulated to have the maximum glow brightness and duration. He calls it: SuperLume. The final design challenge that we faced was the inlaying and finishing process. Due to the unique nature of each ring, they need to be hand inlaid with strontium aluminate and hand finished. This is where Patrick Adair Designs shines. Featuring over a dozen seasoned artisans, they specialize in creating handmade rings making them the perfect team to hand finish each Voltage Ring. Each Voltage Ring is Born in Brooklyn, New York: The wooden stock is processed and machined into bands The titanium, carbon fiber, and lume liners are machined and inserted into the wooden band High voltage is used to burn fractals into the wood The rings then are packed and leave Brooklyn And Finished in Salt Lake City, Utah: The rings are vacuum infused with a clear resin to make them waterproof The fractals are packed with strontium aluminate glow crystals and infused with a resin (sourced from Carbon Fi in Phoenix, Arizona) Each voltage ring is carefully hand sanded then given a glossy finish The ring is packaged and shipped to the customer A finished Voltage Ring What Materials Make a Voltage Ring? Wooden Band: There are three varieties of wood available: Cherry, Walnut, and Maple. The Cherry option features a beautiful reddish-brown hue. Walnut is darker with a rich earthy tone. Our Maple wood bands feature a lighter color with an elegant, smooth grain pattern. Inserts: Titanium Insert: At 3X the strength of steel, Titanium is an excellent and straightforward choice. Featuring a polished metallic finish, it gives a traditional and professional look to your ring. We use aerospace grade titanium which is incredibly lightweight making it a perfect choice to accent the wooden band. Forged Carbon Fiber Insert: Forged Carbon Fiber is a luxury material that is commonly reserved for Super Cars (like the Lamborghini Hurracan). Hand forged in Brooklyn, New York, it features a beautiful marbled pattern that can't be found in normal Carbon Fiber. Our Forged Carbon Fiber is silky smooth and incredibly lightweight meaning most of the time you will forget it's even on your finger. Luminescent Resin Insert: Our proprietary SuperLume resin is made using the same high quality, long-lasting, and non-toxic materials found in luxury Swiss watches. It is rated to have intense glow for 10+ years. The glow is powered by UV radiation that can be found in natural sunlight or the light bulbs around your house. If you are looking to rapidly charge your voltage ring, we highly recommend you use a black light!

Hey everyone I'm DJINN! You might know me as the guy who said "No" to The Voice... TWICE! The $1000 objective has been reached! Continue to pledge and we could make a nice music video with the release of the EP! I decided I was gonna start my career as an independent. Now more than ever, you have singer songwriters that manage their career on their own and make a decent living out of it. The reason for that is that record companies don't invest in young artists as much as they used to and social media has made promotion affordable to anyone. Back in 2013 I got a message from one of the casting managers for The Voice, and he said: "I like what you do, come and audition". The thing they don't tell you when you watch the show is that there's a contract. So this is what happens, they make you sign a contract that is gonna rule the next 15 years of your career before you do the show. Because you are small and will give up anything to become a star. It's an 80 pages long contract with ridiculous details like on how much they are gonna take from you when you sell T-shirts in 10 years. And what is even more absurd is that they only talk about business never about art. You don't know with whom you're gonna work. You don't know if they are gonna understand what you are trying to create. If for some reason it doesn't work out with them you're done. In the music industry you don't get a second chance. I want to keep it real. I want my art to be true. Yes I do want to make some money like everyone else, but that is not the reason why I wake up everyday. In a way I have to thank them. Cause not signing with them, that's what got me out there. Disappointed I decided to take my amp and my guitar and do my own The Voice in the streets. See if people stop, if they turn around... I just finished recording 3 songs and now I'd like to have them mixed by a professional to get the best sound out of them. I found an awesome independent sound engineer in Los Angeles to mix them. If you wanna support me on this: With a $1000 I'll be able to print some CDs and sell them on the road. With $2000 I'll be able to make a nice music video. Summer opera galas and productions have been the tradition of Opera Libera since it was founded in 2010. Originally started by a group of Temple alumni to honor the memory of Temple Professor John Douglas, Opera Libera hopes to continue to honor him other other professors at Temple that have made a positive impact on many singers in Philadelphia. With the recent passing of Temple conductor Luis O. Biava Sr., Opera Libera would like to dedicate this summer's concert to his memory. Luis O. Biava Sr. was an avid supporter of orchestral music and opera, and a huge supporter of Opera Libera. With your help, we can continue his efforts to keep opera alive in the Greater Philadelphia area! We are grateful to have Maestro Biava's son, Luis Biava Jr. to continue the tradition of great music in the Greater Philadelphia area as the current conductor for the Opera Libera productions. However, it takes the support of an entire community to put on concerts with full orchestra and world class singers. Please help keep opera alive by supporting Opera Libera in putting on a beautiful concert dedicated to our beloved conductor Luis O. Biava Sr.!

Hi everyone! I'm Caroline and I'm raising funds to help turn my handmade felt patches and custom embroidery into a viable business. I'm a person that is always making something or working on a project, so I initially started doing embroidery for fun over a year ago, after already having a solid sewing background using a machine. I figured I could make cool things for myself while still satisfying my need to constantly create (I'm a total nerd when it comes to all the grandma hobbies!). I started posting photos of my traditional-tattoo-inspired felt patches on social media and started receiving immediate interest from friends, family, tattooers, artists and small business owners who wanted to purchase my designs or have custom patches made with their own design or ideas. Over this past year, I have made patches for wedding parties, tattoo shops, food trucks, restaurants, birthday parties, stylists, motorcycle and car clubs... the list goes on. And I only want to continue to grow. I'm raising funds to help take my burgeoning embroidery business to the next level. I want to be able to: - Contribute to the rent of my work space for the next 6 months - Purchase enough materials to have on hand to aid in the production process (felt, embroidery floss, tracing paper, a light table, shipping materials, marketing materials, etc.) and purchase more comfortable, supportive chair to sit in as I spend hours and hours hand-stitching. - Provide better packaging for merchandising, and high-quality materials so that my patches and embroidery can continue to last the test of time and wear and - Expand my reach to my customers through advertising so that I can continue to create patches and embroidery that people will wear proudly and love I am the one-woman show behind this endeavor and do everything myself, from the design creation and drawing, to the stencil making and sewing, and I truly believe in the power of amazing handmade products. I chose the style of my patches to look like traditional, 1950s American-style tattoos to harken back to the days where rolling up your sleeves and doing it yourself was a commonplace endeavor. When soldiers were returning from WWII and starting motorcycle and car clubs. When Sailor Jerry was tattooing Navy boys in Hawaii. In other words, just solid, classic and bold styles. I would love to continue to create my unique designs and keep the quality and integrity of hand-sewn, custom items alive.

Internationally recognized trumpeter & composer Charlie Porter is making his second album as a leader. Immigration Nation is contemporary art with a purpose. It carries a message that is two-fold: celebration of our rich immigrant history, as well as recognition and empathy for current immigrant struggles. In a time when immigration policy has become a heart wrenching political topic, Porter (the great grandson of Lebanese, Greek, Italian and English immigrants) felt compelled to reclaim the uniting power of the word immigrant. "We live in a time of profound polarization on the subject of immigration. Paradoxically, with the exception of Native Americans and African Americans forced into the U.S. through slave trade, every person in the U.S. has immigrant roots," says Porter. "Our nation�s ideological divide has created a gap so large that our sense of unity is in question. Fortunately, art has the power to unite and when done with intention it can be a great balm to what ails us." The American-born Jazz idiom has always welcomed the diversity of its multi-cultural constituents. Steeped in the jazz tradition, Charlie's writing explores the rich palette of human emotion involved in the immigration experience. The twelve compositions on the album include a wide range of global influences, including some from Porter�s own heritage, yet retain the core essence and language of jazz. In 2018, Charlie�s self-titled debut record garnered high praise and reviews by prominent publications such as DownBeat and Jazziz, as well as receiving worldwide airplay. After the success of Porter's debut, there is no doubt that this album will be received by an even wider audience. Giving Back Upon it's release, ten percent of all future album sales of Immigration Nation will be donated to the International Rescue Committe (IRC), to help refugees survive, recover and rebuild their lives. Recording Personnel Charlie Porter (trumpet, flugelhorn), Nick Biello (tenor saxophone), Oscar Perez (piano), David Wong (bass), Kenneth Salters (drums) and special guest Sabine Kabongo (vocals). David Wong, Oscar Perez, Charlie Porter, Kenneth Salters and Nick Biello (photo by Steve Alboucqe) CPQ Rehearsing in Brooklyn, NY (photo by Steve Alboucqe) Charlie Porter, composing at the piano Studio & Engineers The studio: Samurai Hotel Recording Studio, Astoria, NY Engineers: Grammy-Award winning engineers Mike Marciano and Max Ross Why Kickstarter? Think of it as a pre-order. For a minimum contribution of $10 you are essentially ordering this album in advance (digital download). If you can give more, we have some other great rewards (check them out to the right). Every bit helps, so please give what you can. Your contributions will help to ensure that we have what it takes to get this album off the ground. As you can imagine, there are lots of costs to cover, including: the recording studio & engineer, producer, mixing & mastering, fees for the musicians, cost of CD design and printing, etc. A minimum of $10,000 is necessary to cover most of these expenses. Any funds raised above the minimum goal will be used to pay for a PR campaign and radio promotion, which are paramount in getting the message out about the album and making sure it gets heard by the world. Thank you for your support! Project Image: The photo used for the project image was taken by Augustus Sherman. He worked as a clerk at Ellis Island in the years 1892-1925. He was an untrained, yet highly gifted photographer who created hundreds of images documenting the new arrivals to America.

Hi! I'm Andy Smith and I've been a professional comic book artist for 25 plus years, whew, that is a long time! Some of my clients include Marvel, DC, Image, Valiant, Cross Gen, and now I'm with Ominous Press drawing Demi-God and I'm the company's art director. Check out some of my work at www.andysmithart.com. Go ahead take a peek, I'll be here when you're done perusing my work. I've written three previous books on comic book art as well, "Drawing Dynamic Comics", "Drawing American Manga Superheroes", and "The How to Draw Superheroes Sketchbook" which I did in association with Render Demo. Now I bring to you my first Kickstarter for the aspiring character designer in you! "Dynamic Hero Templates" The book!!! What a perfect book for you to design in and show your friends how cool you are! When I was a kid learning to draw, I had a lot of character design ideas rolling around in my head but I wasn�t at the talent level I envisioned in my head to put them down on paper in a way I was happy with. That�s the reason I created "Dynamic Hero Templates" so whether you are an aspiring artist or someone that likes to create characters but doesn�t want too deal with the hassle of trying too draw an accurate figure now you can just open this book and start creating your characters over my blue line figure templates! On the left is my first drawing of 1st Man done when I was a kid, not exactly to the professional level that I envisioned in my head. With this book you can design your character over the ideal figure template of your choice to give it a professional look! This book is for all ages and skill levels. If your young child shows an interest in art and making up characters this book is perfect for them. If you want to design characters that have a finished polished feel this book is for you. Instead of a crude drawing of a figure that doesn�t show your design in the best light now you can design over professional figure and head templates that will showcase your design at a professional level! Love superheroes? Create your own and with the multiple templates in the book you could create your own super team! Science fiction is a fantastic genre you can explore with some of the templates in the book too! Role playing games always have you create characters and now you can fully visualize them with this book and your imagination! And with the full page head templates you can show the details of your characters fantastic faces! The book measures 11" x 8.5" in landscape format so you have ample room to draw your designs and is 48 pages in length. The book includes 8 different types of male figure physiques so you have a variety of body types to use when designing your characters. The body type of a character is an important part in the overall character design so with these body type varieties you�ll be able to create an abundant number of characters each unique in its design and physicality. � The standard iconic hero physique, featuring two different bodies with subtle differences between them. � A dwarf physique. � A hulking over-sized physique. � A child physique. � A mid-teenager physique. � A heavy-set larger physique. � A lean, thinner physique. The body types in the book, each figure type is replicated three times for you to design over. Also included in the book are 6 different head types, front and � view, so you can design the head at a larger scale then the one on the figure template to accentuate the details of the head and face. � The standard male head. � The hulking brutish head. � The child male head. � The mid-teenager head. � The heavy-set head. � The lean, thinner head. A variety of heads to design details over of your character! Each is replicated three times in the book! This book will be able to lay flat on your table for you to easily create your characters in comfortably! Each figure and head type has three pages devoted to them so you have many options for each one! Some examples from the book. Don't worry my name won't be on the pages. Charlie McElvy example! I asked my buddy Charlie to pick a template and work up a design of his as an example to show what someone that isn't a professional artist can do. Charlie is known for "The Official Handbook of the WatchGuard Universe", "The WatchGuard Source-book" , and The Chemical Plant (a HeroClix� map) Charlie- "Having created hundreds of characters on my own, and published dozens of them in various projects like "The WatchGuard Source-book", this project really spoke to me. I've used tools like Hero Machine, and others to help get me started, but what I've always needed was a set of templates that fit my goals. THANK YOU, ANDY!! This is exactly what I've always needed: base figures of various types, professional turnarounds, and a flexible set of templates from which to work. Perfect." As you can see Charlie chose the Brutish figure template and went to town! Once finished he scanned his design and added some basic color. Now that's a tough looking character I'd like to draw! Check out some of Charlie's stuff: Xion Studios, WatchGuard Comic (which I did the interior art for, shameless plug) Pledge $20 and get a copy of the book and a copy of the ultra rare 1st Man #1, my creator owned book that came out in 1997 from Image comics. I did say it's ultra rare didn't I? The iconic cover that introduced 1st Man to the world! It can be yours at this great deal of a pledge level! A sample of the interior from 1st Man! Pledge $50 and get a copy of "Dynamic Hero Templates" and "Demi-God" a 64 page hardcover graphic novel and "Black Book: The Art of Andy Smith" a 112 page art book featuring a ton of my work from throughout my career! What a deal, these all would retail for $60.00 but through the campaign you can get them for this sweet bargain price! Pledge $100 and get a head sketch inside the front cover of the book! Head sketch examples! A head sketch like this could grace the inside cover of your book! Pledge $400 and get an 11" x 17" single figure character of your choice commission! Single figure 11" x 17" commission examples! Whoa! You can get your very own 11" x 17" commission to hang on your wall with a copy of the book, just look at some of these past commissions! Pledge $400 and get a copy of "Drawing Dynamic Templates" and the original 11" x 17" cover art to Inhumans vs. X-men #1 by Ron Lim and inks by me! Pledge $400 and get a copy of "Drawing Dynamic Templates" and the original 11" x 17" cover art to Thanos vs. Hulk #4 by Ron Lim and inks by me! Pledge $1000 and get an 11" x 17" cover recreation of a cover of mine or pick one of your favorite covers to have me recreate! Cover recreation examples! What?! You can own a cover recreation now of one of your all time favorite covers...drawn by me! You read that right, look at these awesome pieces I've done for other people...now you can own one too! What's next!? Glad you asked, if this project is fully funded I will continue with Volume 2 "Dynamic Heroine Templates"! Check out some examples from that volume! Here are some examples of the templates from the "Dynamic Heroine Templates" book! What the funds are for? I know when I back a project I'd like to know where the money is going, seems reasonable. The funds for this project are for the printing of the book, which is the bulk of the cost of production, and the time I put into putting the book together. The book is complete and ready to go to the printer and that is where you come in. Shipping and handling info: PLEASE NOTE: shipping costs may vary via the addition of extra copies. The totals provided below are estimates and not final quotes. Approximate shipping amounts you should expect upon completion of the campaign: � USA: approximately $9 � Canada: $12 - $15 � EU: �7 - �14 � Aus & NZ: $22 � Asia: $35

�3 of 5� is the story of a tragic breakup� the miscommunication, painful exchanges and acceptance that flows between two individuals once so in love. This EP is the third chapter of a concept R&B album that follows an epic love story from the first encounter to the absolution of two people, just like you and I. Listen and you may come to recognize your own story through theirs. This 5 track EP is the result of over 20 months of hard work and collaboration between over 8 different artists, from writers to producers, vocalists, instrumentalists and photographers. We need your help to fund the final mixing and mastering of the tracks for release in July. Everything has been recorded, now for the finishing touches and dissemination to the masses! Thank you for being a collaborator and bringing art to the people. -Trevor Toms

Citizen Skyland is the second volume in the Cupid graphic novel series, but this time, YOU decide the story direction. All backers get a vote on whether Lilly Skyland kills or not and on whether Cupid lives or dies in Citizen Skyland. Check out some our other rewards below! We started Excavation Pictures in 2014 with the goal of producing original graphic novels that tell stories that are not addressed in mainstream media. We love our customers and believe they should help define the fate of our characters and our stories. We gave ourselves the test of publishing a feature-length graphic novel before coming to Kickstarter, and with Cupid: Under the Gold Knife (Volume I), we passed that test. We did everything ourselves, from developing the concept, to writing the script, to finding the perfect artist and traveling to comic cons to pitch our story to fellow comic book lovers. Since its release on Amazon and Comixology, Cupid Under the Gold Knife (Volume I) has maintained a perfect 5-star rating, reached the top-25 bestseller list for mystery graphic novels, and sold out at three comic cons. Cupid Under the Gold Knife Ranked #24 on Amazon's Top Mystery Graphic Novel List We put our money and time on the line to bring this to life -- our way. We were even able to get the extremely talented Glenn Fabry (cover artist for Vertigo�s Preacher series) to do our cover art without any industry connections. Now, we're looking to do it again with YOU and your help. We wouldn't ask for anything without giving you a part in the process and now that we're in a place to do that, we're excited to have you aboard in determining how the Cupid Series continues! Cupid & Citizen Skyland Sketch Art (Artists: Glenn Fabry & Adam Brown) Cupid Under the Gold Knife Unfinished & Finished Panel Art (Artist: Joaquin Gear) Cupid Under the Gold Knife Panel Art (Artist: Joaquin Gear) Cupid Under the Gold Knife Panel Art (Artist: Joaquin Gear) Excavation Pictures Ace Comic Con Booth | Chicago, IL | October 2018 Ace Comic Con PHX | January 2018 Filming our Kickstarter video at Cloud City Comics with owner Jeff Watkins (Thanks Jeff!) Cupid Under the Gold Knife (Volume 1) Cover | Artist Glenn Fabry Our first volume, Cupid: Under the Gold Knife, tells the story of Dr. Gabriel Kupidian, the world�s leading cardiothoracic surgeon. Dr. Kupidian works beneath the weight of his heavy heart, having lost his son to suicide. His celebrity status in the medical community has led to his staff dubbing him Dr. Cupid, because he mends broken hearts � literally. In his brilliance, Cupid has theorized a groundbreaking surgical technique that would allow him to alter a patient�s mind and personality through heart surgery. The procedure, named Eudemus after history�s first neurologist, alters the concentration of blood flow from the heart to the brain and vice versa in order to volumize certain regions of the brain that correspond with different behaviors. For example, a higher concentration of blood in the hypothalamus and a lower one in the amygdala produce a patient who is more docile and obedient and less aggressive, and the reverse concentration produces the opposite effects. Cupid has refused to perform the surgery since the suicide of his son, until one day when Agent Thomas Ozdemir of the FBI�s Behavioral Analysis Unit-2 recruits him. Ozdemir tells Cupid that the nation requires the good doctor�s medical expertise to save American lives, but what he really wants is Eudemus. The FBI has a captured terrorist on its hands and Ozdemir wants him to flip by any means necessary. As we pursue our mission of disrupting the comic book industry, we are coming to Kickstarter in the hopes that we can raise funds to produce and market the second graphic novel in the Cupid Universe, Citizen Skyland. In the process we would also like to bring our audience into the universe through voting on critical story arcs such as the life or death of Dr. Cupid and the mercy or vengeance of Lilly Skyland. Citizen Skyland Cover Art (Artist | Adam Brown) The second volume in the Cupid series is Citizen Skyland. It tells the story of Lilly Skyland, a recent graduate of the United States Military Academy, commonly known as West Point or simply Army. Like Cupid, Skyland is a celebrity in her field. As a cadet, her thesis work on Unmanned Aerial Vehicles (UAV), or drones, advanced the army�s fleet decades ahead of schedule. Skyland�s genius was put to the test when she used her own proprietary UAV technology to rescue New York City from an attack during the Thanksgiving Day Parade. But also like Cupid, the spotlight doesn�t come naturally to Skyland. She has been tortured by her own work since the suicide of her older brother, Jon. A West Point graduate himself, Jon last met Skyland at the presentation of her thesis, Project Endangered. He had just returned home from his last tour of duty in Afghanistan as a UAV operator. The next day Jon was dead and Skyland was alone. But not for long. Because Agent Thomas Ozdemir of the FBI has his eyes on another prize. High Level View of our estimated Citizen Skyland Production and Post Production Costs All backers get a vote on whether Lilly Skyland kills or not and on whether Cupid lives or dies in Citizen Skyland. Check out some our other rewards below! Cupid Under the Gold Knife (Volume 1) Hardcover with Certificate of Authenticity Signed by Glenn Fabry and the Excavation Team (COA is secured on the first page of the book) Citizen Skyland Graphic Novel Mockup Citizen Skyland Authentic Dog Tag & Chain Citizen Skyland Variant Poster Mockup Cupid Under the Gold Knife Variant Poster (Mockup) Excavation Pictures Dad Hat Cupid Under the Gold Knife Bookmark Kickstarter will allow us to leverage your input for Citizen Skyland to create a more interactive process to the production lifecycle and allow us to give contributors more specialized prizes and finally we are putting ourselves in a better position to do good for what originally inspired the book and to build up our fan base. We decided to name our company Excavation Pictures because we are constantly digging for original content, inspired by true stories. Cupid Under the Gold Knife (Volume 1) was inspired by both the mythical cherub we have all come to know and the late Dr. Tom Starzl who conducted the world�s first successful liver transplant. We wanted to tackle the issue of domestic terrorism through a hero whose powers were within his own two hands. His surgical expertise. The experience of publishing an original comic from start to finish was an exhilarating education. Interacting with comic book fans and getting the story out into the wild has only fueled our passion even more. To see more on Excavation Pictures check us out on the following social media platforms: Instagram: @Excavation_Pictures Twitter: @ExcavationPics

It all began just early 2016 when Kent State University professors Amy Fritsche and Courtney Brown approached playwright Catie O�Keefe with a question they wanted to see come to life on stage: What could have happened to Emilia from Othello and the Nurse from Romeo and Juliet? These two women were pivotal characters in shaping the plots of these two Shakespearian masterpieces, and yet � even though the pin hinge to the story of others � they are easily forgotten or often dismissed. After adding Jess Tanner (a then Kent graduate student) to the team, a script was developed by O'Keefe in which these two women could unravel the importance of their actions as characters in the eyes of their creator�and themselves. Aim�d so near (the new title for the most recent rendition of Best Intentions) first premiered at the Pittsburgh Fringe Festival before traveling to London, UK. And finally ending up at the Edinburgh Festival Fringe in the summer of 2016. �We always wanted this production to come home to Northeast Ohio where it was conceived, but we knew when we did it that we wanted to make some changes and explore more deeply the character�s desires and the dramatic resolution� of Aim�d so near, said O�Keefe, Artistic Director of Shark Eat Muffin Theatre Co. �You can only be in purgatory for so long before you finally decide � okay, how do I move on from here?� And now, in 2019 we present Aim�d so near as part of the inaugural BorderLight Fringe Festival in Cleveland OH in late July 2019. The Story of Aim�d so near | Two spirited women�a locked room�a tape recorder�and a kitten puzzle? Have these women met before? Their stories echo each other, but with a hazy recollection of the past while stuck in a mysterious room, it�s only a matter of time � or the lack thereof � before secrets creep out from all directions, and new and forgotten feelings take hold of the moment. Based upon two significant and courageous � but often overlooked � women from William Shakespeare�s classic dramas Romeo and Juliet and Othello. Join well-to-do Army wife Emilia and live-in nanny Angelica as they mine their memories to discover common flaws and the true reason for their confinement. They may have Aim�d so near, but will it be enough to free these women from the past or bind their fates forever.
Into the Suck review

The text - "I can't believe her and the boys are gone!?!?:( How could he? I'm devastated. Have you seen the news?" The phone call - "Can you please pray for us? John's sister was stabbed to death in the parking garage at the hospital where she works. It was her husband. Ex parte's are just a piece of paper." The news from another state - " The family of Vashti Forrest are shocked to learn of the tragic 'house fire' that took her life. Only her husband and 2 sons survived." The HOPE? Grace in the midst of suffering. Not Too Far From Here takes a look at domestic violence through the lives of 2 teenage girls. Kaffa and Darian are from two different families and yet have a common ground. Darian understands her struggles. Her and her mother, Patty, are in hiding from a man who lives with bi-polar and sociopath tendencies and refuses to seek help. Kaffa is confused by hers. Her parents are loving, Christian professionals in their communities. Why she continues to have a re-occurring nightmare of her mother killing her father in a fit of rage terrifies her. Could she be foreseeing something yet to come? But they don't argue or fight at all. Darian believes that's a sign of hidden secrets and it's only a matter of time. This film takes a look at the reality of the suffering, what happens when secrets are kept, and the freedom and hope that truth brings. It addresses how adult decisions, or lack thereof, affect the children. 7 million children live in severe domestic violent homes and could potentially repeat patterns when they become adults. It's time to stop the chaos by addressing the issues of life. The struggle between fear based and love based emotions, and how the lack of knowledge on how to cope with normal life issues can spin out of control and lead to lives shattered. No matter if we want to admit it or not, it is happening in all of our worlds, Not Too Far From Here. People can move from hurt to hope in many life moments. This film will expose those tools for success. For those that have eyes to see and ears to hear and make different choices in their lives, they can kiss domestic good-bye in their lives without it being a violent departure. The funds raised from this campaign will go to the project to: Hire storyboard artist to work with the director and producer on structure. Secure gear needed for production. Begin casting contracts, secure shot locations and cover expenses needed for casting calls.

Both Travis and Maryam have a passion for cooking, hospitality has been part of Travis life since a was little and with 20 years of experience is looking to take the next step in owning is own restaurant. Maryam over the last 4 years has been building a home based business with Matryoshka's Bakery and has a passion for french pastries. This is our opportunity to join forces and build a restaurant that features both of our talents and passion. The restaurant we are looking at is Good Times Cafe in Hinesburg where Travis grew up eating. This location has been a staple of the Hinesburg community for over 23 years and is looking for new ownership.

Snippets of the Songs! About the album Ordinary Love is my tenth recording and I know I say this every time, but I think it's going to be my favorite! I love the songs and I'm so excited to be working with so many incredible musicians here in Minneapolis. I've got the gals from The OK Factor on violin and cello, the women from Give Get Sistet share their powerful vocals, and a whole bunch of other local Minnesota folks. I've been working with Steve Kaul at Wild Sound Studios and it's been a joy to work locally. I am so excited to share two of the in-progress songs with you from this record featured in the video (Ordinary Love and The Finest Adventure). I reached my goal on June 20, 2019!!!! I am so thrilled that I know for sure that I have the funding to finish this recording, mix it with care, complete the album artwork design, the manufacturing of CDs, LPs, and other fun stuff. So now we're into the stretch goals! I really am hoping to raise $40- $50,000....If I do reach beyond my initial goal, I'd like to make music videos and hire a publicist and radio promoter to help this album really fly. Usually I make a record and spread it person by person, one show at a time. This time, I would love to try to land spots on NPR, in major music magazines, as well as in other mainstream media. And I can do all that, with your help! It's my hope that this Kickstarter campaign will give you a way to be a part of making all of this happen. There are a lot of options for sponsoring and dedicating songs, associate or executive producing the record, getting signed copies of the album, guitar lessons, and so much more! **Video photo credits: Thank you to Michael Charney, Steve Kaul & Terri Delaney for the wonderful photos! About Ellis About Ellis I am a contemporary folk artist. This is my 10th solo album. I can hardly believe how lucky I have been and continue to be in this indie folk music career. I suppose I always think my best songs are ahead of me, but y'all I think this collection will be my most mature and moving recording effort yet! For folks (maybe like you) who already know me, you know that it is my life�s work to practice being undefended and open; to write songs from that place and offer them wholeheartedly. I believe songs are powerful, and at their best, they can connect people to themselves and to one another. I LOVE recording my songs! It's a way to give them the chance to come to life outside of any live performance. I aspire to make recordings that are beautiful and feel alive like an oil painting with color, perspective, and depth, along with a story that lives inside each song that hopefully feels like an old friend. I want to inspire laughter and acceptance and appreciation of all the beautiful things right here without pushing away the troubles that can feel so heavy and break our hearts. I hope to make this an album that you love, and become friends with, and that you want to carry around with you every single day. I can't wait for you to hear it.

Phase 1: The Kickstart Too many people have said, "you should sell these." And after walking art fairs and seeing what is out there, I want to give it a go. The initial Kickstarter amount is enough to: Form the LLC (e.g., state filings, insurance, banking) Fulfill all Kickstarter Project Rewards As soon as we reach the goal, I will filepaperwork for the LLC and, once approved, announce the new name of the company! Photos Each reward level is offered as a photo. You get to pick which one you want (except for the lowest tier Thank You cards). Keep scrolling to see your options! Thank You Card Americana Still Life No. 2 This barn photo will be used for the Thank You cards for Backers. You can also use it as a choice of 5x7 or 8x10. 5x7 Prints & 5x7 Double-Matted Prints All 5x7 and 8x10 prints are professionally produced on Kodak Professional Endura Premier paper with a lustre sheen. It generally takes about a week from when I place the order with the lab to have it delivered to my doorstep. I will then sign, mat and bag each item. Grey Chicago Idahoan Fields Last Stop Winter at Salt Creek Winter on the Fox Sunrise Chicago 8x10 Any of the above photos are available as an 8x10 with a double mat. However, please keep in mind that the cropping will be slightly different (more square). Email me if you have a concern. Metal Print This is NOT a metallic print. This print is literally printed onto a piece of aluminum 2mm thick and coated with a protective gloss. It will be fitted with a kickstand hanger in the back for desk or wall mounting. Only available in Sunrise Chicago, it will be produced as an 8x12: Sunrise Chicago (metal print, 8x12) Bonus 1 If we hit $750, I'll post a video update with my gratitude. I'm normally the one behind the camera, not in front of it, so this is basically the equivalent of a digital dunk-tank. At this level of funding, I can fully produce my initial stock of 5x7 photos, mats, bags, etc. and start selling them locally. Bonus 2 At $1,000, I'll add the names of any backer (if you indicate you want it added) to my website and to the LLC's website when it launches for a minimum of 180 days. I'll come up with some clever tier titles and announce it across my social channels (Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Pinterest). Every backer will also get a Thank You postcard (but not more than one). Bonus 3 At $1,500, I'll unlock holographic labels and Certificates of Authenticity for each matted print and metal print sent to Backers. Normally holographs and certificates will only be used on 11x14 and larger prints, so you'd be getting a very unique and limited reward. Funding me at this level will allow me to stock all 5x7, 8x10 and 11x14 prints, mats and materials needed for the first art show sale. Above and beyond Of course, this is just the Kickstarter. Once we move beyond Bonus 3, I'll be better able to invest in the business with a display tent, display panels, and other equipment needed to run a booth at an art show.

A message from Kathryn and Mickey Welcome to our Folk Opera Kickstarter page. With your help, we will be able to finish our most ambitious musical project to date! Our Folk Opera will combine the unique sound and perspective we have developed as experienced musicians and performers with a socially relevant storyline and a score intentionally composed with traditional folk instrumentation. At this time, the writing process is nearly complete. This is just step one, however, as we prepare to record, engineer, and promote the album. We couldn't be more excited about the creatively challenging work that lies ahead. We can't wait to have the finished album and artwork to ship off to you and present to the world! Our Folk Opera idea began three years ago in the studio as we were recording our second album "Till We Know Better." While building sound effects for some of the story centered songs, we laughed about how fun it would be to write a complete concept album in our style of acoustic folk. Like many of our musical heroes before us had written "rock operas", we jokingly decided that the world needed a "folk opera", and we would be just the folks to write it. How were we to know that our pie in the sky idea would turn into the most creatively fueled project of our lives? We have spent the last two and a half years formulating the characters and storyline, composing thematically motivated music, and brainstorming ways to make the Folk Opera the best it can be. This included putting together a team full of award-winning and critically acclaimed musicians, artists, engineers, and producers. Our goal is to deliver a concept album that combines our love of theater with our passion for songwriting and folk music. The Folk Opera is driven by character development, socially relevant subject matter, soaring melodic themes, and compelling visual art. Here are a couple images from our January trip out to GNAH Studios Inc in Los Angeles where we did our first Folk Opera artwork meeting. First meeting in LA with our Folk Opera artist, Avi Renick At GNAH Studios Inc. in Los Angeles Our award winning artist, Avi Renick, will be creating original artwork for all the characters and locations in the story. One of our creative Kickstarter reward tiers is to have you send our artist a picture of yourself to be rendered into Folk Opera art. Check out the "rewards" section of our Kickstarter page for all information about our rewards tiers. We had a blast recording our Kickstarter video with Marcel Ardans of Lessons with Marcel. Marcel is a talented YouTuber and we are proud to have him on our Folk Opera team. Filming our Kickstarter video We are also reuniting with our friend Rob Diaz de Villegas from WFSU-TV. Rob is responsible for asking us to write the television Theme Song for Local Routes which went on to win a Suncoast Emmy Award. Rob will be helping us document the creative progress of the Folk Opera. We always enjoy glimpses into our favorite artists' creative methods and feel our supporters will want to see Rob's documentary about "the making of" the Folk Opera. meeting with Rob Diaz de Villegas of WFSU-TV with Rob Diez de Villegas at the 2016 Suncoast Emmy Awards We are thrilled to work with talented musicians like Cory Walker. We met with Cory down in the Florida Keys to go over his musical role on the Folk Opera. Cory is world class and we are excited to have his virtuosic touch on the banjo. Here is a picture of Cory listening to Folk Opera demos for the first time. meeting with Cory Walker in the Florida Keys We do plan to take a small break from recording the Folk Opera in July to venture North for our Summer Tour! New York City, here we come! Visit Belle and The Band for more info on our upcoming tour and performances. 2019 Summer Tour poster Thank you in advance for contributing to our Folk Opera Kickstarter! Your contributions will go directly into every aspect of bringing this idea to reality. Paying for musicians, studio time, creating sound effects, engineering, and promoting the album will all be made possible by your generous contributions. We will keep you updated of our progress along the way. Folk Opera is about telling a story -- Thank you for helping us tell ours! Peace and Love, Mickey and Kathryn performing at Suwannee Roots Revival

"Keep your children with you, wherever you go!" DESCRIPTION Childcare Management is a critical function, especially considering the hustle and bustle of modern life that promotes working flex hours, having multiple part-time jobs, or enrolling in continuing education deep into adulthood. There is much more being demanded from adults these days- adults who may also be parents. When time is a luxury, busy parents need information on the go. PINWHEEL is designed to work on mobile and desktop devices, and allows daycare staff to interactively engage parents via direct messaging, child attendance tracking, daily reports, and multimedia sharing. Parents may use the application for free, and can pay invoices generated by the daycare for services rendered. PINWHEEL also facilitates proper management of the daycare by providing mechanisms to generate invoices to clients, collect payment, track teacher-child ratios, review staff timesheets, and publish a calendar for parents and staff to view. DESIGN DRAFT Click here to view the entire Layout of the Landing Page!!! PLANNED FEATURES Responsive, hybrid website / mobile application Multi-tiered user account system, flexible by design so that Parents could also even be Childcare Providers PayPal integration with client invoicing (Provider to Parents), and subscription payments (Website to Providers) Staff timesheets Child attendance tracker Teacher-child ratio tracking Direct messaging system Multimedia uploading and tagging Calendar and schedules Child daily journals/reports Multilanguage Support Social Media Sign-in

CLONSTERS combines the weirdness and humor of 90s cartoons like "Aaahh! Real Monsters" with the whimsy and heart of modern day animation like "Adventure Time." CLONSTERS is back with another volume, and this time we're going planetary. CLONSTERS: SPACE NUGGETS is about a world of strange, lovable monsters who discover the existence of aliens. With the heart of a Pixar film and the off-kilter humor of your favorite 90s cartoon, CLONSTERS: SPACE NUGGETS is an adventure that is truly for all ages. An interior page from CLONSTERS: SPACE NUGGETS by incredible series artist, Vanessa Cardinali! Love weird little monsters? Love aliens? CLONSTERS: SPACE NUGGETS IS THE BOOK FOR YOU AND YOUR FAMILY! I'm PAT SHAND and I'm proud to present to you my 12th Kickstarter. I write CLONSTERS with my wife AMY SHAND, who you might also know as the co-writer/creator of the successfully funded graphic novel PRISON WITCH. VANESSA CARDINALI returns as the series artist, creating an immersive and beautiful fantasy world in full, stunning color. Our lead character is an Earth Nugget named POLLY, who rescues and breeds cat-like creatures called SPLATS. Joined by a SEA NUGGET named NIMAE and the reformed splat-hunter JEKKA, Polly sets out once again to save her world from an alien invasion. CLONSTERS: SPACE NUGGETS will be 70 pages bursting with extras and fun features to enrich the epic story. We might even be able to expand the story itself if we hit stretch goals... Take a look at some art! Interior pages from CLONSTERS: SPACE NUGGETS CLONSTERS: SPACE NUGGETS is action-packed, hilarious adventure for both kids and adults We have two covers available. One by VANESSA CARDINALI and our limited edition variant by PLUME creator / AFTERGLOW artist K. LYNN SMITH. Also, if you missed CLONSTERS VOLUME ONE, get that book here as well! That book told the epic story of Polly's quest to find out where all the Splats have gone, which leads her on a hilarious journey across her world. Take a look at Volume One in this video! You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. So many people got the book itself along with custom clay creations made by Amy. One of our biggest supporters, Zack Oconnor, even got a Clonsters tattoo! Jump on board and we promise you'll fall in love with this whimsical world. All the characters in this graphic novel are based on original polymer clay creations that Amy hand-crafted. Amy created Earth Nuggets, Space Nuggets, Sea Nuggets, Pocket Robots, Pocket Stones, Splats, and more -- so we essentially have an entire line of toys tying in to the graphic novel series. SEE US gives readers a rare and personal look into the lives of 5 visually impaired young adults from NYC as they juggle their responsibilities between home, and work. Those featured in this book share their feelings about their disability with candid photographs that expose readers to the lives of a group of teens experiencing adult hood. As a Program Director for an internship program that serves blind and visually impaired young adults, this is a project that I feel will shed new light on people with visual impairments. Watching the participants in my program grow right before my eyes as they go through different work experiences through out the year has been a blessing. But this book is not a promotional tool for my program, it is to inform people that despite a visual impairment, these young adults from diverse backgrounds are eager to find their way in the world and show others what they can do, how they do it, and what they go through along the way. The young adults featured in this book will be photographed during their summer 2019 work semester. Each working at a different site of their choice, all with different career goals. If all goes well with the book, a documentary will follow.
