What if we could translate the human experience, as described through the Enneagram, into a series of paintings -- landscapes, aerial photos, or a bird's-eye-view of the home from here. What if there was a way to experience the Enneagram metaphorically -- something that felt like a drone photo of the path ahead, a map folded up in your pocket, and maybe, perhaps even a mirror of yourself. Could it make all of this human experience less morpheus, and a little bit more tangible? Could we better understand and give grace to each other, if we knew the kind of path they tread? These questions were inspired by my time painting the artwork for Sleeping at Last's "Four" music video, and I set out on a nine month deep-dive into enneagram theory, and how to translate our shared experiences as humans, into landscapes -- into art. Over the months that followed I read books, listened to podcasts, poured over enneagram-based songs, spoke with hundreds of people, and studied the language our Earth already uses. I wanted these paintings to be tied to real places in the world, places our feet really can traverse, as that would give even more grounding to what we experience in our minds and hearts, which can sometimes feel like a vast and overwhelming expanse. As much fun as it would be (and how much easier on me as the artist!) these are not paintings of what each Enneagram type likes. Instead, I�m aiming to represent who they are. And to do this I had to reach beyond myself and my own interpretations of life. I asked hundreds of people these questions: "If your internal landscape was an actual place here on Earth, what would it be? What biosphere could be used to represent what it feels like to be you, and what your journey looks like? If your internal processing, fears, motivations, virtues were a landscape, what would it be?" Compiling their answers, my understanding of Enneagram theory, and my interpretation of the world's textures, I created a sort of vocabulary that I could pull from to create these maps. [CLICK HERE TO SEE THE PLACES IN THE NATURAL WORLD THAT INSPIRED EACH PIECE] I wanted the paintings to "read" from left to right, coming from the disintegration type and childhood wound, and traveling across the landscape, heading into health. I wanted each piece to depict a different biosphere, and capture the vast variety and beauty of both our world and humanity. I wanted the depictions to include the type's distraction possibility, fear, obstacles, core struggle, growth point, and virtue. And above all, when a piece was on the wall of its type, I wanted it to feel familiar. After each painting, I shared it with a core community of each type, hearing their interpretations and insights, tweaking things when it was needed, and processing with them. You guys were AMAZING! And this project honestly wouldn't be what it is apart from you! I said it so many times during that process, and I'll say it many more: I feel so honored and privileged to be able to do this project with and for people like you! ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ After months of painting, study, and repainting, here are the Nine base Enneagram pieces! WANT TO KNOW THE INSPIRATION, METAPHORS, EASTER EGGS, AND MORE HIDDEN WITHIN YOUR PIECE? When you support this project you will get exclusive access to videos I am sharing throughout this campaign. There is one video for each painting, showing the planning, inspiration, hidden metaphors, time-lapse of its creation, and more. These videos have been incredibly encouraging to the backers who have watched them, and I hope they will encourage you as well. BUT WAIT, THERE'S MORE Because these maps were done reading left to right, the paintings can be lined up by their integration direction!! Like this: This is an easy way to see which type you pull from in stress (taking on that type's negative characteristics) and which type you lean into in growth (taking on their positive characteristics.) For example, if you are a Nine, you pull from Six in stress, and lean into Three in growth. Not only can these effects be seen in each painting, but when lined up, you can see the story of our human experiences carry through each piece! And let me just say, we humans are pretty dang amazing together! Now, if you know your Enneagram theory, you know there's a core part to this whole thing we haven't talked about yet. Where are the wings? Never fear, friends. Using a double-exposure technique (yes, think a digital version of the film photography technique) I overlaid the paths of each Enneagram wing pairing (there are 18!) to create images for every one! 9w8 is different than 8w9 after all! CLICK BELOW TO WATCH AN EXAMPLE OF THE TRANSITIONS BETWEEN WINGS: [Seen here: 7 - 7w8 - 8w7 - 8 - 8w9 - 9w8 - 9] You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00 That means, in total, there are 27 images -- 9 base types + 18 wing pairings! Whichever map you resonate with most can now be in your hands and on your wall -- a constant reminder of your beauty and the beauty of your journey! ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ ALRIGHT, HOW DO I GET THESE IN MY HOME? You are in the right place! This Kickstarter campaign is the first and currently the only place to purchase these prints! We want to cover costs of their creation, and fund their distribution out into the world! There are three sizes to choose from, and all are made to be durable, ready to be displayed wherever you need an encouraging reminder. Printed on metallic paper, they literally GLOW, and because they are mounted on 2mm styrene, and sprayed with a luster coating, they can be hung directly on a wall, sit on a display shelf, go in a glass-less frame, or almost any other standard frame! ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ WHAT HAPPENS IF WE HIT THE FUNDING GOAL? The FUN has only just begun! Here's what else we would like to do: 10K STRETCH GOAL -- NEW REWARD TIER: After seeing the impact these paintings can have on the community -- how it can shine a light on our journey towards health, and help us see each other and ourselves with more grace -- I want to create a functional tool that can bring this artwork off the walls and into your conversations. We came up with the idea to make a pocket-sized box set, with all 27 paintings, and the explanation for each written on the back. I see these being a wonderful tool for coaches, and for communities who want to explore the enneagram together. The cards are printed on plastic, completely washable, durable, and perfect for spreading out on the coffee shop table. I would love to make these a reality, and need your help to do it! > > AND YOU DID IT! < < On day 10 of this campaign you shot us past our 10K stretch goal, making the production of these cards possible! Here's a short video of their features! What you see here: There will be cards with all 27 paintings on the fronts (this sample pack only has the ones that were completed when we ordered it.) The back of each painting will have information on the type, and the metaphors in the painting. There are additional cards with info on the project, how to read the paintings, and basic enneagram info. The titles of the types on the top of the card are color coded for ease in finding a specific type. Flexible, non-tearing, won't crease or fold. Can line up by number, wings, or integration direction. Coffee-safe, washable, waterproof. You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00 NEXT STRETCH GOAL @ $15,000 If we hit $15,000 before the end of the campaign I will open the option for you to get a CUSTOM DOUBLE-EXPOSURE, with any landscapes you choose! These are surprisingly time-consuming original creations using a digital technique to layer the paintings I created. Each one takes a few hours to perfect -- longer than it takes to paint it in the first place! There are many different implementations of this concept! Think relationship combination, tritype, etc. Here's a time-lapse of the **first half** of a combination of 1w9 and 7w8: You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00 And the finished product as an example of what you can have created especially for you! ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ WHAT ARE PEOPLE SAYING ABOUT THIS PROJECT? ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ WANT TO LEARN MORE ABOUT THE ENNEAGRAM? IS THERE A TEST? I do not usually suggest Enneagram tests as a way to type yourself. Having studied the creation of psych tests/assessments, and how to make accurate personality tests, the Enneagram is very hard to test accurately. That said, Your Enneagram Coach came out with a new *FREE* test recently, and it has had very good results. You can take it here. And my suggestion? Look into the top 2-3 type results. There are great resources on the test's site, as well as simple references at The Enneagram Institute. Study the core fears, motivations, virtues, levels of health, etc. of your results, and see which fits you best! Remain a student, don't feel stuck, and see where this journey takes you! The resources below will also help a TON! TO READ: I cannot suggest Chris Heuertz's book "The Sacred Enneagram" too highly. It is a fantastic, grace-filled, growth-focused resource. I have mine within arm's reach most of the day. FIND IT IN A BOOKSTORE NEAR YOU, OR BUY A COPY ON AMAZON! Other good Enneagram books I've read are "The Road Back to You" by Ian Morgan Cron and Suzanne Stabile, and it's amazing follow-up "The Path Between Us" by Suzanne Stabile. TO LISTEN: The above books can be found as audiobooks, but when you want to stretch beyond book format, here are some absolutely incredible resources. PODCAST Ryan O'Neal of Sleeping at Last, and Chris Heuertz of "The Sacred Enneagram" come together in an incredible podcast series, discussing each Enneagram type, and the song Ryan created for them. YOU DO NOT WANT TO MISS THESE. I've cried at nearly every single one. Listen on Spotify or iTunes. The final podcast Episode, for Enneagram Nine just released today (June 7th) and you can listen to it here! MUSIC As mentioned above, Sleeping at Last has been crafting songs for each Enneagram type, and every adjective I could use would fall immensely short. They are works of art -- beautiful and packed full of grace. (This is actually how I discovered the Enneagram!) If you have an idea which Enneagram type you might be, go check them out, and bring the tissues! "One" through "Eight" are on Spotify, and "Nine" is releasing on June 7th -- during this campaign! This will finish out the Enneagram series he began over a year ago! You don't want to miss it! "Nine" is out! Listen to it here! DEEP DIVE: Want to deep-dive into this whole enneagram thing? Then I have a course for you! Beth McCord of Your Enneagram Coach, has created amazing grace-filled and growth-oriented courses. Having worked with her throughout this project, I can guarantee that you will come away enCOURAGEd, enriched, and ready. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ I HAVE SO MUCH TO BE THANKFUL FOR! And to all of my family, community, those on Instagram/Facebook, or "in real life", thanks for letting me deep-dive into the Enneagram and for geeking out with me. Thank you for the hundreds of conversations, for the encouragement, reflection, redirection. Thank you for sharing your stories, with me. They are gold, that I hope in some way I have melted down into the very ink of these paintings. I hope you feel honored. I hope you feel you belong. I hope you know you are loved, dear ones. This is for you. Beth McCord, thank you for the amazing generosity of your time and spirit. You cheered me on, checked in on me, let me ramble, and geeked out with me over all of these mutual passions. Thank you for being a second pair of eyes, and for believing in my vision for this project. Chris Heuertz, thank you for your wonderful, grace-filled interpretation of the Enneagram. Between your podcasts, your amazing book, and checking in over email, I felt like I constantly had a place where I could get grounded, and remember the deep & good truths. Ryan O'Neal, this project is finally happening, and you are such a core foundation in this story! Thanks for finding me last year and bringing me along in your amazing work. Thanks for geeking out with me about the Enneagram over the phone and in the studio, and for being the first person to say, "Hey, that painting looks like an Eight!" In the midst of creating your own incredible work with the Enneagram, you've cheered this on, and been such an inspiration. Your songs are the backbone of these artworks and hope they can echo even the slightest melody of the gift you've given this world. Leslie, so many of our conversations over the last few months revolved around the Enneagram on this project. You sat on the porch with me and let me rant, ramble, process, fall apart, and come back together. You're to thank for having the idea that Threes could be depicted as a desert, for the underwater volcano in Nine, and for thinking of Antelope Canyon for Six but letting me come to it on my own. I can't think of my journey in this project without remembering all our conversations, and I can't thank you enough. Now we're 900 miles apart, but this art is forever a memorial of our collaboration, and the beauty of our shared human experiences. Paul, my dear husband, through this crazy year of transitions, your constant reminders were such an encouragement to me. "What about that enneagram project?" "You still hoping to launch your project in May?" And when the time came to sprint you sprinted with me. Late nights, early mornings, teaching me to use Slack and then fixing it for me when I did it wrong. You're always the strength and ambition and adventure in these projects, and I'm so excited to add another one to our list. You're my favorite. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ MUSIC: "Seven (Instrumental)" by SLEEPING AT LAST VIDEO: Created by Alexander Jones of DNA VISIONS VA SURVEYS, ADD-ON STORE, AND POST-CAMPAIGN SUPPORT PROVIDED BY:

Sample Pride Pins created for this campaign. It's Pride Month. You deserve to be proud. Sometimes it�s hard to show your pride. Sometimes people call you fake, or say you don�t belong, but you can�t be afraid. You are valid and you will not be erased. PRIDE PINS is a collection of enamel pins displaying animals holding pride flags. Show your pride. You deserve it. Fursona Pins proudly brings you high quality enamel pins. Our previous Kickstarter campaign, Carry the Stars in Your Hands, was an enormous success, raising $23,473 by its amazing backers. Over ten thousand pins were delivered to customers who backed the campaign and purchased over $6,800 in add-ons through Backerkit afterwards, putting the final total at over $30,000 raised in our first campaign. This new campaign is more ambitious. With a final stretch goal of $40,000, we're excited to bring you an amazing set of pins representing LGBT identities. When you back Pride Pins or purchase anything from Fursona Pins, you can confidently know you're purchasing from a minority and LGBT-owned business. Representation is crucially important. We are proud to do our part. Will you join us? Let's begin! Last 24 Hours! Pride Pins is currently the #1 most funded enamel pin Kickstarter in history, and the most funded LGBT project live on Kickstarter right now. That's all thanks to you, our amazing backers! Current Stretch Goal: We are pleased to present a campaign where your identity is NOT a stretch goal. Each milestone represents the unlocking of all flags for each animal. The identities we are proud to represent in our campaign are below... as introduced by our campaign mascots, the Pride Pals: Flynn the Fox is our Pride Pal for the Gay Pride Flag. Also known as the Rainbow Flag, the Pride Flag, or the LGBT Flag, this flag is flown to show solidarity among all LGBT folks. Wilde the Wolf is our Pride Pal for the Bisexual Pride Flag. This flag is flown to show support for bisexual identity, those with attraction to two or more genders. Harley the Hyena is our Pride Pal for the Lesbian Pride Flag. It is flown to show support for lesbian identities: women who are attracted to other women. Riley the Red Panda is our Pride Pal for the Pansexual Pride Flag. It is flown to show support for pansexual identity: attraction to all (or regardless of) genders. Corbin the Cheetah is our Pride Pal for the Asexual Pride Flag. It is flown to show support for asexual identity: a lack of sexual attraction to any gender. Dakota the Deer is our Pride Pal for the Demisexual Pride Flag. It is flown to show support for demisexual identities: those who only experience sexual attraction with a strong emotional bond. Desi the Dragon is our Pride Pal for the Polyamory Flag. It is flown to show support for polyamory identity: consensual intimate relationships with more than one partner. Toby the Tiger is our Pride Pal for the Transgender Pride Flag. It is flown to show support for transgender identity: identifying as a gender other than the one assigned at birth. Willow the Wild Dog is our Pride Pal for the Genderfluid Pride Flag. It is flown to show support for genderfluid identity: one who does not identify as having a fixed gender. Finn the Fennec is our Pride Pal for the Genderqueer Pride Flag. It is flown to show support for genderqueer identity: one who identifies with neither, both, or a combination of male and female genders. Seth the Shark is our Pride Pal for the Polysexual Pride Flag. It is flown to show support for polysexual identity: attraction to multiple genders but not all. Raz the Rat is our Pride Pal for the Agender Pride Flag. It is flown to show support for agender identity: one who is genderless or lacking gender. Robin the Rabbit is our Pride Pal for the Aromantic Pride Flag. It is flown to show support for aromantic identity: one who is without romantic attraction. Lark the Lion is our Pride Pal for the Non-Binary Pride Flag. It is flown to show support for non-binary identity: one whose gender falls outside the binary of male and female. Roman the Raccoon is our Pride Pal for the Straight Ally Flag. It is flown to show support and solidarity for LGBT folks. This or the Rainbow Flag can be flown by straight allies to show support! Though our Pride Pals are super cute, the fun doesn't end there. You can mix and match our unlocked species and any pride flag you wish. Read on to see which species we have unlocked throughout the course of this campaign! Pride Pins is the #1 LGBT Kickstarter live right now. We want to be more inclusive, too! The following Pride Pals enamel pins are available exactly as-is: these flags are only present on their exact animal below, and are not available to the other species. We have these Pride Pals because we want to include other identities that have been requested throughout the campaign to be more inclusive for all our customers! More coming. This campaign features twenty five beautiful animals. Remember, your identity is not a stretch goal. When an animal unlocks, all of its flags unlock with it. I have been a licensed nail technician for the past 6 years but unfortunately I have been diagnosed with carpal tunnel and it really makes it hard for my clients to sit through my sets since it takes me longer than other techs. Not only is it embarrassing when I have to say sorry every time I take for ever but I loose clients and that is my bread and butter for my family, even when I bring my prices down for taking so long most of them don't come back. I'm in love with what I do but because of the pain shooting in my hands it's hard to hold items in my hands and at times I loose the strength in my hands and do to that I can't hold certain jobs witch make it hard for me to provide for my family financially when I can't book people for nail sets. I'm not able to work fast but man can I sure make some beautiful art work when I can take my time. I know how to mix and make amazing acrylic colors and for this reason I know deep inside of me that I can make a small business with personal colored acrylics grow like wild fire and this would help me tremendously to make ends meet. I would like to thank you for taking the time to read my story and hope that not only can you provide me with your support but also know that you are making a huge difference in my family's life since I plan to leave this business to my children. All of this will be possible with the beautiful seed you planted. Thank You!!

My name is Jordan Johnson. Welcome to my Kickstarter! When I first decided to leave Jehovah�s Witnesses, I knew that I wanted to eventually pen my story. However, at first I struggled with finding my own special angle. I hadn�t done anything that thousands of other young men in the organization hadn�t already done. I graduated high school, pioneered straight away, qualified to become a ministerial servant while still a teenager, and waited for my time to arrive until I finally received the letter that so many young Jehovah's Witness men covet: �Dear Brother Johnson. We are pleased to inform you that your services are needed at Bethel.� I have read around a dozen books published by former Jehovah's Witnesses. I have read a few more dozen forum posts of life stories from people that had realized that Jehovah�s Witnesses do not actually have �The Truth." There seemed to be nothing especially outstanding about my story. But that�s when it occurred to me; there isn�t anything special about my story. That�s what makes my story so important. By all accounts, there is no reason why I should have woken up from the indoctrination into the religion of my parents. In my teenage years, being one of Jehovah's Witnesses wasn�t exactly my burning desire. Even so, I never considered leaving it altogether. Become inactive? Maybe. Be disciplined? Sure. But never in my life did I think that I would ever put my foot down and say: �This isn�t the truth, I�m leaving.� I have read stories of people that went through hell with their parents or elders in their congregations. Some were sexually abused, physically assaulted, and emotionally tortured. There are some terrible stories about what people experienced as a result of being one of Jehovah�s Witnesses. I was fortunate in that I never had to experience anything like that. I have to admit that I had a really good upbringing. This is why I feel my story is so important. My story isn't the outlier; it's the norm. I am living proof that anyone can wake up from the indoctrination of Jehovah�s Witnesses. I never set out to be a �JW Activist�. It just kind of fell in my lap. I originally started writing about my experience in my English 201 class. My professor indulged me as I completed every assignment for that class writing papers about my time spent as a JW. For the capstone project, we were supposed to create an informational document about an important social issue. A brochure, a poster board, a blog, a YouTube video. When she and I were discussing what I was going to do, she said she thought a perfect project for me would be to make a blog and contribute a few articles about my time as a JW. Thus, JW Rebuttal was born. I originally intended it to be merely a thought experiment. I have long wanted to be a writer, and so I intended the blog to be a way of me forcing myself to write more. Plus I had wanted to remain anonymous, and the blog allowed me to write under the pen name �Mark Harris�, a character from my favorite book of all time. Sadly, life doesn�t ever go according to plan. In June of 2018, I could no longer hide the fact that I didn�t want to be one of Jehovah's Witnesses anymore. It just didn�t seem worth it to me. My parents kicked me out of their house and I found myself with my entire world taken away from me. To keep myself from going crazy, I thought that I would create a video where I simply talked to the camera about my experience. I set up my phone on a makeshift tripod using a stack of my schoolbooks, sat on my $150 Costco mattress that was laying on the floor, hit record and just kept talking. I did three takes, did a little editing, and despite my best efforts 98 minutes was as short as I could get it. I uploaded this video thinking nobody would ever watch it. It didn�t matter anyways. I was merely using it as a springboard for me to post my rants on YouTube and talk about my desire to run away. I went to bed, not knowing what I would wake up to. 1000 views. 2000 views. 5000 views. 10,000 views. The video had gone semi-viral in the exJW community on YouTube, and as a result I began to receive hundreds of messages of love and support. The video finally slowed down around 60,000 views after merely a few months, but still gains a few hundred a month. At the time of writing this, it sits at just shy of 90,000 views. Not only did a lot of people watch my story video, but a lot of them actually subscribed to my channel. As I continued to upload videos where I would just ramble about my experience as a JW, my subscriber count kept going up, and so did the people reaching out to me on social media. That's why I say that I "accidentally became a JW activist." I thought, as JW activists do, that I should share my complete story in a book that people can read. Heck, even if nobody reads it, at least I�d have the satisfaction of knowing that I had completed my life�s dream and written a book that I was passionate about. But even so, I knew that I needed to find my own unique angle. It wasn't until I read Amber Scorah's book about her amazing experience waking up as a JW missionary in China that I finally realized what I wanted to do. Her story is in my top 3 pieces of exJW content of all time, and now she released a full book! I read the entire thing in one sitting. Her book breathed new life into me. I sat down that night to sketch out my own memoir and I wrote just shy of 20,000 words in a straight eight hour session. Something that I have struggled with my entire life is learning to put the past behind me. When you wake up one day and realize that you have given 25 years of your life to a cult, that feeling of �a life wasted� becomes so strong that it can paralyze you. This book is me saying goodbye to the past once and for all. It's a letter to 17 year old me. It's the advice I wish I had received instead of the words of encouragement from that elder 10 years ago...

Hello, and Welcome! My name is Rachelle, and I'm a self-taught artist living in Truth or Consequences, New Mexico, USA. For several years I had wanted to try my hand at ceramics, and in 2018 it finally happened. I stumbled upon and into the craft and fell in love. I am beyond excited to explore this medium, and to develop my own techniques and methods. I've completed over two dozen pieces, including: tumblers, mugs, bowls, pet dishes and ring dishes. Thrown, trimmed, ready for the bisque fire! Large Porcelain Bowl. Take this opportunity to help an artist develop and create! I'm looking forward to adding ceramics to my repertoire! My amazing partner, Joseph - a talented writer and musician - came up with the name for my Ceramic Studio: "Mercurial Creations, Musings of A Butterfly". Under this fun new title, I plan to make functional and unique pottery (as well as art/sculptural pieces in the near future) to be used and enjoyed every day, Zia Ombre, Orange Interior, Small Porcelain Cup WHAT CAN YOU GET IN EXCHANGE FOR YOUR HELP? I'll be ordering PORCELAIN to make your rewards. High-end pottery is commonly made of porcelain as it is the most durable form of clay. The finished product is: food safe non-stick non-porous dishwasher safe microwave safe  REWARDS  -> FREE SHIPPING for all rewards <- Fabric bookmark, screen printed and stitched by me. (7" x 2") Hand-Printed Fabric Bookmark Bee Bowl (various colors to chose from) Bee Ring Dish, Brown Stoneware Pet dishes - cat or dog (various colors to choose from) Cat Dish, Stoneware Succulent Planter (various colors to choose from) Succulent Planter Sunshine Mug (various colors to choose from) Sunshine Mug, Brown Stoneware. The goal of $3,500 will fund: Kiln purchase, transportation and installation. ($1,590) Kiln shelves & other kiln supplies. ($100) Throwing wheel. (1,200) Banding wheel (used to trim & decorate pots). ($90) Electrical work for kiln. ($335) Clay & Glaze ($185) Brown Stoneware Bowl Please keep in mind: Kickstarter is all or nothing - I have to reach the goal in order to benefit from your support. Thank you SO MUCH for taking a look at my project, feel free to share with friends and family, together we can keep handmade and HOME-made possible.

Project Description This woodworking kit gives you a fun project to build for all levels. This can just be a fun build and it gives you a few tips for anyone who has or hasn�t woodworked before. For beginners this will help you get started in your woodworking adventure. All the pieces come precut. Why I Decided to Make the Woodworking Kit I created this kit for several reasons. I loved building lego sets as a kid and every birthday and Christmas that�s all I would ask for. I grew out of legos and was looking for a fun hobby to do and discovered woodworking. I designed my first project and then realized the amount of tools I needed. I was fortunate enough to receive some of my neighbors old tools which helped me start but realized how do other people get started with a low budget and thought of making building kits. Another reason I created these kits was because I loved building lego sets but then I would never know what to do when I was done. I would play with them for a few days, then they would just gain dust around my house. This kit creates three builds that you can use and keep forever. Who I Am My name is Thomas Temperley and I am 14 years old. I�ve enjoyed building almost anything since I was a little boy. It started with legos and moved to woodworking. I also attended a program called YEA(Young Entrepreneur Academy) which helped me create my business. This taught me a lot about starting a business. What�s Included All you need is a hammer and tape, everything else is included in this kit. You will get a barcode that you scan and there is a video from opening the box to admiring your creations. Each kit has the materials for a tissue box, picture frame and tool box. Kit(Snow White) This shows the Snow White kit once you have finished building and painting it. Tissue Box This is the tissue box that comes in your kit. The wood is 1/2 in wide and the dimensions of the box are shown above Picture frame This is the Picture Frame that also comes in your kit. This can fit a standard pice of paper with the dimensions shown above. Tool Box This is the tool box that is also included in your kit. This can hold all your household tools, your art supplies, school materials or whatever your mind limits you to.

Who or what is Creole Amour? Creole Amour is a laser cut and handmade jewelry brand inspired by travel experiences and the culture of New Orleans. We believe in crafting lasting pieces that won't tarnish or break with everyday use, so our jewelry is created using 14k gold filled and laser cut acrylic. CA gives back by donating 10% of profits to nonprofit organizations that have a positive impact on the community through programs and opportunities for the youth and those who are less fortunate. Creole Amour is now expanding this approach by helping you create your most inspired space through decor and ultimately helping to create an inspired life. Why these rewards? These rewards are a good representation of influences and experiences from travel and the culture New Orleans made into decor and accessories that inspire a good feeling environment. If you've already watched our video, then you know that through travels I, Kiki, found how important it was to feel inspired, feel motivated, and overall just feel good while I was away from family and the city that I love. It became obvious that the vibes and how I felt in my temporary homes had a significant impact in my mood and life, so I set out to create an environment that I loved and inspired me no matter where I was. It has been life changing for me, so I want to share with others. Why a Kickstarter? Literally, for years I've been a fan off Kickstarter and planned one day to launch a campaign for Creole Amour. It just seemed like the right time to move forward in helping others feel inspired in their spaces with our designs, and finally purchase a laser cutter to not only expand but to host workshops to help inspire the youth and others to create and unleash their wildest imaginations. What's the budget? This kickstarter is to raise $7,900 in order to buy a small laser cutter that will be life changing for this business. $6,650 will go towards the actual purchase of the laser cutter, while $500 will go towards purchasing materials to create and ship your beautiful rewards, $200 will go towards funding our very first workshop, and the rest goes to Kickstarter and payment processing fees. While $7,900 will fund purchasing a laser cutter, if this campaign does so well and exceeds this amount, my next goal is to raise enough to purchase a larger more powerful laser cutter, which runs about $15,000. What's the timeline? After this campaign is successfully funded in 30 days, l immediately purchase the new CA laser cutter. We will take the month of July and August to purchase materials and start making your amazing rewards. By September we plan to start shipping rewards and getting them to you asap! What's the bigger picture? A part of what I do with Creole Amour through jewelry is share my story and experiences through designs while also giving back 10% of profits to nonprofit organizations that help the youth and those less fortunate to live fulfilling lives. As mentioned before, having a laser cutter will allow Creole Amour to go out and directly impact others by helping them to see all that they can create from their imaginations in the laser cutting world and ultimately in their life (as long as they can see it, they can create the life they want). I don't plan to stop there. At some point Creole Amour will grown enough to employ others who need jobs to get them on their feet to live their best life. Also, this laser cutter will help to save money from laser cutting expenses and remove time restraints and accessibility issues that come with not owning a laser cutter. ----The Rewards---- All wall signs and decor is hung using command strips. No signs will require nails or push pins. Most are relatively light and using the correct strength commander strips will hold wall decor in place. Any rewards that require a choice in material, color, etc. will be communicated via messages and surveys after the campaign is has ended and is successfully funded. If you have any questions, please send a message here or contact us on our website (www.creoleamour.com) or social media pages (@ShopCreoleAmour). I�ve had the pleasure of working on The Folio for the past 5 years, and with each new adventure I keep coming up with more things I want to create for the betterment of dungeon adventuring. With The Curse of Roslof Keep, I�ve had the pleasure of designing a high level dungeon crawl, and Folio #23 will be the fourth installment of this particular dungeon. This particular crawl, known as The Kasbah Dungeon, features players taking on the DM as he or she assumes the role of The Infernal Machine that has been driven mad by a dark elder power beyond our own dimension. The players will have to defeat the monsters within the fourth level of the dungeon as well as try to figure out how to 'reboot' the Infernal Machine and wrest the control over the monster generator from the lurking darkness that threatens this world! I�m truly excited to journey in Level Four of The Kasbah Dungeon and to see what dastardly threats the Infernal Machine has in store for the players! What is included in Folio #23? This module will provide the adventurers with access to Level 4 of the Kasbah Dungeon as well as a new monster that even threatens the existence of the Infernal Machine. Dungeon details include 2D standard 'blue' hex maps as well as fully 3D renderings of Level 4. It also features a fully removable stand-alone cover that can act as DM screen. Send your high level party through the first 3 levels of the Kasbah Dungeon with Folios #20-23! Who is this adventure for?: It will be based around classic AD&D gaming mechanics, while also have 'grey' stat and treasure blocks for 5th Edition D&D, so it is easily playable in BOTH formats. It has been designed for 6-8 characters, roughly levels 11 thru 13, and will include a Virtual Table Top map without secret doors, traps, and numbers. Check out the incredible 3D maps! What are the 'Bridge' Mini-Adventure Trios? There are 2 sets of mini-adventures, the first three help characters transition for the original Roslof Keep campaign to the new Kasbah Dungeon campaign. The second three are set within the happenings of the Kasbah Dungeon and help add content to the first three levels of the dungeon. They each have a map, and a 10-15 room dungeon that will add magic, experience, and content to the overall campaign arc. What are all the other Folio products? The bulk of my Folio adventure series has been in physical form and can be found at artofthegenre.com. For the purposes of some of the upper pledge levels, these previously produced adventures are offered at a substantial savings. Thus far, there have been 22 Folio standard removable cover adventures, and 5 hardcover Folio books (3 compile and reprint the Folio campaigns, and 2 are gaming supplements). You can see more about these products in the video below. For the Hardcover pledge, what are the 'Orange Spine' books?: These 'Complete' volume hardcovers include not only all the information from 6 Folio adventure modules, but also 6 or more 'mini-adventure' supplements added for extra content, iconic character cards that are playable, and a gazetteer supplement that defines the world the adventure takes place in. Also included is the Storyteller's Arcana, a 128 page DM & Player guide of my own tips and experiences in 30 years of gaming, and the Folio of Fiendish Monsters with 115 new monsters. ALL these books are in in both AD&D and 5th Edition D&D formats. 4 of your incredible hardcovers! *TRADEMARK DISCLAIMER "D&D" and "AD&D" are trademarks of Wizards of the Coast, LLC. Art of the Genre is not affiliated with Wizards of the Coast LLC. We make no claim to, or challenge to, such trademarks.

A combo-driven nautical adventure � escape the Kraken in the solo and cooperative dive, or go head-to-head in a heart-pounding race against other divers! Back today and receive 6 Exclusive Characters and an Art Book which will not be available to mass market! Overview: The Refuge: Terror from the Deep takes you into treacherous waters with a 2-6 player competitive dive and a 1-4 player solo and cooperative dive. Compete with rival divers in a frantic race to the escape pods, or work together in a story-driven experience to defeat the kraken! Whichever game mode you choose, you'll be one of eight asymmetric characters in an immersive, cinematic experience that takes you head to head with an angry Kraken! The Refuge: Terror from the Deep includes 25 gorgeous miniatures. We have been fortunate enough to work with two amazing sculptors: David Whitaker & Tom Lishman. David's work includes minis for Lord of the Rings: Journeys into Middle Earth, Moonstone, and more. Tom has sculpted for games such as Dark Souls: the Board Game, Descent 2nd Edition, and Godtear. We're incredibly excited about the miniatures in The Refuge: Terror from the Deep, and we think you will be too. A larger scale brings out more details and make minis easier to handle and paint. Painted by Den of Imagination. Miniatures supplied unpainted. The Refuge: Terror from the Deep's competitive dive is based on our 2016 release The Refuge: A Race for Survival. The Refuge: a race for survival continues to be enjoyed by gamers all over the world, and is well-received for combining exciting, fast-paced gameplay with simple mechanics. We're excited to take that to the next level in competitive dive � an action filled race to the finish! Escape The Kraken � or Die Trying In competitive dives, 2-6 players race to the escape pods of the mysterious UB-85 submarine. To reach the refuge of the escape pods, players must carefully plan their movement to outwit their opponents � and to avoid the Kraken's wrath! To win, be the first diver to reach the escape pods at the end of the board with a Decryptor or complete an Objective for the key to a specific pod. On your turn, you take one action: Move your character one space and activate the space you land on Draw a Salvage card Play a Salvage card Use one of your character's abilities As you move, you'll activate spaces on the board with special features: Spawn spaces let you place pesky tentacles on other unoccupied Spawn spaces. Cave spaces are safe and tentacles can't reach you there. Whirlpool spaces let you switch with a player who is currently on a Cave. Lair spaces lets you control the Kraken's tentacles to knock defenseless characters back to the start. Card Driven Combos: Combining your hand of Salvage cards, Character abilities, and movement allows you to chain together devastating moves � propelling you toward the final goal and luring tentacles to attack your opponents. Don't wait too long to string together the perfect combination though: a slow start means there will be a dozen tentacles blocking your path! Solo and Cooperative dives bring you an immersive, cinematic experience in the world of The Refuge. 1-4 divers will work together to solve a series of challenging objectives deep beneath the sea � as the Kraken threatens to overwhelm them. The victory conditions change every game, providing new challenges and puzzles each time you dive (especially as you try each of the asymmetric characters). All the action of an underwater monster movie in 30 minutes! Story-driven Experience To win, you'll need to complete all three objectives without being overwhelmed by the Kraken. Each Objective drives a little more of your undersea story � you might need to recover a shipwreck, research the Kraken's behavior, or get devoured by the Kraken and cut your way out from the inside! When you complete an objective, you earn the reward on the back side! On your turn, take two actions: Move your character one space and activate the space you land on Play a Salvage card Use a Character Ability Discard two matching Salvage cards to recover a diver or Character ability You'll need to carefully plan with your teammates to combine your Salvage and Character abilities to accomplish objectives, because at the end of each turn, you'll reveal a Kraken card, which will move the Kraken's head and the tentacles on the board. Easy and Intuitive Kraken AI: The top section of each Kraken card moves its head, and the bottom section moves the tentacles in the three columns of the board directly in front of the head. If the Kraken's tentacles reach your starting area, you'll gain Threat - which can make you lose the game. When you eliminate tentacles, you'll earn valuable Salvage cards which will help you accomplish your goals: Built from the Ground Up for Solo: At every step of the way � cooperative dives were designed with solo in mind. All objectives work as a solo diver, and the Kraken AI already provides a powerful and flexible framework for a solo opponent: The Refuge: Terror from the Deep is a standalone sequel to B&B Games Studios' 2016 release The Refuge: a race for survival, and does not require the base game. However, every pledge comes with 18 Kickstarter Exclusive Crossover Character cards for players who own both games! These introduce all new character roles for the 6 player minis in The Refuge: a Race for Survival, and for players who have both Terror from the Deep and Race for Survival, allow you to use the zombie-killing survivors as characters in the competitive dive of Terror from the Deep. To purchase an add-on, simply increase your pledge by the corresponding amount. Add-on prices include shipping if you are pledged at a "Deep Diver" or higher pledge level. Miss out on The Refuge: a Race for Survival Kickstarter? Pick up this bonus mini expansion! Unfiltered Gamer: Man Vs Meeple Live Cooperative Game! Undead Viking: Jambalaya Plays Games � Solo Live Stream: The biggest live stream of the day. The Refuge: Terror From The Deep by B&B Game Studios. Aida is the postpartum help coordinator we, as parents, always wish existed. This new postpartum tool guides you through creating a postpartum plan and easily connects it with your network of trusted family and friends that can be there to lend a helping hand�all with the push of a button from your phone or computer. It also provides postpartum education to both you and your chosen helpers/support team to inform all involved in your experience. Whether it�s a helpful meal delivered, an hour or two of childcare for a desperately needed nap or walk around the block, a request for an adult conversation, and everything in between, Aida pushes out calls for a little assistance to your support network. The person from that group who can help easily accepts that call. It�s really that simple. Aida is for parents and parents-to-be who want to take charge of their postpartum experience by creating a postpartum plan with the support from their friends and family. Asking for help shouldn't be hard. With Aida, we�re taking back the term postpartum�changing it from one of depression, isolation, or �getting back to your old self� to one of strength, support, and togetherness. Picture this: the entire day has been spent feeding, changing, and bouncing an amazing but why won�t this little thing sleep baby, all while keeping up with a toddler who can�t be left out of sight. The clock says it�s 1:00PM. Food? Nope. What is a glass of water? What is that smell? Help is needed, but who is even available and what would the ask even be? It�s all overwhelming and too much trouble to figure out who can help so it�s easier to go at it alone. Sound familiar? We�ve been there, and it�s a hard place to be. Now, let�s paint a new picture, with Aida. The day will start the same (sorry), but thankfully you created a plan for postpartum with Aida. Meals, togetherness, or extra hands�get help when you need it. With a push of a button, Aida sends out the call to your network of chosen family and friends who are ready to meet your needs. They accept the call and are ready to lend a hand. A shower, shoulder to lean on, and warm tea. You are charged physically and emotionally for the rest of the day. Sweet relief. Cris is a mother, parenting two spirited boys with her steadfast husband. Her own struggle in postpartum inspired her to become a doula. She aspires to connect with fellow humans and support them as they navigate pregnancy, birth, and the messy, joyful journey into parenthood. TGW Studio is a social impact marketing and creative studio that partners with forward-thinking businesses and individuals to tell their stories and breathe life into ideas. As parents themselves with similar blindsiding experiences into parenthood and the desire to spark change in that arena, it was a natural fit to team up with Cris to bring Aida to life.

Inspired by her daughter who was born deaf with cerebral palsy, the knee sneakers, later named Skneeks (pronounced �sneaks�) were made to create a way for her to get around on her knees while other kids her age were running. In the beginning, there was tons of testing with various knee pad solutions and dozens of different types of fabric and materials. With years of trial and error, the knee pads evolved into using her husband�s biking arm sleeve warmers, silicon, and shoo goo. After 6 years of extensive research and progression, it has led her to create the first of its kind, an all day wearing, flexible, durable, tear resistant knee pad. By using a sneaker sole material on the knee, they can last far longer than any other knee pad out there withstanding wear on cement, asphalt, rock, you name it. First created out of a need to promote independence for people with physical disabilities such as cerebral palsy, hypotonia, and hemophilia. Now after some testing, the Skneeks go beyond just special needs. They are being used by rock and wall climbers and have potential for so much more. There is a need for a multi-sport tear resistant kneepad. - video with subtitles here - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Lxzgz9RUJ70&t=8s ..... GoLiiv wants to create more inclusion by inventing more adaptive products. We are teaming up with others to help in this journey giving people the ability to live life to the fullest as everyone deserves the ability to enjoy every day recreation and to Liiv! After testing all types of knee pads, hard shell, volleyball, and other various knee protection, even sweat bands, not one would work in the way we needed it to. They would either tear, too hard, too short, can�t walk/crawl in comfortably, didn�t stay in place, and just not meant for all day use and for constant impact on hard surfaces. Spandex/Poly performance fabric Thick non-slip silicon elastic to keep in place with lots of movement Velcro strap (no more dealing with little too big, too small) Abrasion resistent, waterproof & non-slip knee using shoe sole type material Neoprene padding for shock resistance Opening in the back for breathability Lightweight, low profile Created for daily / all day wear, comfortable Easy to wipe clean (or hand wash) To be worn on bare skin or to wear over pants(certain types better) * Patent Pending You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00 You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00 You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00 *testing out our Skneeks *Note : The knee stitching on the Skneeks may alter depending on the size. The final knee stitching is in our main profile picture and side view picture above. Tamra Logans daughter Birkley contracted a virus during pregancy later resulting in cerebral palsy. When her daughter was finally mobile on her own at the age of 4, she was using her knees to get everywhere. The Skneeks (knee sneakers) gave her daughter her independence and freedom to be a kid. Now after she started walking at age 10, she still uses the Skneeks when falling on her knees and while knee walking. More of Birkleys Story Featured in: With our Skneeks Grow a small team to help streamline the process from manufacturing to shipment. Finalize all fabric, materials, sizing, stitching. Have the ability to order in larger quantity to keep prices down. Create more product for quicker shipments. Marketing and ecommerce support For GoLiiv Invent and manufacture more products: We aren�t just apparel. We are talking with engineers, university engineering programs, nonprofits and other companies to create more inclusive recreational products. Build a small team to join in our mission to bring more adaptive products to life. Video : Music by the Cedars, "Boogie Nice".

Thank you for visiting our Kickstarter campaign! We are so excited to present you our "The Avenger's last suppler" enamel pin set. You can check out our other products here and find us on Instagram @thepinshoppe.com. Each pin will have 2 back clutches to prevent from spinning, and will come on a backing card and in a poly bag. Any funds raised above the goal will go into a larger order, as well as future pin designs that will be able to come out sooner with your help. Whichever pin designs get unlocked will get produced. ***Pin Description*** Approx 1.5 Inches Black Nickel Plated Dual Post (to prevent spinning) Hard Enamel (Color and details may vary slightly from production) Once the campaign is over and all the Kickstarter rewards have been sent out to backers, any leftover pins will be available for purchase in my online shop. SO WHY PLEDGE NOW?There is never a guarantee that there will be leftover pins of each design. If you pledge now, you're guaranteed to get the pins you want once it has been unlocked. PLUS, pledging through this campaign gives you the pins at a DISCOUNTED PRICE! Backers will choose their pins from the funded designs through a survey at the end of the campaign. Surveys will be sent out after the campaign ends. New to Kickstarter? For any of you that are not familiar with Kickstarter or how crowdfunding works, it is pretty simple. There is a funding period for a project (on average, it's 30 days). If the project reaches or surpasses its goal before these 30 days, great! If the project reaches 30 days and doesn't reach its goal, the project is unsuccessful, anyone who backed the project will not get charged anything, no one will receive any rewards. If the project is successful, at the end of the funding period, Kickstarter sends out surveys to backers and collects the funds that everyone has pledged. (Please keep in mind that the money you pledge is not taken from you the moment you decide to support this Kickstarter campaign. You are only charged if the campaign is successful.) To avoid shipping delays, everyone who backed the project should return their survey with their correct address and any other needed information as quickly as possible. ***TIMELINE*** Mid June (Start) - Kickstarter launched Early July - Kickstarter campaign ends and surveys are emailed to during that week. This will tell me what items you want. Mid July - 2 weeks after the campaign the funds are released and I will submit pins into production! Production should be roughly 3-4 weeks from the manufacture. Late July - If everything runs smoothly I should have the pins in hand for inspection. Please allow me time to inspect and hand pack your orders! Early August - You should received your orders by mail within 3-5 days (depending on where you are in the world. From my experience it International Orders will take longer! About 2-3 weeks) ***Cost Breakdown*** Pin Production: 70% Shipping & Packaging: 20% Kickstarter Fees: 10%

The North Shore has some of the most celebrated surf breaks in the world. Heroes are made there, and people die. In December, when the Pipeline Masters are held, and the waves can hit twenty feet, the best professional surfers on the planet are concentrated in a handful of beachfront rentals within a few hundred yards of each other. These houses are the closest thing to an actual backstage that exists on the North Shore. This is where surfing�s elite convene. But don�t expect to jump off a tour bus with your suntan lotion & fanny pack and get to truly experience the North Shore. This is the birthplace of modern surfing, but much of the real action is off limits to the general public. The North Shore is an extremely tight-knit community that is largely inaccessible to most visitors. This book is an intimate behind-the-scenes tour of the North Shore shot with remarkable access and from a perspective rarely seen by outsiders. HI 1K features an astounding 1000 candid photos, portraits and interviews shot over the course of 10 seasons. The rich backstories of these moments are illuminated with dozens of detailed and evocative captions. HI 1K is a lush and voyeuristic journey chronicling the private lives and unguarded moments of the larger-than-life characters that make up the surf culture of the North Shore. Why Kickstarter? We�re incredibly excited to announce the pre-sale campaign for HI 1K � 10 years, 1000 moments on the North Shore of Hawaii. The creative team at Indoek have an amazing track record of creating beautifully designed book projects that remain true to the aesthetic and tone of the images and content inside. Last year they produced and designed the critically acclaimed �Surf Shacks� book. For this project, we�ve spent countless hours curating and editing thousands of photos from 10 years worth of material. We�ve researched paper stocks, sourced an amazing offset printer, and assembled 244 page layouts that bring the saltwater, grit, excitement and splendor of the North Shore to life. We are passionately committed to creating the most meticulously-designed book and using the highest quality printing methods and materials. This process is not cheap, but this book was too important for us to cut corners, or to concede control by handing it over to an outside publisher. Instead, we opted to produce and fund this book by offering it directly to a community that recognizes the value of this material and trusts our commitment to quality. This project has been a massive undertaking, but we�re incredible proud of what we�ve put together. Now we just need your support to help us get over the finish line. PRINTING DETAILS HI 1K will be a stunning hardcover book available to the general pubic in fall 2019. Kickstarter backers will receive first edition copies at a significantly discounted price before they are released to the public. Unfortunately we can't ship pre-sale copies of HI 1K internationally due to the high shipping costs and the associated fees charged by Kickstarter. Please check back in fall 2019 - We will be offering HI 1K for worldwide sales! The book specs are as follows: 244 Pages. 4 Color Offset printing with spot varnish. Case bound, hardcover with fabric wrap and foil stamp. Embossed cover image. 157 GSM Matte Art Paper. 9.5" X 11.5" HI 1K Page Layouts and Captions Examples "Greyson skated up to the Banzai Skatepark with two Coors tallboys, took a long swig, and then dropped in wearing flip flops. His casual flow and perfect style is mesmerizing to watch. He is the undeniable star of the park. But rather than monopolizing time and taking more runs than others, I actually found myself wanting to see him skate more. Instead, he seemed to relish in the social aspect of the scene. I watched him roam from corner to corner of the park cracking jokes, laughing, and talking to groms and girls like a celebrity working the room of a Hollywood restaurant. After finishing his Coors, he wiped his sun-bleached, overgrown beard, and cracked open another. He stood quizzically, and with his movie star smile he wondered out loud to nobody in particular why more people weren�t drinking beer. It was as if we all were at his private party and he was genuinely concerned that some guests might not be having enough fun. Everybody certainly was." "I'd been commissioned to shoot the legendary surfer Bruce Irons for an ad campaign. I knew that I wanted to do an underwater portrait, but I felt that it was very important that we had a controlled environment to work in. I decided to shoot it in his pool. Thankfully, the waves were flat on the island that day, so I had Bruce's undivided attention... sort of. We met him at his house and I started by taking some portraits of him around the property. I kept attempting to get him into the pool, but there always seemed to be something that would distract his attention. I eventually got him to put on board shorts and he approached the water. Just as I thought we were finally going to start shooting, Bruce suddenly became obsessed with trying to figure out why his remote-controlled audio system wasn't working. I watched patiently as the sunlight began to fade. I ultimately got him into the water, but I wasn't getting anything spectacular. We came up with the concept of trying to shoot him blowing "vortex bubbles". Neither one of us knew how to go about making them. With wet hands, I frantically attempted to search for some info on my phone. It was approaching late afternoon and we were losing daylight fast. After about 60 seconds, I happened to look over and see Bruce sitting by himself cross-legged at the bottom of the pool nonchalantly blowing a flawless stream of bubbles. I jumped in the pool and began shooting. I had a water-housing, but no mask, so I was virtually blind under water. I estimated the framing of Bruce as best as I could, then I panned the camera and fired multiple shots left to right and up and down hoping to capture the appropriate cropping. After about three or four attempts, we nailed the perfect shot. I got out of the pool and reveled in the epic picture that we had just captured. I asked Bruce how he managed to figure out the bubble technique. He declared mysteriously, "It's simple.... it's how dolphins do it". Bruce later gave me a long cryptic speech about how "...basically, the entire universe is nothing but vortexes." "Mark Cunningham is a North Shore lifeguard and a pioneer of the sport of bodysurfing. He is a true Hawaiian waterman, and he has a very intimate relationship with the sea. Bodysurfing doesn't involve a lot of equipment - it is wave riding in it's purest form. Before he swam out into the ocean this day, I saw him pause at the water's edge, stare into the horizon, and have a quiet reflective moment. It was just him and the sea. He's witnessed the energy of these waves take human lives. He's also had countless hours of pleasure as a result of their power. As I stood there watching him, his vast respect and love for this insurmountable force was palpable" "The day was riddled with controversial scores. Kelly Slater and John John Florence both put a on a brave face and gave the obligatory interviews to the hungry press. It was an epic battle that played out like a Shakespearean play. The young prince didn't quite usurp the King, but John John did have the consolation of the Triple Crown trophy and the knowledge that during his matchup against World Champion Mick Fanning, he had masterfully put the Champ in a combo position within minutes of the start of their heat. Kelly Slater earned himself another prestigious Pipe Masters title. They both surfed magnificently that day... but their their awe-inspiring accomplishments were tainted with the bitter irony that Kelly had desperately wanted another world title, and John John had lusted for the elusive Pipe title. Despite their magnificent victories, they both were horribly disappointed. At dusk, I spotted the 11 time World Champ walking solemnly down the bike path. Alone. The number 2 on the back of his jersey resonated poignantly in my mind as I watched Kelly make the 5 minute trek towards his home - sans entourage or fanfare." The Surfer Poll is the one time of year where the top surfers in the world gather to wear skirts too small and suits too large. But then again, judging surfers on their fashion sensibilities is as pointless as trying to critique Cara Delevingne on her barrel-riding skills. People have designated lanes. The attendees that chose to keep it simple with a modest black dress or a button down shirt with closed toed shoes tended to pull it off best. JJF�s well-tailored blue suit was the exception that proved the rule, while Mason Ho made the sensible choice of a Hawaiian shirt and black pants. Classic look. Although these two Hawaiian locals have very different personalities, they share at least one thing in common. They are both universally revered on the North Shore. John is the humble heir apparent and Mason is the loveable wisecracking prince. Both of them have the upmost respect for their surfing elders and the DNA of the sport. Mason loves to get loose, but he also knows just where to draw the line. Shortly after this picture, he had to politely reign in his right hand man Burger�s rowdy backstage antics. �Just because we won this award, doesn�t mean that they won�t kick us out, Burger!� "Pipeline is not only one of the most dangerous waves on the planet, it is also one of the most crowded. All of the top rated surfers on the pro-tour as well as a handfull of local wildcards compete in the prestigious Pipe Masters contest every December. Just being a competitor is a huge honor, but being in the Pipe Masters event also provides another invaluable opportunity - the chance to surf this legendary break with only a few other surfers in the lineup. The break is closed to the public during the contest, but the moment after the final heat is completed, the lineup is once again teeming with dozens of surfers. They�re all hoping to beat the odds, snag a precious set wave, and get the ride of their life." About this project! Hello! My name is Melissa and I am the artist/owner behind Mimosa Studio, and this will be my third Kickstarter Project. These will all be black nickel plated, hard enamel, with a single pin post and rubber clutch. They will all have the same body size of approximately 5/8". The ears will make some closer to 3/4" in total height. The initial 7 pins are using the same mini snowmen molds from my previous Kickstarter, but with more traditional coloring instead of solid white. At the end of the campaign, I will send out a survey for you to select which pin(s) you wanted. Pin Grading Pin grading varies from maker to maker, but there are typically three categories: Standard Grade (Nearly Perfect), B-Grade (Minor Defects), and Seconds (Major Defects). Most pins will have very minor defects in them, as it's almost impossible to have a truly "perfect" pin, which is very subjective from eye to eye anyway. Backers will receive standard grade pins, which means any flaws will be subtle, if noticeable at all. Costs The initial cost of the entire project is low, as the molds for the original seven are already made. With the funds that I have already placed aside for this project, I only need $500 more for the main goal. The stretch goals are spaced a bit further apart, to help cover the production costs of the new designs, as well as cover the freebies that will be included in select tiers. Timeline If successfully funded, charges will begin on July 13th, so please plan accordingly. There may be a delay due to it being the weekend, but it's better to anticipate the earlier date. It will take up to 3 weeks for payments to be cleared before I can pay the manufacturer, hopefully around August 2. From there, it takes an additional 4-6 weeks for production, so I hope to have these in hand around September 13th. I plan to have all of these shipped by the end of September, but this is also based on the number of backers. If there are more than I anticipate, then it could overflow into October, but I will work as quickly as I can. Goals UNLOCKED! My first stretch goal is to have all ten of these designs printed on a 3.5x5" sticker sheet, which will unlock at $1000. This will be produced by an outside party. UNLOCKED! My second stretch goal, newly updated to $1400 (was $1600) will be to have the mouse mini pin FREE for tiers B, C, D, E, and the two early bird tiers (all 3+ pin tiers except for the B-Grade and Minor defects tiers). UNLOCKED! My third stretch goal, newly updated to $1800 (was $2200), will be to have the panda mini FREE for tiers C, D, E, and the two early bird tiers (all 5+ pin tiers except for the B-Grade and Minor defects tiers). My fourth stretch goal, newly updated to $2200 (was $3000), will be to have the red panda mini pin FREE for tiers D, E, and the two early bird tiers (all 7+ pin tiers except for the B-Grade and Minor defects tiers). My fifth stretch goal will unlock at $2400, in which the washi tape will be free for all tiers! My sixth stretch goal will unlock at $2600, in which the mini cow pin will be free for all tiers! Updates The sticker sheet has now been updated to include the cow! The cow mini pin will now be on the survey and can be pledged for. I am doing both a brown and black cow, as well as glitter variants of them. I've also added a Fall Friends washi tape! These will be a $4 add-on ($6 each after the campaign ends). If we hit $2400, it will be free for all tiers!

My name is James Quigley, aka Gunsho. Gunsho's Goetia is an ongoing series of 72 illustrations of the demons of the Goetia. Each demon is produced as a limited edition 5-color screen print. I've been working on and off on my Goetia series for a decade. Though artistically rewarding, the costs of producing each print makes tends to put the series on the back burner. I've produced 29 prints so far and I've got a lot more to go before I finish 72. Money for materials and labor has been an obvious obstacle. Each illustration takes time to draw, color, and then print by myself. It's a costly endeavor. I'm hoping to remedy that by raising funds to produce one print at a time until I'm finished with the series. By contributing to this, you'll make it more possible to continue this series and bring it to light. Thank you.

We are the Share Fairies� and our mission is to empower children to share. We believe it takes a village to raise a healthy child, and the Share Fairies diverse village of characters are here to support you. Share Fairies is the passion project of a sister-duo, Stefani and Amy, who are both moms to small children. We know how difficult milestones in learning and developmental transitions can be for children and parents, and we created the Share Fairies to ease these challenges. Our initial goal is to publish the first of a series of Share Fairies children�s books. This first book will empower children ��to donate and share their baby/toddler items when developmentally ready to take the next step. "We're the Share Fairies and we love to share! The big kids give, and it shows they care. When the babies receive, they giggle and coo. Thank you for sharing; we appreciate you!" Problem: "My child simply will not give up her binky/pacifier. She panics when it rolls under the couch and I carry around three extras in the diaper bag just in case. Is there a stress-free way that my child will volunteer to give up her binky?" Solution: Share Fairies! Problem: "Potty training has been so difficult! Even though my child is capable of being diaper-free, he simply will not let go of his diapers. Is there a stress-free way that my child will volunteer to give up diapers for a big-kid potty?" Solution: Share Fairies! Problem: "My child's play room and bedroom are filled with old toys. She refuses to give them away, but Santa is coming next week and we simply cannot fit any more toys in these spaces. Is there a stress-free way that my child will volunteer to donate her toys?" Solution: Share Fairies! Our Story When Stefani�s daughter Kate was two years old, she took Kate to the dentist for a checkup. It turned out that Kate�s teeth had been moving in all of the wrong ways due to her beloved binky, and it was time to "take it away." As Stefani and her wife geared up to cut off the tip or simply "lose" every single binky Kate owned, it occurred to them that it would be much more palatable if Kate made the choice to give them up on her own. Stefani found several pacifier/binky fairy books on Amazon but was disappointed that all the books she reviewed were either gender-specific or limited to use with pacifiers. Having two young kids of her own, both of whom cherished their binkies, Amy also became interested in finding a better way to help her children part ways with their precious baby items. Thus, the idea for Share Fairies was born! We provided Kate with a special Share Fairies box (parents provide a receptacle), gave her time to personalize the box by coloring and decorating the outside, and, right before bed, we read/sang our new Share Fairies book! To our surprise, it worked! Kate voluntarily rounded up every single binky and placed them in the box all by herself. She said goodbye and crawled right into bed! In the following days, Kate referenced the Share Fairies several times in terms of where her binkies had gone, and she was happy to have donated. Needless to say, our donation journey had begun! Six months later, Kate�s cousin Reese was visited by the Share Fairies and waved goodbye to her binkies with no tears shed! Our first Share Fairies book is a fourteen stanza, rhyming song (read a sample of the story below) about the Share Fairies needing your child's help to donate items to the babies who really need them. When the Share Fairies retrieve items during the night, they may leave a special Thank-You note or a small token (stickers, toothbrush, a book) of their appreciation in the box. We decided to further test the theory that our idea could work with other children, so we asked our friends and family with children to test it out. We sent the story out and measured the results! 5/5 other children have jumped on the Share Fairies bandwagon and have successfully given up binkies, bottles, diapers, and toys! Since we introduced the Share Fairies into our family, our children have also successfully donated their bottles, diapers, pull-ups, old toys, and training toilet to the younger children who need them! SAMPLE STANZAS: Deep in the Land of Sharing, magical creatures lurk, Share Fairies work while they toil, hard at work. Singing joyous songs and spreading shareful cheer, To the big kids (like you) who are big enough to hear. �We�re the Share Fairies and we love to share. The big kids give, and it shows they care. When the babies receive, they giggle and coo. It�s time to share. We are waiting for you!� When it is time to choose a box, you know what to do. You�re a big kid now. Share toys you don�t use. Share those diapers and the bottles. Spit that binky out! Get ready! Get set! Let�s hear you shout! What makes Share Fairies Unique? The Share Fairies is a different concept than any other product or publication on the market because we take a holistic approach to empowering children to share. Not only will we publish our first book to empower kids to let go of their beloved baby items; our vision is to expand the Share Fairies brand to sharing in all facets of life by publishing many more books in our series and by creating a robust website, blog, and set of resources parents can access for support. We envision supporting childhood social emotional learning and academic endeavors by catering to children and by providing parallel resources to parents and guardians. The Share Fairies access a child�s sense of wonder, sparking imagination and creativity unlike other products or publications. The Share Fairies believe in diversity, inclusion, and gender neutrality. The artwork we envision for our fairies and the Land of Sharing showcases a plethora of diverse personalities, colors, shapes, sizes, abilities, and cultures. Boys and girls alike will identify with our fairies, which will more closely reflect an intentional artistic approach in diversity of character rather than the traditional vision of a petite, pink fairy. Other ideas to incorporate engaging elements include creating a Share Fairies tracker to be accessed on our website so kids can track the location of the Share Fairies who are on the way to their homes (comparable to a Santa tracker), and to have the text of each book recorded as a song to be accessed through the website. The audio element is a fun way to read the story with a child, while also supporting early childhood literacy by allowing kids to read the book independently with support from the song. Sample Future Books: Share Fairies: Feelings are Meant to be Shared (Sharing feelings) Share Fairies: Friends Share (Sharing with others) Share Fairies: The Season of Sharing (Holiday edition) Share Fairies: The Kind of Human I Want To Be (Sharing kindness) Share Fairies: Sharing Cultures (Celebrating diversity) Share Fairies: Share the Wealth (An introduction to financial literacy and social responsibility) Share Fairies: Sharing Responsibility (Taking responsibility) The Budget The book will be a fully illustrated hardcover, 8x10 inches and 20 pages. We will also publish an eBook in EPUB/PDF format. Your donation in support of Share Fairies will contribute to: 1. Illustration & Book Design Fees: Working with a local artist! 2. Publishing Expenses 3. Administrative Fees: website, shipping fees, ISBN creation, etc. 4. Kickstarter Fees (8% - 10%) Aspiration: Professional vocal artist to perform the Share Fairies song. Please note that the estimated delivery date in the Rewards section is January 2020. Our goal is to deliver prior to Christmas 2019, but we are building in time during production for any adjustments that may need to be honored. Thank you. STEFANI: I am a mother, wife, daughter, aunt, educator, and sharer. I have spent my career in education, as a master-level teacher in the classroom, as a professional curriculum designer, and, currently, as the head of our educator Professional Development department (supporting learning experiences across the nation for educators in Kindergarten through 8th grade). My daily work is geared toward designing and executing on meaningful learning experiences for kids and adults, and the Share Fairies exemplifies that passion! Personally, I am a mother who wants to actively take part in creating a world where we support healthy childhood development. Empowering children to make positive choices that not only support their personal growth, but also help and lift up others, captures who I am! AMY: Lawyer, athlete, aspiring interior designer, and the left-brained engine behind the Share Fairies. Mother of dragons. Wife of a unicorn. Passionate about early education and human rights. Still trying to master the art of negotiation with toddlers and Instagram filters. Please find Share Fairies on: Twitter: @Share_Fairies Instagram: @share_fairies Facebook: Share Fairies

Versatile is an album of experimental love songs to the lands and communities which restore us through turmoils again and again. Recorded in remote forested hideouts, off-kilter compositions of harp, layered strings, pump organ, found sounds, and crystal glass explore the versatility of queer love and survival. Written during songwriter Elliott Miskovicz�s passage to living in the woods due to neurological conditions after a lifetime in the Philadelphia area, these 11 songs follow the journey of the sacrifices we make in the name of solace. Although rural life was not always easy as a trans fag, his songwriting there evolved from a tool for coping with chaos into an expression of reverence for the enduring ecosystems surrounding him. Mixed by Candlewolfe sound and currently being mastered by Kris Force, Versatile's physical release will include 11 handmade drawings of plants corresponding to each song by herbalist Miranda Resnick, and an evocative cover poster by queer metal artist Stephen Wilson. Funds from this pre-order will go towards costsof: - Recording, mixing, and mastering - Visual art and printing of 11x11" song illustrations - Tape production - Creation of customized safer sex supplies - Shipping and packaging Pre-order available now at kickstarter.com or via bandcamp: astickandastone.bandcamp.com/versatile or via paypal : astickandastone11@gmail.com or cashapp $astickandastone - Thank you!
