With these funds I would like to get my company off the ground. There are legal fees involved. I have a logo and theme that I would like to copywright. I need funds to purchase more raw product to make my crafts. As well as funding for web sites: creating and maintaing my own web page, funds for selling on Amazon.com and Etsy. I have a long term goal of my own brick and mortar building. The purpose and vision of my company is to help people. This is a billion dollar industry. It used to be kept secret and hidden. But not any more. We can see a huge presence in main stream media and all over the internet. A lot of this has to do with the work of Patti Negri a "white" (good) witch. I am starting a company to market Wiccan products. My main theme is a commonly known phrase: "With harm to none. Do as you will." Which means: do not intentionally harm anyone and do not try to make anyone do anything. I care deeply about people and I feel a deep need to supply people with hand made items that can possibly improve the quality of their life. In a loving and supportive way. After all, don't we all need some help sometimes? I am a 50 something who just recently lost my invlaid Mother. I am still taking care of my handicapped brother. Starting a business from my home gives me the flexibility to continue to help him and gives me an abundance of time I can devote to my company. I have been studying my competition, and I can offer a wide and varried assortment of products. I have lower overhead costs, as I am not yet renting any commercial space. Although my dream is to have a "brick and mortar" as well. I can sell from other brick and mortar business already open as well as on-line stores and I am developing my own web presence as well. I am devoted to offering a reliable product. I have high quality expectations and I plan to surpass my customer needs and expectations. Once I have met my goal, all contributors will receive something. For $10-$19: a hand written thank you note and a small gift. For $20-$49: A hand written thank you note and a candle. For $50-$99 a hand written thank you note and a minimum of 2 gifts. For $100-$249 a hand written thank you note and 4 or more gifts of your choice. $250-$499: a hand written note and a small "basket" of 7 or more items. $500-$999: a hand written note and a medium "basket" of a minimum of 15 different items. For $1000+ a spectacular gift of handwritten note and a large "basket" of 30 or more of my creations. **The number of gifts depending on the $amount. I want to be fair about this and give more of my products to anyone who can give more. <3 If you are giving more, I want to give more back to you. <3

Hello! A wildly creative and motivated team of University of Florida students and alumni filmmakers are embarking on another adventure this summer. This group is set to film in June of 2019 a fantastically wicked horror film. This Kickstarter is being put towards our budget for the film. It will be used on any equipment, props, outfits, production design, food for crew and location creation for the film. The support through this page will help create opportunities for all the members in our cast and crew to gain valuable experience that will benefit them in their future careers. We are all dedicated to making this film the best it can be. It would be greatly appreciated by the crew for any help and support that is given. After production, we plan to submit this into festivals because we believe that it has the potential to shake up the horror genre. Below is a summary of "Growing Pains". We hope you take the time to peak inside our little creation. Summary: DARREL has just graduated High School with his two best friends, TREVOR and JENNIE. He is under the impression that all 3 of them will stay together in the small town during college, Trevor and Jennie have different plans. They plan to move away to start their own separate adventures. In the hope to change Darrel�s mind and motivate him to move on, Jennie and Trevor have dug up the time capsule the 3 buried together as children. One last trip down memory lane turns into a night of nightmares, when the 3 friends don�t only open a box of memories but open the gate for a fiendish and horrific figure, called The Gazer. As Jennie and Trevor work to rid themselves of The Gazer�s torture, Darrel is determined to show the true potential The Gazer has as the savior of their friendship.

The Story: One of the biggest issues we grapple with today as a country is immigration. It is not a modern struggle, but rather one that has been present in our country for generations. The parallels between immigration in 1910's Texas and immigration now is both eerie and fascinating. Our film follows two Latina women in 1910's Texas, a mother and daughter, who are migrants from Mexico seeking a better life. Their lives are put in danger when they happen to be caught in the wrong place at the wrong time, and they go from hunting rabbits to becoming the hunted. By looking at a familiar issue through a historical context, we are able to examine the impact of how we treated immigrants then and let it inform our treatment of them now. Through the female characters of this story, we see the time period through a feminine lens, offering a human visage point to this deeply divisive issue, all while connecting it to the relevant issues we face as a country today. Historical Setting: In 1910, a bloody revolution exploded throughout Mexico, when the dictator Porfirio Diaz was challenged by intellectuals and liberals. This war of ideals became known as the Mexican Revolution, and was a concomitant reason for the brutal treatment of Mexicans living in the Texas Borderlands during this time. The reported violence occurring in Mexico (thievery, murder, arson) of Mexican citizens against their countrymen and U.S. citizens travelled fast to the Texas border. This forever tainted the image of the Mexican, whether they were Tejanos, Mexican-Americans, or Mexican migrants. They were all seen as violent, dirty, sinful people who could not be trusted. Therefore, the Anglo-Texans, who felt most threatened by their ever-growing presence in the country believed extralegal violence was not only necessary, but mandatory to protect themselves. This fear continued to grow in large part from the fear mongering, prejudice, and bias put out by state and local news outlets, clumping all Mexicans together in the same category, demonizing them and marring the trust between the Mexicans living in Texas and their Anglo neighbors. This anti-American rhetoric that got passed around and reported on, was held in high regard as fact, and became the driving force behind the prejudice and righteous fury Anglos had towards the Mexicans living in their country as the Revolution surged on. During this brutal time, Mexicans found their lives and livelihoods increasingly at risk by segregation, lynchings, and outright racism. It is something all too familiar in our country right now, a human issue we still grapple with finding an answer to, and one we must work together towards repairing. Director's Statement Have you ever felt connected to a story, but don't know why? That's how I explain why I was drawn to this history and creating the story of these two women. I'm intrigued by unknown histories and the people within them, and that is what drew me to this project. The humanity of it. The tragedy of prejudice and hate, and how that affects the lives of people. To understand this story, to feel empathy for these people and this time, you just need to be human. We can see ourselves in these characters, feel for them, root for them. To me this film is an anti-Western, we don't see this story through a white man's perspective, but rather the migrants'. How many Westerns can you count that have women of color at the center, that tell their history, and more importantly, show their perspective? Not many. Along with my natural curiosity in the places that surround me, my life and experiences inform my writing. This story harkens back to a difficult trauma my mother and I experienced, and having the center of the story be between a mother and daughter was no mistake. It was incredibly important to me that it centered around two women caught in a horrific situation and how they dealt with it. More importantly, I wanted to explore the human face of immigration, of moving, of migrating, from someone else's perspective. How do the choices we make affect the lives of those around us? What steps must we take as people, as a society, to ensure that this history does not repeat itself? Why support us in finishing this film? In this political landscape, this story feels at once foreign and familiar. It is from a different time, but the parallels of where we were then and where we are now are undeniable. It is a history rarely, if ever, visited in cinema today or in generations past, and we feel it is imperative to shed light on something that has had lingering effects on Mexican immigrants. By supporting this film, you are supporting this little know history being shared with a larger audience, Mexican history, and the career of a female filmmaker. Women directors are historically the most under-represented demographic in Hollywood--something that is slowly changing, but there is still much work to be done. By supporting this film, you are helping a female filmmaker get her film out into the world. Once the film is completed it is going on to be a apart of an immigration-in-cinema series at Violet Crown Cinema in Austin and then will be screening at 3 different ACLU locations in Texas. The ACLU screenings will be followed by immigrants' rights panels! We are so lucky to have the support of these organizations, but we cannot make these events happen without finishing the film first. THIS IS WHERE WE NEED YOUR HELP. Here are some of the awesome perks you can get for supporting our Kickstarter campaign! $10 perk level - exclusive postcard design $50 perk level - Screen printed graphic tee $35 perk level - screen printed sweatshirt $20 perk level- enamel pin design $25 perk level- screen printed film poster The Production: We�re proud to be a team of varying perspectives, backgrounds, and colors. The screenplay, written by Annie Bradford, took over 2 years to hone, a plethora of research, and over 103 rewrites. Actress Emma Perez-Trevino served as the translator for the script, and brought her experience as a former news reporter on the southern border to the storytelling process. Writer/Director Annie Bradford talks with actress Emma Perez-Trevino about the next scene. Alonso Lujan joined the crew as the Director of Photography. It was really important for us to have someone who was passionate about the story leading the camera team, and Lujan captured beautiful footage with them. The post production team is also full of compelling, talented, hard-working artists who come from diverse backgrounds. DP Alonso Lujan talks about the set ups for the next scene with his camera team, Beca Rodriguez and Sean Salcido. Post-Production Team: Alli Holland / Editing & Visual Effects With an impeccable sense of storytelling and editorial design, Alli has lent her skills to Swizzle and 360 Studios in Austin. She's also edited several short films and commercials, and is very excited to be apart of this project. Laura Sinnott / Sound Design Chicago-based sound mixer and editor Laura Sinnott holds a degree from NYU. While helming her own studio in New York, she was on the faculty at Tisch Graduate Film School and New York University's Steinhardt Graduate Music Technology. Her work has been featured in Sundance, Tribeca, SXSW, VH1, PBS, and Comedy Central among others. Laura now has a doctorate in audiology and works as an audiologist at Sensaphonics. She's thrilled to be joining this project and designing the soundscape of this film. Daniel Fernandez/ Music Composition Hailing from Honduras, Austin-based musician Daniel Fernandez gravitated towards music at an early age. He loves exploring new ways to tell stories through music and is so thrilled to be completing the original composition for this film. Daniel leads the rock quartet band, The Halfways, in Austin, TX, and their music has been described as "energetic", "full of sonic textures", and "unusual song structures". Cullen Kelly / Color Correction Cullen Kelly is an LA-based colorist, writer, and director. His film work has been been featured at SXSW and other festivals. He's had a successful colorist career as well doing work for several music videos, commercials, and TV shows, which have been featured in Rolling Stone and Netflix among others. He's excited to be apart of this special project and bring the images to life that Lujan created for this film. Updates Stay up-to-date on our post-production journey by following our instagram, Facebook, and Twitter. For personal updates from the director and cast, please follow the blog on our website. www.thehuntedfilm.com Share We would be so appreciative if you collaborated with us on finishing this film, and used the share tools on our Kickstarter page to raise awareness of our short film with big subject matter. By sharing our campaign link on your social media platforms, it helps connect us with people who may be as passionate about this history and film as we are. Facebook: https://business.facebook.com/bewarethewilderness/ Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/the_hunted_film/ Twitter: https://twitter.com/The_Hunted_Film Thank you We cannot tell you how thankful we are that you have contributed to something we have put so much of our hearts in to. Every little bit counts and we are so thankful to have your support!

For the love of western cinema and 35mm film as a medium. OVERVIEW Pleasant Canyon is, in it's essence, the story of two Irish brothers at odds. Having grown up in a household where their father's life was ruled by the bottle, Dusty and Jasper O'Banion have been through quite a lot before we meet them. After losing his ranch on a wild placed bet in Oklahoma Indian territory, Emmett O'banion moved his family to Carson City, NV under the false pretense that a distant cousin of his had founded the silver mining enterprise that ruled the development of the area. With a defiled family name in town, his two sons were forced to fend for themselves and defend their own integrity against the other townsfolk. It's not until their father is shot and killed in a bar fight that each of them must find their own journey to making sure their mother is taken care of. Our story takes place after Jasper has left town on a mission to rob several banks and bring home money to save their mother from another ill fated marriage. We meet Jasper as his brother breaks him out of the Ballarat jailhouse in the deserts of California. This is story of their journey together, trying to find peace with each other and make it south to avoid being killed by a posse of Pinkerton agents and law folk. Western in genre, the period piece focuses on the dynamic of a sibling relationship that's been shattered due to their family's struggle against alcoholism. Dusty, the older of the two, has spent the last five years of his life working in the Carson City mines to bring home enough money to support his family. Jasper, who was always much closer with his mother, has devised a plan to rid the family of their troubles for good. When he's caught after robbing two banks further south he's forced to rely on his brother to get them out of harms way and head to Mexico. WHY THIS STORY? The plight of Jasper's fight to save his mother is close to home for me, as I too had to try and help my own mother after my parents' divorce from the pitfalls of trusting a new man unworthy of her love. In many ways Jasper's sacrifice and journey to a darker side of life is a small piece of me that I hope others who have gone through a similar situation will be able to relate to. Beyond that, the tail of two brothers trying to make amends, working both together and against each other is a dynamic that we can all relate to in some way or another. Being raised in a town of 2000 people, all of my best friends are brothers to me blood or not. We've been through highs and lows and when I was young one of those irreplaceable friends passed away. Ultimately, this story is a reflection of many things in my own life as well as an homage to my love for the western genre. WHY A WESTERN? Having grown up in Telluride, CO I've been fascinated by the west since I was a kid. Now a ski town, the San Juan mountains once produced millions of dollars of gold in their heyday. Tails of Alfred Packer, Soapy Smith, Butch Cassidy and the Hole In The Wall Gang and the history that goes along with the west holds a special place in my heart. Directors like Leone, Corbucci, Peckinpah, Tarantino have created amazing works of cinema that continue to inspire me today and in all of that I endeavor to create my own tails of the west. This is the start of that mission. Think of Dusty's story as the prologue for another film down the line. WHY AM I ASKING FOR HELP? We will be making this short no matter the outcome of the kickstarter. However, any help that I can get from friends, family, or anyone else willing to put their trust in me as a storyteller will go a long way. Creating a period piece is no small feat and it requires an enormous amount of support from some very talented people. I have an incredible crew taking shape, with two phenomenal leads and we're lucky enough to shoot on 2 perf 35mm film, with a Director of Photography on board who will help take this project to a higher place than I could have ever dreamed of. WHERE WILL THE MONEY GO? Not only will your donations help us feed and house the crew on location - they will help us cover permitting and insurance costs; fund critical story elements like props, costumes, animals; allow us to secure the necessary gear and support; and most importantly make sure we have everything needed to create a safe environment on set.

The goal of Where the Earth Meets the Sky is to create a breakout, feature length documentary film that will reach a global audience to galvanize new and broad support for Tibetan Freedom. It is also an intimate, genuine, and often funny portrayal of one of the most daring nonviolent direct actions in recent history, as well as the unbreakable bonds of friendship that were forged along the way. We are entering a critical moment in the Tibetan people's epic struggle for freedom. Reeling under seven decades of Chinese occupation, Tibet remains one of the world's last, and most oppressed, colonies. China�s all-out campaign to erase Tibet from the global consciousness, by means of coercion and cash, has created a conspiracy of silence on the issue. But Tibetans in Tibet, as well as in exile, continue to resist China's tyranny in their own creative ways, through acts of resistance wherever and whenever possible. With this film, we will propel Tibet to the center of the global spotlight, just as China prepares to host the 2022 Olympic Games. To reach fresh audiences, members of the Everest Action Team have reunited to share their harrowing and inspirational protest story with the world for the first time. We have assembled a �dream team� of experienced storytellers and high-caliber filmmakers to produce a unique, engaging documentary that we hope will inspire a new generation of people to support the Tibetan cause. Tibet is one of the most restricted places on the planet today - a no-go zone for international journalists and foreign watchdogs - but our film slips between the bars. Where the Earth Meets the Sky is a compelling tale of courage and international solidarity; of friends uniting for something much bigger than themselves; of taking risks to see a bit more justice in the world. Produced by the Everest Action Team themselves, this film is designed to leverage the upcoming Olympic media spotlight to draw attention to China�s growing authoritarianism, widespread surveillance, and ongoing brutality in Tibet. Our team is passionate and driven to make this film come to life, and we are confident we have the right plan and tools to turn it into a major success. We have come as far as we can through self-funding and volunteered time and so, in order to take our film to the next level, we need the support of our community and those out there we haven't yet met but who are committed to supporting Tibetan freedom and innovative, independent, documentary filmmaking. In essence, if you're reading this, we need you! And more good news...as a Fiscal Sponsee of the International Documentary Association, your donations are Tax Deductible!* Please join us by making a contribution�at any level�to support the project and stay in the loop on our filmmaking journey. And be sure to follow our path on social media, @wheretheearthmeetsthesky. Read on to explore project details and get to know our team. Thank you! Bhod Gyalo! Everest Action Team & Students for a Free Tibet Synopsis: A group of unlikely, tech-savvy activists orchestrates a high-stakes heist on Mount Everest to steal China's global spotlight ahead of the 2008 Olympic Games, refocusing the world's attention on occupied Tibet. Pulling off the near-impossible and inspiring a generation of activists, this film reveals a rare, behind-the-scenes, glimpse into an historic moment in Tibet's ongoing struggle for freedom. Storyline: In 2007, five young activists, including one Tibetan, entered occupied Tibet, breached a militarized zone on the side of Mount Everest, and launched a nonviolent protest of historic proportions. As part of its aggressive lobby to win the Olympic Games, China promised the most spectacular "Torch Relay" in Olympic history, including summiting Mt. Everest, the world's tallest mountain. For Tibetans, such a symbol of international unity paraded across their occupied country was the height of mockery and disrespect. For human rights activists, it also represented the opportunity of a generation: a chance to steal China�s coveted Olympic Spotlight and shine it instead on the horrific occupation of Tibet. Indeed, the elaborate Global Torch Relay and the Opening Ceremonies for Beijing�s 2008 Games were the most widely watched events in human history. At the center of our story is Tendor, �The Torchbearer,� a young Tibetan born in exile and raised in the Tibetan Children�s Village refugee schools in Dharamsala, India, founded by His Holiness the Dalai Lama�s sister. Tendor was brought up on stories of Tibetan resistance, living side by side with friends and schoolmates who escaped Tibet as children (some of whom lost their limbs to frostbite while crossing the Himalayas) and were desperate to see their families again. He grew up longing for the day he would see his homeland with his own eyes, like any exile yearning to return to a free Tibet. Never did he imagine that when that day came, he�d be traveling incognito, mostly hiding in hotels, and pretending to be anything but Tibetan. Surrounding Tendor is a group of undercover activists, each with a unique skill for the mission�s success. Lhadon, �The Mastermind,� leads Students for a Free Tibet - the organization that planned the daring protest - and is the public voice of the action. Shannon, �The Organizer,� is charged with building her �dream team� for accomplishing the risky mission, and acts as the central hub of the group�s connection, personally recruiting each member. Laurel, �The Smooth Talker,� has years of experience with nonviolent direct action planning and dealing with authority figures while putting his body on the line for his convictions. Kirsten, �The Smuggler,� has spent her career ferrying funds and information across borders for an underground network of frontline activists. Jeff, �The Geek,� is a highly trained mountaineer and direct action activist with a brilliant mind for outsmarting the technological obstacles the team eventually faces. Tendor�s love for his homeland, coupled with his enduring faith in his people, drive the team�and the film�ever forward towards Everest and their inevitable arrest. At night, in the cover of their hotel rooms, they are busy making protest T-shirts, assembling a large banner, and designing the �Opening Ceremony for Team Tibet.� By day, they struggle to hold their tongues and pretend to be charmed by China�s grotesque development of Tibet in order to earn the trust of government minders and nosey tour operators, and to avoid provoking any suspicion of their true intentions. The team�s mission is to expose China's Olympic Torch Relay as a massive publicity stunt meant to cover up the truth of Beijing's appalling human rights record, including the brutal, decades-long occupation of Tibet. To this end, they stage a colorful protest, rich with symbolism and strong messaging�from 17,500 feet. They successfully conduct�and broadcast�their Opening Ceremony for Team Tibet, unveiling a protest banner and lighting a unique butter-lamp torch, while Tendor sings the banned Tibetan National Anthem. They are immediately arrested at gunpoint and whisked away into days of intense interrogation. Meanwhile, out in the world, the action is a success. When China unveils its torch route the following day, outlets from CNN to Sports Illustrated pair that story with the Tibetan independence activists who protested on Everest and �haven�t been heard from since.� The team has hijacked China's Olympic limelight before the torch relay even begins, putting Tibet�s occupation front and center at a time that China desperately wants the world to forget it. With the 2021 release of Where the Earth Meets the Sky we plan to again challenge the Chinese government's false narrative on Tibet and remind the world that a few committed voices of dissent can forever change the story. Who we are Creative Team: We've brought on a world-class, Emmy nominated, team of Directors, Editors, and Storytellers whose creative credits include, Blackfish, Glenn Campbell I'll Be Me, No Subtitles Necessary, Unfriended, and two of Oliver Stone's documentaries. Their recent films have debuted at Sundance, Telluride, and Toronto Film Festivals, and they are deeply respected filmmakers within both Hollywood and the independent film world. Producers: Tenzin Dorjee Tenzin Dorjee (Tendor) is a Tibetan activist and writer, and the author of 'The Tibetan Nonviolent Struggle: A Strategic and Historical Analysis.' Born and raised in India, Tendor graduated from the Tibetan Children's Village in Dharamsala and earned his bachelor's degree in international relations from Brown University. He worked at Students for a Free Tibet from 2004 to 2013. He works as Senior Researcher and Strategist at the Tibet Action Institute and is currently a Ph.D. student in the department of political science at Columbia University. He is also a political cartoonist for the Tibetan Review. Shannon Service Shannon Service is an independent reporter and filmmaker whose work has appeared at Sundance, the Toronto International Film Festival, the Telluride Film Festival, the Berlin International Film Festival, The New York Times, and The Guardian of London. In 2012, she broke the story of slavery at sea for National Public Radio�s Morning Edition. Her feature documentary Ghost Fleet follows up, setting sail with a Thai abolitionist as she scours remote islands for slaves who�ve jumped ship. Shannon was a finalist for DOC NYC�s �Best New Director� award and won the Palm Springs Film Festival�s �Best Emerging Director� prize. As a reporter, she has earned several awards including an Edward R. Murrow, a National Press Photographers Association award, and a Knight Award for Best Narrative Science Journalism. Lhadon Tethong Lhadon Tethong is a Tibetan independence activist and co-founder and director of Tibet Action Institute, where she leads a team of technologists and rights advocates in developing and advancing open-source communication technologies, nonviolent strategies and innovative training programs for Tibetans and other groups living under extreme repression. Formerly the Executive Director of Students for a Free Tibet (2002-2009), she led the high-profile global campaign to condemn China�s rule of Tibet in the lead-up to and during the 2008 Olympic Games, making international headlines as she posted real-time accounts of her travels through Beijing on her blog BeijingWideOpen.org�one of the first in the Tibetan world�before being detained and deported. She was awarded the first annual James Lawson Award for Nonviolent Achievement by the International Center on Nonviolent Conflict in 2011 and currently serves as the Co-Chair of the International Tibet Network, the global coalition of Tibet-related non-governmental organizations. Dorjee Tseten Dorjee Tseten is the current Executive Director of Students for a Free Tibet, as well as a strategist and an organizer, leading global campaigns for Tibet. Dorjee served as the President of the Tibetan Youth Congress Baroda chapter during his university studies and developed his skills as a trainer at the Tibetan Center for Conflict Resolution before joining the staff of Students for a Free Tibet (SFT) India in 2009. He served as SFT India�s National Director for four years and joined the SFT International team as Asia Director in 2013. In 2016, Dorjee was elected as a Member of the Tibetan Parliament in Exile. Dorjee graduated from MS University in Gujarat with a Bachelors in Economics and Post Graduate Diploma in Human Rights Studies. Kiri Westby Kiri Westby is a trained human rights defender who began her career working clandestinely on the front lines of war zones, transporting funds and information across borders for an underground network of feminist activists. Raised in a Tibetan Buddhist household, her affinity to the struggle for religious freedom began at a young age. Kiri now works as a professional writer and stays on her toes chasing her two young children. Laurel Sutherlin Laurel Sutherlin is a lifelong environmental and social justice activist who has spent the last decade as a communications strategist with Rainforest Action Network while supporting hard-hitting campaigns with The Yes Men, Students for a Free Tibet and many others. Laurel joined the Tibetan freedom movement over a dozen years ago and has participated in multiple high-profile international acts of civil disobedience to bring attention to the issue. He has worked closely in support of many frontline communities defending fighting projects including old-growth logging, offshore oil drilling, tar sands pipeline infrastructure projects, and palm oil plantation expansion. He's also an avid naturalist and bird nerd. ARTISTIC CONSULTANT BIOS/REWARDS Political cartoon by Tendor - Producer Finding common ground, 8" x 10", by Tendor Photos by Sonam Zoksang - Artistic Consultant Bio Sonam Zoksang was born in 1960 in a small village in Tibet called Kyirong. His parents escaped to India one month after his birth. He grew up in refugee schools, got a degree in Buddhist Dialectics, and slowly taught himself photography. In 1985 Zoksang moved to the US where he began his political advocacy for Tibet and has served as a board member for various organizations including the US Tibet Committee. In 1993, he visited Tibet for the first time since his birth. His mission is to tell the story of his homeland through photography. He does this by documenting Tibetans and Tibetan life, both in and out of Tibet, and he has an extensive collection of His Holiness the Dalai Lama's public talks and teachings. He is one of the most well-known and celebrated Tibetan photographers in the world. MT. EVEREST WITH PRAYER FLAGS MT. EVEREST & RONGBUK MONASTERY Artwork by Lobsang Choephel - Artistic Consultant Bio Lobsang Choephel is a Tibetan artist and master calligrapher born and raised in Tibet, educated in India, and currently living in New York. As an exile who has spent most of his life separated from his family in Tibet, he taps into the experience and struggles of his own life to explore brief yet penetrating insights into themes ranging from loneliness to friendship, from anger to compassion, and from attachment to liberation. "Team Tibet" calligraphy art, 24" x 18", by Lobsang Choephel Artwork by Chungpo Tsering - Artistic Consultant Bio Chungpo is a renowned contemporary artist born in Tibet, raised in Nepal, and today based in San Francisco and Dharamsala. Chungpo�s abstract paintings evoke a sense of discontinuity and displacement, exploring what it means to be an exile and stateless in a world of nation-states. His work has been widely exhibited in Hong Kong, Thailand, Nepal, Korea, and the U.S. Holy rocks in Yamdrok Lake, 30" x 30", by Chungpo Tsering The scripture of climate change, 24" x 18", by Chungpo Tsering Artwork by Tenzing Rigdol-Artistic Consultant Bio Tenzing Rigdol is a leading Tibetan artist whose work includes painting, sculpture, drawing, collage, digital, video-installation, performance art, and site-specific pieces. His paintings have been exhibited at prestigious galleries and venues around the world, including the Metropolitan Museum of Art and the Moscow International Biennale. Rigdol is also the subject of an award-winning film Bringing Tibet Home, directed by Tenzin Tsetan Choklay, and is an artistic consultant for this film project. Tibetan Roadbuilders: Shovel Songs Project Timeline We have hours of footage from inside the action before the arrest, troves of news footage from around the world during our detention, interviews shot just after we were released, and the temporary sit down interviews that we used in the trailer. We plan to let our Directors/Editors dive into this existing material to create a string out in phase one of the editing process. We will shoot additional interviews and abstract recreations (minimally, but strategically used), and finish the film with an additional thirty weeks of editing. Our goal is to submit to film festivals for a 2021 release. Outline of our working production schedule: JUNE 2019 $65,000 needed to enter EDIT PHASE ONE. Reached through individual donors and Kickstarter Campaign running May/June 2019. JULY, 2019 EDIT PHASE ONE ( 4 weeks) SEPTEMBER, 2019 Production of additional interviews and recreations. OCTOBER 1, 2019-JUNE 1, 2020 EDIT PHASE TWO ( 30 weeks) SUMMER 2020 Scoring, Color correction, and Sound. AUGUST 2020 Due date for submission to Sundance Film Festival, 2021. * TAX DEDUCTIBLE DONATIONS: Your donation is tax deductible! Where the Earth Meets the Sky is a fiscally sponsored project of the International Documentary Association (IDA), a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization. Contributions in support of Where the Earth Meets the Sky are payable to IDA and are tax deductible, less the value of any goods or services received, as allowed by law. The value of goods and services being offered is noted under each donation level. If you would like to deduct the entire donation you have the option to simply decline the reward at checkout.

If that goal is still met at the end of the campaign, that design will be available as a pledge reward.  Once the campaign ends, backers will be charged their pledge amount. In about two weeks, those funds will be transferred to the campaign creator.  Surveys will be sent to each backer asking which of the unlocked pins you would like as a reward.  Upon receiving the campaign funds, the unlocked enamel pins will be put into production. This usually takes about a month, but may take a bit longer than that because of the large number of designs.  Pledge reward packages will be sent out ASAP, starting with the largest pledges. Just a friendly reminder that you can pledge now and will only be charged if and when the campaign is fully funded! Hi everyone! Thank you for taking the time to visit my first-ever Kickstarter campaign! With this campaign I'm hoping to raise enough funds to get my first enamel pin into production! I'm Kathleen and I'm best known for sewing pincushion cats. I have a small business called "The Fat Cat Factory" where I get to let my imagination run wild. I get to take all my quirky cat designs I have in my head and turn them into tangible products for other people to love and enjoy. Or at the very least, make someone smile. The bulk of my work has been from sewing and turning my cats into felt pincushions, ornaments, magnets and garlands. This has been a project in the making for many years. I've always wanted to turn my cat designs into enamel pins. And I've finally decided to go for it! So that is what this Kickstarter campaign has been created for...to help bring this concept into an actuality. And with your support, pledges and sharing of this fundraiser, I'm sure we'll be able to accomplish it! For those of you new to Kickstarter, here's how it works: The funding system is all-or-nothing. The campaign will run for 30 days and during that time you can pledge to help fund the project. And you are only charged if the campaign is successfully funded. If the initial funding goal isn't met, no one gets charged anything. Pledging for the styles you're interested in (even if they are still locked) will contribute to unlocking those (and more) styles. All pledges, big or small, will help to reach the ultimate goal of a full 5 pin collection! You can change your pledge, or cancel, at anytime while the campaign is still active. Though, you will not be able to change your pledge after the campaign ends. After the campaign ends, if successfully funded, surveys will be sent out to obtain which of the unlocked pins you choose and to gather shipping address. Feel free to contact me! I'm here to answer any questions and/or concerns you may have! When I was thinking about which of my cat characters I wanted to try making pins of first, I kept coming back to Halloween. I absolutely love Halloween and it is my favorite time of the year. And what goes better with Halloween than cats, right? So it only made sense to have my first enamel pin collection be "Halloween Fat Cats"! The 1st pin that I'm hoping to get into production is my personal favorite: the Jack-o-lantern cat! Once that initial funding goal is met, then the other cat designs... Ghost, Vampire, Black Cat and Skeleton... will start to get unlocked as their stretch funding goals are met. So the more pledges coming in means there is a better chance of getting all 5 styles funded. All pledges, big or small, will help to reach the ultimate goal of a full collection! Pledging for the styles you're interested in (even if they are still locked) will contribute to unlocking more styles. **The Stretch Goals have been updated thanks to a pledge offline! My mom and aunt wanted to pledge but don't know how to use the internet (and my mom doesn't even have a computer) so they gave me a check. Haha...gotta love family! So that's great new to all of us and the new unlocking pledge goal costs have been adjusted!** **In the final hours, I've decided to go ahead and "Unlock" the Vampire Cat pin! I will self-fund him so backers will now have 3 pin styles to choose from! Yay! (pincushion and ornaments are open to all 5 styles) The bulk of the funds will go towards manufacturing of the pins. Since this is my first time making pins I've chosen to go the route of using a middle-person instead of a direct-to-factory. Yes, the cost is a little more than what they'd be if I used a factory direct. But I honestly feel that this is a safer way to go since I don't have a tried-and-true factory. Going through a middle-person is helping me to make sure my designs are ready for production and they'll be able to help fix any issues that may arise through the manufacturing process. Plus this company was highly recommended to me and is already proving to be very helpful to a new enamel pin designer, such as myself. I feel that my pins will be in very safe hands! Again, since this is my first experience in enamel pin making, I'm allowing 1-2 months for production time. I'm hoping the 2 month mark is an over-estimation, but I figure it's better to allow for any unexpected delays that may come up. For backers within the US: The majority will be getting shipped out with USPS First Class Mail, with tracking included. Depending on the weight, some of the packages will be getting shipped out USPS Priority Mail (the rewards with multiple pincushions included) For international backers: There will be a flat fee of $8 for shipping to Canada. And a flat fee of $12 for shipping to Everywhere Else. All packages will be insured, but sadly the tracking will usually drop off once it leaves the US. Please note international backers are responsible for any customs, tax, etc... which may be charged by your specific county. I'm sorry about that but it is out of my control! And I will always declare the full value of your pledge on all international custom forms and will list it as merchandise not as a "gift". It is illegal for one to do so otherwise. Or course I had to include some of my original Fat Cats into the reward levels! Though the Black Cat (in all forms...pincushion, ornament and garland) has never been available to purchase before! He's a brand new style I made to compliment his enamel pin counterpart. Along with the enamel pins, included in some of the pledge levels will be, limited quantities, of pincushions, ornaments and garlands. Those pledge levels will be available in limited quantity. And some of them, due to the higher shipping weight, won't be available for shipping outside the US. The garland will feature the 5 enamel cat pin styles: Jack-o-lantern, Ghost, Vampire, Black Cat and Skeleton Thank you for taking the time to look through everything and reach all the way to the very bottom here! You are awesome! So just for you, I've added a little bit of fun random trivia about myself: my lucky number is 8, my favorite animal is the Pallas Cat (or the Wombat or the Groundhog - I go back and forth often), I have a border-line obsession with Buster Keaton and I have Lupus. Shout out to all my fellow Spoonies! When I'm not sewing Fat Cats, I'm playing with my 2 furbabies: Little Nina and Fatty Elvis. I wish everyday was Halloween so I would have a reason to keep up my decorations year-round and make more costumes...(This year I'm hoping to make a Squirrel Girl costume). I never learned to ride a bike and I often trip going up the steps. My sewing room walls are this super bright lime green which everyone, but me, seems to hate. I love reading and will try any and/or all books but I can't seem to make it through a Stephen King book. Ever. And I've tried multiple books, multiple times. And lastly, I'm terrified of yellow-jackets. I will hyperventilate and possibly pass out. And if you liked all that, come say hi on social media! On Instagram On Facebook Or in my Etsy Shop Crazy Cat Lady in the Making!

RAMMING THE RAMPARTS! This project will fund an "absurdist, surrealistic" alternate history anthology, entitled RAMMING THE RAMPARTS, containing approximately 9 or more all-original (no reprint) short stories by some of todays hottest SF&F authors. The inspiration comes from our current President's recent commentary on the Fourth of July, including the idea that our Army "took over the airports" during the Revolutionary War. What if there had been airports during that war? Absurd! George Washington was not a fighter pilot! There was no "Battle at LaGuardia Baggage Claim"! And yet... This anthology asks authors to explore these and other absurd, surrealistic alternate histories. These DO NOT need to be based off of our current President's comments, either on July 4th or at any other time. However, I'd like to see at least a few stories based off of airports during the Revolution. I'd like to keep the stories set around that era, actually, so the 18th Century or so, although this is not a hard and fast rule. Backers of this project will essentially be generating the base funds needed to produce an ebook of the anthology�including payment for the contributing authors, payment for the cover artist, production costs for producing the anthology, etc. Confirmed anchor authors include: Gerald Brandt David B. Coe Esther Friesner Elektra Hammond Nancy Holzner Rhondi Salsitz Steven H Silver Alan Smale Harry Turtledove Confirmed Stretch Goal authors include: Walter H. Hunt Gini Koch Kristine Kathryn Rusch This is a "quick and dirty" Kickstarter from Zombies Need Brains, so at the moment there is no cover art. Stretch goals will include expansion of the anthology beyond the initial 9 authors to include stories from an open call and possibly a paperback version of the book. We offer professional pay rates. As we did in our previous anthologies, we plan to include the very best stories we can find, including an open submission window if the Kickstarter is successful and reaches certain stretch goals, where anyone can submit their stories featuring the current theme for a chance to be part of the anthology. And Zombies Need Brains is officially a "qualifying market" for the Science Fiction Writers of America (SFWA)! ZNB produces quality anthologies from leading authors. Check out our current offerings: Temporally Out of Order Alien Artifacts Were- Submerged All Hail Our Robot Conquerors! The Death of All Things Guilds & Glaives Second Round: A Return to the Ur-Bar The Razor's Edge Portals Temporally Deactivated Alternate Peace at https://squareup.com/market/zombies-need-brains-llc. You can also find them online at Amazon.com and Barnes & Noble; they are available in trade paperback format as well as on almost all ebook platforms (Kindle, Nook, Kobo, Scribd, etc.). If the Kickstarter is funded, the intention is to have all stories handed in by the end of October 2019. We expect the editing and revision process to be finished by the end of December 2019 and the ebook to be designed, produced, and ready for release by the end of August 2020. Funding will cover the costs of producing the ebook in all standard formats (MOBI, Epub, PDF), cover art commission, payment of the editors, advances for the authors (at a minimum of 8 cents per word), and advertising and promotional expenses. Funding above the minimum would be used to increase the number of the stories in the book, allow for higher production values for the ebooks, increased advertising, and potentially the production of a paperback edition of the book. Stretch goals would include adding additional story slots to the books (most of which will be filled with an open call for submissions), producing a paperback, etc. We will add additional stretch goals as the Kickstarter proceeds. Stretch Goal: Once the Kickstarter reaches $6,000, we will add Walter H. Hunt as an anchor author to the anthology! Stretch Goal: Once the Kickstarter reaches $7,000, we will add Gini Koch as an anchor author to the anthology! Stretch Goal: Once the Kickstarter reaches $8,000, we will add Kristine Kathryn Rusch as an anchor author to the anthology! Stretch Goal: Once the Kickstarter reaches $10,000, we will do an open call for submissions to the anthology in order to fill SIX additional story slots, so the anthology will contain a minimum of 18 stories. Zombies Need Brains LLC is a small press owned and operated by Joshua Palmatier that focuses on producing professional quality science fiction and fantasy themed anthologies initially funded by Kickstarters. Having successfully published ten anthologies in the last five years, ZNB is currently expanding its anthology production, with the intent to eventually publish stand-alone books once the press has gained its footing. Check out the webpage at www.zombiesneedbrains.comand the online store at https://squareup.com/market/zombies-need-brains-llc. Signup for our newsletter at http://eepurl.com/dv3TLv. You can also find Zombies Need Brains on Facebook (https://www.facebook.com/zombiesneedbrainsllc/) and Twitter (@ZNBLLC).

If you have any issues with your pledge, if you have any questions about Backerkit, or you are a retailer seeking to make a pledge, please contact us via the KS messaging system. As of the end of this campaign, there is no contact button on Kickstarter. To send us a message please click here or on this banner: It's rare to be able to work on something you love. This is what happened with On the Underground. Long out of print, it was a favourite in our gaming group and when we realized that the rights were available, we reached out to Sebastian Bleasdale and, well, here we are! The massive network of London Underground stations makes up one of the most complex transportation systems in the world, and On the Underground challenges you to develop it. Build the most successful lines, connect them to landmarks and attract passenger traffic! On the Underground is a game for players who love to create. While seemingly a simple game, the strategic depth takes you beyond other network-building games such as Ticket to Ride, Thurn & Taxis and Through the Desert. Besides each game being different due to the on-board objectives, the Passenger introduces a singular challenge to each turn of the game, inviting you to participate (and earn points) even when it is not your turn. This edition of On the Underground includes the all-new Berlin map, a challenging change of pace for those who have played the original London one, which has also been updated to match the real-life Underground and improve gameplay. Besides adding Berlin and improving the art and graphic design, we took the opportunity to perfect the contents of the game, and even more so for the Deluxe edition that we hope to create with your support! We decided early on to include more than one Passenger shape options, and thus the five custom-shaped tokens were born. Three of them (wheelchair user, elderly and pregnant) were kindly provided by Ian O'Toole and Alban Viard. In addition, we felt the need to do even more to thank you for your support, and with something truly special. That is why we created the transparent acrylic token, and we gave it a shape that may be familiar to our previous backers... Finally, we decided to wrap the whole package up in something even more "Deluxe", a beautiful slip case that will have your box shining amongst others on your shelf - literally. The wraparound UV coating on the water-colour graphical elements gives it an elegant sheen that stands out. The Deluxe edition will be available through this campaign (including any retail backers - see below) and through events where we participate. We also wanted to make sure that we offer the basic edition of the game to those who do not want improved components. There are no other differences between the two editions. Note that the included rulebook for any basic edition copies fulfilled as part of this campaign may depict Deluxe components. In On the Underground, players compete to build the most valuable and convenient transportation network in London or Berlin. Each player controls 2-4 different lines, depending on the number of players. At the beginning of each turn, 4 Destination cards are facing up, corresponding to stations on the map. A player�s turn consists of taking four actions, followed by the Passenger�s movement. After the player�s turn, the Passenger token is moved along built lines and avoiding empty track spaces as much as possible, in order to reach 1 or 2 Destination stations. The Destination cards corresponding to the visited stations are then replaced by new ones, and then play passes to the next player in clockwise order. Players score points in two ways: � By building track and connecting their lines to various types of stations, by building a circular line in London, or by collecting Landmark tiles in Berlin. � By having the Passenger use their lines when moving. The game is over after all Destination cards have been drawn and all players have taken the same number of turns. The player that has earned the most points is the winner, having built the most valuable network On the Underground! You can download the rules of the game here (5 MB, right click and Save as�): On_the_Underground_rules_EN_016_compressed.pdf Please download this file, as PDFs viewed in-browser may not be displayed properly. This file is the low-resolution version of the rules document. If you find any mistakes, please use this form to submit them: https://goo.gl/forms/jTFX4bDRvO7cuejD2 Other languages On the Underground is completely language-independent. We are definitely going to have rules in German and French in the box. Other languages are a possibility, and we will update this space with new information. Solo David Turczi has worked with Sebastian to create a really cool solo mode, with its materials available as a post-campaign add-on, via Backerkit. As usual, we offer you the chance to try the game before you back the campaign. The game has been implemented on Tabletopia, and you can play for free by clicking here: Note: The videos below show prototype components. The game may look really good in these videos, but know that the final product is even better (linen-finish cards, board & box, wooden screen-printed tokens, etc.). With that said, here we go! Tom Vasel reviewed the original 2006 edition. This video also illustrates the effort and care that went into updating the art and the materials for the 2019 edition. https://www.dicetower.com/ Richard "Rahdo" Ham runs down On the Underground: https://www.patreon.com/rahdo Paul "Gaming Rules" Grogan gamely rules this playthrough: https://www.patreon.com/GamingRules Tom "Slickerdrips" Heath loses to a glass cat called Marty: https://www.patreon.com/slickerdrips Jon "Actualol" Purkis actually makes you lol (if not with this video, try this or this): https://www.patreon.com/actualol Luke "Broken Meeple" Hector had things to say, important things (note, Luke is referring to prototype components): https://www.patreon.com/TheBrokenMeeple Also, in case you missed it at the top of the page, here is the awesome On the Underground trailer https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4d-NOuoOFMo Matt "Creaking Shelves" Evans took a look at On the Underground at the UK Games Expo: http://www.creakingshelves.com/first-look-at-on-the-underground/ Joel "Devon Dice" Wright played a rather eventful game, also at the Expo: https://www.devondice.co.uk/on-the-underground-review-by-joel-wright/ General Terms We expect to fulfill the rewards bound for the USA from within the USA, and the rewards bound for EU and other countries from Germany. EU backers do not have to worry about customs or VAT. Shipments to backers outside of the EU and the USA will have 35 EUR declared as the value of the package. That's roughly equivalent to 39 USD / 52 CAD / 57 AUD / 39 CHF / 4288 JPY. Note that we can not be responsible for any customs fees. We can also not be responsible for any re-shipping fees in case your package is returned as unclaimed, or if the address you provided is not valid. Should a package not arrive within a certain time frame that will be announced when it has been shipped, we will spend a period of time investigating its fate before any action is taken. Certain countries do not appear on the list of available shipping destinations. This is due to past experiences and potential cost overruns due to weight fluctuations. Click the pledge level and please contact us via KS message if your country does not appear on the list. We expect to have tracking for the USA, but not for anywhere else. If tracking is important to you, please contact us via the KS messaging system before the campaign is over. We do not expect to be sending tracking codes when the games are shipped. Regrettably, we can not offer pickup at Spiel in Essen or at any other convention. We will be using Backerkit as our post-campaign fulfillment suite and pre-order management platform, through which additional copies may be obtained. Costs The real cost of shipping is subsidized and is offered for the period of the campaign. It includes costs like ocean freight, import fees and/or VAT, packing materials, labor, replacements shipping; and the risk of shipping cost increases. Those can add anything from $3 to $10 to the price you would have to pay if we did not subsidize them. EU: 9 USD. Real cost: At least 12-22 USD USA: 9 USD. Real cost: At least 12-22 USD Worldwide: 14 USD. Real cost: At least 18-28 USD IMPORTANT: Do not add these amounts to your pledge! We will collect the shipping cost after the campaign, via Backerkit. Retailers who wish to back this campaign must back at the $1 pledge level, and then contact us via the KS messaging system: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/ludicreations/on-the-underground-london-berlin/messages/new?message%5Bto%5D=ludicreations This offer is available only to retailers which have a physical store in the countries allowed by the $1 pledge level. Stores with event space will be prioritized and all entities and locations will be verified. Online-only retailers will be considered in territories where there no physical retailers have backed the campaign. Fulfillment will be conducted in the following steps: 1. Individual backers 2. Physical stores 3. Online-only stores (if any) - at least 2 weeks after the previous step There will be a limit on how many copies of each edition that a retailer can order. A deposit will be taken during the campaign, with the rest of the funds payable via Backerkit. Only retailers who back this campaign will be able to re-order the game, should there be any stock available, for at least 6 months after fulfillment has commenced. Please contact us for more information. What You See Is What You Get - we like to run simple, straightforward campaigns. We are aware that stretch goals would increase the funding total. However, we have already thrown everything into this game - a lot of time, effort, and money. We are already going to print with the highest quality materials. We also want to offer the game at the cheapest cost possible - and that is incompatible with stretch goals. We'd have to add "hidden" profit in the pledge levels that we can then "spend" to give you stretch goals - nothing is for free. Raising money beyond our goal does not give us extra money on hand to create stretch goals. Retail availability: We pledge that, along with the exception of a limited number of retail backer and convention copies, your games will arrive long before the game (the basic edition) is available through wide distribution. SPIEL availability: Should production be completed in time, we plan to airship a limited number of copies to Essen, where we will be selling them. As mentioned above, we can not offer pickup there or at any other convention, and we can not guarantee availability. Game Design: Sebastian Bleasdale Illustration: Viktor Csete Graphic Design: Viktor Csete Rules Editing: Paul Grogan Trailer: Sonja Hatanp�� Tabletopia Implementation: Viktor Csete Special Thanks: JKLM & Rio Grande Games, Teppo Saarinen, the JunaCon crew, Ian O'Toole, Alban Viard, Toni Heinonen, Kira Peavley, David Turczi, John Albertson, Adrian & Sandie Whipp, Brett Gilbert, Matthew Dunstan, Tom Vasel, Luke Hector, Matt Evans, Joel Wright, Martyn Poole, Derek & Lizzie Funhouser, Nick Welford, Antti Punavaara, and the many, many playtesters that helped create (and re-create!) On the Underground. LudiCreations is a publisher of such novel games as Crisis, �and then, we held hands, Mr. Cabbagehead's Garden, ESSEN, Kune v Lakia, Pocket Imperium, [redacted], and Town Center. Working with talented contributors from around the world, we create games with unexpected themes and mechanisms. Gather your friends, and turn wood and cardboard into joy! www.ludicreations.com

For years I have been making dice jewelry for my friends and family as a hobby and for gifts. A few years ago I decided to start making my items more widely available and people really seemed to enjoy them at conventions or whenever they were found. It is now time again to expand on my previous offerings and I bring you....Amethyst and Cats Eye Aquamarine dice jewelry! All pieces are hand crafted, on stainless steel findings, and feature an engraved "20" on one side. Amethyst D20 Earrings on Stainless Steel Hooks with ear nuts Amethyst D20 Necklace on 23" Stainless Steel Chain Cats Eye Aquamarine D20 Earrings on Stainless Steel Hooks Cats Eye Aquamarine D20 Necklace on 23" Stainless Steel Chain

Hi there! My name is Linda. I've been a violinist for over twenty years. I grew up taking lessons from my mom, who was a professional violinist, and grew up playing classical music in local orchestras. In 2011, I started making covers and 4-part violin arrangements of popular songs on my YouTube channel. Around that time, I also started learning to code and became a software developer. This is my first album of original instrumental music. All the songs in this album are inspired by code. Song tracks Album cover My workspace Check: loop pedal violin keyboard amp mic rubber chicken So... what does your music sound like? I love epic instrumental music, so my composition style is influenced by: Two Steps from Hell Taylor Davis Ludovico Einauldi Zo� Keating Here's a sample of a mashup cover I've done in the past: Why $100? I am raising $100 to launch the album on Spotify and iTunes via CDBaby ($49.00), pay for the UPC Bar Code ($20.00), and pay for associated taxes and fees like Kickstarter's 10% fee. Why $100? Stretch Goals Anything greater than $100 will help pay for: the music editing software I use (Logic Pro X - $199) help me raise money to purchase an even better loop pedal (the Boss RC-300 - $559.99) new violin strings ($84) purchase a new hard drive ($99) and give me inspiration to create more music and YouTube videos. Stretch goal: Special video for 100 backers I'll make a rubber chicken cover of any song voted on by all of you, when we reach 100 backers! I do have a chicken: Acknowledgments Many thanks to everyone who's supported me on Patreon! You'll get a link to this album for free if you've already contributed the price of the album. Many thanks to Anbuselvan, who gifted me the RC-30 loop pedal two years ago to replace a broken one. Many thanks to my husband Arthur for coming up with some of the brilliant song titles, to my mentor Simon for suggesting the title of the last track, and to my brother Alan for giving me music feedback. Thank you!

Ted Bundy. Charles Manson. Rodney Alcala. All these serial murderers had something in common: they were good-looking�dare I say fuckable?�and deeply charismatic. Also, they were pathetic, whiny baby-men who were so pathologically incapable of handling rejection that they literally had to kill people to feel better. Let�s face it: true crime is having something of a moment. From podcasts like Serial to fictionalized retellings like American Crime Story, murder media is saturating our airwaves. But the real horror story�the one going untold�is that so much of this is happening because dudes don�t know how to handle their feelings. Enter RIDING IN SUBARUS WITH BOYS. When Iris� friends drive away from a campsite parking lot while she�s in the bathroom, she�s stranded in the middle of nowhere with an overstuffed backpack and a dead phone. She decides to hitch a ride, and as luck would have it, the first person to stop for her is a cute guy named Noah who likes the same weirdo music as her. But as soon as Iris lets her guard down, she discovers that Noah may not be as harmless as he looks... Tonally, RIDING IN SUBARUS WITH BOYS is what would happen if the protagonist of IT FOLLOWS stood up halfway through the movie and was like, �Wait, what the fuck?� Much like the patriarchy, this project straddles the line between a horror film and a dark comedy: it�s a story about how women are expected to work overtime to help emotionally stunted men deal with their feelings, even if it means putting ourselves in harm�s way. Depending on how you hold it up to the light, that fact is either terrifying, bleakly funny, or both. Visually, RIDING IN SUBARUS WITH BOYS combines the lush scenery of northern New Jersey with a rich, dark palette heavy in blues and greens. The goal is a dramatic, almost romantic look, to be juxtaposed with unsettling, awkward shot composition. Examples? Sure, we've got examples! Visual reference: IT FOLLOWS Visual reference: DEATH PROOF Visual reference: MILLENNIUM MAMBO Visual reference: HEATHERS SUBARUS writer/director Keely Weiss on location I�m making this movie because I believe we need to find a new way to talk about toxic masculinity. The attitude that �boys will be boys� is not yet extinct: Brett Kavanaugh�s Supreme Court confirmation last year served as ample evidence of this. And we already know that the consequences of this conditioning are dire�for proof, look at just about any news story involving the rape or murder of women. And even though movies and shows like Big Little Lies have us finally talking about the consequences of this kind of masculinity, it sometimes feels like we�re missing the point. Sure, men like Donald Trump or Alexander Skarsgard�s Big Little Lies character Perry Wright pose a real and dangerous threat, but the root of toxic masculinity isn�t �manly� behavior or even aggression: it�s entitlement. From GamerGate to �incel� culture, the internet is rife with examples of �nice� guys who feel so entitled to women�s time and attention that when they don�t get what they want, they believe they have a right to go out and take it. But we are afraid to offend the delicate sensibilities of the men around us by acknowledging that male fragility is putting us all in danger. I say screw that: it�s high time that we recognize �manliness� for the farce that it is. The sooner we decide it�s okay for men to be laughed at, the sooner women will stop dying. We're working with a badass crew featuring women in all lead roles. Meet our key collaborators: Keely Weiss (Writer/Director) is a writer and filmmaker. Her short film THE THING ABOUT US has screened at film festivals all over the world, including Outfest and BFI Flare, and was executive produced by Jill Soloway. Keely was previously the Features Editor at Harper�s BAZAAR and has written for Interview, Nylon, LA Weekly, and elsewhere. Marie Bardi (Producer) is a Brooklyn-based producer with experience in narrative features, branded content, and short films. Recent credits include the features HER SMELL (dir. Alex Ross Perry; Official Selection - TIFF and NYFF) and MODERN PERSUASION (dir. Jonathan Lisecki / Alex Appel; currently in post), and the shorts 86�D (dir. Alan Palomo; Vimeo Staff Pick) and THREE STARS (dir. Emily Yoshida; currently in post). She graduated with honors from NYU�s Tisch School of the Arts with a BA in Cinema Studies and Producing. Charlotte Hornsby (Director of Photography) is a cinematographer based in New York. She shot the 2017 and 2018 Sundance Film Festival Narrative Short Film Jury Award-winning films HAIR WOLF and LUCIA BEFORE AND AFTER. Her work has appeared in Pitchfork, Nylon, Rolling Stone, the Fader, MTV, The New Yorker, Vogue and at the Sundance Film Festival, SXSW, BAM Cinemafest and MoMA. We are currently working with a $15,000 budget which is coming entirely from personal savings. This money will cover most of production, but it's not quite enough, so we're looking to grants and this Kickstarter campaign to make up the difference. Here's the breakdown of where your $10,000 will go: Camera and equipment rentals: $4,300 Meals for cast and crew: $700 Post-production: $5,000 Any extra money raised past the initial $10,000 goal will help us cover submissions to film festivals and marketing materials.

THE STORY BEHIND "AHMA & ALAN" () Ahma & Alan is a dramatic short film about a Taiwanese grandma (ahma) that has to travel from a rural town in central Taiwan to the capital city of Taipei to pull Alan, her American-born grandson, out of jail before he gets deported by a vindictive police officer. Ahma & Alan still: Gregory Yuan as Alan (left). Akio Chen as Officer Bei (right).  -  () -  ( This film is based on personal experience: I moved to Taiwan after college to study Mandarin and to reconnect with family living there. I was almost deported for allegedly teaching English illegally at a kindergarten since I was not �Taiwanese� (i.e. no Taiwanese passport or ID). There was a law that forbids foreigners from teaching kindergarten in Taiwan for fear the children would be culturally corrupted. When I had to report to the police station, my ahma (grandma) came with me. She told the officers, �My grandson�s Taiwanese! He doesn�t need to work illegally, I can take care of him!� Seeing such strength come from this small, elderly woman gave me such pride to be her grandson and was part of the inspiration for this story. My ahma, circa 2006. | 2006. Ahma & Alan tackles identity issues many Asian Americans and the Asian diaspora face: What world do we belong to? Asia or America? This film shows the generational and cultural loss that comes with immigration, particularly in the loss of one�s heritage language. As a child (age 4-5) in the U.S., I was proud of my Taiwanese background and spoke an elemental mix of Taiwanese (Hokkien), Mandarin, and English. Entering kindergarten I was teased for my lack of English fluency. Going through elementary, I began to attach shame to speaking Mandarin and Taiwanese in public and a disdain for having to go to Chinese school. I didn�t want to be seen as less American or even worse, considered a FOB by others. I eventually lost my Mandarin and Taiwanese language ability. The connection I had with my non-English speaking grandparents, who were helping my parents raise me, grew tenuous and distant. Years later, after my grandparents had moved back to Taiwan, I visited my ahma and ahgong (grandpa) as an adult and I saw how unconditional familial love can still connect us across time and nationality. This is what I want to explore in Ahma & Alan. Me age 8 or so in California. 8 This is a passion project of mine that I�ve personally funded along with tremendous help from my family. Late 2018, I left my job in Los Angeles to travel to Taiwan and give this film 100% of my attention and energy. After much hard work, encouragement, and some luck, we were able to complete principle photography with an extraordinary local and international cast and crew. However, we�re stuck. I�m back in LA with the raw files for the film, but we don�t have the necessary funds to complete post production in addition to paying back deferred production costs. That�s why we need your help. Creating a high quality, professional short film, even after cutting costs, requires a large amount of resources and funds. Let's find out how much. Why the $18,000 goal? The funds from this Kickstarter will first be used to complete post-production costs for this film such as: Editing Coloring Sound mixing Musical score Costs estimated to be $9,000. The remaining $9,000 will be used to pay back a portion of the production costs of $23,000 such as: Crew Cast Gear Production Design Transportation Catering Remaining funds will be used towards marketing, festival fees, and travel. Thus the $18,000 is to cover a little over half of the total budget (56%). Here's a video where I give a more detailed breakdown of film budgeting. As you can see, making a high quality, professional level film costs money! Which is why we need your help. Ahma & Alan still: Grandma Lin (actor Mei-Hou Wu).   To support, please click the �Back this project� button on the upper right and give what you can. Even small donations of $5, $10, and $25 add up. We have awesome rewards that are exclusive only to Kickstarter backers. You can also help by spreading the word about this Kickstarter campaign on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, LINE, Wechat, Kakao...and by word of mouth with friends and family. You can find us on Facebook and Instagram. Please follow and share! Grandma and I, circa 2014. 2014 How to use Kickstarter Need help signing up for Kickstarter and making a pledge I made a video for you! Kickstarter Kickstarter

Adventurer's Coffee Company is the brainchild of three friends who decided to become partners. We grew tired of the usual hustle and bustle of corporate life, and we set out to do something good for ourselves and the community. The company started as just a production company, with a plan to produce green- to roasted-bean coffee, with a nerdy and an outdoorsy twist to it. We felt that both of those markets had no real representation in the coffee world, and we felt like both of those worlds pretty well represented who we are. We're video gamers, hikers, table-top RPG'ers, campers, and so much more. No one else seemed to really hit the nail on the head of what we wanted to convey. As the idea came closer to life, it became a store front; a place for everyone to come in for a cup of coffee, a latt�, or some un-thought-of concoction based on a video game character. We feel like everyone wants to feel that sense of adventure. Whether you're a desk jockey like we've almost always been, a travelling salesman, a professional rock climber, a video game streamer, a weekend warrior, or, well, anything... we want our coffee to give you the fuel to put you feet first into your next adventure. This Kickstarter hopes to be the foundation of a beautiful project that will unit a community, provide career potential for many individuals, breathe life into an avenue otherwise under-touched, and light the beacons so that more may know the way. (That's a Gondor reference, if you couldn't tell.)
