Greetings Program! I present to you a badge designed to hack other badges. This badge is not only cool looking, but also features a playground for better understanding digital communication and a very useful tool for people of all skill levels in electronics. Not to mention it's hackable and blinky. About the Badge render of boards Electronic badges are becoming more common, but after what ever conference they were procured at, they often quickly find their way to a drawer or wall hook and are not ever used again. I wanted to design a badge that was useful long-term and wouldn't end up gathering dust. As I was trying to figure out what to design for this badge, I noticed that I kept using one tool on my work bench, my bus pirate. For those who don't know this tool, designed by Dangerous Prototypes,it has a myriad of features as follows: 0-5.5volt tolerant pins 0-6volt measurement probe 1Hz-40MHz frequency measurement 1kHz - 4MHz pulse-width modulator, frequency generator On-board multi-voltage pull-up resistors On-board 3.3volt and 5volt power supplies with software reset Macros for common operations Bus traffic sniffers (SPI, I2C) A bootloader for easy firmware updates Transparent USB->serial mode 10Hz-1MHz low-speed logic analyzer Servo driver Can program many AVR microcontrollers (Supported by AVRdude/Can emulate the AVR STK500 v2 with alternate ST500 Clone firmware ) Programs FPGAs and CPLDs with alternate XSVF firmware Scriptable from Perl, Python, etc. The community has written firmware which adds even more features. I decided to integrate the bus pirate v3.6 because it has better support from the original developers and community over the bus pirate v4 which, while newer, didn't see as great of support from the developers. The badge has a switch that can be used to physically disconnect the bus pirate from the rest of the badge or connect the bus pirate to either act as a UART bridge to the brain of the badge or get an I2C playground for learning and testing. Both the recognizer badge and identity addon are back-lit with RGB LEDs so you can hack into the badge, choose your color, and have groovy animations. The recognizer badge also features: 8x12 LED matrix display 3 buttons 3 SAO ports 2 Minibadge ports USB micro-b port 2xAA batteries #WifiCactus I've also collaborated with @d4rkm4tter to bring you this #wificactus SAO which will work with any badge that supports the new SAO 1.69 standard. Final board render Who am I? I am a computer science and electrical engineering technology student. I have designed a couple of addons for SAINTCON and decided I wanted to design my own indie badge for DEF CON 27. End of line.

STRETCH GOALS! We're funded, so here's what happens if go even higher! $2000 Everyone gets hard cover copies of the the book instead of softbound. $2500 Everyone gets a bonus print from Angela and a Foxy lanyard to wear at work or conventions. The Project Scott and Angela have produced a gorgeous and spooky book. It's about a very wise fox who doesn't believe in ghosts even when they are chasing him. If you like the Adams Family or know what happens if you say Beetlejuice three times, you'll feel right at home. We've been showing this book at conventions and fairs for several months now and everyone loves the art. Angela did amazing work and we can't wait for you to see it. Timeline We love this book, and guess what? The book is already finished! We just need to print it and send it into your hands so you can love it too. We expect to be printed and shipped before the end of September. Plenty of time for Halloween and Christmas. Reward levels that include a bonus print by Angela are marked for Delivery in early October. Just to be safe as the print will be new and we want it done right. But we expect it to be done and shipped in September as well. The long term plan is after the kickstarter success, in October at the earliest, the book will be available for purchase online at places like Amazon and Barnes & Noble. You will already have your copy by then, and if you live in the continental US, you didn't pay for shipping or tax. That was on us. Reading Level The words are suitable for a 4th grade reading level, and we figure nine and up is a good range for scary stories. If your child is brave enough for ghost stories, they will be more than ready. Younger kids may love it too, but they'll need someone to read it to them. Current Cover Design Bah! Restarts! Money! We want stories! Scaredy the Cat and Anthony Fox are hoping you'll pledge. Artist: Angela Fullard Angela creates comics, art, and now has her own ongoing webcomic. She creates art that exists on the border of the supernatural world and our own. She calls her cute but odd creatures that she loves to draw, Oddlings. Angela's Oddlings Writer: Scott Bachmann Scott has his own publishing imprint, Corgi Press and it's filled with dozens of titles. Illustrated books, Graphic Novels, Novels, games - there's no limit to Scott's creativity. The bonus book from Corgi Press that could be yours! Sample Pages

June 6, 1944 00:10 Pathfinders of the 101st Airborne division parachute into Normandy. For more than a decade Lost Battalion Games, has been remembering the allied invasion of Normandy. We want to share our love of the history and our appreciation of the sacrifice of ordinary men called to acts of true valor and courage. The D-Day invasion battle was a stage where perfect execution by the British 6th Airborne division was contrasted by amazing improvisation by the American 101st and 82nd Airborne divisions. The Landing at Utah beach was executed generally according to plan. But �Bloody Omaha� beach and the raiding forces like Point du Hoc had to adapt to confusion and disorder. Sometimes coming ashore while in the wrong place, faced with stiff resistance from Axis forces. In all, D-Day was tragic and triumphant. We want to allow you to remember this great battle with us, while sharing a game of cards with family and friends. How Can You Help? First off please spread the word through posting on Facebook, history blogs, reddit pages, game forums or any other platform where you have an established presence and voice. Lend us your voice. Our project is first and foremost about remembering those who fought in D-Day. We do that through stories and games shared with our family and friends. Support us in any of these backer levels: D-Day 75th Anniversary Backer - $10 USD You will receive a copy of the D-Day 75th Anniversary Bridge Size playing card deck. Share the Memories Backer - $250 USD You will receive a case (30 decks) of D-Day 75th Anniversary Bridge Size playing card decks. Customize the Illustration and Memorandum My Uncle Fought Backer - $350 USD We will illustrate one card using a photograph of your "Uncle" (or any family or friend). You must have a photograph of your "Uncle" for which you own the copyright or is in the public domain. We will use this as a guide for the artist to do a custom illustration of a single card - for example, the 2 of Hearts. Your custom card will be included in each deck of your reward. Reward is a case of 30 decks. D-Day Legacy Backer - $1000 USD You can replace one illustration in the deck that everyone gets, with a custom illustration and two line text memorandum. Our artist will exercise creative license to enshrine the moment you wish to commemorate. We will use your photograph as a guide for the artist to do a custom illustration of a single card. You will also be able to choose which of the remaining cards in the deck will feature your custom illustration. This will be selected in backer order. You will receive a case containing 30 decks of D-Day 75th Anniversary edition cards. Custom Illustration and Memorandum Our good friend Tom Burman from Sergeants: Day of Days. The above example was done for a Vietnam era veteran that served in the 101st Airborne. We did this because of his avid play and support for our Sergeants: Miniatures Game. For backers of "Legacy" and "My Uncle Fought" levels this is the way we convert your photograph into a production illustration. We have done many of these for veterans and museums. Please join us in remembering the valor of these men. Moments in Time Time, Force and Memorandum Each card in the deck commemorates a moment in time on D-Day. Each card has a time, force and memorandum, along with the suit rank and illustration. Here is a list of the times and memoranda that are currently in the deck. June 6, 1944 00:10 - Pathfinders of the 101st Airborne parachute into Normandy. June 6, 1944 00:11 - German soldiers detect the Pathfinders and engage the Pathfinders as they place the "Eureka Beacons." June 6, 1944 00:15 - The "Rebecca" receivers on the C-47 pick up the first of the landing beacons. June 6, 1944 00:16 - D Company British 6th Airborne Division lands by Horsa gliders between B�nouville and Ranville bridges. June 6, 1944 00:20 - Pathfinders from the 22nd Independent Parachute Company drop to continue marking the landing zones. June 6, 1944 00:31 - D Company British 6th Airborne Division captures both bridges - "Ham and Jam" success is radioed. June 6, 1944 00:48 - The first paratroops from the 101st Airborne Division land in Normandy. June 6, 1944 01:21 - The first of the 82nd Airborne troops land in Normandy. June 6, 1944 01:38 - Only one of the eighteen Pathfinder teams landed on their assigned landing zone. June 6, 1944 01:40 - Only 1100 paratroops from the 101st Airborne dropped in their landing zones. The rest were scattered. June 6, 1944 01:45 - The 505th Parachute Infantry Regiment lands in "Drop Zone O" and moves to Sainte-M�re-�glise. June 6, 1944 02:44 - The paratroops of the 82nd Airborne Division complete their landings, most are badly scattered. June 6, 1944 03:54 - Gliders from the 101st Airborne Division crash land from hitting twenty foot hedgerows� instead of six feet. June 6, 1944 04:00 - Men of the 501st and 506th made Landing Zone D in the third wave. June 6, 1944 04:00 - The 3rd Battalion 505th Parachute Infantry Regiment is led by L. Col. Ed Krause to capture Sainte-M�re-�glise. June 6, 1944 04:30 - Landing Zone D is counterattacked by German forces causing heavy casualties. June 6, 1944 05:30 - The Allied naval bombardment begins with fire from the French light cruiser Montcalm. June 6, 1944 06:05 - Allied airplanes drop 11,000 tons of bombs prior to the invasion. June 6, 1944 06:25 - The shattering bombardment ceased after firing 2000 shells every 10 minutes. June 6, 1944 06:30 - The first wave of troops from the VII Corps First US Army approach Utah beach at H-Hour, 06:30. June 6, 1944 06:35 - Company A 116th and Company C 2nd Rangers landed in the face of extreme resistance. June 6, 1944 06:40 - At "Dog Red" Company F 116th Infantry Regiment takes 45 minutes to cross the beach with 50% losses. June 6, 1944 06:45 - Sainte-Marie-du-Mont, defended 91st Luftlande, was attacked by the 3rd Bn. 501st PIR. June 6, 1944 06:55 - The 146th Army Engineer Battalion lands to clear the beach of obstacles ahead of the infantry. June 6, 1944 07:00 - Company L of the 16th Infantry Regiment lands and reaches the bluffs without casualties. June 6, 1944 07:10 - Reinforcing companies land among the confusion on "Bloody Omaha" beach. June 6, 1944 07:10 - Ninety men of Rudder's Rangers reach the 100 foot cliff of Point du Hoc climbing into German defensive fire. June 6, 1944 07:15 - Companies A and B of 2nd Ranger Battalion takes 50% casualties trying to take Pointe du Hoc. June 6, 1944 07:15 - Reinforcements for Point du Hoc are driven three miles off course by wind and waves arriving 40 minutes late. June 6, 1944 07:20 - On "Omaha Beach" follow on waves land amid the confusion and are savaged by German machineguns. June 6, 1944 07:30 - Brigadier General Cota lands among the 116th Infantry Regiment to take charge of the floundering attack. June 6, 1944 07:45 - Command Control breaks down on Omaha. Squad level initiative continues the attack, carrying the battle. June 6, 1944 08:00 - The 16th Regiment, 1st Division lands near exit E-3 on Fox Green, breaching the defenses. June 6, 1944 08:30 - General Cota gains control of the 116th Infantry Regiment achieving a breakthrough to the bluffs. June 6, 1944 09:00 - USS McCook goes close inshore to destroy German heavy guns near Varreville. Ad hoc squads push forward. June 6, 1944 09:00 - Three of the four exits from Utah beach were opened by mixed waves of infantry, engineers and tanks. June 6, 1944 09:00 - Brigadier General James Gavin attacked the causeway from the northwest with 300 assorted Paratroops. June 6, 1944 09:30 - The troops on Omaha scale the cliffs and capture officers of the "Ost Battalion" gaining critical intelligence. June 6, 1944 09:50 - US destroyers risk running aground to provide direct fire support, the tide of battle turns for the Americans. June 6, 1944 10:00 - The follow on waves landing on Omaha joins the confusion on the beach, but press through to nearest exits. June 6, 1944 11:30 - The USS Arkansas BB-33 came inshore to fire directly on bunkers allowing swarms of troops exit Omaha. June 6, 1944 12:00 - The 1st Battalion, 505th Parachute Infantry Regiment attacks La Fi�re bridge capturing it for an hour. June 6, 1944 13:00 - The 18th and 115th Infantry Regiments clear beach exits D-1, E-1 and F-1 taking an hour to cross the beach. June 6, 1944 13:45 - Pvt. James Mattingly scouts La Fi�re Bridge in... �the best piece of individual soldiering I have ever seen.� June 6, 1944 14:00 - The Navy reopens Omaha beach for vehicle landings. June 6, 1944 15:00 - The 336th Battalion reinforced by 2nd Battalion 18th Infantry Regiment are both stalled in front of exit-E. June 6, 1944 16:00 - A counterattack led by old R-3 tanks overran the an outpost of the 1 Bn, 505th PIR holding Cauguigny. June 6, 1944 16:40 - At La Fi�re bridge 3 German tanks were destroyed by bazookas, engaged at 30 yards, also rescuing prisoners. June 6, 1944 17:00 - The 336th Battalion is supported by 741st Tank Battalion debauched exit E-1 after taking the 12-foot road. June 6, 1944 20:00 - The 745th Tank Battalion forces through exit F-1, capturing the high ground before darkness. June 6, 1944 21:00 - 1 Bn, 505th PIR dug in at the manor while the Germans did the same on the far side of the swamp. June 6, 1944 22:00 - The second wave of glider reinforcement for the 101st Airborne are scattered for throughout the area. June 6, 1944 23:00 - Germans attacks against Pointe du Hoc continue for 4 hours. Rudder's Rangers are down to 75 effectives. June 6, 1944 24:00 - By midnight the supporting tank battalions push through exit E-3, securing "Omaha Beach."

Tachyon Rider is a VR retro cyber-racer with themes of action and adventure existing during the Tachyon Era. Mankind has surpassed the slow and monotonous lifestyle, so turn up the music and put that pedal to the Tachyon metal as you glide across the cyberscape. Fancy some competition and danger? Visit the Retro City Arena to participate in a variety of exciting and immersive game modes! Everybody has a place in the world of Tachyon Rider, but only the fearless few make it to the top... Retro City: The large and immersive city of the future, Capital of the Tachyon Era 3 In depth game modes: Prism, Highway121, Neon Cup Retro City Side Quests 3 Customizable vehicles Interact-able NPCs and voiced characters Win currency from each game mode used to spend in Retro City Purchase a variety of upgrades and abilities The creation of Tachyon Rider is currently a solo project. Funding will allow for unique, high quality music to better immerse the player into the Tachyon world. Every aspect of Tachyon Rider will feel exciting and new with plenty of character to set it aside from your regular VR experience. Funding also enables more time and dedication to be administered into the project as well as hiring help where needed. Completion of stretch goals will provide the funding for a bigger and more immersive experience, more game modes, and even the possibility to invite your friends for the ride! Planned platforms include: Oculus Rift/Rift S/Quest/Vive With funding/demand: Index/PSVR 2019 Q1 - Campaign/Development 2019 Q2-Q3 - Music/Development 2019 Q4 - Polish 2020 Q1 - Release! Tachyon Rider is being developed inside the Unreal Engine along side Blender for high resolution assets and textures and an overall high quality experience

I have created captivating commercials and films for brands worldwide. Now, my eyes are set on a new adventure film that promises the same thrills and action of a roller-coaster ride -- OPERATION CAVITY. 'Write what you know.' That's the traditional wisdom that screenwriting gurus tell aspiring filmmakers when they're searching for ideas to create. However, I took a bit of a different approach, 'Write what you fear.' I began developing this project four years ago after shooting my last award-winning short film, Hi-Glow Retro. The concept focuses on a boy and his fear of the dentist. Growing up, that boy was me. test footage Maybe I can blame myself for having a mouthful of cavities from a diet of sour candies or that time the orthodontist shaved down my front teeth so that they were perfectly flat-edge. Whatever it may be, I know this -- in the eyes of a kid, going to the dentist can be terrifying. Syringes. Drills. Pliers. Now, throw in my love for great action films and we have OPERATION CAVITY. test footage WHAT IS OPERATION CAVITY? This is a heist film. Think Stranger Things meets Ocean's 11. Or for the older crowd think 1980s-style adventure, like what Steven Spielberg's Amblin Entertainment started off creating. Operation Cavity is an unusual coming-of-age story that follows 11 year-old Douglas Maroney as he plots to rob the dentist who traumatized his childhood. test footage When Douglas complains to his friends about his dentist, keeping a tooth that he extracted from him � he soon discovers that he�s not the only one. In fact, they realize that the dentist has a secret collection that he�s been building over the years. Douglas and his friends are inspired to plot an elaborate heist to steal back their teeth from the Dentist and sell it to younger students on the 'black market' at school for tooth fairy money. Fast. Action. High-Stakes. This is a bank job. There�s never a dull moment on this roller-coaster ride. As any good film, there are some comedic moments, but this isn�t a comedy � these kids want their teeth back. Each shot will push the narrative or introduce a new piece of information to help our viewers follow along. Think Hell or High Water, Die Hard, Jurassic Park, Sicario, Ocean�s 11, Baby Driver, Overlord, and Goodfellas. test footage THE A-TEAM In order to successfully pull off a heist, you need a highly-skilled group of craftsmen -- Mountain-Movers. Can-Doers. Punctual. Creative. These humans below are seasoned professionals, the Avengers of filmmaking. Alex on-set with his #1 fan WHY SHOULD I GIVE YOU MY MONEY? Our last film, Hi-Glow Retro, proved that we could produce a compelling and striking film inexpensively. Four years later, we have grown tremendously as filmmakers and have gained tons of experience. Now we want to step up our game, but we need your help. We've already invested a significant amount of our own resources and will be receiving no pay for this shoot. The budget we're asking for is what we need to get everything else done: from craft services to the custom design and creating a denture for the surgery scene. From start to finish, from production to post, you will be making this film happen. And it will be epic. We hope to encourage supporters of independent film to participate in this production from the very beginning. We want to involve you (the audience) in this adventure, as well as give you opportunities to share in the success of the film. Alex and the team prepare for liftoff. BUDGET GAME PLAN As soon as we�ve successfully funded this project, we�ll immediately move into production. We�ve already began pre-production work (location scouting, scheduling and more), and selecting key cast and on-boarding crew members (and you). But to officially attach these professionals, we first need to complete funding. We plan to shoot for four days in Early August 2019 in Fairfield County, Connecticut. Our goal is to premiere at film festivals in the Spring of 2020. This project is a proof of concept for a TV series that Alex is currently developing. Alex directing a commercial for Unilever in Myanmar. REWARDS The poster has not yet been created but it will be similar to this poster for Hi-Glow Retro or better! Silvermine's 'Make Mountains Move' T-Shirt Festival Premieres! As an Executive Producer, you'll join us on the red carpet. Alex and producers at the Connecticut premiere of Hi-Glow Retro WHY KICKSTARTER? I have helped four Kickstarter campaigns raise close to a million dollars through the videos I have created over the past seven years. Among the most successful campaigns were EMBR Wave, a campaign that reached $629,856 from a $100,000 goal and Daniel's, which raised $243,918 from a $25,000 goal. I have witnessed the influence that Kickstarter has in helping creators find supporters for their projects and now I am hoping to find those supporters for my own passion project, Operation Cavity. WHY SHOULD I CARE? Alex is a sought after director known for creating distinctive worlds with emotional storytelling, strong characters and a very cinematic visual style. Operation Cavity is his most ambitious project yet and will surely be the best. Why not be involved in creating something epic? Below are some of Alex's greatest hits (including Hi-Glow Retro above): THANK YOU Thank you for reading about OPERATION CAVITY! This project is very important to us and we are excited to share it with you. Follow us on Twitter , Instagram , and Like us on Facebook Simply put, we CANNOT make this without YOU! With Kickstarter it is all or nothing. If a campaign does not reach its goal, no money is collected, no project can get made, and thus no rewards distributed. Alex & Crew after wrapping a Kona Brewing Company commercial

And 5 other stretch goals unlocked! A casual strategy game showing the adventurous entrepreneurial spirit of millennials... packaged inside a wearable "Fanatee Pack". A fashionable game night choice. Be the first player to pay off 20 Manatee Coins worth of Student Debt. Each round has two phases: Place your manatee token on any of the four cards on the left OR any of the four fixed spaces on the right. You can purchase a business venture or gain another benefit. Business Ventures can pay off by giving you more coins later in the game. Having the toast token is helpful because it gives you first dibs on what you want. Wow, we did it! Thank you! Zach Stafford draws Extra Fabulous Comics, animates funny videos on youtube, and has a Patreon. Jason Anarchy is a game designer who makes silly card games like the Drinking Quest series, Newfoundland Jam and HECK: A Tiny Card Game. Thank you from the bottom of our manatee hearts for any support you can give us! You can also view a simple gameplay video here.

From Neigh to Zebra is a whimsical read about a horse that falls in love with a zebra. Since their love is taboo, the horse tries to find some stripes while the zebra tries to get rid of hers. They both eventually succeed but then they still don�t match! In the end, love conquers all because #LoveIsLove. The story is an allegory meant to promote discussions of acceptance and diversity. Our team comes from the world's leading children's brands We've been lucky enough to receive acclaimed reviews Our work has been lauded by editors, child psychologists, teachers, authors, parents, and, most importantly, kids! Examples of the spreads! Here are just a few of the spreads (in addition to the ones shown in the video) so you can get a feel for what the book looks like and sounds like. Here's a spread near the end, but we�re keeping the final pages a secret so you�ll have to get the book to see what happens next ;) We believe that details matter Illustration: Each spread is a different color so the book itself is a rainbow and the colors match the tone of the page. Text: Each line is exactly 11 syllables with the exact same stressed and unstressed meter, save for a couple twists expertly crafted for literary effect. My grandma's imprint and saying "no" to a major publishing deal Since starting this project, I�ve connected with many amazing people in the publishing world. Two of these people asked me if they could bring my book to their publisher (one of which was a Big 5 house)! I said "no". Why? It�s important for me to publish my first book under my grandmother�s imprint. My grandma fought to be a part of the boys club of business and I'm not going to let her down! We've dotted our "i"s, crossed our "t"s, and are ready to print! We�ve been certified by the leading crowdfunding logistics partner to ensure we understand the complexities of fulfillment, we have a sound logistics plan, and we know exactly how to reliably and cost-effectively get our books into your kids� hands. We�ve also partnered with an Independent Publishing Collective so that we can band together with others in order to get the same discounted rates that the big publishing houses get. The funds raised here will go entirely towards printing, shipping, credit card processing, and other fees associated with production and fulfillment (The resurrection of my grandmother's imprint and working with industry professionals to create the book itself has already been funded separately). My daily inspiration and my larger mission This big-hearted boy below likes to wear skirts and dresses sometimes... and he rocks the color pink. In the Victorian Era, all young boys wore dresses (and often had long hair) and in the late 19th and early 20th Centuries pink was considered the most suitable color for boys (while blue, of course, was for girls). I bring this up to put into perspective the sheer randomness of our society's "rules". I desperately want to shine a light on the arbitrary, to normalize the abnormal, and to do my part to increase the declining levels of empathy in our world. This book is about being true to oneself, despite societal pressures that dictate how one "should" behave or what (or even whom!) one "should" like. As such, after this crowdfunding campaign is complete and we're able to go to print, a portion of the profits from each book that's eventually sold on Amazon will be donated to an amazing LGBTQ charity that helps create safe-spaces for kids of all gender expressions in as many schools as possible. Here's what you've all been waiting for! In addition to the book itself, here are a few other fun rewards you can get! Discounts & Freebies :) With each additional book you order, you get increasingly more significant discounts plus more free rewards! With multiple copies on hand, you'll always have the perfect gift for the next baby shower or kids birthday party. #Winning. Plus, research shows that spending money on others makes us happier than saving money or spending money on ourselves. So get your happy on :) The Rewards Included Up Close & Personal We're working with a group of amazing educators and empathy researchers to build out our discussion guide as well as a short, fun, and interactive empathy workshop. Then, on June 21st, we'll be testing this out with a group of almost 30 4-7 year olds! In addition to the reading and workshop, you'll be able to have a personal chat with the author about anything from empathy research to starting a publishing company to going heli-skiing ;) This reward tier also includes a special thank-you to you, in ink, in the book itself! Personalized Poem & Portrait This is a Kicstarter exclusive and will not be available after this campaign. Send us a picture of a loved one and some details about them and we'll create a personalized portrait and poem. This will be framed to make the perfect gift! Shipping Rates by Country Our warehouse is located in the US. As such, we're able to offer free shipping across the entire United States. At a loss to us, we will offer $5 flat rate shipping to Canada and $10 flat rate shipping to the rest of the world. Since we have Canadian roots, we figured we'd also offer a free pick-up option in a couple major Canadian cities. If you're interested in that, you'll be able to let us know via the survey at the end. You'll be required to pay for shipping up front but we'll hand you back your $5 in cash upon pick-up. You may even be able to have a spot of tea with the author or her mom! We may be able to arrange for free pick-up locations in other countries/cities as well. This will depend on the volume of orders from each region and whether or not we know people traveling there :) Cute toddler pictured above not included. Unless you're offering up childcare... Timeline You can expect to receive your digital rewards in July and your physical rewards in September (We�re aware that some educators may require their books in August. If this is the case for you, let us know via the survey at the end and we can arrange for expedited shipping. We�re happy to waive the additional shipping fees if enough copies are purchased.) Readings/Workshops will be scheduled in July, via the survey, and slots will be available throughout the school year, starting in September.

About Tuxtla Tuxtla is an adaptation of a game our family has enjoyed for years. Learning the game is easy, and it is enjoyable to play without mastering any of the deep strategies. Of course, it is all the more fun as you learn the strategic plays that appear unwise and end up paying off in the end. The Tuxtla deck has five suits of cards numbered 1 through 10. Each round takes less than 10 minutes to play and is fast paced. A game is won when a player reaches a total of 15 points. Most games last under 30 minutes. The beta version of the deck has been fully designed and tested for playability and for quality of materials. This Kickstarter campaign will fund the final steps of production and distribution of the game. As we exceed our funding goal we will go into our second design plan for the cards, moving from a caricature to a more realistic image for each card. We will also move up from a plain box to customized or even to a custom tin box. About Call Family Games The Call Family grew up playing games. Each holiday, family event, and many evenings are spent around the game table. Grandpa says that game playing allowed his children to learn "how to lose without being losers". Relationships are strengthened, self image improved, and education enhanced through game play. Interpersonal relationships skills are refined. And most importantly, games are fun. A number of years ago we started vetting out ideas for new games that should be marketed, culling the best aspects of the games we love most and creating fun, family oriented games. We have so many exciting projects to start, but we realize that we need to get significant experience under our belts before we move on to some of the more involved games. We decided to launch Tuxtla as our first game precisely because it is so well tested (we have played it for years) and because we can set a very low funding level for our first offering. As we continue to gain experience we will refine and then offer future projects through Kickstarter. We are excited for this first launch!

It is time for your war ravaged kingdoms to rebuild, but all of your treasuries lay barren. In order to get the gold you need, you will have to turn to the wealthiest - and most dangerous! - individual you know... The Dragon! In Jesse Li's Dragon's Interest, you will be the leader of one of these kingdoms, and it will be up to you to outbid, out maneuver, and out play your opponents to reign supreme. You will borrow gold from the draconian loan shark on the mountain to finance your improvements, but you will need to make sure you have ample reserves on hand when the Dragon comes calling, because if you can't pay her back, she will take out her anger on you and your kingdom, laying waste to all you hold dear! Dragon's Interest has players competing with economic engines that they will create in their kingdoms. They will collect gold and knights and knowing when to spend or save those resources will be the tightrope they will need to walk. Dragon's Interest modifies and enhances the original mechanisms found in Ponzi Scheme to allow players to bluff their opponents and engage in secret bidding wars as they try to stay one step ahead of their opponents, and of course their scaly loan shark. Only the player who does the best job in rebuilding a large and diverse Kingdom will come out on top in this mid-weight Euro style strategy game! At the start of each round, you will bid interest payment values for your loan from the dragon. The more interest you're willing to pay, the better your selection of loan value and building type. Take turns activating buildings. Gain resources based on how many of a particular building you have, then make secret offers to others (based on the type of building you activated) for buildings and resources. Be careful- if your offer is too low, it may backfire on you! At the end of the round, the Dragon will move at least one space around the mountain. Whichever building type she passes dictates which building projects owe interest to her - payable immediately! Sometimes new building tiles revealed in the center will indicate that she should be moved more than one space, or that other events should trigger. Click on the banner above to read the rules to Dragon's Interest! At $30,000, we will add a King and Dragon Meeple to the game to take the place of their cardboard counterparts. At $45,000 we will add a Mountain Meeple for your Dragon to circle, as well as stickers for all the meeples - your Knights, King, Dragon, and Mountain that was just unlocked. At $60,000, we will add a cloth lining into the Premium Magnetic Box so your Knights and Coins don't get so bruised when they are thrown into it! Dragon's Interest will follow our high quality shipping standard of being bubble wrapped inside a custom fitted box to ensure maximum safety when being shipped to you.. This will ensure that your copy arrives in pristine condition, ready to enjoy. What does Friendly Shipping mean? It means that for each of the above countries we will be sending bulk shipments to fulfillment partners paying VAT and fulfilling more directly. We have also done all we can to ensure that globally everyone has a good experience with the best shipping options that we could source. Whenever a shipping partner has the games and is ready to ship, we give the green light. This means that some parts of the world might receive their game a few weeks before other places. This is done so that you get your game the earliest we are able to get it to you! Friendly Local Game Stores are an invaluable part of this hobby that we love, and we appreciate everything they do to bring value to the industry. TMG recognizes that the brick & mortar store is not only a place to buy games, but a location for people to enjoy their hobby with a welcoming community. The individuals who own and run game stores are some of the most informed people within the industry, and the knowledge that they have shared with TMG has proven to be most insightful. We invite all Retailers to join our Facebook Retailer Group so they can be part of the conversation between publisher and retailer, get any questions they might have answered, and be involved in future projects. The group is available now, and not just for backers. You can find it here: https://www.facebook.com/groups/TMGRetailers/ Please use our TMG Retailer Facebook Group for specific pledge information for Dragon's Interest.

Made from a natural silicone rubber, SuperSkin� helps you get back into any regular activity that strains your knees. This innovative new brace works by decelerating rather than inhibiting your natural range-of-motion like bulky metal/material braces. Great For Any Water Sports / Wicks Away Sweat / Keeps Your Muscles Warm During Any Activity! Invented by a health professional in San Francisco who was tired of non-solutions from a stale industry. SuperSkin� rapidly came to life via design work: And testing multiple materials and manufacturing processes to achieve the quality we wanted: Various Prototypes For over a year, we've tested it across a variety of activities including running, swimming, surfing, snow sports, cycling, boxing, weight training, hiking and more. SuperSkin� provides the support you need for any activity that puts a strain on your knees!! Our product has been tested and proven to work. We've done the research, been granted our patent and trademark rights, and now want to get our product into your hands!! We've identified a few important updates we'd like to make so we can bring you the best product possible. We've done everything we can to get it this far, but now we need your backing to help us take the next step!! The process required to create the molds for SuperSkin� is extremely expensive and we can't do it without your help! Once the molds are made, we can start manufacturing at scale and ensure timely delivery to our backers!!! �The device helps stabilize my knee joint and gives me more confidence. I feel stronger when I wear it and my knee feels better even after I remove the brace. I love it and would not ski or workout without it!� One of our earliest beta testers was a 66-year-old lawyer and mother of two who enjoys being active. She suffered an initial knee injury in 2005, and pain reappeared in 2015 and persisted through 2018. Her injury included swelling of the right knee joint with sever degenerative changes including spurring, loose bone chips, and a torn meniscus. This was the worst knee pain she had felt during the course of her various injuries, to the point she was unable to walk and felt anxious. The potential for knee pain is always on her mind, and she was seeking a better solution. While working through all her rehab, she was introduced to SuperSkin� by its creator, who was also her personal trainer, in August 2018. She started wearing SuperSkin� when she was riding her bike, skiing and working out at the gym. You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00 Thanks for checking our project out, we hope you'll support us! Co-Founders Chris & Tennyson

Stackable. Magnetic. Modular. We make premium, detailed miniature architecture. Our terrain has become warp-resistant, less expensive, and has a more consistent color. Our Drakenite pieces are shatterproof and inexpensive. They come in gray. It's an adaptable game tile for your roleplaying sessions. Build each room on the fly with magnetic elements. Throw your minis and monsters down and they snap into place. Build hybrid environments with 2D and 3D elements or draw directly on the surface with any type of marker. FEATURES: 10� x 10� Carbon Steel Platform: Light. Durable. Square. 1� x 1� Grid: Perfect for gaming or table-based spreadsheets. Chemical Resistant Surface: A lot like Teflon, but for markers and stuff. Use any kind of marker on it, and it comes out squeaky clean. Please don't use them to cook meals (we haven't tested that functionality). Integrated Impact Frame: Keeps �em from denting and warping, even when you flip tables. Neoprene Padding: Like most discerning gamers, the Grid prefers soft butt padding for long sessions. Embedded Magnets: Lock multiple grids into place and also (probably) erase VHS tapes. 2D Magnetic Maps: Slap �em in place! Slap elements down on top of �em! Move �em! Nope - that one was a joke. They stay in place. 3D Elements: Build elaborately planned death traps and environments for your players in three glorious dimensions. Adapt your Collection: Slap our included magnets on your existing minis and terrain. Don�t be shy, they won�t mind. Here's a quick list of the features written directly on the surface of a Grid with acrylic and permanent markers: BASICALLY, IT'S ALL ABOUT MAGNETS The Grid's entire surface is steel. You can stick elements directly to it with any type of magnets, or use the adhesive magnets we've hand-picked with just the right amount of force. Miniatures, terrain, maps � even refrigerator magnets, they all stay in place. No more meticulously setting up your dungeon and having that one clumsy player, let�s call him Steve, accidentally bumping the table and knocking everything over shifting your minis out of place. You can build your maps beforehand, even with terrain and minis in place, snapping them in when the time is right! It's versatile enough to change on the fly, too - allowing you to rearrange it quickly when Steve splits the party and wanders off to a cave or something. LIGHTWEIGHT AND DURABLE We designed the Grid with portability, weight, and durability in mind. Our prototypes weigh around half of a pound each. With 28 gauge steel, each Grid is a super tough little guy that won't get squished by all those heavy books. The bottom of the Grid is soft slip-resistant neoprene which lifts the Grid away from the table and helps keep it from sliding around and scratching the surface it sits on. Inside of the steel housing is an integrated impact frame that adds rigidity protects the Grid from dents and warping, even if you drop it or, kick it, or... you know, dropkick it. Although, we don�t know why you would dropkick something so great� in fact: All of this comes together to form the Mimic�s Grid, which is small enough to carry alongside your books and other roleplaying gear, and lightweight so carting them around won�t give you a hernia. The bottom line is � we know it sucks to carry all of your gear to a game, and we set out from the start to make the Grid light and portable! OK, BUT CAN I WRITE ON IT? Yes you can. Using science magic, we applied a durable coating to the Grid that imbues it with extreme chemical and stain resistance. We call it Any-Erase - you can draw on it with ANYtype of marker, and it cleans up easily - no streaks, no stains. That makes it spill-resistant, too, if one player at your table (Steve...) is prone to horizontally aligning their beverage containers - your art and the Grid should stay safe. You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00 Permanent marker lines stay on the Grid until you clean them with alcohol or acetone - the ink won't smudge, and won't even come off with water or other cleaning solutions. Dry erase comes off with an easy wipe, and wet erase comes off with anything that is wet. Party with your Party like you're at a 90's Rave! With UV markers on your Mimic's Grid you too can create intricate maps like you've been trapped in an underground bunker on a mysterious island: Do you have any suggestions for markers that we should test next? Let us know in the comments! ONE MORE NEAT ANY-ERASE BONUS You want another rad feature? We got you! With the specialized coating and ability to use different marker types, you can draw out something, like a dungeon or city street, with a permanent marker, and then draw various elements with dry erase. Wipe the board with a dry cloth � the dry erase comes off, and the permanent marker stays in place. You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00 ACCESSORIES: Artifacts are wondrous items discovered deep within the Cursed Crypt, each imbued with magical interactions with each other and with the Mimic's Grid. In slightly more boring real-world terms, they are what we call our line of accessories. 2D ARTIFACTS We have several series of 2D maps, scenes, and elements you can get as part of your Kickstarter reward package. They are high-resolution prints on durable, thick magnetic sheets. For example - you can throw down some grassland, populate it with trees or a garden path, putting each individual piece where you want it to go - each set is designed to give you endless possibilities. You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. These unique sets will be available as one of the choices for the reward tiers that include an Artist Set. Each set is 14 pieces of high-quality urethane lovingly handcrafted by good ol' Dan. I can personally attest to the fact that he had a strange grin on his face the entire time he was sculpting these beautiful pieces, probably (definitely) lost in thoughts of all of the terrible things that would befall players in between his walls. Here's what comes in the set: 2 Doors 2 Four-Inch Walls 4 Two-Inch Walls 4 Corners 2 Columns CUSTOM CARRYING CASE The Legendary Hero Box and Maps tier includes a custom oak carrying case, and we wanted to show off what we've been working on so far with some pre-production design shots. The next step is to send this off to our manufacturer for prototyping, and we'll take you all with us on that journey when the time comes! It'll be made from white oak, which gives it a kind of rough-and-tumble "don't mess with me" vibe that we like very much It has a metal-plated bottom, just like yer mum It uses a pretty unique hidden barrel hinging system, giving it a flush exterior The inside has magnetic plates that your Grids will snap right into We've designed to hold 12 Grids The Mimic is laser burned on the outside to show that you are a cool person with cool tastes It's got room for books and other stuff, too! Keep in mind that this is a prototype render, and some of these details may change, but the basic design is there. We hope you like it! A Special Thank You Reward We're putting together a little romp through this world we're creating around the Cursed Crypt, and we're going to be giving all of our backers the very first adventure written specifically for the Mimic's Grid. Each backer will receive a PDF copy of the adventure, which will weave the tale of the Crypt, the world it is a part of, and the colorful characters that surround it. ADD-ONS AND PLEDGE MANAGEMENT MAP & 3D ARTISTS: Our stats are pretty good, but we know when we're outmatched. Additional Artist Sets will be available in the Add-On Marketplace. Keep an eye out for Artist Spotlight updates toward the end of our Kickstarter. QUALITY GUARANTEE: Every single Grid's steel housing is manufactured, coated, painted, finished, and sandwiched with its guts in the good ol' USA, just minutes from our office in Spokane, Washington. Like us, our manufacturers are perfectionists with high standards for quality. That's one of the main reasons we partnered with them to help bring the Mimic's Grid to life. They put each and every Grid through an intense verification process and thorough check for imperfections before it is packaged. The Mimic's Grid is our flagship product, and is representative of the quality that we hope to provide you with all of our products. It's our introduction, like a very, very square handshake that is the foundation of a long-term friendship. We hope you see it that way, too. If your Grid is defective or imperfect in any way upon delivery, we will replace it for you immediately with no questions asked - that's our guarantee. COMMUNITY: We wouldn�t have had the inspiration for this project without the amazing creations of the DIY, homebrew, and creator community. You are a beacon of light and hope in a bleak world, and we appreciate everything you do. One of the most exciting things about the future of the Mimic�s Grid is YOU. We can�t wait to see all of the crazy things that you�ll do with our product � whether it is building maps at angles, or even completely upside-down, adapting your own terrain and elements in creative ways, or using the Mimic�s Grid in ways we didn�t even anticipate. We can�t wait to hear about it all. At launch, we�re going to have a system in place for featuring your wonderful creations and for overall community interaction. Grab Your Own Artifacts from the Crypt In our hearts, we are crafters and creators - that's how the Mimic's Grid was born. We know that DIY is the beating heart of the RPG community - creators sharing their designs, supplements, and art to enhance other's experiences. We pledge to embrace that state of mind and do everything we can to provide the community with the resources you need to work with the Mimic's Grid. We're going to provide you with low-cost, easy-to-use adhesive magnetic discs to adapt your creations to work with the Grid. However, we promise to never limit you to only using our products or shun you because you used other magnets! Our creative team will share our process, our games, give tips and be there to answer any questions or help out when needed. We'll provide digital versions of our Cursed Crypt created maps and art assets for free, fully licensed for non-commercial reprint. We'll work with our partners to provide a portion of their creations to you in the same manner as our content. We are going to seek out partnerships with the best artists, content creators, and crafters out there. We will strive to be open and honest with you about every move we make as a company, and, just like it has been up to this point, everything we do will be "community-first". Want to see your artwork or creations featured on the Mimic�s Grid? Cool, we do, too! Get involved in the process by popping over to our website and contacting us. We look forward to working with you. We�ve got big plans for the way we�re going to feature you and your creations on the Mimic's Grid! Don't be shy! Contact us today, and let's talk! ABOUT CURSED CRYPT: Cursed Crypt is an American company based in Spokane, Washington that produces tabletop game accessories and content. We�re tabletop gamers. We love creating exciting worlds and that rush you get when you crit, those long sessions spent unraveling a mystery (or sometimes long sessions spent deciding whether to go left or right � we know how it goes). We studied our play sessions and started to think of ways to improve the processes without sacrificing interactivity or immersion. We firmly believe that adding too much automation or technology to a game ultimately detracts from the experience and stifles the magic. That frame of mind led us down the road to the Mimic�s Grid � the perfect tool for enhancing immersion and playability without sacrificing emotional investment. Ok, but who are you really? We are a team of marketers, engineers, technologists, and super friends that have worked together for over two decades running comic conventions and building digital products of many shapes and sizes. We have a ton of skills and specializations that have given us a keen eye for quality and what we think people will like. Prior to Cursed Crypt the partner team built Uxiliary, a Digital Agency in Spokane Washington. Launched in 2014, Uxiliary provides technical development and design services derived from user experience research. Notable clients include Nike, Intel, Dell, Amazon, The City of Spokane, INB, FSB, BECU, Northern Quest, and many more. We have stories, you should ask. Cursed Crypt is located in Spokane, WA. Visit us to sign up for updates. Assorted Videos! You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. Inclusion within our video is simply to show how their incredible products can be applied to our system. All copyrighted materials are the property of their respective owners - but a huge thanks for letting us show off our stuff using your stuff!

Once every five years the Emperor and his nobles throw a feast to celebrate the conclusion of their week long council meeting in which they toiled to determine many key aspects of the rule and foreign policy of the provinces of their far flung, stitched together realm. Here you will hear the massive imperial kitchens at work, servants shuffling back and forth, the highest nobility enjoying the fruits of their hard work with just a little too much to drink. Two massive fire places keep the room aglow. And last, but not least, a talented harpist infuses the room with an ethereal sense of warmth. "Feast of the Emperor" is the latest in Darkraven Games' expansion of "Vivat Imperium" -- the world's biggest project to bring audio for your adventures in large fantasy cities to life! Look no further! Following on the successful heels of "Inn of the Green Dragon 1" and "Inn of the Green Dragon 2", "Feast of the Emperor" is the ultimate audio with specially commissioned harp music played on medieval and Celtic harps to bring all of your large noble feasts to life in your role playing adventures. Think about the most cutthroat games you know, the ones that threaten to tear apart even the oldest and closest of friends. Now add weapons to that game and you are getting a little bit closer to the intensity and thrills of Slay Your Friends. Are you partial to your friendships? No worries! Instead of duking it out with one another, you and your friends can Slay Your Enemies instead! The Slay Your Enemies expansion ships with every copy of the game! This game mode takes what is otherwise a straightforward and quick game and transforms it into an entirely different experience. Instead of a free-for-all, this mode pits one player, known as the raid master, against all the other players who form a party of adventurers with only one thing on their mind "Glory". In this mode you and your friends will face seemingly endless hordes of beasts and collect mythical items along the way to aid you in your future battles. Can you and your friends traverse all five raids and come out victorious? What We Need & What You Get Right now, we are turning to you, Kickstarter, for help raising the funds that we need to publish, print, market and distribute the first run of Slay Your Friends. Our funding goal is just $5,000, which will cover all the start-up costs that we are facing as we work to bring Slay Your Friends to life. Every dollar that we raise helps, and to say thanks, we have put together some wicked rewards, including some Kickstarter exclusive add-ons! About Ghoulish Games LLC Based in Lexington, Kentucky, the whole team at Ghoulish Games LLC is proud of Slay Your Friends, and we cannot wait to hear about all the fun people have playing it. Tabletop gaming is what we care about, and you can be sure that if it comes from Ghoulish Games, it's going to be a fun night! We have committed ourselves to innovation in tabletop gaming, taking what we know to work and building on it with imagination. Other Ways You Can Help In addition to making a monetary contribution, you can show your support for what we are doing by sharing a link to this campaign on any social media platforms you use. Facebook? Twitter? Instagram? Let everyone know just what we have created and just how much you are looking forward to playing it. Get some friends together for launch day so that you can be one of the first people to post about it! We spent over a year and a half carefully balancing the game through extensive play testing. Somehow, our friendships are still intact. Now that it�s just the way we pictured it, we�re ready to unleash it to the masses! Lastly, if you've made it this far down, thank you so much for checking out our campaign. Also, enjoy these outtakes of Nick.

What is Principle Dilemma? Principle Dilemma is an intellectual card-based board game which aims to give each player the opportunity to use their creative thinking and moral compass to delve deeper into their own minds, thoughts, and discomforts, as well as those of their opponents. Among the many diverse groups and situations in which Principle Dilemma has been played, two constants remain: Every person learned something about themselves, and something about those they were playing with. They couldn't wait to play again. This party game for thinkers can be played seriously or just for fun. Either way, it shatters the ice in a meaningful way by providing a stage for authentic and exciting conversation between friends and strangers alike. Principle Dilemma with the hand crafted cherry wooden box. The concept is simple. For a PDF of the current rules (subject to minor change) please visit here: Principle Dilemma Guidebook Below is a demonstration of how a basic round of principle dilemma might look, and outlines several of the different possible outcomes for each player. Hear what some of our play testers have to say: "Principle Dilemma is my go-to game for just about any gathering." - Max A. (Play tester) "A deep dive into your mentality and decision making...I found myself enjoying the game the more I played. (Blind play tester & professional game designer) "A round of Principle Dilemma left my table of friends with a genuinely heartfelt conversation about how we allow the scales of humanity to tip. This game gets straight to the point of what it�s trying to accomplish and is open ended enough to adapt to whatever needs your game group might have.� - Jennifer G. (Writer - Play Satellite) "Right from the artwork, to the box, to the unique scenarios and dilemmas - all hit the right spot!" - Pranav S. (Play tester) "Whether you�ve known someone for years or are playing the game as an ice breaker, Principle Dilemma is a great way to learn more about people."- (Lucas D. - badda-bing badda-blog) Read the full review here! To read more reactions from the game, check out our page on Board Game Geek If you would like to purchase one or more of our add-ons, we will be sending out a survey allowing you to add them to your pledge following the completion of our campaign. Principle Dilemma in its natural habitat- Everywhere Why We Need Your Help: This game has been in development for almost two years, and although we have come really far, we need your help and funding to help us bring Principle Dilemma to the market. The main game is just about complete, however, we would like to do some refining of the text on the cards, and we would also like to add some more dilemma cards to share the love for our supportive Kickstarter backers. We also need to manufacture Principle Dilemma at an economical price. We have done our best to bring Principle Dilemma into existence, and we couldn't be more excited about the results and reactions from our hundreds of play testers. Together, we can help spread this passion to the rest of the world! Shipping: Our goal is to have your rewards arrive just before the holiday season (middle of December.) Shipping Logistics: In order to reduce shipping costs for you, our customers, all international orders will be shipped by our eCommerce fulfillment partner. All domestic orders (US) will be fulfilled by the creators of the project, with our fulfillment partner stepping in to help with exceptional volume. Note for international customers: All copies of Principle Dilemma will be printed in English. Retail Inquires: If you are a retailer interested in carrying Principle Dilemma, please send a contact email to joe@principledilemma.com for pricing information and other details. It's 1950. Valinova, or commonly referred to by its citizens as Undercity, is the home to extraterrestrial refugees from all over the galaxy. Located somewhere underneath the North American continent, the underground city has remained a secret for over forty years. Undercity Tales is an anthology series. Each issue focuses on standalone stories illustrating the corruption festering in Valinova and the noble-yet-tortured individuals in law enforcement compelled to fight it. It's Sin City meets Alien Nation (kudos to you if you've seen it!). The first issue focuses on two wise cracking detectives, Whitlock and Caine, investigating the murder of Venus Centurion, a legendary Nephalian jazz singer from the Axxarian System. PAGE ONE PAGE TWO PAGE THREE PAGE FOUR MIKE TENER (CREATOR, PRODUCER) Born and raised in West Virginia, Mike grew up thinking he was a dinosaur. He began his writing career in 2015, producing Issues 1-5 of THE DRAGONFLY for KID Comics and just recently released Issue 1 of BLACK JACKETS for Ugly Bug Media, a publishing brand he owns and operates. In 2019, He began collaborating with other writers and artists on multiple upcoming projects like UNDERCITY TALES (with Scott Wilke) and MIDNIGHT HIGHWAY (with Alex Maday). He likes going on adventures with his girlfriend, Alice, and shares an apartment with his fat and emotionally-complicated cat, Avy. SCOTT WILKE (CO-CREATOR, WRITER) Scott Wilke is the writer and creator of the comic The Legend of Everett Forge. When he�s not busy writing about robot cowboys, he likes to spend his time reading comics, playing video games, and spending time with his wife and daughter. He also enjoys Dolly Parton, warm baths, and head scratches. BRIAN BALONDO (ART) Brian Balondo is a self-taught freelance comic book artist from the Philippines. Since 2012, he has been doing commissions for independent companies and comic related projects for independent writers as well. His first published work is Starburn previously release under Markosia. BRYAN ARFEL MAGNAYE (COLORS) Bryan Arfel Magnaye is 29 years old from Manila, Philippines. He graduated with a degree in multimedia arts and design. He also attended several seminars and received training from studios like Glasshouse Publishing, Dog 'n Bone animations, and Deped. He started working as a colorist in 2011 with his first coloring job being the comic book Godsend from About Time Comics. MATT KROTZER (LETTERS) Matt Krotzer gives voices to characters and adds sound to action. As a comic book letterer and graphic designer working for powerhouses like Image, Dark Horse, and many fine independent comics around the world, he�s collaborated with some of brightest artists in comics. He is an optimist and frequent champion of lost causes, including the mighty Bengals of Cincinnati. Matt lives in suburban Pennsylvania with his wife, daughter and faithful feline companion, Teddy Variant cover by Stan Yak and Jasen Smith. Variant cover by Ryan Winn. Bormellian Whiskey pinup by Gwynn Tavares. Variant cover by Ed Brickford. "Ga Latt�ca" Pinup by Kevin Anthony De Castro "Patsy" pinup by Alexandria Monik. Variant cover by DaveCaveDraws. "Zero-Gravity Gretchen" pinup by Stephanie Mooney. Saturn Records enamel pin design. More info to come.

STRETCH GOAL At $4000 all Backers of a physical pledge level starting with the $35 - Art Enthusiast Bundle will receive an additional 5.5x7 mini-print of Page 10 from the new issue. Page 10 Mini-Print If you're new to Side-Kicked and want to Catch-Up on the series and receive the Side-Kicked Volume 1 trade paperback (containing Chapters 1-4), it is very simple to participate in the Stretch Goal reward. When you select your Reward Tier (starting with, at least, the $35 - Art Enthusiast Bundle), add $20 to the Pledge Amount so you will still receive your signed copy of the Side-Kicked Volume 1 trade paperback (containing Chapters 1-4). It's that simple! ABOUT SIDE-KICKED Sick and tired of being taken for granted by the citizens of Chicago, ignored by the media, and disrespected by the super-heroes they worked with, the sidekicks of Chicago WENT ON STRIKE. Side-Kicked Chapter #1 - Page 23 That is the story detailed in Side-Kicked Chapters 1-4, which were successfully funded on Kickstarter in two separate campaigns. This campaign is to raise funds to print Side-Kicked Chapter 5, the First Issue in a brand new 5-issue mini-series, and the beginning of an all-new, complete story in the world of Side-Kicked. But don't worry. If you missed out on Side-Kicked Chapters 1-4 (collected in the Side-Kicked Volume #1 trade paperback) you can still get copies through this campaign. There are three Reward Tiers specifically for catching up on the story so far. $13 - Digital Catch-Up Streamlined Edition $24 - DIGITAL CATCH-UP TIER $35 - PHYSICAL CATCH-UP TIER You can also INCREASE YOUR PLEDGE at ANY PLEDGE LEVEL to add a Digital Copy of Side-Kicked Chapters 1-4 ($8) OR a Physical Copy of the Side-Kicked Volume #1 trade paperback ($20). DISCLAIMER: You don't NEED Volume 1 to understand or enjoy Chapter 5 (Side-Kicked Volume 2: Issue #1), but you will certainly have a greater experience if you've read it. Side-Kicked Volume 2 (Chapters 5-9) is a 5-issue comic book mini-series created by series writer, Russell Brettholtz. Its story picks up right where Side-Kicked Chapter 4 left off. The strike is over. The sidekicks have teamed up with some of the heroes they formerly worked with creating Chicago's first super-team. But will an alien threat destroy the new status quo the sidekicks fought so hard for? And all the while, the former sidekicks to Chicago's greatest super-villains are consolidating their own power, filling the vacuum left by the imprisonment of their former bosses. Series writer and co-creator Russell Brettholtz (that's me) has already finished scripting the entirety of Chapters 5-9. Sales from the Volume 1 trade paperback produced enough profit that the artwork for Chapter 5 is paid for, but I will still need help with printing costs. Having physical copies of issues of Side-Kicked to sell provides me with the necessary money to continue paying my art team to produce this series (and reduce the funding goals for future Kickstarter campaigns to create Chapters 6-9). Once the artwork for all of Chapters 5-9 is complete, I will be able to present the new, complete series to Darby Pop (publisher of the Side-Kicked Volume #1 trade paperback) for consideration for greater publication. Side-Kicked Volume 2: Issue #1 (Chapter 5) Cover 1A - by Dustin Collins (Standard Cover) Who Will Love Side-Kicked? Fans of Side-Kicked Volume 1 (Seriously. If you enjoyed Volume 1 you will definitely enjoy what's in store for Volume 2). Also fans of The Justice League, Young Justice, The X-Men, The Tick and other super-hero comic books. Collectors looking for limited print run books and great artwork. Supporters of independent comics who want to see what the comic book world has to offer beyond the BIG 2. Side-Kicked Volume 2: Issue #1 (Chapter 5) Cover 1B - by Dustin Collins (Kickstarter Exclusive) What Will You Get by Backing This Campaign? Side-Kicked Chapter 5 (Volume 2: Issue #1) is a 24 page comic (22 pages of story) in standard American comic size (6.625 X 10.25) printed on 60# Uncoated Text by Greko Printing & Imaging (aka ComixWellSpring). All physical product Backers will get the Standard Edition 1A Cover AND the Kickstarter Exclusive pencil and ink 1B Cover (featuring the Kickstarter logo) by Dustin Collins. All $5+ Backers will also receive additional content via the Side-Kicked Chapter 5: Behind the Scenes PDF which includes every stage of development from Character Concepts to Layouts to Pencils to Inks to Colors. At the highest Pledge levels, Backers will be able to get a LIMITED to 100 VARIANT 1D Cover drawn by Nikkol Jelenic, Kickstarter Exclusive art prints, Sketch Covers drawn by Side-Kicked Concept Artist Jeff Bonesteel, Cameo Appearances in the actual book, and the original penciled Side-Kicked pages by artist Andrey Portilla. What Are People Saying About Side-Kicked? Side-Kicked Volume 1 Trade Paperback (collecting Chapters 1-4) "You should pick up this book - its heart is in the right place... and yours will be in your throat!" - Michael Zapcic (Comic Book Men) "Brettholtz�s deadpan comedy allows few breaks for the sidekicks throughout, tapping into the down-on-their-luck wave (think Hawkeye or Ant-Man) that has proven to be a winning formula in the last few years. The series is worth a look if you are keen to venture outside the mainstream capes." - Jeff Marsick (Newsarama) "4 out of 5 Stars" - Richard Vasseur (firstcomicsnews.com) "Check out Side-Kicked - You'll be glad you did!" - Ed Garrett (tmstash.com) "I hope there�s a sequel." - (Don't Read My Blog) Meet the Creative Team Writer: Russell Brettholtz Russell Brettholtz started reading comic books at the age of eight, when his grandmother gave him an Archie. At twelve he graduated to the X-Men which he collected for over twenty years. Russell�s road to writing comics began with X-Men fan-fiction in high school and college, and finally a story submission to Marvel (it was not published). When he realized that finding an artist and self-publishing were realistic possibilities thanks to the internet, Russell put serious effort into creating his own comic book. Side-Kicked was his first full length comic book with original characters. The Volume 1 (Chapters 1-4) trade paperback sold out of its initial Darby Pop Publishing printing and is well on its way to selling out of its second edition, as well. Russell lives in New York�s capital region with his wife and two daughters. Penciler: Andrey Portilla Andrey Portilla is a Colombian comic book artist and illustrator. He discovered his interest for comic books at the age of 14 when he bought his first Spawn. Marveled by the art of Greg Capullo, he began to copy his drawings and set a goal to someday reach the same level of success as him. Andrey made his professional studies in graphic design, but abandoned them soon after realizing that his course was deviating from his goal that was to draw and to live comics. From there, Andrey began to work for publishers in his native country, drawing textbooks and children's books, later beginning to work with comic projects for comic book publishers and indie authors. Andrey also worked on storyboard, character design and concept art. In his spare time, he likes to write stories, paint, read manga and draw his own comics. His previous works include Knight�s Legacy: Awakening of the Pen Ddraig (Heroic Tendencies Studios) and Dragon Tamers (Bronco Ink Publishing). Inker: Quepler Pirchiner Quepler Pirchiner is a 23 years old, comic book inker and colorist. He graduated in Graphic Design from Est�cio de S� University Rio de Janeiro, Brazil and has published works for the North American and Brazilian markets. One of his most recent works was for John Daniel Taylor IV�s, 3 CORPS (Top Secret Press). Colorist: Colin Patrick Moore Colin Patrick Moore is an artist and colorist based out of Portland, Oregon. His color work can be found with publishers like Dynamite and IDW, as well as in a wide variety of indie markets. His art can also be found in the webcomic, River City. Letterer: HdE HdE has been lettering comic books since 2010, having slapped fonts down on books published by Source Point Press, Attic Studios, Dark Horse, Darby Pop, Aspen Comics and Devil's Due Publishing. He also writes and presents 'HdE's Totally Unoriginal Gaming Show' on YouTube, an acclaimed but under-watched show in which he examines video games from every era. Side-Kicked Volume 2: Issue #1 (Chapter 5) Cover 1D - by Nikkol Jelenic (Limited to 100 copy print run)) What is the Money For? Comic books are expensive to make. The artwork for a single issue can easily cost between $4,000 and $5,000 dollars (or more). In order to raise the money to pay my art team I have sold off large portions of my personal comic book collection, attended comic book conventions to sell copies of Side-Kicked Volume 1, and ran two successful Kickstarter campaigns. I now have enough cash to cover the art costs for Side-Kicked Volume 2: Issue #1 (Chapter 5). The $3,000 Goal amount represents the money I will need to pay for printing costs for the physical copies of the comic and mini-prints, and packaging/shipping costs. I am not keeping any money for myself. This campaign is all about the production of the comic. A successful campaign means I will have new product to bring to conventions to sell and continue to save funds toward the artwork for the next issue. Check Out This Four Page Teaser! Page 10 Page 11 Page 12 Page 13 What Rewards Are Available? How Will Your Books Be Packaged? All comics will be individually bagged with boards. Backers at the $15 Print Edition Reward Tier will have their books shipped in ULINE Stay-Flat envelopes. All Backers at Physical Reward Tiers above $15 will have their books shipped in Gemini Comic Supply Flash Mailers. Original Art will be secured in hard plastic top-loaders, sandwiched between two pieces of cardboard in a large bubble mailer. I will be handling fulfillment, personally, so any problems can be directed straight to me and I can fix your problem without delay. (True Story: Months after my last campaign ended and the rewards had been shipped I got an e-mail from a backer. He told me that he never received his comics. I immediately put together a new package for him, drove it to the post office the next day, and he received his books just a few days later. Nearly a year later, his original package was returned to me, having apparently spent several months in a Houston sorting facility. Crazy) THANK YOU Thank you for taking the time to explore my Kickstarter campaign. Any contribution you can make to this project is greatly appreciated (and if you can't do it with money, consider helping by spreading the word). If you decide to become a Backer, please consider leaving a Comment letting me know where you heard about this project (Facebook, Twitter, Website Forum, a Friend, My mom, etc...). Marketing a comic book campaign for Kickstarter is very difficult and time consuming. Any information on what worked will help tremendously in the future. Thank you!
