Even while I was a broke college student, I have always loved great self-care products. I especially love soap bars, shampoo bars, and salt scrubs. Most importantly, I care about these products because purchasing them allows me to reduce waste. While these products are not always as convenient as traditionally packaged materials, I think it makes a difference for our planet and our skin to choose them. Earth has provided us with an overwhelming number of gifts. Why not use them well? I have recently graduated with my Master's in English, and I plan to teach writing courses for the rest of my life. I love teaching, and I love writing. However, especially in this economy, teaching doesn't pay well. I do it because I love it, but a girl's gotta keep a roof over her head. I love making soap, and the joy on someone's face when they take that first deep breath of the scent makes me happy. It feels good to lather yourself in something you truly enjoy. So why not supplement my income by starting a small soap business? Of course, my mutual love for writing and soap-making is not the only thing that connects these two ventures. With each soap bar you purchase, I will include a short quote from various works of literature. My favorite poet is John Milton, and his words and my values have given me the name of this small business: Heaven's Last Gift. Each carefully made product you receive from me is made from the gifts Earth and Heaven have given us. All packaging is 100% recyclable, and I make sure to use environmentally conscious ingredients. Help me spread the joy and love of Heaven's best and last gifts and pledge to my campaign today.

The Project I love East Nashville�s interesting, creative, and slightly eccentric residents, many of whom are the source or participate in the lively discussion on our community facebook page. The East Nashville neighborhood seems to provide a constant stream of often bizarre, often perplexing, always entertaining events that we all love to follow. Whether an unopened gallon of milk have been sitting at your front curb for a couple of weeks or you just spotted a grown adult dressed as a chicken (again), you know everyone will want to hear about it, even if they have moved away. As I have joined in as a spectator and reporter of new events, I realized how great it would be to have a single collection of some of the most memorable moments, and thus this coloring book was born. After initially making a list from my own memory, I began talking to friends and neighbors (including our online community page). This helped me fill in the gaps in order to make a solid roster of East Nashville�s �best� moments. I did take some creative licenses. like choosing alternate street perspectives, in order to make well balanced compositions that would also be fun to color in. However, none of the pertinent facts about the incidents have been altered or exaggerated. If you are a long time East Nashville resident, you are likely to quickly recognize all of the locations and events included (you might even have been present at the scene). If you are a newer resident or visitor of the neighborhood, this will be a great way to understand what an awesomely weird place it is. Please support a local project made in East Nashville and completely about East Nashville in all of its strange glory. About the Creator I am a local teacher (and artist on the side), and I have lived in East Nashville since 2013. When my job brought me to Nashville six years ago, I immediately knew East Nashville was the neighborhood I wanted to live in and have been here ever since. While I have mostly been a spectator of our latest neighborhood news, I am responsible for some facebook post such as �Pregnancy test discovered on the side of the road� and �Chair left on lawn for pickup makes a couch friend by next morning�. The Art All of the drawings are original, hand-drawn illustrations of actual events that took place in East Nashville. I started by choosing events, gathering any photos that were posted about it and then taking lots of my own photos of the East Nashville intersections in question in order to choose the best viewpoint. Once I had a general layout in mind, I began making a pencil sketch of the scene. After I adjusted sizes and slightly moved some stop signs that were blocking the view, I began the ink line-drawing process. Then the process of scanning and digital editing begins. As far as the content goes, I chose the ones that caused the most interests, likes, and uproar on Facebook. It has been hard not to laugh out loud while drawing. So many scenes were personally suggested by our residents. Because of all of this, you should be advised that this coloring book may not be suitable for children. Our neighborhood is awesome but it may not always keep things perfectly classy, or PG for that matter. Still, you can expect some hilarious moments that you can color in and keep. Final Product I have been drawing for a few months, but progress has been slower than expected. I have a tiny person to keep alive, on-and-off part time work, and haven't always been able to find free time to sit down and work. Now that I�m near the finish line, I need one last push to get these babies printed which is where your financial help comes in. I am currently working with local print shops and designers to lay out the book. There will be at least 15 original illustrations and they will be printed on thick, high quality paper, with one scene per sheet in case you would like to remove and display them. I will be updating our supporters with exciting details as they are finalized. I can�t wait to put this book into the hands of our community, who I�m sure will enjoy adding their own spin to each page. Ask me more If you have any additional questions like �Will there be brown recluses?� or �Was that fireworks or gunshots?� feel free to ask on here or reach out to me at rosanac@msn.com, message me on Facebook, Twitter @OnlyInEastNash, or Instagram @rosana.portillo.art

Felt like it was time to do another little capsule project! This round is inspired by my Art Teacher Mom and my Art Teacher sister. Since we last met here (see Gnome Hugs project) I have acquired a laser cutter and, oh my gosh, do I love it! This project will feature perks which are laser engraved by me in my studio in addition to items that are fabricated elsewhere (pins and stickers). I decided to go with a magnet closure this time for those of us who are embroidery enthusiasts so we can use the pin as a needle-minder or a pin for our art smocks/aprons. Double duty!

Remastered Original Edward Curtis Photogravures Printed for our biggest Curtis fans... Ca�on de Chelly / Vanishing Race / The Scout - Apache Thank you for checking out our project! The Curtis Legacy Foundation's goal is to print 60 total prints of three famous Edward S. Curtis images�Ca�on de Chelly, Vanishing Race, and The Scout-Apache. These three photographs are being produced from actual Curtis Studio glass plate negatives passed down through the Curtis/Graybill family. "I am John Graybill, President of the Curtis Legacy Foundation. My two sisters, Ann, Janet and I are the only great-grandchildren of Edward Curtis and have finally made the commitment to continue our ancestor's great dream: to bring the history, knowledge and understanding of the Native American culture to the world. I say finally because while we were growing up there were always Curtis images all over the house�it was no big deal. According to our dad, it was to be kept that way. He despised anyone who made money from Curtis' photographs because like most famous artists, Curtis himself died poor and unrecognized for his work. It has taken until now, for us to realize the importance of Curtis' own descendants sharing our family history; we have documents and treasures that other researchers/historians don't have and we feel the need to share it." "Just before our father's passing at the beginning of 2019, my sister's and I presented the idea of carrying on the Curtis legacy through the founding of a non-profit organization in Curtis' honor. Our father, Jim, was one of only two grandchildren of Edward. Our Uncle Ted was killed in WWII before he could marry and have children, thus leaving the responsibility of carrying on the Curtis legacy in the hands of my immediate family. Dad gave a large portion of his Curtis collection to the Smithsonian years ago, but held out a number of glass plates negatives and those serve the basis of this Kickstarter offering. We also asked dad specifically about selling photogravure prints to be made from these negatives. Dad was glad to see our strong interest in carrying the torch and thought these were both great ideas. Somewhat to our surprise, we got his blessing!" Depending on the image, vintage originals run from $3,000 to $100,000 putting them out of range for many people and leaving them to be displayed only in private collections and museums. The Curtis Legacy Foundation wants to print new photogravures from these negatives, giving you the best reproduction quality available today, at a much more reasonable cost. Yes, there are other reproductions on the market, but most are either a lesser quality printing process or made from copying original prints, thus also reproducing the texture of the paper they were originally printed on as well. Every time you make a copy of a copy, it reduces the quality of the print. A "Remastered Original" means that we have digitally cleaned up imperfections on the image and worked the subtleties of the negative to achieve the highest quality and richest reproduction possible, while still maintaining Curtis' original intent. You may be asking "what is a photogravure?" Digital (direct to plate) photopolymer gravure printing is done using a photopolymer plate which is printed on directly bypassing the traditional film overlay, resulting in a high quality plate that can reproduce the detailed continuous tones of a photograph. These types of prints are individually printed... one... at... a... time. Roll on ink�wipe to right amount of ink�run through the press�wipe the plate totally clean�start inking all over again. You will like the results! It is very difficult to explain the whole process here, so go here for more information on the photogravure process. "Remastered Original Photogravure" is what the foundation is calling these new, digitally cleaned up versions of prints produced using modern photogravure methods. The photogravure process for these prints was chosen because it was one of Edward Curtis' favorites. All of the tissue and fine art paper prints in The North American Indian and portfolios were printed using this method. The archival value of photogravures using proper inks and quality papers is substantially longer than that of silver-gelatin and current photographic processes, thus giving you a print that will stand the test of time, 600 years or more! This makes these prints truly an investment that you will be able to pass down generations. The intent is to give you amazing affordable prints that mirror Curtis' vintage originals but not at vintage prices�we want them in your home, not locked up in a museum. A huge part of the Curtis Legacy Foundation's mission is to tell the stories surrounding the images. The more we know the stories behind the images, the more we like them. Each image you pledge to, you will also receive a story about it. Ca�on de Chelly by Edward Curtis, 1904 Have you ever looked really closely at the image Ca�on de Chelly? There are, what we believe to be, 5-7 spirit orbs in the image. Check out the enlarged image below with some of the orbs circled. We didn't notice them until we were working up the image for printing. We started taking them out digitally, but then realized what they likely were. When we were in Ca�on de Chelly last fall, we asked my Navajo guide about them. He enthusiastically agreed that there are spirit orbs all over the canyon. That was all the affirmation we needed! Can you imagine what those spirit guides are trying to tell us? In a note written by Edward to his son Hal in 1948, he asked if Hal remembered the face in the rock from the family trip to the canyon in 1904. If you look above the left side riders, you'll see the profile in the highlighted rock. Ca�on de Chelly Orbs Vanishing Race - Navaho by Edward Curtis 1904 Vanishing Race is also of the Navajo Nation and likely taken in Ca�on de Chelly or Ca�on del Meurto. This image, according to Edward's son Hal, was taken with new equipment and was severely underexposed. They had to work very hard in the darkroom to result a good image. Regardless of what Curtis' initial intention for the image was when he clicked the shutter, sometimes the mistakes end up telling the story better than you planned. His fear for his Native friends was that their way of life was disappearing due to the white colonization, and he felt this image portrayed that�that they were headed into the dark unknown. Curtis was very saddened by this thought and in his own words to President Teddy Roosevelt wrote, "You realize too, Mr. President, that the Indians we are looking at in these pictures will no longer be with us 50 years from now. This great race of people in their primitive state will be vanishing from the earth. White man's progress will eliminate their way of life and all they hold scared. In the westward thrust of civilization, there is no place for him unless he sheds his beliefs and assumes our mode of life." Thank goodness they held tight to their beliefs through this dark time and are now becoming stronger than ever! We want to celebrate this strength and resilience by keeping Curtis' images in the public eye, bringing attention to the resurgence of this amazing culture. The Scout - Apache by Edward Curtis 1906 The Scout - Apache "To follow them was a fruitless task which often led to the destruction of the pursuers. The primitive Apache was a true nomad, a wandering child of Nature, whose birthright was a craving for the warpath, with courage and endurance probably exceeded by no other people, and with cunning beyond reckoning. Although his character is a strong mixture of courage and ferocity, the Apache is gentle and affectionate toward those of his own flesh and blood, particularly his children. Fear, to him, is unknown. Death he faces with stolid indifference; yet Apache men have been known to grieve so deeply over the loss of a friend as to end their troubles by self-destruction." Volume 1, page 14, The North American Indian by Edward Curtis As you can tell, all of Curtis' images are not only rich with stories and culture, but are beautiful fine art worthy of hanging in any office or home. How would you feel if anyone of these images, or all three for that matter, we hanging in your home? Just imagine the stories you will be able to tell your friends and family about them, showing your support of not only Curtis' work, but understanding the need for diversity and other cultures to enrich everyone's lives. With your backing of this project, we can make this a reality! REWARDS Pledge $1 or more - Custom pledge amount with no reward You just love our project and want to help! If you want to give a custom amount and don't want to receive a thank you gift, click here and receive our utmost gratitude. Thank you for considering our project worthwhile! Every dollar helps us to reach our goal of printing 60 of these amazing photogravures. Pledge $25 or more - 5 Edward Curtis Greeting Cards You will receive 5 5x7" blank cards printed on 10 pt matt card stock of 5 different Curtis images, including envelopes. These beautiful greeting cards are perfect for thank you notes, get well soon messages, and congratulations! On the back of every card is a story taken directly from Edward Curtis' writing in The North American Indian. Our hope is that you find this little snippet intriguing enough that you finding yourself looking it up in that volume and reading more! Pledge $50 - 10 Edward Curtis Greeting Cards You will receive 10 5x7" blank cards printed on 10 pt matt card stock of 5 different Curtis images (two each), including envelopes. These beautiful greeting cards are perfect for thank you notes, get well soon messages, and congratulations! On the back of every card is a story taken directly from Edward Curtis' writing in The North American Indian. Our hope is that you find this little snippet intriguing enough that you finding yourself looking it up in that volume and reading more! Pledge $100 - 12 Month 2020 Curtis Calendar This 11x17" 12 month calendar is spiral bound at the top and includes 13 images from Edward Curtis' North American Indian. The pages are printed on a nice heavy weight paper and won't curl on you! Each month includes a photograph and a story about the image taken straight from the volumes. We want you to learn about the person or tribal nation in each of the photographs, so we all have a better understanding of this amazing culture. Pledge $150 - 8x10 Fine Art Print - Castle of Dreams Did you know that Edward Curtis also photographed fine art nudes in the 1920s while living in Los Angeles? A reliable source has told us that "Castle of Dreams" is of model Rose Delgado. When I questioned our source on the spelling of her last name, he answered "I would bet a stack of comic books on it!". Ms. Delgado is standing in front of a background painted by Ferdinand Earle, who was the set artist for the Cecile B. DeMille Studio in Hollywood. Edward also worked for the DeMille Studio in the Roaring 20s, photographing movie stills for such productions as The Ten Commandments and Adam's Rib, among others for multiple studios. Curtis produced a set of three fine art nudes, Castle of Dreams, Aphrodite and Sunset Trail. This set, along with other things, proves what an incredible photographic artist he was. These images were all originally printed as a blue toned silver gelatin print and used to help raise funds to continue his "North American Indian" project. This image is also printed from an original Curtis Studio negative. This print will be a full bleed (edge to edge printing) 8x10" on Hahnem�hle Torchon paper, a pure cellulose watercolor paper with a distinct textured surface. It will be mounted on 3mm white styrene to prevent warping. It is also available as an 11x14" print listed below. Pledge $250 - 11x14 Fine Art Print - Castle of Dreams Did you know that Edward Curtis also photographed fine art nudes in the 1920s while living in Los Angeles? A reliable source has told us that "Castle of Dreams" is of model Rose Delgado. When I questioned our source on the spelling of her last name, he answered "I would bet a stack of comic books on it!". Ms. Delgado is standing in front of a background painted by Ferdinand Earle, who was the set artist for the Cecile B. DeMille Studio in Hollywood. Edward also worked for the DeMille Studio in the Roaring 20s, photographing movie stills for such productions as The Ten Commandments and Adam's Rib, among others for multiple studios. This image is also printed from an original Curtis Studio negative. Curtis produced a set of three fine art nudes, Castle of Dreams, Aphrodite and Sunset Trail. This set, along with other things, proves what an incredible photographic artist he was. These images were all originally printed as a blue toned silver gelatin print and used to help raise funds to continue his "North American Indian" project. This print will be a full bleed (edge to edge printing) 11x14" on Hahnem�hle Torchon paper, a pure cellulose watercolor paper with a distinct textured surface. It will be mounted on 3mm white styrene to prevent warping. It is also available as an 8x10" print listed below. Pledge $250 - 11x14 Fine Art Print - Black Hair We have chosen one of our favorites images, Black Hair, taken by Edward Curtis in 1905 for this pledge level. This image was NOT used in Curtis' 20 volume "The North American Indian" nor in the accompanying portfolios. The image itself is approximately an 8x10" image printed with about a 1-1/2" white border. It is printed on Hahnem�hle Torchon paper, a pure cellulose watercolor paper with a distinct textured surface. It will be mounted on 3mm white styrene to prevent warping... and will look incredible on your wall! Pledge $500 - Curtis Family Favorites Collection This collection consists of 10 Edward Curtis prints on sturdy triple thick art paper inside a handcrafted image box. Curtis' own descendants have selected their favorite images to add to this collection and have written an explanation as to why it's their personal favorite on the back of each image, along with their name and relationship to Curtis. The cover is a Mocha raw silk fabric with "Curtis Family Favorites Collection" embossed on the lower right corner in rose gold. It will be a perfect accent to most any home decor. Each image has a 1" white border around the image making it suitable for framing or you can trade images in and out of the box and display them individually on an easel. We know you will love this collection! Pledge $750-$1000 - Remastered Original Photogravures Get one OR all three in the Trio Collection! These photogravure prints are made from actual Curtis Studio glass plate negatives, passed down to me, John Graybill, his great-grandson. These individually hand printed images are created on beautiful fine art paper. I will hand sign the back of each print and they also come with a Certificate of Authenticity and story about the image. These Remastered Original Photogravures will be approximately a 14x17" image with a 3" white deckled edge border. (We are still in the proofing stages, so this could change slightly) Be sure to check out the early bird specials! The earlier you pledge - the better the price! First 6 of Ca�on de Chelly - $750 Next 9 - Ca�on de Chelly - $1000 First 6 of Vanishing Race - $750 Next 9 - Vanishing Race - $1000 First 6 of The Scout - Apache - $750 Next 9 - The Scout - Apache - $1000 First 3 sets of The Trio Collection (all 3 gravures!) - $2000 Next 2 sets - The Trio Collection (all 3 gravures!) - $2500 (UPDATE 7-8-19: We have realized we had an error in our math and there wasn't savings with this package so we will increase the value by adding your choice of either a fine art print of Black Hair OR two calendars and 10 greeting cards.) NEW DEALS & OFFERINGS! 7-10-19 NEW DUO PACKAGE DEAL! 7-8-19 Ca�on de Chelly and Vanishing Race - $1500 NEW DUO #2 PACKAGE DEAL! 7-10-19 Ca�on del Muerto and Clam Digger - $1000 NEW PHOTOGRAVURES 7-10-19 First 10 of Ca�on del Muerto - $550 First 10 of Clam Digger - $550 GET ALL 5 PHOTOGRAVURES! $3000 Ca�on de Chelly, Vanishing Race, The Scout - Apache, Ca�on del Muerto and the Clam Digger Pledge $5000 - Private Presentation John Graybill, great-grandson of Edward Curtis and his wife Coleen will give up to a 4 hour presentation to any group of your choosing in the U.S.A. They could talk about the life and history of Edward, or they could break it down into particular topics such as his work with specific tribes, his relationship with Teddy Roosevelt, his camera gear and types of printing or just share his family stories. They have a wide range of knowledge so they could Q & A for hours! John and Coleen are also working on the Descendants Project. John, as the direct descendant of Edward Curtis, is seeking out the descendants of Curtis' images. He and Coleen will be interviewing, photographing (with a similar camera and glass plate negatives to Curtis), and telling the story of being a Native American in the 21st century. This project will culminate with a coffee table book and a traveling exhibition. The stories they are learning from working on this project are also fascinating and could be a short presentation as well. With this level you will also get to choose ONE of the photogravures. Which is your favorite? Pledge $10,000 - Play Hooky with the Graybills When is the last time you played hooky? Take the day off and meet John and Coleen Graybill, great-grandson of Edward Curtis, for a day of exploring a Curtis exhibition, gallery, library, university, museum near you (in the USA only) or just hang out in your living room for the day talking about Curtis! They will share family stories and answer all your Curtis questions! As a thank you for this tremendous support, we are adding ALL of the reward goodies listed above including giving a presentation to a group of your choice! We just ask that they be scheduled on consecutive days.

Shirt prototype Page 1 Page 2 This cartoon will be the 2nd installment of Henderson Four Twenty, where he and his friends link up for a show. We have been looking for a building for about a year to make into to a museum and research center in our area. Someone mentioned at one of our monthly meetings that there was an old jail under City Hall. Several of us went to check it out. Its old, its dirty, its under City Hall, the entrance is horrible, the walls are 83 year old plaster that is falling down. I'm sure by now you are saying exactly what we did. PERFECT !!!!! It needs work, and we are willing to put the work in that it needs. We want our area to have that special place to visit and preserve our history. To brag a little that we are the home town of Mac McAnally, Jumping Gene Simmons, and Jerry Bostick. We want to help people search for lost ancestors and teach the younger generation what our history is about. We need some help, lets me honest, we need cash. We are a non-profit organization. We have sold books, raffle tickets, will be selling lunch plates and standing at the red light with buckets. But its not enough. We need to raise $10,000, and as you know on Kick starter one penny less in absolutely nothing. Please help us reach this goal. You are all welcome in Belmont, Mississippi. Free tours of the museum when its open! Original Jail Cell Mac McAnally from Belmont, MS Jumpin' Gene Simmons - Golden, MS Jerry Bostick - Golden, MS

Hey there! My name is E. D. Mead. I am a 2D animation student, a freelance artist and a part time Artist Alley vendor at local comic and anime conventions. I've been creating merchandise for the past 5 years or so for my table, and I've done things like keychains, coin purses, prints, vinyl sticker sheets and more! I've wanted to do enamel pins for a very long time, and I've had so many ideas knocking around in the ol' noggin. So I had to think to myself which one I wanted to tackle first! I decided on a "Dungeon Master" pin, inspired off of DND and fantasy tabletop gaming, for all of my fellow nerds out there. I've seen a good amount of folks make d20 designs, or designs based on the classes, but I haven't seen nearly as much love out there for the hard-working DMs! Dungeon Masters work very hard to craft fun stories, engaging battles and thrilling mysteries for their players to solve, and it's time they got the appreciation they deserve in the form of an enamel pin! The Dungeon Master enamel pin is a 1.5 inch hard enamel pin with gold metal. The magical dice floating in the design will have a gold glitter to them too! The goal of $200 will be helping fund the production of these pins with a manufacturer, payment & mold fees, the costs of shipping them to me, and then shipping costs of shipping them out to all you wonderful adventurers! By pledging to this kickstarter, you'll be helping fund these pins and getting one for your very own, while also supporting an artist that is hoping to create many more nerdy pin designs! You can keep this pin for yourself or give it to your favorite Dungeon Master to show them just how much you appreciate all their magical hard work. Thank you very much for reading! STRETCH GOAL -- DELUXE VARIATION! UNLOCKED!!! If this campaign gets to $500, it will unlock the deluxe color variation of this design! It will be done in silver metal, have glow-in-the-dark eyes and dice as well as a dark blue glitter background! This is inspired off of some of the more cosmic art I've seen people do of DMs and really driving home that all-powerful story crafter role.

Welcome to our Kickstarter! We are so glad you've made it this far, and we hope you will take a look through our project and choose to support our dream! We are raising money to take care of the last few things needed to get us on the road. From commissary fees, to permits, to all the supplies we will need to serve with, we can't move forward until these things are taken care of! Our waffle truck was inspired by our love for waffles. It began with a simple tradition of eating waffles every Wednesday and has grown into a business where we can share our love for waffles with the community around us. Watch our video above and keep reading below for more information on how you can help us and how this dream developed! OUR STORY Let�s take things back to the beginning where the idea of this waffle truck was inspired. It takes us to a small college town in South Carolina where Aleisha, a young lady who is from northeast Ohio, and Holly, a former Clemson college graduate from New Mexico, met as fellow baristas at a local coffee shop where they bonded over their love for waffles and their dream of owning their own business. Both have a love for people and a desire to cultivate community, so they thought, "Why not try to combine our love of waffles with our love for people?" This jumpstarted their journey to begin Waffling! Soon after they started to dream and plan, their friend, Trenton, a young man who moved from Pennsylvania to South Carolina to help start a teen ministry, decided he wanted to jump on board to make this dream happen! Aleisha, Holly, and Trenton They have been working on this project for a few months now, meeting up every week and scheduling taste testing events, photoshoots, and meetings with local business owners to get tips on how to best run Waffling. Our friends have also played big parts in the process to make Waffling successful! MISSION Aleisha, Holly, and Trenton are all on staff at a local ministry in Seneca, SC. This ministry focuses on working with at-risk teens by simply spending time with them through activities to build relationships. Because this teen ministry is something they all love to be a part of and desire to see succeed, Waffling will be giving a percentage of their profit to support the ministry so they can use the money on activities and events with the teens. Our goal is to serve the best waffles in upstate, SC, cultivate an atmosphere of community, and give back to local ministries. WAFFLES Our truck will be designed to provide people with fresh waffles such as our rich, delicious chocolate waffle, our dairy and gluten free waffle, and our golden plain waffle. We will also have a topping bar filled with our wide array of toppings that people can use to create the waffle they want! We will also offer a selection of waffles that we have created with our favorite toppings just for you! Strawberries and cream waffle Maple bacon waffle Chocolate peanut butter waffle REWARDS For those of you wanting to pledge to our Kickstarter, we have some great rewards! From tickets to our grand opening party, t-shirts, a year of free waffles, and pre-paid waffle parties for you and your friends! Keep scrolling down to see some cool merchandise we have made! HOW CAN YOU HELP? GIVE! - The very best thing you can do is give to this Kickstarter campaign to help us cover the cost of things to get us started! Every pledge matters no matter how big or how small, and if we don't fully fund, no one gets charged, and we don't receive any of the money. SOCIAL MEDIA - Follow us, like us, comment, and share! The more active you are on social media with us, the more people will find us and be able to get involved! Click the links below! https://www.facebook.com/WafflingTruck/?ref=page_internal https://www.instagram.com/wafflingtruck/ If you have any questions regarding our business or how the Kickstarter funds will be used, please email us at wafflingtruck@gmail.com and we will do our best to answer any of your questions. Thank you for your support. The Waffling team. *Waffling. does not own the rights to the song in our video

Welcome to the Mofumofu Dress-Up Bears Enamel Pin Kickstarter!! It has been a long time coming and I appreciate your attention~ this project means a lot to me and features two of my favorite things -- teddy bears and magical girls!! I really love plushies and wanted to capture their sweet, fluffy style, I hope that you enjoy it! This is my 3rd project and I'm very excited to get this collection made! Each goal will unlock a dress-up bear and / or companion mascot. Please note that the reward tiers you pay for are for individual pins -- bears and companions are at different price points to purchase due to the size and difference in complexity. This way we can make the kawaii companions more affordable for everyone! The bears start at $9 in the 1 pin tier, and the mascots/companions start at $7 in the 1 pin tier. Below are all of the designs which are now unlocked! Thank you to all of my wonderful backers for helping bring this project to reality. Many of the pins feature details like screenprinting or glitter, and some of them even feature real 3-D crystals! The Bears average at a size of 2" tall and the companions are small pins averaging around 1" tall! I have put a lot of effort in to ensure that all of the bears and companions are matching in size and proportion~ I'm super happy to offer some great freebies for all my backers!! Each pin comes with a matching diecut jumbo glossy sticker, these are made at home by yours truly! Anyone who backs at least 5 pins or more will get a special soft enamel "the bear button" enamel pin for FREE! This is a cute bear-themed button that I like to imagine Momo-chan uses in her sewing tools. Your pin will be chosen at random from 6 colors. On top of that, you will also receive a special "Momo's Break Time" mini print which is currently in the works~! And if you are a REALLY big fan of this project and back 10 pins or more.. you get all of the previously mentioned freebies plus a super super cute small mofumofu paw pin! This is going to be another super cute pin that will be great as a board filler and wearable every day~ you will be sent one color version at random! Both the button pin and paw pin can also be added to pledges for +$5.00 each Q: What is the benefit of pledging on Kickstarter for your project now? A: You help get the pins made, of course! Besides that, you receive freebies, a great discounted price not available anywhere else, and are guaranteed the standard grade of your favorite design(s)! I tend to never get enough standard grades as I'd like for popular designs, so they are often sold out before I even get them in stock. Q: When will I be charged? A: You will only be charged when the Kickstarter ends and if it has successfully raised enough money for our first goal. Q: How do the reward tiers work? I want X pins but there are only tiers for 1, 3, or 5? A: When you pledge, you can actually manually adjust the amount! All you have to do is add the +$ amount that you see listed in the tier for each extra pin. If you are international, just use the standard currency conversion given to you online. All prices in tier descriptions are listed in USD. Please don't be shy to ask me if you need help pledging! Q: What does "International users add +$7 for full tracking" mean? A: I am super happy to now offer much cheaper international shipping than before! However this means that if you are outside of the US your pins are shipped a bit differently. Due to the limit on package thickness & bend ability I have to package them differently. Your pins will not receive extra padding inside (I usually wrap all my pins in bubble for extra protection) and stickers/paper will not have any cardboard to protect them. The +$7 is on top of how much you are already paying for shipping. So, if you are paying $9 for shipping, you have to add $7 on top of that. Please note that regardless the international shipping is still first class mail and the tracking is still very limited no matter which option you choose. Once it arrives in your country, it may not track anymore. Again this cost is in USD, please use your standard conversion rate given online! I'm sorry for any confusion by the way it was worded in the reward tier descriptions, unfortunately I lost the ability to edit it ><; Q: Who is this cute bear girl scattered among your Kickstarter? I want to be her friend! A: That is Momo-chan! She is one of my original monster girl characters and the mascot for this Kickstarter. Momo-chan grew up with a love for teddy bears, and runs a small boutique with handmade plushies in her little Yokai Village. I plan to include some freebies of her in the Kickstarter if we can raise enough money The worst part of pin making, I wish I could just *poof* my designs into reality, ha ha ha! We all hate waiting and, while I can't predict delays or issues, I try to minimize them as much as possible and I will communicate them to you all. Our timeline, if everything goes without issue, is as follows: May 24th - June 23rd - Kickstarter runs~ (ganbare!) June 23rd - July 13th - Funds arrive & are transferred to manufacturer July - Pins are made by my manufacturer and shipped to me~ (My cameo the sticker robot works hard at sticker making at this time as well ehe) August - Pins are sorted & checked for quality, rewards are shipped to all backers! Thank you so much for your love and support in my projects! If you can not pledge but enjoy my work, I appreciate your comments and sharing with friends~! Please check out my Instagram @shopcutematter for more of my portfolio

DISCLAIMER: this pin design is done in collaboration of us with @falegeffa from Instagram and we are not claiming to own any of the characters from this franchise-these are fan made. Hello we are the Pin Expedition Co! Welcome to our new and first Kickstarter project! We are excited to introduce to you a series we want to bring to life: My Hero UA Cafe Servers. Part of being a hero is knowing how to deal with people, so, why not have our selected heroes train as a server in their very own UA Cafe? We want to bring these character designs into reality-collectible pins. We really hope to have your support to make this dream of bringing this artwork into life. How this works: you will pledge to support our project to get this artwork into a pin and will be charged later. You will only be charged once the goal is met which means we have achieved the funding goal. When the Kickstarter ends and this project is not fully funded, you will not be charged. If the goal is met, you will be notified by Kickstarter. PIN INFO 2.5 inches tall Gold plated 2 back post Only 60 pieces will be available for this pre-sale for quality control. Remaining pins will be sold on our web site at a later date. Hard enamel COST PRODUCTION Pin production: 70% Kickstarter fee: 10% The rest, we will self fund with whatever is left. Pre-sale will cover pin production and guarantee the backer a pin plus incentives. ESTIMATED TIMELINE This Kickstarter project will run for 25 days and funds will arrive to us within 2 weeks after this is fully funded. Once we have the funds, pin production will take between 2-3 months depending on pin progress. Once the pins are in hand, we will quality check them and ship them to all of our backers. Follow us on our Instagram. Check out our web store PinExpeditionCo EXAMPLES OF OTHER PINS WE HAVE PRODUCED

: *:* Welcome *:*: Hi! My name is Andrew and I am an independent artist, aspiring e-commerce seller, and creater of Subculture Creature shop on Etsy, a shop geared mostly towards creating horror-inspired enamel pins. Although not typical to the theme I am planning for the shop's future, I thought it would be nice to commemorate one of my favorite shows of all time, Steven Universe. I wanted to stay true to the source material while still throwing my own love of monsters in the mix, thus, Monster Fusions was born! The first pin of this proposed set, and the one who inspired it in the first place is none other than Alexandrite! If she is fully-funded, Alexandrite will be a massive "2.5 double-pronged soft enamel pin with iridescent rainbow metal (inspired by the real life gemstone) and an epoxy top coat to give in a glossy, hard enamel look. This pin will be a great addition to any Steven Universe fan's collection, or really anyone who appreciates a bad ass giant woman. I am working with a middle-man pin company with whom I've worked with in the past to create my first (and so far, only) pin on my beginning Etsy store (It's been well recieved so far, much to my joy!) Please consider pledging if you are able and wish to participate in helping a budding shop grow, as well as receive a new addition to your pin collection. If you are unable but would like to see the project funded, send the link to a friend and/or fellow Steven Universe lover! the more people who see the project, the more likely it will be successful. Thankyou for stopping by! - Andrew, Subculture Creature Shop

ShiftCam The ShiftCam journey began over 2 years ago with our first Kickstarter campaign: a 6-in-1 Traveler lens phonecase. Now shipping to over 80 countries, this pioneering product was just the beginning in compact, convenient and comprehensive mobile phone lenses designed to enhance mobile phone photography. Since then, ShiftCam�s growing team of photography enthusiasts have gone on to develop ShiftCam�s removable ProLens series and mounting system. Combining high quality performance and user-friendly experience, today ShiftCam proudly introduces the latest addition to our Phonetographer collection of detachable lenses. Are you a Phonetographer? Whether professional or savvy enthusiasts, photographers today are increasingly switching between their trusty DSLR cameras and mobile phone photography. With ever-improving technology, mobile photography is quickly catching up. But whether using a digital camera or your mobile device, your photographs are only as good as your lens. By developing professional grade detachable lenses for your mobile phone, ShiftCam is blurring the lines between DSLR and phone camera performance. Combining the pocket-sized portability of your mobile phone and the high-quality capability of a DSLR camera, ShiftCam Phonetography is on the rise. Yes, that�s PHONETOGRAPHY, a new word for a new era. See more... way more than ever before Thanks to the pioneering use of specialist DSLR lens manufacturing techniques on a much smaller scale, the first-of-its-kind aspherical lens allows for zero distortion of lines even with the impressive 122� ultra wide angle of view. A unique optical design, coupled with nano-coated lens minimizes chromatic aberrations and unwanted flares for a sharper image. Close-ups or long shots, indoors or outdoors - the edge to edge clarity makes this innovative detachable lens perfect for precision photography. This is one small lens for your phone - one giant leap for PHONETOGRAPHY. Awards & Reviews of ShiftCam Seeing an opportunity to expand on the existing ProLens collection (60mm Telephoto, 18mm Wide Angle, 230� Fisheye, 25mm 10X Macro, 75mm 3X Long Range Macro), ShiftCam introduces the first of its kind: an impossibly small aspherical 12mm ultra-wide angle detachable lens for your mobile phone. Features Because ultra wide angle is suitable for so many occasions, we are launching 3 accessories to go with your new 12mm Ultra Wide Angle, so that you can make the most out of this lens. Maximize your video content with the perfect stabilization assistant. Use this fully adjustable universal counterweight to balance any ShiftCam lens in conjunction with your gimbal for perfectly smooth, judder-free footage. Before you ask � it was glaringly obvious - so yes, we thought of that too. A ShiftCam 62mm filter with corresponding adapter. Moreover, this adapter is designed for any CPL and universal filters, so you can even use your own filters with the ShiftCam 12mm Aspherical Lens. There�s something for everyone here! Don�t use an iPhone? Not to worry. The ShiftCam team has produced a small but strong Universal Lens Mount that supports ALL ShiftCam existing Lenses. There is also a Cold Shoe Mount built in with this universal Lens Mount for accessories expansion. The 122� ultra wide angle allows you to capture 3x more content in one frame. Tell the whole story without missing any important details of your surroundings. Our world is vast with so much to see. Make the most of breathtaking landscapes with your ultra wide angle lens. Capture majestic architecture preserving original content just as you see it. Thanks to the groundbreaking aspherical lens, you can avoid warping of lines and that all-important proportion. When space is limited, you no longer need to bend over backwards to see the big picture in confined indoor environments. With a winning combination of the aspherical lens, optical design and precision nano coating, benefit from edge to edge clarity, capturing impressive images in incredible detail. With multilayers of customised nano-coating, unwanted flares and ghosting is minimised. This is where mobile photography comes in to its own. With this new lens and the right app, you can easily auto-calibrate, fixing perspective with the tap of a button. You�ve essentially got your whole studio in your pocket for quick and easy editing on the go. Discover new and exciting perspective with the 12mm focal length. See more than first meets the eye, with 0.35x mini wide angle macro close-ups revealing unexpected little details. Weighing less than 100g, this pocket-friendly detachable lens houses an impressive 6 element 4 group structure - perfect for capturing those unexpected moments. View all sample photos here: http://bit.ly/2R9esG7 So you think you know your lenses? Well then you will know that ultra wide aspherical lenses are industry gold standard. They make a world of difference, with cheaper spherical lenses often the cause of major distortion and aberration. The wider the lens, the more difficult it is to achieve zero distortion. No Distortion vs Distorted Image Why the price difference? It�s all to do with the glass finish based on how the lens is manufactured. Most large-scale manufacturers sand and grind theses spherical lenses in to shape, which can cause minute, but vital imperfections. By melting the glass first, the purity and finish of an aspherical lens can be guaranteed. The Solution: A New Technique for Zero Distortion With a bit of innovative thinking, the ShiftCam team have come up with a new precision technique to produce the smallest ever aspherical lens for your phone. Combining 15 years of optical engineering experience and 9 months of dedicated product development in partnership with industry leading manufacturers from Korea, Japan and China, the Design and Development team has created one-of a-kind tooling capable of sustaining thousands of degrees heat whilst maintaining precision and accuracy. These custom-made discs of glass will enable perfectly concentrated light sources to be piped into your phone, maintaining zero distortion and replicating all that you see with the naked eye. Marah in the Mainsail/Coyote Kid is a Minneapolis-based, independent, Cinematic Alt-Rock band with a dark, dynamic sound, and a strong emphasis on story telling. After three entirely crowdfunded story albums, the stage is set for our biggest release yet. As we transition into a new phase of the band, we will be adopting a whole new branding as well, and going by the name Coyote Kid as we continue to develop the vision and style we established as Marah in the Mainsail, revitalized and poised to explode onto the world-wide stage. We really believe in this music, and we cannot express how honored we are to serve such a passionate fan base. We cannot do anything without you! Kian Dziak, Austin Wilder, Cassandra Valentine, John Baumgartner, Austin Durry This new story album is titled The Skeleton Man. The sound is large and aggressive, but more stylistically diverse then any of our previous releases. We wanted to take the cinematic sound we established in our previous albums and expand it to encompass more musical influences and a larger emotional range. From dynamic drums, growling bass, and shimmering spaghetti-western guitars, to soaring trumpets and bellowing trombones, the stage is set for this supernatural, post-apocalyptic western. This is, by far, the most dynamic work we have ever compiled. Each record will be pressed on beautiful marble vinyl, and will include the full album story and lyrics, a poster insert, and a pair of red and blue lenses that reveal both sides of The Skeleton Man cover art. The album picks up the ongoing tale of the Marah Anthology. The story of our last album Bone Crown ended in an apocalyptic wildfire that left the world in ashes. This story begins hundreds of years later. The world is wild and untamed, as civilization is slowly rebuilding from the ashes. We follow the story of The Coyote Kid, The Bloodhound, and The Medicine Crow as they traverse this new dark age under the watchful eyes of The Skeleton Man. We have always built our albums around narrative stories, and we want this album to be as immersive as possible. We are excited to share that the full Skeleton Man Bundle includes a set of three metal mini-figures � The Skeleton Man, The Bloodhound, and The Medicine Crow � as well as our complete new merch lineup! The Bloodhound, The Skeleton Man, The Medicine Crow. Get your choice of white or black T-shirts, all double printed on incredibly soft, high quality shirts, or snag one of our new ultra-soft hooded sweatshirts! We are really proud of this new merch line, and we want you to feel proud of the art you have helped create. All merch designs subject to change We want to bring an element of adventure into the real world with this album, so we have gone out and hidden The Golden Skull of the Skeleton Man somewhere within the US (similar to a geocache). The only way to find this beautifully-crafted, resin skull is to discover the passcode hidden somewhere in the album. This code will eventually lead you to the GPS coordinates to find the skull. The first person to find it gets a full merch bundle of all of our releases, as well as free shows for life. As soon as the album drops, the game is on. The Golden Skull of the SKeleton Man. Will you be the first to find it? We are so thankful to all of our amazing supporters. You control the future of the art you believe in, and we are truly honored to have your ear and your support. Our future is in your hands. -Coyote Kid

We, the owners of Vansauwa's Tacos and Vegan Eats, are hosting this business fundraiser to cover the costs of expanding from a taco tent to a mobile taco trailer. We look to bring your favorite Caribbean vacation food (i.e., jerk chicken, fried plantains, etc.) to your hometown. Our goal is to get our award-winning, Caribbean-inspired tacos to you faster, more efficiently and in more places. With the food trailer comes the costs of outfitting it with the right equipment, that includes a larger griddle, commercial fridge, steam table, deep fryer, prep station, hand-washing sink, generator and wrapping our 8.5-by-20-foot trailer in bright, bold colors. If you don't know, this equipment costs thousands of dollars, and we are two ambitious 20-somethings trying to make it happen on a budget. With your help, we can continue dishing out the Caribbean-inspired tacos and vegan fare that you all have come to love. We hope you will come alongside us as a Vansauwa's Vanguard (similar to Beyonce's Beehive), and make our campaign a success!

SYNOPSIS The Receptionist follows a young woman's struggle to come forward with bombshell information when allegations against the company's prominent head come to light. Despite her low standing, she finds herself in a position that can dramatically alter the fate of the company� as well as her own. The Receptionist, proof of concept DIRECTOR�S STATEMENT The Receptionist is inspired by my own experience working at the Weinstein Company during the scandal that became ground zero for the #metoo movement. When the scandal first broke, I was of course appalled by Harvey�s actions and admired the women who bravely exposed him, but to say I was shocked would be a lie. Tales of the casting couch have existed since the dawn of the film industry, and frankly, I was no stranger to the whispers about what Harvey did in hotel rooms� after all, it was the worst kept secret in Hollywood. This made me question my own complicity. Was there something I could have done? Even if I had known, would anyone believe me? And why didn't this reckoning happen sooner? Deep down, didn�t we all know this was going on� not just with Harvey, but everywhere? There is no simple answer to these questions, and I want this film to explore the complexity of this issue. That is why I decided to tell this story from the perspective of the receptionist. I wanted to illustrate how the imbalance of power in a corporate setting makes it difficult for those with little power to come forward or speak up. Oftentimes, those with the least to gain have the most to lose. As a storyteller, I�m drawn to stories about the unseen, internal struggles of everyday women. My NYU thesis film, Teen Daze, was about a young girl exploring her sexual identity. With The Receptionist, I want to tell a story about reclaiming one�s voice. The Receptionist, proof of concept TIMELINE As it�s early in the pre-production process, we are still locking down exact dates and deadlines. Here is our rough timeline: Pre-Production � May / June We are currently in the process of casting and assembling a great crew to help tell this story. Film is a collaborative art and no one job is too small! Production � July We will be shooting for 2-3 days in Manhattan. Post-Production � August / September We already have an incredible post team and plan to jump right in after wrapping. Ideally, we�ll have a completed film by September. Festival Submissions � September onward We plan to submit to top-notch film festivals such as Sundance, SXSW and Tribeca. Premiere � Early 2020 We hope to premiere the film at a film festival before sharing it online. Those who donate $25 or more will have access to a private link the day of the premiere. The Receptionist, proof of concept THE TEAM Brigette Lopez - Writer/Director Brigette Lopez is a third generation Cuban American from Miami who swears cafe con leche runs through her veins. Growing up around burlesque dancers and pin-up models, Brigette developed an affinity for playing dress-up and watching classic cinema at a young age, and later earned a Bachelor's in Film & TV Production from NYU's Tisch School of the Arts (�15). Under the mentorship of Susan Seidelman (Smithereens, Desperately Seeking Susan), Brigette�s wrote and directed her thesis short film TEEN DAZE which went on to screen at numerous festivals. She currently lives in Brooklyn and spends her free time writing and teaching herself tarot. Stephanie Salgado - Actor/Producer Stephanie Salgado is a Colombian American SAG AFTRA actor and filmmaker! When her parents first came to this country they would sneak her into the movies. As an impressionable five year old she wanted to be a part of making those stories. She went on to get her BFA from NYU Tisch School of the Arts. She loves pugs, traveling, female rappers, and taking astrology too seriously. In the past year she has worked on seven film projects including, starring and coproducing We�re All Alright and Foreplay the Series. Some of her other past credits include: Wildling (SXSW/IFC Midnight), Like They Magical (Playwrights Realm), The Thing That Never Happened (NYC Fringe Festival), Teen Daze, Pink Dreams, Midnight Amblin, and Lejana Tierra Mia. Aimee Kuge - Producer Aimee Kuge is a producer, editor, and practical effects enthusiast with a passion for representing minority groups in her favorite genre, horror. She is a third generation Japanese American hailing from Denver, Colorado whose film practice evolved surrounded by a community of experimental filmmakers. This led her to earn both a Bachelor's of Fine Arts in Film Production and a Bachelor of Arts in Studio Art from The University of Colorado at Boulder (�15). Aimee has created multiple film projects and music videos including an array of digital, pop-star, cult-leader Unicole Unicron's music videos which aired on MTV and VICE. She currently lives in Brooklyn and manages an embarrassing amount of social media accounts. Samantha Lee Robles - Producer Samantha Lee Robles is a Puerto Rican designer, actor and producer. She has been called to film and entertainment ever since she could hold performances on the sidewalk. After Samantha graduated from Syracuse University for Communications Design, she went on to produce a number of short films including Days Spent Searching (NYC Lift Off, Chain Film Festival) and Hydra . A designer by trade, she has experience producing content to promote Michael Moore�s feature film Fahrenheit 11/9. When she�s not working, she�s watching The West Wing or day dreaming about her next vacation. The Receptionist, proof of concept WHY DONATE? The funds raised through this Kickstarter will allow us to create a quality project about an important topic for our current cultural climate. You will not only be helping to bring this project to life, but also supporting diverse female filmmakers! Your donation will allow us to feed our dedicated cast and crew, rent equipment, secure a location, fund post-production, and cover festival submissions. THANK YOU!! Thanks for taking the time to read this page! We hope that you'll consider donating and help spread the word. This is such an important story to tell right now, and we want it to reach as many people as possible!

SundayMorningView (SMV) is new kind of online magazine for women�SMV inspires women to be natural, sexy, strong and above all: to love themselves. Our goal is that one day women will not feel the need to hide their bodies in shame or feel less than, but rather embrace the desire to love their bodies with confidence. We live in a world where fashion magazines and media constantly feed information to women on how they aren't beautiful enough through fabricated beauty ads, SMV offers women something radically different. Rather than give women an unrealistic representation of beauty, SMV gives women a raw, unadulterated kind of beauty to be inspired by. By replacing the media's fabrication, we are creating a change towards a more natural beauty, a beauty that is ever lasting. SMV is a digital outlet that publishes daily content and features on self-love, body positivity, health, fashion, travel, sex and relationships. Regular articles include: approaches to natural beauty, photographic stories to inspire women, articles on loving your body along with humorous and educational content. Everybody's excited about SMV. Click to Watch. SMV is for THE WOMAN who feels she isn't beautiful enough. It�s for the woman who has cellulite, stretch marks, extra weight or doesn't fit into traditional beauty standards. It's for the woman with a Hijab and for the woman sun kissed with all shades of beauty. SMV is for ALL WOMEN. We celebrate the beauty of women daily but Sundays are extra special because we feature one inspiring woman who celebrates her imperfections as the very things that make her perfect, we call her a SundayGirl. We celebrate her with a different kind of photoshoot, it's a bit unorthodox because: We remove the dresses, the heels, the makeup, hair extensions and free women from societal beauty restraints. On Sunday she is just herself, raw, bare and beautiful. All shoots are natural. This means makeup free, re-touching free, and free of digital body manipulation. A SundayGirl encourages realness, by being the example. Here are just a few inspiring SundayGirls we've featured: We live in a world where women don't feel beautiful nor feel like they can ever measure up to society's beauty standards. � Only 4% of women around the world consider themselves beautiful (up from 2% in 2004) � 72% of girls feel tremendous pressure to be beautiful � More than half of women globally (54%) agree that when it comes to how they look, they are their own worst beauty critic Our dream is to help women feel beautiful and our journey has just begun. Join us on this beautiful ride to help women feel beautiful, it's time for the world to see beauty in a new way. With your pledge we can: Fund our office which serves as a hub for our community and is inclusive of content creators, staff writers, a photo studio, and most importantly, the epicenter for all of our inspiring events. Hire more skilled professionals; Editor, Events Coordinator & Assistant Publisher With every dollar you pledge, you'll earn some serious feel-good vibes from knowing you could potentially be changing a woman's life to help her build the confidence to love herself and finally feel beautiful. And if that doesn't convince you to back this project, here are a few other perks SMV STICKER HAND DRAWN SMV POSTCARD - IT'S A SURPRISE  ONLINE FEATURE TOTE BAG CANVAS WALL ART- IT'S A SURPRISE  EXCLUSIVE COFFEE TABLE BOOK- IT'S A SURPRISE

We all love movie posters! So for our first stretch goal, we are working to collaborate with a talented artist to create a badass poster for this movie. But to get the quality of the poster we want, it will cost a bit. This poster will act as the face of our movie. Also, if you or someone you know is an artist willing to collaborate with us, shoot us an email at blindcop2@gmail.com! BLIND COP 2 is a hyper violent, action revenge feature film that satirizes and pays homage to the action genre, all while thriving off it's own originality. This film was inspired by the absurd staples of action cinema in the 1980�s: protagonists are invincible, countless henchmen are killed with no remorse, and blood...lots of blood. There have been a plethora of over-the-top 80�s revival films recently. However, BLIND COP 2 is different from the rest. It has a crazy premise that takes itself completely serious. We feel the funniest films are the ones that play it straight. Final product Behind the scenes It all started 5 years ago as a fun idea, a goofy little short with a character named, BLIND COP. We never thought this could expand into anything more than just a homemade video to share with friends and family. Fast-forward to 3 years later, at the end of our second year of film school, we found that many of us were growing tired of the countless sequels, reboots, and remakes that have overcrowded the market of today�s cinema. We wanted something different, something we haven't seen before. We came back to the character of BLIND COP and decided to develop a sequel to a movie that was never made. What's more original than that? We created a NEW proof of concept trailer to show you our vision for this film. BLIND COP 2 is a feature film that not only Hollywood can't make, but won't make. Final product Behind the scenes Now after over 2 years of development, we have a completed 90 page feature script that explores action movies in a way we haven't seen before. On top of that, we are big believers in pictures speak louder than words. So instead of just talking about the film we want to make, we thought why not show it. That's why we decided to film a teaser trailer for BLIND COP 2, to show what we can do with just our passion and hard work. Behind the scenes In order to accomplish a film that is true to the spirit of 1980�s action movies, we are going all out with practical effects. That means miniatures, explosions, squibs and lots of fake blood. This helps the actors with their performances and will immerse the audience deeper into the world of this film. Your donations will go towards making this a reality. While we really believe in our technical skills (and hopefully the trailer proves it), we can't make this film on our own. We need your help. Your donations will go towards everything from feeding the cast and crew, to paying for locations and blowing up fake heads. Any amount of support is appreciated! Official Teaser Trailer poster Interested in working on the crew or helping with promotional art? Or just want to chat? Contact us at: blindcop2@gmail.com

Introducing the U.L.C. (Urzan Liberty Corps), an elite(?) and deadly(??) fighting force of teddy bear soldiers, ready to hop out of your 3d printer and conquer the known galaxy. The U.L.C. range prints easily on FDM or resin machines with minimal supports needed (a few print without support), and are easy to clean thanks to their rounded, fuzzy features. In standard scale (close to 32mm scale, if you want to match them with mainstream ranges like Games Workshop or Reaper) they stand just over 20mm on average (though you can print them in any scale you like). Some core urzans with a people eater (upcoming stretch goal model). Urzans come un-based, but you can base them any way you like. (We're partial to 20mm clear acrylics.) It's even easy to base them before printing with your bases of choice, if that's your jam. With the core rewards, you get the 17 urzan models (shown above). For everyone backing at the $25 level and higher, we'll be unlocking stretch goals as we go: GALLERY A full squad of people eaters (our first stretch goal to be added) along with the variant field commander that comes with the set. Grand prize winner (by Patreon supporter, Kelly O�Keefe) for our Urzan painting contest we ran back in April. You can get the STL free on Thingiverse now!

From the team who brought you SERPENTS, comes Pope or Nope! His Holiness Pope Peter II lies on his deathbed. You are among the few Cardinals he trusts to serve as his successor, but you have to earn it by performing good deeds. To complicate things, the other Cardinals won't go down without a fight; they'll do everything they can to sabotage your every move. Pay them back in kind. Pope or Nope is played in quick rounds. Each round, players attempt to perform a good deed. Players then take turns sabotaging each other's deeds, redeeming their own, or using action cards for added strategy. The first player to complete 5 good deeds is the winner and may don the Papal Mitre.* *Included in select tiers Each round, each player is dealt 5 cards. Players are given the opportunity to play a DEED from their hand by placing it face-down in front of them. Once all players have played a DEED (if able), all players flip their cards face-up. Subsequent cards played during the round will be played on top of these initial DEEDS. Players take turns playing one card at a time, starting with the player holding the INITIATIVE TOKEN, and continuing clockwise. A player's turn consists of one of the following: SABOTAGE - play a matching CROSS card on another player's DEED REDEMPTION - play a DEED of the next level on a CROSS card USE OF AN ACTION CARD PASSING - out of necessity, or strategically When all players have passed in succession (or have run out of cards), the round ends. ALL cards from the round are discarded. Any DEED that is not CROSSED at the end of the round is worth 1 point to the player. The first player to earn 5 points wins the game. Pope Peter II may have ideas about who should succeed him, but His Majesty King Carlos II has his own list of papabili. Work collaboratively to defeat the opposition. When playing with an even number of players, Pope or Nope can be played in teams. The first team to earn 7 points is the winner. Watch our 6-minute comprehensive tutorial. Numbered I-IV, these cards represent "good deeds" that each cardinal may perform. The higher the level, the greater the deed, and the rarer the card. DEEDS can be played on cards whose level is one less than their own. Numbered I-IV, these cards give each cardinal the ability to sabotage the deeds of another. CROSS cards can only be played on DEED cards of the same level. If a DEED remains CROSSED, it will not be worth a point at the end of the round. This card is used to "reduce" the level of any numbered card in play by 1. When REDUCO is played on a Level I DEED, the player is thrust into "Dante's Infernope". This DEED is now Level 0 and is not worth a point. This Player has been thrust into the second circle of "Dante's Infernope" This card is used to "cancel" a card that is already in play. All cards that may be "cancelled" feature the CANCELLO STAMP. When placed in front of a player this card offers a new "opportunity" for the performance of a good deed, and the chance to earn multiple points in a single round. Discard this card to draw two cards to your hand. The POPE card acts as a "wild" DEED. However, it cannot be played to begin a round or to fill an OPPORTUNITAS card, and cannot be reduced. It is still vulnerable to sabotage with the correct CROSS. When the POPE is played on a Level IV card, "Papal Infallibility" is invoked. This DEED can now only be sabotaged by a NOPE. When the POPE is played on a DEED below Level I, he lifts the player out of "Dante's Infernope" and acts as a Level I DEED. A NOPE card is the ultimate sabotage. NOPE can be played on any card in play and redemption is impossible. THE HUNGRY GAMER Preview Video Gameplay Review "I really enjoy the theme of this game. [...] I also really like the idea behind the mechanics. It is clever, and it is a good balance of playing cards on yourself and on others." JORGE ZHANG Rulebook Review "Overall, Pope or Nope seems like an interesting and highly interactive game that is very simple to learn, but still has some strategy to it!" Gameplay Review "Our group really loved this game. I personally enjoyed it a lot, and found that Pope or Nope made for a very simple and easy game to bring out to the table. I would recommend the game to those looking for a fast-paced game with a lot of player interaction." ARTHUR MONTGOLFIER Instagram Review "It can get quite competitive (and that is exactly what I am looking for in my party games) we had a decent amount of laughs during the game. I advise you to look into this if your game shelf lacks that 'quick party game for everyone to get into'." INOD French Language Review "Avec comme m�canique forte, cette possibilit� de plus ou moins se concentrer sur ses actes de bont� ou ceux adverses." PARTNERS To ensure a quality product, a smooth, speedy fulfillment process, and low shipping rates, we've partnered with some of the best. We'll be manufacturing with AdMagic. You may be familiar with games they have manufactured before, including: Exploding Kittens, Cards Against Humanity, Secret Hitler, and Joking Hazard. For fulfillment, we'll be partnering with Flowship. Click to learn more about our logistics plan. We will be subsidizing your shipping in this campaign, meaning for every order, we'll be absorbing some of the shipping costs in order to simplify pricing on your end, and save you a little money in the process. We will be taking care of any import taxes. The price you see when you finalize your pledge is the price you pay. No surprises. RETAILERS If you are a retailer who is interested in purchasing copies of Pope or Nope in bulk, contact us at team@vectorarcade.net, let us know how many copies you might be interested in, and we will see what we can offer. A Complete RPG & sourcebooks for 5E Fateforge is a self contained RPG using the 5e system and does not require any 5e edition book. The Adventurers and Grimoire books are enough to play. If you are already a 5e Edition player, these books offer a new campaign setting, as well as a multitude of options and additional rules to create and play characters in the world of Eana or from it. Map of Eana Fateforge offers you a new world to explore ... Here is the map of Eana included in the Red Dragon and Dragon King of Ajagar pledges: Map of Eana / Click to enlarge More... Learn more about the Fate-chosen, the Modular System, and the plans for the series by reading this article on the Fateforge blog. The updates also give you many insights about Eana: discover the legendary Fateforge, the dreadful Canker or the strange woods of Plokholes. You can also learn about some majors phenomenon like Geomagic. God-Dragon: All-in Pledge If you wish to get all the options and all the exclusive rewards of this Kickstarter campaign, the God-Dragon pledge is made for you. It is equivalent to Dragon King of Ajagar with the addition of all available options not already included in this reward tier (metal Fateforge die Bronze Edition, tiefling miniature, dragonborn miniature, PDF of the Bestiary, and Grimoire art prints) at a $5 discount. Two Bronze Edition dice are also included as freebies (you will get three of them). Last but not least, the God-Dragon reward tier lets you choose the edition of your books: Standard or Red Dragon. You will make your choice during the Backerkit step. Note that the only difference between these editions is the cover. The contents themselves are identical. STRETCH GOALS: NARA�S JOURNEY By going beyond the project�s initial goal, you help pave the way for the continuation of the series. We have planned several stretch goals to thank you. All of these bonuses have been imagined with the intent of not delaying the delivery of the rewards, even if your subscription is a First Wave pledge. In the course of this subscription, you will journey at the side of Nara the adventuress, a proud Kaani Merosi trained both as a warrior and a scholar, following the great tradition of her people. Learn more about each stretch goals: Old Kaan ; Arolavia (Module by Ed Greenwood) ; Drakenbergen (art prints) ; Free City 1 (Map fo the City) ; Free City 2 (Spellcaster's Guide); Syrinscape Fateforge Soundset ... ; In addition to the main team above, the Fateforge project involves more than 20 people, including writers : Alak D�l, Benjamin Diebling, Benji Lacrouts, Dominique �Doudou� Lacrouts, Fabien Fernandez, Ed Greenwood, Eric Nieudan, F�lix Huet, Olivier Fanton, Vincent Basset ; Copy editors : Jo�o Bento, Simon Collins, Constance �Destiny, Justine L. Boudet, Kevin Ronald Dombrowski, St�phane �J2N� Roy, Tyson Pink, Richard Pratt, Travis Shelton; Concept artists : Ann&seb, Cheza, Fred Pinson, Nicolas Jamme & Olivier �Akae� Sanfilippo. Many thanks and congratulations for their work these last three years! Meet us on Discord or follow the brand new Facebook page for Fateforge. Based in France, Studio Agate has become specialized in creating imaginary worlds, writing scenarios, and transmedia. We design role-playing game books (Shadows of Esteren, Fateforge, Vermin 2047), music albums, and video games, and have won a dozen international awards. We also translate and publish in French licenses of great games (7th Sea, Vampire: the Requiem) under the label Agate RPG. Triquetra Entertainment is our North America partner for commercialization in specialized shops and for our presence at conventions. Studio 2 Publishing is our distributor and logistics partner. This campaign is powered by the Crowdfunding Agency. SHIPPING This project is US and EU-friendly. Physical rewards will be sent from the USA and France. Backers from these countries will not pay import taxes. Shipping fees will be added after the subscription campaign, during the Backerkit phase. Below are a few shipping fee estimates. The exact amount will depend on the weight of your package. Your PDFs will be available on your DriveThruRPG and your BackerKit account.
