Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00 In 2014, Rather Dashing Games released a new game which became one of its signature titles: DWARVEN MINER. The game featured a two-tiered crafting game where players delve into the depths of ancient mines to acquire materials necessary to forge mighty artifacts for their Dwarven patrons. It remains one of Rather Dashing's fan-favorites to this day. Now, in 2019, Rather Dashing Games is pleased to announce that LARRY ELMORE has signed on to help reforge this game into a new masterpiece! DWARVEN MINER: REFORGED is a game for 1-4 players (currently) and builds on the tried-and-true mechanics of the original while adding new depths of play based on feedback from our dashing fans. Featuring increased player interaction, intuitive strategy, and the approachable game-play Rather Dashing is known for, DWARVEN MINER: REFORGED is a sequel more than a reprint and is an excellent addition to the line. Review of the game by Lynnvander Studios. Larry Elmore has been a cornerstone of the fantasy games industry for nearly 1000 years (give or take). Larry's signature style has become its own fantasy genre and helped put Dungeons & Dragons on the map way back when dragons still roamed the earth! For DWARVEN MINER: REFORGED Larry offered to paint a new cover, new game board, and any other pieces necessary to bring this game to life. Among the stretch goals is a "Backpack Board" which would serve as each player's unique resource management playing area. We made it the first available stretch goal because Larry really wants to include a third original oil painting for us in the final game, and around here we does what Larry wants! Larry has also generously allowed us access to his considerable library of beloved legacy artwork to round out the game and make it even more epic and nostalgic. Larry is already hard at work painting up the new cover and game board. Part of the Kickstarter goal is to help cover his expense, but we thought we'd post some work in progress of the board and planning. DWARVEN MINER: REFORGED is "Art you can play". From all of us at Rather Dashing, thank you for supporting this unique project. Obviously, the art of Larry Elmore is included at all levels of DWARVEN MINER: REFORGED. New box. New Gameboard. New Cards(?). Also, as a Kickstarter Exclusive, Larry will sign a gameboard plate to be affixed to the Kickstarter editions only! After that, it depends on the general success of the campaign (this is where all of you fine and dashing folks come in). $7,500 : Funded! Thank you! Includes a Kickstarter-exclusive signed "plate" you can affix to your game board or box! $10,000 : Backpack Player Boards! All games will now include a player board, one or each player, painted by Larry Elmore! $15,000 : Challenge Coin! For doubling our original funding level, all backers will receive (free) an exclusive Larry Elmore challenge coin. It has Elmore on the front, and our Dwarves on the back! The game rules will quite clearly state that players with a Challenge Coin get first chance to choose their position. Additional challenge coins may be purchased as an add-on. $20,000 : 5 Player expansion! We will develop a 5-Player expansion and include it in all copies of the game. $30,000 : The Tower of Elmore! We will draw upon some of Larry Elmore's amazing art to create a fun, themed dice tower (using punchboard material) to sit alongside your game board. One free copy of The Tower of Elmore will be added to every copy of REFORGED! CHALLENGE COIN : $10 Add a Larry Elmore challenge coin to your pledge level. DWARVEN DICE : $30 Upgrade your dice to some gnarly Dwarven-metal versions, provided by our awesome friends at Norse Foundry! This add-on is a set of 6 high-quality metal dice; a $40 value, offered here at $30. SIGNED PRINT : $40 Larry will mail you a signed print of his REFORGED cover or game board art. This will fulfill right after the close of the campaign! Shipping is not included in this price, and will be set by Larry Elmore dependent on your location! Se the video below to see the prints! You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00 More Add ons!!! Element Silver! : $30 Pick up a copy of our latest edition of Element which include the Silver expansion. Step up your game by adding Lightning, Wood, or Metal to the mix in this latest version of Rather Dashing's ever green title. Normally $40. ALDR the High Sage : $30 Our latest game which isn't even out yet! This is a tactical card laying game of area control set in the Element universe. Build Elemental patterns while blocking your opponents form doing so. Includes a micro expansion to Element. Wakening Lair : $30 Our 2-6 player fully co-op dungeon crawl never disappoints and has quickly become a fan favorite. Normally $35. Hafid's Grand Bazaar: $20 This light Euro game of bidding and negotiation is a loud, raucous good time around the table. Normally $35, get it before it's gone. Finally, any retailers can pic up as many copies of the above Rather Dashing Games at 50% MSRP. When deciding who gets to go first (or last, or even third, if your prefer) all players with a Challenge Coin get to game for it. Place your coin beneath the table and then choose a side to be face up when you turn your hand over. Or, leave your hand empty. When everyone is ready, reveal your hand. (do not simply drop the coin. Turn your hand over to show an empty palm or a face-up side of the coin. (Dropping the coin is automatic disqualification. Metal is too precious to discard!) Of course, Nothing beats Larry Elmore! Larry Elmore beats Dwarves (but he's very conflicted about it). Dwarves are better than Nothing! Feel free to use this to decide who pays for pizza, makes a soda run to the fridge, or, really, anything that comes to mind!

Reward List Las Meraki Tales We are raising funds to showcase at London Fashion Week! We could not be more excited for this opportunity. Fashion Week is something we having been dreaming of since we started BlancoMaj in 2015. Our journey of us creating began in a basement studio at Majies parents house. Art has always been our form of therapy. It is our escape from this mad world. Love has guided us to the creation of our garments. Every piece that is created is triumph over life�s challenges. We want our clients to feel empowered, inspired, and confident when wearing BlancoMaj. The London Fashion Week show is $13,000. That includes us to have models, makeup, photographers, videographers,and the venue space . The funds donated will be used to pay for our show and our flight expenses. We graciously appreciate all the love and support.

Hi there! I'm CR, a freelance illustrator and cat enthusiast. Here's my cat, Jak. A big boy. I adopted Jak twelve years ago, he was part of a litter of stray kittens someone had found on their property, and he's been a spoiled baby ever since. Anyone who's hung out with me has probably been subjected to me excitedly showing off pictures of him. I even made a zine about him (Ask Me About My Cat) that I bring with me to conventions, and it's been fantastic connecting with other cat owners who love to tell me about their own kitties. No matter where I am, what convention I'm at, I've always found other cat enthusiasts who can relate to everything from floofy snuggles to having to deal with yelling for food at 5 am. This shirt is for them. And me, it's also for me (I love my cat, ok). The Tee The tee is a Bella + Canvas Women's Raglan Tee with 100% Airlume combed and ring-spun cotton. Printing will be done here in Austin, Texas by Antic Screenprinting. You can find their sizing specifications here. It features a single pocket-sized graphic on the upper chest area, and a full-sized graphic on the back. Shirts are available in Small to XXL. All supporters who order a shirt will receive a survey at the conclusion of the campaign to specify what size they'd like. Front and Back Front Graphic Back Graphic The Sticker The sticker is a 3" x 3" waterproof vinyl sticker, suitable for indoor or outdoor use. Slap it on whatever you want (within reason) and let everyone know how you feel about cats! It's sticky (but like, not in a bad way) The Buttons A set of three 1.25" buttons featuring some very good boys. Just a bunch of good beans. Cat Commissions I also have a very limited number of commission reward slots! This includes all previous rewards, including the shirt, sticker, and buttons, as well as a commission of your own cat (or maybe a friend's or your mom's or maybe just some cool cat you saw on the street) in this style! A big mood. You'll receive both a digital copy of it as well as a 8.5" x 11" print. I'll contact you to make sure to get proper references of your kitty, as well as make sure that their personality gets across in the artwork. Stretch Goals and Supporting Paws Cat Shelter While Jak has a comfy home to call his own, there are still a lot of cats out there still looking for their forever home, and I'd really like to use this shirt to help bring some awareness and support to that. Our current funding goal doesn't leave much room for donations outside of production and shipping of rewards, but once we hit that goal, I plan to donate 10% of each shirt sold to Paws Cat Shelter, a non-profit and no-kill shelter located in Woodstock, CT. While I recently moved to Texas, Paws was my local shelter for years, and as a small town shelter can always use more support. If you don't want to wait for the campaign to end to support them, you can find them here! On top of this, once we've reached the $1600 goal, I'll be adding in a 4.7" x 1.9" vinyl sticker to all tiers at no additional cost! The Cost Printing costs for the shirt takes up the bulk of the funding goal at about $1300, since the front and back design require two separate screens, which raises the price a little. Kickstarter and credit processing fees I've estimated to be around $130, and the rest of the money goes towards sticker printing, buttons, shipping supplies, and a little bit extra to cover anything that pops up.

So where did the idea for SKULLTROOPERS come from? Simply, vinyl toys. You know, the art toys more and more indie artists are tapped to design. If you're not aware, modding those toys has become a popular culture in it of itself, so much so the manufacturers would sell blanks of their forms for hobbyists to mod. And for the LONGEST time I've wanted to mod a toy, but I couldn't for the life of me think of what to do! Then it hit me. I've come to find that a lot of artists in this space have Stormtroopers or skeletons in their personal work. And I thought that would be a fun mash-up. And with that, SKULLTROOPERS were born! After meetings with companies and what not to show the work, variants sprang from the OG Trooper, and next thing I knew I had a whole line. Which brings me to Kickstarter. I would love to give this idea form. And while this sprang from an idea for idea for toys, I would love to see this happen as an enamel pin set. Each pin will measure approx. 2" high. And you can see the collection below. I hope you dig the idea. And I hope you'll become a Backer. But if anything, thank you for your time. �Ben UPDATE 6/4/19 UPDATE 6/5/19

The Spirits need your help. You've been called to Moonside, the otherworldly home base of our spectral caretakers, at a time of crisis: Earth is rotten, Spirits are getting lost and no one can remember how to make things better. Some of the Spirits think you can help; others are not very happy you've arrived. Can you make things right � or is a sinister fate in store for our ghostly hosts? The original immersive play, "Welcome to Moonside," will feature a predominantly female cast and is set in an unconventional space. Moonside will feature a series of scenes in which the cast will lead audience members throughout the world of the show for one-on-one conversations. While a good portion of Moonside will feature longer scenes not dissimilar to those found in a traditional play, the performances will be fully interactive; there is not a stage and a passive audience, but rather a complete and immersive environment in which the action takes place. In the show, 25 humans will be brought to Moonside, the cosmic home base of a group of spirits tasked with preserving life on Earth. Soon after they arrive, however, they discover the adverse effects that �time� has had on the spirits, hindering their memory and clouding their judgments. As tensions rise amidst the uncertain and crumbling power structure within Moonside, the �future� will be dependent not only on the diverse and widely opinionated ghosts, but also on choices the humans will make. �Welcome to Moonside� will explore the relationship between memory and mental clarity, asking audiences to help our characters dive into their own history at a time of political crisis. It is our hope that our audience members will forge real connections with our characters, bringing their own personal experiences to a resonant, yet fictional, setting. Vigilance Theater Group presented our debut production, "Hollow Moon," in November 2018. "Welcome to Moonside" is a shared-universe follow-up to that production; many of you wanted to know more about the ghostly visitor that haunted "Hollow Moon." In "Welcome to Moonside," your questions will be answered. The money raised through Kickstarter will assist our efforts in securing a budget for the location, set dressing, and technical needs to help bring our vision to life.

I just released a new album! It�s called �The Shade from Our Trees� and you can download it from my website, stream it on the platform of your choice, or be a hero and help Kickstart it! Where have I been, you ask? After making a dozen albums and hundreds of songs non-stop for over a decade, I was feeling pretty burned out. I decided to just take some time off to recharge my battery until I was feeling truly inspired to make more music. That finally came this year, and I�ve been working feverishly ever since to finish this album! "The Shade from Our Trees" has been a long time in the making, which seems oddly appropriate given the source of the title. The album's roots came as the second half of a double-album called "Feathers and Tethers", where "Feathers" was the light CD, and "Tethers" was the dark one. As I was close to releasing it, I realized it was way too dark, even for me. I cannibalized a couple of songs from it to put on what became "Addressed to the Stars", and let the rest gather dust. When I came back to the project with fresh ears, I started working on new material to pull the album together and make it more balanced. I ended up abandoning most of the original project to make room for the newer material I was writing. The result is maybe the most ambitious project I�ve tackled to date, incorporating a lot of new sounds into my music. In addition to the album itself, backers with $5+ pledges will get a digital EP of updated versions of the previously released songs that didn't make it onto the album, the original acoustic version of Vanishing Note, the original upbeat version of The Maze, and an unreleased track. Everyone at the $30+ tiers get their name in the liner notes of the album, along with a photo of me holding a personalized thank-you note. There's a $50 package for those of you who don't need a shiny disc, but who want basically every digital goodie I can throw at them. And for the truly adventurous, TinyTune commissions are back! Thank you all so much for the support. I love you all!

The Undercroft is a ~15,000 square foot facility that will house co-working/co-location space purpose built for the cybersecurity community. Located in a landmark building in historic Ybor City, our space will include 7 private offices, 12 dedicated desks, 2 conference rooms, 2 training/meetup bays, a courtyard, and multiple shared common areas. We also plan to add a multipurpose media studio. When complete, our facility will support and empower a diverse community of cybersecurity professionals, students, and enthusiasts. We want to organize and host a wide variety of events, classes, and workshops, and produce security focused content. Whether you are new to the industry or an industry veteran, you will be welcome here. The Undercroft will be the first facility of its kind bringing together industry leading technology companies, subject matter experts, startups, students, and talented practitioners. Our community has realized that when we come together, we can do so much more than we can separately. Welcome to Ybor City Cybersecurity meetup Common Area When it comes to general business expenses we've got it covered. What we need your help with is building a media studio. We want our community to have a voice and a means to be able to share that voice with the world through video and podcast production, product and software demo capability, live streaming of capture the flag events, and member led cybersecurity workshops. We belive that the general public would also benefit from the completion of our studio. We would be able to offer low cost rental rates to the general public looking for a way and means to be able to express themselves creatively. THE STUDIO Future Media Studio Future Media Studio Podcast Bay Because we have gotten such amazing support from all of our backers it's time to take this project to the next level. There is still a lot of work to be done and more resources needed to complete our quest to build a Cybersecurity Hub here in Ybor City, Tampa $15,000 Stretch Goal If we hit our first stretch goal, we will be able to make a significant investment in our primary collaboration lab that will house our sandbox environment and guild co-working. We will be able to: Cage and secure the Sandbox Bay Fully furnish the collaboration lab with hotdesking, benching and seating Install A/V (Flatscreen & Sound) Install white boards $20,000 Stretch Goal If we hit our second stretch goal, we will be able to invest in upgrading our primary training bay that is a shared resource for members, residents and partners to host meetups and community driven events. We will be able to: Install white boards Install PA/Sound System Additional Flatscreen A/V Cabling $30,000 Stretch Goal Our building is the second oldest building in Ybor City and served as the original incubator for cigar city. As you can imagine keeping up with such a historic building is not an easy task. If we hit our third stretch goal we will be able to make the investment necessary to upgrade aging infrastructure, fixtures, and building systems. $40,000 Stretch Goal We would be able to upgrade our facility hotdesking by adding additional electrical to provide each desk with a USB charging port, electrical outlets, mounted monitor. Additional kitchenette for the primary collaboration lab $50,000 Stretch Goal Security & Automation Install additional role based access control on parking gate, pedestrian gate, and courtyard gate Formal Automated Podium Smart Board THE CONTENT Producing cybersecurity related content is such an important goal for us long term. Through videos and live events we will be able to inform the community of potential risks, fixes, and ways to fight back against cyber criminals that wish them harm. Your donations will help our members produce content that they feel will benefit the community in a positive way. Weekly shows that talk about the latest cyber news THE EVENTS The ability to host and live stream cybersecurity events and conferences is a huge benefit to the community. Conferences are a great place for people who are looking to join the industry, to network and receive information on potential jobs or information on furthering their education. It's fantasic for security practitioners to collaborate on ideas and industry methods that help us combat the growing threat to our safety and the security of our country. Live Stream Events Your pledge will allow us to build out our media studio with the requisite equipment to support member driven cybersecurity meetups, workshops and podcasts. Teach members how to produce, shoot, and edit cybersecurity awareness videos. Help member backed startups record product and platform demos. Stream live classes and meetups to extend our reach in the region. Here is a list of just some of the critically needed items: Computers for Editing Bay Theater Style Seating Chairs Conference Table Collaboration Pods AV Projector Webcasting Station Green and White Screen Lighting Equipment Video Cameras Tripods Microphones and Headphones for Podcasts In addition to finishing our media studio, we want to enhance our primary collaboration lab (maker/hackerspace). Your contributions will also provide needed resources for us to provide experiential learning for students in the local community, Future White Bay Our primary collaboration lab will be outfitted with a wide range of technology and tools for our members to disassemble, build, break, and learn. Here is a list of just some of the needed items: Benching and Seating Standard Shop Tools (Specifically for Electronics) 3D Printers RF Equipment Servers & Storage Firewalls Sandbox With your help and along with the help of our members, residents and partners, we plan to build a community Sandbox environment where our members can launch, test, and study dangerous malware without risk of infecting their own devices or putting our standard network at risk. Industry supporters have already donated racks, servers, and other equipment and seek to make this a community project that will provide valuable hands on experience to our members as well as create a shared resource to help the community keep pace with the ever-evolving cyber threat. We are taking a bottom up approach to increasing the cybersecurity posture of the Tampa Bay region. It starts here in the community with the people who are security practitioners engaging with those who want to learn. It starts here with small to medium size business who have just as much a need for security as larger organizations. Pledge $2+: Thank you for your support! To show our gratitude we will give you a shout out on all our social media channels. Social Media Boost ($2 or more) Pledge $10+: Our members will create a �Thank You� video featuring all the names from this reward level. Our members created this special edition Kickstarter sticker pack just for you. Old recycled floppy disks will be painted, and your name or handle will be signed onto the final product. The artwork will be framed and displayed in our lobby for all to see. Each poster, badge, sticker, and shirt are sequentially numbered to 150. At the end of the campaign, we will hold a drawing of donor names at this reward level to determine what number will be given for each item. This is a great way for us to be creative, cost effective, and environmentally responsible. Check out the process in the video below. The Cooler Lockbox (TM) Check out The Cooler Lockbox(TM) on YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=13t3uTCN704 The Cooler Lockbox is the trade name of an exciting new device that secures parcel deliviries at the doorstep. In addition to security, the Cooler Lockbox allows perishable foods, prescription medications and alcohol (yes, alcohol delivery is becoming a thing) to be safely delivered without the shopper having to rush home to accept the delivery. No more stress, no more melting ice cream, and no more peak-delivery surcharges. Although we will begin manufacturing The Cooler Lockbox in July 2019, this Kickstarter campaign will help decrease both the manufacturing cost and the time it takes to ship the product out. This will greater enhance the appeal of The Cooler Lockbox, because the sale price will be more affordable and the time to produce and ship will be greatly reduced. Please visit www.CoolerLockbox.com.

You can also help by talking to your friends and family about the campaign to see if they would be interested in donating to this incredible series.

STRETCH GOAL ADDITIONS (INCLUDED IN ALL COPIES): Player count expanded from 3-6 to 2-8. 2 additional play boards. All 8 will have custom names/descriptions. Upgraded Reigning Ruler token (3D punchboard crown). Constellation Prize Expansion (back side to each board, 60 constellation tokens). Upgraded card stock, spot UV on the box, full color printed interior divider. 8 Kingdom Power/Reference cards. 1 Create your own Free Creature card. STRETCHIER GOALS: Ok, full disclosure, you guys cleaned us out in the stretch goal department. Due to the time constraints we have with our printing schedule and availability constraints of our artist, there aren't any additional physical changes we can make at this point. In fact, all files except for the rules and the punch board layouts are already being reviewed so we can start printing next month. The good news here is that you've unlocked the full game as we envisioned it, and that you'll receive it in a fraction of the time that many other projects take. Games will ship in October (barring any mishap), just over 4 months from now. However, that doesn't mean we don't want to continue to award you for your support of the project. So, we've devised a few additional add-ons that we will be delivering to you between now and the time the game eventually ships. UNLOCKED: $55,000: Upgrade the box insert/component divider from white to color printed featuring Apryl's amazing artwork. UNLOCKED: $60,000: 5 print at home greeting cards incorporating characters from the game and an HD digital wallpaper pack with artwork from the game. UNLOCKED $65,000: A print-at-home table mat with labeled spots for the deck and 2 discard piles. UNLOCKED $70,000: A digital art-book with concept sketches, rejected Creatures, and a story-book style narrative of each of the Creatures in the game. UNLOCKED $75,000: A print and play version of Cover Your Kingdom. UNLOCKED $80,000: 3D print file to print your own Cover Your Kingdom Crown ring. Created by the 3D Printing professor Joe Larson. Facebook Pledge will be added at noon PST. 12 will be available to celebrate the last 12 hours of the campaign. Surprise! We've added a pledge level. To celebrate the last 12 hours of the campaign we've added a new exclusive reward level full of items that you literally can't buy ANYWHERE else. It's so much awesome stuff you'll need a Klaken to help carry it. THE KLAKEN PLEDGE $200 What you get: Signed copies of ALL 7 of our games will be shipped in 7-10 business days. Cover Your Assets Skull King The Bears and The Bees Nuts about Mutts Golf Cover Your Kingdom: Prototype copy of the deck and playmats. Antiquity Quest (our newest game that won't be available for sale for another month) One of a handful of copies that arrived last week that we had shipped via airmail. You will also receive: An Early Release Copy of Cover Your Kingdom. (It will be shipped to us by airmail directly after printing, signed, and forwarded to you, 6-8 weeks prior to all other backers). A 3D Printed Reigning Ruler's Ring: Designed by Joe Larson, the 3D Professor A 30 Minute Video or Phone Call with Jeff Beck or Grandpa Beck: Discuss strategy, game crafting, or whatever else you would like. Your Name Printed In The Rulers Book: Forever, not just this first printing. A Fine Art Print: It will feature art from the game and will be signed by the artist, Apryl Stott, the developer, Jeff Beck, and the owner, Grandpa Beck. Well, what are you waitin' for? If you want this package, you best get Klaken! Due to the timely nature of this package, it will only be offered in the US. If all 12 are sold by 6PM PST another 6 may be added. Why Kickstarter? With five games in our line-up, thousands of Amazon reviews, and hundreds of thousands of fans of our games, launching a game on Kickstarter might seem like an odd choice. We have the funding, the game's design is almost complete, and we're experienced in the production process. The reason we are here is simple. We designed our first couple of games for the family market. Our last couple of releases, Skull King + Legendary Expansion, The Bears and The Bees, and now Cover Your Kingdom, are still excellent games for families to play. However, with their more advanced mechanics they have sufficient depth and strategy to find broader appeal at the tables of casual and hobby gamers as well. They have been warmly received and well reviewed by many within these groups, but we are still relatively unknown in the gaming community as a whole. That is the reason we made the decision to launch Cover Your Kingdom on Kickstarter. It's also why we are offering our best pricing of all time when you purchase a bundle of this new game along with our other 3 best sellers. All three are included for $24, or $8 each (50 cents over wholesale), when you buy them together with a copy of Cover Your Kingdom. We strongly believe that if you buy the games, and try them, that you'll love them and share them with those you play with. If you love the games, we know that when you teach them to those you play with, that they will them too. They'll also love you for introducing them to these excellent games that we stand behind 100% as a family. From our table to yours, Grandpa Beck - Grandpa Beck's Games Special Thanks This game was created with the help of too many people to thank by name, but there were a few individuals who provided a tremendous amount of support, guidance, and advice during play testing, development, and preparing this campaign that we'd like to thank by name. Brent Jentzsch Randal, Brynn, and Kristian Brandon Rollins Dave Stevens Mike Bruner Vinnie and Avie Austin and Valentina The whole team at Red Balloon Toy Stores Thanks for you all so much for your help, the project could not have happened without you. This project is promoted by Jellop, the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarters with 650+ successful Kickstarter projects with over $300MM raised between them.

I'm not a book author or illustrator, I'm a Cyber Security professional. I also have two children under the age of four and am all-too familiar with picture books (AKA board books). As I was reading an ABC book to my son it occurred to me, there aren't any children's books on Cyber Security. I wanted to make a fun illustration that makes security concepts easy to understand but are enjoyable for the adults as well. I'm hoping there are other InfoSec Moms and Dads out there like me. I'm unsure if I'll create more than the initial 500 copies, so sign up here to reserve your copy! The book cover in the image above and the "U is for Unauthorized Access" page should give you an idea for what each page will look like. Unique monsters will be on each page for every letter of the alphabet, done by this same multi-award winning children's illustrator. Although there isn't a lot of text in the book aside from the alphabet terms, I plan to add a privacy page at the end, stressing the importance to children about not talking with strangers online, giving up personal information, and not clicking on ads, etc. If you're a company, there's a single quantity pledge that will get your company logo branded on the back of the book as the official corporate sponsor! In addition to this I'll find a fitting place to put your logo into the actual story as well. Additionally, there are two pledge rewards available for secondary corporate sponsors. For these I will also add them into the story line, either on a hacker hoodie or hacker stickers on a laptop, for example. It also occurred to me that these books could be given during trade shows and security conferences by companies. If you're anything like me, I take most of my "swag" home to my kids anyways, so why not give out something relevant and educational? Or, maybe you have an executive team that could use them. ;) If funding exceeds my 100% Kickstarter goal, I plan to put that money back into additional copies so more children and parents can have access to this book. I apologize for those of you not in the United States or Canada. I enabled support for other countries but shipping is more expensive.

A short genre film in the tone of The Descent, Close Encounters of the Third Kind and HALLOWEEN. While babysitting a precocious 6 year old, Mia is stalked by a shadowy presence that trips the home security system. As loud beeps sound off whenever a door or window is opened, the system meant to protect her becomes an amplifying terror while she attempts to survive the night. Safe and Sound is an atmospheric love letter to all things 70s/80s Steven Spielberg & John Carpenter. Growing up in the suburbs, I�ve always had a deep fondness for horror and science fiction that revolved around contemporary, everyday life. Visually stunning films that brought the impossible what-ifs and terrifying unknown into our homes and leave you questioning every bump in the night. Late one night while staying with my girlfriend's family (watching a horror film no less), we both hear the ominous beep-beep of the home security system. Already primed and on edge from the film, it took us a moment to rationalize what could have opened or closed in the house. We quickly came to the conclusion that it was her grandmother opening a window and since we survived the night, that was most likely the case. ...but what if it wasn't? We were so conditioned to the security system's beeps that someone or something could have gotten inside and we would be none the wiser. Over the following months, Joshua Storms and I crafted that moment into a tight, tension filled sci-fi nightmare. The best horror films submerge themselves in social commentary and Safe and Sound is no different. There�s a lot of uncertainty in the world right now. While people want to feel secure and rely on the news/leaders to tell them everything is okay, it can become a repeating signal of anxiety and stress. Even worse is growing accustomed to the bad news and falling into complacency. What I want to explore and capture in this short is the concept that the very thing that should be helping and supporting Mia is actually terrorizing her. Each time the security system beeps is a moment of horror and not of safety. We are looking for $10,000 in addition to our own funds to cover production costs and will shoot the film this summer. Halloween Moody and atmospheric, inspired by the heavy anamorphic style of 70s and 80s cinema. We�ll build the tone and feel with ambient sources; warm lamps and accent lights of the home mixing with the cold teal blast of motion sensing lights surrounding the house. We want to embrace the dark corners of a tranquil environment, a familiar, yet stylized look of an older suburban home. Let Me In Using the JAWS approach of less-is-more, we�ll thoughtfully frame and light to avoid revealing too much of the creature, leaving it mostly in the darkness and only seeing the movements of its grotesque shadow. In the end, immersive sound design will do the heavy lifting when it comes to portraying the stalking monster. Although we are planning for some limited digital effects, I want to capture as much of the blood and terror in camera. The Descent The expansive, multilevel layout of our location is perfect for exploring dark corners and dimly lit hallways. 33% - Camera and Lighting Equipment 20% - Casting 18% - Production Staff & Crew 17% - Art Department and Effects 12% - Sound SAFE AND SOUND: THE COMPUTER GAME Inspired by the 8-bit style graphic adventure games of the 80s, it features original art, music and expands on the film�s story with some added humor. www.safeandsoundthegame.com POSTER: 18x24" Poster Signed by Cast, Crew and Artist Ian Kammer Writer & Director Born and raised in a small, rainy Pacific Northwest town, I left to attend Art Center College of Design in Pasadena. My work has been recognized with wins and short-lists at the Clios, D&AD, AICP, Cannes Young Director Awards, Porsche International Student Advertising Film Awards, Vimeo Staff Picks, and the SHOOT New Director Showcase. Joshua Storms Writer A writer residing in Sleepy Hollow, NY. His work combines horror and the interpersonal. Kyle Nolan Producer An LA based film and television producer focusing on short form content using cinematic and artful storytelling. Raised in Philadelphia, he brings an east-coast gritty work ethic and �get it done�mentality to every production he touches, making sure high quality projects are executed seamlessly. Kyle�s passion and vision for content creation stem through his full in-house video company Meanwhile, where culture and color collide. Tiffany Frances Co-Producer A Taiwanese American director, writer and producer working in music videos, branded content and narrative film. She was selected for SHOOT Magazine's 2018 New Directors Showcase, where a trailer of her short film, WHAT I WISH YOU SAID, screened at the Directors Guild Theater in New York. Her producing credits include commercials for Barney's and Red Bull, music videos for Toro Y Moi and Killer Mike, while her directing clients include National Geographic, Dia & Co, Tanya Taylor, Citibank, Acura, Montiel and Jonesy. Justin Gurnari Cinematographer Los Angeles based Cinematographer who grew up in northern New Jersey. Upon completion of his B.F.A. from Emerson College, Justin spent a short time working in New York before moving to Los Angeles. There he began his career as a camera operator for television and film, and eventually attended Art Center College of Design in pursuit of an M.F.A. Films he has photographed have played in over 35 film festivals internationally, and his commercials and music videos have won awards at AICP, SXSW Film Festival, and the College Television Awards. He has been a member of the International Cinematographers Guild Local 600 since 2010, and is represented by ICM Talent Agency. Brody Howard Editor The founder, owner, and creative force behind Ditch. Brody Howard spent the majority of his early days on the run (from what we don�t know), having moved 14 times and landing in 8 states before the age of 12. Finding himself fired from an Oklahoma radio station for mouthing off to upper management, Brody wisely decided on a new career path and spent his formative editing years at Fallon. After branching out for a bit to other markets, Brody returned to Minneapolis in 2008 to open Ditch. When he�s not busy creating comedy gold in the editing chair, Brody takes his greatest pleasure spending time with his wife, 3 sons, 2 dogs, and 150,000 pet bees. Vincent Lin Executive Producer A 2005 NYU Film/TV graduate recognized with both the Founder's Day and the New Amsterdam Scholarship Awards, Vincent's achievements as a producer and as a director continue to soar. As a go-to freelance producer for leading New York agencies BBDO and Resource/Ammirati, Vincent works with top executives in business and advertising... and he is widely known for producing top comedic spots for major brands including Labatt Blue, Midori, Samuel Adams, Wild Turkey, and others. Matthew D'Amato Executive Producer After studying traditional arts, graphic design, and digital media at New York City's LaGuardia High School and School of Visual Arts, he earned degrees in Digital Art & Design and Film from Full Sail University. He landed his first industry job with production company Smuggler in New York, where he collaborated with many top commercial industry talent. VALIANT PICTURES is a New York-based independent production company specializing in branded content, commercials, and original entertainment. Established in 2010 by director Vincent Lin and executive producer Matthew D'Amato, the latest creative achievements from Valiant's award-winning filmmakers are captivating diverse audiences across all media platforms. Continually and courageously challenging conventional expectations, the best is yet to come. PREVIOUS WORK: Subconscious Disconnect: Two scientists grapple with reality while watching the dream of their final subject. Reunion: In 1992 a father was taken from his family, now a daughter is left with only home videos and the hope of a reunion. A short film to promote the International Day of the Disappeared, August 30th.

Hello horror fans, welcome to the final Kickstarter campaign for Retro Redux Entertainment & Peter Anthony Production's - The Fall of Camp Blood SYNOPSIS In The Fall of Camp Blood, we pick up following the events of Friday the 13th: The Final Chapter. Camp Blood has been shutdown after the gruesome murders occurred. Before the demolition of the site, a group of teenagers must venture to empty their parents cabin before it's destroyed. It doesn't take long before they remember why it was shut down in the first place. These are Jason's woods, and anyone who enters must deal with the consequences. Peter Anthony will be playing James Dier, the revenge-seeking sibling to the late Rob and Sandra Dier. James' journey is a key one in The Fall of Camp Blood. Will he finally take down the man that murdered his brother and sister, or will the only living Dier sibling undergo the same fate? More Cast Announcements Coming Soon... The script we have written includes extensive amounts of practical effects, as well as traditional filmmaking elements, which requires products that we as independent filmmakers just can't afford. All of the funds raised will go towards completing production, post production expenses, and fulfilling all backer rewards. Independent filmmaking is extremely difficult and expensive, and that�s where we need your help. Here is a breakdown of how your funds will be utilized: PRODUCTION: This will cover all of the equipment that we will use in the production of the film such as; cameras, sound, lighting, insurance, etc. MAKEUP AND EFFECTS: We are heavily relying on practical effects, rather than VFX, to make our kills, and our killer, look as realistic as possible. PROPS/WARDROBE/JASON COSTUME: This portion will help us dress our counselors and Jason, and buy all the props and weapons to make sure that every scene is memorable. POST PRODUCTION: These expenses will help cover our editing and visual effects added after the film is shot, and will add any finishing touches to the project. KICKSTARTER FEES AND REWARD FULFILLMENT: We will need this to help cover our expense in getting the rewards to our loyal fans. We cannot thank you enough for donating to our project! ZERO PROFIT will be made as a result of this film. Since we are asking for you to put your faith in us, we would like to show you what we are capable of. We produced a Friday the 13th Fan Film in 2016, with absolutely no budget, which has reached almost 200,000 views. Hopefully, this past film shows you the product that we are capable of making. Every backer will receive exclusive updates and production information! We also have plenty of "killer" rewards as a thank you for supporting our project! These include The Fall of Camp Blood blu-ray, posters, as well as many digital items to choose from. We also have options to purchase props, used on screen in The Fall of Camp Blood. and gain the opportunity to BE KILLED BY JASON VOORHEES!* *United States only Design subject to change Design Subject To Change Design Subject To Change Design Subject To Change Design Subject To Change STRETCH GOALS Once we hit 200 backers, all backers at a $50 tier and higher will receive the Digital Soundtrack for FREE! Design Subject To Change. We are proud to announce that C.J. Johnson is officially signed on to compose the score for The Fall of Camp Blood! C.J. is known for his work in the horror genre, including just last year, when he worked on a film by Blumhouse called "Hurt". He�s definitely a perfect fit for The Fall of Camp Blood, and we couldn�t be more excited to have him onboard! If you would like to check more of C.J.'s work, click this picture to go to his website! Retro Redux Entertainment is a small, low budget film and photo production company based just outside of Chicago, IL. We specialize in horror shorts; however, our work spans from podcast work, to documentary filmmaking. While some of our videos are made for tutorial and teaching purposes, most are made for pure entertainment. Our crew is full of many energetic members with extremely hard-working and determined mindsets. Director Riley Lorden has been making films since a very young age and continues to study film and media, while pursuing his dream of becoming a film director. He's also responsible for all of the editing for all of the shoots, while also being involved in most of the writing. Producer Nic Christian is definitely the mastermind behind many projects. His charisma and determination has led to many successful projects, including the 2016 Friday the 13th Fan Film, and JACK, along with our podcast - Slash �N Cast. Producer Peter Anthony is a lifelong Friday the 13th fan and marketing guru, being a driving force behind Friday the 13th Vengeance and Steve Dash: Husband, Father, Grandfather. He is an incredible asset to the independent horror genre, and is the perfect edition to The Fall of Camp Blood team! Peter is also taking on a main acting role in the film. Director of Photography Emma Clair graduated from Beloit College in 2019 with a B.A. in Media Studies. She is interested in pursuing fictional narrative work in films that explore concepts of identity through an authentic lens. She has worked with the Beloit based production company, Ethos Films, as a Production Assistant and is currently a producer for Doorstop Productions. Jason Voorhees Griffin Thatcher has been by Riley's side since the very beginning. He's a gifted writer with some very unique and creative ideas, in which he's extremely excited to present to the world in the future. He currently is working full time to monetarily support the podcast, while still making it back to help with on camera endeavors. He played Jason in the 2016 Friday the 13th fan film and can not wait to put the mask back on! Please donate or share this page with your friends and family. We appreciate any support you can give us. Thank you for supporting not just us, but independent filmmaking as a whole! Feel free to contact us with any questions you may have. What am I funding here? Gideon Ira: Knight of the Blood Cross is the first novel in my new series of Christian Pulp stories, Deus Vult Wastelanders. The initial books follow Gideon Ira, a young knight in power armor as he traverses a post-apocalyptic wasteland America full of demons, necromancers, warlocks, vicious bandits, and savage warlords. The Church has unified into one community of believers, though friendly denominational factions remain and support one another because this is not a time to be divided. Gideon Ira is Catholic himself while his best friend is a member of the Assemblies of God. Holy knights guard the huddled masses of survivors in the shelter of walled city-states. Mankind has largely forgotten the ability to forge advanced tech, so they preserve the existing power armor, plasma swords, and heavy weaponry like holy relics. Gideon Ira: Knight of the Blood Cross opens with the wandering knight in desperate battle against a demon of pride. He's tracked the hulking monster to its lair, and the audience gets to see a range of special abilities supplied by Gideon's power armor. He takes the severed head back to the nearby border village where the hunt was commissioned and dumps it off at the local church for cataloging and disposal. When he hears the resurgent cult of Ba'al up north has laid waste to an entire village in order to harvest their children for living sacrifice, Gideon sets off on a journey across the wasteland. The entire journey takes him to many locations: The ruins of a megacity populated by demons and cultists, the holy city of Belltower run by the Church, the demonic mirror world which lays beneath our own, cracked highways turned into gory battlefields, and across the flowering wasteland of a broken America. Several battles are gritty and brutal, real slugfests with huge swords and claws, while another adventure requires Gideon to work with a team of stealthy fellow knights operating with military precision as they seek to abduct the wicked Blackthorne. Gideon faces angels both fallen and faithful, articulate demons who seek to destroy his soul, and witches and warlocks commanding unholy powers. The goal of this series is to create stories to inspire Christians with a new wave of heroic figures living out their faith in uncompromising ways. I'm studying the pulp writers who brought us Conan the Barbarian, Solomon Kane, Tarzan of the Apes, and John Carter of Mars, and my goal is to write blistering page-turners to keep Christian audiences begging for more. What's the money for? This Kickstarter campaign is to help the author pay for cover art, professional editing, and professional formatting for both ebook and paperback editions. The rough draft of the story is already finished and currently stands at around 53,000 words prior to self editing and professional editing. My tendency as a writer is to increase the number of words during self editing because I leave description out of the rough draft, so that word count is likely to increase. The professional editor for this novel has worked on a wide range of novels and is already booked for August. He also holds a degree in theology, and I've got several members of multiple denominations ready to review the final copy and make sure it's friendly for all Christian audiences. The cover art for Gideon Ira: Knight of the Blood Cross is designed to look face-meltingly awesome, likely with the titular knight in power armor, his weapons, and a scattering of demonic enemies. My goal is to have art so beautiful that people will want to hang enlarged versions up as posters in their bedrooms. Renowned artist Ivan Tao has already agreed to do the work and is booked for August. Examples of his professional work can be found at https://www.artstation.com/ivantao. All backers will receive their digital copy of the novel at least 2 weeks in advance of the book being available for sale anywhere else. Backers are welcome to publish reviews as they wish upon receiving the novel and do not have to wait for the street date. The book is yours at that point to discuss to your heart's content. A short appetizer The first unedited chapter is included below to give backers a taste for what they can expect from the story: Chapter 1: Deep in a reeking pit in the earth, a knight in power armor challenged a feathery demon. Two gasping torches hurled in haste upon the floor splashed light over the duel and revealed the nest of the foul monstrosity. Human bones crunched underfoot and putrid soil lined all other sides in the crude cavern, the last in a mazelike warren of twisting rabbit tunnels. Like sentinels of death, bleached skulls embedded in the walls with jaws agape shrieked empty songs audible only to the damned. Metal rang and breath chuffed as the combatants stirred the bones at their feet and clashed once more. The stalwart knight stood his ground even as a rain of blows fell upon him in a waterfall of death. Claws like daggers scraped his gunmetal gray armor, seeking purchase in the dark gaps between. The armor�s gilded edges reflected like gold sunlight in the flickering light of the torch. A bloodred ragged cross was painted across the warrior�s breastplate. As soon as the demon�s attacks dwindled, the knight whirled into his counterattack. The crimson loincloth draped from his belt stirred with the movement, and the half-cape of the same color over his left shoulder snapped as the attacker pirouetted and slashed with his enormous two-handed greatsword. As tall as a man and a foot wide, the blade whistled as it cut the stagnant air of the stinking cavern. Golden glowing eyes set into the knight�s helm blazed like starlight as he struck again and again at the monstrous beast. For its part, the feathery demon withstood the flurry of attacks. Like a hulking ape covered in obsidian insect chitin, the enormous opponent repelled every attack, no matter how ferocious. The demon stood three times the height of a man so its head, like the head of an iguana and covered in the same gleaming black chitin, nearly scraped the cavern ceiling as it whipped back and forth to track the knight. Craggy thorns as long as a man�s arm intermixed with vibrant peacock feathers rising from all over the demon�s body reached to gore the knight at each opportunity. When the massive charcoal-gray greatsword proved ineffective, the knight pushed off with his foot and launched himself backward. The power of his suit augmented his strength and gave the backstep a reach of fifteen feet. Upon gaining some distance, the knight reached for his hip. A wide leather gunbelt hung askew across his armored hips. With the greatsword held tight in his left hand, the knight drew a silver-plated hand cannon from the holster and fired. The crash of gunfire tore through the underground cavern. The .50 caliber bullet ripped through the air and crashed into the hulking demon�s shoulder. Despite the power of the round, the bullet pinged off the tough chitin armor. The shot was powerful enough to stagger the beast, but no more. Not content to be fired upon, the gleaming demon roared and charged. Reeking earth flew like blowing curtains as the massive clawed feet churned the floor and propelled the monster forward in the blink of an eye. The knight barely had time to roll aside before the beast hurtled into the space where he�d been and slammed into the wall behind him. From the floor, the knight fired twice more at close range. The huge gun thundered in his hands, and once more his helm�s auditory dampeners kicked in to save the prone man�s hearing. Even as his shots rebounded off the monster�s back, the knight pushed himself to his feet again and whirled his greatsword for a one-handed overhead slash. His suit�s maintenance was so thorough he could not even hear the servos whirring as the powered arms augmented his attack and slammed the sword against the demon�s flank with the force of a freight train. Uncowed by the hit, the demon backhanded the knight with a hand the size of a car door. The metal armor rang like a gong and the knight flew across the cavern. His back slammed into the packed earth wall and he collapsed to the floor in a clatter of bones. Both weapons had dropped from his hands during his flight. The beast roared hideous laughter. The sound boomed in the tight confines of the cursed lair. The knight reached for his belt pouch and drew out a rosary. Sandy wooden beads rattled along the length of tan parachute chord. The steel crucifix on the end flashed in the torchlight. The knight wrapped the rosary around his gauntleted fist and struck a battle stance. When he roared his challenge, the scrapper�s voice resonated through the chamber and silenced the demon�s laughter. �Come at me, filthy churl,� the knight shouted. �I shall crush you with faith alone.� Snarling, the beast complied. Its charge was faster than the blink of an eye, its fist rising to crush the knight where he stood. The knight slipped by his attacker�s fist. The wind of the passing attack stirred his cloth drapings once more. With a roar, the faithful warrior threw his entire strength into a punch which slammed the iguana jaw of the hulking monstrosity. At the instant of impact, a flaring light burst forth from the rosary. The demon screamed and twisted away to avoid contact, but the knight lashed out again and punched the demon in its torso. The blow caused another flash of light. Where the punches had landed, smoke curled up from the scarred chitin. Suddenly wary, the huge monster threw itself across the cavern to escape. The knight made to pursue but his boot caught on the hilt of his greatsword and he stumbled. He lifted the enormous blade from the pile of rattling bones and hefted it in an overhead guard. The demon snarled at him from across the room. Inside his helm, the knight smiled. With his finger, he flicked the switch hidden inside the cross guard of his greatsword. The sharpened edge split apart as the blade butterflied open on both sides down the center spine. A roaring jet of golden plasma burst forth from the edges of the sword and threw surging shadows through the demon�s lair. At the same time, the knight used his tongue to flick a switch inside his helm. The golden edges of his armor lit up as bright as the sun, surging into sudden radiance. For the demon, the effect was like staring into the heart of the Sun itself. The beast roared in agony and covered its face with both hands to block the painful light. A countdown inside the knight�s helm started up, ticking down from 60 seconds in the top right corner of his vision. As the plasma blade thrummed in hands, the counter fell to 59 seconds, then 58. The HUD displayed the numbers in vivid red. Another warning along the bottom right of his HUD read Flash disabled. Recharge time: 120 minutes. With no time to lose, the knight rushed to the attack. His plasma sword bit into the beast�s arm but failed to fully penetrate the chitin. By knocking the limb aside, he was able to drive his blade into a thrust directly at the scarred chitin on the beast�s torso where his blessed rosary had burned the monster. The plasma blade tore through the chitin and into the flesh beneath. The demon, which had been swinging blindly as it defended itself from the unseen foe, lashed out in all directions. Blue ichor squirted from the wound and splashed across the reeking earth at the knight�s feet. Ignoring the splashing blood and the swinging attacks, the knight stepped under the flailing arms and slashed his plasma blade at the demon�s face. The sword connected but the monster twisted away at the last second, so the blade failed to plunge through. The knight had been aiming for the scarred chitin along the monster�s jaw where he�d punched its face but the dodge caused the weapon to scrape along the apelike demon�s eye. With a burst of fluid the eye exploded and the beast shrieked in agony. Another backhand hurled the knight back ten feet. His armored greaves skidded through the bones and shattered them to dust beneath his heels. As he slid to a stop, his HUD read 30 seconds. The blinded demon recovered vision in its remaining eye and fixed the dark orb on its tormenter. With a cry of fury, the monster charged forward. The knight hurled himself into the attack. His plasma sword burned through the air as the countdown continued to tick toward depletion. The monster reached with both claws to snag the knight. The knight allowed himself to be caught around the waist, with both arms over his head. With a cry of triumph, the demon squeezed with all its might, attempting to crush the knight. In the bottom left of the knight�s vision, the words Armor integrity decreasing appeared. An outline of his body showed yellow around his lower abdomen, and the color was quickly burning toward a darker orange. Trusting his armor to hold, the knight lined up a swing and slashed his plasma blade against the side of the demon�s face. The plasma sword bit deep into the scarred chitin along the jaw and into the cratered eye socket. With a sizzle, the blade bit through the side of the beast�s face and into the meat beneath. The huge body jerked as plasma incinerated its brain and central nervous system. While not native to the material plane, the demon was forced to abide by the laws of living creatures when inhabiting a body. That meant a brain to house the spirit-body connectors. As for any living creature, destroying the brain meant separation of spirit and body. The clawed hands around the knight maintained their grip for another moment before falling away. With a crunch, the limp corpse collapsed into the piles of bones and moved no more. With 10 seconds left on the countdown, the knight pressed the switch under the cross guard on his sword once more. The golden plasma ceased to flow, the sword edges closed into a normal sword blade, and the countdown in his HUD disappeared. With a flick of his eyes, the knight activated his gear search. The sword in his hand lit up as white light outlined the weapon. Across the room, another white outline showed him the location of his lost hand cannon. Bones crunched underfoot as the knight strode to his pistol and lifted it up to check for damage. Satisfied that the weapon was intact, he slid it back into its holster and turned to regard the fallen demon. �I require your head,� the knight declared to the lump of armored meat.

About "This story follows the journey of Kayla, a young actress who challenges the status quo while striving to improve her craft. I specifically wanted Kayla to learn from Sarah Bernhardt, her idol and legendary actress from the late 19th century who was an unstoppable force of nature on stage and in life. It's Sarah Bernhardt's boldness to forge your own path in life - and in your career - that inspires Kayla, and I believe will inspire audiences as well. - Kathleen Barth (Writer and Director) The Story When aspiring actress, Kayla auditions for the title role in her college�s production of Hamlet, she nearly flops at the audition. But Sarah Bernhardt, the legendary actress from the turn of the century � and Kayla�s acting idol � mysteriously emerges onstage to help Kayla with her audition. But undergoing Sarah Bernhardt�s intensive training proves to be far more difficult than Kayla imagined. The Director's Vision In this project�s infancy, the production team and I brainstormed concepts for a short film and it was then that I created the story for �The Audition�. When I officially took on the responsibility of writing the screenplay for our team's short film, I decided to write a story about two women with a master and apprentice relationship dynamic . I also loved the idea of setting this film in a theatre. I mean, write what you know, right? Yet I also wanted to give this story a splash of fantasy and have the master in this dynamic be an historical figure who magically emerges to life on stage. It took me two seconds to decide that this historical figure must be Sarah Bernhardt. Sarah Bernhardt is a legendary French theatre actress from the turn of the century, and she even crossed over into film during the early days of French cinema. She performed and lived her life in an over the top fashion, yet it was her bold performance of Hamlet that solidified her place in the acting firmament. And in playing Hamlet, Sarah Bernhardt proved that a woman�s role is whatever she chooses it be. And that boldness inspires Kayla, the young actress in this story, as well as artists today. I mean without Sarah Bernhardt�s Hamlet, we wouldn�t have Glenda Jackson playing King Lear on Broadway right now. Sarah Bernhardt�s fierceness and determination to forge her own path and challenge the status quo clearly continues inspiring artists and other professionals alike. When writing Kayla, the young aspiring actress in this story, I was inspired by my own journey as a young actress studying performance in undergrad. Like me, Kayla struggles getting out of her head and embodying the physical and emotional life of a character. Yet during her magical master class with Sarah Bernhardt, Kayla gets the opportunity she desperately needs to nail her audition and improve her craft as an actress. When I swapped my writer hat for my director one, I sought to create two worlds for this film, and therefore, two stages: one that exists in reality, and another full of fantasy. In reality, the audience gets a peak into the world of collegiate theatre and the experience of auditioning. As a trained actor, and now as a director, I have worked on both sides of an audition and I wanted to evoke the experiences of an actor and of the director during an audition. I especially wanted to reveal how vulnerable actors often feel during an audition, particularly when their audition isn�t going well. This is what Kayla experiences during her initial audition: she feels infinitely small in front of a sea of unfriendly eyes while standing alone on a vast and empty stage. Yet when Kayla hits rock bottom during her audition, she finds herself transported to a sort of dual dimension, or fantasy world. In creating the fantasy world, I wanted to give the stage the appearance of a void where darkness engulfs the space. Yet in this void Sarah Bernhardt, along with characters from Hamlet, seemingly emerge from the darkness and onto the stage. I also wanted to establish Sarah Bernhardt as the ringmaster in this void; she can appear and disappear at will, and she ultimately wields the power to summon other entities onto the stage. I also set out to evoke how mentally and emotionally exhausting one-on-one acting coaching can be. During Kayla�s master class with Sarah Bernhardt, mental and emotional exhaustion gradually seeps into Kayla and I wanted the audience to go on that journey with her. As Sarah Bernhardt pushes and pushes Kayla, the audience will also feel the strain that continually performing weighs on her. Yet when an actor veers on the verge of their breaking point, that�s when they often let go of their inhibitions and a new kind of magic happens as the actor fully embodies their character. This is the moment that Sarah Bernhardt is trying to push Kayla toward, and the audience will follow Kayla to see if she breaks or triumphs. Amid the fantastical elements of this film, �The Audition� ultimately portrays the tale of a young woman determined to step into a man�s role while receiving help from a woman who did it over a century earlier. As the writer and director for �The Audition�, I want viewers to adopt Sarah Bernhardt�s fierce methodology: a woman�s role can be the same as a man�s, and that the only limits we have are the ones we place in front of ourselves. Meet the Filmmakers Kathleen Barth: Writer and Director Rachel Ledon: Producer and Editor Scott Duvall: Director of Photography Emma Williams: Costume Designer and 1st AD Blake Howard: Production Assistant and 2nd Cam Heather Rody: Lighting Designer Domanique Cummings: Lighting Designer Rachel Petras: Production Assistant FROM THE FILMMAKERS: This film is not only an opportunity to tell an important and powerful story, but to bring together artists and creative professionals who want to achieve great storytelling through collaboration and strong relationships. It's a chance for us to learn from one another, build on our craft, and do what we love. We'd love to have you on our team! A story of empowerment, inspiring women to think beyond their boundaries and realize their full capabilities. Our female-led cast and crew are eager to tell this story of talent, wisdom, and courage through one of the boldest women in history. Full Cast Table read of "The Audition" Mackenzie Larsen (left) as Kayla, and Kaely Clapper (right) as Christie Tandrea Parrott (left) as Mary Clowning Around at the Table Read

UPDATE! WE'RE FULLY FUNDED! THANK YOU! HELP US HIT OUR STRETCH GOALS! -If we hit 28.5K, we�ll produce at least seven sketches. -If we hit 32K, we�ll add at least two more sketches to the block (8). -If we hit 40k, we�ll make at least nine sketches AND a multi-episode mini series. -And if we somehow hit 50K, we�ll make a full year of sketches (12) and a multi-episode mini series. Last Friday night, in the middle of a live stream, we hit our $25,000 goal and passed 100% funded (check out the moment it happened here: https://youtu.be/wOyNPR9WZ70?t=4913). We can't believe we got here so quickly, and we can't believe so many of you are out there supporting us. We're so happy, so grateful and so excited to make these sketches. Like, for real, we're so freaking pumped. We'll be reaching out in the weeks ahead to fulfill all of your rewards, and we'll keep you posted as we move forward. And to encourage you in this final stretch we're adding two new rewards! If you jump in now at the $10 level, we'll shout you out in a live stream and send you a handful of limited edition pieces of Chris and Jack artwork for download. And with limited availability, for $500, we'll send you a special prop from one of our past sketches, along with some autographs and a real nice note! Again, we really can't thank you all enough, and this is all icing on the cake. If you don't feel like donating anymore (which we totally understand!) feel free to share the campaign to anyone you think might get a kick out of what we're doing. Thank you thank you thank you!!!! We won't let you down! ----------- Hi there! We�re Chris and Jack! We�ve been dear friends and collaborators for over a decade and for the last three years we�ve been writing/directing/editing and starring in sketches for our Youtube channel. Since we started the channel, our focus has been on delivering high-quality silliness. We love sketch comedy. We love crafting these odd little worlds and dropping you right in. We love playing with genres, drawing inspiration from our shared passion for sci-fi, heist films, and the like. And we love to sneak in some heart where you may not expect it. We set out to become better filmmakers, to try to make each other laugh, and to share that with an audience. And to that end, we�ve been incredibly lucky. We�ve found an unbelievably supportive community online. With a little over ninety thousand subscribers, we know there�s a growing fanbase for what we�re doing�finding those people and interacting with them has been awesome. We love making these things and sharing them with you all and we don�t want it to stop. So we�re reaching out for help to produce a block of 6 new sketches for the channel. We�re really proud that our stuff feels consistently high quality, but that takes a lot of time and a lot of money. When we�re playing with film genres, high production value, or at least the appearance there-of, really helps you buy in quickly so we can get straight to the funny. We like awesome sets, complicated make-up, sweet visual effects, and, most importantly, a fantastic crew. A huge part of how we get a professional feel is that our crews are always full of actual professionals (a director of photography, gaffer, grips, sound, make-up, post, art department, costumes�whatever the sketch calls for.). We�re in LA and our friends are super talented working pros, and while we�re not paying them anywhere near what they usually make, it�s important to us that we honor their hard work and pay them what we can. And so while we stretch every dollar, and use every shortcut and favor, it all adds up. We�ve been lucky enough in the past to get some funding from outside groups, but the bulk of it has been out of pocket, and we just can�t keep it up right now. $25,000 would give us a flexible budget to create at least six sketches. If we can stretch it, we�ll make more. Historically, our average sketch runs us around $3500. There are a lot of costs that are a given for every sketch (equipment rentals, insurance, crew, food), but for everything else we really try to put our money where the sketch needs it most. If we can get away with shooting for free in an apartment, we absolutely will. If instead, we�ve gotta get the perfect warehouse space, great, but then we'll figure out how to make that crazy prop from scratch for ten bucks. Sometimes we�ll sit on a script for a while, waiting until we can figure out how to make it affordably. Like this one: Thanks to the Youtube Space LA, we got the chance to film for free on a set from Alien: Covenant, so we figured out the rest and pulled out True Friendship, a script we weren�t sure we�d ever be able to shoot. Point being, whatever our budget is, we�re gonna find every way we can to get even more production value on your screen. With $25,000, we'll be able to meet all of the built-in costs of shooting these sketches and maintaining our channel, have the ability to spring for some special elements if the idea calls for it, and have some contingency funds to deal with all the unforeseen craziness of filmmaking. We'd jump straight to work and bring the channel back in full force this fall. We're not trying to pay ourselves with this. Whatever money our channel generates right now goes straight back into the sketches. We're doing it because we love making this stuff and sharing it around. And because we get to have days like these: Thanks so much for considering us! -Chris & Jack

animated demo of the flip-book animation The Joker and Backside The Box Hello - and thank you for taking the time to look at my Kickstarter campaign! I'm hoping to fund this lovely deck to be printed in the USA by USPCC in a limited edition (to be finished September or October of 2019). This deck combines my two career tracts, Graphic Design and Animation, by featuring flip-book style animation on both sides. It is visually based on NYC and its art deco style; should this first "clockwork" become popular I would like to make this the beginning of a series based upon other international cities. Do know that the animation on the backside is "event neutral," meaning that one cannot tell what is on the faces of the cards by studying and memorizing the individual backsides of the deck. You're safe from cheaters! This will be printed standard CMYK process, no metallic inks will be used on this deck. A Sample of the Spade Cards The animation on the faces of the deck includes a speedy clock, my logo (which includes a raven landing and taking-off), and in the crescent moving clockwork with letters passing under a magnifying glass - hmmm . . . what words do they spell? Included will be instructions on returning the deck to its original order to view the animation. To see all of the face cards and a demonstration of the animation, you can view the movie above. A Sample of the Diamond Cards A Sample of the Clubs Cards I hope you enjoy owning and using this deck as much as I enjoyed making it; though it has not been my most labor-intensive deck, it has definitely been the most technically challenging. I encourage you to purchase at least two, one for collection and one for usage. I will be using Gambler's Warehouse to distribute the decks. A Sample of the Heart Cards My professional website: http://www.stephenwbrandt.com For Swabbed Decks: http://www.swabbeddecks.com My direct email: swb@stephenwbrandt.com

$1,500 Stretch Goal: Leader Cards These 5 cards will be used to indicate the leader in each category so you can easily see where you stand. Let's see if we can make it to $1,500! About the Game Ever wonder what it would be like to get a divorce? Live that fantasy with Divorce Simulator! Slam the deck down in front of your spouse (or anyone) and tell them you want a divorce, then play the game and see who comes out ahead. In Divorce Simulator, you will take turns splitting possessions (or even relationships with other people) and laying out cards for your opponent to take on their next turn. Bluff by laying some cards face up and some face down, and tempt your opponent into taking the pile you want them to take. Compete for a majority in 5 different categories like Reputation and Possessions in this game of deception, deduction, and dark humor. The player who wins 3 or more categories by grabbing the best set of cards and deceiving their spouse/opponent into choosing poorly will win the game! Check out the full rules here! Geek HQ "If you are looking for a fun easy game to play or take with you when traveling, then you will want to be sure to keep an eye out for the launch of Divorce Simulator." USA - $3 Canada - $7 EU - $7 Australia - $8 Rest of World - $9 Featuring historic Japanese artwork, Martial Art is a card game of factions warring for dominance of feudal Japan. The game takes place over a series of battles in which players must anticipate their opponents' actions, build their hands, and manage their cards to acquire enough land and power to defeat the other clans. As clan leader, command your armies and muster forces to conquer places of economic and cultural significance such as the capital Kyoto or the rising city of Edo. But to secure victory will take more than foot soldiers. Provoke a peasant rebellion, influence the emperor to support your claim, or even distract the enemy commanders with lovely Geisha. Successfully funded on Kickstarter in 2016, Martial Art was awarded the Dice Tower Seal of Approval by Married with Boardgames. We have made it available again here at a reduced cost. Check out the Kickstarter pages for Martial Art and its expansion, Martial Art: Battlefields for more info! Gangster Dice is a game of bidding, bluffing, and of course dice rolling in Prohibition-era New York. Published in October of 2015, we were thrilled to share this game with the world! We still have some copies left so we decided to offer them here. If you enjoy the 1920s gangster theme, rolling dice, or just fun games, check it out on the game's Kickstarter page! Coming soon. Add-ons are listed below. Add the cost to your pledge now, and you'll have a chance to tell us which add-ons you want after the campaign. Note that for Martial Art, the base game only supports 2 players but you can support up to 4 with two decks.
