Rust Hulks is a tabletop roleplaying game about playing space truckers in a low-fidelity science-fiction future. The game is Powered by the Apocalypse, meaning it uses the rules found in Apocalypse World as a foundation, and builds from there. In Rust Hulks, you will play as the crew of a large, derelict spaceship. You will fly around the solar system picking up jobs, earning credits, scraping through hulks, improving your skills, and expanding your ship. On its face, it's simple; in practice, it gets messy fast: You're aboard a flying scrapheap halfway to Mars and three of your fuel canisters blow; the crew, while tentative friends, are mostly here for money�when things go real south, what will you do? If you grit your teeth and drive hard bargains, you'll make it out the other side. Profit, even, if you're lucky. If you can't cut it, well, let's just say there'll be one more hulk out there for the scavengers. The game is, at its core, about going through highly tense and stressful situations as a group, and examining the relationships that form and break because of it. Rust Hulks is like Alien. Or Firefly. Or some parts of Star Wars. Everything is used, rusty, and worn-down. Your ship is cannibalized from a dozen other ships and tweaked or patched with every piece of junk and scrap you can find. It's really less a singular ship than it is a collection of individual rooms, held together with shoestrings and chewing gum. There are no laser blasters, no energy shields, and no gleaming computers. Instead, there are wooden crates, canned rations, and radar scanners. Your computers are little more than fancy calculators, your ship is armored with scrap metal, and your guns spit hot lead. The world is always dirty, usually decrepit, and often desperate. The kind of ship you might fly in Rust Hulks. First, you and your crew get to make a ship together while you make your characters. You elect a Captain, and then you get a job. Jobs vary; simple ones are just hauling cargo or ferrying passengers. More complicated ones might be escorting merchants, running hits on pirates or outlaws, or doing search-and-rescues. Real dangerous jobs will see you pulling heists, smuggling contraband, and assassinating high-profile targets. When you play, you'll be good at some things on the ship, and worse at others. As you complete jobs, you'll earn credit to repair and upgrade your ship, and you'll advance your own skills to learn new abilities and moves. Rust Hulks is a roleplaying game; you sit around a table and describe what you do. The other players and the Master of Ceremonies�what this game calls its Game Master�will do the same. Occasionally, you'll roll some dice. If the roll goes well, you describe what you get to do; if the roll goes badly, the MC will describe what happens to you; if the roll goes midway 'twixt the two, you and the MC will both figure it out, together. It's Powered by the Apocalypse, which means things that involve dice are divvied up into things called Moves. When you make a move, you roll the dice: roll two six-sided dice and add the results together; you'll often add some other modifier to that roll, too. If that total is 10 or higher, things go well; if it's a 6 or lower, things go poorly; if it's a 7, 8, or 9, things end up with a bit of both. That's the entire dice system in a nutshell: everything else is variations on that theme. At its barest bones, Rust Hulks is a game about telling stories, together, out in the hulks. Anything that doesn't add to that in some way has been stripped out. You also get to draw your ship together, and then change it as time goes on! There are lots of roleplaying games about flying around in spaceships. There are even a few games that are also Powered by the Apocalypse that are about flying around in spaceships. Rust Hulks is different, first and foremost, because the scale is much smaller. The game is entirely set in our own solar system, and there aren't any aliens or magic; you don't explore new worlds as much as you skim across the existing ones. Your goal is not to save the galaxy, it's to stay afloat. If anything, the only thing you're saving is the crew�and even that isn't salvation from some alien warlord, it's escape from running out of fuel halfway to Neptune. The scope is smaller, more detailed, more intimate. Rust Hulks is also different because it's a little more intricate, a little more tangled. Your relationships with the other crew members change in more ways than one; you've got relationships with the ship and the individual rooms that make it up; there's a Captain that's somehow supposed to oversee everything as it's happening. Things will get messy between you, the others, and the ship�and quickly. The game is not really about the goal you all set out to achieve; it is on some level, sure, but it's really about how all of you change along the way. Nine different playbooks, with special moves, gear, and options for each: Plus a playbook for the ship, with all of its moves. You can see a sample character playbook and the ship playbook below: Click this image�it links to a PDF! Rules, guidelines, and suggestions for all of the above, plus detailed explanations, examples, and possible ways to twist them around. Some intermediate rules, for governing things like relationships, resources, legality, that sort of thing. Moves, guidelines, and advice for running the game as MC; what you can and can't do, what you should and shouldn't be doing. A list of jobs, rules and moves for each, and how they affect the broader game as a whole. Some brief high-level worldbuilding and history, indices of descriptions for locations and objects, and a quick overview of what you might find on each planet and moon in the solar system. Suggestions, advice, and guidelines for hacking the rules of the game past what's already here, including possible options and modifications for stuff like mechs and landcrawlers. The book itself will probably be about 200 pages, give or take. The book will be printed in a small format (about 6" x 9"), in black and white with a color cover, with some basic art done mostly by me. As stretch goals are reached, the page count will likely increase. (On a related subject, if you're a publisher of tabletop RPGs and this seems like the sort of thing you'd be interested in picking up, I would love to talk to you�contact info's below!) The PDF is just that, a PDF of the game. The hardcover book is, likewise, a hardcover copy of the game. The hardcovers will be printed through DriveThruRPG; PDFs will be distributed via DriveThruRPG and itch.io, as well as potentially others in the future. I've worked with DriveThruRPG before, and as a student, my printing resources are otherwise limited. The Playtest Kits are a bit more involved. A couple times over the course of this year, in August and then again in December or January, I will release playtest versions of the game, which you will get to play. You'll also get access to a Discord server I've set up, where you can give me feedback on the game and I'll do my best to answer questions. (This is also the tier where, if we make it to stretch goals that include digital content, you will receive that digital content for free.) The crew patch is a 2"-3" embroidered iron-on patch, which will feature the image of a derelict spaceship, much like one you might fly in Rust Hulks. It's suitable to put on a jacket, backpack, or wherever else you can iron on such things normally. The dog-tag is a military-style metal dog-tag, which you can customize the text of, about five lines' worth. Once you've chosen your custom message, I will then use chemical shenanigans and my own two hands to artificially rust the tag, so when it comes to you it will already have seen a decade's worth of space-trucking. The oneshot session is a single session of Rust Hulks run by me, Sam. You can pick a handful of friends and we'll get together online (or in person, if you're in the Boston or Rochester areas) and play a session sometime before the game's release. It'll likely run about 3-4 hours, enough for an evening's game. The etched steel brick is exactly what it sounds like. It's a big block of steel etched with a message of your choice, and then once again artificially rusted by me. It makes a fantastic paperweight, building material, or murder weapon. A potential mockup of what the rusty dog tag might look like. A chunk of it is going towards printing costs and getting the orders in for the various rewards. It's also going towards software, like InDesign and Photoshop; towards artists for a few pieces of artwork I'm not confident I can do myself (like the cover); and towards other expenses, such as travel to playtest sessions or materials needed for testing. Mostly, though, it's going towards my rent, so I can work on this instead of having to hunt down some other job. The main goal for the campaign is $5,000, which will get everything listed above. At $7,500, I will have the funding to be able to hire a better artist than me, and so the book will have several much-nicer pieces of artwork throughout, plus fancier cover artwork. At $10,000, a tenth playbook will be added to the game, tentatively called the Machine. It's a robot or other mechanical entity, one with unique abilities governed by highly specific laws. At $12,500, I will have the funding for even more better art. This will include a separate piece for each of the ten (or eleven?) playbooks, some rad diagrams of ships, and more art throughout the book as a whole. At $15,000, an eleventh playbook will be added to the game, likely called the Stranger. It's a weirdo, someone with oddball powers; a psychic, a cyborg, or something far more alien. If the campaign goes beyond $15,000, there will be more stretch goals added. This might be short hacks, more in-depth worldbuilding, or something else entirely. Who knows? Hello! I'm Sam. I'm a student at the Rochester Institute of Technology, where I'm going into my senior year of studying game design, with a focus on roleplaying games. Currently, I'm back on my home turf in the Boston area of Massachusetts, but I'll be back in Rochester come fall. Over the past few years, I've developed some other RPGs and RPG-ish stuff with some success, which you can see on my portfolio. I ran a successful Kickstarter campaign just a few months ago for my cyberpunk zine as a part of ZineQuest (the PDFs of which just shipped, and the zines themselves will ship over the summer). I also run an experimental homebrew Dungeons & Dragons campaign on Twitch; it's on hold for the summer months, but we'll be back in the fall (if you're curious, check out our VoDs). Outside of RPGs, I'm into theater, music, and running giant games of moderated tag. If you've got questions, comments, or just want to talk, feel free to hit me up on Twitter, @HeadOfTheGoat. Thanks!

In Sheep-Boom-Bah, your sheep have wandered into an active minefield. Your goal is to guide them safely back to their barn without accidentally stepping on a land mine. There's one problem...your path is unclear and you must move onto a tile to reveal what is beneath. Is it a barn? Is it a Safe Field tile? Is it a landmine? There's only one way to find out. 4-Player Game Setup In the quest to help the herd find their barn, you must take two actions which will move your sheep throughout the field. In addition, you can use cards dealt to you that have unique abilities such as moving your sheep, stealing another player's sheep and even saving your own sheep. Gain points along the way for discovering safe tiles, diffusing landmines and finding barns. You will also score points at the end of the game for having sheep in your Barn and Barnyard. The player with the highest score wins the game! Artwork / Images not yet finalized This game is colorblind friendly. The tiles, cards and player boards currently have icons to identify the player color. The colored sheep will have a symbol printed on them in the final production run of the game. How To Play Sheep-Boom-Bah: (see video below) Sheep-Boom-Bah takes place over a series of turns. Gameplay moves in clockwise order. On your turn, you must take two (2) actions. In addition, you also have the option to play or discard any number of cards from your hand. Actions and card play can occur in any order. If you play or discard cards, draw back up to four to end your turn. The two types of Actions include: 1.) Move a sheep to a field tile. Flip over that tile and resolve its effect. You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00 In the video above for example, revealing the safe field tile will score that player 1 point. Once a tile is revealed, moving your sheep onto that specific tile again will no longer score points. The image below shows the tiles hidden within the field and how to resolve their effects. 2.) Move a sheep from the barn to the barnyard on your player board. You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00 Cardplay Below are the types of cards that are available in the game Blue background cards are shown above. There are also red, green and yellow variants of each card. The icons on the cards are used to identify each player color. A player can choose whether or not to play cards on their turn. If cards are played, the used cards are placed into a discard pile next to the draw pile. Some important aspects of card play to keep in mind: Players can have a maximum of four cards in their hand during the game. There is no limit to the number of cards you can play on your turn. Players can play certain cards out of turn. Once played you may draw back to four cards. On a players turn, if cards are played or discarded, draw back up to four cards at the end of your turn. END GAME AND SCORING Once a player has removed all of their sheep from the field, the remaining players take one more turn. Then the game is over. Note: If a player�s last sheep is bumped into a barn, out of turn, that player would still have one more turn before the end of the game. The player with the highest score wins the game! In case of a tie, the player with the most sheep in their barn wins. We will hand deliver the games to friends and family backers. Local pickup will be available. We are a board game design & publishing company run by brothers, Bob & Ryan Craig. We aim to deliver high quality, family friendly games that blend strategy and a dash of chance. Last year we were fortunate enough to have our first game, Monster Highway, funded on Kickstarter. In this game, players are trying to escape a nuclear meltdown and a radioactive monster by building roads and driving their car to their home base. The game was manufactured and delivered to our backers on time. We have been happy to receive pictures and emails of the game in play with friends and family. It has even won several awards including: Gameacon's Crystal Award for "Tabletop Game of the Year" and the Inquisitive Meeple's "Hidden Gem" award. We are excited to have our second game, Sheep-Boom-Bah, on Kickstarter now. We have taken everything we learned from Monster Highway and applied it to Sheep-Boom-Bah. You can expect the same high quality in the game components, easy to learn rules and quick game play. The addition of unique game mechanics has made Sheep-Boom-Bah a game that has exceeded our expectations. There are a lot more exciting games scheduled to be released in the near future! WebFPGA is a cloud-based development environment for FPGAs with compatible development boards. Our software toolchain uses a recent browser technology called WebUSB to program the FPGA, without any software required other than a modern web browser (Chrome/Opera/Edge75 supported for now). We also provide a browser-less, command-line solution. We plan to open-source all of our hardware designs. View our cloud IDE here: https://beta.webfpga.io. We're fully compatible with IceStorm/iCECube in offline workflows! Check out the update: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/ryanmjacobs/webfpga-rapid-fpga-development-system/posts/2537234 **Stretch Goal Announced** Scroll down for details! **International Shipping** Send me a direct message or email (ryan@webfpga.io) if your country is not listed in your pledge reward � we have to manually add each country. Cloud Development Environment -- Works on All Operating Systems FPGA Device; 32 GPIOS and 5,280 Logic Cells From the second you receive our board, you will be able to plug it in, synthesize Verilog, and flash it. NO SOFTWARE REQUIRED! Stretch Goal! If we exceed $24,000 in funding, all FPGA Kits will be upgraded! Each kit will receive an additional RGB Neopixel LED Strip and Seven-Segment Display. That's right, each kit will come with two of each! � in addition to the other three companion boards, of course. These modules are chainable, so you can effectively have an 8-digit seven-segment display or a 16-long individually addressable RGB LED strip. If you have already backed WebFPGA, don't feel obligated to increase your pledge. We appreciate every existing contribution. This is just a little extra kick for those interested. Also, consider upgrading from a standalone device to a kit. We have been hard at work polishing our Verilog standard library, which works out of the box for each companion board. Here is a close-up of the chainable IO pins. The inputs are on the left-hand side and additional modules are chained on the right-hand side. "DI" denotes "Data Input" and "DO" denotes "Data Output". (Note, these two modules are not intermixable. Neopixel strips can only be extended with Neopixels strips, and Seven-segment Displays can only be extended with Seven-Segment Displays.) Neopixel RGB LED Strip with Circled Chainable IO Pins Seven-Segment Display with Circled Chainable IO Pins Who are we? This endeavor was conceived and developed by: Mick Jacobs - Hardware Lead (previously an ASIC Manager at Cisco Systems) Ryan Jacobs - Software Lead (student at UCLA, Computer Science & Engineering) What�s an FPGA? (If you�re already familiar with FPGAs and their use cases, you should skip this section.) FPGA is an acronym for �Field Programmable Gate Array�. In essence, the �field programmable� isn�t too relevant other than implying that the whole �gate array� is programmable. The �gate array� is the cool part. Think of the whole chip as an array of logical gates (e.g. AND/OR/etc). These logic gates can be wired up however you may desire. For example, you might decide to write some logic that tints an entire image red. On a CPU, each pixel would need to be tinted one by one. But in digital logic, each pixel can be tinted simultaneously. Microcontollers, CPUs, GPUs, etc. consist of logical gates solidified into an integrated circuit at a silicon foundry. However, with FPGAs, these gates can be reprogrammed on the fly. FPGAs are used to develop specialized, dynamic digital logic systems. If you would like to learn a little bit more about Verilog and FPGAs, checkout this brief introduction we've made: https://youtu.be/VjklURLUXHo. It's aimed at people coming from a software rather than hardware background. We also plan to write a series of easy-to-read blog posts to make learning digital logic as approachable as learning traditional software programming. Read the first one here! https://blog.webfpga.io/2019/03/02/sr-latches/ Motivation Until recently, FPGA development has suffered from a high barrier to entry for newcomers. In the past, development boards using Xilinx, Lattice, and Altera chipsets easily fetched $250-$2000 price tags. The hardware barrier has been all but eliminated by recent entrants, which include MojoBoard (https://alchitry.com/products/mojo-v3), the IceBreaker (https://www.crowdsupply.com/1bitsquared/icebreaker-fpga), and TinyFPGA (https://tinyfpga.com/) who offer sub-$100 kits. However, despite the hardware barrier being dramatically lowered, the required software to develop on these systems is still �hefty�. The Xilinx and Lattice environments easily exceed 30 GB installs. Additionally, due to its nature, synthesis (place & route) is a computationally intense task. Lightweight student laptops (such as Macbook Airs or Chromebooks) cannot adequately supply the necessary raw processing power. Not only this, but most toolchains do not support all operating systems equally. With WebFPGA, educators could teach a classroom of high-school students with nothing more than a Chromebook per kid. In fact, some modern smartphones support WebUSB too! We aim to completely revamp the digital logic development experience. Our cloud-based toolchain performs synthesis on our backend, forwarding the logs and final bitstream to the client for flashing. Local CPU expenditure is zero. WebFPGA is a remote wrapper around these powerful and complex toolchains. Simply feed it your hardware description in Verilog source files and about a minute later it will return a synthesised bitstream, ready for flashing! (VHDL will be supported in the future). Software Backend Our backend is comprised of a network of self-hosted Kubernetes orchestrations. Our nodes are a mix a of self-hosted and remote bare-metal machines. We are selling our hardware to fund the backend. So, all backers will receive a full, lifetime membership to our software. Read our FAQ for more information on our business model, compatible toolchains, and support plan. For our launch, we allow any anonymous user to synthesize Verilog on our website. However, in the future, we will require users to create an account to synthesize code. This protects us and ensures that paying customers will have always have adequate resources. Command-line Support A certain subset of developer culture avoids GUI IDEs like the devil� which is why we provide a separate CLI toolchain. The CLI toolchain integrates flawlessly into the *nix-style workflow (Git, Make, and friends). In the near future, we will have an official release for the toolchain. You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00 Roadmap Our software is currently in a beta state. We will remain in beta for one month after our funding ends. Our boards are fully functional with the beta site, however there are some user features that we still plan on developing. For participating in our beta, you will be rewarded with a full membership to our platform. Our beta roadmap includes: A pristine standard library, including modules for the on-board RGB LED, button debouncing, standard SPI/I2C interfaces, etc. User accounts and file saving A Verilog module community (think NPM, but for Verilog) that allows users to seamlessly share and integrate code Online simulation and waveform viewing Vendor Lock-in Don�t get us wrong, as a software student and a member of the industry, we understand the fear of vendor lock-in. That is not our goal. Please note that our boards are fully functional without our software � the Lattice IDE is free to download and can work independently of our toolchain. (The open-source toolchain IceStorm is also compatible with our chipset.) If we ever decide to end official support, we will open-source our entire backend. All backers of our campaign will receive a lifetime membership to our cloud-based toolchain at no additional cost. Additionally, all components of our hardware stack are user-programmable. We encourage power-users to reprogram our on-board microcontroller and discover interesting use cases. General Specs Device Features 4-IO bridged communication between MCU and FPGA On-board Neopixel RGB LED User button Reset button User Single-Color LED On-board precision clock oscillator FPGA Specs Lattice iCE40UP5k FPGA 39 IOs (32 accessible) 5280 logic cells 1 Mbit SRAM 120 Kbit Block RAM Hardened SPI/I2C macros 10 Khz & 48 MHz internal oscillator On-board PLL & DSP functions Microcontroller Specs STM32F04-Series MCU WebUSB interface Fully user-programmable 48 MHz internal clock 32 KB flash 6 KB RAM UART/SPI/I2C 16 Mbit shared flash We can synthesize logic to produce 8-bit audio for Star Wars utilizing less than 6% of the logic cells in our FPGA! Web Buttons As you might have noticed on our cloud IDE, there are four buttons on the left toolbar labeled "BTN1", "BTN2", etc. These buttons are referred to as input wires "WF_CPU1", "WF_CPU2", etc. because they actually stem from the on-board microcontroller. These are a godsend for debugging. You can simply include them into your top-level module and when you click on the in the IDE, they will respond accordingly. This example simply uses BTN1 to toggle the state of the on-board LED. Example of using a web button to control the state of the on-board LED. Companion Boards In addition to our standalone board, we are selling a kit that comes with 5 compatible companion boards. All of these boards have working example code on our website. The Full Monty: Standalone FPGA Device, RGB Matrix, RGB Neopixel Strip, 7-Segment Display (BLUE), Audio DAC, Switch/Joystick Board 8-LED RGB Neopixel Strip You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00 RGB LED Matrix You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00 Yes... you get both. 7-Segment Display You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00 IO Expander 8 Slide Switches, Directional Joystick, Controllable Bi-Color LEDs Audio DAC This board accepts I2S signals and produces analog audio output. Dungeons and Dragons is full of dashing adventurers and handsome knaves. We see men proudly dressed, robes and cloaks fluttering in the wind. But we rarely see these men�s sensual sides... Strapping Lads book cover Meet the Strapping Lads, an all-male, queer-friendly adventuring guild. Every year, the guild selects twelve of its handsomest members, one from each class, to pose for their fundraiser magazine. Enjoy this roster of sexy adventurers fit for your entertainment, or for adding as NPCs to your campaign. The Strapping Lads Tarak the Tiger (half-orc barbarian) Rhovan (dragonborn bard) Djoser (human cleric) Farid (fire genasi druid) Ehecatl (human fighter) Durgan (dwarf monk) Cedric (aasimar paladin) Khunoth (goliath ranger) Zerrakas (tiefling rogue) Regulus (human sorcerer) Conalt (half-elf warlock) Antorvir (drow wizard) Zerrakas (tiefling rogue), Ehecatl (human fighter), and Antorvir (drow wizard) What it is The Strapping Lads book is a full-color 28-page supplement for Dungeons & Dragons 5th Edition. It features twelve male characters, one of each class from the 5e Player�s Handbook. Each character�s spread contains a saucy pin-up, a condensed statblock, and an interview profile. More than simply eye candy, the Strapping Lads are characters you can include in your own game as either a player or a DM! I draw the portrait digitally and use sublimation to press the ink into the cloth. Dice bags are water resistant, but should not be run in the dryer. Doing so may cause the ink to fade. Sample dice bags - Final product may look different You�ll receive: One (1) digital character headshot One (1) dice bag with your character�s headshot To save on shipping costs, your Strapping Lads book will be shipped with the dice bag. This may delay your shipment approximately 1-2 months. Custom Character Commissions (Limited Quantity) At this tier, you�ll receive a print copy of the book AND I�ll draw you a full-color, full-body picture of one D&D character with no background. This can be your character or you can do it as a gift for your friend or favorite player! This portrait can be as safe or as saucy as you would like (18+ art is acceptable). The commission itself is a digital-only reward. You will NOT receive a print along with your print Strapping Lads book. If we reach $1,000, I'll add an Artificer character as a digital bonus feature! At $1,250, I'll add a Mystic! And if we hit $1,500, I'll add a Gunslinger. Since I have most of the pre-Stretch copy ready, I'll include these three characters as a digital-only supplement. This way I can get you the books in the promised time frame. However! If we reach $2,000 I'll include the bonus classes in the print edition as well! About the Creator Hello! I'm Micah, a Virginia-based illustrator and cartoonist with a love of tabletop gaming, mythology, comics, and pin-up art. I�ve felt like there is a need for more saucy male art in tabletop gaming, so I created the Strapping Lads supplement to satisfy that need. If you enjoy my work, you can find more on Patreon, Twitter, deviantART, and Instagram! I also create the online comic, the Sparrow, a mythology-meets-superheroes story where all the characters are based on myth and folklore from around the world!

Support the creation of the first Periodic Table Card Game boasting artwork from international virtuosos, and receive Kickstarter exclusive rewards including Standard Card Decks, Extension Decks, Game Pendants, Art Prints, Original Sketches, full-scale Murals, and much more! The GOAL has been Reached - $25K Stretch Goal Initialized for Extension Set: HEAVY METALS THE GUEST ARTISTS We hand picked the CRUNCHIEST line-up of Street Artists and Visionary Artists from around the globe to assist in manifesting the Elements, with each artist developing and transforming their Universal building block into a visual portal that tells the story of the Element! We spent over a year developing the "Royal Pack", which contains 34 Element designs and scientific information pertinent to each. This information is presented in simple icon format, describing the properties of each Element. The Royal Pack is a large, Tarot Sized Card Deck (7 x 12 cm / 2.75 x 4.75"), printed on Premium Quality Paper (350gsm) with rounded edges and a Smooth Finish. But we have more Elements to include and with your assistance we can complete all 118 Element designs, pursue more amazing artists, and assign more Elements to our core Guest Artists! atommix :: Royal deck featuring "Action Cards" THE GAME atommix :: is a Card Game visually portraying the 118 Elements of the Periodic Table, allowing Players to experience true chemistry through visual storytelling! Our primary goal for the game is to make the Periodic Table approachable for children as well as adults, while exploring a creative way to educate ourselves and the next generation. The 42 Card Royal Pack, including 34 Elements and 6 action cards, comes neatly packaged in a hardcover "Boom Box", nestled alongside the Complete Rule Book, allowing Backers access to the most abundant Elements. Download (WIP) Rulebook for atommix :: Help Construct the Game Download Rulebook in Hebrew LEVEL 1 is the simplest, where the goal is to experience the Elements by Family. An Element family is a set of Elements sharing common properties. This is a useful way of looking at the Periodic Table with a fresh point of view, and it helps us remember the Elements and their families the more we play! It is a very quick game, between five to ten minutes, so it is perfect for a short coffee break, or as an activity with children. We also have fun shouting out the names of each Element we discard as we play. You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00 LEVEL 2 adds some spice to the game. This time we are experimenting with Energy Levels. Electrons in an atom are contained in specific Energy Levels (1-7). The larger the number of the Energy Level, the more energy and mass it contains. In the "classic" Periodic Table each row of the table represents an Energy Level. LEVEL 2 makes it easy to grasp the order of Elements from lightest to the heaviest, in a playful manor. We also introduce our 3 ACTION CARDS, which add strategy and surprise to the game! You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00 LEVEL 3 is a whole different ballgame, well Card Game. This Level is a fun way to explore the properties of each Element, or as we like to call them "Special Effects". By comparing the Special Effects we can find similarities between the Elements and see the correlation between the Families (the colors). The Winner is the first to score 10 Points by matching Special Effects with another. In your turn you can either gain points or disrupt and block your Opponent from gaining points. The Action Cards in this level enhance the battle between the players in reaching the Top Score. You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00 Level 4 is for advanced gamers and withholds the key to unlocking all of the properties of the Elements, including: Special Effect, Energy Levels and Families into one game. By being the best Card Collector and Bidder you can WIN the highest score to rule the Microworld! Battle for your chance to be Player 1 and unlock the Elements of your choice. The first to collect 6 cards in his scoring zone ends the game. But you might be surprised who will be the actual winner. You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00 Download Print & Play Prototype of atommix :: Royal Pack Eddition (contains watermark) Together we can UNLOCK Level 5, and here is how: Download the "Rulebook" and "Print & Play" Version of atommix :: (buttons above) Play Levels 1 - 4 with your Extra Crunchy Friends Develop either a "Solo Version" or "Multiplayer Version" Concept Message your Level 5 Concept to us Best Level 5 Concept WINS three Limited Edition Extra Crunchy Art Prints Limited Edition, Extra Crunchy Art Prints for Best Level 5 Concept Stretch Goals & Rewards If we successfully surpass the $20K goal we will institute Stretch Goals to unlock atommix :: extension packs. For every additional $5K of funding a new set of Elements will be UNLOCKED as follows: $25K unlocks the Heavy Metals / $30K unlocks the Crystals / $35K unlocks Radioactive. Pledge early to receive special "Early Bird" Backer discounts and assist in unlocking all 118 Elements, plus all FIVE LEVELS of Game Play, with each level adding complexity and strategy to the game! Sermob is a Mexico based artist using tight lifework in his murals and compositions to convey a deep message concerning the unity of all things living, and the profound connection between cause and effect. Emily Ding is a Texas based artist with tenacious ambition and relentless drive, whose devotion to the visual arts exhibits itself in artwork bearing messages related to caring for all creatures, and a focus on movement and flow which she describes as �visceral�. Dionne Ong is a Vancouver based artist with a focus on transforming strange animals into graphical line flow, and artwork that tells stories of enchanting, haunted forests, moonlight critters and other oddities. Why a Card Game? Most of us have long ago discarded the Periodic Table from memory, but in order for it to genuinely stick we have combined the Elemental properties with visual language, which is immediately interpreted by the brain. Our brains are far more engaged by storytelling than just plain text, so by placing powerful and beautiful images next to words our brains create an immediate connection between the two - just like in advertising - the same manipulation can be used for a better purpose! atommix :: Card Game Prototype Who is EXTRA CRUNCHY? We are a duo of street artists otherwise known as Extra Crunchy. In the past three years we have traveled around the world painting murals and spreading good vibes. Last year a unique concept dawned upon us, one that would allow us to learn more about the building blocks of our reality - the atoms from which we and everything around us are made, and this path led to the creation of atommix :: mural in Denver, Colorado, 2017 We enjoy exploring many fields, but street murals are a favorite because they are out where people can see them, the scale is fun, and it is a great way to share positive messages through art. mural of Argon in Kharagpur, India, 2019 We decided to use our mural making skills to promote atommix :: and had the pleasure of traveling to three technology institute events across India, each giving us the opportunity to paint live Element murals and share the concept of the Game. mural of Neon in Chennai, India, 2019 As creative explorers we also love finding new sources of inspiration and sharing them. This project is a great opportunity to get exposed to art that speaks a language higher than words! Use the links below to find us in a variety of locations, and to share us with others! Guest Artist Inspiration More Games Please Interview "Today I'm being joined by Rafi and Tutti creators of the card game 'atommix'. Thanks for joining me! Before we find out about the game itself could you tell our readers a bit about yourselves and what you do?" To read the Interview click the image Article in Fourtato Games Click to read more Instagram Review @DateNightDice "The first thing we noticed is the incredible art on the cards. Sometimes unusual, sometimes beautiful, but always interesting to look at. This game plays in different levels. You can up the level to add a little more, or step it down to have an easy 'beer and pretzel' sort of game...Overall I'm excited to see where this game goes and what they add next to the game play." Special thanks and credits to: Mike Correll, Joy Correll, Nir Netzer, Lubomir Arsov, N3o, Hobbes Escrew, Deih, Sermob, Dragon76, Otis Chamberlain, Emily Ding, I AM EELCO, THOTH, AJ Davis, Date Night Dice, Peacelovegames, The_gamer_babe, Boardgeekgirl, Ross Connell Nyssa Skorji, Gau Nunez,Christopher James Boux, Raiska Verbickaya, Luc Emc, Isabel Martha, Orlando Guier, Aviram Zadok, Rani Byron, Ooma, Franimani, Ricardo Arevalo, Raquel Orozco

This book has been a long time in the making. I am so honored and excited to share these original prose and art with you all. I have always loved to write, and truth be told, the style of creating artwork that includes word, color, and images came about towards the end of my time in Art School in Chicago about 20 years ago. It was my way of putting my writing out there, without having to feel center stage. The words were not in clean, legible black and white print, so I could hide them in the scribble. Additionally, I loved the aesthetic of handwriting, which was so important to me with the loss of handwriting in today's world. My feeling was always: read the words, look at the words, or enjoy the words, and the pretty picture. There are no rules. This book is my opportunity to tell the truth, because that's all I've ever wanted to do. The truth is not easy, and usually scary- but as Elizabeth Gilbert's dear friend Ryya Elias always said "The truth has legs." It will be the last one in the room standing, so why don't we just cut to the chase, and begin there. Thank you and much Love you all. https://thejulietteletters.wordpress.com/

This was the Kickstarter for Thunderstone Quest: Back to the Dungeon! Our thanks to all the Backers who supported us in this Quest! A link to the Pledge Manager for Late Pledges will be coming soon! If you have any questions or comments please email kickstarter@alderac.com. Thunderstone designed by Mike Elliott is a deckbuilding game of heroic adventure. We successfully Kickstarted Thunderstone Quest in the spring of 2017 and delivered it in the spring of 2018. In the spring of 2018 we Kickstarted To The Barricades!, adding solo and CoOp play and two additional Quests, which were delivered in the spring of 2019. New Horizons After the climactic battle in Quest 4: At the Foundations of the World, the Champions are dispersed by the forces of wild magic. One awakens in a far realm of endless sands. Another discovers himself in a strange new city where he may learn the fate of his people. The world of Thunderstone Quest is even larger than we could ever imagine. It's time to explore these New Horizons. Back the campaign TODAY to begin or continue your Thunderstone Quest adventure! Due to the overwhelming support of the community, the $400,000 Stretch Goal has been Achieved! We will add the 4th Level Heroes Add-on to all New Horizons Rewards (and Rewards that include New Horizons)! Congratulations to everyone who helped rally the community to reach this HUGE goal! Because of Kickstarter's rules, we cannot change the description of the Rewards to note that the 4th Level Heroes have been added. All Quests including Vengeful Sands and Clockwork Destiny can be played in either Barricades Mode or Competitive Mode. This campaign also includes a special promo pack for Barricades Mode: Ezuzrius' Lair (estimated MSRP $9.99) included in the New Horizons Reward (and all Rewards that contain the New Horizons reward)! Ezuzrius' Lair is a Kickstarter Early Access release, meaning that Kickstarter backers will get this promotional pack before it is available for sale. At this time we do not have a planned retail release for this item. You have four options to back this Kickstarter - New Horizons which consists of just the new content in this campaign, Champion which consists of the Champion Reward from the 1st Kickstarter, Champion + Barricades + New Horizons which combines all three Kickstarter Rewards into one Reward, and Your Inventory is Full! which includes everything we make for Thunderstone Quest. Your Inventory is Full! (If you have a Thunderstone Quest base game (Retail, Adventurer or Champion) and did not back To the Barricades, you will be able to add it as an Add-on in the Pledge Manager with your New Horizons pledge.) We are also offering a limited quantity of Expedited Rewards. Because of the long lead time for production of the new content in this Kickstarter we will not be able to deliver the new content until next year. But we have set aside a limited quantity of Champion and Barricades components so that we can swiftly manufacture enough units for delivery this November! New Horizons and Add-ons to Expedited orders will ship next year with the rest of the Rewards. Note for Expedited Backers: After the campaign ends, you can not drop your Expedited Pledge, switch to Your Inventory Is Full! and still get your Expedited components. If you have an Expedited Reward, don't change it. In the Pledge Manager there will be a special Add-on option just for you that will allow you to get all the contents of Your Inventory is Full! at the same price as the Reward listed in this Kickstarter, and keep your Expedited Status. If you drop your Expedited Reward, we can't re-instate it. So don't drop it unless you really, really don't want your shipment Expedited. This campaign also includes a special Add-on: 4th Level Heroes! The 4th Level Heroes bring more power and abilities to the game. Note to all Backers: The Champion/To the Barricades! boxes contain space to hold these two new Quests and they will be shipped without the individual boxes shown in the graphics for this campaign. If you would like to order the boxes for these Quests they'll be available for a small fee as Add-ons in the Pledge Manager. Note to Non-English Speakers: All the contents of this campaign are in English only. AEG is working with a team of international partners on future campaigns for non-English language support which we'll be announcing later in 2019. Benefits to this Campaign: You will get the product at a discount to the suggested retail price ($39.99 x 2 Quests + an estimated $9.99 for Ezuzuris' Lair) You'll get the New Horizons content before the normal retail release You'll get the Ezuzrius' Lair Promo Pack You'll get the 4th Level Heroes Add-on If your order includes the Champion Reward you will receive Kickstarter Exclusive Content If your order includes the Champion Reward and/or the To the Barricades Reward you'll get the large boxes & storage system with those Rewards Qualified Brick & Mortar Retail Stores please see the Kick It Here section below for details on the Kick It Here Reward. Vengeful Sands Previews We are pleased to showcase some of the cards from Quest 8: Vengeful Sands here on the Kickstarter Campaign page. You can see all of these previews as blog entries at alderac.com! Scarabs (1 of 3) Click this image to download the Rulebook (26MB PDF) Click this link to download the Questbook (33MB PDF) Click here to download the Barricades Mode Rulebook & Questbook Thunderstone Quest is a deckbuilding game where 2-4 players (or 1-6 players in Barricades Mode) compete to see who can score the most victory points when the game ends. In deckbuilding games your objective is to try to assemble the best possible deck to achieve the play strategy you prefer based on the options that are assembled for each game, and the random challenges you'll need to overcome. Each player's deck represents a party of stalwart adventurers who will face and defeat the challenges of the Dungeon and will return to the Village to recover and re-equip. On each turn you use your deck to generate a hand of cards, and you take actions based on the cards you drew. Sometimes you'll be in the Village buying new cards and using your resources. Sometimes you'll be in the Dungeon fighting monsters. And sometimes you'll do a little bit of both! In Thunderstone Quest you'll be playing an adventure which is comprised of a set of Dungeon tiles and a selection of monsters, treasures, and challenges that are themed to that Dungeon. You'll get the sense of a dramatic campaign as you grow stronger and finally confront the Guardian. Depending on which cards you buy and which adversaries you defeat you will earn victory points. After the Guardian encounter is over, the player with the most victory points is the winner! The competitive mode is designed for 2 to 4 people (up to 6 people with To The Barricades content!) to play and it takes about 90 minutes to complete an Adventure. Barricades mode is designed for 1 to 6 people to play and will also take about 90 minutes to complete an Adventure. You can add funds to your pledge as described in the graphic above which will be automatically credited to your account in the Pledge Manager. Or, you can wait until the Pledge Manager opens and purchase Add-ons directly, paying the balance due on your order in the Pledge Manager instead. There is no difference in price or availability. Altering your pledge on Kickstarter is convenient and it helps us grow the total amount pledged which has a positive effect for attracting more Backers. To the Barricades (not shown) You will be able to order To the Barricades in the Pledge Manager as an Add-on. It will be priced at $50 + Shipping & Handling (approximately $15 for US backers). It will be identical to the previous Kickstarter Reward and will have all stretch goals in that Reward. We won't be able to ship them Expedited unless they're included in an Expedited Reward. Epic Thunderstone Support for Champion: This is a special set of over 200 cards that supports Epic-style play of Thunderstone Quest for the Champion Rewards. The Champion Reward does not include an extra copy of every card for Epic Thunderstone use. Epic Thunderstone is a popular way to play invented by players of Classic Thunderstone. In Epic Thunderstone you build a Village and a Dungeon draw pile using one of each of all your cards instead of playing with a pre-selected tableau. It's a way to see and use more of your card collection. Every game will be different. Rules for Epic Thunderstone are included in the main rulebook. You can read those rules in the Rulebook link above! The purpose of this Add-On is purely convenience. There is no content in the Epic Add-On that isn't already in the Champion Reward. All the content in To The Barricades! and all new content for New Horizons in this campaign will be Epic-compatible and will have Epic support automatically included. Neoprene Playmat This is one of the most requested upgrades from the community and we're proud to announce that we'll be able to make Neoprene Playmats available as a part of this Kickstarter! And the reverse is the "night" side with spaces for the Barricades board overlays, showing the Village partially destroyed. The "night" side is intentionally darker than the day side to reflect the perilous condition of the Village! The Playmat will be sized so that it can fit within either the Champion or the To The Barricades box, box, rolled up. The length is 300 mm. The Sleeves are 66x91mm, 0.09mm thick (0.09mm = 90� (or "microns" = 3.54 "mils")) and will fit Thunderstone Quest cards and cards that are the same size as Magic: The Gathering cards. We are providing them in packs of 500 Sleeves for $15 per pack. You can order as many packs as you wish. You can store all 9 Quests, starting cards, Kickstarter exclusive cards, and Epic support cards, sleeved, in the Champion and To the Barricades boxes. Space is also available for the rolled up playmat and all other game components. Chickenshit is a drinking card game where players do challenges for points with the help of complete strangers. This game is different from most card games in that it's designed to be played at bars, clubs, house parties, bachelor and bachelorette parties, underground bare-knuckle boxing matches... anywhere you're bold enough to play. It revolutionizes the experience of being out drinking with friends, and most people who play it say it's literally the most fun they've ever had going out. Chickenshit has extreme replayability because the environment, as well as the people involved, are always changing. You don't even have to drink to play, we just prefer to drink while playing, well... any game. You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00 Players take turns drawing cards and completing the challenges on them within the time limit for points. Cards can range from anything like, "Get a stranger to twerk," to "Propose to someone and get them to say yes." You can only ask people you don't know, and each player can only go up to the same person once. Each card is worth a different amount of points based on how hard the challenge is to complete. If you complete a challenge, you get to keep the card, and the player with the most points after the last card has been drawn wins! Try out different game modes like Blitzkrieg where you rush against your friends to get as many challenges done as possible, or Legendary Mode where you have to keep the fact that you're playing a secret. You and your friends can even just take turns drawing challenge cards at your own pace, or root bystanders on to draw a card and try to complete a challenge themselves. We realized that many people find going out to sit at a bar, club or lounge a rather boring experience, and even those that do enjoy going out are often looking for new ways to have fun and be social. We also noticed that there really aren't that many great drinking games that can be played out in places where people intentionally go to drink and socialize, which seemed ridiculous. The Chickenshit game cards are pretty tame and lighthearted in nature. They're designed for everyone (even your grandma) to enjoy. Initially, we created the game just for ourselves and our friends in order to make going out way more fun, but every night, tons of people we'd encounter while playing would come back up to us and ask if they could join our game. And thus, Chickenshit was born.

FROM THE CREATOR OF WILD WOODY'S COMES THE "HALLORAN HOUSE� **LATE 2019** The Halloran House is a traditional Irish pub in honor of my family�s history, and the turn of the century Irish mafia that once congregated at the Halloran House Hotel. It will be rich with history at every turn. The pub will feature all of the classic characteristics of a traditional Irish pub. Dark woods, rich leathers, and staff dressed in the traditional Irish garb of yesteryear. There is no detail we aren't covering. We spent several years developing our food & drink menu with the healthy irishman in mind. Our menu will be different. Cheese's imported from Ireland. Craft cocktails. We are even working with an irish specialty company (in business since the 1800's) just to make sure we have real-deal authentic products. PLUS all the shenanigans you have come to expect from Sadie & her staff. So why am I here.... With this project i want to go a little beyond what people have come to expect from the Clarksville scene. I don't want to open just another corner bar. Our current budget for the project doesn�t account for all the really cool extra stuff that we want to add, so we want to raise just a little bit more capital. Go big or go home right? When you make a pledge & choose a reward, you don't pay for it until the project is fully funded. The more we raise, the better this place will be! Thanks. See you soon at the Halloran House!!! I started teaching private in-home piano and guitar lessons seven years ago, driving all over Brooklyn from Greenpoint to Ditmas six days a week. Together with the kids and their parents we've built a strong musical family, which we've celebrated at an annual recital each June. I am thrilled to have the opportunity to take a big next step toward growing and strengthening this community. This September I will be opening Echo City Music Lab in Clinton Hill, a music school and performance space designed to serve these talented young musicians. Here are a few of the things I am excited to offer that were not possible as a roving music instructor: Group Lessons Many educators now consider group lesson formats to be the ideal way for beginner musicians to develop their skills. Here are a few of the benefits of group lessons that are difficult to recreate in a private lesson setting: Students learn not only from their teacher, but from their peers as well. Healthy competition and the desire to keep up with peers motivates practice. Playing together in an ensemble helps students develop critical listening and rhythmic skills. Students gain experience performing in front of their classmates which translates to confidence in larger performances. Group activities and games sustain attention and create a fun environment in which to learn musical concepts. Providing group lessons will make it feasible for me to offer scholarships to students who need them. Gig Nights Individuals who go on to become skilled public speakers and performance artists are often the ones who got their start performing in their community at a young age. With monthly "Gig Nights," students can hone their confidence in a safe and supportive space. These shows will be headlined by local musicians and bands to help inspire this new generation of creators and performers. Workshops and Summer Intensives This space opens up endless possibilities for workshops taught by guest musicians on a broad range of topics from technology to vocal technique to music history. Echo City will eventually host a recording studio to give students hands-on experience with the magic of record making. The money you help raise will be used for: 6 digital pianos and 3 iPads for the group lesson program An upright piano for private lessons Microphones and a PA system for performances Headphones, music stands and chairs A few small construction projects We have some incredible rewards, many generously donated by friends of Echo City: Pledge $10 or more Thank you so much for helping make Echo City a reality! Your name will be listed on the "Supporters" page of our website. Pledge $35 or more Echo City Tote Bag. Carry your books, tools, or vegetables in style! The design will be announced in early July. Pledge $45 or more ArtShack "Staircase Vase." Beautiful and funky ceramic "Staircase Vase" created at ArtShack http://www.artshackbrooklyn.org/ Pledge $75 or more Tote Bag With Surprise Cassette and Vinyl. You get the Echo City tote bag, but this one is filled with at least one cassette and one vinyl from friends of Echo City (at least two different artists). A hand picked surprise! Pledge $80 or more Birthday Party Singalong. Isaac Gillespie has entertained children as a music enrichment teacher at dozens of preschools all over New York as well as at the Children's Museum of the Arts since 2011. He will bring a custom twenty minute music class to your child's birthday party with sing-along and ukulele. (Limited to NYC). Pledge $90 or more Guitar Set-up. Luthier Ethan Bassford will bring out the full potential of your guitar, bass, or other non-viol stringed instrument. Setup includes adjusting action, intonation, fret cleaning and polishing, nut height, and sundry tweaks to improve sound and playability according to your preferences. (Limited to NYC). Pledge $100 or more Intro to Ableton and Electronic Music. Get a 45-minute lesson from synth wizard Noah Prebish. (Limited to NYC). Pledge $110 or more Alexander Technique Lesson You�ll build awareness by getting to know how you�re thinking and moving. You�ll learn ideas that allow you to experience any activity with less effort and tension while finding more ease, flow, and optimal balance--great for musicians! (Limited to NYC). www.alicemac.com Pledge $125 or more Piano Tuning. Get your home piano tuned up and sounding great! (Limited to NYC). http://littleearpianorepair.com/ Pledge $150 or more Gig Night Seasons Pass. You'll get free entry to all of our monthly "Gig Nights" for the entire 2019-2020 school year! Pledge $300 or more Professional Studio Time. You get 3 hours of studio time assisted by an in-house engineer at Pinch Recording, a state-of-the-art recording studio in Long Island City, Queens. https://pinchrecording.com/ Pledge $500 or more Name A Piano. You get to name one of the 6 full-size digital pianos used for the group lesson program! A plaque with the name will be displayed on the side of the keyboard, and we will refer to it as such in the classes. Music in video: "Tempelhof" by Nate Terepka

One December day in 2016, two songbirds, Camille Rose and Ashley Elizabeth, flew in to each other�s paths in the Pacific Northwest. As winter faded and their love bloomed, the folk-pop of Complimentary Colors was born. Complimentary Colors dances through a rainbow of emotions with childlike joy as they play small, often unusual instruments behind their lush harmonies. Touted as "the lovechild of Amanda Palmer, Stevie Nicks, and Brandi Carlile", hear them explore their alt-folk and country roots together, adding touches of the theatrical, while they steal your heart with their catchy, heartfelt tunes and the love that they share. Here we are, almost 2 full years after we formed this band, and we had a crazy idea. Since we know SO MANY talented people, we would just pull them together, rehearse a couple of times, and record a live album with a much bigger sound than our traditional acoustic duo. The result is a celebration of sound and friendship, a project that became a supernova outside of anything we ever dreamed of. We even got our dear friend Simran Narmis (SlowCamera Paparazzi) to paint us live! Featuring Morgan Laubach and Daniel Joseph of Ghost Town Cinema, Elle Archer of Shaylee, Hannah DiMo, Damian Hayes, Kyle Neidig, and Laura May Sowards, this recording is one of a kind, a snapshot of a moment suspended forever... And we need your help to bring it to life! We're in the process of mixing the album now with its release slated for July 21. Your donations will help pay the talented folks mixing the album, editing videos (shoutout to Caitlin Indermaur for the Kickstarter video!), and handling other production tasks. Following our epic backyard release party, we'll be hitting the road for the first leg of tour to Montana and back, followed by shows in Seattle and a couple of other Oregon towns. Then we'll catch our breath until September when we head to California (San Francisco, Sacramento, Chico, and more TBA) and southern Oregon. If we exceed our goal, we'll start planning to extend our tour reach even farther... but one thing at a time. As part of funding our tour, a big chunk (about $1000) of funds raised will be going toward outfitting us with a PA, a recording interface, and some new instrument cables. If we exceed our goal, we will be purchasing microphones, stands, and other essentials to make our array of tiny instruments sound the best that they can. Ultimately, with all of this gear we intend to start a podcast, begin producing our own music as we travel, and spread the love as far and wide as we possibly can. We've created some really fun rewards. That said, if there is something you'd absolutely love as a reward that you don't see listed, talk to us! We may be willing to discuss! If you have any questions, comments, or concerns (including those related to distance for reward delivery), please reach out to us at info@complimentarycolorsmusic.com. Thank you in advance for your support, and please remember to share this campaign far and wide. We are all the media! We can't do it without you! With all our love, Camille Rose and Ashley Elizabeth Complimentary Colors

THE PROBLEM Take a look around you in 2019, turn on your television or hop on the internet, and you might experience the overwhelming feeling that our society is doomed. Things just ain�t what they used to be. In the world of basketball, you got kids doing stupid dribbling tricks (read: traveling) for the �Gram, high schoolers more interested in their HUDL highlight reels than winning conference championships, and media outlets like ESPN celebrating alley-oop dunks while flawless defensive closeouts go unreported. This assault on the fundamental way of life has moved beyond the actual basketball court and into our daily lives. There is no greater example of this disastrous mission creep than in the world of water bottles. You don�t even have to leave Kickstarter to find a hundred projects claiming to have invented the �water bottle of the future.� But that�s an oxymoron. The water bottle was fine the way it was. Why isn't anyone focused on doing a few things great instead of a million things okay? Let�s face facts: there�s no $60+ price tag, no amount of Bluetooth connectivity, no new age way of folding up a water bottle� that will ever be a substitute for courage. If you think possession of the latest and greatest water bottle is the one thing missing from your life � the thing that will finally solve all your problems � snap out of it, son. THE SOLUTION The only way evil endures is if good men stand around and do nothing. And we�re not problem people � we�re solutions people. So we got to work reinventing the water bottle� back to the way it used to be. We hit the lab, cut down dozens of trees in our wanton use of sketch paper, and tinkered away into the wee hours of the morning attempting to configure a water bottle that consisted only of the elemental features that made it great� and none of those excessive features used to cloak cowardice and separate Americans from their hard-earned money. The result: The Men�s League Water Bottle, the greatest water vessel ever invented. By eliminating the superfluous features of most modern water bottles, and focusing on essentialism, we were able to create what we believe is the perfect water bottle. Every feature in our bottle is of our highest standards: An easy-flow push cap that eliminates unwanted water leakage A grooved grip made in the image of a basketball net An additional level of high-grade adhesive tape meant to block out freezing temperature transfer (that can survive dozens of wash cycles without issue!) The Goldilocks of water containment- 24 ounces - not too much, not too little. If simplicity is the height of sophistication, then our deconstructed, fundamental water bottle has a PhD from Harvard, an annual subscription to the New Yorker, and a love for fine Bordeaux wines. Except � that�s how losers define sophistication. In our world, sophistication equals flawless bounce passes, proper lane fills, and box outs that are so sublime the ball hits the ground and eventually rolls to a stop. If you�re the kind of guy that understands you shouldn�t get credit for simply doing your damn job, then finally, you�ve found a bottle that matches your disposition. This is a water bottle for the man you ought to be, a water bottle for the self-actualized you that no longer needs an alarm because you wake up at 4:30 on your own, fired up about life and another opportunity to get better. This is a water bottle for the men who know the glory is the grind. WHO WE ARE This all started with an ordinary man, called into extraordinary circumstances, by the dissolution of fundamental basketball. As the world crumbled around him, one average Men�s League veteran realized that somewhere along the way, we�d let the Look-at-Me Ballers of the world take over every gym in America. Threes were being heaved with reckless abandon. Neon shoes were everywhere. Youngsters were more concerned with Nutmegging their defender for �the �Gram,� than sliding in on help-side defense for a crucial charge. With no one else willing to take a stand, this Men�s League Guy took to the streets, preaching the Good News of the Fundamental Gospel. A movement was born. His ministry struck a nerve, and what started as a Twitter account meant to vent frustrations, soon became something much bigger. Men�s League Guy, the Commissioner of Men�s League and in turn this movement, knew his aims had to be higher. So he set out to create the greatest gym water bottle ever invented. The Commissioner has begun building out a team of highly competent individuals to help him make this water bottle a reality. These team members are experts in their field, and 100% committed to spreading the Fundamental Gospel from sea to shining sea. Mastering the water bottle is our first project as a team. WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP Project Water Bottle (the codename for this project) began in earnest in March 2019. We spent the last three months working with our manufacturing partners to finalize a working prototype. This is the bottle you see in our video and photos, a water bottle we're proud to say meets our standards and vision. But it's still a prototype. That's why we've launched this Kickstarter, because there's still work to be done. Perfectly manufactured water bottles are not just conjured out of thin air, folks. There�s a lot of research and development that goes into this, and we�re at a crossroads as a company right now. We need $261 to create that final strip of runway to get our water bottle to the mass market. Specifically, your financial investment will allow us to: Make final development adjustments to our water bottle There's currently a chasm between our prototype design cost and our planned cost-per-unit production model. We need your financial help to finalize the design of our bottle without sacrificing any of the quality that makes our prototype best-in-class. That entails... Securing the necessary inventory to sell our product to the masses on August 1 There's obvious cost savings when producing mass quantities. This Kickstarter will allow us to precisely place our first inventory order, giving us the confidence through early bird orders to manufacture, package, and deliver our first run in an efficient manner. Paying designers to help us develop industry-leading brand packaging This is our first product, and we want do this right. We're not just sending water bottles in empty boxes. We need to pay graphic designers to help us create a brand identity in our packaging of each water bottle. This also involves working with a packaging manufacturer to mass produce packaging for our influx of inventory. We need your capital to help ensure we produce our packaging at a competitive, cost-effective price. Build out the e-commerce infrastructure on our website to turn our company from a content site to a fully-functional shopping platform Right now the Men's League website is content-based, but for it to become the exclusive home of Men's League water bottles, we need to revamp our site to make it an e-commerce platform. This involves time, energy, and capital to make sure we do it the right way. Acquire the marketing budget to spread the Good News of our water bottle far and wide Simply producing the world's best minimalist workout water bottle means nothing if no one knows it exists. That's why we plan to use a portion of our Kickstarter raise to fund social media marketing around the water bottle's launch on August 1. This is vital to ensuring a positive rollout and setting our Men's League water bottle up to not just be a fad, but an enduring competitor in this space. STRETCH GOALS Look, the $261 fundraising goal is our bare minimum, keep-the-lights on goal. In basketball parlance, it�s the equivalent of being up on the scoreboard at the end of the game. Sure, winning is the goal, but the true goal goes well beyond that. There�s a way to be a loser in victory. If this project hits its goal, we still need your support. Don�t take that as a sign that help is no longer needed. Winning is the bare minimum. What we�re aiming to do is ignite a spark-plug that sends the Men�s League Water Bottle atmospheric. We don�t want to put exact numbers on our stretch goals, because we find that often humans constrain themselves to the limits that are placed on them. But we will say four and five figures are just the beginning of our vision. Right now, we are only planning to produce the water bottle in white and black. But if we exceed our goal, we will immediately dive in to development on the following: Production of the water bottle in at least (3) more body SKUs: black, navy, red Production of the easy-flow push cap in at least (3) more SKUs: white, navy, red Design of a "Floor General" version, which will sell for $14.99, but offer a higher tier of material quality than our original model Production of two new sizing options LET'S GET TO WORK Look, sometime in the last ten years, the water bottle industry went mad. Everyone tried to out-innovate one another, and they took their eyes of the ball: you need a competitively priced water bottle - with all of the essentials - that will outlast your knees, whenever they shall fail. And damn it if we're not gonna give it to you. The Men's League Water Bottle was designed with the essentials in mind. We poured our hearts and souls into perfecting the parts of a water bottle others overlooked in their push to add bluetooth technology to beverage vessels. We're almost to the finish line, ready to deliver this product to the masses. Take a stand, join our league, and help us tell the world that the coolest thing on this planet is a product that doesn't seek glorification for simply doing its damn job.

WHAT WE DO Purple Cactus Farms aims to provide the community with luscious conservatories harboring the world's most unique and endangered plants. Our goal is to educate the community on the crucial need to save these plants and give them an oasis in the middle of North Carolina. Whether it's a family day out or an opportunity to learn something new, Purple Cactus has something for everyone. With everything put aside, our main goal is providing citizens with education on the many awesome plants and encourage them to pass the amazing gifts of nature down generations in their family. There isn't very many places in the northwest NC for teens and children to go, especially with the increase in franchises popping up everywhere, we would like to give everyone a safe and enjoyable place to make memories. The Purple Cactus Plan Our plan is to build a large glass palm house much like the one at Kew Gardens for our tropical varieties. We hope to include a cactus conservatory for our desert plant friends as well. We want citizens to feel like they are in different parts of the world no matter what the weather or season is in NC. It gives the community a sense of a tropical paradise to "get away" for a day. The Purple Cactus also has a small petting zoo farm. Animals include: Goats, pigs, chickens,(of course dogs) and other small friendly animals. There is a farm hand always on duty to ensure the animals are safe and healthy. The admission fee will cover the cost of the feed children can give to the animals. We have many different varieties of plants and flowers in our outdoor gardens harboring many walking paths. Many of our flowers such as tulips, dahlias, etc. are available to be picked and purchased in our floral fields. We also host a cafe and coffee shop at the farm. Guest can enjoy snacks such as hot dogs and burgers, to our many gourmet vegan items The cafe would be accessible to those whom do not wish to visit the farm(which means no admission fee), but would like to dine with us for the day!

"Bramble" is an album of songs that have grown from seed to fruit in the last couple years. Following the release of Cold Mountain Child's previous album in 2015, I've had the good fortune of collaborating with three gifted brothers - Shane, John, and Milowe - for Bramble's realization. They've each added their own flavors and textures to the songs. Drawing inspiration from human struggles, from my travels, power structures and wild nature, these songs are ready to be heard. Who am I? I'm Tyler, a songwriter who lives out in the country near the woods with my genius wife Marisol and our two goofy cats. Born in California, I grew up mostly in Michigan and love its natural splendor and human hearts. Alongside gardening and homestead projects, I've put together a studio in a room in our house where the tracking, mixing and mastering for Bramble happened. These last many months have been filled with recording, mixing, balancing, revising and then doing it again! Now the album is ready for physical fabrication and distribution. I'd be honored if you would join me in supporting this Kickstarter to release "Bramble"! This campaign is a bit unique in that the sound-production work of the album is finished, so studio costs are not part of the equation. Your support will make possible: -the fabrication of CD's and cassettes. -creation of new merch to support the release. -the distribution of songs to online music services and radio stations. -shipping and Kickstarter fees. As a thank you for your help with this Kickstarter campaign you'll be getting the new album "Bramble" featuring the artwork of Mary "Marby" Vallee. Plus other treats for your kind-heartedness. Song seeds were planted, sprouted, nourished and refined. I'd be so grateful for your help in sharing the fruits. Thank you so much! -Tyler Cold Mountain Child videos: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TcbA4cIbCxc https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5wniRFDowuo
