Hey Kickstarter Community, We have a new product that we need your help to Launch: A Solar food dehydrator for Mason jars. It's called DRYCERATOP! DRYCERATOP in Action The mason jar is a great tool for making, preserving and experimenting with food now you can use it to dehydrate foods using 100% solar energy. DRYCERATOP x5 The DRYCERATOP is an amazing set of capabilities in an incredibly small, beautiful package. Conventional food dehydrators are huge, clunky, consume energy and cost a lot. DRYCERATOP is TINY and folds away into a drawer when not in use. It will never cost anything to operate for years of service! SUSTAINABLE DRYCERATOP uses 100% solar energy and can be brought anywhere! There are no batteries or circuitry - when the sun shines it just works. It's perfect for cooks, chefs, gardeners, foragers, hobbyists, outdoors people, scientists, prepers or herbalists. It works outside. Perfect for having fun in the patio, in the garden, on the live aboard boat, or for your #vanlife. DRYCERATOP DRYCERATOP is made of wood! Wood is beautiful and renewable especially aspen a highly sustainable species. We make DRYCERATOP in Minneapolis and we don't want to cut large amounts of plastics in our shop. Kitchen products of wood fit our aesthetic. Increasingly people are returning to wooden spoons, spatulas rolling pins and we are into that! WHAT TO MAKE DRYCERATOP can dry almost anything. Many things like herbs, hops, potpourri, flowers, and mushrooms can simply be put into the jar and maintain their own airspace. Fruits like bananas, apples, apricots or vegetables like squash, peppers and tomatoes can skewered to maintain airspace. You may want to slice certain foods to increase the drying area. The same food and preparation goes for any dehydrator so you can use times and techniques found anywhere online. Mushrooms, Herbs, Fruits and Vegitables Dehydrate with DRYCERATOP Gardeners can preserve more food in less space by dehydrating the excess at harvest time. DRYCERATOP works even in cool weather so you can dehydrate all fall. Surplus food is cheap at harvest time, save money all year by preserving food from the farmers market at harvest time. Dehydrated vegetables are preferable to canned and make great flavorful nutritious ingredients for soups. Prepairing fruits and vegitabes for DRYCERATOP Herbalists will like that you can choose to dehydrate low and slow, minimizing the loss of fragile or volatile elements like fragrances or more elusive nutrients. This makes DRYCERATOP ideal for teas, seasonings or traditional medicines. All without using any energy from the grid! HOW IT WORKS DRYCERATOP is incredibly simple! The jar, set in the sun, heats up from solar gain. The solar panel powers a small fan. The warm circulating air can carry away the water in food quickly. The fan and solar panel will last for many years. DRYCERATOP works with "wide mouth" standard Mason Jars. DRYCERATOP LOVES HOPTOP DRYCERATOP Dehydrator and HOPTOP to Brew and Ferment HOPTOP is a mason jar Fermenting lid. It was funded on Kickstarter and has been successful ever since. We are offering the perfect pairing DRYCERATOP and HOPTOP in one reward. With this set you can brew, ferment, and dehydrate in Mason jars the options are limitless. Science and STEM Arduino time temperature and humidity logging DRYCERATOP has been thoroughly tested. It automatically creates perfect drying conditions when placed in full sunlight and faced towards the sun. If desired, higher temperatures can be achieved by putting a black card stock "solar collector" in the jars. Temperatures and relative humidity and airflow are comparable to plug in dehydrators. With a black sheet of cardstock we can achieve 120F+ with 60F ambient temperature. Relative humidity hovers between 5% and 15% Depending on many factors. Solar dehydration of food has many factors ambient temp, ambient humidity, surface area, surface membrane, and water content of food but also sun angle and atmosphere. These many variables make it very hard to characterize a general formula for how food dries but it has been done in many scientific papers. The most comprehensive we found is here. Testing 5 DRYCERATOP at once with Arduino In order to test DRYCERATOP we used and Arduino data logger. Temperature and Relative Humidity (RH) was logged to an SD card and graphed for 5 test cells. If this you are interested in the Science and STEM aspects of DRYCERATOP we will detail our process and arduino code on our website. Time lapse rig just for fun DRYCERATOP 4HR TIMELAPSE

Kickstarting a project with Raspberry Pi is always exciting. Yet, it can be a daunting task. Once you realize coding is not easy, transferring codes takes ages, plenty of cables around you are annoying and on top of that, the circuits never work instantly. But... as a developer, we never give up. This is why we decide to create Ezblock Pi. Meet Ezblock Pi, a multitasking magical extension board that allows you to bring your ideas to life spontaneously. An instant and mobile way to transfer codes, debug programs, and control your projects wirelessly and seamlessly. Quick, Mobile and Powerful. Ezblock Pi is for everyone, from creative beginners to professional makers. What's more, the Ezblock Studio is an application where you can conduct electronic component simulations and visualize the effects before putting the project into practice. With strong computational power, supported by STM32 controller, Ezblock Pi application can be connected to all types of Raspberry Pi and you can unleash the power of most physical applications. Ezblock Pi allows your sparkling project ideas to become a reality. Sky is the limit to your imagination. Whatever dreams you have, start creating them! Feed your pet when you are out of town. Receive live alerts on your mobile and check their status in real-time with ease Cool wearable gadgets A game-changing, intuitive and personalized IDE that is open-source and enables you to customize your IoT projects efficiently. So that you can have more options available in Blockly. The more you play and explore, the more customized tools you have in your toolbox. Ezblock Studio integrates Hardware Simulator, Bluetooth Debugger, IoT Panel, and Customizable Remote Controller, allowing quick prototyping of applications. It is an application that drives the project to your imagination supported on both mobile and desktop devices. While Ezblock Studio allows you to see instant results and further supports your coding as a professional developer, it also caters for the beginners who have just started learning how to code. You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00 Let's walk you through the process of creating an IoT project with Ezblock Pi! The coolest part of using Ezblock Pi is that you can also use voice control to trigger and send commands to your project even when you are not around. No need to worry about your plant or pet at home, you can take care of them remotely with Ezblock Pi Studio. The Ezblock Pi can�t function alone and so we have exclusively put together sets that you can select based on your personal expertise. Choose from the Basic kit, IoT kit, and Advanced kit and get on your maker journey. A basic kit for all creators who are just starting off. The basic kit includes an Ezblock Pi extension board that is compatible with the Ezblock Studio App. The Basic kit allows you to make up to 15 different types of projects with ease. Your journey to becoming a maker starts with this kit. We make it easy for you! Check the steps below: Along with the kit, you will also get a bunch of tutorials which can make your learning even easier! Right from creating your own quiz buzzer, to saving your plants from dehydration with constant moisture reminder, the Basic kit has got you covered. Endless possibilities. Here are the 10 advanced projects you can make with Basic Kit: The Ezblock IoT kit includes EzBlock Pi and an additional bonus of 16 IoT modules to take your projects to another level. The IoT modules include a set of sensors and actuators. Sensors are the one's that actually respond with an action to sound, light, temperature, touch, etc. Actuators, on the other hand, are the components that are responsible for motion, or 'movers', such as switching on/off the light, changing the colors, etc. They are the go-getters. The IoT kit has all the necessary electric components like LED, Buzzer, a couple of resistors and transistors, etc. Here are the the 16 IoT modules inside this kit: With Ezblock Pi's IoT kit you can create exciting projects with simple drag and drop. Keep the lights and temperature of your house balanced with the outside environment with a thermostat, or make motion sensitive lights for your room. Let your imagination run wild. If you are ready to go on and experiment more and learn how to code as well, this kit is perfect for you. In Ezblock Advanced kit, you get an Ezblock Pi that is compatible with the Ezblock Studio App and also a PiMobile car. The coolest gadget to get your hands on if you are want to learn coding basics and robotics is the PiMobile. PiMobile is basically a 3-wheeled robot car equipped with an ultrasonic distance sensor and a 2- channel IR grayscale sensor. We have joined hands with Bang good team! By using their extensive computer software market research skills, we co-developed Pi Mobile robot car that any type of audience can use and enjoy. You and your friends can order and get excellent support from Bang good team anytime, even after the crowdfunding campaign ends. We finished RasPad campaign last year and were able to raise $610,966. Over the last year, we have been working very diligently to constantly keep improving RasPad for our users. RasPad is a personal tablet for makers to create projects anytime, anywhere instantly. RasPad version 2.0 has an enhanced OS and a fully supportive hardware to make this process smooth for makers to turn their dreams into reality. RasPad hardware upgrade includes mini fans to dissipate 20% heat and reduce malfunction due to overheating. It also includes an additional 5V power cable port and improved battery life. RasPad OS has also been upgraded by removing touch sensor lag. We have also personalized the OS by adding personal centre just like Microsoft office that allows you to store all your information in the RasPad itself. RasPad - a portable Raspberry Pi tablet that we launched earlier was a great success among makers. We are grateful for getting funded for $610,996 on Kickstarter with the help of you. Now, with the same concept of enabling easy and unhindered programming in mind, we developed Ezblock - an add on multi-tasking board that will allow you to bring all your creative projects to life. Though the world now is obsessed with technology, we are a group of geeks who are never satisfied with the current technology. Nowadays, topics covering Artificial Intelligence are everywhere. Instead of being intimidated, why not become a part of it by starting to learn how to code? Everyone is born to make something and we are here to help. Since founding SunFounder, we have been committed to promoting the maker movement, STEM education, and bringing knowledge and enjoyment to schools and families. Our vision is to offer a creative outlet for ideas, practical skills, and fun in the rapidly advancing programming world. This project is promoted by Jellop, the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarters with 650+ successful Kickstarter projects with over $300MM raised between them.

Hello Everyone! I'm Anashi the illustrator/designer and one-woman show behind Eriu Studios and also Battitude (the bat-themed etsy shop!) I'm an avid animal enthusiast with a fluffy gray cat and two crazy ferrets. I had an intense love of the aesthetically pleasing so couple that with my love of books, comics, anime, video games and basically all things nerdy and...well...how was I NOT supposed to make adorable enamel pins??? You can check out my instagrams for both my etsy shops below:  art of nashi  Battitude Shop There are 6 designs in total and there might be a few stretch goals such as vinyl stickers, and other surprise goodies, but these won't unlock until all the pins have! These pins will back at $9 USD and the price with rise to $10 USD each after the kickstarter if any are left! The pins will unlock at the following tiers The main goal is set at the Daenrys Pin and the other 5 designs will unlock as follows:  Design 1 (Danny)- $200 **UNLOCKED**  Design 2 (Jon)- $360 **UNLOCKED**  Design 3 (Arya)- $520 **UNLOCKED**  Design 4 (Tyrion)- $680 **UNLOCKED**  Design 5 (Jamie)- $840 **UNLOCKED**  Design 6 (Night King)-$1000 **UNLOCKED** BOTH STRETCH GOALS REACHED!! Sansa will unlock at $1200 **UNLOCKED** The Hound will unlock at $1360 **UNLOCKED** Cersie will unlock at $1520 All of the pins feature:  Sizing that changes with each design (ex Tyrion is the smallest pin)  Silver/Gold plating  Hard Enamel finish  2-3 Pantone matched coloring  Double Rubber Clutch Fastening  Each character will have their own individual backing card with personal saying Although I've done my best to show true representation of the colors chosen, there may be slight differences in appearance depending on what monitor/screen you are using to view, and slight differences in how the colors translate from digital drawing to physical pin manufacture. You'll be able to select your pin choice via a survey that will be sent out if the project is fully backed within the time limit and if for any reason you'd like to change your selection before shipping feel free to message me! I came up with the initial idea while out to brunch with my boyfriend. We were having mimosas and discussing the Game of Thrones episodes we had just watched the night before. If you follow me on Instagram, you're aware of how popular my current ferret pins are. Well, because of that, we started discussing what Game of Thrones ferrets may look like. I started with Daenarys and one of the first things I decided was to give her mini ferret-dragons. I ended up doodling this design on a napkin and several weeks later I finalized 6 Game of Thrones Ferret designs!! Everything is ferreted over. The dragons are ferrets. Ghost is a ferret. The sword hilts are ferrets. Ferrets...everywhere... Here are some of my pins from BOTH my Battitude shop and also my Eriu Studios shop to give you an idea of what the final product may end up looking like.  Late May- Kickstarter Launches  Late June - Kickstarter Ends  Late June/Early July- Surveys sent out  Mid July - Kickstarter funds become available  Mid July - Production order placed Late July - Pins arrive and we will begin packaging and shipping all orders out  Late July-Early August- Pins will be delivered to you! For international backers: International parcels are shipped using a Global Advantage Program. This postage method is untracked in order to keep costs low for international backers. Also, please be aware that International backers are responsible for any customs fees their country may ask for, so plan accordingly! Pledging towards the campaign is completely risk-free! Payment will not be taken from you until after the campaign is finished and only if it is successful. Pledging via kickstarter helps me raise funds for the manufacture of the pins, including cost of the pin itself as well as backing cards, packaging, shipping materials and kickstarter fees (10%!) The reason I produce a little more that necessary in quantities acts as a safety net in case certain designs are more popular than others, and so the pins can also be made available after the kickstarter has ended to the general public! Thinking about changing your pledge? You can click the 'Manage Your Pledge' button on the campaign page, or by clicking your current reward tier and then 'Change Your Pledge'! Here you can change your reward tier to a different reward tier, or you can add on an amount to your tier! Because the pictures shown on the Kickstarter are mock-ups, colors may vary slightly and, If necessary, there may be slight changes in the design to prevent manufacturing problems, but the overall aesthetic and design will stay the same. During and after the Kickstarter, it is my goal to keep things running as smoothly as possible and to keep you regularly updated both here and on my social media.  If you have any additional questions, feel free to email me at anashi.sterling@gmail.com

DETAILS "The Mage Stone" is a novel (and soon-to-be film) about a mage princess who doesn't actually have any magic. She ends up on a journey to discover why as well as other hidden secrets from her past. It has been compared to a "more feminist 'Game of Thrones'," as it features LGBTQIA characters, strong female characters, and multiple instances of people fighting back against oppression. All that said, "The Mage Stone" is far less bloody, and there will likely be no out-right nudity. Agreeing to join our cast, is the well-known performer, Simonna. If you don't know who she is, then you should check out her IMDb, twitter, and instagram! She has a huge following both online and in the movie and television industries and has agreed to allow us to mention her in our campaign as well as to advertise the final product. We are very excited to have her aboard! Casting is already in progress, but if you'd like to audition or contribute in any way that isn't financial, then please email me at wollmerdakota@gmail.com! What we need the money we raise through this campaign (and from private backers) for, is filming locations ($7,000 min), props ($3,000 min), costumes ($3,000), digital effects ($5,000 min), editing ($1000), paying/transporting/feeding cast and crew ($10,000), and advertising/submitting to festivals ($1000 min). The truth is, the more money we raise, the more money we can put into each aspect of production. Any and all support is appreciated, even if all you can do is share this campaign! Thanks for reading. ^_^ POST PRODUCTION PLANS upload to Amazon upload to Vimeo (pay per view) submit to Film Festivals around the world Advertise on YouTube, Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Tumblr, billboards, subways, radio shows, magazines, and wherever else we can afford to! Sell DVDs/Blu-rays Potentially partner with different streaming websites. Thanks the hundreds, thousands, or millions who love our work and helped to make it great~

Calling all fans of gryphons! My name is Alex and I write novels about gryphons based in the modern world. This kickstarter is to help me publish the second installment of The Gryphon Generation, and provide some fun goodies to existing fans as well as newcomers. Introduction to the story The modern world as we know it has been transformed with the arrival of sentient Gryphons. These man created beings now live among us and take part in society, but not without repercussions from closed minded humans. Some people argue that these beasts should not have the same rights as them and are appalled by their creation. Others believe the Gryphons should live their lives just as humans do, without red tape and hurdles to jump through. With the popularity of the new Gryphon sport, Gryphball, many humans have changed their opinions about the beasts. Gryphball is now a worldwide phenomenon, outpacing every other sport in existence and the players are put on a pedestal of society. We follow the story of Johnathen, a human male, and Thyra, a female gryphoness that are a married couple in Georgia. Until recently, the thought of an interspecies couple outraged many people, but has been accepted in main society. The righteous half, however, have fought every step of the way to keep such marriages illegal and to convince others these couples are an abomination. Johnathen and Thyra meet many friends along the way who accept and support them for who they are. Many find the relationship comical and interesting, especially the rare gryphons Thyra comes across in the southern states. When Thyra accepts an offer to become part of her first Gryphball team, she meets her new best friends, Rachel, Antonio and Aadhya. The Drive I am extremely passionate about writing, but it is not my fulltime job. I work in the car manufacturing field as a technician, and write in my spare time. I also practice falconry with my redtail hawk, Ranger who I love like my own family. Gryphons and Gryphon novels have been a tremendous part of my life. They have helped me escape to new worlds and let my imagination flow. All I hope for is people to enjoy this new installment of my series and help them escape into their own imagination. Rewards! ****STRETCH GOAL #1**** 2500$ UNLOCKED! The Anfang design will be added to the pin and sticker Tiers NOW for the fun part! With incredible help from many talented friends, we have collaborated to bring you a fun tier of rewards! Stickers and pins designed by my friend, Royalty! The Redtails Gryphball team merchandise designed by Fleeks! And, of course, the books themselves. Thank you for looking through this Kickstarter and I hope you will join me in making this next installment something memorable!

Story Edward�s father moves the family to a new community after taking a new job. Edward is 15 years of age and is optimistic about his first year of high school. He is looking forward to meeting new people but his optimism soon dwindles when he becomes the target of a group of bullies. Never having dealt with bullying before, Edward has a difficult time coping with the situation. He is reluctant to turn to his ex-military father for fear of being told to �man-up� and doesn�t want to be a snitch either and so Edward becomes withdrawn. Edward�s mom is busy getting her life put back together after the move. She has become preoccupied with her new part-time realtor job to have noticed Edward�s emotional change. While Edward is sitting on the street curb late one night, a girl (Gayle) comes rolling up in a wheelchair. A friendship soon blossoms between the two and Edward opens up about his problem. Gayle explains to Edward that she became paralyzed from being pushed down the stairs after by bullies while taking up for a class mate. Gayle convinces Edward to report the bullies to the school authorities. He finds hope causes a great weight to be lifted off his shoulders. Then things goes terrible wrong. Purpose I feel that "Such A Good Life campaign" will be important to those who have suffered from bullying and the depression that follows. While writing this script, I have had to confront and have defeated some of the demons that have plagued me over four decades by realizing that I was not alone in my torment. That is why I feel that this movie is important in helping others will be a help to others. Not just the ones who have been bullied, but those who are bullies. Summary It is nothing new that people of all walks of life have either been or have known someone who has been bullied. There have been many previously released movies dealing with the topic of bulling. But this movie gives a unique view point on the how a bullied person handles and the long reaching consequence of bulling I�m Paul Stratton, age 57 years old and have dealt with the ramifications from bulling from 40 years ago. This film will open a frank and honest dialog on bulling among peoples of all ages and backgrounds. Once this film is completed, we plan to take it and reach out to the community in order to help others. We are so confident in this project that we have donated thousands of dollars into it. We must not fail in our attempt to help others. What We Need & What You Get We even though we have donated thousand of dollars into this project, we still need $9,500 more. We have hired professional actors from across America to bring the talent we need for this film. We offer perks ranging from: Autographed Items. Private Screenings, Cast Dinner � Walk on Roles Most Monies will go to the Actors, Room, Board, the rest will go towards enhancing the movie quality. The Impact This film is important to help those who have been bullied to know they are not alone. 410 Productions have worked with musicians creating music videos and movie shorts. I have put parts of my life in this film for all to see in the sincerest attempt to help others with bulling. Other Ways You Can Help We understand financially burdens, but your help is still needed by spreading our project to others. Again, this movie project will be completed one way or another. It is up to you to help make it better. Again, my deepest thanks for taking an interest and your time in looking at our project.

It's been one massive display of support and love towards Red and her universe! For more info on what's been unlocked so far please scroll down to our Stretch Goals section or check our updates clicking right here. Welcome to The Few and Cursed Season Finale Kickstarter! "Part of the journey is the end..." - Stark, Tony My name is Felipe Cagno and I'm the co-creator of TFAC alongside Fabiano Neves. I'm the writer, he's the artist, and together we've been working on this title starring the Redhead for nearly four years now. This is the Kickstarter to publish the 32-page issue #6 of the post-apocalyptic Western series The Few and Cursed: Crows of Mana'Olana! This is our season finale, we have reached the very end of our first story arc. But don't worry! Now is your chance to grab the entire mini-series! While this might be the Kickstarter to fund the last part of the story, you'll also find all the previous issues among many of our tiers so if you are a new backer and reader, make yourself right at home! Whether you are a new or old reader, if you are interested in any of our previous collectibles, we will have a Pledge Manager after the campaign closes where you'll be able to customize your package with whatever items you might have missed. THE FEW AND CURSED BOARD GAME: A CURSE CHASING ADVENTURE The world of The Few and Cursed has grown because of your amazing support and will continue to grow with an original board game! Indie game publisher Rock Manor Games launched a Kickstarter to produce the official The Few and Cursed Board Game and raised over $135K in pledges from over 2.300 backers! If you missed it and would like to pre-order the game: https://gamefound.com/projects/mike/fewandcursed It's been an incredible journey and I'm glad we made it this far. And we couldn't have done without an avid base of readers that have successfully crowdfunded every issue so far always unlocking multiple Stretch Goals! Thank you all for sticking with us. Let's continue this journey together, shall we? SO PICK YOUR COVER AND JOIN US FOR THE EXCITING CONCLUSION OF THE FEW AND CURSED: CROWS OF MANA'OLANA \o/ We have four beautifully illustrated cover artworks by phenomenal artists for YOU to choose from or perhaps collect them all: Regular Cover & The Kickstarter Exclusive: The ISSUE #6 KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE edition with art by concept super star HYOUNG NAM though will not be available anywhere else ever again! This special edition will feature the Kickstarter logo and will be done as PRINT ON DEMAND meaning we will only print as many comics as sold on this campaign. If we go well above our initial goal, we will also have exclusive Stretch Goals to this edition only i.e.: Chromium upgrade, new back cover art, numbered series sticker, etc. Variant Covers: Variant Cover "A" by Rafael De Latorre & Juan Fernandez on the left. Variant Cover "B" by Jenevieve Broomall & Ivanna Matilla on the right. You can also pick tiers that include our seasonal exclusive Mini-Print by Brazilian artist ALLAN JEFFERSON to go along with the Halloween special: *Look for this print in our higher tier packages. And last but not least there are also tiers featuring another collectible 9-card set printed on Chromium paper stock featuring art by artist Z� CARLOS showcasing the friends and foes of the Redhead: WHAT IS THE FEW AND CURSED? WHO IS THE MYSTERIOUS REDHEAD? GUNSLINGER. SURVIVOR. CURSE CHASER. LEGEND. She is the star of The Few and Cursed in what can be described as a Buffy the Vampire Slayer meets the Old West comic book series. This is the ideal comic book for any Western, Adventure or Supernatural fan! It's been seventy years since most of the water in the world was just gone overnight in a mysterious apocalyptic event. And even though what was left of mankind found a way to adapt and survive using water, the most valuable asset on the planet, as currency, survival turned the world into a wicked wasteland where it's either kill or be killed. And evil not only endured, it blossomed. People turned to dark arts, old tales of mischief and curses to survive. Red is a hardened survivor that was born in this reality and now fights to protect the innocent. As for every darkness there is also light among the few and cursed are those willing to fight to bring balance to the lands: the Curse Chasers. SO THE REDHEAD IS-- --a Curse Chaser, right. Every whisper in the night about something terrible, something supernatural, something evil and the Redhead is off to hunt it down. And she's become exceedingly good at it. WHAT KIND OF MONSTERS ARE WE TALKING ABOUT EXACTLY? Shockingly evil and devastatingly wicked. That kind. Creatures spat back straight from hell that should never exist in the first place. But desperate times call for desperate measures and people turned to the darkest corners of the world to survive... A poisoned vial, a cursed coin, a hangman's tree, all ways common folks can become powerful beyond measure despite what they might become in the process. Chief among those monsters The Crows of Mana'Olana - the villains of our first story arc. CROWS OF WHERE? Mana'Olana - a small town in the Honolulu Mountains region (what was once Hawaii). That's where the bedtime story about giant Crows that kidnap children in the silent of night comes from. Oh and while they are taking the kids, they also shred the grown-ups to pieces. For years the Crows of Mana'Olana have preyed on the innocent unchecked. Until she came along... the Redhead. THAT SOUNDS AWESOME! HOW MANY ISSUES ARE PLANNED? The Crows of Mana'Olana story will be told in six (6) issues - each with 32 fully colored pages in standard comic book format 6'625 x 10'25in. The first five books have already been published thanks to the amazing support of many of you. This Kickstarter is to print issue #6 - the epic conclusion! If this is your first time hearing about The Few and Cursed here's an issue by issue synopsis: (skip this section to avoid potential spoilers!!) Issue #1 introduces the Redhead to readers as we get to see her chase a local Indian myth, the Tsilkali, a giant snake preying on the small town of Mountain View, California. In Issue #2 we follow the Redhead to the border of San Andreas and see her first meeting with a 94-year old survivor of The Reaping, Jebediah Younger. They team up to cross the Pacific after the Crows of Mana�Olana and learn firsthand how real they really are� and how dangerous. In the next installment of the series, Issue #3, the Redhead and Jebediah finally make it to Mana�Olana. In a flashback story, readers learn what the Redhead is truly capable of. Issue #4 features the very first big battle with the Crows in Mana'Olana. We also go deeper in Red's fatherly relationship with Jebediah and unravel some of his background. In Issue #5, the Redhead comes face to face with the Crows in a violent death match and finds out who they really are. We're now working towards the conclusion in Issue #6 and Red will not walk away clean from this last encounter... Work on Issue #6 has just begun but you are more than welcome to check out some previews for the first three pages below: WOULD YOU MIND SHARING SOME PAGES FROM EACH ISSUES? What's a great story without some terrific art to go along with it, right? Fabiano Neves is a master storyteller with 20 years of experience working with comics and The Few and Cursed is his passion project. Needless to say all that passion really oozes onto the pages: Issue #1 - Preview Issue #2 - Preview Issue #3 - Preview Issue #4 - Preview Issue #5 - Preview [Issue #6 - Preview shot] WHAT ABOUT THAT CHRONICLES OF THE FEW AND CURSED ANTHOLOGY? The Chronicles of The Few and Cursed is an anthology featuring short stories by top artists set in the same universe. The book collects 8 brand new stories - including two exclusive Redhead tales - for a total of 96 fully colored pages and was produced both in softcover and hardcover formats. Some of our higher tiers designed for new readers already have Chronicles included but you will also be able to add it to any pledge after the Kickstarter ends through our pledge manager. With Chronicles we were able to explore the four corners of the world and how other cultures around the planet have dealt and continue to deal with the disappearance of most of the water. Visit a Persian city overtaken by horrifying Daevas, raid a tomb in Egypt after the Eye of Horus and get lost in a shark cemetery in the Australian outback. Our main dish is obviously The Few and Cursed: Crows of Mana'Olana issue #6 in all its' different variant covers but we're also offering all the back-issues so new readers have access to the full story in one fell swoop. These rewards are also included in EVERY pledge: *Every comic book in the mail comes signed by me (Felipe Cagno) *Every reward tier includes YOUR name in our "Thank You" section (regardless of the tier you pick, we are very grateful to have you joining us on this adventure!) *Also included is a digital copy to whatever book you are getting in print (downloadable PDFs) *We've also produced full sets of collectible cards, commemorative coins, exclusive mini-prints & more which will be available after the Kickstarter through our Pledge Manager \o/ Set of Prints - Series 3 If you are looking to go beyond the comics, we offer full sets of large format A3 prints mailed separately in cardboard tubes! *Series 1 & 2 prints will be available in our Pledge Manager as well. The Few and Cursed has always been very lucky to snag pin-ups by some of the world's most talented and popular artists. Some were included in previous issues in our Galleries, some were produced for collectible cards and some were specifically done for these posters. Backers can choose to go home with a set of 8x large format posters including a gorgeous piece of art by Tou Vue exclusively commissioned for this set! Prints come in a large 11x17in size glossy high-end paper and we ship them in a separate thick cardboard Mailer Tube. *International backers please note this means twice as much shipping as the tubes are considered packages as well. The Series 3 set of posters includes art by: Priscilla Petraites & Marco Lesko (Redhead board game edition) Fabiano Neves & Sanju Nivangune Rodrigo Ramos Mauro Fodra Ig Guara & Juan Fernandez Lauren Marshall & Vinicius Townsend Clonerh series 2 Tou Vue (exclusive art!!) Original Artworks On top of printed artworks we are also offering the unique opportunity to get three original Redhead artworks by top pro artists! *These are original one-of-kind artworks and will be mailed separately to ensure they arrive in mint conditions Bella Rachlin art on the left & Tou Vue art on the right Original art by Norvien Basio Original Artwork by Alexandre Tso Original Artwork by Allan Jefferson There's a lot planned including new items for collectible sets we started in previous Kickstarters. That means more trading cards, commemorative coins, mini-prints and more! If you back now and spread the word... we just might be able to squeeze more into your package! Here's everything unlocked so far: FELIPE CAGNO - Writer & Editor I'm 35 years old and I have been working pretty much exclusively with comics since 2013. I have a background in film making, got my Master's degree at Chapman University and wrote and directed my first feature-length film in 2012, A Bullet With No Name. My first comic book series was The Lost Kids: Seeking Samarkand epic adventure adapted from a feature screenplay I wrote while at Chapman and working at producing companies like Arad Pictures, Weed Road and Misher Films. I went on to create and publish the anthology of short stories 321: Fast Comics, the original graphic novels Too Good to Be True and Choices: A Hero's Tale. In 2017 I was the recipient of a prestigious cultural grant in Brazil to produce the sci-fi book Adagio and I also have another creator-owned series in the works, the spy thriller Classified. One of the coolest projects I've worked on was a short story for Planet of the Apes published by comic book app Madefire and 20th Century Fox. FABIANO NEVES - Artist Professionally working as an artist since he was nineteen years old, Fabiano was first published in the US in 2000 with Xena Warrior Princess. He then went on to work for Marvel, DC, Dark Horse and Dynamite among other publishers. A talented colorist as well, Fabiano has done both interior pages and covers for Xena, Marvel Zombies, Red Sonja, Robocop, JLA�s Vibe and Constantine among many other titles. The Few and Cursed represents Fabiano�s first creator-owned project. TIAGO BARSA - Colorist Newcomer Tiago Barsa has been with us since issue #3 and has taken over coloring duties on issue #5 for the remainder of the series. Every page he carefully crafts always surprises me and Fabiano for the sheers quality behind them. His credits include work for Ape Entertainment and Ed Benes Studio. DEYVISON MANES - Letterer One of the best letterers in Brazil, Deyvison has built an impressive body of work over the past couple of years and is slowly tackling more and more titles for the US comic market. He's been with The Few and Cursed since the beginning and has also done every other book I've ever published. He is also a crafty writer and has his own creator-owned sci-fi book - Justi�a Sideral. Fabiano and I are all about 100% transparency and we believe you deserve to know where your money is going to. All of the money raised by Kickstarter will be used towards four things: Production, Printing, Shipping and Fees. Here�s a breakdown of our costs based on previous TFAC Kickstarters: Total - $16,777.57 Any additional funding over the initial goal will first cover whatever is left from the above and all the extras like collectible cards, pin-ups, magnets, etc, and production of future books of The Few and Cursed saga. I've also substantially raised the budget for shipping to make sure you get your rewards as fast and safely as possible. We pack and mail our rewards using hard cardboard photo mailers plus dust-free clear plastic bags and comic book sized card-boards. *** For higher tiers or packages with extra books we use Easy-Fold Mailers: *** We also ship our prints using thick cardboard mailer tubes: Our primary goal is to entertain you and release the series entirely through Kickstarter. It all starts with YOU and YOUR support so thanks so much for sticking with us. If you have any questions please send me a message or shoot an e-mail at cagno100@gmail.com

My Stars and Planets was born with a desire to remember those special moments where the stars were ours. I started experimenting with crafting these pieces as a way to make a present for those special people in my life and show that for that moment they were all that mattered. It wasn�t until I started sharing the progress with others that people were interested in sharing those special moments with their loved ones as well. That is how My Stars and Planets was born, out of a desire to preserve the moment held dearest to the heart. Furthering our story of humanity and marking those moments, that for a moment the stars were ours. "My Stars and Planets was born, out of a desire to preserve the moment held dearest to the heart. " THE CONSTELLATIONS The back image is the constellations and stars, as visible from your location on that special day. Choose from 6 different images around the outside, each having a special meaning. PLANETARY LOCATIONS In Astrology, the Natal Chart is the planets position at the time of birth. We capture that moment and put it on top of your constellations and stars. These are unique to every person on earth. No-one will have the exact same alignment, each moment belongs to that person. Choose from 6 different backdrop themes: You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00 Step 1 Chart Creation: We use the customers specified, time, location and date to design a astrology chart as well as a star / Constellation chart. Step 2 Chart Conversion: Once the display is created, it is converted to allow our laser etcher to engrave the art into the acrylic glass. The glass pieces are separated to give the depth between the astrology chart and the constellation / Star Chart. Step 3 Wood Selection and Cutting: We hand select our walnut and fine woods, from a local exotic wood mill. We look at each piece for 3 things. Grain Color, Grain Style and Age of the board. This ensures that each piece is beautiful and unique. We begin to cut and shape the wood, re-sawing and milling to the size required for the displays. Step 4 Refinement and Center Piece Creation: After the base, the case have been created. We check for quality and refine the wood preparing for assembly. This is when the Main Center Piece is etched and refined, we check each center piece for clarity and crispness. Sometimes they require multiple attempts, which is fine with us, we want the quality to be right. After the center piece is installed, we install the color lights that the customer decided on, and connect all the wires. The lights are powered by a 9v Battery and has an on/off switch on the bottom of the base. Step 5 Assembly: When assembling we look over each piece, fine sand where needed and stain with a natural wood stain. This allows the beauty of the walnut to show and pops with the color of the lights. Step 6 Shipping: Each item is shipped with care and a thank you note. Current Schedule of Production: Turn Around time from order to shipping, is 2 - 3 weeks currently. That includes the design work, the wood crafting, assembling and finishing of the product. Goal of Production at full funding: When we meet our funding goal here, we are looking at being able to cut the production time in half, where we can ship as little as 1 week depending on volume. Custom Gift Box / Storage Box - A box that will fit the Astro-Display, beautifully! Variety of Woods Offered - Looking adding PurpleHeart, Blood Wood and more. Custom Ornaments - Convert the central display into an ornament display. Astrology Clock - A live motion "clock" to see the current planets vs where they were when your event happened. and more! Your Funding helps us purchase equipment such as a CNC Machine and Laser Etcher, that allows us to make these even more beautiful and expand into product offerings that could not currently do by hand. The Financials: Laser Cutter - $1,200 CNC Machine - $2,500 Material Stock - $500 Advertising: - $300 Kickstarter Fees: ~$500 $6,500 - We Donate 600 Tress through NationalForests.org: We love working with these beautiful wood materials, and want to make sure that all communities will have the opportunity to enjoy our forests! $8,500 - Plugin Adapter Included: No Batteries? No Problem! You will be able to plug the Display into the wall outlet! $9,500 - Color Changing Display Option Upgraded: Does your color change with your mood, like ours? Well we will have you covered with this option, to allow for you to change the color of your display as you see fit! $10,500 - Expanded Wood Choices in our store: Walnut not your type? That's fine, we want to get into Purpleheart, Bloodwood, Zebra and several more! This goal will allow us to start stock a selection of woods. $15,000 - Collector Coin Set: 12 Zodiac Signs, 12 Coins... All personalized with your Name and on the coin with your Sun Sign we engrave your Natal Chart. Made of Metal, and packed with care. (Must be in the specific Reward Tiers to receive this perk) Facebook : https://www.facebook.com/mystarsandplanets/ Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/mystarsandplanets/ Twitter: https://twitter.com/MyCustomStars Our Give Back Program After some thought about how I could give back, since being honored to have many customers that love what we are doing here. I decided that the best thing I could do is help plant more trees. Since our product is mainly wood, replenishing it would be a the right course of action. I started with some research and decided that I would donate through https://www.nationalforests.org. They have a small business partnership program which I signed up for and am now working out the details. To make it super simple, what we will do is for ever $25 dollars Spent with My Stars and Planets we will help plant at least 1 tree. It is our way of giving back to nature, as nature has allowed us to make so many beautiful items. We want to help bring back forests, and build natural homes for the wildlife. Thank you, for helping us give back.

Freelance Restaurant Menu connects your customers directly to your kitchen using the device that is always at hand, their phones. All software is personally branded with your choice of name and your logo. Early development - Customers Main Menu All of this at nothing more than the cost of supporting this project! That's right you won't be paying a subscription fee which can cost up to several hundred dollars a month, or paying any additional transaction fees that cut into your profit! I'm not here to make money off your hard work. I don't believe in a scaling profit. I'm not there sweating in your kitchen or managing your books. I aim to provide a solution to empower your business. The only cost for running the software is a web server MYSQL server and if you already have a .com then your paying for it now! Software designed to be simple to learn and use. Early development screenshot of the edit menu feature in the FRM Managers Portal Customized to give your customers a professional experience that is uniquely tailored to your restaurant. Your name, your logo and your choice of color scheme set the stage for your menu to really become your menu! Add your own pictures to showcase your food, which you can change anytime! Early Development screenshot of the customers demo menu Run specials, change up your menu to draw attention to the items you want your customers to see. Software designed so simple there will be no need to train your staff! Product features: Dedicated software is better than a universal app which may temp customers to your competition. Branded with your company logo, name, and your own icon on your customers screens. No subscription fees! No transaction fees! Customer phone app(Android during Kickstarter, iOS after launch) for placing orders. Quickly create your menu in less than 1 hour and go live. *Assumes SQL setup is completed and prior collection of any photos for use in the menu. Easily edit your menu at any time in minutes to keep it current Run specials , choose what and when, includes customer notifications. Loyalty reward program, entice your customers to return with rewards you set! Determine the conditions to be met and what they can earn. Provides a map with google maps integration to help customers find your business Point of Sale kiosk - Take orders at your counter Dedicated kitchen display to show your cooks what to make when the order comes in and mark its progress with a tap. Requires only 1 Android (Android 5 or newer) device to perform complete operation. Can be expanded to unlimited devices as desired without additional costs! Track sales Manage the register drawer count Freelance Restaurant Menu Basic comes with four portals which can be run on and Android(Android 5 or better) device! That means you can use pretty much any tablet($50 tablet from any major retailer works great!) rather than having me sell you an over priced single purpose device. As a business you would only need one device to run the Freelance Restaurant Kitchen Portal after setup. Early development screenshot - Adding a new item is a simple as filling out a short form! FRM includes 3 different access portals! FRM Manager Portal: Go from no menu to your full menu in under an hour! A simple user interface which allows you to create categories which are menu options the customers will use to find the items they wish to order faster. Categories can be arranged to change the order they appear on the customers portal to draw attention where you want it. Add, remove, and arrange items in each category to control your own menus flow. Add options to your menu items. Setup additional fees for some options like (+$1.00) for an additional topping for example. Run specials to grab the customers attention! FRM Customer Portal: A custom tailored experience just as unique as your business! Simple to use and without any signups! Less hassle for your customer! A unique customer id is made to identify customers should there ever be a need. The customer IP(The Internets version of a street address) is recorded for your security purposes should a problem arise. Customers see the categories and descriptions you made. They can navigate through the menu adding items to their order. They will be able to include any options you set for a menu item as well as special requests. Once an order is placed it will alert the Freelance Restaurant Kitchen Portal and provide them with everything they need to know. Can be used as a counter order system - Counter Portal add on is planned for future release, but the customer portal could certainly be used at your counter right out of the box! FRM Kitchen Portal: Instantly alerts your staff when an order is placed and provides them with all of the information they need to complete the order along with any special requests from the customer. information is presented in an easy to follow manner to provide exactly what they need to know. Allows for 1 touch clearing when an order is completed which will notify the customer that their order is completed. Freelance Kitchen Portal can be run on any Android(Android 5 or newer) device, tablet recommended. That means you don't spend hundreds or thousands on an over priced single function device! Any new $50 tablet from a major retailer will work wonderfully. A MYSQL database is needed for the package to operate. Don't know what that is? That's ok! I can help, and if your business has a .com your already paying for it! Otherwise there are plenty of cheap options like godaddy out there. Have a question? ask away! What about customers using Apply products? Development throughout the Kickstarter campaign will be limited to Android functionality only. After the Kickstarter launch has successfully been completed, an iOS version of the Customer portal will be released shortly after. I want to ensure the launch goes smoothly first. If funding provides I will release a iOS version of the other portals, however post launch development will primarily be focused on the implementation of additional features for a while. About me: I have been an avid programmer since before computers were screeching through phone lines. I enjoy making functional software to problem solve. Now a days big company delivery and restaurants attract lots of customers through the one thing most Americans keep in their hands. Their phone, a gateway to pretty much anything. Since eating is a habit, it's easy to expect a connection between the two. As someone who has ordered many a meal online I often find it a lot harder than it needs to be. Log in?! To a pizza joint?! I either use my secure password or try to remember a new one...which I won't. Don't worry your customers can use a 3rd party to order from you and make a killing off your labor... Or you can reach your customers directly. Save them money, earn more business and promote your products. There are options like this already out there. They average in the hundreds of dollars monthly, or take a percentage of each sale you make. Or, you can choose to exchange payment the same way you always do and keep others paws off it. By backing this project you are helping to empower small restaurants compete in today's market. The inspiration to this project is my father. He has been a chef most of his life and now owns his own small restaurant. It is inside the American Legion in town. It provides a great pool of good customers but because there is a membership requirement he is missing out on most of the potential customers in the area. Nothing prohibits take out or delivery, but he told me about the costs of working with companies that handle online ordering. I was floored and could only imagine how stiff that would cut his profits. Freelance Restaurant Menu was started to solve that very problem. Early development image - The price is hiding behind the cheesy goodness!

What is Akai? This Shonen series is titled �Akai�. Akai is the main character that was born on a leap year in God's Garden Society. No parents. Raised by Grandma; he has to find a key to begin the journey to right the �curse� that is bestowed upon him. During this course he stumbles across a �divine oracle� who tells the boy he must wear the Black Orlov chain and one day his curse will be broken by fate, to rewrite the world. He goes through the trials of discovering the curses true meaning, and realized after he has come to see the divine oracle; The world is now different that she is gone. His grandmother has died of cancer, and he is now alone and must rely on growth and maturity without guidance. Each 13 year old in every tier of this society must test there mental/physical combat abilities at the �Heaven�s Gate� Academy. Thus... Akai discovers his newfound powers, and his new found family/friends/agenda which makes the TRUE plot unfold... Why create "Black" Manga? More color, more diversity, and a more unique storyline. We have never really seen a Black Manga with a All Black cast, and I want to bring a new form of artistry to light. Children need hope of doing something that is different but OUR people need a leader to show them the way. I decided to dedicate my brand, my Manga, and Anime to the children of the next generation to be inspired to follow my footsteps and create a story of there own... Anime should be UNIVERSAL. I have been reading Manga and watching Anime for 18+ years now. Manga is read from right to left, and my manga will follow Japanese/Mangaka traditions. I would like black cosplayers, black merchandise, black voice actors, and black video games to follow after my series! I HAVE A ANIMATION PREVIEW COMING FOR SUPPORTERS VERY SOON! Who is AnimeBae� ??? AnimeBae is a 25 year old African-American Gamer turned Manga Creator, who had a idea as a kid to one day start his own Manga/Anime Producing Company. AnimeBae quit his job in October 2018 to pursue his goal! I started off as a HEAVY fan of the early 1990's hit Anime "Naruto". I was ranked #2 in the World at Naruto Storm 4, so on January 26th, 2018 (due to popular demand) I started YouTube!....and 600,000 views later HERE WE ARE! This story was born to seek Black representation in mainstream animated projects. manga, and also wanting to promote self love for our fellow Men, Women, and Children. There is a strong message of self love, good energies, and empowering our people but ALL people. Main Characters: Akai Yuna Tymes Katsu Chozen Himeko WIP! Special Character Mug 3 Glass Magnets Special Character Folder Special Notebook (Limited Edition) THESE REWARDS WILL BE UNLOCKED ONCE WE PUSH PAST OUR $2000 Goal! S.P.I.R.I.T. Issue #01 is a 24-page full-color comic about a group of teen girl ghost hunters. Mary, Ada and Jane are the scientific paranormal incident research investigation team or S.P.I.R.I.T.! The team uses science to disprove the supernatural for their vlog, but are shocked when they come face to face with a real ghost! Along with their new friend, Ash, the team investigates this supernatural mystery to find the truth! S.P.I.R.I.T. is a female, science, diversity and LGBTQ positive comic suitable for middle school kids and up. Our goal is to print the first issue and begin work on the second issue. Enter the world of S.P.I.R.I.T. by backing our kickstarter. The story begins with the S.P.I.R.I.T. team of Mary, Ada and Jane performing a ritual to contact Annabelle Lewis at a local Indiana graveyard. Annabelle was the unfortunate victim of her sister Prudence on their 19th Century farm. The team fails yet again to have a supernatural encounter. What the girls don't know is that Ash is watching them from the woods and sees a ghost. The next day, Ash confronts the team and challenges them to find out what is happening but they are interrupted by the spirit of Annabelle's sister. Dealing with proof of the supernatural and a new person in their group S.P.I.R.I.T. head out on an adventure to find out the truth. Mark Bell is bringing his life long love of comics and creating stories together on this special project. His company, Plague Doctor Press, also publishes the web comic ZED (zed.plaguedoctorpress.com). He is interested in bringing new voices and new talent to the comic industry. He lives in Bloomington, Indiana with his wife and kids. You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00 Melissa Capriglione (cap-rig-lee-own) is a queer comic artist living in Indiana. She graduated in 2017 with a BFA in Drawing and Illustration from Herron School of Art and Design in Indianapolis. She is best known for self-publishing a webcomic called "Falconhyrste" with co-author Clara W. since 2016. She specializes in stories featuring women who love women. Her work has also been featured in anthologies such as Awesome 'Possum, Strange Romance Vol. 3, Lilies Anthology, and Recondite Hill Anthology. Backers have the possibility to not only get the print copy or digital edition of S.P.I.R.I.T. Issue #1, but can also select additional rewards. Digital rewards will be emailed when the book is sent to the printer. Here are the available tiers: Funding from this project go towards Kickstarter fees, paying the artist, production of the books and rewards, and shipping. The first five pages have been completed and the rest will be completed after successful funding of the kickstarter. We have more rewards available to our backers if we fund! Once we are funded the remaining pages will be created. This will take about 90 days. We will be working with Comix Wellspring (division of Greko Printing). Our previous print run was with this printing company, and we received great customer support and high quality prints. Each physical reward will be ready for shipping by November 2019. Digital rewards will be distributed when the book is sent to the printer. We're glad to be able to share our story with you! If you enjoy what you see, we look forward to your support!

10 years ago, my life shattered. And this year, on the 10th Anniversary, I want to share my story Shattered at the biggest Fringe Festival in the world - the Edinburgh Fringe Festival! I need your help to get there! Shattered is a serio-comedy solo show that uses humor to heal. It's a fast-paced, comedic and heart-breakingly raw journey through dating, dysfunction and sexual devastation - told through the voices of 35+ characters. Shattered ultimately tells the story of one individual picking up the broken pieces of herself and putting them back together again. The Impact Shattered was created to explain the complex psychological fallout of sexual assault - a tragedy far too many people experience. Whether an audience member can (or hopefully cannot) relate to the story told, Shattered brings voice to the darkest parts of the one's experience and the power of the human spirit to rise again. You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00 1 in 5 women will be raped at some point in their lives (CDC, NISVS 2010 summary report) ....but, in actuality, the statistic is much higher because many rapes go unreported. Mine did. Want to read more about Shattered? Check out these glowing reviews and articles: NoHo Arts District: click here This Stage: click here VoyageLA: click here Next stop - Edinburgh Fringe Festival! With over 3,500 shows - the Edinburgh Fringe Festival is the biggest in the world and provides an unparalleled opportunity to showcase my work and story! Sexual violence is a global problem that does not discriminate. I cannot imagine the impact I might be able to have by performing my show 25 times at the Edinburgh Fringe July 31-Aug 26! August 2019 will mark the 10th year anniversary of the assault that I talk about in the show - so, for me, it's incredibly important to take Shattered to the Edinburgh Fringe Festival this year. The past can never be undone, but sharing my story is an opportunity to re-write August for the future and help others do the same. The Funds Taking Shattered to the Edinburgh Fringe Festival will require costs to perform and live for the month (theatre rental, promotion/marketing, fees, accommodations, etc.) I've invested what I can to fund the project, but will need an additional $10k to complete the obligations. Stretch goals - Anything raised above the initial $10k will go toward incentive distributions, plane tickets/per-diem living expenses, etc. Other Ways You Can Help Can't contribute? No worries! Here are some ways you can help: - Please comment, like and share the campaign! Every bit helps to engage people, raise awareness and support Shattered Follow @dianavarco and visit: www.supportshattered.com - Share your story! Talking about this topic attacks the cycle of shame and silence that allows it to occur again and again and again. - Take care of yourself - we all experience pain and deserve to heal!

Hello friends, philanthropists, theater lovers and moon landing aficionados! Join OYL Theater Company in supporting the development of a new play PIECES OF THE MOON by Nick Flint � an expansive project that examines the 1969 moon landing and the socio-political atmosphere that surrounded it. ABOUT PIECES OF THE MOON: PIECES OF THE MOON is a new theatrical event that parallels two sides of America during a paradigm shift. We examine the energetic rise of the Black Arts Movement beside the scientific marvel of touching the stars. This cosmically adventurous work draws on the personal lives of the three Apollo 11 astronauts alongside the life and music of Gil Scott-Heron... highlighting the vastly different experiences of America at the time: clashing economic and social priorities, the rise of the Black Arts Movement, and the collision of events that formulated the space race. The script merges pieces of historical text, including political speeches, sermons, poems, conversations, letters, phone calls, the lunar landing radio transcript, music, and song. We explore how connections and divisions between people and communities shape who we are, who we become, and how we are remembered. This will be a unique theatrical event featuring aerial acrobatics, live music, ballroom dancing and a diverse cast ranging in age from 12 to 70 years� PIECES OF THE MOON is a massive production with massive talent! Apollo 11 launches SUPPORT PIECES OF THE MOON: A serious study into the moon landing, the events surrounding it, and how we remember this historic event, PIECES OF THE MOON is a complex spectacle. After 3 development workshops, the participation of over 20 actors, an aerial showing at 5th Wall Studios in Brooklyn, and with the extraordinary support and partnership of Stages Repertory Theatre in Houston, TX and The Walton Arts Center in Fayetteville, AR, this project has exciting momentum. The funds raised from this Kickstarter campaign will cover the next phase of the show's development: an extended residency with our circus arts partners in the Fall of 2019; purchasing the first flying rigs for the show; two more script development workshops and marketing outreach to put together a regional tour. Creative workshops so far have brought Ethan Slater (Broadway: Lead in Spongebob Squarepants) and Adesola Osakalumi (Broadway: Lead in Fela!) together. Past workshops and future development costs for the project total over $80,000. And this is before we hit the final four-week rehearsal period prior to the Houston premiere. ANYTHING we raise above and beyond this campaign�s goal will go towards the production, and we hope that with your help we can both meet and exceed our goal! Neil Armstrong, Michael Collins, Buzz Aldrin WHEN, WHERE, & WHO: OYL has been developing PIECES OF THE MOON since July 2018. PIECES OF THE MOON will be directed by Ianthe Demos with Movement Direction by Natalie Lomonte. PIECES OF THE MOON will receive three readings at Walton Arts Center�s Artosphere Festival this June 19, 20 and 21. The cast includes Danny Bernardy, Xavier Davis, Nathaniel Kent, Christina Bennett Lind, Adesola Osakalumi, Cristina Pitter and Richard Saudek. More information HERE. The show will premiere in Houston at Stages Repertory Theatre in October 2020. October 2018 Aerial Workshop at 5th Wall Studios MORE ABOUT OYL: One Year Lease Theater Company (OYL) is a professional theater company based in New York City. OYL�s mission is to create bold, athletic new works of theater that draw on the power of collaboration � the group, the ensemble, the chorus � to express bold visions of our collective human experience. Our vision is to create experiences for audiences that transcend the ordinary, transport the spirit and embrace the magical. We are deeply passionate about the artform of theater and seek to inspire the next generation of creators through our educational programs. Over the last two years, OYL�s mainstage programming has focused on creating new work inspired by important historical events. By taking seminal moments in time and looking at them from varying perspectives we throw into question our collective memories, amnesia, and responsibility to the past. We hope to initiate and support important inter-generational and cross-cultural conversations through the theater. OYL�s work has been critically acclaimed as �first rate young actors� (Charles Isherwood, The New York Times), �theatrical witchcraft� (Scott Brown, New York Magazine), �riveting theater� (Ed Siegel, Boston�s NPR), �fiery and fantastical� (Eric Sundermann, Village Voice), �screams of novelty� (Alexandra Villarreal, Huffington Post), �playfully poisonous� (Terry Byrne, Boston Globe), �a gleaming portrait of our collective contemporary existence� (Andy Propst, American Theater Web), �a celebration of theatrical energy� (Gerald Berkowitz, The Stage), "a captivating, visceral spectacle" (Morgan Kinney, Houstonia Magazine), "exquisite" (Suzanna Bowling, Times Square Chronicles). OYL has received two Drama Desk nominations in NYC as well as a Stage Award at the Edinburgh Fringe Festival. In addition to our work in NYC we run an Annual Apprentice Program for college students in northern Greece for a month every summer, alongside our company residency. Visit www.oneyearlease.org for more information on our productions and programs. Our gratitude to: The Muse at 350 Moffatt Street, Brooklyn for allowing us to tape our interviews for the above video in their space. 5th Wall Studios, Brooklyn for the aerial workshops. Gene Gallerano and Christina Bennett Lind for donating their talent and time to film and edit this campaign video. Olivia McGiff for creating the moon graphic at the top of this page.

I am raising money to publish my first book, and maybe even go on to publish a series. I want to be able to do this before my grandmother, who's my biggest supporter, passes. I love writing and it's what my world revolves around. The rewards I included are things I don't sharing. The rough draft of the first five chapters will give readers a sneak peak as to what is to come. The character sheets are for readers to get to know the characters a little better before they read the book. The book is titled "The Noblest" and it is a supernatural story. The description is: "The Lancaster family is notorious for being the strong werewolf bloodline. With the death of both of her parents, Annabelle must keep order among the supernaturals and continue to remain secret to the majority of the human race as the only child and daughter her father ever had. With both worlds beginning to clash, Annabelle Lancaster must do her best to restore harmony and contentment. To fight this battle, she enlists help from her half-brother, twin vampire and werewolf brothers, an assassin witch, and an entire demon clan."

About the musical: In this dark yet whimsical exploration of food, fitness, body image, and metabolic endocrinology, middle-school-aged Maria completes her health project with help from her chronically-dieting mother, all of your gym friends, and a human liver�s rhythmic visit. Schedule: Thursday, July 11, 6:45 PM Sunday, July 14, 3:45 PM Thursday, July 18, 8:45 PM Sunday, July 21, 6:30 PM Saturday, July 27, 7:00 PM Sunday, July 28, 4:00 PM Who do you think you are? I'm Mary Beth Gayle and I like to be called MB. I started writing this musical in 2017 around the same time that I started my master's degree in Obesity and Weight Management because I wanted to find a way to make metabolic endocrinology accessible to everyone. Because people are inundated with conflicting health advice every day, beginning from an early age, it can be difficult to find good information.

Where did this project come from? - I am an instagram blogger (@BeStrongWithNataly/@fit.mom.natalia) and a while ago I decided to start hosting group fitness courses with prizes for best participants. This idea got so popular so I decided to create unique interactive platform for such fitness competitions & challenges in mobile app. Is not it great to get rewarded with cash & prizes for fitness results? My product is a Female Fitness Game in Mobile App, it is already developed and launched for Russian speaking community of the globe in July 2018 (you can search for 4FitnessGirls in iOS/Android App Store or visit www.4FitnessGirls.com, and now I do localization of the product in the USA market. Many more features to develop in the future, but current product is already valid to be used for first app users. My plan & schedule? - Right now I am looking to do localization of the app and kick-off the ground CPI marketing campaign, it would be enough to start generating revenue in the USA market and re-direct it again to new marketing campaigns. Moreover, I am in Berkeley, CA startup incubator called The Batchery and demo day where I will pitch to potential investors is June 12, so anything could change dramatically and fly up to the sky after that. What�s my budget? - Product is developed in Russian language, localization and kick-off marketing campaign will cost 2000$ and 3000$ respectively. Yes, it seems to be a small amount of money compared to what I've already spent on development and production, but it is a reality of startup. Why I care? - This project is my "baby" for the last 2 years. I am mom of 2 small kids and this project is actually my third kid, believe it or not. I cannot wait to show everybody all the features that I've developed and let everyone to try unique product that will motivate, support and help to not just start fitness and healthy lifestyle journey, but also to move on and on. Who is Olena? Olena (creator of this kickstarted project) is my mom, she helps me with setting up my application inn the USA market and get things going.

MISSION STATEMENT To develop a troupe of collegiate theatrical artists who engage in performing arts peer education. VISION STATEMENT We envision a collective run entirely by college students where theatrical knowledge can be shared, peer-to-peer, to foster a motivated, versatile education in the arts. THE HOLE IN THE MARKET Before we come of age, summertime performing arts education is abundant in the greater Burlington area with programs such as Flynnarts and Very Merry Theatre. Upon graduation, the opportunities to participate in a musical over the summer cease, unless we book professionally in one of the three regional theaters that operate during the summer: Northern Stage, Skinner Barn, Lost Nation, all of which require a lengthy commute from Burlington. Verdantrics� productions will open up close-to-home opportunities for every kind of student who enjoys working in the theater, be it backstage, at the light booth, designing the set, choreographing a few numbers, or performing in the musical itself. Unlike all other Burlington area educational summer theatre programs, participation is free. Verdantrics understands the hefty financial burdens put on college students, so we�re striving to provide a space where we can educate each other using the skills learned at our various universities free of cost. GOALS IN THE SHORT TERM, Verdantrics is producing 35mm: A Musical Exhibition to establish ourselves in the community and teach ourselves what it takes to be local producers. Next year, we hope to put on a musical with a bigger troupe and continue gathering a diverse range of college student interest. IN THE LONG TERM, we hope to pass on ownership of Verdantrics to fresh college students when we earn our degrees to ensure the company�s peer education aspect remains and flourishes. At that point, we can provide mentorship in producing while passing the torch down to the next generation of the troupe. The creativity and ambition of the collegiate mind is immortal! FOR FUNDRAISING, we have a budget goal of $10,000. Our wonderful sponsor PCC has offered us a challenge grant: For every dollar raised, it will be matched up to $5,000. That means every cent you donate is worth twice as much! Our goal here on Kickstarter is only $1,000 to ensure that we reach it and can access our funds, as Kickstarter has funny rules about that. But if you or anyone you know is interesting in contributing more, just shoot us an email at verdantrics@gmail.com to talk more! DISCLAIMER: If you donate in one of the categories that have prizes, please email us letting us know who you are and what you donated, otherwise we will not be able to contact you to arrange your thank-you gift(s). Kickstarter does not share donor's information with the project creators.
