ALOE VERITAS In a Nutshell Aloe Veritas is an online publication that will feature articles, essays, poems, photos, artworks and other forms of creative expression that celebrate, defend, and seek to heal all beings that share this environment -- this small blue-green dot in the vastness of space that we call Mother Earth, our home. Aloe is a miraculous healing plant (not a cactus but a member of the lily family) that many people see as a symbol of peace, healing and gentleness. It is therefore a perfect symbol for a publication that seeks to reach out and mitigate against harm and oppression of all beings of the earth, particularly for those who cannot speak for themselves -- marginalized and underrepresented people, all animals and the environment. And we will be placing a very strong emphasis on Food and everything about Food, from growing to preparing to eating to celebrating -- and all completely vegan. This magazine will be a Foodie's delight! Please check out our website at: Aloe Veritas - Arts and Letters Of the Earth More About Who We Are And Why We're Here We believe that perpetrating the harm and suffering of animals, even those we call 'livestock', is deeply immoral and unnatural to human beings. Meat production is totally unnecessary, never has and never will mitigate against poverty or starvation, and now cattle grazing is proving to be the largest environmental threat the earth has ever known. The amazon forest -- the lungs of our planet -- is daily being whittled away to make room for more and more cattle. And all the while these worldwide herds are producing methane gas and other pollution problems that are far more destructive to the atmosphere than fossil fuels and other industrial emissions combined. So far, corporations and Big Agriculture have been very successful at hiding these facts. Further, Aloe Veritas is predicated on the understanding that history has proven that once the killing and consumption of animals is accepted as normal, then oppression, murder and even genocide of people is a concomitant. The two are never separate. The same disdain for life and willingness to harm and consume or oppress animals (human and non-human) leads inevitably to the third element: the drive to exploit and destroy the environment that sustains us all. When caring and empathy have been turned off, no one matters anymore and nothing is safe from harmful exploitation, not even the earth itself. Therefore we see veganism not as an ancillary issue, but as an understanding of life that is paramount and primary. The vegan worldview can provide a vast umbrella under which new ideas and ways of living and thinking can be nurtured and created. True, whole societies and their economies will have to change, but within the rubric of loving and protecting Mother Earth and all who live within her is a great fertile expanse of amazing possibilities! Aloe Veritas and the growing vegan movement heralds not so much the end of an old way of life, but the beginnings of incredible new ways to love, experience, grow, create, learn and live in harmony with all other beings -- human and nonhuman-- on our beautiful planet. Grandmother Tree of Aloe Veritas What We Will Cover Aloe Veritas is therefore not a narrow perspective but a wide open field. We will cover broad range of topics, most certainly Food in all its aspects: political, social, aesthetics, availability -- including recipes, cooking, gardening, farming, restaurants, and any art forms that celebrate food. And we will cover the economics of food and food production and all things that affect the economic interactions of people, animals and the environment. The rights and preservation of all animals that we share the earth and the environment with will be examined and investigated. And we will cover the environment itself, the various pollution problems, the power struggles, the politics, and the stories of hope, improvement and success. Aloe Veritas will also devote coverage to the rights and issues of human beings, and include the viewpoints of Feminism, the LGBTQI movement, inequality studies, the black lives matter movement, and all voices that speak out against discrimination in all its hydra-headed forms. All of these groups and viewpoints essentially address the same destructive greed and inhumanity that is threatening to destroy all life on earth as we have ever known it. Aloe Veritas will feature and share in the arts, literature, journalism, non-fiction, films, podcasts, music and live performance -- any form of creative expression which honors and heals the earth. Artists, authors, performers and freelancers will be encouraged to send us their work. We may have to start out without much ability to pay contributors but our goal is to become able to pay according to industry standards for high quality contributions as soon as possible. We will always have a home for great humor, including satire and other types of comedy and comic writing, review and art. We hope to have our own cartoonist someday... And we will be willing make space for differing points of view and those who disagree and will include a "letters to the Editor" section and an op-ed forum. Reader collaboration, feedback, and participation will always be encouraged. Funding and the Future Once we are funded, Aloe Veritas will transform from a blog site to an online magazine platform which will include a professional, fully functional website which will be monetized and capable of accepting donations, and it will accept and process paid subscriptions to the magazine. We may accept paid advertisements that align with our mission and principles and we may display unpaid notices and public announcements from organizations and entities on a similar basis. We do intend to partner with seller(s) of Aloe and other products and will offer a "Store" page on our site. We also intend to sell books (in partnerships) and other items that relate to veganism, or are of interest to our readers. These partnerships will generate commissions on sales that will provide ongoing funding for Aloe Veritas, to be used mainly for the purpose of supporting the website and ongoing production of the magazine; and this will enable us to pay contributors who provide material (written, visual graphics, or other media) for this publication. Aloe Veritas will follow the nonprofit organizational model and will seek grant funding from various sources on a continuing basis. We will also recognize, reward and thank all of our supporters, subscribers and funders to the best of our ability, including a "Friends of Aloe Veritas" page and other forms of recognition throughout the magazine and throughout the year.

Hello, I�m Enrique Estrada and I live in El Salvador, I have been flight dispatcher, instructor and performance engineering in an airline for about 18 years. With my friend Gustavo Cruz who lives in Los Angeles and works as autoparts seller in North Hollywood, want to show you our project. Enrique Estrada The purpose of this project We want to create an ecological system that include a natural reserve and a bees sanctuary to stop bees extinction and reforest the planet. did you know... That May 20th is the international day of the bees designated by the UN? That bees are the most valuable insect of the earth and whitout them 90% of the food would not exists? That bees pollinate more than 170,000 species of different plants? According to forbes article that is pointing Morgan Freeman�s effort to preserve bee lives creating a sanctuary in his property in Mississippi, we want to emulate that project here in El Salvador, the project is called SAVE THIS WORLD. Bee sanctuary Save this world Natural reserve How was this idea born? have you seen all consequences due global warming and climate change? according with UN we are about to face the sixth massive extinction of species, and in this occasion it is totally caused by human being actions..could you believe that? In danger due global warming We are creating very awesome projects, that I�m sure will succeed But...what is the use of having a lot of money if in a near future we won�t have a place to enjoy it? It is supposed that we have kids, brothers,wife, husband, parents right? If so..this project should matter to you also. How do you call this pic? Happiness could be? What do we have? As we already have the defined area to do this project we have began all steps to legalize it with correspondent Salvadorians authorities (MAG, MARN) That process is practically done. It means that we have the basics to begin. through MARN, We already have an agreement also with major universities who will provide us engineering, veterinaries and biologist to initiate the project and count in that way, with professional support To establish bases and begin with the project as planned. What do we need? Since we already have the designated area and support from local authorities, we need funds to start implementing all the steps to realize this system. How will it be implemented? During the rest of 2019, we must secure the area to reforest, and the area for bees sanctuary it means two perimeter inside one. June 2020, at this time we must have at least 55 bee hives already installed in the reserve, and the well trained staff to take care of them. Details like the kind of wood to use for the bees house,temperature, location, must be take in account. Bee hives September 2020, at this time, we must have at least 3500 trees already planted and distributed into the reserve, the trees to include will be: conacaste, caoba, cedro, funera, ceiba, amates and fruit trees to feed wildlife in the reserve. At least 6 kind of trees planted November 2020, at this time we pretend to finalize an artificial lagoon to collect water during winter, and using it during summer as contingency. Artificial lagoon taking care of lanscape November 2020, building to have all staff related with reserve must be finalized, stuff as tools, fertilizers, equiptment etcetera.(suministre center) January 2021, as this is the first project to implement around the world the privilege must be for local people, for that reason and as a social service, we will train three local guys to learn french english and german, to attend tourists in the future from diferents parts of the world, that want to visit our reserve. Local people must be educated about this project and the importance of having this kind of project in their city. To such a degree that all local habitants feel proud and know the value that this treasure has. as you can see SAVE THIS WORLD is a project for all the planet. Trilingual kids! February 2021, reserve must be finalized and all steps done as planned. Natural reserve and bees sanctuary Additional requirements. To start working with this project, we need to hired staff as: forest rangers, farmers Equipment for staff (tool, binoculars, radios vhf, lamps, uniform, bicycles, vehicles , projector,video cameras, etcetera.) Build a suminister center, to collect and store all fertilizers, tools computer and all stuff related with reserve. Supply center Hire a language teachers as social service for the local communities and prepares them to the visit of foreign tourists. What will you receive as a reward? -A picture with our logo signed by our Salvadorian vice president on behalf our president Nayib Bukele. Felix Ulloa Salvadorian vice president Our Salvadorian president Nayib Bukele Ortez -According to local autorithies MARN and MAG, the reserve will appear in the maps for android and IOS apps, this is to guarantee that reserve exists, is legal and finished. -Monthly status by mail of how the process goes, until it ends(pictures and videos) Once project finalized, we will make a written acknowledgment, wich will be in the entrance of the reserve, to show to the world the names of kickstarter sponsors motivational message by Morgan Freeman�s. (What about if I tell you that Morgan Freeman would come to this inauguration?..I will invite him to El Salvador, I do not promise nothing but...everithing could happen ;) An acknowledgment like this We have to understand that at this moment save this world, is not an option..is an obligation come on Kickstarters!!! Let�s save this world�! I�ll see you very soon. Rene y Enrique.

Giorgio drawing an engine Giorgio Piola�s career started as a bet between brothers. A friendly challenge to settle the debate as to who�s illustrations were strong enough to be published in the leading motorsport magazines of the era. Giorgio won, racing headfirst into a career analyzing the technical designs of Formula 1 cars and quickly taking pole position in a journalistic area that didn�t exist before him. His amazing artwork skills that have allowed millions of fans around the world to better understand Formula 1. Giorgio and Colin Chapman For the last 50 years, and after a record breaking 814 Grand Prix covered, Giorgio has profiled every change in design and engineering for every car on the grid. In a sport where victory is determined by mere hundredths of a second, it is often the most minute change that makes all the difference. Giorgio interviewed by journalists Giorgio�s trained eye allowed him to painstakingly recreate and document each new design without missing a beat. He studied ground effect aerodynamics, passionately recreated the designs of the infamous, hell-raising V12 engines with poetic precision and documented the integration of the now commonplace carbon fiber chassis. Suffice to say, there is nothing Giorgio hasn�t seen. Giorgio at Ferrari's box with Gilles Villeneuve Giorgio�s F1 career began at the 1969 Monaco Grand Prix and he simply hasn�t stopped drawing since. He invented a new method of covering Formula 1, and has a unique perspective on the development of the sport. Giorgio's drawings are his legacy; his dream is to make them last for many more years and to go beyond the pages of magazine and websites. This dream inspired the 50 years collection: A series of 12 hand-picked drawings selected from the thousands that make up his archive. These drawings tell the story of Formula 1 over the last five decades. They depict not only the cars and engines, but the creativeness of the engineers and the solutions they brought forward to gain an edge in the ultra-competitive world of F1. These drawings make the perfect set to decorate the living space, office or garage of any Formula 1 fan. The collection is offered in three options each with its own advantages. Made of 100% cotton paper, these prints are robust and have a natural texture that make the colors more vivid. With Gyclee printing and the use of archival ink, the quality is guaranteed. Because these prints come unframed, they give customers the flexibility to be creative in displaying these drawings and also allow for an affordable price point. Sample of T-Shirts The printing is done through direct to garment printing or DTG. This is a process of printing on textiles using specialized ink jet technology. DTG printers hold the garment in a fixed position and use specialty inks that are applied to the textile directly by the print head and are absorbed by the garment's fibers. Peace Through Art Hey Hey! My name is Shakira Shipman and I'm a visual artist from Middle of Nowhere, NC who currently resides in Raleigh, NC. "Fragmented" 18x24 Acrylic on Canvas I've been painting and drawing since I could properly hold a brush and pencil. Art and pictures have always been a lot easier for me to grasp and understand than words. I used painting as a release from the loud, and sometimes aggressive, forces of the outside world. More importantly, I believe my work offers a degree of healing and peace for the people who look at it. I think it is very important that people surround themselves with art and beautiful pictures because it offers a mental reprieve from the constant onslaught that is daily life. "Cancer" Acrylic on Metal [Custom Christmas present for a friend] "Forest Friends" Pencil and Colored Pencil on Paper [Custom Christmas present for a friend] "Spider-Dou" 9x12 Acrylic on Black Canvas [Custom Christmas present for a friend] I've been dabbling in custom portraits and pictures for people I know, but until very recently I didn't share the works that I did on my on time,for me. Now that I am, people are interested in putting my art in their homes and that blows my mind. I just want to be able to share what I do en masse with the people around me. "An Unintentional Series: Fragmented, Stifled, Scattered, and Detached" 18x24 and 16x20 Acrylic on Canvas So, I've decided to create a website and buy the supplies necessary to sell my art to people. I could very well sell the individual canvases but I've seen a demand from multiple people for single pieces and I believe that anyone who wants to own it should be able to. I plan on purchasing a professional grade printer, paper, and inks so that I can make custom prints, on demand, and not have to worry about outside printing companies (which can be expensive and time consuming), and to set up my own website to sell from. Since I am constantly coming out with new paintings, the website would always have a steady flow of new art to select from, as well as the assurance that all old work will stay there until I am no longer able to distribute it. "Sweet Dreams Series" Graphite, Ink and Acrylic on Paper My short term goal, which you would be helping me to accomplish, is to be able to sell the prints from my home, but also to display and sell them at art shows and galleries in my area. Raleigh specifically has First Fridays every month, and I'd love to one day be able to participate. I've also been that told I should start a zine, and have been putting in place plans to do so. I'd like to make a sort of art collective of my friends and local artists in my area to help not only spread their work, but offer a peaceful project for them to work on every few months. My long term goal, however, is to be able to open up my own little shop/work studio/gallery. It would be a space specifically for me to express myself artistically and also for people to come to engage with and enjoy my work. The steps that I am beginning to take today will hopefully lead me to that long term goal. "Pomme" 9x12 Acrylic on Black Canvas Painting is something I have been doing for a long time, and something I know I will continue to do until I no longer can. It is also the most reliable source of income I can think of, after a regular hourly job, because I know that I will always be putting out work. I will say that selling my art will never compromise the quality because I do this first and foremost for myself. And in the words of the Joker "If you're good at something, never do it for free."

Since starting my small business in 2017, I have been hoping for a brick and mortar location. This spot is central to downtown Lakeland, right in the heart of the farmer�s market area within great foot-walking traffic on the corner of Bay St. and Kentucky. The building will be open to move in on June 15th and I still cannot believe it! Another incredible business, Honeycomb Bread, will be moving in as well, utilizing the bar space in the back of the building for their delicious handmade bakery goods. Our dream for the space: Lakeland does not have a destination spot like Twenty Seven & Honeycomb will be. The shop will be full of paper goods - greeting cards, art prints, notebooks, wrapping paper, party supplies, etc. It will feature a variety of local makers� work, some little home decor items, and vintage accessories. Honeycomb Bread will be making an amazing menu - for everyone to cuddle up with fresh-baked bread and a cup of tea. We are thrilled to host live music nights, workshops, and outings that cultivate community in downtown Lakeland. We believe Lakeland will be so richly benefitted from this retail space - and we cannot do it without your help! I ask that you would consider contributing to this project to bring sunshine and hope to Lakeland. This is my dream, and I have worked so hard for so long to reach this point. I am so incredibly grateful to so many who have supported me since the start. I�m ready to give you a retail spot of dreams! With the $12,000, we will be: � painting the interior walls � installing new lighting fixtures � furnishing the shop with seating and shelves � purchasing a large inventory of my designs, and wholesale items from other creators (local & beyond) � filling the shop with it�s basic needs - cleaning supplies, a register, speakers, etc. Thank you so much for your support in making this dream a reality! Get ready for a lot of yellow!

To understand my story I will have to take you back a little bit. A couple of years ago I became a caregiver for my father, who was 86 at the time, was recovering from two strokes. While sitting watching TV one night a commercial for visit Australia came on and he said "I always wanted to go there and now I never will." The sadness and longing in his voice hit me hard. I looked over and told him, "Dad, I will make it there for us. I will take a picture of me holding a picture of you and call you and tell you we made it." At that moment I decided that I don't want to be that person who said they always wanted to and never did! From there my adventure to travel the world relying on a tight budget and small pockets began. My Father and I In 2018, I was able to fulfil this promise on my half year trip around the world. I made it to Australia, with the help of my friend Mike from Australia, I took that picture and called my Dad, who is now 92, and said "Dad, we mad it!" It was emotional to say the least! I will never forget that moment overlooking Sydney Harbor. My picture with Dad in Sydney Harbor Calling my Dad from Sydney Harbor Chapter two: Creating a Travel Series While on my second trip on the Camino De Santiago across Spain, I met an amazing group of people from South Africa that were filming a series on Camino called Elders Die Camino. I ended up being in a few episodes and we quickly became friends bonding over traveling, videography, and good food. Kobus and I in Johannesburg, South Africa On the same trip that took me to Australia, Kobus, the camera and drone pilot for the Elders Die Camino series, hosted me in South Africa. During my three week stay there we began to chat about a true budget travel series that would that would not only feature our travels, tips on how to travel with limited resources, as well as showcasing others who decided to live their dreams! Without giving away too much it would be a true budget travel series showing how to travel cheap for those with small budgets. From staying in Hostels to BnB's and more. Taking public transportation, trains and buses to get around and also interviewing someone in each location who decided to live their dreams like me no matter what it is. They would talk about the steps they went through to live their dream and to encourage more people to do the same. This would be a series unlike any other travel series on TV or streaming. We have so many possible ideas to make this very different from fan interaction on episodes and more. Now all we need to do is get the team together, plan out the locations based off of the budget and make it happen! This is where you come in! With your help we can get the team together and film pilot episodes that would later be presented to streaming and TV services to hopefully help this dream be realized. To show people they can live their dreams if they choose to and we can all experience this beautiful world together! Come along this journey with us and thank you for your help and support! I would like to introduce you to the Backpacker Mike team: Kobus Zietsman (Motion camera/Drone pilot/Director) I am a video professional with 16 years industry experience in videography, directing and editing. I have worked on projects ranging from corporates, news, music videos and wildlife, specializing in documentary and reality. As a freelancer with a passion for travel and visual storytelling I have had the opportunity to work on various projects that have taken me all over the world. https://kzietsman2.wixsite.com/kobuszietsman Patrick King (Still Camera/Drone pilot) The simple truth is that I stumbled into photography during university. I was studying Meteorology at the time, but the desire to create images hit me like a ton of bricks, but somehow I was in love with the impact. During the early days of my love affair with the camera I lived in a rural village teaching mathematics and life skills to high school students. During that time I was incredibly lucky to travel on a shoestring to neighboring countries in Southern Africa. Once the honeymoon was over it was time to get a real job. That job was in Washington D.C. and involved photographing businessmen and women, politicians and even the administration of the US at that time. The next decade of my career would include travel to 5 continents for photo assignments. I focus most of my energy on jobs related to lifestyle in the travel and hospitality industry. I reside in Cape Town with my wife, two energetic daughters and two four-legged, furry canines. Of course they hate seeing me getting into the Uber on the way to the airport for the next assignment, but that seems like the norm these days. www.patrickwking.com Jessica Garrett (Marketing Director) I am a creative director with over 10 years of digital art, web design and marketing experience for a wide range of clients. I work closely with clients to capture and successfully execute story branding. I work with Backpacker Mike on branding. I am also an avid traveler and enjoy many of the National Parks in the USA.

The Miyako Map The Inspiration There remains an unjustified dearth of illustrative Kyoto maps in the world, as it is a cultural and historical powerhouse. When I moved to the old capital of Japan three years ago to teach at junior high school, I searched online to buy a detailed black & white street map of the city to decorate my room. But, there were none to come by. Poster companies tended to sell detailed street maps of only the world�s most famous cities, such as New York City, Paris, and London. So, I decided to make a Kyoto map of my own! Thus, the Miyako Map was born. As I now prepare to finish work and leave the country, I see the Miyako Map as my sort of love letter to Kyoto - my adopted home and the beating heart of Japan of old. (Miyako, meaning �capital� in Japanese, is an endearing name often used by the Japanese people to refer to Kyoto City - Japan�s old capital for over 1,000 years before the relocation of power to present-day Tokyo.) The Process I did not trace the map. Referenced from guide books and Google Maps, every shape was measured proportionally by ruler and drawn by hand and eye. Johan, a good friend of mine and a professional architect, kept pushing me to detail the map further and further despite my impatient desire to be done with the project in its less detailed stages. Once I overlaid the pencil with Staedtler pigment-liner pen, I had myself a completed black & white Kyoto map! However, I had come this far (thanks to Johan's persistence). So, I decided to go all in and bring the map to life with watercolor. Half a year after the first pencil mark, I finally put on the finishing touch of watercolor. More than just an illustration of Kyoto, this project bears the marks of me continuously exceeding my initial targets. When I ride my bike down the Kamogawa River to enjoy cherry blossoms, hike up Daimonji Mountain for a sweeping view of Kyoto, or wander the alleys of Kiyamachi to grab dinner with friends, I can envision in my head the corresponding ink lines on the Miyako Map. I do hope that the finished product will inspire you to wander through Kyoto someday and take in its sights, if you haven�t already. The Design The Miyako Map features 95 temples and shrines, 14 universities, the 6 bonfires from Kyoto's mountain fire festival, major rivers and small streams, all above-ground train lines, the Imperial Palace, Nijo Castle, UNESCO World Heritage sites, and several national treasures detailed with watercolor paint. Since the pen work is neither computer generated nor traced from a model, the streets, buildings, and mountains all contain my unique touch and vision. I encourage anyone familiar with Kyoto to find a side street or alleyway on the map that does not exist � I am confident my commitment and eye for detail has left nothing unmarked in the city limits. Kyoto�s very distinct and charming four seasons are due largely to its location in a basin. As such, you can see topographical lines that detail the mountain ranges circumscribing the city to the north, east, and west. The estimated 300 hours of work turned into not only a meditative experience, but also an in-depth study of Kyoto�s rich history. From founders of universities to destroyers of castles to preachers of Buddhism, history-altering figures left their mark on this city and this map. About Your Miyako Map You will receive a color 18 x 20 inch print of the Miyako Map. It is printed on Washi Kozo paper, which is made in Japan from Kozo fibers. The company that I have partnered with, Photo Innovation Lab, uses the Inkjet �Gicl�e� process - which provides archival quality and detailed image reproduction. The product will be shipped to you in a tube. Once you flatten out the map, we recommend that you frame it for your viewing pleasure and to ensure it remains undamaged. Send me an email and I will sign it with my signature and my Japanese crimson ink seal. Why Kickstarter The purpose of this Kickstarter is to raise funds to create high quality prints and get them into your hands. In the near future, I also hope to establish an online store to offer my work to other appreciators of cartography, lovers of Japan, and the people of Kyoto. I am currently working on a map of my neighborhood in Kyoto, known as Nishijin, as well as my own renditions of Berkeley (my old college town), Los Angeles (my birthplace), and Geneva (my future home for the next two years). With your support, I will have the means to manage my own website and design maps of new cities in the future. I even look forward to making maps of your requested cities someday. I hope to give the walls of your living space a map that is worthy of being the centerpiece.

The belief in reincarnation is as old as religion itself. Life thus becomes a purifying and learning step in the search for the liberation of the human essence (mind, soul, energy, �). After death, a new life in another body allows us to be better people. Thus, death is not the end but the beginning of a new stage, and that's the idea that inspired the artist to make these awesome designs. Death, considered as past life, is represented by the black suits while life, the promising present, is depicted in the red suits. Reincarnation Classic Deck Reincarnation Original Deck Despite the complete customization of the faces, the designs preserve the traditional pattern that makes the cards very recognizable and keep their play-ability. Two editions have been created for the campaign: CLASSIC and ORIGINAL. The CLASSIC edition uses a more colorful scheme with traditional colors (red, yellow, blue and black). Reincarnation Classic Deck Inner Cards The ORIGINAL edition is much more austere, almost monochromatic, with grayish and brown tones that give it an aged look. Reincarnation Original Deck Inner Cards Both decks will be printed by the USPCC in a limited print-run of 2,500 decks per edition. The tuck case of the ORIGINAL deck will be produced in-house by Gamblers Warehouse and will use gold foil. Kaz awakes from the trauma to find himself in another world�one in which his only way home is to forge peace in a place that has only known war for centuries. In Book One (now available at www.TheForeignerComic.com,) Kaz grapples to make sense of Ravenika and its dangerous surroundings. He is smaller and much more frail than others, making him vulnerable prey in the eyes of the kings and queens who will stop at nothing to take advantage of him in order to get what they want. Fortunately for Kaz, he befriends a mysterious shepherdess, Natya, who becomes his protector. King Acedia who rules Vlangskaar (northern kingdom), is protected by his Royal Air Force. King Ira has Geranika (southern region) is backed by fiercely loyal half-breed comrades. Finally, King Superbia who reigns over Sorendahr, (the east), commands a terrifying robot zombie army. Ravenika - A once peaceful land now plagued with chaos and destruction. As The Last War begins, King Acedia�s Royal Air Force is defeated and the walls of his kingdom have fallen. King Ira clings to life after a vicious and unexpected attack by Natya. King Superbia is just beginning his masterful plan to turn his brothers against each other. What happens now? Will Kaz find a way home? Will Superbia win? Will peace ever return to Ravenika? The only way to find out is to back The Foreigner: The Last War Kickstarter campaign beginning June 12 and make Book Two a reality. Backers successfully rallied to breathe life into The Foreigner: Book One. I am so grateful for everyone who helped make Book One a successful reality. Thank you so much! The remainder of the funds are allotted to help cover hired help, fees, and rewards. I've made many improvements since my first campaign with Book One. The script and art layouts for The Foreigner Book Two are done. Currently, about a third of the line art in Book Two is also complete. From award winning game designer Thomas Eliot (Cultists of Cthulhu*, Murder Most Foul) and illustrators Alexandra Latham and Maddie Kathleen (twitter, website) comes your new favorite 15-minute filler game about Silicon Valley startup acquisition. We've all heard the tales of incredible inventions and fabulous wealth coming out of Silicon Valley. But who is profiting the most from this? Is it the ingenious inventors? The savvy marketers? No - it's the venture capitalists who make the bets and reap the rewards! Now you too can enjoy the thrill of being a member of the 1% and gambling with your friends on what hot new startup will blow the competition out of the water and make you millions. Whether you're a baby boomer worried about your retirement funds, a millenial who's not even sure what "investing" means, an up and coming silicon valley entrepreneur who wants insight into the minds of the investors you're going to have to woo, or an actual VC who wants to unwind after a day of investing by pretending to invest, this is the game for you! Venture Capital is a complete game, ready to print and ship as soon as the campaign ends and your pledge goes through. Because the game is already in its final form, there are no stretch goals - you're definitely getting the complete experience! And because we're printing with the latest in Just-in-Time manufacturing technology, you will be able to print and ship your copy as soon as your pledge goes through. This is the same way we fulfilled Murder Most Foul and will fulfill the Enchiridion. DriveThruCards will then print your copy here in the USA and ship it directly to you. You'll pay for printing and shipping after the campaign, around $13-16 in the US. Venture Capital is a 15 minute bidding game for 2-6 players, with an additional solitaire mode. The game is played over 15 rounds: each round, all players bid on a given startup, and once all 15 startups have been acquired, the game ends. Whoever has built the most profitable portfolio is the winner! We also made a video of a complete game, though it turned out a bit blurry. Each player has a hand of 15 bidding cards, numbered 1-15, each of which will be played exactly once, representing the amount of money you're willing to invest in that startup - the startup founders will go with whoever offers them the most. The deck of 15 startup cards is shuffled, then the first startup is revealed. Each player selects a card from their hand to bid on it, places that face down, and when everyone has done so, the cards are flipped face up and the highest non-tied bid gets the startup. Then the next startup is revealed, and the game continues until all 15 startups have been bid on. Top, the backs of the other players' cards and the startup deck, middle, what your hand might look like a few rounds into the game, below, some startups Startups can have two attributes - a profit value (a number), and what industry they're in (Apps, Gadgets, or Services). Your score is the sum of the profits of all the startups in your portfolio, plus the Dominating the Industry bonus you get for each of the three industries. Count up how many startups you have in each industry, square it, and get that many bonus points! Most startups turn a profit and are in an industry, but there are also some which turn a profit but aren't in an industry, and some that are in two industries but don't turn a profit. The components of the game comprise 15 startup cards and 15 bidding cards for each of the six players, for a total of 105 cards, plus the rules and box. Examples of the various startups you can bid on And that's it! Simple to learn, tough to master, Venture Capital will have you coming back for more as soon as you finish your first game of it. But don't just take my word for it: click to see what else he's designed click to watch the full review click to watch the full review *Cultists of Cthulhu won "Best Indie Multiplayer Game of 2017" at DreamHack Denver's Indie Playground Why Kickstarter? How will this be manufactured? This is our fourth game and fifth project here at Sixpence Games. Our first two games, Professor Pugnacious and Cultists of Cthulhu, were manufactured using a traditional offset printing process - which means they were made in China, it took several months to manufacture them, more months to ship them to the USA, and then yet more time to ship them out. While this meant access to bulk discounts, it also meant that the manufacturing process and cost were slow and subject to unpredictable delays and expenses - things like increased postage costs, upcoming tariffs on imports from China, etc. Starting with Murder Most Foul and continuing with The Enchiridion, we experimented with switching to using print-on-demand. This has several major advantages: it means that we can have a much shorter turnaround time for fulfillment (hence our promise to start fulfilling as soon as the campaign ends), it makes manufacturing and shipping costs much more predictable, it means we aren't subject to the new 25% tariff that just got enacted, it means that we won't run out of any given product, and it means manufacturing jobs here in America, and less pollution from transatlantic shipping. (you can go buy Murder Most Foul right now, whereas if you want a copy of Professor Pugnacious or Cultists of Cthulhu you'll need to hunt one down at a retail store). Of course, this process wouldn't work with a big box game with lots of components like Cultists of Cthulhu, and that's okay - constraints like that breed creativity, and we think you'll really like what we've come up with, and what we're going to come up with next. The process for fulfillment will be that, after the campaign, each backer will receive a unique code that they can use to have a copy of Venture Capital sent to their address. Shipping and printing will be calculated then, and you'll pay it after the campaign - about $13-16 altogether in the US. This means that the total cost will be about $30 for a shipped copy of Venture Capital (more if you live outside the US). You can think of it this way - the amount you pledge here on Kickstarter is what will go to pay the designer and artists, while the amount you pay afterwards goes to pay the manufacturer and postal service. Thank you for your support!

I'm Reggie Mosby, Jr., a digital illustrator/graphic designer living near Seattle, WA. Thank you SO MUCH for stopping by to read my story. I love to create art. I have been drawing for as long as i can remember. I also have completed numerous amounts of commissions for clients. The one thing I have never done is host my own art exhibition. Therefore, this will be my goal for this year in November for Hip Hop History Month. The theme for the art show is: The Golden Age Hip Hop Art Expo (a free event, by the way) will consist of 30 digital and traditional art pieces celebrating the lives of female rap artists both the past and present. The concept and theme of the show is a marriage of true hip hop, and the Golden Age of Hollywood (the 1930s through the 1950s). It will have art pieces that will feature Queen Latifah, Missy Elliot, MC Lyte, and the like. The show will also have food, drinks, and entertainment; as well as a live auction segment. Preview of Missy Elliot FUNDING! It is not easy putting an art show together, let alone creating all of the art pieces, and I need your help. There are a lot of components that must be funded that, simply put, i can't afford it all myself: �Prints �Material �Space Rental �Videographer �Photographer �Event DJ �Catering �Promotion/Advertisement �Website As we are asking for support to reach our goal, we are offering a variety of THANK YOU's. Anything from prints to custom paintings/illustrations will be available once the goal is met. Preview of Eve If the project happens to surpass the goal and reach up to $15,000, all pieces created will be brought together as a small coffee table book. One hundred copies of the book will be made and given to the first one hundred backers of $60 or more. *ALSO, updates of the pieces and the process show will be shared with the backers. That's it! I really hope the goal can be made. As for us, we will do our best to make sure that all 30 pieces are completed. And when it becomes reality, we hope to see each one of you at the exhibition! Stay blessed!

Samples painted by Adam Sadler and Allyssa Perry. Miniatures come unpainted. Altar Quest is a cooperative game of fantasy adventure inspired by the classic dungeon crawling board games that many of us grew up with. Using the Modular Deck System (MDS), introduced in Street Masters and Brook City, the game features incredibly modular gameplay using several different types of decks. Hero decks, threat decks, villain decks, and quest decks can all be mixed and matched along with altar cards, feature cards, and other game elements to create countless combinations of unique adventures. With an engaging one-off experience and narrative campaign play, Altar Quest offers players endless adventure in a unique fantasy setting with years of support planned for the game. Whether playing an individual quest or part of a campaign, each quest is made up of a combination of several different decks and other game elements. Heroes must complete the goal set out by the chosen quest deck in order to win the game. They must overcome several obstacles during the quest determined by the chosen threat deck and villain deck, as well as the deck of lurker cards. If any hero is defeated, the heroes lose the game. All Original Fantasy Setting Altar Quest takes place mainly in a realm called Aridika�a land of high fantasy and Gothic horror. As players dive deeper into the game, they�ll learn about the deep lore and many mysteries that hide within the shadows of Aridika and the world of Rhuna. Designers Adam & Brady Sadler have been developing the world of Rhuna since their early days of playing Dungeons & Dragons, and are excited to share it and expand it with Altar Quest. Altars The world of Rhuna was created by powers called �rhunes��godlike essences that came together to create all existence. Mortals were never intended to wield the untempered powers of rhunes, so they were crystallized deep within the earth to keep the lands above in balance. Unfortunately, evil finds a way, and deep below Aridika where the lich queen Szera slumbers, the rhunestones have been corrupted and forced to the surface. These altars are worshipped by power-hungry opportunists that use the rhunic energies surrounding them to further their own nefarious plans� During each quest, the chosen altar card will constantly affect the state of the altar pool. The altar pool is made up of 5 altar dice that are rolled at the start of the quest. Each altar die has 6 unique sides, each one containing a rhune symbol. These rhunes are used by the heroes, as well as the enemies, to trigger special effects. After an effect is triggered by a rhune symbol, the altar die showing that symbol is rolled and the new symbol is added to the altar pool. Players will have to balance using their rhune effects with making sure they aren�t empowering the enemy too much. Incredibly Modular Featuring the versatile Modular Deck System (MDS) that the Sadlers first introduced with Street Masters, the variability of Altar Quest is one of its key features. Players will have a world to explore by mixing hero decks, villain decks, threat decks, and quest decks with fluctuating feature decks to keep the environments fresh. Players can create their ideal game scenarios by matching up decks of their choice, or leave it to fate and embark on a randomized quest! Truly Solo, Truly Cooperative Altar Quest features an elegant player scaling solution built into the core design of the game, which means one player can play the game as easily as up to four, with no exceptions or special rules. Three Great Ways to Play While Altar Quest is designed to be a satisfying one-off adventure, players can also embark on an epic campaign by linking their quests together, earning upgraded cards for their decks, finding new equipment, and facing new challenges with enemy upgrades. Additionally, stories allow players to explore the vibrant setting of Aridika by playing through a story deck using the campaign rules. For more information on the add-ons, click here. Show your support for Altar Quest by donning one of many avatars available here: https://www.blacklistgamesllc.com/altarquest Shipping Info Like our previous campaigns, shipping will be collected after the Kickstarter based on the actual costs incurred to ship, via our pledge manager after the campaign ends. This is so we can be fair to all our backers as shipping varies from region to region and doing so will allow us to provide more stretch goals for you during the campaign! Depending on what region you are in, we will ship from the following hubs: UK (for EU/UK backers), China (for Asia Pacific backers), Canada (for Canadian backers), Australia (for Australia and New Zealand backers) or Indiana (for USA and the rest of the world). The following is a list of rough estimates for shipping a standard game package (4kg or 8.8lbs volumetric weight). Keep in mind these are just estimates and costs may increase based on weight from unlocked stretch goals and/or any optional buys you get. USA: $10-$20 to most states. $50 to Alaska, Hawaii, and Puerto Rico. CANADA: $15-$30 to most cities. LATIN AMERICA: $70-$80 to most countries (see below). ASIA: $10-$15 to China, Hong Kong, and Singapore. $35 to most other countries. OCEANIA: $25-$35 to Australia and New Zealand. AFRICA: $95 to most countries. EUROPE: $20-$30 to most countries (see below). � $35 to Norway, Switzerland, Finland, Estonia, and Latvia. � $50 to Bosnia/Herzegowina, Croatia, and Iceland. � $70-$80 to Israel, Liechtenstein, and Serbia. Unfortunately, because of certain import laws and customs, we currently are NOT ABLE TO SHIP TO Afghanistan, Argentina, Brazil, Kazakhstan, Ukraine, Russia. If your territory is listed above we hope to be able to offer our product to you later at retail, but are unable to commit to shipping to these territories during the Kickstarter. THE LOOMING TARIFFS: We have spoken to our factory and shipping logistic reps and until anything officially changes, nothing will change or affect us cost-wise. If things do start having a financial impact, Blacklist Games, LLC will be absorbing what we can, so we can keep overall costs and shipping as familiar to what you're normally used to with our campaigns. If there are any increases at all, it will be minimal and only be set by any fulfillment costs outside of our control, since we do not intend to randomly up-charge our products for the sake of doing so. POST PLEDGE MANAGER NOTICE: Any pledges confirmed after our pledge manager deadline will be shipped from the US hub at a later date and will likely incur increased shipping costs since it would be out of our normal fulfillment cycle. For non-US backers that will likely incur import taxes as well. We also cannot ship to PO Boxes domestically or internationally due to the size of each package and the risk of the package being bounced back to us. Refund Policy We can refund you within 2 weeks (14 days) of the campaign�s end date, fees included. All refunds taking place within 14 days of the close of the campaign are reversed via Stripe to your credit card. After that, we will accept returns minus the Kickstarter and payment processing fees (which we cannot get back from them) up until our pledge manager is closed. At that point, refunds will no longer be possible. This project is being funded in USD and any refunds processed will be in USD for the exact amount received in USD, excluding any applicable fees depending on the time of the refund being processed.

So you know those shrines we all see driving down the roads? Have you ever wondered who put them up, or who was the person who it was erected for? Well I want to go around the country, photograph those shrines, get to know the person those crosses and other items represent. Give a face to them, and hear their stories as told by their family and friends. I will be using the funds to help me travel some, take pictures of the different shrines, talking to the families and friends.

Why Drip, Drop & Drizzle? The need to stimulate creativity among kids is at an all-time high because funding for arts education is at an all-time low. With cutbacks in arts education in schools, kids are not getting the opportunity to reap the many benefits offered by the creative arts, including greater confidence, focus and problem-solving skills. Sample Page This journal helps fill the gap by encouraging kids to express themselves artistically and using the written word. Here is what the research says: Americans for the Arts reports that art education is known to improve fine and gross motor skills, as well as the ability to focus, make decisions, take risks, persevere and generate a strong sense of self-confidence and resilience. The American Art Therapy Association says the creative process improves and enhances physical, mental and emotional well-being. So much so that speech therapists frequently borrow from their art therapy colleagues to assist children in strengthening their verbal expression. (Check out Speech Buddy for more on this.) PBS Parents, citing the same Americans for the Arts survey, states that �young people who participate regularly in the arts. � are four times more likely to be recognized for academic achievement, to participate in a math and science fair or to win an award for writing an essay or poem than children who do not participate.� Parents also receive value from their child's experience with Drip, Drop & Drizzle: The potential for even better lines of communication between you and your child, as a result of children being encouraged to express themselves about difficult topics. A memento of your child�s younger years, which you can then gift to him or her as they grow into adulthood. Quality time for your child away from digital screens and devices. Whether you actively engage in the journal together, or simply share quiet time as your child works in Drip, Drop & Drizzle and you read your favorite book, you're sure to both be enriched. Sample Page ABOUT ME My name is Mary Ostrowski. I�ve been an educator in both public and private schools in the United States and abroad for 18 years. I�ve worked in teaching and administrative positions with hundreds of students. Children of all ages tend to call me Ms Mary, and most know I love hugs! In addition to teaching children, I have mentored many teachers and supported even more parents through the joys and challenges of their children�s development. Today I own a small super cute preschool (you saw some of my students in the video above), write children's books, and am also in the process of developing a series of creativity workshops. This journal is a culmination of all I love about being an educator, an advocate for children, and a kid at heart myself. After all, speaking our truth and using our own unique voices is a lifelong journey. Why not help our kids embark on this journey as early as possible? This is the foundation of Drip, Drop & Drizzle. BEYOND THE BOOK Drip, Drop & Drizzle is just a beginning. Once published, it will form the centerpiece for a larger educational effort offered through my practice, Healthy Equation. Small and large group workshops bridging the gap between communication, social emotional growth and academic learning in creative writing will be designed in variation for: children groups parent groups groups of children and parents together Visit my website www.healthyequation.com to learn more. You can also follow us on Facebook and Instagram @healthyequation. Timeline

This is an appeal for art on a mission. I've been selected to contribute three larger paintings to a traveling museum exhibition focused on climate change which will reach thousands of people throughout the south and midwest. I need to obtain professional-grade crates for the work's shipping to Florida and the subsequent sites on the "tour," which hits six states through 2021. The shipping date is the first week of August, so I need to purchase and have the crates ready to go by then. Among the three works I've been invited to contribute (all of which use tar for its reference to industrialism and fossil fuels) is "Event Horizon," a 4 ft. x 4 ft. tar painting inspired by an AP news photo of the Deepwater Horizon oil rig explosion. Here's the painting: Event Horizon, 48" x 48," oil and tar on canvas I also need to ship "Event Horizon #2" (below), also based on news photos of the Deepwater disaster, as well as "Plume," a 4 ft. x 3 ft. tar painting evoking methane gas releases in the Arctic Ocean. Event Horizon #2, 20" x 30," oil and tar on canvas It's not enough to make the work. It needs to be in front of people concerned about humanity and our future. The exhibition, Environmental Impact 2, showcases contemporary artwork to hopefully raise awareness and spur action on the disastrous effects of global warming and mass species' extinction. We need climate-aware art not only to make the case for our peril, but to motivate action at all levels. The shipping crates alone will cost over $700. I also plan to travel to Asheville, North Carolina, the second stop on the exhibition tour. In Asheville, I'm seeking to arrange a gallery show of related work and set up a lecture at a local college or university, in which I'll share an extensive presentation on contemporary artistic responses to climate change. Please consider helping and forwarding this to others who might!

WE DID IT! WE DID IT!! THE PRIDE BIRD PROJECT IS FUNDED!!! Thank you all SO much for your contributions and pledges!!! I have always wanted to make these cute little pins to celebrate who we are, and it was YOU who let me live that dream!! HAPPY PRIDE MONTH!!!!! HOORAY!!!!! Let's keep it up until 12 AM on July 4!!! Let your colors soar!  Yo, my name is Astral! I'm a game design & illustration student from Florida who loves to make little goodies with my works!  About two years ago, I came to the conclusion that I was bisexual. It wasn't until April of 2019 did I come out to my immediate family, which took immense amounts of emotional strength. My life had been nothing but endless anxiety over the topic, until I heard with my own two ears that my family were accepting of me. To this day, I still can't believe I came out. I did it! Because of this milestone in my life, this June of 2019 is my first pride month out of the closet!! To celebrate this, all the wonderful folk I've befriended in the LGBTQA+ community, and all the closeted people hoping to someday find peace and strength, I decided to try my first ever enamel pins: Pride Birds! I have always adored birds, and they've become my symbol on the web! So, of course, I decided to mix my identity with my favorite thing. Enjoy these prideful birbs! Remember, you're loved and amazing, no matter your gender or sexuality! Even if you're not ready to take flight today, the sky will always be there for you. You're part of the flock! Not the writing utensils, or the feathers shiny and cute!  The Pride Birds enamel pins will be 1.5 inches/38 mm. They will all be hard enamel (flat), with varying plating dependent on the design. They will have one rubber clutch and come with a backing card. If funds allow, they will also be backstamped! Ooooh Aaaaah  Introducing the backer cards! Each lil birdie will come with their own little backer, to keep them safe and in the spirit! Each card is 3.5" by 2" matte cardstock! Let's get this bread(crumbs)!  Our first 4 designs are Gay Wren, Lesbian Pigeon, Transgender Chickadee, and Bisexual Budgie! These pins will be unlocked upon complete funding of the kickstarter!  Next we have Pansexual Finch and Asexual Parrot! These pin designs will be unlocked at $3000! All or Nothing  Next we have Non-Binary Hummingbird and Aromantic Crow! These pin designs will be unlocked at $4000! Two of my fav types of bird! More stretch goals may be added in the future!! If $4000 is reached, expect more pins, stickers, and more!  - JUNE 4: Project Launched! ...  - JULY 4: Project funding closed!  - JULY 15: Pin orders placed ...  - AUGUST (mid-late): Arrival of pins from manufacturer  - SEPTEMBER (mid-late): Shipping pins to you!  Pin production - 65%  Shipping + Supplies - 20%  Kickstarter fees - 10%  Buffer - 5% NOTE: Since this is my first pride month out as bi, I'd like to thank all of my wonderful friends, lgbt and ally, for all their support and love! And thank you for supporting a queer rising artist! You are loved beyond all measure and the universe welcomes you with open arms. You are perfect just the way you are. Thank you, for being you

Buttcracker producers Sara Jinks, Diana Cardiff (standing), Matt Mulkerin and Jana Hill. Luna Foto // Karen Garrett de Luna OUT WITH A BANG Behold, Buttcracker V...the last thrust! For the past five years, Buttcracker performances have brought hair metal, modern dance, and sold-out crowds together. And even though we always say �this year could be the final year,� well, this time, it actually is. In 2019, we're bringing new moves, old favorites, special guest performers, and all the glory of '80s rock n' roll one last time! We want to end this crazy Butt ride with a bang! BUT, and it's a big butt, before we can capture the Christmas spirit and regurgitate it back to you with reckless abandon, we need your help. Today, we're asking for $3,000 to help �take it to 11�! Images from Buttcracker IV...the Final Countdown! in December 2018. Photos by Casey Gainor and Jim Coleman After all, The Dingle Fairy needs a new dance belt. The fireplace needs wood. Santa�s chaps need replacing. The Ragdolls need their stockings filled, and we are in dire need of more �snow.� Your generous donation will pay for: Compensation for 20 professional dancers and crew. Renting Erickson Theater on Capitol Hill for TWO glorious weekends (Dec. 13, 14, 15 & 19, 20, 21, 22) In addition to: Fake fur Leather Glitter Spandex Whips Chains ...and much more! WHERE IT ALL BEGAN Producers Diana Cardiff, Jana Hill, Sara Jinks, and Matt Mulkerin created Buttcracker in December, 2015 � reviving the spirit of their wildly successful Buttrock Suites. This modern-dance performance series reached a fever pitch in the early 2000s. In 2005, The Seattle Weekly described Buttrock as �a hilarious-yet-heartfelt performance that will entrance both metalheads and fans of modern dance.� The Stranger�s David Schmader described the buttrock/modern-dance phenomenon this way: �Watching such physically eloquent, conceptually engaged dancers navigate the crude-by-design crunch of hard rock is a ridiculous thrill.� With well-known Seattle choreographers such as Alex Martin, Juliet Waller Pruzan, Crispin Spaeth, and the Buttrcracker producers, these shows consistently sold out Velocity, Bumbershoot, Neumos, and Triple Door, to name a few. A throwback pic of "Buttrock Suites" by Michael Doucett BACK TO THE MAIN POINT We know you love Buttcracker � the energy, the booze, the utter silliness. We love it, too. As SeattleDances wrote of our performance, "The spirit of the rock concert was alive and well ... this show may have been a tribute to sex, drugs, and rock �n roll, but it also successfully captured the communal spirit of the holiday season." So let's do it again. One last time. Let's bring back the performer/audience catharsis, the head-banging, and the holiday cheer with a twist that is... Buttcracker! Buttcracker images by Roy Anderson, Lance Mercer and Jim Coleman THE PRODUCERS Diana Cardiff is a critically acclaimed performer and choreographer from Seattle, Washington. She has created, produced, and performed in an original production called the Buttrock Suites since its inception in 2003. With Buttrock Suites, she was able to successfully express her flair for the dramatic. Diana was a founding member of d9 Dance Collective (1992-2004), has also been a member and collaborator with the Pat Graney Dance Company and Wade Madsen and Dancers. She toured nationally with the Pat Graney Dance Company and has set work for Ian Bell�s Brown Derby Series at Rebar, Teatro Zinzanni, Seattle Repertory Theater, LiveGirls! Theater, various musicals, etc. She has a BFA from Cornish College of the Arts. Sara Jinks has produced and co-produced work at the Merc Playhouse Theatre and with Methow Arts Alliance in the Methow Valley. She also produced Ten Tiny Dances in Seattle and Twisp in 2015 and will bring a new Ten Tiny to On the Boards this fall. Sara is the Production Manager to acclaimed choreographers Heather Kravas and Jody Kuehner/Cherdonna Shinatra. As a performing artist, Sara was a member of Pat Graney Company from 2000-2018 and danced extensively with Crispin Spaeth Dance Group and d9 Dance Collective. Jana Hill earned her professional dancing chops as a member of Mid America Dance Company (MADCO) in St. Louis, Mo. As a member of the company she performed, did assistant choreography and was rehearsal director for their annual holiday spoof �The MadCracker�.This irreverent take on the Nutcracker; brilliantly conceived by Ross Winter, with original music by Michael F. Hunt, was a huge influence on her creativity and choreography. Upon moving to Seattle became was a founding member of Rockhopper Dance and Buttrock Suites. When she�s not dancing, Jana enjoys making pretty gardens. And she also tries to wrangle to crazy genius of Matty. Matt Mulkerin started his dance career at the ripe old age of 21, after deciding degrees in Japanese and International Business were less financially lucrative in the real world. Matt has had the opportunity to dance in a whole bunch of places with a whole bunch of great people in his career, during which he performed with the Mid America Dance Company, and was a co-founder of both Rockhopper Dance and the Buttrock Suites. His largest audience to date (5,000 + people) was at the Walla Walla hot air "Balloon Stampede" in 1991, during which his performance was interrupted by an emergency evacuation due to a major gas leak that threatened to blow the venue up. He is very grateful for this, as it taught him to never take choreography too seriously, as you may just end up getting blown up. In addition to the four producers, Buttcracker will include performances by young whipper-snappers, as well as guest and VIP performers. Performers include: Richard Ayres, Becca Blackwell, Karen Garrett De Luna, Christopher Engelbrecht, Amy J Lambert, Ken Jarvey and Sarah Paul Ocampo. The Buttcracker V...the last thrust! is powered by Shunpike.

PLEDGE NOW, PAY AT THE PROJECT DEADLINE IF FUNDED! About the Kickstarter Hi! I'm Rosi, an artist with a presence across Tumblr & Instagram & Twitter. This is my third Kickstarter riding off the success of my second. You can find the pins from my previous Kickstarter here or see examples at the end of this page. For my last Kickstarter, I only expected to unlock four designs at most and we reached twenty-two! Please feel free to leave a comment on the Kickstarter after you've backed!  FREE STUFF Free charm for first 50 backers Free charm for every backer Your Pledge / FAQ How does Kickstarter work? Kickstarter works in a PLEDGE NOW, PAY LATER format. You won't be charged until the project deadline and are free to manage your pledge as you like until that day. After the project ends, there's a 14 day waiting periods for funds to reach me, after which pins will go intro production for 3-4 weeks. Shipping will take another week after that! When do I choose my pins? Backer surveys are sent through Kickstarter after the project deadline. You will input your shipping information and which pins you want depending on your pledge. You have ONE WEEK to respond to the survey after the project has ended! PLEDGE FOR THE AMOUNT OF PINS YOU WANT, NOT THE ONES ALREADY UNLOCKED. You help us reach the finish line faster that way. I am an Early Bird Pledge but I want more pins, do I have to change my pledge to a higher tier? Early bird is a benefit tier, you don't have to choose a higher tier to receive more pins INSTEAD what you do is go to Manage your Pledge and change your pledge amount to reflect the amount of extra pins you want. (+$7 per pin). Timeline May-June: Kickstarter takes place. June-July: At Kickstarter's end backer surveys will be sent out and production will begin for an estimated time-frame of 4-5 weeks after funds are received (14 days after the Kickstarter deadline). August: Shipping begins. Below are examples of pins from my last Kickstarter for the quality that you can expect! Pictures courtesy of @ladylokisbish on Twitter.

You Are Here Life can get kind of crazy sometimes. Whether you live to work or work to live, it's important not to lose yourself in all of the hustle and bustle. But sometimes you lose yourself anyway. Maybe you need a helping hand to find your way again. Maybe all you need is a small reminder that you're on the right path. These pins were made for anybody and everybody. Inspired by the compass, True North is a collection of stained glass pins adorned with elegant (but playful) hard enamel motifs. Commonly used in places of refuge and sanctuary, my hope is that the stained glass can remind you that you're still safe, even when you feel lost. I am very fortunate to be able to collaborate with the wonderful, the creative and the lovely Scribbles_With_Faces! It has been a pleasure to work with her to design these pins and I would be so happy to be able to make more beautiful things with her! Why Kickstarter? This project, as a concept, just felt right for a Kickstarter. Filled with positive and encouraging reminders to help guide their bearers through the day, it gave me goosebumps thinking about how wonderful it would be to see a project like this supported by a group of people instead of one. I simply didn't want to take credit for this by myself. And so, whenever someone wears one of these pins, it is my greatest joy to have them know that not one, but many people are by their side through good and bad times. Where To Next? Below you'll find everything you need to know about this project. It's been a big focus of mine to present you with a simple and straightforward experience. Feel free to browse through these beautiful concepts and read about the intentions behind each. I've set up a simple system for "Unlocking" the entire set. I hope you'll join me in bringing these wonderful and encouraging motifs to life. Rise And Shine Rise and Shine! Now is the very best time to make your move. Even though getting started can be difficult, just think of the sun and everything will become clear to you. Its warmth will comfort you even after the coldest nights and its light will lead you through the darkest of times. Gold plated with sky-blue stained glass, this pin features a gold bordered hard enamel sun motif. The bottom part of the sun is gold as well, expressing the brightness of the sun reflecting on water. Afternoon Bloom Stay strong and be vigilant! From dawn until dusk the sunflower stands at attention, following the sun wherever it goes. They grow tall, stand strong and find courage to persist day after day. Believe in yourself, the strength of the sunflower is in each and all of us. Gold plated with blue stained glass, this pin features a gold-bordered hard enamel sunflower motif with gold floral accents. A wonderful pin to celebrate the harmony between boldness and elegance. Lucent Night Whether you have arrived at your destination or must continue your journey tomorrow, rest easy. The guardians of the night stand watch so that you can rest peacefully. For those of you whose journeys take you into the night, may the beacon be a reminder of where there will always be safe passage. Regardless of where you find yourself, may the moon and stars remind you of your direction. Even when you find yourself surrounded by darkness. Silver plated with grey stained glass, this pin features a silver bordered hard enamel motif of a lighthouse amidst turbulent waters. In the sky you can see the moon and stars on their orbits, symbolizing certainty in the midst of the uncertain. Noonday Loftiness There will be times when even the best of us loses hope. Our dreams, our ambitions...everything seems to deflate right before our eyes. The hot-air balloon flies against all odds. Though deflated just moments ago, it serves as a reminder to find your fire and rise despite the challenges you may face. The only way from here is up! May the weight on your shoulders be lessened by the loftiness of your dreams. Rose Gold plated, this pin is a beautiful departure from the previous ones: the border, the sun and the flame of the basket pit are warm yellow stained glass. The clouds extend beyond the borders, symbolizing our hope for you. May you rise with lofty thoughts and expand beyond your perceived horizons. Nightfall Narrative As the day comes to a close and the sun makes its way beyond the horizon, your haven awaits you with a warm welcome home. This is the perfect time to reflect and recover from your day. Cozy up with your favorite book, light some candles or just enjoy the beauty of the evening sky. Whatever you choose, be sure to remember and care for yourself. May you find your peace daily, and it give way to rest, recovery and warm memories. This rose gold plated pin features a vibrant sun displaying a gradient of orange which symbolizes the range of emotions a person can feel at the end of the day. The book serves to remind everyone to reflect and recover from the day. In the dimming sunlight of the evening hours, we also see a lantern. Warm, comforting light emanates from it, reminding us that we don't need to focus on more than we have to right now. Backed by a lush purple, often seen in the evening sky, the border, the small rays and the space of the lantern surrounding the flame is an ochre colored stained glass. When the dust settles at the ends of our days, we're left to sort through the range of things we experienced therein. Whatever it is that we face in ourselves, there's no need to let the worries we bear go with us into sleep. Take time to care for yourself, and approach the night with peace of mind. What's an Evil Queen Ambassador ? Queens from distant realms have made themselves known and are opening their borders, seeking new alliances. Each Queen has hand picked an ambassador to represent her realm. Ally yourself with your favorite Evil Queen or Queens. Your ambassadors will travel to you, strengthening your nation and establishing goodwill throughout your lands ! What is Ammewnition Studios ? Ammewnition Studios is a new boutique inspired by all things cute and spooky, with a splash of crazy because we like how it sparkles in the moonlight. Each character is created by our artist Nicole (Sadi) Richardson with affection, care, and lots of love. Why Kickstarter ? Kickstarter is a great way for us to gauge interest for our Evil Queen Ambassadors hard enamel pins and allows us to get homes quickly for these mischievous cuties ! Enamel pin production cost can add up quickly, especially with the number of ambassadors we have ! This provides us a fantastic way to fund production costs for a project with several designs. So thank you in advance for visiting our campaign and we hope you enjoy these little cuties with attitude at backer exclusive prices ! Meet the ambassadors and their queens. We have collected quotes from the Queens so you may get a feel for each monarch. Each ambassadors has his or her own pledge that will be sworn to you when you embark on a treaty with their queen and realm. Pin Designs and Stretch Goals Each Ambassador is a large pin over 2 inches in size, they will have 2 posts, and carry a backstamp for Ammewnition Studios. The Mew pin will have glitter in his wings and the Carmen pin will have glittery gemstones ! The Ghost pin will have silver plating while all the other ambassador pins will have black plating. As we progress through the campaign, we have some fun stretch goals to unlock! Here are some of the things you can help us unlock for this Kickstarter! All pledges will be represented in hearts and display our progress to unlocking additional ambassadors. There have been rumors of a mysterious Queen who is a little quiet and very shy. She may make herself known as a future stretch goal and offer her very own ambassador for you to form a treaty with. Costs and Timeline Timeline Mid June to Mid July: Kickstarter campaign August - September :Production ( estimated 3-5 weeks ) September - October : Shipping to backers! We are giving ourselves some cushion with time. If we receive the ambassadors ahead of schedule we will be shipping them immediately. Backers will be kept in the loop with regular updates of the production process. Follow us Link Tree Twitch Instagram Disclaimer We are not responsible for any lost or stolen packages. We are also not responsible for any taxes, claims, or additional fees that your country may have. We are based in the United States.

My name is Katonya Hughey and I am an aspiring children�s author, consultant and self-confessed advocate for today�s youth. As a lover of life, I believe that all children deserve to lead a happy and healthy life. I love words. I love books. I love self-empowerment. I love the intricacies of managing an everyday life and inspiring others. I am raising money for an exciting and engaging children�s books series for second and third grade students. The books will provide an understanding of everyday events, promote healthy living and provide lesson plans and standardized curriculum for overworked school teachers. This unique approach to learning turns everyday life experience into a learning opportunity that helps to build self esteem, self image and an understanding of the value in appreciating differences. While the stories are fictional they are based on real life events and the imagination and curiosity of my seven year old granddaughter, Kenzie and her friends. The world is changing and it�s important to develop children that are flexible, healthy and open minded. It�s equally important to support, develop and retain talented teachers. Providing lesson plans and curriculum based on common core standards and 21st century skills will help to simplify the teaching process, streamline and create efficiencies in the planning precess without sacrificing academic success. I�ve been working with kids since 1995. I have mentored kids at several schools in the greater Hartford area and Atlanta, GA, developed curriculum for the Wilson Gray YMCA 7th grade entrepreneur program and implemented a youth mentoring program at Fred D. Wish elementary school in Hartford, CT. My love and commitment for today�s youth inspires me to create reading materials that will promote a healthy mind, healthy lifestyle and helps to develop an appreciation for differences. Besides writing� I spent 20 years as a leader and executive in Corporate America devoting my time to helping consumers understand and plan for a secure retirement. After going through numerous re-organizations, I decided to follow my dreams to help today�s youth. My bachelor�s degree is in Business Administration, and I received my graduate degree in Organization Leadership from Quinnipiac University in CT.

You massage all your body to relieve your fatigue, but what about gums? Now, relax your gums that protect your teeth. Gum care is as important as tooth brushing. Catch both of them with additional teeth whitening. Vumblr is world�s first Vacuum Gum Stimulator that massages entire gums at once with teeth cleaning and whitening effect. Vumblr Features: Vacuum Control Technology Ergonomic Mouthpiece Foam toothpaste with Hydroxyapatite Don't worry about choking or gagging, the mouthpiece is made with soft silicone for medical use. Gingivitis and periodontal disease, which are the second most common disease after cold, can be prevented sufficiently through simple gum massage. Gum massages provide a couple of benefits that make gum disease treatment more effective. Massaging your oral soft tissue increases blood flow to the area, allowing that tissue to repair itself more effectively. As a result, your gums will be less susceptible to the harmful effects of gingivitis and periodontitis. Periodontal disease (periodontitis) has long been known as the leading cause of tooth loss in adults. But the damage isn�t confined to the mouth. Gum disease has also been associated with an increased risk of serious degenerative diseases. Over the years, people with perio-dontal disease have been found to be at higher risk for cardiovascular dis-ease, diabetes, chronic respiratory disease, pregnancy complications, and dementia. Moreover, the association probably works both ways. For example, diabetes research has determined that successfully treating periodontitis reduces the severity of diabetes and vice versa. In recognition of its potentials from the experts, Vumblr is confirmed to participate in following international exhibitions. Take the opportunity to purchase products recognized by many dentists for the first time. We�re ready to meet interested buyers from all over the world and let more people know about our products. Vumblr creates painless vacuum pressure inside the mouth using a mouthpiece with over 300 bristles to clean, whiten, and massage your teeth and gums.
