Alvilda&Co is a children's clothing company that provides cute, comfy, and ethically sourced clothing pieces at an affordable price. Our designs are inspired by a west coast color palette combined with a relaxed European style, which results in a uniquely beautiful aesthetic. Each piece in our collections coordinate with the others, so busy mothers can dress their children quickly and stylishly. Our designs also make it easy for children to dress themselves. We plan to personally source every fabric used in our company, and to use local, USA-based vendors in order to support other start-ups and provide the highest quality products to our customers.

These handcrafted organic lotion bars are the perfect addition to any skin care/self care regimen. Made from raw organic materials (with vegan options), these solid lotion bars protect against the effects of free radicals while improving the look of skin and promoting cellular repair and rejuvenation. Bars are prepared on the lowest heat to protect the vital nutrients of each ingredient. CONTAINS: 1 (2.2in x 2.2in x 0.71in) Lotion Bar 1 (4in x 4in) beeswax wrap INGREDIENTS: *Raw Cacao Butter, *Coconut Oil, *Beeswax, *Essential oil FOR VEGAN OPTION: Candelilla wax *Denotes Certified Organic 100% of the total ingredients are from natural origin HOW. Simply massage the lotion bar on your skin and allow your skin to absorb all of these skin loving ingredients. All you need is a little body heat to soften the bar. Lotion bars are especially effective in the shower/bath, or right out of the shower/bath when pores are open. A little goes a long way! When done, place in a cute dish or back in your reusable tin! Oil cleansing? Skip the soap and just use the bar! Coconut Oil is antibacterial and will cleanse and nourish your skin! BENEFITS. Hand crafted in small batches, these lotion bars will keep your skin hydrated all day long! Essential oils nourish and treat the skin with their distinct healing properties. Raw cacao butter is superior to cocoa butter because it hasn't been treated with high heat, which destroys vital nutrients. Raw cacao butter is rich in antioxidants, polyphenols and essential fatty acids. Coconut oil is a great emollient if the barrier function of your skin is disturbed . It's great at repairing and restoring this quickly as it is rapidly absorbed into the epidermis. Coconut oil contains Vitamin E, essential amino acids, and lauric and caprylic acid which form part of the barrier function of your skin and help maintain your skin's natural flora. Bees Wax forms a protective barrier to seal in your gorgeous glow while improving the feel and appearance of your skin. FOR VEGAN OPTION: Candelilla wax- This vegetable wax is often used as a viable substitution for beeswax, which is great for vegan lifestyles. Candelilla wax is rich in nutrients and easily absorbed into the body, scalp and hair while creating an instant barrier to prevent moisture loss in the body, scalp and hair. SKIN CARE WITHOUT COMPROMISE: Lotion bars have a reputation for being a health-conscious choice because they are free from the potentially hazardous chemicals found in commercial lotion products, such as phthalates, parabens, formaldehyde, para-aminobenzoic acid (PABA), ethanolamines and petroleum. Lotion bars are mess-free and convenient. GREEN BEAUTY: They look like a bar of soap but require no plastic bottle/ Environmental Footprint. With organic ingredients, the process for creating a lotion bar is low impact, supporting a green planet!

Welcome to Berry Blitz Studio�s first Kickstarter campaign! My name is Jess and I love all things video game and cute, and sell cute video game inspired art at conventions around the Midwest. In early 2018 I made the decision to expand my product line to include enamel pins. Since I worked in vectors already, it was a perfect fit for my style. I wanted to create a series that showed off my love of video games, and also celebrated the LGBTQ+ community. It took several months of trial, error, and manufacturer research, but eventually this series was born! To get my feet wet in the pinmaking game, I ordered a design (mostly for myself!) to see how the process works, and to see if my concept had a market. I released the bisexual Switch pin in January 2019, and it has been incredibly popular both at conventions and online! This was enough for me to want to expand the series to include more consoles and more pride flags, as many as I could come up with. These pins will be hard enamel with nickel metal and 1.5� at their longest point. Each pin has two posts with rubber clutches for security. All pins shown as "unlocked", including our existing bi pin, will be available as rewards at the end of the campaign. The initial goal of $1500 covers the production of the first four designs. The goal also covers Kickstarter fees, packaging and shipping material, as well as marketing materials. Each stretch goal will have two or three additional pins to unlock, for a total of 13 pins. If we smash through all of my pin stretch goals, we can start reaching toward getting stickers made of all 14 designs - including the bi switch! The image shown above shows the pins in their first conceptual vectored state. Prototypes of the pins will be developed during and after the campaign, and I will share all progress in the updates section of this campaign. The sticker stretch goal will unlock 3" vinyl stickers of all 14 pin designs, including our existing bi switch pin. Want more than three pins? Want to add a bi switch pin to your order? You will be able to add additional goodies to your order in your survey! Just be sure to add the equivalent amount on top of your pledge total (i.e. if you wanted four pins, you would pledge $40+shipping). If we unlock stickers, you can add $3 to your pledge for each sticker you would like. Note: Stickers WILL NOT BE AVAILABLE until we reach $5000 in funding! June 1 - June 30: Kickstarter Campaign Early July: Surveys sent after successful funding, pins ordered July-October: Pin production October: Shipping to you! Please note this is an ideal timeline, with some padding to account for any delays. Should anything happen during production (or if things move faster than I anticipated), I will keep everyone updated. This breakdown is for the initial $1500 goal. Percentages will change as we unlock more pins, but I have accounted for those every step of the way. To stay updated outside of the campaign, feel free to follow me on social media! FB: facebook.com/berrybltzstudio Twitter: twitter.com/berrybltzstudio Instagram: instagram.com/berryblitzstudio Patreon: patreon.com/berryblitzstudio Or email me at berryblitzstudio@gmail.com

Kara�s Chimichurri � Delicious & Wholesome Whether you are looking for something healthy to snack on or something savory to satisfy your cravings, you can serve up Kara�s Chimi Chimi anywhere. A knockout at parties, chimichurri is the perfect sauce that you probably have never tried yourself. Originating from Argentina, chimichurri is made from parsley, garlic, vinegar, and other natural ingredients. Chimichurri is widely known for marinating meats and serving alongside meat dishes. Kara�s Chimi Chimi brings meat dishes to life and can be used for dipping chips and vegetables too. It can also be served as a spread or a condiment on tacos, salads, sandwiches and so much more. Tired of the same old sauces giving your foods the same old flavors? We were too, and that was why we set out to make something different, our very own chimichurri that we could use as a universal sauce. What makes our Chimichurri different? Unlike most Chimichurris you find at stores, Kara's Chimi Chimi is Refrigerated Organic Creamy (dairy free!) A zesty and garlic-y compliment to all of your grilled meats, sandwiches, dips. Introducing: Kara's Chimi Chimi During a group camping trip in 2018, paired with Brazilian BBQ, Kara's Chimi Chimi was an instant hit, both kids and parents couldn�t get enough of it. It has been Kid-Approved many times over and kids don't want to share! Because of its creamy texture, you can use Kara's Chimi Chimi on just about anything: eggs, sandwiches, tacos, chips � whatever you're in the mood for. Our plan is to launch Kara's Chimi Chimi in Original flavor first and then launch Cilantro and Spicy shortly after. Let us tell you a little more. Certified Organic We have gone through the extra steps in order for Kara's Chimi Chimi to be USDA Certified Organic. So if you like to know where your food is coming from and what standard the ingredients are held to, you can have the utmost confidence when enjoying this sauce. You never have to feel like you are going into the kitchen (or the grocery store) blind again, every container of Kara's Chimi Chimi carries the USDA Certified Organic seal so you know that we're using the best ingredients. Vegan, Kosher, Halal, Keto-Friendly Not only is Kara�s Chimi Chimi superior in taste and texture, it is also meets all the dietary requirements above�jam packed with so much goodness! You can enjoy it on anything � without worrying that you are crossing any of your own personal boundaries. Non-GMO Of course, this would go without saying, USDA Organic Certified also means Non-GMO. From the start, we have wanted this sauce to stand for quality and the values that we seek out in food ourselves. Gluten-Free & Dairy-Free Even though our Chimichurri is creamy, it is completely dairy free and gluten free so you can rest assured that you can fearlessly enjoy. Made to Share Each container of Kara's Chimi Chimi features a wide mouth, making dipping and sharing easy. On the go, in the office, or at home with your loved ones, Kara's Chimi Chimi is just the sauce that you want to have stocked in your fridge, something that everyone can enjoy together � totally guilt-free! What We Need & What You Get Right now, we are turning to you to help raise funds that we need to manufacture, market, and distribute Kara's Chimi Chimi on a larger scale. We also would like to launch 2 additional flavors: Cilantro and Spicy. We're almost at the finish line and have overcome most of our hurdles. Our goal through this campaign is to raise $5,000 which will cover all the costs that we are facing as we take this special sauce and bring it to the Organic foods world. One of the greatest challenges that we currently looking to solve is shipping the Chimi Chimi chilled to destinations on the East Coast. We have been looking at several different solutions and are close to finding an option that works. To show our appreciation for all your support, we are honored to offer early access to Kara's Chimi Chimi exclusively through this campaign. An Entrepreneurial Dream -The Female Trio Just like mom, Kara at age 10, is a fierce entrepreneur, we are working on this together. Kara has also passed on this spirit of ambition and creation to her younger sister (our master taster), making our team a trio, and we couldn't be any happier with the way things are going. We want Kara's Chimi Chimi to be known as a healthy, simple flavor option, something that is equal parts nutritious and delicious. We know we can make this work with your help! Other Ways You Can Help After you make a contribution to our campaign, please let all your friends and family know what Kara's Chimi Chimi is. We want to spread the word about this sauce far and wide, and we know that social media is the way to do that. We appreciate all your support, both monetary and non-monetary, and we thank you for taking the time to read about our plans.

WHERE WE ARE NOW: Every dollar we make from this point forward goes toward our accessibility goals! Accessibility is important because not only is it the right thing to do, but because it significantly increases our ability to negotiate for an affordable long-term lease, in addition to making additional avenues of funding available to us via project and facilities grants! MOONSHOT GOAL $30,680 - Fund a wheelchair lift to become a fully accessible space! Due to our high loading dock entrance, temporary or ramp-based accessibility plans are not available to us. Any and all money raised beyond our viability goals will go into a fund for this accessibility device, and we hope to fully fund the $15000-20000 construction project if possible! The Steep and Thorny Way to Heaven is Portland�s longest running entirely volunteer DIY performance space and arts venue. Steep and Thorny was artistically founded by Myrrh Larsen and Megan Skye Hale, a couple of working artists who stumbled into providing a space that is one part night club, one part performance venue, and one part arts incubator. Most of what we do is offer a safe place to foster ambitious and creative work from performers of all disciplines. We sat down with the building's new owners to finalize the new agreement and discovered that the effective rent increase is actually significantly higher than what we were given to understand from the offer. We adjusted our plan to meet the new math: $9,830 - Fund 9 months of our expanded responsibility in the space, to provide a contingency fund while we ramp up our fiscal sustainability plans. This includes 3 extra months at the higher rate in order to accommodate for the extra funds we will need to raise and give us time to work our plans up to that higher rate. STRETCH GOAL $10,680 - Fund new avenues of revenue intake via filing for tax-deductable status for our resident projects. This way Speculative Drama and Susurrations Productions can pay The Steep and Thorny Way to Heaven rent for their use of the space, helping to cover overhead costs. Facing a significant rent increase, we are looking to fundraise a nine month grace period to keep this vital Portland landmark alive � and implement a long term plan for finances that doesn�t compromise the dedication to artists AND audiences that we are known for! For the last 8 years The Steep and Thorny Way to Heaven has been Portland�s home for the underground arts. With performances ranging from aerial circus, to dance, to our resident musical artist Myrrh Larsen and theatre company Speculative Drama, we have spent the better part of the last decade encouraging the growth of high-quality performance arts in the inner Southeast Portland Industrial area. Now the realities of a growing city have caught up with us and we need YOUR HELP to enact a sustainable long term financial plan. With 100% of in-house production door proceeds going directly to performers, and helmed by two struggling artist working as volunteers, overhead costs are largely paid for by rentals, donations, and concession sales of our infamous virgin and adult beverages. Our budget includes six months of Myrrh�s financial burden in the venue, and any additional funds raised go directly toward essential fundraising avenues and a permanent accessibility plan in the form of a wheelchair lift. We have nearly ten years of successfully running a Portland institution on a shoestring, and our backer rewards include some of the best art, events, and cocktails in the city. The risk is low, and the rewards are high for backers of this project! In addition to these stretch goals, we will be posting milestone rewards for you, our public support system, here on our Kickstarter project page! These rewards include behind-the-scenes interviews with our Artistic Directors Myrrh and Megan, blooper reels from the kickstarter video, a live cocktail lesson and toast with us when we reach our goal, and more! What your Money Goes to: 9 months of Myrrh�s financial responsibility at The Steep and Thorny Way to Heaven (total rent partially subsidized)- $8910 Estimated Kickstarter Fees - $920

Hello my name is Brandi. I had a rough child hood, I've served my country, I'm a disabled vet, I'm a single mother. I have passion. I have goals. I'm a fighter. I'm a survivor. These are just some of the things that make me different than you. We are all different in our own little ways. Some of us start our days at 4 am, while others sleep until noon. We hike mountains, we raise families. we have careers. We laugh. We grind. We are bold. We are different..but... we all go though mother nature.. every month. Bold is not pink. And from my experience, mother nature isnt either. I have designed a new tampon. One that we can all relate to. One that is just as bold as all of us. This project is to help create a prototype.

I'm tired of YouTube recommending me flat earth videos to watch so I'm going to be the first man to fly around the world and broadcast it live. We've got lots of technology in 2019 lets do this! There are some planes that have wifi so I'm hoping to be able to live stream the flight to a website that is made for this, but if it's not possible within this $100,000 budget then I will stream the gps location of the plane to the website and upload the unedited raw video footage as I am able for example at each time we touch down to refuel ect.. I promise though to try my absolute hardest to get the entire flight broadcasted live even as I fly across the oceans if it is in my capabilities to do so while staying in budget. The finished documentary will be made public to everyone on the website and also on YouTube.

Chi Chi is a short film written and directed by Chelsey d'Adesky. The film will be produced by her productions (her-productions.com), 432films (432films.com) and The London Film School. Chi Chi is a coming of age of story set in the environment of excess, luxury, and fast paced style of 80s Miami. The story follows Ava as she makes an attempt to step out on her own, and subsequently begins losing control. In this loss she finds her strength and is able to protect herself when the pressure is on. The tone will be upbeat, energetic, colorful, and visceral. We will move through time quickly and with intention both visually and dramatically. The film will be shot in Miami, with stylized 1980s production design, costuming and a lush jungle-like, tropical backdrop, muted color palettes, and bold prints. VISUAL REFERENCES PRODUCTION TEAM Writer & Director: Chelsey was born in Miami and grew up in Los Angeles. She studied broadcast journalism at The George Washington University in D.C. before going to work as a commercial producer at Publicis New York. While in advertising, she worked on spots for Cadillac, Citibank, Garnier, P&G and more. She moved from producing to directing before deciding to get her Masters degree at The London Film School. While in school she directed, produced and production designed several short films. Chi Chi will be her graduate film for this program. To check out the trailer for Chelsey's last short film: Producers: her-Productions is based in Los Angeles, focusing on creative video content. After all attending The New School in New York the team gained several years of experience in their separate fields of Media Production� Nicole Franzen, Rachel Cohen and Vivi Rojas established a production company inspired by their surroundings and cultural backgrounds, in hopes of visually providing a voice to those that inspire them. her provides an experienced team to collaborate with influential creatives, inspiring brands and captivating artists to create a unique visual representation for their clients. https://www.her-productions.com/ Director of Photography: ET Ng is a London based Cinematographer. Originally from Singapore, he is currently finishing up a post-graduate degree from The London Film School. Over the past year, he has served as the cinematographer on various projects shooting in different parts of the world, ranging from China, Bangladesh, Morocco and many more. Production Designer: Mondalena Nikc is an interior designer with roots in Miami and New York. She recently founded her boutique interior design studio RROSHE INTERIORS, a full service interior design studio focused on both commercial and residential interiors. Chi Chi is her first production design project. http://rroshe.com/ Production Designer: Ashley Navid studied interior architecture at George Washington University before making the move to New York City. She then went on to work at MR Architecture + Decor, a studio that specializes in designing high end residential, retail, and other commercial spaces. Chi Chi is the second of Chelsey's films Ashley has worked on as production designer. MONEY Every dollar donated will go directly to the film budget. We are almost there but need this amount more to cover the most appropriate camera equipment and post production. For camera equipment our biggest cost is lenses, lighting and film processing and development. In staying true to the look and feel of the time, we are hoping to use vintage lenses and shooting on 16mm film to achieve a moodier look. On post production we need funds for: editing, color grading, sound mixing, and ultimately film festival submissions. Any help would be so greatly appreciated. Thank you so much!

Music and memory are tied together in fascinating ways. Music makes it easier to memorize things: the order of the colors in the visible spectrum, the number of days in a month, the names of U.S. presidents. The songs we know can take us back to specific places in our memories. When Josh�s grandmother was in the last years of her life and starting to have trouble remembering peoples� names and even some of the events of her life, she could still recall the words of the songs she had loved as a girl. The Bible commands Christians to memorize Scripture and emphasizes several benefits that come from memorizing Scripture. Psalm 119:11 says, �I have stored up your word in my heart, that I might not sin against you.� God�s memorized Word is a reserve, like Joseph�s grain in Egypt�s cities, ready for the long, lean years. Colossians 3:16 talks about letting the Word of Christ �dwell in you richly,� a picture of God�s Word alive in us. Proverbs 30:5 tells us that �every word of God proves true.� In other words, God�s Word has been tested. In 2016, our church began sending out a Scripture memory verse or passage each month. Our family looked forward to receiving each verse, and soon after, we were inspired to write songs to go along with the verses. We had both written music for existing lyrics in the past. Kirsten had co-written a new melody to �And Can It Be� a couple of years earlier with Dave Hunt that appeared on our church's worship CD (Amazing Love), and Josh had written music for a couple of musicals back in college. Without much of a plan beyond just trying to find melodies for the verses, we started making up songs on the guitar or piano and singing them around the house. We wrote all of the songs in the midst of daily life. Josh wrote the melody to the first one, Proverbs 30:5 (�Every word of God proves true. He is a shield to all who take refuge in him,�) while giving our kids their baths one night. Writing these songs felt like play, and it became something we looked forward to each month. We didn�t pick the verses ourselves, so we didn�t know what was coming next. But as we started looking at the songs, we started noticing patterns in the aspects of God�s character that the verses emphasized. By the end of the year, we had a collection of songs that told a coherent story about God--the Creator, the Father, the Shield, the Patient One. We started sending rough recordings via email to the families in our church, and we had many people tell us how applicable the songs were to the situations their children were going through. We also noticed how much we were singing these songs in our own home, and how these songs helped us to imprint God's word on our hearts and minds, as well as our children's. It was so exciting to watch our kids memorize these verses and start humming them to themselves throughout the day. After seeing the impact the songs made, we decided to launch this Kickstarter project to produce recordings of the Scripture songs that we could share inside and outside of our church community. Asher Peterson will be producing the record, and we couldn�t ask for a better fit for the project. He plays drums for the Gray Havens, he�s toured with his family as part of Andrew Peterson and the Family Band, and he�s the mastermind behind NAMO, a Nashville-based music collective. He also interns for Josh�s brother Ben at The Beehive. You can hear what his work on this project will sound like by listening to Psalm 19:1, which you can hear in the Kickstarter video or on streaming services. The CD will have ten songs. We've printed the lyrics for the verses below: Psalm 19:1 - The heavens declare the glory of God, and the stars above proclaim His handiwork. Psalm 121:1-2 - I lift up my eyes to the hills. From where does my help come? My help comes from the Lord, who made heaven and earth. Proverbs 30:5 - Every word of God proves true; he is a shield to those who take refuge in him. 1 Peter 1:3 - Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ! According to his great mercy, he has caused us to be born again to a living hope through the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead. John 1:14 - And the Word became flesh and dwelt among us, and we have seen his glory, glory as of the only Son from the Father, full of grace and truth. Ephesians 4:6 - ...one God and Father of all, who is over all and through all and in all. Isaiah 43:5 - Fear not, for I am with you; I will bring your offspring from the east, and from the west I will gather you. Phillipians 4:6-7 - Do not be anxious about anything, but in everything by prayer and supplication with thanksgiving let your requests be made known to God. And the peace of God, which surpasses all understanding, will guard your hearts and your minds in Christ Jesus. Colossians 3:23 - Whatever you do, work heartily, as for the Lord and not for men. 2 Peter 3:9 - The Lord is not slow to fulfill his promise as some count slowness, but is patient toward you, not wishing that any should perish, but that all should reach repentance. (Note: These aren�t in the order in which they�ll appear on the CD, and some of the songs might be expanded a bit to include surrounding material in the passage.) The budget of our project is $7,500. This amount is a big goal for us to meet on our own, so that's why we decided to put together a Kickstarter campaign to ask for you to partner with us in completing this project. We hope you will consider investing a project that will encourage you in remembering God's word in your everyday life. Please don't forget to check out our rewards. One of our reward items is an amazing Psalm 19:1 coloring sheet designed by Jennifer Trafton (jennifertrafton.com). We also have an option for you to make your own choice for Scripture wall art designed by Amanda Groh or Jennifer Trafton. Lastly, we have accompaniment tracks and a songbook so that you (or your ministry) can have these resources to play and sing these songs on your own. Thanks again for considering being a part of this project. We are praying that it will help you keep the words of Deuteronomy 11:19, which says this about God's words: "You shall teach them to your children, talking of them when you are sitting in your house, and when you are walking by the way, and when you lie down, and when you rise." ~Josh and Kirsten

We reached our goal, and we still have time! We are beyond ecstatic! You are the reason this story will come to life. We are particularly grateful for the leadership of women clergy who have been sharing and pledging fiercely. This is a story of liberation. This funding will get us through the archive research and most of the filming; but there will be a lot of post-production expenses to cover. It will be easier to raise the rest of the funds if we have a large audience waiting for the film. Can we raise 90k? Can we reach 600 backers? Please continue to share. Together we can do this. Margo & Nikki Instagram @PhilElevenDoc // Twitter @PhilElevenDoc // Facebook @PhilElevenDoc The Film Eleven women were ordained Episcopal priests against church rules in Philadelphia in 1974. They hit a chord, in a deeply divided world, by questioning who speaks the word of God. The media caught on, and the women priests were thrust into an international limelight. In 1975 four more women were ordained priests. At the time of the ordinations, the women were on a personal journey of faith. Each woman had to decide how to live out her priesthood in the face of an institution that did not accept her. The Philadelphia Eleven (working title) is a feature documentary film that will tell the story of these women priests in their words. Why now? It will inspire a new generation. The patriarchy is flexing its muscles again. This is a story about women who followed their call, and in doing so challenged society to acknowledge them. We can learn lessons from those whose shoulders we stand on. This struggle continues. It is still a challenge to be a woman priest; and women are still kept from the biggest decision-making tables around the globe. Time is of the essence. Many of the "eleven" are with us, but they are quickly aging. This story resonates. What does it mean to be whole? How do we pursue our vocations, regardless of obstacles? How do we keep our integrity, when it feels like the easy answers ask us to compromise? How do we stand up for justice in every moment, when life pulls us in so many different directions? No gift is too small. By supporting this campaign, you are actually making this film with us. That is why we lovingly refer to you as our "film family." What we have done. Since 2015, we have taken ten trips around the country, and filmed 12 interviews. We have held phone conversations with an additional seven people who were intimately involved, and begun sourcing archival footage. Grants from MassHumanities and the LEF Moving Image Fund have supported this work, plus unimaginable hours of volunteer time driven by passion and given with love. Storytelling is a very personal endeavor, and we know how much faith it takes to trust others to tell your story. We are humbled to have earned the trust of the women priests with their stories. For that we are grateful, and we take the responsibility seriously. What we still need to do. There is so much more to film, and many more archives to go through. After we gather all the footage, we will need to edit the film. There is a long road ahead. With your help, we can bring this film to life. Rewards. See the side panel for a complete description of rewards. NEW REWARD - Artist June Linowitz created "Communion" in 1974 to represent the eleven women ordained priests in Philadelphia. She is generously donating artist signed and numbered prints for donors at the $7,500 level. This image is historic! Don't miss this opportunity! This reward is designed for institutions, churches or individuals with more disposable income. If you already pledged, click "manage my pledge" to choose this reward. We will still need to raise additional funds after the end of the Kickstarter campaign. Donations at this level will help get us there more quickly. COMMUNION IMAGE ON TOTE BAG This image is historic! Artist June Linowitz created "Communion" in 1974 to represent the eleven women ordained priests in Philadelphia. Communion Tote Bag SOUL CARD with The Rev. Alla Ren�e Bozarth's poetry, and images from Bear Blessings Soul Cards. SIGNED BOOKS Signed copies of memoirs written by Bishop Barbara Harris, The Rev. Carter Heyward and The Rev. Alla Ren�e Bozarth, Ph.D. are still available! How to contribute. It's not just about money. 1. Pledge to this Kickstarter Campaign. 2. Send a letter to post to our film blog about your experience. Have you ever wanted to tell the eleven how they have paved the way for you? In what ways? All posts must be respectful. Send directly to us: margo@timetravelproductions.com. 3. Share your scrapbooks. If you have photos, footage, or audio recordings of the irregularly ordained women priests, or of any related activities, and you are willing to grant us permission to use them in film, we would love to see them. We are interested in content that relates to the women priests and those who opposed their ordinations. Please include a note granting us permission to use in the film (or tell us who to contact for permission), and your contact information. Mailing address: Time Travel Productions LLC Box 584 Watertown MA 02471 If they are digitized, you can email to: margo@timetravelproductions.com. 4. Help us find archival material. Some of the key players in this story have passed away. We are looking for older interviews with them. Please contact us if you are aware of audio or filmed interviews with any of the "irregularly" ordained women priests, or any of the people who played key roles in their ordinations, particularly those who have passed. You can email directly: margo@timetravelproductions.com. 5. Share with friends. Email is the best option. You can also click on the graphic below to share directly to Facebook. Who we are. DIRECTOR and PRODUCER - Margo Guernsey Margo began her film career in 2010 as a producer at WPBT2 (Miami). Councilwoman, her first feature documentary, is touring the country, and will air on PBS's America ReFramed in the fall of 2019. Over the past 20 years, Margo has worked as a union organizer, non-profit development director, Spanish/English translator and media instructor, always building multi-racial collaborations across class lines to inform the work of building a more just society. Margo brings her organizing, fundraising and filmmaking background to work on film outreach and impact. She holds an MFA in Film (University of Miami), MA in History (Umass/Amherst), BA in History (Brown University), and is a Tribeca/Camden/CNNFilms Retreat Alumni. DIRECTOR OF PHOTOGRAPHY and co-PRODUCER - Nikki Bramley Nikki is a director of photography based in Boston. Her work ranges from independent documentaries to high-end commercial projects. Recent broadcast credits include: Councilwoman (America Re-Framed, 2019), Breaking Big (PBS 2018), Seeing Eyes/Feeling Heart (American Masters 2018), NOVA �Addiction� (2018), NOVA �Prediction by the Numbers" (2017), Frontline (2017, 2015). Her documentary and nonprofit cinematography work has taken her across the U.S., and to Thailand, Ireland and South Sudan. Nikki graduated from the S.I. Newhouse School of Communications at Syracuse University in 2002 with a BS in Television, Radio and Film Production. CONSULTING PRODUCER - Patricia Benabe Patricia produced feature documentaries Councilwoman (America ReFramed 2019), Memories of a Penitent Heart (Tribeca Film Festival, 2016; POV, 2017) and short films Love The Sinner (Tribeca Film Festival, 2017) and They Took Them Alive (Full Frame, 2017). She co-produced The Hand That Feeds (Emmy Nominee; America ReFramed, 2016) and Reportero (Emmy nominee; POV, 2013). Her films have received support from Ford Foundation, Cinereach, Latino Public Broadcasting, ITVS, POV, Chicken and Egg, Fledgling, and Sundance Film Institute.  STORY CONSULTANT - Rachel Clark Rachel Clark is a documentary video editor currently residing in Boston. Clients include the History Channel, the Discovery Channel, the BBC, Errol Morris, PBS, the National Geographic Channel, and Cinemax. She edited the Emmy award winning HBO documentary Have You Seen Andy?; the documentary Family Affair (OWN), premiering in competition at Sundance; and The Amish: Shunned for PBS�s American Experience. Most recently, she cut East of Salinas for the PBS documentary series Independent Lens, and several feature length documentaries, including Balian, and Eat Up, both currently touring festivals. KICKSTARTER VIDEO EDIT and GRAPHICS - The video was a collaborative edit that includes editor David Reeder, story consultant Rachel Clark, and editor Sarah Secunda of Backtalk Videogr�fica. All graphics were done by Lani Rodriguez of Backtalk Videogr�fica. The song "Call" was composed by widely regarded composer of choral music Joan Szymko. How we spend our funds. The more we raise, the bigger the audience for the film. We want to show the world that viewers are hungry for a documentary film about the original women priests. ON OUR WAY: If we raise $70,000, you will help us move this project forward! Our funds support the production crew and archive researcher who work to gather footage. There is very little overhead, because we all work from home offices. FINISH PRODUCTION: If we raise $120,000, you will fund the completion of filming. The farther we get in production, the more money we spend on an editor. FIRST ROUGH-CUT OF FILM: If we raise $235,000, you will fund us all the way to our first rough-cut! At this point our production crew expense is for archive research and producing, and a lot of our time is now in the edit room. Instagram @PhilElevenDoc // Twitter @PhilElevenDoc // Facebook @PhilElevenDoc

born in Hong Kong, raised in Brooklyn NYC. Carpe Diem was introduced to music when in university when he was trying to find his passion. Amongst his studies, he would find refuge in playing with production software like Fruity Loops and Ableton. after spending his entire university career essentially learning nothing about mechanical engineering, and everything about audio engineering and production, he honed some skills to start DJ'ing some of his tracks. He also developed a new style of music in which he calls Classical EDM. he spent most of his time at an underground music venue DJ'ing in the Lower East Side. There, he found his love for performing live in front of crowds. Retrop befriended many talented artists in the industry and became a student of the craft. After 3 years of DJing for at multiple venues in LES, Carpe Diem met another musician named DJ Retrop, where they created a strong musical bond. They got along quickly and decided that it was best to combine EDM and classical and take it to the next level. That's when they decided to create a collaboration album. The collab album has been in the works for the last few months and now they're ready to show the world what it's about. Their hopes is to really create a new subgenre and take the world by storm.

THANK YOU PLAYTESTERS! RETAILERS: Message us directly! This project is promoted by Jellop, the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarters with 650+ successful Kickstarter projects with over $300MM raised between them.

Hi! I'm Jessica Feinberg, a wacky author and illustrator dedicated to bringing strange creatures to life! I'm so excited to be ready to print the 4th book in my Fantastical Coloring Book series! Each 8x10 book in the series features over 70 unique pictures to color with no repeats! Volume 4 features many dragons, mermaids, and all sorts of other creatures. The artwork ranges from simple to highly detailed and is all-ages friendly. Pictures are printed on bright white 55# paper on ONE SIDE ONLY so you can use crayons, colored pencils, or markers! ALL FOUR BOOKS IN THE SERIES ARE AVAILABLE in digital PDF and printed copies! First three coloring book in the series! There are NO repeat images between books or inside books :) Bookmark and Print Sets Print sets are four 4x6 prints. Bookmark sets are four 2x8 bookmarks. Both are printed on 14 pt. uncoated paper. Patreon Bonus Rewards: Backers who pledge for a physical reward and are also subscribed to my patreon get bonus rewards: Subscribers at $1 or more per month will get a free bonus bookmark to color ONLY available to them! Subscribers at the $5+ level will also get a bonus 4x6 print to color, again available ONLY to them! 8x10 Prints of the full color cover artwork are included with many pledges or can be added on too! NEW! 11x14 COLORING PRINTS The project is over 300% funded so I will also be printing 11x14 coloring prints! These larger prints feature some of the more detailed artwork and are on 100# stock (twice the thickness of the coloring book pages). You can add on one print for $10 or a set of five for $32. A SIXTH BONUS PRINT (the peacock dragon) will be included in SETS added on by $5+ patreon subscribers. This is BRAND NEW ART from a future coloring book. Optional Add-ons Backers (except digital backers who pay no shipping) may increase their pledges by the amounts listed below to add these optional items: Bookmark Set of 4 $3 Postcard Set of 4 $6 8x10 cover print $8 (signed) 11x14 Coloring Print $10 each (shipping included) 11x14 Coloring Print set of 5 $32 (shipping included, 6th bonus print for Patreon subscribers too!) Pledges already getting at least one physical coloring book may add on additional coloring books for $12 US/$15 INT (your choice of vols 1-4). This price includes any additional shipping costs. PDF OF THE BOOK IS INCLUDED TOO!! Want JUST the PDF of one of the books? They are $6 for one or $10 for two, or $20 for all four.

WHY YOU'LL WANT PRINCESS PIRATES Above all, Princess Pirates is an ADVENTURE book filled with fun and exciting illustrations! It's got jungles, pirate ships, lava, tigers, a sought-after treasure, an enchantress--basically all the ingredients for your child's ideal pirate quest. First and foremost this book is about engaging your child in a great story that you can both cherish. But, what's awesome about Princess Pirates is that on top of that, this book: 1) Role models bold, brave female characters which are important for children of both genders to see! Girls need more adventure books to see strong, bold, and DARING people they can relate to! And you know what? Boys need to see girls in these kinds of role too! 2) Encourages children to use imagination to foster creativity. Imagination is a magical thing! Children have an amazing ability to find joy in pretending, especially when you can get them away from screen time for a bit. This book helps children see how they can re-imagine their surroundings into new adventures to do just that. This kind of imagination sparks valuable creativity that will serve them their whole life long. 3) Tears down gender stereotypes. Useless gender stereotypes not only limit a child�s imagination, but their thoughts on possibilities for their future. Girls shouldn�t feel like because society has said pirates are a �boy thing� they shouldn�t like them. Who cares what �society� says?! Be you and love it! 4) Helps develop vocabulary and reading skills in a fun way. This book is a rhyming book which is fun for smaller children to hear and really helps early readers develop their reading skills. There are just a couple words that your child may not know--this was done on purpose because I think children�s books are the perfect opportunity to grow your child�s vocabulary! WHAT IS PRINCESS PIRATES ? Princess Pirates is the story of three sisters as they dare to be brave and imagine a whole new world right inside their very home. They start off as princesses in their castle but hear an enchantress has their treasure. They then become pirates, too, and embark on a daring adventure. They sail across oceans, cross a river of lava, travel through the jungle, and even fight tigers to find their treasure. There is nothing too difficult that these fearless girls cannot find a way through! HOW YOU CAN HELP AND WHAT YOU'LL GET FOR IT! While I have written this book and have had it fully illustrated, when you back this project you're really pre-ordering Princess Pirates to help me fund my first production run of books. Here are the various rewards can you get for backing: $10 3 PDF coloring pages Receive 3 PDF coloring pages for your kids, sketched by the magnificent Polina Klimenko! These will be e-mailed to you so you can print them over and over again for your child(ren) to color! $28 ($24 early bird!) One hardcover book, eye patch, 3 PDF coloring pages Receive ONE hard cover copy of Princess Pirates plus ONE eye patch for your child's next swashbuckling adventure and the THREE PDF coloring pages sketched exclusively for this Kickstarter. $54 ($35 early bird!) 2 hardcover books, 2 eye patches, 3 PDF coloring pages $108 ($67 early bird!) 4 hardcover books, 4 eye patches, 3 PDF coloring pages $130 ($82 early bird!) 5 hardcover books, 5 eye patches, 3 PDF coloring pages $240 ($150 early bird!) 10 hardcover books, 10 eye patches, 3 PDF coloring pages Thank YOU and don't forget to follow me! Thanks for making this dream come true for me (it means the world to me!) AND for promoting limitless imagination! Be sure to follow me on Instagram: www.instagram.com/dkackerman_ Facebook: www.facebook.com/D-K-Ackerman-370618233734276/ Website: www.dkackerman.com Illustrator Extraordinaire: Polina Klimenko You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00 Polina is from Krasnodar Russia, but currently lives in the Netherlands. Believe it or not, I found Polina's work on Instagram first and knew she was exactly what I was looking for! I messaged her and asked how she would feel about illustrating a children's book for me and THANK GOONDESS she said yes! Her attention to detail and sweet style has given the story a life like I couldn't have imagined myself!

Dancing Yak Miniatures is proud to be bringing you a full Infernal Chaos Dwarf and Hobgoblin army in both 10mm and 28mm. If funded, it will offer a huge variety of units to fill all the needs one may have from tabletop RPGs to the myriad of wargames that have some form of evil dwarfs. Models have been tailored to fit the 9th Age rule system for which we are a supporting company. Everything is sculpted digitally with some minor adjustments by hand and all prototypes will be 3D printed with a high resolution resin printer. Production is then made by our own hands, spincasting in high quality metal, so we can ensure the highest level of detail. We are making the models in 28mm heroic scale and 10mm. From the bottom of feet in 28mm hobgoblins are around 28-35 mm tall and dwarfs 25-35 (some of the hats are big). For 10mm, models are scaled to the standard so they work with other 10mm fantasy makers out. Hobgoblins are 12-15mm and dwarfs are all around 15mm, plus or minus. Hobgoblins are much taller than dwarfs. Dwarfs are fatter and have much larger hats. We bought 2 soon to be 3 printers, resin, a spincaster. We need to buy mold making materials and equipment, metal, and living expenses. We have also dedicated 4 months to this project full time already and several part time. We seek your help to fund the masters for the models, the production molds, and the materials required for the casting as well as the production expenses. What you will get are the models you have been wanting at a discounted price from future retail. You will get the models before they go for retail sale. You will also get exclusive Kickstarter models and bonus goodies, have access to making stretch goals available, exclusive army deals, and shipping subsidies.We plan on having models shipping out to buyers august-september. We hope you will join us on this adventure. www.dancingyakminiatures.com www.facebook.com/dancingyakminiatures Disclaimer: All models come unpainted and without bases (except Admiralty Miniatures' Slave Drivers which come with bases.) We are two sculptors and longtime gaming enthusiasts who have dedicated ourselves full-time to bringing you high-quality metal miniatures at affordable prices. We have wanted an evil dwarfs army for a long time and figured if no one else made one we liked, we would make one ourselves. We look forward to bringing our miniatures to your tabletops. Thank you for your time, love, and support. We hope this is just the start of things to come.
