creator_name: Mats III Palsson Horn af Aminne
story: Hi Kickstarter! We are a small team from Sweden that loves to push buttons. We invented the Smart Button in 2013. Thanks to our amazing community, we have run two successful crowdfunding campaigns before and delivered on both of them. Today, we are very excited to show you what we have been up to for the last three years. Kickstarter - welcome Flic 2 and the Flic Hub LR! Flic is a small push button. In the Flic App, you choose what you want to happen when you push, push twice, or hold it down. You don't need to talk to Flic. You don't need to unlock your phone or trust that an AI will figure you out. You just have to push a button. We�ve taken everything we�ve learned from making smart buttons for over six years, we�ve listened to feedback from the community and revisited every single detail to come up with a product that we sincerely believe is the perfect button. The Flic Hub is an optional accessory to Flic so you don't have to connect the buttons to your phone. It has also been rebuilt from the ground up to optimize performance, to add HomeKit capability, and to add Bluetooth Long Range. The most common ways our community use Flic are to toggle lights and control music. But people are really creative, there are literally thousands of wildly different things that people use Flic shortcuts for! We all have different routines. What we do when we wake up in the morning, how we get to work, and how we structure our day. Flic is a tool that helps you simplify your everyday routines. Instead of different apps or complicated voice commands, structure your life with buttons! A push-of-a-button life doesn�t have to be complicated. Quite the opposite! Reduce the clutter with technology that just works. There are a large number of integrations already in the Flic App and ready to use! Through third-party services such as IFTTT, Zapier, and Microsoft Flow, practically anything is possible. And if you're an advanced tech user, with our versatile HTTP Request function you can write your own commands in the Flic App. Everyone knows how to push a button. We have seen applications for kids, for people with disabilities, for visually impaired, and even for dogs! After 5 years we still see and hear about new amazing things that people do using Flic buttons. Here are just a few things that our community has shared with us: Flic 2 opens up new opportunities that were not possible before while maintaining the world-class simplicity, stability, and security that Flic has been known for. The easiest way to set Flic 2 up is with the free Flic App. The most common Flic features are already available there. Here is how the new 2-step pairing with the App works: How to set it up so that it sends its location to mom - a great safety measure for kids! You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00 The Flic App is already available. Select what you want to happen for each push, double push, and hold. You can even sequence actions, so that multiple things happen when toy push twice, for example. The micro-suction adhesive is included with every Flic 2. The suction adhesive allows you to attach Flic to any surface. Micro-suction means it contains hundreds of tiny suction cups that don�t leave any residue! The suction pad is easy to clean with water and can be reused many times. Yep, Maria throws it up on the roof in the last scene - it sticks there like a magnet! Flic 2 is built for accessories. New label stickers make it easy for you and your guests to understand what each button does. The new rigid multi-purpose metal clip makes Flic easy to attach to keys, clothes, bags, and much more. Flic 2 can give you visual feedback in three colors: green, yellow, and red. Just like traffic lights! It can blink green if your action was successful, yellow while you�re waiting (not applicable for most uses), and red if there is something wrong. With Flic 2, you can access any other app that is open for Flic, and developers can build apps for the entire Flic 2 community. This opens up for A LOT more things you can use Flic for! If you develop a use case for Flic 2, it will immediately be made available to the broader Flic audience. This is something we are extra proud of - Flic 2 can toggle multiple apps at the same time! You can push to turn on the Lights in your lights app and push twice to snooze the alarm-app! Flic 2 can switch mode between being a smart Flic button, a Bluetooth Keyboard/mouse, or a Low latency MIDI controller. With Flic 2, there are many ways to be truly creative. If you�re a musician for example, it can be configured to imitate a wireless amplifier switch. Compared to the original Flic, this button is infinitely more flexible and open. There is no longer a requirement to use the Flic App or the Flic Hub or even to have an internet connection when you set it up. As an example, you can implement our open Flic 2 connection protocol in your Arduino robot, or use our free SDKs for iOS, Android, Linux, or OSX, and many more, without making any stability or security compromises. Read more under For Developers. Every Flic button needs to be connected to something. The common ways are to a phone, a laptop, or a Flic Hub. The benefits of using a Flic Hub is that your Flic buttons don't need your phone to be around in order to work. So in your home or in your office, you can put up buttons that everyone can use even when you are not around. One Flic Hub can be connected to 63 Flic buttons at the same time, while a phone can connect to 6-8 Flics depending on the type of phone. Flic Hub LR (Long Range) has been rebuilt from the ground up, for optimized performance and double range. It has the same discreet and award-winning design as the original Flic Hub, and it packs a lot more power. We are working together with Apple to add HomeKit support to the Flic Hub LR. This means that all your Flic buttons (including original Flics!) that are connected to a Flic Hub LR can be configured in the Apple Home App. So all your buttons will be able to control everything in your Apple Home ecosystem! Since this is a lot of work, we won�t have this in place when we ship the Flic Hub LRs in September, but it will be released as a software update this fall. The IR (Infrared) accessory to the Flic Hub allows you to control things that you otherwise would need a remote control for. Control your TV, Home Entertainment systems, A/C, to name a few. The IR Accessory is the same that was available before. However, due to hardware improvements in the Flic Hub LR, the precision of the IR learning and blasting makes it possible to use for even more devices. Flic 2 and Flic Hub LR both have Bluetooth 5.0 Long Range capability, which means that they can stay connected to each other over larger distances. The range of Bluetooth Long Range can be compared to WiFi if not even better. Flic Hub LR can support Flic 2 buttons scattered in a large apartment or a small house. We truly want to give you the power to create anything. This is why we created the Flic Hub Javascript SDK. With it, you can write code directly on your Flic Hub � in real time! All you need to get started is a Flic Hub and a web browser, no additional software is needed! Read more under For Developers below. When we released Flic for the first time, we got an incredible amount of requests from creatives, developers and entrepreneurs that wanted Flic buttons to work for their corporate applications. Luckily, we could do almost anything they wanted because Flic is so versatile. We provided code they could apply and a plastic casing for Flic that we could print logos on. Here are a few examples: We love to talk about the sports fishing app Anglr, who uses PbF buttons (a white label version of the original Flic) to drop location pins whenever a fish is caught. Anglers with wet and slimy hands can't pull up their smartphones when they�ve just caught a fish! Dominos pizza with their pizza button, Pizza Hut with their pizza ordering shoes (yep) and Clarion Hotels' "Save Me" button for boring conferences are all creative and inspiring applications. Sometimes it is not easy to know how a button can make MY life better. We know that once you start with Flic there is so much to discover, and you will soon find Flic shortcuts in your life that can range from mildly convenient to life-saving. Here are some simple getting started ideas: A find-your-phone button in your hallway - push it and your phone will blink and make some noise. A next-slide button for your presentation connected to your laptop - push to advance, push twice to go backward. An "I'm-home-from school button" - for your kids to easily let you know that they're home safe. An in your car share-your-location-with-your-spouse button. Send a geo-tag of where you are so that your spouse can see how far you are from home. A play/pause/next-song button in your pocket so you don�t have to tap your headphones or talk to a voice assistant on the run. A counter button to register habits - get a detailed view of how often you change diapers on your baby, how often you drink coffee, where and when you smoke, or at what times you go to sleep. SPECIAL REWARD! You can control most things and services when Flic is connected to your phone or when it's connected to a Flic Hub. When a Flic button is connected to your smartphone, it can also control functions in your phone, such as Find My Phone, Camera Shutter, Share GPS Location, and more. However, this requires your phone to always be near your Flic button. If you intend to have Flic buttons in stationary places at home or in the office, the Flic Hub is for you. The Hub ensures a reliable experience as you do not have to worry about the connection being lost when your smartphone is not near the buttons. Additionally, other people can use the Flic buttons when you are not around. Furthermore, a Flic Hub LR can handle many more Flic buttons than a phone. Using a hub is also the only way to use the IR blaster, Apple HomeKit, and Bluetooth Long Range. By backing this campaign you give proof that you support what we do. Your funding helps us develop the products and as a thank you, we send you the rewards that you want as soon as they are finished. When you support this campaign: You get Flic 2 and the Flic Hub LR at a much lower price than what will be available after the campaign. You receive the products before everyone else. You can help to shape the products as you want by giving early comments and feedback, and by participating in polls and surveys. If you want to be *really* early with trying the products, you can apply to be a beta tester (and accept on some bugs!) You will always be our hero ;) Our current target for starting to ship is September. As with any crowdfunding campaign, an exact reward shipping date cannot be promised as there are things that remain in the product development. We would rather delay a shipment than shipping products that we are not proud of. Flic 2 We have already kicked off the production tooling for Flic 2 so we�re well on the way but there�s still a lot of fine tuning left to be done which we hope we can finalize before end of June to start ramping up the production in July. As soon as we have a production worthy sample we can also start certifying the product. Flic Hub LR The Flic Hub LR is using the same design as the original Hub and therefore the tooling is already in place. The electronics is already designed and tested as well! A lot of the software can be ported from the previous Hub but there�s quite a few new features which requires development time and effort such as Long Range and 5Ghz Wifi which also significantly increases cost and requirements during for the certification process. For every Flic 2 you receive we include a CR2032 battery and our micro-suction adhesive pad. For every Flic Hub LR you receive, there is a USB cable included. A power adapter is not included. Label sticker pack: Add $2 to any reward to get a label sticker pack. Metal Clip: Add $3 to any reward per metal clip that you want. Bundle offers are available for certain rewards. IR Accessory: Add $15 to any reward that includes a Flic Hub LR. How will you know exactly what I wanted? We will send surveys after the campaign and if there is any doubt we will reach out to you directly and ask you! All rewards will be shipped from Sweden. For EU and US VAT and sales tax are included in the rewards. EU and US customers will not be charged any import taxes. For all other countries, taxes and duties may apply. Why? We learned the hard way that we can't ship to countries where our products are not certified or other reasons, they'll get stuck in customs. If you think this makes no sense, let us know! We may very well be wrong about your country. Shortcut Labs was founded in Stockholm over six years ago. What drove us then and what still drives us is the love for buttons that we share with our community. We want to make life simple for everyone, whether they're a super-user with all the smart home gadgets or a toddler who simply wants a light switch that can be mounted right next to their bed. Controlling everything we do with our phones can become frustrating, tiresome and anti-social (as we're always looking at a screen). Voice is a wonderful tool but, quite simply, it's not always appropriate in all situations. Flic is built to make our interactions with smart devices as simple as pushing a button and, through this, it has the ability to enhance and enrich the lives of millions of people every single day. This is our journey and what we're striving to achieve. We'd love you to be part of it. After a few months of tracking his nicotine consumption on his smartphone Joacim, Flic's co-founder decided enough was enough. He had to get out his smartphone, unlock it, find the right app, and then finally register his consumption. It was frustrating, it was painful, and it was complicated. Surely there had to be a more straightforward way? Shortcut Labs was founded in 2013 with the mission to create the world's smartest button. The first version of Flic came out on crowdfunding platform Indiegogo for the first time in 2014. Not only was it able to count nicotine consumption, but a wide range of things were possible. Flic had to be connected to an iOS or Android phone, and the Flic team built every single action right into the Flic Apps. It was a great success, as almost fifteen thousand people backed the campaign. Since then, Flic and Shortcut Labs have been on a rollercoaster startup ride, and today, Joacim and the Flic team have shipped almost half a million shortcut buttons to 85 countries around the world. Flic integrates with hundreds of technologies we all use daily. Every Flic user has a story to tell about how they use their button. From helping them create perfect morning routines to being the guardian angel that keeps their home safe, there are thousands of innovative and imaginative ways Flic is used. But underneath all of them, one thing always remains the same - Flic makes life simple. A shortcut and a life-hack in the form of a button that brings smiles to millions of faces every day. Flic 2 looks similar to our previous PbF buttons or "Flic Single" buttons, much because we found this design close to perfect. But Flic 2 is different from its predecessors in many ways. The outer shape is improved, the battery can be replaced, and the surface material has been perfected. But that's just the plastics. The really big differences are in the circuit board and software. The Flic 2 circuit board packs a lot more powerful components. And so does the Hub LR! The new Flic products are completely backward compatible with all previous Flic products. If you have Flic buttons, they will work with the new Flic Hub LR, and if you have an original Flic Hub, it�ll work with Flic 2. The Bluetooth Long Range capability is only achieved with Flic 2 connected with Flic Hub LR, and you can still connect original Flics to your Flic Hub LR at the same time. The Flic App for iOS, Android, and Mac will all support Flic 2s. Long range technology will only be available if your receiving device (phone/laptop) has Bluetooth 5.0 Long Range, however. Apps that have implemented the previous Flic SDK will have to include a new SDK in order to support Flic 2 LR. As a developer, there are a lot of options for you if you want Flic to work for your application. If you have an app, we recommend to include the Flic 2 App SDK which will be available natively for iOS and Android. If you want to develop applications for the Flic Hub, we� will soon release the Flic Hub Javascript SDK. As usual, there are SDKs and connectivity daemons for other platforms such as Linux and Windows. No license fees Use any official Flic software for free, most under the Creative Commons (CC0) license. Internet connection not required Previously, Flic products have required an internet connection in the Bluetooth pairing process. But not any longer! (Dear NASA, we can fulfill your request from 2016 now!) Open communication specification If you want Flic 2 to connect to other hardware devices, we have some good news for you: the Flic 2 Bluetooth communication protocol is open. Meaning that if you don�t want to use our SDKs and daemons, you don�t have to! Write your own protocol implementation using our guidelines and best practices and you can integrate Flic into literally any hardware running Bluetooth Low Energy. Our old Flic SDKs (yes, we�ve had two) were littered with restrictions and limitations as a result of decisions that were made when we designed the first Flic back in 2014. This time we have re-worked everything and combined all the good stuff into one SDK that's truly built with openness in mind. It�s easier to set up and integrate, it has multi-app support, fewer restrictions and it�s more reliable! Multi-app support With Flic 2�s new architecture, you can connect multiple apps to the same Flic, which opens up a whole new world of possibilities. This means that we are no longer restricted to using one app for one Flic for a single task. Now you�ll be able to combine a flurry of apps to create your perfect workflow. Flic Marketplace To kickstart the ecosystem of Flic 2 enabled apps we�ll introduce a Flic Marketplace. This is where people share app ideas and find other apps that do just the right thing. Here you can request features not only to us but to an entire army of developers! Smart Phones are great, but if you want to create solutions that aren�t dependant on a smartphone being around, something that always just works, then the Flic Hub SDK is for you. The Flic Hub SDK with a super easy-to-use programming environment lets you write code directly on the Flic Hub! No Tools Required We wanted to make coding on the Flic Hub accessible to everyone. All you need to get started is a Flic Hub and a web browser, no additional software is needed! Simply log in through our developer portal and connect to our web-based development environment. Start live coding directly on the hub within minutes! JavaScript API We created an easy JavaScript API that takes care of all the complicated parts and lets you focus on Your Ideas. However, if you want to get technical, there are advanced, low-level APIs as well. Share Your Work When you're done you can, of course, share your work to let other people take advantage of your awesome ideas! Large Scale Deployment For businesses that want to use the Flic Hub in custom solutions at scale, we offer a Device Management platform that lets you push applications to hubs in your domain instantly. Zero Setup We are also working on a Device Management Platform for large scale deployments of the Flic Hub. For Hubs in the Device Management Platform, there will be an ability to Cloud Configure Hubs. This means that you can assign new Hubs to specific configurations and ship them directly to customers without ever having to open the box. When the client plugs in power and Ethernet, the Hub will fetch its configuration and set itself up automatically. If you are interested in the Device Management Platform let us know and we can sign you up on a pre-release. If you have an app, a product or a web service that can be enhanced with Flic buttons, you can monetize on your user base by providing information about Flic or selling Flics that have your logo. We can take care of the entire chain from the point of sale until delivery to your customers. Get in touch with our sales team to find out more! We take your privacy very seriously, and that�s not just something we say. With Flic 2, we have changed our mindset. When we created the original Flic, we wanted to collect data in order to individualize and improve the experience for our users, but that�s not how we see it now. We don�t want your data anymore. With our products today and in the future, you can feel safe in that we know nothing about you or about how you use your Flic buttons. We still collect anonymized statistics in the apps so that we can spot bugs and so we can see which functions are popular and not. You can read our current Privacy Policy here, however, we are constantly improving it. This project is promoted by Jellop, the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarters with 650+ successful Kickstarter projects with over $300MM raised between them.

We are very excited to present BIO-CRAFT in an affordable STL format for gamers with 3D printers. I spent a great deal of time and energy on this project and hope that it finds an audience. I love to make bio-mechanical art and play tabletop games. The BIO-CRAFT line of gaming tiles are inspired by my love of surreal art by H.R. Giger and many science fiction movies I still marvel at watching. For those of you without a printer, like me, check out this link for 34 of the best online 3D printing services of 2019. Companies which do printing on demand. You just upload the file(s) and pick the material you would like it to be printed in. They have all sorts of durable plastic materials even several metals as an option. Imagine BIO-CRAFT in silver! ALL STL files will be sized in millimeter for easier printing accommodation. Cheers -Jason A. Hite of Hite Studios Ltd Here is a link to a free terrain archway to test print. To see more of my sculptural work please visit: http://www.hitestudios.com/ MOTHERSHIP a Sci-Fi Horror RPG is a great game to play with BIO-CRAFT tiles. We are now adding magnet recesses to fit 6x3mm magnets into all BIO-CRAFt walls! Magnet recess with 6x3mm Neodymium Magnet

As a filmmaker it has always been a passion try out new and exciting things. Well a friend asked me to model a character he had been creating for a class a few months ago, allowing me the chance to get put up in four and a half hours of prosthetic work to create something amazing. I instantly fell in love with the character that he had created. Mr Sweets. There was something about this terrifying creature that drew me to it. So I set out to write a script based around the character, which leads us to here and now. As most of you know, making a film costs money. I am currently looking for funding for this roughly 15 minute short film, mainly for the use of practical effects, as it is a horror film. Anything given helps us reach a goal of making the best possible film we can! Below is a brief synopsis of the story: Ben, a small, timid child, has been bullied throughout his life. His father is a drunk that shows barely any signs of life, while his mother is a clean freak, caring more about a clean home than her son. The only comfort Ben finds is in his notebook, when he is drawing out pictures of his imaginary friend and protector, Mr Sweets. Ben's bullies seem to escalate to a breaking point, that results in Mr Sweets coming to life, to aid and seek revenge on those that have wronged Ben.

"Winning in America" is a short film I'll be writing and directing as my thesis project for the Graduate Film program at NYU Tisch School of the Arts. We'll be filming this short in Hyde Park, Chicago this coming August! I'm excited to return to where I grew up to tell this story about an immigrant family coming together to support one of their own as she takes the stage in a competition notoriously dominated by Indian-American overachievers: the Spelling Bee. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Dream With One Eye Open centers on a special artist named Sylvia who was diagnosed with autism spectrum disorder (ASD) at the age of 3. She connects with the world through art, especially in drawing characters with only one eye. Art has become the key to unlocking the door between Sylvia, a girl who has a mentality of a 3-year-old stuck inside the body of a 14-year-old, and her mom Katherine, a woman who has overcome life struggles including multiple divorces, domestic violence, and jail sentence yet never given up on offering unconditional love to her autistic daughter. Autism spectrum disorder (ASD) is a developmental disability that affects a person�s communication and behaviors. It affects over 2 million people in the U.S. and tens of millions worldwide. Autism is a lifelong condition and we still don�t have a medical cure for it. Finding appears to reflect a lack of screening of ASD in minority communities. Furthermore, this documentary explores the issue of autism in girls. The criteria for diagnosing ASD are based on data derived almost entirely from studies of boys. The main subject of this film � Sylvia, is a multiracial girl with ASD. Sylvia, now 14 years old, was diagnosed with autism since age 3. Sylvia demonstrated her artistic talents at a very young age with her first drawing when she was only 3 years old. While having speaking and learning difficulties, art was Sylvia�s outlet to the world. Sylvia�s vibrant and often unique drawings say loudly, what words otherwise fail to tell. Sylvia�s artworks with bright colors, unique shapes and one-eyed characters provide us with a glimpse into her imaginative and inventive mind. She now lives with her mom and two sisters in Los Angeles. Katherine Yu (age 56) is an author and scriptwriter, but she always describes herself as an autism mom first. Katherine considers ASD as a gift for her child. 30 years ago, She applied to multiple grad schools oversea after having her first child Jenny in China. She received full scholarship to come to study in USA. It was during the 90s, while most women in China were playing the role of a housewife, Katherine never stopped improving herself academically. She went through two broken and abusive marriages while raising three daughters on her own. Katherine portrays strength, patience and heart love through her struggles and hard work both as an independent woman and as an extraordinary mom. Alina is Katherine�s second daughter. Alina is 2 years older than Sylvia and they were born to the same parents. Alina and Sylvia share a wonderful sisterhood. One of Sylvia�s greatest habits is to put makeup on Alina. Sylvia loves to �create art� on Alina�s face and turn Alina into one of the abstract characters she draws. These two girls still draw together in the same room on the same table everyday. Jenny was born in China and currently 33 years old. Jenny moved to USA to live with Katherine after her parents got divorced. Jenny is 19 years older than Sylvia. Even though Jenny and Sylvia don�t share the same father, they still share the closest sisterhood. Jenny now lives with her sisters and mom. She now works in the office with minimal wages in order to have flexible spare time to take care of Sylvia. Jenny has promised Katherine that she will not have her own child as she will treat Sylvia as her own child in the future when Katherine passes away. Family Photo One Eye Characters Sylvia started to connect with the world through drawing and painting at age 3. Sylvia�s pieces have evolved to contain unique one-eyed characters that exist within the fantastical and beautiful worlds she creates. Her artworks have never been seen by the rest of the world and as such, we would like to hold an art exhibition for Sylvia to showcase her extraordinary and unique craft to her community and the world for the very first time. This event is extremely important for Sylvia�s family; it will serve as a release and celebration for these lovely, headstrong four women to continue fighting and dreaming for their coming future. Art Exhibition References Director Even Wu Even Wu is an award-winning Chinese-Canadian film director/writer. Even graduated from Queen�s University in Canada with a Bachelor of Arts (Honors) degree, majoring in Film and Media. She's currently a Film Production MFA Candidate at the USC School of Cinematic Arts, concentrating on directing. Even has directed numerous films of diverse genres and received countless festival accolades around the globe, including the Cannes Film Festival (Short Film Corner) and Venice Film Festival (Focus On China Category). Even also pursues film projects in China, where she has directed 4 feature films with 3 of them having released nationally. She indulges in edgy visuals and strives to create significant and captivating films that reflect a passion for storytelling. Producer Ruoyu Ren Born and raised in China, Ruoyu is currently earning her MFA in Film & TV Production at USCSchool of Cinematic Arts. Ruoyu left for the UK at the age of 16 and graduated with a bachelor�s degree in Film Production at the University of Westminster. During her time in London, she worked as an office assistant for the 25th Raindance Film Festival and has previously been involved in various creative backgrounds such as film production, fashion advertising and public relations at festivals. Producer Alexa Velasquez Alexa Velasquez is going into her third semester as an MFA in Television and Film Production at USC�s School of Cinematic Arts. As an undergraduate Global Health major also at USC, she studied leukemic resistance to chemotherapy and contributed arts and culture pieces for a variety of on-campus magazines. After graduation, Alexa worked as a production assistant and writers� PA on a variety of projects and television shows. Alexa was born and raised in Los Angeles, California, where she has been spoiled with good weather and and thriving communities her entire life. Director of Photography Hark Xu Hark Xu is an award-winning Cinematographer whose work has taken him around the world, and started off his adventure from his home Guangzhou, China shooting commercials and fashion shows in 2012. In his undergraduate years, he majored in Film Studies at the University of California, Berkeley, and was a member of the Delta Kappa Alpha National Professional Cinematic Fraternity. He made significant contributions to a range of film societies and production companies before his return to graduate study at the USC School of Cinematic Arts as an MFA candidate. He has become a prolific cinematographer and continuously crafted stunning images to tell great stories. Production Designer Shange Zhang Born and raised in Xiamen, China. Shange found his passion for filmmaking and began to work in Art Department since 2012. He started his path as a Production Designer/Art Director by making award winning narrative short films selected by top tier film festivals including Berlin International Film Festival, Sitges International Film Festival, NBC Universal Short Film Festival, SAG-AFTRA Foundation Showcase, Edinburgh International Film Festival, Cleveland International Film Festival. B Camera Operator Yining Bei Yining Bei is a Chinese actor, director and editor. At an early age, Bei acted on a popular television sitcom and became aspired by film and television production. He got his bachelor of chemical engineer as his undergrad. Upon realizing his true passion for filmmaking, he became involved in various television productions at the Shanghai Orient Television station. He worked as the editor and post-production supervisor while at the station. Editor Lai Jiang Lai was born and raised in Ningbo, China. She received her B.A. in Broadcasting & Television Studies at Shanghai University, where she fell in love with filmmaking, especially editing. She has edited and sound designed multiple fiction and documentary films during her first two years of film & television production MFA at USC film school, including a previous documentary about the world of kids with autism. She has a strong passion for telling stories based on the genuine emotions between people. Editor Marjan Mona Koffa Marjan Mona Koffa was born in Raleigh, North Carolina and grew up in Maryland. She graduated with a Bachelor's degree in Media Studies and a Minor in Philosophy at The Catholic University of America in Washington D.C.. After graduating, Marjan worked at National Graphic as a production assistant for a year. She is currently getting her M.F.A. in Film and Television Production, focusing on writing, directing and editing at the University of Southern California�s School of Cinematic Arts. Marjan is interested in telling stories that allow her audience to intimately connect with authentic characters. Sound Designer Colin Ren Hailing from northeastern China, Colin never dreamt of expressing himself through film. Yet the art of sound and moving images became the place he felt most comfortable and understood. Colin has always been in awe of the way sound works with our unconsciousness, and he hopes to use its power to help the world connect with Sylvia in this film. He previously studied Studio Art at Colgate University, with a concentration in video art and installation. Sound Designer Jiashu Li Jiashu was born and raised in Wuhan. He received his dual degrees in both Film Production and New Media Art at Penn State. In the USC Graduate Film School, he found his passion in sound design and he hopes to contribute his vision and creativity to this emotional piece. I have always been fascinated by all the differences exist in this world that make us unique individuals. Sylvia�s story offers faith to individuals who struggle with being �different� as well as connects us to a new dimension of possibilities beyond the appearance of disabilities. This film will showcase that autism is as much a part of humanity as is the capacity to dream unlimitedly. Sylvia shows us beauty beyond the normal. Ultimately, this is a film that celebrates differences and diversities and reflected on the infinite power of a pure heart. This documentary will be created in the poetic style in which special intensity is given to the expression of feelings and emotions by the use of distinctive visual style and emotional rhythm. I am more interested in emphasizing visual elements to evoke emotional responses from the audience, motivate the audience to involve more and lead them to understand an �inner truth� of the story. I would like to tell Sylvia�s story as a visual poetry as she is indeed an artist herself. I will visualize the distorted and blurring reality inside Sylvia�s brain where words held no meaning. The ultimate goal is to capture the complexity, fragility and wonder of an autistic girl�s world and recreate her lifelong struggles of living with autism. I will make the visual experience authentic and comprehensible for the audience who wouldn't understand what autism really means.

WE DID IT! THANK YOU FOR HELPING US REACH OUR GOAL! We're so excited we get to make this film for you. Stay tuned to imgeorgelucas.com for future updates. PROJECT BACKSTORY Connor Ratliff, a 40-something comedian in New York City, has been playing the iconic role of George Lucas for the past five years at the famed Upright Citizens Brigade Theatre (albeit primarily at midnight on Fridays in the satellite East Village space). The show � titled �The George Lucas Talk Show� � didn�t have much hope for success. The premise that filmmaker George Lucas � now retired and without ownership of his Star Wars franchise � would use his free time to start a late night talk show was ultimately a very geeky and niche idea. Bringing that concept to life alongside his CGI creation Watto all while interviewing illustrious guests, commenting on the new trilogy, and reflecting on his past work, raised the show to another level (though Connor would often blurt out mid-performance that it could be cancelled by the UCB Artistic Director at any moment). And yet, it is one of the theatre�s longest-running shows, bringing out a pretty amazing batch of guests (Jon Hamm, D�Arcy Carden, Wyatt Cenac, Janeane Garofalo, David Harbour, Nicole Byer, and so many more) as well as a dedicated and loving audience every month, and is now featured at the main space in Hell�s Kitchen at the prime 7:30pm Friday slot. With write-ups in the Village Voice, special performances at New York Comic Con and SXSW, and a filmed segment on a TV sketch series, �The George Lucas Talk Show� and Connor Ratliff have become beloved fixtures in the New York comedy scene. And yet, the show is put together every month by only three people � Connor (THE MARVELOUS MRS. MAISEL, ORANGE IS THE NEW BLACK, SEARCH PARTY, DON'T THINK TWICE, THE DISCOVERY), his producer and talent booker Patrick Cotnoir (Marvel Entertainment, THE CHRIS GETHARD SHOW, UCB's ASSSSCAT), and co-star Griffin Newman (Amazon's THE TICK, Showtime's OUR CARTOON PRESIDENT, BLANK CHECK podcast) � who have to handle the set design, costumes, guest booking, prizes, video production, music cues, and ideation of general topics to be discussed, all while juggling their own full-time jobs, other creative endeavors, and personal lives. As some of those dedicated and loving fans of the show, we�ve been fascinated by how it all comes together every month while always feeling fresh and funny. And because we get to spend so much time with �George Lucas�, we don�t often get to see much of the man behind the white beard, Connor Ratliff himself. As filmmakers ourselves, we felt there was a story behind the comedy show about one of history�s greatest storytellers, and wanted to uncover more about Connor�s empathetic portrayal of him, what it was that motivated him to create this show, and how he�s kept it running for this long (with no end in sight). Thus, we present to you our film, I'M "GEORGE LUCAS": A CONNOR RATLIFF STORY. PRODUCTION TIMELINE April-August 2019: Filming with Connor, Patrick, Griffin, friends and past guests of the show, and capturing three of the performances September-December 2019: Post production 2020-2021: Film festivals and wide distribution WHY WE'RE MAKING THIS �The George Lucas Talk Show� is a show that brings much joy to its creators as well as its fanbase. Tons of friendships have been formed by show-goers over the past several years, and it even inspired a pair of friends to concoct a bingo game to be played during the show because of their obsession with Connor�s bits, which has now spread to become a fixture for the entire audience. We wanted to match this passion by all involved in creating a film that captures this, while also revealing more to the world about what goes into making it. We believe there is more than what is obvious and apparent, and want to explore the psychology and trajectory of Connor and how it correlates to George himself, as well as the complicated fandom around George and his creations. WHO THIS FILM IS FOR This film is for all those interested in a human story about those in the spotlight and those who go overlooked, and what drives each of them and the resulting art they each produce. It�s for fans of comedy, fans of Star Wars, fans of cinema history, fans of human stories, and fans of the documentary medium. WHERE DOES THE MONEY GO The money that you are so generously donating to us goes towards paying for the equipment we are presently covering out of pocket, as well as the upcoming post-production and advertising costs, to get this film to look and sound as awesome as possible and be seen by as many of you as possible. All of what we raise will go towards covering the production costs of making a documentary, and to support the film in its journey towards distribution. WHY WE NEED YOUR SUPPORT We have put together a fine team of filmmakers to capture and shape this project into a compelling documentary, but we can�t do it alone! We�re regular people struggling with daily life in New York City, and unfortunately that means not having a lot of extra funds to cover our artistic ambitions and endeavors. We could really use the support from YOU, our welcomed visitor to this page, to help us make and finish the film. Any amount you can contribute to our production fund would go a very long way in seeing this film reach the finish line of production, and even more so to reach the eyeballs of audiences worldwide. We�ve put together a vast list of rewards that are super fun and valuable, that we hope will also be of encouragement towards your donation. Additionally, whether you can financially support us or not, we�d LOVE for you to help spread the word about this film to your social networks, as word-of-mouth is often the best arbiter of success. Please post this Kickstarter link to your social channels, and also follow our own handles on Twitter, Instagram, and Facebook for updates and bonus content! DIRECTOR'S NOTE � Ryan Jacobi Over the last few years, The George Lucas Talk Show has become a low-cost therapy. No matter what chaos might be going on in the outside world, inside the walls of the UCB Theater, Connor Ratliff�s hilarious take on George Lucas offers a mix of absurdist, yet sincere, entertainment along with a sense of genuine joy. It exists for an hour, enjoyed by a cult-like following, then disappears, only to re-emerge a month later. Attempting to understand Connor is fascinating. Why has he pretended to be George Lucas for more than 5 years? How and why does he utilize a mainstream figure to express his own story? What does he get out of doing this show for free? It�s too enticing to ignore. After only a few months of filming, it has been surprising and rewarding to witness Connor as a performer and a person, along with his band of talented collaborators. Already, the universal subjects of success and failure, grappling with the past, and learning to live in the moment are begging to be explored. Thank you for considering to back this project. It is my intention that, like Connor himself, the film will be fun, unique, and sincere. With your help, we�ll be able to realize this story�s full potential and create a little more space for absurdity and joy. CONNOR'S NOTE Ryan & Marsh originally approached us (me & Patrick) about wanting to properly film one of our monthly shows, possibly with some kind of comedic framing device. That initial conversation led us to decide to allow them into our actual process in the hopes that something like that might be interesting to watch, a snapshot of a strange NYC-based comedy talk show that has found its level as a well-regarded but peculiar cult comedy event. I think if I wasn't the one doing this show, I might be curious to see a film about it, especially if I was in a part of the country or the world where I was unable to attend the show in person. My hope is that this film will convey what GLTS is and what it tries to be, and that we end up looking good. Then again, a lot of great documentaries betray their subjects and make them look like fools. Please give some money to this Kickstarter and let's find out which kind of doc this ends up becoming! THE STRETCH GOAL The funds we�re raising will cover the minimum costs of production and post (such as color grading, sound mix, master, and original music composition), so that no expense will come out of pocket. Anything we can raise beyond that will go to more ambitious production and post, as well as covering additional film festival submissions and advertising. THE TEAM CONNOR RATLIFF � creator and star of �The George Lucas Talk Show�, a comedian and actor, and the focal point of our documentary. TV credits include The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel, Orange Is The New Black, Search Party, VEEP, Broad City, The Chris Gethard Show, The President Show, Late Show with Stephen Colbert, Late Night with Seth Meyers, Last Week Tonight with John Oliver, Debate Wars and The UCB Show. Film credits include Don't Think Twice, Coin Heist, The Discovery and Standing Up, Falling Down. He has also appeared on This American Life and the Comedy Bang Bang podcasts. You can hear Connor as the co-host of the podcast "12 Hour Day with JD & Connor" which is a 12-hour long podcast where every episode consists of an uncut and unedited twelve-hour conversation between himself and JD Amato. GRIFFIN NEWMAN � co-star of �The George Lucas Talk Show�, co-lead on Amazon�s television series THE TICK, and co-host of the BLANK CHECK podcast. Additional credits include OUR CARTOON PRESIDENT, SEARCH PARTY, VINYL, COP SHOW, and DRAFT DAY. PATRICK COTNOIR � Patrick is the producer and talent booker for The George Lucas Talk Show and ASSSSCAT at the UCB theater in NY. He is currently the Editorial and Talent Producer at MARVEL. He has worked at Saturday Night Live, Above Average, and Sesame Street. He was the talent producer on The Chris Gethard Show on truTV. He was the Talent Coordinator on Comedy Central's The President Show and was a Digital Producer at NBC's comedy streaming platform, Seeso. He owns every season of LOST on Blu-Ray. He�s got a website, please visit it: www.patrickcotnoir.com. RYAN JACOBI � director and producer of this documentary. Ryan is a filmmaker, writer, and audio producer. He most recently produced and co-edited the feature-length documentary, We Breathe Again, for America ReFramed. He has worked for Sync Sound/Digital Cinema on projects ranging from NBC's 30 Rock to HBO's The Alzheimer's Project, and has collaborations with Murray Street Productions and That Studio. Ryan also produces and co-hosts Not Just a Movie, a film and TV podcast, and is a partner at the production company, Crawl Walk Run. MARSH CHAMBERLAIN � cinematographer, editor, and producer of this documentary. Marsh is an award-winning filmmaker and content creator based in New York City. He has worked on a variety of projects with a diverse group of clients including Ken Burns, Facebook, NFL, New Balance, AT&T, The Human Brain Project, Brave Trainings, and Vision Maker Media. As a filmmaker, Marsh has directed, shot, produced, and edited a number of documentaries, music videos, and other media. His first feature-length documentary, We Breathe Again, had its national television broadcast premiere on WORLD Channel�s America ReFramed, and played in festivals and community screenings around the world. Marsh is the owner and co-founder of the production company, Crawl Walk Run, and a proud dog parent to Lil� Lucy Pup. ANNAMARIA SOFILLAS � producer of this documentary. Annamaria is a television development & current executive and a producer, having most recently built the original programming departments at Gimlet Media's scripted division and at the NBCUniversal comedy streaming service Seeso. Annamaria was the creative lead/co-lead on over 25 original long-form series and over 30 stand up specials, including GLAAD Award-nominated "Take My Wife", BAFTA Award-nominated �Flowers� starring Oscar-winner Olivia Colman, �HarmonQuest� from �Rick & Morty�-creator Dan Harmon, "Bajillion Dollar Properties", "My Brother My Brother and Me� based on the hit podcast, "Hidden America with Jonah Ray", "Night Train with Wyatt Cenac", and �The UCB Show� featuring Amy Poehler. Prior to Seeso, Annamaria had stints at IFC, TV Guide Network, and Focus Features. Annamaria graduated from NYU�s Tisch School of the Arts with a BFA with Honors in Film & Television Production. She is a board member of the HRTS Associates NY.

Hear 9 time PGA tour winner Stuart Appleby's take on the Balanswing compression shirt in our video Wearing a Balanswing shirt is like getting instant muscle memory. Balanswing is the compression shirt made specifically for the golfer. Strategically positioned silicon strips integrated into the Mipan Aqua-X performance textile provide tension in all the right areas, offering subtle suggestions to your arms, shoulders, chest and back to get into a proper golf stance. After four years of research in fabric technologies, bio mechanical analysis of golf swings, and kinematic function studies, Balanswing is ready to help golfers all over the world! Compression fit technology has been favored by athletes of all kinds in many sports. It provides support, helps prevent injury, protects your skin, keeps you warm, etc�. However, golf requires specific movements not always conducive to what�s currently on the market. Balanswing is specifically engineered for the golfer, providing all the benefits of compression shirts with almost none of the drawbacks. Regardless of what you might look like in a form fitting shirt, your swing is gonna look great! Much like the Kenesio tape that is used by elite athletes all over the world, the elastic silicon strips strategically embedded throughout the Balanswing shirt work as gentle reminders to get you into proper positions as you swing. The strips are not forceful enough to restrict you, but they have just enough tension to provide awareness. Horizontal strips across the back and chest promote and support proper postures throughout the swing. Vertical strips running down the back provide support for the back and core muscles. Arm and shoulder seams are cut specifically to help position the arms more forward of the body to promote solid �connection� in the swing, where the arms and body work together. The only thing you'll need to remember is to put it on. Moisture Wicking 99% UV Protection Ultra Lightweight Innovative �Mipan� Fabrics Strategically Embedded Silicon Strips Back & Core Support Promotes �Connected� Golf Swing Promotes Proper Posture �Stay Cool� Technology for any weather Multiple Color Options Machine Washable Highly Durable Other similar shirts and training aids are cumbersome, difficult and sometimes plain ridiculous looking - straps and rubber-bands, golfing straight jackets - typical tools used to acquire a more connected golf swing. A book of ten underground adventures for the fifth edition of the world�s most popular fantasy roleplaying game, set within a ruin-filled mountain torn apart by the mysterious Grendleroot. Download the PDF Preview For a thousand thousand years, an ancient entity has been trapped in the heart of a mountain formed from rock not of this world. Over eons, creatures both monstrous and intelligent have explored the endless tunnels, caverns, and chambers of Blackclaw, answering the call of the mysterious entity buried within it. Over long centuries, hundreds of lairs, cities, keeps, prisons, and tombs were established within the mountain, but even those centuries of exploration did not uncover all its secrets. Then, two centuries ago, the entity now known as the Grendleroot awoke. Indestructible black spires shot through the rock of the mountain like the roots of a deadly weed, shattering civilizations, burying cities, and exposing caverns long lost. Today, adventurers residing in Deepdelver�s Enclave explore these lost ruins once again. They seek fellow adventurers brave enough to answer the call of Blackclaw, and to seek the mysteries of the Grendleroot. Ruins of the Grendleroot is a book of ten short easy-to-run adventures for the fifth edition of the world�s most popular fantasy roleplaying game. Designed for characters of 1st to 5th level, these adventures take place in the caverns, chambers, tunnels, and ruins of the mountain known as Blackclaw, within which lurks the Grendleroot�a strange and otherworldly sentience. Across these ten adventures, your characters will cure the corruption of an old tower destined to bring daylight to the cavern of Shadowreach; rescue a lost child who answers the call of a dying god; seek out the source of a plague of gnome zombies; travel to the Forest of Iron to stop the priest who would destroy the Grendleroot�and the entire mountain surrounding it; protect Deepdelver's Enclave from marauding warbands of orcs and hobgoblins; find the beast lurking in abolethic ruins that promises salvation in return for fresh meat; seal up a damaged cell in a forgotten monastery, which contains a being so dangerous that even its thoughts can kill; save a war hero from the elven assassins who hunt her down; discover the secret to quieting the restless Grendleroot from a slumbering vampire archmage; and travel to the Black Cathedral, discover the origin of the mysterious Caretakers, and stop a mage attempting to capture the power of the Grendleroot for herself. Download the free PDF preview�including summaries of all ten adventures and a fully playable 1st-level adventure you can run today! Ruins of the Grendleroot focuses on the sense of mystery and wonder that comes from exploring ancient ruins. The central hub of these adventures, Deepdelver's Enclave, is a frontier outpost overlooking the ruined city of Shadowreach, set deep within the mountain. In Deepdelver's Enclave, adventurers and explorers recount tales of their explorations, trade treasure and artifacts, and enjoy their shared love of uncovering the mysteries of the mountain. These ten adventures can be run independently as single-session games of roughly two to four hours each, or they can be tied together as part of a larger campaign. Five of the adventures can be combined together into a five-session mini campaign that focuses on the strange consciousness lying at the center of the mysterious mountain. Each of these ten adventures is designed to get you up and running quickly and to help you integrate them into your own campaign. If you�re familiar with the format of the book Sly Flourish�s Fantastic Adventures and the concepts in the book Return of the Lazy Dungeon Master, the setup of these adventures will be familiar to you. Even if you aren�t, you�ll find the design of these adventures intuitive and straightforward. In this book, you�ll find inspirational artwork, beautiful maps, fantastic locations, short readable summaries of places and events, evocative keywords to spark your own imagination, flexible read-aloud text, and piles of ideas to fuel your own stories. All Stretch Goals Complete! Throughout this campaign, we crossed all of the stretch goals we had planned. These include: (Unlocked!) A full digital map pack of all of Elven Tower's awesome maps. (Unlocked!) An art book featuring all the maps and art, which you can use at your table to show your players. (Unlocked!) More art throughout the whole book and an ePub version for all backers. (Unlocked!) Grendleroot-themed character backgrounds designed by James Introcaso (Unlocked!) A new chapter of random tables and additional location descriptions you can use to generate your own adventures and campaigns in Blackclaw mountain. (Unlocked!) A new chapter describing the history of the underground city of Shadowreach. (Unlocked!) A campaign adventure outline based on the return of the archmages of the Black Star that takes characters from sixth to twentieth level and a wallpaper pack with artwork by Jack Kaiser. About This Kickstarter Your funding for this Kickstarter will help fund artwork, maps, editing, design, and layout for this book. I have commissioned top creators in the RPG industry to help me bring this vision to reality, including Scott Fitzgerald Gray, Elven Tower, Marc Radle, and Jack Kaiser. Together and with your help, we're going to build one fantastic book of adventures. Collaborators This book is being put together by the following team of professional RPG designers, editors, and artists. Designer & Product Lead: Mike Shea Editor & Layout Artist: Scott Fitzgerald Gray Cartographer: Elven Tower Artists: Jack Kaiser and Bryan Syme Art Director & Designer: Marc Radle Example Artwork and Maps Jack Kaiser, artist for Return of the Lazy Dungeon Master, Sly Flourish's Fantastic Adventures, and Shadow of the Demon Lord, will be illustrating many original pieces for this book, including the stunning covers seen above. The incredibly talented Elven Tower will be doing all of the maps for the book. You can see an example of his work below. We'll also have internal character art by Bryan Syme. Here are a couple of examples of his outstanding work. Check out the sample adventure and support the Kickstarter�and together, we'll make a book of truly fantastic adventures! Print on Demand For the print-on-demand reward tiers we will use DriveThruRPG's print-on-demand service to print and ship these books. Once the books are ready, you will receive a link to order the books from DriveThruRPG at the cost of printing (usually between $4 and $7 per book) and shipping including US and overseas. This is the fastest and most cost-effective way to get these books into your hands.

A freshman girl's "perfect" school experience is shattered by the community around her in the absolute best way. Growing up in a small town, the idea is to be perfect. Have a perfect family, life, friends, etc. Looking back now, I wish someone had told me to just be myself. That's what Kristin Cooper is: A way to show kids to just be themselves, and to learn that's okay! The story of Kristin and her friends are to show social norms in a southern small town, and how to break them. All actors (excluding a few friends) and crew are from the Hartselle area. All main crew are women from the Hartselle area as well.

Experience Raven's first appearance and never before seen special features! The award winning PRINCELESS series reprints THE PIRATE PRINCESS story that introduces Raven in a special deluxe hardcover that's 168 pages long! Princess Adrienne, whose on a quest to save her sisters, alongside the blacksmith Bedelia, find another princess locked away in a tower and decide to save her. But Princess Raven has plenty of secrets and Adrienne finds herself pitted against her deadliest opponent yet! Raven would go on to star in her own critically acclaimed spin-off title, RAVEN: THE PIRATE PRINCESS. This is the perfect hardcover for PRINCELESS and RAVEN fans alike. A great starting point for newcomers who want to see empowering princesses who turn tropes upside down. PRINCELESS is a five time Glyph Comics Awards winner and three time Eisner nominee written by Jeremy Whitley. Jeremy has written several other fan-favorite comic book series, including Marvel's The Unstoppable Wasp, Dynamite Entertainment's Rainbow Brite and IDW Publishing's My Little Pony, just to name a few. The Pirate Princess art team features the creative stylings of Ro Stein and Ted Brandt (art team for Crowded by Image Comics). When asked about the deluxe hardcover, Jeremy Whitley commented, "It was so nice to finally give the first Raven story the full hardcover treatment. It really is wild that what we started as a free comic book day, eight pages story giveaway, and grew into this arc that not only introduced the world to Raven, but also to the amazing art team of Ro Stein and Ted Brandt. Now with the hardcover collection, readers can see what that evolution looked like as Raven went from being an idea to a character that would launch her own series." This volume of PRINCELESS highlights diversity, strength in self, feminism, LGBTQ+ themes and rewrites classic fairy tale tropes in a way suitable for children of all ages. Check out the rewards below, followed by what fans are saying about PRINCELESS, and preview pages from the book! Here's what fans had to say about PRINCELESS: ��this one takes the crown for being child friendly while still being a comic that adults can get into.� (Flip Geeks) �Whether you�re buying for yourself or for a child, regardless of your gender, Princeless: Pirate Princess is a solid book and absolutely worth picking up this week.� (Capeless Crusader) ��works for both new and returning readers.� (Newsrama) �This book was wonderful. It has some much to offer both old and new fans.� (Amazon Customer Review) PRINCELESS BOOK 3: THE PIRATE PRINCESS DELUXE HARDCOVER Preview!

Our 3D Printing Experimental Program. We have been experimenting to find the best materials and printer for the job. We had determined that high resolution resins are the best material to produce high quality creatures, but the start up cost was high and that is why our earlier attempt failed. In this kickstarter we are reducing the number of models and using a newly developed Nylon 3D printer product. The resolution is a bit lower (barely detectable); the texture is different; the cost of material is much lower: BUT they are much stronger and we have a low start up cost. Sprue of 12 stage3 Legionnaire Alien Bugs Sprue of Stage 2 Soldier Alien Bugs Four stages of Legionnaire Bugs with 28mm British Minis (by RAFM). Bugs have been had primer paint applied to make them easier to photograph. HIVE QUEEN and COUNTRY Oh Son's of England; for the first time since the Armada was driven from our shores an enemy has invaded our homeland. The Nation is in peril!The Enemy is most foul. However, we shall persevere; we shall avenge the Duke of Cambridge and Exeter.Arise Son's of England; the enemy is there and we shall drive the vermin from our sacred shores! Welcome to the Hive, Queen and Country universe as envisioned by Terry Sofian and the members of the Hivequeen Yahoo! group. Hive, Queen and Country is set in a modified Victorian history with a number of �conceits�; technologies that are added to increase the excitement of an already fascinating era. Changes include economically viable space travel to Luna, Mars and Venus, as well as widespread heavy life air flight. The new worlds of the solar system are not lifeless orbs but are spheres populated with strange and dangerous life. A race of aliens inhabits Mars and has used enslaved humans to terraform that world, Venus is also home to transplanted Earthers. And in 1892 giant "BUGS" invade England in Devonshire. Thus in this universe "Tommy" will not only face Zulus and Dervishes, but alien invaders and exotic creatures on Venus and Mars. Luckily for our "Tommy" weapons technology is advancing rapidly under the influence of alien technology and the pressure to defend the homeland. Why do we need your support?In July 2013 we formed Rosa Miniatures and Games to develop miniatures for the Hive Queen and Country universe using the latest technology 3D printing.This technology provide more details and permits overhanging parts, thus you will receive "bugs" of exceptional quality. Since the Hive Queen and Country universe is played as both a table top war-game (Hive and the Flame) and as a role-playing game (Stars of Empire), our miniature line for this game will be produced in both 15mm and 25mm. At this time we need your help to move for development into production. THE HIVE When The Hive broke out into Devon and Cornwall in the spring of 1891 it was a threat of unknown nature and capabilities. In parallel with direct military efforts designed to contain and destroy the aliens scientists worked to study and understand them. Initially humans were able to dissect the remains of individual Hive animals and make observations about their physiology. Increased contact with the aliens brought additional data about their life cycles, both of the individual workers, warriors, queens and kings and the Hive super-organism itself. Through the entire Hive War the aliens continuously bred new warriors of increasing size and capabilities, the ability to identify these new castes became critical. Like a human society the Hive is far more than the sum of its parts and the behavior of the entire colony is what in the final analysis made the Hive such a deadly opponent. Like terrestrial social insects the members of the Hive are divided into castes, groups whose bodies are designed to fulfill certain functions within the Hive structure. The Queen herself, and her King are members of the reproductive caste. The vast majority of Hive individuals are workers and these perform a variety of functions, from building the Hive to caring for eggs and the Queen to harvesting, growing or transporting resources. The Hive is defended and territory gained by the warrior caste; the warriors; are designed to fight the enemies of the Hive and bring them back as food. Drones are needed to control workers and warriors, without these individuals other Hive members do not cooperate effectively. Renderings of bugs The worker and warrior castes are further subdivided. The worker caste consists of many types from nursemaids, to diggers to tumblebugs. The warriors are by far the most individually specialized. There are almost twenty known types of warriors in several different sub-castes. Each type has different functions and each deserves to be described on their own. Drone (rendering) The warrior caste has a large number of sub-castes. The following sub-castes have been identified: Lancers, Soldier, Legionaries, and Shooters. Within each sub-caste there are four growth stages: sizes of warrior from the numerous minors to the rare but terrifying super-majors. Each sub-caste has its own tactical role to play on the battlefield. Legionaries are the most generalized of the warrior castes and are often used as scouts. They slash their enemies with mantis like appendages causing gaping wounds. Stages of the Alien Legionnaire Bug (miniatures have had primer paint applied) Side view of Legionnaire Bugs (primer paint applied) New photo by pro Soldiers have enlarged heads with powerful mandibles. Even the smallest of these Creatures can remove a limb with a single bite. Four stages of Soldier Bugs (primer paint applied) New photo by pro (who laughed at my poor camera's focal length) Side view of Soldier Bugs (primer paint applied) Lancers are fast moving and hard hitting. They strike quickly, charging across open fields or from ambush. New photo of lancer family In Hive Queen and Country Flying Lancer are the "air force" of alien invaders. This rendering is our latest model which we hope to test print shortly. Renderig of the Flying Lancer Shooters are the most exotic of the warriors and the only ones that can operate without the control of a drone. They are biological volley guns, cannons, rockets or bombs. Medium and smaller shooters use the power of compressed air to launch volleys of quills. The Shooter Major and super major produce chemicals within their bodies that when mixed fire heavy projectiles from a tube on their abdomen. Renderings of Shooters: not scaled Workers: PICKERS and HAULERS Every hive has a wide variety of worker bugs that collect food and maintain the hive. The Hauler is a the Bug-Truck moving resources where ever directed: . It is often encounters outside the hive. The Picker is a general worker which was named by humans because the often encounter it collecting (picking) food. Rendering of Pickers and Haulers The KILLERS are the fifth warrior class we designed, but we are having issues with printing these as the tentacles that rise off the abdomen are rather fragile. This is the reason we have not yet added them to this Kickstarter: we do send out bad models. The experiments continue. Renderings of Killer Warrior Caste What Rules Can I use? What game system cannot use giant insectiods? These high quality miniatures can be used with any game system. Of course we do think our rules are the best, but then again we are a little bit bias. Stars of Empire (by Terry Sofian) Stars of Empire is a hard science science fiction role playing game in which the Victorian Powers have discovered space flight and are striking out across the vast darkness of interplanetary space. As they explore frontiers on Earth, Luna, Mars and Venus, they encounter transplanted populations of humans, ancient and terrible alien races, and ferocious exotic beasts. Until 1892 each considered the other Great Powers to be their biggest rivals. It was in that year The Hive broke free in Devon and threatened more than just the balance of power on Earth. The Hive put the very existence of mankind at stake. The Victorian in Our Time Line was a period of exploration and scientific achievement, military conflict and colonial conquest and social upheaval. In Stars of Empire aerial and space travel have been cleverly grafted into this historical fabric. Players will be able to interact on not only Earth but other worlds as well. Mars is home to a race of ancient aliens, powerful dangerous and unpredictable to the minds of men. Their true powers and purposes are shrouded in mystery. It is know that for many thousands of years they have harvested humans from Earth for use as slaves. With this human workforce Mars has been transformed from a lifeless rock into a tropical greenhouse of a world. Venus, beneath its thick atmosphere is a strange mix of dark basalt plains and humid cloud forests. Stars of Empire is a stand alone game book. It contains the core role playing rules, and a detailed and dangerous universe setting. Rules include character generation, combat and detailed sections allowing characters to develop engineering projects, scientific theories or inventions. Hive and the Flame (by Terry Sofian) BEST SCIENCE FICTION GAME SUPPLEMENT 2011! as voted by the membership of The Miniatures Page. In The Hive and the Flame, alien invaders meet the thin red line of the British army. Using the well-tested Sword and the Flame British colonial game engine and Eight Hundred Fighting Englishmen's mechanics for larger scale battles, The Hive and The Flame brings in the alien arthropods from Terry Sofian's Hive, Queen and Country setting. Advanced Victorian technology, backed up by the guts of rough British Tommies, faces off against giant arthropods armed with claws and mandibles. Even Zulus and Dervishes can't match the selfless devotion these creatures show to the Hive. Can the humans, with their science and courage, match biological killing machines bred to cleanse a planet of all life? Steam-powered airships and land machines help to even the contest between the alien invaders and the soft, physically weak humans, who are badly outnumbered by the rapidly breeding creatures. Larry Brom's original and inventive rules are smoothly integrated with both the alien menace and steampunk technology. Rules and background are included for numerous insectoid invaders, as well as many new weapons and technologies for the Imperial defenders. The Sword and The Flame and/or Eight Hundred Fighting Englishmen is required to use this product. For more information on the Hive-Queen and Country Universe see:http://hivequeenandcountry.com/home/ Other Rules (Adaptability): What game system cannot use giant insectiods? These high quality miniatures can be used with any game system. Our Steam Land-ships and human troops can be used with any Victorian Sci-fi game. Of course we do think our rules are the best, but then again we are a little bit bias. Investment Plans and Breakdown. The breakdown on your investment will roughly be 30% towards material cost; 30%to recover artist fees and R&D, 20% shipping and 10% overhead (Kickstarter & Amazon fees). As we reach stretch goal percentage of funding will be shift towards increasing more R&D. We anticipate a delivery date in early December 2019, this time is based on the printer schedule and packaging time. Stretch Goals Our stretched goal are designed to expand the play options, by expanding the diversity of the bugs with additional caste. As we reach a stretch goal you will receive the additional rewards starting with Tier 1. Each reward will provide items free of charge to the respective tiers. 600 Bug "Lancer" will be unlocked. Do you use an iPad photo booth and worry about printing through WiFi or needing internet? Do you want to print directly from a live folder on your computer? Well we have a perfect solution for you. iPIX is creating a simple way to print using any iPad app through a wired USB connection. This means lighting fast and worry free printing. No AirPrint. No servers. Just straight forward simple printing. This program will also work as a watch folder printing program. Meaning, you select a folder to monitor and, any files added into it, will get printed automatically. If you are using an iPad app then this method would still require the use of a cheap PC since iPads don't allow for driver installation. However, a cheap $100 tablet will be perfectly fine as its only function is to send a photo to the printer. The process will be simple. 1. Connect your iPad to your computer 2. Open the printing program and select the album on your iPad that you want to monitor. 3. Select automatic or manual printing. 4. Select a watched folder (where the files will go into). 5. Press Start Program 6. Watch the files print. You will also have and option to manually reprint a file if you want to. Simply select the thumbnail of the file, select number of copies, and press reprint photo.

Art & Creativity Are Important This project is about exploring economic possibilities for a creative teenage boy. The Short Backstory As a father I've tried to cultivate curiosity in our kids and help them to discover what they are good at. My son Abner is getting to an age where earning some extra $$$ is important, so the topic of getting a job has been part of our regular conversations. I'm all for hard work and craftsmanship, but I'm not for trading the precious hours of our life, doing work that has no enduring value, for a few bucks. To me, creativity is a gift and should be cultivated throughout life. The world doesn't need anymore plastic widgets, efficiently built by human automatons, destined for landfills and waterways. Abner loves camping - for his 16th birthday we went on a mini road trip around Washington state hiking and building campfires (he also loves to ride his skateboard, but that's a whole different topic). Shirts are something we wear everyday - so they seemed like the perfect way to help him understand that there are many ways that creativity and art can enable him to earn money. The design is a sketch he made for his mother that shares his love of camping. $25 Reward - Abner's sketch on a super comfortable shirt. Adventure shirts. The message is simple - adventure is...out there! We just have to be willing to go look for it. For Abner this shirt will be an adventure; he'll get to learn a little about apparel and screen printing, but most importantly I hope he learns that creativity can provide him with a way to earn a living without selling out or being relegated to a life of mindless drudgery. He doesn't know about this Kickstarter project (yet) - my hope is that I can surprise him with a modest number of orders, so he'll see the potential and do more. $5 Reward - Abner's sketch on a heavy weight postcard. Adventure postcards.
