TsunamiCon 2019 is happening October 18th, 19th and 20th at the Midian Shrine Center in downtown Wichita. We are excited to present our sixth annual national tabletop gaming convention in America's heartland! This year, we've moved across the street to the Midian Shrine Center with more than 10,000 square feet for gaming and events, the TsunamiCon Marketplace, VIG Lounge, and more! And we want YOU to join us for three fantastic days of tabletop goodness and related geekery. As always, we have some very cool rewards lined up for backers. As a backer you get: Badge prices available only to Kickstarter backers. Access to all non-exclusive convention events. Premium access to exclusive events presented during this campaign. Eligibility for prize drawings up to and during the event. Great prices on TsunamiCon merchandise. TsunamiCon attendees can enjoy a number of gaming opportunities and related geekery throughout the weekend! Additional features include: Featured Events Special Guests Organized Play Live Action RolePlaying Miniature Painting Contests and Giveaways And more...! We offer preregistration for numerous games and plenty of open gaming opportunities. Attendees can get in on some old school RPG action or sit down and try something new. We also have access to a sizable library of hobby games and knowledgeable folk to help you get started. It�s a great event for novice gamers and veterans alike! This year we have a lot of rewards to choose from, so here's a handy reference guide to help find the item you're looking for. Be sure to scroll down and take a look at the add-ons, as well, if you'd like to add additional badges or merchandise to your pledge. Learn more at Tsunamicon.org and follow us on Facebook! Volunteers and Game Masters We offer three reward levels specifically for Game Masters and volunteers designed for attendees committed to providing the two vital services that make our convention possible. Each reward level requires a certain level of commitment to working the convention as a volunteer or scheduling and running games over the course of the weekend. Volunteers are expected to review our policies and complete the volunteer application, indicating your preferences and availability, no later than October 11th. Volunteers will be employed as needed (registration, checking badges, helping with special events, running errands, handing out swag, assisting Game Masters, and so forth). Failure to register as a volunteer will require you to pay the difference at will-call to acquire your badge. We also know that plans and schedules can change, and we will work with you as much as possible to fit your needs. Game Masters are expected to schedule gamand events for participants to enjoy at the convention. Registration is now open, and we prefer that Game Masters try to list their events by September 15th to provide ample opportunity for signup. GMs are encouraged to promote their games on social media to elicit registration, but you are not penalized for failing to fill the seats at your tables. Failure to register your games by October 9th will require you to pay the difference at will-call to acquire your badge. Find more information at TsunamiCon.org/VIG. The following reward levels for vendors are available for TsunamiCon 2019. Space is limited! Vendors are encouraged to review our policies and submit a vendor application as soon as possible. Applications will be approved following the close of the campaign, and you will be provided a discount code for the features you have purchased and the option to add additional features and select your space in the Marketplace. The following Add-Ons are available exclusively to backers who select one of these packages and add the additional amount to your pledge: Advertisement ($55): Add a quarter-page advertisement in our beautiful full-color program booklet to your Vendor or Artisan package. Additional Badge ($20): For each additional weekend pass, add $20 to your pledge. Vendor passes provide full access to the convention and all non-exclusive events, but are not eligible for some prize drawings and giveaways. Remember... you can always help us out by picking up extra swag today! Just add the appropriate value to your pledge! If you are unable to attend the con and select items to add to an existing reward, please add an additional $5 to your pledge to assist with shipping. It is not necessary to add additional funds for more items; a one-time shipping fee is sufficient. Thank you. It's also time to announce some additional Add-Ons for package deals on your tickets! Any backer at the $65 KNIGHT reward level can add a second KNIGHT reward by adding $45 to your pledge. Any backer at the $80 SILVER VIG reward level can add a second SILVER VIG ticket by adding $55 to your pledge. ANY backer at a pledge level of $30 or higher may add the ADVENTURERS reward level of four 3-day passes by adding $120 to your pledge. As we barrel down on the final days of the campaign, we'd like to give something back. We often combine giveaways with our Kickstarters for hitting certain goals. This year, we're holding drawings for prizes based on the number of backers. At the end of the campaign, we'll draw names from our list of Kickstarter backers for some free games! The value increases with the number of backers: We're also offering some cool opportunities to expand the scope of this year's convention with special guests and features: Secrets of Blackmoor ($4200): If we reach this stretch goal, we'll be joined by Griff and Chris from The Fellowship of the Thing with an exclusive screening of their new documentary Secrets of Blackmoor, an unprecedented exploration into the evolution of roleplaying games that reveals the true origin of Dungeons & Dragons. They'll also be presenting some old school gaming scenarios from Dave Arneson's early and unpublished work. It's an exciting glimpse into our heritage and where it all began! The Evilest Beagle ($4800): If we reach this stretch goal, we'll be joined by veteran game designer Sean Patrick Fannon from Evil Beagle Games. Sean is best known for his work with Savage Worlds - including his epic fantasy setting Shaintar, the Savage conversion of Rifts, and the exciting Freedom Squadron - and brings with him a wealth of unique gaming opportunities for TsunamiCon attendees!

Very Good Dance Theatre is proud to announce The 1st Annual Gay Show! The 1st Annual Gay Show is a brand new dance theatre work written by Colby Calhoun and William Acker and choreographed by Danielle Georgiou and created in collaboration with the ensemble. The 1st Annual Gay Show will premiere at the Festival of Independent Theatres at the Bath House Cultural Center and will perform on the following dates: - Friday July 12th @ 8PM - Saturday July 13th @ 5PM - Sunday July 14th @ 5PM - Saturday July 20th @ 2PM - Saturday July 27th @ 8PM - Thursday August 1st @ 8PM ---- Why are we making this show? The 1st Annual Gay Show is dance theatre for queer people made by queer people. Our show focuses on the complex experiences of queer people of color living in America and we are devoted to showcasing queer excellence outside of the lens of social norms or popular culture. Queer people, and queer POC especially, are too often portrayed as simply fabulous and fun and their stories are used as a means of entertainment, but in this show we want to show a more wholistic perspective of the queer experience. We want to share not only joy and fabulosity, but also success, failure, talent, shame, and pride. ---- What is the show? The 1st Annual Gay Show is a spectacle filled piece of verbatim dance theatre that both pulls directly from and abstracts the format of a traditional southern beauty pageant while dissecting the ideas of queer visibility, diversity and inclusion, and the role that outward vanity plays in the queer identity. The 1st Annual Gay Show pushes past the surface level of simply including trans and queer people of color and instead brings their stories, and unique experiences, to center stage and pulls back the curtain (puns intended) to reveal the nasty truth behind the smiles, the glitz, and the glamour. ---- Why do we need your help? We are a brand new group and because of that we lack the funds to be able to produce this show on our own. Thankfully, our show is one of eight works chosen for the Festival of Independent Theatres at the Bath House Cultural Center this year. FIT alleviates much of the financial burden by providing a performance space, marketing, and unique festival that exposes us to a wide audience. However, costuming, props, and most importantly paying our artists is up to us. This is why we need your help! A donation to our campaign helps us continue to make theatre like The 1st Annual Gay show and your donations directly goes to supporting queer and trans artists of color! Help us reach our goal of $2000. Funding is all-or-nothing so it's imperative we reach this goal. We want give our performers a well deserved stipend for their fierce talents, time, and dedication. We need you and your support, for you to spread the word of our show, and then please come see it! We can�t wait to see you there! For more information on Very Good Dance Theatre or to reach out to us directly find us here: https://www.facebook.com/verygooddancetheatre/ - Colby, Will, and all of us at Very Good Dance Theatre

Hey everyone! My name is Bissrat Berhanu. I am a full time senior at San Francisco State University, majoring in Sociology, while also being a full time bank teller. I am trying to launch a mobile app designed to help all people of color choose a health care provider that's perfect for them. If you are a person of color, you know that mental health isn�t treated appropriately in our community, in fact it�s usually ignored. Especially for the generations before us. The topic has carried particularly negative connotations. Unfortunately, it's easier to talk about drug or alcohol addiction than depression or anxiety. But in the past decade, the attitude regarding mental health within our communities is slowly changing and the acceptance of therapy is rising. As a person of color myself, I know that we tend to distrust medical professionals. But what if you could speak to someone who looks like you, has had similar life experiences, or has the same cultural background? With this app, I plan to join forces with health care providers with the intention to make people of color more open and comfortable. The goal is to not only help people find a health care provider perfect for them, but to also create an open and honest space where we don�t have to be ashamed or embarrassed to speak our truth. The overall goal is to de-stigmatize, normalize, and most importantly PRIORITIZE mental health. There are millions of people with a mental illness who are getting treatment and living successful lives. Help me help others join them and take control of their health. Below our a couple samples.

For example, a proper sound & lighting system are crucial to the success of a comedy club. So, here's where your money is going: Lighting & Sound System: $4k Tables/Chairs/Furniture: $3k Signage & D�cor: $2k Stage Design & Build: $1k Green Room Buildout: $1k Kickstarter Fulfillment: $1k

It's Indiana Jones in Ancient Rome! Get ready for a high-adventure trek through 3rd century North Africa, as a team of treasure hunters and outcasts uncover the secrets of Alexander the Great on the frontier of the Roman Empire! KYRIE has been a beloved and critically-acclaimed digital comic since its digital launch on Kickstarter in 2014. Now, 240+ pages have been added to this sweeping epic of Roman Africa. But this story has never been put to print! KYRIE tells the story of a curious band of thieves, cutthroats, bookworms and traitors as they attempt to outsmart the North African authorities, while navigating their own dark and competing desires as outlaws of a dying Roman Empire. Part one of this unique graphic novel is ready to be put into your hands! And most importantly: All 120 pages are already finished - with another finished 120 pages (for $1) as our stretch goal! **NOTE** This Kickstarter campaign is only open for ten days! See our Indiegogo page for the longer campaign. Book 1: The Curse of the Macedonian Scroll Chapter 1: Prologue The book opens with an unlikely troupe of thieves, a duo called the Thunder Brothers and led by the treasure hunter Myra, as they race to escape Alexandrian Egypt with the Red Lady of Babylon - an infernal ruby coveted by both Roman and Persian Empires, containing an encrypted message from civilization's dawn. Chapter 2: The Red Lady of Babylon The robbers escape by stealing Senator Valerian's sailing ship, only to discover a prisoner aboard named Marcus, who knows how to reveal the Red Lady's message, and a scroll from Macedon which explains it. But is this mysterious prisoner more dangerous than the Roman naval authorities who are already hunting them down? *BONUS Stretch Goal Content* Chapter 3: The Garamantian Desert This chapter opens with the prisoner, the head treasure hunter, and a surviving Roman soldier washing up on the Libyan shoreline. The prisoner and treasure hunter agree to a temporary alliance in order to hunt for the Red Lady's origins - a forgotten oasis somewhere in the south Egyptian wastes. The senator sets off with a military attachment to chase these protagonists down. The prisoner explains that Alexander the Great originally received the Red Lady, on his quest to defeat the ultimate enemy - his own mortality. The traveling trio enter a dangerous border town, in search of a wandering Berber tribe that can take them to Siwa. This is an independently published graphic novel - meaning this book can only be printed with your pre-orders! Securing a minimum number of pre-orders allows us to hire the printer to run their printer in China and ship the books to America, where we can then distribute them to you. Free KYRIE postcard included for those who share the their Confirmation ID Number on social media and tag @mattcrotts on Twitter or Instagram! BOOK PRINTING SPECS: � 12 pt matte UV cover � 80 lb matte coated interior pages � 6.25"x8.574" at 128 pages The more pre-orders we receive, the lower the cost of each book becomes. This in turn allows us to invest those savings back into the length of the book itself. KYRIE Part II: The Three Sand Seas is also complete - meaning a further 120 pages can be added to this book, but we need a higher pre-order count to afford to thicken this book run. In short, the more support we raise, the more book you get! PRINTING STRETCH GOALS (added for free to each printed book order if enough combined pre-orders on Kickstarter and Indiegogo are raised): � Spot gloss cover � Bonus 16-page Making Of content � Poster by Elliot Fernandez (@jerkmonger on Twitter) � Bonus printed map of KYRIE's Ancient North Africa by illustrated map expert Stephen Hesselman (example below): And the main $7,500 stretch goal (combined with KS and IGG preorders): � Bonus 120-page Chapter 3 added to the campaign, for $1!! (Either printed seperately as a second book, or combined into Book 1. PDF versions will be available as well) PLUS: Awesome fan art will be included in the book either way! ^ art by Madeleine Fisher (@mfisherart) KYRIE is a richly crafted longform comic, following in the best traditions of the classic high adventure storytelling. It's also a love letter to Ancient North Africa. And graphic novels like this one just aren't (yet) available your local comic book shop or bookstore! Purchasing this book helps get stories like this one onto the bookshelves of readers of all ages, all over the world. We just can't do it without your backing! This Indiegogo campaign is the only available way to print Book 1 of KYRIE. Though every page of this book is finished, we cannot produce a printed version without your invaluable support. We've successfully funded and delivered a Kickstarter campaign for KYRIE's prologue back in 2014. We are confident we can do so again. Thanks to the printer, we can get this book efficiently and reasonably printed and delivered to myself or the distributor in just a few months. No one is charged if this Indiegogo campaign doesn't fund. If for some reason the campaign funds but I cannot deliver the book, I will fully refund the campaign. We're sure you'll love this book! And we are making every effort to ensure your book will get to you safely and on time. We want you to be more than satisfied with your purchase. Have questions or concerns? My contact info is in the Q&A section. Just ask! Some people just can't contribute. We understand ! But that doesn't mean you can't help: Help get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. Tell your friends! Social media works! Share this campaign online. Use the Indiegogo share tools! So that's the pitch! Let us know if you'd like any more info. See you after the campaign!

Welcome, friends, to the fundraiser for Young American Sycamore, my second full-length album of original music! THE ALBUM When I began this album last summer I was skeptical if the joy of music-making still resided within me. You see, this album was born in fire and hardened in tension and silence, and those are hard lessons to own. In April 2016, I woke to shouts and sirens and the dim flicker of firelight on the tree outside my window. While I lay sleeping, a mere 10 feet above my head a faulty HVAC unit caught fire. There was enough time to run outside with my phone and keys. Despite the frantic chaos of firemen running up and down the stairs and the orange, hungry flames and the black smoke blotting out the stars and the worried neighbors calling out for missing pets and the TV crew that materialized by our cars and the Red Cross blanket wrapped tightly around me, I heard music. The Sycamores Apartment fire. That's my KIA and two windows above her is my bedroom. Hymns and folk songs weaved in and around me like that Red Cross blanket. My world was burning, and my mind played songs. Such is the power of what we say and write and play and share with one another, and such is what I have attempted to create and share with you in this album. Young American Sycamore is a testament to faith that withstands doubt. It reflects upon the importance of re-evaluating boundaries, and welcomes grieving and rejoicing alike. My belief in these songs is bolstered by the unwavering support so many of you have offered, even from the earliest years. You have encouraged me to keep writing, to keep singing, to keep telling stories. It is this encouragement I am calling upon now to financially support Young American Sycamore. The happiest place in the world (spoiler: it's not Disney) THE COST Albums are not inexpensive endeavors, but at least there's not some big wig producer saying "the only cure for [his] fever is more cowbell". Creating an independent album allows me complete artistic freedom to bring these songs to life in the way I envision them. It is a strange dichotomy of empowerment and humility to be an independent artist. Some albums are fully funded beforehand while others (like mine) go full steam ahead on credit and attempt to recoup the loss at a later time. I personally funded my first album out of a bootstrap-pulling mentality and I missed out on the feverish anticipation and build up that comes from a crowdsourced album funding and release! Simply put, I missed out on you. The band gathered in the room with the man behind the curtain, Producer Don Bates Now I am asking you to join with me in the excitement and fervor! With your support, I am hoping to raise a total of $15,000. It seems unthinkable to me to ask for that amount, let alone any money. But if I have learned anything through this process, it is that we depend on each other for support in all things. With that being said, here is the breakdown, including the fees Kickstarter takes off the top. MAIN GOAL: $9000 * Engineering, Producing, Mixing, Mastering, and Session players: $5400 *CD replication: ~$350 *Promo videos, photos, and graphics: $1400 *Publicity for the first single release in June: $1500 STRETCH GOAL: $6000 *Publicist for second and third single releases (July, August) and album release (Sept). Publicity will give this album the shot Days Like Tonight never had - a wider audience and a platform. Together with Mike Gowen at Milestone Publicity, I believe the singles and the album will be fully represented and given the chance to shine. Who knows, I may even snag a Spotify playlist! Thank you for your love and support always! xo LP

The Chimp With The Brown Hat is a Science-Fiction Western trilogy of graphic novels about a chimpanzee who wakes up in the desert in the Old West circa 1880 with a robotic hand, but no idea of who he is or where he came from. He rides from town to town trying to figure out the mystery of who he is and how he is connected to the space-worms that are attacking the surrounding villages. When we last left our hero he was face to face with the Beeker Boys who were oppressing the people of Lanefare but the stakes are much higher this time. The face of a chimpanzee, the mind of a man, and the heart of an outlaw. Fighting bandits and space-worms in the Old West. Inspired by the Spaghetti Westerns from directors like Sergio Leone, this is the introduction of the Banana Western a story that must be told! Where it Started "Grains and Hops" is the culmination of years of brewing and countless hours of research into the history and flavors of beer. One of the more interesting points of beer history I had come across was "Reinheitsgebot" (Purity Order), or commonly known in english as "The German Beer Purity Law". The law stated that beer could only be brewed with three ingredients, water, barley and hops (yeast had yet to be discovered). Prior to the law, beer had been brewed by many groups of people for medicinal, spiritual and enjoyment purposes and included all kinds of ingredients, from herbs to hallucinogens. Although the law was oppressive and eliminated many styles and brewing traditions, it also helped to create the beer we know today, specifically the prolific IPA. I was introduced to silkscreen printing when I was 15 and have over a decade of printing, graphic design, photography and illustration experience. About a year ago I started my own printing and graphic design company and began crafting and perfecting several designs I had sketched years ago that are inspired by the "Reinheitsgebot" and many personal experiences brewing and enjoying beer. All printing and design work is done in-house with quality as the number one priority. The Goal of the Campaign I currently have 6 original designs ready to print on tee shirts, sweatshirts, koozies, coasters and really anything that's printable! There are always other designs floating around my mind or rough sketches laying about the desk. This campaign is to generate the funds needed to purchase the raw materials (i.e: bulk inks, large shirt order, other textile media) and secure booth locations at my local street markets. The Apparel Unisex Tee shirts: These are the current designs for tee shirts. Hey Pretty Mama, Pretty Mama, how you be? // Hey pretty mama, are you watching over me? // Well I hope you turned away last night cause I wasn�t who you raised me to be // Oh Pretty Mama, I just want to make you proud of me �Play Beautifully!" my mom would say to my sisters and me as she dropped us off for music lessons as children. She sang and played piano, recorder, flute, and bassoon. My journey as a musician began with my mom, and thanks in large part to her, I�ve been a musician my whole life. But I only began writing my own music in 2011, a couple years after my mom had been diagnosed with early onset Alzheimer�s Disease and I returned home to spend time with her. As my mom's disease progressed and other language became difficult, music remained a way we could connect. I spent a lot of time playing guitar and singing with her--she liked to sing Simon & Garfunkel and Carole King and Ray Charles songs with me, leaning in and staring into my eyes as I sang and played. This was our top activity. I�ve written innumerable songs in the past seven years, and helping my mom in her progression with Alzheimer�s and facing the transience of life and loved ones have been preoccupations of mine through this time. Many of the songs on my album explore the emotional landscapes of loss and grief, as well as the hard and important process of healing and transformation. My mom passed away in 2016, the same week I began my masters program in Media Scoring at Brooklyn College. I didn�t intend on making an album of this nature prior to grad school. But as I studied and gained confidence as a musician, it became clear this album was ready to be made! In September of 2017, I partnered with fellow graduate student and music producer Teo Blake, and from demos and demos of songs, we chose the nine original songs for the project and began recording. As a graduate student the last 2.5 years I have contributed music and sound on many different projects, but not a week has passed without working on this album. Now that the project is in its final stages, I want to invite you to connect with this project and support me in the completion of this album. The songs are written and over thirty instrumentalists and singers have been recorded. The big task ahead is to finish mixing the album. Then the album will need to be mastered, which incidentally is the most expensive step in post-production of an album. Finally, we are putting together a record release show in Brooklyn featuring an array of instrumentalists who contributed to the album as well as a summer concert series to take this new work on the road! Your financial contribution and your enthusiasm will help me to accomplish this major undertaking. There�s a lot of work ahead, and I'm energized and ready to do it. Creating this body of work has been an act of love and healing for me. If I have any intention in sharing this music, it's that it can in turn help others process and heal. Thank you for being a part of this project that means so much to me! I can�t wait to finish and share with you my debut full length album that will be Play Beautifully.

ABOUTURBANUS JEANS URBANUS JEANS is snowboard wear brand which started from 2003. Our team set up our own special path to grow URBANUS as never getting old brand. In order to keep this purpose, we always try to search new stuffs such as new way, new style, new try and new technology. For example, we invented waterproof denim pants for ski and snowboard and won many awards from the invention. Our team members have very deep trust to each other and have believed that we are pathfinders for innovation. So, we hope to try another new way of market for customer and our own spirit like we have done so far, volunteer to be a pathfinder for better life. SPECIAL THANKS TO KICKSTARTER For last 15 years, we thought the market system is distorted. The final value of the product is too much over-estimated and bystanders took 70% of the final value. Because of this system, we must bleed manufacturers and staffs for low cost. As soon as we met Kickstarter, we became sure this platform can make the distorted market correct. Specially thanks to Kickstarter. NO MORE DUFF A lot of duffs increase product cost, for example, too complicated distribution channel, riddling result of advertising, too much high level of specs and so forth. In fact, final customers cannot enjoy above outputs from the high cost. So, we decided to cut off all duffs except for essential components. DIRECT COMMUNICATION We don't go to North Pole with those jackets. We only need enough waterproof, water repellent and breath-ability. We don't want to stock inventory in our warehouse and be pressured by sales data. We can offer the best price, better quality and good design after cutting off above not necessary components. THE ESSENTIAL FUNCTION AND BEST PRICE This is actually more than enough(the waterproof of umbrella is mostly 3,000mm). We don't allow over-functioned products to increase cost and price. If products have been stocked for a couple of years, those functions have been degraded. I can guarantee less than US$99.00 is the best price for all new products. QUICK TREND CHANGE We have very long argument about color offering. Sure, if you can have many choice, it could satisfy you easier. But it also can be one of very critical reason for cost increase. So, we unavoidably decided to give up color option. Nevertheless, the offered color of black is the most popular, snazzy and easy color for mass customers. We are sure this black can make you look better than any other colors. URBANUS BLACK'S FEATURE URBANUS adopts 3-layered fabric named SMART LAYERED series fabric. This allow URBANUS have such a great qulity ski and snowboarder. URBANUS BLACK#1 JACKET Non-padded Jacket for riders who want to keep coolness from heat and sweat <Adjustable Hood by String> <Snow gaiter protects the sleeve from snow> <Reflective printing is design point and shiny at night> URBANUS TRACK #1 JACKET Thin-padded Jacket for riders who want to keep body warm <Reflective printing is design point and shiny at night> <Adjustable Hood by String> <Multi-purpose sleeve pocket for ticket and credit-card> <Snow gaiter protects the sleeve from snow> URBANUS BLACK#2 PANTS Non-padded Pants for riders who want to keep coolness from heat and sweat <Snow gaiter protects the pants from snow> <Snow gaiter protects the pants from snow> <Reflective printing is design point and shiny at night> URBANUS TRACK#2 PANTS Thin-padded Jacket for riders who want to keep body warm <String for waist adjustment > <Reflective printing is design point and shiny at night> <Hook a lift ticket or etc> LOOK AT THE DESIGN OF URBANUS BLACK SIZE GUIDE - Uni_Sex size HOW WE WILL SPEND MONEY and THE TIME LINE One of our mission is to make the better quality at the best price to skiers and boarders just like us. By coming directly to you, we cut off the margins added by every bystanders, but to do this, we have to pre-orders and pre-pay to spread those goods at right time and right place. https://www.instagram.com/urbanusjeans/

Gods Sake is a concept I have been working on for several years now in hopes of adding my own personal take on the field of fashion. This brand centers around many sacred and meaningful experiences and understandings I've had with religion and faith. It also in the same breath represents a message or symbol of the relentless drive of human nature to never quit and to never give up on what it believes in... The term "Gods sake" comes from the old saying "for gods sake" usually used in a means to express ones emotion or attitude on a situation as being drastic or dire. You may of heard it uttered by a military commander in some war movie talking over a radio.. Or some coach instructing his or her team on their effort or some romantic drama between a couple trying to work out the mystery of love. Regardless of how you hear it. It always represents the same energy. One of passion and a will to achieve something more... Hopefully with your help this brand can do just that and create not only attractive style but also inspiration to the world.. So please show support "for Gods Sake"

My name is KJ, otherwise known as Feth of Rainbow Raven. I'm a writer and artist with my own independent business, and this will be my first Kickstarter! I've been in love with superheroes almost my entire life, always striving to be as good as the ones in movies, comics, and novels. Representation matters, and lately I've only seen a little bit of it when I feel like there needs to be more. That's the main reason I'm starting this project - so I can breathe a little life into an idea that I've had for a long, long time. For a good majority of us, we have felt like we need to hide our true selves away, much like a superhero does with their secret identity. But dressed up as a hero leaves one feeling free and able to do what they feel they're meant to do, while still keeping their 'real life' safe from prying eyes. Even still, there are too few superheroes who have their pride out in the open, and I wanted to make this series that's special and dear to my heart -- superhero masks in the colors of the pride flags for you to wear wherever you wish. Each pin will be roughly 1.5in in size, two metal posts with rubber clutches, and backstamped with my company logo (Rainbow Raven). The metal of the pins will be soft enamel rainbow metal plating, each representing a Pride flag in either color or style, depending on which pin(s) you choose. ***PLEASE NOTE THAT DUE TO MANUFACTURING, THE RAINBOW PLATING WILL LOOK DIFFERENT ON EVERY PIN. THE COLORS WILL ALSO DIFFER DUE TO YOUR SCREEN RESOLUTION. THANK YOU!*** To start out with, the basic pin to unlock will be the standard Rainbow. For the rest, they will be stretch goals; each mask has been specially designed with a 'hero design' to fit the superhero motif, as well as taking the colors into consideration for each flag. Rainbow - UNLOCKED! If we reach these stretch goals, all UNLOCKED Pride designs will be available to purchase! Lesbian - unlocked at $700 Trans - unlocked at $950 Bi & Pan - unlocked at $1,200 Demisexual - unlocked at $1,500 Aromantic - unlocked at $1,750 Asexual - unlocked at $2,000 Nonbinary - unlocked at $2,250 Genderqueer - unlocked at $2,500 [genderfluid image coming soon!] Genderfluid - unlocked at $2,750 Demigirl & Demiboy - unlocked at $3,100 Intersex - unlocked at $3,350 Bear - unlocked at $3,700 + MORE TO COME AS FUNDS PROGRESS!! Thank you! Don't see a flag you like/want? Message me, and we might be able to work something out! 70% of funds will go towards pin production to make sure everyone gets A-Grade pins. 15% of funds will go towards shipping fees + tracking. 10% of funds will go towards Kickstarter fees. 5% of funds will go towards packaging - pretty backer cards as well as padded envelopes to make sure every pin makes it safely to its new home! June to July: Campaign Run July to August: Waiting on Kickstarter funds, Surveys, and Pin Production Early August to Mid September: Checking pins for any defects/packaging pins to be sent out Mid-Late September to Early October: Barring any issues, pins will be shipped to all pledgers! Thank you for looking, and if you've backed, I very much appreciate your support! If you'd like to support me further in making the entirety of this project a reality (such as getting ALL the pins funded), please consider sharing this Kickstarter for anyone who may be interested! Aside from Kickstarter, can find me on these other platforms: Twitter, Instagram, and Deviantart! NO ADD-ONS Due to this being my first Kickstarter, I will not be doing any add-ons. If you wish to purchase more after the Kickstarter has ended, any leftover pins will be available on my shop store!

OUR GOAL... is to focus on creating creative opportunities for kids in developing countries. OUR STORY... began in Bali working with YKPA Bali Street Kids; an orphanage dedicated to providing necessities and education to children in need. We grew deeper roots when the volcano Gunung Agung awoke and caused thousands of local villagers to evacuate. We pulled together our resources to buy food and supplies for those in need. A year later August 2018 over 2000 earthquakes destroyed Lombok and the Gili Islands (which is home to a majority of our Indo family) so we worked endlessly through social media to promote awareness and raise funds for those who lost everything. While in Lombok we met a group of little girls selling bracelets. We had never seen someone so small hustle so hard and it created mixed feelings of awe and sadness. We had the realization that even though we didn't come from a family with money and sooo many odds against us, we've still been able to smash every goal we've ever dreamt up... and that's simply because opportunity was present. We realized that's exactly our position on this planet... to be the bridge for those who don't have the same opportunity as us simply because of geographical location. BOTTOM LINE... If we as adults have the ability to give a child their childhood back why wouldn't we? That's why we formed the That One Happy Thing Girl Gang (aka we gathered our lil sisters and pinky promised + shook hands that we're now officially biz partners) to produce, sell, and give access to buying the bracelets globally. The thought of all of this... that's our one happy thing.

Thank you for your articles, Make it simple to add speech to any of your projects. It only takes 3 wires to connect it with an Arduino or a Raspberry. No need to install libraries. By coping a .WAV file on the SD, you can play music, a prerecorded sentence or combine it with word synthesis. Hardware: Build in 3W speaker amplifier with a trimmer for the speaker volume, an audio line output jack and headphone amplifier. lt also includes a separate trimmer for the headphone volume. A low-pass RC filter is used to cut any high frequency noise. The word synthesis is done with an SAMD21G18 micro controller, running with an Arduino Zero bootloader. You must always power the board with 5v. Text is sent to the board thru USB Serial communication or by UART connection. There is a level shifter so a 5v (Arduino UNO, etc) or a 3.3v (Arduino Zero, Raspberry Pi, etc.) micro controller can be used. Both can work simultaneously. The default serial speed is 9600, but the speed can be changed by editing the file �setup.txt� found in the SD card. In this file you can also change the bit rate (default 22050), the bit resolution (default 8 bits), and the speed of the text (default 100). An error LED is turned on when a word is not found in the SD card. Also there is a test button, so you can hear that the board is working Software: The Text-To-Speech board has an SD card where all the words pronunciation are stored. When a text is sent to the Text-To-Speech board, the word synthesis begins, it quickly finds the words pronunciation in the SD card from your picked language/voice folder and word synthesis for the sentence begins. No need to install any library. Power it up with 5v, connect it by using only one pin (Tx pin) to an Arduino compatible (3.3v or 5v) or a Raspberry Pi and just send your text thru your serial port. On an Arduino UNO connect the board only to Pin #1 (also power the board with 5v). Use a command like Serial.print(�Hello world�); It/'s really that simple. On a Raspberry connect the board only on Pin 8 (power the board with 5v). Use the command ser.write(�Hello world�); On the SD card you can store as many language/voice packages as you need. So far I created 4 packages. 7,000 English words package language using a real human voice from Wikipedia project 20,000 English words by using the software from http://espeak.sourceforge.net 10,000 German words by using the software from http://espeak.sourceforge.net 10,000 French words by using the software from http://espeak.sourceforge.net. The Text-To-Speech board converts number to text on the fly, so if you do a � Serial.print(�The house temperature is 75.4 Fahrenheit�); � , the board outputs the voice �the house temperature is seventy five point four Fahrenheit� You can test the board easily. Just connect the micro USB to a PC and send your text thru the USB port using your Arduino IDE console or any other serial communication program you like. USB port is used to do software updates. Simply use the Arduino IDE (arudino Zero compatible). The code will be open source after the campaign is successful. Make your own SD card If you decide not to add the $12 for the SD card with the two English packages install, you can use your own SD card. Just download the zip file from github, unzip it, and copy the folder to your SD card. You can create your own package, with your own voice by recording a full sentence and/or all the possible words you may need, like the number �one�, �two�, �three�,'ten','hundred'�..

30 Days 0f Sin $5000 GOAL REACHED - 6/10/2019 Click here to pledge via pay pal In the forge of the fires of former musical projects,, Brand New Sin was formed in 2001 when Joe Altier auditioned to be the singer of a new band, made up of former members of the seminal metal band, Godbelow. Brand New Sin forged their own way with blood, sweat, tears and metal and recorded some of the most raw, honest, hard yet melodic rock in the early part of the millennium. Out on the road touring with many peers like Motorhead, Corrosion Of Conformity, Saliva, Breaking Benjamin, SOil, Type O Negative, Clutch, Mushroomhead, The Cult and more, they hit like a bullet in the night with their three guitar attack and booming vocals. Over the years they have opened for artists such as Slash, Godsmack, Dope, Chris Cornell, Deftones, Drowning Pool, Audiovent, Dillinger Escape Plan, and countless others. However, after many years of rocking hard on the road, Brand New Sin eventually parted ways with original members Joe Altier, Brian �Slider� Azzoto and Michael Rafferty. The History of Brand New Sin MEANWHILE IN 2018 In 2018, The Original Members got together. The original members of Brand New Sin got together as old friends, and in the course of an evening, they decided to perform a one night only concert - a show to celebrate the legacy and catalog of songs of the band. This show became the sold out LIVE AT THE LOST show in May of 2019. To a capacity crowd in the famed Lost Horizon Nightclub in Syracuse NY, the original lineup of Brand New Sin burst out onto stage in rare form, performing a brash and thundering two-and-a-half hour show, with 30 songs from the entire history of the band. The show was recorded that night on not only high quality video, but exclusive high quality multi-track recording. Now, BRAND NEW SIN needs your help to produce, master and distribute this legendary, one night only concert. They�ll be producing a double CD and Double DVD of this historic show - and the music will be available for streaming. In addition, the show will be available for streaming through platforms like Amazon Prime. If you can help them raise the funds to do so. Support your metal bands - support this project, and own a living piece of that incredible night. THE REWARDS: We've got (rendering of rewards, final product may differ) The Double CD Live Concert - recorded in Multi-Track Stereo by SubCat studios, and mixed by Brand New Sin, this concert beautifully preserves the aural majesty of the show. Mixed in Stereo and 5.1 sound for the DVD, you can own this concert on both CD and a DVD of the Concert Video. On the DVD there will also be behind the scenes footage, interviews and a whole lot more. The concert will be available for download on iTune, Amazon Music, Spotify and other streaming platforms. In addition, the concert will be available on Amazon Prime Video. The Limited Edition Concert poster features custom artwork, is signed by the band and limited to 100 numbered pieces. The Concert Poster advertises this once in a lifetime reunion show! A piece of the history of Brand New Sin THE TIERS Seven Deadly Sins Look to the right to see all the tiers and their offers. There are Physical and Digital Tiers. The physical tiers include items that will be shipped to you. All physical tiers also include digital downloads as well. ________________________________ STRETCH GOALS The initial goal of the campaign is $5000 dollars. This is the minimum goal we need to finalize, produce and distribute "Brand New Sin: Live at the Lost" on CD, DVD and Digital formats. But, with a larger budget - we can do more. So we have Stretch Goals. $8,000 STRETCH GOAL - THE VINYL VERSION Rendering of Vinyl. Final album may look different. If this level is reached, every tier will get the new song as a digital download and video. ___________________________________________________________________ $20,000 STRETCH GOAL The Brand New Sin Autobiography and Photo Book will be produced - the history and story of Brand New Sin, direct from the mouths of the band members. Along with the story of the band, behind the scenes tales from the road and insight into the songs and music, there will be a picture history documenting the story of this band. The book will be released in a glossy softcover. Add $30 to any tier to add the book if the $20,000 Level is reached. BNS

This is more than just an album. This is a musical story about a journey to discovery. Twelve years ago, I was invited to collaborate on an album with a dear friend and mentor, Steve Chester. Through that album I discovered that, not only am I a singer, I am a songwriter. This is an album nearly a decade in the making. It's a story of my journey to discover who I am beyond a daughter, a lover, a mother, a sister, a friend... It's for every person who's ever asked if I have an album. It's for every person who's ever encouraged me in my art. It's for my friends and family who have supported me emotionally through the highs and lows of a this type of journey. It's for my daughters. I hope that by watching me on my own journey, they will avoid some of the same pitfalls, and they will begin the discovery of who they are much younger than I did. I hope you learn who you are and how to speak that truth early on so that no one can confuse you along the way. It is for me. It is for the young me I once was who was somehow convinced that she was too loud, too wild, too free. It's for the teenage me who learned that there is not "one" me, but many facets and moods. It's for the twenty-something me who climbed into a box to make others more comfortable. It's for the thirty-something year old me, who climbed out of her box, embarked on a journey to rediscover the many facets and moods and to proclaim, "I am a singer. I am a songwriter. I am a woman. I am loud! I am wild. I... AM...FREE." This, like all Kickstarter campaigns, will be an "all or nothing" campaign. If I don't raise all of the funds, I get none of them. Even before I launch, has been a lot of work involved in preparing for a crowdfunding launch and a crowdfunding campaign. There are photo and video shoots, some early recording and mixing to promote the campaign and the project. I cannot do what I do without the love, prayers, encouragement, and financial contributions of my fans, friends, and family. I am still a full-time mother with several part-time jobs that allow me to invest time in my kids, my music, and my community. This Kickstarter allows you to receive awesome rewards for joining me on this journey to produce this album. From digital downloads of bonus tracks all the way up to private house concerts, these are my way of saying thank you for believing in me and my music. We�ve already been in the studio for several months, so myself, my producer, Daniel Malone, and many of my good friends who are also exceptional musicians are already working toward getting this album out, but I can't finish it without you all. And, to be honest, I don't want to. Whether you've been on this journey with me from the beginning or you're just meeting me (Hi, nice to meet you), I am excited to have you along for the ride. I can't wait to share this with you.

A word from The Quilters: We're grateful for all the support we've had in the Bay Area and so happy we've gotten to share our music with our friends, fam, and loved ones through our live sets. We love playing music for ya'll and don't ever want to stop, but we also want to put out an album for you (and the rest of the world) to listen to outside of our live shows. Having a professionally recorded album is an essential piece of our musical resume that will allow us to take the next step. There are so many great music venues and festivals throughout the Bay that we whole-heartedly believe we should be playing. Being able to record and produce this album will allow us to get our foot in the door at Outside Lands, Hardly Strictly, Bottle Rock, and start opening for bigger bands at The Fillmore, The Great American, Slims, and all the other iconic Bay Area venues. The financial hurdle of recording and producing our first record is a big one, but we believe that with your help we can make this dream of ours come true, and continue to make the music that we love with the people we love. Cost breakdown/Reason for our goal #: Recording studios often cost 60 per hour with recording and mixing time taking upwards of 60-80 hours (~$4500). In addition, Kickstarter applies a 5% fee and there are also additional fees for their payment processors. And we'd just love to be able to provide you shirts and stickers (~$1800). The way Kickstarter works is that, if we don't reach out goal then we don't get any of the money (it goes back to you), and we don't get to release our album. What does that mean? Stakes are high and we hope we can reach our goal of $4500, even though it's less than what some of this might cost. Also, PSA: WE HAVE A LIMITED AMOUNT OF SHIRTS, so please pledge early to get yours! Thanks in advance for your continued love and support. We love ya'll <3. -- Brief bio (you can read an in depth look at The Quilters below): The Quilters are a difficult to categorize band. From San Francisco, California, the group of multi-instrumentalists combines elements of alt-rock, folk, Americana, and indie-pop, with the band�s horn section bringing out a little blue-eyed soul. The band consists of songwriters Ray and Jerome Porter who regularly rotate between keys, bass, guitar, and vocal harmonies. Devin Pugliese, a fellow surfer and Sunset District loc�, chops it up on bass and percussion. Tim Hunt sings harmonies and plays trombone, Gianluca Bullock plays trumpet and percussion, Aneil Dhillon plays sax, and Joe Grandia is on drums. You can check The Quilters out on Instagram and Facebook. You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00 You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00 T-Shirt design: Meet the band: I step inside Ray and Jerome Porter�s family home in the Sunset, into a living room that has sun-colored walls and is strewn with instruments, musicians, and two dogs. Ray is belting out the lyrics to a playful song called �Discount Doggo�, named after his recently adopted puppy, while also playing drums�though he�s much more comfortable playing guitar. Lyrics: After we played for a little the lady asks if we want to put you on hold She said he�s only 3 days over 5 months old She explained that your price had dropped from 350 to 175 And baby, that�s right when I knew I needed you in my life Jerome is on bass, Aneil Dhillon plucks at a guitar despite being recruiting to play the sax, and Gianluca Bullock is blasting his trumpet. Missing are drummer and bassist, Devin Pugliese, and Tim Hunt, the band�s trombonist. It�s an intense, yet amusing and humorous music session, and they�re clearly having fun. A multi-instrumental band, it�s obvious the Quilters aren�t afraid to flirt with different instruments. �Ray and I were privileged to grow up with opportunities to play instruments of all kinds. If we wanted to play an instrument, we could,� Jerome tells me in a solemn, grateful tone. �I took cello classes just because I wanted to try it, and there was always a piano, banjo, or guitar lying around. Ray and I were even in handbell choirs. We grew up playing so many instruments that I think it normalized different sounds and made any instrument seem accessible and within reach. To us, a different instrument is just another tool in your music belt.� The Quilters, a San Franciscan native band, are difficult to define. Their music combines elements of alt-rock, folk, Americana, and indie-pop, with the band�s brass section bringing out a little blue-eyed soul. Perhaps it�s unsurprising the band�s musical background is as diverse as their multi-instrumental setup. Ray and Jerome, the band�s primary songwriters, grew up studying classical music, attending piano lessons, and singing in the San Francisco Boys Chorus. At home though, the Porter brothers began writing and practicing music with influence from their dad and older brothers who listened to everything from Bruce Springsteen to Arlo Guthrie; Bob Dylan to Rihanna. �Genre wasn�t really a thing or a topic for us, apart from classical music. If it was good music, it was appreciated in our home,� Ray smiles as he runs his hands over Benny�s stomach, swollen because he just got into an entire bag of dog food. �I mean, I remember getting paid to sing in the opera with the SF Boys Chorus and I took the money and immediately bought a shitty Fender Squier so I could play Green Day covers.� As for the rest of the band: Tim Hunt comes from a classical music background similar to Ray and Jerome. Devin Pugliese from a ska background, Gianluca from a blues and metal background, and Aneil was inspired by musicians like Norah Jones, Michael Jackson, and Lauryn Hill. The band began with Ray and Jerome, the founders and songwriters, and trumpeter Gianluca, a high school friend of Jerome. Then the trio brought on Devin Pugliese, a drummer and bassist, whom they met through the Porter brothers� sister. The brothers met Tim and Aneil through friends of friends and the band uses rehearsals as time to not only perfect songs, but to be creative with friends. The Quilters seem to have grown largely due to personal relationships and friendships, which might contribute to the chemistry and energy they have on stage. The band�s collective respect, kindness, and empathy for one another sits at the forefront of each session. �These guys allow Jerome and me to bare our souls through our song writing in an extremely supportive, non-judgemental way.� Ray pauses for a while before choosing his next words. �It�s such a selfless, empathetic act to take the time and emotional effort to understand someone else�s self-expression and perform it. Take Devin, for example. He�s a great drummer, but sometimes all we want is a kick, tambo, kick, tambo and he�ll do just that. Everyone has a willingness to put their ego on the back-burner for the sake of the song.� It�s clear that the Porter brothers have a vision for the band and the songs they write, but it�s also clear they want everyone to contribute and to have their own vision and creative freedom. �We know Gianluca won�t remember what he writes, but we know it�s going to be beautiful and have crazy energy in our performance, so we let him solo it out,� says Jerome. �And oftentimes, Tim will write entire horn sections to fit in with what we�re doing, and he does it in such a tasteful, engaging way.� They�ve only been playing together for less than a year, but The Quilters have a number of shows around the Bay Area lined up for the coming months at venues like Hotel Utah, Neck of the Woods, and Amnesia. They used to struggle with feeling confident in their music, but after playing around the Bay, they feel more sure of their sound. Through the amount of attention the band pays to each song, how hard they work to perfect each song and its emotional expression, and the fact that their sound isn�t a specific genre, they�re certain no-one else is doing quite what The Quilters are doing. They occupy a fortunate space--most have been able to play music in their own city by living at home�a city with a lot of venues and a lot of young people with disposable income who are either excited about the arts or looking for a distraction. That being said, Ray and Jerome are excited to move out this month and have their own space in the city. It took them awhile to find an affordable place, but it�s two blocks from the beach and the boys can surf whenever they�re not playing music. You can try and catch them out in the water, but you�re more likely to catch them at one of their upcoming shows, or by following them on Facebook and Instagram.

The "GreenThumb Festival Apparel" Project was something I've just recently started. As an aspiring producer and DJ, I'm somewhat familiar with the music festival culture. In my online store, I wanted to provide all of the festival goer needs but I wanted to offer something unique and beneficial to our community and to our environment. GreenThumb Festival Apparel allows you not only to purchase affordable products for your music festival, but also allows you stand behind and support eco-friendly non-profit organizations trying to protect our environment. Some of these organizations are : Save The Elephants, Save The Sea Turtle, Green America, Sierra Club, etc. After you fill your cart and are finally ready to check out, you will be asked if you would like to donate an amount to the non-profit of your choice. I truly believe that this could turn into something truly amazing and we can fight to make our planet greener and our animals happier. This is simply a kickstarter for simply paying for things such as the website domain, the first month plan via my website provider, and for add-ons such as the one we need to allow you to connect with these non-profit organizations. LETS MAKE A DIFFERENCE TOGETHER.

There is a serious problem when it comes to diversity in entrepreneurship. Personally, I watched my mother run multiple side hustles in addition to her full time job. I always dreamed of watching her fulfill her passion and start her own fashion business. For women of color, like myself and my mother, there is really limited support when it comes to starting a business. In addition to lacking resources and direction, women of color get the least amount of venture capital funding (only 1% of funding goes to women of color!!). My Solution The Samantha Ealy Show is my solution. As a young woman of color and an entrepreneur, I want to challenge the perception around homogeneity in entrepreneurship by hosting a talk show that will bring on diverse founders to tell their stories. I�m creating this web series for people like my mother, who always had several side hustles but didn�t know how to start a business. In this series, I will be showcasing diverse entrepreneurs as well as giving viewers a unique opportunity to watch the entrepreneurial process up close and personal as I build a business on the show. I have made it my mission in life to guide others toward self-actualization and self-achievement, and I intend to build The Samantha Ealy Show on the same principles, doing whatever I can to deliver high-quality, up-to-date entrepreneurial advice to my viewers. Interviewing and featuring some of the top diverse figures in entrepreneurship today, my web series is going to shape the way people see their business dreams and plans � and put success within reach for more entrepreneurs than ever before. Who is Samantha Ealy? Samantha is uniquely positioned to host and produce this talk show given her degree in Film & Digital Media from Baylor University, as well as her past experience as an entrepreneur and content creator for Generation Wealthy. In addition to entrepreneurship, Samantha has experience working for Google, IDEO, and an artificial intelligence startup in Mexico. Well-versed in entrepreneurship, Samantha is excited to dive into the topic of diversity in entrepreneurship with the goal of inspiring viewers to start their own businesses. Why I Am Coming to You I love the community that's built in the creation of a production project. With the right team in front and behind the camera, the results can be impactful and remarkable. but creating a web series is also a time consuming, exhausting, and expensive task. My goal through this campaign is to raise $50,000, which allows me $5,000 per episode to cover the costs of studio space, equipment, crew salaries, travel, post-production, transcription, administration, marketing, legal, and other miscellanies. To show my appreciation for your support, I am offering contributors early access to the first season of The Samantha Ealy Show and some exclusive, dinner with the host, Samantha Ealy. Entrepreneurial Knowledge + Execution = Entrepreneurial Success By sharing what I know and bringing in experts, I know that I can put long-term business success within my viewers' reach. My goal, first and foremost, is to make a difference in people's lives, and with that, you will be helping me when you contribute to this campaign. Go ahead and spread the word about The Samantha Ealy Show with all your friends and family too. I appreciate your support, both monetary and non-monetary, and I thank you for taking the time to read about what I am doing.

Live healthier. Know what you breathe. PiCO Home is an elegant, personal smart air quality monitor that can tell what's in the air you breathe. It measures dangerous particulates in the air in real-time. Our high-quality sensors provide critical, real-time information about the air quality around you instantly, at a glance and gives you recommendations on what you can do to improve the air you breathe. Unlike traditional air monitors, PiCO Home provides you peace of mind with a combination of high-reliable data, portability, and a low price. You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00 As demonstrated here, you can see how a change in environment affects the mobile app, illustrating the performance and integration of PiCO Home's hardware and software. 4.3 million people die annually from exposure to household air pollutants. Most perish from stroke (34%), heart disease (26%) and chronic pulmonary disease (22%). Pneumonia and lung cancer account for 12% and 6% of deaths, respectively. Women and young children, who spend the most time near the domestic hearth, are particularly vulnerable. More than 50% of pneumonia deaths among children under 5 are linked to household air pollution. We expect PiCO Home to be used mainly at home (power plug with USB cables). You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00 You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00 Step 1: Connect to USB-C cable power supply (to external battery, plug, or smartphone). Step 2: Push the power �ON� and launch the mobile app (iOS/Android). Step 3: PiCO Home will give you an immediate visual reading of your air quality with multi-color LED indicators. Step 4: Browse further to get more helpful recommendations and tips. We�ve listened. Since launching the 1st generation PiCO, we�ve learned so much. And very humbled by the experience it has taught us. Since then, we have continuously sought ways to make our service and our product better for our backers. Now, it�s time to deliver.In this 2nd generation update, reborn as PiCO Home, we�ve made the following improvements: Added Wi-Fi communication Enhanced accuracy of the temperature, relative humidity, and VOCs Added flash memory for storing air quality data without a network connection Interworks with Amazon�s Alexa Mobile application updates with better UI & UX A complete, new, and beautiful redesign of PiCO Home 1. MEMS Metal-oxide Gas Sensor: MEMS is the industry standard for detecting potentially harmful gases in the air. PiCO senses Volatile Organic Compounds (VOCs) released by cleaning agents, paints, and carpets, flooring, and even your family! The MEMS sensor picks up any trace of Acetone, methanol, ethanol, and other harmful compounds in the air. High levels of VOCs in the air can have an impact on general comfort and well-being, as well as taking a toll on cognitive abilities. The MEMS Metal-oxide Gas sensing element is first class when it comes to real-world application. It has long-term stability and a low drift (meaning 1 will always be 1). It�s also protected against dust and water making it extremely robust and durable. 2. CMOSens� Sensor: When professionals need to measure temperature and humidity, they trust CMOSens�. So do we. 3. Laser Particle Sensor: PiCO's laser-based particle sensor is far more accurate than cheap, dull LED sensors, ensuring accurate measurement of fine dust (PM2.5 and PM10) in the air. These small particles are among the most dangerous and difficult forms of air pollution to protect yourself against. PM2.5 particles (just 0.0025mm in size) are so small they get through most masks and window seals right into your lungs and blood. 100% Delivery Guarantee and EU-Friendly Delivery There�s no secret about the challenges involved in delivering bits and atoms, but we know what we are doing. Warranty: We are firmly proud of our product. Each PiCO Home includes a 7-day (upon receiving) money back guarantee and a 1-year limited warranty. Support: Need help? If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to reach us at cs@brilcom.com. We will strive to ensure that we deliver to our backers on time.

Glow is an ongoing comic series by Ray Chou and Vincenzo Ferriero with art by Anny Maulina and Dia Jia. Glow takes place in a world where magic catalyzed both industrial revolution and nuclear holocaust. Half a millennia ago, an ancient and powerful empire known as Nymera developed a means to channel and store magical energy into a sticky blue substance known as anima, storing them into massive Towers across the world. With the aid of the Towers, the Nymerans brought peace and paradise into the world. Until one day the Towers fell. The story of Glow takes place two hundred years after that cataclysmic event, and follows the story of those who remain. Issue One introduced us to Caszy and Koken, siblings scavengers of the Wastes with extraordinary abilities. Issue Two continues the story as the witch Myra makes a compelling proposition. While Issue Three explores the ramifications of the misunderstanding between Caszy and Myra. Magic in Glow is channeled through the language of ancient Nymera, the former masters of the world. In order to flesh out this cornerstone of the story, we've been collaborating with Colm Doyle, an Estonian linguist and enthusiastic conlanger. Nymeran is used a number of ways in the comic, including sound effects. Each digital edition of Glow comes with a language guide that teaches you the secrets of ancient Nymeran. Ray Chou and Vincenzo Ferriero are the writers and creators of Glow. Together, they�re the founders of the creative imprint known as Mythopoeia. Glow is their second comic book series after the the dieselpunk airship adventure Skies of Fire. Ray is based in Los Angeles and Vince in London. Anny Maulina is an artist from Indonesia and creator of the webcomic Raruurien. She also enjoys working on comic and art projects on her spare time. You can find her on Patreon and DeviantArt. Dia Jamandron was born in Iloilio City, Philippines and moved to California with her family. She currently works for Wild Canary Animation . Check her out on instagram! Bryan Valenza is an artist based in Jakarta, Indonesia. He currently occupies his time coloring various projects, including Skies of Fire and Witchblade. @bryan_valenza Born in Barcelona, Cristian Docolomansky Cerda (C.D.C.) is an inker and letterer based in Chile. He's worked with several publishers such as Alterna Comics, IDW, and Ariete Producciones. You can find him here. From Ireland, Colm � D�ill is a verification specialist at TransferWise's office in Tallinn, Estonia, where he has lived since 2007. He holds an M.Phil. in Applied Linguistics and a B.Comm with French, and is pursuing a Ph.D. in Linguistics. He is married with two children, and has been dabbling in creating constructed languages since 2005; Nymeran is his first developed constructed language. Hammond Liang is a self taught illustrator who often goes by the name of "Hammling." Growing up in a tiny apartment in Chinatown NY, he always had a fascination in all things art. From martial arts to dance to illustration, he combines all of his experiences to bring motion and life to his artwork. You can find him on Art Station and Instagram. Giulia Frontoni is an Italian illustrator based in Rome with a focus on creature designs. She helped bring to life many of the beasts found in Glow, as well as the postcards and button pinups! crocodev Alexandur Bucur is an architect and illustrator with an interest in history and military hardware of all kinds. When not at his drawing table he can be found standing at attention in a swanky uniform for the benefit of the Military Traditions branch of the Romanian Army. He helped bring together many of the technological designs found in Glow. http://wingsofwrath.deviantart.com/ The budget for this Kickstarter is extremely straightforward, with most of the funds going into printing our physical issues and reward fulfillment. Official Glow T-Shirt design by Anny Maulina. Printed on Next Level Shirts and available in S-XL. Character Buttons. Illustrations also used in Postcards. Tanvir Plushie. Approximately 5x8x3" inches. Comics are 8x11 in size and come bag and boarded. Glow #1 Standard Poster Glow #1 Variant Poster Add-Ons can be purchased during the time of our post campaign surveys via our fulfillment partners at BackerKit. If you'd like to purchase your add-ons during the campaign, please add the following to your pledge amount (S&H included): Digital Posters - $15 Digital Art Prints - $20 Individual Issues - $15 Language Guide - $10 Variant #3 - $20 Set of Buttons - $10 Set of Postcards - $10 T-Shirt - $25 Tanvir Plushie - $25 Art Print - $25 Poster - $30

Hello potential backers, Thank you for checking out my project. This project is designed to help me stay busy. I have found making coin rings to be very therapeutic and would definately welcome a new project to help with absorbing my idle time. Using metal, force, and fire to transform a simple coin into beautiful jewelry is quite therapeutic. In October 2003 while deployed to Iraq I was injured in a HMMWV accident, leaving me with chronic pain for the past 13. Additionally, like many vets, I have been diagnosed with PTSD. It was during a counseling session where it was suggested that I find an outlet for stress and anxiety. From that suggestion came Southern Coinworks, where I have been using pressure, stress, and fire to complete unique pieces of jewelry. Once again, thank you for taking the time to look at my project and I hope to have your support. Life can be hilarious and horrific at the same time. Happenstance is a web series about Brett, a young and successful gay male who finds himself in the middle of a host of professional and personal issues. Some funny, some serious, but all revolving around him and the choices he makes. Episode two has won several awards, leaving audiences with many unanswered questions and on the edges of their seats. We're excited to keep going! The next chapter is written and ready to film. However, to tell our story in the most effective way, we'd like to invest in some equipment upgrades and other things. These include: shotgun microphones, lavalier microphones, sharper camera lenses, location rentals, obtaining rights to the perfect music, etc. Happenstance in on YouTube. I hope you'll check it out and consider supporting us. On a prideful note-- most the cast and crew are members of Kansas City's LGBT community.
