I am pleased to announce that I plan to self-publish my first photobook, with intentions to release it in November. I started this Kickstarter campaign to raise funds for production and an ISBN number. The book, titled 'Colorado: Select Photographs from the Centennial State', will feature at least 100 photographs taken during my 2015-2019 residency in the state. I want to thank each and every one of you who have followed me along on my photographic journey. Your support is what keeps me behind the camera, and to challenge myself each and every time I take photographs. I cannot wait to share these photos with you in book form if this project is successful. The book will only be published if funds are met, and this Kickstarter will be the only outlet for purchasing the book; it will not be sold elsewhere. Thank you, and all the best. -JL 5/9/2019

Momlennials Podcast Motherhood isn't easy, so as two new moms in our late twenties, we are seeking funds to kickstart a podcast that will support expecting and new moms all around the world. Our mission is to normalize what women go through in all stages of motherhood by providing laughter and genuine love through our very own experiences. Each of us offers a unique point of view based on our different experiences in raising a girl versus boy and being a working mom versus stay at home mom. Although we face differences, we also share the want and need to support each other and other moms out there. We specialize in talking about the uncomfortable and are passionate about normalizing the weird, the ugly, and the hard. As soon as we are able, we will be recording episodes that are long enough for us to get real but also short enough to listen to during a commute to the grocery store. Once we acquire equipment, our goal is to begin recording 20-30 minute episodes, create an easily accessible website, and to actively communicate with our listeners via social networking. However, all of these aspects come with a price. The equipment we wish to purchase runs for just over 300 dollars and it will cost 600 dollars to launch a high-quality website with personalized graphic design and photography. It will also come at an expense to put our material on a podcast platform so that we are able to stream through Spotify, iHeartRadio, and Apple Podcast. With our ever evolving, not-so-glamorous motherhood, we know that we will never run out of content. We are confident that now is the time to launch this project. We are moms. We are millennials. (The kind of millennials that stay clear from discussing politics.)

Making Sustainability the Standard Making recycled and sustainable materials the standard for the apparel industry. That's the goal of TerraOne apparel. Its a pretty big idea, and we're just starting out, but that's how we believe goals become a reality. By keeping our mission in mind at all times, we can ensure we are making products that are not only made from recycled material, but also feel just as good as any other shirt, begging the question; why doesn't everyone use recycled materials? Front Design So What? What Drove a College Student to Start This? The idea of TerraOne was born out of one concept; "what if there was a company that was transparent, interactive, and sustainable; what a 21st century business could and should be?" Transparent No one likes being lied to, that's why we don't and won't do it. We share all of our details and "secrets" on our sleeve, and plan to do so for the unforeseeable future. Just look at the section where we discuss materials. While saying we are 100% sustainable would sound great, we will openly admit that we are not at 100% recycled material yet due to the nature of our goal. Keeping only 13% cotton in our shirts saves us, and you, about $7, and since we are trying to keep prices as reflective of a non-sustainable brand as possible, we figured the 13% cotton is something we will take care of in the successive designs we come out with, and that for now the lower price will allow us to garner more attention. The bottom line is that being transparent is a win-win. The people who care about all the details can have them, the people that don't care about these details can choose to not read about them, and we can sleep soundly. Interactive We believe that a truly 21st century company should treat its customers in a fundamentally different way. We see a world where we have ongoing conversations with our customers, and act as a positive force in their lives. The first way we plan to do this is seen with the display of coordinates on our first design (see below), promoting our customers to get outside and enjoy nature. We have several plans for the future on how to expand this idea, and look forward to updating you! Sustainable This one is pretty straightforward; why use value chains when you can use value cycles? We plan on making our entire operation system 100% recycled as soon as possible. From electricity in offices to using electric powered trucks for transportation, it will be a challenge to accomplish this goal, but we are confident that the recycled material in our shirts is a great place to start. Why Apparel? Everyone and their mother, or at least everyone we know, sold t-shirts in college. A t-shirt company is one of the easiest to start in the world. Down the road we plan on expanding into other garments, but for now we're sticking to the bread and butter! Additionally, the amount of waste and resources that go into the apparel industry is unbelievable, especially when you find out how easy it is to make more sustainable apparel. It currently takes about 2,700 liters of water to grow the cotton necessary for one t-shirt. We don't know about you, but that's a little ridiculous to us. Even crazier, Americans use about 50 BILLION plastic water bottles per year. Once again, that's a little insane. There are more and more manufacturers of sustainable t-shirts every day, with people happy to print on them. The second we found this out, we knew that apparel was a great way to have a tangible impact. Why Kickstarter? As you can see in the rewards bar, we only have two reward levels; a general donation for any amount of $1 or above, and a t-shirt pre-order for $25. This is the case because the goal right now is to discover if this idea is something people are interested in, or if we need to tweak our approach a bit. Considering that TerraOne's team is a group of college students, Kickstarter is a relatively cheap and risk-free way to find out if we're onto something, or if we need to go back to the drawing board. With this in mind, if you do have the ability, and truly like the vision we are working towards, please consider pre-ordering a shirt! Tell Me About the Shirt Material The shirt has a surprisingly soft and cotton-like feel. It is made out of a tri-blend; 50% recycled plastic (polyester), 37% Modal (a sustainable material made from Beech Trees), and only 13% cotton. Design Based in Boulder, Colorado, we thought it would be a cool idea to make the limited time first design of our brand represent where we're from. The prominent back design (seen below) features a bright picture of the Flatirons, paying homage to our roots and serving as a reminder of the astounding nature of our planet. Below the image is the coordinates of the Flatirons, giving people an extra push to travel to this destination, and serving as the beginnings of our customer inclusion efforts. The front of the shirt features our logo in a clean, pocket tee design. Unfortunately there are no pocket tees currently produced by our manufacturer out of sustainable material, but we hope to incorporate this garment in the future. Back Design Why Do You Need My Money? The money from your pre-order serves two purposes. The first of these is to show your vote of confidence in our idea. By pre-ordering a shirt, you let us know we're headed in the right direction, and that we are actually making an impact. The second way your pledge is useful to us is that in short, it will help us grow tremendously. All the money from this Kickstarter campaign will go to two places; the purchase of resources to make the brand as professional as possible (such as marketing tools and web designers), and the purchase of shirts in advance, so that we may start selling from our website. These actions will allow us to transition into a more grounded business and give us the reputation to start taking next steps towards reaching the end goal of making a worldwide difference. When Will I Get My Shirt? Since we are only doing pre-orders right now, there will be a slight delay between the time you order and when you get your shirt. Once the campaign ends, or we fill up on pre-orders, we will go into production. Your shirt will be produced within three weeks, and be shipped to you, arriving at your door in about a week. Email updates will be sent both when we go into production, and when we ship your shirt out to you.

In the beginning... Hey there! Nice to meet you all. Our names are Jason Ballew, Nick Martin, and Price Garrison and we're the creators of Kingless Generation, the production company behind the development of the new work, Divine Spark, or Young Man Move Over Here: A Gnostic Odyssey through Time and Space. Or Divine Spark for short! Over 2 years ago, we were hanging out playing some board games when we started talking about the Gnostic Gospels. As we talked about them more and more, we couldn't shake the feeling that there was so much to discover within them. So we set out to do what felt like an impossible task, we read every single one. THAT'S RIGHT. We read 52 gospels. 52. GOSPELS. If you're unfamiliar with what the Gnostic Gospels are, they are a set of early 4th century Christian texts that were discovered in Egypt in 1945. What the texts contain is a completely different idea of what the Christian faith was meant to be. After attempts by the Church to discredit the Gnostics as heretical, the texts were eventually buried and lost to history. The long and short of their message? The God portrayed in the Bible as we know it is actually the physical manifestation of fear and ignorance. Yeah, read that again. If that sounds CRAZY and also SO INTERESTING, first, you're totally right. And second, follow us on Instagram @kinglessgeneration to hear more every day. Photo: Institute for Antiquity and Christianity, Claremont, CA. It IS pretty cool, but like, what exactly are you doing? What a great question! This Kickstarter is raising funds for a series of workshops that will allow us to hire a group of actors, designers, writers, movers and amazing artists of all types to help us untangle this crazy web of really amazing material. After reading all of the gospels, we've distilled everything we've read into three different categories that we want to explore: 1. Origin Stories 2. Wisdom vs Ignorance 3. Religion + Theology Each thematic workshop will consist of two weekends where the artists will gather and begin to help us to get a better sense of what will thematically resonate in our piece, how we can activate and engage with the text through movement and voice, and most importantly, to bring some diverse new voices into the room. This is just the beginning too! After these workshops, we plan to take everything we've learned and turn this into a full production. And it's going to be amazing! But we cannot start this process without each of you! What is all of my money going towards? Totally fair question and it just so happens that WE MADE A CHART FOR YOU! So let's break this down shall we? The largest cost we have is for Rehearsal Space. We want to make sure we have rehearsal space to do this in. Otherwise we'd be out on the street and I'm telling you that it would be VERY WEIRD to do this on the streets of New York y'all. Following that we have Kickstarter Perks. We want to make you some sweet swag and this is just what it costs to do that! We have our vendors all selected and it's going to be great. Next is Artist Stipends. We want to pay everyone for every workshop and we want to make sure that we treat them well! This lets us do that. Lastly, we have Workshop Materials. We want to make sure that we have all the goods at the workshop such as costume pieces, props, paper to write on, water for everyone to drink, you name it. We've also included Kickstarter related costs. This includes the 5% figure that they take. WOW HOW EXCITING... what about them rewards though? Yes, you're totally right. This is Kickstarter after all. WE HAVE SOME FUN REWARDS FOR YOU! Want a good look at the designs we're turning into pins? YES OKAY! These amazing designs are going to be transformed into beautiful enamel pins. They will look a bit different when they're produced, but we'll keep you updated with designs as they're developed! We can't wait to see how these will look. We have a vendor all selected and once we get the funds, we'll start the process! Pin Design by Katharine Wynkoop Such a cool design and it will OBVIOUSLY make a great pin. What about our logo design pin? ALSO VERY COOL. Logo Design by Katharine Wynkoop We've also developed an amazing poster design that we cannot wait to send to print. Look at this! Poster Design by Katharine Wynkoop If those designs aren't enticing enough and you just want more, then we have a tier for you. We will write you a personal parable AND you get everything else. If you want to really support this project in all the ways possible, you can even get a Workshop Producer credit. These are just some fun perks, but remember all the money you give is going to the development and support of some amazing artists! If you have any questions about any of the reward tiers, please feel free to reach out! One last thing: Who are you and What is Kingless Generation? Great point. Kingless Generation is a new production company based out of New York dedicated to story-telling that sparks curiosity, compassion, and creativity. We believe that through myth-making we discover truth, through world building we understand our reality, through creating characters we identify with humanity, and through gathering audiences we build communities. Kingless Generation is dedicated to creating art that provokes questions rather than provides answers. Jason Ballew in The Cherry Orchard That's just a fancy way of saying, we're artists. We've all been involved in theater and film for quite some time and are combining our efforts under the guiding principals above. Divine Spark is Kingless Generation's first production as a company and we're so excited to start the development process. Hatchlings, a reading series produced by Nick Martin Again, what we're hoping to do is raise money to allow us to do a series of workshops. After these workshops, we'll take what we've learned and start devising a show! Theater is one of those things that needs a lot of time to develop and see what works and what doesn't and in order to do that, we need a much larger group of artists than the three of us. Also a more diverse group of artists than just us. Having more voices in the room allows for more questions and in the end a better piece. And that's what we're hoping to do, with your help. Price Garrison in Loserville So what's next? Well, first off thank you for deciding to join us on this odyssey! We cannot do any of this without you. After this Kickstarter when we're fully funded, we're planning on spending the month of June working out all the details. Finding the right rehearsal spaces, reaching out and building our team and putting all of the pieces into place to make this all happen. We're planning on having our first workshop up and running by late summer or early fall (depending on our team and space's availability). We'll be keeping everyone up to date here as well as on our social channels as things develop, but you'll all be along for the ride! Follow along with us over the next 30 days to learn more about what we're doing, get some insight into the workshops we're hoping to run and get to learn more about who Kingless Generation is and what we're all about! We can be found at the following: Instagram: @kinglessgeneration Twitter: @kingless_gen Facebook: @kinglessgen Or on our website! THANK YOU SO MUCH! Jason, Nick and Price

From all it's famous history and stories that have been told through the years, people from all around the world have had their eye on 'Main Street of America.' I am no exception. After almost four years, this July 2019, I'm finally able and going to travel the entire length of Route 66. So, besides traveling the route, what would be the next best thing for you? How about putting together a picture book of my journey to share with you and anyone else who wishes to come along? This Kick Starter campaign is just for that, a chronicle of my adventure: 'The Mother Road.' It will feature a collection of my own, unique, captioned images and story articles I've gathered from my trip. Each book will be $30 to produce. Hello, my name is Michael Gault. I�m a photographer, adventurer, and Youtuber who likes to just go and travel to places on a mere whim. This road trip will start from Chicago, Illinois, and end at Santa Monica Pier, California. I will travel Route 66 as much as possible... this means a bit of off-roading, hiking to great scenic spots and camping beneath the stars in most areas. I have researched, for years, for my time with this iconic road and it is time to experience it! That said, my approach to this trip is about the experience and not about time. I've planned and budgeted for a three-week trip but don't be surprised if I stay out even longer. When I get this kind of itch, I scratch to fulfillment... In addition to taking along my digital and film cameras, I'm also bringing along my drone and my vlogging equipment. There will be frequent uploads to my YouTube channel detailing my progress for you to support and follow :) Why support me when it's been done so many times? Because Route 66 is rapidly changing, no person's trip is the same as another. Travelers of the route approach it with their own perspectives and express their own takeaways from it. All have their own unique approach, style, and level of photography. Me, I'm very good at photography and often push myself through my boundaries... being comfortable with just an 'okay' photograph is just not my style. Only the best of my best can be expected to be featured in my book. Books will be shipped out the second week of September. Every backer's name, state, and country will be acknowledged and every book will be signed by me. This will be a limited run. I'm only going to print 150 books for this project... and each will be numbered. Prints of images will be available for purchase on my website after books ship.

Kwantum is inspired by African culture and language while representing greatness. The word quantum is derived from the Latin word �quantus� meaning �how great�. Kwa relates to a major branch of the Niger-Congo family of languages. Kwantum�s purpose is to provide inspiring, reliable, and consistent headwear to bold, confident Kings and Kweens. We are Krowned Daily reminding us that we are great, we are royal, we are Kwantum. Kwantum is created by a mechanical engineering student eager to leave a mark on the world around him. In engineering, he learned that quantum physics is the study of nature at the smallest, most critical scale of energy. He also learned that quantum is defined as a specified amount. It is derived from a Latin term that means �how great�. Relatively, Kwantum was developed to represent inclusion, importance, detail, greatness, confidence, and purpose.

PLAATO� KEG - The All-In-One Brewing Scale (1) KEG MONITORING The Level of beer inside the keg Real-time Pouring Status Temperature (2) BREWING SCALE Accurately weighs ingredients or water up to 132lb/60kg In Closed Transfer measures when the keg is full (3) CO2 MONITORING Measure how much CO2 that is left in the bottle Identify if you are have a CO2-leak Know how much you have The new Plaato Keg knows exactly how much beer is left in all of your kegs. Highly accurate load-cells keeps track of the good stuff, and yes the beer�s gravity is included in the calculations. See how much you pour Plaato Keg shows you pouring in real-time, and notifies you whenever a beer is being poured from your keg. Get notified if your thermostat goes wild With the built-in temperature sensor and WiFi-connection, you can remotely monitor your kegerator. By enabling push-notifications, you will get notified is something is wrong, eg. an opened door or a thermostat running wild. Share access to your inventory Keep your friends included and grant them access to your account, so they can remind you to run another batch when you�re running low. THANKS EVERYONE FOR GETTING PLAATO KEG OUT THERE! IF WE HIT $150.000 ALL PLAATO KEG DEVICES (Kickstarter Edition) WILL GET BUILT-IN LEAK-DETECTION Get notification in the app if liquid is detected. Plaato Keg is internet-connected, so you will get the notification wherever you are. All existing pledges will get Leak-Detection included if we hit $150.000. How it Works The electrical current between two non-corrosive metal probes are measured continously, and if a leak occurs, the current increases, and the device knows a leak is in action. Once you start kegging, there�s no way back. We know the drill. Starting out happy with a single keg, then suddenly finding yourself with seven kegs. That is why we designed Plaato Keg to be easy to install. 1. Transfer beer 2. Connect device 3. Ready to tap PLAATO Keg uses three synchronized, high-quality load-cells that measures the keg-weight every 0.1 second, sending real-time data of your kegs directly to your smartphone using WiFi. Product Anatomy Made of a impact resistant polycarbonate body, the device is made to withstand even the roughest environments, and at the same time keeping the measurements right on spot. Technology Comparisons There are two leading technologies used to monitor beer kegs; Load Cells and Flow-meters. As beer brewers, we found this to be an easy choice. Don�t get fooled by the sleek design. The PLAATO Keg is small, but it�s ready for big kegs full of beer. High performance materials combined with thought through solutions makes it durable, waterproof and ready to handle kegs up to 13 US gallons / 50L. Fits 99% of all kegs Waterproofed 100% NON-Invasive - No cleaning - No maintenance Easy setup Batch-specific details, real-time measurements and kegerator dashboard. The free PLAATO-app lets you have all your kegs in the same place. Each keg has its own dashboard, letting you type in batch-specific data, including: Last Pour Size Batch name Kegging date OG & FG The built-in calculator automatically calculates the ABV% Real-Time Tap Status The app automatically calculates the volume of beer in the keg based on the Final Gravity, and you can choose between Metric or US Customary units. Connect all your kegs Add unlimited number of kegs in the same account. Industry-standard accuracy High-quality, full-bridge load-cells makes the PLAATO Keg highly accurate, even on the smallest pours (and on the bigger ones). Check out the feedback from our beta-users. Technical specifications, Materials & Performance PLAATO� KEG is developed with feedback from over 350 ambassadors enrolled in the PLAATO Test User Program. This ensures a device that fits 99% of the most used kegs out there, including: All types of Corny Kegs Key-Kegs Torpedo Kegs Sankey Kegs It came to us while in development. If we can measure the real-time level of beer, then we can do the same thing with CO2! Presenting you the CO2-version of the PLAATO Keg. Enable CO2-mode in the Plaato-app, and turn one of your keg-devices into your CO2-bottle monitor, checking the remaining level of gas in real-time. Use it to have control over the remaining level of CO2 to make sure you have enough for the upcoming brew-day, or use it to detect a CO2-leak from a connector. CO2-bottles loses mass as the CO2 is used by carbonation, tapping or leaks. This means that by placing the CO2- bottle on top of our "PLAATO Keg", you will get precise estimates of the remaining level of CO2. This feature can also be used to detect leaks. Most CO2-bottles fit directly onto the Plaato Keg, providing you the tool to never be unawarely out of CO2 again EARLY BIRD REWARDS UNLIMITED REWARDS Comparing the vitals of the PLAATO Keg with the other solutions out there, and it'll make a clear picture We believe in an open community where hardware and software are unified. That is why we already now has started working on the API that lets you connect your PLAATO Keg to best brewing software out there: Brewfather. We have tried, tested and redesigned the PLAATO Keg more times than we want to admit. Our end goal has always been to make a product that we can all stand behind. Located in Oslo, Norway, we do all development and design from our lab. Paal Ingebrigtsen, Co-founder and CEO Michael Kononsky, Co-founder and Lead Designer Tarje Sandvik, Embedded Systems Engineer Tobias Hartvedt Knudsen, Developer Martin Bl�sbjerg-Christiansen, Logistics & Customer Support Thanks to everyone that got our first Kickstarter successfully funded. Now over 6000 airlocks is bubbling away in over 60 countries! The PLAATO Airlock won the Red Dot Award 2018. Check it out here. Follow us on Instagram! PLAATO Keg can be used in many more ways that just for kegs. It is a versatile platform that helps you throughout the brewing process. Use it to measure grains and ingredients - up to 130lbs / 60kg Closed transfer - Get full control and know when your keg is full during oxygen-free transfer Do you have an outdoors kitchen? Use the PLAATO Keg to monitor the propan-tank remotely

Hey guys so first let me introduce myself, My name is Michael Crump and I'm a writer under my small production company "Pure Lion Productions" the work I am most known for is my animated series "Full On!" However I have written a lot of screenplays and have joined short film competitions and have also written comic books that have been published online. The movie I have written hear is wildly based on a real life story with me and my two dogs. I took on a dog as a puppy, I named this puppy Thunder, I had him for about two weeks and then decided to take on his brother from the same litter (who I named Lightning) so that Thunder wouldn't feel lonely when I went to work, after trying to take care of both of them for about two months I realized I simply couldn't do it so I sold Lightning to a young couple who loves him so much and is giving him the best possible life. Me and Thunder still visit Lightning every other week and plan to keep doing so. Through this experience I wanted to do what I do best and write about it, even though Lightning is no longer my dog him and Thunder have still made a great impact on my life and I would love to use that to create an amazing animated movie that I named "Thunder And Lightning, A Dog Story" With your help I can create this movie for all to enjoy as I have enjoyed them.

support@phaseshiftgames.com Gather your gear and prepare to dive into the labyrinth! Teeming with untold treasure, the tunnels are said to be inhabited by unusual creatures, both adorable and terrible. Keep your wits about you as the very walls shift in the torchlight... ...it's time to drop into the dungeon! Image linked to update 26, which includes details on each of the unlocked Stretch Goals; some art shown is not final These add-ons are available by simply increasing your pledge by the amount indicated below (then following the campaign you will use our simple Pledge Manager platform to indicate which specific add-ons you wanted): Metal Draglin cube is not to scale. Actual cube is 12x12x12mm, matching the wooden Dragon cube in the base game. NOTE: Your pledge total with shipping for the Deluxe Version with all add-ons should be $44 (for most regions) to get this add-on for free. Draft rulebook Draft rulebooks translated for other languages are available on the Phase Shift Games website (we currently have French, Spanish, Italian, German, Portuguese, and Chinese available). We at Phase Shift Games are proud to bring Dungeon Drop to life as our first major product launch. While this game is destined for world-wide retail, we know there's so much more we can offer by starting on Kickstarter: Firstly, we're better able to gauge market demand for a game of this type. We're able to add much more content into both the Retail version and a Kickstarter exclusive Deluxe version (Deluxe version will also be sold at some conventions). We can offer you amazing upgraded components, such as a box with full printing on the inside (considering the box is part of the game; pending stretch goal unlock), special heat-printed monster cubes, and adorable custom heat-printed meeples! We have partnered with the best consultants in the industry, allowing us to expertly navigate both the Kickstarter and follow-up fulfillment and world-wide distribution phases. But none of that matters without a solid foundation... YOU! With your support, Dungeon Drop will fly off the shelves in every game store around the planet, and you will personally enjoy one of the most unique tabletop gaming experiences ever imagined! This "Social Responsibility" Stretch Goal will run through to the end of the campaign! As of the $250k mark, 1250 copies of Dungeon Drop will be donated to Toys For Tots!! We've worked hard to make global shipping as friendly and inexpensive as possible. We have accounted for the possible addition of new US tariffs, EU VAT, and other similar fees, and we're proud to be able to set shipping for most countries to $7 (with a significant discount for additional copies). Shipping each copy does cost more than this amount, but we are subsidizing the difference so you can get the game for a great price! CANADIAN BACKERS: As of update #28, we are happy to announce we have a viable Canada-friendly shipping option. Please review those details, and know you can select this upgraded shipping option in the Pledge Manager survey. Thank you!

Through SaloNet, we are going to rescue the dying salon industry by putting power back into the salon pros' hands. What If... Imagine a place where you could let your creativity run wild, a place where you could serve your clients and practice your art. This is a place where you could feel like yourself all the time and not just some of the time, and in doing your work, you could achieve the feeling that comes only when you have the space and the flexibility that you need to feel most comfortable. That space, it is sad to say, is something that most professionals within the salon industry never get to experience. The State of the Salon Industry Take a look around at the salon industry in your local area. Unless you have traveled in a time machine to some decades past, you will notice that the industry is in decline. Everywhere you go, salons are closing down, not opening, failing out of business, not driving profits. If you measure the financial success at these salons against the professionals' passion and strength, it doesn't make any sense. That is the thing, though: it is not the passion that is lacking. Passion Everywhere You Go Nope, wherever you look, you will find salon industry professionals who are ready and eager to do whatever they need to do to serve their clients well. It is inspiring to talk to these people, to hear how deeply they care about their jobs and how much of themselves they pour into all the work that they do. Every morning they wake up motivated to let their creative energy flow and to follow through on the commitments that they have made to their respective art forms. As stated previously, the problem with the salon industry is certainly not a lack of passion. It's the business model. If there were half as much sense in the salon industry's business model as there is passion in salon industry professionals, we would not be in this situation. Salons are burning money, creating a situation that is untenable for everyone who works in it and relies on it. Introducing: SaloNet SaloNet is the solution to the problem that the salon industry is facing. We have devised a new, cutting-edge, intelligent business model upon which to build a stronger, more resilient salon industry. It all starts with just two locations, but we are confident that SaloNet will rapidly blossom into a franchising opportunity. For hairstylists, makeup artists, lash technicians, massage therapists, and estheticians in the Bay Area (and beyond) eager to change up the industry for the better, SaloNet is the way to do. It's not overly complicated either. How It Works Becoming a member through one of our packages, artists can meet clients and then book work spaces at SaloNet, leasing out the spaces on an hourly, daily, or monthly basis. Each membership will come with a virtual address, access to our online portal, private space, and reception room usage surrounding the appointment block. That's all there is to it. Cutting down on overhead and putting power back into entrepreneurial salon pros' hands, SaloNet is going to effect a wide-reaching revolution within the industry. This is a business that is more than a business: it is a proof of concept that will show people just what we need to do in order to rescue the salon industry from the depths it has fallen to. In the future, we will also encourage other salons to partner with us, helping to generate referrals and fill up otherwise-empty space. What We Need & What You Get Right now, we are turning to you, Kickstarter, for help raising the funds that we need to bring develop a companion app and software backend for SaloNet. Our goal through this campaign is to raise $70,574, which will cover the costs of turning our expansion idea into something that is viable to scale, attracting the right professionals and facilitating their transition to our business model. To show our appreciation for everyone who makes a contribution to this campaign, we are offering some exciting rewards, including limited-edition merchandise branded with the SaloNet logo and consultations with the SaloNet founder. The Importance of Wellness In addition to serving salon professionals by putting them in control of their artistic careers, we will also be serving those professionals' clients by making the salon environment more conducive to top-quality work. This is a situation where everyone wins. If you have ever had a negative salon experience, SaloNet is something that you should be dreaming about. This is a once-in-a-lifetime idea that will turn the salon industry upside down. Other Ways You Can Help In addition to making a monetary contribution to this campaign, you can also show your support for SaloNet by letting all your friends and family know what we are doing. Spread the word on Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, and any other social media platforms you use! We appreciate all your support, both monetary and non-monetary, and we thank you for taking the time to read about our plans for the future.

When you create a tyrant during your adventure, the baddies you eliminate during battle will be whisked away to the splicing machine Nobulous� lab by his mech drone army. However, the scientists in the lab can only experiment on so many baddies per day. This means that only the first four baddies killed in each battle will enter the lab. This, of course, turns the typical strategy of targeting the strongest baddies first on its head. Sure, you can bust down that Bone Dragon in round one, but that means you�re going to be bringing a pretty nasty baddie onto the lab mat. As baddies are eliminated, they�re placed into the lab mat�s chambers for testing in the order they�re defeated. The first baddie defeated goes in chamber one, the second in chamber two, etc. As you move into the recovery phase, the splicing will begin, and you�ll make adjustments to your tyrant mat accordingly. Splicing health? You�ll take the combined health of the two baddies adjacent to the lab die. If the total is more than the current total health of your tyrant, increase your tyrant�s health by one. You�ll follow similar instructions for all other stats and attributes. Splice too many ranged baddies? Congrats! You�ve unlocked the powerful ranged ability for your tyrant! Of course, where this really gets interesting is in the combination of skills you�ll run into. Your final tyrant could have as many as SIX skills in play. Each time skills are spliced, place the baddie chip the skills are being taken from into your tyrant mat. Have two baddies with Poison 2? Add them together and...congratulations! You�ve created the first ever tyrant with Poison 4! Poison 4, of course, would break the bounds of modern Gearloc science, so you may find yourself using a D6 to track this skill should such a revolutionary breakthrough occur. You�ll be able to create any number of awful combinations. In fact, the more baddies you own, the more headaches you�ll be able to give yourself! And don�t even think about giving your tyrant the Flee skill from a Timid Geophage or Krelln Skittish - if your tyrant escapes in round 3, you will not achieve victory! Watching your tyrant develop over the course of your adventure brings new strategy to TMB beyond just the order you take out baddies. A sudden introduction of a bevy of health or a particularly unpleasant skill combo can require unconventional builds in your Gearlocs. Every game and tyrant is unique, so you�ll need to stay on your toes! GEARLOC INTERNSHIP PROGRAM MODE: TYRANT CREATION OUTSIDE OF A STANDARD GAME Don�t want to bother with additional effort during battle or recovery and just want to create something to fight? Welcome to your new internship at the Gearloc Council Laboratories! Simply grab your lab mat, tyrant mat, Nobulous deck, and as many baddies as you care to mix, and prepare to get splicing! Just like the standard game, you�ll calculate the baddie points for the day based on the number of players who will face off against your tyrant. Draw a Nobulous card for your daily dose of condescension and the twist you�ll be dealing with as you work. Draw the appropriate amount of baddie points and get to work. It�s simple and quick yet full of meaningful decisions. If you�re a TMB novice and find yourself getting stomped by Nom or Mulmesh repeatedly, try your hand at creating something light and more beatable for your group or solo play. Think you�ve �solved� Too Many Bones and are looking for something to truly test the mettle of your four-player group? Take a stab at making something with Break, Hardy and Poison 3, that targets the two weakest Gearlocs. The possibilities are endless, and we can�t wait to see what folks are able to create within this system. We�re even including a quick boss play score mode similar to the rules for a certain hidden riddle reward from Undertow, allowing you to post your toughest creations online and challenge others to defeat them using the fewest Training Points possible. Given how active the TMB community is, we expect this to be a big hit! Both modes of tyrant creation serve to further extend the already extensive challenge options in the TMB universe and will offer you literally endless content to play. We can�t wait for your 1st day in the lab. You�ll be replacing some Gearlocs who have found themselves unemployed for one reason or another. Read more about them in the add-on section below!

Hey there! I'm Andrew, but you can call me "Schmandrew" because, let's face it, there are a lot of Andrews out there who also make art. I'm an Illustrator, Designer, and Professor who smiles a lot. Over the last three years, I've slowly transitioned from the world of pop art style alternate movie posters to the world of freelance and original art. Before we get too deep and become besties, let me explain exactly what this Kickstarter is and why it�s important. First and foremost, this is a campaign to create enamel pins alongside my good friend, and fellow artist, Allen Panakal. Allen and I have overlapping audiences and we�ve both been toying around with the idea of doing pin Kickstarters for awhile now. The thing that makes this truly unique though is that we are running separate campaigns, BUT we are going to reward anyone who supports us both with a very limited edition metal card with both of our art on it! On top of that, we have a stretch goal planned where we�ll each do an interpretation of the other person�s illustration! Pretty rad, right?! Allen and I at C2E2 So now that I�ve hyped you up, it�s time to get real. In order to understand where these designs came from I need to explain just what the �Banishment� Collection is and what it means. Banishment Everything changed when the fire nation attacked� Sorry, I couldn�t resist! It�s hard not to jump to Avatar when you start a sentence with �Everything changed.� In all seriousness though, I went through a really difficult experience at the end of 2017 and into the early parts of 2018. Without going too in depth, a few very important cornerstones in my life either left or passed away. It was hard. I�m usually a pretty happy, optimistic person, but during all of that, I was not myself. Finally in May of 2018, I remember thinking things were starting to return to normal, but I still felt like I had some pent up energy that needed a release. That�s when I started on �Banishment� and everything actually changed. �Banishment� is about that turning point in any struggle where things start to improve. It�s that moment of victory where the tides turn and good overcomes evil. It�s the first of many steps out of any struggle we may have gone through or are currently in. It wasn't the whole story which eventually led to two more pieces, �The Banisher� and �The Banished�. The Banisher & The Banished While �The Banisher� represents the mix of exhaustion and relief as we let go and move on, �The Banished� symbolizes the beauty we can find wherever we end up. We are all stronger than we think and whatever happens, we will get through it. That is what the �Banishment� Collection represents. Having no prior experience doing personal work, I had no idea how it would be received. Thankfully, I was blown away by the reactions I got! So many people shared their own stories with me and how they related to "Banishment". Someone even got one of my pin designs tattooed! It�s because of that strong reaction that I decided to create these soft enamel pins designs. I think we could all use a physical reminder on our person to remind ourselves just how strong we really are. Check out Allen's pins, prints, mats, and metal HERE And if you only want to snag the pins, there's no need to jump between campaigns to get the metal cards. Just pick Tier 2.5 and you'll get our pins and all the crossover benefits! Assuming we can exceed our funding goal, I've prepared some stretch goals to unlock. Last but least, all shipping costs will be added on at checkout. All shipping amounts are priced at cost via the weight of each item.

Dear friends, The time has come for Mother Marrow to record a real studio album, with a full band! Our full-length album, "Sweat & Splinters", is in the works as we speak. This is a big project, and we can't do it without your help. If you believe in this music as much as we do, you can have a part in it by pre-buying our album here, or donating a little extra, and receiving some fun gifts, to help us reach this all-or-nothing goal by the time we go into the studio on July 10! WHAT THIS FUNDRAISER WILL COVER The money from this fundraiser will pay for recording, mixing, and mastering at Crossroads Studio in Arden, NC in mid-July, album artwork (by the talented Grace Engel @_phlox_), and printing CDs. We thought about doing a really DIY recording, and have the tools to do that, but we really want to make a high quality album to really bring the deepest feeling into the listening experience. Clay Miller will be our engineer, and he has an excellent ear. He has recorded Tina & Her Pony, Amanda Anne Platt & The Honeycutters, The Moon & You, and other local projects. We are so excited to work with him! We know folks don't often use CDs anymore, but many of our listeners (and our bandmates!) have lived in alternative situations, without wifi and Spotify and we really want everyone to have access to this music (and have a beautiful package to open!) so you can all carry this music with you everywhere you go! WHO IS MOTHER MARROW? Currently, Mother Marrow is: Charity Cimarron on vocals, guitar, banjo, Devin Crow on banjo, Emmalee Hunnicutt on cello, and Matt Shepard on drums. Mother Marrow was born out of Charity Cimarron's solo songwriting project, Rusalka. With many musicians in and out of the picture over the years, there was never a cohesive band until now. We have been really enjoying playing together, and the music is feeling really vibrant and alive. As our drummer, Matt Shepard, said the other day, "I just want to be in service to the music." That's why we're doing this! This music is medicine for tender, feeling humans (or those who want to find their tenderness), who are looking for threads of deep truth, in this chaotic, confusing time that we live in. It is healing us, and we want to share that with the world. Mother Marrow on the web: www.mothermarrowmusic.com Facebook: MotherMarrow IG: @mothermarrow Devin and Charity playing as part of Traveling Appalachian Revue '18 WHAT DOES MOTHER MARROW SOUND LIKE? The songs are all written by Charity Cimarron and come from a deep connection to the spiritual realms, a living relationship with the natural world, and a desire to understand the human struggle. Following stories of pain and heartbreak, and awe of the depths that exist in simple things, the lyrics of these songs have "teeth and tenderness". Sharp things made soft again by expression and love. Our sound could be described as Elemental Folk, but that's not a recognized genre (yet ;). The guitar style is complex fingerpicking, with a lyrical flow, and the cello adds sweeping fills, and dives right into the depths. The drums add an intensity and drive in all the right places, while the banjo brightens the sound, or haunts your soul, depending on the mood. The strident vocals, will cut straight to your heart, and bring tears to your eyes, or heal forgotten wounds. (Listen to some older recordings of Charity's solo work here: Rusalka-EP 2015) Kickstarter Kickoff Show at The Mothlight, May 18th, 2019 WHAT NEXT? Mother Marrow will be touring the new album August 9-20, and we are still looking to book shows. Want us to play in your town? If you live in the South-East, Mid-West, or East Coast, hit us up! We especially love house shows! There are already new songs that are being born and dreaming of the next album. Knock us out with this Kickstarter, and you won't have to wait long for the next one! Thank you for believing in this music, and joining with us in making this dream come true! We couldn't do it without you. We hope this album will be a gift to the world, in gratitude for the power of music, community, and all the gift of life that we are receiving every day. With anticipation, Mother Marrow Recording secret tracks for our donors ears only!

A noted lawman and bounty hunter is charged with treason by a prince and sentenced to become the TURNKEY, a jailer at a mystical dungeon for the 5 Ring Kingdoms. As the fantasy world prepares for a Great War, the intrigue grows once the position becomes more political and strategic in determining the victor. With conflicts inside and outside of the prison/fortress known as THE MOUNT, the key to the High Crown may be hidden behind its prison walls and the forgotten dungeons below. We love Kickstarter and think it's the perfect platform to find an audience for this story. Our goal is to tell a diverse fantasy story for the masses and what better way to tell people about that than this platform?! A look inside of the world of the Ring Kingdoms and the first six page preview of our book TURNKEY: New Rewards Stretch Goal Rewards Thank you for your support of TURNKEY! Now that we are fully funded, we want to expand our fantasy world by offering

Founder & Producing Artistic Director of IndieWorks Theatre Company and Director of The Giant Hoax I met Kit Goldstein Grant in the summer of 2015 in a musical theatre writing program. Her lyrics were so clever that Tony Award-winning lyricist, Lynn Ahrens (Once On This Island, Ragtime) exclaimed, �That lyric is gold! I wish I had written that myself!� I knew instantly that Kit (also a composer and book-writer) was someone with whom I needed to work. In 2017, I founded �IndieWorks Theatre Company� and immediately started searching for something to produce or direct that was fun and challenging; a story that had real heart and that I could pour my heart into. Kit sent me the script and score for a show she had been writing for nearly ten years. I giggled gleefully as this stirring, touching, and sometimes just-plain-silly story unfolded page by page, reminding me what it�s like to see the world through the excited eyes of a child. I called her up and with a huge smile, I said, �I want in on The Giant Hoax!� In the months that followed, we worked together to fine-tune the story and streamline the cast in my Midtown office (also known as the Starbucks on 39th & 8th) and in November 2017, we presented two staged readings in Brooklyn to incredible response from both audiences and industry professionals. In the year and a half since, we�ve put together a version of the show that is ready for the New York stage! The Giant Hoax is one of Kit�s most heartfelt and endearing musicals, full of colorful characters, unexpected plot twists, history, adventure, and most of all, imagination. I am thrilled and honored to present it as IndieWorks Theatre Company�s very first mainstage production! There are wonderful things in the world out there, and I truly believe, as you will, that The Giant Hoax is one of them! In 1869, on a small farm in Cardiff, New York, Mr. William �Stub� Newell digs up a giant stone figure and instantly controversy arises! Is it an ancient statue? A modern hoax? Or � as Newell claims � an authentic, prehistoric, petrified giant? Emily, a bright young girl � with quite the active imagination � has decided for herself that the Giant is real and runs away from home to prove it. Newell, charmed by the girl�s steadfast belief that there are truly wonderful things in the world, offers her a job as an apprentice barker in exchange for room, board, and unfettered access to the Giant who later that evening seems to come to life right before her eyes! They become instant �imaginary friends,� going on amazing adventures to the farthest reaches of Emily�s imagination. But all is not well. When unscrupulous circus impresario, P.T. Barnum, offers a hefty sum to buy Newell�s profitable, prehistoric attraction � and soon after rejected � he comes up with a scheme to steal Newell�s business right from under his nose! An enraged Newell brings a lawsuit against Barnum, but his case begins to fall apart when the judge asks him to prove his giant�s authenticity. With Newell�s back against a wall and her new friend�s existence called into question, Emily must sort through what is fact, what is fiction, and what�s all just a part of her imagination. Bringing an imaginative new musical to life is no simple task! It takes time and it costs a lot of money. Especially when you're bringing it to the New York stage! Now, this isn't Broadway (yet...) where capitalization amounts can reach tens of millions of dollars, but there are lots of amazing people to pay, things to buy, and equipment to rent, and for The Giant Hoax, that's no small feat! Here's how it all breaks down: We realize, of course, that we have a lot of money to raise in a very short amount of time. I mean, $60,000...?! That's a lot of zeroes! But we here at IndieWorks Theatre Company believe in this show and haven't been shy about putting our own skin in the game. We've scrimped and saved and put every bit of our own spare money into getting this production started, giving us a nice $12,000 head start on raising the $60,000 needed to fully produce The Giant Hoax at Theatre Row. On top of that, we have a pledge from an angel donor to match our Kickstarter campaign funds up to $10,000! So we are on our way to success! We realize that theatre is a risky endeavor. But we have a contract with the theatre and so the show must go on! And with your help, it will! In addition to the Kickstarter, we've got other plans in place to help us raise the money: We're producing a Summer Cabaret Series of five different shows from showcases of composers and lyricists to dirty little ditties, to a celebration of pride and more! We're partnering with local companies to create exciting fundraising social events that will take our participants all around the city! We're courting corporate sponsors in hopes to build future working relationships! We're doing pledge drives and so much more! All five shows in IndieWorks' Summer Cabaret Series. Got any other ideas? Throw them our way! "So who are you, anyway?" We're glad you asked! We've started to assemble an incredible team for our inaugural mainstage production, but we still need a few more people. You can help us hire a music director, costume, set, & puppet designers, orchestrator, stage managers, and more! The Giant Hoax Creative Team (...so far!) "What have you done with this show so far?" We've done quite a lot, actually! Kit has been writing the show for 10 years and in that time the following happened: In 2009, The Giant Hoax was first presented as a staged reading at the Classic Theater Guild's 6th Annual New Play Festival at Proctors Theater's Education Center. Then some rewrites. The Giant Hoax was presented by the Classic Theater Guild to sold-out audiences at Proctors Theater in Schenectady, NY in November 2010. Directed by Criss Macaione-Bilodeau, with musical direction by Rebecca Benjamin. Then more rewrites. In Summer 2017 The Giant Hoax was presented in a developmental reading at The Playground Experiment in New York, NY, as part of their First Reads series. Then a couple more rewrites. In the summer of 2017, IndieWorks Theatre Company took interest in the show and... You guessed it... rewrites! In Fall 2017 The Giant Hoax was selected as part of the The Gallery Player's Overtures series in Brooklyn, NY. Directed by Christopher Michaels with musical direction by Nissa Kahle. (Do we even have to say it?) In the two years that followed, Kit and Christopher have worked the show into a version that is ready for the New York stage. This is the version we look forward to presenting to you this fall! Images from the 2010 Classic Guild production, the 2017 Playground Experiment reading, and the 2017 IndieWorks staged reading production at The Gallery Players in Brooklyn, NY. To gear up for our fall production of The Giant Hoax, we've also done a lot! So please consider making a contribution to our campaign and help us bring Kit Goldstein Grant's imaginative new musical to Theatre Row on 42nd Street! You won't be sorry you did! And visit us online to see what else we're up to at IndieWorks! Photo Gallery Photo from the IndieWorks staged reading at The Gallery Players in Brooklyn, NY. (Photo Credit: Brian E. Long) Photo from the IndieWorks staged reading at The Gallery Players in Brooklyn, NY. (Photo Credit: Brian E. Long) Photo from the IndieWorks staged reading at The Gallery Players in Brooklyn, NY. Oh Jeremiah makes Joymonger! The sophomore effort by your best friends and favorite husband/wife indie-folk duo. Joymonger is a collection of songs inspired by a return to innocence. It's an album that was born in the spirit of 70's records by Simon and Garfunkel and grew up alongside modern records of indie-folk. Every song is produced by us and mixed by JD Tiner (Producer of our last EP - Post Modern!). For the first time ever, we've created these songs almost entirely by ourselves. And now we want to invite our community to help us make Joymonger our most personal album yet. All backers will receive a digital download of My Baby, Jimmy, and Me at the completion of the kickstarter. Creating joy out of nothing was a theme for this album. Every song started the way it did when we were kids - with laughing, jumping, and cheering. Joymonger is a return to innocence and a genuine love of making joyful music. Last year, we spent most of our energy releasing singles. It was an exciting year! But when we started preparing for our next project, we felt deeply that these songs were meant to live together as a collective album. The concept and song choice are meant to be experienced together. Working in the studio on Joymonger. Honestly: Making records is really hard. There are a ton of long nights in the studio beating our heads against the wall, insecurities as we build out every song, and the expenses are crippling. Kickstarter makes it possible for us to make the record we want to make the way we want to make it. We're recording the album ourselves and every dollar spent goes to take this record further than we've ever been. Where is your money going? Every dollar over our initial goal will go towards marketing and promoting our album! We reached our first goal! The Joymonger Kickstarter Exclusive T Joymonger Kickstarter Exclusive Ebbets Hat Joymonger is a 9 song album of brand new music from us. If you've been at a show in the last year, you probably heard some of the songs performed. It was important to us to make sure we loved playing every one of these songs live. Backwards Heart, My Baby, Jimmy, and Me and Liza's in My Corner are just a few of the songs that make Joymonger. In the studio working on Joymonger. We're planning to release the first single from the album this summer (July). Everyone who buys a copy of the album (physical or digital) will receive all songs at least a week before the general public. There will be four singles and a full release is scheduled for February. If that timeline changes, it won't be very much. Erin recording violin for Joymonger.

Inferi follows the adventures of 3 Quantico students and their Professor who travel the globe solving crimes committed by mythological creatures. Little do they know that's just the beginning as a shadowy organization watches their every move and makes plans of it's own to stop our intrepid heroes. Writer - Casey Bowker wrote his first comic book, Hollowed, last year based off of a movie script he wrote 15 years ago while attending film school. It was meant to be a pitch for the SyFy Channel, but instead it sat in a vault collecting dust until one day Casey uncovered the dark tome and decided to translate it into comic form. It was funded within 10 days and now he has delusions of grandeur in the comic book realm. When he's not writing comics he's the Co-Editor in Chief for geeky pop culture news site, dontforgetatowel.com. Writer - Ruben Romero was born to Venezuelan and Cuban Parents in Caracs, Venezuela on October 26th 1981. Moving to Miami, Fl at a young age Ruben learned very quickly he loved two things about America; Comic Books and Movies. In 2014 Ruben and his book The Agency were labeled a breakout success by Comixology and he was invited to speak on their panel at New York City Comic-Con. Today Ruben is a new father with hopes to continue building worlds and passing his love for all things nerdy onto his son Rian Ezra. Pencils & Inks - Rodrigo Catraca is a Comic Artist and Illustrator based in Brazil. He studied philosophy at Federal University of Alagoas. He's always focused on studies about aesthetics and the interpretation of images in a specific scenario. He's collaborated with some Brazilian publishers like Graciliano Ramos, Sketch Comics, Lumix ArtFilms, DDA Productions, Zumbi dos Palmares Institute and others. He has also worked with Marvel/Upper Deck, UMC Comics (Argentina) and other smaller publishers. Colors - Avery Ferdinand is a freelance illustrator/designer from Baguio City, currently living in Antipolo Rizal Philippines. As an artist his influences are the works of Andrew Huerta, Dan Mumford and Mike Mignola. He does both illustration and coloring in both traditional and digital. He has worked for Weldon Studio as a colorist of Harland Buck Freesword, Dulce Comics, Unparalleled comics and more. He is also a winner of the 2012 MAgic the Gathering Grand Prix Manila shirt design contest and currently working on a new design for another MTG shirt illustration for Montreal Canada(local). He's inspired by different artforms such as Video Games, comics and movies. Page 18 In addition to the fantastic art that Catraca has done throughout the book, we also were able to snag the talents of Alessandro Miracolo for a Goddess Ran Variant Cover, with Tan back on colors. We also entrusted the services of Paris Alleyne for a Quantico Variant Cover. Goddess Ran Variant by Alessandro Miracolo Quantico Variant by Paris Alleyne With the comic now being funded, everyone who pledges $15 and up will receive the track 'Coming out of Shadows' from synth wave artist Ferrari Kid! Listen below to the full track and get swept away in the mythological mystery! You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00 Lineup by Paris Alleyne Liam (Six) - The Profiler. Seemingly has a 6th sense. Since a young age Liam has always known where things were headed until the night he cracked the Kryptos. His keen senses and humble heart will be tested on this new journey, the only question is: Can Liam lead the team through the perils ahead? Jackson (Jax) - The Detective. Son of famous FBI investigator and a loyal friend to Liam and Neelam. Jax will be the north star of our team continuing to push them forward even when things are at their darkest. Neelam - The Scientist. Snarky, a technology whiz. Liam's adopted sister has always felt a little out of place. Her quick thinking and brave spirit will help her along the way but will her past be the team's downfall? Professor Able - The Teacher. Not much is known about him other than he's connected to a world much bigger than our own. Able Is the 'Giles' of the group; All knowing and always planning Professor Able will guide our team through the toughest of challenges. One of the reward tiers doesn't have everything you need? Feel free to use one of the add-ons below. Just 'Make a Pledge Without a Reward' for the price of the item. We'll send a survey at the end of the campaign and you can indicate what you want. Coverage of the Comic Nerds from the Crypt Podcast Martin Dunn - Punkhouse Press - �Ruben and Casey have delivered an impassioned story with intriguing characters and witty dialog that could easily be mistaken as coming from a Kevin Smith script.� Matt Brassfield - Sparkle Comics - "This script reads really well and is a great idea for a comic, I also like how you can feel the influences and yet its total its own thing and universe. Also the art... is well done and this is a comic I would read even if I was not friends with you! Keep it up my friend as you are killing it!" Brian Hawkins - Mad Cave Comics - "Ruben Romero is back! And this time with Casey Bowker and a creative team to boot -- And they�ve weaved an existential romp of an adventure that plays on the harp strings of decipherability. To go into this world, you must attempt to understand it, as the characters begin to unravel, decode, quest, and solve� Well, I can�t give you the whole story now can I? Just read it. Immerse yourself in the art. And enjoy."

In the 1960s, the CIA sent astronauts into space...and lost them. Until today... 2 Stretch Goals UNLOCKED! 2 more added! We blew right past the first two stretch goals: THANK YOU! We've added two more. Keep SHARING the project and telling your friends. Let's get to 3k. Not sure what stretch goals we'll add to get to that one, but we feel like we're up to the challenge! Welcome Welcome to the kickstarter for Kayless #1, the first issue in a five issue mini-series to be published by, Silverline, a genre spanning independent comic book and graphic novel publisher. The comic is completely finished: all 22 pages of story and art plus the covers are done! All we need now is YOU! The Story In 1967, Scott Anders rocketed into space on a secret, CIA-sponsored mission referred to as the Kayless Project... to investigate an astronomical anomaly known only in the darkest corridors of the U.S. Government. Three days later all communication ceased. The project, seen as an embarrassing and costly failure, was erased from history and forgotten. Until today, when Scott mysteriously plummets to earth and emerges, unscathed, and hellbent on one purpose� to return to the anomaly in space. Why does he want to go back? How did he gain his new invulnerability? And what is the mysterious organization that stands in his way, determined to protect the secret of Kayless at all costs? Cover to the Kickstarter EXCLUSIVE edition (cover elements/logo MAY change/move, art will be as shown above) by Steven Butler, Thomas Florimonte, and Leandro Huergo. Kayless is a science fiction/ superhero/ government conspiracy drama in a beautiful full-color comic book, standard 22-page format. This Kickstarter is for issue #1 of the first five-issue arc. The book is finished and ready to ship. The Kickstarter cover is exclusive and will only be available for those who back the campaign. We�ll have regular updates to keep you up to date on how we�re doing. We hope you�ll join us! Some assorted art unlettered page from Kayless #1 Finished page from Kayless #1 Finished page from Kayless #1 Finished page from Kayless #1 Creative Team The Rewards! The Money So...what will we do with the money? We don't have any fancy charts to show you, so I'll just tell you the plan. Obviously, the primary role of the money we raise here will be to print and ship the rewards out to you; remember, the comic is completely finished! Without you, we've got no reason to be here. Beyond that, we're hoping for enough money for some stretch goals--which are always fun. But we're also hoping to raise enough to fund the production of Kayless #2.

Update: THANK YOU!!! + 2ND STRETCH GOAL! Thanks once again to the overwhelming support of our wonderful backers and their incredible generosity, �All Together Now!� has now reached $20,000 half way through its campaign! Thank you so much for your amazing support on this project! I�ve created a second stretch goal of $5,000, which would further support the overall art & design, animation, and storyboard production of "All Together Now!". It would also help create more animated content to share, further developing important characters, their stories, and the world they live in. Thank you so much for your incredible support, and for helping to create inclusive queer media for kids! All Together Now! is a queer animated kid's show. It's about a community of people with different gender identities, body types, abilities, family structures, and cultural backgrounds. They are facing life�s challenges together by sharing their stories with each other, and building a world that celebrates inclusivity, accessibility, and kindness. I'm Molly Allis. I'm an artist, educator, filmmaker and musician living in Los Angeles. As a queer, gender non-conforming person, I realize that being a kid could have been easier if I�d been able to watch a children�s show that was entertaining, educational, and had characters living outside of a gender binary. This could�ve helped me a lot as I tried to figure out who I was. My goal with All Together Now! is to cultivate hope and joy through greater representation in children�s media, so all kids feel proud of who they are, instead of ashamed or scared about what makes them different. I will build upon community-oriented shows like Sesame Street, and artistic shows like Pee Wee�s Playhouse. Frankie's bedroom The world of All Together Now! is a culmination of many things from my own life: teaching kids how to use tools and build projects out of recycled materials, making puppet shows, playing the drums in an activist marching band, and being a queer person living in community. I am passionate about engaging young people's creative voices and visions, so they feel empowered to step up as change-makers, transforming themselves and the world around them. Although I envision All Together Now first and foremost as a show for kids, it will ultimately be an all-ages show that children and adults can both enjoy for its storytelling, aesthetic and messages, bringing people of all ages and backgrounds together. The characters on All Together Now! learn important things like: how to listen to each other express feelings in healthy ways practice self-love. how to make fun projects Whether it�s at the collective bookstore, the community garden, the bike shop, or the marching band practice space, the characters on All Together Now! gain a lot from each other�s experiences. They share skills and resources to create inspiring performances, songs, parades, and gatherings that uplift their community. Sometimes, challenging conversations come up between characters who love and respect each other. How do different generations of people relate to gender, and how do they learn from each other�s experiences? Additionally, how do characters deal with being bullied because of how they dress, or what their families look like? Learning how to make stuff is empowering and fun! A large part of All Together Now! is centered around sharing skills and resources to make cool projects, mostly out of recycled materials. Characters teach each other how to sew costumes, write songs, build toys, cook yummy food, and perform shows in their neighborhood. Through making, they come together, share stories, and discover the power of their imaginations. In a time when many vulnerable communities are under attack, we need safe spaces that help foster connection through our differences. All Together Now! presents a world filled with diverse characters and situations that provide young viewers and their families opportunities to explore different ways of being, thinking, and feeling. I believe that we can create the world we want to live in, and learning how to live in community with each other is a crucial step to getting there. Glitter N' Letters Collective Bookstore In the world I've created for All Together Now!, I have a season�s worth of story ideas to share where characters take small but powerful steps towards social change. With your help, I can introduce people to the characters on the show, by creating 12 short animated vignettes that I can share online in the coming year. I plan on releasing these beginning in October 2019. My ultimate goal is to find a supportive home for this project to grow and develop into a TV series to reach larger audiences of kids and their families, expanding the reach of inclusive queer media. Your donation goes towards: Art production & design Animation Story & Character Development Storyboarding Kickstarter fees (10%) Rewards (6%) Miscellaneous production necessities My stretch goal is $20,000, which means that if my target amount of $15,000 is exceeded, the extra $5,000 will help me achieve a higher quality production value, as well as more in-depth story and character development, which would be hugely helpful! Marching band practice space As a child of the 90s, my artistic style has always been, and always will be, a nostalgic homage to the bright, colorful palettes that I grew up with. All Together Now! will be made with hand-drawn animation, using the textures of watercolor, colored pencil, markers and crayons for a handmade, personal feel. The show's aesthetic will help capture the exciting spirit and joy of creating things, inviting viewers of all ages to take out their markers and spontaneously draw inventive worlds in their notebooks like I did when I was a kid (and still do!) Grandma's Kitchen Come learn about the characters on the show here! Sun City Community Bike Shop Molly Allis (she/they) is an artist, educator, filmmaker and musician. Her work focuses largely on celebrating children and community. She studied directing and design for theater at NYU�s Tisch School of the Arts, with a focus in puppetry. During that time she worked with the renowned Bread & Puppet theater in Vermont, as well as Great Small Works Toy Theater Company in Brooklyn. She has created animations that have won awards internationally, including at the Museum of Fine Arts in Boston, the Brooklyn Academy of Music, the Madrid Experimental Film Festival, and the Linoleum Festival in Moscow. In 2014, she received her MFA from the California Institute of the Arts, with a focus in Integrated Media. At Occidental College, the City of Santa Monica Cultural Affairs, and Kidspace Children�s Museum, among other organizations, she has created interactive installations that take people through imaginary worlds. She teaches children how to create stop-motion animated videos, build sculptures out of recycled materials, and construct puppets. Originally from Boston, Molly lives in Los Angeles with her partner and their two dogs. All Together Now! T-Shirt 11x17 show poster 1 1/2 inch soft enamel pin of Frankie

My name is Tim Briggs and I�m the founder of Folk Hymnal. We have some wonderful, new Christmas and worship music we would like to send out into the world�and we would love your help! Background Last year, I was at a place where I realized I�m a no talent, hack musician who had been writing worship songs for a while�some of which were pretty good�but I had no way of getting them out into the world. As I like to say, I have a face for radio and a voice for the shower. Anyway, I came up with this crazy idea�what if I collaborate with my artist friends who are great and help make these songs come to life. The result was Folk Hymnal�a collection of artists who create theologically rich songs in an accessible and attractive way. I worked with four different artists on four different songs and we released a Christmas EP called Incarnation Songs. And, I think it went great! I mean, my wife liked the songs, my kids, my mom�pretty much anyone related to me liked the songs. Seriously though, the whole process exceeded my expectations. The songs turned out great and they were received really well. My highest aim with this music is to create songs that could be sung by the local church and I received reports from churches around the country that they were singing these songs. Future Projects My role as co-writer and producer of Folk Hymnal has gone so well that I want to keep it going. I have some more original, Jesus-y, folky, non-traditional Christmas songs that I would like to release into the world that would come together into an EP called Incarnation Songs Volume 2. Additionally, I have a whole other EP of songs I�d like to release in 2020 that I�m tentatively entitling Good News Songs. So, I�m terrified�and excited. Would you join me on this terrifying, exciting journey? The Artists Once again, I'm aided by some amazing friends and artists. Stacy Lantz Stacy Lantz is a singer/songwriter and worship leader in Hilton Head, SC. In regards to her 2013 album Ready This Time, Andrew Greenhalgh of Stereo Subversion writes "...the album captures the diversity of Lantz alongside her intelligent and upbeat songwriting style. Lantz�s sound culls from influences as rich as Patty Griffin, Bonnie Raitt, and Eva Cassidy as well as more modern tones akin to Zooey Deschanel and Brandi Carlile, wrapping her lyrics in a warm blanket of eclectic soundscapes." You can learn more about Stacy and her music here. Nathan Storey Nathan Storey is a seasoned folk rock singer songwriter from Charlotte, NC. Nathan has developed a sound where, �he puts lush emotion and sincerity into each note making any listener sit up and take notice�his melodies and chord changes become hook laden delights,� as described by John Fonvielle, The Beat Magazine. In his songwriting, "Storey weaves intimate tunes, filled with emotion and powerful metaphor," as detailed by Hunter Gardner of Charleston Grit. He's been in love with music since he can remember and began pursuing it professionally in High School. Since then Nathan has performed all over the east coast and beyond trying to connect with people by sharing the story of his life, faith and everything else that has formed him. You can learn more about Nathan and his music here. Stewart Fenters Stewart Fenters is a worship leader and songwriter in Charlotte, NC. His heart for the local church is seen in the purpose of his music: to encourage prayerful engagement with the Living God. You�ll find space in his music and that space is intentional. With interest in both organic and digital sounds, Fenters creates a journey that feels familiar but takes you somewhere new. Stewart�s debut EP Give Thanks debuted in May of 2019. Kelly Graham Kelly Graham is a family guy, songwriter, and pastor who has been leading church music for eighteen years. He is currently a pastor at King�s Cross Church in Charleston, SC.

Important Update: Our Quest for 100 Supporters! We are on a mission to reach 100 pledge supporters.
