Trout Grass: The Revival Edition is set to continue its legacy as "a beautifully crafted film." David James Duncan at home on a Montana river. Photo by Yogesh Simpson Help us Revive the International Journey of Trout Grass We seek your generous support because this treasured documentary film needs a major restoration and key technological upgrades to ensure mainstream distribution success. Let's bring this film back for Andy and Ed, the Trout Grass filmmakers who passed away in recent years. Originally released in 2005, the master video tape and glass DVD were lost when floods from Superstorm Sandy hit our distributor�s offices in 2012. Our specific goals for putting your generous Kickstarter pledges to work are included in the list below. The items in bold are currently either underway or in pre-production. Brilliant creative teams are joining forces to revive Trout Grass (linked in blue), so please check out their awesome work! Converting a PAL-formatted (European encoded system) Digital Betacam video tape to a ProRes HQ 422 digital file. Team: AVConservation & Wall Street Productions of Michigan. Preparing the master digital file for the streaming service specifications of Amazon, iTunes, Netflix, and others. Recording a DVD bonus commentary track with David James Duncan and Glenn Brackett. Re-editing and modernizing the original Trout Grass title and end credit sequences. Team: Square State Film of Wyoming. Preparing and synching the commentary track audio. Team: Square State Film. Collecting, formatting, and editing archival footage and interviews for the DVD and digital stream bonus features. Team: Caldera Communications of Wyoming. Designing and writing the new DVD covers, website, and marketing materials. Team: Jessica Perry of Creative Blue Yonder, and Caldera Communications, both of Wyoming. Hand-pulled poster screenprinting and production. Team: Pine Print Shop of Colorado. Authoring, manufacturing, and replicating an initial run of 1500 Special Feature DVDs with Oasis Disc signature eco-friendly cases. Team: Oasis Disc Manufacturing of New Jersey. Create closed caption and subtitle options. Establish marketing and distribution channels for delivery to worldwide audiences. Trout Grass producer and bamboo importer Andy Royer on location in Aozai, China. Photo by Kyle George. A Tribute to the Creative Forces of Trout Grass The film's production lasted nearly three years and spanned two countries, including locations in China, Seattle, Montana, Wyoming, Florida, and Arizona. Andy Royer and Ed George were there, guiding the operations, every dynamic step of the way. Recently, these two energetic creators of Trout Grass passed on to the spirit world. Producer, co-writer, and bamboo extraordinaire Andy parted from two daughters and a wife when he died in 2015 after a years-long battle with cancer. Director and cinematographer Ed left unexpectedly in 2016 following a heart attack. Ed�s first gig in filmmaking was as an assistant on the legendary Woodstock documentary, shot 50 years ago this summer! Trout Grass is an important part of Ed and Andy's dynamic body of work, and it must continue to be available and discoverable for audiences. Trout Grass: The Revival Edition is a tribute to the two innovators. Cinematographer Ed George enjoying a day's work in Montana. Photo from ThisIsBozeman.com "A Beautifully Crafted Film." Trout Grass: The Revival Edition. A legendary rod maker treks to the source of his inspiration. A craftsman halfway around the planet encounters "spirits of the bamboo world." A writer-angler contemplates the power of our connection to rivers. And diverse audiences discover what it takes to convert a piece of grass into a six-sided baton ready to conduct an orchestra of trout and water. The documentary Trout Grass unveils the joys of international camaraderie, fine craftsmanship, and majestic rivers as it tracks the 10,000-mile passage of bamboo around the world. From a lush forest in remote China, to a rustic workshop in Montana, this film traces the transition of bamboo from a living plant to a finished fly rod. Trout Grass has always been an international journey into the passion of fly fishing, but it is also a captivating window into the life force of rivers and the intricate bonds of sustainable craftsmanship. The film appeals not only to fly fishers and bamboo enthusiasts, but also fans with interests in cultural heritage, meaningful work, and the beauty of our Earth's people and places. Ed George and split-cane aficionado Hoagy B. Carmichael getting the shot. Photo by Kyle George. Words and Images Built to Last Trout Grass achieved great success upon its release in 2005. The film was featured at a dozen festivals throughout North America and Europe, including the Telluride Mountain Film Festival, and Bend Film in Oregon. The producers were awarded "Best of Festival" and "Audience Choice" at several screenings. About 5,000 DVDs sold in North America during the first few years of release. The documentary aired on Public Broadcast Service affiliates throughout the western United States. But, hey, as Louis Carlozo of the Chicago Tribune noted, "If it sounds like the stuff of a public-TV yawner, guess again: [David James] Duncan wastes nary a word as he tackles his subject with a poet's passion and reporter's zeal." The film never grows old. Its pace is as soothing as the flow of mountain streams. And like the meticulously crafted split cane fly rods on display in the film, the writing, cinematography, and music are each created by masters of their art. Reap Your Rewards�Exclusive Posters, DVDs, Downloads, or a Custom Fly Rod Depending on your inclinations, the most exciting benefit from your Trout Grass: The Revival Edition pledge might be the custom bamboo fly rod from Sweetgrass Rods of Montana. Glenn Brackett, featured in the film, is generously crafting one of his prized creations as an enticement for your support! A custom Sweetgrass Rod by one of the stars of Trout Grass, Glenn Brackett. Wyoming's own Jessica Perry of Creative Blue Yonder pairs nicely with Trout Grass! Jessica is currently fine-tuning designs for the limited edition, three-color screenprinted poster, hand-pulled by the artists at Pine Print Shop. She's also covering the Revival Edition DVD, new website, and future marketing materials. Below is a draft for the DVD cover. We want to keep an element of surprise for the poster, so log on, pledge, and stay tuned for updates on this multi-faceted production! Draft layout for the Revival Edition DVD cover. Design by Jessica Perry of Creative Blue Yonder.

This year, I (Jenna Smith), Emma S. Kimball, Anal�a Alegre-Femenias Weber, Frances Lister, and IMPACT Dance Company have joined forces to create a dance performance entitled, 5x5 for the Fort Collins Fringe Festival. 5x5 (pronounced "five by five") is a collection of brand new/in-progress dance works by Fort Collins choreographers. 5 Choreographers, 5 Dancers, 5 Unique Points of View. We want more people to feel comfortable watching dance and to find their own story in the movement. This is an opportunity to witness fresh choreography, as well as a chance to see how many exciting artists live and work in the amazing Northern Colorado community! Last year's Fringe show WOMEN WORKING received Salt Magazine's "Movers and Shakers" award, and was runner up for the "Fort Collins Fringe Festival Artist Choice" award. Because it costs money to produce a show, we are asking for support to help cover our production costs, which will in turn help pay the dancers and choreographers. This is where we need YOU! There is no amount too small, everything helps! The funds we raise will help us pay for: Venue Fee (To perform at Bas Bleu Theater) Lighting Designer Costumes Fringe Application Fee Marketing / Promotional Materials By helping us to cover these costs, all of the ticket sales will go straight to the artists! ALL CHOREOGRAPHERS AND PERFORMERS INVOLVED IN 5x5 WILL BE PAID FOR THEIR WORK. Please help us to kick-start 5x5 and support the amazing independent dance artists in the Fort Collins Community! 5x5 Choreographers: Jenna Smith Emma S. Kimball Judy Bejarano (IMPACT Dance Company) Anal�a Alegre-Femenias Weber Frances Lister

Hi Friends, My name is Dara Maclean. I�m a singer/songwriter & worship leader based out of Fort Worth Texas. THE DREAM I�m very excited to invite you to join me as I embark on a journey that will be the fulfillment of a dream that God has been unfolding over the last few years: to record my first worship record experience and to do it as an independent artist, with my friends and family as the lifeblood. THE JOURNEY Worship is where it all began for me. As a young girl, it was just me with my guitar, singing simple songs of freedom over people and humbly watching as God did something extraordinary with it. Music being a vehicle for healing and the way I express worship, has always been the underlying current, even during the years of being identified as a �pop Christian Contemporary� artist. When I was 22, after a lifetime of doing ministry and working hard as an Independent artist, I was signed to a major record label, which led to two full-length albums, �You Got My Attention� and �Wanted.� I was nominated for a Dove Award for �New Artist Of The Year.� My songs were played on the radio and all over the world. I had top charting success in radio, I was on the biggest tour in the world, Winter Jam, touring with the biggest artists in Christian music for three seasons and have been traveling locally and globally doing music and ministry for the last 10 years. I give God all the glory and will forever be eternally grateful for that season. Also, that season allowed me to connect with you. I can�t ever say thank you enough for that. WATCH �WHEN ALL I HAVE IS JESUS� AFRICA VERSION HERE: https://youtu.be/tR-e8GANig0 THE NEXT STEP From signed at 22, to now 32. I�ve decided, with the blessing of my label, to step out again as an Independent artist. Over the last 10 years, I�ve learned so much about myself and what I believe my purpose is as an artist: To reveal the heart of God the Father with clarity and accuracy through music and watch as God uses that to set hearts free, and me right along with it, and to call us back to Him, to each other, and to Family. As it stands today, I�ve been blessed to be a part of a couple of projects that were released through the emerging worship family here in Dallas/Fort Worth and that really set the course for where we are now and where we�re headed with this next record. Coupled with my song, Blameless, that I wrote at 16 and released on my record �Wanted� in 2013 and then, as a live worship video on YouTube in 2015; that day LITERALLY changed my life, I knew for the rest of my life, I wanted to write simple songs and see God move. WATCH BLAMELESS HERE: https://youtu.be/g1BB6Uq6PGk THE NEW ALBUM Full circle, this next record will be filled with simple, vulnerable, authentic songs about love, freedom, family and God as Father, allowing Him Full Access into every room in our hearts, until the whole house that is us gets healed. I CANNOT WAIT to share this new music with you and even more, I can�t wait to do this with you as a family, and together take this message all over the globe. THE BUDGET I want to invite you to be a part of this album, this journey, this next step. I know we can make something amazing if we do it together. We have 30 days to raise the funds to cover the following: studio sessions producer/engineer musicians mixing and mastering disc manufacturing social media marketing Kickstarter fees & costs THE STRETCH GOAL As you know, Kickstarter is an all-or-nothing kind of deal. My initial campaign goal is set at $35K to cover the costs for recording this album, which I totally believe with your help we can meet. Our stretch goal is $55k. As you know, video content is a huge connection point for people so I want to be able to create visual representation for the songs as well as implement a marketing campaign to reach the masses. BUT the dream doesn't stop there. Anything I raise beyond the stretch goal will get me closer to being able to tour with this album, and create "Encounter Nights" locally and globally. THE SHARE Online marketing is KEY for today's Independent artists. It�s the just the world we live in, so, my goal is to have social media work for us in it�s true purpose: getting things that edify and uplift into the hands of every person we can. You and I, are more than enough to make a massive wave for the Kingdom. Thank you in advance for spreading the word, posting, reposting, telling your friends and doing anything in your heart to do to get this message out with me! THANK YOU That�s the dream, and together, I believe we can more than do it. I pray every seed sown, would multiply back to you and your dreams. Thank you in advance for listening, praying, giving and supporting in anyway that�s in your heart. It means the world to me. So much love, - D

Behind The Winds is a docu-fiction feature film dealing with blindness, filmmaking, loneliness and friendship. A meditation on the way humans relate, communicate, listen and see. The characters domino from a filmmaker attempting to write a script, to a blind girl trying to find an energy beyond the school walls around her and finally to a mechanic aimlessly driving around the mountain roads trying to find a reason to live, all against the landscape of Lebanon. Short Summary Art is not for judging, but made for thinking. Karim Kassem is a young director and cinematographer from Beirut living in New York City and will be playing himself. Lyne Ramadan is the young blind girl who will be playing herself, thinking of a world outside the school walls. Fouad Mahouly will be playing himself as a mechanic wandering around the mountains, looking for a better reason to live. The Lebanese School for the Blind will be our main location, to uncover the charm and vision of the children there. Contributions will support our collective vision and bring it to life in the shape of cinema. The Impact What we are trying to do, is create art in a realm that exists between both sighted and non-sighted individuals. Stylistically, the film bends more towards an experimental narrative that sits well with our dreams. A meditative experience dissolving into a soundscape while reflecting inward on the notions of thought and existence.

Short on battery, Hate carrying chargers? Meet THE EVERYDAY WALLET AND THE MULTI-CLUTCH, A MUST FOR ANY WOMAN. We set out to create a wallet and clutch that merged fashion with business. A no-compromise to style but a must to functionality. The Everyday Wallet and The Multi-Clutch combines the best of technology with skilled handcrafting. Utilizing top gain saffiano leather, we wanted to create a elegant and smooth texture that would hold up in any setting whether its in the office, or a party. Each wallet and clutch contains a 4000mAh battery and supports both wireless charging and USB charging. The battery is recharged using a USB C charging wire. WIRELESS CHARGING OR USB CHARGING The Multi-Clutch 10 card slots, 3 slip pockets, 1 ID window, 1 zip pocket, and a stainless steel chain. The Everyday Wallet 15 card slots, 1 ID window, 2 billfolds, 2 slip pockets, and a removable wristlet. All orders are packaged in a dust bag and secured with a hardcover paper box.

Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00 "Backwoods" is a game changing Bigfoot movie that is influenced by researchers, witnesses and enthusiasts. "Backwoods" is classified as a "Docudrama". The story is crafted from dozens of eye witness accounts and first hand encounters. The movie will be shot in documentary fashion using plot devices inspired by real-life experiences. The storytelling of "Backwoods" will entice the audience to become invested in the story and won't let go until the very end. It will be informative, suspenseful and end with a scene that may render sleeping difficult for nights to come. Bigfoot researcher Jim Myers and filmmaker Rob Wagner pursue a life-long passion to create the definitive Bigfoot movie as we follow a band of Sasquatch researches that discover more evidence than they bargained for. Much, much more. Principal photography of �Backwoods" will start in mid-July, 2019. The shoot will focus on witness and researcher interviews and a real world expedition. When possible, the interviews will be conducted at the location of the sighting/encounter. The researchers and filmmakers will be spending several days on location filming a Bigfoot expedition and performing experiments to prove or debunk witness testimonials. The most significant challenge facing the filmmakers will be adapting to quickly changing weather conditions. It is anticipated that most, if not all filming will take place outside in mountainous terrain during early summer. Jim Myers, Bigfoot researcher and producer, is adamant that the Bigfoot community be invited to participate in the making of this film. "This isn't going to be a fan film though, says Jim. "We will have non biased professionals as part of the crew as well. "We are going to craft this film into a story that Bigfoot enthusiasts and skeptics alike will thoroughly enjoy, and come away from with an entirely new perspective on the Bigfoot phenomenon" , says Jim. Jim and the filmmakers invite Bigfoot researchers, witnesses and enthusiasts to be a part of this game changing film by supporting �Backwoods� on Kickstarter.com. If nothing else, says Jim, "we hope to bring a bit of wonder into this world". "So, we�ve only just started. It�s time to get back to work. Thank you for your unflinching support.

CRAVING MORE FERRIS FOOTAGE? Watch this video below: it goes over the whole Ferris System in more detail and with more clarity� and shake testing� than our campaign video! If you're like us, you try keeping things tidy� but you still waste time every day looking for your wallet, phone, keys and sunglasses. To create a better out-the-door experience, we've reimagined a way to organize and carry these everyday essentials. Ferris KeyLoop, KeyFolio, and ModWallet in action� all powered by MagLock Our mission at Distil Union is to create products that solve life's little frustrations in a way that makes you smile. We're an independent design studio that's fueled entirely by crowd-funding since 2012 (this is our 9th Kickstarter� all successful and delivered on time )! For years we've heard what hundreds of you struggle with when it comes to the stuff you walk out the door with every day� so we've distilled the problem into an elegant solution which, of course, involves magnets... As it turns out, the best key ring isn't a ring at all. Keys rotate freely, and attach to any magnetic surface. (Shown: KeyLoop) Built for those of us always on the go, Ferris makes life a little bit easier by improving the things you carry and how you store them. Shown: Ferris KeyLoop, ModWallet and ModStation It�s time to retire the keyring for something more fun and flexible. Ferris is a series of secure magnetic components that easily come together and quickly reconfigure as needed. Powered by MagLock, you can slim down and carry only what you need in an instant� no more, no less, and no tools required. There are many solutions that have tried to tackle the problem of organization, but they come with their own problems or create other issues... We've grown accustomed to compromises and trade-offs, but these little frustrations really add up! We wanted to reclaim that time, and our sanity... A simple solution is long overdue: We're passionate about designing products that simplify your life in clever ways, and after years of exploration and development, we've created a simple modular system named Ferris. Streamline your routine. Walk out the door with lighter pockets, and leave the rest neatly organized on the Ferris ModStation� a modern catch-all for your most common out-the-door items. This is Ferris, a hassle-free system of everyday essentials. Ferris lets your wallet and keychain adapt to what you need to carry� eliminating clutter and increasing peace of mind. We set out to create a better key organizer, and arrived at a system that's more than simply functional� Ferris saves you time and space, and adapts to your life in a fun and meaningful way. That's why Ferris is all about customization� there's no longer a need to carry different solutions. Instead, make what you carry work for you: The Ferris leather-goods include KeyLoop, KeyFolio, and ModWallet Ferris KeyLoop KeyLoop: Carry up to 6 keys + included FobRing holds your car fob, tracker, etc. Ferris KeyFolio KeyFolio: Carry up to 10 keys + included FobRing holds your car fob, tracker, etc. Ferris ModWallet ModWallet: Comes with one CardSleeve to carry up to 12 cards, and a MoneyClip for your cash. Also carries add-ons like additional CardSleeves, KeyMods, USB and MultiTool. Grab a cover that suits your style and accommodates your carry, or pick a combination that adapts to meet your specific needs from day to day (this is the ideal solution for those of you who have multiple sets of keys, but you don't need to have them all on you all the time). Imagine the possibilities! Ferris comes together to suit your needs on a daily basis. You can easily stack and rearrange� even combine your keys and wallet into one consolidated carry so you have one less thing to remember. Scale up or down. Carry only what you need� no more, no less, and no tools required! Ferris is powered by our patent-pending MagLock. This magnetic locking mechanism gives you the perfect balance of security and access that so many key-organizing solutions fail to provide. Free a key instantly to easily swap out + share as needed. Ferris leathergoods work with KeyMods� the heart of the Ferris family. They are made with neodymium magnets and a TPU-backed nylon, well-known for its durability and abrasion resistance. Behind these small mechanisms are years of development and testing to achieve a connection that is: SECURE In your pocket, your bag, dropped on the ground, taking a tumble down the stairs... Your keys will remain securely snapped together. FLEXIBLE Magnets join together quickly and easily. They rotate smoothly for key access without removal, and allow for sharing without the need for a tool. KeyMods shown with USB, FobRing, MultiTool, MoneyClip and a ModWallet cover. The KeyMods work like double-sided magnetic snaps: Nesting magnets with a male/female construction make a magnet-to-magnet connection that's incredibly strong and allows for rotation. This new MagLock works differently than our MagLock Sunglasses, redesigned and optimized for keys to snap together and rotate. In order to accommodate the majority of keys that people carry, we created two types: KeyMod Clicks and KeyMod Sticks. View the Key Guide and video to learn how they work with your keys in our first Update. Any larger keychain items (like a car fob, Tile tracker, or sentimental boondoggles) can be kept on the custom-designed FobRing included with the KeyLoop and the KeyFolio.  Made to last, with durable materials that feel great in your hand� and look great in your home. It all comes together with the Ferris ModStation: A sleek and modern catch-all that gives everything a proper place. Cutting visual clutter not only saves your sanity: ModStation helps you stay organized reduces the likelihood of lost items makes your out-the-door routine quicker and easier ModStation is an easy way keep your desk organized and tidy. Shown here with a KeyLoop used to hold headphones, and ModWallet. Ferris ModStation is so much more than a mail-catch. We call it a "catch-all" because the slim steel tray is designed to accommodate your phone, a Kindle, a notebook, and other similarly sized items ModStation will even hold onto your phone's charging cable so it's always there when you need it� instead of falling behind your desk or getting lost entirely... Shown here: ModStation with KeyFolio and MagLock Sunglasses (our successful 2017 Kickstarter!) ModStation is made of steel with a smooth powder-coat finish. Easy to mount where you need it, all ModStations include a set of screws as well as a panel of 3M removable adhesive that's also magnetic (so you can mount ModStation to any magnetic surface, like a fridge or steel door). Shown here: ModStation with ModWallet. BONUS: Ferris leathergoods instantly hold anything magnetic, like AirPods. Stop searching for your stuff. Streamline your routine. And take back your time. Everyone's needs are different, and we're excited to hear how Ferris adapts to meet yours :) Any surface that could use tidying up, could use a ModStation. KeyMod MultiTool (including bottle-opener) and KeyMod USB (16GB) are available as Add-Ons to any Pledge Level. MagLock Sunglasses are available as Add-Ons to any Pledge Level (choose style after the campaign). DIY: How to Customize Your Ferris Ferris is modular. Each element of the Ferris System has its own pledge level: KeyLoop, KeyFolio, ModWallet and ModStation. Each is a complete product that stands alone, or can be added to for custom solutions (see Ferris Recommendation Matrix below). Want additional items? We want you to have the best Ferris experience, so all Add-Ons are at Early Bird prices! It's a great deal for all who pledge� so they're only available as Add-Ons in addition to one of the Pledge Levels. 1. Select a Pledge Level. 2. Grab a calculator and check the Add-Ons Menu . 3. Enter the total amount as your pledge. The Easy Button = Pick one of the KITS (assortments at a discount). It's the perfectly easy way to get started with Ferris. You can pick a KIT from the blue menu above and call it a day, or add additional items to your KIT by doing the math and entering the total amount for your pledge. Celebrating the 50th anniversary with an immersive map Apollo 11 landed the first man on the moon 50 years ago, on July 20th, 1969. NASA selected the Sea of Tranquility near the equator of the moon for the first lunar landing attempt. Durning the decent, Neil and Buzz overshot the intended landing site and had to maneuver around a large crater and boulder field. Upon touch down, they had less than a minute of fuel remaining. This 3D map allows you to explore the depth and size of the obstacles in the last seconds along the flight path. It also added depth to what it might have been like standing next to a 30m wide impact crater or placing the science experiments that were left behind to collect valuable information of our moon. I now look at lunar surface photos with greater understanding of location, vantage points and scale with this 3D map as a table top reference. Photo credit: NASA To celebrate the 50th anniversary of the moon landing, we are creating The Apollo 11 Site Map. Size: 10�x 5.75� Made from high quality clear acrylic in 3D Accurate locations and scale Labeled items of interest- Flag, TV Camera, LM, LRRR, SWC, PSEP, and Craters Utilizing the highest resolution images of landing site and NASA maps Made in the USA Mapping a distant world To create an accurate map of the landing site, we utilized the closest satellite images of the surface, NASA maps and panoramic images taken during the EVA. From this data, combined with mission notes, we were able to accurately layout the locations of artifacts, where the astronauts explored and the depth and locations of significant craters. Photo credit: NASA Photo showing science experiments, LM, Flag and TV camera Photo Credit: NASA Mapping since the Apollo era Seeing the landing site from earth or space based telescopes is simply not possible because of the limitations of optics. NASA's Lunar Reconnaissance Orbiter has provided much closer images and topography of the moon's surface. Hopefully, the recently announced return missions to the moon will not only advance our exploration, but expand our images of this historic site. Photo from LOR (Lunar Reconnaissance Orbiter) Collectors Accessory Bag This bag is based off of the original Contingency Bag used to stow the first samples collected on the moon. We're bringing it back to this project by popular request. Made from heavy weight nylon, brass zipper and original NASA lettering, it is the most authentic way to store your lunar treasures until you collect you own moon rocks. *All items will be shipping from the United States via USPS First Class Mail. Duties and taxes are the responsibility of the recipient. Meet the Creator Six years ago I launched my first kickstarter that evolved into an international bag business, that I still run today. This will be our fourth kickstarter, but the second under our new brand, Puntzi. I'm excited to blend my expertise in manufacturing with my passion for space exploration, to bring this project to life.

Hi there, thanks for stopping by. My name is Lucas Alvarado and together with a group of my friends, we are putting together a new tech company called Interop Technology. What is Interop Technology? Interop Technology is your stop for all of your tech needs. We have different services from creating and developing websites, to writing content and editing marketing videos. We came up with this idea because the 4 of us are Software developers and we have created websites and designs for most of our friends already. We want a way to reach more people and new customers and at some point work full time only on Interop Technology not just all night (coders do not sleep). Our plan is to provide an excellent quality product at a reasonable price. We can provide a better price for our customers as we do not have to outsource any of our services. We each have special skills on everything we offer and can guarantee satisfaction. Our main goal is to be able to run our own company, work only on Interop Technology, and rent a small shared office space. 80% of the money pledged will go towards advertising on social media and PPC on Google. WHY SONGS ABOUT WOMEN? I can't imagine the man I would be today without the women in my life. We live in a time when the woman is underappreciated for the beauty, strength, poise and nuance she brings to humanity. I wrote 8 original compositions honoring the women in my life who continue to shape me completely as a man. Back in February 2019, I was lucky enough to book a week long residency at Dizzy's Club New York. I called the residency Songs About Women, and performed these songs with my band for the FIRST time. The response? Well... Around 500 people from all over the world attended the residency. On both weekend nights, the venue was packed out the door. We sold out! After one of those nights, two Londoners spoke to me about how moved they were by the song I wrote called JUSTICE, which I wrote for my twin sister: Justice. Shout out to my sis and those two lovely Londoners! Last night of my residency at Dizzy's Club New York MY OBJECTIVE With these 8 songs, I can tell the story I've always wanted to share since I first started making music. So I asked myself: why not tell the story through my first jazz album?! EXECUTING THE PLAN Putting together a jazz album and getting everyone to listen to it requires real commitment. I have a strong vision for how I want to present this project. Now it's going to take a real team effort (you and I) to bring this vision to the world!!! I seriously can't do this without you. #1 We need to produce the full album. This is what that REALLY looks like: Compensating my 4 band members to record the album in a studio Feeding everyone involved in the recording process Hiring a mixer to mix 8 songs Hiring a master engineer to master 8 songs for digital and radio formats #2 We need to promote the album, which really means: Making music videos to accompany the album and hiring the crew to make it happen Performing SHOWS so I can meet you all in real life!! For the music videos, you might even get to see me throw it back to my acting days on HBO's Treme with the big bro Wendell Pierce ;) Me and Wendell on HBO's Treme In the end, I want you to feel as close to these songs as I do and share the love, memories, and New Orleans I've poured into them...with the people you cherish. Yours truly, Jeffery Miller Hugs from me to you

Oops, I did it again!...I wrote another book. Or enough poems that are worthwhile enough to make into a book. Wanna help me make a book? Poetry is free - & abundant - but ink & paper & binding & editing & cover art & all the other expenses inherent in publishing that I have apparently blocked out are not free. So here's the ask: pledge some $$$, get a prize, read my book & have a bunch of thoughts & feelings about what it means to be participating in life on this planet as a human person with thoughts & feelings. ALSO in case you've never participated in Thressa Makes a Book before, you need to know the most fun part is the book release party where we eat food & drink beverages & watch talented artists do their art things & maybe definitely I read some poems & probably definitely I cry & everyone is happy & inspired & we all hug. That will happen in late July in Minneapolis, cuz that's the only place I know how to have a book release & cuz that's when I'm planning to be not-in-Mexico.

ALBUM INSPIRATION The Ithaca musical community has served as a guiding light for me from the earliest steps in my musical career, both as an artist an individual. The lessons of solidarity, collaboration, and creative encouragement I have received here I hold with permanent gratitude. Having had the fortune to travel broadly for musical endeavors, including time spent working and living as a musician in NYC, I�ve gained extra perspectives on the uniqueness that exists in the musical community of Ithaca. As a composer, I�m perpetually comforted knowing that there is a resource of talent here that can fulfill whatever I can dream up, allowing me the confidence to write with an open mind. I have been working on a project inspired by the hope of conveying this thankfulness. SONGS AND PLAYERS I�m honored with the opportunity to create and share a new album of my original compositions, performed and recorded by some of my favorite local musicians and closest friends. I�ve written 10 songs referencing a broad range of my musical interests, with a diverse variety of Ithaca bands and musicians in mind, including members of: Driftwood, Viva Mayhem!, The Crucials, The Thru Spectrums, Brian!, Hank Roberts, The Ithaca New Music Ensemble, members of the Horseflies and Blindspots, and more! Conceptually, I'm aiming to create a flow of music that serves to sample and pay homage to the music that inspires me in Ithaca, and to reflect these sounds through my own compositional style. FIRST IMPRESSIONS: "The melding of genre and style in these compositions is truly masterful and inspiring." -Emily Hoyt, Viva Mayhem! You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00 "Josh is a true music visionary." -Judy Hyman, The Horseflies You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00 "Ox has this amazing way of writing a song that fits perfectly for the specific band and at the same time, is unquestionably Ox." -Amanda Massa, Thru Spectrums A MUSICAL GIFT TO THE TOWN I LOVE From my first efforts as a performing musician, playing piano at my mom�s family�s restaurant Centini's on South Hill, through my experiences studying Jazz and Composition at Ithaca College, and onward to my current roles including conducting and writing for the Ithaca New Music Ensemble, I have consistently been held in awe of the musical spirit that is celebrated here. The supportiveness that I have known here in Ithaca gained an extra dimension for me in July 2010, when I was involved in a life-altering car accident. The path to recovering and persisting with my music has been the great lesson of my life thus far; I live with a daily recognition of the blessing of the people here that have instilled me with hope and purpose to maintain pursuit of what I love. My way of expressing reverence for this support is through continued musical creation.
