JUST ADDED: Check out this exclusive preview of The Atomic Thunderbolt #3 featuring the origin story of the villain, The Baron: https://www.dropbox.com/s/mbrw1735ou97gls/Baronpreview.pdf?dl=0 Following the shocking reveal at the end of The Atomic Thunderbolt #2, our hero demands answers and learns about the real threat he�s up against � The Baron. Aiming to stop the Nazi super-soldier�s quest to revive The Third Reich once and for all, a gung-ho attack ends with a jaw-dropping twist. Welcome to the Kickstarter campaign for The Atomic Thunderbolt #3! After a bit of a hiatus� WE�RE BACK! Hey everyone! It�s been a minute, but we�re back in action! After the second issue, The Atomic Thunderbolt took a bit of an extended hiatus� in fact, all of TJ Comics did. Nothing serious, nothing bad� life just happened to get in the way and I needed to re-examine some things from a creative standpoint. But we�re back on track and can report, The Atomic Thunderbolt #3 is DONE and The Atomic Thunderbolt #4 is already in production! And that's why we're here, to send The Atomic Thunderbolt #3 to the printers and then to YOU! We're also looking to speed up production on issue #4! I�m IPPY Award winning writer Kevin Powers, and I�m teaming up with artist Rowel Roque and IPPY Award winning colorist Donna Gregory to continue the revival of the greatest one-hit wonder in comic book history � The Atomic Thunderbolt. The Atomic Thunderbolt came after the height of the early-1940s superhero craze. The war was over, the Cold War had yet to begin and many superhero comics had begun to cease publication while the precursors of Marvel and DC continued to evolve. The atomic age hero made his first and only appearance in �The Atomic Thunderbolt #1� in 1946. Featured in two stories � one detailing the character�s origin and the other in a slapstick tale with two aloof scientists � The Atomic Thunderbolt disappeared and was never seen again in mainstream comics. In the 72 years since his initial publication by the Regor Company, The Atomic Thunderbolt has achieved a cult status among Golden Age and Public Domain superhero enthusiasts. I discovered him doing research for my superhero series "ExtraOrdinary" and have been fascinated ever since. The first issue of our revival of The Atomic Thunderbolt served as a homage and direct sequel to the original. We included a reprint of the original stories to allow readers to connect the dots and see how we honored the source material. CLICK HERE TO READ THE FIRST ISSUE! In our first chapter, Former OSS � and soon to be CIA Officer � Jay McPherson tracks down our hero who has recently been spotted all over New York City. Staging a bank robbery, McPherson confronts The Atomic Thunderbolt and extends him an offer to make a real difference. Panel from The Atomic Thunderbolt #1 In our second chapter, working with McPherson and a covert squad of commandos, The Atomic Thunderbolt has been tasked with taking out pockets of Nazi resistance that have access to secret super-weapons and hope to restart the war. Unbeknownst to our hero, the Nazis are being coordinated and led by a mysterious man known as The Baron, whose fate is uniquely intertwined with The Atomic Thunderbolt. While taking down the leftover Nazi war machine, our hero discovers a dark secret that McPherson � and the U.S. Government � has kept tightly under wraps. The third chapter picks up moments after the second ends. The Atomic Thunderbolt wants answers for the shocking secret he�s stumbled upon. What he learns from McPherson is the truth about what happened to America�s superhumans and the Nazi superhuman known as The Baron. After learning about the villain's origin, the Atomic Thunderbolt leads an all-out assault on the evil-doer's compound that results in the most shocking twist of the series! The Atomic Thunderbolt #3 cover The third issue is COMPLETE and ready to be sent to the printers! Interior pages from The Atomic Thunderbolt #3 The Atomic Thunderbolt #1 is 50 pages and features 30 pages of our original story, PLUS reprints of The Atomic Thunderbolt's first and only appearances. The Atomic Thunderbolt #2 and #3 are both 28 pages of full-color action! *Every comic comes with the option of being signed PERKS! Here's a look at the perks you'll get as a print backer! These are designed as perks for print backers because they fit neatly inside the book! However, digital backers can still get these if you want them, just let me know when the campaign ends. We've got 3 items... a 6 x 9 cover print (this goes with the prints from the previous two campaigns), a sticker of the updated Atomic Thunderbolt logo, and my personal favorite... a homage to the classic DC Comics Cosmic Cards. The Exclusive Retro Trading Card is exclusive to the Kickstarter and is true trading card size. This will actually be the first in a series and they will all be designed to look like those beloved cards. I haven't finalized the back design yet, but I'll share it as soon as I do! More interiors from The Atomic Thunderbolt #3 Punching Nazis since the Golden Age 11 x 17 poster! Available through this campaign is our "Punching Nazis since the Golden Age" print based on the cover art from The Atomic Thunderbolt #2! The print measures 11 x 17 and is the perfect addition to your collection, office, room and more! "Punching Nazis since The Golden Age" 11 x 17 poster print Check out some artwork from The Atomic Thunderbolt #2! Interior art from The Atomic Thunderbolt #2 Interior art from The Atomic Thunderbolt #2 The Atomic Thunderbolt is also tied into TJ Comics growing superhero universe explored in ExtraOrdinary. Offered as one of our rewards, ExtraOrdinary follows The Challenger and how the modern world reacts to the appearance of what many believe to be the world's first superhero. ExtraOrdinary Vol. 1 collects the first FOUR chapters of ExtraOrdinary, clocking in at 90 pages of story! Interior pages from ExtraOrdinary Vol. 1 Thank you for your patience and support!

Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00 The first One Wipe Wafer prototype was born on June 18 2018 after a conversation I had with a friend, she was venting to me about a peeve she had about the baby wipes sticking together. I suggested to her she should write the company. She told me she did, and many other people had also complained to the company, she received a free package of wipes, but no solution. Upon looking at her package of wipes I found that it just needed some extra tension across the top of the package and some friction. That night I made my first prototype, and gave it to my friend, who was thrilled. She took it to a school function and showed it to some of the parents, they all wanted one. An interesting statistic I came across for combined baby wipes sales in the US in 2016 was 1.26 billion, I wonder how much of that was due to wasted baby wipes coming out stuck together. As I mentioned in my video there are 2 basic sized dispensing windows that are universal through the wet wipe packages, the regular, which is 8.8 cm and the small sized which is 7 cm in length, so I have 2 different sized wafers to accommodate this. Since my first prototype I have spent the past year doing prior Arch searches on the USTPO web site and still can't find any patent for what I have created. So I did my CAD drawings and 3D renderings and sent it to my manufacturer. We are ready to go with the One Wipe Wafer. We just need your help to do it. I also mentioned in the video about the Just One Wipe product line, I have working prototypes for 4 other common wipe packages which I am also looking forward to launching.

Hi everyone! My name is Jonzel Hernandez. I'm an actor and screenwriter trying to put myself out there by creating original content to share with the world. This is one of few projects I'm trying to bring to reality: a web-series. I started this project to add credits and build my resume. However, as I began enlisting more creative people to the production team and cast, I decided to not only build my career and share my content with the world but to also teach and help jump start the careers of others trying to break into the industry. Here is a short synopsis of the story. Title: The Former Life of Darren Mendoza Synopsis: Darren Mendoza's life is a mess. He's been dumped, his acting career is in the slumps, his house is a mess, and to make matters worse; he just got fired. After coming home from work, Darren is visited by James, who claims to be Darren's past life. What starts out as two strangers bickering, the two young men begin to form a strong friendship as James helps Darren navigate and reorganize his life for the better. I'm very excited and passionate about this project because part of the story stems from my life. It's both funny and touching, and I'm sure everyone will enjoy these two characters and their story. The funding that you provide will ensure our production has a budget to film a test pilot. If the pilot is successful and gains enough followers and views, we will put out a Patreon page for continued donations. Each of your donations will go into funding for food for the production, costumes, production costs (design, rentals, etc.). Any amount that you can donate is very much appreciated. Thank you so much for your time and consideration and I can not wait to share this project with you all!

Ever since Danny Phantom ended in 2007, we've been wanting more. Well, now we're going to do just that. But we need you help! Danny Phantom was the ultimate cartoon super hero, and therefor deserves an amazing super hero movie. We have a script to a 15 minute short film that explores where Danny, Sam, Tucker and the gang are 5 years after the end of the TV show. Then, with the success of this short film, we can hope for more Danny Phantom content in the future MONEY To make this 15 minute short film, we are asking for $15,000. This money will go towards finding talented actors, and filmmakers. It will go towards stunts that will need to be performed. It will go towards intense VFX and costumes. It'll go towards all that. We won't be taking any of this money home, and we won't be earning any money off of this. No sales, and no monetization online.

We envision Inbox@ArtBox as an annual celebratory choreographer�s evening - one that represents a cross section of the many artists and styles of dance being explored throughout the Twin Cities/Greater Minnesota dance community. Our goal is to present an evening of dance that showcases the talent and breadth of the Twin Cities area professional dance community, emphasizing diversity in style, perspective, and aesthetics. The Twin Cities has a long and rich history of being a supportive place for all kinds of dance artists to live, collaborate, and create. Unfortunately, despite this great wealth, opportunities to create and present work have significantly diminished over recent years, due largely to the shuttering of many dance venues, and the disappearance of their programs. Most of these venues not only provided opportunities for choreographers to present full-length productions, but also had programs for presenting evenings of short works by multiple choreographers. With this project Hauss Dance seeks to help fill the gap. Rather than reach out to our own connections and colleagues with similar aesthetics, we have established a juried showcase to demonstrate the rich and varied artistic perspectives that exist within this vibrant and well established dance community. This year's selected artists include: Tori Casagranda, Lily Conforti, Jennifer Glaws, Samantha Heggem, Julianna Johnson, Zo� Koenig, Jos� Luis, Alys Ayumi Ogura, Jill Patterson, Charlotte Vail, and Christian Warner. This year's selection panel included dancer/choreographers Jesse Schmitz Boyd and MerSadies McCoy. Last year, for Inbox@ArtBox 2018, Sarah Hauss and Jennifer Isle donated their administrative time, our stage manager agreed to barter her time for rehearsal space, Paul Herwig slashed his rates as a technical director/lighting designer, the dance artists agreed to perform for only $100 stipend and Off Leash Art Box slashed their rental rates nearly in half to make the project successful. This year, we have a $5000 Metropolitan Regional Arts Council Community Arts Grant and we are so very excited! But, to make the budget work and to pay everyone a fairer price, we still need $1100 to round out the budget. Will you help us?

WE REACHED OUR STRETCH GOAL....AFROFUTURISM DANCE CLASSES ONLINE FOR ALL BACKERS PLUS A 1951 PLAYLIST INSPIRED BY OUR CHARACTERS' IN BRONZEVILLE!!!! STRETCH GOAL #2 - If we get 400 backers by the end of our campaign Ytasha will do an Audiobook!!! This Kickstarter project is a set of 3 short books about characters traversing through time in one of America's most iconic African-American communities. We explore a fantastic and speculative world, where people in the past and present are engaged in creating compelling new futures! SYNOPSIS: It�s 1951 in Chicago�s Bronzeville and a spaceship sighting has everyone buzzing. Bonnie, a 20something artist/columnist with the Chicago Defender, covers a not so secret society of people who dissect speculative science theories and the realm of the paranormal. Bonnie�s fascinated by this world of eccentrics introduced to her by a mysterious, handsome poet named Mandalay whose freedom she envies. The society meets in the basement of a slaughterhouse. However, when a blue haired pansexual pleasure activist from the future presents the attendees with the opportunity to live in the 2020s, Bonnie must decide whether life in the Alter Destiny is real or a dangling fantasy. A Spaceship in Bronzeville is a project published by Mouse Books and is was written by Ytasha L. Womack. ABOUT YTASHA Ytasha is an author, Afrofuturist theorist, filmmaker, dance therapist and champion of the imagination. She's author of the book Afrofuturism: The World of Black Sci Fi & Fantasy Culture, a Locus Awards Nonfiction Finalist. She's also author of the Rayla Universe series. as well as the nonfiction books Post Black and Beats, Rhymes and Life, What We Love and Hate About Hip Hop. She's lectured at numerous colleges and festivals all over the world. She is a Spring 2019 creative-in residence at Kickstarter and 2018 writer-in-residence with Emerson College in Boston. Much like Bonnie, she got her start as a journalist at The Chicago Defender. Although her families Chicago roots began in Bronzeville, she personally has not seen a spaceship there... although she's met people who claim they have. EXPLORING BONNIE'S WORLD Chicago South-side, 1950s Chicago's Bronzeville neighborhood was one of the great destinations for African Americans escaping hardships in the South during the first half of the 20th Century. Our story's protagonist, Bonnie, lives and works in Bronzeville. Esoteric ideas and new philosophies were hotly debated as people looked to create new futures in the face of new opportunities. Those who came during the Great Migration created a unique culture; a blend of the aspirations and beliefs rife with robust civic and nightlife. The Chicago Defender (where Bonnie works), is one of the leading black-owned papers and was instrumental in attracting people north. 1951: POINT OF TRANSITION Musician and poet Sun Ra was a resident of Bronzeville in the 1950's It's after WWII and the African American population in Chicago has nearly quadrupled, the Red Scare is in it's early years, housing segregation is being challenged (think A Raisin in the Sun) and the country is on the cusp of both a civil rights movement and cultural renaissance. The Regal Theater, Savoy Ballroom, and Club DeLisa were among the popular hang outs and Washington Park and the Southside Community Arts Center are hubs for the exchange of ideas. Chess and Vee-Jay Records were on the rise. Chicago's meat packing plant (where the characters meet) was at an all time high. Custom Slip Case for 3 Book Set Mouse Books offer a convenient alternative to reading on your phone: a phone-sized book. Mouse Books are approachable, carefully curated, beautiful, durable, real paper books. They are small enough to go with you anywhere. They don�t ring, buzz, vibrate, need batteries, and there are no screens to break. They are ideal for people who want a break from relentlessness of the attention economy. SPECIFICATIONS Mouse Books are carefully crafted to optimize the reading experience in a very compact format. When you are working at a small scale, every detail matters. OUR FIRST LIVING AUTHOR!!! Ytasha being a good sport during late night work session planning this campaign! Mouse Books launched by publishing classic literature by celebrated authors like Joyce, Dostoyevsky, Austen, and Melville. All along we have been waiting for the opportunity to partner with a contemporary author on a special project. We are delighted that Ytasha agreed to work with us, and has created this set of novellas specifically for the Mouse format. WORLD-CLASS PRINTER This is the actual Heidelberg Speedmaster XL 105 at eDOC that prints Mouse Books! Mouse is obsessed with making these books extremely high-quality. We've partnered with one of the great printers in the USA, eDOC Communications from Mount Prospect, Illinois, to bring Mouse Books to life. And since our printing partner is local to our Chicago-based team, we know our quality standards are upheld during every print run. THANK YOUUUU!!!! THANK YOU for making it through the whole description! We sincerely hope you pledge and help bring this project to life!!!!!! Anything you can do to help spread the word is greatly appreciated by Ytasha and the Mouse Team :)

One of my childhood dreams (like many others) was to own an animatronic Good Guy Doll from the movie Child's Play. Over the years there have been a variety of dolls released but none have attempted to replicate the movements seen on screen. Earlier this year, Trick or Treat Studio's released a doll that is affordable and accurate to the movie. Only one problem... it didn't move. I made it a personal goal to turn this doll into a real-life animatronic doll. I started posting videos of my progress and I received a lot of interest from fans wanting to do the same for their dolls. I decided I would design something I could produce for other fans at a price range they could afford. I have spent almost a year coming up with a mechanism that can be quickly installed into the doll. Now I need your help. My budget won't allow me to purchase all the parts and dolls at one time so I am turning to you. Please back this project if you are interested in buying a kit or modded doll. I am making the goal low so that no matter what happens this project will be a success. I am proud to bring this to fans of the movie franchise and hope you enjoy having your very own animatronic Good Guy.

We're TPS Productions and last year we released our first feature film "Unspeakable Acts" and with your help we were able to get that film out to a wider audience. The goal of the Public Domain Dungeon is to shed some light on some forgotten classics and share these films with a whole new generation of movie lovers. But we realize that you can find most of these films anywhere, so with our releases we are providing just a little bit more. If it's a silent film, then we're gonna include a new score. If it's a talky, we'll provide audio commentary. These movies will be given new special features. I mean how many copies of "Carnival of Souls" have you seen with special features? (And we're cheaper than Criterion Collection!) Plus with each DVD there will be an all-new exclusive short film from the folks at TPS Productions. And that's the real draw. We're not selling the public domain films, we're selling ourselves. The scores will be recorded by local musical acts. The shorts will be made by not only Daniel Richardson and Simon Terrell (directors of "Unspeakable Acts"), but by new up-and-coming filmmakers who are just looking for a chance to shine. This is a side project that we feel truly passionate about. The money will go to put the first volume of the series on DVD. If it's a success then we hope to continue the series, putting out as many as 3-4 volumes a year!

Introducing Two Beard Games - Pirate's Plundership A tabletop RPG gaming accessory that doubles as a fun-for-all-ages board game. It started out nearly a year ago when our group of adventures needed a ship map for a TTRPG campaign. Two Beard Games took to the challenge and created a three-tiered ship that fit our table and campaign needs. It became the talk of the campaign and soon our youngest developer (11-years of age) got a hold of the ship and created a stand-alone game to play between campaign sessions. A few tweaks and adjustments later, and the Pirate�s Plundership is ready for the masses! - Model Kit - The Two Beard Games Pirate�s Plundership is delivered as a flat pack model kit made from environmentally sustainable Baltic Birch wood. The Pirate�s Plundership includes: A 3-tiered single-masted ship - complete with crow�s nest Dice Game figures Two cannons Functional Crate Anchor Dinghy A ship figurehead Customizable name plate Decorative box that doubles as the ship�s stand It�s easy to put together and is a blank canvas for those who love to work on models, paint figures, and stylize to fit any TTRPG campaign! When assembled, there are three decks ready for adventure! The ship model is approximately 17 inches long from bow to stern, 5.5 inches wide from port to starboard, and 12 inches tall from keel to the top of the crow's nest. -Tabletop RPG Ready- Two Beard Games Pirate�s Plundership was designed with TTRPG players in mind. Seafaring campaigns are always fun but finding a suitable ship can be tough. We made sure the grid for the board game matched scales with most popular TTRPG systems, added small features like the nameplate for customization, and kept each layer of the ship accessible from all sides. -Kraken Bundle- The Kraken bundle is for those who want to add a little danger to their waterborne campaign. The Kraken is a gargantuan creature base with multiple stand-alone tentacle figures so you can harass your players from each side of the ship! -Pirate�s Plundership Game- Race against your fellow pirates as you board and plunder treasure from your targeted ship. Prepare for battle as you go against the ship�s crew but be aware - the ship could sink at any moment! Pirates that make it back to the dinghy survive the attack. The winner is the one who collected the most gold. Simple Gameplay Roll the included dice to move around the ship and collect the coins you land on. Ending a turn next to an enemy token causes them to attack. It's risky, but enemies are worth their weight in gold, and that can make them worth fighting! Once three tokens with fire icons have been revealed, it's time to abandon ship! You have three rounds to make it back to the dinghy. Designed for 2 - 4 players, Ages 5+, 15-20 minutes per game.

The Last Survey is an interactive narrative video game that explores a speculative future where the metals we use for electronics and green technology are in sudden short supply. You play as a contracted geologist who�s recently completed a survey for a global mining corporation and have returned to deliver the dire news of your research to the company�s CEO. The Last Survey asks players to make pivotal choices in order to steer the conversation toward progressive action, encouraging your employer to reconsider the ecological ramifications of depleting the earth�s minerals and metals. The game is divided into four chapters and is illustrated with hundreds of hand-drawn digital, graphite, and charcoal animations. Based on player choices the narrative, animations, and dynamic soundtrack composed by the duo Big Dog Little Dog will vary. But players must be cautious, for their choices might anger their employer and lead to a premature end to your compelling arguments. For this Kickstarter campaign, I want to bring The Last Survey into a cinema in New York and invite individuals new to experimental video games to play and engage with the game . This live play through will feature a voting platform for mobile devices, allowing audience members to actively participate in the main character�s decision making and dialog options. The Theater @ Kickstarter HQ With your help, I can bring this project to life, commission my collaborators, and hopefully perform the project at future locations across the United States. Come join us! Your contribution will directly support commissioning my collaborators, Big Dog Little Dog, to create a brand new score for The Last Survey. In addition to helping bring their brilliant compositions to the game, your contribution will also provide financial support to inviting them to perform live as I play The Last Survey at an event scheduled for June 26th, 2019. This event will serve as a culmination of my time as Creator-in-Residence at Kickstarter HQ, and will be held in their wonderful theater in Greenpoint, Brooklyn. Your contributions will also help document the event with the collaborative team Intrinsic Grey Productions. Their work documenting, video-taping, and helping produce live performance events and contemporary art exhibitions is unparalleled. With their vision, documentation of performing The Last Survey will help bring the projects to new venues, festivals, and other opportunities. The Last Survey asks how the economic, political, and ecological decisions of a few affect the many. How do systems of power ignore the plight of society at large? By placing players in direct conversation with someone that could shape the health and safety of future generations, The Last Survey asks audiences what they would do this responsibility, and how they would go about deterring greed, corruption, and maintaining the status quo. In creating this work, I wanted to combine speculative fiction and interactive storytelling to interrogate bureaucratic systems of power. By bringing The Last Survey into a participatory setting, we�ll see how groups engage with tough decisions�and how interpersonal dynamics influence choice, engagement, and a sense of agency with games. What better way to start that dialog than to invite people to come together and play the game as a group? $15 � Early Access to The Last Survey. Get the full game before the official launch in Fall/Winter of 2019. The project will be available as a DRM-free download for Windows PC, MacOS, and Linux. $25 � Deluxe Edition of The Last Survey. The full game early access with FULL soundtrack by Big Dog Little Dog and HD video documentation of the first performance. Plus two tickets to The Last Survey: A Live Play Through at Kickstarter HQ. $85 � Collectors Edition of The Last Survey. Otherwise known as �The Binder,� the limited edition process book includes a physical USB copy of the game (DRM Free), full soundtrack by Big Dog Little Dog, original concept artwork for the game, storyboards and research documentation, and other exclusive content. (Edition of 20). Includes tickets to The Last Survey: A Live Play Through at Kickstarter HQ. $125 � Front Row Seats to first live performance at Kickstarter HQ in Greenpoint, Brooklyn on June 26th. This also includes the Deluxe Edition of The Last Survey. (Edition of 10) $200 � Your name will appear in a special dedication during the credits of The Last Survey. You'll also secure a deluxe version of the game and a ticket to the first performance. (Edition of 5) $450 � Receive a framed, signed, charcoal drawing (8x10 in unframed) from The Last Survey. This drawing is a unique animation cel that went into the production of the game. Backers will choose from five different cels on a first-come-first-serve basis. You'll also receive the early access to a deluxe version of the The Last Survey and a ticket to the first performance. (Edition of 5) I�m Nicholas O�Brien, and I�ve been making and researching experimental media and moving-image art for over a decade. My recent focus on games and 3D animation comes from a background in avant-garde cinema, critical theory, and DIY-organizing-curating. Recent projects of mine include a 5-channel video installation about Green infrastructure in NYC at the Knockdown Center in Queens, and a video game project about the sudden closure of a public transportation system shown at LiMA Art Platform in Amsterdam. Though this project pulls together many strands of my research, it�s a big a return for me to more traditional theater settings. I came into my own as an experimental filmmaker while still living in Chicago, and am eager to return to my artistic roots. Big Dog Little Dog is the mild-melding duo project of violinist/composer Jessie Montgomery and bassist/songwriter Eleonore Oppenheim. Their music has been described many ways, but perhaps the most apt so far has been �post-minimalist groove americana.� The pair use an improvisational composition technique that draws on many genres and their experience as native New Yorkers to create lush, cinematic soundscapes that are by turns sweeping and achingly intimate. I�m personally really excited about this project because Kickstarter�s network of creators and backers would not only bring my project to new audiences, but also help connect some of the cross-disciplinary dots that I�ve been tracing in my recent work. So many of my personal favorite projects have started on Kickstarter and I�m continually inspired by community supported art practices.

*Back by Friday June 21st (International Day of Yoga) and get a FREE new book - Ghosh Yoga Therapeutic Exercises! (You will receive this book in addition to the rest of your pledge rewards.) WHAT AND WHY: We know the stories about the men from India who taught yoga. What is still missing, as is often the case with history, are the stories of the women. Were there women practitioners and teachers? Yes! Have they mostly been forgotten? Yes! Is this about to change? Yes! This kickstarter officially launches research into the women of yoga and physical culture. WHAT YOU WILL GET: In 1955, yoga teacher and practitioner Labanya Palit of Kolkata, wrote and published Shariram Adyam, 11 years before Iyengar's Light On Yoga was released. Her book contains over 40 postures and instructions, an introduction from her teacher Bishnu Charan Ghosh, photographs and explanations of yoga asana practice.This book has been completely forgotten... until now. Get your copy by backing this project. You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00 But the release of the Labanya Palit's book is just the beginning... WHAT YOU ARE BACKING: Funds raised during this campaign will go to researching the Women of Yoga. There are more books, more stories, more lives that have been forgotten. If this campaign is successful, they will be remembered. Time will be spent researching these women and writing about their lives. A book will be published about their contributions to yoga. These women were yogis, strong women, circus performers, teachers and authors, yet they have been forgotten. If history had been written differently, they would be the ones we know and celebrate. It's time to remember them. Join me in telling their stories. Ida with the original weights of Bishnu Ghosh, courtesy of Romit Banerjee WHO: My name is Ida Jo and I'm a Yoga Acharya, head teacher of Ghosh Yoga and lifelong musician. I've spent the last many years teaching yoga around the world, as well as writing, editing and publishing books about yoga from the Bengal region of India. Ghosh Yoga Practice Manuals I work closely with Ghosh's Yoga College of Kolkata and help bring people from all over the world to India. These people have included yoga teachers, yoga enthusiasts, studio owners and members of my very own family. Several years ago, Scott Lamps, Jerome Armstrong and I started working on editing and publishing works from this yoga lineage. These included the lost manuscript of Buddha Bose from the 1930s and an out of print German book by Dr. Gouri Shankar Mukerji from the 1960s. All of us have become connected with the region, so much so that Jerome Armstrong researched and wrote Calcutta Yoga (recently picked up by MacMillan Publishing), which details the lives of Bishnu Ghosh, Buddha Bose and Paramahansa Yogananda. While editing this book, the idea was born... what about the stories of the women?! During a preliminary research trip in April 2019, I realized the scope of this project. It's big. There were so many important women, whose work and dedication furthered the progress of yoga. Jerome, Scott & Ida at Jerome's Book Release Party -- October 2018, Oxford Books, Kolkata

Trei and the producers love to explore encouraging themes of humanity via science fiction. This is a story of a young mixed-raced woman that needs to shed her insecurities in order to defeat the bigotry that dominates her persecuting surroundings. She finds that love for herself, her loved ones, and even her enemies, is the element of strength that can free them all. Trei is presenting this as his thesis film for the SCAD-Atlanta Film & Television MFA program. Throughout the years, this team's efforts in learning and helping fellow filmmakers have taught them how to create beautiful yet frugal, independent, award winning films. We will work with a talented cast we have worked with in the past, including child actors under all guidelines provided by SAG-AFTRA, SCAD, and the state of Georgia. Our LLC has created the film as its own entity and Trei has taught himself visual effects software to execute visual effects. The filmmakers plan on building set pieces, creating visual effects, sound design, and strong performances. Our budget will help us purchase the props and construction material. We will also pay on-site police officers and other specialist throughout the production. Producers will acquire proper licensing and permitting for our Atlanta street location. We will supply some of SCAD's brightest filmmakers with prime lens, rigs, and lighting kit rentals to increase the value the production already has from cooperation with the school. READ OUR PRODUCTION BOOKLET LOCATED IN WWW.TREIHILL.COM

Welcome to the PANGEA program, Thank you very much for supporting the Pangea project. The fact that you are here is certainly not a coincidence and you probably want to learn more about the great End-Permian extinction, a subject that has been unexplored, mystical and terrifying. At last, the time has come to face this mystery we still know so little about. Hopefully, this game will bring the Permian age and its tragic ending closer to you, because the design process was preceded by a long study of the history 252 million years ago, so as to most accurately portray the subject and terminology. Consider participation in this program a game in which you will be called a volunteer or a researcher. The Polish version of the game has been funded, and it was a great success. Thanks to Polish backers your copies will include Special Animal miniatures, also all Add-ons unlocked in the Polish campaign are available to you from the beginning. Hopefully the Kickstarter campaign will be dynamic and with your support your copies of the game (as well as Polish backers' copies) will have even more additional content. The KS campaign is going to be very short, only 14 days, still we are hoping that all stretch goals will be unlocked. It is also important for you to be aware the game is already complete and tested, which is why there will very particular stretch goals in the campaign. Even if all of them get unlocked, we are not going to add any new, half-baked ones that could unhinge the game balance, ruining months of our work. Our goal is to release a well-tested and good-looking product, not a ton of poor, unplayable add-ons. We hope you understand that. Remember that together we have an impact on the final appearance of the game and its content. You are welcome to comment. Official Poster What is Analog Rainbow? The Story Analog Rainbow is a sci-fi/drama short film that tells the story of Vivian, a woman overrun by her own nostalgia. Vivian has a fraught relationship with her overly-bearing mother and an obsession with her past, until she is given a mysterious pill by the illusive Analog Rainbow Corporation that allows her to relive her most cherished childhood memories. Although her trip into her past begins well, the experience begins to sour as she rediscovers repressed memories, family chaos, and trauma, learning that her past isn't as simple as she remembers. The film will explore themes of nostalgia and family through the lens of a mother and daughter's relationship through the years. Director's Statement I've made three films so far and I'm proud of every single one of them. However as I set my sails to start work on Analog Rainbow I knew this film had to be different. This script and this story is one that's so profoundly dear to my heart and unlike anything I've ever written before. Nostalgia has played such an important role in my life both positively and negatively and I knew that I wanted to explore this dynamic when I began writing the script for Analog Rainbow. Very quickly into the writing process I realized something important. The basis of nostalgia is the exact same response that causes us to want to scroll endlessly through Instagram and Twitter rather than initiate conversations and facilitate relationships with those around us. It's fear. Fear that our lives won't play out the way we want them to and that we'll wake up one day and realize that we don't like the people we've become. Our past can be a safe place; our memories, both good and bad, can act as a cushion for this fear because they're predictable. We know how the story ends every time. It�s a circular thought pattern that can be comforting but once you find yourself stuck in that pattern it can become a debilitating and blinding tendency. This film is about realizing that life is about learning from and appreciating our past, but also finding beauty in our present. The beauty in the simple things in our day-to-day that we overlook so often like a hug from someone we love, an inside joke that makes you laugh until your stomach hurts, or just long rambling conversations with good friends about nothing and everything all at once. These are the moments that are happening now and I hope to remind people through this film that the past, no matter how sweet, can never replace the present. The Team Henry Czerwonka - Director/Writer - WEBSITE Henry Czerwonka is an award-winning, 18-year-old filmmaker from Cincinnati, Ohio. Ever since he was 10 years old he's wanted to be a film director and that passion so far has blossomed into 3 award-winning short films and a handful of music videos. In 2015 he wrote and directed his first festival-circuit short film "After The Blitz" which was accepted into film festivals across the country and won Most Inspirational Film and the Mountain Lion Award at the 2016 Golden Lion Awards. In early 2017 he released his second widely promoted short film, "Seasonally Challenged." The film was once again met with festival acclaim nationwide and he won Best Director at the Stardance Youth Short Film Festival and Best Original Screenplay at the 2017 Golden Lion Awards. In July of 2018 he released his film, "Paper Chains" which was recently nominated for Best Student Film at the 2019 International Christian Film Festival in Orlando, Florida. Analog Rainbow will his 4th and most ambitious film. Audrey Schlembach - Producer Audrey Schlembach is a soon-to-be graduate of the University of Cincinnati. She is finishing out her senior year by writing, directing, and producing the short film "A Fair Deal", her directorial debut. Her experience ranges widely, from set design to live performance videography, but her passion is for producing. Recently, Audrey has worked as a producer on a TBA documentary short on aspiring Broadway stars, and "The Life and Lies of Teddy Buchanon", a comedy period piece about plumbing gone wrong. Caleb Smiley - Producer Caleb Smiley is a Writer/Director/Producer entering his last year of film school at the University of Cincinnati. His films include The Life and Lies of Teddy Buchanon (UCCAMS Best Short Film), Drainage (UCCAMS Best Editing), and Model Friendship (UCCAMS Best Writing). He is currently in post production on a number of projects including Ghost Sitcom and Murder Most Fowl, a noir crime drama centered on a bloodthirsty chicken. In addition to directing, writing, and producing, Caleb DPs on Short Films and Music Videos. He is excited to be a producer on Analog Rainbow! Luke Holliday - Director of Photography - REEL Luke Holliday is a 20-year-old student entering his third year of film school at the University of Cincinnati. Although Luke got his start in visual effects, he has been pursuing cinematography as a passion and a career. Luke has shot many projects in the last year, including The Life and Lies of Teddy Buchanan (UCCAMS best short film, best cinematography), Cautionary Tales music video (UCCAMS best music video), the promo you saw above on this page, and many more. Luke and Henry have been collaborating closely the past couple of months in preparation for Analog Rainbow. Garrett Satow - Editor - REEL Garrett Satow is an aspiring editor and filmmaker entering into his third year of film school at University of Cincinnati. Garrett�s role as an editor has stretched across many projects within the last year including The Life and Lies of Teddy Buchanon (UCCAMS Best Short Film), Approach (UCCAMS nominated Best Editing), and others. Garrett�s experience primarily comes from narrative-driven work, but he�s also had his hand at making music videos, motion graphics, and documentaries making for a wide combination of tools for storytelling. Garrett is thrilled to be brought on as an editor for Analog Rainbow! Mood and Visual Style Telling a good story is undoubtedly the single most important part in the making of a good film, but strong visuals with emotional resonance is a close second. For this film we will be exploring some very unconventional and exciting visual styles with a bold and colorful color palette that will capture the vibrancy of childhood but will also complement the grounded nature of the film and the characters. Mood Board Here are a few visual references that help to paint a picture of the mood and look of Analog Rainbow. Mood Board Concept Art Here are a few artist renditions of specific moments in the script of Analog Rainbow and how we hope to translate them to screen. (art by Anna Camerer) Vivian traveling through her past in what we're calling the "rainbow hyperspace tunnel". The Analog Rainbow family; one of many strange and unexpected things that Vivian encounters. Vivian encountering her younger self in what will be one of the most important scenes of the film. An idea of what the Analog Rainbow pill will look like. Where's the money going? A logical question no doubt. We will be spending the majority of our budget on honing in the exact visual style we want and renting the equipment necessary to achieve that as well as a decent amount going towards sound, post-production, and taking care of our hard-working cast and crew. Below you can see an exact breakdown of how we will be utilizing our funding. Project Timeline Pre-Production | June - August 2019 Production | 10 days in early to mid August. Post-Production | August 2019 - March 2020 Premiere | April 2020 We plan on submitting the film to festivals like Sundance, SXSW, Tribeca and Palm Springs ShortFest among others throughout the summer in time for the fall 2020 deadlines. Past Work Paper Chains - Directed & Written by Henry Czerwonka - 2018 Interlude (Music Video) - Directed by Henry Czerwonka and shot by Luke Holliday - 2019 Luke Holliday's Cinematography Reel - 2018 Come Out and Play Cover - Shot by Luke Holliday - 2019

My name is Elijah Haswell and I'm a queer transgender artist dedicated to accessible non-fiction storytelling, andPeople of Pride is my passion project over 2 years in the making. This campaign is to fund the publication and distribution of a 8.5x11" hardcover, 125-page, full-color illustrated book highlighting 50 LGBTQ Americans who changed the course of history including Hastiin Klah, Vito Russo, Dr. Pauli Murray, Brenda Howard, and many more. Front cover book mock-up I began Volume I of a free, virtually published series highlighting People of Pride during Pride month (June) 2018, and created Volume II in June 2019. During this time I created singular comics-style images every day to convey as much information about the individual as possible, and the response I received was far greater than I ever could've imagined. Parents, educators, and everyday Americans began regularly asking for the publication of a tangible People of Pride book for themselves and their children, and this Kickstarter campaign was born to facilitate its publication. Image of People of Pride Volume II, #3: Keith Haring Backing this campaign at several levels grants you access to the Kickstarter-exclusive coloring book PDF featuring 10 of the most popular People of Pride. Back cover mock-up People of Pride features 50 updated, redrawn illustrations of historic LGBTQ Americans drawn by Elijah Haswell. Illustration of Gilbert Baker updated from Volume I Illustration of Howard Ashman from Volume II Illustration of Lou Sullivan, updated from Volume I Each person's life is chronicled in a one-page, easily digestible story. Mock-up of page spread featuring the illustration & story of Leonard Matlovich Mock-up of page spread featuring the illustration & story of Marsha P. Johnson Book cover mock-ups 1. Kickstarter-exclusive Coloring Book PDF Back this campaign for $10 or more to receive the Kickstarter-exclusive coloring book PDF featuring 10 of the most popular People of Pride to color and share to your heart's content. 2. The Book Pledge $30 to receive your hardcover copy of People of Pride, or $35 to receive a copy signed by the creator. People of Pride will be an 8.5x11", 125-page, hardcover book packed with 50 stories & 50 full-page, full-color illustrations of extraordinary historic LGBTQ+ Americans. All backers who purchase a copy of the book will be recognized by name at the end of the book in the Kickstarter Hall of Fame!

We're bringing back the Justseeds Organizer! Thanks to popular demand, we're preparing a new edition of the Justseeds Organizer datebook for 2020. And we're hoping you'll be part of the process! Radical artists help us visualize the social changes that we deeply desire. They give form to our dreams, our ideas, and our hopes. They remind us not just of the struggle, but of the inspiration that leads people to work hard for a common cause. People of conscience everywhere are joining together to resist the cruel and destructive policies being enacted against women, people of color, immigrants, reproductive freedom, gender diversity, and even the earth that we all share. We do not have the option of standing aside and watching it happen. The 2020 Organizer will feature the socially engaged art of the Justseeds Artists� Cooperative in a durable, colorful format with ample space for keeping track of meetings, upcoming demos, appointments, schedules and notes. As usual, we're putting out both a pocket edition (3.5" x 5", 160 pages, $15) and a planner edition (5"x8", 112 pages, $18). The Justseeds Organizers are made with tough double-thick 130# covers and durable twin-loop wire, to withstand a year of vigorous use. This handy datebook also includes a moon phase calendar and a year-at-a-glance/month-at-a-glance calendars. Comp of the 2020 Organizer cover. (Art by Jess X. Snow) The 2020 Justseeds Organizer is the tenth one since the first edition in 2010. Regrettably, we couldn't print a 2019 edition of the Organizer because of funding problems. Eberhardt Press was thrown out of our shop by a developer, and our rent tripled, which blew our budget for the project. Production of the Organizers is a huge project (for us anyway), and the budget for materials, overhead and labor is quite substantial. We just couldn't swing it. But we got a really strong response from folx who shared our disappointment that we couldn't put out a 2019 edition. So, we started to mull over the possibility of a 2020 edition. There's certainly no shortage of excellent art from the cooperative, and we've published the Justseeds Organizer enough times to have streamlined the process. But we're a bunch of broke artists � where would the funding come from? That's where you come in. Want to reserve a copy? Pre-order, and we'll send a Justseeds Organizer fresh from the press. Your pre-orders will make or break this fundraiser. Or would you like to give the project a bump with a donation? You can get all sorts of cool stuff in return (see photos below). These donations help guarantee that we can fully fund the project. For the higher donation tiers, you can also get exclusive access to live broadcasts of the printing and bindery processes. You get to see us creating the Organizers as it happens. So, do you want to see a 2020 Justseeds Organizer come out? With your contribution, we can make it happen! The 2020 Justseeds Organizer features art by: Jesus Barraza � Melanie Cervantes � Thea Gahr � Aaron Hughes � Sanya Hyland � Nicolas Lampert � Fernando Mart� � Mazatl � Lesly Yobany Mendoza � Jesse Purcell � Pete Railand � Shaun Slifer � Jess X. Snow � Chip Thomas � Mary Tremonte � Bec Young ...and very very special thanks to the amazingly talented Marisa Anderson for letting us use her wonderful music in the video! Spread from the 2020 edition of the Organizer. The layout is basically done, we're in the proofing stage now. (Art by Pete Railand.) "Banderas Rojas� by Fernando Mart�. Art by Mary Tremonte. Art by Sanya Hyland. "Water is Life" bandana designed by Shaun Slifer. The Justseeds Coloring Book... Each month has an at-a-glance calendar and an open, uncluttered layout. About Justseeds Artists' Cooperative Justseeds is an international collaboration of creative individuals who believe in the transformative power of personal expression in concert with collective action. We produce collective portfolios, contribute graphics to grassroots struggles for justice, work collaboratively both in and outside the co-op, build large sculptural installations in galleries, and wheatpaste on the streets�all while offering each other daily support as allies and friends. Founded in 1998 by Josh MacPhee, Justseeds transformed into a worker-owned cooperative in 2007 � the original network being largely in place through past collaborations and friendships. We operate an online store and wholesale distribution center, as well as an active, multi-voice blog detailing current art and resistance projects around the world. For more information about Justseeds, see: Web site | Facebook | Instagram | Twitter About Eberhardt Press Each edition of the Organizer has been designed and printed at Eberhardt Press, a notorious and renowned community print shop and small publishing house in Portland, Oregon. Eberhardt Press was founded in 2005, and we've continuously published original work as well as printing hundreds of publications for diverse clients. Our books and zines focus on a range of topics such as reproductive freedom, anarcho-surrealism, literature and printing history. We also make and sell journals, notepads, cards and whatnot to help fund the operation. We print the Organizers on a 2-color offset press and bind them on a hand-operated machine. The Organizer is printed with multiple spot inks, just as the original prints were made, to produce bright, solid colors. You can see/read posts about our printing processes at our Instagram page � scroll down a ways to see photos of the 2018 Organizer. For more information about Eberhardt Press, see: Web site | Online Store | Facebook | Instagram

BANKSY: COMPLETED � a book by Carol Diehl The book: The first in-depth investigation into the hidden meaning and social, political, and artistic impact of the work of the world famous and anonymous street artist, Banksy. The author: Carol Diehl, artist and art critic, longtime contributor to Art in America and ARTnews. The publisher: The MIT Press of the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, Cambridge, MA. Kickstarter goals: The initial goal ($22,500) will cover Phases 1 and 2 of the project. Phase 1 will fund the writing of the second half of the book ($10,000), and Phase 2, the logistics and costs of acquiring photo permissions ($10,000+) and the required index ($2500). Anything beyond the initial goal will fund Phase 3: promotion: including a website, book tours and hopefully, hiring a publicist. Rewards: Book cost and publishing date are as yet unknown as well as final title and cover design. Aiming for late 2020. All reward books will be signed by the author. *** Why I�m writing this book: Street artist, vandal, political activist, and film director, the anonymous Banksy�s escapades are inevitably world news, yet he has not been acknowledged as the innovative and influential artist he is. While previous books have documented Banksy�s work with photographs, mine will be the first to deeply examine Banksy�s cultural significance. What sets Banksy apart from other street artists�or any artists�is that he�s a provocateur on a grand scale, a master at grasping the current political situation and mirroring it back succinctly and humorously, setting off waves of controversy that crosses international borders. Through his adept use of social media, Banksy connects with his fans as well as his adversaries, who often end up acting as his involuntary publicity agents�like Mayor Bloomberg, whose remarks about graffiti caused the New York Daily News to splash its front page with two words: �GET BANKSY!� The art world is always skeptical of artists who are overly popular with the public, especially those, like Banksy, whose work brings staggering sums at auction�and at first, I was one of them. However after frequent visits to England, where Banksy is considered something of a national treasure, and having my mind bent while watching his 2011 Academy Award-nominated film, �Exit Through the Gift Shop,� I began to suspect the public might have more insight into the elusive artist than the experts, whose reviews have been generally scornful and even uninformed. I determined to do the research my fellow art critics neglected, and the more I delved into Banksy�s seemingly flippant art and writings, the more substance I found�including philosophical underpinnings based in such diverse sources as Greek mythology and post-Holocaust political theory. The questions Banksy has raised over the last 20 years about the uses of public and private property, the role of the global �corporatocracy,� governmental incursions into privacy, the never-ending wars, and the gap between artworks as luxury goods and vehicles of social and individual expression, have become increasingly relevant, almost prescient. Yet while Banksy�s art is political, in the sense that it�s intended to inspire change, it is not bound to a particular ideology but exhibits a strong sense of inclusivity and humanism that crosses political and cultural boundaries. What�s inside: The book�s title, Banksy: Completed, was inspired by a painting Banksy did on the streets of New York, which depicted a dog peeing on a fire hydrant and a thought bubble floating from the hydrant that read, �You complete me.� In that way, Banksy�s pieces are like John Cage�s Happenings, which Cage said were intended to �catch a fish the nature of which we do not know� � the �fish� in this case, being the unpredictable events that unfold after the painting goes on the wall. Along with discussions of Banksy�s artistic origins and relevance, the book includes several chapters in the artist�s history starting with Banksy�s self-styled New York �residency� of 2013 where, every day for a month, he generated at least one public work somewhere in the five boroughs, turning the city into a giant scavenger hunt. Next, I look into the story precipitated by a single piece, Art Buff, Banksy�s unofficial entry in the 2014 Folkestone (U.K.) Triennial. Sited on a wall at the cross-section of greed and philanthropy, Art Buff caused a spin-off of intrigue, legal wrangling, gentrification, and art world commentary that continues today�with a surprise ending that shows that little in Banksy�s world happens by accident. Then I tour Banksy�s sprawling magnum opus, Dismaland where he fashioned a derelict amusement park in coastal England into a dystopian anti-Disneyland. Open for five weeks in 2015, Banksy�s 2.5 acre �family theme park unsuitable for children� was dedicated to the failure of capitalism, with concerts, film, miniature golf (or rather miniature �Gulf� with an appropriate oil spill), a whacked-out Cinderella�s castle, games that were impossible to win, a terrifying carousel, disgruntled park guides, vegetarian food stands, and an art gallery�in all featuring 10 of his works and that of 58 other artists from around the world. Dismaland drew150,000 visitors to the struggling town of Weston-super-Mare, boosting the local economy by �20 million. After it was over and Dismaland was broken down, Banksy went to Calais with lumber and a crew to build shelters for the refugees. Finally, I visit Banksy�s latest example of artistic activism, a fully functioning hotel in one of the world�s most conflicted areas. Touted as having �the worst view in the world,� it overlooks the West Bank barrier wall in Palestinian Bethlehem. Opened in 2017, the Walled Off (as opposed to Waldorf) Hotel features six guest rooms, a �Presidential Suite,� equipped with a hot tub, bar, and mini-theatre (�everything a corrupt head of state would need�), and a �Budget Barracks� dorm, outfitted with army surplus cots�all artist-designed and decorated. Facilities include a bookshop, a gallery devoted to Palestinian artists, and a museum that has become an ongoing repository for local stories, artifacts, and testimonies about the wall. Now regularly visited by tours coming to the holy sites, the Walled Off is fulfilling Banksy�s intention of attracting visitors to learn more about the conditions there, as well as bringing an economic revival to an area whose business was decimated by the building of the wall. Among the few house rules, �absolutely no fanaticism is allowed on the premises.� Why Kickstarter? Over the past four years my research has taken me from New York to England to the Middle East, funded through the generosity of friends who believe in this project. I�ve written the first half of the manuscript, and contracted with a distinguished publisher�The MIT Press�who will print and distribute the book to a general audience. Now that might make you think that the project is home free�that all I have to do is finish the book and be on to the next! However, authors today must take on many of the responsibilities and expenses publishing houses once covered. Except for a token monetary advance, I will see no income from the book until royalties are paid in June 2020. In fact, I�ve actually acquired costs. I must provide the index ($2500) and will be responsible for securing permissions for 70 photographs, which could cost $10,000 or more. I�ll need to cover minimal living expenses while I throw myself full time into writing the second half of the manuscript, and after that, will devote my time to promotion, including a website, blog, activity on social media, and travel for book talks. So, we know the book will be published. Now I just need to finish and promote it. That�s where you come in�to help complete the remaining phases and ensure that the book�s huge potential can be realized. This project is already a collaborative effort. Please join us and be among the first to see the finished book. Banksy: Completed can only be realized with your help. Three ways you can let others know about this project: Email your friends asking them to check out this Kickstarter page. Share this Kickstarter page on your Facebook wall or Twitter. Share or repost the promotional video, which you can find here. I�m grateful to those who have contributed their talents and funding, beyond anything I could have imagined, to bring this book to life�starting with Christopher Sweet, who has worked tirelessly to connect the book with the perfect publisher; Alex Ross, an artist with an inspired literary eye who has helped me shape it; John Spiak at the Grand Central Art Center in Santa Ana (CA), who gave me a place to work before I knew what the project was and arranged for the first lecture at CSU/Fullerton; former TIME Art Director Arthur Hochstein who designed the potential cover; the remarkable individuals who spontaneously offered to fund my trip to the Middle East; and others who have supported, in so many ways, the writing of the first half of the book. Special thanks to Caren Bayer, Carol Gingles, Margaret Heilbrun, Linda Hirshman, Lucy Holland, Susan Jennings, Seth Jordan, Barry Mayo, Susan Sultan, and Jim Torok. Thanks to E.S. for shooting and editing the Kickstarter video and Jackson Whalan for the background music. The footage from �Banksy Does New York� is courtesy of Matador Content.

Overnight at the hospital shadowing my Dad (Dr. George Gourley). What if I told you that the way to get over heartbreak is go to a meeting every day with a bunch of other people getting over the loves of their lives and talk about them for an hour and a half. You�d think I was insane. But that�s the boat we put our friends and family in who are struggling with addiction. 12-Step programs are the first thing most people encounter when they seek help with substance abuse. These programs say that the first step in overcoming an obstacle is to admit that you are powerless over that obstacle. This is false teaching. You are the most powerful person in the world over your own decisions. 12-Steps had me constantly looking backward, thinking about all of the crappy things I�d done in my life. Again, no other program tells a person that in order to progress they have to go back and fix all of the things they�ve done wrong. 12-Steps were created in 1935 at the height of the great depression and at the end of prohibition. Men all over the country were using alcohol as a means of escape from their harsh reality. 12-Steps were created in a time when people spanked their children and punishment was seen as a valid teaching method. We know that doesn�t work now and yet 85 years later we are still using the rotary phone of addiction recovery as our first line of defense. Whether 12-Steps or the rotary phone work today is irrelevant. If we can do better, we should. Our families and friends who are are seeking help deserve our best. When I finally HAD to overcome addiction, I threw away all of the crap I learned in 12-steps and started from scratch. I broke the problem down to its simplest form. I wasn�t doing what I should be doing. I realized that the only solution to this problem was to start doing what I should be doing. It hasn�t always been easy but it has stayed as simple as that. In my book Making Good Better, I outline the method I used to get back to living my life. I am now entering medical school and have my brain back. Addiction recovery deserves a new first impression built on action and hope. This is the cover art for the book. Making Good Better focuses on adding positives rather than removing negatives. It is empowering and improves quality of life from the first minute. It is forward looking. It is a proactive honest method for using relapse as a tool to get better. Above all it makes sustainable progression the key to increasing power and self-confidence. I am raising money finish my book, Making Good Better and prepare it for print. This book is very important to me. It tells the story of my journey of the past 10 years, from my first experience with substance use, to becoming a full blown addict, to finding my way back, and entering medical school. Heading to medical school. Please visit the website as well to get more information and preorder the book in various formats. https://www.makinggoodbetter.net/

Fey nobility, arcanist-bureaucrats, and anarchist witches falling for their enemies and getting into messy entanglements amid an undeclared war for control of a magepunk city newly inundated with magical energy. Based on the incredible Mobile Frame Zero: Firebrands by Vincent and Meguey Baker, Hearts of Magic: Threads Entangled is a game about the messy lives of fantasy mages in a City charged with magic. Tell the story of the people of The City as they fight, flirt, and steal time together amid a tense and escalating conflict. The witch Fyrestryke holds her wand, white-hot with Magic, pointed at the Auditor-Librarian. "Why have you come here?" Auditor Page looks down, embarrassed. "After I saw your face, I... had to meet you." The flash of Fyrestryke's magic dissipating hides the blush on her cheeks. Play as the Lords and Ladies, the fey noble families of the city, using the fey magic of promises, prophecies, and glamours; The Order, using the arcane techniques of ritual, patterns, and the careful and esoteric arrangement of mundane items; or The Witches, teaching The City to channel raw magic and weave powerful spells. a powerful and haughty Lord or Lady (with their loyal bug attendant) The Game The object of the game is to create messy entanglements. Fall in love with your enemies, ally with your rivals, fight with your friends. Players will create characters, establish their situations in solitaire scenes, and build scenes using the ten included games. Rules are lightweight and simple, and give you all the tools you need to establish and play scenes, even if improvising dialogue is not your strongest skill. Lady Thunderrose pushes the plate away from zinself. "I didn't come here to be teased, witch." "Not a tease. A serious invitation." "You know I could never leave House Facade." "With some help, you could," the Witch smiles. Thunderrose whispers, zir eyes flashing, "Only for you." Play as any kind of person you can imagine, in a fantasy city full of strange fae, visitors from distant lands and other planes, people of all shapes and genders and species. Choose a faction, three attractive qualities, a name, and tell us about yourself as you play. Character creation is quick and easy, and will get you playing in no time even for a player new to tabletops or story games. Hearts of Magic: Threads Entangled is made up of ten games: Solitaire - what were you doing? what have we heard about you? A Chase - do you have the nerve to pursue? A Conversation Over Food - at ease together, or a tense meal? A Dance - when the music ends, will I see you again? A Free-for-all - why do we fight, and what are the stakes? Meeting Sword to Sword - steel meets steel, gaze meets gaze - who will blink? An Oblique Discussion - how can I tell you the things I can not say? Stealing Time Together - alone, together, with a gentle "may I?" Weaving a Spell - how do the two of us make magic greater than either alone? A Wizard's Battle - can you resist the full strength of my powers? Hearts of Magic: Threads Entangled is a game for 3-5 players, with no materials necessary beyond a coin to flip, and intended for one-shot play with no prep and no GM. It's perfect for new players and veteran gamers alike, with infinite possibility to weave tangled webs of deceit, attraction, rivalry, and espionage. "It's true that magic can be dangerous", the Witch said to the noble Lady with a smile. "But so can cold steel." Lady Thistledown can sense the iron of the Witch's dagger against the bark of her chest. "If you had wanted to get so close", she laughed, "you need only have asked." a Witch reveals her true power The Book Featuring layout by Quinn Bleiler, editing by Kai Gee, interior art by Sasha Reneau, and cover art by Finn Carey, the Hearts of Magic book will be printed as a 5.5" x 8.5" booklet. At our initial goal of $5000, we will be able to print the book in B&W; at $10,000 we will be able to print color, with color interior illustrations. About Me I'm Erika Shepherd, a games designer and podcaster living and working in Vermont. I write sad gay games at fadingroots.itch.io. I Kickstarted my first book, Exodus, a game of trans angels on the run, for Zine Quest, funding in less than 24 hours and making over 1850% of my goal. My other games include Wreckage in the Ring, about post-apocalyptic teenage mecha deathmatch wrestling, and Divinity, about learning to love your body (when your body is an immense heavenly machine of war). Stretch Goals $5000 - GOAL! Physical printing, and art from Sasha Reneau! $7500 - International Shipping! It'll still be a little pricey from here, but once we hit $7500 I'll be able to afford to start shipping internationally! $10,000 - Color printing! All copies of the book will be in color, interior and exterior, at no extra cost to you! $12,500 - Date Night! An expansion of romance-themed games, and additional tools and guides for when you really just want to kiss a witch, take a librarian out for tea, or share a late-night call with a fae, without worrying about all those wizard battles and swordfights.

#MANAhat Our "Make America Normal Again" project evolved from a family discussion about how the current president has ignored and/or abused our norms and has debased the office of the president. We were trying to think of a way to protest his behavior and to show the "Red" hats around town that we have a message too and we came up with our "Make America Normal Again" hat. We are an extended family of Democrats who want to right the ship! We want to restore our democracy and return to our American values of decency, morality, and respect for truth. Our goal is to broadcast the message expressed on our hats to every community we can reach. We hope we can rally America to get back to a "Normal" way of life and politics and put the craziness behind us, or even better put it behind bars. We love our country. We are passionate about maintaining the rule of law and the democracy our founders entrusted to us. We hope you love our message as much as we do.... And be sure to check the comments to see how many haters we have! Bring it on! If you like this message, PLEASE SHARE!! * "Make America Normal Again" trademark is pending.

Being a devout LDS single man I realized how hard it is to meet a nice, well adjusted LDS woman. I didn't go to bars or try to pick up random women at the supermarket or most of the ways that men and women meet. I thought that there had to be a better way. I looked online and saw a few LDS dating sites and even tried them. They were boring and didn't work all that well. I thought to myself... I can do better. I've been a software engineer for over 35 years. I have the knowledge, tools and experience to create a truly great dating site! I started creating Deseret Singles but I am working full time and it's been hard to find the time to invest in the project. I believe I can make a impact in peoples lives. I can help bring them together!

So I received notice in October of 2015 that I was going to be laid off of my job of 21 years. At the young age of 50. Yikes!!! Luckily, two months before this information I had gone back to school to get a programming degree. The good news was that layoff wasn't going to happen until December of 2016. I thought had time to get my ducks in a row. After the layoff in March, I was completely freaking out because now I was 52 and unemployed. I was still in school and wouldn't have my degree until December. With all these younger techs looking for jobs, I was not feeling very positive about my chances of finding gainful employment back in the tech field. I kept trying to figure out an app to make or something creative I could come up with to make some money. Then I watched the movie Snowden and it scared the crap out of me!! I had dreams that night of being watched through my PC camera. During those days, I was sitting at my PC for 12+ hours a day programming and had no idea how vulnerable I was. My dream also came up with a solution, The Shudder. I woke up that morning and told my roommate about it. I thought of the name and slogan instantly: The Shudder and "It's Time To Shudder Up". The name is a play on the word shudder...the device is used like a camera shutter, but it also makes you shudder when you think of why you need to use it at all. The idea came to me instantly, but creating and patenting the idea, name and device took 2 years. I definitely didn't have money for a patent lawyer after losing my job. It took 2 years but I kept my invention quiet and saved up enough money for a patent lawyer. The Shudder is trademarked with patent pending and has been for almost 2 months. Now I desperately need money to produce, market, and sell The Shudder and that is why I am asking for your funding. Production won't be super expensive, but I need to get a decent inventory together to have lots of choices to offer customers pre-made. Marketing the device, creating and maintaining an online store will be where the greatest expense comes in to play. I have never had my own business and will definitely need an accountant to guide me through finances and taxes. I hope you share my vision and will help everyone feel more secure while using their end devices and support my project. Thank you.

ABOUT My name is Nick Yasi and I am currently pursuing a degree in cinematic arts. I am going into my senior year and the time has come for me to be more stressed and sleep deprived than the past three years, combined. It is time for me to create my senior film. Over the next year I will be putting in hundreds of hours of work, sitting through harsh critique sessions, and wanting to throw in the towel, all to create a short film that proves I am worth a piece of paper and a handshake. I know, I know, you're probably thinking "Nick, hundreds of hours worth of work? Is it even worth it? Why don't you just create some stereotypical Rom-Com in a coffee shop and call it a day?". Well I'm glad you asked. What I am trying to make will be more difficult than anything I have done before. My love for film, visual storytelling, and sharing stories with the world, is only a small part of what is required to take my idea from the page to the screen. Film isn't just about pointing the camera at someone and pressing record. It's not about creating something within your comfort zone just to avoid failure. Film is about stretching the boundaries. Not just in terms of the stories you tell but also stretching the boundaries of your abilities. With this project I am stepping out of my comfort zone. I am not trying to prove something but rather, I am trying to finally accomplish what I dreamed about as a child: creating something that pushes people to be more than they every thought they could be. As a child I remember being enamored with stories of heroes risking it all for something they believed in. As I grew up I knew that I have the same desire to influence people through film the way I was influenced growing up. Real life is never going to be like the movies so why not make movies? So please,"Join me and together we can rule the galax-" wait... Wrong movie... All right everyone back to one. Lets try this again. THE STORY Set in 1917, A young draftee is sent to the front line, taking part in a large scale assault that ends in disaster, leaving him blinded by gas and the only survivor. Hopeless, scared, and wanting nothing more than to return home, he throws down his weapons, ready to surrender. To his luck, an allied scout stumbles across the young soldier as he flees the German line. Although having just met, the scout makes it his mission to instill hope into the blinded soldier and bring him safely back to their lines; no matter the cost. Of course, this act is easier said than done. THE PROJECT I was always a "go big or go home" type of person and that trait hasn't gotten any better with time. This project stretches the boundaries of everything done before for a senior film. What this means is that without the help and dedication of fellow classmates, friends, teachers, family, and all of you, this project wont be able to be created. I am planning on starting production in July and using entire school year for post production. The most challenging part of this project is going to be creating the set from scratch as well as building a world around the story that is historically accurate and believable. THE TRAILER The video above is a concept trailer I created to help visualize the film. Now, what makes this trailer stand out is that originally, It was a project for one of my classes. In my directing class we had to create a short film without sound and dialog. I was planning on shooting a completely different story but my professor pushed me to take my WW1 idea and put it on the screen. If I'm being completely honest I was against the idea because of fear and lack of self confidence "How am I going to make my backyard look like WW1?!". But with hard work, dedication, and a fantastic team, we were able to create a no budget WW1 short film. On top of that, It was filmed in one night, in my backyard, on a set I built myself, costumed by a friend and myself, crewed by my friends and classmates, shot on my own equipment, and made on a ZERO dollar budget. Its not perfect or 100% accurate (Yet) but it still communicates the idea of the film. I say this not to brag but to prove that with your generous donations we will truly be able to create something that can go on to be incredibly influential. Here are some BTS photos: The Creative Team Cam Op - Marshall Hammer Marshall and I lining up a Glidecam shot. Emily Porter, HMU/Set dresser trying to make a $10 Halloween prop not look like crap. My amazing cast. (From left to right) Max Burak, Matt Jones, Taylor Slusher, Brandon Riddell Character Portrait: Max Burak as Pvt. John - AKA "The Blind Guy". Character Portrait: Taylor Slusher as Lt. Arthur. Character Portrait: Matt Jones as German officer (totally not wearing a WW2 camouflage) Character Portrait: Brandon Riddell as German soldier/G&E Swing (No thats not a German Wehrmacht uniform, why do you ask?) I wasn't legally allowed to shoot a flare at 2:00 AM. The Man, The Myth, The Legend. Cody was the Best 1st Team PA/Set photographer. Without him we wouldn't have any marketing material. The single greatest craft services. THE BUDGET I am trying to raise $6350 for the production $1000 - Equipment rentals. $1500 - Set design, Practical VFX $2500 - Props and costumes. $500 - Post-production and music licensing. $500 - production buffer, food, help with distribution of pledge rewards. $350 - Covers Kickstarter's 5%. A project of this scale is dependent on a budget and sadly, if the goal is not met I will not be able to create the film at this time. LEGAL INFO The trailer music was licensed through Audiomachine. A student SYNC LICENSE has been agreed upon and purchased for this project.
