It offers max. 45W Power Delivery (PD) to various types of laptops, notebooks and other mobile devices. It also integrates useful ports like HDMI, USB 3.0, SD/TF reader, Ethernet and wireless charging pad to connect all kinds of peripherals to your laptop. NoirHub covers all your needs while using your laptop for work and entertainment purposes. With NoirHub, there is no need to carry extra adapters to your device and the hub. It comes with an AC cable and a built-in adapter that can provide up to 45W power to your device while allowing you to connect all sorts of peripherals to your device. NoirHub also allows you to use it with an external adapter to boost the power delivery up to 65W. Make the most of being mobile with ports for everything. NoirHub features a standard 100-240V/1.4A AC input which enables you to remove the original AC charging cable and switch to another one with a compliant plug when you travel to another country. NoirHub makes your mobile a mini-desktop computer, so you can edit documents, send emails and transfer files with ease. Stream 4K UHD video to the big screen without worrying about power drain - NoirHub keeps your devices charged while your audience stays entertained. Lose the laptop - now you can give powerful presentations straight from your phone on a monitor or projector by connecting it to NoirHub�s HDMI port. Instantly share photos and files between your devices with two USB 3.0 and three USB 2.0 ports. Move an HD movie in seconds with USB 3.0. NoirHub�s Gigabit Ethernet port keeps you connected so you enjoy greater speed and stability. NoirHub is both SD and TF card friendly. Copy, move and delete tons of images, videos and other files in moments. We aim to solve those neglected details and helps more and more people achieve the best user experience. Apart from focusing on highly precise technology, the team also pay great attention to stylish design and products with extremely exquisite craftsmanship. We do small things, but we do them perfectly. Make your life easier. This project is promoted by Jellop, the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarters with 650+ successful Kickstarter projects with over $300MM raised between them.

You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00 Join us in celebrating and fundraising for Huneebee Project and our extraordinary youth beekeepers in residence! Huneebee Project provides job-skill building within a therapeutic context, as well as active honey bee hives and pollinator-friendly green spaces to vacant lots and gardens in New Haven, Connecticut. All proceeds directly support program development and employment opportunities for youth with foster care or child protective involvement. Our beekeepers in residence are youth ages 15-23 from New Haven county with diverse interests and identities and backgrounds. They contribute to the installation and maintenance of honey bee colonies as well as the planting of pollinator-friendly green spaces. At the same time, clinical social workers and mentors support our youth beekeepers in identifying transferrable job skills, resume development, and building body and emotional awareness through mindfulness practices. To date, we have graduated our first cohort of 5 youth beekeepers in residence, employed 3 as peer instructors and garden site managers, and inaugurated a second cohort of 5 youth beekeepers in residence! This could NOT be possible without YOU and everyone who has shown up to be a champion for our youth, under-resourced communities, and honeybee friends. We need YOU - your encouragement, support, and bee-lief - to help us make our launch in July 2019 official in becoming a self-sustaining social enterprise. We want to show that we can all serve together and prove to this world that WE ALL can in fact power and drive SO MUCH GOOD. Our beekeepers in residence are fierce and courageous and funny. Artistic and handy and gentle. Talented and determined and ready to share it all with our communities! What's next for Huneebee Project? In time, income generated through our online retail shop and community market places will fund programming, employment of peer instructors and graduates, and beekeepers in residence stipends. Our online retail shop will offer locally harvested honey from the colonies we maintain (through sustainable and natural beekeeping methods), candles constructed from beeswax harvested from the extra honey frame cappings, gardening tools and supplies, and local vases and pottery. For more on who we are and what we do: Huneebee Project involves youth between the ages of 15-23 with foster care involvement, child protective involvement, and/or developmental trauma histories in 4-month-long therapeutic Beekeepers in Residence job-skills training programs. The Project partners with the New Haven Land Trust and adds honey bee hives and pollinator friendly green spaces to community gardens or vacant lots in under-resourced neighborhoods in New Haven, Connecticut. At each garden site or vacant lot, participants experience workshops on sustainable beekeeping practices. Youth beekeepers in residence build, paint, and install honey bee hives, monitor food levels, and address issues of pest control using natural methods. Each participant graduates the program with an increased capacity for relationship building, increased sense of self efficacy and empowerment, an understanding of the role of the honey bee in nature and the many benefits of pollinators, and a completed resume. In addition to the opportunities made available to program participants, communities in which the gardens or lots live are invited to take part in various seminars and workshops hosted at the garden sites. Some examples of offered seminars and workshops include: beekeeping demonstrations, honey tasting, building bee hotels for wild & solitary bees, and talks on medicinal, pollinator-friendly plants and herbs. In addition to empowering and supporting our youth, Huneebee Project seeks to foster community building, collaboration, and kinship. Our vision: We envision a world that leverages the power of relationships and self-worth to increase resiliency and healthy human development. We believe there is no better way to do this than a social enterprise that facilitates kinship, mutuality with nature, mentorship, future oriented conversations, and development of valuable, soft skills. We want to increase collaboration amongst community members in achieving shared goals and visions for our youth, and to do so in a way that supports our environment, nature, and the bees. There are no "beneficiaries": we all serve together and we all benefit together. The team: Huneebee Project is led by a team of 3 beekeepers, 1 photographer, 2 peer instructors, and 4 clinical social workers. The project collaborates with multiple community partners, including the Yale Child Study Center, New Haven Land Trust, Connecticut Agricultural Experiment Station, and Community Placemaking Engagement Network. Our volunteers and partners have experience addressing mental health needs of children and young adults, promoting social justice, and promoting sustainable, natural beekeeping practices and education on pollination to address the declining population of honey bees. Additional opportunities for program graduates: We hire Beekeepers in Residence graduates to fill a multitude of integral roles, including garden site managers and peer instructors! Employed graduates continue to receive supportive, on the job training, contribute to programming decision making, participate in community bee panels and awareness raising initiatives, harvest honey, craft beeswax products, and contribute to a welcoming, safe space for new participants. *Please, join us, support us, grow with us, and bee-come a part of our huneebee family!*

(GEEK speak... if you don't want to read a bunch of tech stuff, scroll on down.) So I'm an engineer and I decided enough is enough. If I was ever going to have my Dream Torch, I was going to have to design it and build it myself, so I started with a list of design criteria. So it had to: have a built in spark igniter, for safety and convenience. CHECK! be really hot to get the charcoal going super fast, 400,000+ BTU. CHECK! be more efficient than other high power torches. CHECK! run on small portable propane bottles for portability. CHECK! attach to economical 20lb propane tanks for stationary use. CHECK! completely consume its fuel and produce an entirely blue flame. CHECK! be made of high-quality materials and last a long time. CHECK! be easy and intuitive to operate. CHECK! be able to be used safely. CHECK! (See "Safety" section below) be fun and able to be used spontaneously when friends dropped by. CHECK! look really cool, so that friends would see it and want one too. CHECK! This was a tall order, but the resulting GrillGun hits every one of these marks. Consequently is the only torch of its kind. Nothing else out there has all these design elements. It's an amazing tool that you'll want on your birthday list, Father's Day list, Graduation list, Christmas list.. It's truly a "Best in Class" torch. Watch me light the grill, cook hamburgers and put out the charcoal in under 8 minutes. It's worth it just to hear it roar and see it in action and in real time. Fun, Time, Taste, Health and Happiness Oh Happy Day Fun - It's hard to describe how fun it is to operate a GrillGun and use it to start all types of fires. It is lightweight, comfortable to hold and easy to use, plus it looks and sounds like a jet airplane. Time - Now you can wait for your friends to arrive before you start the grill, because whenever you want dinner, you just start the grill and your cooking in minutes instead of half an hour or more. Taste and Health - The output from the GrillGun is fully consumed propane gas, in other words, pure fire, pure heat, no hydrocarbon contamination from any petrochemicals poured onto your charcoal or emitted from your gas grill burners. This makes for the best tasting, most healthy, most beneficial hardwood charcoal grilling available. Happiness - Happiness comes from true friendships. The GrillGun facilitates friendships on a multitude of levels -- visiting with friends on the porch while the grill is sizzling and the kids are playing, camping at the lake with your children and grand-children, tailgating with college friends before the big game, the romantic dinner for two under the moon-lit night sky, it just makes you feel good. The GrillGun is a very powerful torch. For safe operation, follow these simple rules: The Grill Gun can potentially burn anything up to 5 feet from its fire bell (flame end) when it is lit and fully operating. Always be responsible to allow plenty of space around you and the GrillGun when using it. Always use the GrillGun outdoors in a well-ventilated area. The Su-V Gun can be used indoors, but with careful attention to ensuring the gas is shut off completely when not in use searing meat, and that you're not using it on or near any flammable surfaces. The fire bell will get very hot within moments of use. Allow plenty of time for the fire bell to cool down before touching it or laying it down on a melt-able or flammable surface. The GrillGun is sold with a stand and a hanging ring so it can either be stood up or hung in an upright position to cool. If children are present when the GrillGun is cooling after use, disconnect the propane and hang the GrillGun out of reach to prevent accidental burns or mishandling by the curious. Always teach someone how to properly operate a GrillGun before allowing them to handle it. Only allow someone to use it, if they respect its power and will operate it safely. As with any powerful tool, keep the GrillGun and its propane bottles safely stored out of reach of children and other untrained, unwise people. When the GrillGun is not in use, it is always safest to separate the GrillGun from the propane. HOW WOULD YOU FEEL IF YOU ACHIEVED ALL THE GOALS YOU SET OUT TO ACCOMPLISH IN 2019? A personal planner built to scientifically track your goals, habits, tasks, and more with ease. *Note, spiral ring will differ from pictures. See pictures below with single ring spiral. *** Great news! We will be adding 1 new hardcover design, 1 solid color hardcover version, and 1 cloth version of the PU style! You guys asked for it so I made it happen! *** BOSS Personal Planner Cover Design Options It's safe to say you want to be more successful. You want to get more done and crush your goals, it makes you feel more accomplished, right? It can be hard though, sometimes very hard. You try things and they don't work. You spend good money on planners you hardly use because they aren't helpful. Sound about right? Not only that, most planners are not built specifically to make you more successful. Most are built as a reflection tool. That's what I experienced, and I got tired of it. The BOSS Personal Planner Compact version features a high quality printed hardcover. More designs can be added if we hit stretch goals. *Note, spiral ring will differ from pictures. See pictures below with single ring spiral. I set out to finally solve this problem. What will motivate you more than anything is the awesome feeling of crushing your goals. That will be by far the best motivation. Let me tell you more about my solution. Full 2 page spread for you daily plan which includes a lot of blank space for notes or your own custom sections. *Note, spiral ring will differ from pictures. See pictures below with single ring spiral. You'll hear it over and over when trying to learn to be more productive, "If you want to get things done, write it down." Announcing a premium personal planner built for people who want to get shit done and crush their goals. The BOSS Personal Planner comes in 4 variations. You can pick from the larger "Ultimate" size or the smaller "Compact" version. *Note, spiral ring will differ from pictures. See pictures below with single ring spiral. Whether you're an entrepreneur, business professional, student, mom, or someone with goals... this planner will help you succeed. For people who want to create a simple and straight-forward plan to success. It's for those who seek improvement in their lives, professionally or personally. This is a planner that works. Introducing the BOSS Personal Planner. *Note, spiral ring will differ from pictures. See pictures below with single ring spiral. The BOSS Personal Planner was built for success. If that is what you're looking for, you're going to love it. It took lots of testing and trial and error to figure out what would help achieve success from a personal planner. Being busy is easy. Being productive is hard. Broken down into sections so you can plan each phase of your life. This makes it very easy to stay organized. *Note, spiral ring will differ from pictures. See pictures below with single ring spiral. I struggled to be efficient and productive. Sure, when you looked day-to-day I was doing a lot, but it didn't get me close to my goals fast enough. I looked for a solution and while other planners helped, they didn't solve the problem. I started using my own note sheets setup as a planner. I created a big picture view and figured out what I wanted to accomplish in the long term. Then I broke it down further and created a road map to get there. After using my system for a few weeks I noticed I was making awesome progress for once. I was actually getting closer to my goals faster than ever. When you think about it, why hasn't anyone made a planner like this before? They all claim to be a "system" but when you use them, they really aren't. BOSS Personal Planner Compact in use. *Note, spiral ring will differ from pictures. See pictures below with single ring spiral. Let's take a look at some of the benefits that makes it so great. 1 notebook for everything - No need for a planner & notebook. This planner has extra room for notes every day. Get focused - Set clear goals every day that align with the bigger picture you planned. Declutter - write things down and empty your mind. Stay positive - Daily affirmation to get you going. Accomplish more - Using a straght-forward plan to accomplish more in less time, maximizing efficiency. Manage your time - Set goals and tasks that you can fit into your schedule. 10,000ft view - If you don't plan long term goals, you're just going to spin your wheels and ultimately get nowhere. The first step is to plan the big picture. Challenge yourself - Set goals that will push you harder, back them up with nice rewards to add motivation. Self improvement - You'll develop better work habits, create routines, avoid procrastination, and many other benefits. Priority to-do list - break down your days, weeks, and months with to-do lists so you can prioritize your tasks and goals. BOSS Personal Planner *The final versions will have the single style spiral instead of the dual band in some photos. 2 page daily view with large section for notes, goal setting, rewards, exercise routine, affirmation, daily focus point, and hourly schedule. Built in pen holder and elastic strap to keep the planner closed or save your page. Back pocket for extra storage or post-its, notes, or loose sheets of paper. BOSS Personal Planner Plan for Success, reading list (A4 version), and habit tracker BOSS Personal Planner Eisenhower matrix BOSS Personal Planner monthly view BOSS Personal Planner priority planning BOSS Personal Planner weekly breakdown BOSS Personal Planner weekly view BOSS Personal Planner daily view BOSS Personal Planner dotted note pages BOSS Personal Planner hardcover size BOSS Personal Planner PU leather size comparison See below for examples of each version. BOSS Personal Planner Compact versions - PU leather and hardcover spiral BOSS Personal Planner Ultimate versions - PU leather and hardcover spiral I'd love to give you guys more so I've set up a couple of stretch goals. If we hit $20,000 in funding, I will add 2 additional A5 covers for each style. So 2 more PU colors and 2 more hardcover designs. We'll be asking you to vote on the colors and designs if we hit the goal. If we raise $35,000, we'll add 2 additional A4 covers for each style. So again, 2 more PU colors and 2 more hardcovers. You'll be voting on which designs are picked at the end. Below are some of the options that will be offered. Help us reach the stretch goals by backing the BOSS Personal Planner now! BOSS Personal Planner stretch goal cover designs Most of the money will be going to fulfilling orders and acquiring inventory. I have already used my own money up to this point to get samples tested, build prototypes and start marketing. I've bootstrapped what I can and funded everything on my own with my personal savings. I have some of the money for the initial order but I'm looking to raise the rest. Some of the money will be put into the website and support structure. I've completely designed the website and everything on my own so far. Also, I want to add better customer support channels to better serve all customers. If the campaign receives enough pledges, I will use some of the money to add more designs and color options. Currently, both versions will be offered in 1 variation. You can see the stretch goals above. BOSS Personal Planner Compact versions with box BOSS Personal Planner box BOSS Personal Planner family The design and build process has been long and challenging. I have created dozens of page variations with constant edits. My goal was to create a personal planner that was fully usable. I was tired of planners I spent a lot of money on only to use bits and pieces or need another notebook with it. I also wanted the planner to make sense. It is a 3 month planner that is used as a system. It's not just paper to write things down. It makes planning and executing goals easier. Figuring out the 10,000 foot view helps you put together a 10x better ground plan. Better planning = getting more done. To figure out your small, daily, goals, you have to have your long term goals and plan figured out. This might change but if you just figure out small goals, you'll find time passes and you didn't really make a lot of progress. BOSS Personal Planner early mockups BOSS Personal Planner early designs BOSS Personal Planner early designs BOSS Personal Planner early design BOSS Personal Planner early designs All design work for BOSS Personal Planner (only printed versions) Shipping should happen quickly. I've spent a lot of time planning this out and getting everything in order so I can fulfill pledges and orders asap. I will quickly send out surveys and hopefully everyone is able to get them back pretty quick. Then I will put the order in with the manufacturer right away. From then, based on what I have talked about with my manufacturer, it will take about 6 to 8 weeks for me to get the first bulk order of planners (includes print and shipping time). Unless I have overwhelming success and tens of thousands of backers, I will be able to ship all planners within a couple of weeks. If I have to, I will hire some helps as well depending on the number of backers I receive. This is my full time gig right now so I can spend 14+ hours a day packing and shipping. Once shipped, US orders should only take a few days to a week for you to receive. You'll get a tracking number as soon as it is shipped. Shipping has been a huge mountain to climb. Shipping prices have seemed to get quite expensive over the years. Being based out of San Antonio, TX, I wanted to make sure I covered shipping around the world. I estimate it will cost about $8 to ship within the US via flat rate priority mail for the small planner. The larger planners will be about $11 on average. For domestic US backers, there will be no need for any additional charge for shipping, it's fully covered in the reward price. For international backers, the shipping price has been subsidized and you will only be charged the additional amount. I've estimated it best I could for different regions of the world. I hope you understand the reasoning behind the shipping charge. ***A little note for all international backers I do not want to charge you an arm and a leg to ship this, I really don't and it bothers me that for this Kickstarter I have to charge the prices that I do. I promise you, I did a lot of homework to find the cheapest rates and at this point, this is the best I can do. It is my goal to partner with a great 3rd party logistics company in the future so I can better serve you and get you an appropriate shipping rate. So, I hope you understand this and still want to back the BOSS Personal Planner. Thank you. If you'd like to get a FREE copy of the BOSS Personal Planner PDF and cannot financially contribute, all you have to do is share the Kickstarter project with your friends and email me a screenshot at support@bosspersonalplanner.com and I will add you to the list of people to receive the PDF version. If you want to stay updated, make sure you keep an eye out in your email and on the update page here. You can also stay updated via our Facebook, Instagram and Twitter where we post more frequent and smaller updates.

My name is Jasmine. Art is one of my main hobbies. Whether I'm using watercolor, digital software, prismacolors, or just pencil--I always enjoyed drawing to my heart's content. I wanted to be able to share my work with the world, and hopefully someday my art makes someone just as happy as it does for me. So I opened my official artshop, Umbra Skies as of 2017! I chose this name because everyday, the starry night sky is always so awe inspiring. Its always reminding me that stars can't shine without darkness. Logo

In June of 2019, Trade Winds Ensemble will partner with the Ruth Ellis Center (a short and long-term residential safe space providing support services for homeless and at-risk LGBTQ youth) to provide workshops centered around creativity, wellness, and self-expression. Beyond our work at Ruth Ellis, TWE will share space together (a rare opportunity for us) planning our 2020 project and working toward our long-term goals. Mural at the Ruth Ellis Center in Detroit, MI When researching organizations in the Detroit metro area, we were so inspired by Ruth Ellis Center's mission. REC�s diverse SOGIE (Sexual Orientation, Gender Identity or Expression) youth often attend schools which may not understand the unique needs and development of social skills associated with their background and experience. The amazing volunteer team at REC is committed to immersing their children and youth in workshops and activities which focus on skills that aren�t traditionally taught in school. Trade Winds will use music, dance, and other non-traditional methods to teach REC�s residents, largely diverse SOGIE foster youth, focusing on problem solving, future planning, breaking down big tasks into small steps, and instilling confidence.

The Rose Valley Thorns need your help realizing the huge project that is album production and release. We want to create the best possible product for our fans, ourselves, and our future, and that requires high-quality studio time, mixing and mastering, merchandise, and promotion. Not to mention loads of time, practice, and dedication! All of these things are within our grasp and we are certainly putting forth the time, practice, and dedication. With the help of your contributions everything else will come! Upon the release of this album we will also be heading out on tour, so you can also help keep gas in the tour van and get us to our shows :) We are a band dedicated to making authentic music and this album and tour will represent a genuine artistic expression, a truly valuable thing, and we are elated to be able to share it with you. We also feel that his project stands as an accomplishment for musicians with disability, as these recordings stand as a triumph over Muscular Dystrophy, a disease that Joshua battles and overcomes on a daily basis. It shows our ability as humans to persevere over adversity, take something constructive from awful situations, and create something beautiful. Photo Credit: Brendan Willing James The Rose Valley Thorns, with their youthful energy and eclectic musical influences, are pushing forward on the front of progressive bluegrass and modern folk while paying homage to the old legends of classic genres. The stunningly beautiful Rose Valley lies in the mountains above the creative community of Ojai, California, a place which has inspired and nurtured the individual and collective artists that The Rose Valley Thorns have become. With aspects of jazz, ragtime, classical, rock, folk, country, and most importantly bluegrass, the Thorns have created a sound that is truly unique and refreshing. Photo Credit: Brendan James Willing The Rose Valley Thorns� love for authentic music and performance is reflected in their relatable songwriting. Touching on subjects from struggles with worldwide social issues to Joshua�s own battle with Muscular Dystrophy, The Rose Valley Thorns create a truly genuine artistic expression. They perform around a single mic, traditional style, and pour their hearts out through their instruments and voices with a conviction and authenticity that captivates their audiences. The Thorns care about nothing more than making music for people who want to hear it. Photo Credit: Brendan James Willing Thank you for being a part of our musical journey!

After two years, an Ameripolitan Award, 140,000 miles, being named "Vocal Group Of The Year" by the Arkansas Country Music Awards, 40 days and nights in the studio, and touring consistently from California to Tennessee... The Reeves Brothers are back with their latest album "The Last Honky-Tonk"! Hi friends and fans, over the course of the past three years we've had a wild ride. We've done over 600 live shows, won Ameripolitan "Honky-Tonk Group Of The Year", Arkansas Country Music Awards' "Vocal Group Of The Year", and have recorded three albums (two of which you've heard). We've always found a way to fund our projects. This is the first time, we're asking you, the fans, for help. We believe in this album, more than anything we've ever recorded, and need help with funding to get it pressed and promoted. Be sure to check out the rewards section to see what we have to offer you for your contribution. New Album on CD New Album on Vinyl T-Shirts Trucker Hats Leather Belt Buckle Live Shows And more!!! Accepting The ACMA "Vocal Group Of The Year" After our win at The Ameripolitan Awards, we met a gentleman named Kevin Skrla. Kevin was good friends with Celine Lee and Dale Watson, and after crossing paths with him multiple times, on the road, he called and asked if we'd like to record a couple songs at his studio "Wolfe Island", in Dayton,TX. We didn't know that he owned a studio, and when we pulled in, it was a dream come true! Wolfe Island Recording Co. The Studio Kevin had took his favorite things about "Sun Records", "RCA Studio B", and "Stax" and merged them to build Wolfe Island. With our heroes cutting a ton of their hits, at these places, Wolfe Island was the perfect place for us. This was the first time we got to eat, sleep, and live at a studio week after week. Writing material there, and getting to piece it together like they'd do in the old days! Not being rushed, and being able to cut into the early hours of the morning. After we had laid all the tracks down, Kevin called up a friend of his named Bubba. Bubba is the owner of legendary SugarHill Recording Studio. This is the very studio George Jones had recorded the original version of Why Baby, Why, Freddy Fender recorded every hit he ever had there, and the Big Bopper's Chantilly Lace was sung on tape inside this historic building. Kevin got Bubba to let us come down and record all of our vocals there, on the same gear so many of our heroes had performed on. Laying Vocals At Sugarhill Studios The Material If you're familiar with our group, you know we have a lot of 70's influence. For this album we wanted to dive deeper into the music we love. Although the album is packed full of 70's style country, we also drew inspiration from the 60's Merle Haggard albums, and the early 80's tracks of Alabama. We wrote 9 out of the 12 songs on the record, and the other three tunes were written by friends ours Shawn Ohler, Gene Price, and Ray Willis. "The Last Honky-Tonk" is a journey through the Honky-Tonk Country Music we grew up listening to, and love! Where Does All The Money Go This is our third album, so we're very aware of the financing it takes to release an album. Right now, we have 450 hours of studio time involved, and 8 trips from Vegas to Houston, that we've personally covered the expenses for. We've been planning for months all the places the money will go to. Here's a list of expenses. Mastering $3,500 Artwork $1,000 Vinyl Pressing $2,500 CD Manufacturing $1,450 Radio Promo Campaign $3,200 Publicist $10,000 Grand Total: $21,650 The Musicians We were so fortunate to have an incredible group of musicians that played on this album. Kevin Skrla We'll start with Kevin Skrla... Not only did Kevin produce this album, he drummed on different tracks, played guitar, piano, pedal steel, organ, bass, and several other things. He also makes the best coffee, this side of the Mason Dixon Line. Kelly Bishop Kelly Bishop has been with our group from the very beginning. He has his roots in Gospel, but loved raising hell! He grew up on a Silver Eagle, as a kid before leaving the South, to come out West! Kelly's laying down the majority of bass parts, you'll hear, on this album. Caleb Melo Caleb Melo is a multi-talented musician. Coming from Porterville, CA, he grew up listening to the Country Music sounds that made Southern California famous! Primarily playing the pedal steel guitar, on this album... he also plays guitar, dobro, and sings some background vocals. Eugene Moles Eugene Moles has been playing guitar since he started walking. Guitarist for Merle Haggard, Hee Haw, Rose Maddox, Hank Thompson, Del Reeves, and The Grand Ole' Opry! Eugene's guitar playing is featured on No. 7 Blues. Norm Hamlet Norm Hamlet played for Merle Haggard from the 1960's until Haggard passed away. We were very honored to have him lay some pedal steel down on this album. Mario Carboni Our friend, Mario Carboni called us up one night, while we were in the studio. He had heard a song we were recording "It Gets Cold At Night In California", and wanted to lay down a piano track for it. We were so honored as Mario is one of the greatest Honky-Tonk Piano players in America, right now! International Backer Bonus: Every international backer who purchases a physical item priced at $25 or more, that requires additional funds for shipping will receive the following BONUS ITEMS as part of their reward bundle! Rare demo recordings of all original songs Custom Reeves Brothers pin Custom Reeves Brother sticker

Breaking Order was the book of my heart-- something talking about the importance of the arts in society in a Dystopian context and how teens needed to have the right to dream. The story of the first book follows a fourteen-year-old girl named Calista as she becomes curious of the dreams, magic, and creativity that's outlawed in her corrupt society (The Regime) and punishable by death. When she meets an artist named Wes, she gives art a try, loves it, and is then forced to keep it a secret from her father-- Head Executioner of The Regime. It's a story of emotional growth which then explodes into an adventure-like series that focuses on a group of teens, rather than just Calista, several of which have magical abilities as well as artistic views. I first published the novel in high school to raise money for my high school's arts departments. It was on a rushed time table my senior year, and now, I'm finding a lot of errors and problems within it. I was pretty young (17) to the self publishing industry then, and rather than taking down the book, I want to make it better for more people to get to read it.If this gets funded, I intend to revise Breaking Order to have multiple POVs and hire an editor for it to help the story really shine. I also intend to publish it in a variety of formats, including hardcover, ebook, and paperback. If I overpass my goal, I'd love to get a map or maybe some more exclusive artwork to be included in book as I love supporting artists with my work. I want my stories to be out there so I can express myself and share stories with teens that might be going through a rough patch right now. Maybe they don't know what they want to do, or maybe they have an artistic goal they love but people don't approve of. I want Breaking Order to encourage them to follow what they believe despite what some think and to break out and not be afraid to show their artistic shell. Thank you so much for the help you're providing for this. I appreciate it so much, and remember, Dare to Dream. - Catherine Kopf, 19-year-old author of the Breaking Order series.

As anyone who has non-verbal children on the spectrum will tell you, one of the hardest things in the world to do is to see the frustration on your child's face as they try to communicate with you. The fits can be down-right frightening because they are unable to request their basic needs. I have been personally witnessing this every day for the past few years, as I am the father of a non-verbal child. That's where my communication app suite will come into play. I'm not going to pretend communication apps don't exist. They most certainly do. They are, however, quite costly. Most of them run on the concept that insurance companies and school districts will pay for them for the students, but, the problem with that is, not everyone is lucky enough to be in those school districts or have insurance plans that will supply their kids with the software and hardware. Most of these applications cost hundreds once you actually unlock all the functionality. My goal is to change all that. There is absolutely no reason why these applications cost that much other than pure greed. Trying to get rich off other peoples misfortune. My goal is to put an app suite on the market for all major mobile platforms as low priced as possible, so that any family who needs it can afford it. No worrying about if their deductible has been hit yet. No worry about if the school can supply them with it. The primary code is already in place, the only problem is, I lack the extra funds to buy the test platforms in order to begin work on the user interface. That's what this kick-starter is for, to buy as many tablets of various resolutions and sizes as I can, so that I can get this application up and running and get the first beta out. The application itself is a digital replacement of the widely successful PEC program, that has been used for ASD children for quite awhile. The PEC program is a series of cards with pictures on them placed in a binder. When the person needs something, they take the card out, and they give it to their care giver/parent/teacher. We're removing the cards and instead using buttons on a tablet with the phrases handled by text to speech, and images you save to the device can be mapped to each of the buttons. If we hit our goal, I will begin ordering the test platforms. If we exceed the goal, then I will put that money towards any further development costs beyond that. The test platforms themselves will be tablets of varying sizes and resolutions, so that we can have non-verbal children attempt to use the application and verify the user interface will be workable for them. This isn't something that can be done using emulators like most developers would do, this has to be done on physical hardware platforms. This code is backwards compatible all the way to android 2.3. https://www.facebook.com/The-Voice-of-Autism-1947572548869463/ is the Facebook page for the project. Please note: The video here is to prove the underlying code works. The user interface is on hold until test platforms are in hand so I can make sure a child with ASD will not have issues using it. The program can say any phrase you need it to, and you can use any image you place on your device. I personally advise taking pictures, so the user sees things they personally recognize. If you have any questions or comments, feel free to message me directly. Thank you for your time! If we go above our targeted goal, I will use the money to buy additional tablets to donate to families with non verbal children with the software pre-configured.

The Piagetian Modeler is an architecture for a general independent learning system. The project began in 2010 as research exploring how to build an artificial general intelligence (AGI). The book Building Minds with Patterns provides the blueprint and a philosophy for building this particular kind of autonomous learning system. The book describes the architecture and motivation for the Piagetian Modeler. It was published in 2018 and is available on Amazon. The Piagetian Modeler prototype initially controls a single humanoid robot, and will be extended to scenarios where it controls multiple devices simultaneously. We need more hardware at this time in order to further this research, therefore your support is greatly appreciated. A new book, Coding Artificial Minds, (scheduled for publication in 2019) provides a detailed description of the implementation of the Piagetian Modeler using code snippets written in the Premise programming language. Premise is a high level programming language designed for creating intelligent systems. Two books on the language, The Premise Language, and The Premise Reference, were published in 2018 and are also available on Amazon. It is hoped that AGI systems will power the next generation of robots enabling missions in environments that would normally be hostile to humans, such as undersea exploration, undersea construction, space exploration, space construction, search and rescue, nuclear reactor repair, and so forth. Another potential benefit to building AGI systems is that the results may possibly provide insights and systems level models of how humans might actually work. The final objective of the Piagetian Modeler research is to produce a book, General Independent Learners, detailing the developmental progress of the cognitive system during its first year of operation and the behavioral milestones it achieves. A PDF of General Independent Learners, will be made available to all contributors to this campaign by December 2020. We are building the future together. Thank you for your participation. Michael S. P. Miller piagetmodeler@gmail.com

Chef/Owner Garrett Benedict My name is Garrett Benedict. I am the Chef/Owner of G-Love. Opening G-Love has been my dream for as long as I can remember. My journey to becoming a chef started when I was 14 and I have never looked back. Cooking is the only job I have ever had, and it is the only thing I want to do. I am 32 now and over the last 18 years of my life I have been carefully planning what G-Love would look like, what it would feel like when you walk in the door, and what would be on the menu. G-Love is the culmination of my entire career spent cooking in restaurants. Or is it the start of my career? I�m not sure anymore! I am so grateful that I have been able to make it this far in launching my dream restaurant, but there are still a few final steps that I have to take before I can make my lifelong dream a reality! I sincerely hope that you will take a look at my humble little Kickstarter page here and maybe help a stranger to reach for the stars. G-Love is a revolutionary restaurant concept. I like to call it a �Reverse Steakhouse.� At G-Love, vegetables take center stage and make up the majority of the menu, while the proteins are served as �side dishes.� G-Love is the opposite of a traditional American steakhouse. Instead of choosing which cut of beef you want to order, at G-Love the choice will be �heirloom tomatoes or summer squash?� Instead of �ribeye or tenderloin?� it�s �romano beans or carrots?� At G-Love, when it comes time to order your side dishes the options are crispy pork belly, seared Alaskan salmon, or charred hanger steak, not creamed spinach, mashed potatoes or grilled asparagus like you would find at a traditional steakhouse. This format is beneficial in so many ways. It is better for the planet, it�s better for your wallet, it�s better for your health, and last but not least, it�s the way I like to cook and eat. Jay, Jordan and Juniper Uth, Olde Moon Farm Owners I have partnered with Olde Moon Farm, located an hour south of Portland, in picturesque Silverton, Oregon. Olde Moon Farm will be supplying G-Love with the freshest produce imaginable. Seasonal cooking is the cornerstone philosophy of G-Love. Restaurants all over the country have embraced the farm-to-table approach, but G-Love is unique in that we own our farm delivery van, and the cooks at G-Love will take turns working a 'Farm Shift' where they get out of the kitchen for a day and drive down to Olde Moon Farm to help with the harvesting and processing of the vegetables we will use at G-Love. After their farm shift, the cooks will drive that day's delivery back to the restaurant to be prepped for that night's dinner service. This format for the cooks' schedules at G-Love is extremely important to me. I have worked at too many restaurants over the course of my career where I felt that I didn't have a single moment to catch my breath. At the best restaurants in the country the cooks are expected to put their lives, health, and sanity on hold in pursuit of the Chef's Vision. This creates amazing food, undeniably, but at what cost? At G-Love we embrace empathy. We will give our guests amazing food, delicious drinks, and fantastic service, but we will not provide that experience at the expense of our most valuable asset, our employees. G-Love is all about that one crucial element that is so important in life. LOVE. We love our guests, we love our employees, and we definitely love our amazing produce! I hope to see you this summer at G-Love! Check out some cool articles about G-Love below! https://www.pdxmonthly.com/articles/2019/3/19/san-francisco-veteran-garrett-benedict-to-open-g-love-with-vegetables-front-and-center https://pdx.eater.com/2019/3/21/18276015/g-love-garrett-benedict-reverse-steakhouse-portland Collin Nicholas The cocktail program at G-Love is something I am really proud of. The crucial element to our amazing cocktail selection is Collin Nicholas. Collin is a one-man wrecking ball of creativity. He has opened and operated bars in New York, Rome, San Francisco and Portland. He has over 11 years of experience in the industry and brings a young, fresh and eclectic perspective to the G-Love bar program. Originally from Berkeley, he grew up immersed in the strong and vibrant culture of the Bay Area. His work in the restaurant industry is focused on creating truly unique drinking experiences that challenge convention but also provide touchstones to classic cocktails. In keeping with that approach, his favorite cocktail is a classic gin and tonic! He is an indispensable part of the G-Love launch! Betty Benedict This is Betty. Without her, literally NONE of this would be possible. Betty is a force of nature, she is the most artistic, thoughtful, creative, caring, and selfless person I have ever met. Also, she is my wife. Betty is making the aprons that all the cooks and servers will wear at G-Love by hand. She is also making the bread baskets, the candle-holders, she is helping me with the interior design, she is the driving force behind all the DIY amazingness that is G-Love. Without her G-Love would not exist. Pledge for an apron, pledge for a bread basket, pledge for Betty! In 1930's Chicago, two naive kids, through a mix of bad luck and even worse decisions, join forces with a vigilante to take on the mob. In their adventure, they learn about themselves and the world around them...for better or worse. '32 Kick-Up is an action/comedy webcomic that's been running since 2016. The simplest way to describe it is a mix of Mickey Mouse, Scarface, and Dragonball. It follows the adventures of two short-sighted kids, the arrogant Patricia-Marie and her humble best friend Calloway. After Calloway's 2nd cousin and guardian is kidnapped by the crime boss, Mr. Tierney, the two find themselves fighting the mob through the guidance of Patty's idol, the street vigilante who goes under the moniker "the Bridgeport Bruiser," real name Helvetia. The comic can be read for free on it's website. '32 Kick-Up Vol 1 is a 185 pg 5 x 7.5 inch paperback. It features chapters 1-8 of the comic, plus more than 20 pages of bonus content, which includes behind the scenes notes on my creative process, as well as sketchbook pages showing the evolution of the story and characters to their final state. The extras are intended to lay bare my creative process and attempt to demystify creativity in general. I want it to be more than just a curiosity and to encourage aspiring creators to work on their own projects and fight off those doubts and insecurities that everyone has to go through. Backers have multiple tiers to choose from. If this Kickstarter manages to exceed it's goal, there are a few stretch goals available. The books will be shipped using USPS. Shipping inside the US is relatively problem free, at a flat rate of $5. But for orders outside of the country (including Canada, to my surprise) the price for shipping jumps up to $30. I feel this needs to be spelled out clearly. Silly Rookie (Perry Renarldo Singletary Jr.) is a cartoonist from Springfield, MA. I studied Sequential Art and Animation at the Savannah College of Art and Design, and I've worked for studios like Lab Zero Games, Oddbot, and Stoopid Buddy Stoodios. Twitter Tumblr Bringing '32 to print would be a dream come true. I want to thank everyone who feels that this project is worth pledging to.

The problem: Today more music is produced than ever before. Yet we find it painstakingly annoying and challenging to discover quality new music that is not produced by the mainstream. Our solution/Product: Nearly everyone will agree the single most effective way to discover a new song you like is to ask a friend/peer. PeerPlay operates with this belief in mind. We believe that this cooperative notion is what sets PeerPlay above other streaming services. Music discovery led by the people for the people, without the input from the labels. The product: The user will enter the genre/mood/attribute, or any adjective at all, of the type of music they want to discover. Similar to pandora's stations, the user would then hear a continuous stream of only songs that are of this genre/mood/attribute without interruption of ads. As the station plays tracks, the user would continuously be hearing/discovering new music as it is produced. The process: Communal music discovery: The genre/mood/attribute that the listener previously entered was for lack of a better word a "bag". "bags" are a collection of songs belonging to a single description, what every song in the bag shares. Think of bags as literally bags filled with songs, each bag is labeled by the types of songs it contains. Bags are how we filter songs. Every song is uploaded without any descriptions nor is it located in any bags except the recent uploads bag, the bag which every song is added to initially. The "explore" page might look something similar to the above; it shows songs as they are uploaded. Here people will listen to songs nobody has heard nor added to any bags. This page is geared at the true trailblazer, the trendsetters if you will.These songs are the newest of the new, however each one is unknown in every way. This is where cooperation is pivotal to the success of PeerPlay. These users will then begin tagging these songs with the names of the bags they believe best identify the songs. With each bag the song is tagged with, we will gain an accurate description of the song, created only by the users. The users who add songs to bags are assisting their neighbors who want to listen to songs of the bag they just interacted with. If everyone works together we all reap the benefits of bags with extensive catalogs. A sample of how users might add songs to bags is seen below. Teamwork makes the dream work. As the listeners listen, they will be able to tag the song with any adjective they feel best describes the song. For instance a person may feel that their current song sounds "jazzy". Once a song receives a tag it is added to the bag bearing its name in our example the song is added to the "jazzy" bag. If the bag does not exist it is created by the user. Now whenever a person is wanting to discover new "jazzy" songs they would search "jazzy" and be played a continuous stream of songs pulled from the "jazzy" bag. Much like reddit the users direct the service, they will create every bag and be the ones adding songs to bags. The communal opinion of the users will over time become a very accurate description of songs, facilitating the discovery process for everyone. Points: Users earn points for tagging songs and listening to recent uploads. Points can then be spent to boost artists or songs that users want to gain recognition. Every week the hot page will display the ranking of songs, bags, and artists that people have spent their points on. Yet another way to discover new songs, this will show what users believe is worth listening to. Considerations: Songs may be flagged if they do not fit the bag they are added to, given enough votes the song may be removed. Songs may also be flagged if they are not the original work of the artist and potentially removed. This service is entirely controlled by the users, they will dictate the accuracy as well as effectiveness of the platform. This platform is designed for underground/up-and-coming artists. People who create music with minimal financial backing but a quality sound nonetheless.

Soul Pact #2 is the second issue of a 5 issue mini series. Each issue of the series will be 32 pages full color. Soul Pact was created because I wanted to create a cheesecake book starring a black woman. Most cheesecake books don't offer a lot of diverse representation. I wanted to find a way to showcase that a black woman can be sexy and powerful at the same time. Nell was lord of the 5th ring of hell until her sisters betrayed her and left her for dead. A human girl named Nia found her. They made a pact that she can possess Nia if she helps her get revenge on bullies. Little did Nia know that Nell has her own revenge plot as well. We'll update as pages are completed, but here's a look at the interiors: You can check out this preview from issue 1 as well: Marcel Dupree Owns and operates Evoluzione Publishing. He has been writing on and off for the past 7 years. Vincenzo Sansone Vincenzo Sansone: born in Naples, has a BA in Italian Literature at the University of Pisa and a professional degree at International School of Comics. He�s been working for several publishers such as Approbation Comics, Dead Canary Comics, Interweb comics, Moonstone books and Evoluzione publishing. When he is not drawing comic books, he likes reading (books and, again, comic books), writing, acting, watching movies and series, listening and playing music. He currently lives in Pisa. He graduated in comics and obtained the Master in digital coloring. His first work, in the world of comics is Kannonau, with Magicpress publishing house. Currently working for Shockdom, Behemoth comics and Evolution publishing. Justin Birch I was born in the hills of West Virginia and raised on a diet of pepperoni rolls and Ecto Cooler Hi-C. I have a Bachelor's in graphic design and have been lettering comics for over a year. In that short time I've worked with numerous publishers and I know I can meet any deadline you may have. I offer a quick turnaround and competitive rates. Email for a quote. I would love to letter your next comic.

Brian Jones: Butterfly in the Park Hardcover book and print set, limited to 300 signed & numbered copies! Michael Cooper (1941-1973) was a beloved British photographer best known for his photographs of leading rock musicians of the 1960s. Cooper began his successful career as a fashion photographer for British Vogue capturing the vibrant energy of the Swinging Sixties in London. In 1964, through the art dealer Robert Fraser, Cooper became immersed in the art and music scene and photographed many leading figures in music, art, fashion, and literature, including The Beatles, The Rolling Stones, Andy Warhol, Cecil Beaton, Twiggy, Jean Genet, and Allen Ginsberg among many others. Cooper's close association with the Rolling Stones, resulted in his largest body of photographic work. As a trusted friend, Cooper was right there with them, camera in hand, capturing every moment, at home, at play, and in the studio. In 1967, Cooper photographed two of the most legendary rock and roll covers of all time, The Beatles� Sgt. Peppers Lonely Hearts Club Band, and The Rolling Stones� Their Satanic Majesties Request. In 1973, Cooper took his own life leaving behind an unparalleled photographic legacy that is cared for by his son Adam. We are pleased to offer the first ever Brian Jones photo book to be published as a deluxe limited edition. Rolling Stones: Their Satanic Majesties Request & The Beatles: Sgt. Peppers album covers which are among Michael Cooper's best known photographic works. It has been 50 years since the death of Brian Jones (1942-1969). Jones, an English musician is best known as the founder and original leader of the Rolling Stones. To celebrate his life and work we have compiled a limited-edition book of rare photographs by Michael Cooper. In addition to the images, we invited some of Jones' closest friends to help tell his story, resulting in more than 10,000 words. Our contributor contributions include a foreword by music legend Donovan and new contributions from Linda Lawrence, Prince Stash Klossowski de Rola, Andee Nathanson, Jones' son Julian Leitch, his grandson Joolz Jones, Rolling Stones road manager Sam Cutler, and renowned music journalist Paul Trynka. Their stories told shed new light on one of rock and roll�s most enigmatic characters. This book was overseen by editor & art director Dagon James in collaboration with Michael Cooper's son Adam Cooper and his wife Silvia Cooper. Together they carefully examined Cooper's original 35mm film, bringing into sharp focus the brilliance of Brian Jones at work and at play, featuring moments in the recording studio with bandmates Keith Richards, Mick Jagger, Charlie Watts, and Bill Wyman alongside more intimate candid images. In addition to the selected photographs, we are pleased to include a never before published poem, written by Brian Jones to his partner Linda Lawrence shortly before he passed away. Brian Jones & Michael Cooper on the Rolling Stones "Their Satanic Majesties Request" cover shoot. Many of the photos in this book are published here for the first time, making this a truly unique document in the history of Rock and Roll. Brian Jones: Butterfly in the Park will be printed on heavyweight 200gsm acid free paper, utilizing a 6-color process with spot varnish and gold page edge gilding, housed in a printed slipcase with metallic foil details to accentuate and protect every book. We are working with one of the best fine art photography book printers in the world to ensure the finest photo reproduction possible. At 146 pages, this lavish book is sure to please the most dedicated enthusiast of Brian Jones, and The Rolling Stones. Brian Jones during Rolling Stones recording sessions with bandmates Keith Richards, and Mick Jagger at Olympic Studios - London, England. Sample view of the limited edition hardcover book and slipcase 300 numbered, hardcover books available in 2 editions. 1. DELUXE EDITION - (Books numbered 1-50) Deluxe books are hand signed by 8 contributors including Donovan, Linda Lawrence, Julian Leitch, Joolz Jones, Prince Stash Klossowski de Rola, Adam Cooper, Silvia Cooper, and Dagon James. Every Deluxe edition comes with a numbered, estate stamped 8x10" or 11x14" archival pigment print of the Rolling Stones album cover Their Satanic Majesties Request, one of their most recognizable and sought after images. 2. COLLECTOR EDITION - (Books numbered 51-300) Collector books are hand signed by contributors Adam Cooper, Silvia Cooper, and Dagon James. Choose from 3 (three) different numbered, estate stamped, 8x10" archival pigment prints of Brian Jones. Note: The Satanic Majesties Request print is only available with the DELUXE edition of the book. Detail of the DELUXE edition signature page with all 8 signatures that you will get with any of the books numbered 1-50. Pictured here are Donovan, Linda Lawrence, Prince Stash Klossowski de Rola, Brian Jones' son Julian Leitch, and grandson Joolz Jones, Adam Cooper, Silvia Cooper, and Dagon James. PREMIUM ADD-ON OPTIONS AVAILABLE WITH EVERY BOOK! The Rolling Stones album cover for "Their Satanic Majesties Request" - Comes as a numbered, estate stamped, archival pigment print with every DELUXE edition of the book. BONUS PRINTS! Left: (Print A) Brian Jones recording piano on a Rolling Stones track at Olympic Studios, London. Center: (Print B) Brian Jones & Anita Pallenberg. Right: (Print C) Brian during a photo session at Michael Cooper's studio. All 3 are available as 8x10" and 11x14" print options with both the COLLECTOR and DELUXE editions as numbered, estate stamped, archival pigment prints. Left: A photo from the 10 page Michael Cooper feature in Lid Magazine #14. Right: The Rolling Stones 32 page mini book about the 1969 Hyde Park concert which the band dedicated to Brian Jones who passed away 2 days prior. Limited to 120 Signed & Numbered copies. "Eleven Hands" 5x7" postcard that comes with every copy of the book. Exclusive to this edition! Every collector who pledges will have the option of having their name printed inside the book as thanks for helping us bring this treasure to life! Brian Jones was not only among the most stylish figures of the 1960's, he was also one of the most creative and adventurous multi-instrumentalists in the history of popular music. Michael Cooper captured Brian on film like no one else, and now you can be a part of this rich, musical legacy with Brian Jones: Butterfly in the Park. Front & back covers of Brian Jones: Butterfly in the Park

WHAT IS THIS BOOK? It's a collection of 100+ pages like this: WHY DID I WRITE THIS BOOK? I woke up one morning in February like I do occasionally, already gripped by anxiety. Every muscle tense, my mind racing, a reader board running through my brain as one aggravating thought after another raced through. Like other mornings, by the time I got up I was fine. I quieted or captured the thoughts with God and then I got out of bed and went about my day. But unlike other mornings, the process of capturing and quieting was slowed down for me. Other mornings, caught in the grips of the anxiety monster, the process was a blur. I only knew that I took breaths and cried out to God and took more breaths and cried out more. This morning though, God shined a big light on the process. As He did, I felt Him saying, �This could help people. Write this down.� So over the next months, as the light continued to shine on the process, I wrote. What I have written so far is now part of a collection of meditations, prayers, and a few short letters to the reader, available as a free download on my website beginning May 15th www.stevieswift.com. What I want to do, what this project is about, is to double the collection and make it available as a printed book. In addition to more prayers and meditations, and I will add a collection of lamentations. WHY ARE WE PRINTING IT? As I wrote these things down, as much as I am grateful for a way to share these things for free in PDF form, I felt a strong desire to put a physical version out there into the world. Something people can hold and flip through and put in a purse or a desk drawer or on a nightstand. I think, as people read through the PDF version, many others will feel the same - I think enough of us will want a print version that we might be able to come together and actually get it done. In that spirit, I created this Kickstarter project as a vehicle for us to come together and get it done. HOW CAN I BE A PART OF THE PROJECT? You should see a section on this page with pledge amounts and a reward described for each pledge amount. Choose which reward you would love, click on it, and follow the instructions for check out. YOU WILL ONLY BE CHARGED IF THE PROJECT IS FUNDED. If we are funded, I will have the books printed and send out all rewards by the end of September (although I'm shooting for the end of July, I want to leave lots of room for any delays we might encounter.) This is my third printing project. I am familiar with the process and I have a great local printer I use. Below is a breakdown of the estimated costs and why I chose the goal amount of $1,102. 150 books printed = $689 (any less than 150 and the per book price is quite high) Estimated shipping and packing costs = $200 ISBN number = $125 Copyright registration = $35 Estimated minimum cost of additional rewards = $100 If you are doing the math, you'll see these add up to more than the $1,102 goal, and there is a reason for it. During this process there was a bit of scripture which gained, in my own heart, a much deeper meaning. It was James 1:2. $1,102 is in honor of how God worked in my own life as I worked on this book, how He pointed me to eternity, how He stripped me of ego, and how He is working in and through all things. "Consider it pure joy, my brothers and sisters, whenever you face trials of many kinds." I'm trusting we will surpass the goal by this little bit and if not, I have a plan for that - you can scroll down to see it! Thank you so much for coming here and checking out this project. Please don't hesitate to ask me questions if you need any help making a pledge or if I failed to answer something in this section!

This project is born out of my fanatic worship at the Studio Ghibli altar and my until now, hidden love for all things astrology & zodiac. For some time now I wanted to create Ghibli pins but couldn't think of how to make them special and stand out from the crowd. I came up with the idea to draw them as the 12 zodiac signs and everything coalesced from there. It didn't always run smoothly, I am a consummate professional when it comes to stall tactics, but I managed to put together a project that makes my weird, nerd heart happy. I hope you also feel mutual weird nerd love. I did my best to match up the characters with signs that suited them but please keep in mind that all signs have multiple facets to them just as people do. So not every trait will match, but not every person born under a sign fits it perfectly. I hope you can see something of yourself in your sign character. For the designs I wanted to include an element of the star sign within the pin but keep it subtle so that no matter when you were born, you could wear any pin. Some designs are more on the nose than others but I think even different star signs can enjoy any of the pins in this collection. These are more detailed and colorful than my other pins and with 12 of them on the lineup, it's a hefty undertaking that I could really use your help with. I want to be able to produce them all at one time instead of breaking up the pins into monthly installments. Scroll down through the page to see more details about the pins, myself and my company Printrovert. I opted for a campaign goal that would fund all 12 enamel pins as opposed to one that unlocks each sign at a time. I want to make sure that if this project is funded, everyone has access to all the signs to ensure maximum happiness. Every pin will measure at 1.75"/44.5 mm and come with 2 backing posts for the highest of security. They are all hard enamel pins and each one is gold plated except for Taurus/Sheeta who is silver plated and Leo/Calcifer who is rose gold plated. Early bird pricing is $8 per pin Kickstarter pricing is $10 per pin After the campaign ends, the retail price will be $12 By pledging you are helping my project of love, sweat and tears come to life AND are saving money. Dolla dolla bills y'all! Kickstarter is an all or nothing funding campaign so if I don't hit my target goal when the clock stops ticking, I won't receive any of your beautiful cheddar. If you want to see these pins in the 3 dimensional world, please pledge and share! Your card will only be charged at the end if the campaign is successful. You can edit or cancel at any time while the campaign is active. Disclaimer: I'm not the intellectual property owner of the characters used in these designs. All characters are property of Studio Ghibli/Hayao Miyazaki. Add Ons Add +10 USD to your pledge for each additional pin you would like to purchase. Add +8 USD to your pledge for each additional pin you would like to purchase if you are in the Early Bird tier. May 29 - June 27: Kickstarter campaign End June - Beginning of July: Funds are sent to my account and surveys are sent out Mid July: Order placed and production begins Beginning - Mid August: Order received and the sorting begins! Beginning of September: Orders sent out (whoo!) Dates are subject to change but all backers will be notified of any changes to the timeline. - . - . - . - . - . - . - . - . - . - . - . - . - . - . - . - . - . - . - . - . - . - . - . - . - . - . - . - . - . - . - . - . - . - Ship times on average: Within the US: 3-5 business days Canada: 5-15 days Rest of the world: 3-6 weeks Please note: shipping outside of the US can come with a lengthy wait. Once the package is dropped at the post office, it is out of my hands. If you have any problems or concerns with shipping or issues with your order once the campaign is over, please contact me via email at: jules@printrovert.com and I will do my very best to help you. Backers are responsible for any custom fees their country may ask for. I'm the less cool one on the left. About Juliet Hiiii! My name is Juliet and I'm a graphic designer/weird kid living on Earth. I really like alpacas, sloths, stingrays and otters (in no particular order). I enjoy: making blanket nests to read in, eating tacos, traveling, drinking tea (preferably jasmine green tea), collecting useless but cute things, making stupidly long playlists and light internet stalking my friends. I also enjoy learning German and singing but am good at neither of those things... My resolution for every year is to pet all the dogs. About Printrovert Printrovert is a small goods & print company founded by this ^ awkward girl who doesn't always like the company of other humans. Printrovert was created in 2015 when I was working as a graphic designer in Los Angeles as a way to escape the fact that seeing homeless men poop on the sidewalk was part of my reality. I'd eat lunch in my Pantone cubicle and come up with illustrations for puns or vice versa. The first products offered were 20 illustrated pun greeting cards that were funded by a successful Kickstarter campaign. Since then I've created art prints, temporary tattoos and enamel pins. This campaign is created to raise initial capital to film the pilot episode of The Hard Pass. I was inspired to write the pilot in 2018. I wanted to create a story that would inspire and provoke discourse on the subject of borders and how every nation in the world is affected (one way or another) by backroom policies. These policies are often self-serving and hurt the very people they are created to protect. This is not an America/Mexico problem, this is a universal issue that affects us all. The series takes place on a fictitious continent shared by two diametrically opposed countries. The Hard Pass is the colloquial name for the forest that lines the national border. It separates the southern dystopian society in the south, from it's rich neighbor to the north. The Northern government creates mechanical beasts, programmed to kill anyone that attempts to cross through the forest into their nation. This patch of land becomes a graveyard of lost souls who attempt to migrate into the north. The people become desperate for hope until one woman takes action into her own hands. Tanji becomes the guide they have been praying for. She masters The Hard Pass and is the only one who can safely traverse people without casualty. She soon discovers that her fight is greater than the beasts in the forests and she has to decide if she's willing to risk it all in The Hard Pass.

Crazy Cultists is a quirky, fast-paced, competitive card game from Rocket House Games where 3-6 players race against each other to summon The Dark One! Gain the Unholy Adversary�s favor and thwart your competition by unleashing terrible hexes on them or by giving them a good ol' fashioned �Beelze-Beatdown�. It's a no-holds-barred free-for-fall fight to be the first to light all 5 candles in your pentagram and usher in a thousand years of darkness! During setup, each player receives (1) pentagram board and (3) cards. The candle tokens are placed anywhere within reach of all players. That's it. Easy peasy. Come up with your own way to determine who goes first (we usually prefer the ol� first one to play a card method) then continue clockwise. Crazy Cultists is a fast-paced game, so don't worry if things get a little chaotic. It's all part of the fun. Players take turns either building favor with The Dark One by creating a Favor Stack, or sabotaging a rival cultist by playing Hijinx Cards. It's a play one/draw one game so planning ahead is key. But remember, the closer you are to victory, the bigger the target on your back becomes! Once a player reaches 10 or more points in their Favor Stack, they earn a candle token. Earn 5 candle tokens to win! Favor Cards are valued between 1-3 points and are used to create your Favor Stack. Favor Cards are stacked one on top of the other so that the corner number can still be seen. Once a player has reached 10+ Favor Points in his or her stack, the stack is discarded and that player earns a candle token. Hijinx Cards are used to sabotage another player�s favor with The Dark One. These cards can produce a wide variety of effects, but most commonly cause a player to discard the last 1, 2, or 3 cards played in his or her Favor Stack. The goal of Crazy Cultists is to be the first player to earn 5 candle tokens. Easier said than done, as the tide can turn at any time! Earn your candles as well as your rightful place at the side of The Dark One, himself! Table talk is not only allowed, it's HIGHLY encouraged. Feel free to let the rest of the table know the contents of your careless fellow cultist�s hand or alert everyone to just how close Little Susie McQuiet-Pants is to getting her next candle token! It�s all about being the cultist on top, so don�t be afraid to make a few enemies! At its core Crazy Cultists is a "Take-That"/"Screw-Your-Neighbor" card game that gets more intense and more fast-paced as the game goes on. Our goal was to create a game that mixes the best parts of a casual party game with tense strategy and non-stop action and we think we've done it! We are partnering with WinGo Games (https://wingo.games/) to handle the manufacturing of Crazy Cultists, but to make this all a reality, we need your help! And that's why we're here on Kickstarter. We can't wait for you to see our game and we hope you love it enough to make it a reality. Add-On Instructions: To add items to your pledge, manually add the $ amount to your base pledge. After the campaign ends you will be asked which items you'd like to purchase during the survey. Note that any additional items you add to your pledge may incur an additional shipping charge.
