GrindKing Disruptor My name is Donald Cassel and in 1988 I started Grind King in Venice, California. What motivated me to create the original high-performance kingpin was because when I would grind on my trucks the kingpin would often get in the way and sometimes cause me to fall. Also the kingpin nut would become damaged from grinding and become difficult to adjust. I realized this out-dated design could be improved to meet the needs of the modern skateboarder especially when it came to grinding. I designed and made a prototype inverted kingpin which I tested that worked good. The invention was a �Grinding Kingpin� so I shortened the name to Grind King. Original Kingpin set from 1988 One of the first Grind King Ads Some pro riders such as Jay Adams really liked them so I knew I was on to something. I took the Grind King kingpins to the Action Sports Trade Show and got a bunch of orders. After a couple years of making and selling them I decided to design trucks that had the GK kingpins already in them. I kept making trucks and skate hardware till around 2009. After taking a 10 year break I have decided to bring Grind King back with an all new GK truck called the Disruptor. This truck is a refinement of all the years I have put into designing trucks and has the lowest kingpin in history for the smoothest grinds. It is my goal to provide you with the best grinding and highest performing trucks in the world. Your contribution means a lot and in return I intend to bring you more innovative skate products that I hope can help progress skateboarding. Grind On! Donald Cassel The GK Disruptor has the lowest kingpin in history for the smoothest grinds. The curved edge on the baseplate helps prevent board breakage. The Disruptor has unique features that give it an advantage in grinding and performance The 6-n-1 tool has all the tools you need for your skate yet fits comfortably in your pocket Grind King has created the ultimate skaters backpack with that is loaded with innovative features such as the removable satellite pack. The GK Backside 180 is the King of all skate backpacks! Super dope high quality GK zip hoodie Stylin logo T-shirt with silver ink FOR THOSE WHO GRIND! High quality hat has embroidery on two sides. GrindQueen tank top is FOR GIRLS WHO GRIND! Cool stickers to represent GK 2.0!

You are a samurai on a quest to become supreme military commander of Japan. Wield cards to attack, defend, and even reflect your rival�s strikes. Call upon the power of supernatural kami to aid you in battle. Master the ways of the blade to dominate foes, honor the kami, and rise as shgun. Turn-Based Action�Wield cards to attack, defend, and even reflect your rival�s strikes in your quest to become the next shgun. Unique Kami Powers�Summon kami, supernatural beings or phenomena capable of tide-turning abilities and kamikaze attacks. Innovative Stance Mode�Outsmart your opponent by playing the right card in Stance Mode, an action that occurs when your rival takes a turn. Katana is a two-player only game with battles that last 15�35 minutes. The game is suitable for ages 10 and up. Gameplay is handled through cards. Each turn you use cards to take an action, respond to your opponent's attacks, and set a defensive stance. The ultimate goal is to eliminate your opponent's health to remain standing as shgun; however, brute force is only one approach to the game, as other strategic paths are available. What makes Katana unique is its intense, thought-provoking action. Distinct from the steel-clashing swordsmanship of medieval European knights, Japanese sword battles were surprisingly cerebral as samurai sized each other up and planned two, even three moves in advance of their opponent. The lethal nature of these encounters made samurai cautious, but effective warriors; one would think of any associated risks as well as the possible rewards that might derive from an action. Turn-based card battles correspond nicely to this, resulting in a test of wills between players eager to be the next shgun. Zephram joins Trevor and me for a game of Katana Battle�Use cards to inflict damage and defend. When taking a turn, you may attack by playing an offensive card. To defend, simply play a card with a defensive value and subtract it from the attack value to determine if the hit landed. Bonus attacks can boost your offensive capabilities, whereas the ability to reflect attacks provides an edge to defenders. Stance�After taking an action, you may play an action card face down. This is your defensive stance during your opponent's turn. When you opponent takes an action, you may reveal your stance card. However, if your opponent chooses not to attack, your stance will break and any benefit to be gained from it will be lost. Placing a card in Stance mode Kami�Divine beings and forces of nature called kami provide crucial support in battle. Every kami possesses two abilities: an active one that requires playing a purify card and a passive ability that is "always on." Not only do kami provide game-changing special powers, they can be called upon to sacrifice themselves in kamikaze attacks that inflict massive damage (crab bosses beware). Each time you activate a kami power, though, you must draw a shrine card. A mixture of good and bad events, shrine cards are yet another element of risk to think about when considering use of kami powers. Purification and pollution�Japanese warriors were deeply spiritual and believed in the ritual dynamics of purity and pollution. In order to activate kami powers, you must play a purify card. Beware, though, as your opponent can prevent you from accessing your kami's powers by playing pollution cards. Fortunately, pollution can be eliminated by countering with a purify card. Click to read full instructions You can play a digital version of Katana right now using the Vassal engine. This open source platform supports recreations of table top games, which are created by users and shared with the wider gaming community. Thanks to the efforts of backer Brandon Minton�you're awesome, buddy!�Katana has its own Vassal module that you can download here. Make sure to install the Vassal client first, then load up the module to play Katana. Play the game on Vassal (thanks Brandon!) Want to try the game before committing to a boxed copy? Pledge $1 and receive Katana�Print-and-Play Trial. Download a secure PDF with printable action, selected kami, selected shrine, and health/armor cards. Click the image to see the trial PDF (password required for printing). Katana�Print-and-Play Trial (password required for printing) Katana�Rnin Edition with Quick Start Guide Katana�Rnin Edition includes: Action cards (50), Kami cards (12), Shrine cards (24), Health cards (10), Armor cards (12), Samurai's Guide, Quick Start Guide, Tuck box Katana�Daimy Edition with close up of Kami deck Katana�Daimy Edition includes: an Action deck (50 cards), Kami deck (12 cards), Shrine deck (24 cards), 10 Health tokens, 12 Armor tokens, Samurai's Guide, Quick Start Guide, Drawer box Katana�Daimy Edition XL with close up of Collector's box Katana�Daimy Edition XL back and interior of box Katana�Daimy Edition XL includes: an Action deck (50 cards), Kami deck (12 cards), Shrine deck (24 cards), 10 Health tokens, 12 Armor tokens, Samurai's Guide, Quick Start Guide, Collector's box Inititally conceived during an interaction design class in autumn 2017 at Portland State University, Katana evolved into a larger design thesis project culminating in this Kickstarter campaign. I believe in the potential for gameplay to communicate historical concepts and cultural memory in ways distinct from traditional forms of scholarly discourse; in other words, historical experiences and a sense of past cultures can be generated through meaningful play. My fascination with Japanese history led me to develop a game that does more than employ history as a setting, but actually evoke the tension, spirituality, and political intrigue of early modern samurai. By backing Katana, you're not just accessing a neat game, you're also supporting meaningful historical gameplay. Read my in-depth making-of article on Medium

StudioLevel has been creating handcrafted and painted wargaming terrain models since 2004. During this time, we have made hundreds of successful projects for gamers all around the human sphere. Now we invite you to our grand project, The G�RDB�K Shrine 2 � the complete fully painted 4x themes: Frozen Wastelands of Nowhere, Desert of Mon'theran, Lava Pits of Sheol and Forest of Felicia terrains ready for gaming right out of the box. You can build your dream tabletop game board today created with the highest resolution for perfect detail, premium printed new double-sided cloth and mousepad gamemats with epic StudioLevel terrain system and all will be suitable for your wargame 28-35mm scale. Our last project The G�RDB�K Shrine was a huge success that showed us that people playing wargames really care about terrain quality and we were encouraged to do even better. Talking with our backers, local players and playing games on our exclusive terrain we went a step forward and created You are asking yourself now... what is new in this project? Let us show you what we have prepared for you. No one knows who built it, nor what propose it served for sure. They were always there, near the frozen Bugk, in the death wasteland of Nowhere. Most people thought it was an ancient resting place of kings, others thought it is a necromantic ground because of the voices you can hear in the cold nights whispering your name in voices long dead...some say that it is just rubble and nothing more then vaporized stone. They were all wrong...Armies on an epic scale clashed in the ruins only fuelling what lies inside. Shouts of victory and bitter defeat sound in the walls surrounding this sinister place. Other ruins of similar design have been found all around the world but in each of them another sinister force can be felt. From the Frozen Wastelands of Nowhere, Desert of Mon'theran, Lava Pits of Sheol to the Forest of Felicia. Find out what connects them. It is your chance to evolve and not only be the General of thousand souls...but a Demigod of the battlefield. We in Studiolevel believe that legendary battles can only be fought on legendary scenery, which is key to your tabletop experience. What we provide is excellence in the form of prepainted terrains which will allow you to deep dive into the game you are playing and loving. If you are looking for the best terrain there is...look no further...we provide. We invite you to familiarize yourself with this epic project. As wargamers and hobbyists with long experience in terrain design we are certain that you will find something for yourself. If you are a fan of wargames or have even played one before, we encourage you to scroll through our site so that it may inspire you to start an awesome adventure of epic miniature battles and strategic tabletop games. With our help, you will find that what you needed all along was a hobby that will introduce you to new people, make new friends, play games involving strategic planning and perhaps the kind of fun you have never experienced before. So what are you waiting for? Shall we get started with the fun Commander? Because of our Gradebook Shrine 1 project we were able to gain much needed experience. We have use it to create a new process in the shipping method that will provide your dream terrains a lot faster. One of the main features of it is that the faster you buck up the project, the faster you get your package. Additional they will be shipped in smaller portions so that shipment will be carried out every week. Our studio is constantly growing, providing us with new intel and experiences that help develop our company and in turn our products. We are well feeding our minions and they are working hard and taking overtime with a smile on their faces. What we have created is a passionate team of Sci-Fi and Fantasy enthusiasts that have come together to do what they love and what they do best. Let us share with you some insight into what they are like: Our previous three projects and our collaboration with Tokmak Studio allowed us to greatly develop our company, employ additional staff members, expand our studio and invest in new technologies, including 3D modelling. It is because of you that we are able to realize our passions, hobbies and evolve as designers for a better tomorrow of wargames and gamers alike here at StudioLevel. In exchange for your loyalty we will do the same and swear that our team will not let you down and we will go further into developing newer and better terrains for you, so that you can have more joy from what you enjoy.. your hobby. Keep up to date on our development process on Facebook and Twitter and feel free to share with anyone that might be interested! Sharing our story will mean a lot for us because every voice matters and we know how loud can the battle cries of wargamers can be.

Game set up for 4 players Exploration is an innovative space themed game with a mix of deckbuilder, area control and unique orbital movement mechanics. You will take control of corporations at the start of the new Space Race. Send out colonization ships, dispatch science expeditions, collect resources, modify your designs, develop new technology, or even sabotage your opponent�s missions. Unique orbital movement mechanics greatly increasing game immersion Spaceship fleet deckbuilding game Area control A flexible strategy depending on your opponent's moves 30 - 150 minutes of gameplay for 1 - 5 players Solo mode *Miniature is not part of the gameplay Fleet Build up your fleet with an array of ships, from transports to destroyers, and everything in between. Some ships rely on speed and maneuverability, while others boast impressive shields and armaments. Build your fleet to your faction�s strengths to gain dominance of near-Earth space. Orbital maneuver movement The Space is immeasurable and your only limitation is the energy that determines the paths of space exploration. The rule is simple, the more complex the maneuver you want to do, the more energy it consumes. You must be well prepared to build a habitat on Mars! You've Been a Hero. You've Been a Villain...but one thing is certain. Your class helps define your story. Whether it be a dungeon or traveling along the forest path to an Inn. These coins have been used by adventurers who go forth to make a name for themselves. Legend says each coin bares the mark of those that held them before. FIGHTER The bold and stout heart of a strong front line fighter! On one side of the coin, you have the armor that keeps them protected. The other? The array of weapons they've dedicated their lives to mastering. RANGER The keen senses and wild nature of the ranger. On one side of the coin, you have the ranger in their element, tracking, hunting and trapping. On the other? the weapons of their trade BARD The free spirit and seductive words of a bard! On one side, you have the bard doing what they do best, telling a story. On the other? The instruments that embellish any tale they tell! These coins are in a 'class' of their own (pun intended) and are made by some of the best masterwork coin smiths in all the realm! Exclusive Metal Gaming Coins and Dice. Designed and minted like real coins, our exclusive full-metal gaming coins are an essential extension to enhancing your live or tabletop Role-playing Game experience. Our team of expert designers create these premium metal gaming coins with your maximum satisfaction in mind and with expert craftsmanship. However, it does not stop there. As included with each set of coins is a set of die! That you will pick to either match the coins or if you've got a taste for another blend! The dice themselves are spun, rolled and imbued with a color that helps coordinate and emphasize each class. With a little bit of style on top. With a set of coins and a set of dice, neither will disappoint or let you down and that's a D20 Collective and Norse Foundry guarantee! You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00 Unique Options To Match Your Style. Our metal gaming coins and dice will come in sets of 10 coins and a set of 7 dice, Each class coin set contains two pieces of each coin in the following denominations: 1, 5, 10, 25 and 100. The set of 7 dice will include each of the following: 4 sided dice (d4), 6 sided dice (d6), 8 sided dice (d8), 10 sided dice (d10), 10 sided percentile dice (d%), 12 sided dice (d12), 20 sided dice (d20). My mother fell and broke her neck 10 years ago. I thought being her care giver would be temporary. I lost track of time, and after so long I realized I had let 8 years pass by. I have been unemployed living with her as she was unable to care for herself and I just got used to it, did not think I was getting older to. I have invented this wall mounted bag holder over a year ago, it is an offshoot from a wheeled base full size model. She is in a home now, and I need to get back on my feet, and thought this thing works so well for my mom that it can actually become something big. This wall mounted trash bag holder is on of 2 inventions she inspired. I made them to make things easier for her. When she does try to be self sufficient it helps to be able to at least be able to throw away the household trash, and to be able to swap out the bags. Pulling a bag out of a can (even a small can in her bathroom) got to hard for her and for me too as I found she just quit doing it! So I came up with a simple wall mounted trash bag holder. It is adjustable, it can fit a small standard grocery sack all the way up to a 55 gallon trash bag (well we do tie the rim of the bag down, but it works!) We tested it to hold up to 10 lbs of trash when using the included hook n loop industrial strength fastener, and up to 17 lbs when using the included wall mounting hardware. Still to be safe it is recommended for basic household trash up to 7 lbs. Yea it could do more but why push it. We did test it but then we just started using them (I say them because we also have one to hold her dirty cloths sack), still we never got over 6 lbs in basic bathroom or kitchen trash. However if this is used in a garage setting, we suggest placing it low enough for the trash bag to touch the ground so any extreme heavy loaded trash would have the floor to support it. Also remember to use the type of bag for the job. I want to take this to the next level, while I can produce them in my garage, I want to grow, turn this into a manufacturing business and produce them here in the USA with a commitment to never outsource the work over seas. I need help getting this started.

MyStage is a multi-purpose, portable platform that transforms any location into a concert venue, personal yoga studio, and more! It�s lightweight, durable, quick and easy-to-use, and can be setup with one person! No crew required. Transporting and installing a normal stage takes massive trucks and large crews. There is no solution for performers or venue owners to transport and set up their own light weight, professional stage. If you own a venue, why pay for an expensive and clunky stage that you will never be able to move? With MyStage, you can link together as many platforms as needed. It�s light enough to set up and take down with one person! Parked far away from your gig or event? Not a problem! Weighing less than 30 lbs, this 4� x 4� stage is light enough to carry anywhere. You can even carry Mystage in one hand, leaving one hand free to carry more gear. That means less back and forth trips when loading your gear. It's quick and easy! Easily take it with you while you�re finding the perfect spot for your beach workout, yoga session, or concert venue. Setting up MyStage only takes seconds! All four legs fold out, lock into place, and extend in height via easy release button. Adjust the platform height to suit your needs. When you�re done with your gig or workout, just fold up the legs, pick up your MyStage and you�re good to go. With Mystage, one person can do the job of a whole crew in minutes! If you need some more surface area, simply connect MyStages together with the easy connection tabs. With enough MyStages, you can build an entire concert venue by yourself! MyStage features adaptive leveling and stability. This means MyStage�s angled legs direct the applied weight outward to eliminate any movement or wobbling, even at maximum height! Set up your full kit and slam as hard as you want! Each leg of MyStage is also individually adjustable, so you can level out any uneven surfaces. MyStage was also designed to be sturdy, so rock out as hard as you want to - MyStage won�t wobble! MyStage�s surface is made of a tough, diamond-plate, non-slip rubber that makes sure you and your equipment won�t slip or slide during your performance. The material is light and strong, so you don�t need to worry about it tearing up or wearing down. MyStage gives you the space and confidence to captivate your audience. If you�re playing on a crowded street, raise MyStage higher to protect your gear and stand out above the crowd! Plus, MyStage is perfect for providing a flat, stable surface for a drum kit - no matter where your gig is. MyStage is also great for dancers and street performers of any kind - providing a safe, secure platform and professional aesthetic for your next stunt. Whether it�s a church fair, community festival, business event, or even just a birthday party - MyStage will give your event the presence it needs to take it to the next level. Get the extra height to make speeches, announce activities or gather a crowd for worship! The levelled and grippy stage also makes it safe to post up speaker and microphone stands and for your event performers to do their routines without worry. MyStage�s raised platform lifts you away from workout hazards such as rocks or roots. Do all your workouts on a level and sturdy platform virtually anywhere. Whether you�re doing plyometrics or jumping around during your performance, MyStage gives you an unshakeable and comfortable foundation for all your activities. Practicing yoga outdoors is a great way to connect to nature, but it is difficult to find a level surface. No one wants to risk injury with extra strain or feel a rock poking into their back during lying poses. With MyStage, you can practice yoga safely and comfortably anywhere. Whether you�re at the beach, in the desert, or camping in the mountains, you�ll be ready and able to enter your flow with full focus and relaxation. Turn any space into your personal venue, platform, gym, or studio! With MyStage, you will no longer be restricted by landscape or space. Rock out, speak up, hit hard, and stretch deep whenever, wherever. The world is your stage - never hold back. Pete Hurley practices ashtanga yoga and was looking for a way to practice in nature - like at the beach, mountains, and jungle. There was nothing on the market truly portable so after 1.5 years of designing finally invented the perfect portable stage, great for yoga and a whole lot of other uses too.

This product was born from my daughter's need to carry jewelry to Austria, and we could find nothing locally available that seemed a safe way to transport the jewelry required for the performance she was to be in. I called my Mom, reminded her of a device she had made to facilitate the storage of necklaces at our house of 4 girls, recommended some minor modifications, and she made the perfect prototype. The desire of this entrepreneur is to have all units home - made, so the manufacturers can make money, at home while being with their families. The result of that is that the product will be made here at home... not at some forced labor factory in another country. The need for funding stems from the desire to have an embroidered logo on each unit, and need to buy a machine to do that, $700 plus tax, and enough to buy some materials in bulk. If this campaign gets maxxed out, will buy the next step up in machine as well.

Indie Feature Film Loving Life Productions LLC presents a LaKesha Lorene film, written by Tiffany Wolfork, 5 Hours to Georgia. 5 Hours to Georgia is a powerful drama that follows three sisters as they take a road trip that ultimately challenges their hearts and minds. As they embark on the journey of their lives, they face unexpected challenges that force them to understand each other like never before. Why We Need You! We are an independent production company producing quality film. In order to continue creating content that not only transforms lives but transforms time, we need help from sponsors. Independent Feature Films normally require budgets of $200,000 and we will complete our film with a budget of less than $10,000 with your donations and our client's investment. By donating to our ultra-low budget independent film, we will be able to adequately compensate our dedicated crew professionals and pay for rental spaces for shooting scenes. We appreciate every donation of any size that will help us reach our goal by our shooting date in August 2019. Thank you for your continued support of Entertainment with Purpose! To find out more about what we do visit lovinglifeproductions.com. Independent Feature Film - Crowdfunding

The Star Wars The Vintage Collection Archive Edition book is a comprehensive historical manuscript and detailed visual archive of one of Hasbro's most popular lines of 3.75-inch Star Wars action figures, The Vintage Collection (TVC). It's inspired by Steve Sansweet's Star Wars: The Collector's Archive, released in 1999, and intended to be its spiritual successor. Page spread proof-of-concept (subject to change). Whether you're new to Hasbro's The Vintage Collection or a long-time collector, you'll find the book's easy to use layout an invaluable resource. With approximately 300 pages covering The Vintage Collection action figures, creatures, vehicles and playsets, entries include a detailed record of each item with crisp, high-resolution photos printed on premium-quality paper. Visual guide layout format (subject to change). Chapter breaks feature full-spread width photos inspired by classic Kenner-packaging, with a modern twist. Photos are meticulously created by renowned toy photographers. For those of you who grew up during the Kenner-era these nostalgia-laden photos will take you back to your childhood. Sample of a full spread-width chapter break (subject to change). If you're an action figure collector, a Star Wars fan or just an admirer of great toy photography, this book belongs on your shelf! Deluxe hardcover in an 9.25 x 11.5 inch (23.5 x 29.5 cm) format Professionally designed layout with easy to use reference guide featuring high-resolution photos and detailed write ups printed on premium quality paper Covers The Vintage Collection (TVC) 3.75-inch action figures, creatures, vehicles and playsets. Chapter breaks with full-page width photos inspired by classic Kenner-era packaging Additional content unlocked with stretch goals. Approximately 300 pages December 2019 delivery To help make The Vintage Collection Archive Edition a reality, we're offering a variety of perks for those interested in backing the project. Be sure to check out all of the unique options to support the campaign, including these special perks you won't find anywhere else! Signed Book Backer Receive a specially designed nameplate for your book hand-signed by the team including author Derryl DePriest and special contributor / Star Wars super-collector Steve Sansweet. Styled after a TVC cardback, the nameplate has a character pill where book owners can write in their name. Book nameplate signed by the authors (final design subject to change). Book + Compendium Poster Backer Photographed by Kim Simmons, photographer of the original "Collect All 92" Kenner card back (TheManWhoShotLukeSkywalker.net), this 24x36-inch The Vintage Collection compendium poster includes the complete lineup of 154 numbered The Vintage Collection action figures on the original yellow background used by Kim during his time as Kenner's principal Star Wars photographer between 1981 - 2000. The first 250 backers will receive an individually numbered poster with the option of having Kim sign the poster. Ships rolled. Kim Simmons behind the camera with the latest The Vintage Collection figures. Special Edition Vinyl Case Slipcover Backer Keep your book safe in a specially designed slipcover reminiscent of Kenner's classic Star Wars vinyl collector case. We've painstakingly recreated the original art of the 1978 Star Wars case using The Vintage Collection action figures and have included a special figure tray dust cover for your book. The first 250 backers of the Special Edition Vinyl Case Cover will receive a "handle" plate engraved First Edition that is also individually numbered 1-250. Special Edition Vinyl Case slipcover (final design subject to change). TIER 1 STRETCH GOALS Light Luke's lightsaber to unlock more content! The book will cover The Vintage Collection (TVC) 3.75-inch action figures, creatures, vehicles and playsets. There's so much more we'd like to include, but we'll need to meet stretch goals so we can add the pages required for the additional chapters. Here's the bonus content that can be unlocked for every backer of the book: $50,000 - FUNDED Thank the Maker: The Vintage Collection Archive Edition is fully funded. $60,000 - UNLOCKED We Shall Double Our Efforts: A chapter with comprehensive entries for Hasbro's Vintage Original Trilogy Collection (VOTC) and Vintage The Saga Collection (VTSC) action figures. $70,000 - UNLOCKED Don't Act so Surprised: A visual quick-reference, chronological timeline of The Vintage Collection action figures organized by release date / wave. $80,000 - UNLOCKED She May not Look Like Much, but She's got it Where it Counts: Special three-panel, fold-out entries for the Millennium Falcon and Jabba's Sail Barge vehicles. $90,000 - UNLOCKED You Know Better than to Trust a Strange Computer: Appendix with a card back matrix of all variants of U.S. The Vintage Collection action figure packaging such as foil logos, offer stickers, reverse-side artwork, etc. $100,000 - UNLOCKED What a Piece of Junk: Guide to all Hasbro The Vintage Collection promotional materials and giveaways including inserts, card backs, posters and more. TIER 2 STRETCH GOALS Impressive. Most impressive. But you are not a Jedi yet... Due to the overwhelming response, we've added a second tier of stretch goals, including a few that have been frequently requested since the campaign launched. Every backer of the book will receive the unlocked stretch goals, regardless of when you submitted your pledge. Thank you for your support! $110,000 - UNLOCKED So What I Told You was True� From a Certain Point of View: A chapter covering concepts, unrealized ideas and unproduced items that were discussed or considered to continue the TVC line beyond its hiatus in 2012. $125,000 - UNLOCKED You Don�t have to do this to Impress Me: A folio containing all of the full spread-width chapter break photographs individually printed on premium 8 x10-inch paper, free of the chapter titles and overlay text. There are currently a minimum of eight (8) chapter break photo spreads earmarked for the book. $150,000 - UNLOCKED The Circle is now Complete: Former Kenner photographer Kim Simmons will recreate his reverse-side masterpiece from the 1984 Star Wars is Forever mail-away poster using The Vintage Collection action figures and vehicles. The 18x22-inch poster comes folded in a mailer envelope, like the original. $175,000 - UNLOCKED Sorry About the Mess: A three (3) coin set featuring the Slave I, Jabba the Hutt, and Jabba's Sail Barge. Not only do these coins tell the story of Han Solo's journey from The Empire Strikes Back to Return of the Jedi, but the Slave I, Jabba, and Jabba's Barge have never had their own coins in either Kenner's Power of the Force or Hasbro's 30th Anniversary lines. They'll fit in perfectly with your existing coin collection. $200,000 - UNLOCKED No Reward is Worth This: All book backers will receive a digital version of Star Wars: The Vintage Collection Archive Edition as a companion to their print edition. Written by Derryl DePriest, former Vice President of Global Brand Management at Hasbro and Star Wars brand team leader overseeing development and design of The Vintage Collection line. Photographed and designed by Rich Alot and D. Martin Myatt, lifelong Star Wars collectors and contributors to the Star Wars photo archive on Rebelscum.com, one of the most comprehensive archives of modern-era Star Wars collectibles online. Foreword written by Steve Sansweet, President and CEO of Rancho Obi-Wan, a non-profit corporation using Star Wars collecting to educate and inspire. In addition to being the saga�s top collector�as Certified by Guinness World Records�Steve is a recognized authority on all things Star Wars, from the making and marketing of the movies and spin-offs to the activities of fans worldwide. Gather a diverse Alliance to win the Fairy Crown! We are excited to bring the stunning fairy world of Amy Brown to life with Fickle, a casual board game of fairy set collection. You have 5 rounds to win the Ritual of Ascendancy. Outwit your fellow players by manipulating their Fairy Cards. Choose a Fairy Family to gain its power and add it to your scoring Alliance. The winner must gather a single Fairy from each family, or "Shoot the Moon" to win with a single faction. All Stretch Goals and Add-ons are Unlocked! Craft each game to match your favorite play style; direct action, tableau building, card strategy and more. Fickle is unique, so you will play it again and again Press your Luck card dealing. Each round, you decide the order of your neighbor's cards. They must 'keep or pass' each card you stacked to find their Fairy ally. Lots of Fairy Powers! All featuring the renowned fairies of Amy Brown. Inverse scoring. To gain Favor points, you need one Fairy from each family. Additional Fairies hurt your score! But, you can risk those extra fae and try to build a Fairy Family so powerful that you 'Shoot the Moon' for the win. Broderick is an original crime noir story done as a comic book. Jack Broderick is a violent member of the 1940�s Chicago underworld who is out for revenge after the Chicago crime syndicate tries to bump him off. This Kickstarter is for issue 2 of a planned four issue run with the option of continuing the story in future 4-12 issue series. The Story Issue 2: Jack Broderick has returned to the windy city, health rapidly deteriorating, desperately trying to find answers to the ultimate question: who tried to have him killed? Haunted by his past choices, Jack has so-far found nothing but questions and ghosts of his past following him around the city. Issue 1: Jack wakes up, weak and riddled with radiation poisoning, in the army base hospital southeast of Socorro, New Mexico. With not much time left to live, and a score to settle, Jack heads back to the windy city to find the rats that did this to him and save what pieces are left of himself in the process. Who Will Enjoy Broderick? Fans of: Frank Miller�s Sin City Brian Azzarello's 100 Bullets Richard Stark�s Parker done by Darwyn Cooke Broderick is intended for a PG-13+ audience. Meet Spooky & The Truth... Spooky has been writing and performing as a solo artist and alongside other groups for over a decade and released his first collection of original songs in last year's "Wit of the Staircase". The entire album was recorded in his apartment, where he performed the majority of the instrumentation. He then set off on a summer of touring throughout the East Coast to promote it's release. While on the road, Spooky desired to perform his music as it was heard on the album, hoping that the audience would experience the songs as they were honestly meant to be. It was then that Spooky came upon "The Truth". Spooky's first album, "Wit of the Staircase" click photo to listen Spooky gathered some of the best session musicians in Philadelphia and not only introduced "The Truth" to Spooky's catalog, but also wrote a new collection of originals. Now that "The Truth" has set Spooky free, it's time to do it right. Mike Pontera (Vocals / Guitar) Spooky & The Truth create a smoky fusion of familiar pop elements with a personal strain of Americana that they coined, "City Folk". The Truth's minimal performance style is both intimate and powerful, bittersweet and inspiring. Spooky pens openhearted songs with lyrics that explore broad themes of innocence lost, mingled with stories of hope and redemption. It is only appropriate that this album be named after the music they create. "City Folk" offers, songs that are relatable and enjoyable by anyone today with a hauntingly familiar recollection of simpler times, be they real or imagined. Andrew "Chubbs" Nittoli (Piano / Drums) Tim Schilling (Lead Guitar / Vocals) Spooky & The Truth have partnered with the Philadelphia Recording Company to produce the first two "City Folk" singles. The Band has also committed to a month long European tour in support of the new Album. In this last year Spooky & The Truth have come far, but in order to finish the album and continue the journey we NEED YOUR HELP. Spooky @ Philadelphia Record Co. All that we have done to this point has been "DIY", everything from album art, to booking and promoting our shows, to screen-printing our own merch has been done by the band and team Spooky. We bring that same "DIY" mindset into the studio however, as independent artists that can get quite pricey. Spooky Sweatshirt Spooky Screen-Printing Spooky & The Truth have already put in a great deal of time and money into this project, and are perilously close to finishing, a mere $2,300. away from reaching our goal. With your donation we will be able to finish the recording process, cover the hefty cost of mixing and mastering, assist in physically and digitally distributing the album, and help us support "City Folk" along our way to a town (or country) near you. Schedule: 5/17/2019 - Kickstarter Launch 6/7/2019 - Release of First Single 6/16/2019 - Kickstarter ENDS 7/5/2019 - Release of Second Single 8/16/2019 - Release of full album "City Folk" 9/2/2019 - Kickstarter Rewards are distributed June-August/2019 - North American Performances September-October/2019 - European Performances Spooky & The Truth (behind the scenes) We want to show how much we appreciate your donation no matter how large or small, in order to do so we are offering rewards for almost any denomination. Check out some of the rewards and pick out the one that fits best. When we reach our goal of $2,300 all physical Kickstarter rewards are scheduled to ship on 9/2/2019. Blurb: Michelle always knew the head cheerleader who stole her boyfriend was demonic. She just didn�t realize Janice was an actual demon. And that�s not even the most interesting revelation of Michelle�s eighteenth birthday�also, coincidentally, prom night. She also learns that she is a half-angel warrior. And nothing could make for a more satisfying birthday-prom than sending that demon cheerleader straight back to hell. Then she discovers that her parents didn�t die when she was 16, after all. They�re alive, and they need her help. What else is a half-angel warrior to do? She heads out to kick some demon ass. Lucky for her, she�s also got her best friend Jonathan by her side. But there are still things she doesn�t know�not only about this hidden world she�s discovered, but about Jonathan himself. And those things could kill her if she isn�t careful. I need help paying an editor I found to publish this bad boy! I'm currently on summer vacation because I'm a substitute teacher. Also, I'm unemployed until I receive gallbladder surgery. Nobody wants to hire me because I'd have to take 2-3 weeks off to recover. In the meantime, I'm trying to write this story and hoping to have it published soon. Break down of where the funds will go: $50 will go to my editor. The money received from shipping & handling will go toward sending out autographed paperbacks. Your help would mean the world to me. This would be my third published story. I have been slowly building a fan-base and I'd hate to deprive them of this story that I've written! Thank you in advance! You guys rock!

Polyfold is excitedly in the midst of coordinating the next five month cycle of our monthly concert series, Polyfold Presents, taking place from September 2019-January 2020. Launched in the Fall of 2017, Polyfold Presents has remained a cornerstone of our efforts toward creating an open platform for musicians to present new works. Coordinating five months of these concerts means booking the venue, Scholes Street Studio, deciding on and asking guest artists and their projects to participate, pairing those projects with Polyfold member projects, and of course funding - this is where we need your help. Polyfold is a grassroots, artist-led 501(c)(3) non-profit organization based in Brooklyn that helps create opportunities for improvising musicians to present creative works. With a core membership of five musicians, Polyfold produces concerts, recordings, and workshops in an effort to serve the broader experimental art community, celebrating open mindedness, honest expression and human connection. Our monthly concert series takes place in Brooklyn at Scholes Street Studio and provides an opportunity for two ensembles to present new, creative music with no expectations regarding aesthetic boundaries or commercial appeal. For each concert, one ensemble is led by a Polyfold member and the other by a guest invited by that member. Guitarist Jessica Ackerley and saxophonist Michael Attias performing at Polyfold Presents Our last six months of concerts were privately fundraised, which allowed us to introduce guaranteed payment for musicians, cover our venue rental fee, and cover our online promotion budget. The results of this financial help translated very clearly into a new level of artistic quality and diversity in our programming. In order for Polyfold�s goal of presenting new, experimental music from our brilliant musical community to continue, we need your support. Contributing to a concert series wholeheartedly dedicated to original work is not just an investment in one or even five concerts - it�s the planting of a seed for creators and audiences alike that will flower into continuously better, deeper work. Contributions made to this kickstarter campaign are tax-deductible donations. On behalf of the audiences and musicians involved in our series, and the members of Polyfold, we humbly thank you for choosing to bring this kind of artistic freedom into the future. Learn more about Polyfold at www.polyfold.org

Introducing Wordy! From parents in Brooklyn who were looking for a way to introduce their daughter to words, comes Wordy. A new educational toy line that focuses on bilingual learning products for children ages 2-5yrs. Wordy is a toy company of the times providing hands-on, no-tech toys with a bilingual focus. The Wordy EnSALADa We are raising production capital for The Wordy EnSALADa. The EnSALADa is a 28pc taco salad inspired play food set. Each piece features Wordy�s unique double-sided design feature with English on one side and Spanish on the other (more languages to come). The set promotes healthy eating habits by making a salad fun! It also provides an engaging cultural learning opportunity by exposing children to new foods or reinforcing the ones they already know. Read Your Vegetables! 28 pieces of double-sided learning fun! **"plato hondo" will be closer together in the final product** The Wordy Mission It is our mission to create a World of Words where kids learn to love words, languages and cultures through engaging toys that fill their environment. The Wordy Story Wordy was born out of the need to provide an engaging way for our daughter, Anayah, to interact with words. We started labeling her toys around the house but the problem was that she would peel them off or try to eat them! So we thought there must be toys that come labeled and much to our surprise there was nothing out there with this concept. So I took matters into my own hands and made something myself! It all started with a ball...that Anayah quickly "un"labeled. The Wordy Process As a director/actor I did not have much, let's say any, experience in toy making but what I lacked in experience I made up for with hard work. I spent the first few months of the process researching everything I could about the toy industry, safety regulations, possible competition, manufacturing, design...EVERYTHING! I have art and design training which finally paid off! After a few months, I settled on a few designs, the first being the puzzles. Me hand painting the first prototypes and Anayah playing/testing them for function. We learned a lot. Mainly...she loved them!! The Wordy Puzzles Wordy's first products were double-sided animal puzzles available in English/Spanish, English/French and English/Mandarin. They come in sets of three with cute little cloth storage bags that have phonetic pronunciation guides on them. A LOT was learned from the process of creating these puzzles and getting them to market. The puzzles have been a great way for us to build a network of enthusiastic bilingual parents and educators. You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00 The Wordy Sea in English/French The Wordy Safari in English/Mandarin Why a Wordy Kickstarter? It is Wordy's mission to create a true World of Words where Wordy expands to have a large selection of hands-on print rich toys. Toys that will be culturally inclusive and speak to kids and parents in different markets. Kickstarter is the perfect platform to help expand Wordy. There is a built in global community that is looking to support innovative ideas and products like the Wordy Ensalada. The funds we will raise on the campaign will be to place our initial inventory order of the Wordy Ensalada. We need to place the order in early July in order to have them in stock by November for the holiday season. We will also use funds to development our pipeline of products. More to Come... With so many languages spoken and parents hungry for educational products for their children, the possibilities with Wordy are endless! We plan on widely expanding our product offerings to include as many languages and different toys as we can. We have made the decision to offer the EnSALADa in English and Spanish because we want to honor and respect the culture and people that inspired the set. The EnSALADa may not translate as well for a Hindi speaking family but there is a product that will. Wordy is committed to developing and building a line of products where parents and kids will find engaging product that speak to them and recognizes their cultural uniqueness. Wordy Kickstarter Exclusives "Read Your Vegetables" Kids' T-shirt "Read Your Vegetables" Deluxe Tote Bag Thank you!!! Thank you so much for contributing to our Kickstarter campaign! We are looking forward to building a World of Words with your support!

Since the release of my previous album, Before The Bright Lights, I decided to lean more into my role as a father and a husband by taking a break from performing and traveling. Since that time I've experienced several life changing events that caused me to stop and reevaluate just what messages I want to convey as an artist and songwriter. Writing personal songs has always been a challenge and I've felt uncomfortable with the idea that anyone would care about what it's like to live in a blended family or the mixed emotions you find when you realize you've got a little less hair and a lot more wrinkles. But over the last 3 years I began writing more personal songs and slowly started sharing them. To my surprise I've found that there seems to be a deeper connection with the listener the more I share them. Being vulnerable can be scary when sharing personal stories and even more when asking folks to believe enough to invest in them. So I am taking a leap of faith and asking you to believe in these songs as much as I do. Each one of the songs mark a significant milestone in my life over the last 3 years and are more honest than I thought I would ever be. They represent who I am now and The Man I Thought I'd Never Be. Later this year I hope to head back into the studio and record an EP titled The Man I Thought I'd Never Be. I'm looking forward to working with Jimmy Smith once again at Clubmen Studio (www.clubmenstudio.com). Jimmy played an important role in helping produce my last album and I believe with his help, and your financial support, this album and these songs will have a lasting impact. We have secured the same talented group of musicians as the previous album as well as a couple new faces who have been gracious enough to come along for this next project. As you may be aware, recording an album at the highest quality can be expensive and this is where you play a pivotal role. I'm asking that you partner with me to help carry these songs from the spare bedroom in my home and release them into the world. If you've pledged previously this is your opportunity to continue to support the work that I do and the songs that I write. I�m asking you to partner with me in support of your belief that the songs I write do have a place in this world. The money raised during this campaign will be used to cover the following costs: Production - Production is comprised of a lot of different components but the majority of production falls under the umbrella of Engineering, Recording and Mixing. These components all work together to give each song a cohesive sound prior to the mastering process. The production phase takes the vision the artist has for the song and brings it to life. Studio Musicians - It takes great musicians to make great music! In order for each song to reach it's highest potential it requires the skill of excellent musicians. We have secured the same core group of musicians as my previous album that all share the same vision for my songs. Mastering - I have lined up the incredibly talented Nathan Dantzler, (www.thehitlab.com), once again to complete the mastering process for this album. Nathan has worked on projects for artists such as Niall Horan, Ellie Goulding, Kelsea Ballerini, Thomas Rhett, Ryan Hurd and Jon Foreman. He is a 2x Grammy award winner and I was lucky enough to have him master my previous album. Album Artwork - Rusty Hein serves as Resident Artist and Creative Director for Renew The Arts. He holds a BFA from the University of Central Florida and has agreed to lend his talents to the visual aesthetic of the album. Kickstarter Fees - As you may be aware Kickstarter assesses a 5% fee for the utilization of their crowdfunding platform which is deducted from the overall amount of collected in the event of a successful campaign. (If the campaign is unsuccessful no one is charged.) CD Duplication - I will be utilizing WTS media (www.wtsmedia.com) for the manufacturing of a limited run of CDs. WTS is locally owned and allows for a quicker turnaround time. Postage & Rewards - I've intentionally set aside a portion of the budget to cover the cost of postage as well as rewards. So Why Pledge Sooner Than Later? Research shows that there is a greater chance of a successful Kickstarter campaign when support is strongest in the beginning. By pledging sooner than later there is more of a possibility that Kickstarter will boost the campaign to the main page which could result in a higher probability of not only meeting the goal but surpassing it. By pledging sooner than later you're allowing others to see that you believe in the work I do which could result in exposure to an audience that I normally would not have access too. You have the opportunity to not only financially support this album but also serve as a conduit for potential backers. Will You Help Me Paint My Guitar in Less than 25 days! As the pledges come in we can track the progress by painting the guitar below. You'll have a visual representation of the impact you're support is making. Take A Listen! Below are rough demos of the songs that will be featured.

For more than twenty years, I have worked as an accountant, and since 2000, my husband and I have been baking cakes. These two skills � accounting and baking � may seem disparate, but they are to me the keys to unlocking a brighter future, one defined by independence and self-sufficiency. Let me give you a little bit of background on myself. I am 45 years old, and I live in Miami. We all believe in working hard and living honestly, and all our three children have made us very proud as they have matured and grown into healthy, capable adults. Recently, we have started to talk in earnest about expanding our cake baking business. This started out as a hobby for us, but over the years, we have developed a strong global network of customers who love what we cook up. Now, we would like to open a cake shop of our own, bringing the same pride and passion for which we have become known to a brick-and-mortar store right in Miami. I plan to call our shop Cakes by Louisa, a name that many people in the area will already recognize because of our ties within the community. Currently, 90% of our customers order from us more than once. This shows tremendous promise for what we can do, but to get started, we need your help. Our Fundraising Goal We are turning to you, Kickstarter, for help raising $10,000, which will cover the costs of launching our cake shop and then expanding our customer base. Every dollar toward our goal helps, and to show our appreciation for your generosity, we are offering thank-you notes, free cakes, and free catering. Other Ways You Can Help Beyond making a monetary contribution to this campaign, you can help us by sharing a link to our campaign on any social media platforms you use. Spread the word about our cake shop � especially to those who may have tasted one of our cakes in the past. I appreciate your support greatly!

My name is Alice Mao and I�m a 17 year old high school student and avid artist. With my partner Taylor Wang, 15, we�ve gathered funding and momentum around our latest project: an art show, featuring the work of other student artists like ourselves. We're planning to use the funds from this Kickstarter to help pay for the shipping of artists' works, and framing. We already have a space secured, and supplies for hanging and displaying works. The goal of this project is to make this show as accessible as possible-- No submission fees, no shipping fees, no printing fees for digital work. Just young artists coming together to make something special. We�ve already received a $950 grant that we're planning to use towards shipping and have just posted our call for artists, and the response has been overwhelming. Thanks to the sweeping wave of support, we have achieved most of our goal already. We only need $500 of funding to top it off. This is a non-profit event, and we are working as volunteers to put on this show because we know, as young artists ourselves, that we would really appreciate this sort of show. It�s often events like these early in artists� careers that give them confidence and propel them forwards. Student Art Spaces is the brainchild of Alice and Taylor. We met in our high school AP Art class, and just kept on running into each other. Eventually, Taylor texted me about an idea she had for a teen art show. At that time, it was just us and our prior experience in art. With no real guidance to follow, we took advantage of any resources we could find, such as local art museums and galleries. Our motivation was our trust in each other and confidence in our abilities�plus a little help from the Internet. Our first contact was my art teacher, Ruthie, who offered us a space at Seattle Artist League. The next order of business was getting the word out. By utilizing Instagram and Facebook, we promoted our competition online, as well as running ads and making physical flyers. It hasn�t been easy�With school commitments and extracurriculars pulling us in all different directions, it�s been a stressful few weeks. However, we�re confident in this project's success. We�ve had to learn a lot of things about business, marketing, and organization, and right now is an exciting time for us ripe with prospects. For more info, check out our website, at https://www.studentartspaces.com/ Taylor and I are excited to review submissions as the last ones trickle in during the coming weeks. We want to give underprivileged artists a chance to shine, without having to worry about the costs. It's going to be exciting to curate all the artwork. However, we also spent hours researching grants, filling out applications, and doing all the behind-the-scenes work that isn't so pretty. We are both very capable individuals who are determined to succeed, so please take a moment to support young artists on the rise!

Thanks to Bleeding Cool for the Shoutout!: https://www.bleedingcool.com/2019/06/09/george-jeanty-superhero-sketchbook/ Let's Print Georges' Sketchbook (2019 Edition) Comics Artist Georges Jeanty GEORGES is an Eisner Award-winning, New York Times bestselling comic book illustrator, whose first major work was Marvel Comics� BISHOP: THE LAST X-MAN (1999). Currently, his work can be seen in AGE OF X-MAN: THE X-TREMISTS, part of Marvel�s �Enter the Age of X-Man� story arc. Along with his work on many Marvel and DC Comics titles, Georges is known for the critically acclaimed, sixties-era graphic novel THE AMERICAN WAY (2006) written by Oscar-winning screenwriter John Ridley and published by DC Comics, its sequel THE AMERICAN WAY: THOSE ABOVE AND THOSE BELOW (2017), and being a regular artist for Dark Horse Comics� official continuation of BUFFY THE VAMPIRE SLAYER and SERENITY (2007-2018). While you may have seen his work in your local comic book shop or bookstore, not everybody is lucky enough to live near a comic-con and get their hands on an original sketch or a collection of his work. That's why - for the first time in OVER A DECADE, he's decided to collect 46 of his most amazing sketches so that anyone can get their hands on them. The purpose of this campaign is to raise enough funds to print and ship the sketchbook and other rewards. Georges has brought so many great stories to life, including "Buffy," "Serenity," and "Batwoman." Who is Helping Georges with This Project? Hi, there! We are Kaba Lounge - the digital home and hub of all things Georges. We curate his online artwork, communicate with fans on social media, and create sweet merch - including this amazing sketchbook. If you're a fan of Georges or any of the dozens of characters he's brought to life, then consider yourself a member of the Lounge, too! Collectively, Lounge members have backed a bunch of kickstarter projects, and some of us have run successful campaign for comics and other fun stuff, for which Georges has generously contributed time, energy, and even original art. Why Now? In recent years, Georges has printed a few specialty sketchbooks to sell at cons, like the ones focused specifically on his work for the "Buffy" and "Serenity" franchises. But it's been over a decade since he's collected a variety of his work into a sketchbook that reflects his interests across the comics and sci-fi spectrum. Having seen the treasure trove of original art he's kept over the years, we feel like this 46-page sketchbook isn't only long overdue, it's also just the tip of the iceberg. Dedicated "Buffy" and "Serenity" Sketchbooks from Recent Years So, What's In This Sketchbook? Inside this 46-page sketchbook, you'll find a curated selection of Georges' masterful musings from the past decade or more. Each page will feature one amazing sketch that fills up the entire page. Below is just a small sample of the pieces that Georges plans to include... Sketchbook Cover and many more... What Other Rewards Can I Get? But why stop at the sketchbook, right? This is a Kickstarter campaign after all, and you expect some pretty amazing rewards. Well, Georges has 'em! Backers at different levels (described to the right of this page) will receive the following awesome pieces, depending on backer level. Original Comic Pages Comic book artists get to keep the original artwork they draw for comic books, whether those are covers or interior pages - and Georges has tons of amazing pieces! Early backers at the $250 level will receive an original comic art page, in addition to their sketchbook and other rewards. But hurry - Georges is only offering a limited number of these! Original Sketches INSIDE Your Sketchbook For backers at the $100 level, Georges will create an original sketch inside the front cover of your sketchbook! Artists like Georges typically sell these types of sketches in person at conventions, but for fans who can't always make it to a con, this is a great way to get your hands on original artwork. These will typically be a bust, and YOU get to choose the character! Limited-Edition Prints Backers at the $75 level will get a limited-edition 8x10 signed print of one of Georges' drawings. We don't know which drawing this will be yet - maybe we'll put it to a vote during the campaign, and let YOU decide! Stickers and Bookmarks Backers at the $40 level will receive a sticker and a bookmark, custom-made for this sketchbook campaign. Georges will only print one run of these, so they are destined to become collectors' items. Please Share! If you like Georges' work, please share this project's link on your social media: https://qrgo.page.link/Dj42M And visit us at Kaba Lounge here: https://kabalounge.com/kaba/ Or on social media: Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/kabalounge/ Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/KabaLounge/ Twitter: https://twitter.com/kabalounge

I decided to get some help on this next project instead of trying to fund it all myself! ** You will not be charged until the campaign is over and it is fully funded!!
