Many of us have experienced the frustration of trying to look at our mobile device while being outside, but couldn't see anything because it's so bright out. Users of mobile phone devices are actively being outdoor and using their phones more than ever, a phone display with improved outdoor viewability is not only wanted but essential to many. Despite this compelling need, the $500MM/year screen overlay market in the US and phone manufacturers worldwide have no answer. Therefore we want to start the Eclipse Display Enhancer project � to enhance user experience, one display at a time. Our team in Eclipse project consists of experts in thin film coating. We have engineered, manufactured and operated production equipment across solar, display and aerospace industries. We have developed a breakthrough in anti-reflection coating that is not only able to significantly reduce unwanted reflection but also durable enough to withstand the rigorous requirements of cell phone daily uses. Anti-reflection optic works to cancel reflected light similarly to how active noise-canceling headphone reduces ambient noise � through wave interference. Active noise-canceling headphone doesn�t block noise, but rather analyze and inject ambient noise in opposite direction, so that they cancel each other out when hitting your ear drums. Similarly, Eclipse utilizes a phenomenon in which light speed changes as it travels through different optical mediums, and precisely arranges multiple layers of Silicon Nitride, and Silicon Oxide such that the light waves reflected from the top and bottom of the optical stack cancel each other out. Eclipse Optical Interference The Silicon Nitride in Eclipse is among the hardest materials on Earth, behind only diamond, and is on par with Sapphire. The ion source plasma technology we developed is the secret sauce behind the ability to produce this material commercially. Eclipse Plasma Eclipse is proudly Made in USA and manufactured entirely in our facility in Tucson, Arizona. Eclipse Production Through Eclipse, we hope to disrupt the screen overlay market and raise the bar for outdoor viewability to display manufacturers around the world. The below photo is an iPhone X with top half equipped with Eclipse vs bottom half with standard glass screen protector iPhone X + Eclipse (top half)

MY STORY Some of my earliest memories of art are tied to my mother. I used to beg Mom to draw or paint things for me, and then give her my "constructive criticisms" until one day she said to me, "Lane... why don't you just go ahead and draw this yourself." I'd say that was the day my journey as an artist officially began. A inspirational aspect of this journey centered around a man who also had a close and loving relationship with his mother- Bob Ross. It was my Mother who introduced me to the man who, for me, has become an absolute legend and inspiration. Although my dreams once centered around creating art for a living, my life has taken a different path and drawing, painting and visual art have all taken on the role of occasional hobby. I have frequently struggled with making art a part of my weekly and even daily routine. As an adult (thanks in large part to Amazon Prime), Bob Ross has found his way back into my life. I began watching again as a form of pure enjoyment and relaxation, as well as way to introduce my daughter (now just over 1 year old) to one of my boyhood heroes. However, one thing I never realized about Bob is that he's dangerous, and if you're not careful, he just might get you inspired, motivated and digging your paints out of the closet. One day, I'd had enough and couldn't fight the urge any longer. I rummaged through some old totes, found a stack of canvases I had neglected, threw together some acrylic paints and said, "What the heck?! Let's get to it!" The fury that ensued was incredibly addictive and I had found the "joy of painting." I also found some frustration. While trying to accomplish certain techniques and effects, I realized were almost impossible as Bob famously used oils and a "wet-on-wet" technique, which allows painters to accomplish incredible things very easily and quickly. This is where you find me TODAY! Looking into beginning my journey with oils (which I've always found intimidating). After taking a look at the cost to get up and running I thought, as most artists do, I'd ask for your support and your patronage! After a little brainstorming, I came up with some rewards that I hope you will find a worthy return of your investment in an artist ready to bloom! MY PLAN After reaching my goal, I will be purchasing all things Bob Ross, including: -The Bob Ross 2-in-1 easel -Full Set of Bob Ross Oil Paints -Full Bob Ross Landscape Brush Set (see Brush Buddies backer level for more details) -The Bob Ross large French Style Pallet -The Bob Ross cleaning system -Full Bob Ross base coat set (liquid white, liquid clear, black gesso) -Value pack of 18"x 24" canvases (see Happy Trees backer level for more details on how a painting can be yours!) Once I have all of my tools at the ready, the painting will begin and I be joining Bob in earnest on the Journey Through the Joy of Painting, going through each episode, learning techniques from Bob and using those techniques to create original pieces along the way. For all backers, exclusive access (backers only) to an Instagram account will be given to follow the adventure as I go, hopefully inspiring you to pick up some paints and start creating, yourself... I want to test Bob's theory... if I can do this, you can too, and we'll know his words are true... MY THANKS Before I even begin, I want to give thanks to all of you who will send support my way. My hope is that you will see this as a small investment in the future of my artistic endeavor to learn a new technique and skill, taking you along the journey with me, as I try to keep my passion for art alive and pass it on to my children, my wife, and anyone else willing to say "What the heck?!" and jump into the joy that Bob has illuminated for us all. Here's to the journey and my thanks! Lane Smith

Playascope is an experimental short film that aims to visually create what it really feels like to be on the playa - magical :) To make sure Playascope is possible, I have made my initial funding ask the minimum required to create this film, however, a short film of this quality would realistically cost $50-100k to make. This film can't be made if it's not funded! Why I'm called to make a film about the Playa: The playa is the foundation, the support of all that is Burning Man. This project is a celebration of the natural world, creation, collaboration, and education. In many ways Playascope is the natural continuation of Lake of Dreams. The success of Lake of Dreams has had a huge impact on my work as an artist. It has supported my belief that there is a space for lyrical documentary work that explores the magic of the natural world, and how that magic manifests through art and creative action. While Lake of Dreams primarily explored how the art and creative cycle of Burning Man exists within a lake bed that in itself is an extraordinary natural phenomenon, Playascope will turn the lens to explore aspects of what makes experiencing this phenomenon so powerful. My goal is to open the doors of perception as it were, and trigger the subtle layers of feeling that connect us to the natural world and inspire us to create. I will be experimenting with timelapse, film, and aerials. The first project I crowdfunded on Kickstarter in 2013 became my short film, Lake of Dreams. If you haven�t seen or heard of Lake of Dreams, it is my pleasure to share it with you. It is the best example of what can come of your support, and how your contribution can ripple out into the world :) LAKE OF DREAMS LAKE OF DREAMS IN THE SMITHSONIAN An updated edit of Lake of Dreams is included in the Smithsonian�s exhibition, No Spectators: The Art of Burning Man, which first opened in the Renwick Gallery in April 2018 and is now touring the country to the Cincinnati Art Museum and the Oakland Museum of California! Renwick Gallery with Banner Image courtesy of Roy Two Thousand Timelapse still from Lake of Dreams Projection Installation Nora Atkinson using my photo in her TED talk about Burning Man Lake of Dreams on the Smithsonian website: https://americanart.si.edu/videos/roy-two-thousand-lake-dreams-timelapse-video-installation-2017-18-156852 One of my still photographs of the playa was used for the Banner for the Smithsonian exhbition at the Renwick Gallery, and was also used in the Smithsonian TED talk. Footage from Lake of Dreams was used in: The Art of Burning IMAX film Dear Guardians - A Burning Man Short Film: https://vimeo.com/101272130 Amplify Her: https://amplifyher.com Dr Megavolt: From Geek to Superhero Oprah Winfrey's Belief Series I believe in the Burning Man Principles and I hope that whatever I capture and create for Playascope can be as much of a creative resource to the community as Lake of Dreams has been. MAKING PLAYASCOPE Roy Two Thousand making Lake of Dreams at Burning Man 2013 Playascope is building on my experience of making Lake of Dreams from conception to completion. One thing I learned from making Lake of Dreams is that my own dreams need more focused direction, and while I can bring all of my ideas to life, I can�t do everything at once. My funding goal is simply to be able to pay for travel, gear, and cover my basic needs so I can dedicate the time and creative energy necessary to make this film. Any funds exceeding my funding goal will go directly towards creating the full vision I have for Playascope, including Playascope Live, a Playascope VR experience, and Burning Man 2019! The film will be submitted to film festivals such as SF Film, Nevada City, and SXSW. It will also be released to the public where everyone can stream it on Vimeo and Youtube ad-free. THE EXPERIENCE Every timelapse is a collaboration with nature. The sun and moon, clouds and stars, rain and rainbows, dust, and shadows are my partners in this process. I try to incorporate Reflection, Meditation, and Connection in all my timelapse, film, and music processes. My goal is to bring the qualities of magic and timelessness to my work by incorporating these elements along with the environmental elements that I'm capturing. TIMELINE April 2019 - Pre-production and planning. May 2019 - Kickstarter campaign begins June 2019 - Kickstarter campaign ends June - October 2019 - Filming October - December 2019 - Timelapse processing + Post Production + Music Composition January - April 2020 - Music Recording + Film Editing + Mastering May 2020 - Playascope film complete! June 2020 - Playascope Live! BUDGET Bringing Playascope to fruition will require time, equipment, transportation, and camping: 1 month playa camping/RV rental (1 complete moon cycle) = $5,000 Recording studio time, engineers, musicians = $5,000 Equipment costs = $5,000 The budget is adjusted upward for costs I will have to pay for after the crowdfunding campaign: Prints and shipping costs = 10-15% of total raised Kickstarter and credit card fees = 8-10% of total raised In total, $17k is the minimum needed to make this happen. Beyond $17k and I can spend more towards additional equipment, adding layers to the Playascope experience! For reference: Lake of Dreams cost over $30k to make. $10k of that came from my Kickstarter campaign (after fees and rewards fulfillment), and the other $20k was out of pocket. My films are passion projects! I volunteer my time and labor, and I spend my own money to create them for everyone to enjoy for free :) This crowdfunding campaign covers the bare minimum cost of making Playascope happen! REWARDS Playascope Live Playascope will be a film of original footage and music, but it will also be the seed for Playascope live! One of the ways I want to go deeper with this project is by creating a Playascope live musical concert, performed in sync to an extended collection of footage from the Playascope film, projected in visual accompaniment to the music. Mogli has played drums and percussion on both The Fertile Desert and Lake of Dreams soundtracks, and we will be recording drums on the Playa for Playascope! https://www.themogli.com Mogli will also play live drums for Playascope Live! Playascope Live Backers will receive: 2 tickets to the debut performance A high quality video export of the visuals set to the music An art print made just for Playascope Live backers! Mogli in the studio recording drums for Lake of Dreams Timelapse Workshops Many of you know that I�m an educator and have taught digital film making and various film, motion graphics, and audio production classes for over 10 years, so for Kickstarter I have made several opportunities to share my skills and techniques! Black Rock Desert - Saturday, June 22, 2019 San Francisco - dates TBD in September/October, 2019 6-8 hour workshop, groups no larger than 10 people Things we'll cover: Tools of the trade and which equipment works best for certain situations Photography exposure basics Photography exposure related to timelapse capture Best settings, intervals, and lenses for timelapsing different scenes and environments of daylight, clouds, fog, night sky, sunrise, sunset, people, cars, etc. Motion control timelapse setup and techniques using Dynamic Perception's Stage Zero and Stage R Hyperlapse equipment, processes, and techniques Caring for your gear while capturing in dynamic and extreme weather situations True Limited Edition Prints! 8� x 10� and 16� x 20� sizes available. Printed by a local printer who is also an artist: https://youtu.be/ijhT_o4VsV0 Giclee art prints are printed using Epson's archival pigmented inks, which are guaranteed not to fade for at least 100+ years, on a 100% cotton rag, museum quality, acid-free, archival bright white fine art paper. Prints are smudge resistant, long lasting, and fade resistant! Securely packaged using an acid free plastic sleeve, and shipped inside a protective flat, stiff envelope or cardboard. You can choose between these prints from the Playa, Burning Man, Lake of Dreams, my timelapse adventures, or from Playascope when it is released. Each print is hand signed and limited to 100 copies total and forever! Burning Man Prints are only available to backers during crowdfunding! ~~~~~~~ Black Rock Desert and Burning Man: Razorback Milky Way Sunset Razorback Orion Moonrise Love The Temple Space Whale Lighthouse Sunset La Victorola Magic Sunrise Dust White Ocean Razorback Milky Way Playascope One Black Rock Sunrise Still Available from Lake of Dreams: Temple of Whollyness Playa Lightning Black Rock City Sunrise Heart Temple The Node Believe Truth is Beauty Truth is Sunrise Truth is Rainbow Balloon Chain Magic Temple of Whollyness Burn Still Available from The Fertile Desert: Walking Man The Man and the Moon San Francisco: Transamerica Sunset Bay Bridge Moonset Golden Gate Crescent Golden Gate Moonsets Golden Gate Lunar Eclipse SF Crescent Moonrise Bay Lights Crescent Moonrise Arizona: El Capitan Moonrise ABOUT Filmmaker + Timelapse Artist Roy Two Thousand is a filmmaker and musician from the San Francisco Bay Area who explores the energetic nature of being through sound and visual elements. By pairing film and timelapse photography with original music compositions, he creates multimedia experiences that amplify natural acts of transcendental motion, and provide an immersive portal to a creative world inspiring love and light, community and compassion, and hope for the future. His work has appeared in Oprah�s Belief series as well as Genius by Stephen Hawking. His lyrical short documentary, Lake of Dreams, received a Vimeo Staff Pick and over a million plays in under a year. An updated version of Lake Of Dreams was featured in the Smithsonian�s Renwick Gallery as a video projection installation. The exhibition titled �No Spectators, The Art of Burning Man� opens in the Cincinnati Art Museum in April 2019 and The Oakland Museum in October of 2o19. Educator + Storyteller As an educator and artist Roy is passionate about creating immersive narratives that bring an experience to life and inspire empathy while dissolving barriers to understanding. Wisdom of the heart and knowledge of the mind join with a passion for technology and pushing the boundaries of what can be. From building the hyperlapse robot used to capture the moving timelapses in Lake of Dreams, to challenging his students to think �Beyond the Screen,� Roy creates tools for the imagination, and translates technology and the technical challenges of production to an adventure into the imagination. roy2k.com

Misu-Misu is an original animated, short film that tells the story of an exceptional cat's life and the people who loved her. Misu-Misu promises to deliver a light-hearted short film that covers the joy and loss of having a pet in your life. The world feels heavy at the moment. There are very heavy topics that we could be covering instead but in response to the anxiety that the world can sometimes bring, Misu-Misu delivers a light but important piece of life that many of us can relate with. Our pets are a welcomed distraction from a complex world to a simple one, one of unconditional love. We've chosen to keep all of our rewards digital so that we can put all of the money we raise into production. Although we love rewards as much as anyone, the work needed to source and send out physical items would take time away from production and our team isn't big enough to support that. We do promise that the digital rewards are awesome!!

Cover Art: Issue #2 "Checkmate" The climax to the Guardians of Acure's epic battle against General WheezeNCoughuus and his Nobreath Army from the Nicotini Wastelands of Emphysemmahh! THE VISION/GOAL The Goal of the STEM-based super hero franchise is to make it exciting and fun to learn about science, technology, engineering and mathematics. The objective is to entertain and inspire readers to possibly pioneer future medical breakthroughs in their adult lives. For hospital patients suffering from disease or difficult medical conditions, the franchise serves as a torch of positive thinking to help psychologically combat their medical setbacks through digital media, and action figures. For families dealing with health issues of a loved one, it can serve as a supplemental source of information to educate and create meaningful dialog between patients and their doctors. This G.O.A. learning experience is based on medical, scientific and historic fact. The story lines are based on actual medical cases. Families allowed us to interview them as they shared their experiences. Story lines will include: Sickle Cell Disease - The HemoGoblin Diabetes - The Diabeasts Leukemia - Acutetuus and the Evil Legion of Leukemiatnahh Asthma - General WheezeNcoughuss and The Nobreath Army Other story lines revolve around: Hepatitis C, Cystic Fibrosis, Lupus, Autism, Asperger's Syndrome, Alzheimer's, Breast Cancer, Multiple Sclerosis and more... The GOA digital comic book development has the support of a impressive roster of medical-science researchers and practitioners, who give input to insure medical accuracy and serve as Subject Matter Experts. The goal of the franchise is to achieve international distribution to every 2nd - 12th grader and up in the civilized world. Translations in English, Spanish, Japanese, Arabic, Hindi, Cantonese, Portuguese, German and French are underway for a late 2019 release. COMIC BOOK PRODUCTION FUNDING: $225,000 ($18,750 per issue penciling, inking, colorization, translations and editing) $25,000 (Upgraded computer equipment (3 workstations, 3D printer for action figure prototyping, and Radeon RX Vega 56 graphics processor with 8GB of HBM2 memory. $70,000 (Marketing, Promotions, Advertising, Comicon/SXSW exhibits, Travel). $30,000 Subject Matter Expert Consulting/Video Interviews ($2,500 per issue (12). THE CHALLENGES Our challenge is clear. To meet the release deadline of the Guardians of Acure comic book series by Sept 1, 2019, we must secure funding by July 1, 2019. It takes 8 weeks to produce each issue (6 weeks penciling, inking, color) and (2 weeks for video/content editing). However, because the base scripts for all 12 issues are complete, 2 issues can be produced in 10 weeks, 3 in 12 weeks etc. Once an issue completes the penciling phase and moves to inking, issue two can begin penciling. HARDSHIPS Even though we are accepting Pre-Orders via the website, the stress of trying to secure funding for production is a clear and risky challenge. Also, funding is critical for new computer equipment. Numerous program crashes occurred due to a crippling lack of memory to support robust graphics files. Creativity at times was limited by available RAM. THE OUTLOOK The interaction with the public introducing the series via exhibits, and connections through Linkedin with medical organizations (Alameda Health System, Seton Medical Center, Cincinnati Children's Hospital Medical Center) and others, confirm that once we are confidently able to release the products, the market is there to purchase.

Jessica Sgambelluri by Paul B Goode POSSESSED? How else to create + fund a dance about a trance state called Morso D�Amore? Caterina Rago and CRDance Company ask for your help now, pronto, to create: 1. A major new work called Morso D�Amore that upends the classic tarantella, a dance rooted in the traditions of Southern Italy during the 15th to 17th centuries, and is destined to become a significant contemporary work premiering in the USA in 2020. �To cure the body of the poisonous bite of the tarantula, it was said that three or four days of dancing in a trance-like state would relieve the body of physical and psychological trauma. In Morso D�Amore (Bite of Love), the dance is imagined as a state of ecstasy or rebellion, recalling a strange imprisonment. A cycle of capture and release is at hand in this complex work that crosses global cultures and examines both personal and political crisis. 2. Help fund the re-launch of CRDance Company, LLC. Founded by Artistic Director and Choreographer Caterina Rago, CRDANCE Company, LLC is based on an "El Sistema" approach to modern dance and choreography. With a special focus on Italian and American dance, CRDance Company is invested in choreography as a way to map new ideas onto the history of dance. Currently being re-launched in New York with the collaboration of Caterina Rago and Cheryl Kaplan, Executive Director, as well as the company of eight dancers, CRDance Company is now taking choreography beyond stage-based performance while also creating major new works, such as Morso D�Amore. �With its ambitious schedule of teaching and performing, CRDance Company looks at choreography much like musicians or an orchestra might look at a set of scores under the guidance and vision of a conductor collaborating with both orchestra and composer. The scores in this context are choreographic works that require not only training, but active interpretation. Known for its visceral use of movement, CR Dance Company approaches choreography as an action-based method of problem-solving. This physical thinking has important applications to a wide range of fields that, with your support, we are in the process of developing now. CRDance Company �Moves with crisp synchronicity and feverish purpose.� �BWW Dance World.com THE COMPANY: Caterina Rago: Artistic Director, Choreographer and Founder of CRDance Company and TDM, its educational dance program, Rago, a native of Italy, founded the company in 2007. She joined the Martha Graham Dance Company in 2009 after completing the company�s Professional Training Program, and received commissions from Steffi Nossen Dance Foundation, Accademia Nazionale di Danza and Peridance Capezio Dance Center where she�s on the faculty. Rago teaches at Dance Theater of Harlem and Martha Graham School and was named Emerging Choreographer for MET Dance Company (Houston). She restaged Martha Graham�s 1935 work, Panorama for Accademia Nazionale Di Danza at Rome�s Soirees Dans and Karole Armitage�s American Dream for the Ravello Festival. Cheryl Kaplan: A filmmaker, artist and critic, Cheryl Kaplan is the Executive Director of CRDance Company. She has produced films for Eve Sussman, Rosanne Cash and Laurie Anderson included in major international museums and film festivals. Kaplan appears in Alan Berliner�s Oscar nominated HBO film on Edwin Honig. Her writing appears in Art in America, Flash Art and BOMB among others. Kaplan is the founder of the Mobile Studio Lab, teaching movement in relation to understanding the body�s structure. Kaplan has received fellowships from the Bogliasco Foundation, the MacDowell Foundation and the Royal Academy of Arts, London. Sarita Apel: Born in Germany, Apel received her BA from Codarts, Rotterdam Dance Academy and studied at the Ailey School (NY). She joined CRDance Company in 2015, has danced with Graham 2, Dansgroep Amsterdam and Creative Time/Nick Cave. Pier Paolo Bisleri: The acclaimed Italian Set and Costume designer collaborated with Andy Warhol, Placido Domingo and Daniel Barenboim, with work seen at Teatro alla Scala, Teatro del Maggio Musicale Fiorentino, Teatro La Fenice and New Israeli Opera. Davide Di Donato: Born in Italy, Di Donato creates spectacular sculptures and life-size reconstructions for theater and cinematic scenography for McFarlane USA, Illy Caff�, Fanatico Figurines AG and Gaspez Arts. Rapha�lle Kessedjian: Born in France, Kessedjian joined CRDance Company in 2015. Trained at Centre Choregraphique Veronique Thery and Martha Graham School, Kessedjian is a member of Graham 2, Nu Dance Theater, Caliince Dance and a guest artist with Martha Graham Dance Company for Cercando Picasso. Kessedjian joined Adele Myers and Dancers in 2012, touring and teaching with the company. Carley Marholin received her BFA from Long Island University, having trained at Greater Hartford Academy of the Arts. She was a member of Bradley Shelver Contemporary Dance Theater, Steps Repertory Ensemble, and Graham 2, having performed and apprenticed with Martha Graham Dance Company. Currently she is a member of Abarukas. Rosalia Panepinto: Born in NY, attended the Joffrey Ballet School Contemporary Program and Teatro alla Scala Summer Intensive Program. A 2018 Peridance�s Certificate Program graduate. Performed in the Florence Dance Festival and with Peridance Contemporary Company. Apprenticing with Parsons Dance, she recently joined CRDance Company. Jaclyn Rea: Lives in NY, performing with Ariel Rivka Dance Company, joined CRDC in 2015, Heidi Latsky Dance, Graham 2 and 360 Dance Company. Dance faculty member AMDA College, Rea holds a BFA from SUNY Purchase and has danced works by Mark Morris, Stephen Petronio and Ethel Winter. Jessica Sgambelluri: A 2015 winner of the Pearl Lang Award and member of Graham 2 Company and CRDance Company, joining in 2017, Sgambelluri is based in New York. Performed with Yang Liping Intl. Dance Festival (China), Table of Silence, Visible Project, 360 Dance Company, TED Talks Live's War and Peace episode, Michael Klien's Excavation Site: Martha Graham USA and SLC's Odyssey Dance Theatre Thriller tour. Received a BFA from Marymount Manhattan College. Lissa Smith: Born in Florida, Smith attended The Boston Conservatory and studied at Jacob�s Pillow Dance Festival, Juilliard, Martha Graham and Joffrey Ballet Schools. Winner of Arts For Life, presented by former First Lady of Florida, Columba Bush. Performed with Hubbard Street 2, Chicago Symphony Orchestra and Art Institute of Chicago. Smith was a dancer for Walt Disney Imagineering (LA) and joined CRDance Company in 2015. Hannah Wagner received her BFA in Dance Performance and Choreography from the University of Missouri Kansas City, having trained at the Classical Ballet Academy of Ballet, Minnesota. Ms. Wagner has danced professionally with Ballet Minnesota, Williams Henry Contemporary Dance Company, Nimbus 2, and Moll�t Contemporary Ballet. She participated in the 2018 Tecniche di Danza, Rome with Caterina Rago and is now performing with CRDance Company.

Hello, my name is Max Reinhard, nice to meet you! I graduated Montserrat College of Art in 2018 and I am currently working in part as a freelance painter and illustrator. I work a part time job at the art supply store Blick, and I am a seasonal volunteer at non-profit New Urban Arts where I teach art to High School Students. I have created Illustrations for the book This Time They Hear You for the 826DC Young Authors Book Project, and opened my first solo show Edible and Poisonous this spring. I sell my artwork online and occasionally do conventions, which I would like to get much more involved in. I hope to continue to make awesome paintings, illustrations, and merchandise that can allow me to start selling in person more regularly. What is this project? This project is funding the production of four sticker designs I�ve created. Two stickers are updated versions of designs I have in my Storenvy and two are brand new. I use a combination of traditional colored pencil drawing with digital coloring to make bold graphic stickers with traditional textures. My Nautilus lady sticker is going to be holographic, which is super exciting! A color pencil sketch turns into a bold full-color illustration with the magic of digital painting! For previous stickers, I�ve had to print on sticker paper at home. This means that the colors were duller, the stickers were not weather-proof, and my options were limited in terms of material. The four stickers I�m creating in this set will have a variety of finishes, with two being vinyl (white background), one being holographic, and one having a clear background. What do you still have to do to complete this project? The designs of the stickers are already completed, so once funded I can have them printed and shipped almost immediately. This way you won't be waiting long to get your rewards! So what will you receive? At the lowest tier of just $15, you get all four stickers and a hand written thank you note. Each sticker varies in size, but none of them are under 2" or over 3.1" in width or height (see bottom most image for exact measurements). Each tier will receive at least one copy of EVERY sticker With each tier, the additional rewards increase. These rewards include extra stickers, buttons, showcards, postcards, bookmarks, and even a custom sketch commission! So why use Kickstarter for stickers? When ordering sticker designs off of websites, there�s a minimum amount of stickers you can purchase at a time. With the website I want to use (which I have chosen because of reviews and design options) the number of stickers varies on the size, but it typically isn�t under 30 per design. If I have backers to fund their production, not only will I know if the demand for this product is actually there, but I�ll be able to provide merchandise directly, efficiently, and cost-effectively. Aren't stickers cheap to make? $405 may seem like so much for something so small! So let me break down the cost: -I�ve allocated $50 for shipping, total. The stickers are small and flat so they should be fine in a standard envelope with a cardboard insert to keep them from bending. -In order to have the max amount of stickers in case every reward option available is backed, I need to spend $204 on the actual stickers (luckily, shipping is free). So far that�s $254 total. Cost breakdown per sticker. This is the number of stickers I'll need if all backing options are sold out. -I�ve allocated $130 of profit to me for my time creating the stickers, printing them, shipping them out, and creating this kickstarter. It also leaves me a bit of wiggle room in case shipping costs turn out to be more than what I budgeted for. This brings the cost up to $384. -Kickstarter takes 5% of the total in fees, so I round up the total to $405 since increasing the total brings the fees to $20.50, which, subtracted from $405 comes back down to $384.50. (If you made it through that section, kudos to you. I think that's enough math for one day!) Your support means everything. It is my hope you get excited about these fantastic mystical stickers and decide to back this project. Remember that each time you support an artist, you are helping to provide the means for them to spend more of their time and resources creating more wonderful art for the world. Thank you so much for helping me fund my Mystical Sticker Multi-Pack! Sincerely, -Max Reinhard

Story. About a year ago, I set out to write and direct my first film ever. Draft, after draft, after draft, I wrote up a story I truly felt would be worth sharing. Unfortunately, 61 pages is a lot of reading, and no one was willing to read it, the few who did begged me to either cut it short, or cut it all together. After months of frustration, an originally fully narrative story about a time traveling saint, an old man, and his caretaker traveling across america, was cut into a short film, about a time traveling saint, an old man, and his caretaker. And the director writing it all. What originally started as a meaningless narrative piece, turned into a rather...nutty therapy session for myself, a story inspired by films like Fellini's 8�, and more so, by Bob Fosse's All That Jazz.

Welcome to the world of Chibimals. A growing library of kid friendly, whimsical models for your 3D printer. Designed FFF-friendly. Perfect as a test print or just for fun. With soft edges and a huge, useful interior, they are suitable for all ages. Help build the whole set and print your own world of Chibimals! FFF-Friendly? Yes. These models are carefully designed so that they'll print easy on a home 3D printer. They require no supports and could be printed with zero infill to save on material. That makes these models perfect for a quick print, as the basis for a projects, or for experimental materials like flexible filaments for squishy prints. What about color prints? While the chibimals print great with single color 3D printers, if you are one of those with a MMU, Palate, or even Davnici color, versions of the 3d models with Multi-material and full color options will be included in your pledge. You Help Build It! How many Chibimal 3D models will be included in this kickstarter? It depends on how much it raises. For every $300 raised, a new Chibimal is added to the Kickstarter Collection. For your support you will not only receive all the chibimal models developed in this campaign, but you will have a vote in what the next chibimal will be as the campaign progresses. This is a backer driven kickstarter. Your choices guide the campaign. Accessorize your Chibimals In addition to the animals, your models will include a library of accessories that you can add to any Chibimal and make them your own. Wings and Halos, Hats and Magical Horns, Umbrellas and Grass Skirts, allow you to give personality to your own Chibimals. Simply import your choice of animal and accessories into your favorite 3d modeling program, or even directly into your slicer, arrange them how you want, and 3D print your customized Chibimal. (Accessorized Chibimals may require supports to print properly) Meet the Chibimals Chibimals started with only 6 models chosen to demonstrate the style and range of creatures possible, and has already grown to more than 16. How many will there be in the end? Only you will be able to decide that. So far the world of Chibimals includes: The Artist This project is brought to you by me, Joe Larson, the 3D Printing Professor. An award winning 3D designer, blogger, YouTuber, and author. This project combines my passion for 3D design, drive for education, and excitement for interacting with my audience. You can see more of my stuff at 3dpprofessor.com and on YouTube at https://www.youtube.com/user/mrjoesays

This is a 15-day QUICKSTARTER. Note: People who already own the "first" PDF will get the updated PDF free of charge. If you only want the PDF and you already have it, you are merely backing this project to help fund better editing, better art, and a cleaner layout. Otherwise, the print edition will be different and backers should consider ordering the new book if that sort of thing is important to them. This is a limited print run and not print-on-demand. That means high-quality paper and cover. King for a Day is among the best-selling books on Drive Thru RPG. It is generally ranked as a 5-out-of-5 stars book and is certainly one of the most complete, intensive, and best works I've ever produced. I've always wanted to improve the art inside and clean up some of the editing problems. And this is my chance. King for a Day is an extensive campaign-adventure-sandbox set in a semi-historic valley called Brycshire, which is roughly the equivalent of circa 800 A.D. Anglo-Saxony. The book is systemless and works best with low-tech, quick and dirty rules systems like Harn, Black Hack, or DCC. General themes include disorientation, fear, malaise, and psychological horror. No attempt has been made in the six years since it's release to give away too much about the adventure. The secrets inside are unlike what you are used to in traditional roleplaying game books. Any hint to these secrets will ruin the adventure. For those looking for more information, there are reviews online, though most are smart enough not to reveal anything. It is not my aim to be purposely cryptic for the sake of faking the drama. The adventure really is that different. I promise. The book is system neutral and can be played with any modern or old school fantasy systems. The printed book includes a new cover (similar design as before, but with a new symbol). The book is over 300 pages and includes over 100 locations, 200 NPCs, and 50 storylines, allowing gamemasters room to personalize their King for a Day campaigns. The book thoroughly explores and explains a living environment, explaining the economics, politics, and day to day life of the people. It is designed specifically to root the gamemaster into the world so he or she can run the game fluidly, placing the PCs into a myriad of complex storylines. New artwork, updated maps, and a few additions to the locations mark the difference between the original and this book. In addition, some of the interior fonts have changed, making the book easier to read. The PDF has some color, but the limited edition books through this kickstarter are Black and White (to match the tone of the setting). The limited edition books also have a unique cover, so backers have something no one else can get. For every 100 backers, each backer receives a free PDF from the post world games online store. For every $1000 raised, another piece of art is ordered and added to the book. There is already $1000 invested in new art for this edition, so I technically don't make any money on this project until around the $3000 mark. I am doing this out of love for the project. At $15k, everyone gets their books signed. Just kidding. Everyone gets their books signed if they summon a cookie for me.

There are a lot of bugs in the world. There are also a lot of books. Consequently, there are a lot of books about bugs, and even a lot of books that claim to bring readers the very weirdest bugs they've ever seen. That's a noble effort, to be sure, and I respect anybody who has undertaken such a task...but every time I've seen a book about "weird" bugs, I've found it hardly scratching the surface of just how weird a bug can, in fact, actually get. That's why I'd like to provide you, your kids, and any other literate organisms in your dwelling with a book of bugs so peculiar, freaky and absurd that the average person has surely never heard of them all, and may have a difficult time even believing that all of them are real! (mockup - final product may differ) The WORLD'S WEIRDEST INSECTS (it's a working title, maybe the final one will be more interesting) will be a small, fully illustrated, full color book ostensibly for children, but hopefully just as eye-opening for people of all ages, presenting flies, beetles, bugs and other six-legged arthropods from the depths of frozen ice caves to the fur of woodland critters. Abilities, behavior and lifestyles will be the focus of this book, not merely insects that happen to look really cool, though hopefully you'll find a lot of them as visually interesting as their daily lives are eccentric. Each illustration will be reasonably close to the real thing, with a degree of cartooning, and all facts presented will be verifiable, accurate, and written in a way even early readers should understand! A few bugs in the book might get a little scary at times - we will definitely include a share of fearsome predators and eerie parasites - but we hope to emphasize that every one of these creatures are just animals, neither good nor bad, surviving in incredibly novel ways around the world; a colorful cast of characters that make our planet more fun by their very existence. The FINAL DIMENSIONS, softcover vs. hardcover, paper stock and other formatting specifics of this book are still in the developmental phase. If we get funded, we'll first be ordering proofs through a couple of different printing companies until we've settled on the best quality we can get with your money, and hopefully finish up the book within six to seven months - just in time for the holidays! Full scientific names and taxonomic information will be provided by an index for those who would like to research any of the book's subjects further. A sample of insects currently in CONSIDERATION for the book includes all those seen in our above prototype pages, as well as: The carnivorous bagworm - a killer caterpillar that builds its own house from the remains of dead bugs! The ice crawler - an insect that lives its entire life on glacier ice or in perpetually frozen caves, and can die in the warmth of the palm of your hand. Ant butt beetle - one type of beetle imitates the abdomen of an ant, and attaches to an ant's waist in order to infiltrate their nest. The ant is never smart enough to wonder why it has two butts. Gumleaf skeletonizer - a caterpillar that collects its own old, discarded heads every time it molts, stacking them up on top of its real head. We don't even KNOW why! Roridula bug - a type of predatory bug lives only on the leaves of a sticky plant. The plant traps other insects, just so its bugs can eat them and fertilize it with their poop. The bugs are, literally, the plant's digestive system. The frog-hunting beetle - perhaps this one would be a little too alarming for kids, but one type of beetle actually hunts and eats frogs many times its own size. That's basically like eating dragons for every meal. Jackal fly - these very tiny flies actually hang out with spiders on purpose. Not only do they share the spider's food, but the spider will allow them to clean its fangs! Amazon glow worm beetles - a type of beetle larva in the Amazon jungle hides itself in a burrow and glows green to attract other insects, then bursts from its hole like a jack-in-the-box to devour its prey. ...and many more! $5000 STRETCH GOAL: 30 BUGS AND NOT JUST INSECTS! Now TWENTY insects are the initial plan, but if we go up to $5000, we'll go ahead and throw in an extra TEN, which will include Arachnids, Crustaceans, and more! $5200 STRETCH GOAL: REALISTIC REFERENCE KEY! At $5,200, the book will feature some extra pages illustrating what all 30 "bugs" look like in real life detail! We may use scientific illustrations under a creative commons license with all necessary attribution and permission. Any we can't provide this way, I will do my best to illustrate myself! For an example, this is biologist Desmond Helmore's anatomical drawing of the New Zealand Bat Fly I sketched above: $5500 STRETCH GOAL: LIMITED RUN HARDCOVER EDITION! They're costlier to print, but if we reach $5,500, I will print a run of hardcover editions with exclusive cover art, limited to 50 copies! WHY I'M DOING THIS: All my life, I've loved insects. Insects are as exotic, fanciful and surprising to me as any mythological spirits, movie monsters or cartoon characters, yet they're real, and everywhere, and always revealing another secret to those who study them. It was my dream since childhood to pursue a career in natural science, and I even tried to make my own "books" about bugs as soon as I knew how to write, but undiagnosed ADHD and a stiflingly low income kept me from ever completing college, and I did what many people do when they fail to become a scientist: I consumed, and created, way more cartoons. But the urge to get involved in biology is as strong as ever, and there's nothing I think I'd be happier doing than spreading education and appreciation for some of the most amazing things we share the planet with. That's why, last year, my spouse and I illustrated and described 31 amazing species of spider on my website, for free, in an educational feature we called Spiderween. This book project is in a very similar spirit, but something I'm taking much more seriously as a new career endeavor. If it isn't funded, I'll try again with a slightly more modest goal. If this never happens, I've always got my online stuff, but there's just something that's always felt special to me about the prospect of making a real, physical book about science, and especially the kind of book that got me interested at a very young age.

Sixteen year-old Michael Beatrice Evans of Normal, Idaho has a problem. He's reckless. He�s arrogant. And he�s too smart for his own good. He�s also $20,000 in the hole after betting on Super Bowl 49 . . . . But Michael�s got a scheme to fix all that. With the help of his brother and four friends, he quietly starts counterfeiting Dilly Bar coupons � selling the �purchased� ice cream for profit. Everything�s going according to plan . . . . And then all hell breaks loose. This is a story of friends and enemies, crime and punishment, love and loss . . . This is a dark satire, an ultra-violent thriller, an apocalyptic legend . . . This is The Seven Acts. The Seven Acts is the debut novel by Fargo, ND author Malcolm Strand. Part black comedy, part shock-fiction, part morality tale -- The Seven Acts is a powerful, new work by a major, young talent. Thanks for reading!

Forty years ago the Grant County Braves Basketball Team had a once in a lifetime season, where records were shattered and they made it to the State Tournament for only the second and last time in the school's history. Brave at Heart: The Story of the Sherman County Braves is a thinly veiled work of fiction based on real people, places and events that took place in Grant County Kentucky in the mid to late '70's. My father had a unique point of view as the team mascot and he is writing a comical memoir of the misadventures of him and his friends weaving in and out of the basketball season. In his own words, "Brave at Heart: The Story of the Sherman County Braves is a coming-of-age story set against the backdrop of one team�s incredible and unlikely high school basketball season in rural, 1970�s Kentucky. In 1979 a group of high school basketball players from Northern Kentucky would make an unlikely run to the Kentucky state high school basketball tournament affectionately known in the Bluegrass as the Sweet 16. This is their story. It's basically a true story, (except for the parts I made up), only the names have been changed to protect the guiltocent. Along the way these boys established a bond that would last the rest of their lives. " This kickstarter project is to raise funds to help defray the costs of publishing the book as well as getting assistance with editing/layout/typesetting/etc. Beyond simply telling the story of the basketball season and games, the book also takes a look at High School in the 1970's in rural Kentucky, pop culture, coming of age, and friendships that have lasted a lifetime. This story has never been told before and the fortieth anniversary seems like an ideal time to share this story with a wider audience. "Before we begin in earnest, let�s set the stage a little, high school basketball in Sherman County in Kentucky in the late 1970s was a big thing. ESPN The worldwide leader in sports would not launch until four months after we graduated in September of 1979. There was no social media, no smart phones, no internet; home computers were still unheard of. It was a goddamn stone age. All mail was paper and not E. We only had five TV channels, three VHF, two UHF and the UHF channels were fuzzy. There were no DVDs, or Blu-rays and the only thing that was streaming was the creek that ran behind our house. If you wanted to see a movie you got in the car and drove to one of the new multi-plex cinemas or local drive-in. It was a different time to say the least. And people had to take their entertainment as they found it especially in the wintertime. Now in Kentucky everyone enjoys basketball on all levels, God love �em. At Sherman County High School back then we had no football team and in Kentucky it�s basketball that makes the mare go �round. So when November of 1978 came along, people in Sherman County were looking forward to the upcoming basketball season. The team had matured and they promised to be entertaining to say the least. They had finished the previous season at 12 wins and 13 losses and had been runners up at the 32nd District Tournament. No one in the county was looking forward to the season more than our basketball Coach. He couldn�t wait for his 1978-1979 Sherman County Braves to take the floor. He had 4 returning seniors and a deep bench. This year�s crop of Braves was the best group of shooters that he had ever coached. Coach had been preaching the gospel to some of these guys for going on 3 years and they were thoroughly prepared. All they needed was another team in front of them. They had been running up and down the steps in the gym since July and they were chomping at the bit to get started. When the school year began I had no idea what was in store for me. No idea whatsoever how my life would be changed by this Sherman County Braves basketball team. That year I was a senior, who hadn't done anything special. If anything I was running an overt campaign for 1979 class clown. I had discovered as a little kid that I could make people laugh and so I went with that. In high school I had the reputation of being stuck up, which I didn't learn until after it was too late to do anything about since I�d already graduated. I also had a reputation for being a bit of a wild man and for causing the Sherman County high school authority figures bucket loads of trouble. Back then there were no middle schools in Sherman County. Only four elementary schools that were still on the old fashion system of graduating kids from the eighth grade and sending them directly to high school. Throwing them all together on a hot day in August and calling them freshmen. So the friendships we had formed in elementary school became more important to us on that warm summer morning known far and wide as the first day of school. We viewed kids from other parts of the county with a jaundiced eye and it would take a while for all of us to feel comfortable together. When you�re a freshman you just want keep your head down and survive. But by our senior year we�d forgotten all that who came from which part of the county crap. After three years of the familiarity that high school breeds we�re all from the same spot, and damn proud of it. Sherman County High School. In December of 1978, half way through my senior year my world as just another Sherman County senior with a pretty face changed entirely. For the most part it happened almost overnight. One day I was just another guy going to class and putting in his time and the next day I�m the Sherman County Brave, the school�s new mascot. I had purpose and new friends, I had excitement and drama, I had duties and more new friends. I was part of something bigger than anything that I had ever been a part of in my life, family aside. I had a locker in the main locker room, I had my own uniform complete with war bonnet and there were cheerleaders in short skirts and all I had to do to fulfill my duties was to be myself. It was the best job I ever had! Being part of a team is like having a second family, and my second family was just like my own real family. It was big, it was boisterous, it was loud and it liked to show off. The only difference was that my second family could play basketball like nobody�s business and my first couldn�t. I saw it all from the inside. I was there, court side, the locker room, and traveling with the team to away games across the width and breadth of northern Kentucky. I saw it all and I�m here to tell you brother it was fun..."

Pixel Hearts LIFE Dice are designed for Zelda fans. Rather than the regular numbers 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 and 6, these dice have Pixel Hearts Containers to represent the pips on a normal die. They are real, standard-sized (16 mm) acrylic dice with Pixel Heart symbols engraved in them. For every $5 you Pledge, you'll get One Pixel Hearts LIFE Die. You can pledge as much as you want, in $5 increments, and get as many dice as you want. Each 1/2 Heart represents one pip on a Regular die Adding Dice to your Pledge If you want to get additional dice just Increase your Pledge amount. You will receive one Die for each $5 you add. CLICK on the "Manage your Pledge" button and then on "Change your Pledge" button, increase your pledge amount. I created some alternative color designs for the stretch goals dice. The color designs are inspired by different video games. Color design is inspired by Link to the Past. The LIFE Hearts are Pink to match Link's hair. Color design is inspired by Breath of the Wild. I based the color on the Link's Light Blue and White Tunic. Color design is inspired by Metroid's Samus. I based the colors on Samus' Helmet and Power Suit. Color design is inspired by Mega Man. I based the colors on Mega Man's Helmet and Suit. Color design is inspired by Super Mario Bros. I based the colors on the logos on Mario and Luigi's Hats. Shipping Details All shipments will be go through the United States Postal Service. USA orders will ship through First-Class Service and international orders will ship through International Service. All rewards will be packed carefully to lower the risk of damage during shipping. For our International backers, the shipping costs are based on what the USPS charges. The dice are being shipped from the USA. Thank you for checking out my project!

The past is warmer than you think... Welcome to the Kickstarter page for the 4th installment of DARK BEACH. For our newcomers- DARK BEACH is a sci-fi noir mystery about Gordo, a crime scene photographer, who lives in a future world where Earth has drifted away from the Sun. As one murder unfolds, so unravels the mystery of why our planet left its original orbit. Gordo is caught in the middle, fighting new foes and old habits. Slowly, he realizes that he's more connected than he could have ever imagined. Issue #4 takes place two days before Issue #1. Yes, this is the official prequel issue! You'll get to see the events leading up to the infamous murder that sent Gordo down the rabbit hole. You'll also meet THE SUN FREAKS, an underground collective in search of the truth about the old sun. With only 2 more issues left in our story, this is the beginning of the end my friends. To those who're returning, I want to say thank you! To the newcomers, I want to say welcome! Your contribution keeps Dark Beach alive. Follow the progress with updates on the twitter @darkbeachcomic 1.25 soft enamel pin 2 inch iron on patch Art samples by Gonzalo Ruggieri : Writer - Michael J. Ruiz-Unger I love telling stories, especially through comics. Dark Beach was originally conceived for the big screen but after being influenced by several graphic novels, it became clear to me that the best way to execute this story was through sequential art. I feel extremely lucky to continue telling this story (with amazing artists) and present it to you through the power of Kickstarter. As the story continues to gain positive press and new readers, the more I realize that this was the right decision. If you ever need advice on how to make a comic series, I'm always an email away. mruizunger@gmail.com Artist - Gonzalo Ruggieri Since we're going back in time and memories are often fuzzy when thinking about the past, I decided to have a guest artist change up the visuals for the story. Gonzalo Ruggieri, takes over for Issue #4. He's an amazing artist whose been featured several times in Heavy Metal Magazine.

911 Alert App is a new smartphone app that will instantly text up to 10 designated contacts from a phone dialing 9-1-1. Emergency contacts linked up through the app will be notified of the caller�s location and be connected with fellow contacts through a convenient chat feature that allows all parties to communicate. In 2018, 911 Alert inventor Steven VanDyke and his family were hit with two major emergencies. First, his sister experienced a massive stroke while on a family vacation and almost two months later, his wife�s cousin suffered a heart attack. His sister was fortunate enough to be in the presence of family members and had support through her medical emergency, but the cousin passed en route to the hospital. For days, she laid in the morgue as �Jane Doe� while family members struggled to understand what happened. Steven wondered what would have happened if his sister had also been alone or only in the company of her eight-year-old daughter. How long would it take for a family member to find out what happened? Steven knew that there had to be a more effective and instant form of communication in an emergency situation, leading to the creation of this essential mobile app. �THE INSURANCE YOU NEED AND THE ASSURANCE YOU'LL HAVE, BECAUSE IT'S BETTER TO HAVE IT AND NOT NEED IT, THAN TO NEED IT AND NOT HAVE IT." A Little Extra Security in Your Life. An app that immediately and automatically sends a text message to as many as ten preset emergency contacts when you dial 911 from your cell phone. We are developing an app called 911 Alert app that will immediately and automatically send a text message to as many as ten preset emergency contacts when you dial 911 on your cell phone. (redundant, two sentences that says the same thing) The problem is if we are in an emergency situation and our loved ones are not around, we need to call them one by one and explain the situation many times over and often this process is delayed and slow. 911 Alert app allows families and friends to connect instantly. To alert loved ones and friends faster when 911 is dialed. When a call to emergency services is made, the app will instantly and simultaneously send a text alert to up to 10 emergency contacts and open a chat channel for communication. Both the caller and their contacts can interact through the chat option. In many situations where a person is under threat from another party, this silent form of communication will be the only option that keeps them safe. The location of the primary phone will also be revealed to chosen contacts so that they can find out where the caller was when the emergency took place and if they are on the move. It�s ideal for any situation, but especially helpful for parents with young children who may not know what to do during an emergency or for people who live alone. When emergencies happen, you want to be prepared. You want to know that you have the tools you need to respond effectively before you actually need them. This is what responsibility is all about: planning for contingencies so that you can keep yourself and your loved ones safe. The more support that you position for yourself, the more confident you can be about your safety. Priced at just $5 per annual subscription, 911 Alert app is affordable for all, making this high-powered app an innovation poised to change people�s lives and change the way we approach emergency preparedness as a society. Live alone? Over the age of 65? Concerned about a loved one? This is the app for you! We are developing the app for both Android and iOS, and we are scheduling the launch for Fall 2019. Get connected today for your opportunity to purchase a lifetime subscription for you, your family and your friends! In many cases, the caller may be incapable of alerting their emergency contacts of an emergency and it can be days before family or friends find out that someone is in the hospital or worse. 911 Alert app is designed to act as that convenient and instant connection between a 9-1-1 caller and their chosen contacts. When a call to emergency services is made, the app will instantly and simultaneously send a text alert to up to 10 emergency contacts and open a chat channel for communication. Both the caller and their contacts can interact through the chat option. Steven VanDyke, Inventor & CEO of Fight�Win�Survive I have a B.S. in Management from Jackson State University where I started my own entertainment company (VanDyke Entertainment, Inc.) in 1994 going into my senior year. I have worked in third party collections, customer service and government. In 2012 I started and trademarked an encouragement merchandiser and ministry outreach company called �Fight�Win�Survive� where we have sent our encouragement wristbands all over the world. I am an author who has released four books, and has executive produced a music project called �The Power of Prayer.� I have been a business consultant for many individuals who have started their own company or wanted to start their own company. My strengths are strategic planning and overall management structuring. I have always considered myself as an innovator but over the years just lacked the connections to bring many of my ideas to fruition. In 2016 I ran for my county�s commissioner seat as a write-in candidate. Now, I can focus my attention to 911 Alert app so families don�t have to go through what my family experienced first hand. Product Specific FAQs:  Will The 911 Alert App Work If I Use My Phone App To Dial 911? The 911 Alert App only works when 911 is dialed on a cell phone through the app. If 911 is called normally on the phone, emergency contacts will not be notified.  Is This Available For My Phone and Tablet? 911 Alert app is only available for Android and iOS telephones.  Does This Integrate With Life Alert Or Similar Devices? 911 Alert app at this time will not integrate with Life Alert or other similar emergency alert devices.  Does The App Have To Be Open To Track My Location? The tracking feature of the app is activated for emergency contacts when 911 is dialed from the initiating caller�s cellphone. Once initiated, the app will track the phone for up to 72 hours.

Before I get into The Greatest Love Story Ever Told, I need to tell you another story� It started in Kenya, with a bracelet. In 2012, I had just left my job in corporate fashion and immersed myself in international development. I visited a group of Maasai women in Ngong, Kenya where I saw their beautiful beadwork. Inspired by the bold colors used by their tribe, I designed a simple bracelet featuring the word LOVE in their traditional beadwork. The ultimate goal was to create jobs for their community. I chose the word �love� because it is universal, relatable to everyone in the world. It is the common thread that connects us all. Photo: Georgina Goodwin With that bracelet in hand on a flight to Russia in 2014, I asked two strangers from Uzbekistan and Kyrgyzstan what love meant to them. I then profiled them on my Instagram. What started as a personal travel project would soon become an international conversation around the true meaning of love. I continued to travel�for six months to 50 countries. Along the way I asked that same question: What does love mean to you? I collected dozens of love stories and took photos of people wearing the LOVE bracelet. A social media campaign took root, and soon I was pitching the bracelets to American Eagle Outfitters. They sold 20,000 LOVE bracelets post-launch and created over 400 jobs in Kenya. Since those early days, I�ve turned Love Is Project into its own self-funded company. We now provide 1,200 female artisans in 10 countries with jobs, with plans to expand our efforts even further. A single bracelet has transcended cultures, countries, and notions of what love can do. And now, we want to do even more. Since starting the Love Is Project five years ago, I�ve heard thousands of love stories. Each one is unique, personal, and yet� so familiar. As I collected these stories, I realized I had the makings of an exceptional book. A book about romance, humor, family, triumph, and dreaming big. The profiles of the people in this book give voice to positivity and humanize different cultures around the world. The book seeks to inspire readers to foster deeper, more meaningful connections�and to live their lives with hearts open. Our supporters around the world resonate with the Love Is Project�s message of love, acceptance and empathy in defiance towards negativity. The Greatest Love Story Ever Told reveals how far love can take us all. For the artisans in these countries and beyond, love�and the efforts behind the Love Is project�grants a new kind of freedom. Economic empowerment Steady employment Over $100,000 donated to global charities Fair wages Educational opportunities Seeing women around the world run their own businesses and lives is immensely rewarding, and hard to describe in words. It�s another reason this book is so powerful. I feel lucky to have witnessed this progress firsthand, and it�s an experience I want to share with the world. Maasai mother, Ann, kissing her baby. Photo: Georgina Goodwin A MOTHER'S LOVE | Chrissie Lam, Founder, Love Is Project In 2017, three years after the #loveisproject campaign started, I was lucky enough to visit our artisan Ann and her community of Maasai women in a remote village outside of Olepolos located over the Ngong Hills in Kenya. We toured her new house in her manyatta, which is literally a home that LOVE built for her and her family. I heard firsthand how we've changed thousands of lives by providing stable jobs during drought years, allowing families to pay school fees for children and invest in other income-generating projects. For Ann, love is being together and sharing everything. I left them with photos and touching stories from customers all over the world who wear their LOVE bracelets with pride. These moments remind me that we're creating much more than just a bracelet. Love is in the air! Supeyo, shows off his Maasai jumping skills. Photo: Georgina Goodwin LOVE IS HOME | Georgina Goodwin, Kenyan Photojournalist "What does love mean to me? Such a huge and wonderful question! It means connection, comfort and safety, a place of belonging, home. Knowing there is something out there � LOVE - that is so perfect and also so imperfect at the same time, challenges me to be the best person I can be. I love my work�my photographs�as it�s a way to connect with people, to travel the world with the purpose of experiencing, hearing and sharing stories of people and the environment. I love vibrant color, so my photographs are always full of color! One of my favorite memories of working with the Love Is Project is when Chrissie had this incredible idea to have Maasai and Samburu jumping on a trampoline wearing LOVE bracelets. She actually found a huge trampoline and lugged it to the Ngong Hills just outside Nairobi where we did the most fun photoshoot capturing beautiful Samburu men dressed in their traditional shuka (blanket) and mchanga (beads) jumping on a trampoline for the very first time in their lives! Their faces were priceless! The Samburu (and Maasai) are known for their jumping skills. When these very happy men came back down to ground and tried to jump off the earth again they were dismayed at how hard they found it to get any lift after experiencing what was possible on the trampoline!! What a day! I�m a passionate Aries born in Nairobi, Kenya � it�s my country, my home and my huge LOVE. Pretty late on�my mid-20s�I bought my first decent camera and started feeling the need to create by taking photos. That need has developed into a successful and wonderful career over the last 12 years. It was while on a job, in the deepest Tanzanian bush, that I met my husband. My work took me to a place where I found who I had been waiting for my whole life. I LOVE color, I LOVE new experiences, I LOVE the access photography allows me to our world - to travel, to hear and to share the stories of the people I meet and the places I see. It�s a privilege to have the life I lead." Georgina is a contributor to Getty Images and her work has been published in the NY Times, Vogue, Elle, AFP. As an East African photojournalist, Georgina normally covers heavy topics, such as FGM, Fistula and Humanitarian Crisis. Winter on the Mongolian steppe. Photos: Khasar Sandag LOVE IS FREEDOM | Khasar Sandag, Mongolian Photographer "I wanted to be documentary filmmaker growing up because documentaries reveal life on earth. They have no script and are genuine. However, when I went to university in 1996, I bailed on my childhood dream because I didn't think i could live off movie making in Mongolia at the time. I chose the most logical career path at that moment. Mongolia was new democracy and had opened its doors to business and capital, so I chose to study international business. After working in various fields including government agency, private business, international finance institution and a multi-national company I came to the conclusion that the only thing I didn't do is work for me and to love my work. At 34, I quit my day job and became a documentary photographer. This is the closest I could come to my dream job of documentary filmmaking right away. I met Chrissie few years back in Mongolia while she was on her journey through various countries. She had a dream of making meaningful, inclusive products and wanted to make change in the supply chains of distant and exotic lands. She had only one LOVE bracelet with her at the time and asked people to share what love meant to them. She used the only one bracelet she had with her to get photos and quotes. It struck a note with me because love is such a wonderful thing to give, share and experience. It is very intimate, yet people were happy to share their thoughts on it. Being able to share what love is for Mongolians is a privilege for me because I get to showcase my people, my country and their love through my photos. Come visit Mongolia, a land of wonderful people and magical landscapesa place where you truly feel freedom." Khasar's work has been featured on Apple iPhoto billboards around the world. Photo: Natalia Ditto PUPPY LOVE | Natalia Ditto & Loki "We love Loki because he's family. He's got a fiery big personality and lots of opinions, so he fits right in. Love to him means protecting his family, always being close and showering us all with licks. The excitement he wakes up with each morning is contagious-he can't wait to snuggle and play." Cave-hopping in Petra, Jordan. iPhone 5 Photos: Chrissie Lam LOVE IS BORDERLESS | Chrissie Lam, Love Is Project In August 2014, the Syrian crisis was heating up with journalist beheadings, and Israel and Palestine were at war. Tourism to Petra, Jordan, had come to a standstill. The UNESCO site which normally hosts 5,000 visitors a day, now barely had 300. Traveling by donkey, my guide took me cave-hopping to meet the inhabitants of the modern day Bedrock. If you're Bedouin, you can stake your claim on any empty cave in Petra and make it your home...put doors in, paint the interiors, park your car in the cave garage. No rent. No mortgage. You don't even have to ask any one! As a former New Yorker, this is an unfathomable concept. I shared tea with the Bedouin patrol team at sunset overlooking Petra. Ahmed self-tattooed his beloved's name, Miriam, on his arm before she agreed to marry him. He's happy she said yes. They now have five children. "Love is the best thing in life." For Mahmoud, who has six kids, "Love is a feeling that describes no borders." Rakan of Jafar is also part of the Bedouin police force. For him, "Love is something you want, but sometimes is difficult to get." After a meal at my guide�s village, I went road tripping with Ahmed and Mahmoud. I asked them to play me their favorite tune in the car. Expecting local music, I was surprised when they turned the volume up on "Gangnam Style" and sang along to every word. Apparently, love is K-pop in Jordan. Photo: Martina Orska In addition to painting a picture of love�s power to transcend distance and circumstance, this book will also help fund future partnerships with female artisans around the world, so we can continue to pay it forward. These partnerships give women the chance to have their product sold on a larger scale, securing their economic future. This is more than just a book or a bracelet. This is about how the power of LOVE can change lives and bring people closer together. Thanks to years of concentrated, inspired efforts among the Love Is Project community, we have almost everything we need to make this book a reality. The only thing left are the funds to get it published. That�s where all of you come in. Your support can help us further expand on what we�ve done for so many years�spreading the love and shedding light on cultures that once felt worlds away. LOVE unites us all. Photo: Tommaso Riva We thank you deeply for anything you can pledge. We can�t wait to get this beautiful book in YOUR hands. We need your help to print the first 1,000 copies, pay the book designer, writer & editor. Here is a breakdown of what your pledge will help fund. Countless research, design and production trips around the globe 19 Collaborating photographers 100+ User generated photos 6 Illustrations 400+ Hours of editing 200+ Hours of designing AND... The printer, the writer, the designer, the copy editor, the fact checker, the video editor, digital marketing team and my assistant. We have chosen to work with a top-of-the-line printer based in San Francisco, CA. Printing the books domestically will cost us slightly more, but it will give us better control over the quality of the book and save on shipping costs. If we see success in sales in the Asia market, we will look to expand print production to Hong Kong to save on shipping costs as well. Self-funding this book project in its entirety was no small feat, but it was important to me not to compromise on the quality. Here's the Breakdown: Timeline: Book Details: Dimensions: 9 inches x 9 inches Paper: High quality semi-gloss paper Delivery Timeline: February 2020 Credit where credit is due: The Greatest Love Story Ever Told is a stunning, collaborative project and we're excited to offer a hardbound book with 150+ beautiful pages of color and black and white photography from talented photographers from around the world. We will also include some of the best photos and stories from our supporters as well. Contributing Photographers: Tommaso Riva @tommasorivaphotography (Italy), Zissou @zissou_ (UK), Wawan Muhammad @wawan_was_here (Indonesia), Georgina Goodwin @ggkenya (Kenya), Mark Nicdao @markdnicdao (Philippines), Jake Morales @jakemoralesphotography (Philippines), Martina Orska @martinaorska (Ecuador), Pablo Naranjo (Ecuador), Lionel Gasperini @lionelgasperini (France), Chucho Potts @chuchopotts (Mexico), Khasar Sandag @inomad (Mongolia), Sean Dekkers @seandekkers (USA), Benjamin Conley @benjamin_conley (USA), Sara Davis @sara_davis_photography (USA), Anna Watts @anasaura_ (USA), Bobby Neptune @bobbyneptune (USA), Danielle Rubi (USA), Peter Prato @peterprato (USA) Chrissie Lam @thesupplychange (USA), Raskal @raskal (Australia) Contributing Illustrators: Sujean Rim @sujeanpics (USA), Vannina Olivieri @mynameisjeanette (Corsica), Amber Vittoria @amber_vittoria (USA) Photo: Zissou If you�ve gotten this far then thank you! My name is Chrissie Lam and I�m the founder of The Love Is Project. After graduating from Parsons, I worked as a concept designer at Abercrombie & Fitch and American Eagle Outfitters in NYC. I then founded The Supply Change�an organization that increases access to sustainable employment and ethically sourced consumer goods, and connects the fashion industry with artisan communities. The Love Is Project truly is a labor of LOVE. Startup life has its ups and downs and I'm so grateful to all our supporters and contributors helping me spread love and joy around the world. All of these life experiences have ultimately led me to the place I am today, running The Love Is Project and now, passionately putting together the Greatest Love Story Ever Told. I hope these stories inspire you and bring a smile to your face. Over the years, many people have asked me about purchasing my original Love Is Project book of travel photos and stories. The costs were prohibitive to one-off print. Now, with our Kickstarter, we can fund the production of a beautiful coffee table book AND include all the incredible collaborators we�ve worked with from all corners of the globe. We're looking forward to sharing all these beautiful stories with you all. What better time to release a book of love stories than Valentine�s Day? Based on our forecasted timeline, we expect to ship the books by early February 2020, making it the perfect gift for Valentine�s Day. We�ll print with a company based in the Bay Area to fulfill USA & Europe orders. If we receive enough Asia sales, we will also print in Hong Kong.
