Please help us meet our $5000 match challenge During this year's FRIGID New York Festival at the Kraine Theater, a new patron in the seats pledged a $5,000 match, a full one-third of our for this project. We're starting in an amazing place, but we still need your help. About Voice of Authority You know that voice in your head, the one that tells you you're doing it wrong? It's convinced Dean to give up being on stage and go work for his uncle. But now that uncle has disappeared, and the US government is coming after Dean for $19 million he doesn't have. So much for being practical. Instead of getting a lawyer as his most trusted advisor, Dean finds a ballet dancer. Zachary, a former Balanchine dancer and choreographer of the Metropolitan Opera, only ever want to dance, so it's all he ever did. It's what got him through World War II. He just may be the person who can teach Dean to tune out that pesky voice of authority. February 2019 performance at the Kraine Theater, NYC, photo credit Erika Conway Why this show? I�ve always loved stories about the kid who believes he has a destiny, maybe to be a performer, and even though everyone tells him he�ll never make it, he fights for what he wants until he shows 'em all. But what happens to the story when that kid does listen to the naysayers, including that voice in his head? When he gives up what he loves to get a "real" job? In my case, I landed in bigger trouble than I'd ever known was possible. This show is the true story about what Zachary taught me when that happened: life may make us all suffer, but we get to choose what we fight for. Lighting tech rehearsal at Pittsburgh Fringe � that stylishly untucked shirt was all the rage in Paris after this show Why Edinburgh? Edinburgh is the biggest arts festival in the world. It has the best performers. Industry flocks there. People find collaborators there. They learn from seeing great work. They test themselves on one of the world's biggest stages. I'm going there to get better as an artist, writer, performer, producer, and to see how far I can take this project. And the goal in creating this show has always been to take it to Edinburgh Fringe. Voice of Authority at The PIT Loft, NYC, in 2018, photo credit Todd France What's in it for you? 1. My eternal gratitude, although I probably already owe you that. 2. A chance to be a part of developing a show and getting it ready for Edinburgh Fringe, which is a pretty cool and kind of weird thing to do. 3. I want you to see see what it's like so I will send everyone who donates a photo of the day from the festival by email. 4. Much cooler than either of those though, is getting to have a drink with both the performer and the writer of the show. Live from Edinburgh. Behold the Voice of Authority official shot glass, my favorite reward at the $50 level. Bigger than life At least three times, I'll set up a live video chat from the festival where we can all drink a toast together, and if you don't drink, these are silicone, you can use them to make yourself a popsicle. And since they're silicone, you can also throw it against the wall when you're done, and still be able to use it again. The goal of this campaign One thing I learned from having the US government sue me for $19 million is that transparency is invaluable. With that in mind, here's a macro view of the budget for this show: Venue rental: $2900 Insurance, registration: $500 Publicity: $2000 Marketing: $1300 Contingency: $1500 Living expenses: $1500 Travel and accommodation: $3500 Fees for design, direction, tech, coaching, etc: $2000 Total: $15,400 What I'd love to do here on Kickstarter is raise the $5,000 I need in matching funds to secure the $5,000 pledge from the patron I met at the FRIGID New York Festival. The remainder will come from individual fundraising and myself. The point of going to Edinburgh is to grow bigger as an artist and as a producer. This budget creates opportunities to do that. Tax Deductable Donations For those of you who would prefer to get make a gift as part of a charitable donation, I have fiscal sponsorship with Fractured Atlas here � Other Ways You Can Help I know not everyone can afford to donate to this project, but you can also help in a big way by following me on social media and helping me reach a bigger audience for Voice of Authority: Twitter: @deantemple Instagram: thatdeantemple Facebook: facebook.com/deantemplevoa Medium: medium.com/@deantemple The Crew Dean, Carol, Zachary, Alex Dean Temple Writer/performer: Dean is based in New York City and Millbrook, NY. Notable credits include Fannie Lou the Musical (Carnegie Hall/dir by Felicia Hunter) Salome: Voodoo Princess of N�Awlins (Nuyorican Poets Cafe/dir by Rajendra Ramoon Maharaj) and Accumulated Heartbreak Disorder (Access Theater/dir by Jo-Anne Cahill). He won a best actor award at the 2016 Madrid Intl Film Festival (Here Lies Joe) and Staff Pick Best Show at the 2018 Pittsburgh Fringe Festival (Voice of Authority) and his audiobook The Upstarts by Brad Stone has been an Amazon bestseller since February 2017. He also performed stunts on horseback for the video game Red Dead Redemption 2. @deantemple (tw); @thatdeantemple (insta); deantemple.com Carol Lee Sirugo Director: Carol is an actor, writer, director & clown/physical comedienne. Her directing credits include: Voice of Authority (FRIGID NEW YORK, East to Edinburgh at 59E59, Edinburgh Fringe); How to Suffer Better (Edinburgh Fringe, Edmonton Fringe, FringeNYC, SOLOCOM); My Little Friend (Eclectic Evening of Shorts at Artistic New Directions); Killing it! (web series on Amazon Prime); Take Away with Max Roche (upcoming web series). Off & Off-Off Broadway acting credits include: High Priest of California (29th St. Rep.); Pip�s Island (3-Legged Dog); Clown Play (FringeNYC); Dick Whittington (Dixon Place); Rat Bastards (Dixon Place); Metro (Bushwick Starr). She has toured the Canadian Int�l Fringe Festival Circuit with her new work, including: This Town (Media Choice Award, Saskatoon Fringe); The Hysteric (BEST OF FEST Winner, Winnipeg Fringe). As a clown, her duo & solo work incl: SOLOCOM Fest (the PIT); Comedy in Dance Fest (Triskelion Arts); Bindlestiff Variety Night (Dixon Place); Move It Fest (HERE Arts Center); The Int�l Clown Fest (The Brick Theater). www.carolleesirugo.com Zachary Solov Zachary was Dean's mentor and a close family friend. Best known for his work as choreographer of New York's Metropolitan Opera House, where he won the first-ever Capezio Award, Zachary danced for George Balanchine, Eugene Loring, Anthony Tudor, Hanya Holm, Agnes de Mille, and Jerome Robbins. He also appeared on television shows including Your Show of Shows and The Fred Allen Show, and he starred alongside Jackie Gleason in Along Fifth Avenue on Broadway. You can learn more about Zachary here � Alex Tuller Production Manager: Alex is a founding partner of Drake Creative Collaborative. Her work has ranged from visual identity systems to monumental design, environmental graphics, and theatrical backdrops. Her clients have included VDAY, the Internet Archive, the Library of Congress, AIG, Thomson Reuters, and the Carnegie Endowment, and she has created graphics and projections for productions at venues including Lincoln Center, Carnegie Hall, the Apollo Theater, the Superdome Arena, and the Hammerstein Ballroom. At the Kraine Theater, NYC, photo credit Erika Conway

At Lemma Coffee Roasters, our people are what set us apart. We�re passionate, we�re creative, we�re lighthearted, we love making coffee and having fun with our customers. Our mission is to celebrate specialty coffee while creating an experience that is fun, uplifting and doesn�t take itself too seriously. In the summer of 2017, Daniel Baum, our owner and founder, left his former career path in commercial photography to pursue his passion of sourcing, roasting and serving mind-blowing, single-origin coffee. Knowing that the key to a successful business is people, he aspired to eventually build a team and create the kind of positive workplace culture that he wanted to see more of in the professional world. In just under two years, Lemma has grown from a one-person show working local farmers markets, to supplying several DFW coffee shops and grocers as wholesale partners, to operating a mobile coffee truck, to most recently opening a full-service espresso bar on the campus of University of Texas at Dallas. Now, we are a team of 5 and ready to plant our roots and open our first storefront, which will house our roasting operation as well as a full-service caf�, in the Carrollton, TX historic square this summer. We are incredibly excited and looking forward to showing our guests in Carrollton a damn good time, providing an engaging caf� experience focused on fun and hospitality, regularly hosting special events and local musicians and most of all, serving delicious and thoughtfully crafted food and drinks every day. We are asking for your help to ensure that we can provide an extraordinary caf� experience from the first day we open our doors for business. The money raised from this campaign will allow us to: Move our roasting equipment and finish the build-out in our new Carrollton home Purchase and install necessary equipment and smallwares for our kitchen Invest in growing our team, primarily through paid pre-opening training and development workshops More about our new location: We chose this location for our first caf� because as the Carrollton historic district continues to grow and realize its full potential, we saw a significant opportunity to put forward high-quality coffee and additional breakfast/lunch options. This space is perfect for us, too, because we will be able to consolidate and showcase our roasting operation, housing the core elements of our business under one roof. Our coffee menu will include espresso beverages, pour-over coffee, cold brew, and much more Our food menu will include locally-sourced pastries, yogurt parfaits, breakfast and lunch sandwiches and more We are a DIY-focused business. We have built multiple coffee bars ourselves, and the build-out in Carrollton will be no different. We are performing a majority of the labor ourselves, including building fixtures, painting, sourcing and framing artwork and installing equipment Our espresso bar in the Arts & Technology Building on the UT Dallas campus Our Coffee Truck at Day of the Dead in Denton Here's our new home in Carrollton! Here's what your mug will look like!

UPDATE: ALL REWARD LEVELS ABOVE THE SINGLE PACK WILL INCLUDE THE METAL AUTOGRAPH CARD, and ALL Reward Levels will include ONE Backer Exclusive Promo Card Pledges received on DAY ONE will receive a gold foil "Day 1" stamp on their promo card. Digital Mockups, Product Not Final ABOUT THE SET Dan Brereton's Nocturnals is a premium wax pack trading card set featuring full color artwork and all new prose stories by series creator Dan Brereton! Each set will contain 18 retro picture cards packaged in a hand-folded and heat-sealed wax wrapper. The cards and pack are printed entirely in the USA, and are designed to replicate the look and feel of classic monster cards from the 1960s and 70s. The cards are printed on old school cardboard chip stock, and the wrapper coated in real wax; hold them in your hands and you'll be instantly transported back to your childhood! ABOUT THE NOCTURNALS Dan Brereton first published the Nocturnals in 1994, to critical acclaim, including an Eisner Award nomination. Over the years a series of graphic novels and specials has followed, leading up to The Sinister Path, a 96-page graphic novel published by Big Wow Art and funded right here on Kickstarter in 2017. The Nocturnals tells the story of supernatural investigator Doc Horror, his spooky daughter Halloween Girl, the silent revenant Gunwitch, the beautiful wraith Polychrome, and a cast of other-worldly outcast heroes who do battle with the netherworld nightmares that threaten Pacific City! ABOUT SIDEKICK The set is produced by SideKick Lab, who manufactured Topps' Mars Attacks: Occupation trading card series, and who's other Kickstarter sets have included Dan Brereton's Creeping Flesh Trading Cards, Ed Repka's Monsterdom Stickers, and The Funny Fiends. Each set is wrapped in a heat-sealed wax-coated paper package, and contained in a miniature full color display box! 11 x 14 SIGNED PRINT Full color, hand signed by creator Dan Brereton, and hand numbered to the limited edition produced just for this campaign! Final numbers to be dictated by orders. METAL AUTOGRAPH CARD Printed by Faerie Metals, these special metal cards are double-thick, full color, and includes the autograph of Nocturnals creator Dan Brereton. COLLECTOR BINDER Two inch collector binder with all-over, double sided full color Nocturnals artwork by Dan Brereton! Store all your Nocturnals cards-- or use it for work or school! Included with the binder is a 3-card "Triptych" Panorama set! SKETCH CARDS In two versions: pencil or full color! All sketch cards will created by Dan Brereton. These cards have already been produced and are currently being drawn by Dan! RAINBOW FOIL EDITION A special version of the set printed on flashy rainbow foil and packaged in a rainbow foil miniature display box emblazoned with the Nocturnals logo! PRINTING PLATES The one-of-a-kind metal plates used to print the set, a "rainbow set" of plates includes ALL FOUR COLORS used to print that card. These sets are available at the highest limited reward level. PDF Sketch Collection A PDF collection of high resolution scans of some of Dan Brereton's greatest Nocturnal's sketch cards! The Samuel French Off Off Broadway Short Play Festival (OOB) is the nation�s leading short play festival. In its four decades, the festival has given voice to emerging playwrights, directors, performers, and production companies. Each year, the festival receives more than 900 submissions, and offers the opportunity to be featured in the festival to just 30 writers. To be accepted is a tremendous honor. Among the 30 playwrights in the festival, some have producing partners: educational institution or theatrical organizations � such as The Royal Court, Circle-in-the-Square, Ensemble Studio Theatre and The Yale School of Drama � that will provide creative teams and financial support. Other writers, like yours truly, unaffiliated with an incubating educational program or theatrical home, will self-produce the work, in order to have it seen in this festival. "Partner Of�" has been sheltered and supported, all over the country: It's had staged readings at Mainstage West, in Sebastopol, CA; the Midwestern Dramatists Center�s Conference, in Kansas City, MO; on the steps of the historic Mordecai House in Raleigh, NC, and the Ivoryton Playhouse Women Playwrights' Initiative, Ivoryton, CT. The play premiered at Rover Dramawerks, Plano, TX, with performances in the Between Us Productions' Take Ten Festival in NYC, where it won Best Play. The play is a finalist in the Garry Marshall Theatre New Works Festival, Los Angeles, CA, will be developed at the Association for Theatre in Higher Education (ATHE) Conference in Orlando, FL. It was published by the Coachella Review, University of California, Riverside. And with your support, will be featured Samuel French Off-Off Broadway Festival in NYC. This is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to expose my work to industry professionals, I am delighted to have the chance to build the best play we can, with longtime director, Leslie Weishaar. Seeing how she will guide the piece makes this such a compelling moment. In the past year, I've dipped into my own pocket to self-produce in New York City several times, and each experience has had its career-building rewards. Here's what the budget for this project looks like: $450.00 ($25./hour X 18 hours for bargain rehearsal space, at Shetler Studios.) $75.00 for props and costumes (that can't be found or borrowed.) $150.00 for original music and sound design $700.00 for honorariums, to offset transportation for three actors, a director and assistant GRAND TOTAL: $1375.00 I am deeply thankful for your support.

WE'VE RACED OUR WAY THROUGH FOUR STRETCH GOALS ALREADY! AND MORE REWARDS ARE JUST AHEAD! HERE'S WHERE WE STAND: SEE BELOW FOR MORE DETAILS. But first, THE BASICS: Creating an ALL-NEW 102+ PAGE GRAPHIC NOVEL about 23rd century bounty hunter Mercy St. Clair, "TREKKER: BATTLEFIELDS". Hi, I'm Ron Randall, and is my third Kickstarter to bring an all-new TREKKER story to print. TREKKER is my dream project. I began telling Mercy's story in the pages of Dark Horse comics. Now I've turned to Kickstarter to publish the rest of her adventures. Everything I love about great comics, great science fiction, and great storytelling finds its way into the pages of each Trekker story. Readers who like Firefly, Battlestar Galactica, and Blade Runner are going to find a lot to love in the pages of TREKKER. "TREKKER...is a genuine badass...A female character that is sexy but not sexualized, that is tough but not without flaws and doubts, and that is dangerous but not without compassion... More Trekker, please."-- Gail Simone �I love TREKKER--and have for a long time. What Ron's built with this series is a genuine accomplishment in this field.�--Mark Waid Like the previous books, TREKKER: BATTLEFIELDS works as an excellent introduction to Mercy St. Clair and to her violent, eventful world as well as a thrilling new ride for long-time readers. There she is thrust into ground zero of a raging war zone. Will she survive to continue her quest for answers in her past that will determine not only her own future, but the course of her entire world? BUT-- I do have the "regular" catch-up bundle in it's place-- everything except that gone RITES OF PASSAGE volume can be had for a mere $55! See, there's always a silver lining. �Retailers! I love seeing TREKKER on bookshelves. So you'll see a special Retailer's Reward Level included here so your store can be a vital part of the Mercy Campaign! Retailers can recieve FIVE copies of BATTLEFIELDS as a special discount rate. �I offer one ADD-ON reward, the complete DIGITAL BUNDLE of ALL of Mercy's stories to date. Close to 600 pages of every Trekker story leading up to BATTLEFIELDS, including several extra touches- like special stories and alternate covers--that I added exclusively to this bonus, catch-up pack. To add this, simply hit the MANAGE MY PLEDGE button, add $50 to your pledge amount, and send me a note via the Kickstarter message feature. NOW, THE FULL LIST OF REWARDS: A TREAT FOR 100 RE-TWEETS: We did it! We succeeded in getting THIS TWEET re-tweeted 100 times before our campaign ends! So, every backer will get a special, digital Inktober sketchbook I have compiled of portrait sketches from several of my favorite TV shows (plus a few from my favorite comic book)! We are marching through a large array of extra features to be added to our campaign, all designed to make TREKKER: BATTLEFIELDS as cool a book and as fun a campaign as possible. (Note: Digital backers will get the digital version of each of these, except for the Cover Spot Varnish.) Here's where we stand: Our first stretch goal lets me add a full supply of Behind the Scenes Extra features- everything from snap shots of the process steps I use to create some of the key pages in the book to initial character designs, to some finished character portraits. Enough extras to make you feel like you were there at every step of bringing BATTLEFIELDS to life! Our second stretch goal added a classy, distinctive spot varnish over Mercy's figure to the cover. If you have either of the two earlier books, you already know how cool this makes the book look and feel. If you don't have those earlier books yet, I can promise you'll agree that this enhancement will make TREKKER: BATTLEFIELDS hold its place on your bookshelf with even more pride! I've always loved this extra enhancement on GN's, and I'm thrilled to bring it to our new book! And, we've just unlocked a Kickstarter-first for TREKKER: A FULL-SIZE poster urging you to join the the Trekker cause! This will come folded, and with a worn, tattered look to give it a real "Battlefield" feel. (Note: This is an initial design, and may be revised and refined before printing.) For our fifth Stretch Goal reward, let's add a little protection to our book, to keep it safe when the action gets heavy! I'll design a custom wrap-around dust jacket exclusively for our book! Another Trekker Kickstarter first, to celebrate the growing success of these campaigns! Next, a set of four memorable images from the BATTLEFIELDS story, printed as a Kickstarter-exclusive postcard set! AND THAT'S STILL NOT ALL. I have even more cool, exciting stretch goals waiting in the wings to be deployed as we hit these. So dig in, take aim, and fire at will to knock our way through these targets! SHIPPING: FULFILLMENT BY BLACKBOX! Once this campaign ends, I'm committed to getting TREKKER: BATTLEFIELDS into your hands in as timely a fashion as possible, and to have you be just as delighted with the service as you will be with the book. And because of that I�m thrilled to be working again with Blackbox, a fulfillment company from the kind folks behind Cards Against Humanity! These classy and delightful professionals will assure us the best, most dependable, and timely fulfillment process possible! Having worked with Blackbox on my previous two campaigns, I know the level of excellence they deliver can�t be beat. They offer great follow-through at every aspect of the work. And in the few cases where something goes wrong with a shipment, Blackbox works immediately to address it. That�s professionalism. And it comes with a cost. The shipping fees that I�ve set for each reward level are based on the charges I get from Blackbox. This rate generally, though not always, cover their fees to me. I aimed at a fair balance of the costs. The rates you�ll see at most reward levels are: $7-$10 US $25 Canada $40 Rest of the world NOTE: International charges are particularly tricky. I intentionally set one, "International Introductory Shipping Rate" for international backers who order just the basic single copy of BATTLEFIELDS at the TOUR OF DUTY LEVEL. Honestly, at this rate I am losing money for these backers. But if that's what it takes to get the new book into your hands, I'll take that hit. WHERE DOES THE MONEY GO? Creating a book like TREKKER: BATTELFIELDS isn't cheap. I've had to factor in the costs of printing, shipping, manufacturing rewards, Kickstarter fees, fulfillment services (yep--that great, reliable service from Blackbox comes at a cost)...etc. And while I'd also love to eventually get paid for the weeks, nay, months that I've labored on this book, I'm not asking for that in the campaign's goal. But I am paying for some invaluable expert aid to assure that TREKKER: BATTLEFIELDS is as good as I can possibly make it. Beyond those good Blackbox folks, our campaign in enriched by savvy editorial guidance from the Alissa Salah (Sleepless), splendid cover coloring by Jeremy Colwell (Batman/Ninja Turtles), and interior coloring assistance by Caitlin Like (Maiden in the Machine). I'm also once again taking on printing consultant and a production ace Rhiannon Rasmussen-Silverstein to make sure we get all the bugs out before we deploy. I need to recoup those out-of-pocket expenses to help me keep my own lights on while I draw away tirelessly and lovingly on the TREKKER tales that will, when we succeed here, follow close on the heels of BATTLEFIELDS!

In his Bowling Alone work, Harvard professor Robert D. Putnam concluded that the decline in the American Bowling Alley as an institution reflects a similar decline in American social capital � the value of our human networks. But there's more to the American Bowling Alley then just social capital. According to Stanford professor Raj Chetty, the rise and fall of the American Bowling Alley likely reflects the rise and fall of nothing less than the �American Dream� itself � the belief in upward social mobility. The American Bowling Alley is a bellwether of the American Dream. What do these bellwethers of the American Dream look like? What visual clues about the American Dream � lost or found � do bowling alleys reveal? BOWLING THE AMERICAN DREAM seeks to answer these questions, visually documenting the American Bowling Alley and its bowlers. The book will be approximately 112 pages, with over 100 photographs and an introduction by the photographer. The book will be hardcover with a full color dust jacket, and the pages will be 100 pound coated stock. A fantastic book for any coffee table or photography library!

My name is Emily Gartner, I am an Indiana artist/designer that creates historical memories with a modern twist though my sustainable fashions and pop art designs. I also teach sewing to adults and youth and mentor select children who show promise in fashion, art and design. One such individual is Zairion Lester. I have been mentoring him for 4 years. Last summer he worked as my intern helping me with a wearable art project for Habitat for Humanity's 'Women Build' fundraiser. He currently goes to Signature School and will start his junior year in August. He came to my attention when his teacher, Sarah Mabis, from Glenwood Leadership Academy, asked me to come check out what he made from scrapbook paper I had donated to her class. He built a Harlem, NYC brownstone out of foam core board, scrapbook paper and LED lights. It was the house of Harlem Renaissance artist, Lois Mailou Jones. I didn't know about her before, but I certainly have seen her artwork in museums in NYC and Boston since Zairion brought her to my attention. Zairion's brownstone of Lois Mailou Jone's Harlem residence I met Sarah Villines last year. Her grandmother had passed away and she was given her vintage sewing machine. She wanted to learn how to sew on it. And since my class has vintage sewing machines and one similar to her grandmother's, that was not a problem. Her intent listening and execution of projects was impressive and I could tell she simply loves every aspect of fashion by nature. Sarah is 11 and attended Harper School this year and will go to Washington Middle School next year. Typically, the team would not consider her because they look for children 13-17, but I convinced them that Sarah was their ideal candidate and they would not be disappointed. Sarah has been upcycling her dresses into crop tops for a few years. You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00 We are all honored to be selected to compete in the very first Indiana Fashion week June 18-22 in Indianapolis. Zairion & Sarah will compete in the 'Youth Design Challenge' and I will compete in the 'Super Model Market Challenge'. In addition to that, I have been selected to be a Sewing Mentor at this very prestigious event, mentoring one-on-one in that same Youth Design Challenge. (Although, I seriously doubt I will be paired with Zairion or Sarah.) Zairion and Sarah will shop at Goodwill Indy on 6/18 with 4 other teenagers and select clothes they will 'upcycle' into a new, fresh design. On 6/19 they will spend the day with individual sewing mentors (me included) designing, sketching and creating on the sewing machine. On Saturday, their designs will go into a runway show, which will be the first official runway show of Indiana Fashion Week! My design challenge is a little different: I've been given a mood board with different color palettes from the color wheel...red+orange/blue+green/yellow+gold. The theme for the display models is "The Super Model Market". Think high fashion and Met Gala. I'll be honest with you high fashion, couture is not a comfortable category for me, but certainly the quirky pop art accessories are something that I love. (I've designed a Tang handbag and the wild astro umbrella hat shown in our group photo...I know, crazy, right?!) Super Model Market Challenge Designer Showcase The Tang handbag So how did this all come to be you ask??? Recently, I applied for a Creative Entrepreneur Scholarship that the Arts Council of Southwest Indiana announced. I was honored to receive that grant through the Indiana Arts Commission On-Ramp program. During a panel discussion I met Mich(ael) Weston, a Fashion Branding guru from NYC, although he originally started out as a pastor in Indiana. Anyway...during his talk he began to map out the details of Indiana Fashion Week and I was hanging on his every word. We had already begun to chat before his talk as he had noticed my newly designed bomber jacket. And after the talk, I wanted him to know about some of my sewing students. He insisted I send him their names for the youth competition. And one thing simply led to another...and the ball has not stopped rolling yet. It is the very first time Indiana will be presenting this event, a brain child of Denisha Ferguson, designer of D'Lang Designs. There will be a strong presence of New York's Fashion Week represented. As a matter of fact, Fern Mallis, the woman who initiated New York's will be honored at www.IndianaFashionWeek.com (Watch the documentary "The Tents" to learn her story, it's fascinating!!!) So you see, Indiana has way more to offer than just corn, Indiana is fashion too...who even knew? This is an incredible opportunity for us to represent our city of Evansville and shine. I met with Zairion and Sarah to bring them up-to-date on expectations and have given them assignments to discover more about this event. They just finished school for the year. We will likely do a trial run at our local Goodwill to be better prepared. I've already purchased all of my fabrics, baubles and bits for my challenge, which has taken over my house. We will head to Indy with the parents chaperoning the week of June 18th-22nd to compete and volunteer in Indiana Fashion Week. And with that comes a budget of expenses we will incur and we need your love and support. Here is the breakdown on expenses: Hotels (x3 rooms) for 5 nights $1,500. Gas there and back for 3 cars 210. Food (x6 people) for 6 days 1,620. Supplies for design comp. 100. Addl. trips for garment drop offs 60. INDFW ticket for family members 210. VIP Party, Rewards & S/H 200. Reward Images... Zairion's Harlem Renaissance musician print Evansville, Indiana's Greyhound bus station print

The Officially Licensed One-To-One Scale Seed of Chucky Doll is the most screen accurate Scarred Chucky Doll ever produced. Why? Because every detail of this doll is made from actual screen used molds and the clothing was replicated using screen used swatches. MEET THE DESIGNER - TONY GARDNER Tony Gardner on the set of Seed of Chucky Tony Gardner has been a makeup effects artist for over 30 years. After starting his solo career creating the Half Corpse for �The Return of the Living Dead� at the ripe old age of 21, he and his wife Cindy formed Alterian Studios, which has been responsible for the creation of many iconic makeup effects characters through the years, including Liam Neeson as Darkman, Doug Jones as Billy Butcherson from �Hocus Pocus,� and Bruce Campbell as Evil Ash from �Army of Darkness� and of course Chucky from "Seed of Chucky." Tony loses his head in Seed of Chucky His love of masks has extended from his own early Alterian Ghost Factory mask line (which spawned the �Scream� mask), through the design and creation of �Happy Death Day�s� Baby-Faced mask, the Killer mask for �Hellfest,� and Daft Punk�s iconic robot disguises. PLEDGE LEVELS THE DOLL The production molds for the Doll where made from the actual screen used Seed of Chucky Doll Master Molds and the Paint Master was made directly from the insane hands of Tony Gardner, making this the most screen accurate Scarred Chucky Doll ever produced and made available to the public. The Doll stand 30" tall. People will swear that you're holding the actual Screen Used Doll in your evil hands. The internal frame of the doll is made from POM (Polyoxymethylene) Thermoplastic Connectors surrounded by a soft flexible foam giving you the ultimate in durability and flexibility allowing you to pose the Doll anyway you want. It's a lot more impressive when its done we assure you. Also, your Doll will come in a very cool heavily weathered Good Guy Box. Appreciate you all and tell all your friends about our Kickstarter. A Magical Website Hello, everyone! I am Christina Reynolds, better known under the artist name Chante Venuz, and the screen-name ClickaClackPopPop, of DeviantArt (or 1AlmightyFabl, of Discord)! For years, I have always wanted my own business, ever since I was about 7 years old roughly. XD Yes, I was a very studious child in that regard. Boring, I know, but when you have a dream, you gotta just go for it, you know? I wish to finally turn that dream a reality, through several steps: Raise the money! I chose $1000 as the goal in order to cover ALL the cost of creation: Getting the website built, buying the licenses to become a full fledged merchant, having enough money for the first stock, and the finances to ship said stock out to my customers. Get the website created! The second, but easily one of the most important processes. I will be seeking a professional to design the site to be as user-friendly as possible, with the look I want. Get the Licenses! As always, the government demands all merchants to have these licenses in order to sell and actually set up shop. Can't go without 'em, such as the EIN ( Employer Identification Number)! The first stock! Where most of the money will get dunked on. I aim to sell many things, from beautiful crystals and geodes to earthly smudge sticks, from informative books to colorful tarot cards! And, of course, getting my art printed from a computer format into tangible items, such as portraits to hang on the wall, cups, shirts, key-chains, and so forth. As you can see, it's quite a bit that needs to be done, once the financial goals are met! With your help though, I'm sure to make these hopes and dreams a reality, through hard work and determination on my end, and gracious donations from yours~<3 Thank you so much for your time, everyone!

"I'm a guy who loves anthologies, and what could be better than a collection that hits the nail on the head--or, in this case, punches Nazis in the face?' -- Howard Chaykin "Tough to argue with the sentiment! A good read full of passion and craft." -- Mark Waid (about Vol. 1) WHO WOULDN'T PUNCH A NAZI ... AGAIN? Everybody knows who the Nazis are. More so, if you saw a Nazi, you would want to punch that Nazi right across his face. ALWAYS PUNCH NAZIS is the next best thing to actually punching a Nazi. This 66-page anthology addresses the Nazi-like racism that has been growing in America. The creators of Always Punch Nazis focus on the rising issues in America and how to handle bigots who want to oppress the country's citizens. This satirical anthology tells stories inspired by an evil that, although defeated during WWII, continues to fester today. You will learn lots of effective ways to deal with a Nazi, what happens when super-heroes fight for what they believe, how a certain comic book creator handled the Nazis when they knocked on his door (which you can preview below), and many more fun tales about standing up for what is right. Always Punch Nazis Volume 2 Cover by Chuck Wojtkiewicz WHY DID WE RETURN? The first volume of Always Punch Nazis garnered an incredible amount of attention. Word spread about Pilot Studios' mission to share stories and inspire people to battle against racism. Creators from various mediums approached the studio about contributing to the cause. That was the moment the creators realized we needed to continue producing Always Punch Nazis. Thus, Volume Two was born. "What's Better Than Punching a Nazi?" story included in APN Volume 2 OUR MISSION These anthologies are not about earning money. They are about spreading the word and educating people about racism, which continues to grow in our country. With a small goal, Pilot Studios can guarantee that you will receive the anthology that you so eagerly support. That bodes the question ... WHERE DOES THE MONEY GO? Every Always Punch Nazis creator donated his or her time and talent to this book in exchange for copies of the book. The reward tiers are priced to cover the cost of printing and shipping the books, both to backers as well as over thirty contributors. The price also covers the Kickstarter fees. Any extra money raised will go to the production of Always Punch Nazis Volume 3. CREATORS Cover Art and Colors by Chuck Wojtkiewicz Back Cover Art by Hilary Barta and Colors by Jim Nelson Front Cover/Back Cover/IFC Design by Chas Pangburn! APN Logo by Kenneth Matthew Created by Silas Dixon and Ben Ferrari Editor in Chief: Ben Ferrari WRITERS Matt Miner Mike Luoma Kurt Belcher Ronald Bryce Jose Sender Will Allred Robert Wolinsky Mark Badger Sam Noir Kyle J. Kaczmarczyk Jay Huwer CW Cooke Chuck Wojtkiewicz ARTISTS Matt LeJeune Juan Carlos Quattordio Randy Haldeman Jay Peteranetz Jose Sender Robin L. Davis Nicolo� Arcuti Mark Badger Christopher Yao Kurt Belcher Luis Rivera Kevin Norman Ben Ferrari LETTERS Taylor Esposito Mike Luoma Mick Schubert Jay Peteranetz Jose Sender Will Allred Micah Myers Sam Noir Sebastian Valencia COLORS Juan Carlos Quattordio Sebastian Valencia Nicholas O�Gorman Christopher Sotomayor Tony Zollo Christopher Yao Dario Reyes Jose Sender PINUP ART Jay Peteranetz Hillary Barta Jose Sender Kenneth Matthew Michael Spivey Sebastian Valencia Orlando Baez Vic Moya Paradox of Intolerance sample Liberty & Justice Sample Sample Interior Page! MISSED OUT ON VOLUME ONE??? Hey, that's not a big deal. Every tier of Always Punch Nazis Volume 2 comes with a PDF of Volume 1. If you're like us and prefer a physical copy of the anthology, we got you covered. Pick up one of the APN Volume 2 tiers that contains a physical copy of Volume 1. Hi, my name is Roni, I'm an Israeli musician, actor and writer. Any Gama started in early 2017 as a collaboration between myself and Brazilian drummer. By the end of 2017, we managed to collect 5 more people and go to a recording studio together to do our first ever live session. The session resulted in a series of high quality music videos. Here's our first original single, "Running Ahead": And here's our gorgeous instrumental rendition of David Bowie's immortal classic "Space Oddity": Since then we've played every kind of gig there is to play in New York, and now I want to grow bigger. Last time I did this session with 7 people, now I'm doing it with 21 - bass, drums, piano, guitar, flute, 2 violins, viola, cello, 3 trumpets, soprano sax, tenor sax, baritone sax, 2 trombones, tuba, percussion, snare drummer and two singers. On May 26th I'm going to gather everyone in Bunker Studios in Williamsburg for a day of wonderful multicultural music. We'll recover 6 songs, 4 of them originals and the other two covers for two songs that are very special to us: the first one is a beautiful instrumental version of the Bolivian song "Llorando Se Fue" by Los Kjarkas, the second one a first ever English cover to a well-known hip Israeli song "We Just Wanna Give You the Funk" (   ') by Mercedes Band. We believe in creating music that combines many different influences from all over the world. If music is the international language, what we do is a conversation. We come from many traditions, most prominently the jazz fusion scene from the seventies until today. We are happy to create a multilayered sound that speaks to anyone who enjoys good music, no matter where they come from. Come and be a part of our journey! Check out some links to see more of us: Official Website - https://anygama.com Videos from our last session "The Flux Session" - https://goo.gl/osbLc7 Instagram page - https://www.instagram.com/anygamajazz/ Facebook page - https://www.facebook.com/anygamajazz/

As a Lutheran church musician, I've always been writing new music, whether it's a hymn descant or a choir anthem or a liturgical setting. That's the heritage of the Lutherans; lots of congregational song, lots of music, and all held to the highest imaginable standards set by the quintessential Lutheran musician, J. S. Bach. It struck me that I could find a voice by setting the Psalms to modern music styles, meaning the gospel inflected r & b that we all loved in the 70's exemplified by the band Earth Wind and Fire. That music was infectious and uplifting-wouldn't it be great if church music could sound like that? Wes Skold from theproducerwes.com Well of course music does sound like that in the African American church. Jazzy chord voicings, rhythmic grooves, and improvisation is a big part of the gospel style. So my mission really turns out to be about bridging the gap between these two disparate and historic traditions. I like challenges. Ty Lemar When I began writing these psalm settings I knew they would be popular in my church, Nativity Lutheran in Rockport, Maine, and my choir loved to sing them. So naturally I wondered if there might be a wider, more national audience for this music. In order to check that out, I had no choice but to commit myself to finding the best talent and making the best sounding recordings that I could afford. What emerged was the plan to record three of the set and then try to kickstart support for the rest of them. I had recorded Garageband demos at my studio but the quality wasn't good enough to convince others to help me to finance better recordings. Thankfully my nephew Wes Skold was setting up his own recording business in Philadelphia and found the singers with the perfect feel for this music. After collaborating long distance on the basic tracks we assembled for this moment. Here is the Philadelphia crew. From lower left clockwise we have Devaun Brown, Charles Brown, Layla Jones, Jess Taylor andTy Lemar. This scene is from the end of April when we finally all got in the same room and recorded the chorus parts over the course of three days. Ty Lemar had previously recorded his superb lead vocals. What a pleasure to finally hear a complete recording with such amazing voices! Thanks to all! Now you can listen to the first three here. Psalm 40, Psalm 121, and Psalm 23. LISTEN HERE! https://soundcloud.com/cbrownjr Now the fun part begins. Finding our audience. With our ace team now assembled we are ready to tackle whatever comes next, including the remaining 147 Psalms. Will what we have begun with so much promise and potential take on a life of its own? Kickstart it!

The G7 POD is a lightweight comfortable 1.5kg (3.3 lbs) 4-season insulated inflatable ledge that replaces the traditional 7.5kg (16.5lbs) single framed portaledge plus sleeping mat. Imagine climbing Grade VII walls lighter and faster than ever before. This ledge is so light it unlocks the impossible. The G7 POD is a big wall living space. For those times you need some personal space from your partner. Hang two G7 PODs Side by Side to create a spacious double ledge. Sleeping head to head, this is perfect for Date Night. The G7 POD is fast and easy to set up. It can be hung on a vertical wall, an arete, or even a round object like a tree. The G7 POD can be used as an improvised stretcher for support when rappelling. The G7 POD is a four-season synthetic insulated ledge saving you the weight and cost of an additional sleeping mat. At 30" wide x 84" long it's comfortable even for giants. This shelter deploys from a stuff sack and is easy to repack when it is time to climb again. The Storm Shelter�s removable door allows it to fit both single and double G7 POD set ups. No questions asked, no fine print, no BS. How does this work? The G7 POD is really durable. It�s not indestructible. You can not stand on it with crampons, you can not stab it with a knife, but you can use it on a big wall as a ledge to belay from, sit on, sleep and rest. Regardless, if your G7 POD ever gets damaged or wears out, we have your back. As a Kickstarter backer and our first customers we make this commitment to forge a lifetime partnership with you. We ask in return that you do your best to take care of your G7 POD. WARNING THIS IS NOT A SAFETY DEVICE. ALWAYS REMAIN TIED INTO YOUR CLIMBING ANCHOR WITH A CERTIFIED SAFETY LEASH. DO NOT USE THE G7 POD WITHOUT EXPERT CLIMBING KNOWLEDGE AND EXPERIENCE.

A New Idea - The Arctica Featherlyte Down Jacket and Vest The Arctica Featherlyte Down Jacket & Vest What's the Deal Introducing the only down jacket and vest with its own storage pocket located at the inside back that allows the jacket to be stuffed inside and converted to a neck pillow. Great for air travel or that long road trip to your next race event. The Featherlyte has a trim racer fit that can be worn on its own, layered underneath a shell or other insulated jacket. It also has two zippered hand warmer pockets, reflective trim at the center front zipper and reflective logos for safety. A double slider on the front zipper provides infinite adjustment. A mini storm cuff inside the sleeve keeps the elements our without strangling your wrist. Shell fabric is ultra light down proof 20 denier nylon that is soft and comfy(gold & silver slightly different). Filled with responsibly sourced 650 fill power goose down it has an incredible warmth to weight ratio. Watch how the Featherlyte works! Trim racer fit, reflective trim at the center front zipper and reflective logos for safety. Mini snow cuff keeps the elements out without strangling your wrist. Interior neck pillow pocket can be used to store valuables. Double slider at center front zipper allows for infinite adjustment. Featherlyte Down Jacket color options Arctica Featherlyte Down Vest color options Order process Both jacket and vest are available in men's and women's sizes, small thru extra large. We will gather size and color order info via an email order form after the Kickstarter campaign ends. Returns and size exchanges will also be allowed. Why Kickstarter? Ten years ago we quietly launched our company out of a garage on a single item, The Full Side Zip Ski Pant 2.0. We thought that by offering a high quality product in ten colors, backed by exceptional customer service and at tremendous value might mean something. Turns out we were right! Five years ago we launched our revolutionary Raceflex Speed Suit on social media turning the industry upside down. It has quickly become the fastest selling speed suit in the market. Many brands in the outdoor industry are actively promoting next year's gear on Kickstarter, so we decided why not give it a try and give our followers a chance to see it first and offer a preorder price in exchange for their early support! So today we introduce the Featherlyte Jacket and Vest, a unique concept offered at an exceptional value to early supporters. We are happy to answer any further questions via the FAQ and comment pages.

�But we are strong, each in our purpose, and we are all more strong together.�  Bram Stoker, Dracula NIGHT IS FALLING is an eerie ten-issue comic book series centering around a group of neighborhood kids who join forces to thwart a sinister plot involving an ancient vampire who has crept into their town during the hot New England summer of 1977. THE STORY In NIGHT IS FALLING, brother and sister Valerie and Joshua Haskell are moving from New York City to Jonah's Harbor, Maine, ostensibly because their dad has a new job in the town. But it's a chance for a new start in many ways, as Valerie has been dogged by cruel rumors at their former school, and Joshua has been kicked out for fighting. They soon discover that the Jonah's Harbor kids who take them into their circle have been keeping a dangerous secret, and cultivating a plan to save the town from an unspeakable evil. THE SETTING Jonah's Harbor, Maine is a tiny coastal mill town, which in the summer of '77, finds itself once again in transition. The mills are closing, and previous industries (shipbuilding, shoe manufacturing, poultry) are gone for good. Will the town's salvation come in the form of new businesses taking advantage of the cheap land and an eager labor pool, or will a darker force capture Jonah's Harbor in its evil grip? WHO WILL LOVE NIGHT IS FALLING? People who grew up on movies like Fright Night, Lost Boys, The Goonies, Stand By Me, Buffy the Vampire Slayer, The Gate, Monster Squad, Gremlins, E.T., Cloak and Dagger, War Games� any of those timeless classics from the 80s where it�s up to the kids to save the world. (And a story that isn't afraid to put our heroic kids in serious danger.) Readers of bleeding edge comics like Sabrina, Afterlife with Archie, Monstress, Lumberjanes & Motor Crush Fans of Stephen King stories/films like Salem�s Lot, It and Stand By Me (The Body) and other spooky tales set in New England People who love the commitment to detail and setting in the hit series Stranger Things Fans of Dracula and other classic vampire stories Fans of Neil Gaiman�s young adult horror stories Coraline and The Graveyard Book - We've got some vampire violence and light swearing but depending on your child, we'd rate our book a PG-13. If you'd enjoy a comic with the pacing of an old school horror film, atmospheric visuals, and starring a cast of characters you care about, THIS IS YOUR BOOK! WHAT EXACTLY DO YOU GET WITH NIGHT IS FALLING #1? Night Is Falling #1 is a full color comic book that will be 30+ pages in standard American comic size, on high-quality gloss paper. It's the first of 10 planned issues that cover our 1977 story arc. Backers get a digital and/or physical copy of the book. Includes 30 pages of story (no ads) plus great bonus content at the end of the book. At higher pledge levels, great bundles of extra collectible merchandise, including an enamel pin, a metallic mini-print, and a Kickstarter exclusive Salem's Lot parody t-shirt that's sure to be a conversation starter! At the highest levels, limited opportunities to get original art on sketch covers, an extremely rare Kickstarter exclusive variant cover, an original vampire story starring you, and the chance for a pet, yourself or a loved one to be immortalized forever and drawn into the first issue of Night Is Falling. THE CREATIVE TEAM Also, when time permits, we slay vampires. If you share our love for vampire stories, especially ones inspired by modern film classics where average kids become heroes that embark on fantastic and dangerous missions, we think you'll really dig what we are up to. Those are the kind of stories that shaped us during our formative years. Our whole team feels in this modern climate, tales of heroic kids are particularly resonant and we want to bring more of these stories into the world. THE REWARDS Below you will find examples of what you can receive depending on which tier you choose. Free US Shipping! THE PLEDGE LEVELS ALL OR NOTHING With Kickstarter, it's all or nothing funding. Meaning this project will only get funded and made if it reaches its goal. And you won't be charged for your pledge until after our campaign ends, so please don't hesitate to make a pledge now if you can't afford it until later. IN SUMMARY With your help, this will the the beginning of something big! If you've made it this far, thank you so very much for your interest in Night Is Falling. Our long-term goals for this project are to expand far beyond this 10 chapter story. If this project is a success and finds its audience, we hope to branch off into live-action continuations of the story which may include audio drama, web series and perhaps even a feature film. The world of Night Is Falling starts small but we have big ideas to expand the universe and mythology of our story. With your help, we have many monstrous roads to travel together! WANT TO GET A BITE-SIZED TASTE OF NIGHT IS FALLING BEFORE YOU BACK? SCROLL DOWN TO READ THE 10-PAGE PROLOGUE! If you like what you've seen so far, and want to help us bring the world of Night Is Falling to life, please select one of our pledge rewards and click the green BACK THIS PROJECT Button to climb in the coffin with us. And don't forget to share this with your friends. There may be someone you know who would love this story. Any help you can give us to get in front of them would be so awesome. Thank you!

The regular cover for The Crimebusters #1! Scroll down for a sneak preview! The Crimebusters is a mystery adventure featuring a team of student sleuths who uncover a deadly secret. When one of the most beloved professors at bucolic Curtiss Tech college turns up dead, amateur detectives Chuck Chandler and Trixie Trouble must reluctantly team up to solve the mystery of his demise. Was it suicide... or supernatural? Who will love The Crimebusters? What secrets await you inside the first issue of The Crimebusters? The Crimebusters is a 36-page comic in standard American comic size, printed on high quality paper This first issue includes the complete, self-contained 30-page comic adventure novel "Return of the Death Mask!" printed in glorious black-and-white! It also includes a full color cover, a character bio sheet, and a two-page text feature discussing the genesis of The Crimebusters and stars Chuck Chandler and Trixie Trouble backers at every reward level will also receive a digital PDF copy of the comic, including bonus features like concept sketches, character designs, variant covers, and a tease for future issues! this first issue is 100% completed and will go to print as soon as this campaign ends! All stretch goals have been fully unlocked! Who am I and why am I passionate about The Crimebusters? My name is Scott Harris, and I am the creator of The Crimebusters. I've spent the past several months doing every aspect of this issue: the writing, the art, the lettering, everything. It's been a ton of work � and I've loved every minute of it. As a kid, I loved teen detective stories, reading and collecting every volume of series like The Three Investigators and Trixie Belden. As an adult, I rediscovered that love when I came across a comic book character named Crimebuster. An amateur sleuth who helped solve cases while attending college, Chuck Chandler's adventures took him from abandoned mines in upstate New York to Spanish bullfighting rings to the Amazonian rainforests. The Crimebusters creator Scott Harris cosplaying as Chuck Chandler at Boston Comic Con in 2016. I wanted to read more, but there was one problem: the series ended in 1956. And I couldn't find anything like it in today's comic book market. I realized that if I wanted to read more, I'd have to make it myself � and since Chuck Chandler is in the public domain, I could. Still, there was something big missing, which is why I created Trixie Trouble, a spunky and tenacious reporter in the long tradition of classic characters like Veronica Mars, Nancy Drew, and Lois Lane. From the moment I read my first comic book at the age of 10, I've known I wanted to make my own comics. But it took a very special story and a couple of very special characters to turn "wanted" into "needed." I really hope you enjoy The Crimebusters as much as I do, and I can't wait to begin working on the next adventure! What exactly is this Kickstarter for? This Kickstarter is primarily to fund the printing of the first issue. But it's also because I believe Kickstarter is the best venue for independent comic creators to introduce their work to the world. There are so many passionate comic book fans and creators doing interesting work on Kickstarter � work that you can't find anywhere else � and I want to be part of that. Uncover the mystery of... the Death Mask! Check out the first six pages from the first issue of The Crimebusters right now! All Reward Levels Include FREE Shipping Inside the United States! The PDF, included at every reward level, features a ton of bonus stories and material, including concept drawings! The Crimebusters fulfillment timeline Here's a projected timeline for the production and distribution of The Crimebusters, which is 100% complete and will go to the printers as soon as this Kickstarter campaign ends:

This is my first serious attempt at raising funds through KickStarter, and it is for one of my many ideas for a new product. I chose this idea of mine to use because it is the simplest, and I believe most easily marketable of my ideas. If this goes well, there will be other product projects in the near future. The idea is simple. It's a wand to attach all of your (up to four) remote controls to. There are remote control caddies out there, and also universal remote controls to control several different devices at a time. But, neither of those products work very well, or achieve the intended result. This remote control wand would have all of your most important remote controls attached to it, so that you just have to grab for one object in order to control your main devices. No more searching around for remote controls, or sifting through the remote control caddie looking for the correct one, or having to put up with a universal remote control that doesn't full work all that well. This is a simple and low-tech solution for our high-tech world. I will include a simple diagram of the proposed end result, as well as pictures of my prototype. It would be made of hard molded plastic - so it could possibly come in several colors or patterns. On each flat side would be a strip of powerful velcro. A matching strip of velcro would then be put on each remote control. And, once the velcros are joined, your remote controls go wherever the wand goes. Just like attaching something large to a set of keys so that you don't lose them, the same mental trick works with this wand. When all of the remote controls are attached to the wand, each individual remote control cannot be lost, the group of them on the wand is easy to find, and the whole device is easy to manipulate. The goal is for $30,000. Doing the research on getting a new product from idea, to prototype, to production and distribution requires capital. I am past the idea and prototype phases. The most expensive parts are yet to come: production and distribution. In order to protect the idea, I need to hire a patent attorney to submit the paperwork and to keep on retainer to protect the idea. That is about $10,000. Once patented, I have to market it and produce it. That would be another $10,000. And, the final $10,000 would be for incidentals along the way. It would be marketed as a household gadget, much like how you see hanging on store shelves, maybe even marked as "As Seen on TV". But, to get this idea into production, I need to be creative and flexible with my options. I thank you for taking the time in reading this, and thank you in advance of your involvement. I am personally invested into this, and my future projects. So, I promise timely updates along the way. Thank you.

Trans Pride Pun Pins! Fathers Day 2019: My parents choke, gasping for air. Why? I finally proved I was the greatest dad at the table, having delivered my latest dad joke. You see, I can see right through my dad's tough guy facade. I'm nonbinary - making him a trans parent. (I also have a great one about pies) Pin Deets Each pin will be approximately 2" in length and held on with two rubber clutches. They'll feature black plating and a strained glass/transparent enamel, giving these pun pins their signature look. The best dad jokes work on multiple levels - and so do these pins! Featured color variations include trans pride and nonbinary pride flag colors. For trans-trans-parents. Or trans-parents. I've also created versions with "parent" in black and white, hearkening to the ally pride flag. These would be intended for trans-parents --- wait. Trans parents? Trans-parents? Y'all get the idea. It's pride month. So let's celebrate some good trans pride puns. Funding deets My initial goal is for $1,000. My hope is to fund production for enough pins to fulfill rewards, and have 50 pins of each design left over for FlameCon this year. (Plus two extra for my folks!) If we somehow get to the stretch goal point (omg but why, this is only a week long campaign), these can be made into patches or stickers? Or I'm open to other color variations if y'all have suggestions!

About me: I am an upcoming singer/songwriter in the pop genre. I have been writing for years, but have yet to release my true magic. My purpose here is to relate to people in the every day life. I will be displaying the hidden daily life obstacles of youth. There are so many struggles that we all face, yet we tend to be blinded to them. I will display this is in a clever, touching, humorous, and refreshing way. Something the world has never seen before. We are taught to follow a routine and forget that we have the capability to unfurl our wings and fly outside of the common society. My goal is to create a music video for a specific song I have written, while simultaneously work on new music. I want people to see that magic is possible when they co-create with others around them. We all have hidden talents. We all have dreams. We feel as if they are unrealistic but in actuality the answer always resides inside of us. I will be collaborating solely with the local youth of Philadelphia. A Music Video by Jenni W:

Howdy, pals! We're Self Taught No Lessons, a garage rock band outta Cleveland, Ohio with a punk twang sound. We are a mostly-family, all-friend band who formed the group late one tequila-fueled evening much to all of our surprise. We are releasing our four song vinyl EP called Packin' Up at the end of June, and using Kickstarter for pre-orders and to cover a bit of the cost of this DIY band life. We'd love to get this weird little record in your hands! Our guitarist, Joel, lives for recording gear and found himself a Tascam 4-track 414 on a swap page. For a bit of fun, we started recording a few songs with the 4-track and soon realized that our songs sounded pretty damn good straight to tape. We spent the better part of Summer 2018 holed up in our basement studio doing it live 'till we got the takes just right. We picked out four favorite tunes to fit on a 7" record: Slow Song (a song about boozin'), Fantastic Beasts (a song about being fat and fantastic), Time Waste (a song about "nice guys") and Dot (the song that gives the EP its name). The songs on the vinyl were mixed and mastered 100% analog and cut to lacquer from cassette tape at Well Made Music. We have a few other rewards for your support as well: Packin' Up on cassette with bonus tracks (two of which can be heard on our Spotify a Bandcamp pages), test presses, t-shirts, stickers, buttons, cover songs, and recording sessions with our guitarist and sound engineer, Joel! ~sizes s-xl, also available in army green~ Any money made over our goal will go toward recording our full length record and a big bottle of tequila. Hope to see you at our record release show Friday June 28th at The Happy Dog in Cleveland, Ohio. Thanks ya'll! <3 Anna, Ashley, Joel, & Johnny

The relaunched version is clean and modern; it�s bigger, meatier, more colorful, and an homage to Mizer�s classic works interspersed with the best in images from emerging artists. The response from you, our supporters and readers, has been tremendous. Unfortunately, the cost of regularly printing such a high-quality zine has been tremendous as well. From the quality of the digest-sized paper on which we print, to the inclusion of more dazzling color, to staffing and shipping costs, we take pride in bringing Mizer into the 21st century with fresh, new photographers and artists while honoring the practices, tone, and feel of Mizer�s original Physique Pictorial, a physique culture mainstay for more than 40 years. A donation to help fund the continued success of Physique Pictorial will insure that Bob Mizer�s message continues to be delivered and heard, in the medium that gave him the most popularity and acclaim, and in the way he always meant it to be. Hi! My name is Frank and I'm tired of being sold out by companies. My data was sold by a certain social media company, I see advertisements every time I surf the internet, and know that I'm continuously being tracked. Even the big VPN companies are logging data to sell it to the highest bidder. I've become "internet wary" of my use. So, here I am, a person like you. I'm a regular guy whose mission is to encrypt everyone's data from end to end. I decided to make something better and easier for anyone to encrypt their data. In Korean, BoHo means "protect". A VPN is a method of encrypting one's data from one point to another. So, BoHo VPN was born. BoHo VPN's mission is to provide end-to-end encryption. We're not only going to encrypt your communications from your cellphone or tablet, but we're also going to add an ad blocker to help stop those annoying things! By the way, have you tried to search for yourself on the internet? You'll find your cellphone, address, and even your social security number! So, we've come up with an idea. Why not remove all the personal data from those sites? So far, a proven method has been developed to delete all the personal information. This method is a service we'll provide to get your data off of those sites. Be part of the Cyber Revolution!

Imagine walking up to a piece at sunrise and realizing that it�s not swaying in the air, that it is actually moving. And the reason it�s moving is because others are making it. Instead of standing back and just observing, or looking with judgement, you are drawn to step up and take a turn. Try your hand. Challenge your inner fear of inclusion and exclusion to be part of the art. That is why we are making a hand reaching from the dust. Our intention with this piece, is to create art that requires participation to be complete, that thrives on communication, and the willingness to allow yourself to become part of something fun and interactive. Stop standing on the sidelines and get in there. You�ll never know unless you try, yeah it�s scary the first time, but change never comes without a challenge. The sculpture only becomes art with your participation, and the results of these interactions are unpredictable and cannot happen without everyone�s radical self inclusion. You have nothing to be afraid of, except living a life wishing you hadn�t been scared of. I.L.Y. I.L.Y. IS A PIECE ABOUT COMMUNICATION, COLLABORATION, AND THE EAGERNESS TO WORK TOGETHER. Debuting at Burning Man 2019, ILY will be a 32-foot, interactive sculpture made of recycled metal and scrap objects. Housing an internal armature of cables, sprockets, pulleys and springs, the involvement of participants allows the fingers and parts of the hand to bring the sculpture to its full realization. Rewards level images: Sticker Bottle opener (made by Poby Heglar) This will be etched onto a stainless steel flask! This is a mock up of what the tee will look like. Teamwork makes the dream work, ft Bobandi and Rufio. We already have our base! It was fabricated by Jeff Schomberg at the Letter Factory in Reno, NV. Base being fabricated by Jeff Schomberg at The Letter Factory, Reno NV Base being loaded for transportation! It arrived! Getting ready for unload! Can we lift it? Do we need machines or are we the machines? You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00

We are back with our 11th Kickstarter project! Our bestselling flashlight and customer favorite is the feature-packed ZEROHOUR RELIC XR. Now it�s time for a sequel! Introducing ZEROHOUR RELIC XR2: Compact USB rechargeable tactical flashlight with 2,000 lumen LED, variable control ring, and waterproof USB-C portable charger all-in-one. USB-C (USB Type-C) features a new, smaller connector shape that�s reversible so it�s easier to plug in. USB-C cables can carry significantly more power, so they can be used to charge larger devices. USB-C provides plenty to like. It�s reversible, so you�ll no longer have to flip the connector around a minimum of three times looking for the correct orientation. It�s a single USB connector shape that all devices will adopt in the future, so you won�t have to keep loads of different USB cables with different connector shapes for your various devices in the future. And you�ll have no more massive ports taking up an unnecessary amount of room on ever-thinner devices. It has been no small endeavor to integrate an LED this powerful with a top quality high-drain battery, and then route that power to your portable charger. Packing all this energy into the original XR�s patented design, ZEROHOUR XR2 incorporates a tail-cap switch with momentary-on click setting, anti-roll ring, removable clip, and replaceable stainless steel head bezel. We come to you with experience developing many successful campaigns from start to finished product. Whether you're indoors or outdoors, on the go or on the job, ready for adventure or just keeping safe, XR2 is the perfect choice to power and light your way. Built with the latest game-changing Cree� XLamp XHP35, a high-intensity LED that radically reduces the optical source size and power required to achieve its 2,000 lumen output. XR2 shines dangerously bright, providing plenty of confidence and security for its size and weight. Cycle through four different mode positions on ZEROHOUR XR2's innovative variable brightness control ring: Mode Overview *We apologize that the camera's auto-focus made it a bit hard to see the variable brightness mode; 0 to 2000 lumens Triple Output: Press the tail-cap half way for momentary-on at 10 lumens. Fully click for constant-on at 10 lumens. Click twice more within two seconds to jump to high (2000 lumens), click twice again for strobe. Stand-by/USB-C: From position one, turn one-click clockwise to set to stand-by. This activates the USB-C ports, which can be used to recharge XR2 or send power from the powerbank to your devices. Variable Brightness: This next setting allows you to select any desired brightness from 0 to 2000 lumens. USB-C Powerbank Feature You can charge practically any USB device using our supplied USB-C to USB-A adapter cable and any USB charging cable (e.g. Apple Lightning, Micro-USB, Mini-USB, etc.) Battery One 18650 High-drain 20A IMR battery provides 3,100 mAh of power (1-2 full charges) for most smart devices. If you are a cycling enthusiast or planning to join the sport, then you must know the importance of tracking your workouts to keep yourself motivated. This is where XOSS G+ comes in. XOSS G+ upgrades on the wired cycling computers with the latest breakthrough in GPS technology that tracks each and every moment accurately and precisely. It is easy to install and offers a seamless user experience. With four satellite positioning systems, including GPS, BEIDOU, GLONASS, and GALILEO ensures that your connection remains stable throughout your ride. XOSS�s support of ANT+ protocol transmission makes it a premium range product that�s compatible with most cycling sensors on the market. It records 15 kinds of data to meet the most essential need of cyclists. XOSS G+ supports third party apps such as Strava and Training Peaks, so you can easily share your rides with friends and fellow cycling enthusiasts. XOSS G+ also comes with its own companion app, providing professional data analysis and performance tracking. This data could be critical for those preparing for cycling tours and competitions. With IPX7 technology, XOSS G+ is waterproof so that you can enjoy the cycling experience in all weather conditions. Inside the package, you�ll find the XOSS G+ Cycling Computer together with other accessories including rubber bands, rubber gasket, bike computer mount and a USB cable. The deck of the Wet Nose was abuzz with activity. The crew desperately adjusted sails, pulled ropes, and turned wheels � anything to try and steer the course of the ship away from the looming thick fog sitting dead ahead of them. Captain Pug calmly walked among the crew, staring at the Fog when she wasn�t barking the occasional order. Eventually, the blue sky took up more and more of the view. Noctis returned to his captain, who was still staring ahead. �Ma�am, shouldn�t you be happy? We�ve cleared the Fog.� �We have. But you�ve forgotten one thing.� At that precise moment, the water all around the ship started to boil. The acidic water splashed onto the desk, irritating the eyes and skin of all the crew as they tried to figure out what was going on. Noctis ran to the side of the ship and stuck his head into the spray, shielding his eyes to get a better look. He caught a glimpse of something dark and rubbery slithering under the water before it disappeared again. Then he heard a loud keening wail, and a giant squid-like creature lurched out of the water in front of the ship. Its tentacles waved menacingly in the air as it reared up, as large as the ship itself. Captain Pug stared calmly at the monstrosity. �You forgot the kraken, number one.� Click <HERE> to learn more about the Realms of Pugmire! The main goal of this Pirates of Pugmire Kickstarter is to enable us to create a hardcover edition of the Pirates of Pugmire book compatible with the other Realms of Pugmire core rulebooks such as Pugmire and Monarchies of Mau. We want to create an 7" x 10" hardcover with an evocative, action-packed cover image and a Pugmire- and Mau-inspired cover design. We estimate the book to be between 150-200 pages, with a full-color interior and endpapers on high quality paper stock. We also want to get at least one print run into traditional distribution and available for sale at game and hobby stores. Not Final Design. Pirates of Pugmire is a chronicle sourcebook for both Pugmire and Monarchies of Mau. It�s usable in either game, or as part of a joint experience. Some highlights include: Two new species for players to enjoy: lizards and birds Six new callings, including two for dogs and two for cats Rules for building, sailing, and sinking ships A trove of new allies, enemies, and treasures Information on Waterdog Port and Port Matthew �Going on the Account,� a chronicle of three new adventures, taking characters from 1st through 6th level Throughout this Kickstarter campaign, we will be posting complete previews of the Pirates of Pugmire manuscript as backer-only updates. MORE INFORMATION, INTERVIEWS, and REVIEWS To hear Eddy's complete audio Design Diary, check out the OnyxPathcast <HERE> Click below to hear an interview with Eddy about Pirates of Pugmire from The Story Told podcast team: Click to hear an interview with Eddy Webb about Pirates of Pugmire Dogs have inherited the world, building the kingdom of Pugmire untold centuries after the Ages of Man were over. These dogs have been uplifted to use tools and language, and they seek to rediscover the ruins of the Old Ones. Some have learned to use the leftover technology of humanity, but they believe it to be magic handed to them by their lost gods. Others seek to create an ideal civilization, using a Code of Man compiled from ancient, fragmentary lore left behind by humanity. The world is dangerous and mysterious, but good dogs will persevere. Pugmire is a light-hearted and family-friendly fantasy world. It�s one of the first of Onyx Path�s creator-owned games, produced in a partnership with Eddy Webb and Pugsteady. Combining the ideas, passion, and creativity of experienced designers with decades of experience in producing quality roleplaying game products, these creator-owned games push the boundaries of the �Onyx Path brand� in new and diverse directions. After a successful Kickstarter campaign, the Pugmire roleplaying game Core Rulebook was released in 2017. The game featured a traditional fantasy rules system redesigned for streamlined play and easy creation of heroic dogs, with an emphasis on cooperation and action over competition and violence. Since the initial release, the Realms of Pugmire have expanded to include adventure scenarios and audio dramas, as well as a new game in the setting featuring the cat-based Monarchies of Mau. The recent introduction of Canis Minor, a community-driven digital content storefront, has further opened up the world for exploration. As noted, the primary goal of this Kickstarter campaign is to create the best version of the Pirates of Pugmire that is possible. Your support allows us to fund the best production, use the most appropriate components, and possibly even contract more art for the book. We hope to not only deliver a beautiful book to all of our backers, but also fund at least one print run to be sold through distribution and into book and hobby stores that are so vital to our community. Beyond that primary goal, we hope to gain additional funding to explore more of the Realms of Pugmire, expanding into rules companions and other Pugmire-related tools and accessories. The greater our funding for this project, the more resources we are able to explore options and this game line. Thirdly, we want to celebrate the success of Pugmire and Mau so far by offering an opportunity to for new players to join in. We'll help backers by including a discounted selection of PDF titles � the core rulebooks, as well as a digital treasure chest containing expansions and supplements. Beyond all of those campaign-specific goals, we hope to do what our games have always done � open a path to a new world; a setting for our community to build new stories and entwine imaginations.
