My name is David Savedge and I am a blacksmith and artist. I started smithing and metal work as a child and trained with a journeyman blacksmith at Jamestown Settlement and a master brass founder at Colonial Williamsburg. I have finally built a basic shop on my farm, Ravenstead. It's a simple shop reminiscent of the 17th century shop I worked in at Jamestown. Ravenstead is my home and family business with smithing becoming a bigger part of what I do to provide. This current project will help better establish the blacksmithing shop at Ravenstead. When I'm not working on the farm or smithing I'm thinking about games and gaming. I love classic tabletop role-playing games. I had a blast making my last several Kickstarter Projects, Forged Iron Protection Runes: A Tabletop RPG Token , Dragon Scales: A Tabletop RPG Game of Chance , Scrying Dice: A Tabletop RPG Runic Accessory. and Dice Vaults and Treasure Coins: Tabletop RPG Accessories I am excited to share my new project, Troll's Teeth: A Tabletop RPG Game of Chance� ! It is a combination of my two favorite things, gaming and blacksmithing. I am presenting the game in a fantasy setting here, but I already have plans to use this in a Sci-Fi Campaign taking place in an isolated back-world cantina. Troll's Teeth truly fits into any RPG! Troll's Teeth is a game of chance for use with any Role Playing Game System. The rules are straightforward and designed to favor the adventurer, inspiring excitement and fun. The game is played with six handmade iron or wooden teeth that are cast across your favorite tavern table. Place your wager, cast the teeth, then count the pips and consult the results table in the PDF rules provided. I am offering sets of wood and iron. Each set comes with a cloth drawstring bag, three hand-struck pewter coins, and a PDF copy of the rules. The wooden set features teeth made from western red cedar and has pips wood-burned into opposing facets. Each tooth roughly measures 0.5" x 1.5". The teeth are finished with linseed oil giving them a deep golden color. The iron set is hand-forged and filed, with pips stamped into opposing facets. Each tooth roughly measures 0.375" x 1.5". The teeth are lightly coated with beeswax to protect the finish and prevent tarnishing. Trolls Beware! Beware of trolls at your doorstep! The best way to protect your stronghold is to display a lock of troll's hair affixed with a forged nail. This will serve as a warning to any marauding beasts that a mighty slayer resides within! This reward includes a lock of troll's hair adorned with a copper colored plastic bead and two hand forged nails. I keep one nailed above my forge to discourage any nasty beasts from hanging around! I have plans for numerous add-ons and stretch goals for the project. If the project reaches a high enough goal I will be able to offer leather pouches, extra pewter coins, and a handcrafted Troll's Tooth necklace! Let's make this a BIG project! Here is a look at the Troll's Tooth Pendant. You can pledge for this alone or add $38 to your original pledge to receive the pendant along with your other rewards! The money I earn with this project will go towards improving my blacksmith shop and developing my Etsy Store. In terms of shop improvements, we are looking at building a larger work space here at Ravenstead. This would involve pouring a concrete slab, construction of a building, running power to the building, and the monumental task of equipping the shop with forges and other heavy equipment. It will be a long process and the first step will be site planning, surveys, and drafting of plans. If you're anything like me, you like to know the behind-the-scenes details of a project like this. I would like to share this process with you, so some of the funds from this project will go towards establishing a stronger presence on YouTube and towards developing a Patreon Page. Anything left over will go towards coal for the ever-hungry forge, and other consumables such as metal files, wire brushes, and metal stock. Shipping I will be using USPS to ship all rewards via First Class Package service. Should the shipping weight exceed 16 ounces with the purchase of extras or add-ons an additional fee may be required to cover the postage. (c) 2018 - 2019 David Savedge

We need your help to turn post consumer, one time use plastic bags into durable, lightweight minimalist wallets. This project exists to help tackle the growing problem of one time use shopping bags while raising awareness of the mounting problem of plastic pollution. Why bags? Plastic bags are among the most common sources of marine debris and are not biodegradable, meaning each bag thrown away could potentially become a wildlife serial killer for hundreds of years. According to Waste Management only 1% of plastic bags are currently being recycled. This is because bags are really hard to recycle. Do to the nature of the bags, there aren't many companies who can actually recycle them. This is because in order to recycle bags, companies need expensive and specialized equipment. In fact, most municipalities don't have this equipment and ask their customers to keep the bags out of the recycle bin because they just end up jamming their recycling machines. There's also not enough of a financial incentive to recycle bags in the first place as plastic is extremely inexpensive and easy to produce. Workers at a Waste Management Inc. recycling facility try to detangle dozens of plastic bags stuck in the sorting equipment. The plant has to suspend operations several times a day while the workers fix the problem. A campaign for a better tomorrow Changes start small and good ideas are worth spreading. After months of trial and error, we're fortunate to have found a process of upcycling bags that produces a beautiful leather like material that is both lightweight and extremely durable. Also, the process to turn these bags into leather like material does not produce any smoke, fumes or pollution to the environment. If the campaign were to be successful, we could show the world a small solution to the growing plastic problem and spark the innovation of other entrepreneurs and activists to create solutions of their own. Why this campaign matters This minimalist wallet is made from 100% post consumer, one time use plastic shopping bags and the campaign's success shows the world that there is demand for upcycled goods. This is more than a minimalist wallet, this is proof that upcycled goods can be unique, beautiful, and perform better than mass produced products.

This project, intended for professional IT security auditing use, aims to create rainbow tables for NTLM 9-character passwords using the full U.S. keyboard character set. Generation will be done using the open-source Rainbow Crackalack code. Compared to brute-force searching, password auditing with these tables can be 19 times more efficient in terms of time and electricity usage! Several milestones for the project are set: 10% coverage of the entire keyspace. 25% coverage of the entire keyspace. 50% coverage of the entire keyspace. The first and second milestones (10% & 25% coverage) are guaranteed to succeed even without any funding. However, 50% coverage can only be attained with the purchase of additional GPU (& support) hardware. Along with electrical costs to power the equipment, this is where all project funds will go towards. It should be noted that even 10% coverage can be extremely useful in some real-world scenarios. For example, if NTLM hashes for 20 high-privilege accounts were obtained, cracking with this limited set would yield two plaintext passwords on average. And as any experienced penetration tester would confirm, all that's really needed is one cracked hash... Ideally, 95%+ coverage is desirable, but experimentation with 8-character NTLM tables showed that pushing past 70% is problematic. Namely, the efficiency of raw tables begins to drop very significantly; in the 80% range, 1 TB of raw tables yields only 37 GB of processed and usable data (only 4% efficiency!). Given that the 9-character keyspace is 95 times larger than the 8-character keyspace, this implies that roughly over 150 TB would be needed, which would take many years to generate with the project's existing hardware, along with many thousands of dollars in electricity costs. We will attempt to crowd-source free help from the community regardless. Every $3,000 the project raises, a new 6 x NVIDIA RTX 2060 machine can be purchased and operated for six months (hydro-electric power is cheaply sourced from Niagara Falls). At least one new machine is needed. If over $10,000 is raised, additional machines based on the NVIDIA RTX 2070, 2070 Ti, 2080, and/or 2080 Ti will be built. This is estimated to yield results in the 65% range in 5-6 months. Funding up to $100,000 can be effectively used; reaching this limit would make 99% coverage of all 9-character NTLM passwords nearly guaranteed! No matter the outcome, all tables will be made publicly available for free via BitTorrent on the project website (https://www.rainbowcrackalack.com/). Hard drives pre-loaded with the tables can be purchased for convenience/sponsorship. Together, we can Make Rainbow Tables Great Again!

Sunny Side Skies is a comic about a detached barista and a bubbly college student who become friends! The plot revolves around their antics and character growth as they go through young adulthood. Read it free online here. The story began as a webcomic in 2017 and after two years the first book is finally ready for print! The goal of this campaign is to collect the first two chapters into a 200 page softcover book, along with a never-before-seen bonus story showing how the two main characters met (This bonus is exclusive to the book and will not be available online). All proceeds from the campaign go directly towards the very first print run! For higher pledge tiers goodies like keychains, prints and enamel pins are offered in a special bundle! This bundle is Kickstarter-exclusive and offers savings on the merch. It also includes a signed edition of the book. As an added bonus for backers, all $25+ tiers come with a kickstarter-exclusive sticker sheet (even if it's not mentioned in the rewards sidebar!) If you can't back on Kickstarter, don't worry! I'm running a social media T-shirt giveaway on Instagram, Twitter and Tumblr. You can help spread the word AND enter to win a cool T-shirt! That about sums it up -- thanks for checking out my project! I'm super excited to get Sunny Side Skies into print! ^o^/

I live in Lewis County, Kentucky and one of our greatest assets is a creek named Kinniconick Creek. The creek originates southwest of Petersville before curving its way 99 miles across the county to its confluence with the Ohio River in Garrison. The miles are filled with fishing, waterfalls, swimming holes, rock formations and more. As far as I know, there as never been a extensive book with photos covering this amazing natural resource that we are lucky enough to call our own! I have the equipment (the computer, software) and the expertise to put such a book together and I am excited about this possibility. I plan to gather more research about the beginning and the end; attain land owners permission when needed; include as much as possible about the creek in regards to the name and its origin and take advantage of the seasons. Since I manage my own business also, I am expecting this project to take from 6 months to a year. I am hoping the final product will lead to an awareness about this local attraction. There has been a lot of talk about kayaking/canoe shops, camping features and other possible ways of increasing tourism. We don't have a great deal of industry in our area but we do have the water and the hills- which in my opinion, make us quite spectacular!

The SpiderForest Webcomic Collective was founded in 2004 to be a home and collaborative community for quality, creator-owned webcomics of all genres. Together, we promote each other, help one another hone our crafts, collaborate on comics and art projects, and create a safe, positive online environment for webcomic creators to learn and grow. Our forums and chat are free to join, regardless of membership! Learn more about us and our comics at spiderforest.com, and be sure to check out the SpiderForest Podcast. We're planning to print a small offset run, but the quantity of books can be expanded if the campaign does well. If we meet our goal we have some fun extras in mind -- including extra comics, SpiderGhost stickers, a "sketch page" edition, and more!

Dear Amazing Arts Supporter, My name is Starry. I am an elementary school teacher, a playwright and the founder of Imaginary Theater Company. Our mission is to produce original plays that empower children to be the heroes of their own stories. Since our inception in 2015, we have produced 5 original plays in New Haven, CT as well as a podcast. Three of our plays have been published by Drama Notebook. We�ve had children and adult actors take their first bows on stage alongside professional actors heading out on national tours. Participation in our productions is free. Our plays are inspired by real challenges children face and the heart, smarts and imagination they use to face them. Growing up, doing summer theater changed my life. I looked forward to it every year. It is where I found my voice and my community. Many of the people I met performing in plays are still my closest friends today. As an educator I have seen how acting helps students build skills they use onstage and off, including public speaking, teamwork, literacy and empathy. By supporting this project you are fueling the passions of a new generation of theater makers and creating lifelong memories for us all. With Love & Gratitude, Starry The 2018 cast of "Canary, Cockroach, Phoenix" About the Play �The Boat� is near and dear to our hearts because it was the first play Imaginary Theater Company ever produced. That first production featured three adult actors and a very talented first grader named Aija making her theatrical debut. (We are thrilled that Aija will be returning to the stage with us this summer along with her younger sister, Alana!) To celebrate our 5th anniversary, and our final summer in New Haven, we are mounting an expanded, revamped version of �The Boat� with more roles to incorporate the children who have joined our company over the years. Our new version of �The Boat� follows the story of two young girls, Marina and Ida, whose mother has disappeared at sea. Everyone, including Marina, believes their mother has drowned. But Ida believes her mother has become a mermaid. Through music, poetry and whimsy �The Boat� tells a tale of grief, healing and resilience. Aija and Mark as Marina and Hunter in the original 2015 production of "The Boat" How Funds Will Be Used Funding will go towards: Renting Lyric Hall for tech week and performances Costumes Props Lights & Sound Publicity Our 2017 production of "Dream Train" at Lyric Hall Our Collaborators Our auditions and rehearsals will be held at The New Haven Free Public Library, our rehearsal home for the 4th summer in a row and the winner of a 2019 National Medal for Museum and Library Service Our performances will be held at the beautiful, one of a kind Lyric Hall, �the best small stage in New Haven� Our promotional artwork was created by Sarah Unghire of Hazel and Bean Our logo was created by Amy Watkins of Cozy Reverie

New York City - Independence 2019 Independence gives us the opportunity for our individuality. The identity of a city is comprised of its individual people. So what could possibly be more about independence than "Independence Day?" Especially in the biggest and most diverse American city in the world, New York City?? This project will reveal the identity of NYC, through real people, painted from life -- not from photographs. This book will also capture scenes of New York that will never be seen again. Seasons change. People come and go. Every moment is unique and will never repeat itself. That drives me to paint all these scenes from life (and not from photographs later). Paintings done from photographs often lack emotional authenticity. Let�s start noticing each other again. See each other as human. Witness our humanity! My pocket-sized travel paint set. Steps to get there. Travel to NYC Paint NYC people leading up to Independence Day.. Paint Independence Day in NYC! Post-processing Print copies of my book by self-publishing my book Create posters of the most iconic imagery. Immediately after this project is funded, I will head to New York City for a total of one week in order to paint the city and its people, all from life. Afterwards, I will self-publish copies of the entire book using high quality papers and inks. Live-painting a Soul Journal in San Francisco. Funding: The majority of the funds will be going toward transportation (airplane, subway, taxi). The rest will be distributed among lodging and cost of materials. I'll be living with everything on my back for a week! Some people have already offered lodging to offset costs. Thank you! Simple materials, significant results. Rewards: You will receive a copy of this book in softcover and/or hardcover formats. I will also print custom posters of certain paintings I created within the book. Previous Soul Journal publications.

I began this project over a year ago with the hope of creating something beautiful and something that would make me proud. Each new illustration has been a discovery of what I'm capable of and love to do. It's been an enriching experience, and I'm thrilled to be here in my kitchen typing this introduction just days before it finally goes public. I chose the story of the "The Little Mermaid" because it was the perfect match for my fondness of dark fantasy, romance, and drawing flowing organic shapes. Mermaids are truly wonderfully fun to draw, and I can't get enough drawing of glorious long hair. It's a simple thing, but I love it. How does it differ from the original 1830s version by H.C. Andersen? I've mostly just updated the grammar so it reads more easily, plus I have added a few of my own ideas. For example, our mermaids have glowing bioluminescent hair to help them navigate in the dark depths of the sea. They have eyes, gills, and skin like a ghost shark. Our little mermaid has a treasured skull collection of all types of creatures that have floated down from the world above. Bird skulls mostly, but there are a few human bones from the poor sailors lost at sea. She has three loving siblings, two sisters and a brother, who watch her grow with pride, and marvel at her talent in singing and dancing. --------- � --------- � --------- � --------- --------- � --------- � --------- � --------- � ------- I bring you an adaption of Hans Christian Andersen's The Little Mermaid. The little mermaid has always yearned for the strange and exciting life of the humans. After saving a human man during a sea storm, she desired his love and to have a life with him. And if they were married, his soul would be shared with her. For mermaid have no souls, and merely return to the ocean as sea foam when they die. Naive and desperate, the little mermaid turned to the banished sea witch among the world pools. The exchange to be human was high. To walk on two legs, she had to offer-up her tongue, and with new feet every step would feel as if she were walking on daggers. Unless the man chooses her as his wife, the spell would break and she would die. Scared, but determined, the little mermaid accepts the sea witch's terms and begins her journey to find love and a soul. --------- � --------- � --------- � --------- --------- � --------- � --------- � --------- � ------- A 60-page signed 6x9 hardcover book with a gold foil stamped cloth cover and spine. A 40-page signed and numbered 8x11 hardcover lay-flat coffee table book with a handmade paper foil press cover. The title is stamped on the spine in silver, and introduced in the first interior page. The book features 12 black and white chalk pastel illustrations, and several graphite spot illustrations. In 2013 I shot a film along the Camino de Santiago in Spain and France and really enjoyed myself. I was able to experience different cultures firsthand and share it, via my film "Wayfaring", to whomever would watch. When I heard a few years ago that some folks had put together a route in Ireland of a similar nature, I knew that I would probably one day want to do it. Well, that day is now! (Best time to hike is usually starting in late June through August). What I also found appealing is that this would be the first trail that I would attempt to make a film of that's, essentially, still in its infancy. The Pacific Crest Trail, Appalachian Trail, the Camino and the 3 trails I hiked in Australia were well-established. Plus, as far as I know, no one has put together a full-length documentary about the Ireland Way as of yet. So the challenge of putting something together that's hopefully informative, entertaining and inspiring truly rocks my boat. The trail should take about 40-45 days to hike (it's roughly 600 miles long). The money would go towards food, some lodging (more camping along the route than the Camino but not as much as the PCT or AT) and a small rent-a-car to be used for about a week to drive around and get b-roll footage via my handheld and a drone that my ever-lovely girlfriend would bring over and lug back. God bless her. I plan to be on the Emerald Isle for a total of 60 days. Hope you partake! Thanks, Scott (Squatch)

Overview Hey everyone! Here at Dapper, we have designed what we are calling the World's Strongest Motorcycle Hoodie! We've taken some of the best abrasive resistant technology out there and married it to your normal everyday hoodie. We use a 4 layer system we've called MAR which stands for a Multi-Layer Abrasion Resistance. On the most outer layer (1), it features a 100% soft spun cotton that is soft, breathable, and most important of all, comfortable. Next (2) is a layer of aramid woven fiber that is designed to protect you against cuts, scratches, and road rash abrasion. (3) Third is CE rated shoulder and elbow armor with a spine protector that protects against impact. It's held in by (4) a mesh inner lining that holds all the layers together while allowing airflow and breath-ability during all riding conditions. What? Being avid motorcycle riders, our founder recently caught himself riding in hoodies rather than full gear during short trips and in summer weather. So the thought occurred, how could we build a protective hoodie to make causal riding safer? We had two goals in mind: 1. Can I go to dinner without anyone realizing this is a fully armored abrasive resistant hoodie? 2. Could the hoodie withstand a 60mph crash? How? We took this hoodie design to a few manufacturers that specialized in motorsport and casual apparel and partnered up. We went through about 5 prototypes and tested each one along the way trying to figure out the right amount of aramid fiber (yes, the same material in bulletproof armor), pad location, preventatives against ride up (when your shirt/hoodie rides up during a crash exposing your skin). We developed a few different mechanisms including a belt loop latch and thumb catch. But the ultimate test was how it fared in a crash. We originally were skeptical that this was going to work. Crash During a meeting, we asked "Anyone want to lay a bike down?" No hands went up. "Anyone want to get dragged down the street?" Silence. No eye contact. It's funny how we love to race cars, ride motorcycles, and be dare devils but when it comes down to it, no one wanted to risk their butt on a product we didn't know worked. Instead, we decided to take Josh, our 100lb body weight, and drag it down our street. One Saturday morning, we zipped up the hoodie, strapped Josh with a tie down and started driving down our street. The first pull was about 60MPH where we dragged him about 500ft. We hopped out of the truck and looked at him. "Wait what?... nothing happened?" There was a little bit of wear on the cotton but really nothing had happened. So we did it again... and again... and again. 5 times at 60MPH back and fourth on the 500ft stretch of road until we broke through the layers. On the 5th time, the aramid fiber layer finally gave and wore through the fibers. We plan on testing this with a stuntman in late 2019. Why Kickstarter? We've always been a small company employing local people and trying to do as much as we can domestically. We design all our products as users of the products. Almost all of our staff are licensed motorcycle riders looking to solve the simple problems we look over. A downside to this method is slow production, higher cost, and slower development. With a successful Kickstarter campaign, we will release the Gen 4 hoodie. The Gen 4 Hoodie includes revised armor placement, additional high strength velcro to adjust the armor placement higher and lower down your shoulder/elbow, and a new drooping rear to give you additional protection lower down your back. Additional changes include a new logo, labeling and a revised sizing chart. Revised Gen 4 Sizing Chart Goal At the end of the day, our goal is to move beyond motorcycles and create a new category of apparel "Protective Casual". Whether you're out gardening, underneath a car, or hands on at work, we want to reinforce your apparel. With materials and technology that can reduce injuries and material wear, you'll be protected. With DFNDR, "Stay Strong and Be Strong."

Hello all, I'm the Artist behind The Tall Grass - thank you for checking out my Campaign! This is my 2nd Kickstarter Campaign (my first being an Eeveelution Acrylic Charm set), but my first running one for Enamel Pins. I've self-funded my first 8 designs over the past 4 months, but need your help to bring this specific collection to life! This series is a fun idea I've been playing with for a few months now, and focuses on the "evil" Organizations from each region of the Pokemon universe, and their most commonly-used Pokemon dressed as their mascots! I've designed 7 Pins in total, as well as 1 Freebie Stretchgoal! Please check out all the designs below, and if you favor any of them, remember that pledging now helps unlock all the designs sooner! Our main goal for this campaign is the Poochyena duo for Team Aqua and Team Magma of the Hoenn Region! I chose Poochyena as the Mascot for these teams as both teams use this common puppy Pokemon, even if they disagree in the whole land versus sea thing. Our first round of Stretchgoals are for Team Rocket Meowth - for reasons that I feel should be obvious to all Pokemon fans - from the Kanto Region and Team Skull Alola Rattata from the Alola Region! Not only is Rattata a common Pokemon used by the Team Skull Grunts, but he seemed the perfect choice to pull off one of Team Skulls more ridiculous, yet iconic, poses~ Stretchgoal wave 2 starts with Team Flare Scraggy from the Kalos Region! Scraggy is the only Pokemon chosen in this campaign that doesn't hail from his teams home Region, but he was a very common Pokemon used by the Grunts in the gang, and he pulls off their pose quite well! The second part of this wave is a FREEBIE Stretchgoal to all backers of 1 pin or more: Giovanni Persian! I couldn't resist sketching up Persian dressed in Giovanni's iconic orange suit, and decided to do his more classic Team Rocket suit as well and turn it into a double-sided clear Acrylic charm! Our 3rd and final wave of Strecthgoals starts Team Plasma Purrloin from the Unova Region! Team Plasma actually has 2 very different uniforms depending on which version of Black/White you played, but I felt the Militia Uniform from B2/W2 suited Purrloin best. And finally we end on Team Galactic Croagunk from the beloved Sinnoh region! There were a few decent choices for Grunt-used Pokemon, but when compared to Plasma's ridiculous outfits and hair... the only true choice was one confused Croagunk! All backers will get a specific number of 2-3in Vinyl Stickers based on their reward level. The sticker designs matching your chosen Pin(s) backed for when you fill out your surveys! There are very limited Reward tiers involving Plushies! The 3 choices are based on the first 3 Pokemon in the Campaign; Poochyena, Rattata and Meowth! These typically measure roughly 10-12in in length. If you back for one of these options, at the end of the campaign you will have the choice of coloring (normal or shiny). For Rattata backers, you can choose not only coloring, but if you'd prefer Alola Rattata versus Kanto Rattata, and Meowth backers can choose to have Meowth with the awake versus sleeping faces! ADD-ON Pins; For any Early-Bird Tiers or Plushie Tiers, if you'd like to add on extra Pins simply add +$12USD to your over-all pledge per pin added. This is restricted to the Pins in this Campaign only, NOT the pins in my store. If you're interested in any of my store items, please message me :) Rough Timeline: JUNE - Kickstarter Begins, runs for 21 days JULY - Kickstarter Ends and Funds are transferred (2-3 week process) AUGUST - Funds are received and Production begins SEPTEMBER - By the end of Sept, all the Pins should be completed and shipped to me. Quality checking will take place. October - Backers begin receiving their rewards! This is a very rough, and generous timeline. Things could progress and finish much faster than October, or they could go right as planned above - but it's better to over-plan, than fall short! Some of my other manufactured Pins;

Every holiday it's the same: a handwritten note scribbled on a punny card. That's not fun. Giving a greeting card should be exciting. With Greeto�, you can attach any video to a physical greeting card in seconds. Our mission is to make your greeting card unforgettable. Seriously, a goofy video of you, mixed with a pink banana card? It can't get better than that. Seems complicated? Don't worry, it's not. Really - it takes seconds to get a Greeto card all ready to go. Look below for some more detailed instructions! Does it make more sense? Awesome! We included a few quick video tutorials below if you need to get an even better grasp on how viewing or attaching a video works. Greeto� is a new technology, but that doesn't mean it has to be confusing! How to attach a video: You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00 How to view a video: You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00 Our all-new batch of awesome Greeto� designs is here! All of the following illustrations have been crafted by hand by Greeto's lead artists - Caroline and Ally! You can learn a bit more about them below. At the end of the campaign, you will have an option to pick any of the designs for your Greeto� card through a reward survey! Design #1 - Banana: This is a funny, yet sarcastic, birthday card that is bound to give your friend a laugh! With bright colors on the front, it will stand out in any pile of greeting cards. Design #2 - License Plate: This is a sincere thank you card that ought to make your friend feel extra special. The sophisticated artwork on the front instantly draws attention! Design #3 - You're Alright: This is another sarcastic card that can be used for a variety of occasions - from a birthday to a congratulations card. If you aren't sure which design to get - this is your best bet! *LOCKED* Design #4 - No Big Deal: A bold way to wish someone a happy birthday. This card uses contrasting colors on the front to draw attention to the subtle puns. --- Looking for a larger variety? Don't worry, the number of designs is not set in stone! As long as the campaign continues to grow, we will keep adding more and more new, awesome card designs - seriously, tons of stuff is in the works. Excited to see what you will receive? Don't worry - we get it. Above is a quick gif of what a typical package might look like; with a tiny exception. The Greeto� card, as well as the white envelope, will be packaged in a transparent bag that will preserve the card during shipment (we excluded the bag simply because it did not show up on camera)! Awesome news! In addition to your Greeto� card(s), you will also find a unique card from our team that highlights your supporter number and shows that you were one of our early adopters. Please note that due to the way we process pledges, your supporter number does not necessarily correlate to your backer number! Our production facilities as well as the Greeto� cards themselves follow the best practices for recyclability. Our planet becomes a little bit greener each time a card is made. Glitter, foil, metallic inks, adornments (ribbons, etc.), and photo paper being used in greeting cards result in at least half of all greeting cards being thrown away into landfills (RecycleByCity). We kept the cards simple, using 100% recycled paper stock that can be disposed of with ease! We encourage you, and the recipient of the card, to put it in any recycling bin once it has served its purpose! Are we a small team? Oh yeah. Yet, our dream of making the next big thing in the greeting card industry is not even close to "small". The story of Greeto began in the summer of 2018. Walking through the aisles of the local department store looking for a perfect birthday card, nothing seemed to work. Either the designs were boring or the inside of the card limited what could be said. Plus, writing long messages just gets annoying! Just a few days later, the idea of a QR-powered greeting card was born. A while later, Caroline and Ally were invited to be a part of the team because the first designs made by Paul were just really, really awful... Now, it has only been a few months and we have already successfully funded and shipped out our first batch of designs! This time, we are ready to make it bigger, better, and more colorful. Shipping price info: All domestic shipping is free. There's no catch! World-wide shipping is available. During the Kickstarter project, we will be offering discounted shipping anywhere on Earth! Shipping details: Orders for < 10 Greeto� cards: Your reward will be delivered in a large flat envelope (9" x 12"). Sadly, to minimize costs, we are not able to provide a tracking number. However, upon request, we will provide a confirmation image of your flat envelope being shipped out! Orders for > 10 Greeto� cards: Your reward will be delivered in a large bubble mailer (6" x 9"). Upon request, we will be able to provide you with your tracking number! Returns & refunds: Supporting a crowdfunding campaign can often be a risky business. What if the creator doesn't follow through? What if the product doesn't function? Well, we want to give you a peace of mind. Your Greeto� card is eligible for a full refund within 14 days of you receiving the card. It's quite simple, really. If your card is deformed, misprinted, or simply torn, we will send you your money back - no questions asked. You do not have to ship the card back to us - all that's required is a photo for proof! Here's the best part. You will be kept in the loop - constantly. Every time we hit one of the landmark points in production, an update will be sent out to all backers! Furthermore, if you have any questions or concerns during this process - we are always available to chat through email: contact@getgreeto.com. Want to chat through our contact form instead? You can find it here! What we have here is a greeting card that uses QR technology to make sure your card stands out from the crowd. We make your gift awesome. So, what? Moving forward, beyond greeting cards, we will be working together will smaller stores in the Pacific Northwest to cumulatively reduce the number of greeting cards sold with glitter, foil, and other non-recyclable materials. Jointly, we hope to reduce the number of cards that go to landfills - quickly and efficiently.

So You've Ruined Your Life This is the artwork for my first album. If this project is funded, this will also be the artwork for my very first songbook. Basically, I'm going to hand-write the lyrics and chord charts for all of the songs from my first album, So You've Ruined Your Life. On the opposite side of the page will be anecdotes and stories about the recording of the individual track. These will published in a high-quality, hard-bound, cd-sized book. If this project is funded, I plan on doing a Kickstarter campaign for each of my full-length studio albums as well as the ep's, so that, ultimately, there will be a complete collection of all of my song lyrics and chord charts.

Who I am My name is Rachel Bearinger, and I'm an Iowa-grown singer-songwriter transplanted to Minneapolis, MN. I've been making music and performing since I was a child, and in my house, it seemed like destiny to create sounds and songs. Photo by my mom Photo by Sierra Steen In the summer of 2017, I wrote, recorded, produced, and released an EP using a Zoom H2 digital recorder, Logic Pro X, and a lot of research. I digitized cassette tapes with audio recordings from my childhood, and integrated those recordings into songs about love, family, and figuring out my place in the world. That EP is called We Were Well, and you can listen to it here. What I'm making I've spent the past two years writing and recording new music. I narrowed down my list of material and chose the 10 songs that best capture my life as it currently stands. My 23rd and 24th years have have been defined by new experiences, loss, self-doubt, and a whole lot of joy. Each song is different from the others, yet they fit together beautifully into a continuum. I've had a blast performing them at my shows recently in Minneapolis. Photo by Sierra Steen My debut album will be called "Spirals." This project is already very much off the ground, as the songs have already been written, recorded, produced, and mixed! And let me tell you, these songs sound good. Myself, Mason Meyers, and Patrick Cunningham recorded my parts at the Institute of Production and Recording in downtown Minneapolis using top-of-the-line equipment. All of the other instruments were recorded in various locations in Iowa by Patrick, one of the most musically intuitive people I've ever known. He arranged all of the music, including the songs that feature string quartet. Here is a rundown of all of the musicians/artists who have already contributed their passion and talents to "Spirals": Patrick Cunningham - percussion, piano, producer (3 P's for Patrick!) Patrick Mason Meyers - recording engineer Rishi Kolusu - trumpet, voice Clayton Ryan - electric and upright bass Clayton Ryan, bassist extraordinaire Abigail Moore - violin and viola Kelsey Chidley - cello Abram Miller - tenor saxophone Andrey Floryanovich - clarinet Jason Andriano - trombone Chris Hansen - pedal steel guitar Kevin Bohenke - electric guitar, trumpet Kevin Bohenke, guitar and trumpet man David Meyers - electric guitar Helen Teague - cover art Holy collaborators, Batman! Patrick, a man of many talents, also produced the songs, adding his very distinctive style and musical ideas with grace. He, myself, and Mason edited and mixed the songs at IPR to get just the right balance of all these sounds. Pat at the board Photo from studio recording So, what's next? Now comes the fun part, and the part where I will need your help! The next steps in the process are mastering, CD manufacture, and album distribution (to get it up on Spotify, Apple Music, etc.) My mastering engineer will be Greg Rierson at Rare Form Mastering in Minneapolis, who has mastered songs for Prince, The Cure, and Sufjan Stevens. Copycats Media in Minneapolis will manufacture the CDs. What you can get by contributing When you pre-order the album on Kickstarter, there are plenty of cool do-dads that you can collect! Such as... The Album The first thing you'll get by contributing is the album! Either a digital download, CD, or both. The songs sound lovely, and the cover art was done by the wonderful Helen Teague. The Discography In addition to the new music, if you haven't gotten a chance to get your hands/ears on my previous work, you can get that, too. I'm very proud of We Were Well and would love to give you a copy. :) The Lyric Book This just might be my favorite reward. Only 10 people can claim a handwritten book of all of the lyrics for the new songs. Each copy will be made-to-order, so your copy will be unique from all others! My mom gets one of these for free. The Custom Cover Tell me your 3 favorite songs in the whole world. I'll pick one, and record an acoustic cover and a video, just for you! I'm sure we have similar taste. The House Show I'll come to your residence and play a show for you and your family and friends. We can eat, drink, and commiserate. I'll even bring 10 copies of the album to give away to the audience! Where your money will go I love a good pie chart. Here is a breakdown of exactly where your money will go (the album budget) STRETCH GOAL One of the wonderful things about Kickstarter is that once you reach your funding goal, you can KEEP FUNDING and use those that extra money to expand your project further! If we hit the $3,200 mark, Good Era Productions in Cedar Falls will be producing a music video for one of my favorite songs off the album. Finally, Thank You. Thank you so much for checking out my project. I'm so excited to release this music into the world, and I couldn't have made it this far without all of your support. Let's do this, together!

Welcome to my 23rd Enamel Pin Kickstarter!!! Each pin: is hard enamel is 1.5 inches tall has silver colored plating had two posts/clutches Why did I make these designs? The first pet I ever had (that was not a family pet) was a little goldfish that I won at a school fair. I was so happy bringing him home in his little plastic bag! That iconic memory was the inspiration for this pin collection. For those of you who were wondering, I named him Valentine and he lived a good seven years after that. He helped foster my love of all animals, not just the furry ones. Please understand that as an adult I am not in favor of living creatures being used as prizes, nor am I advocating for people to go out and bag animals from the wild. I wanted to join my warm memory with my love of so many different aquatic creatures and create these whimsical pin designs. I was a little concerned about the level of detail in these pins, so I had some samples made of the octopus and they turned out beautifully! About Frost Dragon Designs, LLC My name is Joshua R. Pinkas and I am the creator and owner of Frost Dragon Designs, LLC. After years of working on projects for others through freelance work and private commissions, I decided to start building something for myself and started Frost Dragon Designs, LLC. I am a seasoned pin creator and have designed, had manufactured, and delivered thousands of beautiful enamel pins. All of my designs are my own original creations. I start my creative process with traditional drawings in sketchbooks. Even the simplest of designs will usually go through a dozen or more revisions before I recreate it digitally and prepare the files to send to my manufacturers. I love launching new projects and designs on Kickstarter because this is where I got my start with my company, and because I have found a wonderfully supportive community here who genuinely care about creatives. Every pin you back helps fund the production of new original designs!

Isabel is the Jazz/Folk Musical that teaches empathy for #metoo survivors. Book, Music, Lyrics, & Training Programs written by Anna Westbrook Album Summary: This 11-track album tells the story of a 16 year old girl named Isabel who runs away from home and finds herself trapped on a magical train full of people who won't stop running. Isabel is the only person on board who remembers her own name and it is up to her to stop the train and save the other passengers (including a Porter, several Choir Members, and a mysterious Writer who may or may not be dead). However, the relationships between Isabel, the passengers and the evil Conductor turns out to be much more complicated than she originally thought. She soon discovers that in order to get off the train, she will have to take a hard look in the mirror and lean on her family to process an unaddressed history of trauma. Learn to discuss sexual maltreatment, invest in your own mental health, and support #metoo survivors by pre-ordering this full album and experiencing Isabel's musical journey. Learn more about our plans for the album with our Full Crowdfund Summary [5 page pdf]. Listening Party Summary: Our Community Listening Party will be hosted by Armstrong Community Music School on September 8th from 2 p.m. to 5:00 p.m. This will be a flexible timeline event with three interactive listing stations, culminating in a live performance of a selection of songs from the album. The experience will be curated by local producer, composer and playwright Anna Westbrook with assistance from key Isabel team members, including audio product manager Jajuan Sanabria. Local wellness professional Junice Rockman (Clinical Psychotherapist, M.A. LPC-Intern) will be present at the listening party to help support audience members during our guided listening activities and to facilitate a group discussion during the live performance that will close out the event. "Friend of Survivor" Video Training: Most people know someone who has experienced sexual maltreatment. However, they may not know that they know someone who has experienced this, and if they do, they may not know what to say to support them. Our pre-recorded Friend of a Survivor webinar will help you understand how to use the Isabel music to address that issue and support survivors. CEO and Isabel Lead Trainer Anna Westbrook will guide you through why she wrote each song and how you can help your friends heal by sharing the music with them in thoughtful ways. Isabel Album Song List: [During the 2018 production, the Isabel cast surprised Producer/Composer Anna Westbrook by creating a cast album with simplified versions of each song. You can sample those tracks here. ] 1. Almost Ready 2. You're Fine Dear 3. Are We There Yet? 4. Here and Now 5. Empty 6. Let the Light In 7. Believe Me 8. Healing [See video of a performance of this song and the accompanying scene here.] 9. Crumble 10. I Love You Isabel 11. I Can't Make It Better Sample the music at IsabelandtheRunawayTrain.org/music Team Bios Anna Westbrook (Producer, Composer, Playwright, and Trainer) is an experienced communicator who specializes in speaking on emotionally charged topics without fear, guilt or shame. She holds a B. A. in Music with a specialization in Composition from Connecticut College and has been working in the music industry since 2012. After interning with an audio-production company in Atlanta, Anna moved to Austin, TX in 2016 to begin working with the city's art-activism community. In 2018, her production of Isabel & The Runaway Train collaborated with more than 10 local businesses and attracted 300 audience members. She has since launched a state-wide Isabel training program that prepares participants to support survivors of sexual maltreatment. Awards and achievements include the Jack Niblack Memorial Scholarship & Grant (2014), the Connor Donahue Community Development Award (2016), the City of Austin's Community Initiatives Grant (2018), The Creative Fund's Q-Rental Subsidy Grant (2018), the City of Austin's Capacity Building Grant (2019), and a second Community Initiatives Grant from the City of Austin to help fund the recording of this album (2019). JaJuan Fari Sanabria (Audio Product Manager) studied classical double bass performance and audio engineering at James Madison University. He has played and produced within a myriad of ensembles ranging from bluegrass, jazz, classical, pop, hip-hop, and much more. Having various management positions throughout his adulthood has honed his leadership and communication skills while also enhancing his emotional intelligence. In July 2018, he served as the Sound Designer and Audio Engineer for the Isabel premiere and has continued his collaboration with Anna on various projects throughout Austin. He now resides in Austin, Texas where he works diligently to proliferate his music into the local scene with a group of loyal and dedicated friends and colleagues. Read more about our team at IsabelandtheRunawayTrain.org/Leadership. Learn more about our plans for the album with our Full Crowdfund Summary. Questions? Email Isabel.runawaytrain@gmail.com.

Brick Mini Chess is the perfect scale for your miniature figures. *Photo is of painted prototypes only which may show blemishes from 3D printing such as the resolution lines on the Knight figures. The final product will be injection molded ABS in color-matched colors with a polished finish.* Brick Mini Chess Pieces offer a whole new world of building opportunities with your existing brick collection. We set out to create new brick elements that would combine the joy of building and the beauty of design together. Not only do Brick Mini Chess pieces look great, they also connect to other bricks in various ways, meaning you can use them to build and create just like any other brick. They will fit right in with your collection of LEGO�, Mega Construx�, Kre-O� and more! One Color Set contains 18 total pieces: 8 Pawn figures, 2 Rook Figures, 2 Knight Figures, 2 Bishop Figures, 2 Queen Figures, and 2 King Figures. In other words, one Color Set is equal to one half of a chess set's figures (with one extra King and Queen). You'll want at least two Color Sets in different colors if your goal is to use these pieces as chess pieces. For this reason, Color Sets come in pairs for each reward tier. Single Color Sets can be added to a pledge as an add-on. The reason for Color Sets as the building-block for each reward tier rather than just full chess sets is simple. We recognize some backers will just want black and white sets of figures. However, we also recognize that other backers may just want a lot of a single color for incorporating into their own creations. Whatever your intended use, you'll be able to choose the exact colors you want when it comes time to fill out your survey. ABOUT In the past one hundred years of Jazz, the American music scene has witnessed incredible artists who have reshaped the world of music through innovative art and pure talent. Decade after decade these artists evolved, bringing fresh new trends and sounds. Sadly, due to the lost genre and fragile record keeping of the past, many works of fabulous artists are being lost to time. Today a fresh group of musicians is helping to restore and catalog many of the hits and unique music styles of a lost generation. The goal is to educate through performance, recording and discussion to keep rare Jazz music alive � to inspire new audiences of musicians with restored sounds from our great American Jazz history. Enter Michael Persico. Mike has been a music educator and band leader for over 30 years. He has collaborated with many artists and focused on Jazz music from the Great American Songbook. In addition, Mike works with Jack Bradley, Louis Armstrong�s personal photographer and friend, archiving and cataloging over thirty thousand images of the American Jazz scene as seen through Jack�s lens. Jack had the incredible opportunity to witness some of the most prolific Jazz artists of their generation play in hundreds of venues. It occurred to Mike that these images would be the perfect backdrop to a live show that featured songs from some amazing period Jazz musicians. Jack Bradley with Louis Armstrong THE PLAN The overall idea is to create a Historical Jazz Performance Series that will tour colleges and universities throughout the United States, performing lost and unique Jazz music from the Great American Songbook to an audience of new musicians. These musical performances will include narration with Jack Bradley�s Jazz Visions historical photographs as a backdrop, and end with a music education question/answer storytelling segment with the band. Music selections will cover artists from 1900 to the 1960�s and showcase songs that have not been heard in decades, exploring the artist�s inspiration and roots. Persico and his band will record and create a music video album (DVD) to accompany the tour, which brings us to this campaign. Michael Persico Classic Jazz and Swing Orchestra and Jack Bradley's Jazz Visions THE CAMPAIGN This Kickstarter campaign will be used to produce and record a music video album that will feature many of the unique songs that will be performed in the Historical Jazz Concert Series. The album will include a running visual backdrop of Jack Bradley's Jazz Visions treasured photography that chronicles decades of Jazz behind each song. We will be recording eight new tracks in studio with our eight-piece band of musicians, that in combination with four completed tracks, will be a total of twelve for the album. The $10K raised will cover the cost of renting the studio, paying the musicians, paying the engineers, and covering most of the cost of physical production of the album. We will raise additional money through other means for promotion of the Historical Jazz Concert Series tour, the album, and pay for design/artwork. TRACKS 1. Medley: Flee As a Bird | Traditional / Didn't He Ramble? | W.C. Handy 1900 2. That�s a Plenty |Lew Pollack, Ray Gilbert 1914 3. Dinah | Harry Akst, Sam Lewis and Joe Young 1925 4. Medley: Always | Irving Berlin 1926/Jitterbug Waltz | Thomas "Fats" Waller 1942/ What'll I Do? | Irving Berlin 1923 5. Struttin' With Some Barbeque | Lil Hardin Armstrong 1927 6. Medley: I'm Sittin' On Top of the World | Walter Vinson, Lonnie Chatmon 1930 / I'm Gonna Sit Right Down and Write Myself a Letter | Fred Ahlert and Joe Young 1935 7. A tisket - A tasket | Traditional/Ella Fitzgerald 1938 8. Solitude | Duke Ellington, Eddie Delange and Irving Mills 1935 9. Sing, Sing, Sing | Louis Prima 1935 10. In the Mood | Jerry Gray 1939 11. Is You Is, or Is You Ain�t My Baby | Louis Jordan and Billy Austin 1943 12. A Night in Tunisia | Dizzy Gillespie 1944 Video DVD Vintage style label

Gradience is a brand new print magazine exploring how different intersections of queer identity inform unique individual experiences. Image from the Gradience Kickstarter launch The beginning The Gradience founders We are three queer friends (Joylyn, Rachel, and Cody) who met in design school and bonded over our mutual queerness and love for outside-of-the-box design. The three of us were at our favorite local bar one night and began talking about how different our experiences as queer people had been and continue to be. Yet it seemed to us there was a certain perception of a singular queer experience in the world. We decided we wanted to create something that could foster conversation about the nuances of unique, individual queer identities and the stories at their intersections. That is how Gradience was born. We realized we could combine our love of design and storytelling to a make a special new publication that not only fostered nuanced conversations within its pages but could support physical spaces and people that lead these conversations every day. Gradience (n): the absence of a clear-cut boundary between one category and another. The Magazine Gradience will center around queer stories, voices, and artists. It will be inclusive of all identities, and promises to feature not only captivating written stories and interviews, but incredible art and expression from the queer community. Each issue will tell nuanced stories around a single topic. The first issue of Gradience will center around the topic of Coming Out. It tells the stories of transitioning, coming out to oneself, family, religion, and much more. Magazine Spread A Partnership � Seattle's LGBTQ Center For Issue one, we're partnering with Seattle's LGBTQ center Gay City in support of their mission to promote wellness in LGBTQ communities by providing health services, connecting people to resources, fostering arts, and building community. Proceeds from issues of Gradience sold will ultimately support Gay City's mission and the beautiful community that inform and allow Gradience to exist. Why Print? We feel print is the most intimate form of media which would reflect the nature of our magazine's content: deeply personal stories, images, and art. Additionally, as designers, we cherish the challenges of print work and love that it can be shared and passed down from one person to another. Cody reading a Gradience article during the Kickstarter launch We need your help In order to create and share the beautiful content in this magazine, we need help with its cost of production. We want to make a high quality product that you can hold on to and feel proud to own for a long time. This costs money to do. All Kickstarter funding will go towards the production of the publication and its release. If you are financially able, we would greatly appreciate any support you can give. From the bottom of our queer hearts, thank you <3 From the Gradience Kickstarter Launch From the Gradience Kickstarter Launch

About the Project We are bringing a new line of action figures based on old school video games. Our first pick is a video game called Switchblade. Switchblade was a game originally developed by Core Design (Tomb Raider, Rick Dangerous, Wolfchild, etc), and published by Gremlin Interactive (Top Gear, Body Harvest, Zool). With this Kickstarter, we will launch a new brand called "Toyetico" that will be the pin point for toy merchandise based on video games Piko Interactive has the rights to. Switchblade 1989 Amiga Cover Art Switchblade Game Backstory On the cyber world of Thraxx, Havok has returned. After 10.000 years of peace, the Fireblade, source of power for the ancient Bladeknights, has shattered. The night burned red, and the people of the Undercity fell beneath the onslaught of Havok's nightmare creations. Helpless, the Bladeknights died alongside their people. Only one of their order survived. You play Hiro, the last of the Bladeknights, a hi-tech warrior armed with stealth, cunning and a powerful re-programmable cyber-arm. You must enter the Undercity and reassemble the sixteen fragments of the shattered Fireblade. Only then will you be able to take on Havok and average the death of your people. Switchblade Gameplay Screenshots Switchblade Characters and Enemies (Original Concept art from 1989) Enemies Concept Art Circa 1989 Producing Brand Toyetico will be a subsidiary that will concentrate producing fun and exciting toys based on video game properties owned by Piko Interactive. Toyetico logo State of the Project Currently we have already designed and produced a prototype of the action figure. We just need to make the order to open a tooling and start the production run. It would take 3-5 months to finish the tooling, produce the figures, and get them to our door. We need to produce at least 1000 units of the same figure as the factory has placed that minimum quantity. This is why we have come to Kickstarter. At this time, we only need 8,000 USD to get the mold ready and finish the first production run. One of the main reasons why we are doing this is because we believe there is a great lack of indie toy makers. Indie video games is now a great part of the video game industry, but toys has stayed behind in terms of indie productions. We hope this project is appealing enough to collectors and action figure enthusiasts as our selves, to get it funded and kickstart a long line of indie action figures based on beloved retro video game characters. How to Make an Action Figure The process to develop an action figure is quite straight forward: We design the character's action figure in 2D drawing> Reproduce the 2D Drawing into a 3D Render> Sculpture produces prototype based on 3D Render (we are here)> Use approved prototype to produce final mold > Mold is ready for production and production starts! Hiro 2D action Figure Design. Hiro Figure 3D Render Hiro Figure 3D Assembling Render We have also prepared other figures based on Switchblade's characters. These are Hiro's Enemies that you encounter during the game. Here is a 2D design of ManSnake/Cybersnake. Mansnake A.K.A. Cybersnake. For this particular figure, we have picked a body style that resembles the Marvel action figures of the 80s and 90s. There are 3 popular action figure lines that have impacted our lives through our childhood memories. They are Toybiz's Marvel figures ,Playmates' Ninja Turtles, and Hasbro's 3.75" GI. Joe. We will base our line's designs on these body types and figure styles. Toybiz body type comparison. Extra Goodies and Stretch Goals We have also developed retro video game version of Switchblade, based on the Amiga port. These will be available as rewards for those that want the whole old school toys experience. Switchblade Atari Jaguar Switchblade Sega Genesis Stretch Goals If we reach 25,000 we will produce ManSnake's figure If we reach 45,000 we will produce Cresthed's Figure If we reach 63,000 we will produce Reptilon's Figure If we reach 80,000 we will produce Flamehog's Figure If we reach 100,000 we will produce an unreleased enemy figure (picked by the backers as there are a few). If we reach 140,000 we will produce a Tiger electronic's style handheld for the Switchblade Video Game. Stretch Goals If Stretch Goals are met, new items produced will be available separately. However backers who pick rewards that include multiple copies of figures will be able to pick figures from the rewards met. Video background by Visualdon

AHOY THERE! Forrest Bower here, Seven years ago, in my tiny apartment with my crummy laptop, I started Bower's Game Corner, a hobby game review channel on YouTube. Since then I have recruited Eric Baca to work the behind-the-scenes action and we have now released well over a thousand videos reviewing, and covering old games, new games, classics, stinkers and everything in between. We release a new review every day or two in addition to Learn to Plays, Kickstarter game re/previews, game plays, Top 10 lists, and the occasional vlog. Last year we successfully completed a similar project to shoot over 130 unique videos centered around our time at Gen con 2018. We filmed previews, full-length game sessions, first impressions of new releases, Top 10 lists, events, one-on-one interviews, and daily recaps. During the five days we walked, talked, filmed, edited, and posted videos and, most importantly, played games. It was an amazing experience that was both rewarding and exhausting. Gen Con is the longest-running, best-attended gaming convention in the world and we are hoping to once again bring the excitement of the convention to those of you won't be among the 70,000+ people in attendance. WHAT WE WANT TO DO Our ultimate goal is to bring over 132 pieces of Gen Con related content to your lovely eye holes! We don't plan on seeing this being a problem as we have done this the last 4 years. One again this year we are doing a lightning quick format which should get the videos to you super fast. Last year we posted over 90 videos while at Gen Con! We plan to do this by bringing on a third person again to help streamline our production process and upgrading our recording capacity, and equipment. We will be shooting pre- and post- convention Top Ten lists, previews of new releases, full-length game plays, interviews with game designers and artists, impression videos, Gen Con After Dark tours, and much more! PLEDGE LEVELS $1- Thank you! Just want to show your support and watch some Gen Con interviews? This is the pledge for you. $5- Sponsor A Review. I'll put your name/Company/Logo/Message *whatever you want within reason* at the front of one of our videos throughout the year, and message you when it goes live! $150- Re/Preview your game level. Guarantee an honest review or a non biased preview of your game whatever that may be! Great for companies planning Kickstarters. $250- Sponsor the Madness. I will show your logo and personally shout your company or project out before every Gencon Bonanza Kickstarter video we shoot at Gencon. Only 1 Available! $250- Rob Oren Painting Level. Minis painter extraordinaire, Rob Oren will send you a Minis game he painted! Message me for more info! Only 1 Available! $400- Custom Gaming Bag Of Amazingness. An amazing Bag I'm creating for you that you absolutely will not want to miss out on! Huge thanks to some incredible companies for supporting our bag making. Only 4 Available! STRETCH GOALS I've been slowly improving the production quality of my reviews over time and my hope is that if the Kickstarter does well enough I could get better lighting, or in a perfect world, a newer Ipad with better picture and more video editing options. *I shoot all my reviews currently on an Ipad Mini 3* THANK YOU! I also want to give a huge Shoutout to these AMAZING companies who supported us to make the Bonanza possible! Be sure to show them some love!

This Kickstarter is for the funding of 80 books. If pledges go above that, the more the better! The Great Express Robbery (1907) crime pulp novel. This crowdfunder is to get a 102 year old pulp crime paperback back into print. The Great Express Robbery (1907) by Grace Miller White is based upon the play by A. H. Woods. It's protagonists are two young women who live near their father's coal mine somewhere outside of Old San Francisco and they deal with rough outlaws. Including a husband with bad intentions for everyone! The setting is barely more than a decade after of The Old West era (1865-1895)! And as you can figure from looking at the cover, train robbery is involved! Hello! My name is Darren Nemeth and I published two other books. How To Film Moving Pictures in the 1910's, which was funded here successfully in early 2018, and 1907 Chicago Projecting Co.'s Entertainer's Supplies Catalog No. 122; Deluxe Edition (printed in 2015). Both are about early motion pictures and filled with carefully retouched ephemera, some are very similar in printing as The Great Express Robbery. I found The Great Express Robbery a few months ago and never saw a pulp novel going back that far in person. Especially with a color cover. While reading it the story and language was surprisingly fresh, not �ye old timey-wimey.� The plot is brisk and I believe is enjoyable for modern readers. Why Reprint It? Paperback pulp novels from over a century ago are hard to find. Even more rarer is finding one that isn't shedding paper flakes and even more rarer than that are ones that can be read from cover to cover without coming apart. The 128 pages story is fast paced and full of action. I rarely read fiction and had a hard time putting it down. Read nearly all of in one sitting which is something I've never done before. I think that most everyone will enjoy it also. If the funding goal is reached it will pay for a print quantity of eighty books. If above the goal, the more the better! How Was This Reprint Created? The binding of The Great Express Robbery was taken apart so the pages and cover could be individually scanned laying completely flat at 600 dpi. The cover was extensively retouched and readability of illegible text was restored. I doubt anyone will be disappointed. Disassembled so the pages can be laid flat on the scanner. Most of the retouching was to reduce the yellowing on the pages, being careful that none of the printed ink was removed. Some of the characters in the printing press had too much ink and were blotchy. Some were barely readable due to too little ink. Those were fixed by moving legible ones from other areas of the page on top then erasing the surrounding smudge. The skew of the pages was also corrected and centered. With these minor repairs the easy flow of reading is restored. More info on how this was done will be in upcoming updates! If funded I endeavor to restore and reprint more crime, adventure and romance novels from the 1890's-1910's period. When Does It Ship? If funded, all rewards will ship July, 2019. As soon the printer, Blurb, delivers the books they will be mailed to backers. The interior pages are 100% finished, the cover is 99% finished (the bottom part shown below will be changed) and the spine is done. The only thing left to do is the back cover! The first proof. The text at the bottom will be changed. After the back cover is designed "The Great Express Robbery" will be finished and ready for the printing press.
