At the 15k stretch goal, every deck will get an exclusive card stamp sticker At the 20k stretch goal, everyone will get a custom poker chip from Any Means Necessary At 25k we're giving EVERYONE the Hyena Poker Chip PLUS another custom Poker chip At 30K we're adding on a custom foil stamp with each individually numbered for all decks! (Artwork is a mockup and not final image) ???? Any Means Necessary is made up of Shawn Coss and Michael Nemitz, a clothing and art brand out of Ohio that is always looking to push the boundaries on what a brand is and should be. Shawn, known best for his mental health series, Inktober Illness and It's All in Your Head, recently decided that he wanted to tackle a more traditional series that has history that dates decades back. We've all played in some form a game with traditional poker cards. We didn't want to reinvent the wheel of the deck itself but we wanted to put our spin on the artwork and concept of the traditional playing card. Mors Vincit Omnia translates to "Death Conquers All" and the artwork reflects each suit in it's rotting appearance. IMPORTANT NOTE: If backing the project, please use an email you have access to and to be sure to add Kickstarter / amnclothing@live.com to your contacts so you'll receive updates on production and shipping. The last thing we want to happen is that you back the project but forget to update your survey at the end of the campaign with your address and miss out on getting your cards. The deck comes with 54 playing cards 300 gsm linen poker sized, each card featuring the art of Shawn Coss with custom printed tuck box and produced by Bicycle, the leading brand in playing cards. The Age of Legend... Continues! An age of magic once existed in our world. Lost to history, this time is remembered in the echoes of myth and legend. The land was once besieged by the Horrors, foul creatures from the depths of astral space that seek to feed on and destroy all that is living and good. Their time -- the time of the Scourge -- has passed. The people of the world have returned to the surface reclaiming the lands that were once their home. Brave heroes band together to explore the wilds of Barsaive, fighting the Horrors that remain and protecting their loved ones from those who would dominate and enslave them. Earthdawn is a fantasy role-playing game currently in its fourth edition. After more than 25 years it continues to deliver a setting tinged with a compelling mix of high magic and horror flavored with a dash of post-apocalypse and a generous sprinkling of hope. An adventurer faces off against some cadaver men The Latest Sourcebook We have released several products for the Earthdawn line in the past five years: Three core rulebooks (Player's Guide, Gamemaster's Guide, and Companion), three sourcebooks (Travar: The Merchant City, Elven Nations, and Questors), a GM Screen, Quick Start Guide, and several entries in our ongoing Legends of Barsaive adventure series. The next sourcebook is ready to go. This campaign is to help cover production costs of paying the freelancers (writers, artists, and other production staff) who contributed to the book, and pay for printing and physical production. That new book is The Adept's Journey: Mystic Paths. Planned to be roughly 400 pages, it introduces the concept of Paths, organizations in the Earthdawn game that reflect a particular goal and outlook. They modify an adept's Discipline, giving them access to new talents and unique abilities. This gives you new challenges to face and stories to tell as your character's legend grows. Some of the paths might be familiar to long-time Earthdawn players, while others bring brand-new concepts to the game. Twelve are included in the book: The Brother of Stone is an obsidiman who seeks a greater connection with their Liferock and the living earth. A Fire Eater is dedicated to controlling--and gaining power from--an ork's gahad. Horror Stalkers are dedicated to tracking, facing, and destroying Horrors. The Journeyman is focused on enhancing a human's ability to easily learn magical abilities from other Disciplines. Liberators strive to free Namegivers from slavery--whether literal or metaphorical. Messengers openly spread news and deliver critical messages, but secretly gather intelligence to ensure Barsaive's independent future. Outcasts follow their own path, drawing strength from their personal definition of honor. The Purifier devotes their life to healing the world, cleansing it of the Horrors' lingering taint. Scholars focus on learning, the codification of accumulated knowledge, and making that knowledge widely available. The t'skrang Tail Dancer learns to use their tail to enhance their fighting prowess. Windmasters are windlings who turn their mobility and speed into impressive advantage. Elves who follow the Woodsman path have unparalleled understanding of, and connection to, the forest they call home. In addition to these twelve Paths, the book includes three Disciplines: Boatmen are a variant of the Air Sailor, focused on riverboats instead of airships. The Gauntlet is a new combat Discipline dedicated to unarmed combat and making themselves an implacable living weapon. A Shaman is a magician who studies the living world and builds relationships with the spirits of wild places. Of special note, the Shaman has been rebuilt from the ground up with a dedicated spell list and a new type of spirit. In addition to the rules required to play these varied character options, each Path and Discipline has an in-character essay (similar to those found in Questors) that provides insight into how these adepts see the world and practice their special magic. A Nethermancer and his friend Rewards, Add-Ons, and Stretch Goals Back this Kickstarter, and you get access to the pre-art draft of the manuscript (it will be linked in a backers-only post shortly after the campaign closes). We offer this to show that the text is complete, and give you a look at what you're backing. At this point the book just needs to make its way through the rest of the production process. As the campaign progresses, excerpts of the material in the book will be provided. We're offering the new book in PDF and physical versions, and the PDF is included with any physical reward. We also have reward tiers that include previously released books in case you missed our earlier Kickstarter or weren't aware the game had returned. The prices here are lower than you'll find elsewhere (even our own web shop), and they are all in print and in stock, so there wouldn't be any additional wait for delivery. Reward Tier Breakdown If the bundles are too... complete for you (for example, you already have the Player's & Gamemaster's Guides and just need the Companion), our first suggestion is that you gift those books to friends! But we will also have add-ons for individual books. Prices (and additional shipping charges) are listed below. You can add one of the Earthdawn anniversary pins for $4. Created for the game's twenty-fifth anniversary, these were available to attendees at GenCon in 2018, as well as some backers of the previous Earthdawn Kickstarter. Like the other books, they are in stock and will ship with your other physical product. Earthdawn 25th Anniversary Pin We have two planned stretch goals, which will be available as add-ons if they are unlocked. First, if we reach $10,000 we will produce a poster-size version of the Barsaive map included in the Fourth Edition Gamemaster's Guide. The art is already done, we just need to put it into production. A new large-scale map has been a popular request, and it would be great if we could bring it to you. Adding on the poster will be $5 for backers. Second, if we reach $15,000 we will make a hardcover version of the new book available as an upgrade. This is currently planned to be a Kickstarter-exclusive; we will produce enough to fill the orders, but not many more. Upgrading to the hardcover option will be an extra $15. The design for this hardcover will match the hardcovers from the previous campaign: blue cover with silver inlay for the title, logo, and Namegiver portrait. Two additional stretch goals have been added. If we reach $25,000, all backers who receive any level of product will get the form-fillable PDF character sheet at no extra charge. This sheet automatically derives many game characteristics, as well as fills in Step Dice where appropriate. At $40,000 we will do a new limited hardcover print run of the core rulebooks. These hardcovers will have a different design than the ones from the first campaign to distinguish them from the originals, and we'll take the opportunity to update them (and the associated PDF files) with errata. These books will be $75 each + $2 shipping. Stretch Goals The anniversary pin can be added to any pledge. If added to a pledge level with print books, there is no extra shipping charge. If added to a PDF-only pledge, a $4 shipping charge will be added. If the poster map is unlocked, it will be available as an add-on for any reward tier with similar shipping charges -- free with any other physical product, $4 on its own. You can get both the pin and poster (if that's all you want) for only $4 shipping. The hardcover (aka "blue-back") version of the Mystic Paths book (if unlocked) can added as a $15 upgrade to a reward tier that include the physical book. If you want the "deluxe" hardcover version instead, that is a $35 upgrade. Likewise, if your reward tier includes physical copies of the core books, those can be upgraded to the deluxe hardcovers for $35 each (with no additional shipping charge). For those who are looking to fill in holes in their collection that an existing pledge bundle doesn't satisfy, we are offering single-book add-on options, as follows: Single Book Add-On Options These individual books include the PDF at no additional charge. If you are adding physical product to a PDF-only tier, the first book is $8 shipping (even if it is noted as free shipping above), with added costs based on additional books ordered. If you want to add an additional copy of Mystic Paths (for example, you're upgrading your print copy to hardcover, but want a softcover as well), softcover is $40, hardcover is $55 (+$2 shipping per book). For all add-ons, please include the amount of the add-on in your pledge. You will be able to select the specific add-ons as part of the survey at the end of the campaign. You can adjust your pledge amount at any point before the campaign ends. Earthdawn Core Book Covers New to Earthdawn? Earthdawn is a fantasy role-playing game originally released in 1993. It was named one of "The Millennium's Most Underrated Games" by Pyramid magazine in 1999, and 24th in Arcane magazine's 1996 reader poll of the 50 most popular role-playing games of all time. Now in its fourth edition, the game delivers a rich setting flavored with high fantasy, post-apocalypse, and horror. After a successful Kickstarter to launch the new edition, the reception from fans has been broadly positive and many more new fans have come into the fold. Players step into the role of adepts, individuals who draw on a variety of magical powers to explore the world, recover knowledge lost to the Scourge, and fight those that threaten the lives of innocents--including the Horrors that remain in darker corners of the world. Each adept follows a Discipline, defining the focus and scope of their magical abilities. Some adepts hone their fighting prowess, some enhance their mental and social abilities, while others learn and cast spells. The core game engine of Earthdawn is the Step System. As your character gains power and advances along the path of their Discipline you roll progressively larger dice, with open-ended rolls allowing for potentially legendary results. Adepts can boost their magical abilities through the use of karma, which adds additional dice to your rolls. The Earthdawn Quick Start Guide (available free at our web shop or on Drive-Thru RPG) provides a great overview of the game system, examples of the magical powers available, and includes sample characters and a brief introductory adventure. Namegivers of Barsaive Returning to Earthdawn? If you've been away from Earthdawn for a while, you'll find many familiar things in the new edition, while others have changed to open up design space and incorporate lessons learned from previous versions, as well as other RPGs released over the years. First, as mentioned above, the core game engine remains largely the same. The specific dice used at each Step have been tweaked in a couple of places to smooth out some bumps in the underlying probability, but still uses all the common polyhedrals. The game no longer uses the success level table from previous editions, now the game counts successes--for every five points over the target number, the character scores an additional success. This success mechanic has been incorporated into most of the game's talents, skills, and spells so that--in general--better rolls mean better results. Earthdawn fourth edition keeps the "talent option" approach to Disciplines introduced in third edition, but refines the required talents at each Circle to be more broadly useful, and improves the choices available at each tier to allow for better customization options. Spellcasting has introduced a new concept--extra threads--that allow magicians to modify and enhance their spells as they cast them. These options give lower-Circle spells a longer life and more utility over the course of the character's career. The timeline has been advanced. It is a few years after the Second Theran War, and a new status quo exists in Barsaive. Throal has a new royal family on the throne, and has reduced their involvement in provincial affairs as they recover from the war. Other political powers have started expanding their influence, moving in where the dwarfs have left a void... including the Denairastas clan of Iopos. They have already claimed the city of Jerris, and look for ways to expand their influence even farther. This is a great time to get back into the game, and this project gives you access to the books we've released so far at a discount. Why not journey back to Barsaive, and build some new legends? A troll raider comes calling

The Mission If we want to preserve and protect Earth's natural beauty for future generations, there's one clear place to start: spreading a sense of love and wonder for nature to all those around us. As children, we found the tiny details of life astounding and wonderful. I'll never forget watching caterpillars go through metamorphosis on my second-grade desk and emerge as butterflies. But that curiosity is dampened as we grow up. Darwin is a strategic game that will reawaken a sense of wonder and love for nature. The Game In Darwin, each player's goal is to evolve a species that will survive. Darwin comes with 96 adaptation cards, each with a picture and description of an organism with an incredible adaptation that helps it to survive in a hostile environment. As you play, you'll compete for scarce resources and use them to add adaptations to your species. To survive, your species will need to eat, reproduce, and avoid being eaten by other players! Whether you love out-smarting your friends in strategy games, or just enjoy discovering the wild adaptations, Darwin gives everyone a chance to have fun and learn something new. The deck contains 96 adaptation cards, 24 resource cards and 4 environment cards. Adaptations help your species to eat, reproduce, or survive, or give you a strategic advantage in managing resources. I'm working on a brand new re-design of the deck, here's a sneak peek at what it looks like: Survival and Eat adaptations (new card designs) Back in December, I collected a bunch of crazy adaptations from asknature.org and made the first iteration of the game. I created the first deck by printing on full-sheet labels, cutting them out, and sticking them to a deck of Bicycle cards. It was a Christmas present for my family. This is what it looked like: The first home-made edition Since then, I've play-tested the game with many different groups of friends and family, and though the deck looks similar the game play has evolved dramatically. Thanks to the input from many testers, Darwin is now a highly strategic game as well as being fun and educational. Darwin as an Education Tool Darwin is a great educational tool that combines fun game play with high-level thinking: how will your species combine evolutionary traits and strategies to survive? How will you collect and manage resources in a changing environment? How will you adapt when other species begin to develop predatory strategies? In playing Darwin, learning about amazing adaptations is just the beginning of the educational experience. Playing the game will spark curiosity and excitement about life's strategies, and how to reflect them in our own problem solving. Even without playing the game, the Darwin deck provides a rich source of inspiration for any number of activities whether you are learning engineering biomimicry, mathematics, evolutionary biology, ecology, economics, or almost anything! Life's solutions are often more elegant, efficient, and sustainable than humanity's best efforts: we have a lot to learn, and Darwin provides fun entry point into the wonders of the natural world. Funds, Production, and Stretch Goals I'm planning to have Darwin professionally printed by makeplayingcards.com. I have already researched the adaptations and designed the deck. If I can reach my Kickstarter goal of $2000, I can produce 100 copies of Darwin and send them out to the funders. If I reach $5000, I will be able to upgrade to a higher card quality from the printer. About Me Hi, I'm Sam. I love hands on projects and spending time in nature. I'm fascinated by biomimicry: taking inspiration from nature in order to design better products and services. I just graduated from Penn State with my Masters in Engineering Design, and this summer I will be working in the National Parks for Leave No Trace center for outdoor ethics. I originally made this game as a Christmas present for my family back in December. I was surprised that people really enjoyed playing it, and decided I wanted to get Darwin into more people's hands. The goal of this project is to give people a fun reminder of how awesome nature is, and why it's worth protecting. Thank you for supporting the project!

Onsite Brewing Company is going to be a community-focused, neighborhood nano-brewery. We will be the smallest brewery in Anchorage and the first brewery to open in Midtown. Starting small allows us to create an inviting, friendly gathering space to enjoy a beer while you plan your next adventure or celebrate your latest one with strangers and friends alike. As a professional mountain guide and a rock climber, we are both passionate about the outdoors, new adventure and good beer. We want to create a place in Anchorage that is somewhere people can share their love for adventure and beer with others. In climbing, �onsite� means to finish a climb the first time you try it. This term was the ideal name for our brewery since we wanted it to be inspired by our joint dedication to the climbing community. It will be our first venture in running our own business and we are starting so small that we will mainly sell our beer for onsite consumption in the tasting room. Our location near the local climbing gym and REI is the perfect space to start our small climbing/adventure-inspired brewery. To begin we are going to be small, but over time we will grow and improve our space into something great! Ultimately, we love making great beer, are good at it and find joy in others drinking what we spend a lot of time and energy creating. We want to start a successful, community-focused Alaskan business, in an industry we are both passionate about, in the place we call home. How did the dream begin? As a professional mountain guide and a competitive gym climber, we bonded over our passion for climbing and a constant desire for new adventures. When we met we realized we needed a joint hobby to do when Tom was off the mountain and Amber was having rest days from rock climbing. This is when we began brewing, since we both loved good beer. Over the past 6+ years, this pastime has turned into a profession. Our beers have placed in homebrew competitions in Washington and Alaska. Together we want to succeed in the brewing industry in the same way we have both succeeded with our recent climbing ambitions. Our dream is Onsite Brewing Company! What are we going to brew? The beauty of being a small brewing system is that we can experiment and frequently rotate our beers on tap so there can always be something new for everyone to taste. We are especially proud of our seasonal Sitka Spruce juicy IPA, and our delicious Brut/champagne pale ale. We would also like to be one of the only breweries with a choice of lower alcohol percentage but delicious full flavored beer. What's in it for you? We want to get you the first set of Onsite Brewing Company Swag! Reward # 1 ($5) - High Five Reward #2 ($10) - Nifty Sticker Reward #3 ($25) - Sweet Glass Reward #4 ($50) - Awesome T-Shirt Reward #5 ($75) - Sick Hat Reward #6 ($100) - Awesome T-Shirt AND Sick Hat Reward #7 ($100) - Ticket to Epic Opening Event w/Stainless Steel Pint Glass! Reward #8 ($150) - Stylish Hoody Reward #9 ($200) - Double Glass, Hat and Shirt Combo Reward #10 ($250) - Glass, Hat, Shirt AND Hoody! Reward #11 ($350) - Forever being part of Onsite Brewing Company *Exact look of backer wall TBD Reward #12 ($400) - Double Glasses, Hats, Shirts AND Hoodies! Reward #13 ($5,000) - Help us grow and name your own unitank! What's the timeline? We have most of permits but are waiting for the final ones through the local government. This should be done by early June. Once we have this, we can start brewing! Good beer takes time... If all goes to plan with permitting and brewing, we hope to be open in early-mid July! As we work our way through the rest of the process, we will keep everyone in the loop! Coming up, we have an assembly meeting on April 23rd for our state liquor license and another one June 4th for our special land use permit for alcohol business. (Yes it all really is as confusing and boring as it sounds but we are almost done! The summit is in sight and we are ready to enjoy a delicious summit beer once we finish this last slog to the top of the permitting mountain!!) Why we need the funds? We have learned a lot during this adventure of opening a brewery. We have also accomplished a lot, especially with raising our start-up capital, finding a location, and the permitting process (which is time-consuming and challenging, to say the least). But we did it (mostly)! We are just waiting on our Municipal permits to be approved. We just need a little bit more financial help to aid in offsetting the final taproom costs. The cost of getting our local permits was drastically higher than anticipated and has put us under a budget crunch. We need your help! Who are we? Amber is a driven rock climber who bartended through college and loves beer and the craft brewing scene which is what prompted her to get into the brewing industry. In early 2017, she was offered a job that relocated us to Anchorage; this offer was well timed since we were looking to leave the Seattle Area and move to Alaska! While in Anchorage, Amber worked part-time at Anchorage Brewing Company as a barkeep to create connections in the local beer community; this is in addition to her full-time job with the Municipality. She keeps up her big kid job to support her climbing habit and help fund the dream of Onsite Brewing Company! Tom is from England and grew up dreaming of being a mountain guide and leading climbers up the tallest and most remote peaks in the world. After moving to the United States at 18, he was able to make this dream a reality and also became a US citizen. Years of hard work and determination resulted in Tom having a successful professional mountain climbing career, for one of the most prestigious climbing services in the world. He has been leading expeditions and instructing globally for over 10 years now. Highlights include 1 expedition and summit of Mt Vinson (Antarctica), 22 summits of Kilimanjaro (Tanzania), 13 summits of Aconcagua (Argentina), 7 summits of Denali (Alaska), 2 summits of Mount Fairweather (Alaska), 34 Rainier climbs (Washington). He loves working hard, learning new skills, and helping others succeed in achieving their goals. He has guided and lead hundreds of clients from all walks of life including professional climbers, CEOs of Fortune 500 companies, television crews, large charity groups, and training members of the U.S Special Forces. He is now ready to transition from helping others succeed at achieving their climbing goals, to pursuing our goal of a great adventure-inspired brewery.

At Three Bee's Honey, we want to portray the honeybee experience that can be found in our "single hive," honey. The exploration of the honeybee foraging on wildflowers captures unique flavor of every season. This is what inspired our family to separate harvests by hive location and season in our individually packaged bottles. We are currently raising funds to help transition from 10 hives to 30+. We are passionate about beekeeping and want to share our honey and knowledge on a larger scale. Teaching a class to future beekeepers Work in progress Three Bees Honey logo

Essence: Destiny Of The Twelve Warriors follows a group of children who find themselves in a battle for survival as the universe is overrun by fierce creatures called Harvesters. By absorbing the Essence of any living thing they kill, these soulless beings grow more powerful without any signs of just how formidable they can become. With the power gained from the keepers of the universe, their "Guardians", our heroes will need to stand up and fight for their lives against these treacherous foes as they search for the one being capable of bringing balance back.... Vitus. WAIT! THERE'S MORE! IT'S A HERO THEME! -- There's a difference between our heroes compared to almost any others.... Ours can share abilities. THIS IS AN ENTIRELY NEW UNIVERSE -- If we become successful enough we'll be a separate entity from the Marvel and DC universes. This will be the Essence Universe. HELP US BECOME SOMETHING GREAT -- Be sure to spread the word and help us grow. Our success depends on the community engaging itself with this new ongoing comic book series. -- To learn more and stay up to date with Essence: Destiny Of The Twelve Warriors after our KS visit us at EssenceComics.com. -- You can get the digital versions of Issue #1 on amazon Kindle. If you have kindle unlimited then it's free to view. >>Click Here<< to be taken to the digital version. -- Each single Issue we release will be 22 pages of reading with a little added content in the back. Once we've accumulated 6 issues we'll combine them into a larger, 132 page book. A Little About Issue #2 Starting from where we left off in Issue #1, Charity finds herself fighting for survival against a creature she's never before encountered. How will she fare against an enemy she knows nothing about while also fighting an internal battle with her emotions. Will she be able to gain control of herself or collapse under the weight of her own suffering. Follow her in Issue #2 to find out. COVER AND FIRST 5 PAGES Front Cover Issue #2 Page 1 Issue #2 Page 2 Issue #2 Page 3 Issue #2 Page 4 Issue #2 Page 5 FUTURE PLANS Even though we're only at Issue #2 there's so much more to offer. So far we've gotten 12 Issues set up and ready to produce but just like everything, funding is our main issue. In addition, even though we have the first 12 Issues, the story is far larger in scale and will continue on for many seasons afterwards if not longer than that. This will be a story we'll be releasing for many years to come. We're even hoping it'll eventually become an animated series, video game, card and board games with a list that keeps on growing. Of course that's all stuff to think about in the coming future, we need to take it one step at a time. So what might that be? Gathering a good supporting base to help us become successful and gain recognition is a good start! REWARDS ALL REWARDS COME WITH A KICKSTARTER STICKER ON THE BACK OF THEM AS PROOF OF YOUR SUPPORT. Below is an example (From our Issue #1 physical copies) of what to expect for the Amber, Red and Vitus packages (It'll come inside a clear Ultra Pro Protective Case). Each Issue will come with these limited copies of signatures and won't be available once sold. You can contact us and ask to pay for the same package and number to maintain a consistent collection as we release future Issues. These package deals are meant to help fund our project while giving you the opportunity to invest in something that could be worth value later. Again, I won't be signing with these colors of sharpies other than what's offered for these packages. (This applies to each Issue we release for these packages, not just one issue) Eventually, once we begin making enough money these packages will have other addition quality added into them such as a variant front cover that will be different than the rest of the books. Example: Amber Package- 50 silver metallic signatures per Issue of Essence (35 from KS) Red Package- 100 bronze metallic signatures per Issue of Essence (80 from KS) Vitus Package - 1 white signature per Issue of Essence. Available until sold and is a first come first serve basis. You can't pay for future issues with this signature package. Here is an example of what the comic will look like with a signature. You'll either get a Bronze, Silver or White signature depending on what package you bought. Basic book signatures will not have these colors. Coloring Book INTRODUCTION TO CHARITY Charity by Ale Garza Introduction to Charity INTRODUCTION TO CONRAD Conrad by Dimitri Pantazis Introduction to Conrad PRINTS Prints STRETCH GOALS For every additional $2,000 after reaching our $3,000 goal we'll have a commissioned piece done by an artist. This is an added bonus to our current stretch goals already posted below in the hopes it'll encourage people to help us gain further funding once we're past our $3,000 goal. This not only brings extra material in the form of pictures but also helps Chris and I gain more materials to showcase. We'd also be giving back to the community by paying artists involved in the project. The more money we make, the faster we'll be able to release more content, including releasing comic book issues much faster than we currently are. WHERE'S THE MONEY GOING? All the money we receive from KS will be going back into the Essence: Destiny Of The Twelve Warriors project. We want to be able to continue bringing more materials to our fans and supporters so there's never enough support we can receive, especially with how large this project is set up to become. THE CREATORS Charles Dobes: Creator of Essence: Destiny Of The Twelve Warriors Chris Gevenois: Head Artist and Co-Creator of Essence: Destiny Of The Twelve Warriors Fahriza Kamaputra: Colorist of Essence: Destiny Of The Twelve Warriors Ross Campbell: Front Cover Colorist of Essence: Destiny Of The Twelve Warriors Adam Wollet: Letterer of Essence: Destiny Of The Twelve Warriors

I'm about to make my next studio album. It's the scariest one yet. After making two albums with one of the world's best producers (Dave Cobb), I've decided I have to make the record I need to hear. Let me back up ... a little over a year ago, my life blew up. I ended an engagement and a 10-year relationship that was falling apart. I squatted at a friend's house for 6 months, and then packed up all the stuff and moved to Nashville. It was the hardest and lowest point in my life so far. Luckily, I leaned on songwriting. I wrote to understand and I wrote to survive. I wrote some of the best songs I'll probably ever write. I thought I'd come to Nashville and find another hotshot producer or band to take my music to the next level. But what I discovered here is the power of being myself and trusting my gut. That's why I am producing this record with my longtime bandmate and co-creator Will Robertson. The album is called "Empty Spaces." It's about loss and redemption. It's about feeling everything. And it's about starting again. These are my favorite songs ever. But I can't do it without your help. Records are expensive to make. To be blunt, $20k isn't really enough to cover studio time, engineer, producer, musicians, mastering and duplication of CDs and Vinyl. Not to mention promotion and and marketing costs. Still, it will get us most of the way there. And that's a big deal! You can help me make this record happen by pledging whatever amount is comfortable to you! Thanks for being part of this. I love your guts! Cayamo 2019 Eddies Attic with my team, Will Robertson and Bret Hartley. 2019

Welcome Hi there, Hoap here. for those of you who are unfamiliar with me, welcome, thanks for stopping by and taking a second to check out our project. I say our project because (as the title will tell you) this is round two of my Tubble Pin Pals Kickstarter project, and this here is a celebration of all those who helped me the first time around. I am so excited to be back creating Tubbles; little chubby cuties that I truly love making. This right here is Cheer Bear, our first goal to reach! This bear is just too dang cute to not be out in the front of the pack. What do we need to do to get there? Simple, raise $200 in pledges, and then we can move on to all the fun and exciting designs I have lined up. Once the first goal is reached every $200 we raise will unlock a new "LOCKED" design (excluding the last stretch goal listed, that one is seriously special and will require a bit more be raised to bring it to life, but oh goodness do I have my fingers crossed that we get there). Each hard enamel pin will be roughly 1.5" tall, and I will have some with gold, some with black, some with silver, and some with my favorite, rose gold plating. I have so many special little extras that I have already been working on and producing, and some of it will go out to the early supporters only so get in there with your pledge early to make sure you don't miss out! Stickers, buttons, postcards, and originals to every person who pledges at the 3 pin level and above say what?!? Yep, when I first reached out to you all to make my little dream of turning my art into a wearable little pin I sent out a custom Tubble Pal illustration with everyone who pledged at a certain level, and even though it may kill me (that would be a good problem believe me) I want to do that all over again. I've been so lucky over the past three years to have your support, and this is one of the ways I plan to say thank you. I created a lot of new designs this time around, but I wanted to make sure to really pay tribute to the first project by bringing back a few of the designs we created then. They are revamped, reworked, and revitalized I hope you love them even more this time around. Cheer Bear Tubble Pal. 1.5" Rose Gold. UNLOCKED To everybody that's been here with me from the get, thank you for keeping up with me, and following my journey. This project is dedicated to you all, I would not be doing this without you. You all helped me create my first enamel pins over three years ago, and it is high time we bring some more Tubble Pin Pals to life. Stretch Goals. I have many stretch goals in store, and many designs to pick from once we reach our first goal. Keeping that in mind, if you see a design you are excited about that is not yet unlocked, pledge anyway, you can always cancel your pledge if your favorite does not get unlocked. The more people who pledge the more designs will be unlocked and the more awesome pins we will be able to create. $400 Pretty accurate representation of how I see myself. Marie Tubble Pal. 1.5" Rose Gold. UNLOCKED $600 I love this because Sabrina is straight up magic, bam! Sabrina Tubble Pal. 1.5" Black. UNLOCKED $800 & $1000 Rainbow the Unitubble and The Mad Cat, two out of three of the original designs from my first kickstarter. Reworked and updated to be even better than they were first time round. Rainbow and the Mad Cat. 1.5" Rose Gold (Rainbow) and Black (Mad Cat). UNLOCKED $1200 & $1400 Jack returns bigger and better than ever, and he brought along his lady love. Jack and Sally Tubble Pals. 1.5" Black. UNLOCKED $1600 & $1800 The perfect combination of creepy and cute all rolled in to two chubby little spirits! No Face and Radish Spirit. 1.5" Black (No Face) Gold (Radish). UNLOCKED $2000 & $2200 Lydia and the B-man! Need I say more? Lydia and Beetlejuice 1.5" Black. UNLOCKED $ 2400 This remains one of the best Drawlloween pieces I ever created, and clearly it would make a magical pin. Haunter 1.5" Black UNLOCKED $2600 Orange Cream reminds me of all my favorite sherbets, like orange creamcicle meets pink lemonade. The Unitubble will always be my first pin love! Orange Cream Tubble Pal. 1.5" Rose Gold. UNLOCKED $2800 Stand up for what you believe in, I just cannot say enough about the impact the films of Ghibli have had on me, this is a tribute to one of the strongest characters I have ever seen. Princess Mononoke Tubble Pal. 1.5" Silver. UNLOCKED $3000 I love This wacky little bunny so much, Oswald does not get the love he deserves. Oswald Tubble Pal. 1.5" Black. UNLOCKED $3500 This is my "there is no way we make it to here, but I wanna reach for the stars anyway" stretch goal. This pin will end up having to be at least 3" tall, and will be the biggest, most intricate pin I have or probably ever will make. Oogie and the Boys Tubble Pals. Roughly 3" Black. UNLOCKED I have so much more in store, so many things I want to create so I can add them as freebies to your rewards, and with your help they could all be possible! *if you want to add other rewards aside from your selected tier, such as a postcard with a doodle from Aria and I then just add the appropriate amount to your pledge. Make sure to message me and let me know what you were adding the extra funds for. To change your pledge amount, or select a new pledge tier Click the "Manage Your Pledge" button by clicking your current reward tier, click "Change your pledge" and add your add-on total to the current pledge amount A Little Kickstarter Rundown So now that we have our goals set lets talk turkey. Why Kickstarter, and how will this all work. I like the idea of us all being involved in making something, it is collaborative, and helps keep things fresh. I also enjoy the all or nothing approach this platform has. If we don't hit our goal, small though it may be, we do not get the funds, and you are not charged. Through funding each of these pins here, I know that I can make the best product possible, and the more funds raised, the more stuff we can add. I have still yet to release a pin with glitter, and I would love to do that, something that would be made possible through direct funding like this. Most of the funds will go to get the pins made, like a staggering amount 70% or more depending on how the final pins work out, the rest of the funds will be used to create backing cards, buy shipping material (every reward will come in a thick bubble mailer, bigger rewards will need to ship in a box) around 20%, paying Kickstarter fees 10%, anything at all left over will go towards making even more rewards and extra goodies! You will not be charged until the day our project's campaign ends, and only if we reach our goal. You can cancel your pledge at any time. Project Schedule: May 16th to June 9th - Kickstarter campaign time! We have 25 days to raise these funds. Once the project is over and fully funded surveys to get everything in order for shipping and such will be sent out. Please please please make sure you have your address entered correctly, this will help make sure your rewards arrive in a timely manner, and due to the nature of some of the items they will not be able to be replaced. June 9th to June 25th - Funds (minus fees and so on) will transfer somewhere in this stretch to me so things can get goin! Late June - Pin production begins. Early to Mid July - Pins and all other rewards will ship out.*As the project progresses I will continue to update the time frames of each step of the process. Past Pins: Creature Feature Pail You Have Beautiful Eyes Gray Bunny Ice Cream Sandwich Stardust

What am I doing? I'm raising funds to bring my new show to peoples homes across the rural American West by horseback. This August I plan to depart and travel 3,000 miles with 2 horses over 14 months. Traveling by horse, moving through wilderness, dipping into small communities, living in a daily practice of putting my animals needs before mine will inescapably have a massive effect on how the show changes and how I change. As an artist and as a person who believes that curiosity is an essential practice in building a better world, I think traveling songs by horse will be a powerful way to share what I have with others and invite them to share with me. Soup and Troubador with Long Canyon in the background. I want to keep making new work that surprises my audiences and surprises myself. I want to make new work and deliver it in new vessels. I love eclectic performance, shows that continually subvert your expectations and repeatedly bring you to new plateaus of sound, or fun, or depth, or questions, or catharsis or productive discomfort. I feel comfortable in so many ways on stage now and I want to keep pushing myself to feel uncomfortable in new ways. That's an artists job right? To bang their head against the wall in search of something meaningful, something beautiful, something truthful to share with their audience. This tour is really two shows moving in tandem, the performances and the travel. They are in equal measure what I'll be sharing. I want to be raw and honest in my show and in how I communicate what I'm experiencing on the journey. Hardship, woe, discomfort, emotional and spiritual exhaustion are all things I'm expecting. That's part of the appeal. What is there to mine outside the comfort of the life I know? I ask this question and choose this experience with tremendous privileges as a white heterosexual man from New York City with a loving supportive family and community. Questions about those privileges will be part of the constellation of experience as I move through rural America. I've gathered over 3,000 potential host contacts in 83 countries all by referral from audience members written on maps after shows. Audiences have filled 28 maps and I organize the contacts in spread sheets. Now I need lots more possible hosts along my route. Finding new homes Going into peoples homes, trusting I can find homes, trusting my network to reach out to their cousins and colleagues and exes and pastors and shepherds and dentists and DJs to find me homes, trusting that I'll meet interested hospitable strangers along the way is a mode of faith. It's a faith supported by the experience of arriving at over 600 mostly strangers homes to be greeted with warmth, kindness and curiosity. Hosts in Te Pahu New Zealand 2012 Tokyo hosts enamored with my song typewriter Minneapolis host who gave me his accordion that he used to win polka competitions with as a child. Inside scoop - dogs do chase mailmen. In this time where we see ourselves as remarkably divided, traveling by horse could be a great inroad to a conversation. It can inspire an invitation or a conversation where there might not have been one. I've met thousands of people playing in homes, all different kinds, but I'm trusting the horse element can help me find different people than my networks would normally connect me to. The horse tour is an opportunity to reach all types of new populations and communities in mostly new regions for me. The hope is to use that new reality expansively to give access to folks who are often missed on my more city based tours. Learning to trim the feet. Working with a rasp here with my first horse mentor in New Zealand Stephen. Stephen previously hosted my show in 2012 then horse tutored me in 2017. What's this money for? Over the last six months I have raised just under half my budget from previous hosts, audience members, supporters of past projects and received a grant from The Speranza Foundation. That has allowed me to purchase a considerable amount of gear, continue learning and living in Boulder Utah while working on my show. Right now I'm reaching out to my larger network for the remaining necessities.... 2 horses (whom you will soon meet) $10,000' Vet services $2,000 Ferrier services $2,500 Supplemental feed for the horses $8,000 Permits $1,000 Press Person (PR) $3,000 to get features and stories about the trip in areas I�m heading towards so potential hosts can find me easily. This way its not just me always finding them. Human food $6,500 TOTAL $33,000 The route and the plan (the broad version) Aside from funding I'll be asking my network for any and all connections to potentially interested hosts along the route. The route will be taking me down the Continental Divide Trail through Colorado and New Mexico, cutting across Arizona through the Mogollon Rim and the Tonto Forest, linking with the Pacific Crest Trail in Southern California and traveling north on the PCT through Oregon then cutting across Idaho to conclude in Yellowstone or Missoula MT in fall of 2020. I'll be sharing more about the route during the campaign. The very nature of horse travel is one of shifting plans so parts of the route will change throughout the trip. Long Riders run into big trouble when they have a fixed plan and make choices according to it. Flexibility is an absolute necessity. This proves a huge challenge for setting up shows while on the trail. The system is to find interested parties within reasonable distance of the route, give them a large window of when I could get to them, stay in touch, and as I approach, continue to narrow that window. Hosts are pots of gold at the end of the rainbows. The horses are the rainbows and I am..... the trail? You know what I mean! Where am I now? In July of 2018 I moved to be based in Boulder Utah a town of 300 people where I had met stupendous cowboys, horse people and wilderness folk years ago on tour. I found this tiny extraordinary place cause someone put it on my map. Over the last year they have become my friends, mentors, teachers and high counsel guiding me on my preparation. It's been grand to learn so much new information, to continuously be a student immersed in new languages and physical/emotional challenges. I don't feel I'm a naturally great student. It's something I desperately want to be good at and this process is pushing me towards it. Learning how to ride, pack, take care of horses, camp with horses, tend to all their needs has been a slow process and it's one I am currently in the middle of. It has required a level of patience, maturity and thoughtfulness that are not a part of my natural demeanor. I am in a world of new. It's beautiful, exhausting, illuminating and comes with lots of sore muscles and occasional bouts of overwhelming anxiety. Every day I wake up and start productively failing. At the end of each day I see I'm a bit closer, a bit smarter, a bit more capable of doing this thing. Riding starts with one horse, then leading a horse, then leading a horse with a pack saddle, then leading with a loaded pack saddle, then an overnight, then multiple nights, then multiple multiple nights. Regularly finding sufficient feed and water on the trail are two of the biggest challenges. Driven by curiosity In the process of preparing for this trip I've made some dear friends with people I disagree with on a great many issues, probably most of the issues that are at the top of the American zeitgeist right now. We forged a connection through working with horses, eating food, asking about each others history and what the other was excited about. That gave us a foundation of respect and understanding where I now feel we could talk about anything with curiosity for the others experience rather than reducing them to their stance on an issue. It's been a great lesson and reminder in what makes a person and the kinds of connections I value. I believe deeply in complexity. I think we all have complicated stories that brought us to where we are. I want to stay curious and get curiouser about all people. I think curiosity can be contagious as can fear. I choose the former and will carry that ethos with me as I move through different communities. But really, why do this? I did not grow up with horses or in the wilderness. It's hard and new. Forces me to slow down and think. There is very little space for ego in this learning process and I feel more open to all deeper knowledge and criticism. It's forced me to think less like a person and more like a horse. I'm looking forward to more of that. Being a person has its limits. How hard this is and what kind of hard is what drew me to this endeavor and what keeps me in it. I've spent a lot of life trying to have good experiences or comfortable ones. I'd like to be interested in meaningful experiences above the rest. REWARDS! The reward this project really produces is being a part of this journey and experiencing it with me. Also offering some other fun things I made. Here are a few pictures of Tour Tea towels you could choose from in the rewards and a physical copy of my debut album. In 2020 ill be printing my second album Glitterbones Bargain to vinyl and will make that available to my kickstarter backers first! My debut album My Brother Is Isaac with case that features the names of all the people I ever met in my life written very small. New Zealand tour tea towel with hosts names Theater show tea towel IF YA DON'T KNOW ME AND WOULD LIKE TO LEARN MORE ABOUT WHAT I DO AND HOW I DO IT CHECK OUT MY WEBSITE WWW.MYNAMEISGIDEON.COM

...first, let us introduce ourselves... �At times, they dived into the track of the moon in the dark sea water and opened their mouths to swallow the silver. At times, they plunged into the path of the sun in the green-blue ocean and opened their mouths and drank the gold.� � Pat O�Shea, The Hounds of the Morrigan  From Upstate New York, Oona Grady, vocals/fiddle/viola, and James Gascoyne, vocals/guitar/banjo, play and sing North Atlantic dance tunes and folk songs. Steeped in Irish music for as far back as she can remember, Oona spent many years living in Cork, Ireland, where she honed her skills as a fiddle player and Irish music specialist. Upon moving back to her hometown of Ithaca, NY, Oona immersed herself in the local traditional music scene and incorporated old time and Cajun tunes into her repertoire. Growing up outside Louisville, KY, James was surrounded by music from an early age; radio, vinyl records, church music, and live concerts were a part of daily life. Finding his own musical style as an adult, James always keeps his ears open for sounds � new, old, familiar, or strange. While singing and playing guitar and banjo with Drank The Gold, he delves into the traditions of American old time and Irish dance tunes, while keeping true to his borderless, experimental musical roots. Now based in Saratoga Springs, NY, Oona and James collaborate as Drank The Gold, bringing new perspectives and innovative arrangements to the music they love. Craic agus ceol (good times and music)! our first photo shoot! ...the project: Sipped The Silver... In March of this year we traveled to Oona's hometown of Ithaca, NY, and recorded an album's worth of material over two days. It was an intense and focused time, but the once the recording gear was set up, the music bubbled out of us! These are tunes and songs that we have been playing over the past months and years, honing the arrangements and locking into a groove. We traveled back to Ithaca the following month to do a day of mixing, and have spent the subsequent months coordinating all the other details involved in producing an album (more on that below). We chose Sipped The Silver as the title for this project in reference to the quote above - the same quote where we got our band name. A bit obscure, but we like the ambiguity and the poetry of it! ...the space: Electric Wilburland... We have been really lucky to work with Will Russell at Electric Wilburland in Newfield, NY (a small town outside of Ithaca). The studio is situated in an old church next to the oldest covered bridge still in use in New York State. A beautiful and serene and inspiring space - good vibes abound! We tried setting up in a few different spots, and eventually chose this corner up on the stage. We sat facing each other and played without headphones, as if we were in our own living room! Will set up the microphones with care to pick up the best sound possible, yet not disturbing our performance. THE ROOM at Electric Wilburland ...the material: Twelve Tracks... We played some of our favorite tunes and songs, two or three takes each, choosing the next piece organically, following the flow. In the end, we found ourselves with twelve tracks that we feel represent our current work as a band. Our main source of inspiration is various North Atlantic fiddle and folk music traditions, especially Irish and Appalachian old time music. Some tunes came out sounding somewhat similar to how we learned them, with simple duet arrangements. James wrote four of the tracks, and we worked up arrangements on fiddle/viola and banjo. And the rest of the music falls somewhere in that beautiful grey area between traditional and original! A couple of sneak peaks: James "ruined" a set of Irish jigs by playing them in a different time signature on the banjo; he also adjusted the feel of an Irish song by playing it on the banjo. {insert banjo joke here!} And Oona experimented with the mode of an Irish reel, dramatically changing the mood to suit the title. Though the material comes from many disparate sources, we can't help but play it sounding like us, putting our Drank The Gold stamp on it. the view from the control room ...the people involved: an amazing crew... We have been supported from start to finish by experts in their fields! Will Russell (engineering and mixing) is a grammy winning engineer who has made this process feel "easy" from start to finish. Dana Billings mastered the album beautifully, taking our requests and nailing them on the first try. Elizabeth Pedinotti Haynes took so many gorgeous (and flattering!) photos of us during our photo shoot that we agonized for hours trying to choose which ones to use. Mike O'Donnell has taken the graphic design to the next level, while also being positive and encouraging about our own graphic contributions. And, last but not least, Pat Burke has shepherded this project to completion, offering trusted advice and insight into the business of music making. We are so proud of this album, and of all that these folks have done to help make it great! Electric Wilburland ...how you can help: action steps... We appreciate all of the support we have already received over the years, from the venues that have hired us, to our families, and of course to everyone who has enjoyed our music! THANK YOU! Have a look at the pledge rewards and see what appeals: first and foremost, we'd love for you to use this Kickstarter campaign as a way to PRE-ORDER THE NEW ALBUM - get the CD if you still have a player, or even if you don't (it includes beautiful album art + a DTG designed sticker: keep it on your coffee table!). If you have gone purely digital, we have that option too. If you are able to give a larger pledge, we have a lot of options: support Oona's newfound obsession with block printing by ordering a set of cards or a t-shirt; sign up for a lesson with one or both of us; or get James to write you a tune. Last but not least, we'd absolutely love to come and play a house concert for you in your living room with all of your favorite friends! However you are able to help us along the way to making this project a reality, thank you! Like we said above, the music is recorded and we're very proud of it, and can't wait to share it with the world! the album cover image!

You've asked and I've listened... it's time for more animals from the World of Whimsi! The dragons and cats need a new friend, and the first one to hatch is a fox. Why a fox? Voting at conventions and through social media has shown that you want a fox next. --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- What's the fox like? Super soft and cuddly, this winged fox can't wait to meet you! Big feet, giant ears, super soft, long fabric, and a heart on her chest, she is ready for cuddles. She is baby-safe, since she has embroidered eyes and integrated (not jointed) legs. They still move since they are extra floppy, so she still "sits" and "stands" (with your help). She's 8 inches sitting, 10 inches standing. She's been designed so that accessories for the dragons will fit her. So -- your hats, scarves, cloaks, and pins will still fit your new dragon fox. Fox has squinty eyes and whiskers! A fox with open eyes may be added at a later date, but for now we are making the closed eyed fox. Thank you for your votes! --------------------------------------------------------------- What about the money? Funding Goals: Basics: Initial Goal: $2880 This breaks down to: $1900 for production $380 for Kickstarter, Backerkit & credit card processing fees $300 Safety Testing $300 Mailing Supplies For you visual people (like me!) here's a chart of how it breaks down. Funding for the campaign is entirely for production of the animals, safety testing, shipping supplies for Kickstarter rewards, and Kickstarter/Backerkit/credit card processing fees. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ALL BACKERS will be charged shipping after the campaign ends. You will get a survey through Backerkit, and will be charged the actual amount of postage for your items and any add-ons. Can I back the campaign if I'm outside the US? (International shipping?) I love international backers, but I found postage, customs, and shipping to be much more complicated (and expensive) than I anticipated. If you are international and you'd like to back, here's how it will work. International backers have ONE tier they are able to pledge through (INTERNATIONAL - Two Friends) You will be charged the actual amount of shipping once the campaign ends. Keep in mind there are customs fees as well, which can be unexpectedly high. These customs fees are entirely your responsibility. Do you like swords? Are you a lesbian? Do you just want to buy a sword in the colors of the lesbian flag? I have great news for you! These pins were inspired by my love of weaponry and my love of women, and in the hopes that other lesbians feeling neglected by merchandise during pride month can see themselves recognized by a product catering directly to them. I hope you all enjoy them as much as I enjoyed creating them! The specs are as follows: Each pin is 2" long (50.8 mm) at its longest point, hard enamel with shiny gold metal representing one of the oranges of the pride flag. They will have two locking clasps for security,and an equally cool looking backing card comes along with them. There are three initial designs for the funding goal: Rapier Longsword Katana These are automatically unlocked with full funding of the campaign! Those aren't all! If we hit all our stretch goals, three additional pins will be unlocked. These include: Greatsword Khopesh Zweihander All designs that are successfully unlocked will be available for you to choose from once the campaign has been completed via a survey that is sent out. UPDATE: I'm happy to announce our next series of stretch goals: Sapphic Swords! These swords were inspired by a Medium article that proposed a new lesbian flag, made with colors mentioned in poetry by Sappho. While the orange and pink seems to be the most recognized flag, I understand why some people may be uncomfortable with its' origins as a descendant of the pink flag, so I'm so pleased to be able to provide this option. For the Sapphic Swords, the stretch goals start with the Rapier, Longsword, and Katana- if we unlock all three of these, I'll unveil the Greatsword, Khopesh, and Zweihander in these colors as well! Thank you all so much for your continued support. Finally, please be aware that these are mostly final, but some small changes may occur when they're sent off to the supplier in order to make the best pins I can for you. Thanks for understanding! June-Early July: Kickstarter campaign Late July: surveys sent out after funds are received August-October: production of pins November: pins ship out! Funds received through the campaign will go toward the following: Pin Production Costs Shipping, Fulfillment and Packaging Costs Kickstarter Fees Want to get in contact with me? Send me an email at susannah@susannahgrady.com if you have any questions or comments. You can also find me on my Twitter at @venandum or on my website, susannahgrady.com.

The biggest hand puppets�or puppet hands�in the world! Squonk�s Hand to Hand will reveal the grandeur and tomfoolery of size and scale: big things little and little things big, the universe contained in the music of a 30� Moog synthesizer and hands the size of a house. These 25-foot hands are metaphors for our scale and impact. Hands were an evolutionary leap that developed with our brains as we became bipedal, and which led to tool use and all the other technologies of civilization. Our puppet hands will invoke the comedy of power, and who is controlling whom. The hands will be fully operable, with the visible rigging of a sailing ship or hot air balloon. The opposable thumbs that gave us such advantage will oppose each other wholeheartedly. Squonk�s original music, on bass and drums, guitar and wind synth, keyboards and bagpipes, will drive a journey that we hope will be spectacular, plaintive, and comic as the band runs head to head into these overwhelming hands of fate. Hand to Hand will be propelled by our instinct to create timely and boisterous music spectacle for the public space, free and accessible to all. Our show will end with these hands being inverted to represent the hands of the audience, coming together to grab the rigging, each individual powering a larger movement. A single giant movement. Grab a rope. All hands on deck, a handshake, helping hands. Hands together. Hand to Hand. Scale and Agency. How big we are. And what we do. Hand to Hand photos by John Altdorfer / Hand to Hand video by Jason Cohn

Dear Friends, Allow me to introduce a good friend and remarkably talented artist � Igor Eliseev. In the 15 years since we first met in the faraway Siberian city of Chita (just north of Mongolia), Igor has been producing beautiful, profound paintings focused on mystical themes. To view an exhibition of his work is to journey to another world�a realm of enigma and dreams, of soulfulness and peace. Now, he turns to you, the Kickstarter public, to seek your help in creating an installation that will combine his incredible canvases with music, video and�in what might be a world�s first for art exhibitions�a stunning collection of fine jewelry themed to the elegant and soaring motifs of his paintings. It is with great pleasure that I now share the wonder that is Igor Eliseev with all of you. Michael Shipley You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00 "Moonlight Kiss" 100 x 100 cm. My name is Igor Eliseev and I am an artist. My art is an expression of my inner world. I listen to glorious chill-out music while I create and my paramount goal is to convey that same emotional experience to my audience with the help of large, beautiful canvases and inspirational multi-media installations. I have staged numerous solo exhibitions and art projects, both locally and internationally. Each has been a conceptual event depicting profound ideas, subtle meaning, and timeless values. I have done work for high-profile art fairs and prestigious events organized by museums, foundations, and government agencies. My work has been acknowledged in various art publications and specialized magazines reviewed by famous art critics. Now I hope to create an art project combining all my concepts in one space and spanning a range of media�from painting to jewelry and from striking images to subtle and entrancing sounds. 1. The project is currently under development. I have more than 20 completed paintings from current and previous collections. In this spirit, I have created a series of paintings with such titles as �The Sands of Time,� �Magic Carpets,� �Domes of Heaven,� and �Magic Geometry.�. Work on this series continues and more canvases may yet take shape. The project will feature both these original works and those that I plan to create. In all, I plan to have 60 large-size oil paintings on display. 2. The project will be accompanied by a detailed description of all my philosophical concepts that form the basis of my work. I want to use the services of experienced writers and art critics who will review the project and convey my thoughts in the correct form. 3. While painting �Domes of Heaven� and �Magic Geometry,� it occurred to me to create a jewelry collection using the same motif. This was, in a sense, inevitable: while studying ornate Arab patterns and designs to transform them into works of art on my canvas, I also began developing a clear vision of these future articles of jewelry. Each is a study in form, in mystery and grace. The next step will be to realize these creations in gold, diamonds and precious stones. The first collection, called �Sultans of the Sky,� will include more than 30 nique and elegant pieces of jewelry. 4. An important part of the project is a marketing kit. This will include a catalogue of the jewelry and paintings and an USB flash drive in a gift box (containing the above catalogues), providing a window into my private art gallery as well as a glimpse into my audio-video art installations. 5. The design studio will be able to start creative work on the project and development of the website once 75% of the preparatory work is complete. 6. The project will use the special chill-out music of famed composer Michael E. Frith. 7. We will finalize the project by inviting guests of honor from the private and public sectors to attend a public opening ceremony. We will also stage public presentations at prestigious art platforms in museums and galleries around the globe. I believe this project will benefit the art community and have a positive cultural impact on each area where it is held. You will be welcome to see the progress in person, through studio visits at any time, at the Bodrum studio in Turkey. There, I am once found inspiration, which became endless since I had the privilege to start working there. At the studio will be made all the works of the art project. The studio is part of a large house where my the best sponsors would be hosted. We will talk about art and life, listen to music, enjoy the swimming pool and stargaze in the garden Igor Eliseev "Approach" 97 x 130 cm. " Gold Is Silence" 100 x 60 cm. " Golden Light In Treasury " Magic Revelation As a child I was fascinated by the magical Arabian tales�stories of flying carpets and genies living in lamps. In my imagination, I traveled with a caravan of camels carrying immeasurable treasure across the vast desert. The animals were beautiful in their slow and rhythmic movements and time seemed to stand still over the scene. The dunes and desert mirages carried me away on a long and fanciful journey. It seemed as though the stars dotting the heavens had so much they could tell me if only I listened�not to their words, but to their radiance. Then, on my first visit to Turkey some years ago, I re-experienced those feelings from distant childhood, when my world had been filled with fairy tales of the Middle East. I saw in the night sky all the same stars that shone upon me in childhood. Again, it felt as though their radiance carried a message, something important they wanted to say. This time, though, I was more attentive and I had a clear sense now was the time to listen�and hear. I will never forget this revelation because it changed my life. From that moment on, I was able to discover that which was hidden, uncover the secrets of this visible world and discern what is normally hidden from sight. I began seeing many things in new ways, with new eyes. My subsequent work depicted these insights, these attempts to make visible that which was unseen. My work took on deeper meaning: my feelings became my guide. I had only to find a story, a structure�in the same way a rough diamond needs careful shaping to become a precious gem. Each facet of such a diamond must reflect the visible world, while the invisible must shine out from within. Igor Eliseev " The Cheetah " "The Pearl" 100 x 60 cm.
