An Americana/British folk mind meld from Good Intentions and I See Hawks In L.A. Paul and Victoria from I See Hawks in L.A. first met Peter and Gabi from The Good Intentions at a house party in Sierra Madre, CA, hosted by singer/writer Bliss Bowen. The Liverpool folk duo were on their first tour of the USA, and their English accents and timeless tunes charmed and impressed the Americans. Soon, the Hawks and Intentions were good friends. Over the years and several shared stages, from Peter and Gabi's house concerts in Liverpool to rocking Pappy & Harriet's nights in the desert, the friendship suggested a songwriting endeavor. One evening in Rob's Highland Park garage studio, Rob, Paul L and Peter sat down with guitars and some trepidation, suddenly out of their comfort zones, but came up with the beginnings of "White Cross" and "Rolling The Boxcars" amidst much fun and laughter and the chaos of the Waller children. After this promising start and the Liverpudlians' return to Liverpool, the songwriting process migrated to the cold digital theater of email--lyrics and mp3s bouncing back and forth the Atlantic by the hundreds, nestled amidst internet spams and bank statements. The challenge of creating heartfelt folk songs through cyber connection was not lost on any of us. As the email threads mushroomed, the Hawks and Good Intentions discovered the subtle and at times gaping differences between English and American musical sensibilities, phrases and idioms, as well as quirks (defects?) in their own personalities and hardened songwriting habits. Both groups shared an appreciation for nuanced shadings; and tiny but dire quibbles on a single word or phrase accompanied every stanza. These heated if wit-defused discussions became a deep learning experience for all involved, including Hawks bassist Paul Marshall and drummer Victoria Jacobs. What emerged was a song crafting process more deliberative and careful than the Hawks have ever been disciplined enough to undertake. Where Paul L and Rob often revel in their reckless irreverence for traditional forms, Peter employs a more careful and thoughtful process. Both sides fought it out but surrendered when necessary and appropriate to the truth of the evolving song. The songwriters bounced around twenty or so ideas, completing about fifteen, including "Singing In The Wind" and "White Cross," which appeared on the most recent Hawks record, Live And Never Learn. Peter and Gabi Onstage Many Hawks fans are familiar with the Good Intentions. Peter Davies and Gabrielle Monk have been voted Best Americana Band by the British Country Music Awards. They've released four albums produced by L.A.'s own Rick Shea with the cream of the crop of L.A. roots musicians. Hawks at Tintern Abbey in Wales I See Hawks In L.A. have released eight critically acclaimed CDs since their high desert conception 20 years ago, and were named to MOJO Magazine's 2018 Top Ten Americana Releases for "Live And Never Learn." They were just named "Best Country Band" by the L.A. Weekly. HAWKS WITH GOOD INTENTIONS is a collection of ten ballads, waltzes, and rocking train beats, sung by Peter, Rob, and Victoria, with duets and harmonies by both bands' singers, in unique combinations. Except for some slide guitar, this is all acoustic, with beautiful contributions from fiddler Gabe Witcher (Punch Bros) and Richie Lawrence (Yolos, Ray Bonneville). This is new British American folk, a cross-pollination with roots in the 70s, 60s, and much earlier. Rob, Peter, and Victoria visiting Paul McCartney's childhood home We're raising funds for recording costs, mix/mastering by four time Grammy winner and longtime friend Alfonso Rodenas, and CD manufacture and promo for UK/Europe. We are very grateful for our friends/fans' past support and hope you enjoy this release as much as as we do. Please join us in getting this music out into the world. "Hawks with Good Intentions"

Synopsis The end of the world is nigh! At least that's what Jenna confesses to Rhett at the end of their first date. On top of that, she believes he's the Second Coming of Christ! Quite an unexpected responsibility for a college Freshman who is only three weeks into school. For now, the world is still intact, but Jenna, Rhett, and their roommates believe the end of time is starting right in their very own NYC dorm. Will their Savior rescue them? The play explores such current issues as identity, prejudices, faith, and responsibility through the lens of five progressive college students in 2018. Wrapped in the humor and light-hearted dialogue of Generation Z, The Second Coming depicts the current fears of the American youth and their journey toward understanding themselves and each other. Characters (in order of appearance) Rhett is a nice Jewish boy. Well, culturally Jewish�he's actually an atheist. Having recently moved from New English suburbia into the city, his excitement of living among skyscrapers has increased his confidence enough to ask out a girl for the first time in his life. Still, he is anxious about getting lost in a sea of strangers. It doesn't help that he's far away from mom and his older brother, who's studying on the other side of the continent. Nonetheless, he tries his best at socializing and not taking criticisms too personal. Jenna is mature and reasonable. At least she thinks she is. Actually, she believes she is... most of the time. But how do you explain having visions in the middle of the night? Anyway, she should stand for what she believes in. Even though it's not always fully clear to herself. But that's part of feminism; learning and growing. And now's the chance! The campus offers her many people of diverse backgrounds for the first time in her life, so she has to grab onto that opportunity. But she knew that already. Ivan is Christian and gay. No, the two are not conflicting with each other, not since his early teens. Since his parents accepted him, he did as well. But he never did anything with the gay part, really... The distance from home helps. It puts everything into perspective. But he has to find someone soon, just to... know what it's like, being gay, you know? He likes order and his relationship with God helps him with that. He's also very happy keeping all this stuff to himself... if only Rhett wasn't so difficult... Mariam is the daughter of immigrants. Never stepped foot on wherever her parents came from. She still knows some of the Arabic for the prayers and a couple of French phrases her dad kept rambling every now and then. Must've been a leftover from colonial times. But that's not much of her concern right now. She grew up here. She feels some pressure to show as a modern woman, but it is also kind of easy to her. She just is who she is. Oh, and she loves weed and thinking about things... Cheers! Tanya is a committed Resident Assistant of this beautiful dorm adjacent to the gorgeous park. When she moved in here, it reawakened some memories of her own Freshman year. Now she wants to make sure her "Littles" are having a similarly great experience... and that they follow the house rules. But don't get her wrong, she's also got her own dreams for the more distant future. She wants to keep those on the DL though, haha! About the Author Hi! My name is Mario del Cubo. I'm a Swiss-Spanish actor and writer. During my time at NYU Tisch, I started exploring the world of writing and found great joy in the development of new stories to tell. At 239 Arts, a theatre group a couple of friends and I founded in the summer of 2018, I began to create The Second Coming as a writing exercise. Eventually, the piece grew into a fully fleshed-out play. Now, I am excited to present it in front of an audience, and perhaps hear some feedback on my debut as a playwright. Performance A staged reading of the play is scheduled to be performed on the evenings of June 28-30, 2019 at a Manhattan theater (we're still scouting theaters). The show is applying to be acknowledged by Actors' Equity Association and will adhere to the regulations of a "29-hour Reading." Furthermore, I would like to encourage diversity at the theatre and hope to employ a team of young talent on, as well as behind the stage. However, this project wouldn't be possible without your help! Budget Our costs primarily consist of space rental, actors' stipends, and printing of programs. The following is a budgeting estimate based on possible locations for the performance. Space Rental (three 4-hour evenings) $1020 Actors' Stipends (travel and other expenses) $600 Printing Costs (programs and feedback sheet) $200 TOTAL $1820 This is truly a passion project; all individuals involved in this project will not (and cannot) receive any financial payment. However, the experience will not only help the development of the play, but also create a network of young talent and three enjoyable evenings at the theater for the audience. If you have any questions or concerns, please don't hesitate to contact me at mdelcubo@gmail.com or text me at (718) 801-2591. Thank you for your support! Best, Mario

We are seeking funds to support the post-production of EARTHLINGS, a feature-length film adaptation of a short story by novelist and screenwriter Jonathan Raymond (Night Moves, Wendy And Lucy, Mildred Pierce.) The films stars Luis Chavez, Daniel Edward Mora, Kelvin Han Yee, Tina Holmes and James Le Gros. The story begins with Tom Chen, an affluent Chinese American who decides to celebrate the anniversary of his divorce with a dinner party. When his intended guests cancel, he impulsively invites the two Mexican day laborers, Javier and Diego, who are working in his yard, to join him instead. But as the three men are settling in to the evening, finding connections and differences in their respective American stories, two of Tom�s original guests show up after all, and the resulting clash of cultures and beliefs takes the evening to new heights--and depths--of desire, hedonism, and conflict. We have completed all principle and secondary photography and cut a rough edit of the film. We are seeking $22,000 in donations for costs associated with our edit and musical score. Join our great team in making EARTHLINGS the movie a reality! Our deepest thanks to you supporters who helped get this movie as far along as it is. Because of you we were able to assemble a great cast and crew and get the movie shot as scheduled. Our Team: Executive Producers Todd Haynes, Kelly Reichardt, Jonathan Raymond Associate Producer Luis Chavez Producer Jacqueline Gault Cinematographer Marc Greenfield Editor Jacob Pander Producer and director Steven Doughton Adapted for the screen by Steven Doughton

Blueish Greetings is an animal themed greeting card project that puts colorful and seasonal artworks onto greeting cards. This project has been a long time in the making and it is the pleasure of Cailyn/Blue to bring the project to life. The project is currently ready to go, with many designs prepared or conceptualized that will be ready for scheduled releases down the line. The cards are also priced to be affordable an accessible, as all greeting cards should be. These cards are created to bring smiles and joy to those who send and receive them and it would feel wrong to make them anything but. Before shipping, the cards will start at $5 a piece and this price will be maintained for the foreseeable future. It will be run through Etsy with two releases a month, at the beginning and halfway through the month. These releases will consist of sets of themed cards, always containing more than a single card. These themes will be holiday based, seasonal, event related (birthdays, anniversaries, etc.) and will be available whenever possible through the Etsy website. They will be announced at least a week in advance to give everyone a chance to plan for them. Pictured below are simulated proofs of what the first set (Summer Fun! themed) released will look like. The cards when folded measure at 5 inches wide by 7 inches tall and come with their own envelopes. The current timetable dictates that after the Kickstarter, should the fund be raised, the cards will be ordered soon after an official proof is obtained and then the cards from the Summer Fun! first set will be posted on Etsy the first week of August. Rewards will also be sent out the first week of August alongside orders. Below are the two first release cards in the Summer Fun! set. The second Summer Fun! set will be announced around this time and will be placed on Etsy the middle of August. After that, there's a long list of cards planned. Some examples include... Oktober Fest Birthday cards for ages 1-10 Get Well Soon cards 3 December Holiday card sets Halloween And much more not listed! The current budget for the project is set at $350 for a beginning stretch goal, with the others priced to cover the costs of getting the cards printed and getting the mailers for them. All the money obtained through this Kickstarter will stay WITHIN the business. Not a penny that comes from you all will go into my pocket. I have more bonus cards planned, events, and graphic designers on the line to help me improve the look of the brand, and a web designer will be hired for a website should the budget permit. Most of the money goes to purchasing the greeting cards. There are a few stretch goals that are being offered as patrons give their funding. Listed below are the current stretch goals! $650 - Full Summer Fun! Collection The second Summer Fun! is released at the same time as the first during the beginning of August. This leaves room for more possible cards and releases that month. --------- $825 - The first set of Pampered Pets! If this goal is met the first two cards of a bonus collection based around pets! These are slated for a ate August or early September release and WILL NOT replace the currently planned cards. These are bonus cards! --------- $1,150 - Full Pampered Pets! Collection Release If this goal is met there will be four Pampered Pets! cards in the bonus collection instead oh just 2! These are slated for a ate August or early September release and WILL NOT replace the currently planned cards. These are bonus cards! --------- $1,400 - Bonus September Mystical Mayhem! Duo If this goal is met another bonus set of mystical creature cards will be released in mid September. This will likely be a duo of a dragon and unicorn although this is undecided at this point. Cailyn/Blue is the illustrator for these cards and has been working on designs and a calendar of future released for a long time. Blue/Cailyn is a 23 year old artist and illustrator from Cleveland, Ohio. She is currently a student of graphic design and animation who wants nothing more than to create and bring people happiness through her creations. She has been drawing since she could sit up and loves working in bright colors and fantastical settings and pushing her limits to improve as a person and as an artist. The plan for the business is thought up and ready to be rolled out. We just need our help!

I started Designer Daddy as a passion project. I have always loved fashion but struggled to follow my dreams. It was not until my family and I were on our last leg that things started to change. One day I took my family to Disney Land and my daughter wanted a princess dress. I knew I could not afford it so I promised her I would make her a special dress of her very own. When he got to work my wife challenged me to make something special, something more than a simple dress. What we created was magical a dress that could transform from an ordinary dress to a beautiful princess gown. As soon as other people saw the dress it was an instant hit. People started asking me to make them a dress and they wanted to follow me on social media. Designer Daddy was born! Since then I have been blessed to with great fans and customers that have allowed me to make some amazing things. Everything has been made custom by hand which is amazing but also means our work is very expensive. Our Goal is to make the magic of Designer Daddy more affordable to more people. We are scaling up to mass produce exciting designs. We also hope to introduce new designs and we have some amazing things planned for you! Designer Daddy is more than just me. I have always relied on the power and passion of everyone that supports me. I have been so inspired by the support that everyone has given us over the past few years and I know we can build something beautiful that will reach millions of people. We can bring a little more magic to this world. Thank you so much for your support. I hope you will join us on this Journey!

The New Standard for CNC Routers... The Mammoth CNC Routers aim to bring large-scale milling capabilities to all skill levels at an affordable price. The Control Pendant breaks you free from being tethered to your laptop with USB cables by running the jobs for you. Our machines also bring about a sense of freedom from project-size constraints with their large cut areas. Welcome to the new standard for CNC Router Machines. You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00 We have foregone a rigid base platform for our machines, as this is a leading contributor to the cost of many machines currently available on the market. Instead, we elected to harness the inner-maker inside all of us and build a base using standard 2x4 lumber that is readily available at your local hardware store. This allowed us to significantly reduce the overall cost of the system, and deliver a more affordable product to you. This also affords you, the user, the opportunity to build the platform as large or small as you want along the Y-Axis. We found this route to be most useful as well when it came time to break down the system to store in the corner of a shop, or when it is moved to a new location. How I store this Mammoth when not in use! For a cost of around $35, this hands down beats a rigid table that is many times more expensive and logistically challenging. 3'x8' Table used by a Mammoth CNC Plans, along with a building materials list, will be provided to backers for how to construct a few variations of the base platform. The variations offer solutions for those with both a larger and smaller area to use their Mammoth CNC in. With using lumber for the base of our machines, we are able to achieve a very strong, rigid frame that supports our machines in every aspect of their operation without sacrificing accuracy and repeat-ability. You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00 Mammoth machines use Kevlar reinforced HTD5 belt to traverse along the Y-Axis of the base platform (as shown by video above). The Mammoth CNC comes in two formats to accommodate different space restrictions that you face, and what size of projects you may see yourself doing. The Hardware and Electronics... At the heart of every Mammoth machine is the TinyG motion controller. The team behind the TinyG has set a standard for motion control that reflects the high standards we have for our machines. We feel we have the absolute best motion controller running all of our machines. The Control Pendant lets you have complete freedom while setting up your machine, and running your cut jobs, all on it's vibrant 5" touchscreen. Our Pendant accepts standard gCode, allowing you to use your preferred CAM software for all of your post processing. Running your job is accomplished by saving your files onto the Control Pendant's SD card. You can scroll through all of the jobs on the SD card, and select which one to run. Setting up the work space is all done through the Control Pendant in less than 5 minutes. All of the machine's power is run through an Emergency Stop switch, which will cut power in the event of an emergency. Power for the router is run through this switch, and a power receptacle is built into the machine. Two cooling fans are also used to ensure that the everything stays cool and runs at optimal performance levels. Router power receptacle built into the machine. One of our main focuses was to not have a handful of cables coming from the machine, and with only a single cable required to run, we have achieved our goal! Only one cord coming from a Mammoth CNC....the power cord! NOT INCLUDED: The cutting power for each machine is provided by a Makita RT0701 / RT0700 Router. This is the router that we have found to be best suited for our application, and provides the spindle speed and endurance that fits our needs. Some people may already have routers, so we have elected to not include this. However, if you need a router, one may be added to your order by adding $120 to your pledge. Software... To ensure that our machines are as easily integrated into your work environment as possible, the Control Pendant was designed to accept standard gCode, which almost all CAM software is capable of outputting. We use Autodesk Fusion 360, and have demo projects and tutorials currently under construction for this platform. Spoil boards... With the use of a 2x4 base platform, you are able to directly attach the spoil board to the base. Or, if you need that little bit of extra Z-axis cutting depth, you can always forego the spoil board and attach your cutting material directly to the frame itself. We have run using either method, and both work equally well. If you do run with a spoil board, 1/2 inch MDF is our recommended material. Mammoth Specs... Cut Volume: 34" on X-Axis, 3" on Z-Axis, Unlimited Y-Axis Max Speed: 2500mm/min Resolution: +/-0.1mm Mammoth XL Specs... Cut Volume: 54" on X-Axis, 3" on Z-Axis, Unlimited Y-Axis Max Speed: 2500mm/min Resolution: +/-0.1mm Why a Mammoth CNC... If you have ever had to measure out your usable cutting area to the nearest 1/16th inch just to ensure your project would fit, we feel you. Our main goal is to bring you a large footprint machine that you can make extravagant projects on, at a low price. Having your computer fall asleep during your project; accidentally unplugging the USB cable in the middle of a cut; not being able to design and process more projects are all issues most of us have run into using a CNC. Our Control Pendant is the solution to those very common problems. We wanted to address the need for a hand-held controller that runs your cut jobs and stays with the machine, so you no longer dedicate a computer for the job. It was for these reasons, and so many more, that made the Mammoth CNC line into what it is today. We can't wait to share this journey with you, and see what you create! SKYE Sneaker-Boots can be dressed up for a day in town or dressed down to coordinate with the most casual athletic clothes you own. With a no-tie lace design, you can easily slip the shoe on or off � no time wasted. A discrete YKK zipper closure system located on the side of the shoe provides function and style. We blend our modified slip-on system with modern materials to maintain a stylish boot silhouette. We believe that feeling amazing starts with where you stand. The sneaker-boots are lighter than most, which makes activities easier and less strenuous on your feet. The boot shell consists of 4-way stretch fabric for an extra comfortable fit. An optimal contoured cushioning design evenly distributes the weight of your body, relieving the pressure and shock of each step. A sculpted insole provides support on the arch and heel for all-day comfort. Your feet won�t ache after a long day, bringing you a new level of comfort. The sneaker-boots are engineered with highly durable materials such as military-grade Cordura and Japanese armor. The toe boxes of the shoes have TPR mudguard protection, the tips of the recycled plastic cords are dipped in rubber to prevent fraying ends, and the soles feature a unique water flushing pattern with a sawtooth profile to provide excellent grip in all types of weather. The sneaker-boots are 100% waterproof and snowproof. Not only is the entire shoe welded TPR for weather protection, but it also keeps water out with a waterproof YKK zipper. The weatherproof material also has insulating layer keeping your toes warm from the cold and snow. Our footwear is man-made with ethical manufacturing procedures. We strive to limit our carbon footprint to help preserve the environment. We use materials like recycled plastic and 100% natural, biodegradable rubber to create our shoes. We are also vegan-friendly � we do not use animal by-products. People love shoes. The average American owns about 19 pairs of shoes at one time. You might have hiking shoes, running shoes, rain boots, casual sneakers, snow boots and desert boots. Imagine buying a single pair that could work in all of these occasions. For those who value quality over quantity, combining your favorite, essential pairs of shoes into one sensible, attractive pair would be a dream. We made it our goal to present the eco-friendly, exceptionally crafted, affordable shoe option. Our company promises this to you, in addition to comfort, longevity and versatility. We can�t thank you enough for checking out our project and helping us make SKYE Sneaker-Boots a reality. We know not everyone will be able to support us with a pledge, but if you like SKYE Sneaker-Boots, please help us spread the word on Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, Reddit, and anywhere else you can think of! We�re only happy if you�re super-comfy and look great. We�ll be sure to exchange your shoes as long as they have not been worn outside, still have the tags attached, and are accompanied by the original receipt within 30 days of receiving the shoes. Once our shoes are available for retail (a few months after backers receive the early-birds), you�ll need to purchase your correct size from us at retail, and we�ll refund the difference. If there�s a manufacturing issue with your shoes, no problem, we�ve got it covered. Connect with us and we would be happy to assist.

The Story Facts can fade, but stories are sticky. In my work with a nonprofit affordable housing developer, I frequently meet people with misconceptions about affordable housing. Like many growing American cities, Nashville is struggling with a significant affordable housing crisis, at a scale that can be difficult to comprehend and even more difficult to imagine solving. It is critical to break down the stereotypes, numbers, and acronyms that can make housing development so inaccessible, and refocus on the human component of affordable housing. The initial prototype of the Game of Rent at Nashville's PARK(ing) Day 2017 The Game of Rent began as a simple conversation starter during Nashville's PARK(ing) Day in 2017, trying to engage passersby around housing affordability. Over the past two years, the Game has evolved into a highly effective teaching tool for building empathy and understanding around affordable housing. Whether talking to NIMBY* neighbors or advocating to decision-makers, the Game of Rent helps players put themselves in their neighbors' shoes. With a roll of the dice and drawing of cards, each person assumes a new identity - perhaps a single parent working as a middle school teacher with two kids, or a young professional with a few roommates, or a couple caring for an aging parent. I've played the prototype Game with bankers, students, community advocates, public officials, developers, teachers, and architects - in Nashville and around the country - and consistently hear feedback like, "I'd never thought about that barrier to housing," or "I didn't know that's what my employees struggle with," or "wow, this is so real - like, this is my exact living situation." The reality is that the rent is too damn high for almost half of American renters, but that statistic is still less meaningful than drawing a Housekeeper card, having four children, needing to account for an eviction record, and trying to find a two-bedroom apartment for under $600. The Game of Rent begins to simulate what members of our communities experience on a daily basis when looking for somewhere to live. Why Kickstarter? These challenges are different in cities across the United States, so it's really important that the Game reflects the local context - and that's where the Kickstarter comes in. My goal is to scale this project and make it available outside of Nashville. From Boston to Seattle to Austin to Charlotte, I want to make this tool - and the conversation about affordable housing - accessible to more communities, but I need your help. The Rewards The Game of Rent: Nashville Edition is fully designed and prototyped, ready for neighbors and housing advocates to get a full physical version and take it to their next neighborhood meeting! Each physical copy of the Game comes with a "Not a NIMBY*" sticker so you can show your support for affordable housing in your neighborhood. For other cities, Customized City Editions require the initial sourcing and verification of local data and design of customized map game boards. Every physical copy of the Game comes with a "Not a NIMBY*" sticker. Want to print and play your own Game of Rent? Print + Play Backers will receive a digital download link for a PDF of the game components with instructions for DIY printing, and details for additional components needed to complete the Game (like dice). No physical components are included with this reward. Don't have a use for the Game but still want to support the project? Show your support for affordable housing with a snazzy "Not a NIMBY*" sticker. Live in Nashville, or want to make a trip here (let's be real, who doesn't)!? Rewards levels that include invitations to exclusive in-person Game Nights with local housing advocates, or private Game Nights facilitated by the creator are also available. Exceeding Expectations What if this project is massively successful and funded several times over, you ask?! An online version of this tool is a stretch goal; however this skill set would require additional human resources for the design and coding. Pledges above and beyond the funding goal will be put towards that effort, as well as producing and implementing in-person and online training for facilitators and advocates in Nashville and other cities. Doesn't that sound awesome?! *NIMBY is a common abbreviation for "Not In My Backyard," often referring to the resistance to affordable housing development in a given community.

After School Projects is an imaginary creative agency and fruitless arena (in arts & science) powered by a handful of creative friends. We curate + host art exhibitions, design + produce apparel, and aim to present quality photo/video/design content across various platforms. We eat nostalgia for breakfast. ASP's genesis was located in the UW dorms (Elm Hall, 721) as a misadventure and brainchild of Aidan T. E. Galassetti. Since then, it has youthfully matured into an incentive for Aidan and his friends to play, explore, and do the arts! You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00 Gingerly stepping out of our Southern California comfort zone, we are working to bring the first, and likely last, After School Projects Art Show to Seattle, Washington. The show, titled 'Everything Can Still Happen So Nothing Can Really Be That Wrong,� is a celebration of the journey thus far. The purpose of the show feels youthful - it is not to launch a brand, make a name, or generate the clouts. We are here to lean into the uncertainty of life and create a space buoyant with creativity and curiosity amongst friends and family. We aim to create a window for those we hold near and dear to share their ideas and stories in a gallery space they might not conventionally find themselves in. The show will include original art, live music, collaborative poems, a ramen tower, plaster blocks to chisel and sculpt, balloons, 490 square feet of mylar blankets, food, drink, merchandise, and much more! We're reaching out for donations that will enable us to rent a venue fit for the nature of this event. All proceeds will be used to secure a suitable venue and successfully execute a blissful show. If you do not feel like or are not able to use a credit card to make a donation on Kickstarter - please feel free to donate via venmo @afterschoolprojects with the description 'donation'. We sincerely appreciate any and all contributions made to support this fruitless misadventure in arts & science. Part of our show will include the opportunity to take home a hand painted original skateboard deck. Please keep an eye out or contact us on social media for more details. Previous (hand-painted original) decks are valued at $300- $500.

Imagine if Superman had been published by Marvel during the Bronze Age of Comics. I'm Barry Gregory. I'm the writer/colorist/publisher of John Aman Amazing Man. I grew up in a place that was literally twenty miles from a stoplight. On a clear day, we had two television channels. I was never the outdoorsy type like most of the kids I went to school with. Comics were my refuge. They were everything to me as a kid. Especially the great Marvel Comics of the mid-1970s. John Aman Amazing Man is my love letter to those comics. I wanted to write a comic that captured the spirit of those books that meant so much to me then --and still do more than forty years later. I enlisted the aid of the best superhero artist I've ever known in Steven Butler to bring it to life. If you love classic superheroes ... stories filled with larger-than-life characters, action, adventure, mystery, romance, intrigue, and humor... then this might be just the comic you didn't know you were looking for. John Aman Amazing Man Volume One Remastered and Expanded Edition Trade Paperback This edition collects all six issues of the popular superhero comic by Barry Gregory and Steven Butler based on Bill Everett's classic Golden Age of Comics character The Amazing Man! This collection includes an all new introduction by legendary comics writer (proclaimed by Marvel as one of "Marvel's Greatest Creators") and creator of Black Lightning, Tony Isabella! Also included is a John Aman pinup gallery by some of comics' best artists, early design work by series artist Steven Butler, a plot-to-page feature, an Easter Egg guide to appearances by Golden Age characters you may have missed as well as behind-the-scenes info from the Gallant team, and a never-before-seen, never-to-be-reprinted ALL NEW SCENE that lays the groundwork for the continuing adventures of John Aman! Over 200 full color pages in all! Classic Superhero Action and Adventure in the tradition of the Bronze Age of Comics! The X-Bureau had never seen anyone quite like John Aman. Created to monitor and control superhuman activity in the United States, the X-Bureau and its legion of operatives thought they'd seen it all ... then John Aman arrived. Super strong, super fast, able to fly and transform into a green mist that can flow through any surface, Aman was a one-of-kind. But X-Bureau operations chief Sylvia Manners could tell there was something more. Something Aman kept hidden. A secret... John Aman Amazing Man is written by Barry Gregory with artwork by Steven Butler (Web of Spider-man, Silver Sable) and features characters created by Bill Everett, Jack Kirby, Will Eisner, and other legendary comics creators! Here's what people are saying about John Aman Amazing Man... �John Aman is a superhero comic unafraid to cross genres in its glorious recapturing of old-school adventure. Prepare for a good time reading this comic!� Dirk Manning �It�s fun, it�s engaging, it�s very well-written in the way the best comics of the 1970s were well-written, like Steve Gerber or Steve Englehart or Paul Kupperberg at their very best, the art likewise. It�s not neo-Golden Age pulp silliness, and neither is it over-the-top, we�ve-seen-it all-before Watchmen-ish apocalyptica. It�s good, solid superhero adventure that still has subtext and meaning, appealing art and characters you care about.� Mark Shainblum "An absolutely solid, completely professional superhero story that does a fine job of reviving Bill Everett's early superhero Amazing Man. But then it's hard not to love a comic that shows due respect to one of the strangest characters of the Golden Age, Dr. Vampire." Steve Bennett NEW REWARDS! John Aman Amazing Man #2 Remarqued Covers! Pledge $40 and get a copy of John Aman Amazing Man #2 with a Hand-Drawn head sketch in the bottom corner -- penciled, and inked by series artist Steven Butler. This pledge also INCLUDE a copy of the John Aman Amazing Man Revised and Expanded TPB! LAST DAY ADDITION! ONE MORE Steven Butler Original Art FULL COLOR Sketch Cover Edition of Gallant Comics #1! Gallant Comics #1 is the out-of-print comic that would later be reworked and expanded to become John Aman Amazing Man #1. These comics come with a one-of-kind HAND-DRAWN --penciled, inked, colored, and signed --cover by series artist Steven Butler! This pledge also INCLUDE a copy of the John Aman Amazing Man Revised and Expanded TPB! We've also got add-ons! For example, if you pledged the Early Bird and you want to add an action figure, just increase your Early Bird pledge from $25 to $35. At the conclusion of the campaign, we'll ask if your pledge includes any add-ons. Here are a few of the other rewards we're offering for your support! For resellers, there is also a 10 copy bundle for a pledge of just $100. That's $10 per book, allowing you to almost triple your money if you resell at our recommended MSRP of $30! This Variant Cover Edition comes numbered signed by the creators! It is strictly limited to 100 copies and will never be printed again! We're also offering you a rare chance to own an original page of artwork used to produce the comic. Each of these pages is penciled, inked, and signed by series artist Steven Butler and is a one-of-a-kind collectible! This pledge also includes a printed copy of the Regular Cover Edition. Matt Kennedy is known by many for his courage, perseverance, and above all else, his ability to take things seriously. This summer he is embarking on the greatest challenge of his life: Holding in his own urine for 30 days He believes that successfully completing this challenge will be one of the greatest feats in human history and is totally not covering up anything. "Holding It In" is my attempt as a filmmaker to make sure his story is seen. TEASER

99% pure Grade II Titanium MADE IN THE USA Listing is for a single die Handmade item (CNC Milled) dimensions are .688" (17.47 mm) square Great for any collection! Available for purchase is a CNC machined casino die. Our dice are standard 6 sided die. Actual dimensions are .688" (17.47 mm) square. They feature a brushed metal finish and flat bottom pips. These are a wonderful addition for any dice or titanium collector. Constructed from 99% pure Titanium these dice will literally last for all of eternity. We here at Empire Tactical USA want to create the lightest, Hardest, most durable gaming dice the world has ever seen. Industry utilizes titanium in jet engines and The hatch on the M2 Bradley infantry fighting vehicle is titanium offering a weight savings of 35% and also providing increased ballistic protection over the original forged aluminum design. We wanted to make combat ready dice! A metallic element, titanium is recognized for its high strength-to-weight ratio. Titanium is 60% denser than aluminium, but more than twice as strong Titanium is a chemical element with symbol Ti and atomic number 22. It is a lustrous transition metal with a silver color, low density and high strength. It is highly resistant to corrosion in sea water, aqua regia and chlorine. Titanium has become dramatically more significant as a workpiece material in machine shops. Two industries are driving this. One is aerospace. The latest aircraft designs use dramatically more titanium than planes of the past. The other is the medical industry. Titanium is a common material used for implants and devices used within the body. Titanium�s high hardness and low thermal conductivity make it more challenging to machine than other metals that most machine shops are more accustomed to facing. Why is milling titanium worth the attention? There are at least two reasons. First, the material is used for high-end parts�not just components used in an aircraft�s frame and engine, but also medical parts, for example. Shops able to thrive in the United States increasingly will migrate toward higher-end work, meaning that a growing percentage of U.S. shops will encounter this material. That�s one reason. Another, broader reason for covering titanium milling relates to the procedures for machining effectively when the material is difficult to cut or the available speed is low. Not every shop has access to high spindle speeds and feed rates This project will help propel us into many other titanium projects in the future! WE LOOK FORWARD TO THE FUTURE! -Adam M. Pfeifle EMPIRE TACTICAL USA Adam Pfeifle (me) The Machine shop!

�Think you're escaping and run into yourself. Longest way round is the shortest way home.�  James Joyce, Ulysses About TERRA FIRMA TERRA FIRMA places dance at the crossroads of art, theater, and performance.The project is an intimate and poetic exploration of life as a journey� journey not conceived simply as displacement in space and time but also symbolically through a sense of desire for knowledge of oneself and in the search for oneself.( copyright Grazia Capri, TERRA FIRMA 2019) How it all started The inspiration for this piece began with reading Baricco's Mr Gwyn. In the book the protagonist has the idea to �write� a portrait. With the purpose of bringing the person back home he puts them in an isolated condition for hours, days, alone with themselves in order to remove the mask of everyday life, which obscures the true essence in each of us. _____The idea struck me immediately as I had already worked on this concept in a different way in my previous performances. ( copyright Grazia Capri, TERRA FIRMA 2019) Grazia Capri in "Beyond" and "Corpi in Vertigine". Photo : Vinciane Verguethen - Yuken Teruya ( copyright images Grazia Capri Company 2010/2019) The description of the preparation of the environment and the way the protagonist arrives at the portrait�s creation enchanted me. ( copyright Grazia Capri, TERRA FIRMA 2019) I started to create the solo Silent Breath but I could not prevent myself from thinking that in the end it was in fact an emotional, or rather, an intimate journey, a journey searching for itself.( copyright Grazia Capri, TERRA FIRMA 2019) Grazia Capri - Silent Breath - ( copyright image Grazia Capri, Silent Breath 2018) On the note of travel, I couldn�t resist thinking of Ulysses, whose with his journey became a symbol of the contemporary unrest. ( copyright Grazia Capri, TERRA FIRMA 2019) Material that inspired me during the creation But also description of Ulysses in Homer's ODYSSEY, passing through Dante's INFERNO to get to the modern Joyce and the Umberto Saba's poetry ULISSE. ( copyright Grazia Capri, TERRA FIRMA 2019) Grazia Capri's draft for the rehearsal of TERRA FIRMA ( copyright draft Grazia Capri, TERRA FIRMA 2019) My focus and my challenge as a choreographer, working on stage, was to find the balance between the physical journey and the intimate journey.( copyright Grazia Capri, TERRA FIRMA 2019) Performers: Amanda Bouza, Kaity Myers, Irene Paci in "Terra Firma". Photo: Alexander Sargent ( copyright Grazia Capri, TERRA FIRMA 2019) Performers: Amanda Bouza, Kaity Myers, Irene Paci in "Terra Firma". Photo: Alexander Sargent ( copyright Grazia Capri, TERRA FIRMA 2019) This intimate and poetic work takes form as a series of suggestive lighting projections, unique atmospheric music, and intense, unexpected movement creating a space where dreams and desire unfold across a spectrum of emotions. ( copyright Grazia Capri, TERRA FIRMA 2019) what PRESS said about my work - More performance art than dance, this is a remarkable work that masterfully manipulates the audience�s perception of the body - By Rachel Donnelly - Festival Journal UK. - Capri challenges preconceptions of comfortable viewing by creating awkward angles in her body and staring out at her audience - By Lucinda Al-Zoghbi - Three Weeks UK. click here to contact Grazia Capri Challenges The goal of this campaign is to support the production costs of my new piece coming in the Fall of 2019. The full production preview of TERRA FIRMA will be performed on June 23rd, 2019 at the Dixon Place Theater. Buy your ticket here: http://dixonplace.org/performances/terra-firma-6-23-019/ Your support is crucial to allow us to fully produce this show. Our goal for this campaign is $10,000. Your donations will go directly toward covering the show�s basic costs: Payment of the Company of three dancers Payment of my collaborators for the music composition, live music improvisation, light design, costumes, and video projection Payment to the filmmaker who will videotape the complete performance and some of the rehearsal work. The final cost of the production is $25,000 with other costs paid by pending sponsors and ticket sales. We need your contributions to finalize this production! EVERY CONTRIBUTION IS EXTREMELY APPRECIATED! THANKS TO MY COMPANY AND ALL THE TALENTED COLLABORATORS FOR THEIR WORK AND ENTHUSIASM! YOUR CONTRIBUTION IS GOING TO SUPPORT THEM. - DANCERS Amanda Bouza is a native of Miami, FL where she began her dance training at South Florida Ballet. She attended the nationally recognized high school New World School of the Arts and holds a Bachelors in Fine Arts from The Juilliard School in New York City. Amanda has danced nationally and internationally in the works of choreographers, Anne Teresa De Keersmaeker, Gustavo Ramirez, Pam Tanowitz, and Crystal Pite. Her profound interest in educational outreach led her to become the spearhead of Creative Borders, an arts outreach initiative in Gaborone, Botswana that aims to serve underprivileged communities through dance, music, and drama. Amanda is excited to continue her artistic growth with Grazia Capri Dance Company in 2019. Kaity Mayers, a Colorado native, recently graduated from Virginia Commonwealth University in May 2018, where she performed in works by Dr. Gaynell Sherrod, Melanie Richards, Eric Rivera, and several student works. In the spring of 2017, Kaity studied abroad in Paris, France with world renowned choreographers such as Nathalie Pubellier, Heidi Weiss, Maurice Causey, Nadine Beaulieu, Wanjiru Kamuyu, Kevin Quinaou, Julien Desplantez, Jenny Sandler, Clint Lutes, and Michael Foley. Kaity has performed in a MinEvent by Merce Cunningham at ADF 2017 staged by Andrea Weber as well as Homecoming choreographed by Jelani Taylor and Christine Wyatt in June of 2018. She recently finished her 200 Hour Yoga Alliance certification with Samadhi Yoga in Denver, CO and now lives in Manhattan. NY continuing her endeavors as a professional dancer. Irene Paci, was born in Pistoia, (Italy) and received her early dance training at AXE Dance School and Ballet (Italy), and at Institut de Formation Professionelle de Dance Jazz Rick Odums (Paris). In 2015 Irene moved to NYC and furthered her training at The Ailey School, where she graduated in the Certificate Program. She broadened her training by participating in programs and intensives such as Nederlands Dans Theater Summer Intensive, San Francisco Conservatory of Dance Forsythe Improvisational Techniques Program, Henny Jurri�ns Stichting Amsterdam Summer Intensive, and Les �t�s de la Danse Paris Festival. While in the US, Irene has performed works by artists such as Darshan Bhuller, Alessio Silvestrin, Alex Ketley, Alvin Ailey, Earl Mosley, Brice Mousset, Darrell Moultrie, Amy Hall - MUSIC Stefano Cavazzini is a drummer and percussionist and composer graduated at the American School of Modern Music in Paris He perfected in analysis and composition with the American composer Eugene Kurtz and began to take an interest in electro-acoustic music. Since then, he has regularly composed music for theater and dance, sound installations for exhibitions and film music. Stefano recently composed for: the Renzo Piano's exhibition, at the Royal Academy of Arts in London, the documentary "Sabotatori" by Nico Guidetti and Matthias Durchfeld (Italy), "Corpi in Vertigine" and "Corpi in Vertigine # 2" for the Grazia Capri Company, NY. As a performer, he is called to perform in different contexts ranging from early music to contemporary creations. Martin Nevin is a New York City based composer and bassist. He has worked with notable artists such as Albert �Tootie� Heath, Greg Osby, Ethan Iverson, and Aaron Parks, in venues across the U.S and abroad. Martin leads his own quintet whose debut album, Tenderness is Silent, was released in 2018. He is a 2017 recipient of the Jerome Fund for New Music, awarded by the American Composers Forum. He holds a bachelor�s degree from Manhattan School of Music and a master's degree from Columbia University. - DESIGN Xiaoyue Sherry Liu is a designer and 3D artist based in New York City. She has experience working on a wide range of creative projects including graphic design, packaging, illustration, and motion graphics. She is currently focusing on animation and exploring new media technology. She was born in mainland China and moved to New York at the age of 18. She received her Bachelor of Fine Arts degree in Communications Design from Pratt Institute, Brooklyn, and Master of Fine Arts degree in Computer Arts from School of Visual Arts, New York. Annie Xiang is a digital visual designer/artist, whose works vary from motion graphics, visual communication design, animation to illustration and installation. Her main focus is on interactive art like creative programming and projection mapping. Through discovering multiple mediums, her works link the �unreal� media world to the reality and question the viewer to rethink the boundary of these two. Mokshini Gobin is a lighting designer based in Brooklyn, NY. She is a recent graduate from SUNY Purchase College. Selected credits include Earthquakes in London (LD), and The Brothers Size (LD). She also designed the lights for many of the 2019 BFA Dance majors, which lead her to her love for dance lighting. Photo credit: Alexander Sargent The project TERRA FIRMA are protected by copyright. Today We Reinvents the FPV Drones ZinkyUFO are the world 1st Mixed Reality & FPV Drone. ZinkyUFO is the a smart aircraft that truly allows you to feel the gift of flight and the feeling of being tiny with Mixed Reality Experience. A small apartment becomes a vast terrain worthy of taming. Control the ZinkyUFO flying like superman to hunt down monsters in your room with lots of FUN How to Play ZinkyUFO The first drone of its kind, ZinkyUFO brings your perspective down to a smaller range of size through our Non Latency Video with mixed reality interface. you can fly like Superman across your ceiling or race a band of aliens across the constellation made up of the four corners in your kitchen. ZinkyUFO puts you into the pilot's seat, making drone racing into a more personal and more immediate experience than it has ever been before. Reason we start ZinkyUFO Project We are working for FPV drone racing for 5 years, we love FPV because its cool and make you addicted to it, when you flying you can have out of body experience like superman, but flying FPV drones are not easy for beginners, the whole set equipment are include FPV drones, remote controller, FPV google or screens, cost about 1000-2000USD, and require lots time to practice and repair, and need the empty place to practice, the speed are unto 100KM/H, so sometime can be dangerous. that's why not many people are taste the fun of FPV flying. we decide to making the Ready To Fly FPV drone set under 200USD, must be safe, easy to control, tough, link with phone with real time, and easy to record and share the videos, we use the Racing drone 48-channel 5.8G FPV system on ZinkyUFO and link with phone without latency, plus Mixed Reality technology it bring this experience into another levels with flying colors. What is FPV? First Person View Drone racing puts you in control of a drone at a high speed: pilots get an out of body experience, and you will feels like a superhuman when you fly in FPV. The video relays in real-time, and features include WiFi, FPV VS, and 5.8GHz FPV, making this solution both high-quality and affordable. You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00 WiFi FPV VS Digital FPV VS 5.8GHz FPV WiFi FPV: Very affordable, but suffers from lag Digital FPV: Very expensive but video image are HD, once lost signal will blue screen 5.8GHz FPV: Best of the three. Used in hobby and professional grade RC drones racing using 5.8G FPV with FPV Goggle/Monitor For more information please click: 5.8G FPV VS WIFI FPV What is Mixed Reality? Mixed reality (MR) merges the real and virtual worlds to produce new environments and visualizations where physical and digital objects co-exist and interact in real time. Mixed reality takes place not only in the physical world or the virtual world, but is a mix of reality and virtual reality. You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00 The Video Latency Test: ZinkyUFO VS DJI ZinkyUFO 5.8G Video to the Phone delay best results are only 0:00.00.10 10MS DJI's Digital Video Transmitter to the Phone delay best results are 0:00.00.30 30MS You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00 Mixed Reality � The World First MR Drone We had most difficulty for adding the Mixed Reality into the game, as there are no engines support for Drone Cameras videos link yet, we study that drones related with AR in the market, eg, AR DRONE and Drone Prix for DJI, none of this APP are developed based on AR engines. Situated at the crossroads between our world and the virtual world, mixed reality is an advanced tech concept that involves generating new environments based on the environment that you already exist it. This is not quite virtual reality, but as you will see once you are inside ZinkyUFO, it is not quite our world either. Rather, it is a thrilling and completely unique mix of the two. ZinkyUFO � We Have Liftoff play with friends ZinkyUFO is capable of auto-hovering, and it runs on a powerful, heavy-duty, 65000RPM motor. Operating on a 230Mah battery, it can remain in flight for a full six minutes, and the cockroach frame and protective structure ensure durability. There are two different speed levels, a headless mode, and a low-voltage alarm, and right out of the box, ZinkyUFO is ready to cruise. The shrouded propellers make it safe to fly anywhere, even around kids and pets, and you can fly it anywhere drones are permitted (under 250g, lighter than what the FAA classifies as a drone). Simple Controls & Tough Design You shouldn't even need to think about crashing, though, because ZinkyUFO's controls are simple, intuitive, and easy to pick up. Spend just 5 minutes with ZinkyUFO and you will be zipping around in it in no time � hovering, flipping, spinning, looping, and of course, landing! Toggle the lights off and on and get started (and get home) with a single key-press. It's just that simple. Crashes may happen, but ZinkyUFO won't break: the flexible, tough cockroach Frame that make up ZinkyUFO's outer shell mean that you can bring it to the ground again and again without nary a worry. ZinkyUFO � it may be tiny, but it's ultra-tough! ZinkyUFO-Game of Drones APP ZinkyUFO-Game of Drones is the mixed reality game APP that we have developed alongside ZinkyUFO, and it works with both iOS and Android devices. You can access a large world of characters, landscapes, cockpits, and content in Game of Drones, even using one of our special ZinkyUFO stickers to place a monster somewhere in the game (just by placing the sticker somewhere in the real world ). We spent nearly 29 month and made more than 30 different hardware solution in order to enable the iOS device to receive the 5.8GHz Analog video without delay at a reasonable cost: this was key issue because iOS requires their own MFI certify Chips to control the external information into the system. When we undertook development on the mixed reality tech and the ZinkyUFO-Game of Drones app in March 2017, our goal was to create the world's first MR flying camera. We have drawn inspiration from some of our favorite 80s and 90s video games, especially Pacman, and all of us on the FPVSTYLE team (hailing from locations on multiple continents!) are excited to launch ZinkyUFO worldwide. What We Need & What You Get After nearly thirteen months of development and more than thirty different hardware solutions, we are finally ready to launch ZinkyUFO to the consumer market. Our goal through this campaign is $10,000, which will cover the costs of manufacturing, marketing, and distributing ZinkyUFO on a large scale and moving beyond the fifty sets we have manufactured thus far. To say thanks to all our contributors, we are offering some exclusive, limited-time-only rewards, including discounts on ZinkyUFO. Risks & Challenges One of biggest difficulties we have faced is in figuring out how to avoid the MFI-certified chips that iOS requires. That, however, is done, and we are now moving into the production stage. We will soon offer an API for developers, building a stronger sense of community around ZinkyUFO. If any other challenges arise, we will be sure to keep all our contributors in the loop, remaining transparent throughout this process. Other Ways You Can Help Beyond making a monetary contribution to this campaign, you can show your support for ZinkyUFO and the FPVSTYLE team by sharing a link to this campaign on any social media platforms you use. Get the word out about what we are doing and what we aim to offer with this innovative product! Know someone who is into mixed reality or virtual reality? Let them know what we are up to. Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter are all excellent avenues for spreading news of ZinkyUFO. We appreciate all your support, both monetary and non-monetary, and we thank you for your time.

Bringing a childhood dream to life... Hi there! Thank you so much for checking my project out! I've always had a love of doodling random things here and there ever since I was a child in elementary school. I used to read the comics section of the newspaper religiously every day my mom would get the paper! I always used to try my best to doodle or draw some of the characters I'd see like Garfield, Snoopy, Dagwood etc. I dell in love with comic strips in general. Fast forward to my awkward middle school years...I was a social outcast with a very small group of friends and we would get into some interesting situations. The idea of my comic strip, We Are The Bored, was spawned from my love of comic strips and doodling to my dream of becoming a cartoonist someday and my misadventures with my friends and awkward teen years. I know the idea of a comic strip based on one's personal life isn't exactly the most original idea out there, but it's something I've always wanted to do and keep alive. My goal is to get back into my long lost passion of drawing my strip and creating more adventures for my characters and to give them a fresh start! The funds gathered from you is completely going towards getting a tablet and drawing tool so that I can make my comic digital and bring it to you guys! I unfortunately cannot raise the funds on my own and I truly want to pursue my childhood dream and with your help I can see this become a reality! Every little bit helps and I'm thanking you in advance for any and all help you can give!

The Douglas MacLean Double-Feature DVD Project This Kickstarter will fund a project that brings 2 rare Douglas MacLean silent comedy features to DVD: One a Minute (1921) and Bell Boy 13 (1923). The films that will be on the DVD will be seen in new 2K digital scans of archival materials preserved by the Library of Congress, and will be scanned by the Library of Congress' lab. I will create a brand new custom musical score for each film. One a Minute (1921) survives in an excellent 35mm print and Bell Boy 13 survives in a very good 16mm; these are the only prints of these films on the planet. The DVD box art will be created by professional graphic designer and silent era aficionado Marlene Weisman. The DVDs will be professionally authored and they will be made available for sale online as MOD (manufacture-on-demand) discs The finished DVD will be available via outlets like Amazon.com, TCM Shop, DeepDiscount and more, as well as international online retailers. The release will be publicized and reviewed. The DVD will be NTSC format, and will be region �0� (region-free). This is the same workflow as I have been doing successfully for all 21 of my DVD releases. This Kickstarter covers all costs for the DVD's production and release, as well as of the making of and shipping of backer DVDs. Kickstarter backers will get their copies of the DVD before it becomes available to the general public. Release date (expected): Based on my current performance schedule for summer 2019, the time it takes for scoring and authoring, and the wild-card factor that unexpected things will just come up, I expect to be able to have the DVD finished for you by the end of December 2019, and for a February 2020 release. Be "somebody"� We've all heard of great silent films having been preserved at a film archive and thought, "wouldn't it be great if somebody put that out on DVD?". Here's a chance for you to be part of that "somebody"! Make your pledge to "The Douglas MacLean Double-Feature DVD Project"�and participate in a unique silent film enterprise. A bit about Douglas MacLean Douglas MacLean starred in 23 feature-length light comedies from 1919 to 1927, and his screen persona was that of a middle-class young man making his way in the world and going on wacky adventures. It was a type of film Douglas Fairbanks pioneered and made from 1915-1920 until he switch to swashbucklers when he made The Mark of Zorro. MacLean essentially picked up the genre where Douglas Fairbanks left off. He made two or three features a year and was one of the comedians you went to see while you were waiting for Buster or Harold to come out with a new picture. Nearly all of MacLean's features are either lost, overseas, or missing reels or are fragments, but these two are 100% complete and have been preserved by the Library of Congress. A bit about me I've been accompanying silent movies on piano and organ for 38 years; I play for silents at MoMA, at the Library of Congress, at the Silent Clowns Film Series (which I also produce) in NYC, and at festivals, historic theatres and at schools and universities throughout the US and internationally. I've scored dozens of silent films for DVD release for companies like KinoLorber, Milestone, ReelclassicDVD and Thanhouser and for air on TCM. Over the last 6 years, I've produced and distributed 21 DVDs of rare silent films � great silent films you've never heard of�but should � fan-funded via Kickstarter. The films have been sourced either from collectors or from the Library of Congress, whom I have a co-branding arrangement with. My website is silentfilmmusic.com, and my complete line of DVDs can be seen at Undercrank Productions. My other Kickstarter campaigns: Read about my previous 7 successful Kickstarter-crowdfunded DVDs at: Accidentally Preserved: volume 1 & 2 The Mishaps of Musty Suffer The Marcel Perez Collection (2015 award-winner) Accidentally Preserved: volume 3 When Knighthood Was In Flower starring Marion Davies The Marcel Perez Collection: Volume 2 The Alice Howell Collection

Venture Mechanical Keyboard on a Wooden Desk Full-size layout in a low profile form factor 4-device Bluetooth Low Energy (4.x+ LE compatible) memory Advanced per-key RGB lighting and light ring Battery life: 4 weeks without RGB (2-3 hours per day), up to 16 hours with per-key RGB Future-proof USB C port for wired mode and charging Accessories: Mac keycaps and Mac mode included, carrying case stretch goal ($200k) 6-key rollover (anti-ghosting) in BT mode, NKRO / 1000 Hz polling when wired Dimensions & weight: 17" x 5.5" x 1" � 1.57 lb. Presenting the Venture Mechanical Keyboard Please send all questions to info@hexgears.org � this allows us to have conversations in a shared US support system. Inquiries on Kickstarter will be directed there as well. When the campaign closes, backers will be emailed a voucher code to redeem at Kono Store (our US partner). You must use your voucher on Kono to claim your reward. Black and Grey Venture Mechanical Keyboard Options Wireless keyboards let you choose your input experience. Want to game on the couch? Sure, and you can control compatible home theater devices while you�re there. Need to set up a presentation away from your desk? No problem � just unplug the keyboard and take it along. Wired devices (we launched a few this year) are useful for immobile work and stationary gaming, but you can�t beat wireless flexibility. USB C Port on the Venture Wireless Mechanical Keyboard Keyboard switches directly affect your keyboarding performance and comfort. Mechanical switches, which have discrete metal contacts and springs, are better than mushy rubber domes in a few vital ways. Mechanical durability is remarkable; Venture�s Kailh Choc switches are rated for 70 million presses. While you can rest assured that your switches will stand the test of time, there�s something more important to consider. Kailh Choc Switches Personalization is the key to your satisfaction as a typist or gamer, and mechanical keyboards deliver it. Three different switch options are available in the Venture � linear (red), tactile (brown), and tactile clicky (white, retooled). Each imparts a unique fingertip sensation, or form of tactile feedback, and doesn�t need to be bottomed out to activate. This results in slightly faster input, which is good for gaming. Regular rubber domes are squishy, unsatisfying, and almost always force you to press all the way down. View Venture�s features (below) to learn more and make a Choc switch selection. Most wireless keyboards are compromised by poor design choices. Some optimize for battery life at the expense of key feel and features. Others alter keys to save space, creating an unfamiliar layout, or use a custom dongle that is incompatible with a range of devices. In rare cases, those trade-offs are worthwhile. Most of the time they�re not. Nonstandard key sizes and other quirks can slow people down. Most companies fail to recognize that some of us want a familiar layout, which hurts the entire tech ecosystem. We created the 108-key Venture to avoid those pitfalls and innovate. Touching the Venture Wireless Mechanical Keyboard The Hexgears X-1 marked our debut in the US; it was also Hexgears� first Kickstarter. Amazing backers and helpful reviewers pointed out potential changes. Some of the ideas weren�t right for the X-1, which we envisioned as an ultra-portable keyboard. The concept worked well as it was � an X-1 even went to the South Pole on a research expedition. X-1 Mechanical Keyboard at the South Pole Most of those suggestions found a new home in the Venture. Mac keycaps were requested, and they'll be included with every Venture in the final production keyset. Larger batteries, sculpted keycaps, and new RGB features (like a light ring) were added. Wireless subsystem updates and other tweaks are also complete. Even the manual will be improved vs. the X-1. Read about Venture�s compelling features below. Included Keycap Set with Mac Keycaps - Venture Mechanical Keyboard Venture can remember 4 paired devices and switch between them in a couple of seconds � phones, laptops, and more are fair game. This is convenient if you multitask with different devices, as you won�t need multiple keyboards. Venture�s carefully tuned Bluetooth Low Energy chip saves power, offers wide compatibility, and responds quickly while gaming. It operates at the fastest possible polling rate for high performance low latency input. Multi-Device Bluetooth on the Venture Mechanical Keyboard Dual 2000 mAh rechargeable cells are included with the keyboard (for a total of 4000 mAh). That�s a lot of power � more than most smartphones. With RGB lighting disabled, the keyboard lasts 4 weeks with 2-3 hours of use per day. That runtime can even be extended. Venture�s batteries are user-replaceable via a compartment on the back of the keyboard. You can swap in standard AA cells or compatible rechargeable units. This increases endurance on the go and allows you to replace batteries if they degrade. Venture Mechanical Keyboard with Full RGB Lighting The Venture includes per-key RGB lighting, which is configured onboard. This ensures functionality with all keyboard-compatible Bluetooth LE devices. It�s also the first wireless keyboard with an RGB light ring. Numerous animations for the keys and light ring are built in. Battery life varies based on brightness, light settings, and use. We estimate up to 16 hours with the stock rainbow wave pattern. If the light ring is enabled with per-key lighting, that estimate changes to 7 hours � a full day of work or gaming. Three Choc switch options are available in the Venture. You must select a switch on Kono Store after the campaign closes (see Important Information above for details). Choosing a switch can be tough, so we're including some descriptions and raw data to help. Choc Brown: gentle, smooth tactile switch (quiet, general purpose) Choc Red: easy to press linear switch (quietest, great for gaming) Choc White: sharp sounding clicky switch with amazing tactility (loudest, retooled) Kaihua Choc Brown Mechanical Switch Force Curve Kaihua Choc Red Mechanical Switch Force Curve Kaihua Choc White Mechanical Switch Force Curve If that jargon doesn't make sense, or you need more details, read the following: Brown / tactile switches have a tangible �bump� when pressed, but no click. They�re a familiar option for typists and gamers � most keyboards are tactile. Red / linear switches don�t have a tactile bump or a click. That can be advantageous if you prefer uninhibited keypresses and extra smoothness during a press. White / clicky switches make sharp clicking noises. They also have a delightful tactile bump. Check with your coworkers, or family, before introducing a clicky keyboard. These were retooled for better performance in the X-1 campaign. They�re gloriously loud! The Venture's upper case is machine-finished aluminum, which is carefully textured and anodized for color. Its lower shell is durable injection molded plastic. This ensures solid Bluetooth signal penetration and reduces lower case wear. Machined Aluminum Case on the Venture Wireless Mechanical Keyboard We're including Mac keycaps for the bottom row � this is paired with a firmware Mac mode that swaps the modifier keys. Those were the most requested add-ons during the X-1 project. Other accessories may be finalized as we hit or add stretch goals. A carrying case will be included at $200,000 � but we're open to more ideas. If you have a cool suggestion contact our US support system via info@hexgears.org. Hexgears builds high quality equipment for elite gamers and disciplined workers. Gaming is a lifestyle, so each of our products is developed based on feedback from eSports players and keyboarding experts. Peak performance and ultimate control are our calling cards. We're here to help you dominate at the perfect price. Don�t lose a match because you have a cheap peripheral, and don�t get cheated by branding. The difference between victory and defeat can be a split-second. Play faster, longer, and better with Hexgears. Find Us On Social Media Hexgears Media Coverage Additional Backer Information We intend to provide updates every other week, even if there isn't major news, based on feedback from our last campaign. When the campaign closes, voucher codes and instructions will be sent to supporters via their Kickstarter email. This will be announced in an update. We ask that you check your spam and promotions folders if you don't see your code after they're sent. Once you have your voucher, please configure your Venture on Kono Store and check out. You must use your voucher on Kono to receive a Venture.

In addition, a portion of proceeds beyond our goal will benefit Inroads to Opportunity, (Providing a social outlet, family support and employment options to adults and teens with disabilities)! Sincerely, Joshua Van Ness Joshua Van Ness official web site
