The Neal Anderson Quintet is a five-piece modern jazz group that performs all-original music. We link together our compositions with improvisations to create a unique and seamless performance at each of our shows. We recorded our first album, "Parallel Fifths," in 2015 (listen here: https://nealandersonquintet.bandcamp.com/releases). Since then, we've been experimenting with and developing our performance concept with new compositions. We're ready to share these new compositions with the world - or even the galaxy - in the form of a new EP! I'm thrilled to have Molly Jones (saxophone), Nathan Flanders (keyboards), Jon Hammonds (bass), and Cory Tripathy (drums) bringing their creativity and virtuosity to the music on this album. Our new compositions are inspired by the idea that the music should dictate the form, instead of the form dictating the music. Each member of the band has the agency to dictate where a performance will go next. Intertwined with an exploration of melody and groove in odd meters and phrase lengths, I think you'll find our music bothy catchy and refreshingly unexpected. We recorded videos for two of our songs last year - one for the NPR tiny desk contest (watch here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=P6VRVhV_aiA), and one in a public access TV studio (watch here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=F8RMStXFtio). In order to make a high fidelity recording of our music and properly compensate everyone working on the album, we need your support! Between studio time, compensating the musicians, and producing the CDs, I expect the total cost of this project to total $3,500. We've scheduled studio time in May and will be mixing, mastering, and pressing this EP over the summer. With your help, we hope to share this music with you the end of the year!

Who are we? Hi, we're Y-Studs A Cappella! We're an all-male Jewish a cappella group, originally from Yeshiva University. We started as a club in 2010, and have since grown beyond the collegiate level to the professional stage. You may have seen us in one of our many music videos, like our viral hit Evolution of Jewish Music, and our dynamic covers of Hashem Melech and La La Passover that have garnered over 6 million views across social media. Before anything else, we�re a group of college students and young professionals who love making music together. We pride ourselves on both our energy and our depth and are therefore extremely deliberate about the music we choose for our repertoire, ensuring every song has both uniquely Jewish undertones as well as a universally resonant message. We are blessed to be able to share our music with the world and influence so many in the process. Our love for singing, combined with a sincere belief in the power of song, yields our unique ability to connect with and inspire the audiences we sing for. We are fortunate to have entertained audiences across the globe, embarking on multiple European tours and singing at countless concerts, bar mitzvahs, charitable functions, and more. If you�d like to learn more about us, you can check out our Instagram and Facebook pages, or our website at YStuds.com. We love connecting with our fans, answering their questions, and hearing their ideas! We need your help We are on the cusp of releasing our next full-length album! We�ve selected an eclectic repertoire of covers - everything from Michael Buble's Feeling Good, to Meilech Kohn's VeUhavtu, and so much more! Recording an album is very expensive, and to give you the best product possible, we need YOUR help! As a thank you for your donations, we�ve assembled an extensive list of rewards�everything from autographed CDs to a night out with some of your favorite Y-Studs! But most importantly... Pick the Final Song on our Album! That�s right! With just a $5 contribution you get to decide which song you want us to cover on the album! We are so excited to give this powerful influence to our devoted fans. Who better to make this decision than you? You�ve listened to our voices for so long, now allow us to listen to yours! Looking forward to making incredible music together, Y-Studs A Cappella Check out some of our recent music videos:

Whether your adventure is a walk through a city park, or a trek to the top of a mountain, adventuring with dogs comes with its own set of needs. Currently, that involves grabbing LOTS of little pouches and packs. And if you're anything like us, that takes a lot of time. And somehow your phone is still out of reach, your sunglasses still get lost, and you're still asking a friend to dig for your keys. Enter MuttRuk With miles of trails under our feet and paws, we felt there had to be a better solution for getting outdoors with all that you and your dog need. Imagine grabbing just ONE pack with a place for both your gear as well as your dogs. Easily accessible pockets for treats, waste bags, even those stinky little used waste bags, water, sunglasses, keys, phone and more. Yea, we thought that sounded pretty great too. So we started drafting and designing and prototyping and trail testing. And We Think You're Going to Love this Solution You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00 photos by @explorewithmedia unless otherwise mentioned photo by @kali.collie photo by @aspenthepyrador Waist Straps that Work Right at your fingertips, the Phoenix 14 waist straps get to work for your dog providing accessible pockets with washable, zip-out liners, perfect for housing treats or even a used waste bag. An integrated waste bag dispenser ensures they are never forgotten, and a quick-connect leash loop provides the perfect solution for short hands-free needs. Shoulder Straps You Need Right up front, the Phoenix 14 shoulder straps get to work for you providing four (4) integrated, microfiber lined, zipper pockets. Keep things like your sunglasses, a large phone, a small leash, tools for safety, keys, ID and more within seconds reach without needing to stop to unpack. Low-Profile and Stylish The Phoenix 14 offers 14 liters of pack space in a comfortable and stylish low-profile design. It can house plenty of water with a water bladder compatible port and sleeve in addition to durable, oversized exterior pockets that fit a real water bottle. We're talking those 40oz lugs. Go ahead and bring them so you and your dog will never go thirsty. You and Your Dog Deserve to #takeamuttruk A lifetime of outdoor adventure and years of backpack exploration have led to the prototyping and final design of this pack. Now, our next goal is to make this pack available to all of you. And we felt Kickstarter was the perfect place to do it. By using Kickstarter and receiving your help, we can bring this pack to all of you with both quality construction and at an affordable price. As a Kickstarter backer, you'll have exclusive access to our debut discount price before this product hits stores at a higher retail price. You'll also have some other cool rewards to consider! Check them out below. REWARDS To say thanks for being a Backer, we've got some awesome extras for you. photo by @myadventuretails photo by @myadventuretails photo by @jade.n.bowie photo by @june_and_todd photo by @jade.n.bowie photo by @kodi_thecoloradopup photo by @aspenthepyrador YOUR SHARING HELPS! The Little Details Lifetime Guarantee We stand by the construction and design of our products. If for any reason there is a manufacturers defect that causes deterioration, please contact us directly. We will either get a brand new product sent out, or will offer a full refund. Return Policy We've tested the Phoenix 14 and our products through and through; on many different backs and in many different environments. This pack is tough, it's comfortable, and it will be more than you imagine. If for any reason you are not satisfied, simply send the pack back to us within 30 days for a full refund. Shipping If our shipping carrier attempts delivery and is unable to deliver due to wrong address or change of address without notifying us, it will be the buyer's responsibility to pay the shipping fee to reship the order. When you receive your tracking number, keep an eye out! International Shipping Unfortunately, there is no legal way around customs. MuttRuk cannot mark our products as gifts. Pricing does not include VAT, CST or other country taxes. This means that the buyer is responsible for shipping and any duty or taxes that may be incurred. You may use this tool to assist you in calculating duties. Remember to convert the U.S. dollars to your local currency: https://www.simplyduty.com/import-calculator/ Typically, your local customs authorities will contact you asking for payment to have your order processed through customs. Once you make that payment to the customs broker your order will be processed for final delivery.

Mishka's seventh full length studio album: "This Love" Hi, welcome to my Kickstarter campaign. I�m so glad you�re here to join me in the making of my 7th full length studio album, This Love. The writing and recording of This Love has led me to a deeper engagement with myself and with my singer/songwriter roots: Through this process has come a full, fresh immersion in the authentic feel of the music - both for me playing the songs, and for you, my listeners and friends. You�ll hear lyric driven melodies backed by raw acoustic guitar and sparse but focused studio instrumentation and sound. This album is an intimate meditation on life, destiny, loss, forgiveness, renewal. Above all, it�s a celebration of love. The release of This Love will also mark the 20 year anniversary of my 1999 debut album. And the sound of this new album is reminiscent of that first album in the acoustic nature of the songs. So, it truly is a reflection on all the years gone by: of living, of loving becoming a father and a husband traveling the world meeting the most amazing people everywhere that the music has taken me, making friends and playing with great musicians There have been a few sad goodbyes along the way but essentially it has been a journey of adventure and gratitude. At the heart of it, I�m still A Guy With a Guitar and I am still here singing these songs for you. I am so grateful to be able to share this inspiration with you. I am pleased to invite you all to be an integral part of the making of This Love. Scroll down below to find lots of different ways in which you can dynamically contribute and support the release of This Love into the world. Thank you for all the support and love over the years. I give you This Love in heartfelt return.

My name is Dan, I began practicing and studying photography 8 years ago and I now feel that I am nearly ready to become a professional photographer. My dream is to be able to travel the world and document that beautiful thing called 'life'. My project is to share the true beauty of our everyday surroundings through photography. One of my new goals is to photograph one item for each letter of the alphabet. I will be traveling to different areas in hopes to locate the perfect items for my photos! The items I will be looking for are: A-alligator, B-bird, C-candy, D-stack of dominos, E-elephant, F-full moon, G-grass, H-Hay, I-ice skating, J-jack rabbit. K-kangaroo. L-lamb, M-monkey, N-nail polish, O-orange, P-paper crane, Q-quote, R-rose, S-swan, T-turtle, U-umbrella, V-vine, W-water, X-xenons, Y-yoke, Z-zebra. Other Ways You Can Help If you can't contribute that's ok, just share this campaign with your friends and family on facebook, twitter, using a messenger pigeon, making smoke signals or in anyway you can! I will be eternally grateful for your support! Love, cheers and many thanks to everyone!

First development stage. (Icons and logos could change during the developing process) "EVLO" will be a community site with a synchronized app like the most popular social networks, designed exclusively for People with disabilities or any physical conditions. One of our friends that has a birth disability has expressed to us how hard is for him to make new friends, or even more difficult to find a life partner. This encourage us to do something about people going through similar circumstances. There are way to many dating, social network Web Pages and Apps, but almost non dedicated to people with disabilities. We hope to reach as many disabled people as possible and give them the opportunity to make new friends and find love. "EVLO" will allow users to create a profile, upload pictures, tell other users about themselves, what are their likes, what are their disabilities, and chat with other users. They will be able to browse profiles by filtering what others like, their age, disability etc, to facilitate matching with the right person. Will also have location option to see where your friends are, and user blocking options as well. some of this options will have enable and disable buttons. Andres M (Project Leader) https://evlo.tk

UPDATE: I've updated the video and cover image! The book now has a name: "The Peculiar Adventures of Abigail Grimm" and here's a mockup of the cover (it'll be an imitation leather sketchbook cover with this image burned/etched into it). A Sketchbook Journal is a journal one would bring with them out and about in the world, taking notes and drawing (or painting) the sights and events along the way.I've been keeping a sketchbook journal for years and it's wonderful to look back on memories with both written word and illustrations made on the spot. I often bring watercolor and inks to properly capture the moment when I travel. Rather than publish a collections of my personal memories, I took paintings from my trips out to one particular place (Paramount Ranch) and crafted a fictional GHOST STORY around it.I wanted to both share my art, while engaging readers with a unique story that ties all of the illustrations together into a fun and endearing tale. You get a replica of my sketchbook journal. Complete with imitation leather cover, watercolor paper, and fully illustrated watercolored pages. The book will be 8.5x5.5 inches and there will be 36 pages of thick watercolor paper with full illustrations. I have 90 paintings compiled in this book and all of them will be available to own! I will do my best to let each back in this tier pick their favorite piece in order of when they backed this reward tier. These are the ORIGINAL WATERCOLOR PAINTINGS I made on location and scanned in for this book. See below for samples of some of the paintings take from my sketchbook. Absolutely! Here's the first 3 pages. The author/storyteller will be a woman in her mid 20's.

Building out the next phase of the Wild Mile: a mile-long, floating eco-park in the Chicago River, with educational programming for Chicago students as a top priority. Your pledge will connect your name to the next century of Chicago history and inspire urban river innovation around the world! Aerial view of the future Wild Mile, indicated by the dotted white lines. What Your Donations Will Fund: The Wild Mile will include the entirety of the Goose Island canal, as well as the Army Corps turning basin at the north end of the canal. The foundation of the Wild Mile has been laid thanks to our previous kickstarter efforts, all of the stakeholders from the Wild Mile Framework plan, and our volunteers. Now, with your help today, we will launch the first phase of the Wild Mile plan, in earnest. When we hit our goal of $25,000 we'll be able to add 500 sq. ft of additional habitat into the Wild Mile and sponsor 60+ student's field trips to the Wild Mile (all expenses paid) so they can learn about river ecology, the importance of additional habitat and personally be part of installing gardens into the Wild Mile. Our team has permits ready to put your support to work immediately! However, our work doesn't stop there, if we raise: A GIF showing the growth of the gardens as donations grow! $50,000 Install 1,000 sq ft of additional habitat 120+ student kayak field trips (all expenses paid) Begin building the Floating Forest $100,000 Install 2,000 sq ft of additional habitat 240+ student kayak field trips (all expenses paid) Expand our floating gardens $150,000 Install 3,000 sq ft of additional habitat and 360+ student kayak field trips (all expenses paid) Expand our floating walkways $200,000 Install 5,000 sq ft of additional habitat 600+ student kayak field trips (all expenses paid) Finish the Floating Forest Make the Wild Mile the coolest floating park in the world! The Wild Mile North Reach (Render) Credit: SOM During this Phase, we will: Expand the artificial riverbanks and wetland habitat for native plant species and wildlife with our existing permits (Waste Management, Whole Foods Market and REI property line on Goose Island). Begin to bring students from across Chicago to the Wild Mile. Start creating the first Floating Forest in the Chicago River. Test and evaluate the efficacy of mussel habitats, floating tree platforms, benthic macroinvertebrate pallets, and supplemental aeration systems, among many other river restoration strategies to determine which conservation actions yield the greatest benefit to the river ecosystem and provide benefit to a wider range of wildlife. Our goal is to install all additional gardens and execute all of our student school trips for the 2020 river season which is approximately June 2020. Our team needs to plan out the designs, put orders in for plants and coordinate with schools in advance. If student led trips are sooner, we will communicate with all backers. Dr. Phil Willink Looking at Plant Growth The Wild Mile Is For The People The Wild Mile is designed to be accessible to anyone who wants to escape from the city into a natural sanctuary, surrounded by native plants, wildlife and the river. It is free to visit and enjoy, and provides ample opportunity for schools and community organizations to use the Wild Mile as a unique ecological resource in their own backyard. Additionally, educational programming will be layered onto the park with programs from young learners to graduate researchers to adult volunteers�many of these programs are already running. Urban Rivers Co-Founder Nick Wesley showing off some Wild Mile designs Ready to go The Wild Mile is fully designed and the next phase is fully permitted. The only obstacle remaining is raising the proper funds to fully implement the vision. Our Timeline So Far First pilot module - Our true genesis was in 2014, with the experiment designed by co-founder Josh Yellin. His experiment looked to determine if a small artificial wetland platform could attract more fish than other man made structures in a stretch of the river that was starved for natural habitat. This experiment demonstrated significant potential; fish were twice as abundant directly adjacent to the pilot platform than any other observed location in the canal and native species were witnessed spawning around the module, which proved that it was more than just an attractant but also supported growing wildlife populations. Building on this success, in 2017, we turned to Chicagoan's and the Kickstarter community to help us turn our pilot island into a full-fledged floating wetland. More space for native plants would allow us to properly research the ecological and environmental benefits of these structures in a meaningful way, and provide us with the tools to be able to provide the most value to wildlife. In 2017, funded almost entirely by the Kickstarter community in our first campaign, we raised over $25,000 which helped us install over 1,500 sq ft of floating gardens hosting over 55 native Illinois wetland and prairie plant species. We have been working hard to develop partnerships with community groups, schools, local businesses, and other companies and organizations that realize the value of supporting the larger vision of the Wild Mile. Partnered with the Chicago Department of Planning and Development on creating the Wild Mile Framework plan, which is a vision for how to bring the Wild Mile to life. Why the east side of Goose Island? The east side of Goose Island currently doesn't have any existing commercial barge or boat traffic which opens up the possibility for a recreational park to be installed for the community, by the community. Goose Island is a man made island, created in the 19th century by the excavation of the Goose Island canal by one of the first mayors of Chicago. For over a century, the canal dutifully played its assigned role as expanding industrial access to the Chicago River. In recent decades, the canal, now unused, has fallen into disrepair, and can no longer function as a navigable waterway (east side of Goose Island), and lacks the natural riverbanks to be able to support healthy wildlife populations. Centrally located in a rapidly de-industrializing area of the city, we realized an opportunity to create a wildlife haven where only rusty seawall existed before. Beautiful Shot of Gardens With City in Background Partnerships Over the last five years, we have developed strong, ongoing partnerships with prominent businesses and local organizations. From Patagonia who gave us our first grant, to Kayak Chicago who provides in-kind kayak donations for our volunteers, to Shedd Aquarium and Near North Unity Program who partner with us on educational programming--the Wild Mile is a place for everyone. Partner Organizations Press and Awards The Wild Mile has been featured in dozens of press articles, blog posts and TV segments. Most notably, the Chicago Tribune, Crain�s Chicago Business and WGN. Urban Rivers and the Wild Mile have also won prominent awards, including the 2017 ASLA Honor Award, �The Coolest Thing of 2018� from the Friends of Downtown, �The Silver Ribbon� in 2019 from Friends of the Chicago River. The plan is to continue to build the Wild Mile in phases toward the fulfillment of the community-developed framework plan and guided by the guiding principles. The high-level plan is can be seen here. Skidmore Owings & Merrill designer Rachel Momenee speaking to local kids about the Wild Mile! Team The team that makes up Urban Rivers is a passionate group of ecologists, volunteers, entrepreneurs and public servants with a collective background that spans world-renowned organizations, businesses and institutions, like Microsoft and Google. Collectively, our team has experience in conservation, international environmental projects, biology, entrepreneurship, agriculture, environmental education, and hydroponics. Our values are forged from these experiences and the belief that communities deserve to enjoy nature every day. The core team has a rich understanding of botany, community engagement, and biology. Additionally, our board is comprised of industry leaders and local community managers that have experience in building public spaces and urban design. Some of the Urban Rivers Team @ our Summer Fundraiser

Scooterman The Comic Book Movie Based on the Comic Book �Scooterman� (c) and TM 1993-2019 D.Squire Wells Down and Out �Scott the Mechanic� a popular kids TV host on local Cable loses his successful show due to the towns lack of funds and financial shortfall. Visiting The State Fair the following week he enters a Virtual Reality Game Contest called �Save River City� Prize money is a cool Million. You get to choose a vehicle but when all the Cool Vehicles are chosen already, he is left with only a scooter as a choice. No contestant has ever won on a scooter. Scott being a former Motorcycle racer,Martial Artist and Gun enthusiast is more then up for the challenge.He defies all odds and ends up placing 1st in the Game,winning the $ and donating all the proceeds to his hometown of Brant Rock USA. He is now known as �Scooterman� and is considered a Hero throughout the gaming World.

Howdy! My name is Cass and I independently run a small art and costume company called That One Pink Dog Studios. I've been in the business for years, but I've been creating art since I could first hold a pencil. Enamel Pins have been something I've enjoyed collecting myself, and I've always wanted to make an enamel pin design to share with all of you. Once upon a time, my significant other, Jack, had a video posted of him wearing a cowboy outfit that got too viral for its own good. We all know him as "that one guy that says 'howdy' on Twitter," and I was proud enough of his accomplishments to doodle something silly for him. It turned out a ton of people really liked this ridiculous design, so I thought it'd be fun to make it more than just a silly doodle and bring it to life via enamel pin! These will be gold plated, iron, hard enamel pins that are approximately 1.5" in size. The stickers will be approximately 3" in size. They're weatherproof vinyl stickers, die-cut, and come in two different variations! � With Text � Without Text The funds will be going to the manufacturer, shipping costs, and Kickstarter fees.

Turn your gift exchange into the life of the party with THAT GIFT GAME - the new holiday party game that puts an exciting spin on giving! Play your cards right to get your hands on the perfect present, just don't get too attached - It's not yours to keep...yet! Combine a little bit of strategy with a little bit of luck while playing your cards to get your hands on the perfect present. THAT GIFT GAME puts a creative, fun & social twist on the classic holiday gift exchange tradition. Our story The idea behind this project began as we kicked off the holiday season with dinner and a gift exchange party. We quickly realized that we each had a different way of having played this "white-elephant" type of game in the past with various rules. After that night, we decided we needed a real game that was fun for everyone... one that was as much about the party and having fun together as it was about finding the perfect present to bring! That Gift Game has quickly become one of our favorite holiday traditions and we can't wait for it to become one of yours! A little about us... Hello! We are Brooke and Amanda - Two Arizona moms and business owners with a serious love for parties, games, and (of course) Christmas. We met on our daughters' very first day of kindergarten and as they became fast friends, so did we! With over 15 years of experience working directly with manufacturers, graphic design, marketing and importing, making this leap into the game industry together has allowed us to perfectly combine our skills to create a game that we are so excited to share with you! Project Status That Gift Game is ready for large scale production and we couldn't be more excited to share it with you! Our product research and design is complete, the packaging is perfect, and after endless research and quality testing, we have found an AMAZING production partner! Now we just need you! Designing and producing That Gift Game has been such an exciting and creative process from start to finish. We want this game to be perfect for you and have put our heart and soul into the details...from making sure the game play flows smoothly every time to finding cards that glide perfectly in your hand and designing a game box that fits right in at your holiday party. Our initial order from our production partner turned out even better than we had imagined and we are ready to place a large scale order in preparation for the holiday season. Join this party! Let's stay in touch! Check us out on FACEBOOK & INSTAGRAM! The GOAL While That Gift Game can be played anytime of the year, the holiday season is it's time to shine! We expect most of our sales to be in the months leading up to the busy holiday season and are currently preparing for fall and winter of 2019. Our goal on KICKSTARTER is to help fund a large scale production order in preparation for the holidays, while also creating awareness about the game with plenty of time for orders for the 2019 season. Due to our initial investment and first order of That Gift Game, we are able to quickly fulfill rewards at every level of campaign success, making KICKSTARTER an amazing platform to reach supporters. The REWARDS LIMITED RELEASE, EARLY BIRD PLEDGE Be one of the first to support That Gift Game and get your hands on an early copy! It's like Christmas in July! $22 THAT GIFT GAME Your new favorite holiday tradition will be in your hands with plenty of time to spare! Estimated to ship in October 2019 $24 THAT GIFT GAME X 2 Get ready for your gift exchange with 2 copies of That Gift Game... one for you and one to share! Estimated to ship in October 2019 $44 THE HOLIDAY PACKAGE Not only do you get an early start on your holiday shopping - you get to be the person who gifted your favorite people with a new holiday tradition! Plus, who doesn't love giving gifts that come in easy to wrap, pretty boxes!? Estimated to ship in October 2019. $200 CUSTOM REWARDS AVAILABLE for wholesale and large quantity orders. For more information contact us directly: info@thatgiftgame.com We are happy to ship worldwide from the United States, providing it is legal to do so. Thank you for being a part of this party! Brooke and Amanda
