My name is DeAnna Lam and like many women I struggled with PMS for many years seeing my period as a bother and a nuisance. However, in the early 90's I began a personal journey to embracing my womanhood and after a great deal of education and training called my first "Menstrual Empowerment Circle" in 1994. The response was incredible and I knew I had found my purpose. Since then, I have been writing, teaching and speaking throughout the U.S. and abroad for the past 30 years with the goal of empower women by helping them to reclaim their menstruation as a source of inner guidance and renewal. Last year I was having discussions of my platform and the movement with my good friend who is in the jewelry industry. Initially the idea to collaborate was never thought of - we merely talked about one another's businesses in parallel. Eventually we thought of various ways that we might collaborate together so that I could share my message with the world and the idea for Goddess Compass was born. International Backers: Goddess Compass is for women around the globe! We are excited to bring a monthly subscription box to your doorstep wherever you are in the world. We will be using USPS (United States Postal Service) for International Shipments. We realize that shipping costs to International customers are high and appreciate your understanding that we do not make these prices ourselves and do our best to find the most reliable and economical option to offer our supporters.

This campaign is about so much more than funding a documentary. It is about using the power of film to help not only save our democracy but make it better for everyone. We need to use every tool we have to motivate Americans and get them out to vote in 2020. RESISTERHOOD will do just that. UPDATE: Every reward over $35 will receive a digital copy of the documentary after its commercial release! In the two and a half years since the 2016 election, Americans have resisted and persisted. We've flooded the streets and packed the airports. We've spoken up at town halls and sat down in Congressional offices. We've stood up for human rights and for each other. We've raised our voices and we've voted. And through it all, RESISTERHOOD was there. This powerful documentary captures the stories of everyday Americans who became grassroots activists working tirelessly to defend our democracy and stop the erosion of our civil rights. RESISTERHOOD is about ordinary women, men and children doing extraordinary things. RESISTERHOOD showcases the wave that brought us the most ethnically, racially and gender diverse Congress in history in 2018. The film shares stories of hope that will re-energize the movement and inspire even more people to join the fight to secure a bright future for our country. RESISTERHOOD will stand as a testament to the strength of all of the people who fought to uphold the American promise of equality and justice for all. RESISTERHOOD aims to energize and inspire Americans to vote. The first phase of RESISTERHOOD did just that - through dozens of short films, we inspired hundreds of thousands of voters ahead of the Midterm Elections in 2018. The second phase is where you come in! We need your help with the production of a feature-length documentary to be released in early 2020. We have completed filming and are beginning the long process of editing over 500 hours of original footage. Your support will enable us to finish this critical project. We follow 6 Americans as they resist and persist through the first two years of the current presidency. A woman who marched from Selma to Montgomery in 1965 takes her power back to the streets, a congressman puts his freedom on the line, a grandmother runs for office, a great-granddaughter of a Suffragist becomes an activist, a professional athlete teaches radical love, and a new citizen stands up for peace. Making RESISTERHOOD is truly a team effort. We have a powerful, majority female-identifying group of professionals volunteering their time and talent to make this project a reality. From social media to artwork to original music to editing, the RESISTERHOOD team is experienced, enthusiastic, and dedicated. To date, we have self-funded this project and relied on financial contributions from people who share our passion for American democracy. Our team has donated their precious time and energy to work on bringing the many moving parts together necessary to create a full-length documentary. We hope you join us by supporting this campaign! Filmmaker Cheryl Jacobs Crim is an award-winning filmmaker who has been producing, directing and editing award-winning television specials and documentaries for more than 30 years. She has been honored with a gold medal at the International Film and Television Festival of New York, "Best of Show" at The Houston International Film Festival and two Silver Telly Awards. She has also received 12 Regional Emmy Awards for outstanding documentary and entertainment programs, including two awards for individual achievement in directing and editing. We've got the footage, now comes the hard part. We've filmed marches, arrests, election days, and quiet afternoons and amassed over 500 hours of original footage. We need your help to support our work as we edit and distribute the documentary. Here's what we need to do and where your donation will go: Editing: We need to hire a top-notch editor in order to make sure the documentary is ready before the 2020 elections. Media Rights: We need to pay to secure rights to news broadcasts and other footage to supplement what we already have. Music Rights: Similarly, we need to pay for the rights to all non-original music in the film. Sound Design: We need to hire a top-notch sound designer to edit levels and make sure the documentary sounds great. Distribution Fees: We will pay distribution and film festival submission fees so we can bring RESISTERHOOD to the widest possible audience. Every dollar we raise beyond our goal will go to very good use: production, operations, distribution and towards the creation of short films to be released throughout 2020. These short films will further the mission of RESISTERHOOD and inspire an even wider audience to make their voices heard and vote. Our rewards are just a small way we can say thank you for your support!! Your generous contribution will make our dream come true and help us bring RESISTERHOOD to the world. Here is a sample of some of the rewards that you will receive in exchange for your support: T-shirt: Soft, high-quality cotton t-shirts will be available in sizes XS-XL and in both feminine and unisex cuts. You'll get to choose the shirt you want after the campaign ends. Photo for demonstration purposes only. The actual t-shirt will be similar or higher quality. Photo for demonstration purposes only. The actual t-shirt will be similar or higher quality. Mug: A tall 15oz ceramic mug decorated with Normon Greene's beautiful RESISTERHOOD painting. Photo for demonstration purposes only. The actual tote bag will be similar or higher quality. Tote Bag: High quality tote bag with Resisterhood logo. Photo for demonstration purposes only. The actual tote bag will be similar or higher quality. Documentary Poster: The poster will feature the documentary's logo and be printed on sturdy paper, equally suitable for taking to protests or hanging in your house. Art Print: Celebrated artist Normon Greene will sign and number a print of his original, commissioned painting depicting the RESISTERHOOD. Painting by Normon Greene

Who am I? I'm Holly, an 18 time Kickstarter creator, 15 of which have been successfully funded and fulfilled. I've been a "maker" since before the word entered popular vernacular as an alternative to "artist." I'm going on 35 years of producing tangible visual expression. I do everything from designing enamel pins, to jewelry, drawing, painting, sculpture and more... What�s happening? What am I making? I am in the fields and mountains of Peru for the next two months and I will be documenting my journey through mixed media illustrations made from a combination of water color, colored pencil, and markers. I'd like to share this adventure of a lifetime learning about this amazing country and culture with you by offering my work as rewards! Since packing space is at premium while backpacking, this means that I have size limitations as well as supply limitations to work with, but limitations are often a gateway to creativity. All the supplies I�ll be using to produce these small works will be procured here in Peru. I�m offering two sizes of drawings/paintings. One is about 4x6 and the other is about 8x11. These sizes are approximate as I�ll have no cutting device and will be hand tearing the paper, as is customary with watercolor. They�re small pieces because I have one giant backpack (other than my daughter�s small backpack) to carry everything and I don�t want them to get crushed. I will be using Modigliani 200gsm paper. Small watercolor of wheat from the field on the farm we're currently at. I�m also offering two different shipping options. -Shipping from Peru (7 or 8.00 for the rest of the world) Ships on the 25th of July, August Delivery. -Shipping from the US (free for U.S. addresses 5 for the rest of the world) ships at the end of September/beginning of October, October Delivery. If you choose shipping from Peru, you�ll receive your piece earlier than if you choose free shipping from the US since I won�t be back in the US until the end of September. Why Peru? Other than the fact that Peru has nice people, lots of different climates; desert, rain forest, alpine, cloud forests, beaches, etc� therefore lots of visual variety, as many of my repeate (and MUCH LOVED) backers and Drip subscribers know, I am a nomad and split my time between the U.S. (Atlanta, Birmingham, and Los Angeles) and Montevideo, Uruguay. Every summer I bring my daughter (now 12) with me to Uruguay. This year the flights were so unbelievably expensive that I couldn�t afford it. BUT I have been wanting to go to Peru for most of my life and this seemed like the perfect opportunity for the adventure of a lifetime. Two months here is costing me HALF of what our flights alone would be to go back to Uruguay. SO, being the risk taker I am, I decided we�d do it! Where are we going? We were in Lima for about 2 weeks, just to get a feel for the place before we head out on the real adventure. Then we got on a double-decker bus and 14 hours to a little town called Ayacucho. They are known for their massive religious parades and festivals, gorgeous colonial architecture, and the start of a violent Maoist uprising that ravaged the country in the 70�s, finally ending in the 80�s. I�m hoping to be able to capture some of these things in my work. We are now an hour South of Ayacucho, an area called Cusibamba. We will be staying here for four weeks on a potato farm in the Ruta de las Papas located in a valley on the Eastern Occidental of the Andes Mountains. I will be hiking with my daughter and art supplies in tow most of the days we are here, and I�m hoping to make some beautiful small pieces, since there are about 4,000 different types of potatoes that grow here (I plan on painting as many kinds as I can), as well as other flora and possibly fauna. Large watercolor and pen drawing of the softly sloped mountain behind the farm. Once the four weeks at the farm is up, we�ll go back to Ayacucho, get on another giant bus and drive for eight more hours overnight to Abancay. When we arrive in Abancay, we�ll hop on another collectivo for two hours, then take a taxi for one more hour. We�ll then hike to a break half way up the mountain to get to the camp we�re staying at. The views are incredible from our tiny little two person grass roofed tent/hut. I can hardly wait to start trying to capture the beauty of the Andes, lush green in the valley with terraced farms and snow-capped peaks in the distance. Again, we�ll be hiking and making art most days here since wifi is spotty at best. A few types of the more than 4K varieties of potatoes that grow in Peru. Then what? After 14 days on the mountain, we�ll retrace our journey through the Andes, get back on the bus for a 16 hour trip back to Lima on the 24th. Once we arrive in Lima, I�ll be mailing off any rewards that are being shipped from here on the 25th of July. It will take about 15 days to get your reward once it�s mailed, this is an estimate for U.S. delivery. I hope you�ll frame your new piece, hang it where you can see it every day, enjoy it for years to come, and hopefully you�ll be inspired to take a risk in your daily life, change up your routine, or go on that trip you�ve always been dreaming of. Possible questions: What if I want more than one piece? I've put limits on the number of pieces just in case for some reason I have a ton of people who are interested. This doesn't happen too frequently, and I'm not exactly anticipating it with this project, but better safe than sorry. Once we get close to the end, I'd say within three or so days, I'll let everyone know if you can adjust your pledge to add on additional illustrations. If you choose to purchase more that one piece, most likely shipping won't increase, unless you add on like, 10. What will MY illustration look like? I'll be capturing a variety of subjects. Once the project is finished, I'll be sending out a survey where I'll give you the option to choose a category based on what I've painted. Most likely these will include: Flora, Fauna, Landscape, Cityscape, Food, or People. From that choice, I'll send a random but also the best I have to fulfill your rewards. What if there isn't a reward that I'd like to see? Then PLEASE let me know! I am more than happy to add the rewards you'd like to see and I love creating special things for the special people who show me so much support. As more questions arise, I'll respond directly to them them in the comments and possibly add them here if they're super important things that I haven't yet thought about.

We began Penny Magic Press last year as a way to tell stories to delight readers through our website, pennymagic.co, and our podcast, the Penny Magic podcast. Now, we're ready to take our first ten stories and publish them in print. Fairytales for Grown-Ups is a volume of ten fictional short stories to delight readers and bring you into new worlds, telling tales like: a mermaid taking her gap year on land, a string of mysterious deaths in a small town, a flood that sweeps through the suburbs stirring up memories, and more. All ten stories in Fairytales for Grown-Ups are written and ready to be printed. What You Are Getting Each of our rewards is designed with readers in mind�bookmarks to keep your place, a secret story postcard to bring delight to your mailbox, and the chance to participate in the process by having your name in the book, a shoutout on the podcast, or the power to choose a character name in our upcoming Vol. 3 or 4. Shipping is included in the price of each rewards tier, so the price you see is the price you pay. What You Are Supporting You are helping readers read more and writers write more. We know reading is important to you, and that�s why we value your support in this project. Your financial support will go towards the costs of producing and printing this book, as well as shipping it to you, our readers. Higher rewards tiers are designed to let you be an advocate for reading to your friends and family with additional copies of the book. See below for a breakdown of our costs. What�s Next? We just finished publishing the stories of Vol. 2: A World of Our Own on our website and via our podcast. In the fall of 2019, we'll be publishing Vol. 3 online with another set of ten short stories around a theme. We dream of bringing these volumes to print in the future as well...and many more books after them! About Penny Magic Press Penny Magic Press is run by husband-and-wife team Matt and Natalie Mills. Finding themselves full of short stories with nowhere to publish them, they decided to fill the need themselves by starting pennymagic.co, a short story anthology website and podcast. Right now, Penny Magic Press focuses on publishing volumes of ten short stories over ten weeks around a specific theme, such as Fairytales for Grown-Ups! In the future, we hope to expand by bringing on new writers and publishing standalone novels, serials, and more.

Examples of dressing mixing/serving bowls *****ALL PIECES WILL BE DELIVERED BY SEPTEMBER 2019 **** Little by little, my home studio is coming together. We bought a used kiln that needed a little work and is working great now! We have shelves and some tools and have worked to make the space more usable. We still are working to get the wheel and a few more tools, that is where my Kickstater campaign comes in! Example of noodle bowl on dark clay Example of kitchen utensil holder So far, all of my experience has been in a community studio setting. As I continue to grow and sell more of my pieces, I have found my needs changing. I want to be able to try new things with different types of clays, glazes, temperatures in the kiln and even with glass. That is not possible to do while working within the structure of a community studio- and understandably so! That said, we made the decision to make a home studio! We are already in this process, however the $1500 will go towards making the studio complete. Rice bowls after applying the rice paper underglaze pattern, ready for glazing! Rewards Green pattern noodle bowl Example of noodle bowl with pattern I will be making custom pottery for this campaign: the very popular noodle bowls, a salad dressing mixing/serving bowl, ice cream bowls, and kitchen utensil holders. If I reach my campaign goal, I will send out surveys with all of your options! All noodle bowls will be handthrown on the wheel in either white or marbled clay. On white clay, choice of either a rice paper underglaze pattern or solid glazed bowl. On marbled clay, clay will be left partially exposed on the exterior of the bowl to show off the natural beauty of the clay, your choice of glaze color. All glazes a food safe. All pieces are microware, oven, and dishwasher safe. Please note that due to ceramic nature some objects can vary slightly from the pictures. Production Timeline July 20- September 15th, 2019. Once the campaign is over, and assuming the funding goal is met, I will proceed with the production process of the ceramics. September 15, 2019: Packaging and shipping the orders (earlier if possible). Example of noodle bowl with glaze and exposed clay. Example of noodle bowl with marbled clay Example of ice cream bowl! Other noodle bowl examples Examples of Kitchen Utensil holders

Anger provides the energy needed for change. Maybe your situation, maybe yourself. But learning to respond to your anger, not react from it, is the key to healthy usage. Think of healthy anger as a road you are walking. On the left side of the road there is the anger that we don�t allow ourselves to feel and express (which makes us sick and ruins our relationships) and on the other side we have anger that is over-expressed (which makes us sick and ruins our relationships). If you have veered off onto one side, you want to course correct back to the middle, not overcorrect to the other side. Aren't we all pissed off about something right now? We're not wrong to be. But how do we use that anger to change the world instead of letting it poison our own lives? About the book Unf*ck Your Anger: Using Science to Understand Frustration, Rage, and Forgiveness by Dr. Faith G. Harper, PhD, LPC-S, ACS, ACN is a 5x7 inch, 128-page paperback book, illustrated by Trista Vercher. This is Dr. Faith's ninth book! In it, she uses her trademark combination of science and swearing to shine a light on this much-felt but little-discussed emotion. She tackles topics like: Anger's evolutionary function and why we need it even though we often get carried away with it The human brain's nine rage triggers and how to figure out your main ones The close relationships between anger and depression, bipolar disorder, anxiety, trauma, and self-harm Tons of tools and exercises for managing your anger in healthier ways Steps for using your anger to create social change A new 5-stage model for practicing forgiveness A little about the origins of this book: It started out as a 32-page zine (if you don't know what that is, it's pronounced "zeen" and is like a stapled pamphlet but cooler) called This is Your Brain on Anger, which evolved into becoming one of the chapters in Unf*ck Your Brain. We've been steadily reworking and expanding those chapters into full-fledged books in their own right, in order of popularity�starting with anxiety and depression, and now it's anger's turn. (If that doesn't give you a snapshot of our national psyche, I don't know what does.) The book will be over 4 times as long as the zine/chapter and completely rewritten � it contains a few of the same big ideas but is it's own entirely new thing. A spread from the book, showing an illustration of a brain throwing unhealthy anger in the trash, with a framed "healthy anger" poster on the wall, and the text "Much better!" A spread from the book's chapter on using your anger for social action, showing an illustration of brains participating in a march, holding a sign that says "enough is enough" A spread from the chapter on forgiveness, showing two brains hugging it out. About the author The author poses with one of the classic focal points of anger discussed in her book. Dr. Faith Harper is a trauma-informed therapist with a PhD and a growing number of other degrees and certifications. She is the author of eight books including the bestselling Unf*ck Your Brain. She lives in San Antonio, Texas where she has a private practice, trains other clinicians, and writes prolifically. She proudly identifies as a woman of color and an uppity intersectional feminist. About the publisher The day we got 11 pallets of books delivered to our building. We are Microcosm! Since 1996, we've been publishing and distributing books and zines chosen to put your power in your hands. Today we are independently distributed and don't sell directly to Amazon. We have 13 workers, over 400 books in print and over 10,000 titles in our distribution, an office and storefront in Portland, Oregon, and a whole lot of ideas, energy, and heart. Every day, we take our anger at structural inequities (and the ways the publishing industry upholds them) and work to channel it into building something better. About the rewards We have a lot of Dr. Faith books here, plus many great books by other authors that we have the pleasure of publishing. Enjoy! The workbook � at only $5, this is definitely not the main event. It can stand alone... kind of. But trust us, the $10 book is where it's at. You can add extra workbooks to any reward level for $5 a pop. Unf*ck Your Anger � This is the book itself! You're gonna love it! The ebook � comes out a bit later, in January, 2020. Why? Piracy. Which leads us to... Piracy Forgiveness � This reward level is a grant of general amnesty for any past piracy. You'll get a copy of the ebook, put a little money towards any Dr. Faith ebooks you've downloaded without paying for in the past, and hopefully walk away feeling a little lighter, free-er, and less likely to avail yourself of unauthorized free digital downloads in the future. Unf*ck Your Day-to-Day Not sure what's up with you, but know your brain is jacked and want some basic, baseline help? Here's a good place to start. Includes: Unf*ck Your Anger Unf*ck Your Anger Workbook Unf*ck Your Brain � This is the Dr. Faith classic! Walks you through recovering from the way trauma (which might be from a big traumatic event but is just as likely to come from life's thousands of cumulative paper cuts) rewires your brain An Unholy Quadrifecta We've got a whole chapter coming at you about how Anger is often a manifestation of anxiety, depression, or PTSD.... with anger just being a more socially-acceptable way to express those things for some. If it's you, read all about them: Unf*ck Your Anger This is Your Brain on Anxiety � A small but potently helpful Dr. Faith manual on the care and healing of an anxious brain This is Your Brain on Depression � Dr. Faith walks you through the science of depression and what you can do about it This is Your Brain on PTSD � Derived from the Unf*ck Your Brain book, this zine takes a deeper dive into the many faces of post-traumatic stress disorder I Love Workbooks It kinda took us by surprise, but it turns out that a lot of you really, really love workbooks. We've been making them for a bunch of different books recently, including this one. Here's a selection of all the ones we've printed so far, most of them in the form of zines: Unf*ck Your Anger Unf*ck Your Anger Workbook Unf*ck Your Brain Workbook � A whole bunch of photocopyable worksheets for coping with emotions and vanquishing your brain gremlins Unf*ck Your Intimacy Workbook � Alone or with a loved one, work through these questionnaires and exercises to find more fulfilling close relationships and sex Achieve Your Goals Workbook � Choose a goal. Workshop it in this tiny zine. Actualize. Repeat From Chaos to Creativity Workbook � Trying to figure out how to manage your day-to-day life so that you can find time for the work you're most passionate about? Start here A People's Guide to Publishing Workbook � If you've ever dreamed of starting a publishing company, this workbook is a great place to get that plan on paper. Could work for other big creative dreams, too Unf*ck Your Relationships Anger may or may not be the cause of our difficulties getting along with the people closest to us, but it sure isn't helping matters. Here's a set of books to start working some of that out with: Unf*ck Your Anger Unf*ck Your Anger Workbook Unf*ck Your Intimacy �Dr. Faith's deep dive into sex and relationships. She addresses various obstacles to having good sex and deep love, and shows you how to untangle it all, for your own self and in your close relationships Unf*ck Your Adulting � This Dr. Faith book is not so much about how to fix a flat tire, more about how not to totally freak out or lash out when you get a flat or other such life crap Chill-Out Books Will putting on some really relaxing music, pouring a glass of lemonade, and curling up in a hammock with these books help you manage your anger? Won't know til you've tried. Unf*ck Your Anger The Beard Coloring Book � Put your thoughts on hold for a while and get lost in these swirling patterns and fascinating, fancy beards Pedal, Stretch, Breathe � Move your body in ways that make your whole self feel better Dream Whip #15 � Reading these travel stories is like being lost in thought watching the world go by through a bus window Amica's World � Relax and marvel at photos of this giant bird who lives in a suburban living room Unf*ck Your Sleep � Dr. Faith's zine about sleeping is a game-changer Eat Well, Feel Calm This is another one where ymmv. Preparing and eating a good meal might totally get you into a calmer zone, and if so check out this excellent bundle of cookbooks: Unf*ck Your Anger (not a cookbook!) Paleo for Unicorns � Learn basic recipes that even picky kids will eat, paired with inspiring feminist diet rants Mama Tried � Vegan versions of classic Italian recipes�comfort food galore! Chocolatology � Sweet or savory, chocolate makes pretty much everything better Sprouts � Want to eat more fresh veggies? Grow them in your kitchen all winter long The Revolution Won't Forget the Holidays � A hidden gem of a dietary-restriction-friendly cookzine by Dr. Faith (did you know that she's also a nutritionist and loves to cook?) Harness Your Rage, Change the World You know what? You're right to be angry. There's a piece in the Anger book about channeling your rage into social action instead of punching walls. Let these books give you fuel and tools to take that energy and create change: Unf*ck Your Anger Street Journalist � A powerful toolkit of reporting skills for creating change and accountability in your community Bikenomics � The economic case for bicycling, and a blueprint for anyone to make the case for the issues that matter to them Katrina's Sandcastles � An account of teaching in a troubled school system, and a case study in the perils�and importance�of putting your caring into action Underground � A fun history of the DIY punk house show scene, showing how you can build a huge network and movement with talent and passion rather than money and corporate control Make a Zine � Publish your own revolution, you've got this Unf*ck All the Things! Here's the option for the serious Dr. Faith stans. This isn't everything she's written by any stretch, but it's enough to carry you for a while. Unf*ck Your Anger Unf*ck Your Brain Unf*ck Your Intimacy Unf*ck Your Adulting This is Your Brain on Anxiety This is Your Brain on Depression Coping Skills � Broken down into categories for different needs, from surviving the moment to shifting your perspective in the bigger picture How Not to Kill Yourself � Set Sytes (with Dr. Faith assist) humorously and earnestly lays out the nuts and bolts of this essential life skill Self-Compassion � Quickly becoming Dr. Faith's most popular zine, this one is all about getting ok with yourself Woke Parenting #1 � How do you raise a child to accept themselves and others, be safe around authorities who aren't necessarily on their side, and grow up to fight the good fight? (with Bonnie Scott) Detox Your Masculinity � Body image is a huge problem in our culture�and it affects masculine people as much as or even more than feminine people (with Dr. Aaron Sapp)

ABOUT THE DOCUMENTARY FILM 'By Hand� is a feature length adventure documentary film about twin brothers that paddled 2,200 miles without support. In an attempt to escape comfort, reconnect to the natural world and set a new bar for ocean adventure, twin brothers Casey and Ryan Higginbotham made a decision that would reshape their lives. On March 18th, 2016 they embarked on a paddle from Alaska to Mexico with 18' paddle boards. The brothers carried nothing more than two dry bags of gear each and a camera. No support boats, no paddles, and nothing similar to gauge from. Nothing like this has ever been done. �As far as expeditions go, its got to be up there as one of the most difficult trips of any kind� - Jimmy Chin Raised with a never-quit mentality on stories of the men in their family that came before them, the expedition forces the arch rivals to set aside a past filled with intense clashes in an attempt to grow into a team. �It's like summiting Mount Everest for the first time� - Kelly Slater Motivated by a challenge of great proportion �By Hand� is a coming of age story exhibiting the mentorship found in the natural world, a testament to human potential, and an unspoken promise to never quit on your brother. �When there's a chance you may get eaten by a shark or bear, or fall off your board and get hypothermia, I think that says enough about what the commitment level of this trip meant� - Jamie Mitchell About the Filmmaker: Kellen Keene At 30 years old Kellen Keene has worked as a director and as a director of photography for some of the most compelling, dynamic, and authentic films that Patagonia and Yeti have put out into the world in the last 6 years. He understands and is drawn to human stories that are set in the wild and he has devoted himself wholeheartedly and very successfully to telling them. Keene lives on a farm and spends part of his year fishing salmon commercially in Alaska's Bristol Bay. He's stubborn about being true to a story and the folks he documents. So filmmaking for him has to be real in its endeavor to create honest and lasting stories. Kellen has been working on his forthcoming film BY HAND for over four years now. I have seen the rough cuts. I believe it's got the potential to become an instant classic in the outdoor world as well as transcend that genre in that it is based on a very human story that just happens to take place in the wild. -Chris Malloy Ryan and Casey Higginbotham: Born on the Central Coast of California and raised in Pismo Beach the youth�s of twins Casey and Ryan Higginbotham were unknowingly orienting them for an unprecedented expedition. (Paddling By Hand Down the coast of North America) Casey spent his young adult life working as a lifeguard at Oceano Dunes State Park while also training in various martial arts, competing in a multitude of physical competitions including Iron Man World Championships while also focusing his Political Science studies on Counter Terrorism. Ryan also lifeguards at Oceano Dunes State Park while spending his summers working Wild Sockeye Salmon Runs in Bristol Bay Alaska. His college studies were focused on landscape architecture, but he and Casey both knew their pursuits wouldn�t align with what�s considered a traditional path. Life after school has been focused on passion projects, Muy Thai kickboxing, ultra marathons, and various forms of self manufactured physical suffering. Funny enough, paddling wasn�t a big part of their background, far from it actually, but throwing out ideas and not shying away from them is a tendency that built up over their life. This journey is a testament to seeking out our mind�s wildest ideas and running towards them. The sacrifice made by both brothers and the adversities overcome, is overwhelming even to the most accomplished in the outdoor world. We want to make this film with people who appreciate independent film making. The 'By Hand' team has poured the last several years - and several dollars - into this project. We've followed the twins idea from conception to completion, documenting hundreds of hours of content. We've travelled high and low to interview over a dozen people to help tell the story and we've spent more hours than we care to admit in front of a computer writing and editing our hearts out. The current state of that work is a 1 hour rough cut film. In order to complete this project we need to get through a few more steps, which is why we are fundraising.... to carry it across the finish line! Our aim is to complete the film with our Kickstarter campaign. This will allow us to submit it to film festivals, and ultimately seek distribution after screening at film festivals. This opportunity for filmmakers is only possible thanks to backers like you, allowing independent films to still be produced. This process from start to finish of course is a long (and expensive) one, but we really want to do it right. It's important to us that each dollar spent on this film is intentional, purposeful, and absolutely necessary. The main portion of the work is done, however the money raised through your generous support of this Kickstarter Campaign will help us complete the below prioritized tasks to bring this film to it's completion: *Animation/Map Design: A professional animator will create a mapping sequence that will portray the route and length of the overall voyage. This map will be used throughout the film to remind the audience of their progression south. *Sound Design: A professional sound mixer will creatively score, edit levels, master the audio files, and create ambient sound design. *Music Sync Rights: Obtain the rights to music used in the finished film. This has larger financial weight as big fees are accrued to acquire master licensing as well as sync licensing. If we surpass our goal, any additional funds raised will go to the remaining prioritized projects: additional aerial footage to help showcase the reality of this voyage, marketing, and additional sync rights. Of course, the bigger the budget the more we can get done..not only in this production phase but post-production including screenings, distribution and more content. $64,000 is the bare minimum we need to get this through production and onto your screen! None of this can get done without your help. We are currently a very small team, and are incredibly grateful for your help! We realize this is a huge 'ask' to make a pledge and we want to make sure you get your money's worth for your patronage! We have a huge list of rewards including 'Limited Edition By Hand' merchandise, training and paddles with the brothers, private screening with your friends, and much more!! We hope you can find something that is right for you! YOUR backing truly supports our mission. All who donate immediately become a member of the "By Hand' community, and we look forward to keeping you updated on the progress of the film. Thank you for your time, consideration, and support! photos by Colin Nearman

The Netflix Castlevania adaptation left me wildly excited, spellbound, and craving for more. With a resurgence of a long lost fandom of mine and the abilities to create, I figured now would be an amazing time to make a series of wooden pins that would make fans undeniably happy. What would be better than a set of pins featuring everybody's favorite hunter, scholar and soldier? DESIGNS Each wooden pin will be 40mm in size (about 1.6'') and made of responsibly sourced birch plywood. Each pin will come with a metal butterfly clutch and will be fastened onto a themed backing card. STRETCH GOALS $350  At $350, all backing cards will be upgraded to a spot gloss finish! $450  At $450, all backers will get an included 3'' vinyl sticker when their pins ship! $550  At $550, a Dracula wooden pin will be unlocked as a pin choice! $750  At $750, a 1.25'' enamel pin will be unlocked as a pin choice! BREAKDOWN TIMELINE June 3th: Kickstarter launches! July 3th: Kickstarter ends! Surveys will be sent out to determine your final pin choice. July 6th: Files sent off to the printer. July-August: Estimated arrival of pins & supplies. August: Shipping starts! CONTACT If you need to contact me, please feel free to send a message here or to artofstudiomaz@gmail.com! Other places to find me: Tumblr I Twitter I Instagram I Etsy

Welcome to my Kickstarter! My name is Jessy and I am a self-taught artist based in the United States. I am a collector and creator of enamel pins. I�ve previously done successful Kickstarter campaigns and I have an understanding of how to run things smoothly. I also have experience with the manufacturer I will be using, so I know that they are trustworthy and that they produce good quality pins. The goal of this Kickstarter is to produce my enamel pin design and get the Greenhouse art piece I created turned into a 5 x 7 art print. These designs were inspired by my love for plants. Pledge now, Pay later: Kickstarter wont charge you until the campaign has ended and is successful. Kickstarter also allows you to change your pledge at anytime before the end of the campaign. The pin will be made of hard enamel and come in both a gold and black nickel finish. It will be 1.5" tall (38mm) and have two rubber pin backs to keep it secure. Here's an example of previous pins I've created: Art Print Mock-up A5 / 5x7 Greenhouse Art print This piece will get to become my first ever art print! It will be in full color and printed on 10pt felt woven card-stock and have a watercolor texture. June-Mid July: Campaign Runs Late July: Funds are received and surveys are sent out. Pins go into production and art prints are made! August: Pins arrive and rewards are sent out. All funding received will go towards the Kickstarter project. 60% will cover the manufacturer and 30% of funding will go towards packaging supplies and shipping cost. I also took into account the 10% fee that Kickstarter receives from all campaigns. Contact Information: Thank you for your interest in my campaign ! If you have any questions feel free to contact me through my messages or email. Email: jessyblu.art@gmail.com Instagram: Jessy.Blu

First some quick links for ongoing reference, including some more videos to get you started: PLEDGE LEVEL GRAPHICS ENCOUNTER GRAPHICS ALL ADD-ON SETS STRETCH GOAL MAP SOCIAL STRETCH GOALS HELLSCAPE PRICING SPREADSHEET PHOTO GALLERY HELLSCAPE COMPATIBILITY PHOTOS WITH OTHER DF TERRAIN ENCOUNTER 1 WALKTHROUGH VIDEO ENCOUNTER 2 WALKTHROUGH VIDEO ENCOUNTER 3 WALKTHROUGH VIDEO KNIGHTESS JENNEY OC'S HELLSCAPE FAQ Welcome to Hellscape: a brief, feature-packed and focused campaign to create the new, infernal-themed terrain you'll see below -- and set your games on fire! To old friends and to newcomers, we've come a long way together since our first Kickstarter campaign, Game Tiles, in 2013. Since then, right here on Kickstarter, you�ve made an otherwise unimaginable variety of gaming terrain possible. Thank you! All gamers know that there's one theme that's a key part of any great adventure: danger. So we're proud to introduce our most deadly setting ever: Hellscape! Only the most intrepid (or the most foolhardy?) will venture into this lethal underworld... where peril permeates the entire plane, and manifests as fire that consumes the very ground beneath your feet. Here, the threat is relentless -- and your only imaginable victory is survival. Hellscape brings you detailed, modular terrain so real, so visceral and dramatic, you can feel the blazing magma on your tabletop. Enter if you dare... Hellscape has been painstakingly sculpted by hand-- every rippling lava pool, each jagged rock spire, every infernal rune -- by our team here at Dwarven Forge. Many of the pieces have a 4"x"4" footprint, so modular building is fast and covers a lot of ground. Months of refinement have produced what we think is our finest painting to date, including specific areas with translucent paint. Everything is cast in Dwarvenite�, our proprietary casting material that combines great heft, tactile feel and amazing durability. For Hellscape, we've developed a translucent, yellow-tinted formulation for most of the lava pieces that allows light to penetrate in just the right places. About half our Hellscape pieces are completely new; the rest are updated translucent, lava-painted pieces adapted from Caverns Deep. You can see the entire catalogue of pieces here. We've done our very best to make Hellscape come alive! Hellscape pieces include standard anchor magnets wherever practical so they will stick to our terrain trays, making them easy to move and carry without disturbing your setups. One essential feature of all Dwarven Forge terrain is modularity. Hellscape is no exception. You can build the Encounters we�ve pictured -- or you can build something completely new, every time. You can also combine your Hellscape pieces with any of our other terrain for unlimited versatility. With this Kickstarter, we're also introducing some brand new technology: DF Light Panels: Our goal was to illuminate entire builds at once, without hotspots, embedded connections or batteries. Place your Hellscape terrain atop these thin, 8"x8" Light Panels and illuminate your setup (in the right places) in an instant. You can use just one, or connect them together in a "daisy chain" (up to approximately 9 panels with a single transformer). One look and you'll understand why translucent Dwarvenite is so perfectly suited to this terrain. DF Light Panels are included in specific "Illuminated" Pledges, and are also available as Add-on Sets. Please note: Light panels will accept 110-240 input voltage, but will come standard with US style plugs. So you won't need to convert the voltage, but you need an adapter to plug into a non-US outlet. These are easy to find and inexpensive, but we will also try to offer them for the EU and Australia in the pledge manager for a nominal fee. Phantasmal Filters: Bold graphics are printed onto these 8"x8" thin but sturdy filters. They look great (and appear opaque) on their own, and magical when placed atop DF Light Panels and light illuminates them from below (you can see the effect in the image below). Hellscape consists of: Three Main Encounters: the Crucible Chamber, the larger Torrent of Torment and the giant Soulcage Vault. Each Encounter can be built as shown, or the pieces can be rearranged and combined with other Dwarven Forge sets in endless combinations. The only limit is your imagination! Add-on sets: A wide assortment of Add-on sets to customize your choices and enhance your collection. New Add-on Sets will be introduced steadily throughout this campaign. Painted and unpainted sets: All sets are available either fully hand painted or unpainted*. Unpainted pieces will mostly be cast in yellow-tinted, translucent Dwarvenite (the color shown below might change a little for production). Please note: painting Hellscape requires more time and a finer hand than the typical wash and drybrush required for normal dungeon or cavern pieces. While this complexity makes our painted prices a little more than usual, we recommend painted sets for those of you "on the fence" between unpainted and painted selections. *Does not apply to Terrain Trays, Overlays, Phantasmal Filters, DF Light Panels and certain Pledge Levels. If you'd like to back our campaign, our pledge options are outlined below and actual pledge levels run down the right-hand side of this page. They include: A Build Your Own option for those of you who want to select Encounters and Add-on Sets completely � la carte. If you choose sets that contain unlocked free stretch goals, they will be included automatically. We've photographed some recommended Build Your Own pledges at various price levels (starting at $98 unpainted) here. With this pledge, you'll confirm all your specific set selections using our pledge manager after the campaign is complete. Hellraiser. This starter option includes an assortment of Scatter Terrain. These are standalone pieces that aren't just for Hellscape, but go perfectly with battle mats, other types of terrain or even just decorations for your gameroom. First, Second and Third Circles of Hell. These pledge levels feature our Main Encounters, with bonus packs and free stretch goals as specified. The "Illuminated" versions of these pledges include DF Light Panels. All Hell Breaks Loose. Our ultimate top level pledge includes double the sets included in the Third Circle of Hell, additional bonus packs -- and two Kickstarter-exclusive, very special resin capstone pieces. Here are some alternate builds of the pledge levels: ENCOUNTER 3 ALTERNATE BUILD First, check out the map below to get the lay of the land and a sense of scale. Detailed graphics showing our 3 Main Encounters, Crucible Chamber, Torrent of Torment and Soulcage Vault follow... Encounter 3, continued... As the funding level of this Kickstarter grows, our production run gets larger and more efficient. This enables us to add in both: Free stretch goal pieces that "unlock" (and are automatically added to your pledge) at specified funding milestones. Each free stretch goal fits into a specified set. If your pledge includes that set, you receive that stretch goal when it unlocks; if your pledge does not include that set, you do not receive that stretch goal. New add-on set options that we can afford to tool as our funding grows. Stretch goal milestones are eligible to unlock until the Kickstarter ends on July 1st, at 9PM US Eastern time. Our stretch goal map is shown below. In addition to the Encounters, Hellscape includes a wide variety of Add-on Sets. Some Add-ons are actually subsets of the larger two encounters, while others are specific types of pieces that you might want to add to your collection. Select Add-on Sets are shown below. Click here to see them all. 1) First, select a Main Pledge level. These are the pledges shown down the right-hand column of the page. 2) Once you select your Main Pledge, you can also include any other set(s) you see on this Kickstarter, as long as it has a price listed on our Google Sheet or our Pledge Calculator. These include anything from small add-on sets, to full Encounters -- or even another Main Pledge level. Take note of the total amount for everything you want. 3) To pledge, click on your Main Pledge selection. Then enter the total amount (including shipping/taxes) of your Main Pledge + any additional set(s) you want, and press "continue," then "pledge". You can modify your pledge as many times as you want until the campaign ends at 9PM US Eastern Time on July 1st. You don't get charged until the Kickstarter ends. How do we know which sets you've chosen? I. When the campaign is over, Kickstarter will charge you for your pledge. Kickstarter takes their commission, and then they send the remaining funds to us. They give us: your e-mail (the one you use with KS); your main pledge level; and your pledge total. It's then up to us to collect all remaining information. We do that with our online Pledge Manager. II. About 4-6 weeks after the campaign closes, you will receive an e-mail invitation to this online Pledge Manager. It will be pre-loaded with your main pledge and your total pledge amount. You'll then enter your name and shipping details, and reconfirm your set choices from our online menu, which will be a much enhanced version of the pledge calculator. Once you're done, you can download a copy of your order, or even upgrade your selections (subject to availability). If you didn't include shipping/import fees with your pledge, the pledge manager will also collect them. III. This will be our 7th Pledge Manager, so please don't worry -- this part is easy and fun. Any questions at that time, we are absolutely available to help! While, with your help, we've run 6 successful Kickstarter campaigns, we remain a small business in a pretty narrow market. Kickstarter -- primarily through our amazing backers -- provides a platform that funds our tooling and allows us to produce relatively vast assortments of products that simply wouldn't be feasible if we were speculating which items -- and especially how many of each -- you wanted. In addition, Kickstarter helps us reach a lot of passionate gamers who have never heard of us. We remain deeply committed to this platform and most importantly, to the backers who support us. That's why we continue to offer our Kickstarter backers: Kickstarter-exclusive prices that will never be as low again. Guaranteed availability of backers' set selections (which, although we try, is nearly impossible to offer on our website). Our guarantee that Kickstarter backers always receive their product before any Hellscape items are sold to any other party. Shipping is not included in the pledge and set prices. You can see exactly how much your shipping will cost on our Hellscape Spreadsheet. (If you are including Add-on Sets, Kickstarter cannot provide you with shipping totals because it does not capture any shipping associated with add-on sets.) Please include the shipping in your total pledge. If you choose not to include the shipping, our post-campaign Pledge Manager will collect your shipping charges. Taxes Our Hellscape spreadsheet and pledge calculator will provide totals for import fees/taxes for shipments to the US, Europe, Canada, Australia, New Zealand, Japan, Taiwan, Hong Kong and Mainland China. Duties, taxes and fees for shipments to other countries are not included and will be collected by the courier upon delivery. In addition, sales tax for shipments to NY and Connecticut will be collected in the pledge manager. We deeply appreciate the interest of backers from all over the world, and we apologize that we aren�t able to make any exceptions to these extra charges. About half the pieces in Hellscape are already tooled, since they are translucent, repainted versions of Caverns Deep pieces. Therefore, we expect the tooling and production to be a bit faster than Caverns Deep, and we expect to commence initial shipments by April, 2020. Please spread the word and join in the Comments section. Your input helps us make the campaign the best it can be. Interested in reading more? Visit Jenney OC's Answer Board, hosted on our forum and organized by subject. Thank you all!

"The Homeless Ghostwriter" - The Closest Person to You, is You A now homeless ghostwriter, Ruth, starts a less-than-ethical experimental medication for her schizotypal personality disorder with hopes to escape loneliness and become normal. A dark comedy short film, �The Homeless Ghostwriter� will follow the journey of Ruth Berk, a now homeless former ghostwriter in her late sixties/early seventies, as she navigates her homeless life while managing her schizotypal personality disorder (STPD). When Ruth makes a peculiar new friend named Paloma, Ruth faces the challenges of her life-long struggle to connect with others and her strong desire to be "normal" or "regular." �The Homeless Ghostwriter� is unique because it is a unique odyssey story. The journey in this film is not a heroic struggle by a character we wish to be, but instead it is about the real struggles of a person who represents who we actually are. Doing this through an older women struggling with not only with relatable feelings of loneliness but with the additional struggle of mental health and homeless offers tells a story not often told. Additionally, addressing mental health struggles in the main character gives identity and respect to a part of our culture too often marginalized and ignored. The Film - The Budget Below is the budget estimates for the production of �The Homeless Ghostwriter," the total standing at around $9,000 for this short film, the total time not surpassing 19 minutes and a maximum of 9 shoot days. Overall Budget Outlook For a more detailed outlook of the budget - Click Here. A Film with a Cause ALL remaining funds not used to fund the film will be donated to St. Francis House, a homeless shelter located next door to Emerson College in downtown Boston. Learn more about the St. Francis House at https://stfrancishouse.org/ The Crew - Bios Mackenzie Blalock - Writer and Director �Even though the world is cold and I�m alone, I�m loving what I�m feeling inside. I probably cried a thousand times but I�m alive, I�m loving what I�m feeling inside. This world is wonderful and that�s why I�m loving what I�m feeling inside.� -�Feeling Inside� by Paranoid Castle As the writer and director, Mackenzie �Mack� Blalock is excited to face the challenges of completing her BFA film �The Homeless Ghostwriter.� Mackenzie starts her senior year at Emerson College this fall, where she will finish her Visual Media Arts degree. In addition to writing and directing various different shorts, she has produced films in different genres, including period pieces (the 1890s), romantic comedy, and parody. Mackenzie�s other interests � like environmental sustainability, art history, and psychology � often inspire her creative work. These influences will flow into the creation of �The Homeless Ghostwriter,� where she strives to tell a story that is an empowering, but truthful take on homelessness and mental disabilities. Juliana Hartman �I don't mind that you lie sometimes, because I lie too, guess I'm just like you.� �edward 40hands� by Mom Jeans. Juliana Hartman (Jules is what the cool kids call her) is a senior Media Arts Production Major at Emerson College with a concentration in Producing, and a minor in Creative Writing. With her foot in both Television and Film, Juliana has a hand in The Emerson Channel as the Director of Programming and as an Executive Producer on the upcoming game show �Mind, Body, Blank�. She has also Produced and Directed several cerebral short films that engage with ideas of mental wellness and the question of life itself. As one of the Producers on �The Homeless Ghostwriter� Juliana is excited to delve into this fearless and heartfelt story that speaks truth to mental health realities today. Jared Quinn �Tumble outta bed and I stumble to the kitchen, Pour myself a cup of ambition, Yawn and stretch and try to come to life, Jump in the shower and the blood starts pumpin', Out on the street the traffic starts jumpin', With folks like me on the job from 9 to 5� -�9 to 5� by Dolly Parton Jared Quinn is an aspiring director, producer, and production designer, who is extremely excited about being a producer on Mack�s BFA film, �The Homeless Ghostwriter.� Starting his junior year at Emerson College in the fall, and working towards his degree in Visual Media Arts, Jared has worked on various sets as a producer and also been on the design and art side of things. His work primarily has been in film, but he has been a part of some studio television productions. Jared would like his future career to veer more towards film rather than TV. He is most excited to work on this project because he rarely sees scripts at Emerson that revolve around older woman, specifically one that deals with so many modern issues as mental illness and homelessness. Mario Mathiss �We may lose and we may win but we will never be here again� �Take it Easy� by Eagles Mario, is a recent business marketing graduate from Suffolk University. His role in the Homeless Ghostwriter as a producer is accounting and marketing of the film through social media platforms. The majority of projects and brand audits Mario has worked on in the past have been related to a business. Mario is very excited to work in this film production and bringing his business and marketing background to the film�s marketing strategy. Nico Carbini �If you don�t eat your meat, you can�t have any pudding!� Pink Floyd Producer/Production Coordinator Emerson College Senior Visual media arts, specifying in producing and grip and electric for the experience and also the future industry. He�s been involved since he�s transferred in 2018 as a second semester sophomore in both 48 hour film festivals, and as many video turned projects I could make. He is into editing, filming and acting but has recently started to enjoy producing. The project is enticing, he says because it deals with real life issues that seem to be completely desensitized and frowned upon with a misunderstanding of the real problem it lies under. It's a subtle light hearted narrative that will show attention in a cinematic way to mental illness. Bridget Connell �She wants to know why it is though she�s the door, she can�t be the room� �Stephanie Says� by The Velvet Underground Bridget Connell is a junior at Emerson College studying Visual Media Arts and the editor on The Homeless Ghostwriter. Bridget worked as an editor on a few BFA and BA projects in her time at Emerson, as well as editing all of her own projects and working in Emerson�s post production labs. Bridget is excited about the project because she wants to use editing to try and help accurately represent mental illness.

A Scripture Card Story As a young boy, I was drawn to comic books, role playing games, and most of all trading card games. With a small pile of cards worth hundreds of dollars, I competed in tournaments with thousands of dollars in prize money. When I devoted my life to Christ I left that world and found a new passion in practical scripture memorization. I saw the practical value of hiding God�s word in my heart and it was not long before I brought this new passion alongside an old appreciation for cards. After years of development, The Scripture Card Project was born. I now desire to point others to the Bible, where they too can equip for the struggle. Because I have personally experienced the life changing power of Scripture memorization, I have set out to equip others with tools for hiding the Word of God in the heart. One such tool is the use of scripture cards such as those found in the Open The Armoury Starter Deck. The Starter Deck contains 70 Scripture Cards from the King James Version. Equip for the struggles of daily life with the weapons and armour of the Word of God. The verses selected explore a variety of themes from the Bible such as The Gospel, Faith, Strength, Spiritual Warfare, The Law Of God and Love. I encourage each of you to hide the word in your heart and be ready to fight the good fight as a good soldier of Jesus Christ.

JourneyQuest is created by an ever-growing team of talented and passionate actors, producers, crew, and support staff. Together, we've not only produced three seasons of JourneyQuest, but the ongoing Gamers series, Dark Dungeons, Demon Hunters, Attacking the Darkness, Strowlers, and much more. While our budgets are still a fraction of what Hollywood spends, doing it right means taking care of our cast and crew. Your support is what lets us keep telling original stories that you can't find anywhere else! He is joined by Mike Waverecan, a producer from M1 Films. M1 Films joins Zombie Orpheus for production of this season. Social media coordinator Lee House will add his considerable talents to spreading the word about this campaign far and wide. Of course, it wouldn't be JourneyQuest without our phenomenal cast. This season we're thrilled to bring back Christian Doyle (Perf), Alyssa Kay (Nara), Fran Kranz (Silver Tom), Kevin Pitman (Glorion), Brian Lewis (Carrow), Emille Shimkus (Wren), Jesse Lee Keeter (Rilk), Bob Sapp (Karn), Samara Lerman (Assassin), and many more! Our shipping partners at Ship Naked will be handling warehousing and shipping for our campaign from their warehouse in the US. If we have a sufficient number of international backers, we will utilize their warehouses in Canada, Germany and Australia as well. World of Fartherall is available for your storytelling and art under ZOE's new Shared Cinematic Universe License Agreement (the SCULA). What does this mean? It's like the Open Gaming License and Creative Commons had little license babies: it's an agreement that gives you permission to create, adapt, and release your own derivative works within the world of Fartherall! Check out the web page for the full details, but the fast and dirty summary is that as long as you abide by the terms of the agreement, you have the freedom to create non-commercial AND commercial Fartherall derivatives. Make a roleplaying game. Shoot a web series. Create your art. Sell it if you want. Or give it away. It's your choice. You, the fans, have made these works possible and this new agreement helps us give back. Come and play, you're invited! Just remember to Share Alike, Transform (don't copy), provide accurate Attribution, and don't break the law. Plus, if you want your creations to become a canon part of the world, we offer a path to make them official. And a cool seal. It's pretty awesome. ZOE and JourneyQuest are committed to cultivating healthy, inclusive communities where everyone is welcome. We extend that mission to improving representation both on screen and behind the camera. We're stronger when we work together to achieve common goals! We welcome fans old and new to the community that will come together during this Kickstarter campaign and remind everyone that hate speech is not tolerated in this space. Our moderators are trained to help if you experience harassment in any ZOE-managed social arena. If we happen to miss it when it happens, please don't hesitate to reach out and let us know, so that we can take action to resolve the issue. We are always happy to assist! If you have a question that was not answered here, please send us a message through Kickstarter or via the contact form at zombieorpheus.com.

Darwinauts, designed by Chris Bryan (co-creator of the Board With Life web series, and designer of Lanterns Dice Game, Favelas and Dragon Ball Z: Perfect Cell), is a light-to-medium weight Euro-style game of tile-laying, worker placement, set collection, and action selection. During the course of the game, a player takes 2 actions on their turn, selecting from 5 possible actions; place an explorer, place a tile, replenish tiles and remove explorers, discover a species, and record a species. Whenever recording a species, a player immediately takes one of 5 possible bonus actions that allow the player to set themselves up for future turns or alter the landscape. Players continue to take turns until The Rift Tile is revealed, making the portal to the new world unstable. Once The Rift begins, players add an additional phase to their turns, taking part in dismantling the landscape they have opened up for exploration. The game comes to a close as they race to complete their tasks and return home. When the game ends, players receive prestige points for their recorded species and bonuses are earned for specializing in specific sets of species. The Darwinaut with the most points will win the game and go down in history as a pioneer in this new age of discovery. Darwinauts is a game for 1-4 players, ages 13 and up and plays in 30-45 minutes. Darwinauts comes in our bigger box size 9.5" x 7.25" x 2". The same size as Forest of Fun! We think Darwinauts is GREAT but don't just take our word for it! Check out these previews and other helpful links! (Please note that all pictures use prototype components and don't always reflect the final product.) Check out the live play-through from Board Game Spotlight: "Chaining tiles for resources, researching new species for VPs, and art from Vincent Dutrait makes this a fantastic, thinky filler with the depth of a larger game." -Derek Funkhouser, Board Game Spotlight "The amount of fun in Darwinauts is exceeded only by it's ease of learning and ability to make you want to play it again and again! The Mechanics feel familiar enough that you understand it in an instant yet deep enough to make you want to explore more options during each play." -Dan Patriss, Geek All-Stars Richard Ham of Rahdo Runs Through takes a look right here: Click the logo below for a live play-through that Jason did with Infectious Play (Jonathan Gilmour and Ian Moss) : Tantrum House shares their thoughts: Edo take a look here: "Darwinauts has a little bit of the feel of other tile-laying games like Carcassone, but the �remove explorers� action to acquire resources is new. I like how it keeps the game clock ticking, and pushes everyone inevitably toward the end. The one thing it doesn�t share with other tile-laying games is the way you can enjoy the map at the end of the game�because, by the end, there�s almost nothing left! If you like tile-laying games and far-out alien creatures, maybe you�ll want to become a Darwinaut yourself." -Jonathan Liu, GeekDad Listen to Draft Mechanic gush about Vincent's art here! "The growth and collapse of the map in each game of Darwinauts makes every decision feel vital. It�s a tight balance between efficiency and exploration enhanced by Dutrait�s excellent artwork!" -Draft Mechanic "It�s the perfect combination of tension and strategy." - Angelica, Married Meeples A video update from designer Chris Bryan about the journey to Darwinauts: And more to come... We have plans to add value (STRETCH GOALS!) to Darwinauts that we think you will really appreciate. We plan to add value by upgrading components and adding content to make this cool game even cooler! We have several stretch goals in mind and we hope to hit them all! But know that just as with our previous campaigns, we won't likely be adding more just to add more. We believe that more isn't always better, especially if it holds up production and delays delivery. That being said, we'll be listening closely to your feedback and ideas and will carefully consider all the ideas that comes our way. Here's a peek at the first few stretch goals! We'll announce more funding thresholds as we get closer to funding! If you've checked out the videos and read the reviews and still want more info, you can check out the First Edition Rules PDF RIGHT HERE! The rules are currently being edited and reformatted for clarity and to match the updated graphic design. UK and EU copies will be shipping from within the UK with VAT paid! (Currently seeking alternatives to UK shipping in case Brexit becomes an issue!) Note: International Backers outside of the UK and EU will be responsible for any import fees, brokerage or delivery surcharges, or applicable taxes that may be levied after we have shipped your package. We have learned that shipping is a costly endeavor, especially with the ever-changing rates of the US Postal Service. We must try to keep our costs as low as possible to keep our games at an appropriate price point for when they hit retail. We understand that shipping to our international friends can be cost prohibitive and that others have found creative ways to mitigate some of this cost. We have managed to work with a partner in the UK to ship our UK and EU packages to backers to help alleviate VAT charges. As a small company that mostly handles our own fulfillment, we simply pass our shipping cost on to our backers. In addition, it is our goal to continue to develop our network of awesome international partners that we have worked with to localize Darwinauts for game markets around the world. Chris Bryan is a filmmaker and game designer. You might know him from the award winning web series he co-created, Board with Life. Or you might know him from the Golden Geek Award winning D&D Podcast, Board with Life: Adventures where he plays as a Tabaxi Fighter named Prince Smith Dith Rith the 5th, (the strongest boy alive.) His previous game designs include Lanterns Dice: Lights in the Sky, Favelas, and Dragonball Z: Perfect Cell. When he isn't writing bios about himself he enjoys camping, gardening, climbing, playing drums, and spending time with his wife, 2 cats, and tiny dog in Denton, Texas. The visual world of Darwinauts was brought to life by legendary artist, Vincent Dutrait (Elysium, Lewis and Clark, New York: 1901, Rise of Augustus) who painstakingly crafted the various species by hand. Over the last 20 years, Vincent Dutrait has become one of the most beloved illustrators in the board game industry. His body of work includes art direction, graphic design, and illustration in the game industry and in children's book publishing. Vincent currently lives with his family in South Korea. You can find out more about his amazing work here. Graphic design assistance is provided by SplatteredInk's Darryl T. Jones (Into the Black Forest, Dobbers: Quest for the Key, Freshwater Fly, and the upcoming Alwaysgreen Garden). Green Couch Games was founded by Jason Kotarski to release great little games that make great big connections. Darwinauts will be their thirteenth release following Fidelitas, Best Treehouse Ever, JurassAttack!, Avalanche at Yeti Mountain, Wok on Fire, Rocky Road a la Mode, OutLawed!, Ladder 29, Before The Earth Explodes, Best Treehouse Ever: Forest of Fun, Filler, and Into The Black Forest. You can check out our other games right here on our website! Jason is also a game designer and co-host of 20 Minutes of Filler and runs the 20 Minutes of Filler Facebook Group that seeks to create a larger platform for the best games that come in small packages.
