I want to bring a new wine bar concept to life in the Atlee, VA area. Last year I was diagnosed with breast cancer and underwent chemotherapy treatment and multiple surgeries. This past year has given me so much to be grateful for and has also been a time of reflection and soul searching. I know we all struggle with "a purpose" but I truly feel this has all happened for a reason and I am meant to use my experience to help others and give back to the community. This wine bar is how I plan on accomplishing that. During treatment, I had a hard time finding places to eat out due to changes in taste and just generally didn't enjoy going out anymore. I felt people were always looking at me and judging (probably not, but you know what I mean by this). It would have been nice to have found a place in the community to gather with friends and family to enjoy a healthy meal and glass of wine (of course!) but this simply doesn't exist. I want to create this safe place. A place for people to gather and come as they are with a special menu filled with items suitable for someone who is going through treatments. It's the best way I can think to use my experience from this past year and pay it forward - benefiting the entire community. Wine with a purpose - what's better than that?! Here's where you come in. I can't do this alone. Please help me spread the word to assist in initial funding, or donate/invest if you feel so inclined . Every little bit helps! Thank you for reading, sharing, promoting - anything! All my love, Myra

Introducing "Anywhere Grill" - A Grill for Anywhere A folding bracket, and a stand, that lets you use your grill anywhere! Gas - Basic shown here - There are 3 height adjustments for any grill used on the anywhere bracket. Shown here on a 2x6 railing Electric - Basic shown here ( includes a stand for the grill ) Electric - Deluxe - includes a table - also a carry tube for both leg sets. Gas - Deluxe shown here - all items shown. Products Specifications: The Gas grill is 15 lbs 5 oz, Propane bottle is 2 lbs full, this grill measures 20 inches wide across the legs and is 17 inches overall depth, also the cooking grate is 15 x 9.5 inches (porcelain enamel coated), 145 square inches of cooking surface ( 8 hamburgers) the burner is stainless and is 5,500 BTU. The Lid latches and there is a spill resistant drip tray. The Electric grill is 16.5 inches in diameter and weighs 10 lbs 8 oz, and the electric grate is 15.5 inches in diameter (wire welded ) has 176 sq. in. of cooking space, and has a 1500 Watt UL and CUL -listed heating element. It has a twist and lock lid. Our folding bracket that mounts the grill is 8 lbs 9 oz and is 22 inches wide, 13 inches tall and 12 inches deep, materials are 3/16 thick steel powder coated, with stainless and aluminum hardware, Rubber is used to protect your railing from scratches. Grilling height has 3 settings, detailed instructions come with this unit to properly install it - and NO TOOLS are needed to adapt it to your height setting and railing size. (up to 2x6 lumber size). This unit folds and hangs in your closet and only takes the space of a coat. Two formed aluminum powder coated adapter plates (for 2x6 railing) are included with the folding assembly. The Table is epoxy coated and measures 16 inches tall, 23.5 inches wide and 17.5 inches deep. The legs are solid 1/2" aluminum round and the cross piece is stainless - all are polished there are vinyl tips on the legs to protect your flooring. Simple instructions are included and NO TOOLS are needed, this table will support over 50 lbs. and a 3" thin wall tube that holds the leg components and hangs in your closet is included. The Magnet kit includes 4 neodymium magnets with custom threaded studs giving the option of mounting the grill on the bracket assembly OR the table - with the purpose being a quick on/off solution vs the plastic knobs.

The Artist: Hello there! My name is Bethanie Lynn. In the past I have worked as a tattooist, illustrator, jewelry maker, and photographer. However, my passion is in making the art I love, on my own terms. Started in March of 2019, Gutterfly Clothing Company has gained a lot of momentum in a short time. We have been selling hundreds of shirts through Pittsburgh local events and festivals. Gutterfly vendor table at a recent event. The Mission: Now, we are raising money to expand! Currently limited to graphic tees, this fundraiser will allow Gutterfly to expand into a full clothing line. We're talking pants, socks, shoes, hoodies, jackets, sweaters, and more! Your donations will help Gutterfly increase inventory. This fundraiser will also cover the initial financing for our own garment printing equipment. No more outsourcing! Gutterfly will soon be printing our graphics in house. Why Gutterfly? What makes Gutterfly so special? I am selling a LOT of shirts. Why? With a million different graphic tees out there to choose from, I decided to do something to set my shirts apart. Obviously the artwork is pretty cool and super unique, but it's also the traditional way in which the designs are made that sets Gutterfly apart from the crowd. Each shirt starts out as a raw pencil sketch. The art is then inked and hand colored with pencils. I use Photoshop to splice in some bits from my original acrylic paintings. The final art is scanned and screened onto shirts. Also, every design I produce is offered in a limited edition printing. Each graphic is printed a MAXIMUM of 100 times and then it is retired forever. In addition, all of my tags are numbered and autographed, making every Gutterfly t-shirt a collectible artist print. Tier 1: $25 or more This selection of graphic tees are available ONLY through kickstarter rewards. Each shirt will only be made a maximum of 50 times. The more pledges at this tier, the more exclusive shirts I will add to this collection. These shirts will never be available anywhere else but here! Get them before they're gone. Super limited run. No more than 50 of these exclusive shirts will ever be printed. Tier 2: $50 or more Tier 2 pledge: I will work with backers at this tier to create original graphics based on your specifications. I will draft up to 3 images for your selection. You'll get a t shirt of your customized design and discount pricing for any future purchases featuring your graphic. Have an idea you think would be great? Have a band or other organization/club that would love to have an original t shirt design? You can use this tier to promote your own cause! You get your own original shirt, and you can get more for reduced pricing. No expiration or limits! Great gift idea! Tier 3: $100 or more Tier 3: Pledge and choose from any available original drawings and receive the corresponding t shirt, too! There is only one drawing for each of my graphic tees. First to pledge gets first choice of art Original art ranges in size and medium. When you pledge $100 or more, you will receive an email showing all available artwork for your selection. Currently 13 original pieces available. $100 pledge also includes a discount coupon on ALL future purchases, with no expiration or limits. Thanks for taking a look and supporting Gutterfly! Can't afford to back this project? You can still help by sharing this Kickstarter! If you would like to see our current inventory, check out Thegutterfly.com Follow us! Instagram: @thegutterfly facebook: thegutterfly

Dear friends, My name is Peter Slavov and I have been playing music for most of my life. Music has been good to me: I've traveled the world performing as a sideman with incredible artists like Joe Lovano, Quincy Jones and many others. I've been part of award-winning ensembles and have been featured on many celebrated recordings, one of them nominated for a Grammy award. But here's the thing: I've never recorded an album of my own. There are many reasons why that hasn't happened so far, none of them artistic...but I'll come back to those reasons later. The Music and the stories I've been writing music since I can remember and I've always felt that a good piece of music tells a story. Music, especially instrumental music, is an abstract art, and the story it tells may be different to different people. My idea for this album is to tell my stories, the ones that inspired the music and the titles: dreams, personal experiences, books that I read. Each piece on the album will be accompanied by a written little story about what inspired it and what it represents for me, the composer.Hence, Little Stories. The musicians I've chosen to convey these stories are some of my favorite players on the New York jazz scene. In addition to the traditional jazz piano trio and quartet formats, the music will feature a classical string quartet, bass clarinet, and voice. (...and back to) Why I Need Your Support As you probably already know, in the past 10-15 years the reality of the "music business" changed dramatically, especially for independent artists such as myself. In the era of Spotify, sales and revenues are down, and record labels are rarely signing new artists... But one thing remains constant: Recording and releasing an album is a very expensive endeavor. And, since I'm doing this on my own... Without a record label and its infrastructure behind me, I have to pay for: studio time, musicians' fees, mixing, mastering, publicity, printing, cover art and more...the expenses for a decent, no-compromise record are in the tens of thousands of dollars. I have, in fact already recorded some of the music (you can hear excerpts in the promotional video I've posted), but I still need your help to finish the album. I would like to invite you to be part of this project by pre-ordering the album, or choosing between the different reward options I'm offering: signed copies, lessons, sheet music, and much more. Please consider supporting and joining me to help my debut album come to life. We have one month to do this! If I don't reach the stated goal, the album won't get funded. Without your help, and in this current environment, this album wouldn't be possible. So please consider pledging if you can! Thank you! Peter Slavov

Are you the worst guitar player in the world? I mean� do you really, really suck at guitar? Because that�s the name of this book! Clearly it�s fate. You Suck at Guitar is designed to be a brutally honest, completely ridiculous, and hopefully helpful way to kickstart (see what I did there?) your terrible guitar skills into slightly-less-terrible guitar skills. You can do it! Probably? If the mysteries of music have largely remained a mystery for you - then you need this book. If even picking up a guitar makes you look completely and utterly awkward - then you need this book. If you enjoy strangers (me) making fun of you from across the world - then you need this book. The key is honesty. Music books lie to you. They tell you that you are doing great, when, in fact, you are not. We here at Sadsap Music (that�s the name of the company I started to make these books) are more honest. Your friends know you are bad at guitar. Your lovers know you are bad at guitar. Even I know you are bad at guitar. So let�s fix it. Together. But not TOO together, because there�s no way I can stomach listening to you practice. I�m Dr. Joel Pierson, and I�ve made a career out of music and mockery. I�ve worked with some artists of great repute (New York Philharmonic, Kronos Quartet), and am well steeped in pop culture from working with artists like Wayne Newton and Ke$ha and touring with My Chemical Romance and Linkin Park. I�ve performed on all seven continents (yes, including Antarctica), written music for films (including additional music for The Internship with Owen Wilson), and had a recording contract with Warner Brothers Records. I have a Ph.D in music composition, and my music has been performed by over 20 major symphony orchestras. I once sat in with the Saturday Night Live band (I didn�t actually PLAY with the SNL band, I literally just sat with them while they played, in case there was a piano-related emergency.) Once I performed Let It Be for an audience of one: Paul McCartney. But enough about me. This book is about YOU and how bad YOU are at all things musical. Joining us on our craptacular journey is illustrator Jamie Chen, who I�m relatively certain is a real human being, like us. I have no reason to question that she was born on Earth, just like you and I. And it would certainly be inappropriate to assume that as a baby she was dropped off in the Bay Area by aliens in a wicker basket. So everything is completely normal with Jamie. Believe it or not, most music publishers think that mocking their customers is a BAD idea. Huh! So I�ve turned to Kickstarter for funding. 2 years ago my first book, You Suck at Piano, raised over $80,000. I followed that campaign up with 2 additional books: You Suck at Piano 2: You Still Suck, and 20 Piano Pieces for People with Emotional Problems. And now we tackle guitar!

How We Got Here My daughter and I set out to find her a productive hobby that would give her something artistic to do with her hands that would provide her with a sense of accomplishment. When I asked her what she wanted to do, she said that she wanted to do something to raise awareness about mental health issues (especially suicide awareness and prevention). So, we went to Hobby Lobby and started looking around. The idea she settled on was making "worry stones". We bought a bag of rocks (actually glass mosaic accent gems) and a cheap rotary tool and started carving them to give to family, friends and anyone who would take them. The first ones she made had semi colons engraved in them. (For those of you who don't know, the semi colon is to support suicide awareness / prevention because it symbolizes that the author (person considering suicide) could have ended the sentence (their life), but chose to pause and move on with the sentence (their life). MyRockAndI Semi Colon Many people find the rocks to be very relaxing. Some people leave them on their night stands, others keep them in their purse, pocket or backpack. And one girl I know has 10 of them scattered all around her world so she never has to look far to find one. Personally, I keep one in my pocket at all times. Every time I reach for my keys or change, I feel the rock and remember what it stands for. Mine says "My Rock And I", and when I hold it in my hand and rub my thumb over the letters, I remember that "My Rock And I can do anything." Every person has a reason to carry a rock, and they just need to find the right rock for that reason. One day I asked my students if any of them would like a rock, and 20 of them took one. We figured that they were just being polite and doing what their Professor wanted them to do, but we were encouraged to make more. Over the next week, other students started asking about the rocks, and some even asked if we could put other things on them. So, we experimented. Here are a few of the ideas we came up with: MyRockAndI Examples As the assortment of rocks grew, so did the number of people asking for them. And as the number of people carrying them increased, so did the feedback. When school went on break, the students took their rocks with them and posted pictures on social media holding their rocks and saying "#MyRockAndI are on the beach in Florida", and things like that. It was quite an experience for Jessie. One lady picked up a Breathe rock out of the blue one day, and the next thing she knew her daughter had an anaphylactic reaction and couldn't breathe. She posted a picture on Instagram with her rock sitting on her knee as she waited for word from her daughter who was in the ICU. Thankfully, her daughter recovered and everything turned out ok. The next time she saw Jessie, she gave her a huge hug, and they both cried. Another lady was doing volunteer training at a local hospital that specializes in treating children (I won't name drop, but if you can't figure out the hospital, send me a message and I'll let you know), and the staff noticed her rock. She had a Dot Dot Dot Rock (the three dots were a shorthand that we came up with for You're Not Alone) and when she explained it to the staff, they indicated that they would like to give them to the patients and families that came through the hospital. MyRockAndI Dot Dot Dots We made 100 rocks with three dots on them and dropped them off with Social Services so that they could ensure that they got to the patients and families who needed them. When we checked back with them later, they said that everyone (staff, patients and families) loved them, and even shared a story that one of the patients who was given a rock said that her three dots stood for her three reasons for living. They invited us to come by the following week for a Mental Health Awareness Month event, and we delivered another 50 rocks to them that day. MyRockAndI Delivery While we were visiting the booths at the event, we met the Chaplain. Jessie showed her the rocks we had brought for Social Services, and she said that they were amazing. When we told her about the Breathe rock described above, she indicated that she would love to have rocks to hand out to people who were stuck in the Emergency Room and/or Surgery waiting areas. We followed up with her the next week, and she indicated that she would like to have Dot Dot Dot and Breathe rocks for the waiting rooms because she felt that those would be most appropriate for those settings. We really want to fill this request. Why We Are Doing This Over the past three years, we have learned that Jessie is an Empath (MY terminology, not a diagnosis). Whenever she meets someone, she has an uncanny ability to get inside their minds and hearts... and not just understand what they feel... she actually goes there herself. When this happens, it is sometimes very difficult to get her mood back up to the point where she can function. This project has been so wonderful because it has allowed her to do something that impacts people's lives for the good without having to fully immerse herself in their emotional state and experience what they are going through. The vast majority of the feedback she gets is for the positive things that have come about because of her rocks, and we believe that this is the most healthy thing she has done since all this started. The objective is to figure out how to expand her reach without further draining the time, energy and resources out of her (and the rest of the family). Many people have asked how much she charges for them, but the answer has always been "we aren't selling them." Some have insisted, and we have accepted some money with the strict understanding that it will all be poured into buying more rocks that we can carve for the next person. It's just hard to think about making money when these things need to be out there regardless of the profit. (I told Jessie that I need to go on that TV show where you get investors, and I should make a deal with Mr. Wonderful. HE would make sure that the product went everywhere it could possibly go, and we'd make all the money we possibly could.) School is out for the summer, and we have been having discussions about whether or not she should get a job to save up for college next year. We both see the positive aspects of her taking that step, but we understand that her taking a job will pretty much mean an end to this project. We (and a lot of other people) have seen the power and positive impact this hobby has had as far away as Colorado, Florida and New Mexico, and we have been told countless times that we "should sell these things!" I think it's time to see if that is true. This project has funded successfully, and we will use the funds to purchase more rocks, a couple better (and lighter) rotary tools, bits, and pay a fast food kitchen wage so Jessie can work at home instead of working a job that doesn't make this kind of impact on the world. Any funds remaining at that point will be spent on advertising to drive more public demand so that the business becomes self sustaining. It is our hope that Jessie will be able to build this into an ongoing part time (if not eventually full time) job that she can use to save up for college. Potential Markets The potential in this market is almost unlimited, and if we can just capture 1/2 of one percent of it, we... Yes, Mr. Cuban?? Seriously... While being in three mental health provider's offices and an amazing hospital is a great start, we know that there are therapists, counselors and psychiatrists all over this nation who could use these for their patients. There are also doctor's office, Emergency Room, ICU and Surgery waiting rooms everywhere, and these rocks could be a great comfort to the families waiting in them. MyRockAndI Size We also want to serve the Military Veterans. Statistics indicate that we are losing 22 former service members to suicide EVERY DAY. That's 22 too many. Every Day. Some will argue those statistics, and all I will say is that ONE is too many, and leave it at that. These rocks should be available to every VA mental health service provider in the nation to hand out to their patients, and should be available in every waiting room in every VA facility in the nation. Thanks to the same lady who got the first rocks into the Children's Hospital, we are now in discussions to provide rocks to one of the nation's largest youth-centric non profit organizations to provide rocks to every attendee of their upcoming national convention. This would put 800 additional rocks into circulation via their "swag bag" that each attendee will receive. (If this actually happens, we might just be back here doing another campaign.) You don't have to have mental health issues to appreciate our rocks. The majority of the people who are carrying the rocks are just normal (as normal as people get in Southeast Texas) people who enjoy having a touch stone with them as they go through their day. Other potential markets include church groups, fund raisers, fraternities / sororities, sports teams and schools. They make great reminders of upcoming dates (weddings, vacations or the end of finals week) and for reminders of past dates (anniversaries, sobriety dates, etc.) We have even made rocks for a dear friend of mine to give out at a Celebration of Life that she hosted for someone who passed away. Full (and Absolute) Disclosure It is important to note that Jessie doesn't personally engrave every single one of these stones. This is HER project, but it is also a family affair (her mom, sister and I help out to get whatever needs to be done completed). This project is important to all of us, and provides a positive outlet for some of the stress that comes with being a family with two teenaged daughters in it. I can, however, absolutely assure you that she is intimately involved in the purchase of the rocks, engraving, cleaning, packing and shipping . She crosses paths with every single rock at some point in the process, and considers every single one of them hers. She also has a couple of really close friends who have been begging to be a part of this project, but we just haven't been able to utilize them because the demand hasn't been strong enough. We would love to include them if the demand gets strong enough. There are other "Worry Stones" out there on the market. Some of them are absolutely beautiful. They come in all shapes, sizes, and composition. You can even get them with your favorite saying, bible verse, images etched / pressed / painted into them. We aren't set up to do any of those things. Every rock we do is "freehanded" with a rotary tool, so the amount of information we can get on a rock is limited, and while we can do words and flowers, our ability to do logos or images is severely limited. We also have some smaller red and blue round rocks (a little larger than a dime), but they are only large enough for a flower, semi colon or Dot Dot Dot, and we are hesitant to put a lot of those out there because they could be a choking hazard if they got in the hands of small children. MyRockAndI Designs And sometimes we mess up. Jessie likes to say that every rock is flawed... just like her, and probably just like you! While prices vary wildly depending on what is on the other people's rocks, how they are processed and what they are made of, we fully believe that our rocks are more than reasonably priced. And we guarantee that every single one of them has been done with love and a belief that it is going to impact your life when you get it. You will soon be seeing them out there on Amazon, Etsy and the others so you can do a side by side comparison. A big part of the cost of these rocks comes from shipping and handling. Due to their size and shape, they have to be put in padded "bubble envelopes" (kind of expensive) to keep from chewing up the USPS sorting machines, and the postage is also expensive. We haven't shipped many because most of them have been hand delivered, but as we get experience, we hope that we will be able to significantly decrease these costs. For now, we are operating on the "Ramen Noodle Shipping Rule" and assuming that the cost of delivering the product is going to be higher than the actual cost of the product. THIS PRODUCT IS NOT MEANT TO PREVENT, DIAGNOSE, CURE OR TREAT ANY ILLNESS OR DISEASE. Success Looks Like MyRockAndI Eating Pho For everyone who made a pledge, we will donate a rock to a deserving organization for every one you get. We are expecting a lot of volume, so we will be focusing on the rocks that we know are popular. You will have your choice of Blue Oval, Black Oval, Purple Oval, Clear Star, Tinted Star (these are only slightly colored) or a Long / Bent Rock (these are clear with a colored center kind of like a marble). There are a few other options available, so if you aren't happy with the above options, just let us know and we will try to accommodate you as best we can. We will custom engrave which ever rock you choose with whatever you want (within reason and under 12 letters), but will give the receiving organization to option to pick the type of rock they want and what is engraved on the ones we donate. Goal : $500 Thankfully, this project funded at over 233%, and the money will be used to buy a couple new hand held engravers, bits and the blank rocks needed to create all the rewards for the supporters, plus all the rocks to be delivered to the children's hospital or non profit organization for distribution to the patients and families that need a little something in their hands to calm them and remind them that they aren't alone. Thank You for Your Help and Support We understand that not everyone could make a pledge, and some people weren't even remotely interested in the product we make. But we had 40 backers to the project, and met some amazing (and inspiring) people along the way. We promise to do our best to spread the blessings you have all bestowed on us with as many others as we can. Where To Now? We will be doing periodic updates here on KickStarter as we work through order fulfillment. After that, you will be able to go to http://www.myrockandi.com to order more rocks or find the links to our social media outlets. (Please know that the website may be up and down over the next couple of weeks as we build out an online store and work out the kinks that always come with that.)

Hello, I am very excited to share with you The Sound Bath Suite! 20 minutes of acoustic soundscapes for healing, meditation, relaxation, and sleep. The gongs, singing bowls, chimes and other instruments were beautifully recorded at the Bunker Studio in Brooklyn New York and mixed by Nolan Thies. However, I need your help to get this finished! It's going to cost 600$ for mastering (so that it sounds good on whatever device you're listening on) plus artwork. Anything you can give is greatly appreciated. Thank you in advance ! ! The sounds and practices around these instruments have truly helped me find hope, healing and peace. They have helped me to tune into the aliveness and richness of life's music. I sincerely hope that the Sound Bath Suite can help others in need of these vibrations. -Alex Listening back at Bunker Studios

My name is Nichole and I have been obsessed with makeup since I was 6 years old. One of my earliest memories was sitting in front of my young, cool aunt's vanity mirror and "coloring" everything in my path with lipstick. I have worked with, tested, and used thousands of products since. I have created looks for brides, stage productions, movies, and runways. I have worked as a beauty educator across the US. Now, it's time for me to create. The Lipstick Apocalypse will be a line designed for anyone who wants to wear makeup. I stand behind the magic and power makeup can bring and I will stand behind anyone who wants a piece of that magic for themselves. I also pledge to use responsibly sourced ingredients and recyclable packaging. And animal testing? Absolutely not. This line will be 100% cruelty-free. That said, this line is meant for fun. Makeup shouldn't always be too serious. Life is too short for un-fun lipstick! The line will start with lip products but will expand to other areas (eyeshadow palettes, merch, etc) as it grows. I am working on formulations now and hammering down some killer recipes. I am also investigating packaging, website development, and shipping needs. Your donations will help me make the best decisions for my company and my customers. Thank you for considering the potential of The Lipstick Apocalypse. I genuinely appreciate your support.

About The Game Project Asylum is a horror game taking place in an asylum. For 8 nights and 7 days you play as the ex-marine, who due to some personal reasons, is trapped with in the place. The game will have two main phases divided up by a day/night cycle, similar to Silent Hill. During the day time the player can interact with other patients, gather supplies, and look for possible means to escape. During the night phases the player will be forced to fight monsters, or hide to conserve health and materials. The actions in the night phase will have an immediate effect on the daytime cycle with the monster's counter parts being removed form the game in a body bag. The game is heavily focused on psychological horror with little emphasis on gore. Screenshots of the alpha build: Stretch Goals:

While housesitting for his sister Ava, Greg Shen is kidnapped and dragged into the forest. Facing certain death, he's rescued at the last minute by a talking dog named Molly. FOR MOLLY is a fantasy comic that takes place in modern New Jersey. It�s got action and adventure, a rogue cop wielding a sword, a pack of feral talking dogs, and hidden cabals of human cultists that are both unpredictable and dangerous. Click the logo above to read FOR MOLLY chapter one for free! The events of chapter one brought Greg and Molly together. But they'll have to learn to trust each other if they're going to survive. Chapter two begins with Greg and Molly in the forest. They escaped capture the previous night and now they're headed to the Sanctum Free Zone to rescue Greg's sister Ava. Meanwhile, Greg's older sister Iris crosses paths with Officer Edgebrook, who is more than what he seems. And in the forest, an unexpected encounter with Blachjet and his pack of feral talking dogs forces Molly into a dangerous confrontation. FOR MOLLY chapter two continues to explore themes like guilt, abandonment and loyalty as Greg and Molly's unlikely friendship is tested on every step of their journey. We're excited to offer the following rewards tiers to donors! The majority of the money raised ($4,350) goes to artist Benjamin Sawyer, for creating the amazing pages and concept artwork! The rest will be used for creating the campaign rewards, printing the comic, and the Kickstarter fees. Some figures are approximate because the final number will depend on amount of total backers. Molly's past comes back to haunt her in chapter two, and a choice that she makes puts both her and Greg in jeopardy. Greg learns more about his new traveling companion, and their relationship gets off to a rocky start. Blachjet is the leader of a pack of feral dogs. He's canny, ruthless, and has a short temper. Linwood Schneider is an "Advocate" in the New Jersey forest. He keeps the peace between the humans and dogs. Echo is an aggressive young hothead in Blachjet's pack. He's exactly the kind of trouble that Greg and Molly were hoping to avoid. Written by GABE CHENG Gabe has been writing his whole life, but FOR MOLLY is his first comic. He left a successful career as a high school teacher and moved to Los Angeles to pursue his passion for writing and working in entertainment. He�s an avid pizza enthusiast, he's surprisingly good at pub trivia and he finds inspiration from the films of Kevin Smith and the novels of Neil Gaiman. He hosts a weekly Futurama fan podcast called Another Lousy Millennium and writes comic book reviews for Fanbase Press. Follow him on Instagram - Facebook - Twitter - YouTube Art by BENJAMIN SAWYER Ben is a lifelong artist and pop culture geek. He�s a professional illustrator, comic artist, storyteller, and university professor. He loves his dogs, motorcycles, craft beer, video games, and his partner Kim. Check out his work on his website and @sketchsawyer on social media. The history books call it a house of horrors. A testament to the true depravity that inhabits the souls of man. The little girl who escaped the demonic forces which occupied the LaLaurie New Orleans mansion on a sunny day in 1833, though, called it something else: the site of a rebirth. The little girl swore on that day that she would never be anyone else�s victim, and so began a centuries long campaign of bloody revenge. The Retribution Cabal (RC) was born, protecting only those descendants of America�s original sin. Now on a cyberpunk stage where technological wonders leave no place for creatures of legend, the LaLauries and their denizens reappear, continuing their blood-soaked quest for obtaining ultimate power. Time will tell if the remaining members of the fractured Cabal can stand as the bulwark between humanity and the rising hordes of darkness. "Illuminati does creative design for monsters and realistic looking characters, he blends in backgrounds and cityscapes with dynamic action scenes and flowing panels." Comicbooked.com "Great comic, great art, excellent attention to detail. As expected, our appetite for the next issue keeps growing." Akachicomics.com "It has been so long since a book about monsters and the threat they pose has been done in a way that is genuinely creepy and filled with the kind of suspense that grabs the readers� attention, imagination and doesn�t let up for a moment." Readingwithaflightring.com LAYLA A hired gun, Layla lives her life fast and loose. Doesn�t answer to anyone and shirks responsibility. Drafted for the Retoch Frontier Wars, she was one of the more talented recruits, but didn�t like the stifling/ authoritative environment of the military. Added to that, she questioned the Manifest Destiny rhetoric of Earth�s forces and was promptly kicked out. With all the training that she�d received, and no shortage of crap on Earth to weed through, she became a mercenary for hire. She finds herself reluctantly pulled into the shadowy war of The Retribution Cabal. TRAVIS An operative of the Retribution Cabal. A recent recruit in the organizations fight against against the demonic/ supernatural hordes which exist back home Earth. Travis is a gifted pilot, and trained in various forms of hand to hand combat, and adept at using a variety of high tech weaponry. Travis is a veteran of the Retoch Frontier Wars which took place with humanity�s push to the farthest reaches of the universe. He was recruited by Prya when he got back home to join the ranks of The Retribution Cabal. PRYA A ranking member of the Retribution Cabal. Even in a world of the far-flung future The Retribution Cabal has still found itself busy fighting for the disenfranchised in a world beset by the terrors that go bump in the night. Prya is at the forefront of this fight, being tasked to recruit the best and brightest to join the ranks of a failing organization. LIANA MATTHEWS The current head of The Retribution Cabal. She�s made it her goal to continue the fight of the fractured organization, by any means necessary. THE LaLAURIES History tells of the horrors which this couple meted out in a French Quarter mansion. The Retribution Cabal has made it its goal to ensure that the couple is wiped from existence, but the LaLaurie�s have always been able to stay one step ahead of the group.

We are a traditional African dance company with roots in the Congo bringing Central African culture to New York City. We can't do it without your help! What is the Fourth Annual Mfouambila Kongo Dance Conference? The 2019 Mfouambila Kongo Dance Conference, Friday, July 12 to Sunday, July 14, is the fourth annual celebration of African dance and music from Central Africa, presented by the Mfouambila Kongo Dance Company. Now is your chance to join the tradition! Three days of instruction provided by masters of traditional Congolese and other forms of African dance in NYC. We are assembling teachers from the top of their fields and from all over the world to pass on the spirit and skills they have cultivated through their craft over the course of their careers. The conference kicks off with specialized small group workshops where participants learn from the masters themselves the finer points of African dance. The weekend ends with a special finale performance created by the Mfouambila Kongo Dance Company, specially directed and designed by company director, Andoche Loubaki. It's a weekend of excitement from the soul of the Congo to the streets of New York. The Schedule of Classes: FRIDAY, JULY 12, 2019 3:00 PM - Ngoma Drum Class; Instructor: TEBER MILANDOU 5:00 - 6:00 PM - Traditional Congolese Dance; Instructor: TITOS SOMPA 6:30 - 7:50 PM - Traditional Congolese Dance; Instructor: ANTOINETTE YELESSA SATURDAY, JULY 13, 2019 10:00 - 11:20 AM - Traditional Congolese Dance; Instructor: ANDOCHE LOUBAKI 11:30 AM - 12:50 PM - Traditional Congolese Dance; Instructor: MUISI KONGO 1:00 - 2:20 PM - Afro Dance (Ndombolo w/hip hop); Instructor: ANGEL KABA 2:20 - 3:00 PM - LUNCH BREAK 3:00 - 4:20 PM - Traditional Congolese Dance; Instructor: TITOS SOMPA 4:30 - 5:50 PM - Soukous Dance; Instructor: NANA LOUBAYI 6:00 - 7:30 PM - Traditional Congolese Dance; Instructor: MABIBA BAEGNE SUNDAY, JULY 14, 2019 10:00 - 11:20 AM - Traditional Congolese Dance; Instructor: TITOS SOMPA 11:30 AM - 12:50 PM - Traditional Congolese Dance; Instructor: MUISI KONGO 1:00 - 2:20 PM - Mutashi Live; Instructor: Antoinette Yelessa 2:30 - 3:20 PM - Traditional Congolese; Instructor: Nano Loubayi 3:30 - 5:00 PM - Traditional Congolese; Instructor: Mabiba Baegne 6:30 - 8:00 PM - MFOUAMBILA KONGO GRAND FINALE PERFORMANCE You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00 Sneak peek at rehearsal for "Wenga"! The company performs courtesy of Brooklyn Music School at Borough Beats in Brooklyn! More fun in the sun! You had to be there! Presenters Andoche Loubaki (Host) Artistic Director Andoche Loubaki � a master of Congolese dance and drumming from Brazzaville Congo with over 30 years of drumming and dance experience. Andoche began his dance career in 1986 with the �Muesi Modern Damce Company,� directed by Celestin Kauset. He later performed as a member of the Ballet Mfouambilia, and then served as cofounder and choreographer of the Tourbillon Sonnore Percussion and Dance Company with Co-Director Gerve L�autre. Loubaki has performed at the United Nations, the Bronx Museum, and various locations throughout Europe, Africa, and North and South America for a variety of audiences. In 2015 he founded Mfouambila Kongo Dance Company and continues to build the tradition of Congolese music and culture in New York. Titos Sompa Originating from Brazzaville in the Congo, Titos Sompa is a charismatic and extraordinarily gifted performing artist, teacher, and healer. He inspires artists, students and audiences with his African cultural orientation that holistically integrates music, dance, singing, folklore and spirituality. Sompa arrived in America from Paris, where he taught music and dance and toured Europe with his band, Les Echos Noir. Mr. Sompa was the first to introduce the earthly and fluid Congolese style of simultaneous dancing and singing to American audiences. In the early 1970�s, he and lead drummer, Coster Massamba, brought Congolese culture to the New York artistic scene. In addition to dancing, Mr. Sompa is also a renowned choreographer and musician, as well as a master Congolese drummer, percussionist, and kalimba player. Mr. Sompa utilizes his multiple talents to make known and keep alive Congolese musical and cultural traditions the Western world. Mabiba Baegne Mabiba Baegne is an internationally acclaimed dancer, dance teacher and choreographer of traditional and contemporary African Dance. She was born in Congo Brazzaville and was initiated into dancing by her grandparents at the age of eight. In addition to her Congolese dancing, Mabiba has studied West African dundun drumming with master drummer Famoudou Konate in Guinea. She was the first woman to teach this form in the United States. She is also an acclaimed singer and has toured and recorded with Salif Keita, master drummer Mamady Keita and Samba Ngo. Muisi Kongo Muisi-kongo Malonga is a talented dancer, choreographer and instructor deeply rooted in the traditions of Central Africa. As one of the next generation�s foremost keepers of Congolese cultural arts forms, she has passionately sought to preserve Congolese culture through her leadership of Fua Dia Congo, a 35-year old performing arts organization. Her writing, singing, original compositions and choreography have all converged in the telling of the tale of Kimpa Vita, a 17th century Kongolese prophet and martyr. �Kimpa Vita!�, Malonga�s first solo work, is described as a chore-opera, where music and movement merge to convey the powerful story of a woman often described as the Kongolese Joan of Arc. Nano Loubayi Promoting Congolese dance is the focus of Nano Loubayi, dance teacher, choreographer and director of Bitezo Bia Kongo, his Congolese African dance company. Loubayi lives in Santa Cruz, California, and has participated in and has organized multiple-day dance conferences featuring dance masters from across the African diaspora. He performs throughout the Monterey Peninsula and Bay Area as a member of several ethnic dance collaboratives. Antoinette Yelessa Antoinette Yelessa is a Congolese dancer and instructor with many years dancing and performing. She brings years of professional performance on stage dancing with Diblo Dibala�s Congolese powerhouse groups Loteko and then Matchatcha. Teber Milandou Teber is a Master Percussionist and dancer from Brazzaville, Congo. He is the founder of Tanbours Sans Frontieres which means "drums without borders." He also spent four years in Congo�s National Ballet before drumming in Benin, Burkina Faso, Mali and Senegal. His mission is to preserve traditional Congolese rhythms which are at risk of being lost due to globalization.

Kickstarter is �all or nothing,� so if we reach the goal, I'll be able to produce and offer all three designs of summer witches! If we don't, I won't, as I cannot afford it on my own. ABOUT HEX: Music originally brought founders Dan Maravilla and Trent Valladares together as teenagers living in Southern California. Musicians and band-mates they perfected their craft working their way up the local club scene in Los Angeles. Their music style was eclectic - always seeking to create what was not the norm. Their creativity did not stop with sound, however. Both talented visual artists, they would outfit concerts into total sensory experiences by creating and performing original music as well as transforming prestigious concert venues with all-encompassing art installations - to provide a total experience. Clothing and fashion were also on the boys� radar, often repurposing and making their own clothing and accessories. After years in the music and art scene, they decided to launch a small, startup, family fashion business. Early collections gained attention from many world-renowned brands and they started designing and manufacturing for many established labels. This provided valuable opportunities to see inside many great companies and eventually give them the knowledge to be able to launch their own successful brand. Enter HEX. HEX is a creative community that draws from Dan and Trent's years of experience in fashion, music, and art and channels it to equip the next generation of creators through products that empower everyone to explore the outer limits of their potential. Everything HEX does is built on the foundation of its 3 core values of Innovation, Authenticity, and Community.

Dual Wield Studio is a two-person team built on one goal: make things we love for the things we love. We want to create merchandise we're excited for, working with independent artists we're fans of, and support our communities in every way we can while doing so! We have partnered with Little Foolery artist Jayd A�t-Kaci to create a truly unique and beautiful collection of zodiac pins. Jayd is a critically acclaimed and accomplished artist, co-creator of Sfeer Theory and many other works. Every purchase from the Dual Wield Studio: Zodiac Pin Collection will directly benefit the artist and help us continue to collaborate on projects like this one. If we manage to reach $11,000 in funding, we will be offering the Zodiac Pin Collection as black & gold variants. Rather than unlocking each one individually, all 12 variants will unlock and become available for backers once we reach our $11,000 stretch goal! Learn more about the thought process behind each zodiac pin's design below as Jayd gives a short introduction to each sign and the symbolism behind her work. The sizing of each enamel pin varies from 1.1" to 1.5". The ram charges. Aries is a sign of vivacity, existence and life. Cogito ergo sum � "I think, therefore I am." It is not interested in anything other than its birth, and its purpose is nothing more than to live. It wants to experience, to interact, to engage, to pursue. For what doesn't matter, as long as the flames keep being stoked. As such, the pin was designed to be a wild flame and constantly facing forward � even the fur of the ram or its horns seem to be angled in the way of the flame that consumes it. The bull has been worshiped religiously across many cultures and mythologies, of which many are ascribed to Taurus. As a nod to the religious importance, the pin was designed with the aesthetic of a fresco. Flowers and sunshine surround Taurus, as this is the sign that "stops to smell the roses" � in other words, taking pleasure in life. It radiates serenity and peace, because, in spite of it being the sign of value and attachments, Taurus' priority is achieving a comfortable state of perpetual zen. The twins are ascribed to Pollux and Castor � one brother human, one brother divine. Since Gemini rules hands, the pin was designed with the focal point, the silhouette of the hands evoking the Sistine Chapel's Creation of Adam to show the relationship of heaven and earth, though it's hard to know which hand belongs to which brother, if they are reaching to touch or pulling away, or if the vacancy in the middle is a window to a different way of thinking or an empty purpose. The crab wants nothing more than to be protected and loved. The feeling of safety is deeply important to Cancer, and so it shells itself in. The crescent of the moon � the luminary that rules the sign of Cancer � is wrapped around the crab like a protective blanket against the dark, and it curls its pincers to itself not for protection but for comfort. Its rich inner world is only accessible to those who want to hug Cancer tighter than it hugs itself. You hear the lion roar, and you take notice when it does. This pin was designed with one word in mind: LOUD! The mane is the flame that lights itself and its world, and the rays of the sun protrude like an exclamation. At the same time, the sun is still a star, and Leo knows it is a star. It is the most golden pin of the set, as Leo announces itself in its own spotlight with great pride. But, as fierce as the Lion is, the effects that define it is almost cartoonishly dramatic, showing its loudness is for the purpose of entertainment and fun. Virgo is depicted as a maiden of the harvest accompanied by a dove, so for the design I merged them into an angel � of which Virgo aspires to be, a lot of the time. To be an angel means to be a divine tool, symbolic of a greater standard, perfected by service and purpose. Virgo wants to be useful and productive, ensuring a rich harvest for itself and wanting to inspire others to achieve the same. Even meeting Virgo's expectations halfway isn't in vain... you may never meet Virgo's standards, but if you try to even a little you'll be better than you were before. Libra is the air sign that introduces morality... Libra asks what is good and bad, what is right and wrong, what is fair and unfair. It is the sign that represents justice because it weighs the pros and the cons of all things, from all angles, from all perspectives. It does not like dispensing judgement until the scales have weighed evenly, and the verdict is perfectly balanced, accounting for all information and arguments. The pin's design has the scales balanced from an orb that looks like an eye � an eye that you can decide is either blind, or all-seeing. Scorpio is actually defined by its several phases, often condensed to three representations: the scorpion, the eagle, and the phoenix. The mythology has it that Scorpio evolves through all three, continuously, starting as a venomous arachnid, to a liberated bird of prey, to a legendary creature that is doomed to burn itself into nothing and rise again to do it all over. In the pin design, the scorpion is fanned as though spreading its wings, evoking the silhouette of a bird in flight. The colors start dark and black at the bottom, and grows in contrast until it reaches a spiritual discovery, a truth, and transforms. The centaur that always shoots for the impossible. Sagittarius is represented here as an archer whose bow makes up of the world itself. Even though the night sky is full of stars, Sagittarius isn't satisfied with being a star among them, it wants something more, though what is "more" it can't say. It takes hold of the edges of the very sky littered with the legends that came before it, pulls, and releases an arrow beyond what it can see and what we can imagine. The greatest adventure is one even Sagittarius itself doesn't know can be had. The sea-goat here is rigid, black, and intimidating. It's poised aggressively, though it is hard to know if it looking for a challenge or presenting itself as the challenge. The pin design is meant to evoke a number of things: is it a resident of the sea it occupies, or is it the ocean itself? Is it ambitious enough to climb a mountain, or is it the mountain itself? The answer is all the above, really. Capricorn makes the world to live out as king in it. The legend associated with Aquarius is one of Ganymede, a man so beautiful he was whisked away by Zeus disguised as an eagle, and was then made to be the wine-bearer to the Gods. The pin pays symbolic nod to that legend: a figure so beautiful it is hard to know who or what they are in terms of gender, age, or if they are even human � if any of that even matters, that is. They have the wings of heaven carrying them and their world. Their hair falls as water into the vase they hold, symbolizing the nectar of the gods and the well of knowledge. Aquarius rebels against what is defined, and asks us to drink so that we can rebel as well. The sign that represents cycle itself � it is the beginning and end, life and death, creation and destruction, the masculine and the feminine, the active and the passive, and so on. The revolving twin fish represent the dual natures of life, whatever those dual natures are, and how we're both trapped and set free by them at different points in time or growth. The pin is designed to evoke the yin and the yang, opposing natures that compliment and contrast and never stay still, but can only be whole and complete together. Pin production will take place from August to September, and we expect backer rewards to ship out from September to October. If at any point we run into any delays, we will be sure to communicate them right away. Stay in touch and keep up with the latest updates by following us below! Twitter: @DualWieldStudio Instagram: @DualWieldStudio Newsletter: Dual Wield Studio You can also support the artist by checking out Jayd's BigCartel, InPrint and Mastodon!

The ONITIS 45 is the first cooler on the market to provide exceptional durability and ice retention without the extra weight or high price tag that Roto-molded coolers come with. Our team has developed an entirely new way to manufacture coolers through utilizing a proprietary spray that was originally used to make the Pentagon blast resistant! Look All Too Familiar? The ONITIS weighs less than 10 pounds, so you can say goodbye to the days of needing two people to get your drinks down to the dock! Fun fact: The cooler derives its name from a genus of super beetle that has a higher strength to weight ratio than any other living creature on this planet. Thus, we thought the name ONITIS was perfect. Both sides of the lid can lock into place. So once you're ready to get the party started, you can flip the lid over and utilize the cup holders and cutting board. Strength Test: We used a lift to lower a 5,000 pound jeep onto the coolers. Overkill? Maybe. Ice Test: The following test was conducted during a week where average daily temperatures were over 90�F. Note: The particular prototype used was made of a modeling foam that has a weaker R value than the foam that will be used in our manufacturing run. In other words, the prototypes are less insulative than the final product. Arrow Test: For this test, a compound bow that fires arrows at over 300 feet per second was used. We decided to shoot a Roto-molded cooler as well for a comparison. After shooting both lids and side walls, the stopping power of the coating was clear. The ONITIS lid was able to stop the arrow dead in its tracks, while the arrow passed through the lid of the Roto-molded cooler. **Go to bottom of page for more tests** The dimensions and unique manufacturing process used ensure that the ONITIS never tips over. We know mama says not to compare... But taking a peak can't hurt. The harness is made out of high strength nylon webbing and is used as a way to fasten the lid down. Keep in mind, our lid locks into place without the security straps, but the straps are useful whenever the lid needs to be completely secured (i.e. if the cooler is barreling down the river, or strapped to the back of a four wheeler). The Military Grade buckles allow for a quick release of the straps whenever they are no longer needed. How Much Can It Hold? After playing around with the dimensions and rounding off the interior edges, we were able to get our final design to hold 64 cans with 20 pounds of ice. Our manufacturing partners are located right here in Georgia. From the molding of the cooler bases, to the application of the proprietary spray, these coolers are 100% born in the USA. The Harnesses are sewn at another facility in Georgia, so the final product will be assembled and shipped out from our distribution center in Atlanta. We've spent over a year running through trial production runs and we are ready to hit the ground running! You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00 Impact Test: A 5 gallon bucket filled with water weighs about 40 pounds. Dropped from 20ft, that generates over 1,000 pounds of force. You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00 The result was a dented corner in the bucket, but the cooler stood strong. Drop Test: Approximately a 25 foot drop onto concrete. The impact of hitting the concrete resulted in two minor indentions and a scratched surface on one of the buckles (circled in red). Water Test: OK, maybe this one was purely for our enjoyment.

Play Replay with sound Play with sound 00:00 00:00 All Star Version Base Roll is a 2-4 player baseball/softball dice and card game created by Freddie Barlico baserollgame@gmail.com and designed by John Pelico III, www.johnpelicoiii.com. There are two versions of Base Roll you can choose from. If you like to play games at home and want a more authentic feel of the game of baseball you'll want the board. Those that like smaller sized games, take the version with Base Cards. Below are both examples. Same Game, different sizes. All levels Of game play are in both versions. There are three levels of play: Rookie, Professional, and All-Star. The Rookie level uses only dice and player cards. Professional level adds Coach Calls and All Star adds a lineup and more Coach Call usage. The layers of strategy add with each level as cards you play will influence the outcome of rolls. You can bunt, steal, block home runs and try for the cycle. Below is a short tutorial on the most basic level of play Rookie Version setup All Star with Lineup Version CONTENTS (5.5x5.5in matte box) 86 cards-54 player, 32 action (adding hall of fame pack increases number of cards) Board- 4 base cards or board depending on your version 6 dice score pad base card, player deck, coach's calls, player deck OBJECTIVE Each team uses three dice to roll combinations that move their players around four bases to score points. Using your dice and cards, you can affect rolls and block potential base hits, bunts, and even home runs. BOARD The board consists of 4 total bases, starting with Home, and then First, Second, and Third, respectively (counterclockwise). ROOKIE LEVEL (Quick Play) to learn more in depth play please visit www.baserollgame.com Place the four white base cards. Home being the bottom center and starting counter clockwise in a diamond shape first, second, third. Shuffle all decks separately and place the green action cards aside. Pick your Team Deck and place each deck facing down. Each team also chooses 3 Green action cards and will use More during the game. HOW TO PLAY (Quick Play) When a player is up, draw a card from your deck and place them on home. Read the rules on each card and your rolls will be affected by that player. Please read Offensive and Defensive rules for more. You will have the chance to play many action cards that affect each roll. If a player gets an out or returns home after a roll. place them in a discard pile. When players are left on base and a team records its third out,The players on base will be discarded before the player that was up. If you play your entire deck simply flip over your discard pile and start again. SCORING and Winning When a player has moved around all the bases and returns to home they have scored a run. The team with the highest amount of runs after 7 innings is the winner. If the score is tied after the 7th, the game continues into extra innings. If the Visitors are winning in the last inning and the Home team cant score the visitors win. Home team always rolls in the last inning. This game is very easy to learn if you already know baseball or softball but if you don't its still easy once you have the full instructions in front of you. If You would like to learn the full version with more levels of game play please visit www.baserollgame.com HALL OF FAME DECK Hall of Fame Deck PLEDGE TIERS $20 Rookie Level- 5.5X5.5 inch matte box with Full game, score card, 6 dice, and a marker. $25 Professional- same as rookie level, Hall of Fame pack included $40 All Star- 10x10 box, board for more authentic game play, Hall of Fame Pack $50 Legend- Both Boxes included, Hall of Fame pack, White dotted dice Rewards �2018 Diletostra. All rights reserved. www.baserollgame.com Thank you for the taking the time to look at the game. Design Inquiries- John Pelico III. www.johnpelicoiii.com Photo Inquiries- Dino Aranda https://dino-aranda.squarespace.com/contact/ Any game questions please contact baserollgame@gmail or @baserollgame on instagram you can play while you wait
