Earlier this year, our Original Sketchmark raised over 1700% of our initial goal on Kickstarter as "The bookmark stencil for everyone." Now, we're back with the newest addition to the Sketchmark family! The Original Sketchmark was designed for journalers, designers, architects and artists alike. After receiving input from our backers, we created an expansion card with a focus on bullet journalers. Our new design features 3 journal specific tools to take your bullet journaling up a notch. Use the BUJO Expansion Card by itself or combine it with the Original Sketchmark for even more creative possibilities! After packing the Original Sketchmark with over 15 features, we designed the Bullet Journal Expansion Card to complement it, not replace it! We built a card with 3 bullet journal specific features that fit into a small, compact design. Paired with the features of the Original Sketchmark, the possibilities for your journaling are endless! The alphabet stencils were carefully designed to make it easy for you to add titles, dates, and more to your bullet journal! Our unique punctuation stencil allows you to easily create question marks, exclamation points, and periods. The stencils are designed to fit within two vertical rows of a 5mm x 5mm grid journal. Use the monthly tracker to keep track of all your habits! Track everything from your workouts, eating habits, sleep schedule, spending, and much more! Our unique design gives you plenty of versatility in creating your own trackers. Use the card as a stencil to create boxes for each day or use the card as a guide to quickly number your days in perfectly spaced 5mm x 5mm boxes. Unlike most stencils, we included 2 title boxes for more options! You can create amazing titles featuring letters and symbols when you use the alignment guides above the title boxes! Title alignment points make it easy to add icons and titles above your calendars. When drawing a title box, simply stop at one of the 3 marking points to include a 1, 2, or 3 letter title. For example, to add "JUN" to represent JUNE on your calendar, stop tracing at the alignment point with 3 dots to have the perfect spacing to fit your 3 letter title. A single icon fits perfectly when you stop at the alignment point with a single dot above it. Add some character to your bullet journal with our 10 journal icons! We included 7 basic icons that can be used to represent anything you want! We also included 3 journaling specific icons that can take on a few different meanings of their own. Each icon is designed to fit within a 10mm x 10mm box. Just like the Original, the Sketchmark Expansion Card doubles as a bookmark! Sketchmark�s bookmark cutout keeps your Sketchmark close to your journal at all times. Use it to mark your page in your journal, textbook, or book! Sketchmark isn't just for journaling. Use it as your primary bookmark to quickly underline key passages or use the journal icons to take notes and star, check or otherwise mark your book or textbook! Pair the Sketchmark BUJO Expansion Card with the Original Sketchmark! Launched in January, our original card has over 15 tools for journaling, designing and sketching. After raising over 1700% of our initial goal, input from our Original Sketchmark customers helped us bring the BUJO Expansion Card to life! We designed the BUJO Expansion card to complement the Original Sketchmark, not replace it! The features of both cards are designed to work together to give you endless possibilities in creating your journal. Watch our first Kickstarter video below to see all of the Original Sketchmark's features! Add-ons will be available following the campaign through Backerkit! Sketchmark's possibilities are endless! Check out a few samples of what is possible with Sketchmark and the Bullet Journal Expansion Card below! Get inspired by other bullet journalers by following popular hashtags on social media! #BUJO, #bulletjournal, #bulletjournaling

FrisBeer Kickstarter Campaign THE GAME We are ROVE Sports, and we LOVE outdoor games.Out of all of the games, challenges, sports, and battles.There was one that reigned supreme for us. It had been known by many names throughout the globe: Poles, Beersbee, Polish Horseshoes, Frisknock. Many different names, several variations of rules, different scoring systems and general gameplay guidelines that are usually unique to the owner of that particular set or the person who taught them how to play. Whatever the case, there has never been one official set that has unified all the different ways to play, all the different names it has been called, and eliminate the endless arguments of �my rules are the right rules� or �house rules clearly state...� until now! We are proud to present to you, the one and only, FrisBeer! No more: PVC pipes, Ski poles, tiki torches, tall lamps, lacrosse sticks, or fence posts For the last 2 years we have been perfecting our ideal depiction of how this game would be best enjoyed. It was very important for us to not only design a set that is �built-to-last but one that will be easy to set up, break down, stow and transport, aesthetically pleasing, and stupid simple. With efficiency, quality, and portability in mind, we believe that we have designed the most durable and user-friendly game that FrisBeer players everywhere will be proud to play. Every set contains: Two Custom collapsable poles with connectors Two plastic weighted cans Frisbee, designed to professional specifications Digging tool Ultra durable carry-bag The Poles: Both FrisBeer poles included in each set stand 5-feet tall, and are broken down into 3 pieces with 2 smaller connecting pieces holding them together. Our injected molded pipe is far stronger and more durable than your standard section-40 Industrial PVC which eliminates the worry of the poles getting damaged, bent or broken while it is thrown in the trunk of your vehicle along with all the rest of your belongings. The circumference of each pole was designed to the exact width of the bottom of any standard aluminum can which will allow your designated game can to rest comfortably on top of the pole. The Cans: We have spent countless hours engineering the perfect hard plastic mold of our official FrisBeer Cans that come with each set. We designed our game cans to match the specifications of the perfect size and weight of a beverage can filled about 1/2 up with sand. The can also matches the physical size characteristics of a standard aluminum can ensuring that if the cans become lost or stolen, any standard aluminum can of ay kind may serve as a substitute while ensuring the consistency of gameplay. ~ NO GLASS! We at ROVE Sports care very strongly for our environment and we saw it as our role to urge our players as well as fellow outdoor activists, to avoid using glass products to play this game or any other outdoor game in public areas. We designed the poles to fit any CAN in hopes that FrisBeer may act as just one more reminder to keep Glass out of our beaches and parks. Mahalo That's right. ANY. CAN. FITS. The Disc: We have been huge fans of every kind of disc sport out there for as long as we have been able to throw one. Disc golf, Ultimate, or even just for the �hey go long� game of catch. With that being said, we would not allow anything other than a 175 gram, USA Ultimate Disc League approved Tournament Official Size & Weight disc with our sets. Youre welcome. The Auger: You may be asking yourself, �What if i dont live near a beach?� �How will I be able to play if I cannot easily penetrate the pole into the ground?� We have found ourselves in these situations as well and we included a simple solution with our sets. If you have ever taken a beach umbrella to the park with you for shade and comfort, you would know that they usually come equipped with a drill-like tool attached to the bottom of it called an auger making it easy to penetrate the ground and provide a secure fitting to hold down your umbrella. We took this concept and have designed a lightweight and very easy-to-use auger that we include in each of our sets that creates the perfect size hole to secure the poles in any kind of penetrable surface. The Bag: One of the main issues that we felt was most important to tackle with FrisBeer, was portability. We designed a quality drawstring bag, big enough to fit all of the items included in the set as well as enough room for you to consolidate some of your other items you might be carrying with you. The double-stitch lining, and reinforced nylon interior of our bag ensures that it can take a beating and it will not lose its composure or undergo breaches or tears easily. 1. Easy Set Up 2. Fast Breakdown 3. Pack it in, and play it anywhere Mahalo (Thank-You) Koozie ($5+) Get Access to our FAQ, and Stay in the loop A permanent place in our hearts, as an early supporter Limited Edition Exclusive "Mahalo" Beer Koozie Super Early Bird ($40) ONE Complete Set: Two poles with connectors Two plastic weighted cans Frisbee, designed to professional specifications Digging tool Ultra durable carry-bag FrisBeer Friend ($45) ONE Complete Set: Two poles with connectors Two plastic weighted cans Frisbee, designed to professional specifications Digging tool Ultra durable carry-bag FrisBeer Fanatic ($85) TWO complete sets each containing: Two poles with connectors Two plastic weighted cans Frisbee, designed to professional specifications Digging tool Ultra durable carry-bag FrisBeer Family ($160) FOUR complete sets each containing: Two poles with connectors Two plastic weighted cans Frisbee, designed to professional specifications Digging tool Ultra durable carry-bag Extra Swag MAUI ADVENTURE OF A LIFETIME FOR TWO AND BEACH PARTY! ($10,000) Kihei, Hawaii You and a friend will Join co-founder Dan on a one-of-a-kind Maui Jeep Tour adventure of a lifetime. As a long time resident of Maui, Dan will show you the best of the Island. Visit the best beaches, go surfing, hike the bamboo forest, and embark on a guided journey on the Road to Hana, where you will jump off waterfalls and go to the top of Haleakala Volcano! At the end of your journey, a huge all inclusive beach party awaits you, and you are given two Frisbeer sets to take home. Includes: 2x Round Trip Airfare to Maui, Hawaii 3 Night Resort Stay Personalized Guided �Road To Hana� Tour by Dan Custom FrisBeer Beach party with live entertainment all refreshments/libations provided by FrisBeer Must be 21+ Must be based in the continental USA Must love good times Must love Jeep Wranglers How to play: Since there has been many different ways people have played this game, with different scoring breakdowns and lists of rules that are not always agreed upon, when making the official rules, we felt keeping them as simple and easily understandable was key. You will notice that there are a lot of familiar rules set in place that you may recognize from some of your other favorite lawn games. Scoring  First Team to reach 21 wins  Your Team�s score must reach 21 exactly  Scoring over 21 results in a BUST and your score goes back to 15  RULES: Dropping of the Disc= 1 Point  Dropping of the Can= 2 Points  SNIPE RULE: If the Can is struck clean off the pole, and the receiving team FAILS to catch anything, the game is OVER and the throwing team wins Game on! Meet The Crew: We are Dan Venne, and Nick Romano and together we founded ROVE Sports LLC. We are a couple of best friends from Naples Florida who lived 2 doors down from each other when we were kids, and grew up playing sports and doing pretty much everything else together. We immediately developed a bond that grew stronger and stronger throughout the years, and if you asked either of us how we got so close, we would tell you its because we are 2 of the most competitive people you will ever meet. No matter what the task at hand, we were constantly trying to beat each other at whatever it was. Who could chug their Gatorade the fastest, who could win in a foot race, who could hold their breath the longest� you get the point. It was this competitive drive that caused us to constantly try to break the barriers of competition by putting ourselves through various athletic feats involving a combination of skill, luck, hand-eye coordination, and a high tolerance for beer intake. It was through this journey of pushing the boundaries that we discovered the beautiful game of FrisBeer. Along with the discovery of this game of games, we also discovered many flaws in how the vast majority enjoys this game. So for all you DIY beer gamers, and for you MacGuyvers of masterful displays of engineering wonder, we are proud and extremely excited to present to you the game that you ll be proud to play and to call your own. We give you FrisBeer. We hope you enjoy our game and we hope it gives you and the people close to you, a chance to enjoy some friendly competition while verbally assaulting each other with no mercy. Mahalo from both of us! Now get to playin. We'll see you out there

Who is Valentina Sounds? My name is Valentina Raffaelli, I'm originally from Italy but I've been living and working in the USA for the past 10 years. I've always collaborated and recorded with bands, but I have never released a full length solo album, and I have never recorded one of my songs in a professional studio. This is the first musical project that I wrote, arranged and produced all by myself and I'm super excited (and extremely terrified) to share it with the world. Why I need you? I need your help to finish funding paying for mixing, mastering, graphic design, photos and the launch of the album. Phew. That's a lot! I had the budget for the first week of recording but I'm counting on your support to finish this by the end of July so that I can release it in March 2020. What is the album about? Bring On The Fire is a group of 11 songs about the end of the relationship with the person I moved to the United States for, and all the emotions that came from dealing with a difficult year. Not all the songs are sad and depressing. I'm hopelessly hopeful and I've been told I have a unique sense of humor. My songs reflect those aspects of my personality, even though they were written during some of the darkest moments of my life. I'm hoping my songs will inspire people that are not happy with their current situation to make a change in their lives, no matter how hard and impossible it might seem. There is a light at the end of the tunnel. It's gonna be alright (that's the title of the song that closes the album!). "Bring On The Fire" was recorded at Retro City Studios, Philadelphia PA. Sound, mixing and production: Matt Muir. Guitars: Kevin Hanson. Bass: Jim Stager. Drums: Erik Johnson. Backup vocals: Sara Mingle. So thank you, grazie, merci! Your support means everything to me! Tanto amore, lots of love! Valentina Sounds

Since we launched as a pop up in September 2018, the Square Pie Guys has traveled all over the Bay Area slinging our Detroit style inspired pies. We've met y'all at breweries, cocktail and wine bars, even in private homes. Square Pie Guys have always been about building community through the shared love of pizza--and that meant getting our pizzas into your hands anyway we could. Whether that was a crazy electric oven with broken decks, hacked Rocboxx ovens meant for 90 second wood fired Neapolitan pizza, or a convection oven meant for keeping cookies warm, where there was a will there was a way. We might have fancy new toys to play with, but our mission is clear: make delicious food every time. That�s all gonna change with your help Earlier this year the demand started to outgrow the capacity of the pop up. In early March, we found the perfect space in SoMa, at 1077 Mission Street. Our vision is a restaurant for all occasions. From the post work crowd seeking a beer and some awesome food, to the date night over wine. An indulgent bday party with all your best friends, or the large office that needs their lunch or event catered, we're going to meet all those needs. You've reached out with all of these requests and in the past we simply couldn't fulfill them, but now we are proud to say we can. We're creating a warm, welcoming, vibrant space for our staff and guests. We'll finally be on delivery platforms, so when you want SPG you got it! What We Need We�ve been lucky to raise enough funds to get into the space and put down payments on the necessary equipment to keep slinging pies, and even luckier that our space was nearly operational when we got the keys. SPG has carved out a place in the Bay Area, which is why we need you our community, to help make it happen. We�re going on Kickstarter because our place wouldn't be complete without our communities final touch. We want your input, your thoughts, and your imprint on our new space. We know it�s been some time since our Vinyl pop up, and you must be ready for an SPG fix. That�s why want to offer you the chance to be a major part of our opening. Why Kickstarter? You�ve been with us through it all: the tiny smoke filled kitchen of Vinyl, the long lines at Harmonic Brewing, even the disappointing moments when we�ve sold out faster than expected. You�ve been witness to the incredible growth we�ve experienced and worked with us through all the kinks and adjustments. You know that our dedication, work ethic, and passion goes beyond the doors of SPG. Point blank: without your support over this past year we wouldn�t be here, and it�s exactly why we are turning to you, our community, to help get us through this last push. We feel beyond blessed to be able to pursue this opportunity and to have the support of our family and friends. Our Rewards We know part of a kickstarter is all about the exclusive rewards offered to those who are ready to take the leap with us. From newly designed schwag to one of a kind pizza experiences, we�ll have it all. There�s even the opportunity to design and name a pizza that will go on our menu! We want our community to enjoy these rewards both in our store and on the go. We believe in SPG and we hope you do too. The thing with Kickstarter, is that if we don�t reach our goal by the deadline, we receive no funds...zero. It�s all or nothing and we�re placing our bets on you! If you�re with us and ready to make it happen, please do so now. If you have ideas on other rewards you would like to see offered, email us at: info@SquarePieGuys. We also need you to get the word out! Text your friends, your neighbors, even your local dog walker! Send them this Kickstarter, follow us on IG and get ready for SPG to finally open its doors. If you want to participate, click the "Back this Project" button on the right of the screen, or click any reward that interests you. The team Yum

Brian and Kenneth What we are selling! Homeopathy and Essential Oils. What are they? Chances are if you found this page, you may already have a pretty fair idea. Therefore, we beg you to be patient while I give a brief introduction for any newcomers. Homeopathy and Essential oils have been used for hundreds of years. While their methods differ, the essential idea is the same. both use all natural ingredients found in nature to help relieve pain, and cure certain ailments. Homeopathy uses the idea of Like cures Like, which is similar to how shots are made. Allergies acting up? A small amount of onion plant could for example help relieve symptoms to many common allergies. Essential oils uses everything from peppermint to lavender to fig to calm nerves, help induce sleep, among other things. As Pacific Northwesterners and Eagle Scouts, we cherish our environment and seek to build a sustainable world where we can use our natural resources around us. Woodworking Let's be simple, my twin and I want to share and sell our woodworking projects with the world! Since the early 1900s, our family has been into woodworking. Both of our grandfathers were avid woodworkers. They have built their own houses and workshops, tables and benches, bookshelves chairs, hope chests and so much more. Which brings us back to my twin and I. As millenials, we have limited space. However, we just got a house, craigslisted a bunch of tools and would love to keep this tradition and art alive. Too often, we see people our own age buying from amazon, or wayfair or Ikea. Wouldn't it be awesome to continue the local tradition of woodworking. Our heart is to see young individuals all over the world stepping back into local crafts and see the diversity and creative spark ignite our generation! We have had the bare bones shop up for 6 months, and have built several prototypes ranging from bookshelves to workbenches to swords to spice racks to essential oil boards. Which got us thinking, if we could kickstart the easiest thing to mail (essential oil boards, homeoapathy boards and other items) maybe we could make our dream a reality! To be fully ready for a bazaar, or a shop, we need wood for hundreds of projects up front. That is why we are giving ourselves a year. A year to save and to make and next summer, we will be able to sell all our things, both small and large, locally. We're giving you all a chance to be a part of bringing woodworking back! Homeopathy board Please consider donating, or helping by purchasing some of our smaller assorted items listed for sale. We want to keep the mailing cost reasonable, so we are sizing many of our products to take advantage of (if it fits it ships) boxes. Small, medium and large boards made out of whte oak, cherry and purple heart. So Why Kickstarter? You may ask, what made us pick this platform? Well, Kickstarter puts us in the unique position to be able to post our idea, and collect a group of people willing to invest in our project from around the US before spending hundreds of dollars on material. In our research, many Saturday markets require a capital of $1,000 between insurance, rented space and products just for 1 summer! Kickstarter allows us to sell to interested customers and work on raising funding and products so that next summer we will be ready to open a booth. Tiers and Pricing For specifics, please see our pricing on the right of the screen. We will be making Small and Large Homeopathy or Essential Oils Boards. Stretch Goals 750: Our project funding goal. Everyone will get the listed rewards! 1,000: If we make this goal, I will add a custom engraving on each board - like a name, or a message, or a quote. 1250: Wow! If we as a team can make this goal, I will have enough to buy a Planer for our shop!! this will let us smooth out our boards ahead of time without all the arduous sanding. As a reward, we will offer the choice for any board to be made of stripes of different kinds of wood (an oak board with a stripe of purple heart for example). 1500: Holy Cow! My dream of owning my own Lathe may well become a reality!! We can probably pick up a good used lathe, and as a reward, we will make each and every one of you either a honey dipper, mini rolling pin, or spice grinder - something fun!

Over the course of 100 days, 28 comic creators, (from seasoned industry veterans to aspiring freelancers and weekend warriors), banded together and set out to create 28 short comics based on the theme "Mythical Creatures" and the book title "Werewolves & Unicorns"... The Result... Cover Art: Scott Serkland Thee 100s are back with our 2nd Anthology! and this time we�ve brought along even more creators! That means you comic readers get even more comics! 126-pages of fantasy & horror themed stories!-- We�ve got Dragons, Goblins, Merfolk, Bigfoot, Zombies, Werewolves & Unicorns of course, and other cryptids from the air, land and sea! THE CREATORS Noah 'Ox' Baas (Zombies Chase After The Stars, I Never Forgot) Karyn Lewis Bonfiglio (Kitty Wars) Jake Campbell (Adaptation) Thomas G. Clemmons (Robot Friday, Hope Texas) Pepper DeLuca (Camp Fire stories of Lake Kikipapi ) Mike Emeritz (Legend of Space-Cat, Julie Jupiter, Sisyphean Complex) Matthew Enstrom (Cryptid Adventures, Harvey Stone: Private Eye, Beast of Busco) Scott O'Connell Green (Die in Yer Sleep, Mr. Green's MONSTER Zine) Gaz 'Gazbot' Gretsky (EEP, Hero Envy, Kid Switch, Earthling, The Horror A4) Yann Guyt (Space Cathedrals, Fosphor) Dave Hingley ( DeeDee Danger, Negative Nanny) Chris Isakson (Axl & Donnie, The Outsideling, Atris: The Knights of Aerrel) Robert Johnston (My Little Skull, The Reverend, The Grontl, Zero Comix) Joshua Kemble (Three Degrees, The Park, Numb, Jacob's Apartment, Quarterly Stories) Cory Kerr (The Mixed, The Tongue Cut Sparrow ) Jeff Lafferty (Doom 2099, The Dead, Lord Pumpkin, X-Men, Berserkonaut) Marshall Lee (Glyph, Corn Cob Rob, The Hitchhiker) McKay & Gray (Pretty Mouth, The Magpie, The Scourge of Ninepoint) Chris McQuinlan (The Legend of Rock, Nevermorrow, Monkey Junk) True Murray (Hamchop, Wick) Peter Palmiotti (Aquaman, Blood Rites, ARENA, Neon Edon, Bright Eyes, RETRO) Abiel Parsons (Furst Commandos, Blue) Benjamin Pena (Dungeons & Deuce Man) Teresa del Pilar (Graduation Nightmares, Space Copz, Held Back Summer) Scott Serkland (Young and the Dead, Serkworks) C.B. Smallwood (Wildcat, New Empire Comics) Christopher Specht (My Little Skull, The Reverend, The Grontl, Zero Comix) Finn Swan (Final Break) THE COMICS REWARDS We really want you to have a physical copy of our book that you can hold in your hands, but we understand that many people read comics on the go or on their tablets at home. That's why we're offering a PDF version of our book as well. We love Scott's cover so much, we want to look at it all the time! What better way to do that than with a 11x17 poster to pin up or frame on the wall? You can only get this poster here, so when your friends say, "Whoa! Where in the seven realms did you get that magnificently magical poster?" You can say, "I was there, dude... I was there." Imagine this scenario: You're reading your brand new comic anthology... Suddenly, there's a knock on the castle gate. It's your ol' pal, Vladimir The Brave, and he wants you to go on a mythical quest through the Valley of Lost Souls. If you go on a quest with Vladimir, how in the world will you remember where you left off in your awesome new book!? With an awesome new Bookmark, of course! You're helping us bring this idea into reality, and we want to make sure that everyone who reads this book knows who helped make it happen! You'll get the physical book, a digital copy, our exclusive bookmark, and the exclusive poster! All in one package! Are you an aspiring comic creator or artist? Or maybe you're a comic book coneseure who appreciates the craft that goes into making comics? How would you like the chance to join an online hangout with a bunch of the creators who helped bring this book to life? Back this tier and we will make that happen! With the combined experience of our creators, some of them long-time pros in various entertainment and design fields, you have an opportunity to get some valuable feedback and advice to help you on your artistic journey, or glean some unique insight behind the process of making comics and art.Ask us anything about art, comics, printing, self-publishing, editing, crowdfunding, The 100 Days of Making Comics Challenge, you name it! You'll get 5 copies of the book at wholesale cost, and our exclusive poster and bookmark! PLUS... We'll give your shop a shout out on social media, AND we'll list your shop on our website: "Available at these fine retailers." This is a great deal for comic shops and other booksellers. *We may ask to verify that you are, in fact, an actual retail shop. We've got one last reward for one lucky backer. For the last day of the campaign, we have a special reward tier featuring an original piece of artwork from our cover artist and comic contributor, Scott Serkland! This piece is one of a kind, so get it while you can! Did you miss out on our 1st book, Life In Space? Well, you've got a second chance! Some creators from Book #1 have given us a limited number of books for this Kickstarter! These books are limited print runs, so this could very well be the last chance to get Book #1. Not only do you have a very limited opportunity to get a copy of Book #1, you also have an EXTREMELY LIMITED opportunity to get your hands on all the Book #1 rewards as well! Yes, we have 3 sets of the original rewards from our first kickstarter. Our printer shipped us a few extra and we held onto them so we could offer them to you now. But we only have the 3 sets and we can't print more! If you want them, now is the only time to get them! STRETCH GOALS...

A harrowing campfire accident and a great deal of love was the genesis for a truly incredible product, that we now call healing balm. This healing balm has brought to life, an entire line of skincare products made from natural and raw products. The products are known under the With Love & Co. brand of skincare and healing products. Over the past two years and the sharing of hundreds of stories and much love, the With Love & Co. brand has grown. We have grown from one simple farmers market, to 8-10 markets per week and online shipments that reached as far away as Europe, Canada, and Kuwait and the entire United States. All of the success and the love shared with our customers, has created a calling to open a retail and production facility. The retail location will allow us to serve customers 7 days a week and 13 hours a day. We envision the retail location being an experience in itself and not the traditional product on the shelf and cashier environment. It will be an experience that integrates technology and personal genuine service, in creating a place that customers love to be in. It will be a place to acquire awesome skin, great complexions, and to share a story or two. We have started the process, secured the location and are working on creating the experience. Come join us and be a part of something young, and help continue to expand this all natural skincare revolution. Opening soon in the Downtown Summerlin Mall

We hit 10K!! Thank you for joining us in growing this project. Today is the last day! With more funding, we will be able to bring in more writers, organize more events and workshops in more cities, and even begin to create original visual content to exist with our literary erotica. STRETCH GOAL: $12,000 Let's see how far we can go. Sex needs a rebrand. This is AURORE. AURORE is a curated community of feminist and queer writers telling real stories about sex, in their own way. AURORE publishes honest stories about people�s intimate experiences, celebrating the sex they loved, the sex that changed them, and the sex they want to reimagine. We solicit, encourage, and curate a collection of erotic literature that is as authentic and emotional as it is arousing. Our submission process guides new writers to take the plunge with their pen. Our ever-expanding community of talented writers includes first-timers, experienced writers like Zachary Zane, Laura Delarato, and Stoya, and regular contributors who also publish at places like The Advocate Magazine, Playboy, Vice and Vogue. Join us! We are raising funds to bring AURORE to its full potential. We've soft-launched the site, and now we need your help to get it fully operational and sustainable. Your contribution will go towards our badass and unapologetic writers and supporting new authors. We will grow our sexy literati by hosting writing workshops and book club events, creating safe community spaces for provocative storytelling. It's time to takeover the conversation. Join AURORE in telling new stories about sex. Ummm, How Do You Pronounce AURORE? Like Oh-Roar. It's French. Tell Me More About AURORE AURORE is raw and real. Contributors call the experience of writing real sex stories cathartic, healing, and tonic for their relationships. Readers report boners of all genders on the regular. Everyone agrees the stories provoke and reward. Our writers are people of all backgrounds, who use casual language, reveal subtleties, and mention hook-ups at local hangouts: the details of real-life encounters. No one is a professional erotica writer, and it shows�in a good way. Writing and reading AURORE content allows people to reflect on and discuss the kind of sex they�re having, the kind of sex they want to be having, and what their peers are experimenting with. Your support will ensure this project has legs to take its next step. AURORE is Vulnerable Each writer�s decision to �go there� opens the conversation for others, creating a trusted space. Sexiness is often narrowly portrayed. Somehow, telling the truth feels risky. We inspire and educate through our stories. They are ours to own. Founding AURORE I'm Carly. I founded AURORE in February 2019 after six months of restless dreaming and ideation. Since its inception, I have devoted one-on-one attention with each writer, editing to enhance their stories, and urging them to access deeper truths. I'm a writer, content creator, and kinda suddenly the founder of an amazing community. I started AURORE when my travel writing started to veer into the erotic, and I realized there was nowhere to pitch it. There are a whole bunch of sites about women�s sexual health and how-to type stuff, and of course a ton of spaces dedicated to cis-male pleasure, but nowhere existed purely to provide masturbatory material in the form of real sex stories to women and the queer community. So I decided to create a space for the content I wanted to consume. The word 'erotica' still has a kinda awkward connotation for a lot of people, which is puzzling, since porn is so pervasive, but I�m hoping to normalize that, and update the genre for smart, sophisticated readers. This one-woman initiative has already seen significant growth in audience, interest, and submissions�imagine what we can achieve when we build momentum! Thanks to the Kickstarter Creator-in-Residence program and countless favors from supportive fans, AURORE is now ready to grow. By backing AURORE now, you�ll be first to witness all of its transformations, word by word. Nom de Plume Another French thing! AURORE is named for the 19th-century author, Amantine Lucile Aurore Dupin, who wrote under the pen name George Sand. She was a woman attempting to succeed in a man�s world, and was known to dress as a gentleman to enter spaces restricted to women; by reclaiming her true name for the site, we give a wink and a nod to her true identity. Some of our writers follow this trend, donning pen names of the women they adore, imitate, and invent. Our boldness is in the story, our identities are in our expression, and our personal details are private. Our sharing is mysterious in all the right spots. Aurore is also the goddess of the dawn. Think: rebirth, light, hope. A collage mash-up featuring Aurore and Carly Why Support AURORE? You think we need a more provocative and authentic form of sex education You believe in all voices sharing about the sex they loved You want to support writers�especially writers of brave, personal stories You're into supporting a women-powered enterprise You're interested in alternative, literary pornography You want to join a supportive community exploring modern sex You're a voyeur and wanna read about the sex other people are having D, all of the above What Will AURORE Do With Your Support? Supporting Writers Writing about sex is work! While AURORE is built out from the labor of love, we will only sustain if we fairly compensate our writers. Currently, AURORE publishes 4 new stories a month. When you back $50 or more, you will help us publish a voice. Workshops AURORE intends to create physical safe spaces in addition to our digital safe space, to discuss sex and relationships in a positive, supportive environment. Even though AURORE stories are focused on celebrating sex, we realize that things are more complicated. Facilitated by our staff and writers, we open the discussion. Book Club AURORE's Erotica Book Club selects a modern or old-school erotic work to read and discuss. Our meetings have already proven to serve the shared need for open exploration of sex and the issues around it, and future writing workshops and events will do the same. The Creators and The Future We're constantly working to make AURORE a beautiful, easy-to-navigate space with a solid business backbone to keep it thriving. Your support will ensure we can continue to focus on this worthy project, and keep operations running smoothly. Submit to AURORE We are always open to new writers�submissions from women of color and QTPOC to the front! We want all the dirty details, but with names changed to protect the not-so-innocent. We're mainly interested in works of non-fiction, because we believe they have the greatest ability to educate and capture the sexual zeitgeist, but as we all know, recounting intimate encounters often veers into fantasy and embellishment. That's cool, too. Subs welcome here. Rewards We're making a keepsake pocket-sized digital collection, ideal for one-handed scrolling, with never-seen-before AURORE stories and collage art. We're printing a limited edition "READ PORN" t-shirt that is as cute as it is subversive. Made Au Gold is a brand seeking to empower women by providing an outlet to express yourself. They are a female owned and operated business that started in 2015, making cool things for cool people. Reward from Made Au Gold: "Resilient" Keychain For you or someone you love who may need a gentle reminder during tough times. You are fearless and capable...even if you forget your keys sometimes. Reward from Hannah Candle NY: Handmade candle in the shape of a woman's torso In Korean Hannah means �one,� for Judaism, "heavenly grace", in Arabic it represents happiness, within Japan, a flower, while in Maori it's the act of glowing. Le Labo believes fine perfumery must create a shock - the shock of the new, combined with the shock of the intimately familiar. Reward from Le Labo: Hand-poured Candle in Santal 26 Channel AURORE, synonymous with sophistication and sex, when you light this soy wax based, hand-poured, GMO-free, vegan and cruelty-free candle in Le Labo's iconic scent. AURORE has partnered with other awesome, women-founded sexual wellness companies to enhance your exploration. Maude was created to simplify sex. Tired of seeing an outdated, over-assorted, and gendered approach to a human experience on the drugstore aisle and in the industry, they said enough: let's make sex better for all people. My name is Emily McLaughlin. You may know me as Meorow on my social media. At the moment I am a college art student, and over the past year and a half I have dedicated the free time I have now to my dream project - the fully illustrated Celtic fairytale Sionnach Ab�: Fox Forever, also written by myself! I am super excited to have finally finished illustrating all 139 pages of this book, and I NEED YOUR HELP to get it out into the physical world! I want to print my baby, and through this Kickstarter I hope to gather the funds to be able to do so. Plus find new hands to give it to! Sionnach Ab� is an illustrated Celtic fairytale book, intended for all ages - everyone with a childlike heart and an eye for beauty. Every page is an artistic statement. The text, art, and story were all carefully crafted to form one cohesive whole, so that every page has a voice of its own, and no element is an accident. Every part was touched by hand and given careful attention. If you can appreciate classic fairytales of old, Irish folklore, medieval illuminated manuscripts, the Art Nouveau and Arts & Crafts Movements, and of course, nature, then it is my hope that you will love this book! Sionnach Ab� is Irish for "Fox Forever." I knew I wanted the title to be Irish, so I looked up the word for "fox" in Google translate, and the rest was history! "Fox Forever" is meant to reflect the theme of the book. The fox in the story never doubts. He always has a plan. His spirit can never be broken. Forever a fox. Sionnach Ab�! I had never cared much for fairytales personally. But after watching the movie The Secret of Kells, and a 2013 family trip to Ireland, I fell in love with the mysterious lore of the country. It all began in my college library. To pass the time, I casually picked up a book of Celtic fairytales, and thumbed through a story, but it did little for me. The plot was very predictable, and the characters flat and uninteresting. But one illustration of a prince and princess riding upon the tail of a fox, settled deep into my heart. I couldn't get the image out of my head - the specific detail of them riding upon the tail was so delightful. I went home, redrew the image, and simply fell in love. I wanted to create my own version of the fairytale, where the characters were actually people, with relatable emotions and motives. I wanted the fox to be a mysterious, mythical figure; otherworldly, almost. Most of all, I wanted to attempt to express through art and story my new love for fairytales and Irish folklore, and convey their old magic and beauty through a modern retelling. I wrote my own version of the story based on what I remembered, and discovered that the version I read was based off of the Grimm fairytale "The Golden Bird." But, mysteriously, I never did find that book again! It had utterly vanished from the library. Of course it did. It had served its purpose; it had cast its spell upon me, and I have never been the same. Set in medieval Ireland, Sionnach Ab� tells the story of one prince among three who ventures towards the ill-fated woods of Craugh to seek a prize to please his power-hungry father. Along the way he encounters a mysterious fox who offers him more than he could have hoped for. As is the case in most fairytales, things don't go the way they are expected to. The prince stumbles in his quest, by his own folly, yet, through his mistakes, he comes to question what he was really looking for after all. He is joined by the Lady Aideen, the fairest princess of the land, yet because of her beauty, her father kept her locked in her own chamber all her waking days to guard her from suitors. And throughout it all, the fox is forever faithful, forever grinning, and forever keeping them from harm. When magic prevails, fear falls away. The goal of this Kickstarter is to print 100 copies. Most of the money will be going towards the printing of the books. It costs a lot to print a full-color hardcover book! I will be printing the books through Bookbaby Self-Publishing. Here is the basic breakdown of the funds based off of the quote I received from them, and the additional shipping and Kickstarter fees: Thank you for your interest so far! Here's a little bit more about me written in the third person to sound official. Emily is a mixed-media illustrator, with a preference for digital art and watercolor. She is a recent graduate from Montgomery County Community College with an Associates in Fine Arts, and had the joy and privilege of being the Editor-in-Chief of the college�s art and literature magazine, producing the 2019 edition titled �Replications.� Currently she is in the process of earning a Bachelors of Fine Arts at Pennsylvania Academy of Fine Arts in Philadelphia. Illustration and books are her passion, and her professional aspiration is to be a children's book illustrator. Sionnach Ab� is her dream project, the book she has always wanted to create - and now I will break from formality to say thank you so much for helping to make my dream a reality! To help express my deep thank you to you for your support, I created 10 exclusive original Sionnach Ab� themed drawings that you can receive with your book! Each one is unique and hand-drawn on 5.5x8in Bristol paper. The mediums range from pencil, ink, brushpen, and more. Here are a few examples!

Aina is the easiest and the fastest way to control almost Everything without the need to take your phone out. Aina is a premium AI powered smart ring that connects to your phone via Bluetooth and becomes a personalized remote for controlling smart home devices, booking cabs and unlocking devices effortlessly. Aina is also an easier way to take phone calls and talk with Voice Assistants privately, just place your fingertips near your ear and get talking. Aina is also a subtle Fitness Tracker and a beautiful timepiece that sits on your finger. Aina is a beautiful interface that makes use of your smartphone as a remote computing device to let you handle daily tasks in the most efficient way possible. Our Indian counterpart Lazy Design Private Limited was a part of Qualcomm�s 6 month Hardware Acceleration program in Bangalore, India between August 2018 and March 2019 under QDIC 2018 where we connected with verified Electronic Partners and got some great Technical Mentoring. In addition this, we have won various Awards as a startup in the last 2 years. Scientifically, Aina is the Easiest, Fastest and the Laziest way to control. Anything. We are a team of Product Designers, Engineers and Data Scientists(collectively Gadget lovers) who got tired of swiping, tapping and unlocking our phones for every other thing and set out to find an easier way to handle tasks that we do on a daily basis. We spent the last 2 years in Research and Development to devise the perfect solution incorporating the latest advancements in AI, Acoustics and Microelectronics to create Aina. Aina is about 70% faster than your smartphone touchscreens and about 30% faster than Smart Speakers at getting Everyday tasks done. FEATURES, VARIANTS AND COLORS In addition to making a device that is super functional, being a team of Designers, we factored Aesthetics in our Design Process right in the beginning and as a result of this extensive process, we now have 6 beautiful variants of Aina, a color and finish for everyone AND we are now providing Free Global Shipping. Aina connects with your smartphone using Bluetooth 5.0 and works with our Aina app installed in your phone. Its controlled using 4 swipe gestures in 4 different directions on the touch sensing area of the ring that control Aina's display. These Swipe gestures are detected by a combination of Touch sensors on the Band's surface and Motion sensors inside the ring by algorithms that are trained and calibrated to your specific way of swiping on the ring. And whenever you swipe on the ring, you feel a subtle vibration as feedback. By using a combination of such a sensing and feedback mechanism, we avoid accidental inputs for the ring. In case you anyways activate a shortcut by mistake, you can swipe down right after the feel the vibrational feedback to undo that action. The home screen displays time and any recent notifications. AI shortcuts come as pop ups over the Home screen which you can choose to Accept, reject, snooze. You can also find the most relevant shortcuts for you by swiping left to right across the home screen. Swipe Down on the Home screen to activate your Voice Assistant and enter specific "Modes" by giving a Custom Voice Command to Aina. 4 Swipe Gestures to get Eveything done. We have partnered with multiple companies across the globe to bring some revolutionary technologies at your fingertips each packaged as a feature that we are introducing with Aina. 1. AI UI : ARTIFICIALLY INTELLIGENT USER INTERFACE AN AI REMOTE FOR YOUR SMARTPHONE After installing Aina app on your phone, you can select which applications you want shortcuts for. The app uses machine learning algorithms to learn your smartphone usage behavior related to the selected applications and Aina starts predicting shortcuts for you with significant accuracy within 3 weeks. The predicted shortcuts come as pop ups over the Home Screen of Aina which by defauly displays time, you can always choose to accept, reject or snooze the shortcut using the 4 swipe directions on the ring. And as you keep using Aina, these predictions keep getting more accurate. We have already integrated the API's of most popular regularly-used-Apps and will continue to grow our developer network to increase the capabilities of AIUI. Control Smart Home Devices: All popular smart home devices can be controlled using Aina through IFTTT. Book Cabs: We have already integrated with Uber and will be working with Lyft and other popular Cab booking services next. Unlock Cars: We have partnered with Smartcar Inc., a US based company to control, lock and unlock your car with Aina. See the list of cars we work with here. Unlock devices using Bluetooth: Bluetooth proximity based Smart home devices can be locked and unlocked using Aina. Wake up and get your coffee Aina knows when you typically book cabs to Office and it will show the shortcut to Book an Uber to Office just before you need it. Book a cab to office right after breakfast Aina knows when its time to sleep and based on your usage of your Home lights, it will show the shortcut to Switch Off the room lights as soon as you go to sleep. Go to sleep like its 2019 2. NEAR FIELD DIRECTIONAL SOUND Using a Proprietary Acoustic channel design and applying DSP on sound in the Human Speech range, our patent pending Near Field Directional Sound technology projects sound in a focused beam towards your ear from Aina when you place your fingertips near your ear. Take Phone calls: Say "Call Jay" to call your friend Jay through Aina. For incoming calls, Aina vibrates and shows you who is calling, swipe up to receive the call and talk from your fingers. Talk to Voice Assistants: Swipe down on Home Screen and talk with Siri, Google Assistant or Alexa privately without saying the assistant's name. Aina's mic gets activated only when you swipe to activate the Voice assistant so there is no always-listening mode that may hinder your privacy. 3. VOICE ACTIVATED MODES Aina takes custom Voice commands and enters into specific modes to control individual devices or services. Third parties will soon be able to make their own Modes for Aina. A few modes that are going to be part of the first version of Aina are: Slideshow Mode: Control slideshow by swiping up down left right on Aina. Smart Light mode: Control the intensity and color of smart bulbs using Aina for any device that can be controlled through IFTTT . Music Mode: Switch tracks on your phone using Aina, even if you are listening to music from Bluetooth speakers or wireless earphones connected to your phone. TV Remote Mode: Control your TV by swiping on Aina or by giving Voice commands. Works with FireTV and Sensy Remote. Swipe down 3 times in 2 seconds from any Screen and SOS Mode gets activated- Your location co-ordinates are sent to your loved ones and if you are are subsribed to a Security service, the estimated time for arrival of help will be displayed to you. 4. SOUND ID We have partnered with Lisnr Inc., a US company specializing in communication protocols using encrypted sound wherein two devices communicate with each other using near ultrasonic sound that is inaudible, encrypted and more secure than NFC(you can anyways paste an NFC sticker on Aina if you use it a lot). Applications of Sound based authentication are limitless, but we start with a few popular ones: POS Payments: Make payments at select POS terminals around the world just by waving your hand near the receiving device, cross check the amount on Aina and swipe up to approve the transaction. P2P Payments: Send money to your friend's phone in Digital Wallets that allow transactions via Sound based authentication. *Access Cards: Aina creates an encrypted Sound ID for you to access Metros, public transport services and Offices that accept Sound based authentication. Once you help us make Aina popular, we will try and get Sound based authentication installed in all major Public Transport services. 5. FITNESS TRACKING Aina is fitness tracker packed with 6 axis Motion sensors to track your daily activity. Aina is specially designed to complement your office attire as opposed to typical Silicon band based fitness trackers. Step Counting Calorie tracking 6. TIME AND INTELLIGENT NOTIFICATIONS Aina is the first ring that features a 200 DPI OLED Display. A display that is designed to always stay in your field of view, so you can see the time and check phone notifications even when you are driving, typing, writing or just sitting. Check Time Subtle Vibration Feedback for selected notifications Check Phone Notifications: You can select which applications you want notifications from and whenever a selected app's notification comes, Aina will vibrate and the app's icon will be displayed on its screen. You can see notifications from Gmail, Facebook, Whatsapp, Wechat, Line, SMS etc. AIUI and Notifications also work in sync, if you give Aina access to your notifications, AIUI will predict a shortcut for you based on the Notification. Aina has been designed to complement your daily attire so you look great even when you are snapping your fingers like Thanos. How intelligent notifications look like on Aina AINA SDK FOR DEVELOPERS We will be opening Aina�s SDK for Third party developers in a few months so you can integrate Aina with your applications and devices. If you are an Android or iOS developer and want to get early access to the SDK, you can Pre Order Aina Developer Kit or email us at hi@ainaring.com. The current prototype of Aina is 1.2x bigger than the final size of Aina, the main reason behind this is the absence of standard OLED displays of sizes that would fit inside Aina. Aina Ring Current Prototype(1.2x Bigger than the final size) Current Charging Dock(not the Final Design) The 4 latest prototypes of Aina Ring- The right one is the current version. Evolution of Aina Ring Aina is made by Lazy Co., a young Consumer Electronics Startup with offices in Bangalore and Delaware. We are a team of Product Designers, Engineers and Data Scientists who got tired of swiping, tapping and unlocking our phones for every other thing and set out to find an easier way to handle tasks that we do on a daily basis. We spent the last 2 years in Research and Development to devise the perfect solution incorporating the latest advancements in AI, Acoustics and Microelectronics to create Aina. Our Electronics partners in India and Taiwan have a cumulative experience of over 25 years in Electronics Product Development. Media Kit We started our Design process by studying the human body and its muscles to find out which would be the easiest motion in the human body that can be practically used to activate a shortcut. After a lot of Browsing the internet, user testing and surveys we figured blinking of eyes is too unreliable and Brain computer interfaces are still too far ahead, so we selected the next laziest motion the human body can perform- swiping the thumb over the index finger. Wireframes for the App and Initial Ring concepts We started sketching for finger based wearables and came up with crazy ideas of what all the ring can do, we definitely wanted it to take phone calls that would make the ring usable for a task that we all do on a daily basis. But we also had to make sure that the form factor we are trying to come up with is possible to make using the technology available today. First working prototype for taking phone calls- Jan 2017 So, while still in college finishing our major projects when we had no money at all, we started working on a Prototype of the ring using an RN52 Module and an Arduino Board and tested the use case of taking phone calls with the ring in addition to activating shortcuts through it. Designing the first PCB for Aina The image below shows the first design of the ring we were making. We know its horrible, but our PCB design and chipset selection was not very optimized then, and we had no funds at all. First CAD to fit in all the components The first working prototype of the Metallic Ring was able to take phone calls and activate some shortcuts in the phone, the App was being made in parallel. This prototype helped us test the practical battery life of the device and helped us realize that its actually possible to make Aina. Our first functional non display prototype- it was huge The cover made it look better(May 2017) RnD on Directional Sound - Our workspace used to look just Beatiful sometimes(Dec 2017) After finishing our research about what sound technology we should use out of 3 different alternatives, we started developing the Prototype on Qualcomm's Dev Kits and took some sweet time learning how to use it. After months of testing and multiple attempts at getting the PCB right, we finally came up with this 3D printed prototype of Aina which was super slim and was functional enough to be exhibited at our College's Open Day. This was the first prototype that was able to let you take calls by placing your fingertips near your ear using NFDS. 3d Printed Prototype with functional Near Field Directional Sound(March 2018) The main Challenge of building Aina was to put all the hardware components inside the small form factor. Once we got that done, we started exploring all sorts of applications this device can used for, using only the sensors and components which we already have inside the ring. This was the time when Google launched Google Pay which used Sound based authentication and "Voila", we partnered with Lisnr, Inc. to make use of this crazy tech which was far more useful and secure than NFC. Final CAD Design- May 2018 We kept working on the Final ID of the ring and came up with a Unisex design that complements one's office attire. We initially wanted to keep a full screen display on Aina's top but the battery and size constraints didn't allow that. That is where AIUI helped, because of which you won't need to select a shortcut from a long list of applications viewed on a big screen, the shortcut you need just pops up at the right time on the Edge Display of Aina. Perfecting the curves The Edge display was a crucial part of our Design, it was not just an aesthetic feature but it served a much bigger purpose of using the ring on a daily basis. Its strategically designed to be in your field of view when your hands are in a neutral or natural position if you are resting or doing a regular activity while sitting. Aina's first functional NFDC prototype in metal(Sept 2018) Yogansh diagnosing the Final PCB for defects Final Prototype(April 2019) - This is the fully functional May prototype of Aina, we have demoed this version at several places and people already love it. We are already working with EMS companies in India and Taiwan to develop our Prototypes. Once we get an estimate of the number of units to be produced after this campaign, we will be raising further investments, complete the final testing and start the manufacturing process. Shipping fee is included in the Total Price of each Reward. There will be no Shipping Fee charged. Backers will still have to pay any applicable Customs duty/Sales Tax/VAT/GST as per their country's rules. The Most Magical Dragons Studio Ghibli and Pokemon are the two things that always manage to spark that sense of magic to me. I couldn't tell you how many hours of my life have been spent playing the Pokemon games and watching Ghibli movies - often at the same time! I wanted to make a pin that blended these two loves, and it all began with a sketch of my two favorite dragons - Haku from Studio Ghibli's Spirited Away and Pokemon's Dragonair. These two awesome dragons are wrapped around each other on a bed of glittery flowers. Alongside the pin are two smaller pins - a Pokeball and Paper Bird. The Dragon Pin is 1.75". They are hard enamel plated in gold. The flowers will have pink glitter. Each pin has 2 pin backs with rubber clutches. They will have a small back stamp. Haku + Dragonair Pin The Pokeball and Paper Bird pins are 0.75". These are hard enamel, plated in gold. The pink flowers will be glittery. They will have single pin back with a rubber clutch. Pokeball Pin and Paper Bird Pin Details on Pins **Please note, these images are not actual size. This is just for reference. About Kickstarter This is an All or Nothing campaign. You will not be charged until the campaign ends, and you will only be charged if we meet our goal. If we don't meet the goal, no payment is taken, and the pins can't be made. The goal for the campaign is based almost entirely on the production cost. The Kickstarter fee is about 10%, and that accounts for what isn't production costs. I am handling all packaging, backing cards, and such myself, so it is not reflected in the goal. This seemed the best way to keep the goal lower so it's easier for us to reach! Stretch Goals If we are able to make it to $775 or more, we will unlock the Shiny Version! This pretty version will be sent at no additional charge to anyone who pledged along with their other rewards! The Shiny Version will have a shiny Dragonair along with Haku, and the flowers will be teal and white with glitter. This pin will be silver plated. If we can take it even further and get to $1100 we can unlock new pin to the set! This pin features Chihiro and Dratini! They have the same pink glittery flowers as a backdrop. This pin, like the dragon pin, is gold plated and 1.75". This will have 2 posts with rubber clutches and a small back stamp as well. If this is unlocked, it will be sent at no additional charge to everyone who backed the full set. Stickers! There are two stickers designed for this campaign! The first is a 3" holographic sticker of the Haku x Dragonair Design! These are vinyl stickers with a soft holographic sheen. They are part of some of the reward tiers - and will be exclusive to this Kickstarter All backers will also be getting to smaller vinyl stickers! I love how cute the little Haku and Dragonair turned out when I added them to the banner! SO, everyone who backs will be getting both of these cuties! (I'll post actual photos when they arrive!) Dragonair - 2"x2" - Haku - 2.2"x1.8" When It's Done If it all goes great, and we meet the goal - it's go time! It can take a few weeks for Kickstarter to release the funds. As soon as those are received, I will place the order with the factory. It normally can take about a month for the pins to arrive once production starts, and I will need some time to grade the pins and check for defects. I will make sure to ship the pins as soon as they can get out the door! I am as excited about this project as you are, so I'll do my best to keep you updated on the progress! I will posting every update on my Instagram (KatKachuArts). Please let me know if you have any questions or concerns!

CURSED BY PROPHECY. CORRUPTED BY POWER. When Eridani's parents are murdered and their kingdom is seized by a traitorous duke, she plans to run. After she suffers yet another unendurable loss, the lure of revenge pulls her back. Eridani's brilliance as a strategist offers her a path to vengeance and the throne, but success may mean becoming everything she hates. To survive, she must sway religious zealots, outwit ambitious politicians, and confront bloodthirsty warlords, all with few allies and fewer resources. Yet the most menacing obstacle she must overcome is the prophecy uttered by a powerful sorceress: Everyone you know and trust will come to betray you. Click to download and read a sample chapter. Eridani's Crown is a 98,000-word standalone epic fantasy novel I like to describe as "the character arc of Breaking Bad meets the atmosphere of Game of Thrones," and which some of the early readers have called "a Greek tragedy masquerading as grimdark fantasy." This book has plenty of elements that will appeal to fans of traditional epic fantasy. On the supercontinent called the Heart there's swordplay and prophecy, legacy of conquerors past and cults worshiping the forgotten gods. There's an ancient creature its keepers mistakenly think is a dragon, a portal that dispenses dangerous gifts from other dimensions, and a sword forged from the iron alchemists extracted from the blood of a warlord's slain enemies. But those of you who have read my work know that I haven't met a trope I didn't enjoy subverting, and that this novel will be anything but a cookie-cutter fantasy populated by stock D&D characters. Eridani's Crown features a full-on Cold War fought via economics, politics, and misinformation rather than spears and arrows -- something not typically seen in medieval fantasy. Among its cast of characters is a retired general turned pacifist who convinces kings and emperors not to go to war against one another. There's a storyteller who paints her tales in puffs of multi-colored steam. There's a healer that buys and sells illnesses as if they were precious stones... And plenty more I can't tell you about, because spoilers. Underneath all the cool fantasy stuff this book is about power, the choices and moral sacrifices people are willing to make in order to wield it, and how we as a society tend to eventually put despots like Alexander, Peter, Napoleon, or Genghis Khan onto pedestals. We assign them monikers like Alexander the Great or Peter the Great, even though any modicum of greatness they might possess was achieved by sacrificing countless lives. This book was born of trying to figure out what makes someone like Alexander of Macedonia wake up one morning and decide to conquer the world. And, of course, despots always have an excuse: "As long as there are innumerable kings and princelings, all seeking glory and coveting the lands of their neighbors, wars will be endless." -Eridani the Fierce Samples, and praise for Eridani's Crown Download and read an unedited copy of one of my favorite chapters. This is an early chapter, so it's mostly spoiler-free. Mostly. (Note: The text has been laid out by me. The actual book will be laid out by a pro and therefore will look a lot nicer.) Read "Forty-Seven Dictums of Warfare" at Daily Science Fiction. This was published as a standalone short story and is expanded within the novel. Spoilers for Teo, a minor but relevant character, as well as some other minor spoilers. Here's what some of my favorite writers who read the book had to say: With a world as intricate as the titular magical artifact and a cast of characters as morally complex as figures from real history, Eridani�s Crown is a nuanced examination of the drive to acquire power and its distorting influence on our ideals. This epic fantasy will have you turning the pages deep into the night and move you in the manner only the grandest of tragedies can. � Ken Liu, Hugo Award-winning author of THE GRACE OF KINGS A gripping tale of empire and conquest and the crumbling of good intentions in the pursuit of power. Shvartsman takes all your expectations and turns them on their head. � David Walton, Campbell Award-winning author of THREE LAWS LETHAL About the author I've been writing fiction since 2010 and have had over 120 original short stories published in places like Analog, Nature, Strange Horizons, Intergalactic Medicine Show, Fireside, Galaxy's Edge, and many other anthologies, magazines, and podcasts. My stories won the 2014 WSFA Small Press Award and were finalists twice for the Canopus Award for Excellence in Interstellar Fiction. You can see my complete bibliography here. I have two short story collections and a novella published, but Eridani's Crown will be my first novel! I have also translated a number of stories from Russian. These translations have been published in The Magazine of Fantasy & Science Fiction, Apex, Samovar, Amazing Stories, and elsewhere. I've edited over a dozen anthologies, most of them published via my own press, UFO Publishing, but also by Baen Books, Arc Manor/Phoenix Pick, and Deoorc Enterprises. I'm also currently the editor and publisher of Future Science Fiction Digest, a pro zine with a strong focus on stories coming from outside of the anglosphere. Why Kickstarter? Publishing a book right can be an expensive proposition. This is my first, novel, a book I spent 3+ years writing, and I definitely want to do it right. That means hiring professionals to handle every aspect of the project. The gorgeous cover is by Tomasz Maronski, who has illustrated covers for any number of great writers, from Robert Silverberg to Brandon Sanderson. The audio book will be narrated by Nicola Seaton-Clark, who has over fifteen years of acting experience in TV, film, and radio. Copy editing, graphics design, interior layout, and all other aspects of production will be handled by equally-experienced industry veterans. $5,000 will cover most, but not all, of the initial costs. Raising more funds may allow for an offset print run, interior illustration, and other additional goodies that will result in a better book for everyone. The Swag This campaign is to fund the production of the ebook, trade paperback, hardcover, and audio book versions of Eridani's Crown. As such, most of the rewards will feature a combination of these items. However, I also have plenty of other books that I've edited or wrote that are in the mix. All of the following books are available as rewards and as add-ons and I can try and make substitutions if you want a certain reward tier but already have one of the books that it comes with. * You can add the audio book to any reward tier for $20 * You can add any of the following books to any reward tier for $10 each. Explaining Cthulhu to Grandma and Other Stories The Golem of Deneb Seven and Other Stories H. G. Wells, Secret Agent Unidentified Funny Objects 1 - 7 Coffee: 14 Caffeinated Tales of the Fantastic Funny Science Fiction Funny Fantasy Funny Horror Future Science Fiction Digest issues 0 - 3 The Cackle of Cthulhu (print only) Humanity 2.0 (print only) Other items included with each physically-mailed reward of SIGNED books will include bookmarks and postcards and a special collectible pin depicting the titular crown cast on nickel! All orders of 2+ books will also include the Future SF-branded string bag: Thank you very much in advance for any help you're able to provide, be it a pledge to this campaign or sharing it on social media. I can't wait to share Eridani's story!

NEW REWARDS ADDED! Two new rewards have been added! You can star on our back cover in a brand new illustration by Billy Tucci or you can pick up Mr. Tucci's original cover art for Vampire, PA: Bite Out of Crime! Scroll down for more details! WHAT'S ALL THIS THEN? Is that truly Lizzy Borden�s actual hatchet? What were those guys doing on the atomic testing grounds? Is that guy�s girlfriend�s mom really a monster? And what about that girl�s ex-boyfriends? They�re not literally monsters, are they? Welcome to Bedtime Stories For Impressionable Children. Not only do we answer those questions and more, we bring together an incredible roster of creative talent to do so in a spectacular 104-page trade paperback collection! This brand new book includes both the original Moonstone and American Mythology issues of Bedtime, as well as previously unpublished material in glorious, crisp black and white. We also add in an eight-page, full-color cover gallery! Jim Shooter, former Editor-in-Chief of Marvel Comics. Joe James, a comic book veteran from Milestone and DEFIANT, best known these days as an incredible storyboard and concept artist. Veteran artist Gene Gonzales, best known in comic book circles for his amazing Tales From The Cherokee. Mark Wheatley, co-creator of the Vertigo hit Breathtaker, First Comics� Mars, and the pioneering weekly Blood of the Innocent. James Kuhoric, Mr. Back-to-Press himself, the writer of Freddy vs. Jason vs. Ash and Army of Darkness. And we�ve got plenty more where they came from! HOW DID THIS COME TOGETHER? Whether in television or in print, anthologies have always grabbed my attention. When I was a kid, it was re-runs of The Twilight Zone, The Outer Limits and Night Gallery. It was reprints of the great EC comics like Tales From The Crypt and Weird Science, and then I discovered their natural successors, Warren�s Creepy and Eerie. When I was in high school and taking my first creative writing class, I came up with the title for my take on the anthology series with twist endings: Bedtime Stories For Impressionable Children. It was the first screenplay I tried to write. That didn�t go far, but it also never left me. As time marched on, The Twilight Zone movie, several new iterations of the TV show, and a new Outer Limits came and went (and now there's a new Zone out there once again). Bruce Jones created Alien Worlds and Twisted Tales, very much in the spirit of the EC titles, and Steven Spielberg tried his hand with Amazing Stories. Finally, a new incarnation of Creepy arrived along with glorious reprint volumes of the originals. None of these things did anything to dampen my enthusiasm for Bedtime Stories For Impressionable Children. Through my comic book career I became friends with the Gaines family (that�s the estate of EC Comics founder Bill Gaines) and had a chance to assist with the beautiful EC Archives line of books, which we produced at Gemstone Publishing. I also became friends with modern-day owners of Creepy and Eerie. This did nothing but inspire me. Over those same years, I found out many of my favorite creators felt the same way, and they were glad to sign up for Bedtime Stories For Impressionable Children. UNCLE ALONZO Meet Alonzo Delvechio, also known as Uncle Alonzo. He's our host for Bedtime Stories For Impressionable Children. He's an unemployed construction worker in suburban Pittsburgh. After months of being pushed, cajoled, and flat-out nagged by his wife to find a job or start his own business, he decided to open a daycare center. And as soon as it was up and running, she left him. Which brings up a good question: "Who�s more in danger, Alonzo or the kids?� That's a decision we�ll leave up to you! Bedtime Stories For Impressionable Children - Standard Cover READY TO GO The best part about this collection of Bedtime Stories For Impressionable Children -- beyond the stories themselves and their fantastic creators -- is that this book is just six pages away from being done And one of those six pages is the Thank-You page for our Kickstarter supporters! Seriously, we're that close to being ready to roll, but we need your help to get us across the finish line! Vaughn (right) with Vicent Spencer (left) and Alex Alley (center), getting photo bombed by Batman on Free Comic Book Day. ABOUT J.C. VAUGHN J.C. Vaughn is best known as the Vice-President of Publishing for Gemstone Publishing, the home of The Overstreet Comic Book Price Guide. In comics he has created or co-created Zombie-Proof with Vincent Spencer, Vampire, PA, The Flight, and Antiques: The Comic Strip with Brendon & Brian Fraim, Return of the Human with Mark Wheatley, as well as Bedtime Stories for Impressionable Children, McCandless & Company, and others.
