In the process he has worked with 20th Century Fox, Lucasfilm, Crusade Fine Arts, Dark Horse Comics, DC Comics, Disney, EC Comics, IDW Publishing, Image Comics, MGM, and Universal Studios, among others. In addition to comics, he has written for animation, trading cards, magazines, newspapers, and websites. His work has been profiled in Emmy magazine, TV Guide, and 24 Magazine and other periodicals, as well as on comic industry outlets.

�We shall not cease from exploration And the end of all our exploring Will be to arrive where we started And know the place for the first time.� - T. S. Eliot Self-reflection is a difficult process, at least it has been for me. And my artistic goals, like so many others, are those of self-expression through abstraction� in my case, through sound and time. So while painting the full picture, warts and all, can be the most challenging work, I�m starting to realize that for me it feels like the only work. My one time mentor (and musical hero) Danilo Perez used to tell us to �play what we don�t like about ourselves.� A tall order for any young musician, and it�s taken me a long time to fully realize how essential that advice seems to be. When he brought me to Panama and I was able to talk to Wayne Shorter briefly about originality, Wayne�s advice was profoundly simple: nobody has lived your life, eaten what you�ve eaten, felt what you�ve felt... if you can find a way to translate that through your work, it can�t help but be original. These two generous glimpses into their brilliance feel so tethered to one another, it couldn�t have been more obvious what they were trying to pass on. The music on this next record represents my latest attempt to honor that. Sitting with my fears, joys, insecurities, and trying to explain that process as best I can. I�ve asked some of my very favorite musicians, and dear friends, to help pull the music from the pages and into the air- Dayna Stephens on saxes and EWI, Edward Perez on bass, Colin Stranahan on drums and guests Ben Monder on guitar and Caroline Davis on alto sax. If I�m to present this music with the transparency and clarity I wish it to have, the process can be an expensive one. And so without pre-orders, independent artists are faced with a serious uphill battle when it comes to the initial production of the music itself. I hope that my music and goals are compelling enough that you�d like to purchase the record before it�s made� it essentially can�t exist without it. If you are further inclined to support my music, there are several interesting rewards that could offer unique insight into the process, and even more hands-on involvement should that interest you further. Thank you so much for taking the time to read this, I know there are thousands of things tugging at your attention and it means so much that you would spend some energy considering my work. Best, Julian

In 2009, a small group of dedicated art professionals - artists, architects, designers, educators, historians, and patrons - set out to create a national symbol for arts and arts education: a kind of "Smokey Bear" for the arts that also exists and functions as an arts experience. Thanks to original sponsors like Agnes Gund, Lawrence B. Benenson, Rose Ciaola, Artsy.net, artnet.com, the Compleat sculptor and a major grant from the Annenberg Foundation�s/metabolic studios, Mister ArtSee is the first of a series of ArtSee vehicles that not only act as a mascot but also as a platform of awareness online and in real world engagement, for the arts, technology and design. Since its inception, the Mister ArtSee vehicle/project has brought exhibits, lectures, videos, presentations, classroom activities and is currently donating over 2 million dollars in arts education kits for thousands of children around the country. With your help, we can create and update Mister ArtSee as a National Mascot after 10 years of activities, so it can expand its mission of advocating for the arts and arts education across the entire country for many years to come.. Why is this important? Mister ArtSee has brought an important service for the arts and arts education. Besides proving to be an effective spokesperson in ways of engaging the general public, the Mister ArtSee project/organization has helped foster individuals and other organizations contribute to arts education through problem solving and collaborations that never before existed. As a resource and information hub, Mister ArtSee has connected donors to organizations without any restraints or organizational hurdles. Our mission Is simply to be an advocate for the arts and to help solve issues and create opportunities. Similar to the unbounded flexibility of our organizational activities, the Mister ArtSee vehicle has been developed as a work of art as well a space for art to maximize versatility, accessibility and expandability - a multipurpose art-platform, whose possibilities are limited only by the imagination of its participants. With your support, Mister Artsee can build and expand our mission and presence in the national culture at large. Mister ArtSee original collaborators - Elliott Arkin, Vito Acconci, Dario Nunez-Ameni What will your contribution support? After 10 years on the road, Mister ArtSee has seen wear and tear. Your contribution will create Mister ArtSee for the future - a new exterior, new outer covering, a new more environmentally friendly engine, sound and light system, and most of all, a newly designed platform and exhibition area for presentations and performances. These specially designed new elements will prepare and improve Mister ArtSee to go around the United States for many years. Most recently, Mister ArtSee was selected to receive an extraordinary donation, thanks to a committed private art patron, of over 100,000 art education books/kits published by Harry Abrams. Your contribution will directly ensure that we can distribute all these materials outside of New York along with a specially created series of art educational presentations in 2019 Why Kickstarter? What better way is there for a �National Mascot� to gain and demonstrate a national support than to partner with Kickstarter and accomplish our project? Kickstarter is a way everyone can get involved and feel a part of a bigger effort. We hope our �thank you� gifts will help everyone choose to participate. I have started writing this book twenty different times. I would always get several chapters in before realizing, "this is not the direction I wanted this to go." I had a feeling that someday the right book would just come pouring out of me. It did. All previous drafts prepared me to complete this book at this time in my life. With great pride, I have culminated six years of experiences and lessons that finally clicked into a cohesive story. I then worked with a talented team of proofreaders, including a professional editor from NYC, who tirelessly combed through the material many times to bring you the final product. This book has been simmering in my mind for years, with portions of it that I started working on as early as 2013. I love the final product and am eager to share it with you. What's The Book About? "If The Poor Were Next Door" is a short but compelling read. In about one hour, you will know my most intense life experiences and how they culminated in DonorSee. These are the experiences that shaped who I am, what I believe and why I have devoted my life to serving the poorest half of the planet. I do not hold back in this book. I don't sugarcoat any of the stories and I don't shy away from sharing my opinion. This is a redemptive book about some of the darkest moments of my life. Moments that have made me who I am. When you are finished, you will put it down with a brand new, refreshed, inspired and open-minded perspective. Why Do I Need Your Help? There are two major things left to do and I need your help to accomplish them: 1. The book needs a cover. I want to hire a professional designer who can help us make this book as beautiful as possible. The more intriguing the cover design, the more appealing it will be to new readers. 2. The book needs a prominent voice to write the foreword. The person who writes the foreword for this book will help us signal to potential readers the legitimacy behind this project. I appreciate anyone who is able to get involved at any amount. The more people who support this book, the more resources we can pour into the cover and the better chance we'll have at attracting a great person to write our foreword. Who Are "The First 100" And What Do They Get? The First 100 are the 100 people who join at the $79 level and up. There are only 100 spots available for this reward tier. Join at this level and you will get: Name listed. On every edition ever printed of the book, the first page will say, "This Book Was Made Possible By" and then will list all 100 of your names below. You will forever be a part of helping me tell my story. Exclusive "First 100" Edition. The first 100 copies ever printed will be different than all the others. It will include a private letter from me printed exclusively in this edition. You will get 1 of the only 100 copies in existence. Extra Signed copies. You will get at least 2 extra regular edition copies to share. Both your "First 100" and your other copies will be signed by me. eBook. Just in case you prefer reading via eBook, you'll get a version of this as well. Extras. There are 10 spots available to join at a higher reward tier than $79. Each comes with unique prizes listed in the rewards section. Join me at this level and you will play a crucial role in making this book happen. I can't do this without you. You have a special place in my heart and I am grateful that you believe in me and the work I am doing. I just want to say in advance: thank you. About Gret Gret Glyer is the CEO of DonorSee, and has raised more than a million dollars for those in extreme poverty. From 2013 to 2016, Gret lived with the world�s poorest people in Malawi, Africa where he built more than 100 houses for the homeless and crowdfunded $100,000 to build a girls� school in rural Malawi. Gret has been featured in USA Today, National Review, HuffPo, Acton Institute and is a TEDx Speaker. He gives regular talks on charity, poverty and perspective.

See Winston in Action Stretch Goals (All Unlocked Now) Guaranteed Delivery We�re providing a 100% delivery guarantee - if Winston isn�t produced or delivered for any reason - we�ll fully return the money pledged via Kickstarter. VAT/GST For purchases outside the USA, customers are responsible for VAT/GST. Winston�s founder, Richard Stokes, was in the ad-tech industry for over a decade, most recently as the Global Head of Innovation for the media intelligence division of the world's largest advertising agency. In that role, he saw the industry move to embrace new technologies that track, mine, and sell private information (imagine every song you like, every relationship, every purchase you make, and every secret you have being stored forever in the cloud). That was the beginning of the omnipresent surveillance state. Rich decided this was not a world that he wanted his children to grow up in. It all came down to one question�if he wasn't the person to do something about it, then who would? That�s where Winston comes in. We founded Winston Privacy with a clear mission: to help Internet users take back control over their personal information. Comprehensive privacy is not only possible, it's realistic. Our team is made of people with diverse technical backgrounds and skill sets, and a deep knowledge of the state of online privacy. Our founder is an engineer by training who left a career in advertising after seeing firsthand the increasing abuses of personal data that are taking place. At Winston, we�re not only building products that put the power back into your hands, we�re also advocating for change. Our team began the Winston journey by shipping 20 beta units so that users could put our claims to the test. The year is 2876 on a far distant planet named Rennova. Humankind has emerged from their bunkers following the War of the Five Factions. Across the barren landscapes lie mountains of steel, fields of metal, and vast expanses of damaged robots. To help rebuild Rennova to its once great glory, humans banded together and reconstructed robots. With disagreements about how to restore the planet, war broke out again between opposing tribes. Two Robots is a fast-paced, strategic card game of set collection and player elimination in a far distant future. Players in the game control Salvagers with special abilities attempting to build more robots with scrap robot parts than their friends. Be the first to eliminate all players or build Two Robots, the choice is yours. Check out the following videos or download the game rules below to learn more about how the game is played: Please note that we may make some minor adjustments, tweaks, and polishes to the layout so this version might not be final. We have bundled in some unique cards for you all that will live on as Kickstarter Exclusives and won't appear ever again. We refer to these cards as Forsaken Cards. They have a different back to differentiate them and are a piece of our heart to you. These have endured thorough playtesting and vetting, but ultimately were taken out of the game in favor of other things. Because of your support, we are bringing them back, just for you! Kickstarter Exclusive Edition design for the box cover  Centuries ago, light-years away, our ancestors, the people of Earth, were faced with the seemingly impossible task of surviving the impact of a meteor larger than any other in recorded history. In spite of their previous differences toward one another and the panic prevalent across the globe, the people came together and worked toward a solution that allowed many to escape the tragedy that befell their home. We, the people of Rennova, honor our ancestors in everything we do, for, if not for their efforts, we would not be. Two Robots takes place after many events have already transpired. Humans banded together and left Earth after a disastrous meteor was approaching. Escaping on a ship named Perstemico, they landed on a distant planet named Rennova, and proceeded to colonize it. Along the way, high technological advancements were achieved, robots were built, and war erupted between robots. In a daring attempt to quell the disaster, humans hid underground and unleashed a Xanadranium bomb, wiping out all that was above it, or so they thought. The year is now 2876, war has just ended, and humans are now getting back to the surface. A few robots remain, beyond them, scatters of robot parts strewn everywhere. The humans refer to these that remain as Salvagers -- and they are no ordinary robots. The radiation transformed them, unlocking powers in robots that humans never thought was possible. Tasked now with re-building their planet, humans relied heavily on Salvagers to build Robots again from scrap parts. The fields surrounding the once great city of Radixplor were too dangerous for humans to venture, the radiation preventing them from mining precious Tenaxium to power the rebuild. The Salvagers were sent out to bring these parts back to the factories where they could be constructed into Robots once again. However, disagreements on which energy type to build first escalated conflict once again. Tribes were forming, separating themselves from other humans and Salvagers alike. Are you curious about how Rennova came to be, or the origin stories of all the robots? Read our backstory! Click to read the full backstory to the game. Here we break down the stories behind each Salavger, the journey that humans took to Rennova, and everything in between. Here's a few overviews, reviews, and thoughts from the community about Two Robots. Keep in mind that the reviews are based on a prototype of the game. "Thank you for the great review! This sounds like a fun game. I especially like the mechanic of the event cards counting as HP in the game. Who doesn�t like fighting robots?" "Two Robots is clearly a passion project. The backstory is creative and well thought out, and the concept art and final card designs are visually stunning. Combined, we think these guys may have the makings of a potential hit." As well as getting the game and all unlocked stretch goals, we have some optional add-ons that you can purchase. All add-ons will be handled through our pledge manager, Gamefound. After the campaign has ended you will be receiving a link to sign up for our pledge manager, in this you will be able to tell us which add-ons you want, along with your shipping information for them. So how do you purchase an add-on? After you have selected one of our reward levels all you have to do is increase your pledge amount by the amount of the add-on. For instance, if you want to purchase a shirt and also the Rennovan Citizen tier, you would add $20 + $20, and have a $40 pledge. Keep in mind, all backer add-ons are free shipping. We'll take care of shipping! Shirt color options: Check the FAQ and tell us in the pledge manager which one you want :) We will be working with shipping partners within the US, EU, Australia, and Canada. This means that you will get region-friendly shipping and not have to worry about paying any nasty customs fees. Shipping will be $4 for our US based backers, and we will be offering a low fixed fee shipping option for all international backers. Keep in mind -- this fee applies to all tiers, regardless if you are backing 1 or 2 copies of the game. We are striving to keep shipping as low as possible! After the campaign has ended, we will send out a survey through our pledge manager in which you can enter your shipping address and payment information. Here's a breakdown of cost based on your location: US: $4 Canada, EU, UK, China, Hong Kong, Singapore: $8 Australia, New Zealand: $10 Rest of World: $14 The idea for Two Robots was built from a weekly board game night that Omar hosts at his house. We originally had set out to build a fully digital version of the game, and were quite far along. The night was wrapping up, we had just finished a string of games, and that's when the lightbulb moment hit. Our game could really be fun as a tabletop game. After that, we spent countless months calibrating and balancing the rules of the game through extensive play testing to bring you all something that we are truly proud of. If you want to see what we are up to, or get a behind the scenes look, follow us on one of our social accounts below! We are a distributed team with a home base in Austin, Texas. All of us have worn many hats while designing and building this game. If you are ever in Austin, give us a shout and we will buy you a coffee! Special thanks to Butch Mancuso, "The Maven" for all of his help! For media inquiries please reach out to allison@properpropaganda.net, thanks! This project is promoted by Jellop, the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarters with 650+ successful Kickstarter projects with over $300MM raised between them.

Here are some sample pages: Here's how the game works: 1. Sit down and while you do your business, open to the first page and answer. When you're done, don't forget to wipe. 2. When your potty partner goes, they read your response and enter their own. Then they flip the page and start the next question. Two answers per potty visit (PPV). 3. The questions fall into 4 alternating categories: Trivia, Reveal, Hypothetical and Action. They are color coded to make your first grade teacher happy. 4. We've carefully crafted the journey. It starts out light and easy and leads to, well, interesting places. Skipping ahead ruins the fun, trust us. 5. There are 200 questions. Each pad should take roughly three months of healthy bowel movements to complete. Each toilet paper shaped pad of fun has 200 pages: 75 Trivia pages 50 Reveal pages 50 Hypothetical pages 25 Action pages And if your potty partner is out of town, there's a word search on the back to solo play. Over the last 18 months, more than 100 friends and strangers have played different prototypes of the game. The most common feedback we get is: We've also gotten these messages: Fair warning, if you share a potty with your grandma, you probably shouldn't play this game. First, it's a great time. You and your potty partner will grow even closer and have a blast doing it. Second, it's really DIFFERENT. Do you know of any other games that take place on the potty? Card games are played out. Strategy games are hard. This game is fresh. Third, you get a LOT of pages. 200 PAGES to be exact. It'll take roughly three months worth of potty breaks to complete the game. If we haven't convinced you yet, it's probably not for you. Go buy another Cards Against Humanity expansion pack. In 2016, we successfully funded our first game, CoolCats & AssHats: A Funner Way to Party. Since then, we've sold a bunch of copies to fun-loving people like you. Now we're back with our second game...Toilet Tag: A Funner Way to Potty. Before we got into the silly game business, we met working for a Big Tobacco company in the summer of 2007. We became friends and stayed in touch when we both moved on from pushing cigs. Working across the country, we built a game called CoolCats & AssHats. We funded it on Kickstarter and have since sold a bunch of games on Amazon. And we don't care what Jeff Bezos' dick looks like if you're wondering. If you're wondering what ours look like, we're both pretty average. Anyway, we're stoked to be back with another game we think you'll love. So, yeah, we wanna make this sucker real and we need your help.

Ascension of the Galaxy is the rich, maneuver-based spaceship combat game where thinking ahead is not optional. Plenty of decisions have to be made every turn. Although this is a print-and-play game, you could easily use your own space mat with a hex-grid and miniatures to use making for a beautiful gaming experience.

Deadball: Year III is an expansion to the bestselling Deadball: Baseball With Dice, a fast-paced game for one or two players that uses real statistics and RPG dice to bring the ballpark to your tabletop. It requires the original game to play. Inspired by the cheats and scoundrels of baseball history, Year III features Steroid Era all-stars, rules for throwing the World Series, and fully-updated rosters for the wonderfully bizarre Southern Circuit. It also introduces tweaks and updates designed to make the most elegant baseball game on the market even easier to play. I don't put projects on Kickstarter until they are nearly complete. As soon as you back the project, you'll find a 38 page preview of the new book in the first backer update. The PDF rulebook will be released at the end of June�just in time for the All Star break�and the hardcopy will be available soon after. You will not wait long to play this game. What Is Deadball? First introduced in 2017, Deadball is a lightweight baseball simulation designed by W.M. Akers (that's me), creator of the RPG Comrades and author of the mystery novel Westside. Popular with old school baseball cranks and children just learning to love the sport, it allows you to play a game starring players from today, the past, or your own imagination in around 30 minutes. If you�re new to Deadball, check out the free quick start guide and back this project at the $25 level to get the original game at a steep discount. If you love baseball, this is the game you've been waiting for. One hundred years ago, a group of Chicago White Sox players attempted to throw the World Series, creating a scandal that ended their careers and changed the sport forever. It is an ugly chapter of baseball history�and one Deadball couldn't wait to explore. Deadball: Year III allows you to simulate a game or series in which one or more of the players on the field are deliberately trying to lose. They will swing at bad pitches, get thrown out on the bases, and turn easy outs into horrendous errors. And with every mistake they make, the crowd�s suspicion will grow. These new rules are designed to put you in the heads of Shoeless Joe Jackson and Eddie Cicotte, who threw away Hall of Fame-quality careers in hopes of a dishonest payday. How did they feel when they tried to rig the fall classic? In Year III, you will find out for yourself. Along with the rules for fixing a series, Year III includes: An oddities table that seamlessly integrates incidents like balks, fan interference, botched calls, and animals on the field�without slowing down play New rules to simulate modern bullpen usage A revised Deadball scoresheet that makes it easier than ever to keep track of the action Rosters for the notorious All Stars of the Steroid Era A history of baseball�s bans and blacklists by John Thorn, the official historian of Major League Baseball; a meditation on losing on purpose by USA Today�s Ted Berg, and a poem about the dead ball era by Nicole Callihan In Year III, cheaters never prosper�but they still have a marvelous time. In all of baseball fact or fiction, there is no league quite like the Southern Circuit. Fully co-ed and unapologetically eccentric, it features teams like the Paducah Red Birds, the Charlottesville Flycatchers, and the notorious Knoxville Grackles. Its players, owners and managers are drawn from the ranks of past Deadball Kickstarter backers, and it has been designed for fans who love the game's losers and weirdos as much as they do the all-time greats. This book includes complete recaps of last season, previews for the coming year, and two brand new Nine Game Pennant campaigns, which drop you into the climax of a pennant race and ask you to seize the championship or die trying. More than a fictional league, the Southern Circuit is an evolving story that you will bring to life. Pledge $40 to join the league as a prospect with a chance to appear in future books and redefine the Circuit forever. Everyone who pledges $10 or more gets a digital copy of the game, plus all the digital supplements and stretch goal materials, including: The redesigned scorecard, including pre-filled lineups for all the Southern Circuit teams An updated Quick Reference that puts all the new rules within easy reach A Steroid Era Quick Reference that allows for truly astonishing slugfests A partially-blank Oddities Table that you can fill with all the weirdest baseball stuff you can imagine: 10� beer riots, disco demolitions, and whatever else you desire Schedules and scorecards for the 2019 and 1911 Nine Game Pennant campaigns Pledge $15 or more to get the PDF plus a code to buy the print book from DriveThruRPG for the at-cost price of $4.96, and pledge $20 to write your name into the history books by naming one of the record-breaking legends of the Southern Circuit's Steroid Era, who are presented here in lineups for the 1999 All Star Game. This is limited to 25 spots, and the most talented players will go first. If you�ve missed out on past Deadball titles, this is your chance to get them at the steepest possible discount. Pledge $25 to get Year III along with PDFs and at-cost codes for the original rulebook, Deadball: 1909, and Deadball: Year II: an $80 value! Pledge $35 to get all four past books and to name one of those 1999 All Stars as well. (Limited to 25 spots.) Dreaming of a call-up to the big leagues? Pledge $40 to name one of the new class of Southern Circuit prospects. Use your own name, a loved one's, or the classic baseball moniker you�ve always wanted to see in the box scores. This is limited to 32 spots. The sooner you pledge, the better your prospect will be, and the more likely they will be to stick on the roster next season. As always, all rosters are coed. Prefer a spot on the bench to a place in the field? For $50, you can name and describe one of the eccentric skippers who rule the clubs of the Southern Circuit, one of whom is profiled on every team page. Join the ranks of Fay Harbaugh and Doc Pawlowski, and reshape the league in your own image. The at-cost price for past rulebooks is as follows: Deadball: Baseball With Dice � $3.24 Deadball: 1909 � $3.24 Deadball: Year II � $4.31 This does not include shipping or the cost of dice, which you can purchase for a few dollars online or at your local game store. Any set of polyhedral (or RPG) dice will have everything you need. Finally, if you're interested in trying Deadball but financial constrictions make the cost prohibitive, email me or message me on Kickstarter and I'll send you a free PDF of the original game. Stretch Goals At $5,000 (UNLOCKED!), I'll release Ancient Era Deadball rosters inspired by the larger-than-life characters of my novel Westside. At $10,000, I�ll release All Star rosters for the Southern Circuits of 2019 and 1911. At $15,000, I�ll record a �Let�s Play!� video for Deadball, explaining the basic rules and giving a peek at how I play the game.

Naysayer is a dramatic coming of age digital series set in and around New York City. It consists of eight 10-12 minute episodes to be viewed on the internet. Our goal is to create festival-winning content and fund an ongoing series that sparks thought, conversation, and feeling. SYNOPSIS Randall, a teenage survivor of a school shooting ends up in the cross-hairs of hoaxers who will stop at nothing to disprove the tragedy. Randall survived the Marquis Elementary school shooting five years ago, but his sister Julie did not. Their horrific story makes the family an irresistible target for the gun-rights zealots and hoaxers. Outside of the family�s grief, Randall is just another adolescent skater aspiring to Instagram fame alongside his friends. When he and right-wing contrarian Cynthia unexpectedly fall for each other, Randall begins to ask the conspiracy driven questions publicly that Cynthia has encouraged him to work through, setting in motion a quest that will test Randall�s relationship with reality, his family and friends, and his first love, Cynthia. Who's running this show? (Director's Statement) I�m a progressive humanist who grew up shooting guns. I believe that humanism is the greatest -ism out there. Lately, I�ve become increasingly disillusioned by our collective response to tragedies in our own home towns. Mass shootings were once tragedies that gave us pause, rallied us together and reminded us of our greatest power as a people; to heal ourselves. But, today, in this post-truth world, it is now acceptable to prey upon survivors of family tragedy for the sake of an ideology or an industry. Everything is fair game. Well, F* THAT. I appreciate our Second Amendment rights, but not to the detriment of our society. This series is a chilling glimpse of just how low some Americans are willing to stoop to quench their fanaticism. There is a power that takes root in our coming of age, and I hope telling this challenging and tragic story through the unvarnished eyes of a teenager will help bolster our courage as a nation. I hope this will compel us to embrace sensible gun laws� it�s not too late. Why do we need $20,000? We have a tiny budget and a tinier crew. This includes an immensely talented cinematography duo, a director who will also be running sound. Although they have been known to work for food and hugs, we do need to supply them with gear and snacks. Here is a picture of most of our wonderful group (cast & crew) with a few producers for good measure: After the first cast reading, hosted by Dumbo Salt Works, NYC The dedication of the cast and crew is unparalleled. Cast members are using personal wardrobe and taking on the responsibility of doing their own hair and makeup. Crew members are borrowing and lending gear without rental fees. Producers are doing double and triple duty for free. The director is even holding the microphone. Why would we do this? Because we believe in the script and how important it is to tell Randall's story. But, our assets are stretched and starting to show through like that one batch of lululemons. With the money you help us to raise we will meet the bare minimum of what it will take to finish this project. Here are some of items we need to ensure funds for: 1. Meals that that the director does not have to prepare with the few hours he is not actively in production. 2. The locations that every film needs but this production can't (yet) afford. For instance, a diner where our talented teens create the bonds that drive our story. 3. An on-set armorer to keep all of our fingers safe. 4. A professional post-production crew including a sound designer (especially since the director is doing sound). 5. An editor to make sure all of the hard days and long nights fit together seamlessly. The Timeline You are joining us at a very exciting time! Pre-production and casting are complete. Locations are locked. Principal photography is set to begin June 25, 2019. We are shooting at over 40 locations at an unrelenting pace for a total of 21 days. Our intention is to wrap post-production and share our series with you and the world by the end of 2019.

Honeycomb is a local artisan bread bakery. Our artisans specialize in naturally-leavened goods such as sourdough, focaccia, baguettes, rye, and hand-crafted pastry; all baked on a stone hearth. By sharing our love of baking with Lakelanders, we hope to achieve a simple mission: make our beautiful city a better, yummier place. Chocolate Hot Crossed Buns OUR VALUES Generosity, Humility, Grace, Honesty. Honeycomb's core values guide every decision we make at every level. This is how we make you feel special and welcome when you share a moment with us at the Farmer's Market, or at one of our wholesale outlets! Sourdough French Baguettes OUR FUTURE We have been open for less than a year, and yet we are already opening our brick-and-mortar storefront! This summer, we are transforming the historic Studebaker Building at 213 East Bay Street in downtown Lakeland into a beautiful new bakery-bistro; and we are sharing the space with Twenty Seven, who will be bringing an indie bookstore and design studio to the area! The future Honeycomb will feature a stage for live music and events, community-led garden and culinary library, comfortable patio seating, a second-floor mezzanine with cozy reading nooks, and full continental and bistro lunch menu! Did we mention we'll be open Tuesday through Saturday?? Our future is so bright and we hope you will join us on this journey! Smoked salmon & house ricotta on sourdough rye FUNDING We need an investment of $10,000 to help refurbish the space and purchase equipment. The funding is all-or-nothing, so every dollar truly counts so that we can make this dream a reality! We have some exciting rewards for you based on your pledge amount; PLUS, if we exceed our funding goal, we have some extra goodies planned for our backers including additions to the menu (croissants anyone?). Thank you so much in advance for becoming a part of the Honeycomb family! Honeycomb Country Sourdough Lastly, please take a moment to visit the Twenty Seven kickstarter page for more information about our partnership with the retail space and local artist making this all happen! https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/twentyseven/twenty-sevens-brick-and-mortar/description

Anyone ever hear of a People Matter tech startup company??? A company that puts compassion in front of profit?? That's who we are and hints at the way we work. The products we design and build are real solutions to problems trending in today's society. Porch pirates stealing Amazon packages that are all but useless (less than 5% can be resold). Shooters are entering our churches at will, they casually stroll into our schools and kill my babies. Can we not just combine existing technology into an all encompassing machine learned brain that does everything Star Trek did, but in a practical solution type of application. What about using algorithms or video recognition software to distinguish the shooter from a student ?? Our current "system" treats a cheerleader uniform no different from a trench coat killer. Why?? There are no systems in place today, unless you have luggage, travel documents, and a multi billion dollar airline industry to protect. My son and I had an idea for an invention. We had a package stolen and went to Google to find some kind of secured package delivery container for our front door, Google revealed almost nothing. Thus an idea was born. We tinkered with outdoor storage boxes from Lowe's...not perfect by any means--they didn't even have a hasp for padlock...Then we thought why not put a simple alarm in place on our front porch. The driver sees the message (logo / brand), places the box on the alarm; this activates the alarm through a weight sensor. We recently patented this idea--the device we are pioneering is now real, and we own it. These are crimes of opportunity that, with a little common sense, the use of readily available and simple technology, should all but put an end to your package delivery theft problems. During the design phase of the stop button we decided to form an LLC. and become experts in this greenfield market. Think Consumer Reports of alternative security technology. We now have an ever-growing team of IT/Web Builders/ Director of Charitable operations/ Internet Marketers/Mechanical Engineers/Social Media Interns/Office Manager. All team members have full time jobs elsewhere except our admin. Our team will come together into 1 SOMA office soon. Team members either currently own stock or have the opportunity to easily acquire. Stop 99 LLC. is a silicon valley startup with a different flare than most startups employ. We care way more about people--people of all shapes, sizes, and colors than we do about profit margins. Our earning capability is very LARGE, so we believe you don't have to step on people and crush their dreams to climb the corporate ladder. We wanted to become a company where people matter, where we are charitable, we give our time to great causes and we pioneer new charities of our own. Our own South San Francisco charity ""No home left behind" -- where neighbors get together one Saturday a month and volunteer to cut the grass in the front yard for people who either can't get it done, or can't be bothered. Our goals are several 1. Keep our community beautiful by reducing perceived eye sores in the form of tall grass and weeds and 2. Make a difference for those that need us, and set a good example for the ones that ignore good neighborly standards.

Gas Detecting Device Made for Safety The AGDM316 series by Aimtek LLC are pocket-size gas detecting devices that detect and measure density of specific gases in their surrounding environment. All models share the same electronics and mechanics but differ in the type of gas sensor modules used. They provide applications in air quality, breath alcohol content, CO, CO2, Hydrogen and Propane/Methane/LNG measurement. The device�s LCD monitor displays gas measurement, device status, environmental temperature and humidity of surrounding air. Additional device features and options are alarm function that generates alarm sounds when gas level exceeds preprogrammed safe levels, Bluetooth option for remote monitoring and setup and no LCD option with Bluetooth. This device has internal rechargeable Lithium-ion battery that can provide hours of operation without external power based on type of sensor is used. Sound Alarm The AGDM316 device is equipped with a piezoelectric sound Alarm that beeps at 1 KHz with 40db sound level. The Alarm starts sounding at different beep cycles depending on gas concentration levels detected. For concentrations up to 10% above minimum level, it beeps half a second every 10 seconds. For concentrations of 10% to 25% above minimum level, it beeps half a second every 5 seconds. For concentrations of more than 25% above minimum level, it beeps half a second every 2 seconds. Air Quality Indicator Model AGDM316-10 This model has a wide thickness W type case. The sensor is suitable for detecting NH3, NOX and Benzene gases which are detrimental for measuring indoor air quality. The display for Air Quality device depicts a horizontal Gauge as shown above. The middle vertical dial moves from left to right as density of pollutant in air increases. A small upward arrow symbol on bottom of horizontal Gauge indicates starting location of gas concentration that may not be safe and where alarm is activated. A separate line shows the gas measurement in PPM (parts per million) and sensor type. Press the pushbutton switch to start detection and measurement and push again to stop. This device is calibrated using standard clean air and or 100ppm NH3 gas. Model AGDM316-14/15 This model has a narrow thickness S type case. The sensor is suitable for detecting NO2 and NO gases which are detrimental for measuring air quality concerning pollution from automobile exhaust. The display for Air Quality device depicts a horizontal Gauge as shown above. The middle vertical Dial moves from left to right as density of pollutant in air increases. A small upward arrow symbol on bottom of horizontal Gauge indicates starting location of gas concentration that may not be safe and where alarm is activated. A separate line shows the Gas measurement in PPM (parts per million) and sensor type. Press the pushbutton switch to start detection and measurement and push again to stop. This device is calibrated using standard clean air. Breathalyzer Model AGDM316-14/15 This model has a narrow thickness S type case. The sensor is suitable for detecting Ethanol (Alcohol). The display for Breathalyzer device is shown above. The unit of measurement for Blood Alcohol Content (BAC) is in g/dL or grams per deci-liter which is used in the US as legal measurement method. A Zero alcohol content level is displayed as 0.00 and any level above 0.08 will chime an alarm. It is recommended that for BAC measurement one should blow into the sensor well on back of the device using a straw. When device is in ready measurement mode, any measured peak value will be displayed for 2 seconds before reverting to current measurement value. A separate line shows the Gas measurement in PPM (parts per million) and sensor type. Press the pushbutton switch to start detection and measurement and push again to stop. This device is calibrated using standard clean air. Model AGDM316-5 This model has a wide thickness W type case. The sensor is suitable for detecting Ethanol (Alcohol). The display for Breathalyzer device is shown above. The unit of measurement for Blood Alcohol Content (BAC) is in g/dL or grams per deci-liter which is used in USA as legal measurement method. A Zero alcohol content level is displayed as 0.00 and any level above 0.08 will chime an alarm. It is recommended that for BAC measurement one should blow into the sensor well on top side of the device using a straw or mouth piece. When device is in ready measurement mode, any measured peak value is displayed for 2 seconds before reverting to current measurement value. A separate line shows the Gas measurement in PPM (parts per million) and sensor type. Press the pushbutton switch to start detection and measurement and push again to stop. This device is calibrated using standard clean air. CO2 Air Pollution Model AGDM316-12 W type case Co Detector and Measurement Model AGDM316-14/15 S type case Model AGDM316-7 W type case Model AGDM316-10 W type case Butane, Methane, LNG Leakage Detector Model AGDM316-6 W type case Hydrogen GAS Model AGDM316-14/15 S type case Model AGDM316-7 W type case Model AGDM316-8 W type case The display for AGDM316 general gas detection and measurement devices depicts a vertical bar graph as shown above. The vertical solid bar graph moves from bottom to top as density of targeted gas in air increases. A separate line shows Gas measurement in PPM (parts per million) and sensor type. The targeted sensor minimum and maximum gas detection levels are shown in the bottom and top of the bar graph. These devices are calibrated using standard clean air and or associated gases at calibration densities. Press the pushbutton switch to start detection and measurement and push again to stop. Bluetooth Ready Option All models have built in internal Bluetooth Interface, although the Bluetooth data ready is an add-on optional feature. A Bluetooth ready AGDM316 device can also have an option of no LCD monitor. In this case, the device data can only be monitored from a remote Bluetooth computer, Apple or Android device. The App for Android device is included at no cost. Note- This option will not be available in the initial product offering. The AGDM316 device with Bluetooth ready and no LCD monitor is shown above. Specification 1- Size; width = 88.34 mm, height = 56mm, thickness = 25.57 mm W (wide) type, 19.5 mm S (slim) type. 2- Weight; 85 grams. 3- Power; external, connector Micro USB type B, capacity 5 Volts 250 mA, consumption = 750 mW type W, 300mW type S. 4- Battery; internal Lithium-ion 3.7V, 400mAh. 5- Operating temperature; -20 to 70 degrees Celsius. 6- Storage; -30 to 80 degrees Celsius non-condensing. Rewards Note- Devices with multi-application capabilities can utilize this feature with Bluetooth option only. For ordering, a default application from above chart must accompany the selected device model, also add "F (Fahrenheit) or "C" (Celsius) for display default temperature setting. for example; AGDM316-14/15-Air Quality-F. I believe we are in the midst of a global awakening and the consciousness of the planet is rising. As a teacher, healer, and spiritual speaker I am called to do my part to help people live aligned lives and heal/clear/transmute the sabotaging and toxic thoughts, beliefs, patterns, and habits that are keeping them from living the the abundant, healthy, and freedom lifestyle they dream about. This lifestyle web series focuses on clearing clutter on the 5 Pillars (levels) of living an aligned, healthy, and spiritual/holistic life. The video below is an example of a segment on de-cluttering toxins on the physical level by clean eating. This also raises your energetic vibration. Most people that want to transform their life start on the physical level, but they stop there and never make it to the other Pillars! THE DETAILS: The funds will be used to secure a videographer/ film and post-production student assistant from Scottsdale School of Film + Theatre at Scottsdale Community College and miscellaneous film equipment, space rentals, and social media ads. Overall the goal is to bring a holistic and spiritual lifestyle to the mainstream in a way that is educational, entertaining, and easy to integrate for the masses that are called to heal and transform their life.

The Story Flora Borealis tells two stories about our troubled relationship to the natural world. The first is a story of renewal in a darkened future, a tale of queer love and a chance for redemption as two men, Pat and Theo, struggle with depression in a ruined environment. Theo knows they need to make a radical break with the past and start over somewhere new, but Pat feels this effort is hopeless. To buoy Pat, Theo tells him a story. The story Theo tells is one of the past, of loss and hubris, of art and science, of knowledge and morality, as a botanical glassblower mourns his dead wife. Haunted by her memory, he seeks solace in nature, which leads him on a fantastic journey. The two tales weave together, as both Pat and the glassblower struggle to find hope in despair and appreciate the beauty of nature. Pat and Theo The Glassblower Why This Film Is Important Film has the power to change perceptions. The pressing issue of our time, Global Warming, is a product of the view that the earth and nature are resources there for us to exploit. I hope this film can challenge that idea, and maybe shift the conversation towards working with nature, rather than against it. This film is also important because it pushes the boundaries of animation. It will made of 3d models, 3d scans from Harvard's Ware Collection of Glass Flowers, and rotoscoped actors shot on a green screen. For every frame we shoot, I�m going to create one drawing. This means I�ll be doing about 10,000 drawings to bring this film to life. Concept Art Garden concept art Director�s Statement I�m interested in exploring two things in my work: inequality, and nature. This film looks out how these things affect each other and us, whether physically or psychologically. I want to explore why we view nature as something to be controlled and wonder if humanity can return to a more loving and reciprocal relationship with the world. Until now, I've done so in a series of drawings and some short animations, but this is my chance to look at plants and people on a slightly larger scale. The ideas for the film came to me in parts, but a big inspiration was discovering the story of Leopold Blaschkha, who made thousands of glass flowers for Harvard in the late 19th and early 20th century. I was inspired by how he found solace in nature after his wife�s death, and by his amazing ability to perfectly recreate flowers from glass. The Blaschkas' Glass Flowers, from the Ware Collection at the Harvard Museum of Natural History More glass flowers from Harvard's Ware Collection Our Team: Casey Friedman (Writer / Director / Animator) Casey is a Brooklyn-based filmmaker and artist, and a graduate of Brown University with a degree in Sociology. Originally from Montclair, NJ, he is the Spring 2019 Valentine & Clark Emerging Artist Fellow at the Jacob Burns Film Center. He has worked at Cinereach, Ghetto Film School, DCTV, and Meteor Films. He's interested in queer ecology, environmental justice, and is exploring the history of colonialism through botany. Sean Weiner (Producer) Sean is the Director of Creative Culture - Fellowship & Residency Programs at the Jacob Burns Film Center. He has produced films that have screened at festivals around the world. Jake DeNicola (Cinematographer) Jake is a NYC based Director and Director of Photography. Along with his interest in visual anthropology, comes his deeply passionate and active engagement in filmmaking and music. Michael Cafiero (Landscape Designer) Michael is a student in the Landscape Architecture program at Harvard's Graduate School of Design. He's interested in regenerative agriculture, permaculture, and all things green. Why Donate?: I�m raising funds so I can pay the talented people who will bring my vision to life! That includes the actors, the cinematographer, the sound recordist, and the composer. I need pay these people for their time, as well as feed them during our four days of shooting. They also need transportation to the soundstage where we�ll be shooting. During post production, I�m going to need to rent out a more powerful computer that will allow me to composite everything (the rotoscoped actors, the 3d backgrounds, and the 3d models) together. This costs big bucks! Any support you can provide is greatly appreciated, and highly rewarded! Check out those perks! Timeline: Pre Production: May 1 - May 24 We�re finalizing casting decisions, and starting to plan the shoot. Shoot Dates: May-June Shooting begins in May on the soundstage at the Jacob Burns Film Center and wraps in June. Post Production and Animation: June - October Casey will doing the animation and compositing, and we have a great team of other talented individuals who will doing composing, sound mixing, and color grading! Concept Art Concept Art Concept Art Learn More: Curious about our planet's impending doom? Here are the basics. Here's a sobering reminder from the UN. Here's a list of organizations working on fighting global warming that you can support- but make sure to do your research! Want to learn more about Harvard's Ware Collection of Glass Flowers? Click here! What is rotoscoping? Here's a handy video! What is 3d scanning? Here's another handy video! Video music: Open Space by | e s c p | https://escp-music.bandcamp.com

Great maps lead to fantastic adventure! I have created a regional fantasy map for my ongoing adventure series, The Tarot Adventures. Unfortunately, I cannot draw or paint very well so I asked around and found an artist who was up for the task of creating such an important piece. This map was then artistically illustrated by Tania Gomez in full color and is now ready to see print. Available in both a players' version and a game master version (which has a handful of hidden locations), these maps are beautiful additions to your game or as wall art. Players' Map: Digital Preview image from printer site/ Artist: Tania Gomes This KickStarter campaign funds the printing and fulfillment costs for campaign rewards. All art costs have already been paid. What you get (I.E. Backer rewards!): Digital Map Pack ~ In order to make these maps as accessible as possible, I'm making them available in PNG for use in virtual tabletop applications. This file has been reduced to 12 by 18 inches in size to save on file size (we don't want horrible load times). This tier also includes a print on demand code for printed (12 inch by 18 inch) posters fulfilled through Drivethrurpg.com. The POD code will allow you to order the small printed maps, paying only the actual printing cost (presently 48 cents each) as well as shipping. Please note: Drivethru folds these once for shipping. The 24 x 36 inch maps for the higher level tiers are rolled and come from a different printer. Digital Map Pack and a Thank You post card ~ All the rewards of the Digital Map Pack Tier and a personalized 4 by 6 inch postcard sent to you from me. Note: These are sent as post cards, without an envelope, as postage would be prohibitive otherwise. Digital preview of 4 by 6 inch Thank you Card: Generated by printer's site / Artist: Tania Gomes Printed Player Map ~ Perfect for game masters who wants to put the world in the players' hands. Backers at this tier receive a printed (24 inch by 36 inch, yes it is HUGE) players' map poster. This will ship directly to you. Shipping is included for US addresses and an additional amount is appended in the pledge manager for addresses outside of the United States. Printed Player & Game Master (GM) Map ~ Backers at this tier get both printed maps (each is 24 by 36). The game master's version has a hex-grid and lists five hidden locations. These maps will ship directly to you. Additional shipping charge is appended in the pledge manager for addresses outside of the United States. Game Masters' Map: Digital Preview image from printer site/ Artist: Tania Gomes All printed maps ship unframed (which saves on shipping costs). Speaking of Shipping: Shipping of the large format maps within the United States and its territories is already factored into the reward tier. For backers in Canada an additional $5 is added in the pledge manager. For backers in all other countries an additional $8 is added in the pledge manager. This is to cover additional shipping costs that can arise. Backers are responsible for any tariff/taxes (VAT) that may arise. Why KickStarter? KickStarter is a fantastic platform. Sinopa Publishing books have been funded through the generous support of our backers. For this project, the KickStarter will help us determine whether we need to have a full offset print run done, or if print to order will be sufficient. We have no stretch goals for this campaign as it is a QuickStarter. Our goal is to bring this high-quality map to gamers far and wide and to have fun doing it. Where does the money go? Funds from this campaign go toward printing and fulfillment costs. Art has already been paid for. Any excess funds will be used toward future product development, which helps keep future project campaign goals low. How you can help: You can help our efforts by supporting the campaign at a tier that is comfortable for you. You can also help the campaign a great deal by sharing the campaign link on social media, on your blog/podcast/Youtube channel, and by telling fellow tabletop role playing gamers. Any and all support is appreciated. Thank you! Where can I get the Tarot Adventures? The Tarot Adventures, Books one and two of the series are currently available on Drivethrurpg.com. Book Three, Death comes to Glenfallow, is currently in development and will be coming to KickStarter later this year. Click on the images below to go to those listings and see what people have said about them. Tarot Adventures, Book One: The Draw of Glenfallow / Cover by: Rebecca Elisbet Coulthart After liberating Glenfallow from the goblin forces, Pieron had a great deal of work ahead of him. Tarot Adventures, Book Two: Comet over Echo Rock / Cover Art by: Brian Lee PDF rewards and the 12 by 18 min-map POD codes are fulfilled/redeemed through Drivethrurpg.com

SPRYNG� is an affordable, untethered, pneumatic compression wrap that helps improve circulation, athletic performance, and so much more. Whether you�ve had a rough leg day, spent hours sitting in a cubicle, or just finished a marathon, SPRYNG� is the ultimate tool that you�ll love and use every day. What Is Active Compression? Active leg compression is a form of compression that mimics natural muscle contractions in your calves. It helps improve circulation, increase cellular oxygen supply, and stimulate tissue repair. Active Compression helps: By compressing your legs, you encourage circulation of blood where it needs the most support. This, in turn, can help reduce swelling and usher in fresh blood, nutrients, and lymphatic fluid to your legs to help accelerate healing and recovery. Supporting Circulation In Your Legs Due to gravity, your legs usually have the worst circulation in your body- especially if you�re standing or sitting all day. Without active circulation through your calves, blood will pool at your feet - resulting in swelling and pain. When your muscle pump remains inactive, you risk blood pooling, and inhibit circulation throughout your body (the blood in your feet is the same blood that is circulated through your heart and to your brain). This is why we focus on actively compressing your legs to help get that blood moving! The Benefits of Improved Circulation Active Compression is an effective way to improve circulation, flush lactic acid, and increase oxygenation to muscle tissues to get you back on your feet faster. Get more oxygen throughout your body and higher performance. Improved Circulation can help: Passive Compression Just Doesn�t Cut It You�ve likely encountered other compression tools such as socks, wraps, and sleeves. The main issue with these passive compression accessories is that they don�t do much when you�re in an office, plane, car, kitchen - anywhere you�ll be sitting or standing. Passive compression only provides support when you are using your muscle pump. In other words, they only work when you�re ALREADY active - in a workout or on a walk/run. This is where Active Compression comes in. Active Compression actively MIMICS the action of the calf muscle pump without you needing to do anything! The Beauty of Active Compression The Problem With Other Devices Current devices are ineffective or only accessible to professional athletes. These devices end up being bulky, covered in wires and hoses, not portable, and extremely expensive. They can have poor compression patterns that don�t use active compression, don�t match the muscle pump, or, worse, do more harm than good by pushing blood in the wrong direction. Bulky - complicated, heavy, not portable Expensive - reserved for high-paying professional athletes Poor Compression Pattern - dangerous and harmful The Power of SPRYNG� Using our patent-pending WaveTech compression pattern, SPRYNG� effectively mimics your skeletal muscle pump - which means it is the best way to help enhance your body�s natural circulatory flow. This means you get safe, powerful, and effective active compression that compliments your body�s natural rhythm. No reverse flow (which can get dangerous) - SPRYNG� makes sure your blood goes where it needs to go, the way it�s supposed to go, faster and more effectively. Patent-Pending WaveTech Pattern Our unique patent-pending compression patterns actively and gently push your blood in the right direction and work with the natural flow of your body. They do this by mimicking the skeletal muscle pump that acts as a second heart - aiding the return of blood to your core to help reduce swelling and muscle injury. You�ll feel your blood circulating through your calves, up your thighs, and through your body fluidly and powerfully. Relax as your body enters accelerated flow. Strategic Pneumatic Pressure We compartmentalized the compression areas to three strategic parts of your calf to make sure we help maximize blood flow and the efficacy of the compression. Feel the powerful massage hit just the right spots. Targeted Compression Affects Your Whole Leg Not just for your calves! Improving circulation at the lower extremities naturally helps push blood upwards through your thighs towards the heart. As a result, the lower extremities of your legs are one of the best targets to help improve blood circulation. Synchronized Compression SPRYNG� isn�t just synced with your naturally occurring muscle pump and blood circulation, it syncs with its adjoining pair automatically. Through the use of Infrared technology, each SPRYNG� device connects and syncs with its pair to give you dual active compression. The patterns in each leg will be synced up and matched, so you have a cohesive and comfortable session in complete harmony. 3 Levels Of Intensity Simply press the intensity button to increase or decrease the level of compression intensity you want. Internal sensors ensure SPRYNG� never pushes beyond your comfort, so you know you�re in good hands! Choose between two powerful compression patterns: 3 Steps To Setup Untethered Performance SPRYNG� is completely wireless and tubeless. You can use it in whatever position and any situation. Simply strap it on and let it run! There�s nothing to plug in or connect - a fully untethered experience. Compact & Portable Not only is SPRYNG� wireless, it�s also small and compact. You can easily fit it in your bag and even use it on a plane. Through its unique design and patent-pending compression pattern, you�ll get improved circulation throughout your entire leg with just a small area of compression. The device only wraps around your ankle and calves, so you can remain totally mobile without clunkiness or constraint. Feels Amazing Did we mention? SPRYNG� feels absolutely incredible! We honestly can�t talk about it enough. The pneumatic compression is like a a deep tissue leg massage that helps circulate your blood, pull out pain, and relax your entire body. Check out what users had to say about it! Long-Lasting Battery SPRYNG� has a powerful battery that can give up to 2.5 hours of active use. That means you can have up to 10 sessions before needing a recharge. The device can be easily recharged via micro-usb cable. One Size Fits Most Whether you have large legs or tiny calves, SPRYNG� has you in mind. We used a one-size-fits-most model using velcro straps to attach the device. The straps are fully adjustable, so you can switch sizes quickly and easily. Machine-Washable Sweaty legs? Not a problem! The inner layer of SPRYNG� can be removed and is 100% machine washable. Sustainable & Affordable Pneumatic active compression used to be reserved only for professional athletes, universities, and the uber-rich. Now, we�re bringing its performance enhancing powers to you for a tenth of the cost (that�s 90% off)! You�ll not just be getting the same effects, but you�ll have it better, faster, and much more portable than the rest. Throughout this process, we were heavily influenced and inspired by video games. We loved the artwork, design, and mechanics found in these fictional, digital worlds and wanted to create a regeneration tool like those seen in games. With SPRYNG�, we believe we got pretty close. Naturally, we felt our outer layer skin designs should reflect this achievement. So we designed our outer skins to have four unique colorways that draw homage to our favorite video game experiences. SPRYNG� is your real-life power boost and looks it too! SPRYNG� isn�t just for athletes! If you stand or sit a lot, you need to get blood circulating to stay healthy, relieve tired and achy legs, and help increase cognitive performance! This means Spryng is perfect for everyone! From DJs to Moms to CEOs and gamers, get higher level performance across all areas of life! We want our backers to have a great experience with SPRYNG�. We are doing everything in our power - from sourcing the best quality materials to rigorous quality control processes - to ensure that we would get the best product into the hands of our backers. As we are just starting up and offering SPRYNG� at highly discounted prices on Kickstarter, we are only able to accept returns due to manufacturing defect. Several years ago our team was focused on looking at one significant leg condition � diabetic neuropathy. When we dug deep into the realms of neuropathy we realized that a method called active compression could be a wonderful solution to this. That took us down the route of looking at active compression and the technologies we could use to achieve this. In our journey, the more we researched, the more we realized that active compression could not only offer a potential solution for diabetic neuropathy, but it had far more expansive potential therapeutic effects. It was something that could benefit tens of millions of people all over the world. Sadly, a lot of the active compression solutions that were out there were either very very expensive or were used in hospital settings that were inaccessible for many people. We wanted to do it differently. We wanted to bring active compression to everyone out there. Hence, we created Spryng! Through Spryng, we want to bring the benefits of active compression in an easy to use and affordable manifestation to all of you! This project is promoted by Jellop, the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarters with 650+ successful Kickstarter projects with over $300MM raised between them.
