Extra stories, areas, and more that we'll be able to implement if we get to certain funding levels. They'll be given for free to every backer who gets the game! Expanded Area: the Rats The Sapila (Rat People) have been banished to the swamps, with eerie floating watchers preventing them from ever leaving. What did they do? Are they trying to escape? This stretch goal will fill out their story. Short Story: Shepherd's Purse The Kako are cannibals, depraved, crazy beasts to be killed without remorse. Everyone knows this. Shepherd's Purse, an elder at a Kouneli Outpost, isn't so sure... Expanded Area: the Ruins What happened here? Runes and dead plants adorn the stones. Giant statues tell of past rulers, each with their Ozymandias pride. Careful searching will reveal truths found nowhere else. +1 Sticker Design For everyone who gets stickers, an extra design! . . . Thistledown: A Human Story . . . In everything I do, I try to bring people together. I've made tabletop RPGs to bring families and friends together, and I've made coloring books designed to be colored together. With Thistledown, I've written a story about the most uniting human experience - pain and tragedy. I believe that all of our differences, all of our strong opinions and theories about how reality work, all the things that divide us, fall away in the face of pain. I experienced this first-hand when my wife was diagnosed with cancer after years of remission � people we didn't even know stepped up and took care of us. They supported us, fed us, and encouraged us. Our pain stripped away the cultural/political/societal barriers, and united us at our core - as humans, who suffer and comfort those who suffer. There's nothing that unites us like the experience of pain. Thistledown is about anthropomorphic animals, fairies, and magic. But it's a very human story. The conscious suffering that we experience like no other living creature does is perhaps the most human experience. Thistledown is an attempt to touch that experience, and tenderly examine it. I also believe in the healing power of creativity - working on Thistledown helped carry me through unbelievable difficulty, stress, and fear. If you have a creative ambition, artistic pursuits can do the same for you. I hope to serve as an example and an inspiration for those who have creative ambitions: creativity isn't just something that you can do while going through tragedy, it helps you recover from it. Thoughtfully written. Thistledown assumes that games have the capacity to tell a real, true, beautiful story, so we've poured months into writing, analyzing, and refining the story. I contacted the smartest and most creative people I knew to be a part of the script advisors, and I listened to their advice with both ears. Thistledown is orders of magnitude better because of their input. Story only mode. There's a 'story mode' that you can toggle on at any time, which removes most of the platforming challenges and all of the combat. It's an important goal of Thistledown that the story can be experienced by anyone who wants to experience it. Attention to characters. I believe that everyone has a unique story to tell. I've worked hard to animate and create unique portraits and personas for every character in our 60+ cast of characters. You won't meet any 'generic' people, just as there are no generic people in real life. A deep, expansive world. We sought to make a world that felt real and bigger than the story itself, so we put in major work building the world of Thistledown, only 10% of which will be in the game. We made a world that feels like you are only glimpsing a bit of it, because you are. Thistledown is a platformer and a visual novel, or a story-heavy RPG. It's inspired by countless other works. Here are some of my favorite stories and worlds that informed Thistledown: World: Cave Story, Redwall, Middle Earth, Tooth and Tail. Story: To the Moon, The Wind Rises, In This Corner of the World. Theme: The Book of Sorrows, Watership Down, Firefly. Magic:Jonathan Strange & Mr Norrell, Ra. We'll be revealing more information about all of the different members of The Animalia (a catch-all term for the different animal races in Thistledown), as well as the different kinds of Fovos (magic folk, fair folk, or faeries) as the campaign goes on. We'll cover those most important to the story of Thistledown, only a portion of the peoples of Thistledown. The Kouneli (Pronounced co-nelly) Organized in small tribes and families, the Kouneli are humble creatures, living in burrows and using their limited magic to encourage plant growth. Magic:The Kouneli have a small life well of magic, which they can impart to plants, encouraging growth. Every year in the spring, each tribe of Kouneli concentrate their magic to grow a guardian thistle, a symbolic protector, which grows to the size of a redwood. The Kako Feral, meat-eating rabbits, who file their teeth to points and dock the ears of their young ones. They frequently raid small villages and will feast on their genetic cousins, the Kouneli, without remorse. There are very few who know how they came to be this way�in Kouneli myth, the Kouneli gained consciousness and split from the Kako Bloodline many ages ago. They are generally albinos or jet black. Magic: none. The Erpo The Erpo are white foxes, living a secluded existence in the mountains. They reside in insulated canvas yurts, which are improbably fashioned into towers. Probably takes magic to get them to stand up. Probably. They are constantly driving back the hordes of Kako threatening the world. Magic: The Erpo are powerfully magical, second only to the High Fovos in magic capability. They are one of the only races of the Animalia who can practice magic without a contract with a Fovos. The Klosi The Klosi are the most technologically advanced race in the world of Thistledown. They had magical powers once, but almost all of their abilities were taken away from them when they angered the wrong High Fovos. The only ability left to them: they can spin anything. No longer having access to their magic, the Klosi turned to technology, using complex systems of gears and pulleys to create a giant city in the trees. Magic: They can spin things. No straight lines. Just spinning. The Asvos The Asvos manage the countless magical contracts that the magical folk forge with less- or non-magical folk. They�re the contract lawyers of the world. Magic: None, although powerful deep magic protects the contracts they manage. This allows the Asvos to hold the (incredibly powerful) High Fovos accountable. The High Fovos The High Fovos are a group of incredibly magical, long-lived faeries. None of the Animalia know what they really look like, but the form they generally take is that of an 18th century human. They wear powdered wigs and enjoy showing off their finery. They torment the Animalia as much as they can. Magic: The source of nearly all the magic in the world of Thistledown. If a member of the Animalia wishes to perform a magical feat beyond their abilities, they have to sign a contract with a High Fovos or a Low Fovos. The High Fovos are a poisonous race, and they will often try to cause harm to those who sign contracts with them, just for their own amusement. The Low Fovos The Low Fovos come in many forms - from flying lizards to sleepy, hill-sized golems. They are significantly less magical than the High Fovos, but have some power. The pixel art in Thistledown is a work in progress. I use a lot of moving layers and parallax to create the illusion of depth, and to flesh out the world: Lighting layers allow me to adjust the lighting precisely to create depth and contrast with colors. Objects fade as they go back in space, and shift in color towards the sky, the ambient light. I've drawn tons of giant set pieces, that really flesh out the world and make it intriguing. Each statue and building has its own history, a reason for being in the world: Did I mention mood? The art in Thistledown oozes the mood of the story. The environments, weather, etc. all contribute to the story. A personal tragedy forces Oni to push beyond the borders of her village, in search of an unspeakable evil. As she assembles the pieces of an ancient magical contract, Oni leaves a bloody trail behind her, careening towards darkness, death, and worse. Thistledown is a story first. The stakes are high, but only for our main character. It's not the story of a summer blockbuster. She's not saving the entire world in an epic showdown with the villain, she's just fighting for her life, and her family. She's getting kicked, and persevering. When I first posted about Thistledown online, the first comment was from Sam - "I am already a huge fan. Going to drop you an E-Mail". Sam Jones has been an ardent supporter of Thistledown since the beginning, and has written lovely, thoughtful, beautiful music for the soundtrack. Who are we? Andrew Miller - Story/Art/Code Davey Dovel - Worldbuilding genius, coding sensei Sam Jones - Musical Maestro (Working on his own game: Healing Process: Tokyo.) Doubtful Games - a tiny game company started by Andrew and Timothy (his brother). Special THANK YOU to: Matthew Miller - story consult | Mollie Young - story consult | Mitch Roush - story consult | Friendly Cosmonaut - GMS2 instruction, and lots of helpful code. | Shaun Spalding - GMS2 instruction | Pixelated pope - GMS2 instruction | HeartBeast - GMS2 instruction | Michael Azzi - pixel art instruction | Sonia - Everything. You're the best. I love you. The state of the game Thistledown's script has been written, the main character designs have been fleshed out, and most of the major systems are built. What comes next is a whole lot of pixel art, animating, and building cutscenes. Why kickstarter? I've been working on Thistledown for a year and a half. I believe in the story, and eventually I would finish the game, even without Kickstarter. However, I would like to recoup some expenses of development and publication, and I would like to pay something to the people who have helped me make the game what it is. At the minimum funding level, I would fulfill pledges first, and then devote any money left to those goals. If we overfund, I will be able to devote even more of my time to the game, and can add additional areas, stories, and free DLC stories based in the world of Thistledown. I want to be able to expand on my vision. Whether or not this happens depends primarily on you - I don't have a publisher (Doubtful Games is my own company), or a marketing budget. If you believe in Thistledown, please share it. You'll help to make it bigger and better than I can do alone. If you're in the middle of tragedy right now: If you're facing medical bills, or the kind of financial struggle that tends to accompany unexpected tragedy, there's no need to back this Kickstarter. Contact me here, let me know what's going on if you wish, and I'll send you a copy of Thistledown when it's done. It's the least I can do. The Wall of Gratitude I'm so incredibly grateful to anyone who backs this campaign. You're literally helping make my ideas reality, and I can't thank you enough for that. As an extra way to say "thank you", every backer will get their name drawn on the wall of gratitude. It will be a digital wall, with each backer having their own space, regardless of how much they contribute. I'll upload the wall to the internet in many places, thus immortalizing what you've done for me. Maybe for a stretch goal, we'll make a real, physical wall of gratitude. That would be sweet. Maybe we'll name it Wall-E... Or Wall-G, "G" for gratitude. Hee. :) Instruction manual + lore deep dive Mockups, not final design Printed on real paper, these beautiful books are not only for reading with your eyes, but also holding with your hands. Luxury. Instruction manual Game controls, lovingly illustrated A follow-along 'director's commentary". Secret cheat codes. They won't help you win the game, but they will give you more insight into the world of Thistledown. Lore Deep Dive An exploration of the world and universe of Thistledown, outlining races, timelines, history, technology, magic, and myth. Fully illustrated. Sticker Pack We love stickers. We'll jump at any chance to make beautiful vinyl stickers. This is an ever-expanding pack of stickers, too! To start off, you'll get 10 copies of 3 designs (chosen by backers, naturally), and then as we fund more, we'll add more and more designs. When we add the designs will be outlined in the stretch goals. Get ready to vote your favorite stickers into the pack! Jewel Case Soundtrack *not final design Mmmmm, real plastic. The Thistledown soundtrack, fried into real plastic using real lasers. I think that's how they make CDs. Thistledown Poster *not final design The poster: but should it have Oni and Wyrm on it, or illustrations of all the races of Thistledown? We'll do a poll mid-campaign to choose the final subject matter. Either way, it will be big, shiny, and beautiful. Work with us to make your own character in the world of Thistledown. You'll decide race, distinguishing features, name, dialogue, and whatever else you can think up. I'll create your character in the finest pixel art, and put them in the game for you to find. The Low Fovos come in many different flavors, so to speak - there's nearly endless variety to these 'lesser' faeries. From tiny dragons to sleepy monsters the size of a small mountain, the Low Fovos are everywhere. Design your own, work with us to come up with backstory/history/etc. and have your new creation incorporated into the lore and canon of Thistledown forever. A major creative challenge, work with us to design a race - to be incorporated into the canon of Thistledown forever. You decide: The animal that they're based on Habits History Magic use Customs Oh, and everything else. We'll help you refine the race to fit into the world of Thistledown, and they'll be incorporated into Thistledown: A Tragedy of Blood with their own unique area. - - - Social media Follow the development of Thistledown on these channels: Twitter YouTube Discord Website Money back guarantee If you're not happy with your pledge, let me know. I'll make it good. FAQ Platforms? PC/Mac to start with, Steam Keys included. I'd like to support more platforms in the future. How long will the game be? I'm not adding padding (poorly thought-out, un-fun gameplay designed to make the game feel more valuable) to Thistledown. I hate it when I have to waste time playing broken, terrible mini-games to get on with the story. Thistledown won't be a long game, and it won't be infinitely repayable. Probably no longer than 2 hours, unless we add extra stories through stretch goals. Do you accept PayPal pledges? Yes! Here's the link: paypal.me/andhegames. We will honor all available pledges through this link. (Don't pledge for something that's currently unavailable, please!) Why is the goal so low? I just am looking to pay for production and publication costs - I'm doing all the art and code myself, and I'm not trying to pay anyone's salary. - - - Business card psd created by freepik - www.freepik.com

Paw Elementary is a series that is geared towards helping parents and children prepare for potential scary first experiences like going to the dentist, doctor, or even getting a hair cut. This book not only walks Roxy through her visit to the dentist, but it also shows how Roxy works through her emotions about going to the dentist. The book really works to show children it is okay to express how they feel, but it is equally important to be strong/ brave and go through the experiences with a positive attitude as well. My name is Katie Melko, I have a Master's in Science and have been a dental hygienist for 10 years. I fell in love with writing in my graduate program and love animals. Roxy was my furbaby for 12 years before she passed away and she was the inspiration for the main character. Being a dental hygienist in a public health setting, I really saw how much the dentist was feared by children and adults. I wanted to take the opportunity to write this education and fun book to help eliminate that fear factor for families and for parents to use as a resource to help prepare their children for there first visit. I hope to be able to share my message and continue to publish books like this to help families better prepare their little ones for appointments or visits that can cause anxiety and fear! The money raised in this kickstarter will be used to help launch the second book in the series; Paw Elementary: Roxy's Adventure to the Hair Salon. I hope that you will help me make this series of books a reality by helping me fund my next book! ~Katie

We are the editors of Urbana-Urban Affairs & Public Policy. It is a scholarly journal being published for several years now; it distinguishes itself for its attempts to promote diversity and inclusion in the academia. Urbana is a peer-reviewed, open access and interdisciplinary academic journal focusing on the urban realm. It is an independent, small publication, published regularly in three languages - English, Spanish and Portuguese - without any financial support. Urbana operates without a paid staff and without a commercial sponsor. Urbana offers the opportunity for scholars worldwide to disseminate their research on urban issues, city politics, literary views of cities, urban planning and cities and international relations. Our editorial board members are scholars from different disciplines, working in different countries and with vast teaching and research experience. The support we are seeking aims to increase the journal reach - that is - to attract more authors and more readers. We want to strengthen the status of Urbana as a scholarly platform that provides scholars with a venue to publish; one that provides readers with more quality content in the field of urban studies. The contributions we hope to receive will allow us, the editors, to improve the current website and cover the costs of such improvements; to pay a text-editor for the sake of accuracy, and pay for some of the latest publishing industry requirements such as issuing the Digital Object Identifier number - or DOI - now required for all published articles. Urbana is an open access journal, meaning that there are no subscriptions - articles can be accessed free of charge. Urbana does not charge authors - who are free to submit their manuscripts. Those providing services to the journal - the editors, translators, reviewers and authors are not paid. We are committed to the free dissemination of knowledge and to the open access to research. Plus, we strive for a journal that is open to authors engaged in responsible scholarship in the field of urban studies, holding different theoretical and methodological perspectives. We are grateful for your willingness to support Urbana: www.urbanauapp.org

LabRecon software and hardware empowers beginners and experts alike to create beautiful GUIs (graphical user interface) using its drag-and-drop panel/website editor. A built-in server allows access to the panel from browsers running on computers or mobile devices. Custom functionality is achieved with the graphical programming editor. Hardware Design The LabRecon Breadboard Experimentor allows LabRecon to interface to the real world. The device can be configured to realize various combinations of the following: 8 Analog Inputs (12-bit, 0 to 5V) 1 Count/Frequency Input 1 Quadrature/Frequency Input Pair 7 Digital On/Off Inputs/Outputs 4 PWM Outputs 4 Servo Outputs Outputs for 2 Stepper Motors I2C interfaces for 24bit ADCs, 12/16bit DACs, port expanders BBExp2 Schematic Detailed, open-source hardware documentation is available. Design Custom Interfaces Easily A fully configurable strip chart allows historical data, for up to 20 parameters, to be incorporated into the Web page. The Web page is built by dragging customizable objects onto LabRecon�s Web page editor �Panel�. LabRecon generates HTML/HTML5, CSS, and Javascript on-the-fly as the page is built. Simple Take on Advanced Programming �Back end� functionality is graphically programed by adding and wiring functions on LabRecon�s �Wiring� window. Functionality can supplemented with code written in Java, Javascript, C/C++, Python, etc. using LabRecon�s CodeLink feature. The Code Link feature allows the incorporation of code from Python, Java, JavaScript, C++, C#, and more in order to extend wiring functionality. The built-in Remote File Transfer allows editing of the web page on the server from a remote location. Educational Application LabRecon serves as an environment where you can create any simulation using the software to visualize it and use it as a teaching tool. There are dozens of sample projects, such as the simulation of trajectory with drag forces, included for free within LabRecon software with no external hardware required. Trajectory with Drag Extensive Databases of Components LabRecon�s �Measurement Wizard� uses a built-in database of over 500 commercially available sensors to help the user select and interface to sensors. This helps free the user from being tied to a limited set of compatible modules. Integrate with Mobile Devices Built-In MQTT Broker Cross-Platform Compatibility Windows, OSX, Linux* *Linux versions require Wine to operate. Application Showcase Thermostat By measuring the relative temperature and humidity in a room, you can monitor them using this thermostat to track changes over time, get notified when temperature falls below a point, or even control the temperature directly through LabRecon software. Sentry Tank Bot Web-controlled bot with a camera attached. You can move the bot by controlling the direction and speed of the movement, and rotate the camera. Model Rocket Launcher Customized model rocket launcher which allows you to control the launch angle. Other peripherals such as lights and alarms are attached which respond to the controls for the rocket. Photovoltaic Lamp LabRecon controlled photovoltaic lamp. Nerf Gun Nerf gun equipped with a humidifier to simulate fog, a servo that allows rotation of the device, green and red lasers, a webcam, and a spotlight. The gun is accurate enough to easily knock down empty bottles at a distance of 15+ meters. Mouse Trap Miller Urey Hurt Jacket Fish Bot 3D Printer Production The Breadboard Experimentor started as a mostly through-hole board and evolved to a primarily surface mount board to lower production costs. The LabRecon chip on the breadboard was moved to the circuit board to free up breadboard space. Four boards are laid out in each panel to lower the cost of board assembly. An initial run of boards from our contract manufacturer. The Backstory The hardware and software developer, Joe Barbetta, had originally developed custom controller boards for fuel cell applications, such as hydrogen powered cars. These controllers had a simple text based interface and Joe became determined to create the best GUI (graphical user interface) possible. The software evolved into a fully customizable GUI combined with a graphical programming environment. Joe was also driven to make the best possible graphics so users can create beautiful GUIs for their projects. The Breadboard Experimentor was envisioned as a convenient platform for users to interface their projects to the LabRecon software. About Me Joe Barbetta, founder of LabRecon Years ago, Joe Barbetta had a moment of inspiration while atop the Great Pyramid in Egypt, to design the best measurement and control software. At the time, his fuel cell controller boards were being used in one of the first hydrogen cars and various military and government projects, but they used a simple serial text interface. After writing over 250,000 lines of code in assembler, VB6, C, Javascript, HTML, and CSS, his software has evolved into a rich development and simulation environment with its own graphical programming language and IOT (Internet of Things) capabilities. Joe Barbetta has also been an adjunct professor at Stevens Institute of Technology since 1997 and has been mentoring high school seniors from the Bergen Acadamies since 2000. He can be found in his lab in the Englewood, NJ industrial park.

Since birth, my youngest brother was plagued with internal health issues, which finally brought him to rest a permanent rest. He was sick with a disease called pyoderma gangrenosum, which prohibited him from any rough physical activity. During his early twenties, he fell into a depression and gained hundreds of pounds which limited his mobility. We were very close. I was his confidant and his health care surrogate. When he was hospitalized, I would fly to California to make sure he was receiving the best healthcare. When I saw him lying in the hospital bed I was mortified, he gained so much weight that I did not recognize his face. All I could think of was how to get the fat off him and get him back to living a healthy life according to his standards. I became so involved with his weight issue that I overlooked his beautiful smile and jovial personality. My conversations with the doctors were about his weight, not his internal health. My brother found humor in the smallest things, but not me he was overweight, and I had to fix him. Meanwhile, he was dying, and I did not realize it because I was too busy worrying about the fat that consumed his body. I returned to the East coast to resume unfinished business three days later I received a personal call from his Doctor, he urged me to return to the hospital as soon as possible. I had received urgent phone calls from Doctors since he was a kid. Therefore, I was not alarmed. I received another call at 3 A.M from a nurse stating that; "My brother had passed away." The thought of not seeing him again hit me like a ton of bricks. All I could think of was his charming smile and humorous personality. I spent the last days with my brother trying to fix his weight, when I should have been nurturing his spirit. Project Purpose Based on the core concept that humans are intertwined with an internal need to connect.This project is an exploration and documentation of the human spirit; which we all share. While the film will highlight Damien Smith's journey to lose weight, the broader focus of this project is dedicated to documenting why and how people are driven to support Damien. His story of perseverance is a vehicle that inspires and unites a collection of people to lend him their assistance. The project will highlight the values and motivations of Damien and his community that seek to inspire, support, and encourage him throughout his process. This project will illustrate through interviews and testimonials that a person's journey is communitive. My qualifications as a filmmaker enable me to produce a compelling and inspiring story to encourage people to explore the Human Spirit. My goal is to influence people to realize that no matter how much fat consumes the exterior, the interior is longing for an honest stimulation of the human spirit. Loneliness combined with helplessness can bring forth depression and possible suicide; therefore Community intervention and understanding can prevent the human spirit from dying. My resources are reliable and astounding; that's why I am positive that I can produce a film that will globally resonate with people.

Learn what it means to be perfectly imperfect, Daughter of the King and resolutely feminine. Single people often wonder how the Biblical passage, Proverbs 31, can apply to them. It's about a wife and mother who runs her household perfectly. She has tons of perfect characteristics that seem daunting when we try to achieve them like her. Strength and Dignity is a Bible Study for girls in High School or College who wonder how Proverbs 31 applies to them. It's a combined work of 7 authors and comes with an online course! Our hope is you get to know God in a more real way, feel the freedom to make mistakes, learn about femininity and also learn how to practically apply these characteristics to you day to day life!

Goblin Phase: In the Goblin Phase, all players gain 4 goblins. They may play these goblins in their Encampments however they like. (1 / 3, 2/2, 4/0). Players may also purchase upgrades at this time. Movement Phase: Starting with the player with the King's Ear, all players in turn order move their goblins one hex toward the castle. If the goblins are next to a castle unit at the beginning of the movement phase they will not move. At the end of each player's turn if that player has a goblin next to a castle unit, count the total number of goblins surrounding it. If the number meets or exceeds the goblin icon number on a castle unit, that unit is destroyed and that player gets a stone. Castle Phase: The player with the King's Ear flips the top card of the Castle deck and takes whatever action is shown. (For instance, if they flip a Castle Unit, they would put a Castle Unit hex into play.) Then starting with the player with the King's Ear, players may purchase castle cards with stones that they may play or hold in their hands. Each castle card costs +1 stone for a player to buy, so the first player to buy a card costs 1 stone, the next costs 2 stones, until all players pass. Conflict Phase: In the conflict phase, the castle will kill 1 goblin in each hex adjacent to it. All castle units will also kill goblins based on their attack regions and range. (See above, the archer kills 2 goblins in each hex in a straight line of 5 hexes. The knight kills 2 goblins in each hex adjacent to it in a 3 region arc.) Victory: At the end of your movement, if you have at least 1 goblin next to the castle, and there are 5x the number of players in goblins surrounding the castle, the castle is destroyed. (If there are 3 players and I have 5 goblins next to the castle at the end of my movement, and the other players have 10 or more, we have hit the victory condition of 15 and I win because I was the last player to end my movement phase at the target number.) A couple of Christmases ago, I gave my 9-year-old son, Owen, a book about rock n' roll. Owen loves music just as much as I do, so I was excited to share my lifetime love of music with him. I envisioned many happy hours spent together reading about Jimi Hendrix and the Ramones. Unfortunately, this book fell short of our expectations. (I won't mention the name: I'm not here to throw shade--I'm just explaining the genesis of my own book.) It was supposed to be about notable musicians, but some of the featured artists were, um, not quite deserving of that title. For example, I have no beef with Chief Keef, but he probably has a few more years to go before reaching legendary status. Owen was sad. He�d looked forward to this Christmas present. �You know what?� I said. "I�ll write a music book for you.� And so I did. Introducing For Those About to Rock: A Kid's Guide to 50 Legendary Musical Artists. The book tells the inspiring stories of 50 celebrated popular musicians, including Muddy Waters, Run DMC, The Doors, Bjork, Black Flag, Blondie, and Jimi Hendrix, to name just a few. You can see the full list of featured artists below. Each artist's page includes bite-size fact files and top song titles. In addition, each page has a Music 101 section, which focuses on a musical concept that relates to that particular musician. For example, on Blondie�s page, we talk about liner notes; and on Bjork's page, we discuss musicians who incorporate performance art into their work. You can check it out below. The book will also feature portraits of each musician, created especially for this project by talented artists from all over the world. I say "will" because this is where you come in. I want to expand this book's audience to all kids ages 8-15 who love rock n' roll and want to know more about it, and to parents and caregivers who want to bond with their kids through a mutual love of music. To do that, I need your help. Your pledge will help me: pay artists to create the remaining 48 musician portraits edit the book print the book pay for shipping costs create the super-cool rewards that will come with the book You'll help me make this book come to life. So, come on: get pledging, and get ready to rock out with your kids. P.S.: I think Owen likes the book. What do you think? DESIGN: Joey Spector ILLUSTRATIONS: Rikke Rosbaek and Joey Spector MUSIC: Antonio Travis THE BOOK For Those About to Rock: A Kid's Guide to 50 Legendary Musical Acts will be a 7x10 softcover book, filled with the stories of 50 epic artists. In its pages, you'll find out all kinds of fascinating musical facts, including why Pink Floyd wrote "Comfortably Numb;" what snack Madonna survived on during her early years as a dancer in New York City; and which performer once showed up on stage in a giant, padded Donald Duck costume. The book will also feature 50 original illustrations of rock legends, created just for this project, by talented artists from around the world. THE EBOOK Take For Those About to Rock with you wherever you go, and read it on the go! KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE! FOR THOSE ABOUT TO ROCK STICKER PACK Get a pack of stickers featuring original artwork from the book! These stickers are only available to Kickstarter backers! KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE! YOUR OWN CUSTOM BOOK PAGE LIMITED-EDITION REWARD! Did I leave your favorite musician out of the book? Not to worry: I'll write you a custom book page featuring the musician of your choice! There is a limited number of these rewards on offer, so grab 'em while you can. LESSON PLAN: PROTEST MUSIC You will receive a lesson plan designed to teach kids aged 8-15 how rock n� roll has been an essential part of protest movements over the last decades. This was the lesson plan for a course I taught at a charter school in Los Angeles in fall 2018. It includes YouTube and Spotify playlists, and uses music appreciation to help kids understand human rights movements. MUSIC APPRECIATION WORKSHOP I love getting kids to connect with music, and I have extensive experience teaching music appreciation to elementary school children, using rock n' roll as an educational tool to illuminate history and culture. I will come to your school, workplace, library, or other rock-friendly institution, and teach a 90-minute music appreciation workshop.* *Travel costs are not included. FYI when choosing this reward: I'm based in Los Angeles, California. $10,000: HARDCOVER UPGRADE We did it - we reached $10,000! All copies of the physical book will now come with a beautiful hard cover. NEW!! $15,000: NEW MUSICIANS GO IN THE BOOK - AND YOU DECIDE WHICH ONES! This is a new stretch goal, suggested by one of my amazing backers. If we reach $15,000, all the backers--that means YOU--will get to suggest musicians that they'd like to see in the book, but who aren't already in there. Once we have a list, all the backers will get to vote for which musicians will make it into the book, and the top two will be included in the book, complete with illustrations! $25,000: FREE POSTER If we reach $25,000, all copies of the physical book will come with a free 24x36 poster featuring the amazing illustrations in the book. See below for a mockup of what the poster might look like: it will differ from this mockup because your pledges will help pay our illustrators to create new artwork! $40,000: PARENT PAMPHLET So you love rock, and so does your kid. But how do you know which artists are appropriate for family-friendly listening? And what about artists like Prince? Some of his songs are totally kid-appropriate, and some are, well... Darling Nikki. How do you navigate the wild and woolly world of rock in a kid-safe way? If we reach $40,000, all copies of the book will come with a Parent Pamphlet designed to help you introduce your kid to artists that are right for their age group. Each artist in the book will also have a page in the Parent Pamphlet. This page will contain a �What�s in the Music� section, which is a rating system designed to inform parents about the type of content in each artist�s music. Categories include sexuality, violence, drug/alcohol references, positive messages, and consumerism. Each artist also gets an MPAA rating, just like movies do: for example, Buddy Holly�s sweetly innocent tunes get a G rating, whereas the out-there tunes of the Stooges get an R. $50,000: SUPER TOP SECRET STRETCH GOAL If we reach $50,000, all copies of the book will come with a... well, you'll just have to pledge and see. : ) I need your help to pay illustrators to create the rest of the artwork, edit the book, print the first 200 copies, and pay for shipping costs. The book and rewards will ship out to backers in July 2020.

From my first introduction to D&D with the classic pink box basic set, I've had an affinity for role playing and table top gaming. I'm now mixing that love with my love of woodworking by making high quality wooden tabletop gaming hardware. My slim dice sleeves provide users with a beautiful and safe way to carry their dice from table to table. Each dice box is held together by two pair of strong N52 neodymium magnets. We will start by offering our dice sleeves in a handful of domestic and exotic hardwoods. We will add additional wood species to tiers as we meet stretch goals. We will take suggestions in the comments for the order in which we add new wood species. Each dice box will be made by me and my family in our small workshop in Virginia. Your choice of 1 dice sleeve in a Bard Tier wood. Currently Oak, Maple, or any unlocked Bard tiered stretch goals. Bard Tier- Oak Sleeve Your choice of 1 dice sleeve in a Rogue Tier wood. Currently Jatoba, Padauk, Walnut, or any unlocked Rogue tiered stretch goals. Rogue Tier - Padauk Sleeve Your choice of 1 dice sleeve in a Wizard Tier wood. Currently Purpleheart, Bocote, or any unlocked Wizard tiered stretch goals. Wizard Tier - Purpleheart Sleeve The small party tier is perfect for the player that wants to sample a few different exotic wood types or have a couple of extra sleeves to share with their friends. In this tier, you get to select 3 dice sleeves from any unlocked wood species. All three woods can be the same, or mix and match. The large party tier is for the collector. In this tier, you get to select 5 dice sleeves from any unlocked wood species. All five woods can be the same, or mix and match. The God Tier - Granadillo is our first prototype of a travelers vault. This box and accompanying mini sketch pencil was cut from a beautiful piece of Granadillo exotic wood. This wood is prized for its heartwood rich with deep red coloring and stripes of light colored sapwood. The dice slot holds 2 sets of dices. It has an extra large character vault and pencil holder. The matching mini sketch pencil is hand turned and polished, it comes with a 3mm lead and the top has a built in sharpener. This wood is prized for its yellowish brown body with dramatic dark brown to almost black stripes. The dice slot holds 2 sets of dices. It has an extra large character vault and pencil holder. The matching mini sketch pencil is hand turned and polished, it comes with a 3mm lead and the top has a built in sharpener. The matching mini sketch pencil is hand turned and polished, it comes with a 3mm lead and the top has a built in sharpener. Just click on this banner! *we�d like to extend a special thank you to composer Robert Hager for the music in our video* Hi there! This is John & Jason, the writer & illustrator behind INGREDIENTS FOR A WITCH, and we�re so excited to officially welcome you to Halloween Hills! Have you ever felt overwhelmed? I KNOW I HAVE! From publishing your first book (am I right?), taking on projects at school, to even just cleaning my room, sometimes it can all just seem so overwhelming and cause you to doubt that you�re capable of doing any of it at all! And that is exactly how our young apprentice witch Betty feels at the beginning of our story INGREDIENTS FOR A WITCH! Luckily for her she has friends that believe in her! Pumpkin, the orange tabby, and Boney, the skeleton boy, pick her up, dust her off, and show her that all the strength and ability she ever needed was inside her all along! We both love the idea that the power you need to accomplish anything is within you all along and with a little help from your friends anything is possible! So with that in mind we would like to turn to all of you, our friends, and ask you to help us get to our goal and make this magic happen! Ingredients For A Witch is the first book in a series of stories about Betty, a young witch apprentice who learns many lessons in life as she heads down the path to becoming a real full fledged witch of Halloween Hills. Along with her two companions, Pumpkin, an orange cat, and Boney, a skeleton boy, she will learn confidence and overcome feeling overwhelmed by her duties as an apprentice. Follow Betty and cheer her along on her many adventures to come! The 36 page, full-color book will be printed in softcover by a large, reputable printing company. It�s going to look amazing! And since this book will not be a print-on-demand project the cost of the individual book will be less while the quality of it will be much better. Unfortunately, this means that the upfront costs are considerable! So we are seeking your help in the hopes that we can make a lot of copies of this! Some to donate to school libraries, sell at local bookstores, and make available to Witch Betty fans that attend future productions of �The Real Wicked Witches of Halloween Hills!� All of this with the goal of building witch Betty�s audience and, hopefully, giving us enough interest and momentum to jumpstart a small series! Cause we got more stories to tell! Originally when we conceived of this book both of us saw it in our mind�s eye as a beautiful hardcover children�s book. And it would look great as a hardcover! But printing a hardcover book costs 1.5 times more than a softcover. And the shipping for hardcover is TWICE as much for the shipping of a softcover book. And the reality of the situation was this was our first time doing this! This is our first book. Our first Kickstarter. And we didn�t want to seem like we were being unreasonable in what we were looking to fund. Luckily, for us, we�ve had a lot of amazing support already and it�s still early in our campaign! So we have decided to put these other goals back out there! If we�re able to get this campaign fully funded and stretch it out to these other goals EVERYONE will benefit from it! So check them out below and please pass the word along that things just got cooler! STRETCH GOAL 1 - $7,500 If we hit this goal everyone who has ordered a book will receive an ebook copy as well! AND, if you�re so inclined, you can choose to get your ebook in English or Spanish! STRETCH GOAL 2 - $9,000 If we can smash past our original goal and reach this one ALL BOOKS will be upgraded to a hardcover edition! So, if you�re just getting into this campaign now and want a super cool hardcover edition, jump in and pledge now! If you�ve already pledged, GOOD NEWS the books you�ve already pledged for are going to become hardcover! So spread the news and let�s hit this goal!!! Again, this was our original goal and what we always wanted to do! SO please let�s blow by that original goal so everyone can get their hands on this book the way we wanted it to be! We�re printing with Printninja! Check �em out!

Update MARLA HAS REACHED THEIR GOAL! We are so ecstatic for the overwhelming support Marla has received and we want to let you know where your dollars will be going now: Any donations made that bring us closer to $5,000 will be used to: 1. Translate Marla into Spanish! Total: $900 $900 Production Costs. 2. Outreach event at the Watsonville Public Library. Total: $950 $350 LGBTQ Speaker Panel: A Q&A panel with LGBTQ identified people. To learn more, please see http://www.diversitycenter.org/triangle-speakers $350 Drag Queen Story Time. Family friendly arts and crafts event! $250 Refreshments. Share this with your teachers, friends and family! Introduction This book is for educators, parents, youth, and anyone wanting to learn about sex and gender diversity in nature and gender pronouns in a fun way! Looking for Marla tells the tale of a curious clownfish in transition as they find their way through fatherhood, and into motherhood! As readers follow along through playful and punny rhymes, they encounter a diverse cast of friendly marine creatures, each with a unique story to tell and a jewel of wisdom. Looking for Marla hopes to inspire readers of all ages on their own journey of gender expression and self-exploration, while they discover the diversity of parental care strategies in the underwater world. Contemplating single motherhood... Testimonials in Support of Looking for Marla "Looking for Marla takes you on an undersea discovery journey through the surprisingly diverse expressions of gender and sexual identity among marine creatures. I have taught sexuality education classes for ages ranging from kindergarten to senior high school, and this wonderfully imaginative book will be a precious addition to the curriculum. Little kids will marvel at the beautiful illustrations and older youths will appreciate the whimsical rhyming text. For all, the variety of parenting styles and gender expressions depicted in these pages are sure to expand their understanding of the many ways to be human. May they find their own inner Marla." - Franois Bar | Our Whole Lives Sexuality Education facilitator "Looking for Marla beautifully illustrates how art can help to communicate scientific information and break down social stereotypes. We at the Norris Center for Natural History are proud to have supported this creative and outstanding book." - Karen Holl | Professor of Environmental Studies, UC Santa Cruz | Faculty Director, Norris Center for Natural History. "Looking for Marla is joyful, beautiful and informative. If you are curious about: gender identity, the ocean, its inhabitants or parenting then this is the book for you! This is revelatory reading at its best." - Beth Rendeiro, M.Ed | Co-founder, More Than Sex Ed. | Trainer, Our Whole Lives, Lifespan Human Sexuality curricula | Educator, UCLA Lab School "Looking for Marla speaks for the often overlooked and misunderstood ocean creatures. With gorgeous illustrations and unforgettable facts, this story will warm the hearts of those willing to undertake a new perspective on our underwater world." - Roxanne Beltran, Ph.D. | Postdoctoral Researcher, UC Santa Cruz. Marla experiencing the full color of the "Blue Lagoon" with the goby bouncer, a flamboyant cuttlefish, some dual-sexed nudibranchs, disco clams, and more! What We Need We are reaching out to you, our beloved friends, family, and community, to seek support for this project. We are hoping to reach our goal of $3000 to be used toward funding this project. Budget Your generous donations will be applied in the following ways: (1) Printing costs: TOTAL = $2,996.07 a. product cost: $2382.33 b. shipping cost: $613.74 (2) Drag Queen book launch event, Santa Cruz: TOTAL = $350 a. Drag Queen: $150 b. refreshments: $100 c. photographer/videographer and post-production: $100 GRAND TOTAL = $ 3346.07 Our book is supported by multiple art and science programs in Santa Cruz County that have gone to pay the illustrator and production costs: UCSC Norris Center for Natural History, Art and Science Program Santa Cruz Arts Council, Create Grant More locations TBA! Contact our team at LookingForMarlaBook@gmail.com if you want to stock these books in your school. We understand that monetary donations are not always possible. If you would like to support our project in other ways we appreciate all the love we can get! Most importantly, spread the word - sharing our story with your community will help connect our project to its allies! Non-monetary support opportunities: Share the Kickstarter. Get others to donate. Advertise locally. Share with supporting orgs that may want to get involved with the project. Talk about it! Mama helping Marla see her inner mommy potential. Timeline of Events & Purchasing Info Timeline Printing: Spring 2019 Arrival of books: Summer 2019 Norris Center Open House: Fall 2019 Book Launch: Summer-Fall 2019 Motivation In wild clownfish populations, a male member will transition into the role of the dominant female of the community when the female of their family is removed, in a process called sequential hermaphroditism. This biological fact is omitted from the iconic movie Finding Nemo and is a story that our book Looking for Marla helps to share and correct. People may not be aware of the truly vast diversity of sex and gender expression and parental care strategies which occurs in the natural world. The creators of Looking for Marla have observed that these stories, our stories, are often grossly misrepresented or altogether excluded from popular media of today. Thus, we believe that the sharing of these narratives is absolutely necessary and long overdue.We hope that you enjoy learning about the ways in which animals of the sea change between sexes and showcase diverse gender roles in their ecosystems. The creators of Looking for Marla worked with the Diversity Center Youth Groups of Santa Cruz and Watsonville to develop the story. We are happy to share their story to uplift the voices of Queer and Trans youth. Our book draws attention to gender pronoun usage and models what pronouns are and how to use them. We hope that this book will provide support and solidarity for those readers whose stories are so often left untold. The creators of Looking for Marla Our Stories In case you wanted to know a little bit more about who we are and how we got here, the creators of Looking for Marla each wrote about their personal journey to this project, what their hopes and intentions are for its impact, and what role they played in creating it. Paloma (Visionary) As a queer Ph.D. student working in a genetics lab, I studied the ways in which sex chromosomes have evolved in different animals. I found that sex chromosomes, just like any part of DNA, changes over time. The idea that sex chromosomes changed over time shifted the way I think about sex from something stagnant to something dynamic and diverse. I feel excited to bring the examples of gender and sex diversity in nature to a broader audience through the story of Looking for Marla. It was absolutely necessary to center on the voices of queer and trans youth in my community of Santa Cruz to develop the story of a queer clownfish. Working with the Diversity Center of Santa Cruz was an absolute joy, and intimidating as well. Stepping outside of my science + school campus bubble is challenging for me, but it was necessary and fundamental to the process of Looking for Marla. It is a dream come true to be able to merge ecology and art through the story of Marla. I feel excited and honored to share this story with the queer and trans communities, with scientists, with parents, and with educators." Audrey (Writer) "As a queer artist with a degree in marine biology, this project could not have been a more perfect fit. It started as a silly thought experiment when considering how the story of Finding Nemo would change if aligned with actual biological processes, and now look where we are! My role in the project was to help bring this beautiful story to life through poetry, and I could not be more excited by how its turned out! Working alongside other artists and human beings who share the curiosity and care behind this projects message has been absolutely beautiful. My hope is that someone, somewhere, will pick up this book and be healed by it, feel held by the safety and support in its words, learn something about themselves and their connection to the world. Please help us bring community, warmth, and loving connection to those who believe they are the only one." Jessie (Illustrator) My role in this project was to create illustrations to bring the characters of this story to life. It was lovely to be able to be involved from the beginning at the book's early stages of conception and to participate in workshops with the youth groups at the Diversity Center of Santa Cruz. I am so grateful to have connected with the talented writers and artists involved in this project as well as the LGBTQ community at UCSC and in Santa Cruz. Although Paloma Medina and I were paired on this project by chance for the Norris Center Art-Science residency, I couldn't have imagined a more perfect project to work on. I grew up going to a Unitarian church, where we were encouraged to discover our own belief system and our own gender and sexuality in a supportive, open-minded, and loving environment. There is a sex-education curriculum called Our Whole Lives, which follows children through their development to teach them about trust and healthy relationships with other people as well as with yourself. Both of my parents were instructors for this course and we would have long discussions about the best way to communicate these topics to young children navigating these issues for the first time. My father still teaches this course to junior high and high school students, and he is excited to incorporate the book in his discussions about sex and gender. I hope that this book is able to reach those young people searching for themselves, to support those who have found themselves but who are struggling to communicate their identity to their support network, as well as those who can use this book to learn how to support the voyages of their friends and family. I hope this book broadens our minds and our hearts and allows us to be more accepting of the beautiful, vibrant spectrum of identities in our animal kingdom. Sofia (Designer) "The most rewarding part of being an artist is working on amazing projects with great people! Looking for Marla is a book with a purpose I believe in and advocate for, and I am honored to have been able to help them bring Looking for Marla to life as their book layout artist! As an anthropology undergraduate student at UCSC, I understand the importance of representation in the media. I hope that this book can touch the hearts of children and adults alike, while also providing a fun lesson in biology too!" Where to buy? Here! Now! From the Looking for Marla team. UCSC Norris Center for Natural History. More locations TBA! Contact our team at LookingForMarlaBook@gmail.com if you want to stock these books in your school, library, or local book shop. Mama performing, in all of her glory.

My name is Paris Henry. Currently, I have a masters degree in Psychological Counseling from Nicholls State University. Ive worked as a disability case manager for four years, and Im currently a multi systemic therapist. Ive been in this position for three years. A lot of times we gloss over our mental health because were too busy, were afraid of what our family or friends might say, or because of the negative stereotypes associated with it. For those strong enough to admit, Hey, something is wrong. Im sad all of the time. One minute Im hot, one minute Im cold. My mood is all over the place. I cant function today. Im exhausted. Im so tired, but I cant seem to fall asleep. My brain cant seem to focus today. I cant believe my loved one is gone. I cant breathe, my chest hurts, how will I live without them. The list of statements can go on and on, yet, the individual may not know how to seek help or where to start. We live in a microwaveable society. Today everyone wants something quick. The same works with mental illness, anxiety, stress, etc. When an individual realizes they are dealing with an issue they want it fixed QUICK. Although I nor other healthcare professions can help you heal over night, Sip Tea and Heal Me can help provide temporary symptomatic relief to stress, mood, focus and attention, adhd, inflammation, pms symptoms, and also helps fight cancer, while providing you with a list techniques and activities to help you assess your feelings, while seeking out professional help. My tea bags are handmade and filled with the necessary organic leaves provided by me. (ie: lavender and chamomile tea bags will consist of chamomile flowers, lavender flowers, and mint leaves all in a cotton, draw string, sealed tea bag). Teas made with Chamomile: help with insomnia, aids hair and nail growth, boost immune symptoms, and helps soothe anxiety. Teas made with Lemon Balm: reduce stress, elevate mood, decrease feelings of depression, helps with fatigue, soothes constipation, reduces PMS, and battles inflammation. Lavender and peppermint are also two additives that assist in calming and soothing stress and anxiety. My goal/funds will be used: 1.) To bring awareness to mental health through addressing stigmas and stereotypes to them. 2.) Provide a list of universal resources that can assist individuals with seeking help. 3.)With each item purchased, provide a workbook for individuals that consists of coping skills for anxiety, depression, insomnia, mood stabilizing, and stress to assist with treatment and healing while theyre seeking help. 4.) To encourage individuals to use natural, alternative methods to medicines, when possible, through the utilization of tea and lemonade along with seeing a mental health professional or physician. Studies have shown that certain teas assist with fatigue, mood stabilizing (hyperactivity and depression), focus and attention (ADD and ADHD), insomnia, and stress. 5.) I would like to go into the schools and after school programs to speak with the youth about things that they may be feeling or experiencing but dont know how to describe their feelings or who they should talk to. Along with giving them a workbook for their ages with coping skills on bullying, body changes, self-esteem issues, anxiety, and focus and attention. Please be mindful that tea should not take the place of seeking help from a physician or mental health professional nor should it replace medications that you are currently taking without seeking medical help. However, it can improve symptoms and hopefully be the reason a medication can be discontinued. Disclaimer: Please avoid Chamomile Tea and consult a doctor if your are currently taking blood thinners, are allergic to Chamomile or any of its properties, or have any other medical issues/allergies of concern that may need to be consulted with a doctor before consuming any of the above teas. Please avoid Lemon Balm if you have a hypothyroidism diagnosis. Certain tea recipes may contain dairy. Please feel free to modify recipe any of my recipes to fit your needs.

Attention all families battling illness! Have your parents been diagnosed with a long-term or chronic illness? Are you a parent that has been diagnosed with a chronic disease? If your family has been touched by illness you cannot afford to miss this documentary! The new Independent Documentary Film 'Children of Disease' tells the stories of four families across the United States as they struggle to simultaneously battle parental chronic illness and raise healthy children. The film explores the effects of growing up with an ill parent on children, teens, and young adults. A 'Child of Disease' is someone who's parent(s) was diagnosed with a chronic illness anytime before the child turned 18. These children witness their parents become ill and stay ill long term, a heartbreaking experience that one should not have to face until well into adulthood. The children growing up this way have experiences that most children will never face, making children of disease feel isolated from the rest of their peers. 'Children of Disease' may act out, withdraw, experience anxiety and depression, develop physical health issues themselves, or simply have their world view altered in an unhealthy and isolating way. The film also features Dr. Rebecca B. Skolnick Ph.D., licensed clinical psychologist and Co-founder of MindWell NYC, and the organization Wonders & Worries, which offers free professional support for children and teens during a parent's serious illness. Together these professionals offer information and education throughout the film on how families battling parental illness can best cope and endure these difficult situations. Meet the families: Meet the Professionals: Visit the Wonders & Worries Website to learn more about the services they offer! Read the Article written by Rebecca and her mother: "Helping Your Child Cope with a Chronically Ill Parent" Visit the Mindwell NYC website! Parents diagnosed with chronic illness often struggle with feelings of helplessness and distress in regards to their childrens well-being, feeling as though everything is out of their control and they have no way of knowing if their child is okay. A note from the Director: I, Madison VanDerlinde am making this film because I am a 'Child of Disease'. Growing up with a chronically ill father (and for a short time an ill mother) has had a lasting impact on my life. My sister and I watched my father struggle endlessly to keep his body functioning. The children around us as we grew up had no idea the hardship my whole family was facing and continues to face. I absolutely hate the idea of other children growing up feeling as isolated and hopeless as my sister and I felt while we watched my father come in and out of the hospital, try medication after medication, and endure ailment after ailment. For a child one of the scariest things to confront is losing a parent. When a parent is ill children are confronted with this reality everyday. While most children are focusing on school work, fighting with friends, and playing on the playground 'Children of Disease' are worrying about their parents, trying to be strong, and wondering why this is happening to them. It is an unfair way to grow up, but I know we can make it better by talking about it. There are so many families in similar situations to my own, but for some reason there is no sense of community. I aim to change all that and tell the 'Children of Disease' everywhere that YOU ARE NOT ALONE. Join our mission to unite families battling parental illness! We can't do it with out you! Your support will fund: -Travel Expenses -Production Costs (filming equipment, camera operators, etc.) -Editing/Sound -Music Rights/Score -Merchandise Development/Graphic Design -Distribution -Event Planning & Cost Don't forget to follow/like us on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and Tumblr so you don't miss any updates while the film is being produced and released! Subscribe to our YouTube channel! Visit our website https://www.childrenofdisease.com for more information about the families and professionals featured in the film and to join our mailing list so you never miss an update! 'Children of Disease' is an Independent Documentary Film produced by VanDerland Productions LLC. Founded by the Director of Children of Disease, Madison VanDerlinde, VanDerland Productions is an Independent Film Company producing films through crowd funding and individual donations. Built on the principal of cutting out the middle man, VanDerland Productions distributes its films directly to the audience. Fueled by the passion to give a voice to the overlooked and the underrepresented we are a home for the misfits and the misunderstood.

What is Reforge? Reforge is a weapon crafting, battle royale card game! It combines the fun of crafting a unique blade with the polyhedral dice combat of D&D! Players start the game with a lowly wooden grip and Adventurer blade and compete on the tabletop battlefield to forge more powerful weapons with a plethora of grips, guards, and blades to power up their attack and defense, all while utilizing gadgets and shields to turn the tides of battle in their favor. The last player standing wins! For more detailed rules, scroll down a bit or watch our video! The detailed rules and a printable PDF version of the rules can be found here! Photo from demo event at Cool Comics & Games in Cape Coral, FL. All 56 unique cards included in Reforge. Here's how they fit together during a game. Here's the layout with a four player game. Where did the idea come from? The idea for Reforge came to me (Stephen) in a dream early 2019 that involved a card game where you build swords. I immediately started writing down what I saw in my dream and built off of that. The game mechanics came after as I experimented with custom made cards. After working tirelessly for a couple months, I had a product that I was happy to show to the world! After doing some conventions and demos, I'm really looking forward to getting the game into peoples hands! I work full time in a hospital, but have always wanted to create. I haven't stopped since this idea came to me, and I don't intend to until it is realized! About the team! The team for Reforge includes game designer Stephen Royka and artist Sam Donez (Twixxo). After being best friends since high school, we decided to make something awesome together! Reforge is the result of decades of love for gaming and cartoon art. I (Stephen) love videogames, with my favorites being Okami, Resident Evil 4, Hollow Knight, and Bloodborne to name a few. I work as an ultrasound tech to pay for my love of game design. I'm hoping to be able to transition into working full time on card game design for my new company Secret Boss Games someday! Sam is an artist by hobby and trade. While he kicks ass at cartoon art, his real focus is 3D environmental design. Check out his stuff on his website, Art By Twixxo! Why the $6,000 goal? The initial goal is primarily to cover production costs for game and shipping costs from the factory. We are trying to keep this goal as low as possible because we really want this to get made. From the quotes we've gotten, it's looking like this will just be enough to cover all those costs. We have put tons of time, money, and effort into this project and want nothing more than to see it become a reality that people love! And what about that $8,000 stretch goal? (Reduced from $10,000!) If we hit that response, then every copy of Reforge purchased on the Kickstarter will include four sets of polyhedral dice! You need dice to play the game, but we have a solution just in case we don't reach that stretch goal. A webapp will be available for free that acts as a companion for Reforge to keep track of health and roll attack die! The app is currently in development, but a preview of its functionality can be seen here. We really want to ship the game with dice for a complete experience (and we know most people would prefer the feel of real dice!) so we really hope we can reach this goal! We recently received new quotes from manufacturing facilities, so we will be able to bring Reforge to everyone with dice if we reach our stretch goal of $8,000! Check below for info on gameplay, rewards, and more! For more of the nitty gritty details for the rules, check out the complete rule list here! Thank you to all the generous Tier 7 backers! Here are the Final Blades that they came up with that will be included in every copy of Reforge!

Hi! This is an all-or-nothing Kickstarter project  if we don't reach our goal within the 30 days, we don't receive any of your pledged funds! Please read on While we in the Rae Gordon Band still love our award-winning CD Better Than I Was, it's been two years since it came outand our fans say it's high time we unleashed some new music on the world! So that's exactly what we're going to do, with your help. We have a great collection of songs all written and ready to go  this CD will actually be the first Rae Gordon Band release to feature all original tunes and no covers. The songs range from lowdown blues to danceworthy soul to heart-wrenching ballad to horn-drenched funk and always, always back to the blues. We're having huge fun playing them and we are so excited to bring them to you. We'll be recording the CD at Jimi Bott's Roseleaf Recording, with our guitarist/vocalist Kivett Bednar producing. Besides being an award-winning drummer with a jaw-dropping list of credits (The Fabulous Thunderbirds, Rod Piazza & The Mighty Flyers, and most recently the blues supergroup The Proven Ones), Jimi Bott is also an accomplished engineer and producer, with names like Ben Rice, the Mannish Boys All-Stars, Kevin Selfe And The Tornadoes, Mark Hummel and Paul deLay having recorded at his facility. Projects recorded at Roseleaf have received Blues Music Award nominations from the Blues Foundation and Best Recording awards from the Cascade Blues Association. So we're confident our CD is in good hands! But of course, nothing of quality comes for free. Studio time, mixing, mastering, production, package design, photography, duplication, promotion, marketing  all of these are essential to the project's success, and they all come with a cost. Which is why we're coming to you and offering you a chance to participate in this process and help us get the job done. Please take a look at the various levels of support we're offering, shown on the right-hand side of this page, and see what might work for you. We will be eternally grateful to you for any contribution you feel you can make! Want a CD? We'll have 'em! Want a sweet T-shirt? We'll have 'em! Wanna have lunch with Rae and the production team? We'll do it! Wanna host a house concert? We'll play it! IMPORTANT: This is an all-or-nothing Kickstarter project  if we don't reach our goal within the 30 days, we receive ZERO dollars. We don't get any of your pledged funds unless we reach or exceed our goal. So we really need your help. And that means not just your pledge, but also your PR assistance! Please use the "Share This Project" button at the top of this page to get the word out about our new CD via Facebook, Twitter, or any other social media, blog or email you may use. If you feel you can't contribute at this time, we totally understand and just ask that you help us get the word out  we'd appreciate that a bunch! We've had a fantastic couple of years in the Rae Gordon Band, taking 3rd Place at the International Blues Challenge in Memphis, releasing Better Than I Was, receiving awards and nominations, and traveling all over to perform for enthusiastic audiences from Florida to Canada. With this new CD we want to take things to the next level and gain new listeners and fans. With you behind us, we're confident we can make it happen. From the bottom of our hearts, thank you for choosing a level and supporting the Rae Gordon Band.

Indigenous Warrior Enterprise and Richie Ledreagle are Raising funds to release the "I Still Believe in You" Music project. With your contribution we will be able to produce a quality project while putting a positive message and positive energy into the atmosphere. At age six I was a child soldier in the Liberian Civil War. The Girl who held my hand became my God. She kept my eyes open to the gifts of choice I had regardless of how difficult the experience was. In war constantly I saw men force Girls on their backs. That sparked a healing in me to create Girl God as a wearable crown, celebrating the beauty of Girls breaking through their wars. Funding will allow Girl God Fashion to be presented to interested buyers at Saks and Bergdorf Goodman. Funding in this project pays for Public Relations Marketing. Customers buying into Girl God Apparel need to understand this new form of fashion but familiar statement of empowerment, healing for the soul and the planet. The idea of connecting our personal wars and sharing our beauty from it with others creates a lifetime design. Public Relations will also spread fast the eco friendly results of slow fashion and how it preserves our planet. Public Relations will document the stories from the Veterans who previously wore these jackets in combat before purchased and redesigned. Funding will pay for inventory, art materials and a Design Studio/Showroom for Girl God Apparel. A Design Studio will show that Girl God is capabel to fulfill orders to interested buyers in Paris, New York, London and California. Funding will also pay for travel across the United States giving speeches in art galleries, schools, about crowing our challenges and redesigning our triumph and tears into art. Funding will develop a Girl God charitable organization that embraces the connection we all share in our steps towards our inner GOD. Thank You From my Crown to Yours TAKI GOLD

After seeing the short list of political symbols in my project image I know what you must be thinking. How the heck does this guy plan to promote such a controversial symbol in a Kickstarter project and get away with it? Well, let me tell you, this symbol has been used in plenty of mainstream media outlets and even in entertainment for children. Shocking, I know! While the Jolly Roger may have once been a symbol of violence and criminality, it is now often seen as a symbol of defiance to authority and adventure (as seen in Disneys Pirates of the Caribbean franchise).  As for the rest of the political symbolism I am advertising here, most of you will probably hate some and love others. Thats the thing about politics, people tend to get emotionally attached to their side and worked up when they see their rivals. Probably because theyre right and the other guys are a bunch of jerks, but I digress. Hello, my name is Eric and I love politics, graphic design, and making enamel pins. However, that last one is fairly new to me. How did I get into it you might ask? It all started many months ago at a friends wedding*flashback* (Yes, we are doing asterisks.) A friend of mine was getting married and asked me to make a design for some Anarcho-Capitalist buttons that all the groomsmen could wear during the ceremony. Totally not weird at all. *cough* Being the good friend I am, I decided to go overboard and make something a bit more lasting and meaningful. Since we were all going to dress up in our finest attire, I thought we should all accessorize accordingly. And down the rabbit hole I went After doing extensive research, finishing the design, and selecting my manufacturer, the pins finally arrived at my door. They look amazing. (See picture below.) Click the image to check it out in my new Etsy store. The above ANCAP pin has a 30mm diameter with black nickel plating. Since the ceremony, Ive been contacted by a couple of other people that attended the wedding about getting some other types of political pins made. One of them is a staunch socialist (she encouraged the hammer & sickle) and another is probably my favorite gay person on the planet (he encouraged the rainbow flag). The first available pins out of the gate are the circular American Flag and Hammer & Sickle. The circular Rainbow Flag will unlock at the first stretch goal of $600. Survey response time will be crucial to making sure this timeline stays accurate. I'm going to do my part in getting the surveys sent out ASAP, so please make sure you keep an eye out for it. I'll also send out an update at the same time. My goal is to beat this timeline if possible, but I'll need everyone's help to make that happen. It is reasonable to assume that there are pins/symbols missing from the list that many of you would have liked. If there is popular support for a pin/symbol, I don't see why it wouldn't be reasonable to squeeze it in. After about halfway through the campaign, I'll compile of list of frequent requests and send out a poll for all backers to vote in. As it becomes feasible, I'll add those pins into the available rewards according to popularity. Time to give some credit where it's due. The image I'm using for the Jolly Roger pins was originally taken from the wikipedia website here. I have made several modifications to the original design, as is permitted in the license here. The person who created the original artwork, Oren Neu Dag, has a page on the wiki commons website. You can view that here.

Hello Friends, Family and Newcomers My name is Scot Smith and I am the author of Farm Fresh. It's been a dream for a long time to have a cookbook published. I have previously self-published three cookbooks with on demand printing, but that's nothing like a hardbound cookbook with color pages showing the recipes off. I need your help to make this dream become reality. Farm Fresh is a cookbook full of recipes inspired by local farmers and the Farmers Market. There are over 275 pages within this cookbook and it has taken over 4 years to get to this point. The cookbook will include appetizers, main dishes, side dishes, desserts, breakfast items and some of this and that. I also included a special section dedicated to my Grandma Capaul, as she was an awesome baker. I tested the recipes, re-tested them and then photographed them myself. I am proud of what I have accomplished within this cookbook. Farmer's Market Fried Rice About the Author Well, let me give you a little about my background. I have a creative side and enjoy to cook and entertain. I have always enjoyed cooking since I was a youngster. I remember cooking with Grandma Josephine (known as Ma). Although she was not the perfect cook, I learned from her. My training doesn't come from culinary school, but rather comes from my Mother and my Grandmothers and just a lot of practice. As the main person in the family to cook for the Holidays each year, my entertaining experience increased. I also started to cater family & friends' events. Everyone was always asking for my recipes, which I gladly gave to them, but that's when I thought to myself "Why not do a cookbook?". So I took family recipes and put my twist on some of them and created "Family Favorites- From One Generation to the Next". As a result I gained some experience writing recipes, putting my ideas on paper and testing recipes to ensure my pinch of this and handful that would taste the same. Subsequent to that I also worked on an appetizer cookbook called "Small Bites Big Taste". My current project, Farm Fresh, has been my biggest project and I am excited to get it out there. Pan-Seared Cod in White Wine Tomato Basil Sauce Inspired by the Farmer's Market Although the recipes in Farm Fresh have been inspired mainly by the Farmers Market, I have included a few others that I enjoy. While walking through the Farmers Market it is exciting to see the freshness of the produce and products ... and it's also less expensive then the regular store. One of the benefits of shopping the Farmers Market is that you are supporting local farmers, but the best part is that you are getting products at their peak freshness. During a recent visit, a local farmer was selling goat cheese and was passing out samples -what an incredible taste! It made me think about how I could use this cheese at home. While most people would serve it with crackers and maybe some fruit, I decided to do a recipe that would serve it hot with freshly baked crostini. Baked Goat Cheese I need your help This is where you come in. Please help make this dream a REALITY. Check out the rewards and get your own edition of Farm Fresh. I am also looking for Angel donors - your help will be greatly appreciated. If a cookbook isn't your cup of tea, think about giving it as a gift. If your can't afford to help, perhaps you can do me a favor? Please share this kickstarter link with family, friends and co-workers who might enjoy a copy. By passing the word around you are helping me out immensely. THANK YOU - I truly appreciate your help in getting this project funded.
